institvtion christian religion vvrytten latine maister ihon caluin translated englysh according author last edition seen allowed according order appointed quenes maiesties iniunctions imprinted london reinolde vvolfe richarde harison anno cum priuilegio ad imprimendum solum printer reders wheras men haue thought reported fault negligence v haue long kept backe boke profitable woorke namely sithe maister iohn dawes translated deliuered handes tweluemoneth past shall vnderstande excuse behalfe could wel emprinte soner haue ben diuerse necessarie cause constrayned earnest entreatance procure frende oures translate whole agayn translation trust shal well allow hath ben faythfully done translater also hath ben wholly perused men whoes iugement credit al godly learned englande well knowe esteme sithe come foorth pray accept vse faultes haue passed v ouersight beseche let v haue patience haue diligence ihon caluin reader first setting worke loke successe lord vnmeasurable goodnesse hath geuen men vse small workes parte lightly passed ouer vnderstode receiued fauor godly neuer durst haue desired muche lesse haue hoped verily felt hart much geuen deserued thought great vnthankfulnesse least sclender abilite endeuor answere fauourable affection towarde themselues prouoked diligece attempted seconde setting fourth oft sin time worke hath ben emprinted oft hath ben enriched encreasce although repent labor employed yet neuer helde selfe contented til disposed order set trust haue geuen whiche may allowed iugemetes truely great endeuor haue applied selfe seruice chirche god maye bring fourth euident witnesse last winter thought feuer quartaue summoned death much sickenesse enforced vpon much lesse spared myselfe til mighte leaue boke ouerliue might make part thankfull recompense gentle prouoking godly rather dede ben done soner sone enough well enough shall thinke come abrode good season shal perceiue hath brought yet ple tiful frute hath done heretofore chirch god desire truely ful ill holding selfe contented allowance god alone despise iugementes men whether foolishe frowarde iugementes vnskilful wrongfull malicious wicked although god hath throughly settled minde endeuor bothe enlarging kingdome helping common profit though clere myne owne conscience haue himselfe angel witnesse sin toke vpon office teacher chirch haue teded none purpose might profit chirch mayntayning pure doctrine godlynesse yet thinke man hath ben snatched bitten torne sonder moe sclauders tha ivuhe epistle printing certainly enformed augsburgh assemblie state empire holde rumor sprede abrode reuolting papacie gredely receiued courtes prince mete forsoothe thankfulnesse ignorant many trialls stedfastnesse trialls shake fowle sclander al indifferent gentle iudges haue defended deuell whole route deceiued oppressing filthy lie thinke vniust dealing shalbe either discouraged made lesse diligent trust lorde vnmeasurable goodnesse wil graunt may eue sufferace cotinue course holy calling vvhereof geue godly reders new profe setting fourth boke nowe trauail purpose prepare furnish studious holy diuinitie reding worde god may bothe haue easy entrie goe forwarde without stombling thinke haue pointes knitt vp together summe religion disposed suche order whosoeuer shal wel haue minde shal hard determine ought chefely seke scripture marke apply whatsoeuer conteined therefore way one made plaine shal hereafter set fourth expositios scripture shal nede enter long disputation article doctrine wander common place wil alway knitt vp shortly meane godly reder shalbe eased great peine tediousnesse come furnished aforehand knowlege present worke necessarie instrumente entente purpose doth clerely mirror appeare inso many commentary mine rather declare dede set wordes farewel frendly reader thou receiue frute labor helpe thy praiers god father geneua first day august yere augustine vii epistle professe selfe one number write profiting profit writing pto moste mightie noble prince francisce christian kyng french kyng soueraigne lorde iohn caluine wisheth peace saluation christ firlie sett hande thys woorke thoughte nothyng lesse moste noble kyng write thyng afterwarde presented maiestie mynde teache certaine introduction wherby touched zeale religion myght bee instructed true godlynesse trauayle tooke principally contremen frenchemen vnderstode many hunger thirst christe sawe fewe rightly receiued much litle knowlege meanyng boke selfe declareth beyng framed simple playne maner teachyng perceyued furious rage wycked men hath farre preuailed realme roome sounde doctrine thought doo thyng worthe trauayle one worke bothe geue instruction declare confession wherby ye may learne maner doctrine agaynst furious men burne great rage day trouble realme sweard fyer feare confesse haue woorke comprehended maner summe selfe doctrine agaynst crie ought punished prisonment banishement condemnation without iudgement fyer ought chaced away lande sea knowe dede haynous information haue fylled mynde eares make cause hatefull vnto clemencie ought weye shalbe innocence neither wordes dedes may enough accuse truely bryng hatred shall allege doctrine whereof go yelde accompt vnto hath ben long agoe condemned consente degree atteynted many iugementes allready geuen iudicial courtes al sayth shall amount hath partly ben violently throwen downe anding power aduersaries therof partly ben traitorously fraudulently oppressed lye suttle practises sclaunders herein violence shewed without hearyng cause bloody senteces pronouced fraude without deseruyng accused sedition euel doyng none may thynke wrongfully complayne thynges selfe beare v witnesse moste noble kyng lyeng sclaunders dayely accused vnto tendeth ende writhe kynges scepter oute handes throwe downe iudges seates iudgementes subuerte order ciuile gouernementes trouble peace quiete people abolish al lawes vndo propriety possession finally turne al thynges vpsyde downe yet heare smallest portion horrible thynges spreade abroade among people whiche true whole worlde myghte worthily iudge ye mainteiners therof worthy thousande fiers gallowes maruell common hatred kindled agaynst suche moste wrongfull accusation beleued loe thys cause degree agree co spire condemning v doctrine sit iudge beeing rauished affection pronounce sentence freconceiued determination whyche brought home thinke haue well enough discharged duty commaunde man drawen execution suche founde gylty eyther theyr owne confession sufficient witnesse fault condened doctrine say law codemned herein haue stande succor defense denie doctrine selfe mainteine true libertie one mutter vtterly cutt v wherefore doe vniustly require victorious king maye please take owne hande whole hearing cause whiche hetherto hath ben troblesomly handled rather carelesly tossed without al order law outragious heate iudiciall grauitie neyther yet thynke goe make myne owne priuate defense whereby may procure selfe safe returne natiue contree whiche althoughe beare affection naturall loue becometh yet case nowe miscontentedly want take vppon common cause godly yea cause christe himselfe whiche thys day hauing ben meanes torne troden downe kyngdome lyeth despeired case dede rather tyranny certaine pharisee owne knowlege howe cometh passe nedeful tell truely lyeth great distresse thus farr haue vngodly preuailed truethe christ destroyed beyng chaced away scattered abrode yet lyeth hydden buried vnregarded silly poore chirch eyther wasted cruell slaughter dryuen away banishmentes dismayed threatens terror dare one open mouth yet stil continue rage fercenesse wont thru ting strongly wall alredy bending ruine whiche themselues haue made meane tyme steppeth fourth set hymselfe defense agaynst suche fury suche moste seme fauor truthe say good pardon error vnskilfulnesse ignorante men thus good natured men forsoothe speake calling error vnskilfulnesse whiche knowe certaine trueth god calling ignorante men whoes witt see christe hath despised hath vouchesaued communicate mystery hys heauenly wysedome muche ashamed gospell shalbe office noble king turne away eares youre mynde f iust defense specially great mater question namely glorie god may mainteined safe earth ye trueth god may kepe honor christ may haue hys kyngdome preserued whole among v thys mater worthy eares worthy iugement worthy royall throne euen thoughte maketh true king acknowlege hymselfe gouernance hys kyngdome minister god neyther doth vse kyngdome robberie reigneth thys ende may serue glorie god deceiued loketh long prosperitie kyngdome whiche ruled scepter god hys holy worde forasmuche heauenly oracle proue vayne whereby proclaymed people shalbe scattered abrode prophecie saylethpro xxixxviii neyther oughte contempt basenesse withdrawe thys purpose verily knowe right wel howe poore abiecte silly men namely sighte god miserable sinner sight men despised persones yea wil certaine excrementes outcaste world whatsoeuer vil r thing may named remaineth nothyng v glorie vpon god hys onely mercie whereby without deseruing receiued hope eternall saluation men nothyng weakenesse whiche among taken great shame confesse much countenance doctrine must auaunced hye aboue glorie worlde muste stande vnuanquishable aboue power oures doctrine liuing god hys christedan iixxxii esai xiiiii psa iiix whome father hath appoynted kyng beare rule euen sea sea riuers euen endes earth beare rule strykyng whole earth wyth onely rod hys mouth may breake iron brasen strength golden syluer glittering therof potter vessel prophetes prophecie royaltie kingdome aduersaries dede crye contrary say falsly pretende woorde god whereof wicked corrupters howe thys malicious sclaunder also notable shamelessnesse selfe reding confession may according wysedome iudge yet also good say somwhat eyther moue willingnesse hedefulnesse least prepare way reding itro xiivi paul whe willed al prophecie framed agreablenesse fayth hath set sure rule wherby expounding scripture ought tryed doctrine examined thys rule fayth victorie allredy handes doth better fittly agree fayth acknowlege selues naked al vertue god may clothed emptye good may filled bonde seruantes sinne may made fre blinde hym maye enlightened lame hym maye made streight feble hym may vpholden take selues mater glorieng alone may glorious hie may glorie whe say like thinges interrupt v cry thys meane overthrowen wote blinde light nature fained preparation freewill workes meritorious eternall saluation together supererogation abide whole praise glorie al goodnesse vertue righteousnesse wisdome shoulde remayne god rede blamed haue drawen much yt fountayne liuing wateriere iixiii yt contrary syde sharply rebuked haue digged themselues pittes broken pittes able holde water againe agreable fayth promyse themselues god wil fauourable father christ acknowleged brother procurer fauor assur dly loke al thinges ioyfull prosperous hys hande whoes unspeakable loue towarde v hath proceded farr hath spared begotten sonnerom viii xxxii gaue hym v rest sure loking saluation eternall lyfe thynke vpon christe geuen father treasure hidden stepp v crye thys certaintie affiance without arrogance presumption nothing selues al thinges ought presume god none reson spoyled vayne glorie learne glorie lord consider mightie prince al partes causei timo iiiix ioh xviiiii thynke worse kynde wycked men vnlesse playnly fynde troble railed put trust liuing god becaue beleue eternall lyfe know one true god hym hath sent iesus christe thys hope v bounde iron whypped caryed mockage condemned without iugement cruelly tormented escape away flight al distressed wt troble al terribly accursed torne sclaunders handled haynous wise loke vpon aduersaries speake degree prestes whoes becke wil exercise ennimities v consider litle zele caryed true religion taught scripture ought holden certaine among al men easily geue leaue bothe themselues ignorant neglect despise thynke maketh smal mater euery man beleue beleue concerning god christ vnexpressed fayth cal submit hys mynde iugement chirch neither much moued happen glorie god defiled manifest blasphemy man lift vp hys fynger agaynst supremicie apostolike sea authoritie holy mother chirch therfore great crueltie fercenesse fight masse purgatorie pilgrimage trifle farr fourth say without expressed fayth may call thinges godlinesse ca stande wheras yet proue thynges come word god belly god kitchen religion taken away thynke shall onely christian also men though plentuously glutt themselues lyue gnawyng poore crustes yet liue one pott whiche without warning helpes waxe colde also throughly freese therfore much euery careful hys belly much earnest warrier fayth finally endeuor themselues thys kepe still eyther bothe kingdome safe belly full pure zele none sheweth token neuer little neither yet cesse sclauder doctrine al color accuse defame wherby may bryng hatred suspicion cal newe lately forged cauill doutefull vncertayne demaunde miracle confirmed aske whether mete preuayle agaynste consente many holy father moste aunciente custome presse vpon v cofesse schismaticall whiche moueth warr againste chirche chirche hath lyen dead many age whiche suche thyng hath ben heard last saye nede argumentes say may frutes iudged sorte namely hath bredde huge heape sectes many turmoyles sedition great licentiousnesse vice truely full easy triumph vpon forsaken cause lyght beleuing ignorant multitude might also haue turne likewise allowed v speake verily thys sharpe heate woulde sone cooled wherewith doe full month licentiously vnpunishedly agaynst v firste whereas call newe dooe greate wrong god whoes holy worde deserued accused newenesse dede nothing dout new christ new hys gospell new knewe preaching paule olderom iiii xxv iesus christ dyed synnes rose agayne oure iustification shall fynde nothyng newe among v wheras hath long lyen hidden vnknowen buried fault vngodlynesse men nowe sithe bountifulnesse god restored v ought least ryght full restitution receiue agayne title auncientie fountayne ignorance springeth thys take doutful vncertayne thys verily lorde hys prophet complayneth oxe knew hys owneresa iiii asse hys master stall hys people knewe hymn howsoeuer mocke vncertaintie dryuen seale theyr owne doctrine owne blood losse lyfe men mighte see howe much set farre affiance dredeth neyther terror death yet iugement seate god wheras require miracle v deale vnreasonably wyth v coine new gospell holde fast selfe gospell confirming truth wherof al miracle serue euer christ apostle haue done thys thyng haue speciall aboue v euen thys day confirme faith co tinuall miracle yea rather allege miracle may weake minde wyse wel stablished eyther tryflyng worthy laughed vayne lyeng yet although neuer monstruous oughte haue ben value agaynste worde god forasmuche name god oughte euery place euery time hallowed whether miracle naturall order thynges thys false color myght paraduenture haue made better shewmar xvixx acte xiiiiiii scripture informe v lawful ende vse miracle marke teacheth sygnes folowed preaching apostle sett fourth confirming likewyse luke also sayth lord dyd beare wytnesse worde grace signes wonder shewed handes apostle wherwith wholly agreeth sayeng apostle gospell preachedhebr iiiiii saluation confirmed thys lorde beare witnesse signes wonder diuerse power thinges whiche heare sealinges gospel shal turne destroyeng credit gospell thinges appointed onely stablishe trueth shal applye confirming lye therefore mete doctrine whiche euangelist sayeth goeth miraclesioh viixviii viiil firste examined tryed allowed maye lawfully take confirmation miracle true doctrine christe teacheth thys marke tende seking glorie men god sithe christe affirmeth thys profe doctrine miracle wrongfully estemed whiche drawen ende glorifie name god alone oughte remember sata hath hys miracle although iuggling deceites rather true power yet suche may decciue ignorante vnskillfull magician enchaunters haue alwaye famous miracle wonderfull miracle haue nourished idolatrie whiche yee doe proue v superstition magician idolatrers lawfull wyth thys batterynge ramme olde tyme donatistes dyd shake simplicitie common people excelled miracle therefore doe nowe make answere oure aduersaries augustine made donatistes iho trac lorde hath made v ware agaynste suche miracle worker foretold shold come false prophetes lyeng signes diuers wonder sholdmathe xxiiiixxiiii thess iiix ii corin xixiiii hieron prefa ierem ii thess iixi possible bryng elect error paule hath geuen warning kyngdome antichrist power signes lyeng wonder miracle say doon idoles sorceres false prophetes saintes though knewe craft satan transfigure himselfe angell lyght olde tyme egyptian worshipped ieremie buried among sacrifice diuine honor abuse holy prophet god idolatrie yet suche worshipping tombe obteined thought healyng styngyng serpentes iust rewarde therof shall say hath ben euer shallbe moste iust vengeance god sende strength illusion haue receiued loue truth may beleue lieng therfore want miracle certaine subiecte cauillations miracle whiche bring foorth themselues mere illusion satan forasmuch leade awaye people true worshippyng god vanitie moreouer sclaunderously sett father agaynst v meane auncient father writer age yet vncorrupted though mainteners vngodlynesse whose authoritie debate ended better part victorie speake euen modestlie wold bend side wheras many thynges haue ben excellentlye well wisely written father thynges hath happened wont happen good naturall child forsothe accordyng rightenesse haue bothe witt iudgement mynde doo worship onely faultes error thynges well spoken eyther marke fayne knew corrupt man may say care altogether gather dong golde father oppresse v importunate cryeng agaynst v despisers ennemies father wee doo despise mater present purpose could easily proue consentyng voice greater part thynges say daye reade writynges alway remembre thynges serue v haue dominion ouer v christes alone whome muste obeye thynges withoute exception keepeth choise shall haue nothyng certaine religionpro xxlixxviii psal xlvxi forasmuch holye men ignorant many thynges doo oftentymes striue one yea sometymes fyghte themselues without cause say warned salomo passe old boundes whiche father haue sett one rule boundyng fieldes obedience faith ought framed forget people house father haue great delite vse allegory doo rather expound apostle father whoes appointed boundes lawfull plucke vp acatius tripartit hist lib cap ambros de offic lib cap siridio tripart hist lib cap tripart hist lib cap august de opere monach cap hierome expounde whoes woordes haue registred among canon haue boundes father whome meane stedfastly kept doo oft list licentiously passe number father whome one sayd god eateth drinketh therfore nedeth neither cuppes dyshes sayd holy thynges require golde thynges please golde whiche bought golde therefore passe bound holy thynges muche delited golde syluer yuory marble precious stone silkes thynke god rightly worshypped vnlesse altogether dissolutely set exquisite gorgeousnesse rather outragious excesse father whiche sayde therfore dyd freely eate fleshe daye absteined christian therfore passe boundes accurse soule tasteth fleshe lent father one sayd monke whiche laboureth handes iudged euell violent taker robber sayd lawful monkes lyue men goodes although continually busied contemplation prayer studie bounde also haue passed placed ydoll harrell bealies monkes stewes brothelhowses fatted meanes substance father said horrible abhominatio se image painted eyther christ sainte temple christian neither pronounced mouth one man alone epipha epist hiero versa concil ehbert cap ambros de abra lib cap gelasius pap concil roman chrysos cap ephes cali papa de co secr dist gelas ca loperimus de consecr dist cyprian epist lib de lapsis august lib de peccat mer cap vlt apolon eccles histo lib cap paphnutius tripart hist lib cap cypria epist lib august cap co tra rescon gra mat absteyned father stoutely mainteyneth christian people blood lorde ought denied confession wherof commaunded shedde owne blood boundes also haue taken away haue inuiolable law commauded selfe thyng one father punished excommunication reproued strong reason father whiche affirmed rashenesse determine thyng doutefull mater one side without cleere euident witnessyngs scripture bound forgot stablished many constitution many canon many maisterly determination without woord god father among heresy reproched montanus firste charged men lawes fastynges bounde also haue farre passed commaunded fastyng moste streyght lawes father whyche denied mariage ought forbidden minister chirch pronounced man lyeng owne wyfe chastitie father whiche agreed authoritie beyonde boundes haue gone seuerely enioyned vnmaried life theyr sacrificer father iudged onelye christe oughte heard sayd heare yt ought haue regard wer u haue sayd done christ ye first hath comaunded bounde neither doo appoynt themselues doo suffer haue appointed set bothe ouer themselues maisters whatsoeuer rather christe father whiche affirmed chirche ought sett self christe alway iudgeth truely iudges chirche men commonly deceaued breakyng bounde also sticke affirme whole authoritie scripture hangeth vppon awardement chirch father haue one harte accursed one mouth pronounced abhominable holy woorde god entangled suttleties sophisters brawlynges logitians doo holde themselues within boundes goe nothyng ell whole lyfe endlesse striues sophisticall brablynges wrappe encombre simplicitie scripture father nowe raysed lyfe agayn shoulde heare suche arte brawlyng whiche men call speculatiue diuinitie woulde beleue yt nothyng lesse doone disputation god talke shoulde sprede selfe beyonde due boundes yf woulde recken vp howe boldely menne shake yoke father whose obediente chyldren would seme truly bothe moneths yeares woulde lyttle yet extreme desperate shamelesnesse dare blame v sticke passe auncient boundes nowe wheras call v custome nothyng preuayle shoulde moste vniustly dealt driuen yelde custome truely iudgementes men right custome taken good oftentymes happeneth men doo otherwise whiche sene done many obteineth right custom state men hath scarcely time ben good case better thynges pleased greater numbre therefore parte priuate vice many hath made publike error rather comon cosent vice good men would haue stand law haue eye doo see onely one sea euels hath ouerflowed many poysonous pestilence haue inuaded worlde thynges runne hedlong ruine either mater men must vtterly dispeired decret dist ca si e de consuet must lay hand vnto rather vse violence vpon great euells remedy reason dryuen awaye haue nowe long tyme accustomed v euells publike error haue place matter common weale yet kyngdome god onely truthe heard regarded succedyng course yeares custome conspired agreement may prescription limitted olde tyme esase taught electe god say conspiryng thynges whiche people sayd conspiryngesa viiixii say conspire together wicked agreement people feare dread people feare rather sanctifie lorde hostes bee feare drede nowe therfore lett muche list obiect v bothe passed present age sanctifie lord hostes much afrayde whether many age haue consented like vngodlinesse strong take vengeance third fowerth generation whole worlde together conspire one selfe wickednesse hath experience taughte ende offende multitudegen viii heb xivii generall ouerflowyng destroy whole kynde men preseruyng noe small household faith beyng one man condemne whole worlde fynally euyl custome none common pestilence doo neuerthelesse dye dye company multitude epist lib epist ad julian de baptiza moreouer ought haue considered cyprian saith certaine place sinne ignorance although clere themselues al fault yet may seme maner excusable obstinatly refuse ye truthe offred grace god haue nothyng pretend excuse dooble horned argumente doo driue v harde streighte compell v confesse either chirch hath lyen dead certaine tyme haue controuersie chirche truely chirche christe hath lyued shall lyuemathe xxviiixx long christ shall reigne right hande father whoes hande vpholden whose succor defended whose power kepeth safetie wil vndoutedly performe hath one promised present euen vntill endyng worlde agaynste nowe haue warre doo one consent together people faithfull honor worshyp one god christ lorde like sorte hath alway ben worshipped godly themselues little way erre truthe acknowlege chirche see present eie go compasse boundes whiche enclosed uppon poyntes hangeth controuersie firste affirme forme chirche alway appearyng seen set forme see chirch rome order prelate contrary side affirme bothe chirche may consiste appearyng forme forme selfe conteined outwarde shynyng shewe whiche foolishely haue admiration hath farre marke namely pure preachyng worde god righte ministration sacramentes rage vnlesse chirche may alwayes pointed finger howe ofte happened fit people iewes deformed appered forme forme thinke haue shinedi kin x xi helias bewailed alone left log sin commyng christe hath lyen hidden without forme syns tyme hath ben oppressed warres sedition heresy shined side liued time wold haue beleued chirch sayd helias preserued seuen thousand men whiche boowed knee baal neither ought doutfull v christ hath alway reigned earth sin ascended heauen godly hadde sought discernable forme eies haue ben discoragedcontra verily hylarie accompted euen alredy tyme great fault beyng occupied foolishe admiration dignitie bishop marked deadly pestilence lurkyng vnder visor thus saythe one thyng warne beware antichrist yll taken loue walles ye yll worship chirch god house buyldynges vnder ye doo yll thrust name peace doutefull antichrist shall sitte mountayns wood lake prison caues safer prophetes either abydyng throwen prophecie doothe yt world day honor horned bishop thinketh holy prelate religion seeth head ouer great city away therfore foolishe estemyngii tim ii xix rather let v leaue lorde forasmuch alone knoweth sometyme also taketh away syght men outwarde knowlege chirch graut horrible vengeance god vpon earth wickednesse men deserue doo seke withstande iust vengeance god suche wise lorde hath time past taken vengeance vnthankfulnesse men wold receiue truthe quenched light suffred beyng blynded sense bothe mocked lie full absurditie drowned depe darknesse face true chirch seen yet meane tyme saued bothe beyng scattered abroade lyeng hydden myddest error darknesse destruction maruell skill saue bothe confusion babylon flame burnyng ouen wheras would haue forme chirche iudged wote vaine pompous shewe howe perillous wyll rather poynt vnto declare least draw tale infinite length pope say whiche holdeth apostolike see bishop annoynted consecrate hym trimmed fillet miter doo represent chirche ought taken chirche therfore erre pastor chirche consecrate lorde aaron ruler israel also pastorsexod xxxiiiiii aaron sonnes made prestes dyd yet erre made calfe reason shoulde fower hundred prophetes whiche lyed achab haue represented chirche chirche micheas sydei kin xxii xi ier xviii xviii beyng dede one man alone vnregarded whoes mouthe came truthe false prophetes resemblance beare bothe name face chirch one violent assaulte rise vp agaynst ieremie threatnyng boasted possible lawe perishe priest counsell wiseman woord prophet ieremie alone sente agaynste whole companie prophetes declare lord shoulde come passe lawe perishe priest counsell wiseman worde prophet suche glistering shewe shyne councell bishop scribe pharisee assembled take aduises together killyng christ nowe let go sticke faste outwarde visor may make christ al prophetes god schismatikes syde make minister satan instrumentes holy ghost speake thynke let faithfully answere nation place thinke chirch remained sin tyme decree councell basile eugenius thruste downe depriued estate pope aymee set place though would burst denye councell much concerneth outwarde solemnity lawfull summoned onely one pope two eugenius condemned schisme rebellion obstinatie whole flocke cardinal bishop whiche hym practised dissolution councell yet afterward beyng borne vp fauor prince recouered papacie safe againe election aymee orderly made authoritie generall holy synode vanished away smoke sauyng hymselfe appeased cardinalls hatte barking dog pece bread cast vnto hym bosome herelikes rebelles obstinates proceded pope cardinalls bishop abbotts prestes haue ben sin taken goe whether side geue name chirche wyll denye councell generall whiche wanted nothyng outwarde maiestie namely whiche beyng solemnely summoned two bulles well framed order thynges continued dignitie laste ende confesse eugenius companie schismatike whome sanctifeid therfore eyther let otherwyse define forme chirche many shalbe v accompted schismatikes whiche wittyngly willyngly haue ben ordered heretikes neuer ben knowen chirch bound outwarde pompes themselues may v large profe vnder glorious title ye chirch haue long proudly bosted themselues wheras yet deadly pestilence chirche speake maners tragicall dooynges wherewith theyr whole life swarmeth full say pharisee whiche bee heard folowed ye spare leysure reade writinges shall playnly know doctrine doctrine selfe whiche say chirche deadly butcherie soules firebrande ruine destruction chirche finally doo vprightly enough doo spitefully rehearse great trouble vprores contention preachyng doctrine hath drawen fruites beareth many blame euells vnworthily layde vpon ought rather haue ben imputed malice satan certayne naturall propretie worde god whensoeuer ryseth vp satan neuer quiet sleapyng moste sure moste trusty marke wherby discerned lyeng doctrine doo easyly shew foorthe themselues receiued fauorable eares men heard world reioysyng certayn age past thynges drowned depe darkenesse lorde worlde made sport play manner men lay ydle toke pleasure like certayne sardanapalus sounde peace ell doo laugh playe beyng quiet peasible possession kyngdome lyght shinyng aboue somwhat scattered abrode darknesse strog man troubled assailed kyngdome began shake wonted drowsinesse hastily arme first stirred vp force wherby might violently oppresse truthe beginnyng shine whiche nothyng preuailed turned suttle entrappynges stirred vp dissentions disagreementes doctrine catabaptistes monstruous lewde men wherby might darken lengthe vtterly quenche nowe continueth assayle bothe engine trauaileth bothe force power men plucke vp sede darnell much lieth choke may grow beare frute dothe vayne heare warnyng god hath long opened craftes vnto v shold take v vnware hath armed v sufficient defence agaynst al engins great maliciousnesse lay vpon worde god hatred either sedition noughty rebellious men stirre vp sectes deceiuers raise agaynst yet new example elia asked whether troubled israel christe esteemed iewes seditious man apostle accused makyng commotion among people thyng doo day father vpon v trouble vprores contention boyle vp agaynst v answered suchei king xviii elia hath taughte v namely wee scatter error stirre vp vprores themselues wrastle power god one thyng alone sufficient beate backe rashenesse agayne ought mete weakenesse oftentymes happen bee moued suche offence dismayeng wauer let ende may faynt dismayeng discoraged know apostle tyme felte experience thynges nowe happen vnto v vnlerned vnstedfast men wrested owne destruction thing yt paul writte inspiration godii pet iii xvi peter saith despisers god herd sinne abouded end yt grace might abound obiected abide sinne grace may abounde heard ye faithful vnder lawrom viietxv philip ixv answered sinne ar vnder law vnder grace accused exhorter euell entred priuily many false apostle destroy chirches builded enuie contention purely yea maliciously preached ye gospel thinking adde affliction bandes somewhere gospell muche profited al sought owne thynges iesus christe wente backwarde dogges vomite swyne wallowyng myre moste parte draw libertie spirit ye licentiousnesse ye flesh many brethre crept whome came afterwarde great danger godly among brother themselues many striues raised vp apostle haue doone case eyther haue dissembled tyme rather alltogether haue geuen ouer forsaken gospell sawe sedeplott many contentiosluke iixxxiiii ii corin iixvi mater many danger occasion many offence helpe suche distress came mynde christ stone stomblyng rocke offence set vnto ruine risyng agayne many signe spoken whiche affiance beyng armed went forward boldly danger vprores offence thought also ought vpholden forasmuch paule testifieth perpetuall propretie gospel fauor death vnto death perishe althoughe ordeyned vse fauor life vnto lyfe power god vnto saluation faithfull whiche verily also feele vnthankfulnesse corrupt singular benefit god turne owne destruction ought haue ben v onely defence safetie nowe returne soueraigne lord let false reportes nothing moue aduersaries trauail cast feare v sayeng thys new gospell call nothing hunted sought fitt occasion sedition vnpunished libertie vice god author diuision peace sonne god minister synne came destroy workes deuill vnworthily accused desire wherof neuer gaue suspition neuer small likely forsothe practise ouerthrowyng kyngdomes hath neuer ben heard one seditious worde whoes lyfe hath euer ben knowen quiet simple lyued vnder chaced home yet resse pray thinges prosperous kingdom likely forsothe yt hunt licetiousnesse vice whoes behauors although many thynges may founde faulty yet nothing worthy great reprochyng neither haue yl successe grace god profited gospell lyfe may backbyters examplar chastitie liberalitie mercy temperance patience modestie soeuer vertue verily proofe selfe euident doo vnfaynedly feare worshyppe god asmuche desire name halowed bothe life oure deathe enuy selfe compelled beare v witnesse innocence ciuile vprightnesse thys thyng punished death ought haue ben accopted singular praise vnder pretence gospell stirre vp tumultes hetherto hath ben founde haue ben realme pretende libertie grace god defende licentiousnesse vice sort haue knowen many lawes penalty lawes may accordyng deseruynges sharpely punished yet meane time gospel god euel spoken wickednesse naughty thus haue kyng venimous vniustice sclaunderors largely enough declared may wt eare easy belefe binde reportes feare also least largely set forasmuch thys preface maner come quantitie whole boke defense wherby entended make defense dede molify mind aforehand geue audiece ye disclosing cause mind though nowe turned away estranged v yea enflamed agaynst v yet trust shall able recouer fauor therof shall one haue without displeasure troublous affection red ouer confession stede defence v pour maiestie whisperynges malicious possesse eares yt place accused men speake themselues outragious fury doo still winkyng exercise crueltie prisonning tormenting cutting burning shal dede shepe appoynted slaughter brought extremity yet patience shall possesse soules wayte strong hande lord shal without dout present tyme stretche foorth selfe armed bothe deliuer poore oute affliction take vengeance despisers triuph great assurednesse lorde kyng kynges stablysh throne ryghteousnesse seate equitie moste noble kyng baule fyrst daye august yeare fyrst booke institvtion christian religion vvhich intreateth knovvledge god creatour pthe chapter knowledge god oure selues thynges conioyned howe bee lyncked one wyth whole summe manner wisedom ought acompted true perfecte wisedom consisteth two partes saye knowledge god selues two knowledge many bade linked together yet whether goth engedreth hard discerne fyrst man loke vpon selfe muste nedes turne hys sens beholdyng god lyueth moued playne giftes wherewith endewed selues yea euen yt yt haue beyng nothyng el essence one god finally good thynges droppe meale powred v heauen led certayne streames sprynge head nedines better appeareth infinite lety good thynges abydeth god speciallye miserable ruyne whereinto fall fyrst man hath throwen v compelleth v lyft vp eye onely beyng fodelesse hungry craue thence ye whych lacke also beynge awakened feare learne humility founde man certayne worlde misery synce haue bene spoyled diuine apparel oure shameful nakednesse discloseth infinite heape fylthy disgracementes must nedes euery man prycked knowledge conscience owne vnhappynes make come least vnto som knowledge god vnderstandyng igno aunce vanitie beggery weakenesse peruersenesse corruption learne reknowledge elles lorde abydeth trew lyght wysedome sound vertue perfecte aboundaunce good thyngs puritie ryghteousnesse owne euyls styrred consyder good thyngs god cannot earnestly aspyre toward hym vntyl begynne mislyke selues one would wyllyngly rest yea doeth rest long knoweth hym selfe saye longe contented wyth hys owne giftes ignoraunt vnmyndefull hys misery therfore euery man knowledge hym selfe prycked forwarde seke god also led hande fynde hym againe certaine man neuer commeth vnto true knowledge himselfe vnlesse haue firste beholden face god beholdinge thereof descende loke himselfe suche pride naturally planted v alwaye thinke oure selues righteous innocente wise holy vntill wyth manifest proues conuinced oure vnryghteousnes filthynes follye vncleannes conuinced thereof looke vpon oure selues onely vppon god also onely rule whereby iudgemente oughte tried naturally inclined hypocrisie therefore certayne vaine resemblaunce ryghteousnes doeth aboundantly contente v steade righteousnes dede appeareth nothing among v aboute v defyled wyth much filthines therefore whiche somewhat lesse filthy pleaseth v thoughe moste pure longe holde oure selues within boundes man vnclennesse lyke eye vsed see nothing blacke thinketh pure white whiche yet darkesh white brown yea may yet plainli discerne bodely sense much blinded cosidering ye power soule mid day either loke vpon ground behold thing round lye open eye thinke selues haue assured pearcing force sighte loke vp sonne behold wt fixed eye yt sharpnes great force vpon ye ground wt great brightnes daseled confounded yt ar compelled confesse sharpe sight consyderyng earthly thyngs whe commeth sonne mere dullnes euen cometh passe weying spyrytual good thyngs loke earth long wel contented wt righteousnes wisedom strength swetely flatter selues thynke v maner halfe god begin raise vp thought vnto god weie one exacte perfeccion hys ryghteousnesse wisedom power rule whereof oughte bee framed please v selues false pretece righteousnes shal become lothsome v greateste wyckednesse maruellously deceiue v vnder colour wisedome shal stinke v extreame follye whiche beare face strength shalbe proued miserable wekenesse sclenderly doth v semeth euen perfect answere proportion purenes god hereof proceded trembling amasednesse wherewith scripture many place reciteth holy men wer striken astonished ofte perceiued presence god se whiche absence stande assured vnmo ed sone discloseth hys glorye beginne quake dismayed fall downe yea swallowed vp manner destroyed feare death gathered thereby manne neuer sufficiently touched inwardly moued wyth knowledge owne basenesse vntil haue compared himselfe maiestie godiud xiiixxii esa viv e e suche dismaying haue often example bothe iudges prophetes common saying among people god shal die ye lord hath appeared vnto v therfore history iob throw men wt knowledge owne follye weakenesse vncleannesse bryngeth alwaye prinycpal profe describing god wisedome strength cleannes without cause see abraham nerer came beholde glory godgen xviii xvii k xixxiii esa xiiiixxiii esay iix xix better acknowledged hymselfe earth dust see elia could abide tary comming vncouered face terryble beholdyng hym may man corrupcion worme eue cherubins feare must hyde face euen thys prophete esay speaketh sunne shall blushe moone shalbe ashamed lord hostes shall reigne saye displayeth bryghtnes bryngeth nerer sight comparison therof bryghtest thyng shalbe darkened howesoeuer knowledge god selues ar wt mutuall knot lynked together yet ye order right teaching requireth first entreate knowledge god come speake knowledge selues p ii chapter pwhat knowe god ende tendeth knowledge hym meane knowledge god onely knowledge whereby conceyue somme god also wherby learne muche behoueth v know profitable glory finally much expedient speake properly cannot say god knowen relygion godlynesse dooe yet touche speciall kynde knoweledge whereby menne theymselues reproba e accursed dooe conceyue god redemer chryste mediatoure speake onely firste symple manner knowledge whervnto order nature woulde haue ledde v yf adam hadde continued state innocencye althoughe manne syth mankinde ruine perceiue god either father authour saluacion wise fauourable vnlesse christ come meane pacifie towarde v yet one thing fele god maker doth power sustein v prouidece gouerne v goodnes nourish v endue v al kindes blessinges thing embrace grace reconciliacio offered v christ wheras therfore lord fyrst simply appeareth well makinge world ye general doctrine scripture creator face christe redemer vpon arise two sortes knowing former entreated shal orderly folow ye place fit although minde cannot conceiue knowledge god muste geue hym kinde worship yet shall sufficient simply knowe onely oughte bee honoured worshipped menne vnlesse also perswaded fountaine al good thing ende shoulde seke nothing el meane hereby onely hath created worlde infinite power susteineth wisedome gouerneth goodnes preserueth speciallye mankinde ruleth righteousnes iudgement suffreth mercye saue gardeth defense also founde one droppe either wisedom lyght rightousnes power vprightnesse sincere trueth whiche floweth wherof cause ende verely shoulde learne looke craue thinges hande wyth thankesgeuing accompt receiued felinge power god v e scholemaster godlynes springeth religion godlines cal reuerece god ioined loue procured knowledge hys benefytes men wyll neuer willing obediece submit themselues god vntil thei perceiue owe thinges nourished fatherly care author al good thinges yt nothyng sought el hym yea neuer yelde themselues truly hart wholly hym vnlesse assuredly beleue hym perfect felicite reposed therefore doe tryfle vaine speculation entreating question make purpose discusse thyng god rather behoueth v knowe maner one agreeth nature ende serueth confesse epicure doeth god whych doth delyte self wyth ydlenesse hauing care world finally profiteth knowe god wyth may haue nothyng doo rather knowledge hym ought serue thys ende fyrst frame v feare reuerence guydynge teachyng v may learne craue good thynges hys hande accompt receiued hym anie thought god enter thy mind thou must therwithal thinck forasmuch thou art creature therfore thou art right subiect bonde authorite thou owest thy life whatsoeuer thou enterprisest whatsoeuer thou doest ought directed tr w trewly foloweth thy life peruersly corrupted framed obeyng asmuche ought law liue againe thou canst clerely se thou must nedes know yt fountayn original al good thyngs whervpon shulde grow desire cleaue vnto assured trust mannes corruptnes draw mind right serching hym first godly minde doth dreame ymagine selfe god aduenture stedfastly beholdeth ye one trew god doth falsely forge whatsoeuer selfe lyketh content beleue one discloseth self doth alway great diligence beware presumptuous rashnes passe beyond wyll wander way knoweth bicause vnderstandeth gouerneth al thing assuredlye trusteth safekeper defendour therfore wholly comitteth selfe fayth vnderstandeth yt author al good thing therfore thing trouble want thing flieth succoure loking helpe hande persuaded good mercifull therfore assured confidence resteth douteth al euils fynde ready remedy mercifull kindnes knoweth lorde father therefore determineth worthy shoulde thynges haue regard authoritie reuerence maiestie procure aduauncement glory obey commandementes seeth yt righteous iudge armed seueritie punish sinnes therfore alway setteth iudgement seate eies feare withdraweth restraineth selfe prouoking wrath yet afrayed felyng iudgement would conuey self although way open escape rather doeth lesse loue extendeth vengeauce vpon wicked beneficiall godly asmuche vnderstandeth doth lesse belong glory hath store punishment wycked euyl doer tha hath reward eternal life righteous moreouer doeth feare punishment refraine self synning loueth reuerenceth father attendeth honoureth lorde therefore although hel al yet dreadeth onely displeasure behold pure trew religion eue faith ioyned earnest feare god feare may conteine willyng reuerence drawe ryghte forme worshipping appointed lawe hedefully noted al men generally worship god fewe reuerence hym eche great pompous shewe ceremony purenesse heart rare founde truly iudge rightlye alwaye holde certayne grauen mindes men certaine feling godhead neuer blotted yea perswasion yt god euen generation naturally plated depely roted within bone obstinacy wicked substa ciall witnesse furious striuing yet neuer winde selues feare god although diagoras suche doe iest laugh al hath al age ben beleued cocerning religion although dionisius scoffe heauenly iudgement yet laughter teeth forward inwardly worme conscience gnaweth much sharpely tha al whose searyng yrons alledge cicero sayth yt error continuance tyme grow vse religion daily euer ase h waxeth better world little hereafter shall haue occasion shew trauaileth much lieth shake knowledge god al meanes corrupt worshipping onely say dul hardnes wicked desirously labor get despise god withal doth lie piningly harte yet feling god whyche woulde moste al desire haue vtterly destroied liueth still sometyme doeth vtter self whereby gather suche doctrine first learned scholes suche one whereof euery man teacher himselfe euen mother wombe suche one nature suffreth none forgette although many bend endeuoure shake mind almen borne liue end know god knowledge god fickle lyghtely vanisheth away vnlesse procede thus farre euident swarue kinde law creation direct marke al whole thoughtes dooynges lyfe whiche philosopher themselues ignorat phaedrone chaeetero plato meant nothyng el oftentymes taught soueraign good soule likenes god whe soule hauing throughly conceiued knowledge hym wholly transformed therfore aptly doth grillus reason plutarche affirmeth men religion take lyfe onely nothynge better brute beastes also many way muche miserable subiect many sortes euils continually draw fourth troublesome vnquiet life therfore worshipping god thyng maketh better brute beastes alone aspire immortalite p iii chapter knowledge god naturally planted myndes men holde oute controuersie mynde man euen naturall instinction certaine feling godhead end man flee pretense ignoraunce god himselfe hath planted men certaine vnderstanding diuine maiestie remembraunce wherof pouring nowe new droppes continually reneweth yt al one excepted know god maker may bee condemned owne testimonie haue bothe worshipped dedicate life truely knowyng god founde likely el example amonge grossest sortes people furthest ciuile order humanitie cicero de nat deo rum heathen man saith nation barbarous kind people sauage resteth persuasion god euen part lyfe seme litle differ brute beastes yet continually kepe certain sede religion throughly hath thys common principle possessed mennes mindes fast sticketh within men bowel sith beginning ye world hath ben cotrey citie yea house could without religion emplied certaine secrete confession feling godhead written heartes men yea ydolatrie selfe substanciall profe persuasion know vnwillingly man abaseth honour creature aboue hymselfe therfore rather worshyp blocke stone would thought haue god appeareth imprynted persuasio god great force impossible raced minde much easie haue affection nature broken deede broken man natural swellyng pride wyl stoupeth euen basest creature honour god wherfore vaine doe saye religion deuised sutteltie craft policie kepe simple people awe whereas themselues procured worship god beleued nothing lesse god al graunt dede yt suttle men haue inuented many thinges religion whereby bring people reuerence cast feare make mindes pliable obedience coulde neuer haue brought passe vnlesse mindes already hand perswaded god persuasion sede springeth ready inclinacion religion neither likely eue suttelly deceiued simple sort color religion themselues altogether without knowledge god though time past haue day arise vp many deny god yet whether wil oftentimes feele desierous know reade none euer breake forth presuptuous vnbridled despising god caius caligula yet none miserably trembled token god wrath appeared wil quaked fere wilful purpose endeuored despise ye may man commoly see happen bolder despiser god man troubled noise ye falling leafe whense commeth reuengement god maiestie doeth much vehemently strike conscience labor fly away dede loke al starting hole maie hide themselues presence lord whether wil stil holde faste tied howsoeuer sometime semeth vanish away momente yet ofte returneth againe newe assaulte doeth runne vpon reste whiche haue haue torment conscience much like slepe drunkardes phrenetike men euen slepe quietely reste euery momente vexed horrible dredfull dreames therfore vngodly themselues serue example proue yt alway liueth al men mindes knowledge god iiii chapter thesame knowledge either choked corrupted partly ignoraunce partly malice experience teacheth yt god hath sowen ye sede religion al scarcely may found ye hundreth yt hauing co ceiued hart doth cherish ripeneth farre frute appereth due tyme therefore whether become vaine owne superstition doe sette purpose maliciously reuolte god yet runne kynde true knowledge hym cometh passe remaineth true godlynes worlde saide errour fall superstition meane therby though simplicitie myghte excuse blame bycause blindenes haue commonly alway myngled bothe proude vanitie stubburnes uanitie ioyned pride appereth myserable men bothe seekyng god doo clymbe aboue selues ought haue done measure hym accordyng proportion owne fleshly dulnes also neglecting perfect maner searching curiously flye vaine speculation conceiue hym suche one offreth hym selfe doo imagine hym suche one owne rashe presumption haue forged hym whyche gulfe beeyng one opened waie soeuer stirre fete muste nedes alway runne headlonge destruction soeuer afterwarde go towarde worshippyng seruice god accompt doone hym bycause worshyp hym rather deuise owne heartro ixxii owne dreame stede hym peruersnesse doo paule expressely touche sayth made fooles coueted bee wyse sayde made vayne imagination least man shuld thereby excuse theim blame addeth worthyly blynded bycause contented sobrietie presumptuously takyng vpo theselues ought wylfully bryng darknesse vpon yea vayne froward pride make selues fooles whervpon foloweth foolishnesse excusable wherof cause onely vayne curiositie also gredynesse knowe e ioined false confidence dauid sayth wicked madde men thynke harte god fyrst ment onely chokyng light natureps xiiii purpose make selues senselesse shall see agayne lyttle hereafter euen see many haue bene hardened boldenesse custome sinnyng furiously put al remembrance god yet feelyng nature inwardly ministred vnto mynds nowe dauid make madnesse detestable bryngeth though precisely denied god although take beyng takyng hym hys iudgemente prouidence shutte hym vp ydle heauen nothyng lesse agreeth nature god throwe awaie gouernement world leaue fortune wynke synnes men may lyue lycentious outrage vnpunished whosoeuer bee quenchyng feare heauenly iudgement dothe carelessely folowe owne affection denieth god iust vengeance god draw fatnesse ouer harte wicked haue one closed theyr eyespsal xxxviii euen seeyng may see dauid place best expounder meanyng saith feare god eies wyckedpsa xxi agayn euil doinges proudely reioyce selues bycause persuade selfes ye god doth loke vpon therfore although copelled acknowledge som god yet rob glory withdrawyng fro power god paule witnesseth deny hym selfeii tim iixiii bycause continually abydeth like hym self truly sayd men faynyng god dead vayne ymage deny god moreouer noted yt although wrastle theyr naturall felyng desire shake god fro thense also destroye hym heauen yet dull hardnesse neuer farre preuayle god sometyme draweth backe iudgemente seate forasmuche withholden feare runnyng violently agaynst god therfore certayn reigneth theim brutisshe forgetfulnesse god longe blinde pang rage dooeth forcibly cary vayn defence ouerthrowen many wont pretende excuse superstition thynke deuotion religion suffiseth soeuer thoughe neuer much contrary order truthe consyder true religion ought framed according wil god perpetual rule god hymselfe abydeth alway like hym selfe imagined ghost fantasy may diuersly fashioned euery man lykyng truely may playnly se lying deceites superscition mocketh god goeth aboute doo hym pleasure catchyng holde thynges maner whiche god hath testified careth either contemptuously vseth openly refuseth thinges appoynteth saithe pleasant vnto hym therefore whosoeuer dooe sette vp newe inuented formes worshippyng god wourship honour owne dotyng deuises bycause durste trifle god vnlesse fyrste fayned god agreyng folie triflynge toyes wherefore apostle pronouncethgala iiii viii vnstayed wandryng opinion maiestie god ignorance god sayth ye knewe god ye serued nature goddes place saythep ii xii ephesian without god suche tyme strayed right knowledge one god least case differeth muche whether thou beleue one god many bothe case thou departest forsakest true god thou hast one forsaken ther nothing left thee detestable ydoll foloweth therfore must determyne lactantius lawfully allowable religion ioyned truthe also seconde fault neyther haue tyme consideration god againste willes approche towarde hym til holdynge backe forcibly drawen hym euen also haue willynge feare procedeth reuerence goddes maiestie onely seruile constrained feare whiche iudgement god wringeth iudgement bycause escape therfore dread yet therwithall abhorre saying statius feare fyrst made goddes worlde may fittly spoken vngodlynes kynde vngodlynes onely haue mynde abhorryng iustice god hartily wishe haue throne iudgement ouerthrowen whiche knowe stande punishement offence iustice whiche affection warre agaynst god whoe without iudgement vnderstande power impossible bee auoyded hangeth ouer bycause neither force remoue flyghte escape therfore feare least thynges seme despise hym whose maiestie still preasseth vpon vse certayne outwarde forme religion suche meane tyme ceasse defile selues wiht kynde vice ioyne outragious mischeues mischeues vntyll haue poyntes violate holy lawe lorde destroyed whole righteousnesse least holden backe fained feare god swetely rest sinnes flatter theimselues rather folowe ye intemperance flesshe restraine bridle holy ghoste muche voyde lying shadowe religion yea scarcely worthy called shadowe hereby agayne easyly gathered howe muche true godlynesse whiche powred harte faithful meane whiche religion spryngeth doothe differ confuse knowledge god yet hypocrite would obteyne crooked compass seeme nye vnto god whome fle ought haue bene one continued vnbroken course obedience whole lyfe maner doynges carelessely rebellyng agaynst hym labour fewe sacrifice appease hym oughte haue serued hym holynesse lyfe syncerenes hart inuent triflynges obseruances value procure fauour withall yea doo licentiousely lye dull dregges bycause trust yt may discharged wt mockery propitiatory satisfaction finally affiaunce ought haue fastened hym neglectyng hym doo reste themselues creature length entangle theym selues suche heape erroures yt darke myste malice doothe choke laste vtterly quenche sparkes glimmeryngly shyned make see glory god yet sede still remaineth whiche meane plucked vp rote beleue ther certain godhead sede corrupted bryngeth forth none euyl fruites yea therby whiche trauaile proue certainly gathered felyng godhead naturally grauen harte men forasmuche reprobate selues necessitie enforced confesse quiet prosperitie pleasauntely mocke god yea full talke pratynge diminysshe greatnesse power yf one desperation touche stirreth vp seke god mynistreth sodeyn shorte prayer whiche may appeare vtterly ignoraunt god whyche ought sooner haue ben vttered obstinacie suppressed v chapter pthat knowledge god doeth shiningly appeare makyng world continual gouernement thereof moreouer furthest ende blessed life standeth knowledge god way felicite stopped none therefore god hath onely planted mindes men sede religion haue spoken also hath disclosed selfe whole workmanship ye world daily manifestly presenteth himselfe men cannot open eies must nedes beholde substance dede incomprehensible diuine maiestie farre surmounteth men sens hath al workes grauen certain mark glory plaine notably discernable excuse ignorance taken away men neuer grosse dull wittedps cxiiii therfore prophete rightfully crieth oute clothed light garment haue said first began come forthe seen visible apparell since tyme first displaied ensignes creacion world eue way soeuer turne eies appereth glorious vnto v place also prophete aptly compareth heauens displaied abrode roiall pauilion saieth hath framed parloures water cloudes chariottes rideth vpon winges windes wind lightninges swift messenger glorye power wisedome doeth fully shine aboue therefore commonlye heauen called palace first al way soeuer thou turne thy eye pece world neuer small wherein seen least som sparkle glory shine large beautiful frame thou canst one view peruse ye wide compasse thou muste nedes euery side ouerwhelmed infinite force ye brightnes therof wherfore author epistle hebrues doeth well call age worlde spectacle inuisible thingeshe xiiii orderly framing ye world serueth v mirror wherin may beholde god whiche otherwise inuisible whiche cause prophete assigneth heauenlye creature language al nation vnderstandepsa xix ther euident testificacion godhead ought escape consideration nation neuer dull thing apostle declaring plainely saieth disclosed vnto men much behouefull knowen concernyng godrom ixix men without exception throughly see inuisible thing euen power godhead thei vnderstande creation worlde wonderful wisedom innumerable proues bothe heauen earth witnesse meane secreter sort thinges nerer marking whereof astrologie physike naturall philosophie serueth euen thinges thruste selues sighte euery one euen rudest vnlerned man men open eies thei muste nedes bee witness truely haue digested yea tasted liberall artes holpen ayde therof procede much looke secretes god wisedome yet man hindred lack knowledge artes throughly seeth abundantly inough conning workmanship god workes bring admiration workma therof example searching mouings starres apointing place measuring distance noting property nedeth art exacter diligence throughly perceaued prouidence god manifestly disclosed coueniet mynde rise somwhat hier therby behold glory asmuch vnlearned people yea rudest sort ar furnished helpe eye ignoraut ye excellencie god conning workmanship innumerable yet seuerally well ordered disposed varietie doth selfe shew forth selfe euident ther man god doth largely ope wisdom likewise requireth singuler sharpnes wit wey suche cunning galen doth yn l b de vsu part knitting together ye proportional agremet beautie vse frame man body men confession body man doth vtter shew self cunning copacting together maker may worthily iudged wonderfull therefore certaine philosopher olde tyme dydde without cause calle manne littell worlde rare representation power goodnes wisedome god conteyneth hym selfe miracle inough occupie myndes yf content marke themact xviixxvii thys reson paul said blinde men may finde god groping saieth yt sought far al men fele vndoutedly wt themselues heauenly grace wherwt quickened nede go selues find take hold god pardon shal slouthfulnes deserue wil vouchsafe descend find godps viii v reason dauid shortly spoken aduauncement wonderful name honor god euery gloriously shine crieth man thou art mindful mouth infantes suckyng babe thou hast stablished strength pronounceth whole kinde man mirrour woorkes god also infantes whyle yet hange mother brestes haue tonges eloquent ynough preache glory nedeth oratours therfore douteth set theyr mouthes vauwarde beeyng strongly armed subdue madnes ye would accordyng deuilysh pride couet extinguish ye name god herevpon riseth whiche paule alledgeth aratusact xviixxviii ofsprynge god garnishyng v suche excellencie hathe testified oure father lyke euen common reason information experience prophane poetes called father men truelye man assentingly willingly yeld self serue god hauing tasted fatherly loue mutually allured loue worship disclosed foule vnthankefulnesse men thei haue within selues workhouse gloriously furnished innumerable workes god also shoppe stuffed inestimable plentie rich ought burst forth praisynge contrarye wise puffed vp doe swell wyth much greater pride fele diuersly marueylous wise god woorketh taught experience self great varietie giftes possesse liberalitie whether wyll noe enforsed knowe token godhead yet suppresse close within truely neede goe oute themselues would presumptuously taking vpon theselues geuen heauen bury grounde brightly giueth light mindes se god euen day earth beareth many monstreous spirites sticke abuse whole sede godhead sowen man nature employ oppresse name god detestable pray madnes man finding god hundred time body soule pretense excellece deny god wil say chaunse made differente brute beastes pretende cloke nature accompte maker al thinges doe conuey god awaye see exquysyte workemanship al member mouth eye euen nailes toaes yet also putte nature place god specially swift motion excellent power rare giftes soule represent diuine nature doth easily suffer selfe hid vnlesse epicurean like gyauntes cyclops wold bearing themselues bolde vppon hye degre outrageously make warre againste god whole treasure heauenly wisedome mete together rule worme fiue fete long shal whole vniuersalitie ye world wtout prerogatiue firste agree certaine instrumentall thing aunswereth partes man doth serue nothing al obscure honor god rather doeth gloriously set let epicure answer meting vndiuisible bodyes boiling meate drinke man doth dispose part excrementes part bloud bringeth passe al member man endeuorynge offyce eue many seueral soules comon aduise rule one body haue nowe doe ye swyne rather speake vnto geuen suttelties would croked conueiaunce wrythe colde saying aristotle bothe destroye immortalitie soule also take god hys ryghte ar instrumental power soule pretense thereof bynde soule bodye cannot continue without bodye praise nature doo much suppresse name god power soule farre beeinge enclosed exercise serue body pertayneth body man measure skye gather number starres lerne greatenes euery one knowe space distante one swiftnes slownesse goe course many degree decline way way graut dede vse astrologie meanyng onely shewe depe serching heauenly thyngs instrumental measuring soule hath office selfe seuerall body haue shewed one example whiche shalbe easy reader gather reste truely manyfolde nimblenes soule surueieth bothe heauen earthe ioyneth thynges past thing come kepeth memory thinges heard long expresseth eche thing selfe imaginacion also ingeniousnesse inuenteth thinges incredible mother many maruelons artes sure token diuine nature man beside euen slepyng doeth onely rolle tourne self also conceiueth many thinges profytable reasoneth many thynges also prophecieth thyngs come shal case say signes immortalitie emprinted man cannot blotted reason may beare man shalbe diuine nature acknowledge creator shall forsoth iudgement put v discerne betwene right wronge shall iudge heauen shall euen slepe haue abiding v remnant vnderstandyng shall god waking gouernyng worlde shall compted inuenters many artes profitable thynges god shalbe defrauded praise yet experience sufficiently teacheth selues haue diuerse wise distributed amonge v babble secrete inspiracion geueth lyuelines worlde onely weake also vngodly lyke well famous saying uergile aene vifyrst heauen earth flovvyng fieldes sea shinyng globe moone ti an starres sprite fedes vvithin throughout lymmes infused mynde vvhole huge masse dooth moue vvith large bigge body mixe selfe thense come kyndes men eke beastes lyues fliyng foules monster straunge vvater beares vvithin marble sea fyry lyuelynesse heauenly race vvithin seedes c forsothe world created spectacle glory god shuld creator selfe place author folowyng common opinion greekes latynes sayeth say bee haue part mynde diuine geo iiiiand heauenly draughtes eke say god gothe coastes lande crekes sea depe skye hense flockes heardes men kyndes sauage beastes eche byrthe receyue theyr suttle lyues therto rendred laste resolued retournde agayne ne place deathe lyuely flye nombre starres aboue take place vvithin lofty skye loe hungry speculacion vniuersall minde geueth soule liuelines world auaileth engender nourishe godlines harte men whiche doeth also better appeare blasphemous saying filthy dogge lucretius deriued principle euen thys make shadowishe god driue farre away true god whome ought feare worshyp graunt dede may godlily sayed procede godly minde nature god hard vnproper maner speche forasmuch nature rather order prebed god therfore thynges great weight due singular religiousnes hurtfull wrapp vp god confusely inferior course workes let v therefore remember ofte man considereth owne nature one god gouerneth al nature wil haue v loke vnto hym fayth directed hym hym bee worshypped called vpon v nothing agaynst conuenience reason tha v enioy excellent gyftes sauoure diuine nature v despise authoure freely doeth geue theym vnto v nowe concernynge power howe notable example dothe forceably drawe v consider vnlesse perhappes may ignoraunt howe great strengthe onely woorde vpholde infinite masse heauen earth onely becke sometyme shake heauen wt noise thonders burne vp ech thing wt lightening set aire fier wt lightning flame sometime trouble diuerse sortes tempestes god list one moment make faire wether holde sea hanged aire heighth semeth threaten cotinuall destruccion earth sometime horrible wise raise vp outragious violence windes sometime appease waues make calme againe profe hereof serue prayses god gathered testimony nature speciallye booke iob esaie whiche purpose ouerpasse shall el haue place fitter shall entreate creacion world accordyng scripture meanyng touch straungers householde god haue way seking god common folow first draughtes aboue beneth doe shadow set fourth liuely image power leadeth v consider eternitye must nedes al thinges haue beginning eternal continuaunce hath beginning self nowe enquire cause wherby lead create al thing moued preserue shal fynde goodnesse caused yea although onely cause yet ought aboundauntly suffice allure v loue forasmuch ther creature prophete sayeth vpon mercy poured outpsa cxlv ix also seconde sorte woorkes meane come passe byside ordinary course nature doeth appeare lesse euident profe power gouerning felowship men ordereth prouidence wheras innumerable meanes good bountifull al men yet manifest dayly token declareth fauourable kindnes godly seuerite wicked euill doer doutefull punishmentes layeth vppon hainous offence lyke doeth openly shewe hymself defendoure reuenger innocencye prospereth lyfe good menne wyth hys blessynge helpeth necessitye asswageth comforteth sorowes relieueth calaunties al meanes prouideth safety neyther ought thyng deface perpetuall rule iustice oftentymes permitteth wicked men euill dooers tyme reioyse vnpunished side suffreth good innocent tossed wyth many aduersities yea oppressed malice vniust dealing vngodly rather much contrary consideracion ought enter mindes manifest shewe wrath punisheth one sinne shoulde therefore thinke hateth sinnes suffereth many sinnes passe vnpunished vpon thinke ther shalbe iudgemente differed bee punyshed likewise great matter doth minister v cosider mercy oftentimes cesseth shew vnweried boutifulnes vpon miserable sinner calling home fatherly tendernes vntil haue subdued frowardnes doinge good ende prophete particularly rehearseth god case paste hopepsa xvii doeth sodenly wonderfully beside hope succoure men misery maner lost whether defende wandering wildernes wild beastes length leadeth way againe ministreth sode nedy hungry deliuereth prisoner horrible dongeons iron bandes bringeth men peril shipewracke safe hauen healeth half dead disease scorcheth earth heate drienesse maketh frutefull secrete watering grace aduaunceth hasest rascall people throweth noble peres ye hie degree dignitie example shewed fourth gathereth thinges iudged chaunces happening fortune many testimony heauenly prouidece specially hys fatherly kindnes therby geuen matter reioysing godlye wicked reprobate haue mouthes stopped greater part infected error blinde clere place beholding therfore cryeth gift rare singular wisedome wisely weye workes god syghte whereof nothing profit otherwise seme clere sighted truly much soeuer glory god doothe apparantly shyne yet scarsly hundreth manne trewe beholder likewise power wisedome hidde darkenesse whereof one power doth notably appere fierce outragiousnesse wicked beynge mennes opinion vnconquerable beaten flatte one momentepsa cxiiivii arrogancie tamed strongest holdes rased weapon armour broken piece strengthes subdewed deuises ouerthrowen theimselues fall owne weighte presumptuous boldenesse auaunced selfe aboue heauens throwen downe euen bottome point earth agayne lowly lyfted vp duste needy raysed donghil oppressed afflicted drawen extreme distresse men despayred state restored good hope vnarmed beare awaye victorie armedi cor iiixix fewe frome many feeble strong wysedome selfe sheweth selfe manifestly excellent disposeth euery thing fittest oportunitie confou deth wisedom worlde neuer pearcyng fyndeth subtile subtiltie finally gouerneth thinges moste conuenient order see needeth long laboursom demonstration fetche testimony serue glorious declaration profe god maiestie haue touched appeareth way soeuer man chance looke comon ready may easily marked eye pointed fynger noted ar called knowledge god contented vayne speculation doth flye brayne suche shall sounde fruitfull yf rightly conceyued take roote heartes lorde declared power force wherof fele within v doo enioy benefites muste nedes inwardly moued muche liuely suche knowledge shoulde imagine god bee suche one whome shulde haue feelyng whereby vnderstande rightest waye fittest order seeke god attempt entre depely presumptuous curiositie throughely discusse substance whiche rather reuerently woorshipped scrupulousely searched rather behold hym workes whiche maketh hym selfe nere familiar doothe maner communicate hym selfe vnto v apostle mente saydacte xviixxvii psa cxlv god sought afarre forasmuche moste present power dwelleth within euery one v wherfore dauid hauyng confessed vnspeakeable greatnesse descendeth particular rehersall woorkes protesteth wyll shewe foorth selfe therfore also ought geue selues vnto suche searchyng god maye holde witte suspended admiration may therwithall throughely moue v effectuall feelyngein psal cxliiii augustine teacheth place able conceiue hym behoueth v faintyng vnder burdeyne greatnesse looke vnto workes may refreshed goodnesse suche knowledge ought stirre v vp worshyppyng god also awake v rayse v hope life come consyder suche exaumples god sheweth bothe hys mercyfulnesse hys seueritie begunne halfe full without doubt muste thynke herein doothe make shewe aforehande thynges whereof open disclosynge full delyueraunce differred vnto lyfe syde see godly vngodly greued affliction troubled iniuries oppressed sclaunders vexed despitefull dealynges reproches contraryewyse wicked dooers doo flourishe prosper obteyne quiet honour yea vnpunished must gather shall bee lyfe wherin layde vp store bothe dewe reuenge wyckednesse rewarde rightuousnesse moreouer note faythfull often chastised roddes lorde may moste certaynly determyne muche lesse vngodly shall escape scourge de clui dei cap viii wel spoken augustin euery synne shoulde nowe punished open peyne woulde thought nothynge reserued laste iudgement agayne yf god shoulde nowe openly punyshe synne would beleued prouidence god therfore muste confesse euery particular woorke god principally vniuersall generalitie power god sette foorthe paynted table whyche mankynde prouoked allured knowledge hym knowledge full perfecte felicitie power doo workes moste bryghtly appeare yet principally tende vnto valoure bee ende ought waie onely atteyne vnderstande descende selues doo consider meanes god dooth shewe foorthe v lyfe wysedom power dothe vse towarde v ryghteousnesse goodnesse mercyfull kyndenesse though dauid iustly complayneth vnbeleuynge doo dote follypsa xciivii weye deepe counsailes god gouernance mankynde yet also moste true whiche sayth place wonderfull wysedom god behalfe excedeth heares heade poincte shall hereafter place conuenient largely entreatedps xlxiii therfore doo tyme passe ouer howe great bryghtnesse soeuer god doothe myrrour woorkes shewe representation bothe hymselfe immortall kyngedome yet suche oure grosse blockysshenesse stande dully amased playne testimony passe awaye v without profyte touchynge frame beautyfull placynge worlde howe many one v eyther lyfteth vp eye heauen casteth diuers countreys earth doothe directe mynde remembraunce creatour doothe rather rest beholdynge woorkes withoute hauynge regarde woorkemanne touchynge thynges dayely happen besyde order naturall course howe manye one dooth thynke menne rather whyrled aboute rowlled blynde vnaduisednesse fortune gouerned prouydence god yf tyme guidyng direction thynges dryuen consideration god menne muste nedes yer soone haue without aduisemente conceiued feling som godheade slyde awaye dotage erronious inuencions fleshe vanitie corrupt pure veritie god herein dede differ one euery man priuately hym selfe procureth hym selfe peculiar errour poynte moste lyke together one excepted doo departe one trewe god monstruous trifle disease onely common grosse wittes subiect also moste excellent otherwyse endewed singular sharpnes vnderstandyng entangled howe largely hath whole sect philosopher bewrayed dulnesse beastlye ignoraunce behalfe passe ouer rest whyche muche vnreasonably foolyshe plato himselfe religious moste sober reste vaynely erreth round globe nowe myghte chaunce chiefe whoes parte geue lyghte reste doo themselues erre stumble lykewise goddes gouernaunce mennes matter doth playnely proue prouidence denyed yet doothe preuayle menne yf beleued thynges tossed vp downe rashe fortune great inclination vanitie erroure speake nowe altogither moste excellente common sorte whoes madnesse hath infinitely wandered prophanynge truthe god hereof procedeth vnmeasurable synke errours wherewith whole worlde hath bene fylled ouerflowen eche mannes witte hymselfe maze meruaile euery seuerall nation diuersely drawen seuerall deuises onely also eche seuerall man hadde seuerall god hym selfe sin rashe presumption wantonnesse ioyned ignoraunce darknesse hath ben scarcely tyme one manne founde dydde forge hym selfe ydole fansye stede god truly euen wide large spring issue water infinite numbre god hath flowed wit man euery man ouer licentiousely strayeng erroniousely deuiseth concernyng god hym selfe yet nede make register superstition wherwith worlde hath ben entangled bycause bothe soo dooynge shoulde neuer haue ende also thoughe speake one woorde theym yet many corruption sufficiently appeareth howe horrible blyndenesse man mynde passe ouer rude vnlearned people amonge philosopher whiche enterprysed reason learnyng pearce unto heauen howe shamefulle disagreement hygher wytte theym endewed fylled arte scyence muche glorious coloures seemed painte opinion whiche notwithstandynge yf one dooe narowely looke vppon shall fynde theim vanishyng false colour stoikes seemed theyr owne conceipte speake wysely partes nature may gathered diuers name god yet god beyng one therby torne sonder though already enough enclined vanitie vnlesse manifolde plentie god set v violently drawe v errour also egyptian mysticall science diuinitie sheweth diligently endeuored ende seeme erre without reason possible fyrst syght thyng semyng probable might deceyue symple ignorant mortall man euer inuented thing wherby religion hath ben fowly corrupted confuse diuersitie emboldned epicure grosse despisers godlynesse little little cast al felyng god saw wisest striue contrary opinion sticked disagreementes foolishe apparantly erronious doctrine eche theym gather men doo vayne fondly procure tormentes selues whyle serche god whiche none thought myghte freely doo without punishement better brefely denye vtterly god fayne vncertayn god rayse vp contention neuer shuld haue ende muche fondly doo reason rather cast myst hide vngodlynesse ignoraunce men whereby reason thyng shoulde taken away god forasmuche confesse nothyng whiche bothe learned vnlerned doo muche disagree thervpon gathered wittes men dull blynde heauenly misteries erre seekyng god doo praise answere symonides beyng demaunded kyng hieron god desired haue day respite graunted studye vpon next day folowyng kyng demaunded question requyred two day respite oftentymes doublyng numbre day length answered howe muche consyder muche harder ye matter semeth vnto grauntyng dyd wisely suspende sentence darke matter yet hereby appearethe yf men taught nature know nothyng certainly soundly plainly concernyng god onely tyed confused principle worshyp vnknowen god nowe must also holde corrupt pure religion must nedes doo geuen opinion depart one god wil boast meanyng otherwise meane persuade selues maketh muche matter sith holy ghoste pronounceth apostate accordyng darknes owne mynde thrust deuyls place godep iixii reason paule pronounceth ephesian without god tyll hadde learned gospell worshyp true god must thinke bee spoken one nation onelyro ixxi muche generally affyrmeth place menne become vayn imagination syns creation worlde maiestie creatour disclosed vnto therefore scripture make place true one onely god condemneth falsehod lying whatsoeuer godhead olde tyme celebrate among gentile leaueth god mounte syonabacuk iixviiixx ioh iiiixxii flourished peculiar knowledge god truely among gentile samaritan christes time semed approche nighest true godlynesse yet heare spoken christes owne mouthe knewe worshipped whervpon foloweth deceyued vayne error fynally althoughe infected grosse fautes fell open idolatry yet true approued religion grounded onely vppon comon reason fewe madde common people yet doctrine paule remayneth certainely truei cor iiviii prince worlde conceiue wisedome god nowe yf moste excellent haue wandred darknesse sayde dregges wherefore meruayle holy ghoste doo refuse bastarde worshippynges formes fo woorshipping deuised men bycause heauenly misteries opinion conceiued witt men although alway breede heape erroures yet alwaye mother erroure thoughe come worse yet small fault aduenture worshyp vnknowen godiohn iiiixxii whiche fault christes owne mouthe pronounced guilty taughte lawe god ought worshyp truely best lawmaker euer proceded saie religion grounded vpon comon consent yea xenophon socrates praised answere apollo wherin willed euery shuld worship god maner countrey custome owne citie came mortall men power owne authoritie determine whiche farre surmounteth worlde reste decree elder common ordinaunces people receaue withoute doutynge god deliuered mannes deuise euery man rather stand owne iudgement yeld hym self wil sith therfore weake feble bonde godlynesse worshippyng god folow either custom citie cosent antiquitie remayneth god self must testify self heauen vayne therfore many lampes lightned doo shyne edifice worlde shew forth glory creatour euery way display beames vpon v yet selues bryng v right way deede raise vp certaine sparkle suche choked vp spreade abrode anye full brightnesse
