therfore apostle place calleth age worlde image thynges inuisible sayth faithe perceyued framed worde god meaning therby yt inuisible godhed dede represeted shewesheb xiiii yt haue eies see throughly vnles enlightued reuelation god faith paule teacheth creation world disclosed knowen concerning god doth meane disclosyng may comprehended witte men rather sheweth procedeth make vnexcusable paule alsoact xvii xxvii act xiii xvi although one place sayth god sought afarre one yt dwelleth within v yet place reacheth end nerenesse auayleth age past sayth god suffred nation walke way yet lefte hym selfe without testimonie doyng good heauen geuyng showres fruitefull season fillyng harte men foode gladnesse howsoeuer therfore lorde bee withoute testimonie whyle greate manyfolde bountyfulnesse sweetely allureth men knowledge hym yet cesse folowe owne way say damnable errours although want naturall power wherby clymbe vp vnto pure cleare knowledge god yet bycause faulte dulnesse selues therfore colour excuse cutte away v pretende ignorance euen conscience dothe stil condemne v slouthfulnesse vnthankfulnesse defence forsoothe right woorthy receyued man alledge wanted eares heare truth publishyng wherof dombe creature haue lowde voyces yf man shall say see thynges eye whyche creature without eye doo shewe hym yf man shall laye excuse feblenesse witte creature without reason doo instructe hym wherfore sithe thynges doo shewe v right way worthily put excuse wanderyng strayeng way howe soeuer imputed fault men dooe corrupt sede knowledge god sowe theyr mindes meruailous workemanshyp nature groweth good cleane fruite yet moste true sufficiently instructed bare simple testimonie creature honourably declare goodes glory soone haue taken beholdyng worlde smalle taste godhead leauyng true god doo steade hym rayse vp dreames fansies oure owne brayne doo conuey hyther thyther true fountayne prayse ryghtousnes wysedom goodnes power moreouer doo either obscure yll estemyng depraue daily doynges take away bothe glorye authour due praise pthe vi chapter atteyne god creatour nedefull haue scripture guyde maistresse therefore althoughe brightnesse heauen earth shineth eies al men doth sufficiently take away al defense fro wickednesse euen god wrappe al mankind one giltinesse doeth shewe diuine maiestie al withoute excepcion wer portraied creature yet necessary haue also better helpe may rightly direct v creator world therfore vayne hath added light worde therby mought knowen saluacion prerogatiue hath vouchesaued geue v pleased nerely familiarly draw together himselfe saw mindes al men carried aboute wandering vnstedfast motion chose iewes peculiar flocke compassed barres wander vanitie withoute cause holdeth v meane true knowledge himselfe otherwise euen quickly swarue away seme stand stedfast comparison olde men poore blind whose eies ar dimme sighted lay faire boke though perceiue somewhat written therin yet reade two word together holpen spectacle set betwen begin reade distinctlye scripture gathering vp together mindes knowledge god whiche otherwise confused doeth remoue mist plainly shewe v true god therefore singular gifte instruccion church god vseth onely dumme teacher also openeth owne holye mouth onely publisheth god bee worshipped also withal pronounceth god oughte worship doeth onely teache electe loke vpo god also presenteth himselfe vnto loked vppon thys order hath kept fro beginning towarde churche beside common instruccions geue also hys worde whiche righter certainer marke knowe douted yt adam noe abraham rest father help attained familiar knowledge made wer seuerally differente vnbeleuers speake yet proper doctrine faith wherwith wer enlightened hope eternall life myght passe death life nedefull knowe god creatoure also redemer doutlesse obteined worde kinde knowledge wherby geuen vnderstande god worlde made gouerned order came inwarde knowledge adioined onely quickeneth dead soules wherby god knowen onely maker worlde onely authour iudge thinges done also redemer person mediatour yet come fal world corrupcion nature omit also entreate remedy therof therefore let reader remember yet speake couenaunt whereby god hath adopted hymselfe child abraham specyal parte doctrine wherby faithful haue alway peculiarly seuered fro prophane nation doctrine founded vpon christ speake ought learne scripture god creator world certaine markes seuerallye discerned counterfait multitude false god order selfe shal conueniently bring v redemer although shal allege may testimony new testamet also ye law prophetes wherin expresse mencio made christ yet shall al tende ende proue scripture disclosed vnto v god creator world scripture set foorth ought thinke end seke ye busy vncertaine godhead whether god knowen father oracle vision whether mean ministracio men informed hande hand deliuer posterity yet vndoutedly true harte engrauen stedfaste certaintie doctrin might perswaded vnderstand yt learned came god god alwaies made vndouted assuraunce credit worde farre exceaded vncertaine opinion length continual proceding doctrine trueth suruiuing al age might stil remaine world oracle left father pleasure haue enrolled publike table entent law publyshed wherunto added prophetes expositor though diuerse v law hereafter shal better appeare place conuenient specially principall purpose moises al prophetes teach maner reconciliacion beetwene god menro xiiii cause also paule calleth christ end law yet say againe beside proper doctrine faith repetance sheweth forth christe mediatour scripture doth certaine markes token paint onelye true god hath created doeth gouerne worlde ende seuerally knowen reckened false nomber fained god therefore although behoueth man earnestlye bend eies consider workes god forasmuch set gorgeous stage beholder yet pryncipally ought bende eares word may better profit therby therfore maruel ar borne darkenesse waxe hard amased dulnesse verye fewe geue themselues pliable learne word god whereby kepe within boundes rather reioyse vanity thus ought holde ende true religion may shyne among v must take beginning heauenly doctrine man haue tast neuer little true sounde doctrine vnlesse haue ben scholer scrypture hense groweth original true vnderstanding reuerently embrace whatsoeuer pleaseth god therin testifye himselfe onely perfect al pointes absolute faith also al right knowledge god springeth obedience truelye thys behalfe god singular prouidence hath prouided men al age consider slipperye inclinacion man minde hath slide forgetfulnes god great redinesse fal al kind error great lust forge oftentimes new counterfayt religion may therby perceiue necessarie haue heauenly doctrine put writing either perish forgetfulnes grow vaine errour corrupted boldnes men sith therfore manifest god hath alway vsed helpe hys word toward al pleased time frutefully instruct foresaw image emprinted beautifull forme world sufficiently effectual therfore behoueth v trauaile straight way earnestly couet attayne true beholding god must say come word wherin god well liuely set workes workes weyed peruersuesse iudgemet according rule eternall trueth swarue worde saied euen although runne neuer fast yet shall neuer attaine marke course running way thus must thinke brightnesse face god apostle calleth cannot atteined vntoi tim vixvi vnto v like maze cannot vnwrappe selues vnlesse line word guided much better v halt wayps ix xcvixcviixcix c runne neuer fast therfore dauid ofte time teacheth supersticions taken away world pure religion maye floryshe bringeth god reigning meaninge worde reigning power hath doctryne wherby chalengeth himselfe lawfull gouernement error neuer rooted harte men till true knowledge god planted therfore propheteps xixxxi hath recited heauens declare glory god firmament sheweth fourth woorkes handes orderly succeding course day nightes preacheth maiestie descendeth make mentio worde law lord saieth vndefiled conuerting soules witnesse lord faithful geuing wisedome little one righteousness lord vpryght makyng harte cherefull commaundemet lord bryght geuing light eies although comprehendeth also v law yet generalitie meaneth forasmuch god doeth vaine call vnto hym al nation beholdyng heauen earth therfore peculiar schole child god meanyng hath xxix psalme prophet hauing preached terrible voice god whiche thunder windes showres whirlewindes stormes shaketh earth maketh mountain tremble breaketh cedre tree ende last goeth sayth praise song sanctuary vnbeleuers deafe heare al voyces god resounde aire lyke manner psalmeps xciii descrybed terrible waues ye sea thus concludeth thy testimony ar verified beautie thy teple holinesse euer meaning also proceded chryst said woman samaria nation rest honor knew notiohn iiiixxii onely iewes worship true god wheras wit man reason feblenesse therof ca meane attaine vnto god holpen lifted vp holy worde folowed necessitie al men excepte iewes dyd wander vanite errour sought god without hys worde p vii chapter testimony scripture oughte established witnesse holy gost authoritie therof may remaine certaine wycked inuention say er yt therof doeth hang vpon iudgemente churche go nedeful say somwhat authoritie scripture onely prepare men mindes reuerence also take away al dout therof matter confessed worde god sette forth desperate boldnesse vnlesse voide common sense naturall wit man dare derogate credit speaketh daily oracle geuen heauen onelye scryptures remaine wherin hath pleased lord preserue truth perpetual memory scripture none meanes ful credit among faythful doe beleue verely come heauen heard liuely voyce god speake therin matter dede ryght worthy bee largely entreated diligently weyed reader shall pardo herein rather regarde proporcion woorke haue begon may beare tha ye largenesse matter requireth ther growen vp among part men moste hurteful erroure yt scripture hath onely much authoritie common consent churche geuen vnto eternall inuiolable trueth god rest vpon pleasure men great scorne holy gost aske v ca assure v scripture came god assertaine v haue continued vnto r age safe vncorrupted perswade v thys one booke ought reuerently receiued stryken number scripture vnlesse churche appoint certaine rule al thinges hangeth therfore say vpon determinacio churche reuerence due scripture bokes ar reckened canon therof robber god honor whyle seke vnder color church bring vnbridled tyranny care nothing absurdity snare themselues may enforce thys one thyng beleued among symple churche al thynges shal become poore conscience seke stedfast assuraunce eternal lyfe al promyses remayne therof stande bee stayed onely vpon iudgement men receyue answere shal cesse wauer tremble agayne scornes vngodly faith made subiect great suspicion al men brought beleued hath borrowed credit fauoure men babbler wel confu ed euen one worde apostle testifieth churche builded vpon foundacion prophetes apostle paragraph doctrine prophetes apostle fundacion church muste nedes doctrine stode stedfast certaintie churche began nether wel cauil although church take first beginning therof yet remaineth doutful sayed writinges prophetes apostle vnlesse iudgemente church declare chrystian church beginning builded vpon writinges prophetes preachyng apostle wheresoeuer doctrine shalbe founde allowed credyte therof surely churche without churche selfe neuer ben therefore vaine forged deuise churche hath power iudge scripture certaintie scripture thought hange vpon wil churche wherfore whe churche doth receiue scripture sealeth consenting testimonie doeth thyng doutefull otherwyse controuersy make autentike credit acknowledgeth trueth god accordyng dutye godlinesse without delay doth honor wheras demaund shal perswaded came god vnlesse resort decree churche thys al one man aske howe shall learne knowe light darkenesse white blacke swete sower scripture sheweth selfe lesse apparaunte sense trueth white blacke thynges color swete sower thinges tast knowe commonly allege saying augustine wher sayeth would beleue gospel contra epist fu dametale ca saue authoritye churche moued hym therto vntruely cauillouslye alleged meaning whole tenor writing easy perceiue manichee whiche required beleued without gainesaying vaunted trueth side proued make manicheus beleued preteded gospel augustine asketh would light vpon man would beeleue gospel selfe maner perswasion would drawe hym opinion afterwarde sayeth self would beleue gospel c saue ye authoritie church moued therto meaning himselfe straunger fayth coulde otherwise brought embrace gospel assured trueth god ouercome authoritie ye church maruel yet knowing chryste haue regarde men augustine therfore doeth teache fayth godly grounded vpon authoritie church meaneth certaintie gospel doth hang therupon simplye onely assurednesse gospel infidel wherby might wonne chryst vnlesse consent church driue vnto meanyng litle doth plainly confirme saying contra epist fu dame ale ca iii shall praise beleue scorne thou beleuest thikest thou mete v iudge forsake men first call v come knowe certaine truethes commaunde v beeleue thinges vncertaine folowe require v first beleue yet able see made strong beleuing may atteine vnderstande thing beleue menne nowe god himselfe inwardly strengthning geuing lighte oure minde word augustine wherby euery man may easely gather holy man meaning hang credite haue scripture vpon wil awardemente churche onely shewe selues also confesse true yet lightened spirite god brought reuerence churche vnto willyngnesse bee taught finde harte learne faith christ gospel thus meane authoritie ye church introduction wherby prepared beleue ye gospel see minde assuraunce godly staied vpon farre foundacion otherwise deny often presseth ye manichee consent whole churche seketh proue scripture refused contra faustum lib xxxii hence came reproched faustus yelde hymselfe trueth gospel grounded stablished gloriously renomed time apostle certaine succession perpetuallye commended neuer trauaileth ende teach authoritie acknowledge scripture hangeth vppon determinacion decree men onely made much mater disputed bringeth forth vniuersal iudgemet church wherein auautage aduersaries desire fuller proufe herof let reade boke concernynge profit beleuing aug de vtilitate cred shall finde redinesse beliefe commended vnto v geueth v entrie vnto v conuenient beginning enquire termeth yet ought rest vpon bare opinion leane certaine sounde trueth ought holde sayd credit doctrine established v vntil time vndoutedly perswaded god author therof therfore principal profe ye scripture comonly taken person god speaker prophetes apostle bost sharpe wit thigs procure credit n speake neither stande vpon proues reason bring forth holy name god therby compell whole world obedience haue see howe onely probable opinion apparant truth euidet behalfe name god without cause deceitfully preteded wil prouide wel conscience continually caryed vnstedfast douting many wauer stay euery small stop maner perswasion must fetched deper either reason iudgementes coniectures men euen secrete testimony holy ghoste true dede lysted worke way argumetes many thinges might alleged may easily proue god heauen law prophecy gospell came hym yea although men learned depe iudgemente would stande vp contrary would employ shew forth whole force wittes disputacion yet hardened become desperatly shamelesse woulde compelled confesse seen scripture manifest token god speaketh therin wherby maye appeare doctrine therof fro heaue shortly hereafter shal se al bokes holy scripture farre excel al writinges soeuer yea bring thether pure eies vncorrupted sens shal forthwith finde maiestie god shall subdue al hardnesse gainesaying enforce v obey yet disorderly disputacion trauaile establishe perfecte credit scripture truely although furnished great dexteritie eloquence yet contende ye moste luttle despisers god haue desier shew themselues wytty plesaunt febling authoritie scripture trust harde put silence bablinges profitable spende labor confuting cauillations would great businesse shake sunder bragges mutter corner though man deliuer sounde word god reproches men yet sufficeth fourthwith fasten theyr harte assurednesse godlynesse requireth prophane men thynke religion standeth onely opinion ende woulde beleue nothing fondly lightly couet require haue proued reason moises prophetes spake god answere testimonie holy ghost better tha reason onely god conueniente witnesse hymselfe hys owne worde shal worde neuer finde credit harte men vntil sealed vp inwarde witnesse ye holy ghost behoueth therfore necessitie holy ghost whiche spake mouth prophetes entre harte perswade v faythfully vttered god commaunded order aptly set fourth esay wordsesa lixvi spirite thee wordes haue put thy mouth mouth thy sede shal faile euer greueth good men haue ready hande cleare proufe allege wicked without punishment murmure worde god though holy ghost cause called seale pledge vntill lighten men mind alway wauer among many doutinges let therfore stande certainly perswaded trueth holy ghost hath inwardly taught doe wholy reste vppon scripture ye scripture credited selfsake ought made subiect demonstracio reason yet yt certaintie getteth among v atteineth witnesse holy ghost though maiestie selfe procureth reuerence geuen yet throughly perceth affectios sealed harte holy gost lightened vertue beleue iudgemet me yt scripture fro god aboue al man iudgement holde certainly determined euen behelde maiestie god himselfe present ministery men came v mouth god seke argumentes likelhodes rest iudgement vpon thing without al compasse consideracion submit iudgement wit vnto sort wont sometime hastily take holde thing vnknowen throughly perceiued displeaseth conscience wel assured hold inuincible truth neither sort silly men ar wont yelde mynde thraldom superstition vndoutedly perceiue therin strength breathing diuine maiestie wherewith drawen stirred obey wittingly willingly yet liuely effectually man wil wit attaine therefore good cause doth god cry esay prophetes wyth whole people beare witnesseesa xliiix taughte prophecy vndoutedly beleue without guile vncertaintie god himselfe spoken therfore perswasion requireth reason knowledge hath righte good reason maintaine euen one wherin minde assuredly stedfastly resteth vpon reason suche oure feling cannot procede reuelacion heauen speake nowe none thing euery one faithful doth experiece find himselfe sauing wordes much want full declaratio leaue many thinges vnspoken wil el againe conuenient place entreate matter onely let v know onely true faith spirite god doth seale harte yea onely reason wil sobre reder willing learne contented esay promeseth al childre renewed churche shalbe ye scholar godesa liiiixiii singular priuilege therin doth god vouchsaue graunt elect onely seuereth rest mankinde beginning true doctrine redy cherefulnesse heare voice god god requireth heard mouth moises written say thy harte shal ascende heauen shal descende depe worde euen thine mouth pleasure god treasure vnderstanding layed vp store hys chyldren marueil vnlikely common multitude seen ignoraunce dullnessedeu xxxxii rom xvi esai iiiii common multitude call euen excellent vntil time graffed bodye church moreouer esay geuing warning prophetes doctrine seme incredible onely straungers also iewes woulde accompted householde god addeth reason arme god shall reueled al men oft therfore smallnesse nu ber beleuers doth trouble v side let v call minde none comprehende misteries god geuen p viii chapter farre man reason may beare sufficient proues stablyshe credite scripture vnlesse haue assuraunce whiche bothe excellent force iudgement man vayne shall authorytie scripture eyther bee strengthened argumentes stablished consente churche confyrmed meanes defence vnlesse fundation bee layde still remayneth hangynge doubte syde exemptynge common state thynges haue embraced deuoutely accordyng worthynesse thynges become fitte helpes small force graffe fasten assurance therof myndes meruaylous howe greate establishemente groweth herof earnest studye consider howe orderly well framed disposition diuine wisedom appereth therin howe heauenly doctrine euery place nothyng sauoryng earthlynesse howe beautyful agreement partes amonge theym selues suche thynges auayle procure maiestie writynges perfectly oure harte confirmed consyder howe euen violently caried admiration rather dignitie matter grace woords also done without singular prouidence god hye misteries heauenly kingdome moste part vttered vnder contemptible basenesse word least hadde ben beautified glorious speache wicked shoulde cauill onely force eloquence doeth reigne therein roughe maner rude simplicitie dooeth rayse vp greater reuerence selfe rhetorician eloquence may iudge myghty strength truthe holye scripture nedeth art wordes withoute cause therefore apostle maketh argument proue faythe corinthian grounded vpon power godi cor iiiiii vpon man wysedom bycau e preachyng among set foorth enticyng speche man wisedom playne euidence spirite power truthe sette free doubtyng vpholden forayne aide selfe alone suffiseth susteyne self power proprely alone belongyng scripture hereby appereth writynges menne neuer connyngly garnyshed one farre able pearce affection reade demosthenes cicero reade plato aristotle sorte graunt shall meruailously allure delite moue rauishe thee thou come holy readyng scripture wylte thou shall lyuely moue thy affection shall pearce thy hearte shall settle within thy bone comparison efficacie feelyng force rhetorician philosopher shall maner vanysshe awaie easy perceyue scripture whiche doo farre excell gyftes grace man industrie doo deede breathe oute certayne diuinitie graunt deede som prophetes haue elegant cleare yea beautifull phrase speeche eloquence geueth place prophane writer suche example pleased holy ghost shewe wanted eloquence though reste vsed rude grosse stile whether man reade dauid esaie lyke haue swete pleasant flowyng speche amos heardman hieremie zacharye whose rougher talke sauoureth countrey rudenesse euery one theim shall appeare maiestie holy ghoste spake yet ignorant sathan many thynges counterfaiter god deceitfull resemblance myght better crepe simple men myndes hath craftily spreade abroade rude maner barbarous speche wicked errours wherwith deceyued sely men hath ofte tymes vsed discontinued phrase scholemen canoni e vnder suche visour might hyde deceites howe vayn vncleanly curious counterfaityng men haue meane vnderstandynge doo playnely see holy scripture although frowarde men labour byte many thynges yet full suche sentence coulde conceyued man let prophetes loked vpon shall one founde among hath farre excelled man capacitie suche sorte thought haue iudgement tast whome doctrine vnsauorie menne haue largely entreated argument wherfore tyme suffiseth touche fewe thyngs chiefly make principall summe whole matter besyde poyntes haue already towched antiquitie scripture great weight howe soeuer greke writer tell many fable egyptian diuinitie yet remaineth monument religion farre inferiour age moses moses deuiseth newe god setteth foorth thyng whiche israelite receyued longe processe tyme conueyed theyr father wer hand hand concernyng euerlastyng god doth el labour cal backe couenaunt made abraham brought thyng neuer hearde entrie begynne muste nedes deliueraunce bondage wherin deteyned thynge well commonly knowen among hearynge mention thereof dyd foorthwith raise vp myndes also likely informed numbre cccc yeares nowe consydered moses whiche hym selfe long distance tyme al writer begynnyng long hym selfe fetche originall deliuerance doctrine howe muche holy scripture beyonde writynges antiquitie unlesse perhappe liste beleue egyptian stretche auncientie sixe thousand yeres creation world sithe vayne babblyng hath ben alway scorned euen prophane writer themselues cause shoulde spende labour confutyng iosephus agaynst appion alledge testimony worthy remembred auncient writer wherby may gathered consent nation doctrine lawe hath ben famous euen fyrst age although neither redde truely knowen nowe neyther shoulde remaine malicious cause suspicion wicked occasion cauill god hath bothe daungers prouided good remedy moses reherseth iacob almoste thre hundred yeares heauenly inspiration pronounced vppon owne posteritiegen xl x v howe dooth sette foorth owne tribe yea persone leui spotteth eternall infamie symeon fayth leui vessel wickednesse soule come counsell tong secrete truely myghte haue passed ouer blot silence doyng please father also staine selfe whole family parte shame howe writer suspected whiche vnconstrainedly publishing oracle holy ghost principall auncester familie wherof hymselfe descended abhominable doer neither priuately prouided owne honor refused enter displeasure owne kynsemen vndoutedly matter grened also reherseth wicked murmuryng aaron owne brothernum xii mary sister shall say spake meanyng fleshe rather wrote obeyng commaundement holy ghoste moreouer sithe hymselfe hyest authoritie leaue least office hye priesthode owne sonnes appointeth theim basest place touche onely fewe thynges many lawe selfe man shal eche mete many argumentes able bryng full profe make men beleue moses without question commeth heauen angel god nowe many notable myracles recompteth ar euen many establishementes lawe deliuered doctrine publishedex xxiiii xviii caried clowde vp mountayne euen fortyeth daye continued without company menne publishing lawe face dydde shyne besette sonnebeamesex xxxiiii xxix exo xixxvi exo xlxxxiiii lightenynges flashed rounde aboute thunder noyses hearde eche ayre trompette sounded beeyng blowen mouth man entrie tabernacle clowde set betwene kept fro sight ye people authoritie miraculously reuenged horrible destruction chore dathan abironnu xvixxiiii nu xxx nu xiix wycked faction rocke stryken rodde dyd powre foorth ryuer prayer rayned manna heauen god herein commende heauen vndoubted prophet man obiect agaynst take thynges confessed whiche controuersy easy answer cauillacion seyng moses ope assembly published thynges place fayne witness themselues sene thynges done likely forsoth wold com amog rebuking people infidelitie stubbornesse vnthankfulnesse sinnes wold haue bosted yt doctrine established owne syght myracles deede neuer sawe also worthy noted ofte telleth myracles therwithall odiously ioyneth suche thynges myght stirre whole people crye agaynst hym neuer lytle occasion wherby appeareth meane brought agree vnto thei euer sufficiently co uinced owne experience matter plainlier knowen prophane coulde deny myracles done mosesexod vii xi father lyeng hath mynistred cauillation sayeng doone magicall artes sorcerie likely profe haue accuse sorcerer whiche farre abhorred suche superstition commaundeth stone deatheleuit xx exod xvi dooth aske councell sorcerer soothsaiers truly suche deceiuer vseth iugglynge caste studieth amase myndes people get himselfe fame dothe moses crieth himselfe brother aaron nothyng dooth onely execute thynges god hath appoynted dothe sufficiently wipe away blottes thinkyng euyll hym nowe thynges themselues considered enchantment coulde bryng passe manna dayly raynynge heauen suffise feede people man kept store tha iuste measure rottyng therof shuld taugh yt god dyd punishe want beleefe beside many great proues god suffred seruant tried wicked nothing preuayle pratyng agaynst hym oft somtyme people prowdely impudently make insurrection somtyme dyuers conspiryng among selues wente aboute ouerthrowe holy seruaunt god howe coulde haue begyled furour illusion end folowed plainly sheweth meane doctrine stablished continue ende age moreouer assigneth chiefe gouernement tribe iuda persone patriarch iacob denye doone spirite propheciegen xlix specially wey consideration thyng selfe howe comyng passe proued true imagine moses haue ben fyrst author prophecie yet tyme dydde fyrste put writynge passed fower hundred yeares wherein mencion sceptre tribe iuda saule consecrate kynge semed kyngdom shuld rest tribe beniamynsam xixv sam xvi dauid annoynted samuel reason appeared course inheritance kyngdome changed wold haue looked shuld haue come kyng base house herdman whe house seuen brother wolde haue sayd honour shuld lyght vpon yongest meane came hope king say annointment gouerned art trauaile policie man rather fulfillyng heauenly prophecie lykewise thinges moses afore speaketh albeit darkely concernynge gentile adopted couenat god seing thei came passe almost two thousand yeres thei make plain spake inspiration god ouerskippe tellynges aforehande thynges whiche doo euidently sauoure reuelation god men haue sounde witt may playnely perceiue god speakethdeuter xxxii shorte one song clere lookyng glasse wherin god euidently appeareth prophetes yet also muche plainely seene choose onely fewe example gather together greate laboure tyme esaie kyngdom iuda peace yea thought chaldee staie defence esaie prophecie destruction citie exile people admitte yet token playne enough instinct god tell longe suche thinges tyme semed false afterward proued trueesa xlvi yet prophecy vttereth concernyng delyueraunce whense shall saye proceded god nameth cyrus chaldee shoulde subdued people restored libertie passed hundred yeares tyme esaie prophecied cyrus borne cyrus borne hundreth yeare theraboutes deathe esaie man coulde gesse shoulde bee suche cyrus shoulde haue warre babylonian shoulde bringe subiecte myghtie monarchie vnder dominion make ende exile people israell dooth bare tellynge without garnishement woordes euidently shewe thynges esaie speakethier xxv xi vndoubted oracle god coniectures men againe ieremie litle people caried awaie didde determine ende captiuitie within threscore tenne yeares promised returne libertie muste needes bee gue gouerned spirite god shamelesnesse shall bee denye credite prophetes stablished prouesesa xlii thyng fulfilled dede whiche thei theim selues doo reporte make sayenges bee beleued beholde former thynges come passe newe thinges doo declare thei comme foorthe tell leaue speake howe hieremie ezechiell beeynge farre asonder yet prophecyenge bothe one tyme agreed theyr sayenges eyther one theym hadde endyted wordes write daniell doothe write continuynge prophecy thynges come space sixe hundred yeares suche sorte hadde compyled hystory thynges already doon commonly knowen thynges godly men haue well consydered shall bee sufficiently well furnished appease barkynges wycked playne proofe hereof cleare subiect cauillations knowe learned men doo prate corner shewe quicknesse witte assaltyng truthe god demande hath assured v thynges whiche redde vnder title name euer written moses prophetes yea hardy moue question whether euer suche moses manne shoulde calle doubte whether euer plato aristotle cicero would saye suche madnesse woorthye bee corrected stroke strypes lawe moses hathe meruaylousely preserued rather heauenlye prouidence diligence menne thowgh negligence priestes laye buried lyttell yet syns tyme godly kynge iosias founde hath still continuall succession age age ben vsed handes men neyther iosias brynge foorthe vnknowen newe thyng suche thynge hadde ben euer commonly published wherof remembrance tyme famous originall booke selfe appoynted sarredly kepte temple copy written thereof remayne kepers kynges recordes onely happened priestes ceassed publyshe lawe accordyng olde accustomed maner people selues neglected theyr wonted readyng yea maner passed age wherin establishement therof confirmed renued dauid handes knew moses speake al one certayn yt writing came posteritie none otherwise hand hand may terme continual orderly course yeres deliuered father partly heard speake partly remembrance freshe dyd lerne herd spoken whithe obiect hystorie machabees mynishe credite scripturei mac suche thyng nothynge deuised fitte stablishe first lette v wipe away colour lay vpon let v turne vpon selues engine raise vp agaynst v iix antiochus saye commaunded bookes bourned whense come copy nowe haue side aske shop could sone made euidet crueltie appeased immediatly abrode agayn without controuersy knowen godly men hauyng ben brought vp doctrine dyd familiarly knowe yea wicked men beyng wer conspired togyther dyd insolently triumphe reproches vpo iewes yet neuer yt durst lay charge false changyng bokes soeuer thynke iewes religion yet still thinke moses authour prater el bewraie owne doggysshe frowardenesse falsely saie bookes chaunged newe put place whose sacred antiquitie approued consente history spende laboure vainely confutynge suche foolishe cauillations let v rather hereby consyder howe great care god preseruation worde beyonde hope men saued outrage moste cruell tyrant present fyre endewed godly priestes greate constancie sticke redeeme booke euen losse theyr lyfe nede conuey ouer posteritie disappoynted narowe searche many gouernours souldiours acknowledge notable myraculous woorke god scared monumentes whyche wycked veryly thought haue bene vtterly destroyed came abroade agayne fully restored greate deale honour folowed translatynge theim greke publyshe theim throughout worlde thys onely appeared myraculous woorkynge god preserued table couenaunt bloudy proclamation antiochus also among manyfold miserable affliction iewes wherewith whole nation sometyme worne fewe wasted laste brought maner vtter destruction yet remayned styll safe ex ant hebrue tongue lay onelye vnestemed almoste vnknowen surely hadde goddes pleasure haue religion prouyded hadde peryshed altogether howe muche iewes since theyr retourne exile swarued naturall vse theyr mother tongue appeareth prophetes lyued age whyche therefore woorthy bee noted comparyson antiquitie lawe prophetes playnely perceyued whome hathe god preserued v doctrine saluation conteyned lawe prophetes ende christe myghte appoynted tyme bee openly shewed euen moste cruelly bente enemyes christe iewes whome saincte augustine doothe therefore woorthylye calle keeper librarie christian churche haue mynystred vnto v thyng reade wherof theimselues haue vse nowe comme newe testamente howe sounde pyllers trueth thereof vpholden three euangelistes write hystorie base symple speeche manye prowde menne dooe lothe symplicitie take heede chiefe poyntes doctrine therein whereby easie gather entreate heauenly mystery aboue mannes capacitie surely euer haue one droppe honest shame ashamed yf rede fyrste chapiter luke nowe sermon christe summe whereof shortly comprised three euangelistes dooe easyly delyuer theyr writynges contempte ihon thunderynge hye whome compelleth obedience faythe throweth downe stubbournesse myghtily thunderbolt nowe let come foorth sharpnosed faultfinder haue great pleasure shake reuerence scripture oute theyr owne men heartes let reade iohns gospell shall fynde thousande sentence may leaste awaken sluggishenes yea may printe horrible brande theyr conscience restrayne lawhyng bee thought peter paul whose writynges although part blynd yet heauenly maiestie holdeth men bounde faste tyed vnto one thyng doth sufficiently aduance doctrine aboue worlde mathew al geuen gaine money boorde peter iohn brought vp fisher boates grosse vnlearned men learned nothyng men schoole myghte deliuer paule onely professed also cruell blouddy ennemy conuerted newe man sodayne vnhoped chaunge dothe shewe beyng compelled heauenly authoritie nowe maynteyneth doctrine whiche fought agaynst nowe lette dogges denye holy ghoste came downe vpon apostle lette theym discredite hystorie yet styll truthe selfe openly crieth taughte holye ghoste whyche beynge tyme despised men amonge raskall people sodeynly began gloriousely entreate heauenly mystery bee yet also furthermore many good reason consente churche shoulde esteemed without weyght accompted smalle matter syns scripture first publyshed wylles many age haue constantly agreed obey howe soeuer sathan worlde hath trauayled meruaylous meanes eyther oppresse ouerthrowe vtterly blotte deface oute mennes remembraunce yet euer styl like palme tree hath rysen vp aboue remayned inuincible hath lyghtly ben olde tyme sophister rhetorician excellent witte hath bente force agaynst scripture yet haue nothyng preuayled whole power earthe hath armed selfe destroye yet enterprise vanished away smoke nowe coulde haue resysted beyng myghtyly eche syde assayled yf hadde none defence mannes yea rather hereby proued came god hymselfe trauayles men stryuynge againste yet hath owne power styll rysen vp besyde one citie alone one onely nation hathe agreed receiue embrace farre worlde extendethe lengthe breadth scripture hath atteyned credite one holye conspiracie diuers nation whiche otherwyse nothynge agreable one forasmuche suche agreement myndes dyuers disagreyng maner thynges elles ought muche moue v appeareth brought none way woorkyng heauenly maiestie smalle estimation groweth vnto beholde theyr godlynesse doo agree meane onely lyghtes pleased god haue churche shyne nowe assurednesse myde ought submitte v doctrine whiche see stablished witnessed bloude mayne holye menne hadde one receaued sticked boldely without feare yea greate cherefulnesse dye howe shoulde come passe wee hauynge conueyed v suche assured pledge shoulde certayn vnmouable persuasion take holde therfore small confirmation scripture hath ben sealed bloud many witness specially consider suffred deth beare witnesse faith frentike distemperance brayne somtyme erronious spirites wont firme constant yet sobre zeale god reason fewe weake whereby scripture hath dignitie maiestie onely ascertayned vnto godly harte also honourably defended agaynst subtilties cauillers yet suche selues sufficiently auaylable bryng stedfast credite vnto vntyll heauenly father disclosyng therin maiestie doothe bryng reuerence therof controuersie wherfore scripture shall suffise knowledge god bryngeth saluation certayntie therof shall grounded vpon inwarde persuasion holy ghoste testimony men serue confirme shall vaine seconde healpes weaknesse folowe chiefe hyest testimonie doo fondly haue perswaded proofe unfaithfull scripture woorde god whiche knowen faith good reason therfore dooth augustine geue warnyngde vtill rate cre dendi godlynesse peace mynde ought go make man vnderstande somwhat greate matter pthe ix chapter pthat fanaticall men forsakyng scripture resort vnto reuelation doo ouerthrowe principle godlynesse nowe forsaking scripture doo imagine wote waie attayne vnto god bee thought muche holden errour caried rage haue arisen late certain giddy brained men whiche moste presumptuously pretendyng schoole spirite bothe selues doo forsake readyng also doo scorne simplicitie whiche still folowe dead slaying letter call would fayne knowe men spirite whose inspiration caried vp hye dare despise doctrine scripture chyldishe base yf answere spirite christ suche carelesnesse woorthye bee laughed thynke graunte apostle christe faithfull primitiue churche lightned none spirite none dyd learne spirite despise worde god rather euery one moued reuerence writynges doo playnly witnesseesa iixxxi surely foretold mouthe esaie saythe spirite vppon thee woordes whyche haue putte thy mouthe shall departe oute thy mouthe oute mouthe thy seede euer dooth bynde olde people outwarde doctrine thoughe sette learne spelle rather teacheth shal true perfecte felicitie newe churche vnder reigne christe shall lesse ledde voyce god spirite god wherby gather lewde menne wycked sacrilege dooe seuer asunder thynges prophete hathe ioyned inuiolable knotte moreouer paule beeynge rauysshed vp thyrde heauen yet ceassed goe forwarde doctrine law prophetes euen exhorteth timothe doctour singular excellence apply readyngi tim iiiixiii worthie commendation remembred wherwith setteth foorthe scripture sayengii tim iiixvi profytable teache admonysshe reproue seruantes god maye bee made perfecte howe dyuelyshe madnesse fayne vse scripture transitorye lasteth whyle whiche dede guydeth chyldren god euen laste ende agayne woulde haue answere whether haue tasted spirite whiche lord promysed disciple althoughe vexed extreme madnesse yet thynke caryed suche gyddinesse dare boast maner spirite dyd speake promise euen spirite whiche shoulde speake selfe shulde mynister inspire myndes thynges whyche lorde hymselfe hadde taught woordeiohn xvixiii therfore office spirite whyche promised v fayne newe vnhearde reuelations coyne newe kynde doctrine wherby shuld led receiued doctrine gospell seale mindes selfe doctrine commended vnto v gospell wherby playnly vnderstand ought right studiously apply redyng hearyng scripture list take vse fruite spirite god pete ix also peter praiseth diligence hedefull doctrine prophetes yet myght seme haue geuen place risyng light gospell syde yf spirite leauynge wysedome worde god doth thrust vnto v doctrine spirite ought rightfully suspected vanitie lyenge sathan transformeth hymselfe n aungell lyght credite shall holy ghoste haue among v seuerally knowen assured marke truely hath playnly poynted oute vnto v woorde lorde miserable men doo wyllyngly couete erre owne destruction thei seeke spirite rather selues say dishonorable spirite god thynges ought obey subiect scripture dishonour holy ghost euery egall lyke selfe agree self thynges varye deede tried rule either men angel others rule whatsoeuer myght well thought brought obedience ye lyst terme bondage compared selfe consydered selfe canne therfore say wrong doone vnto thus brought tryall graunte suche triall wherewith owne pleasure haue maiestie established ought content v soone entreth v lest vnder name spirite sathan shoulde creepe wylle haue v knowe hym image hym selfe whyche hathe printed scripture authour scripture dyuers vnlyke hym selfe therefore muste needes bee contynually remayne suche hathe shewed hym selfe therein dishonor vnto vnlesse perhappe count honorable swarue goe kinde himselfe wheras cauil yt rest vpon ye letter yt sleieth herein suffer punishment despising scriptureii cor iiivi plain enough paule contendeth false apostle commending law without christ cal away people benefite new testament wherin lord doth couenant graue law within bowel faithful write harte letter therfore dead law lord killeth reader seuered grace christ touching ye heart soundeth eares effectually printed harte holy gost present christ vnto v worde life conuerting soulesii cor iii viii geuing wisedome little one c also place apostle calleth preaching ministerie holy ghost meaning ye holy ghost doth sticke fast truth hath expressed scripture putteth forth displaieth force scripture hath due reuerence dignitie disagreeth said woorde selfe much assured vnto v vnlesse cofirmed witnesse holy ghost certain mutuall knot lorde hath coupled together assuraunce worde spirite perfecte reuerence worde doth settle mindes holy ghost shineth vpon v make v therin beholde face god side without al feare deceiued embrace holy ghost reknowledge image worde thus vndoutedly god brought abrode worde lorde distributeth faithfull light spirite know none spirite dwelte spake apostle whose oracle continually called hearyng worde x chapter scripture correct supersticion doth comparison set true god al innocent rendrest wyckednesse father child childrens child let v marke eternitie himselfe expressed twise repeting honorable name vertues rehearsed described vnto v respect hymselfe one towarde v thys exactly reckened vp nothing seme omitted yet nothing rehearsed may beholde creature plainly perceiue god informacion experyece declareth himselfe hys worde ieremy pronounceth one would haue v knowe hym setteth forth description altogether fulliere vixxiiii yet comming one effecte gloryeth saieth let glory knoweth bee lord mercy iustice iudgemente earth surelye three thinges necessary v knowe mercy alone consisteth al saluacion iudgement dayly executed vpon euil doer greuous prepared eternal destruction iustice wherby faithful preserued tenderlye cherished thinges thou hast conceiued hys vnmouable truth beleue doeth gouerne earth iustice iudgement vnderstandyng hys power whense commeth mercy goodnesse way mercy iudgement iustice must holinesse also nedes bee seen none ende directed knowledge god set forth vnto v scripture knowledge also appeareth emprinted creature say first moueth v feare god put confidence hym ende may learne first honor perfect innocency lyfe vnfained obedience hang altogether vpon hys goodnesse meane gather summe generall doctrine first let reader note scripture ende direct v true god doth expresly exclude cast away al god ye gentile commonly manner al age religion hath ben corrupted true dede name one god euerye knowen renomed euen worshipped great nomber god oft speake according ye proper sense nature simply vsed singular name god contented one god alone thys wisely marked iustine ye martyr thys purpose made boke monarchie god wherby many testimony sheweth thys one god engrauen harte al men thyng also doth tertulliane proue common phrase speche forasmuche without exception vanitie either drawen fallen false forged deuises sens become vayne therefore euer naturally vnderstode beeing one god auayled make inxecusable eue wisest plainly shewe wandering error theyr mynde wyshe god assist theyr prayer cal vpon vncertayne god moreouer imagined god haue many nature although thought somwhat lesse absurdely rude people iupeter mercury uenus minerua yet free deceites satan haue already sayed el whatsoeuer wayes escape philosopher haue suttelly inuented cannot purge themselues rebellio haue corrupted trueth godhaba ii thys reson habacuc conde ned idol biddeth seke god hys temple faythfull admyt hym disclosed selfe hys worde xi chapter vnlawfull attribute vnto god visible forme generally forsake god many erect selues image scripture prouiding rude grosse wit man vseth speake common maner meaneth make seuerally knowen true god false god chiefelye compareth idol doth allowe inuencyons suttelly finely taughte philosopher plainlier disclose folishnesse world yea rather madnesse sekyng god long cleaue euery one imagination therfore exclusiue definition whych commonly heare bryngeth nought maner godhead men frame themselues opinion god hymselfe conueniente witnesse hymselfe meane tyme sith thys brutysh grossenesse hath possessed ye whole world couet visible shape god forge themselues god timber stone golde siluer dead corruptible matter ought holde thys prynciple wyth wycked falshode glorye god corrupted oft shape fained represent therfore god law chalenged glory hys deitie hymselfe alone meaning teache v manner worshipping aloweth refuseth addeth immediatly thou shalt make thee grauen imageex xxiiii similitude woordes restraineth libertie attempt represent wt visible image shortly reckneth vp formes wherwith long time supersticion begon turne trueth lyinge know persian worshipped sonne yea many starres folish nation saw skie many goddes fained scarce liuing creature whiche among egiptians figure god maximus tiri u platonicus sermone xx viii grecian thought wyser rest worshipped god shape manne god compareth image one though one wer lesse mete vsed withoute exception reiecteth image voice thou saweste body therfore take hede thy selfe least paraduenture thou deceiued make thy selfe likenesse c see openly god setteth voice counterfaite shape may knowe forsake god whosoeuer couet haue visible formes hym prophetes onely esay shalbe enough whiche speaketh ofte much herofesa x xviii et xlivii xlvix et xlviv acte xviixxix teache maiestie god defiled vncomlye folishe counterfaiting immortall inuiolable god vile base stuffe put vpon shape men beastes kinde man woman mingled together sondryshapen bodyes call god whiche shoulde receiue breath mete would reckened monster whereby agayne plainly appeareth fonde cauillacion wherewith defender image seke escape say iewes forbidden image inclinable superstition thoughe thyng perteyned one nation onely god bryngeth forth hys eternall beeing contynuall order nature paule spake iewes athenienses confuted theyr error counterfaytyng shape god god dede graunt somtyme certayne sygnes hath geuen presence hys godhed sayed beholden face face sygnes euer shewed dyd aptly serue meanes teache wythall dyd playnly admonishe men incomprehesible essence cloude smoke flame although wer token heauenly glorydeu iiiixi yet bridle
