god whereas people certaine hote hastinesse brake oftentim seke idol euen water great freshe spring boile violet force herby rather let v learne great inclination nature idolatry least throwing vppon iewes blame fault common al slepe deadly slepe vnder vaine allurementes sinne purpose serueth saying idol gentile golde siluer euen workes men handes beecause prophete doth gather stuffe selfepsa cxvb xiiivxv god yt haue golden siluer image taketh confessed truth yt folish fained inuencion whatsoeuer conceiue sense concerning god nameth rather golde siluer clay stone yt beautie price serue bryng reuerence idol concludeth generally nothing lesse allowable god made ded stuffe meane standeth much vpon point men caried awaye mad rashenesse whyche themselues bearyng borrowed breath ready vanish away euery moment yet dare geue honor god idol man must nedes confesse himselfe creature day continuaunce yet haue pece metall compted god himselfe gaue beginning god whense came beginning idol wil uery iustly doeth heathe poet geue taunt somtime fig tree loghora ser sat viii blocke serued nought workeman douted fittest wrought fourme sit vpon el priap god length thought better god make forsoth earthly silly breatheth wn life maner euery moment workemanship shal conuey name honour god dead stocke forasmuch epicure scoffingly iesting hath cared religion let v leaue tauntes suche let rebuking prophete pricke v rather thruste v sayethesa xliiiixv much beastly witted one selfe pece wood make fier warme themselues doe heate ouen bake bread rost sethe flesh make god fal humbly pray therfore place doeth onely accuse law also doth repreche haue learned fundacios earth nothyng lesse conuenient bryng god ure fyue fote aboue measure incomprehensybleesa xxi yet thys monstrous thyng manifestly repugneth agaynste order naturees iiviii et xxxiv et lviix o xiiiiii mic vxiii p xvviii custome sheweth naturall men must moreover holde minde superstition scripture commonly rebuked thys phrase speache ye workes men hande want authoritie god thys may certayne maners worshipping men euise selues detestable prophete psalme doeth amplife madnesse therfore endued wyth vnderstandyng shoulde know al thynges moued power god yet pray helpe thinges dead senselesse corruption nature carryeth wel al nacions eche man priuatlye great madnesse last holy ghost thondreth wyth terryble curse agaynst saying let make become lyke many trust noted similitude lesse forbydden grauen image wherby fonde sutteltie grekes cofuted thynke ar wel discharged graue god payntinges licentiously outrage nation lord forbyddeth image onely made grauer also counterfaited workma counterfaiting euill dishonor maiestie know saying common among people ye image lay men bokes gregory said spirite god pronounceth far otherwise whose schole gregorie ben taught would neuer haue spoken wheras hieremy painly saieth stocke doctrine vanitiehie xviii ha iii viii wheras habacu teacheth yt molten image teacher lye surely hereof general doctrine gathered vaine lieng whatsoeuer men learne image concerning god man take excepcion saye ye prophetes reproue abused image wicked superstition graunt true adde easy men se condemne thing wholy ye papistes take assured principle image ede bokes doe comparison set image god thinges directly contrarye neuer agree together comparison saye made place haue alleged sith one true god iewes worship sse falsly done forge visible shape represent god men miserably deceiued therby seke knowledge god finally true deceitfull corrupt knowledge god learned image prophetes would generally condemne least thus much win shew vanitie lieng men attempte represent god image nothing rehearse word word prophetes haue taught let red lactantius eusebius haue writte matter sticke take certayne yt wer al mortal image seen likewise augustine whiche withoute douting pronounceth vnlawfull onely worship image also set vp image god yet sayeth none thyng many yeares decreed elibertine councel concil bert ca vi ca xxxvi wherof xxxvi chapiter ordeined picture church thing honored worshipped painted wals notable another place augustine allegeth uarro lib iiii de ciuirate dei cap ix xxxi confirmeth owne assent first brought image god toke away feare god brought erroure uarro alone say paraduenture smal authoritie yet ought right make v ashamed heathen man groping darknesse came light se bodily image therfore vnmete maiestie god diminish feare god encrease error men proufe selfe witnesseth lesse truly wisely spoken augustine hauing borrowed uarro bringeth forth mind first admonisheth first error wherwith men entangled concerning god beganne image new matter added encreased secondly expoundeth feare god therefore minished rather taken away therby maiestie may easely folishnesse fonde absurde forging image grow cotempt seconde thing would god proufe finde true whosoeuer therefore couet rightly taught let elles learne image mete knowen concerning god wherfore papistes haue shame let vse thys shyft say image lay men bokes many testimony scripture ar openly confuted althoughe graut much yet muche get thereby defense idoles monster trust place god wel knowen picture image dedicate saynctes example extreme riot vnclennesse wherunto would fashion himselfe worthy beaten staues surely brothe house shewe harlot chastely soberly attyred temple shewe image would haue called virgin euen vncomly array geue martirs lette therfore fashion idol least honest shewe shamefastnesse may somwhat colorably lye saieng bokes holinesse yet would answere ryght way teache faythful people holy place god would haue instructed farre doctryne wyth trifle god commaunded church common doctryne set forth al men preaching woorde holy misteryes whereunto shew themselues haue minde hedeful cast eies beholde image papistes cal lay vnlearned men whose vnskilfulnesse may beare taught image forsoth euen lord knowledgeth hys disciple vouche saueth reuele heauenly wisedome willeth instructed ye holsome misteries kingdom graunt dede matter standeth ar day many cannot without bokes whese pray groweth dulnesse defrauded ye doctrine whiche mete instruct cause cure church gaue ouer office teachyng idoles themselues dumme paule testifieth christ true preaching gospelgal iiii painted amaner crucified eye purpose wer haue comonly set vp church many cross wood stone siluer golde thys wel faythfully beaten people head christ dyed beare curse vpon crosse cleanse synnes sacrifice hys body wash away wyth hys bloud finally reconcile v god father one thyng might learne thousande cross wood stone parhaps couetous set mindes eye faster vpon golden siluer cross vpon wordes god concerning beginning idol common consente thought true written boke wysedome first authoures themsap xiiii xv gaue thys honor ded supersticiously worship memorie truly graunt thys euil custome auncient deny ye fierbrand wherwith rage men kindled idolatry burne therin yet graunt thys fyrst orygynall thys mischiefe appeareth moses image vsed curiositie dedicatig image dead whereof prophane wryters make otfen mention come vre telleth rachel stolen father idol speaketh common faultge xxxi xix wherby may gather wit man may cal continual worship idol generall floud new regeneracion world yet passed many yeares men according lust fained god likely holy patriarch yet liuing childrens child wer geuen idolatry bitter griefe saw earth defiled wt idol whose corruption lord late purged horribe iudgementios xxiiiiii thare nath r euen birth abraham worshipper false god iosue testifieth seing generation sem sone swarued shal iudge posteritie cham already cursed father minde men full pride rashe boldenesse presumeth imagine god according conceit possessed dullnesse yea ouerwhelmed grosse ignoraunce conceiueth vanitie fende fatasie stede god euils added new mischiefe man attempteth expresse workemanshippe suche god inwardly conceiueth thus minde begetteth idole hande bringeth forth example israelite proueth beginning idolatrie men beleue god among vnlesse shewe himselfe carnally presente knowe saied become moses make v god may go vsex xxxii knew god whose power experience many miracle beleue nie vnto vnlesse see eies corporall representacio face witnesse vnto god gouerned minde therfore knowe image going god guide iourney thing daily experience teacheth flesh alway vnquiet till hath gotten counterfaite deuise like self wherin may vainly delite image god manner al age since creation world men obey blinde desire haue erected signes wherin imagined god present carnall eies inuencion forged foloweth worshipping men thought beheld god image also worship legth mindes eies altogether fastened theron beganne waxe brutishe wonder haue admiracion wer nature godhed appeareth men brake worshipping image till perswaded grosse opinion thinke image god imagine dyd certaine force godhead abide therefore whether thou represent thy selfe either god creature image thou fallest worship thou art already bewitched wich superstition reason lord hath forbidden onely image bee erected ar made expresse likenesse also title stone dedicated stande worshipped reason also commaundemente lawe point added concerning worshipping sone thei haue forged visible forme god also tye power god vnto beastlie folish men fasten god counterfaite therfore must nedes worship neither differece whether simply worship idole god idole alway idolatry honoures due god geuen idole vnder color soeuer god wil worshipped superstitiously therefore soeuer geuen idol taken hym lette take hede hereunto seke pretense defende abhominable idolatrie wherwith many age past true religion hath drowned ouerthrowen saye image taken goddes neither iewes themselues vnaduised forgett god whole hande hadde broughte oute egipte made calfe yea aaron saied goddes deliuered oute lande egipte boldly assented shewing plaine toke meaning would still kepe god deliuerer mighte see goe calfe neither beleued heathen grosse beleue god thing stockes stone changed image pleasure still kepte goddes mynde many image one god yet dyd according multitude image faine many god besyde daily cosecrate newe image yet thinke made newe goddesin p cxiii lette excuse read whiche augustine saieth pretended idolater age rebuked common forte aunswered worshippe visible thing deitie inuisibly dwell somwhat better religion calleth saye neither worshippe image spirite corporall image beholde signe thing whiche oughte worship nowe idolater whether iewes gentile none otherwise minded haue saied contented spirituall vnderstanding god thought image sure nerer imprinted suche disordered counterfaiting god well liked neuer ended till daily deluded newe deceites imagined god shewe foorth hys power image neuerthelesse iewes perswaded vnder suche image worshippe one true lorde heauen earth lykewise gentile false goddes yet fayned dwell heauen whosoeuer deny hath thus ben done time past yea within remembraunce impudently lie fall pray turne toward eares godin p cxi true augustine saieth man praieth worshippeth beholdeth image affected minde thinketh heard desireth difference betwene image one god yt passing one image litle reuerence none done honor solemnely doe werry theselues vowed pilgremages visit image wherof haue like home day defense religion countrey fight slaughter destruction suche sorte would better suffer one god idol take yet recken vp grosse error comon people almost infinite manner possesse harte men shew theselues confesse meane al excuse themselues idolatry cal say oure goddes iewes gentile cal tyme paste yet prophetes eche cesse caste teeth fornicacion stockes stone thing daily done would compted christian say carnally worshipped god stockes stone although ignoraunt thinke good passe ouer knew seke escape suttle distinction wherof shal againe make mention large hereafter pretend worship geue image idolodulia seruice image idololatria worship image terme teache may lawfully withoute wrog done god geue vnto image picture worship cal doulia seruice thinke themselues without blame seruauntes also worshipper idol though litle lighter matter worship tha serue yet seke hole hide greke word childishly disagre wt themselues seing latreuein greke signifieth nothing worship saying cometh effect woulde say yt worship dede image without worshippinge cause shuld say yt seke catch word theselues seke cast mist eye ye simple bewray ignoraunce yet though neuer eloquent shal atteine eloquence proue vnto v one selfe thing two sondry thinges let say shewe difference yt thing selfe wherby may thought differ fro old idolater adulterer murderer canot escape giltinesse faulte geuing sinne newe deuised name verye absurditie thinke men quitte newe deuise name ye matter selfe nothing differ fro idolater theselues copelled condene far fro prouing case differeth fro case idolater yt rather fountaine al whole mischiefe vnorderly counterfaiting wherin haue striued witt deuise handes frame signifieng formes expresse fashion god yet superstitious thinke image maye suffred al forasmuch caruing painting giftes god require purely lawfully vsed least thing god hath geue v glory benefite defiled disordred abuse also turned owne destructio thinke vnlawful haue god fashioned oute visible forme himselfe hath forbidde cannot done wythoute defacemente hys glory least thynke onelye opinio haue ben trauailed work shall finde sounde writer alway reproue thynge lawfull make bodily image god muche lesse shall lawfull worshippe god god remayneth therefore lawfull onelye thynges bee painted grauen whereof eies capable maiestie god far aboue sense eies abused vncomly deuised shape sorte partly history thinges done partly image fashion body withoute expressing thinges done first haue vse teaching admonishing man profite seconde bring saue delectacion see yet euident euen almost al image heretofore haue stande vp church wherby may iudge set vp discrete iudgemente choise folishe vnaduised desire speake howe muche amisse vncomely wer moste parte fashione howe licentiously paynters caruers haue pointe shewed wantonnesse whiche thynge haue alredy touched speake end though wer fault yet nothing auaile teache leauing also difference let v waye consider whether expedient christian temple haue image al doe expresse either thinges done body men fyrst authoritie aunciente churche doe thyng moue v let v remember vc yeares together religion yet better florished sincere doctrine force christian church vniuersally without image first brought ye garnishment church sinceritie ministracion lyttle altered wil dispute reason yt first author therof man compare age age shall see muche swarued vpryghtnesse wythoute image doe thynke holye father would haue suffered church long wythoute thyng iudged profitable good rather saw eyther litle profit much daunger lurke vnderneth rather purpose aduisedly reiect itepi xlix ignoraunce negligence omytte whyche thyng augustine doeth also expresse word testifie set place saieth honorably hye seen pray doe sacrifice although want sense lyfe yet likenesse haue liuelye member sens moue weake mindes seeme liue breathin p cxiii c place shape member doeth worke manner enforce thus muche minde liuing within body doeth thynke body haue sense whiche seeth like vnto litel image auaile bow vnhappy soule haue mouth eye eares fete amend neyther speake see heare goe truely semeth cause iohn willed v beware onelye worshipping images1 iohn vxxi also image themselues haue founde muche experience throughe horrible madnesse whiche hath heretofore possessed worlde destruccyon manner godlynesse sone image set vp church signe sette vp idolatrie folly men cannot refraine selfe muste foorthwith runne supersticious worshippinges muche daunger hanging thereby yet consider vse temple ordeined thinkes verie ill beseming holinesse therof receiue image liuely natural image whiche lorde hys woorde hath consecrate meane baptisme lordes supper ceremony wherewyth eies ought earnestly occupyed liuely moued nede image framed ye witt men loe incomparable commoditie image whiche value recompensed beleue papistes thinke spoken enough thing alreadye nicene synode doeth laye hande enforce speake meane famous synode costatine great assembled holden eyght hundred yeares ago commaundemente authoritie irene empresse synode decreed image shoulde onely hadde church also worshipped whatsoeuer shoulde saye authoritie synode woulde make greate preindyce syde although saye trueth dooeth much moue make appeare reader howe farre theyr rage extended desirous image became chrystians first let v dispatche day maynteine vse image allege decree ye nicene synode theyr defense extante boke confutacio bearyng name charles great whiche phrase maye gather haue wrytten tyme therein recited sentence byshoppes presente counsell argumentes wherewith conte ded iohn legate east partes saied god created manne owne image thereuppon gathered oughte haue image man thought image commended vnto v sentence shewe thy face beautifull proue image oughte sette vppon altares cyted thys testimonie manne lighteth candell putteth vnder bushell shewe beholdyng profitable v brought forth verse oute psalme lyghte thy countenaunce sealed vppon v tooke thys similitude patryarches vsed sacrifice gentile must chrystian menne haue image saintes steade image gentyles purpose haue wryshed thys saying lorde haue loued beautie thy house specially witty exposition thys place haue heard haue seen god knowen onely hearyng hys worde also lokyng vpon image like sharpe deuyse byshop theodore maruellous sayeth god saintes place saintes earth therefore thys oughte referred image finally filthy theyr vnsauorye follyes greueth rehease talke worshyppyng broughte foorth worshyppynge pharao rod ioseph piller iacob sette vp albeit thys laste example doe onely depraue meanyng scripture also bryng whyche bee read place seme maruelous stronge meete proues worshippe footestole agayne worshyppe hys holye hyll agayne rychemen people shall worshippe thy countenaunce man woulde scorne putte personage riding foole vpon patrones image coulde gather together greater grosser folly putte oure doubte theodosius bishoppe mira doeth earnestlye confyrme dreames archedeacon image oughte worshipped oracle heauen shewe nowe lette fauourers image gooe presse v decree sinode thoughe reuerende father doe altogether discredit selues either childishly handelyng vngodly fowlie tearing scripture nowe come monstruous impiety whiche maruell euer durste vomitte twise maruellous cried oute againste hie detestacion men good outragiously wicked madnesse bewrayed least false coloure antiquitie maye taken awaye whiche papistes pretende worshipping image theodosius byshoppe amorum pronounceth curse againste wyll haue image worshipped imputeth calamity grecia easte part image worshipped punishment prophetes apostle martirs worthy suffer whose time image adde emperous image met perfume censing muche honoure due image saintes constantius bishoppe constance ciprus professeth reuerently embraceth image affirmeth wyl geue honourable maner worshippe due trinitie geueth life whosoeuer refuseth curseth sendeth away manichee marcionites ye thinke priuate sentence one manne assent vnto yea ihon legate easte partes beeing carried heate sayed better bring al brothelhouses citie denye worshipping image lengthe consente al decreed worse heretikes samaritanes worse samaritanes enemy image playe shoulde without hys solemne farewel thys clause added let glad reioyse hauing image chryst doe offer sacrifice vnto distinction latria dulia wherewith wonte seke blinde eye god counsell wythout excepcion doeth geue euen much vnto image vnto lyuinge god hymselfe pthe xii chapter god seuerally discerned idol may wholly worshipped saied beginning knowledge god standeth bare speculacion draweth worshipping way touched rightly worshipped point shalbe place largely set forth nowe doe shortlye repete oft scripture affirmeth one god striueth bare name god withall commaundeth whatsoeuer belongeth godhead bee geuen wherby also appeareth pure religion doeth differ supersticion eusebeia greke signifieth much true worship alway euen blinde themselues groping darkenesse haue founde rule ought holden god bee vnorderly worshipped de na u deorum name religion although cicero truelye wel deriueth relegere recorde gather vp together yet reason assigneth enforced far fet good worshipper often recorde diligently wey trueth rather thinke name set contrary wandring liberte greater part world vnaduisedly taketh holde whyche first mete withall flieth aboute hether thether true godlinesse ende may stande stedfaste state religit say doth gather vp selfe together within bondes like think supersticion haue name herof contented maner order prescribed heapeth vp together supersluous ber vaine thinges leaue wordes hath alway ben agreed consent age religion false error corrupted peruerted wherupon gather fonde color supersticious pretende whe vndiscrete zele geue selues leaue al thinges although confession sounde mouthes al yet herein shamefull ignoraunce bewraieth selfe neither cleaue one god haue regarde order ye worshipping haue already shewed god claime right vnto himselfe crieth ielous wil seuere reuenger mingled fained god setteth forth lawful maner worshipping holde mankinde obedience conteineth pointes law whe first bindeth faithful vnto hymselfe may theyr lawemaker prescribeth rule wherby worshipped owne minde law v endes therof many wyl entreate place fit touch point therby bridled run way wrong worshippynges first said must holde mind al euer properly belogeth godhead rest god alone spoiled honor worship broken heremust somwhat defully marke suttelties superstition deceiueth doothe reuolte vnto straunge god semeth forsake hyest god bryng hym downe numbre goddes graunteth vnto hym hyest place setteth rounde aboute hym number lesser god among whome diuideth office albeit clokedly craftily glorie godhead cut partes remaineth whole hym ye old tyme wel iewes ye gentile dyd set beneth father iudge god great rout god whiche shuld every one accordyng degree haue comon hyest god gouernement heauen earth saintes fewe age past departed lyfe aduanced felowship god worshipped called vpon honoured stede yet suche abhomination thinke maiestie god muche diuided deede greate parte suppressed extinguished sauyng reteine yll poore opinion supreme power mean tyme deceiued entangled suttelties sonderly caried diuers god purpose also inuented distinction latria dulia terme worship seruice wherby might freely seme geue away honor god angel dead men euident worship whiche papistes geue vnto saintes differeth nothyng dede woorship god alike without diuersitie worship god sauyng charged wynde away exception keepe still god honour due vnto inuiolate leaue vnto worshippe call latria sith question standeth vpon matter woorde wolde permit carelesly mocke matter matter moste weyghtie lette also passe yet winne nothyng distinction proue thei geue worship one god seruice latria greke signifieth much latin cultus englishe worship dulia proprely signifieth seruice yet somtyme scripture difference confounded together without diuersitie graunte perpetuall difference must searche bothe wordes may meane dulia seruice latria worship man douteth serue whorshippe many tymes manne coulde hardely beare serue hym whome would sticke worship vnegall dealyng geue sainctes whiche greatter leaue god whiche lesser many auncient author haue vsed distinction maketh matter menne doo perceiue onely vnfitte together fonde nowe leauyng nice suttleties lette v wey matter selfe paule putteth galathians remembrance lightened knowledge godgal iiiiviii saieth gaue duliam seruice nature god although name latriam worship therfore theyr superstitton excusable doth neuerthelesse condemne peruerse superstition whiche termeth name dulia seruice expressed name latria worship christe repulseth assault sathan buckler written thou shalt woorshyp lorde thy godmat iiiix reue xix x name latria brought question sathan required adoration likewise whe angel eproued iohn felle downe knee hym oughte thinke iohn madde woulde geue vnto angell honoure due onely god possible worshyp ioyned religion sauoureth somwhat perteinyng god therefore coulde adore angell must take away sommewhat glorye god reade deede often men haue bene honoured ciuile honour maye call religion hath rule whyche soone ioyned worshyppe bryngeth prophane abuse honour god maye see cornelius hadde sclenderly profyted godlynesseact xxxv hadde learned geue soueraigne worshippe god alone therfore fell downe peter didde meanyng worshyppe hym steede god yet dydde peter earnestly forbyd hym doo whiche didde men doo neuer narrowly put difference betwene worshyppe god creature without diuersitie geue away vnto creature whiche belongeth vnto god wherefore haue one god must remembre nothyng neuer lyttle muste bee taken awaye glorye kepe styll whyche proprely therfore zacharie preacheth repayryng churche playne word expressethzac xxiiiiix shal one god also yt shalbe one name ye god end ye haue nothing common idol maner worshyp god requyreth shal see place falleth order pleased hym law prescribe vnto men lawfull ryght bynd certayn rule euery man geue hymselfe leaue deuise forme worshyp lyst expediet loade reader heapyng many matter together touche poynte yet onely lette sus ise tyme kepe mynd euery cariyng away dutyefull behauiours godlynesse god alone without robbery god fyrste superstition deuysed geue diuine honour sonne starres idol folowed ambitious pryde whyche garnyshyng mortall men spoyles taken god presumed prophane euer holy although principle remayned among theim honour soueraigne deitie yet grewe vse indifferently offer sacrifice spirites lesser god dead honor slippery way slide fault make common number whiche god seuerely chalengeth hym selfe alone xiii chapter taught scripture one offence god creation whiche essence conteineth thre person taught scripture concernyng incomprehensible spirituall essence god oughte suffise onely ouerthrowe foolisshe errours common people also confute fine suttelties prophane philosophie one olde writer semed haue said wel god al see doo see meane hathe imagined godhead powred ye partes world although god intent kepe men sobre mynde speaketh sparely owne essence yet twoo name addition haue rehersed doothe bothe take away grosse imagination also represse presumptuous boldnesse man mynde surely immeasurable greatnesse ought make v afrayde attempt measure hym sense spirituall nature forbiddeth v imagine thyng earthly fleshely hym cause often assigneth dwellyng place heauen though incomprehensible tilleth earthe also yet seeth oure myndes reason dullnesse lie still earthe good cause lifteth v vp aboue worlde shake slouth sluggishnesse falleth grounde errour manichee appointyng two originall beginnynges haue made diuell maner egall god surely muche breake vnitie god restrayne vnmeasurablenesse haue presumed abuse certain testimony sheweth fowle ignoraunce errour selfe sheweth detestable madnesse anthropomorphites also easily confuted haue imagined god consist bodye oftentymes scripture ascribeth vnto hym mouthe eares eye handes feete man yea though sclenderly witted dooth vnderstande god dooth v speake childishly nurse doo babe therefore suche maners speeche doo playnely expresse god apply vnderstandyng sclender capacitie whiche behoued necessitie descended great way beneath owne heyght also setteth hymselfe speciall marke wherby may nerely knowen declareth hymselfe bee one yet geueth himselfe distinctly considered three person whiche except learne bare empty name god without true god flieth braine man thinke threfolde god one essence god diuided three person must seke short easy definition deliuer v fro errour many doo make muche doo worde person thyng inuented man howe iustly doo beste fyrst see apostle namyng sonne engraued forme hypostasis fatherheb iiii vndoubtedly meaneth father hath beeyng wherin differeth sonne take essence expositours haue done christ like piece waxe printed seale didde represent substaunce father onely harde also absurditie sithe essence god single one vndiuisible hym selfe conteineth pecemeale deriuation whole perfection vnproprely yea fondly bee called engraued forme hym ye father although propretie distinct hath expressed hymselfe wholly sonne good cause sayde hath geuen hypostasis seene hym wherwith aptely agreeth foloweth brightnesse glory surely apostle wordes gather certayn propre hypostasis father shineth sonne whereby also agayne easily perceiued hypostasis sonne distinguisheth father like order holy ghost shall proue hym god yet must nedes father yet distinction essence whiche vnlawfull make manyfolde therfore apostle testimonie credited foloweth god thre hypostasis terme seyng latines haue expressed name person muche pride waywardnesse brawle cleere matter list worde worde translate may call subsistence many sense haue called substance name person hath ben vse among latin onely also grecian perhaps declare consente haue taught three prosopa say person god whether grekes latin differ one worde doo well agree summe matter nowe howesoeuer heretikes barke name persone ouermuch precise men carpe thei like worde fained deuise men sithe get v say three whereof euery one wholly god yet many goddes vnreasonablenesse myslyke woordes whiche expresse none thynge whiche testified approued scripture better say restraine meanynges also oure woordes within boundes scripture deuyse straunge name may begynnynges disagrement brawlyng doo tyer selues strife woordes truthe loste contending charitie broken odiousely brawlyng together call straunge woorde whiche shewed scripture written nombre syllable bynde v hard law wherby condemned exposition ye pie ed together bare laying together textes scripture meane straunge whiche beyng curiousely deuised superstitiousely defended whiche maketh contention edification whiche either vnaptely profite vsed whiche withdraweth simplicitie word god hart embrace sobre minde iudge ought lesse deuout reuerence talke god thynke muche soeuer doo selues thinke foolishe euer speake vnsauorye certayn measure kepte ought learne scripture rule bothe thynke speake wherby examine thoughtes mynde wordes mouth withstandeth v suche scripture capacitie doutfull entangled may plainer woordes expresse theim beynge yet suche wordes doo reuerently faithfully serue truthe scripture vsed sparely modestly without occasion whiche sort example enowe shall profe appere churche great necessitie enforced vse name trinitie persones shall fynde faulte newenesse woordes shall iustly thought greeued lyght truthe blameth onely truthe made playne cleare discerne suche newnesse woordes bee called commeth chiefly vse truthe defended wrangler doo mocke cauillations whiche thyng haue daye muche experience haue great businesse vanquisshynge enemy true sounde doctrine suche foldyng crooked windyng slippery snake doo slide away vnlesse strongly griped holden hard taken old father beyng troubled contendyng againste false doctrine compelled shewe theyr meanynges exquisite playnnesse least leaue crooked bywayes wicked doutful construction woordes hidyngholes errours arrius confessed christe god sonne god coulde agaynsay euident wordes god ben sufficiently discharged fayne certayne consent rest meane ceassed scatter abroade christe create beginnyng creature ende myght drawe foorth windyng sutteltie denne auncient father went pronouncyng christ eternall sonne father consubstanciall father hereat wickednesse began boile arrians began hate deteste name omoousion consubstanciall beginnyng sincerely playn meanynge confessed christ god would haue denyed hym consubstantiall father dare nowe blame good men brawler contentious bycause one litle woordes sake whote disputation troubled quiete churche little worde shewed difference betwene true beleuyng christian arrians wer robber god afterward rose vp sabellius whiche accompted maner nothyng name father sonne holy ghost sayeng disputation made shewe maner distinction onely seuerall addition god whiche sorte many came disputation confessed beleeued father god sonne god holy ghost god afterwarde would redely slippe away sayeng hadde otherwise spoken named god strong god iust god wise god song another songe father sonne holy ghost father without order without distinction good doctours care godlynesse subdewe wickednesse cried oute side ought acknowleged one god thre propreties ende fense themselues againste crooked writhen suttleties plaine simple truthe affirmed truely subsist one god came one effect subsist vnitie god trinitie person name haue ben without cause inuented ought take hede reiectyng iustly blamed proude presumptuousnesse woulde god wer buried dede faith agreed men father sonne holy ghost bee one god yet father sonne holy ghost sone distinct certain propretie yet precise fynde harte striue bare wordes note olde father whiche otherwise spake religiousely matter euery wher agree one eueryone himselfe formes speeche vsed councels doothe hilarie excuse howe greate libertie doothe augustine sometyme breake foorth howe vnlyke grekes latin variance one example shal suffise tyme latin ment expresse word omoousion called consubstancial declaring substance father sonne one vsyng word substance essence whervpon hierom damasus sayth sacrilege say thre substance god yet aboue hundred tymes shall fynde hilarie three substance god woorde hypostasis howe hierome accombred suspecteth lurketh poison namyng thre hypostasis god man vse word godly sense yet plainly saith impropre speeche spake vnfainedly dyd rather wittyngly willyngly seeke charge bishoppes eastlandes whome soughte charge vniuste sclaunder sure one thynge speaketh truely prophane schooles ousia de trini li v cap viii ix essence nothyng el hypostasis whyche proued false common accustomed vse augustine modeste gentyll whiche although say worde hypostasis sense strange latine eares yet farre taketh grekes theyr vsuall maner speakyng also gently beareth latin folowed greke phrase whiche socrates writeth syxte booke tripartite hystorie tendeth ende though ment hadde vnskilfull men bene wrongfullye applied vnto matterde trini lib ii yea hilarie hymselfe layethe greate faulte heretikes charge theyr waywardnesse compelled putte thynges perylle speche men whyche oughte haue beene kepte relygiousnesse myndes playnely confessynge doo thynges vnlaufull speake ought bee spoken attempt thynges licenced little excuseth wt many word bold vtter newe name vsed natural name father sonne holy ghost addeth soeuer sought beyod compasse speache beyonde reache sense beyonde capacitie vnderstandynge place saith ye happy ar ye bishop gallia neither receiued knewe confession olde simple one whiche time apostle receyued church muche like excuse augustine woorde wroung oute necessitie reason imperfection men language greate matter expresse whiche shoulde bee vnspoken howe father sonne holy ghoste three modestie holy menne ought warne v doo foorthwith seuerely lyke censor note infamie refuse subscribe sweare suche wordes propounde doo pride frowardnesse malicious crafte let consider great necessitie driuen speake littell little may enured profitable maner speche let also learne beware least sithe must mete one syde arrians syde sabellian whyle offended cutte occasion cauill bryng themselues suspicion ye disciple either arrius sabellius arrius sayth christe god muttereth create beginnyng saith christe one father secretely whispereth eares disciple made one faithfull although singular prerogatiue say one christ consubstanciall father plucke visour dissembler yet adde nothyng scripture sabellius sayth seueral name father son holy ghost signifie nothyng god seuerally distincte saye three crye name thre god saye one essence trinitie person shal one word bothe saye scripture speaketh stop vayne babblyng nowe holden curious superstition abide name yet man though wold neuer fayn deny heare one must vnderstande vnitie substance thre one essence ment person trinitie thyng beyng without fraude confessed stay longer vpon wordes haue long ago foud often soeuer obstinately quarell woordes doo keepe within secrete poison better willyngly prouoke theim pleasure speake darkly leauyng disputation woordes nowe begyn speake matter selfe call therfore persone subsistence essence god hauyng relation distinguished vncomunicable propretie name subsistence meane thyng essence worde simply ben god meane tyme nothynge seuerally propre selfe iohn hadde sayde amysse god foorthewith addethiohn god hymselfe woorde calleth v backe agayne one single essence could god must rest father hereof ariseth subsistence though ioyned essence vnseparable knot yet hath speciall marke wherby doth differ three subsistence say eche hauyng relation propretie distinguished relation expressely mencioned simple indefinite mencion made god name belongeth lesse sonne holy ghoste father father compared sonne seuerall propretie eyther doth discerne hym thirdely soeuer propre vnto euery vncommunicable geuen father marke difference lib contra traccam agree geuen son mislyke definition tertullian rightly taken god certayne disposition distribution yet chaungeth nothyng vnitie essence go good proue godhead sonne holy ghost shall see differ one surely worde god spoken scripture greate absurditie imagin fadyng vanishyng voyce whiche sente ayre cometh god hymselfe whiche sort oracle geuen father prophecy rather woorde mente bee perpetuall wisedome abidyng father whens oracle prophecy proceded peter testifieth lesse didde olde prophetes speake spirite christi pet dyd apostle dyd distribute heauenly doctrine christe yet openly shewed must vnderstande worde worldes begotten father spirite worde whose instrumentes prophetes vndoutedly gather true god doth moses teache playnly enough creation world setteth worde meane dooth expressely tell god creatyng woorkes sayd doone doon vnserchable glory god may shiningly appere image suttlenosed babblyng men easily mock sayeng name woorde taken byddynge commaundemente better expositor apostlesheb iii whiche teache worldes made susteineth theym mightie worde see yt word taken bidding commaundement sonne hymselfe eternall essentiall word father wise sobre darke salomon saythecclesi xxiiiixiiii bryngeth wisedom begotten god worldes bearyng rule creation thynges workes god say certayne commaundement god seruyng tyme foolishe vayne deede goddes pleasure tyme shewe foorth stedfast eternall purpose yea thyng secrete whyche entente also maketh sayinge christe father doo woorke euen dayeiohn vxvii sayinge begynnyng worlde contynually woorkynge father doothe openly declare whyche moses hadde shortely touched gather meanynge goddes speakynge worde hadde office doynge thynges bothe common woorkynge togyther moste playnely doothe iohn speake shewethe woorde whyche begynnyng god god togyther god father cause thynges geueth worde perfecte abydyng essenceioh iiii also assygneth vnto thyng peculiar selfe plainlye sheweth god speakyng creatour worlde therefore reuelacions proceding god dooe well beare name worde god oughte yet sette hyeste place substancyall worde well spryng oracle whiche subiecte alteracion abideth alwayes one selfe god god hymselfe many dogges dooe barke agaynste v whiche dare openly take godhead doe secretly steale eternitie saye worde beganne firste god creation world opened holy mouthe verie vndiscretelye dooe imagine certaine innouacyon substaunce god name god haue relacion outwarde worke beganne geuen vnto hym worke example thys called creatour heauen earth doeth godlynesse knowe admitte name shoulde signifie newe thinge hymselfe haue chaunced vnto god shoulde come ell hymselfe thys saying iames shoulde fayle euery good geuing euery perfecte gifte aboue commeth downe father lightes variablenesse neyther shadowing turning therfore nothing lesse suffred tha faine beginning worde whiche alwaye god afterwarde creator worlde full suttelly forsoth reason moses saying god first spake doeth secretlye shewe worde whiche moste tryfling argumente foloweth thyng one certaine time beginneth shewed openly therefore neuer anye beyng beforebut conclude farre otherwyse saye seyng momente god sayedge iiii lette lighte made power worde appeared shewed selfe worde longe man aske howe long shall fynde beginnyng appointed certayne space tyme hym selfe sayedioh xviiv father glorifie glory wyth thee worlde thys thyng iohn also left vntouched fyrst sheweth beginning worde god commeth creation worlde saye therefore agayne worde whyche conceyued god beginning tyme contynuallye remayninge wyth hym whereby bothe hys eternitie true essence godhead proued althoughe dooe yet touche person mediator deferre place shall specially entreate redempcion yet oughte certaynly holden wythoute controuersie amonge al men christ word clad flesh place fitte recite testimony proue chryst godps xlv vi sayed xlv psalme thy throne god euer euer iewes doe cauill saye name elohim also applied angel soueraigne power scripture like place raiseth eternall throne creature simplye called god also eternall lorde againe tittle geuen none addicione viii saied moses shalbe god pharao rede genitiue case verye foolishe graunte dede oftentimes thing called diuine god notable singular excellence tenoure texte appeareth suche meaning harde forced agree scubbornesse yelde esaie verie plainly broughte one christe god adorned soueraigne power whiche properly belonging god alone saieth name wherby shall call himesa vi strong god father world come c iewes barcke againe turne texte thus name whereby stronge god father worlde come shall call leaue onely sonne bee called prince peace purpose shoulde many name addicion place bee heaped vpon god father seeyng purpose prophete adorne chryste suche speciall note maie builde oure faith vppon wherfore oute doute like sorte called stronge god little called immanuellier xxiii ii nothing founde plainer place hieremie sayeth shall name whereby sede dauid shall called iehouah oure righteousnesse iewes themselues doe teach name god adiectiue name addicion name iehouah whiche call vnspeakable substantiue name expresse hys essence gather sonne onely eternall godesa xliiviii saith place wil geue glory also seke scape away moses gaue name altare bilded ezechiel gaue newe citie hierusalem doth see altare builded monumente god auauncement moses hierusalem adorned name god onely testifie presence god thus sayeth prophete name citie day shalbe iehouah thereez xlviii xxxv ero xvii xv r xxxvi xvi moses sayth thus bilded altare called name iehouah exaltacion businesse ariseth place hieremie tittle applyed hierusalem wordes name whereby shall call iehouah righteousnesse thys testimonye farre makyng agaynste trueth whiche defende rather confirmeth wheras testified christ true iehouah floweth ryghteousnesse nowe pronounceth churche shall verely fele may gloriouslye vse name selfe firste place sette fountayne cause ryghteousnesse effecte nowe thys dooe satisfie iewes iehouah ofte presented personne angell see wyth cauillations canne mocke oute saied angell appeared holy father angell chalengeth hymselfe name eternall godiu vivii take excepcion say spoken respecte person representeth thys knotte thus losediu xiiixvi seruaunte woulde suffer sacrifice offered hym take god due honoure angell refusing eate bread commaundeth sacrifice bee offered iehouah proueth hymselfe dede iehouah therefore manoah wife thys token gather seen angel god thence came sayed shall dye haue seen god hys wyfe answereth iehouah woulde haue slayen v woulde haue receaued sacrifice oure handes thys doeth confesse god whiche called angell besyde thys answere angell hymselfe taketh away doubte saying doest thou aske name maruellous much detestable wickednesse seruetto affirmed god neuer appeared abraham father angell worshipped place truely wisely haue true teaching doctor churche expounded principall angell worde god aforehande beganne execute office mediatoure thoughe yet clothed fleshe yet came meane betwene god men come familiarly faithfull therefore hys nye communicating himselfe made called angell yet still meane time reteined ye god vnspeakable gloryose xiiv thesame thing meaneth oseas recited wraftlyng iacob angell sayeth iehouah god hostes iehouah worthy memory name agayne seruetto carpeth yt god beare person angel thoughe prophete confirme whiche moses saied doest thou aske name confession holye patriarche doeth sufficiently declare created angell one full godhead residentege appointed nowe seconde chapter zacharie weyed withoute contencion angell sente angell pronounced god hostes hym soueraigne power ascribed omitte innumerable testimony oure fayth safelye resteth althoughe doe muche moue iewes saied esaie beholde godes xxvix iehouah shal waite vpon shall saue v haue eye may see herein meant god ryseth vp saluacion people vehement demonstracions twise repeted suffer drawen otherwhere christe yet plainer fuller place malachie promyseth shall come lorde desiredmal iiii hys owne temple none onely soueraigne god temple dedicate temple yet prophete doeth claime christ wher vpon foloweth christe god euer honored among iewes newe testamente swarueth innumerable testimony therfore must trauayle rather shortly choose fewe largely heape vp thoughe apostle speake since nowe become mediatour fleshe yet shalll bring forth shall aptly serue proue godhead firste worthy singularly marked thinges spoken touching eternall god apostle doe shewe either already performed hereafter performed christ esaie prophecieth lorde hostes shalbe iewes israelite strombling stone rocke fall vponesa viii xiiii rom ix xxiii ro xiiiix esa iv xxiii paule affirmeth fulfilled christ therefore declareth lorde hostes likewise place must al saith one broughte appeare iudgemente throne christe written shall knee bowe shall al tonges swere seing god esai speaketh thing himselfe christe dede performeth himselfe foloweth selfe god whoes glory may withdrawen thing writing ephesian allegeth psalmes euident applyed none god aloneephe iiii v ii psa lviixix ascending hie hath caryed captiuitie captiue meaning ascending shadow shewed god notable victory forein nation shewe forth power declareth christe fully performed ihon testifieth glory sone reueled esaie visioniohn shoulde imagine seconde god whiche himselfe acknowledgeth dout godlye meaning likewise thomas protesting bee lorde god doeth professe onely one god alway worshipped nowe esteme godhead workes scripture ascribed vnto shall thereby euidentlie appeare saied beginning thetherto working fatherioh vxvii iewes whiche moste dull vnderstandyng sayinges yet perceiued toke vpon power god theretore iohn telleth soughte kill didde onely breake sabbat also dyd call god father making himselfe egall god howe dull shall doe perceiue godhead herein playnlye affirmed truely order worlde prouidence creature lord crieth prophete doe awaye thyne offence myne owne sakeesa xliiixxv ix vi according meaning thys sentence whe iewes thoughte wronge done god christe forgeue sinnes christe onely affirmed thoughtes hartesmath ixiiii propretie god alone chryst wherby gathered god nowe miracle howe plainlye clerely doeth appeare thoughe graunte well prophetes apostle egall like miracle yet thys greate differece ministracion disposed giftes god shewed forth owne power vsed sometime praier ende geue glory vnto hys father see moste part power shewed vnto v howe coulde otherwise verye author miracle xx baptise name father sonne holy ghost much effect baptised name one god perfect bryghtnesse hath appeared ye father sonne holy ghost wherby euidente essence god abide thre person one god knowen surely forasmuch fayth ought loke hether thether diuersly wader haue regard ye one god applied sticke fast hereby easily proued diuerse kindes faith must also bee many god wheras baptisme sacrament faith proueth vnto v vnitie god one herof also foloweth lawful baptised one god bicause embrace ye faith whose name baptised meant christe commaunded baptised name father sonne holy gost ought one faith beleue father sonne holy ghost therfore sithe remaineth certayn one god many determine worde spirite nothyng el selfe essence god foolishly arrians prate confessyng godhed sonne take substance prudence fortitude godlinesse yet diuided accordyng distribution grace howe oeuer bee dyuersely dealt abroadei cor xiixi yet remaineth one apostle saithe agayn shewed scripture certain distinction father woorde worde spirite discussyng wherof howe greate religiousnesse sobrietie oughte vse greatnesse mysterie selfe dooth admonishe v well like saying gregorie nazianzene sermo ne e sacro bap ismo thynke vpon one compassed brightnesse thre seuerally discerne three sodeinly dryuen backe one wherfore lette come myndes one imagine suche trinitie person may hold thought withdrawen seueralties doothe foorthewith brynge v agayn vnitie name father sonne holy ghost doo proue true distinction man thynke bare name addition wherby god accordyng woorkes diuersly entitled yet distinction diuision place wee haue already cited doo shewe sonne hath propretie distincte father worde ben god hadde ben thyng father neyther glorye father beyng distinct hym lykewise doothe distinguisshe hym selfe father saythe whyche beareth hym witnesseiohn viii viiixvi purpose maketh whiche place sayd father created thinges worde whiche coulde beyng certaine maner distinct hym moreouer father came downe earth came father father died roase agayne sent neither yet distinction beginne takynge flesheiohn ixviii manifest also onely begotten bosom father abide say sonne entred bosome father descended heauen take manhode vpon hym therefore bosome father enioyed glorie fatherioh xiiiivixvxxvi distinction holye ghoste frome father christe speaketh saith procedeth father howe oft doothe shewe beside promyseth wyll sende confortoureioh xiiiixvi often place borow similitude matter expresse force distinction knowe whether expedient dede olde father wont doo somtyme withall doo confesse soeuer bryng foorth like doothe muche differ cause muche afrayd waye bolde least bryng foorth thyng vnfittly shuld geue occasion either malicious cauill vnskilfull deceiued yet suche distinction haue marked sette reckened fyrst hym sonne holy ghost euery man mynde self enclineth fyrst consider god wisedome risyng hym laste power wherwith putteth decree purpose execution sort sonne said father holy ghoste bothe god therfore simply speake sonne without hauyng respect father well proprely say hym selfe therfore call hym one beginnyng make mention relation betweene father rightly make father beginning sonne whole fifth boke augustine concernyng trinitie dooth nothyng sette foorth matter muche safer reste relation speaketh suttletle pearcyng vnto hye mysterie wander abroade many vayne speculation let therfore yt pleased sobrenesse cotented measure faith shortly learne muche profitable bee knowen professe beleue one god vnder name god vnderstande one onely single essence whiche comprehende thre person hypostasis therfore oft doo indefinitely speake name god meane lesse sonne holy ghost father sonne ioyned father commeth relation make distinction betwene person propreties person bring order beginnyng orginall father ofte mencion made father son holy ghost together name god peculiarly geuen father meane reteined vnitie essence regarde hadde order whiche yet dothe minishe nothyng godhead sonne holy ghoste haue already seene apostle doo affirme sonne god moses prophetes doo testifie iehouah lorde must necessitie alwaye come vnitie essence wherefore detestable sacrilege v call sonne seuerall god father bycause symple name god doothe admytte relation god respecte hym selfe bee saide nowi cor xiiix name iehouah lorde indefinitely taken applied christe appereth wordes paul wher sayth therfore haue thryse praied lorde hadde receyued aunswere christ grace sufficient sayeth power christ may dwell certayne name lorde set iehouah therfore restraine person mediatour fonde childyshe somuch absolute sentence compareth father sonne knowe accustomed maner greekes apostle doo commonly sette worde kyrios lord stede iehouah fetche example farre paule dydde sense pray lorde iixvi ioel iixxviii sense peter citethe place ioell soeuer calleth vppon name lorde shall saued name peculiarly geuen sonne shall se reason therof com place fitte nowe enough haue mynde paule absolutely praied god bryngeth name christ euen whole god called christ hymselfe spirite cause agaynst whole essence god may bee spirituall wherin father sonne holy ghoste comprehended whiche playne scripture euen heare god made spirite holy ghost muche hypostasis whole essence bee called bothe god procedyng god muche satan ende roote faith hath alway moued great cotentions partly concernyng diuine essence sonne holy ghost partly cocernyng distinction persones maner age hath stirred vp wicked spirites trouble true teacher behalfe day trauaileth olde embres kyndle new fyre therfore good answere peruerse foolishe errours hitherto hath ben purpose leade hande ar willyng learne striue hande hande obstinate contentious nowe truthe haue already peasably shewed must reskued cauillations wicked chiefe trauayle shall yet applied ende whyche geue gentill open eares woord god may haue whervpon stedfastly rest foote poynt secrete mystery scripture ought dispute sobrely greate moderation take great hede neyther oure thought oure tongue procede boundes goddes woorde dooe extende howe may mynde man capacitie define immeasurable essence god whiche neuer yet coulde certainly determine howe great body son yet daily seeth eye yea howe may owne guidyng atteyn discusse substaunce god reache knowe owne substaunce wherfore lette v willingly geue ouer vnto god knowledge selfe hilum li pri de trinitate onely hylarie saieth conueniente witnesse hym selfe whiche knowen hymselfe shall geue ouer vnto hym shall conceiue hym hath opened vnto v shall el searche knowe hym owne worde ende written fiue homelies chrysostome anomei yet boldnesse sophisters coulde restrained bablyng vnbridledly haue behaued selues behalfe whit modestely wonted vnhappye successe whiche vndiscretion ought warned take care bend selues trauaile question rather tractable willyngnesse learne sharpnesse witte neuer haue mynde eyther searche god el holy worde thynke thynge hym hauyng word goyng guide v speake thynge whiche taken worde distinction one godhead father sonne holy ghoste harde knowe dooth bryng busynesse comberance wittes expedient let remembre myndes men doo entre mase folowe owne curiositie let suffer selues ruled heauenly oracle howe soeuer atteyne heighte mysterie make register errours wherwith purenesse faithe poynt doctrine hath tymes paste ben assailed long full vnprofitable tediousnesse moste parte heretikes haue attempted ouerwhelme glory god grosse dotyng errours haue thought enough shake trouble vnskilfull fewe men haue spronge vp many sectes wherof doo teare sunder essence god confound distinction yt betwene person hold fast yt alredy sufficietly shewed scripture yt essence one god whiche belongeth father son holy ghost syngle vndiuided agayne father certayne propretie differeth sonne sonne holy ghost shal stop vp gate arrius sabellius also olde author errours tyme risen vp certaine phreneti e men seruetto like haue encombred thinges newe deceites good fewe wordes discusse falsehoodes name trinitie hatefull yea detestable seruetto sayde trinitaries called vtterly godlesse omitte foolishe wordes deuised raile withall opinion sume god made tripartite whe said abide thre person essence trinitie thyng imagined disagreeth vnitie god meane tyme person would haue certaine outward conception forme whiche truely subsistyng essence god doo represente god vnto v fashion beginnyng god nothyng distincte bicause one worde spirite one sin christe arose god oute god holye ghost sprong also god hym though sometyme colour folly allegory saythe eternall worde god spirite christ god bright shinyng forme agayne holy ghost shadow godhed yet afterward bringeth godhed nothing affirmyng rate distribution bothe son holy spirite parte god euen spirite v also wode stone substancially porcion god babbleth person mediatour shall hereafter see place conuenient monstrous forged deuise persone nothyng ell visible forme glory god needeth long confutationioh iohn pronounceth woorde god worlde yet create maketh muche differynge conception forme also yea farthest eternitie tyme woorde whyche god father owne propre glorye father could outward figuratiue shining necessarily foloweth hypostasis inwardely abyde god althoughe bee mencion made spyrite hystorye creation worlde yet brought shadowe essentiall power god moses sheweth vnfashioned lumpe susteined hymgen iii therfore appeared eternall spirite alwaies god preserued susteyned confused matter heauen earth vntill beautie order added vnto surely coulde yet image representation god seruetto dreameth poyntes compelled openly disclose wickednesse sayeng god eternall purpose appointyng hymselfe visible sonne meane shewe himselfe visible true godhed left vnto christe farre eternall decree god ordeyned sonne moreouer transformeth imagined shape sticketh fayne newe accidentes god abhominable confusely myngleth well sonne god holye ghoste creature playnely affirmeth bee partes foorthe lyke monster certaine lewde men meanyng escape hatred shame wickednesse seruetto haue dede confessed thre persones addyng maner howe father whiche truely proprely one onely god formyng son spirit common christ father moreouer person father wiped trinitie wherin shall differ sonne holy ghoste onely god confesse christ god yet say differeth father agayn muste marke difference make father sonne say marke difference essence doo manifestly bring true godhead christe nothynge whiche without essence yea whole essence father differeth sonne vnlesse haue somethyng propre hymselfe common sonne nowe fynde wherin make different difference essence let answere haue communicated sonne could part say made halfe god wycked beside meane doo fowly teare sunder essence god remaineth therefore essence whole perfectly common father sonne bee true touchyng essence difference one say yt father geuyng essence remaineth neuerthelesse god essence abideth christ shalbe figuratiue god god shew name familiarly know hym least alway wauer doutfulnesse therfore pleasure haue history creacio remaining wherupo fayth ye church might rest seke god hym moses hath declared ye maker bilder world first set forth ye tyme yt continual proceding yeres faithfull myghte come first original mankinde al thinges knowledge necessary confute monstrous fable somtyme spred egipte partes worlde also beginning worlde one beyng knowen eternitie god may clerely shine forth rauishe v admiracion neyther oughte thyng moued wyth vngodly mocke maruel came soner ye mind god make ye heauen earth syttig idle suffer immesurable space passe away sith mought haue made many thousande age wheras ye whole continuaunce ye world yt draweth end yet come sixe thousande yeres god long differred nether lawful expediet v enquire man mynd wil trauaile attaine thereunto shal faile hundred tymes way nether wer profitable v know yt thing god hymselfe proue ye modestie fayth hath purpose wylled hydden wel godly olde man speake whiche wanton felowe scorne demaunde hym god done creacion worlde aunswered builded hell curious fooles let graue seuere warning represse wantonnesse tickleth many yea dryueth euill hurtfull speculacions finally lette v remember inuisible god whoes wisedome power iustice incomprehensyble doth sette v historye moses lokyng glasse wherein hys liuely image appeareth eye eyther growen dimme age dulled wyth disease doe discerne thyng playnly vnlesse holpen spectacle suche oure weakenesse vnlesse scripture directe v sekyng god forthwith runne vanitie folowe owne wantonnesse nowe warned one shoulde quarell wyth god emptynesse wherein nothyng conteyned hundred tymes shall godly abhore suche wantonnesse lyke madnesse runne busy selues aboute god sitting stil apointment made world innumerable age soner satisfie gredinesse minde couer passe wtout copasse world though large circuite heauen earth could finde thing enough yt wt inestimable brightnesse may ouerwhelme al sens though six thousad yeres god hath shewed example cotinual cosideracion wherof myndes may exercised let v therfore willingly abide enclosed within boundes wherwt pleased god enuiro v pen vp mindes yt shold instructe v riflyng question sounde godlynesse feare name true confidence duty holynesse let v rest vpon suche knowledge wherfore wil rightly wise must leaue vanity yt ydle men haue taught without warrant woorde god concernyng nature degree multitude angel knowe suche matter many gredily taken holde pleasant vnto suche thynges lye dayely vse greue v scholers christe let greue v folowe order learnyng hath appoynted shall come passe beyng contented scholyng shall onely forbeare also abhorre superfluous speculation whyche calleth v away man deny denyse soeuer hath disputed many thynges bothe subtilly wittyly hierarchie heauen yf man examine neerely shall fynde moste parte mere babblyng dutifull purpose diuine delite eares pratyng stablishe conscience teachyng thynges true certayne heauenly spirites whose ministration seruice god vseth putting execution thinges hath decreed reason ye name geuen god vseth messangers shewe hym selfe vnto men vpon like reason deriued name called greater cause shuld geue ye angel brightnes glory god much abundatly shineth scripture standeth moste vpon reachyng v whyche myght moste make comforte confirmacion faithe wete angel distributer
