xixxxxv e xxxvii xxxvi hath geuen angel charge thee kepe thee thy way shall beare thee vp handes least thou chaunce hitte thy feete agaynst stone agayne angell lorde standeth rounde feare hym doothe delyuer wherby god sheweth apoynteth angel defence hath taken hand kepe order angel lord doth comfort agar fled away comandeth reconciled maistresse god promiseth abraham seruant angel guide iourneye iacob blessynge ephraim manasses praieth angell lorde himselfe bene deliuered euell may make prosper angell set defende tentes people israell ofte pleased god reskue israell handes enemy raised vp reuengers ministerie angel finally ende nede reherse many mo angel mynistred christ ready assistent hym necessity brought tydynges woman resurrection disciple glorious commyng fulfill office defendyng v fyght agaynste deuill enemy doo execute vengeaunce god vpon bent v reade angell god deliuer hierusalem siege slewe one nyghte hundred fowerscore fiue thousande campe kyng assyria whether euery faithfull bee seuerall angell assigned defencedani xxiii xiii mathei xviiix dare certainely affirme surely daniell bryngeth angel persian angel grecian sheweth mente kyngdomes prouinces certayn angel appointed gouernours christ saith angel child doo alway beholde face father seemeth meane certaine angel preseruation geuen charge tell whether oughte therby gather yt euery one hath angell set ouer holden certaintie one angell onely hath care euery one v one consent doo watche oure safetie spoken angel togitherluc xvvii luc xvixxiii ii king xvixvii act xiixv reioyce one sinner conuerted repentance nyntie nyne iust haue stande styll ryghtuousnesse sayd mo angel one conueyed soule lazarus bosome abraham without cause elizeus shewe seruant many fyery chariot peculiarly appointed hym one place seemeth playne rest proue poynt peter brought prison knocked doores house brother assembled coulde imagine said angel shuld seme came mynde common opinion euery faithfull assigned angel gouernours albeit yet maye answered may wel withstandyng thyng appeareth may thinke one angell whome god geuen charge peter time yet continuall keeper common people imagin appointed euery one two angel diuers ghostes good angell badde worthe trauaile curiously searche dooth muche importe v knowe doo contente man degree army heauen watche safetie doo see better vnderstande one angell peculiarly appointed kepe hym restrain vnto one angell care god hath euery one v doo greate wronge selues membres church power succour v ben vainely promised v wherwith beyng enuironed defended fight boldly dare take vpon theim define multitude degree angel let looke well fundation haue graunt michael called danielda xiii iudi iix thessa iiiixvi great prince iude archangell paule sayth shall archangell shall sounde trumpet call men iudgement therby appoynt degree honour betweene angel discerne one speciall markes appoynt euery one place standyng two name scripture michaell gabriell list adde thirde hystorie thobie may signification seme geuen angel accordyng capacitie weakenesse although rather leaue exposition large numbre theym wee heare christes mouthe many legionsmat xxvi lv dan viix psalm xxxiiiiviii daniell many company ten thousandes seruant elizeus sawe many chariottes full declareth great multitude saide doo campe rounde aboute theim feare god shape certaine spirites haue none yet scripture capacitie wit dooth vayne vnder cherubin seraphin paint v angel wynges intent shoulde doute bee euer incredible swiftnesse ready succoure v soone neede shall require lightnyng sent heauen shoulde flie vnto v suche swiftnesse wonted soeuer may sought pointes let v beleue sort mystery wherof full reuelation differred laste day wherfore let v remembre take hede muche curiositie searchyng muche boldnesse speakyng one thyng whiche many troublesome doo call doubt holden certaintie angel ministrynge spirites whose seruice god vseth defence distributeth benefites among men also putteth workes execution old tyme opinion sadduces angel meant nothyng el eyther motion god dothe inspire men token sheweth power agaynste errour crie many testimony scripture yt meruaile grosse ignorance coulde suffred people omitte place haue alledged recited thousandes legion angel ioy geuen vnto said vpholde faithful handes cary soules reste see face father suche lyke place whereby clerely proued deede spirites nature hath substanceact viiliii et ga iii xix mat xxiixxx et xxiiiixxxviixxxi xxv luc ixxxvi tim vxxi heb iiiii iixvi stephen paule doo say lawe geuen hande angel christe sayth electe resurrection shall bee lyke vnto angel day iudgement knowen angel shall come holy angel howe soeuer writhed yet must vnderstanded likewise paule chargeth timothe christ chosen angel keepe commaundementes meaneth quality inspiration without substace spirites otherwise standeth togither writen epistle hebrues christ become excellent angel ye world made subiect christ toke vpo nature ye natur man meane ye blessed spirit whome may comparison agree author epistle expouded self placeth ye kingdom heue ye soules ye faithful ye holy angel together also haue alredy alledged angel child alway behold face god reioyce safetie maruel manifold grace god churcheheb xiixxii subiect christ hedde ye purpose serueth oft appered holy father forme men talked lodged wyth christ selfe principall preminence hath person mediator called angelmala iiii thys thought good touche way furnish simple wyth defence foolishe reasonlesse opinion many age agoe raysed sathan spring vppe agayne resteth seke mete superstition comonly wont crepe said angel ar minister deliuerers good thinges vnto v man reason falleth point thinke yt therfore al honour ought geue cometh passe yt thing belog god christ conueied away angel mean se certaine age past glory christe hath many wais obscured angel without warrant god worde loden immeasurable title honor vice speake almoste none auncient thiscoloss xvi appereth paule himselfe muche doo auaunced angel maner wold haue brought christ vnder subiectio therfore doth carefully presse point epistle colossian christ preferred al angel yt also author al good thing yt thei haue end shuld forsake turn vnto whiche sufficiently helpe selues faine draw ye fountain yt surely forasmuche shyneth certain brightnesse ye maiestie god nothing wherunto ar easily enclined certain admiratio fall worshipping geue vnto thinges yt ar due god thing iohn reuelation cofesseth haue chaunced hymselfe addeth withal receiued answer see thou doo thy felowe seruant worship god daunger shall well beware doo consyder god vseth rather hymselfe without seruice declare power prouide safetie faithfull comumunicate giftes liberalitie among surely doth necessitie though coulde without oft pleaseth hym letteth theim alone bringeth woorke passe onely becke farre aide hym ease hym hardnesse therof therfore maketh comforte weakenesse want nothyng may auaile myndes eyther raisyng vp good hope confirmyng assurance one thyng ought enough enough agayn v lorde affirmeth protectour se selues besieged many daugers many hurtful thynges many kyndes enemy may suche weakenesse frailtie sometyme filled tremblyng feare fall despaire onlesse lord proporcion capacitie make v conceiue presence meane onely promiseth wyll haue care v also hath innumerable garde hath geuen charge trauaile safetie longe compassed garrison supporte theim whatsoeuer daunger betideth without reache hurte graunt doo amisse simple promise protection god alone still looke whense helpe maye come vnto v muche pleaseth lorde infinite clemencie gentilnesse helpe faultii kin vixvii reason shoulde neglect great benefite example therof haue seruant elizeus whiche sawe hill besieged army syrian way open escape striken downe feare maister vtterly destroied elizeus praied god open seruantes eies sawe hill furnished horse fiery chariot multitude angel kepe hym prophet safe encouraged vision gathered vp hart able dredelesse mynde loke vpon enemy sight maner driuen witte wherfore soeuer saide ministerie angel let v applie ende ouercommyng distrust oure hope may bee strongely stablished god succour herefore prouided v god made afrayde multitude enemy though coulde preuayle helpe shuld flie vnto saying elizeus mo side v howe muche order reason ledde away god angel whiche ordeined purpose rectifie helpe present amonge v doo leade v away dede doo streight leade v hande hym may haue eie vnto call vpon publishe hym onely helper consider theim handes moue selues vnto worke direction holde v faste one mediatoure christe maye hang wholly hym leane vpon hym caried hym reste whiche described vision iacob ought sticke fastened myndesgenes xxviiixii howe angel descende downe earth vnto men men doo go vp heauen ladder whervppon standeth lorde hostes wherby meant intercession christe cometh passe ministeries angel doo come vnto vsge xxiiii vii hym selfe affirmeth saying hereafter ye shall see heauens open angelles descendynge sonne man ioh ili therfore seruant abraham beyng comitted custody angell dooth therfore call vpon angell helpe hym holpen commendation praieth lord besecheth hym shewe mercy abraham god doeth therfore make minister power goodnesse intet parte glory dooth therefore promise v helpe ministration plato p nonide crahlo shoulde diuide confidence betwene hym let v therfore forsake platonical philosophie seeke way god angel honour purpose may make god gentill vnto v whiche superstitious curious men haue beginnyng gone day doo continue bryng religion suche thynges scripture teacheth concernyng deuilles tende maner al ende may careful beware aforehande awaites preparation furnishe selues suche weapon ar stronge sure enough driue away euen strongest enemy sathan called god prince worlde named strong armed man spirite hath power ayre roaryng lyon description serue purpose make v ware watchefull readier entre battayle hym whiche also somtyme set expresse woordes peter sayd diuell goeth like roaryng lyon sekyng may deuoure addeth exhortation strongly resiste hym faith paul geuen warnyng wrastle fleshe bloud prince ayre power darkenesse spirituall wickedness biddeth v put suche armoure may serue greate daungerous battayle wherfore lette v also applie ende beyng warned howe dooth continually approche vpon v enemie yea ennemy courage hardy strength mighty policy suttle diligence celeritie vnweriable sortes engins plentuously furnished skill warre ready suffer selues slouthe cowardise surprised syde bolde hardy mindes set foote resist warre ended death encourage selues continue specially knowyng oure owne weaknesse vnskilfulnesse let v call vppon helpe god enterprise nothyng vpon trust hym muche hym onely geue v policie strengthe courage armour shoulde stirred vp enforced scripture warneth v ther one two fewe enemy great army make warre v sayde mary magdalene deliuered seuen deuylsmar xviix wherwith possessed christe sayth ordinary custome deuill bee one caste man make place open agayne bryngeth seuen spirites worse selfmat xiixlii luc viiixxx retourneth possession fynding empty yea saide whole legion besieged one man hereby therefore taught muste fight infinite multitude enemy least despisyng fewenesse shulde slacke enter bataile thinkyng haue som respite meane tyme graunted shoulde geue selues idelnesse many tymes sathan diuell named singular numbre thereby meant power wickednesse whiche standeth agaynste kyngdome iustice churche felowship saintes haue christe head faction wycked paynted vnto v prince hath chiefe authoritie among themmat xxvxli maner spoken go ye cursed eternall fyre prepared deuill angel also oughte stirre v vp pepetuall warre diuell euery called enemy god v haue regarde goddes glory mete shoulde ought force bende selues hym goeth extinguishe affectioned maintain kingdome christ ought must nedes haue vnappeasable wat cospireth ruine therof care safetie touch v ought haue neither peace truce hym continually lieth waite destruction one described iii chap genesis leadeth man awaye obedience owe god bothe robbeth god due honor throweth man self headlong destruction suche one also set foorth euangelistesmat xiiixxviii ioh viiixliiii called enemy said scatter tare corrupt sede eternall life summe whiche christe testifieth hym begynnyng murtherer lyer fynde experience al doynges assaileth trueth god lie obscureth ye light darknesse entangleth mindes men error raiseth vp hatredes kindleth contention strife doeth thynges ende ouerthrow kingdome god drown men eternall destruction wherby appereth nature froward spitefull malicious nedes must great frowardnesse wit made assaile glory god saluation men doeth iohn speake epistle writeth sinneth beginnyng meaneth author captaine principall workman malice wickednesse forasmuch deuil created god let v remembre malice assigne nature creation deprauation euer damnable thyng hath hath gotten selfe owne reuoltyng fall whiche scripture therefore g eth v warnyng least thinkyng came suche one fro god shulde ascribe god himselfe whiche farthest fro reason doeth christ say yt satan speketh owne whe speketh liesioh viiix iiii addeth cause stode stil trueth whe sayth yt stode stil truth sheweth yt one ben trueth maketh father lyeng taketh thys say fault god whereof hymselfe cause himselfe although thinges shortlye plainly spoken yet enough purpose deliuer maiestie god al sclaunder maketh matter v know purpose concerning deuils many perhaps doo grudge scripture doth orderly distinctly many place set forth fall cause manner time fashion thereof thinges nothing perteine v better suppressed wholly yet lightly touched partly beseming holy ghost fede curiositie vaine history without frute se lordes purpose put nothing holy oracle whiche learne edification therfore lest selues tary long vpon thing superfluous let v contet shortly know thus much concerning nature deuils first creatio wer angel god swaruing kinde destroyed themselues become instrumentes destruction otherii pet iiiiii iud ivi thus much profitable knowen playnly taught peter iude god spared say angel synned kept beginningti vxx forsake dwelling place paule naming elect angel doth without dout secretly implication set reprobate angel comparison discorde strife saye betwene god satan muste take styll holde thys certayne doe nothyng wyll sufferaunce godiob ivi et iii rede historye iob presented hymselfe god receyue hys commaundementes durst goe forwarde doe enterprise till obtained license achab deceiued toke vpon woulde spirite lying mouth prophetesi kin xxii xx sa xvi xiiii et xviiix p xxxiiii sente god performed thys reason called euill spirite lord tormented saul scourge sinnes wicked king wer punished place written plage laied vpon egyptian euil angel according particular example paule doeth generally testifieii ii ix blinding wycked worke god wheras called working satan euident therfore satan vnder power god gouerned authoritie copelled seruice nowe say sata resisteth god workes satan disagree workes god therewithall affirme disagremente strife hangeth vpon sufferaunce god speake wil endeuour effecte onely sith deuill wicked nature enclined obeye wyll god wholly carryed stubbornesse rebellion therefore hath hymselfe hys owne wyckednesse desire purpose wythstandeth god wickednesse stirred vp enterprising thinges knoweth god god holdeth fast tied restrayned bridle power executeth thinges ar graunted god doth obey creator whether wil constrained applie seruice whether soeuer god compelleth god boweth vncleane spirites hether thether pleaseth tepereth gouernemet yt exercyse ye faithful wt battail set vpon ambush assaile wyth inuasions presse fighting oftentimes werry trouble make afraied somtime woude neuer ouercome oppresse wicked subdue drawe awaye reigne vpon soules body abuse bondslaues al mischeuous doinges faythful vnquieted enemieseph iiiixxvii pete vviii ii cor xii vii therfore heare exhortation dooe geue place deuel deuil enemie goeth roring lion sekyng may deuoure resist ye beyng strong faith suche like paule confesseth selfe fre kynde stryfe sayeth remedy tame pride angel satan geuen hym myght humbled exercyse therefore common child god promyse breakyng satan head perteyneth generally christ membersge iiixv therefore saye faithfull neuer ouercome oppressed many time stryken neuer astonnied withall recouer theselues fal many tymes wyth violence stroke raysed vp agayne wounded deadly finally labor course theyr lyfe ende obteyne victoryeii sam xxiiiii rom xvixx speake euery theyrs knowe iuste vengeaunce god dauid time geuen ouer satan motion nomber people without cause paul sayth hope pardon least haue entangled snare deuil therfore place paule sayeth promise aboue alleged begon lyfe wherin must wrastle performed wrastlyng ended sayeth god peace shall shortly beate downe satan vnder fete victory hath alway fully hed chryst prince world nothing v member doth partly appeare shalbe perfited whe vnclothed fleshe whiche yet subiecte weakenesse shalbe ful power holy ghoste thys manner kyngdome chryst raysed vp duaunced satan power falleth lord hymselfe sayeth saw satan fall lightening heauen answere confirmeth apostle reported ye power preachyng agayne ye prince possesseth palaceluke xxviii lu xi xxi al thinges possesseth peace cometh stronger throwen c ende chryst dying ouercame satan ye power death triuphed vpo al army yt shuld hurt church otherwyse would euery momente hundred time destroye cosidering weakenesse furious stregth howe coulde stande yea neuer litle time manifolde continuall assaultes supported victory captaine therefore god suffereth deuil reigne ouer soules faythfull onely deliuereth wicked vnbeleuing gouerne god doth vouchesaue haue reckened hys flocke said possesseth thys world without controuersy till thrust christii corin iiiiiiii eph iiii againe doth blinde beleue gospell agayne performeth hys worke stubborne child worthily wicked vesselles wrath therefore rather subiecte minister goddes vengeaunceioh viiixlii ioh iiiviii finally saied father deuill faythfull hereby knowen child god beare image image satan gone kind ar properly discerned childre haue confuted trifling philosophie concerning holy angel teacheth ar nothing el good inspiration motios god stirreth vp mindes men place must confute fondly say deuils ar nothing el euil affection perturbation minde thrust v oure fleshe maye shortly doe many testimony scripture playne enough vpon poynt first vncleane spirites ar called angel apostataes haue swarued kind beginning name sufficiently expresse motion affection myndes rather dede called mindes spirites endued sense vnderstanding likewise wheras christ iohn compare child god child deuili ioh iiiviii wer vnfit compariso name deuil signified nothing el euil inspiration iohn addeth somwhat plainly deuill synneth beginning likewise iude bringeth michael archangel fyghtyng deuil doutlesse setteth agaynste good angel euil rebellious angel wherwith agreeth red hostory iobiob ivi satan appeared holy angel god plaine al place make mention ye punishment begin fele iudgement god specially cheines darkenesse kept vnto damnacio c fonde speches ye deuils ordeined eternal iudgement yt fier prepared already tormented vexed glory christ deuils matter nedeth disputation among yt beleue word lord litle good done wt testimony scripture among vaine studentes speculation nothing pleaseth new suppose haue performed ye purposed ye godly mindes furnished agaynst fonde error wherewt vnquiet men trouble theselues yt simple good touche least entangled error thinke haue none stande againste waxe slowe vnprouided resist meane time let werisom vnto v beautiful stage take godly delight manifest ordinary woorkes god haue el already said though ye chefe yet order first doctrine faith remember way soeuer turne eye al see workes god wyth godly consideration wey end god make therefore may conceiue faith muche behoueth v knowe god good first al learne history creation ye world shortly rehearsed moses afterwarde largely set holy men specially basile ambrose oute shall learne god power worde spirite created heaue earth nothing therof brought forth liuing creature thinges without lyfe maruellous order disposed innumerable varietie thing euery thig gaue ye propre nature assigned office appointed place abidinges thing subiecte corruption yet hath prouided sortes shalbe preserued safe last day therfore cherysheth secrete meanes poureth new liuelinesse hath geuen power encrease generation dying whole kinde die together hath maruellously garnished heauen earth absolutely perfect plentie varietie beauty al thinges possibly might large gorgeous house furnished stored wyth aboundaunce finely chose stuffe last framing man adorning godly beautie many great giftes hath shewed excellent exaple al work purpose present set forth large creation worlde let suffice haue one agayne touched thinges way better haue already warned reader fetche fuller vnderstanding matter oute moses haue faithfully diligently conueied history world writing perpetuall memory purpose make much disputing end consideration workes god ought tend marke oughte applyed forasmuch place already great part question declared muche belongeth presente purpose maye fewe wordes ended truely minded set worthye howe inestimable wisdome power iustice goodnesse god appeareth framing world eloquence garnishment speche could suffice largenesse great matter dout god pleasure continually occupied holy meditation beholde creature loking glass infinite richesse wisedome iustice bountie power runne ouer fleeing eye vaine wandryng looke maye call shoulde wyth consideration rest long vpon cast vp downe earnestlye faythfully oure myndes ofte repeate remembrance busyed kinde perteineth order teaching mete yt omit thinges require long declamation therefore short let reader knowe haue conceyued fayth thys meaneth god creator heauen earth firste folowe thys vniuersall rule passe ouer considerynge forgetfulnesse vertues god presenteth seen creature learne apply selues may therwyth throughly moued harte first consider howe excellente workemans worke place aptly set well disposed order multitude starres heauen nothyng deuised beautifull beholde sette fasten theyr standinges moue graunte free course mouing wander beyonde theyr appoynted space temper motion maye deuide measure dayes nyghtes monethes yeres season yere bryng thys inequalitie dayes whiche dayly see suche tempered order hath confusyon likewyse whe marke hys power susteyning great body gouernyng swifte whirling aboute engyne heauen suche lyke fewe example doe sufficientlye declare recorde power god ye creatio world el shoulde trauayle sayed expresse wordes shoulde neuer make ende forasmuch many miracle power god many token hys goodnesse many example hys wysedome formes thynges worlde yea thynges eyther great small remayneth part commeth nerer fayth whyle consyder god hath ordayned thynges oure garde safetie therewithal doe fele hys power grace selues great good thynges hath bestowed vpon v maye thereby stire vp selues trust inuocation prayse loue hym nowe haue sayed god hymselfe hath shewed order creation man sake created al thynges without cause deuided making ye world six day wheras ben easy hym one moment haue al pointes accomplished whole worke suche proceding pece pece come ende pleased hym shewe hys prouidence fatherly carefulnesse towarde v made man prepared foresaw shoulde profitable hym fyt hys preseruation great vnthankfulnesse bee dout whether good father care v see haue careful v ere wer borne wycked wer tremble distrust least hys goodnesse woulde tyme leaue v destitute necessitie se dysplaied v yet borne wyth great aboundaunce good thyngesgene xxvi et ix ii besyde heare moses hys liberalitie al euer worlde made subiecte v sure mocke v wyth emptye name gifte therfore shall neuer lacke thyng farre shall auaylable preseruation finally make end oft page duplicate page duplicate name god creator heauen earth let come mindes withall disposition al thinges hath create hande power child hath taken charge keping foster bryng vp may loke good thinges hande assuredly trust neuer suffer v lacke thinges nedefull safetie ende hope shoulde hang vpon none whatsoeuer desire praiers may directed thing soeuer receiue profite may acknowledge benefite confesse thankes geuing allured greate swetenesse goodnesse liberalitie maye studye loue honor withall oure harte p xv chapter one man created wherin entreated power soule image god free wyll first integritie nature must speake creation among workes god moste noble excellente example iustice wisdome goodnesse also said beginning cannot plainly perfectly know god vnlesse haue wtall mutuall knowledge selues although knowledge two sortes one knowe created first beginning ye know estate began fall adam smal profit v knowe creation vnlesse also lamentable fall knowe corruption deformitie nature yet time wil contente descriptio nature pure descende miserable estate wherunto man nowe thraldome good learne one created beginning must take hede precisely declaring natural euils man seme impute author nature vngodlinesse thinketh self haue sufficient defense color may lay selfe whatsoeuer fault hath certaine maner procede god sticketh accused quarell god lay ye fault vpo wherof worthely accused yt would seme speake somwhat reuerently maiestie god yet willingly seke excuse wickednesse nature considering therin though openly blame god also whoes reproche shoulde fall proued fault nature sith see fleshe gapeth wayes escape wherby thynketh blame euils may way put fro muste diligently trauail mete mischiefe therefore must handle calamitie mankinde cut excuse deliuer iustice god al accusation afterwarde place conueniente shall see howe far men nowe purenesse geuen adam first must remember man taken earth claye bridle putte vppon pride greater absurditie glory excellencye onely dwell cotage clay also themselues parte earth ash forasmuche god onely vouchesaue geue life vnto earthen vessell also pleasure shoulde dwelling house immortall spirite adam might iustly glory great liberalitie maker doubted man consisteth soule body name soule meane immortall essence yet created whiche nobler parte sometime called spirite albeit whe two name soule spirite ioyned together differ one significationeccle xii vii luc xxiiixlvi act viilix yet spirite sett selfe meaneth muche soule salomon speaking death sayeth spirite returneth gaue chryste commending spirite father stephen spirite chryst doe meane none thing soule deliuered prison fleshe god perpetual keper imagine soule therfore called spirite breath power god inspired poured bodyes yet hath essence thing selfe scripture sheweth much grosly erre true men fastened earth oughte bee waxe dull yea estranged father lightes blinded darkenesse thinke vpon thys shal remaine aliue death yet lighte queched darkenesse touched feling immortalitie surely conscience discerning betwene good euil answereth iudgement god vndouted signe immortal spirite could motion without essece atteine come iudgement seate god throwe selfe feare finding giltinesse body moued feare spiritual peine yt falleth vpo soule wherby foloweth yt soule hath essence moreouer knowledge god doth proue soules ascende vp aboue world immortal vanishing liuelinesse wer able atteine fountaine lyfe finalli forasmuch many excellent giftes wherwith man minde endowed cry yt diuine thing engrauen euen many testimony immortal essence sense brute beastes goeth body lest extendeth thyngs presently set nimblenesse minde man veweth heauen earth secretes nature comprehending age vnderstandyng memory digesteth euery thyng order gathereth thynges come thinges past doth playnly shewe lyeth hydden man certayne thing seuerall body conceiue vnderstanding inuisible god angelles body doe know thynges right iuste honest hidden bodily sens therefore muste nedes spirite seate thys vnderstandyng yea slepe selfe astonieth man semeth take life away fro plaine witnesse immortalitie forasmuch doth minister vnto v thoughtes thinges neuer done also foreknowinges thing time come touch thinges shortly euen prophane writer excellently sette oute gorgeous garnishment wordes godly reders simple putting minde shall sufficient nowe soule certayne thing selfe seuerall body scripture would teache dwell house clay death remoue tabernacle flesh put corruptible finally last day may receiue rewarde euery man hathe behaued hymselfe hys bodye place eche comonly light vpon manifestly destinguish soule body also geuing soule name man shew principall partei cor viii wheras paul doth exhort faithful clense theselues al defiling fleshe spirite maketh two partes man wherein abydeth filthinesse sinne peter calleth christ shepeherde bishop soulesi pete iixxv pe iix pe xiii shold haue spoken fondly wer soules might execute office neyther would conuenientlye stande together saieth eternal saluation soules biddeth clense soules sayeth euil desire fight soule author epistle ye hebrues sayethheb xiii xvi pastor watch may yelde accopte soules vnlesse true soules proper essence purpose serueth paule calleth god witnesse hys soule could called iudgemente god vnlesse subiect punishmentmath x xviii lu xii v heb xiiix also plainly expressed word christ biddeth v feare hath killed body throw ye soule hel fier author epistle hebrues doth distinguishe father flesh god father spirites woulde otherwise plainly affirme essence soules moreouer ye soules remained aliue deliuered prison body christ fondly haue broughte soule lazarus ioying bosome abrahamluk xvixxii ii cor v act xxiiiviii againe soule richman subiect horrible tormentes thing doth paul confirme whe teacheth wander abrod god long dwel flesh enioy presence flesh wil long matter obscure wil adde thys luke reckened amog error sadduces beleue spirites angel also strong profe herof may gathered sayed man create lyke image godge ixxvii although glory god appeare outwarde shape man yet doubte proper seate image god soule deny concernyng outwarde shape asmuch doeth distinguishe seuer v brute bestes doe also therein nerely approche god nether wil much stand thinke thys accopted image god yt al lyuynge creature doo grouellyngwise beholde grounde man geuen vpright face commaunded loke vpon heaue aduaunce countenaunce towarde starres remayn certain image god whiche seene appereth outward signes spiritual osiander writyngs declare haue ben fickle imagination fondly witty referryng image god without difference well body soule mingleth heauen earth togither saith father son holy ghost settle image man though adam stande without fallyng yet shuld christe haue become man opinio body appointed christ example figure bodily shape whiche formed shall fynde christe image spirite graunte deede person mediatour shyneth glorye whole godheade howe shall eternall woorde called image spirite goeth order finally ouerthroweth distinction betwene sonne holy ghost doo call image moreouer would fayne learne hym christe dooth resemble holy ghoste fleshe tooke vppon markes feature doth expresse likenesse hym saying let v make man imagegenes ixvi dooth also belong person sonne foloweth must image himselfe whiche reason beside osianders inuention beleued man fashioned onely figure paterne christ man forme whiche adam taken christ bee clothed fleshe scripture farre meanyng teacheth create image god suttle inue tion colourable whiche doo thus expounde adam create image god fashioned like vnto christe whiche image god exposition also soud also som interpreter make great disputation image likenesse whyle seke difference betwene two wordes difference al saying worde likenesse added expoud first knowe amonge hebrues suche repetition common wherin expresse one thyng twise thyng selfe doubt man therfore caled image god like god wherby appereth laughed doo subtilly argue wordes whether appoint zelem say image substaunce soule demuth say likenesse quality thyng soeuer yt teache god determined create man image somwhat darkly spoken doth way explication repete saying likenesse wolde haue said woulde make man would represent hym selfe image markes likenesse grauen therfore moses little recityng thyng dooth repete image god twise leauyng name likenesse triflyng obiection oseander maketh parte man soule onely giftes thereof called image god whole adam whiche hadde name geuen earth whense taken triflyng say reader haue theyr sounde witte iudge obiection whole man called mortall yet soule thereby made subiect mortalitie called liuyng creature endued reason therby meant body hath reason vnderstandyng although therfore soule whole man yet inconuenient man respecte soule called image god albeit holde still principle whiche haue stablished image god extendeth whole excellence wherby nature man hath preeminence among kyndes liuyng creature therefore worde noted integritie man endued ryght vnderstandyng affection framed accordynge reason sens gouerned right order excellet giftes truly resemble excellence creatour though principall seate image god mynde hart soule power therof yet parte man muche body wherin dyd sparkes therof appere certaine also partes worlde doo shyne resemblance glory god wherby may gather said image man saying certain secret comparison auaunceth man aboue creature doth seuer common sortmat xxiixxx neither denied angel create likenesse god sithe christ selfe testifieth chiefe perfection shall become like vnto theim without cause doeth moses peculiar title sette forth grace god towarde v specially compareth onely visible creature man yet semeth geuen ful definition image god vnlesse plainlier appere quality man excelleth wherby ought compted glasse resemblyng glorye god thyng better knowen repayryng man corrupted nature first doubtlesse adam felle estate departure estranged god wherefore althoughe graunte image god altogyther defaced blotted oute hym yet corrupted remaineth vggly deformitie therefore begynnyng recouerie safetie v restoryng whyche obteyne christe whoe also cause called seconde adam restored v vnto trewe perfecte integritie althoughe paule dooeth comparyson set quicknyng spirite christe geueth faithfulli cor xvxlv liuyng soule wherin adam created setteth foorth abundaunte measure grace regeneration yet doothe take awaye principall poynte ende regeneration chrste shulde newe fashion v image godcolo iiix ephe iiii xxiiii therfore place teacheth newe man renewed accordynge image hym created hym wherwith agreeth saying put ye new create according god sene paul doth principally coprehed vnder renuyng first speaketh knowlege pure rightuousnesse holynesse wherby gather image god first al sene light mynde ye vprightnesse hart soundnesse partes although graunt figuratiue phrase speeche set part whole yet principle ouerthrowen thyng whiche chief renewyng image god also principall creation hymii cor iii xviii purpose maketh place teacheth beholdyng glory god open face transformed image nowe doo see howe christe moste perfect image god accordyng whiche beyng fashioned restored true godlynesse rightuousnesse purenesse vnderstadyng beare image god whiche principle beyng establishedi cor xivii osianders imagination shape body dooth easily vanishe away selfe man alone paule called image glory god woman excluded degree honour appereth reste text applied ciuile order policie vnder name imageioh iiiii wherof speake comprehended belongeth spirituall eternall lyfe thinke alredy sufficiently proued thyng doeth iohn confirme wordes saying lyghte whiche beginnyng eternall worde god light men purpose praise singular grace god whereby man excelleth liuyng creature seuer common orte hath atteined common life ioyned light vnderstandyng therwithall sheweth howe made image god therfore sithe image god vncorrupted excellence nature man whiche shyned adam fall afterwarde corrupted almoste defaced nothyng remaineth sin ruine disordred mangled filthily spotted yet dooth part appere electe insomuche regenerate shall obtein full brightnesse heauen may knowe partes consisteth shall good entreate power soule speculatiue deuise augustine sounde libr de tri x de ciui dei xi saith soule glasse trinitie vnderstandyng memorie neither opinion bee approued whiche sette image god power dominion geuen vnto hym resembled god onely marke appointed lorde possessor thynges dede image god proprely sought within hym without hym inwarde good gifte soule go nedefull meete dotyng errour manicheesgenes iivii whyche seruetto hath attempted brynge agayne age saide god breathed breath life face man thought soule dyd conuey man substance god porcion immeasurable god come man easye euen shortely shewe howe many grosse fowle absurdity deuillish errour draweth soule deriuation part essence god shall folowe nature god subiect chaunge passion also ignorance euill lustes weaknesse kindes vice nothing inconstant man contrary motion tosse diuersely drawe soule oftentimes blynde ignorance ofte yeldeth vanquished euen small tentations knowe soule self sinke receiuer al filthinesse thynges must ascribe nature god graunte soule essence god secrete inflowyng godhed would abhorte monstruous deuise truely dede dooth paule alledge aratus ofspryng god qualitie substanceact xviixxviii much hath garnished v godly giftes meane tyme teare essence creatour say euery man doth possesse part much madnesse therfore must certainly holde soules although image god grauen lesse created angel creation powryng one substance beginnyng essence made nothyng although spirite man came god departyng oute fleshe retourneth god yet foorthwith said taken substaunce pointe also oseander glorieth illusion hath entangled himselfe vngodly errour acknowledgyng image god man without essentiall iustice though god inestimable power holy spirite coulde make v like vnto selfe vnlesse christe substantially powre hym selfe v soeuer colour many dooe go aboute disguise deceiptes yet shal neuer beguile eies reader theyr right wittes easilye see thyngs sauour manichee errour wher saint paule entreateth restoryng image may readyly gathered wordesii cor iii xviii man made lyke forme god inflowyng substaunce grace power spirite saieth beholdyng glory christe transformed image spirite god whyche surely worketh v maketh v one substance god folly borowe philosopher definition soule almoste none except plato hath perfectely affirmed immortall substance dede also socratians dooe touche none doeth plainly teach whiche selfe persuaded therfore plato better iudgement dooeth soule consider image god doo bynde power vertues soule present life beyng body leaue nothyng nowe haue already taught scripture bodylesse substaunce nowe muste adde althoughe proprelye comprehended place yet sette bodye dooeth dwelle house onely minister lyfe partes body make instrumentes therof mete fittly seruyng action appoynted also beate chiefe office gouernyng life man onely aboute dueties earthely lyfe also stirre v vp seruice god although later print corruption playnely perceiued yet euen vice themselues remain emprinted leauynges therof whense cometh shame men haue great care reported whense commeth shame regarde honestie wherof beginnyng cause vnderstand naturally borne obserue iustice persuasion enclosed sede religion without controuersy man made meditation heauenly life certaine knowledge therof engrauen soule surely man shuld want principall vse vnderstandyng shuld ignorant felicitie wherof ye perfection ioyned god therfore chiefe actio ye soule aspire thervnto ye euery man studieth approche vnto god therby proueth hymselfe endued reason woulde haue diuers soules man felyng soule reasonable soule although seme say somwhat reason proueable yet stedfast certaintie reason muste reiecte theim vnlesse listed accombre selues thynges triflyng vnprofitable great disagreement say betwene instrumentall motion part soule endued reason thoughe reason selfe also dissent selfe deuises doo striue army enemy forasmuche troublesomnesse procedeth corruption nature amysse gather therby two soules power soule doe agree together suche well framed order ought suttle disputation power selues leaue philosopher symple definition shall suffise v edification godlynesse graunt thing teache true onelye pleasaunte also profytable bee knowen well gathered theym forbydde suche desyrous learne studye theim fyrste therefore admitte fyue sens whyche plato better lyked calle instrumentes whereby obiectes cteto powred common sense place receypte foloweth phantasye whyche iudgeth thynges one common sense hathe conceyued nexte reason whyche beelongeth vnyuersall iudgemente thynges laste understandyng mynde earnestly bente quiete vewyng beholdeth thynges reason wonte discourse vppon arist etthicorum lib ca vlt ite livi cap consyder understandyng mynde reason phansy whiche thre power sowle rest knowledge doo aunswere three doo reste appetite saye wyll partes whereof couete thynges understandyng mynde reason dooe laye power anger whyche catcheth thynges reason phansy minister vnto power desiryng whyche taketh holde thynges phantasy sense presenteth although thing true least likely true yet feare shall entangle v obscurenesse v thynke beste ouerpasse man lyste otherwyse dyuide power soule calle one power appetite whyche althoughe without reason selfe yet doeth obey reason bee meane directed call power vnderstandyng whyche selfe partaker reason muche agaynst neither confute opinion thre beginnyngs doyng say sense understandyng appetite let v rather choose diuision within capacitie men hadde philosopher meane speake moste plainely doo diuide soule appetite understandyng eyther make two sortes understandyng saye sometyme contemplatiue beyng contented onely knowlege themistocles de anima lib ca de duplici intell de finibus lib hath mouyng action whiche thyng cicero thynketh expressed worde ingenium witte sometyme saye practicall whiche conceyuyng good euill doeth diuersely moue appetite doo diuide lust cal appetite call horme obeyeth reason lust thei call appetite shakyng yoke reason runneth intemperance alwais imagine reason man wherby man may rightly gouerne hym selfe constrayned somwhat swarue maner teachyng philosopher whiche knewe corruption man nature whiche came punishement fall doo wrongfully confounde two diuers state man lette v therefore thus thynke soule man two partes whiche shall serue tyme present purpose say understading wil let office understandyng discerne betwene obiectes thynges sette eche shall seme worthy liked misliked office choose folow whiche understandyng sayth good refuse flee whiche understandyng shall disalowe let v bee staied mee suttelties aristotle mynde hath selfe mouyng choise whiche moueth whiche choise calleth desiryng vnderstandyng ende bee entangled superfluous question let suffise v understanding guide gouernor soule hath alwais regarde appointment understandyng abideth iugement therof desire etthi livi cap accordyng wherevnto aristotle hym selfe hath truely sayde fleeyng folowyng appetite suche lyke thyng vnderstandng mynde affirming denying howe certaine gouernement understandyng direct wil consider place meane onely shewe founde power soule may wel said belong one two membres sort vnder understandyng comprehende sense whiche doo distinguishe say sense enclined pleasure whiche understanding foloweth good cometh passe appetite sense concupiscence lust affection vnderstandyng agayne stede name appetite whyche better like sett name whiche commonly vsed god therfore hath furnished soule vnderstanding mynde wherby might discerne good fro euill right wrong hauing light reason going might se folowed forsake cause philosopher haue called directing part guider hath adioyned belongeth choise noble gyftes first state man excelled onely enough reason vnderstandyng wisedome iudgement gouernemet erthly life also clime vp euen god eternal felicitie haue choise added vnto whiche myght directe appetite order instrumental motion myght altogither agreable gouernement reason integritie man freewill wherby would myght haue atteined eternall life oute place moue question secrete predestination god nowe discusse myght haue chaunced tyme nature man adam therfore might haue stande wold fell owne wil pliable either side geuen hym constancie continue therfore easily fell yet choise good euill free also vnderstading mynde great vprightnesse instrumetall part orderly framed obedience vntill destroying himselfe corrupted good thynges hym hense cometh philosopher wer blynded ruine sought vpright buildyng strong ioyntes vnioynted ouerthrowe principle helde man could liuyng creature endued reason vnlesse hym free choise good euill considered otherwise difference taken away betwene vertues vice vnlesse man dyd order owne lyfe owne aduise thus farre said well ben chaunge man whiche chaunge knewe meruaile though confounde heauen earthe togyther whiche professyng selues disciple christ doo yet seeke free man hath bene loste drowned spiritual destructio going meane betwene ye philosopher opinion heauenly doctrine plainly deceyued touche neither heauen earth thynges shal better speake place fitte nowe onely haue holde mynde man fyrst creation farre posteritie euer sin whiche takyng beginnyng hym beyng corrupted hath receiued infection deriued inheritaunce partes hys soule framed ryghte order stoode safe soundenesse vnderstandyng mynde free choose good doo obiecte stoode slippry state power weake answere state yet sufficed take excuse neither resonable restraine god point make man suche one either coulde would sinne aug ge ne lib xi cap viiviiiix graunt suche nature bene better therfore precisely quarel god though ben dutie haue geuen vnto man muche vniustice forasmuche owne choise geue howe muche pleased hym dyd vpholde strength stedfast continuance resteth hidden owne secrete counsell parte onely bee farre wise sobrietie may man receaued dede bee able wolde de correp gtati ad valentini ca xi might able shuld haue folowed stedfast continuance yet excusable receiued much owne hath wroughte owne destruction necessitie compell god geue meane fraile man fall myghte gather matter owne glory pthe xvi chapter god power dooth monishe mainteyne worlde whiche hym selfe hath created prouidence doeth gouerne al partes therof veray fonde bare make god creatour moment doeth nothyng sin hath one made ende worke poynte principally ought differ prophane men presence power god may shine vnto v lesse continuall state world first beginnyng thoughe myndes wicked beholdyng heauen earth compelled rise vp vnto creatour yet hath faith certain peculiar maner self wherby geueth god whole praise creation therfore serueth saying apostle alleged yt vnderstand fayth world made word god vnlesse passe forward euen vnto prouidence yet rightly conceiue meaneth ye god creator howe soeuer seeme comprehende mynde confesse tongue sense fleshe hath one sette power god creation resteth procedeth furthest dooeth nothyng wey consider wysedom power goodnesse workeman making suche piece worke thinges selues offer thrust selues sight men whether certain generall doyng preseruyng gouerning ye vpon dependeth power mouyng finally thinketh liuely force beginning put thing god doth suffise sustein faith ought perce deper say hath lerned creatour al thing gather perpetual gouernor preseruer stirryng vniuersall motion wel whole frame worlde partes therof susteynyng cherishing caring singular prouidece euery one thinges yt hath created eue ye least sparow dauid fyrst said worlde created god descendeth continuall course prouidence worde lorde saith heauens stablished power therof spirite mouthps xxxiii vi addeth lord looked vpon sonnes men rest saith ye effect although doo al reason orderly yet likely beleued god care men matter vnlesse maker worlde man doeth earnestly beleue god made worlde vnlesse perswaded god hath also care hys workes therefore without cause dauid doeth good order conueye v one generally dede philosopher doe teach men mindes doe conceiue partes worlde quickened wyth secrete inspiration god yet atteine farre dauid hymselfe procedeth carryeth godly wyth hympsa ciiiixxvii saying thynges wayte vpon thee thou mayest geue fode due season thou geuest gather thou openest thy hand filled good thing thou hide thy face troubled thou take awaye theyr breath dye returne theyr dust againe thou sende forth thy spiriteacte xvii xxviii created thou renewest face earth yea although agree saying paul haue moued lyue god yet farre earnest felyng grace commendeth vnto v taste god speciall care wherby alone fatherly fauor knowen thys difference maye better appeare knowe prouidence god suche taughte scripture comparison set contrary fortune chaunces happe aduenture nowe forasmuche hath commonly beleued al age opinion thys daye also manner al men thynges happen fortune certayne ought haue beleued concernyng prouidence wrong opinion onely darkened also manner buried man light among theues wylde beastes wynde sodenly rysen suffer shipwrack sea kylled wyth fall house tree wandryng deserte place fynde remedy hys pouertie hauing tossed waues atteine haue miraculously escape fynger bredth death chaunces well prosperitie aduersitie reason fleshe doeth ascrybe fortune whosoeuer taught mouth chryst heares hys hed numbredmath xxix seke cause wyll fyrmelye beleue chaunces gouerned secrete councell god concerning thinges without lyfe thys thought although euery one haue hys owne propertie naturally put yet doe put forth power farre directed present hande god therefore nothing el instrumentes whereby god continually poureth much effecte pleaseth hys boweth turneth thys doyng creature power maruellous glorious sunne besyde geueth lyght whole worlde wyth hys bryghtnesse howe greate thyng thys cherysheth quickeneth lyuing creature wyth hys heate breatheth frutefulnesse earth wyth hys beames sedes warmed bosome grounde draweth budding grenenesse susteyning wyth new nouryshmentes doth encrease strengthen tyll ryse vp stalkes fedeth continuall vapoure till growe floure floure fruite also wyth bakyng bryngeth rypenesse tree likewise vine warned first budde shote forth braunches sende flower flower enge der frutege iiii lord would claime whole glory thinges himselfe made lighte first earth furnished al kindes herbes fruites created ye sunne godly man therfore wil make sunne ether principal necessary cause thinges creation ye sunne instrumet god vseth pleaseth wheras might leaue al thinges easily himselfe rede yt sunne stode stil two day one degree yt praier iosuaios xxiii ii kin xxxi yt shadowe thereof went backe ten degree ezechias sake fewe miracle god hath declared sunne doth daily rise go blinde instincte nature yt renew remebrauce fatherly fauor toward v doth gouerne course therof nothing natural spryng tyde come immediatly witer somer spryng haruest course sommer orderly course plainly seen great vnegal diuersitie may easily appere euery yere moneth day gouerned new speciall prouidence god truely god doth claime haue v geue vnto almightinesse sophisters imagine vaine idle sleping waking effectual working busied continual one general beginning cofused motion would commaunde ryuer flowe hys appointed chanels one bent redy al particular mouinges therfore called almighty yet sytteth stil doth nothing general instinct continueth order nature hath appointed gouernyng heauen earth prouidence ordreth thynges yt nothyng chaunceth hys aduised purposeps cxviii whereas sayed psalme yt doth whatsoeuer therin meant certayn determined fond expound prophet wordes philosopher maner yt god first agent doer beginning cause al mouing wheras faithful ought rather aduersitie ease themselues thys comfort suffer nothyng ordinaunce commaundement god vnder hys hande gouernemente god extende al workes childishe cauillation enclose within influence nature yet doe defraude god glory themselues profitable doctrine whosoeuer restrayn prouidence god within narrowe boundes suffred al thynges carryed wyth vngouerned course according perpetual law nature nothyng miserable man left subiect euery motion heauen aire earth water besyde yt meane singular goodnesse god towarde euery man much vnhonorably diminished dauid cryeth babe yet hagyng mother brestes eloquent enough magnify ye glory godpsa viiiiii eue sone come wombe fynde fode prepared heauenly care dede generally true yt yet eye sens ouerpasse vnmarked experyence playnly sheweth mother haue ful plentifull brestes almost dry pleaseth god fede one liberally scarcelye geue due prayse almightinesse god receiue double profit therby one hath sufficiently large abilitie good whoes possession heauen earth whoes becke al creature attend vpon yeld themselues obedience may safely reste protection whoes wil subiect al hurtful thynges may way feared whoes authorite bridle sata restrained al fury al preparation vpon whoes beck doth hang euer safetie way immesurable superstitious feares corrected appeased oftentimes conceiue daungers happening vnto v superstitiously fearfull saye creature threaten v geue v cause feare afrayed therof th mselues force power v harme vnforeseen chaunce hurt v hurtes doier xii sufficient helpe god example prophete forbyddeth child god shold feare sterres sygnes heauen vnbeleuers wont condemneth euery kynde feare whe vnbeleuers geue away gouernement worlde god vnto planet fayne yt felicitie misery doth hang ye decree foreshewinges starres wil god commeth passe feare withdrawen away onely one ought haue regarded vnto starres comet whoso therfore wil beware vnfaythfulnesse lette hym kepe alwayes remembraunce creature wadryng power working motio gouerned secrete counsel god nothing chaunce decreed hym witting willing first therfore let reader learne prouidence called yt wherwith god idlely beholdeth heauen done ye world wherewith guiding sterne sitteth ordreth al thynges come passe doth lesse belong handes eies abraham sayed vnto hys sonne god shal prouide meant onely god dyd forknowe successe comegen xxiiviii cast care thing hym vnknowen vpon god wont bring thinges doutful confused certaine end wherby foloweth prouidence consisteth much fondely doo many trifle talkyng bare forknowledge error altogyther grosse whiche geue vnto god gouernement disordered without aduised choise haue sayd yt saye suche whirleth driueth aboute generall motion frame worlde partes therof doeth peculiarly directe doyng euery creature yet error tollerable teache may notwithstanding prouidence cal vniuersal al creature may moued chauce man maye turne hymselfe hether thether fre choise wil doe part ye gouernemet betwene god man yt god power inspireth motion wherby may worke according ye nature planted hym ordereth doinges volutary aduise briefely meane world men matter themselues gouerned power appointmente god speake epicurean pestilence worlde hath alwaye fylled wyth dreame idle slouthful god mad whiche old tyme imagined god rule aboue middle region ayre left thinges benethe fortune euident madnesse dumme creature themselues sufficiently crye purpose confute opinion manner commonly beleued geuing god certain blinde wote vncertayne motion taketh principall thinge incomprehensible wisedome directe dispose al thinges ende name onely dede maketh god ruler world taketh gouernement beseche el gouerne ouer vnder thee thou mayest rule appointed order yet altogether reiect spoke vniuersall prouidence agayne graunte world ruled god onely mainteineth order nature whiche himselfe hath set also hath peculiar care euery one hys workes trew al sortes thing moued secret instinct nature obey eternal commaundement god god hath one determyned doth selfe procede forwarde hereunto may yt applied christ sayeth father euen beginning alway workyngact xviixxviii heb iiii paule teacheth liue moued haue beyng ye author epystle hebrues meanyng proue godhead christ sayeth hys mightie commaundement al thinges susteyned wrong color hide darken speciall prouidence whiche cofirmed certain plain testimony scripture maruell man could dout surely theselues drawe thesame veile speake hide copelled way correctio adde many thyngs ar ye peculiar care god wrongfully restrayn thesame onely peculiar doinges wherfore muste proue god doth geue hede gouernement success al thyngs al procede determyned counsell nothyng happeneth chaunce graut ye beginning motio belogeth god thing either theselues chauce caried whether ye inclination nature driueth ye mutual succeding turnes day nightes winter somer shalbe ye work god insomuch appointing euery one duty hath set certaine law yt shoulde alway kepe one measure egal proportio wel ye dayes yt come ye nightes ye moneths monethes yeres yeres whe somtime immoderate hetes wt drynesse burne vp al ye grain somtime vnseasonable raines mar ye corne sodein harme cometh hayle tempestes yt shal ye worke god vnlesse parhap cloudes faire wether colde heate haue beginning ye meting planetes naturall cause meane roume left nether ye fatherly fauour iudgemets god say yt god beneficial enough mankinde poureth heaue earth ordinary power wherby find nourishment yt vaine prophane inuention though frutefulnesse one yere wer singular blessing god dearth famine wer curse vegeaunce wer long gather together al resons yt serue purpose let authoritie god himselfe suffice v law prophetes doth oftetimes pronouce yt oft watereth earth deaw rayne declareth fauor whe comaundemet heauen hardened like iro whe corne consumed wt blasting harmes fieldes stryke wt hayle tempestes toke certayne special vengeauce graunt thing assured yt falleth drop rain certaine commaundement godps cxlviix dauid prayseth general prouidece god geueth meate rauens birdes ye cal vpon god himselfe threatneth famine lyuing creature doth sufficiently declare yt fedeth al liuing thinges somtime scarce sometime wt plenteful portio thinketh good childish thing said beforemath xxxix restrain particular doiges wheras christ speketh wtout exception yt sparrow neuer smal price doth fal groude wtout wil father surely ye flyeng birdes ruled purpose godps xiiv must nedes confesse ye prophet yt dwelleth hye yet humbleth loke vpo thinges chaunce heauen earth know yt ye world made principally makindes sake must therfore cosider end ye gouernace man prophete hieremy cryeth outhier xxxiii know lorde yt waye man nether belongeth man direct steppe salomon saiethprou xxxxiiii step man ruled lord shall man dispose way let say yt moued god according ye inclinatio nature yt man hymselfe doth turne ye mouing whether pleaseth wer truely sayd shoulde man haue free choise wayes paradueture wil deny nothing wtout power god seing certain prophete salomon geue vnto god power also choise appointment escape away salomo place doth finely rebuke rashenesse men apoint vnto themselues ende wtout respect god though led hys handepro xvii preparation saith hart man answer tong lord fonde madnesse wil take vpon doe thinges wtout god muche speake wil scripture expresse plaily yt nothing al done ye world appointmet sheweth yt thing seme happening chace ar subiect himexo xxi xiii ca ascribe chace tha whe broke bowe falling fro tre killeth wayfaring passing bi lord saith far otherwise cofesseth yt hath deliuered hi ye slaier likewise doth leaue happening lettes blindnesse fortune lord suffereth claimeth iudgement hymselfe sayeth cometh passe ma power stone cast lap drawen oute agaynepro xvixxxiii thyng onely might sayed come chaunce testifieth come hym selfe purpose maketh sayeng salomon poore man vsurer mete together god lyghteneth eye although poore men riche migled together ye world euery one hath state assigned fro god admonisheth yt god geueth light al blind exhorteth ye poore pacience whosoeuer contented wt state seke shake ye burden yt god hath laied vpon prophet rebuketh ye vngodly whiche ascribe diligence men fortune lie misery aryse vp honor come preferment neither easte west southpsa lxxv vii god iudge maketh low maketh hie god put ye office iudge thervpon prophet proueth secret purpose ar honor remayne contempt also say yt particular success generally witness god singular prouideceexo xixxiii god raised ye desert south wind bring people plenty foules whe pleasure haue ionas throwen seaioh ivi sent winde raise vp tempest thinke yt god gouerneth world saye yt chaunced beside common vse therby gather yt neuer wind doth rise encrese special comaundemet god otherwise shoulde truepsa ciiii iiii maketh windes messangers fiery flame minister yt maketh cloudes chariot rideth vpo winges wind vnlesse dryue aboute cloudes windes shewe singular presence power place taught oft sea swelleth blast windespsa cviixxv violence testifye singular presence god commaudeth raiseth vp stormy wyndes lifteth vp waues thereof turneth storme calme waues thereof still place saieth scourged people burning windes wheras power engendring naturally geuen men yet god willeth imputed special grace leaueth barrennesse vouchsaueth graunt issue somege xxxii frute wobe hys gift therfore said iacob hys wyfe god yt geue thee child make ende nothing ordinary nature fed bred holy ghost pronounceth growing fruites earth speciall gift god also men lyue onely bread full feding nourisheth secret blessing godesa iii syde threteneth wil breake stay bred nether could earnestly pray dayly bred vnlesse god geue v fode hys fatherly hande therfore ye prophetps cxxxvi perswade faythfullps xx iiii xvixvii god feding doth fulfil office good father household doth put minde geueth meate al fleshe finally haue ye one syde eye lord vpon righteous hys eares bent praiers side eie lord vpon ye vngodly destroy memory ye earth let v know yt creature aboue beneth ready obedience yt may apply vse soeuer wil wherupon gathered yt onely general prouidece remaineth creature cotinue ye order nature also maruellous counsell applied certayne proper ende would bring doctrine hatred doe cauill yt learning yt stoikes teach fatum destenie lib boni ca vi also one laied reproch augustine v although loth striue word yet allow word fatum one whoes prophane noueltie paul teacheth v flee men go odiousnesse therof bring god truth hatred ye opinion ye stoikes wrogfully laid charge ye stoikes imagine necessitie certaine perpetual knot entangled order cause conteyned nature make god iudge gouernoure al thinges according wisdom hath euen fro furthest ende eterntie decreed would power putteth execution yt hath decreed wherupo affirme yt ye heaue earth creature without life also ye purpose wils gouerned prouidence yt directly caried ye end appointeth wil one say doth nothing happen fortune chaunce answere yt basilius magnus hath truly said yt fortune chaunce heathen men wordes wyth signification wherof mindes godly ought occupied euery good successe blessing god euery calamitie aduersitie curse men matter place left fortune chauce ought also moued wt thys saying augustine retr li capi bokes academikes saith doth displease yt haue ofte named fortune albeit meaning haue goddesse meant therby chauceable happening outward thing ether good euil word fortune deriued word religio forbiddeth v vse forte forsan forsitan fortasse fortuito yt parhap paraduenture fortune chaunce yet must al applied prouidece god yt leaue vnspoken sayd parchaunce euen yt commonly called fortune also ruled secret order cal chauce thing nothing el yt whereof reaso cause vnknowen said dede repenteth name fortune forasmuch se yt haue euil custome yt ought say thus pleased god say thus pleased fortune finally doth commonly bokes teach world vnorderly whirled thyng wer left vnto fortune although place determineth al thyngs done partly free wil partly prouidece god yet doth little sufficiently shew men subiecte vnto ruled prouidence taking principle nothing agaynst conuenience reason say thyng chaunceth ordinance god el happe without cause order whiche reason also excludeth happening hangeth vppon men playnlyer sayeth oughte seke cause god quest li de tri li cap ofte maketh mention sufferaunce howe vnderstanded shall well appeare one place proueth wyll god soueraigne first cause al thinges nothing happeneth commaundemente sufferaunce surely faineth god sit stil idle watch toure hys pleasure suffer thyng whereas vseth actuall wyll may cal whiche otherwyse could called cause forasmuch ye dullnesse vnderstading great way atteine height god prouidece must vse distinctio helpe lift vp say therfore soeuer al thinges ordeined purpose certayne disposition god yet v chaunsable thynke fortune ruleth world men vnaduisedly tosseth thynges vp suche beastlynesse ought farre chrystyan harte order meane ende necessitie thynges happen doeth moste parte lye secrecte purpose god comprehended wyth opinion man therfore thinges chausable yet certaine come passe wil god seme otherwise whether cosider nature whether esteme according knowledge iudgement example let v put case merchaunte entred wod company true men doeth vnwisely stray away felowes n wandring chauceth vpon denne robber lighteth amog theues killedio xiiiiv death foreseen goddes eye also determined decree saied foresee farre ech man life extende bu hath set appointed markes passed yet farre capacitie minde conceiueth thinges herein seme happening chaunce shall christian thinke euen whatsoeuer happened death wil thinke nature chauncing fortune dede yet doubt prouidence god gouerne directe fortune ende like manner happeninges thynges come al thinges come vncertaine vnto v hang suspense might fal either parte yet remaineth settled harte nothing shall happen god hath already foreseen meaning name chaunce oft repeted ecclesiastes first sight men doe atteine see first cause farre hidden yet declared scripture concerning secret prouidence god neuer blotted harte men euen darkenesse alway shined sparkes therof sothsayers philistians although wauer doutfulnesse yet ascrybe aduersitie partly god partly fortune say arke go wayi sam vi ix shal know god hath stryke v go way chaunce hath light vpon v dede folishly conning soth saying deceiued flee fortune meane whyle see constrayned dare thinke euil happe chaunced vnto come fortune god brydle hys prouidence turneth al success whether pleaseth may appeare one notable example beholde euen one moment timei samu xxiiixxvi whe dauid founde nere taken desert mahon euen philistine inuaded land saul compelled depart god meaning prouide safetie seruaunt cast let saul way surely although philistine going armes sodein beside expectation men yet may say came chaunce thynges seme v happen chaune fayth wil acknowledge haue secret mouing god graunt doth alwaye appeare like reason vndoutedly ought beleue whatsoeuer change thinges seen worlde come secret sturring hand god god purposeth necessitie com passe yet necessitie precisely nature self therof familiar exaple ye bone christ forasmuch put bodie like vnto wise deny bone naturally able broken yet impossible shuld broken whereby see againe without cause scholes inuented distinction necessitie respect necessitie absolute consequent consequence god subiect bricklenesse bone sonne exempted beyng able broken brought necessitie reason owne purpose thyng coulde bee whiche naturally myght haue ben xvii chapter wherto ende doctrine applied may certaine profite therof nowe forasmuche men wit bent vaine curious suttleties scarcely possible shall encombre themselues entangled doubtes soeuer doo knowe true right vse doctrine therfore shall expedient touche shortly ende scripture teacheth thynges ordred god fyrste noted prouidece god ought considered wel tyme come tyme past secondarily suche forte gouernour thynges sometyme woorketh meanes somtyme without meanes somtyme agaynst meanes last tendeth ende god maye shewe hath care mankynde specially doeth watche rulyng churche vouchesaueth nerely loke vnto also added althoughe eyther fatherly fauoure bountyfulnesse god oftentymes seueritie iudgemente brightly appere whole course prouidence yet somtyme cause thynges happen secrete thought crepeth myndes men matter tourned whirled blynde sway fortune fleshe stirreth v murmure god dydde make selfe pastyme tosse menne like tennise balles true quiet still myndes ready learne successe selfe woulde length playnely shewe god hath assured good reason purpose either traine pacience correct euill affection tame wantonnesse bryng theym downe renouncyng theim selues awake drowsynesse syde ouerthrowe prowde disappoint suttletie wicked confounde deuises howsoeuer cause secrete vnknowe v must assuredly hold ar layd vp hidde store himpsal xl therefore ought crie dauid god thou hast made thy wonderful work many none count order thee thy thought towarde v would declare speake able expresse although alwais misery ought thinke vpon sinnes verye punishement maye moue v repentance yet doo see christe geueth power secrete purpose father punishe euery one according deseruyngiohn ix hym borne blynde sayth neither hath man synned parentes glory god may shewed hym naturall sense murmureth calamitie commeth euen birth god vnmercifully punish sely innocente deserued christe dooth testifie lokyng glasse glory father doeth shyne syght haue cleere eies beholde must kepe modestie drawe god yelde cause dooynges lette v reuerence secrete iudgementes wyll vnto v moste iuste cause thynges thicke cloudes doo couer heauen violent tempest aryseth bycause bothe heauysome mystynesse caste oure eye thunder troubleth oure eares oure sens amased terrour thynke thynges confounded tombled togither yet whyle remaineth heauen quietenesse calmenesse muste thynke whyle troublesome state thinges worlde taketh v abilitie iudge god pure lyghte ryghteousnesse wysedome dooth well framed order gouerne dispose euen troublesome motion themselues ryght ende surely monstrous rage many behalfe whiche dare boldly call workes god accompte examyne secrete meanynges geue vnaduised sentence thynges vnknowen wyll dooe deedes mortall men vnorderly vse modestie towarde egals rather suspende iudgement incurre blame rashenesse syde proudely triumph vpon darke iudgementes god whiche became v regarde reuerence therfore man shal wel profitably wey prouidece god yt considering hath doo creatour maker worlde dooeth suche humilitie ought submitt feare reuerece hereby cometh passe many dog day doo venimed bitynges leaste barkynge assaile doctrine haue lawfull god reason informeth also raile v al spitefulnesse able contented commaundementes lawe wherin god comprehended doo saie worlde ruled secrete counsel though thyng teache inuention owne brayn though true holy ghost doth euery expressely say repeteth innumerable formes speeche shame restraineth theim dare vomyte blasphemy heauen fayn contende v ende may freely play madman graunt soeuer happeneth worldeps xxxvi vii gouerned incomprehensible purpose god let answere ende scripture sayth iudgementes depe bottomlesse deapth moses crieth wyll god sought afarre cloudes deapthes familiarly sette foorth lawe foloweth hidden compared bottomlesse deapthrom xlxxxiii whiche paule also saith deapth richesse wisedom knowlege god howe vnsearchable iudgementes way paste fyndyng hath knowen mynde lorde hath bene counsellour dede true gospel law conteyned mystery whiche farre aboue capacitie oure sense asmuche god comprehendyng mystery whiche hath vouchesaued open woorde doeth lighten myndes spirite understandyng nowe therin bottomlesse deapth way wherin muste safe walk candell guyde feete light life schoole certayn plainly discernable trueth meruailous order gouernyng worlde worthily called bottomlesse deapthe bicause hidden v ought reuerently worshyp ryghte well hath moses expressed theym bothe fewe woordesdeu xxix xxix secrete thynges saieth belong lorde god thyngs reueled belong v oure child euer see howe byddeth v onely studie meditation lawe also reuerently looke vp vnto secrete prouidence godiob xxvi xiiii booke iob rehersed one title deapth humbleth myndes author boke surueying vp downe frame worlde honourably entreated woorkes god length addeth lo part way howe littel portion heare hym accordyng whiche reason place maketh difference betwene wisedom remaineth god measure wisedome hath appointed men hath preached secretes nature sayth wisedome knowen god onelyiob xxviiixil hidden eies liuyng creature saieth published ende serched sayd vnto man beholde feare god wisedom purpose maketh sayeng augustine bycause knowe thynges whiche god doeth concernyng v moste good orderli lxxxiii quest ca xxiii therfore onely good wil accordyng law prouidence vnchaungeable lawe therefore sithe god dooth claime vnto hym selfe power rule worlde whiche v vnknowen let v lawe sobrenesse modestie quietly obey soueraigne authoritie wyll maye v rule iustice iust cause thynges meane absolute whiche sophisters doo babble separatyng wicked prophane disagremente iustice power meane prouidence whyche gouernesse thynges whiche procedeth nothyng right although cause therof hidden v whosoeuer shalbe framed modestie neyther time paste wil murmure god aduersities lay vpon blame wicked dooynges agamemnon homer dyd saying cause iupiter destenie yet agayn caried awaie destenies wil desperation throwe selues destruction yong man plautus whiche saide unitable chaunce thynges destenies driue men pleasure get rocke make ende goodes life togither neither yet pretende name god couer owne mischeuous dooynges saith lyconides comedie god mouer beleeue god ben knowe come passe rather searche learne scripture pleaseth god guiding holy ghost may trauayle atteyne thervnto also beyng ready folowe god whether soeuer calleth shewe dede nothyng profitable knowledge doctrine uery foolishly doo prophane men turmoile fondness thei maner cofound heauen earthe together saying god haue marked point death escape laboure vainely loste takyng hede selues therfore one man dareth venture go way heareth bee daungerous least murthered theues sendeth phisitians werieth himselfe medicine succour life forbeareth grosse meates feare appeiryng feble healthe dreadeth dwell ruinous house finally men deuise way endeuour diligence mynde wherby may atteyne whiche desire either remedy vaine whiche sought reforme god ell life death health sicknesse peace warre thyngs whiche men couete hate doo trauaile endeuour obteyne escape determined certain decree gather praiers faithfull disordered least superfluous wherin petition made please lorde prouide thynges whiche hath already decreed eternitie short destroy cou sels men doo take tyme come thynges agaynst prouiuidence god whiche hath determined woulde haue doone without callyng counsell soeuer alredy hapned impute prouidence god winke man knowe haue done hath ruffian slaine honest citezen hath executed say purpose god hathe one stollen committed fornication hath doen thyng forseene ordeined lorde minister prouidence hath sonne carelessely neglectyng remedy wayted death father coulde resist god appointed eternitie mischeuous dooynges call vertues obey ordinance god touching thing come salomon doth well bring agrement togither purpose men prouidence god laugheth scorne follye whiche boldely doo enterprise thyng without lorde though ruled hande place speaketh manerprou viix harte man purposeth waie lorde doeth direct steppe meanyng hyndered eternall decree god vnder may prouide selues dispose thynges belongyng v without manifest reason hath limitted life within appointed boundes hath therwithall left v care thereof hath furnished v meanes healpes preserue hath made v haue knowledge hande daungers shoulde oppresse v vnware hath geuen v prouisions remedy nowe plaine see duetie say god hath committed v owne lyfe defende duetie defende offer v helpes duetie vse theim shew v daungers duetie runne rashly theim minister v remedy duetie neglect daunger shall hurt vnlesse fatall al remedy ouercome daungers therefore fatal god hath assigned thee remedy repulse ouercom see thy maner reasoning agreeth order god disposition thou gatherest daunger bee taken heede forasmuch fatal shal escape without takyng hede lorde doeth therfore enioyne thee take hede haue fatall vnto thee madde men consyder whiche plaine eye skil taking cou sell hede enspired men god whereby may serue prouidence preseruing owne life syde negligence slouthe procure selues euils hath appoynted theim howe commeth passe circumspecte man whyle prouideth selfe doeth wynde hym self euilles hang ouer hym foole perisheth vnaduised rashenesse bothe folly wisedom instrumentes god disposition bothe partes therfore pleased god hyde v thynges come ende shoulde mete thynges doutefull ceasse sette prepared remedy till either ouercome past helpe care cause haue admonished prouidence god doeth alwaye shewe selfe naked god vsyng meanes doeth certaine maner clothe men doo vnorderly vnaduisedly draw chaunces time past ye naked prouidece god bicause vpo hag al thigs whatsoeuer happe therfore say thei neither robbery adultery manslaughter committed without god say shall thefe punished spoyled hym whome lordes punishe pouertie shall murtherer punished hath slaine hym whoes life lorde ended suche men doo serue god shall punished deny serue god may say whiche caried euill mynde doeth seruice god commaunder dede doeth obey owne wicked lust obeyeth god beyng enformed doeth labour end whervnto god calleth wherby enformed wil worde therfore doyng thinges must see wil god whiche declareth worde god requireth v whiche commaundeth doo thyng co maundement obedience obstinacie transgression vnlesse wolde doo graunt doo euil thinges ende obey hym doeth commaunde v rather runne headlong minding willeth raging intemperance owne lust sette purpose bende trauayle meanes euill doyng serue iust ordinance accordynge infinite greatnesse wisedome hath good skill vse euill instrument doo good see howe foolishe manner arguyng wold haue doer vnpunished mischeuous actes committed disposition god graunt theues murtherers euill doer instrumentes god prouidence lorde dooth vse execute iudgementes whiche hath himselfe determined denye euyll dooynges ought haue excuse therby shall either entangle god wickednesse theym shall couer noughtynesse rightuousnesse doo neyther boeth able excuse themselues accused owne conscience able blame god fynde euill themselues hym nothyng lawful vse euilnesse worketh whece pray commeth stinke dead carrion hath ben boeth rotted disclosed heate sunne men doo see raised beames sunne yet man dooth therefore saie sunbeames doo stinke whe resteth euil man ye matter gyltinesse euyll cause thought god thyng defiled vse seruice pleasure away therfore doggishe frowardnesse whiche maye dede afarre barke iustice god touche cauillations rather dotyng errours phrenetike men shall easily shaken awaye godly holy meditation ye prouidence whiche rule godlynesse teacheth v thereof maye growe vnto v good moste pleasant fruite therfore christian hart moste assuredly persuaded thyngs come passe disposition god nothyng happeneth chaunce wil alway bende eies hym principall cause thynges yet consider inferiour cause place wyll doute singular prouidence god doeth watche preseruation whiche prouidence suffre nothyng happen whiche shall tourne good saluation hath doo first al men creature assure hym selfe god prouidence dooth reigne bothe touchyng men whether good euill acknowledge counselles willes enterprise power vnder hande god god bowe whether list restraine ofte pleaseth hym syngular prouidence god doeth kepe watche safetie faithfull many euident promise witnessepsal ivxxiii pet vix psa xcii zach iviii esa xxviii cast thy burden vpon lorde shall nourishe thee shall suffer rightuous fall euer careth v dwelleth healpe hyest shall abyde protection god heauen toucheth toucheth apple myne eie thy shielde brasen walle wil enemie thy enemy although mother forget child yet forget thee also principall entent history bible teache lord doeth diligence kepe way sainctes doo muche stumble stone therfore little haue rightfully reiected opinion whyche doo imagine vniuersall prouidence god stoupeth specially care euery creature yet principally shall good reknowledge special care toward selues whervppon christ affirmed sparowe leaste valuemath xxxix doeth fal grounde without father doeth apply ende shoulde consider howe muche woorth
