sparrowes much nyer care doeth god prouide v extendeth care farre may bolde truste heares head numbred wishe selues yf muche heare fall head speake onely mankynde bycause god hath chosen churche dwellyng house himselfe doute doeth singuler example shew care gouerning seruant god beyng strengthened promyses example ioyne testimony whiche teache men vnder god power whether wynne myndes good restraine malice may doo hurt lorde geueth v fauour onely v wellexo iii xxi also egyptian maliciousnesse oure enemy knoweth howe diuerse way subdue somtyme taketh away wit thei conceiue sound sobre aduise like sent foorth sathan fill mouthes prophetes lying deceiue achabi king xxiixxii kinges xiix made rechabeam mad yong men counsell myght spoyled kyngdome owne folly many tymes graunteth witte yet maketh afraide astonished goe whiche haue conceiued sometyme also hath suffred go whiche luste rage dyd counsell theim doeth conuenient tyme breake violence suffreth theim procede end purposed dyd time bryng nought counsell architophell shoulde haue dauids destruction also taketh care gouerne al creature ye benefit safetie yt hisii sam x iivii yea gouerne deuill hym selfeiob ixi whiche see durst enterprise nothyng againste iob withoute sufferaunce commaundement knowledge necessarily ensueth thankfulnesse mynde prosperous successe thynges also pacience aduersitie incredible assurednesse time come whatsoeuer therfore shal betide vnto prosperously accordyng harte desyre ascribe vnto god whether fele bountie god ministerie men holpen liuelesse creature thus wil thynke mynde surely lorde whiche hath inclined myndes hath ioyned vnto instrumetes goodnesse toward plentie frutes earth thus thynke lord whiche heareth heauen heauen may heare earthe earthe also may heare fruites thyngs wil dout blessyng lorde wherby thyngs prosper put mynde many cause wil abide vnthakful aduersitie happen therin also lifte vp mynde godgen xlvviii whoes hande auaileth muche emprint v paciece quiete moderation hart ioseph still continued recordyng falsehode brother coulde neuer haue taken brotherly mynde towarde theim bowed mynde lorde forgat iniurie inclined mekenesse clemency farrefoorth accorde conforted brother said solde egypte god sent saue lyues dede thought euill lorde tourned good iob respect chaldee troubled would foorthwith haue kendled reuengeiob ixxi therwithall acknowledge work god comforted hymselfe moste excellent saying lorde hath geuen lorde hath taken away lordes name bee blessed dauid semei railed cast stone hym looked vpon man would haue incouraged souldiours reacquite iniurieii sam xvix vnderstode semei dyd without mouyng lorde rather appeased lette hym alone said lorde hath commaunded hym curse bridle place doeth restraine intemperance sorowe helde peace saith became domme bycause thou lordepsalm xxxviiix diddest effectualll remedy agaynst wrath impacience surely hath little profited whiche hath learned behalfe thinke vpon prouidence god may alway call backe mynde poynt lordes therfore must suffred onely lawfull striue agaynst also willeth nothyng whiche iust expedient fumme end beyng wrongfully hurt men leauyng malice whiche woulde doo nothyng enforce sorowe wheat mindes reuenge remembre climbe vp vnto god learne beleue assuredly soeuer enemie hath mischeuously doon v bothe suffered sent god disposition paule refraine v recompensing iniuries doth wisely put v mindeep vixii wrastle fleshe bloud spiritual enemy deuil may prepare selues striue thys profitable lesson appeasyng al rage wrath yt god doth arme wel deuill al wicked men stryue wt v yt sitteth iudge exercise oure patiencede xxviii ye misfortune misery yt oppresse v doe chaunce without ye worke men let v remeber doctrine ye law whatsoeuer prosperous floweth fountayne god blessing yt al aduersities cursinges let ye terrible warning make v afraid ye walke stubbornly wil also walke stubbornly agaynst rebuked sluggishnesse according ye commo sense ye flesh accompting al chauce yt happeneth sortes nether encouraged ye benefites god worship himlam iiixxxviii amo iiivi e xlvvi prycked forwarde wt scourge repetauce ye reso hieremy amos sharply rebuke ye iewes thought yt thing wel good euil came passe wtout commaudement god ye purpose serueth sermon esay god create lyght fashyon darkenesse make peace create euil god doe make thynges yet meane time godly man wil winke inferior cause nether wil thinketh minister god goodnesse bi hath receiued benefite therfore let passe vnconsidered though deserued thanke getlenesse wil hartily thynke hymselfe bounde vnto wil willingly confesse hys bonde trauail shalbe able occasion shall serue recopence finally benefites receyued wyl reuerence prayse god principal author honor men ye minister ye truth dede wil vnderstande yt wyll god bounde whoes hand god wil benefitial vnto hym suffer losse negligence want foresight wil determine hys mind yt done dede wt wil god wil impute also hymselfe man dead sickenesse hath negligently handled wheras duty haue taken good hede vnto although ignoraunt yt come appoynted tyme beyond whych could passe yet therby lessen hys offense faythfully discharged hys duty towarde hym wil take perished fault hys neglygence much lesse vsed fraude conceiued malice mynde committing either murther theft wil excuse vnder pretece god prouidence wil one selfe euil act seuerally behold ye righteousnesse god wickednesse man doth manifestly shew theselues principally thynges come wil haue cosideration inferior cause wyl recke among blessinges god disappoynted ye helpes men may vse hys safety neither wil negliget takyng counsell slouthful crauyng helpe seeth haue sufficiet wherof may succoured thinking yt whatsoeuer creature thyng profyt ye offred hys hand god wil apply hys vse ye lawful instrumetes god prouidence doth certaynly know successe ye businesse wil haue goeth sauing yt al thynges knoweth lord wil prouide hys benefyte wil wyth study trauaile yt shal thynke expedyent hym selfe far ca coceiue mynde vnderstanding yet takyng counsel wil caried hys wyt wyl comit yeld hymselfe ye wisdom god guiding therof may directed ye ryght end hys confydence shal stay vpon outward helpes yt haue wyl carelesly rest vpon want wil afraied lefte destitute wyl haue hys mynde alway fastened vpo prouydence god neyther wyll suffer hymselfe drawe away fro stedfast beholdyng therof consideration present thynges though ioab acknowledged ye successe battail wil hand god yet gaue hymselfe slouthfulnesse diligetly execute yt whych belonged hys callyng leaueth vnto ye lord gouerne ye end wil stand valiant saith natio city godii xxii ye lord good eies knowledge shal despoyle v rashnesse wrongful cofydece shal dryue v cotinual calling vpo god also shal vpholde mindes wyth good hope may doute assuredly boldly despyse danger compasse v point doth ye inestimable felicitie godly minde shew forth selfe innumerable euils yt besege man lyfe threaten hym many deathes go tha selues asmuche body receptacle thousade disease yea ha h enclosed doth nourishe within cause disease man carrye selfe must nedes also cary wyth hym many formes hys destruction draw forth lyfe entangled wt death may el called neyther cold sweateth without peril whether soeuer turne thee al thynges yt thee vntrusty frendes thee maner opely threaten seme shew thee present death go ship fote thicknesse betwene thee death sit horsebacke ye slippyng one fote thy lyfe daunger go ye stretes citie euen many tyles vpo house many peril art thou subiect iron tole thy hande thy frendes harme ready prepared many wylde beastes seest al armed thy destructyon thou meane shut vp thy selfe eue garden well fensed may appeare nothyng pleasantnesse aire groud somtime locketh serpet house whych continually subiect fyer doeth ye day tyme threaten thee pouertie nyght tyme falyng vpon thy hed thy feld forasmuche lyeth ope hayle froste drowth tempestes warneth thee barrennesse thereby famyne speake prysonninges treasos robbery ope violence part besege v home part folow v abrode streightes muste man nedes miserable euen lyfe halfe dead doth painfully draw forth careful faintyng breath hadde swearde contynually hangyng ouer hys necke thou wilt say thinges chaunce seldome least alwaies men neuer one graunte seyng putte minde example thinges maye happen selues lyfe ought duty fre tha must dred feare thynges yt maye light vpon v man imagine miserable tha fearefulnesse beside without dishonorable reproche god say hath set open man noblest al hys creature blinde vnaduised stroke fortune purpose speake onely misery man fele brought subiecte vnder fortune dominion light god prouidence hath one shyned vpon godly releued deliuered extreme anguishe feare wherwt oppressed also al care iustly feareth fortune dare boldly commit hymselfe god say comfort vnderstande heauenly father doth holde thynges wyth hys power ruleth wt hys authoritie countenaunce ordreth wt wisdome nothyng befalleth hys apointment yt receiued god tuitio comitted charge angel touched hurt water fyer wepo far shall please god gouernor geue place x iiii song psalme shal deliuer thee hunter snare noysom pestilece wil couer thee vnder hys wynges thou shalt sure vnder hys fethers truth shalbe thy shield buckler thou shalt afraid feare night ye arrow yt flyeth day pestilece walketh ye darknesse ye plage destroyeth none day thense procedeth boldnesse saintes glorye lord helperps xviii vi wil feare flesh may doe lord protector shal afrayed whole campes stande vp agaynst walke middest shadow death cease hope well whense pray haue assurednesse neuer shaken away hereby world semeth shewe without order whirled aboute knowe god worketh euery whoes worke trust shalbe preseruation safetie assailed either ye deuil wicked men case strengthened remembrance meditation prouidence must nedes discouraged cal minde deuil al route wicked euery way holden hande god wt bridle yt neyther conceiue mischiefe agaynste v goe aboute haue conceiued goe neuer muche ca stirre one finger bring passe far shal suffer yea far shal comaunde yt onely holden fast bounde fetter also copelled wt bridle seruice haue abundatly wherwt comfort theselues lordes worke arme furie turne direct whether pleaseth woorke also appointe measure ende dooe licentiously triumphei iixviii cor xvi vii perswasion paule stablished sufferaunce god appoint iourney place said one place hindred sata onely sayed stopped satan haue semed geue much power ben satan hande ouerthrowe purpose god maketh god iudge vpon whoes sufferaunce iourneyes doe hang doeth therewithall shewe satan whatsoeuer goe atteine nothing god wil reason doth dauid sondrye chaunges wherwith man life tossed whirled aboute doeth flee sanctuary saieth time hande godpsa xxxixvi might haue said either course life time ye singular nomber worde time meant expresse howesoeuer state man vnstedfast whatsoeuer alteration nowe happen gouerned god whiche cause rasin king israelesa viiiiii ioyning power destruction iuda semed fierbrandes kindled wast cosume land called prophete smoking brandes nothyng breath little smokeeze xxixiiii pharao terrible men reason hys richesse strength number men himselfe compared beast sea hys army fish therfore god saieth take capitaine army hoke draw whether liste finally tary long vpon thys point man marke shal easily see extremitie al misery ignoraunce god prouidence chiefe blessednesse standeth knowledge therof concerning prouidence god thys saied enoughe much profitable perfect learning comforte faithful fil vaine curiositie men nothing ffycyent neither wished satisfied certayne place whiche seme meane otherwyse aboue declared god hath stedfast stable purpose changeable accordyng disposition inferior thyngesge vivi samu xvxi ier xviii viii firste place spoken repentaunce god repented hym creatyng man aduauncing saul kingdome repent hym euil determined lay vpon people sone perceiueth conuersion agayne rehearsed diuerse repelles hys decreesion iiiiiii declared ionas niniuites xl dayes one past niniue destroyed turned repentaunce getle sentenceesa xxxv iiiv ii kin xx mouth esay pronounced death ezechias moued teares prayer differre hereupon many make argument god hath appoynted men matter eternal decree yerely daily hourely decreeth yt euery man deseruinges thynketh equitie iustice concerning repentaunce thys ought holde ca god tha ignoraunce error weakenesse man wittingly willingly throw hymselfe case yt nede repente say yt god doth repet yt must also say yt god ignoraunt wil come passe yt auoide yt headlong vnaduisedly runneth purpose wherof thinketh yt far ye meaning holy ghost yt tion making repentaunce denyeth god repenting man maye repente noted chapter ioyned together comparison doth well bryng shewe repugnancie agrement changing figuratiuely spoken god repented made saul kingi samu xv xxix added strength israel shal lye shalbe moued repenting man may repent wordes vnchangeablenesse affirmed plainly without figure therfore certayne yt ordinaunce god disposyng matter men perpetuall aboue al repentace constance doutefullnu xxiii xix aduersaries haue compelled beare hym witnesse balaam whether would could choose brust saying yt like man lye sonne man changed possible shoulde doe hath sayed fulfill soeuer hath spoken meaneth name repentaunce euen sort al phrase speache descrybe god vnto v maner men weakenesse doth reach ienesse description hym whiche taughte v mete framed lowe capacitie might vnderstande manner frame low v paynt hymselfe one himselfe one perceiued v wher hymselfe without mouing troubled minde yet testifieth angry synners like therfore whe heare god angry ought imagine mouing rather consider speche borrowed comon sense god beareth resemblance one chafed angry ofte exerciseth iudgemente oughte vnderstande nothing ell worde repentance changing dedes men changing dedes wont declare mislike euery change among men amendment whiche misliketh amendement commeth repentaunce therfore name repentaunce meant yt god changeth workes meane time yet neither hys purpose turned affection changed foloweth one continuall course yt eternitie foreseen allowed decreed howesoeuer alteration seme soden eye men neyther doeth holy history shew god decree wer repelled sheweth destruction pardoned niniuites pronouncedion iii x esa xxx v life ezechias prolonged warning geuen hym death construe deceiued vnderstanding threteninges whiche althoughe simply affirme yet ye successe shalbe perceiued coteined secret condition god sende ionas ye niniuites ell aforehande ruine citie esaye geue ezechias warnig death might haue brought nought without sending worde destruction meant therfore thing make foreknowing death see comming farre euen meant haue destroied haue amended destroied therfore ionas prophecied niniue fal xl day done end fal hope longer life cutte fro ezechias done purpose might obteine longer life doth see god meante threateninges awake repentaunce made afraide ende might escape iudgemente whiche deserued sinnes agreed nature thinges themselues doth leade v thys vnderstande simple threatening secret emplied condition also confirmed like example lord rebuking ye king abimelech taken away abraham wife himge xxviiii vseth wordes behold thou shalt die woman thou hast taken hath husband excused himselfe god said thus restore wife husbande prophete shal pray thou maiest liue know thou shalt die death al thou hast se first sentece vehemently striketh minde bring hedefully bent make amedes doth plainly declare seing meaning place lyke gather thing withdrawen first purpose god made voide thing whiche pronounced god doth prepare way hys eternall ordinaunce whe geuing warning punishment moueth repentance whome wil spare rather varieth thing wil word sauing doth expresse thing sillables yet easy vnderstand sayeng esaie must nedes remaine trueesa xiiiixxvii lord hostes hath determined shalbe able vndoe hande stretched oute shall turne away pthe xviii chapter god doth vse seruice wycked men voweth mindes put hys iudgementes execution yet styll himselfe remayneth pure spot ariseth harde question place said god boweth draweth satan himselfe al reprobate sense ye flesh scarcely conceiueth workyng gather spot fault yea common workyng fre al fault iustly condemne minister upon deuised distinctio betwene suffering many haue thought vnpossible dissolued satan al wicked vnder hande power god directeth malice vnto ende pleaseth hym vseth wycked doinges executing iudgementes modestie wer paraduenture excusable shew absurditie putteth feare wrongfully lyeng defense go deliuer iustice god fro al vnrightfull blame semeth vnreasonable man shuld comaundement god made blynde punished blindnesse therfore seke scape shift done sufferance god hymselfe plainely pronouncyng doeth doeth reiecte shifte men doo nothyng secrete commaundement god trouble selues vaine deliberating vnlesse secrete direction stablishe hath determined proued innumerable plaine testimony certayne whiche alledged psalme god doeth thyngs belongeth doinges men god certain appointer warre peace saied without exception dare say men caried causelessely blynde motion god knoweth sitteth still special example lightsome plainnesse first chapiter iob knowe satan doeth lesse appere god receiue co maundementes angel willyngly obey dede diuers maner diuers end yet go thyng god although seme afterward added bare sufferance hym afflicte holy man yet sayeng trueiob lorde hath geuen lord hath taken away pleased god com passe gather god author triall iob wherof sathan wicked theues minister sathan goeth dryue holy man desperation madnesse sabees cruelly wickedly doo inuade robbe goodes none iob knowledgeth god stripped goodes made poore pleased god therfore whatsoeuer men satan hymselfe attempt yet god holdeth sterne tourne trauayles executyng iudgements god wil haue ye false kyng achab deceiuedii king xxiiix deuill offered seruice therevnto sent certaine commaundement lying spirite mouthe prophetes blyndyng madnesse achab iudgement god deuise bare sufferance vaine fond thyng say iudge doeth onely suffre also decree haue dooneact iiiixxviii commaund minister put execution iewes purpose destroy christ pilate souldiors doo folowe ragyng lust yet solemne praier disciple doo confesse wicked men dyd nothyng el whiche hande counsell god determinedact iixxi act iiixviii ii sam xvixxii euen peter preached christ decreed purpose foreknowledge god deliuered slayne shuld say god whome nothyng hidden beginnyng wittyngly willyngly appoynt whiche iewes execute place herseth god whyche shewed prophetes christ shuld suffer hath fulfilled itii sam xiixii absolon defilyng father bed incestuous adulterie committed detestable wickednesse yet god pronounceth owne worke wordes thou haste doone secretely doo openly sunne ter xxv hieremie pronounceth crueltie chaldee vsed iury woorke god cause nabucadnezer called seruant god god euery crieth hissynges vxxvi esa xv esa xixxxv soud trumpet power comandement wicked ar stirred vp warre calleth assyrian rod wrath axe moueth hande destruction holy citie ruine temple calleth worke dauid murmuring god acknowledging rightuous iudge yet confesseth cursings semei proceded comaudement godii sa xx lord saith comaunded curse often finde ye holy historie yt soeuer happeneth cometh lord departing ten tribesi kin xixxxi sam ii xxxiiii death sonnes hely many thing like sort yt meanly exercised scripture see yt shortness sake bring forth many testimony yet appereth plainly enough yt trifle talk fondly yt thrust bare sufferace place ye prouidence god though god saie watche tower waityng chaunces fortune iudgementes shoulde hang vppon men nowe concerning secrete motion salomo speaketh hart kingpro xxii bowed hether thether pleaseth god extendeth surely mankind muche effecte said soeuer conceiue myndes secret inspiration god directed ende truly worke myndes men rightly said taketh away lippe true speaker wisedom aged men taketh hart fro prince earthe maye wander beaten waieez c viixxvi uitic xxvixxxvi samu xxvi hereto belongeth whyche ofte reade men fearefull farre foorth theyr harte bee taken feare dauid went campe saule none ware slepe god come vpon theim nothyng desyred playnly spoken oft pronounceth blyndeth eies men striketh giddynesse maketh drunke spirite drowsynesse casteth madnesse hardneth hart thing also many referre sufferance forsaking reprobate suffred blinded satan solution fonde forasmuch ye holy ghost plain word expresseth striken blindnesse madnesse ye iust iudgmet godeccl vii rom viixxi ero viiixv said yt hardned hart pharao also make dull strengthen vnsauory cauillation mocke phrase speche place said pharao harden owne hart owne set cause hardenyng though thynges well agree together although diuers maners man moued working god doeth also worke doo turne back obiection selues harden signify bare sufferance motion obstinacie shall proprely pharao weake foolishe expounde pharao suffer hym self hardened moreouer scripture cutteth occasion suche cauillations god saythero iiii xx io xi xx psal v xxv holde harte inhabitauntes land canaan moses saith thei went forth bataile ye lord hardned hart thing repeted prophet saying turned hart hate people agayne esaie saieth sende assyrian deceytfull nationesa xvi commaunde cary awaie spoiles violently take praie meanyng teache wicked obstinate men obey willyngly wil bowe execute iudgementes dyd beare commaundementes grauen myndes wherby appeareth moued certaine appointement god graunte god doeth oftentymes worke reprobate satan seruice meane yet satan doeth office god mouing procedeth farre geuen hymi samu xvixiiii ii corin xliiii euill spirite troubled saule sayde god wee may knowe madnesse saule came iuste vengeance god also said satan doth blind myndes vnfaithfull effectuall workyng errour cometh god hymself make beleue lye refuse obey truthe first maner speakyng saideze xiiiiix rom xxviii prophet shal speake lyingly god haue deceiued according maner speche said geueth men reprobate mynde cast filthy desire chiefe author owne iuste vengeance satan onely minister therof must entreate matter againe second boke shall discourse free bonde wil man thinke haue already shortely spoken muche place required let summe muche god sayd cause thynges prouidence thought gouernesse purpose workes men sheweth foorth force onely elect whiche gouerned holye spirite also compelleth reprobate obedience forasmuche hetherto haue recited onely suche thynges writte scripture plainly doubtfully let feare wrongfully sclander heauenly oracle take hede maner iudgement take vpon fained pretendyng ignorance seeke praise modestie imagined proudely doon sette one small woorde authoritie god think otherwise like haue touched openly speake euill preuaile spittyng heauen newe example waiwardnesse haue ben al age wicked vngodly men ragyng mouth barked point doctrine shal fele thyng dede true long ago holy ghost spake mouth dauid god may ouercome iudgedpsa li vi dauid doth way rebuke madnesse men vnbridled licenciousnesse owne filthynesse doo onely argue againste god also take vpon power condemne hym meane time shortly admonisheth blasphemy whiche vomite vp heauen doo reache vnto god driuyng away cloudes cauillations doeth brightly shewe foorth righteousnessei ioh v iiii also faithe beyng grounded vpon worde god aboue worlde doeth hye place contemptuously looke downe vppon mystes first obiect nothyng happen god hym two contrary willes decreeth thynges secrete purpose hath openly forbidden lawe easily wiped away answere one geue reders warnyng cauillation throwen holy ghoste taught holy man iob confessioniob ixxi pleased god came passe spoiled theues acknowledged iniurie hurt iust scourge god saieth scripture placesi sa iixxv psa cxviii sonnes hely obeyed father god kill also prophete crieth god sitteth heauen doeth euer nowe haue shewed plainly enough god author al thinges whiche iudges wold haue happen idle sufferace testifieth createth light darknesseesa xlvvii amos iii vi deu xixv formeth good euill euill happeneth himselfe hath made let theim tell beseche whether doo willyngly execute owne iudgementes moses teacheth whiche slaine falling axe chance deliuered god hande striker whole churche saieth luke herode pilate conspired doo thynges hand purpose god decreedacts iiiixviii truly christ wer crucified god whense cam redemption v yet wil god neither doeth striue selfe chaunged fayneth willeth thyng willeph x one simple hym semeth v manyfolde accordyng weakenesse oure witte wee conceiue howe god diuers maner willeth willeth one self thyng paule hath said calling gentile hidden mysterie within litle saieth manifestly shewed manyfolde wisedom god dullnesse witte wisedom god seemeth v manifolde olde interpretour hath translated many fashion shall therfore dreame varietie god though either chaungeth purpose dissenteth rather conceiue howe god haue thyng done whiche forbiddeth doo let v call mynde owne weakenesse therwithal consider light wherin dwelleth without cause called inaccessiblei tim vi xvi enchirid ad lauren cap bicause couered darknesse therfore godlye sobre men easyly agree sentence augustine sometyme man good willeth whiche god willeth good sonne willeth haue father liue god haue dye agayne may come passe man may wyll thyng euill wyll god willeth good euyll sonne willeth haue father die god also willeth nowe fyrst two sonnes wylleth whyche god willeth sonne willeth whyche god also willeth yet naturalnesse first sonne doeth better agree god although willeth contrary thing vnnaturalnesse sonne willeth thyng great difference wyll doeth belong man god ende euery one applied haue either allowed disalowed thynges whiche god willeth well bringeth passe euill wylles euyl men littel said angel apostataes fallyng away reprobate muche concerneth theim selues god would respecte omnipotencie god coulde meanes dopsal cxlii didde god god doone vpon whervpon crieth great ar workes god ought sought al loue meruailous maner thing doon without also done coulde done suffre yet doeth willyngly beyng good would suffer thyng done euil vnlesse omnipotent coulde euill make good maner assoyled rather vanisheth awaye obiection god doo onely vse seruice wicked men also gouerneth counsel affection author al wicked doynges therfore men vnworthily condemned execute whiche god hath decreed obey done amisse confound comaundement together appereth innumerable example differ farre asunderii sam xvixxii though absalon abused father wyues god punishe dauids adulterie dishonor yet dyd therfore comaunde wicked sonne committe inceste vnlesse perhappe meane respecte dauid speaketh railynges semei whe confesseth semei rayleth hym commaundement god doeth therin commende obedience froward dogge obey commaundement god acknowledgyng tongue scourge god paciently suffreth corrected holden mynde god performeth wicked thyng decreed secrete iudgement excused though dyd obey commaundement dede owne euill luste doo purposely breake howe thyng godi kin xi xx ruled secrete prouidece men doo wickedly election kyng iarobeam playne exaumple rashenesse madnesse people seuerly condemned peruerted order apointed god falsely fel house dauid yet knowe shoulde annoyntedosee viii iiii osee xiii xi whervpon wordes osee appereth certaine shewe repugnancie god complayned kyngdome erected without knowledge agaynst place saith gaue kingdom iarobeam rage howe shall sayenges agree iarobeam reigned god made kyng god euen thus neither coulde people falle house dauid must shake yoke whiche god layed vpon theim neither yet god libertie taken away myght punishe vnthankfulnesse salomon see therfore howe god willyng false breache allegeance yet ende iustly willeth fallyng away prince whervppon iarobeam beside hope holy annointyng driuen kyngi kin xixxiii maner doeth holy historie say enemy raised vp spoyle salomos sonne part kingdom let ye reders diligetly wey thing pleased god haue ye people gouerned vnder ye hand one king therfore whe diuided two part wil yet ye diuisio toke beginning wil surely ye prophet word ceremonie anointing moue iarobeam whe thought thig hope ye kingdom without ye knowledge ye god comauded done yet rebellio people iustly condened yt wer ye wil god fel fro posterite dauid maner also afterwarde said yt rehabea proudly despised request ye people done god cofirme ye word spoke hand ahiha seruat lo god wil ye sacred vnitie torne sunder yet god ten tribe forsake salomos sonii kin xvii let v adde like exaple wher people cosenting yea laying handes vnto ye sonnes ahab slaine ofspryng rooted iehu said dede truly yt nothing word god fallen ye groude doon yt spoke hand seruat elia yet vniustly rebuketh ye citezens samaria yt put hand vnto ar ye rightuous saith haue cospired lord hath killed haue think alredy declared plainly one self work ye fault man doth bewray selfe also righteousnesse god gloriously apereth episto ad vincen modest wit answere augustin shal alway suffise father delyuered sonne christ deliuered body iudas deliuered lorde delyueryng god ryghtuous man faultie one thyng whiche dyd cause one whych dyd combered saie consent god man man rightuous mouyng god doeth whiche lawfull let remembre augustine saith place de gratia libero arbitrio ad valent cap shal tremble iudgementes god worketh euen harte euyll men euer yet rendreth accordyng deseruyngs truely falsehoode iudas shall bee lawfull laye blame wicked deede god hymselfe wylled hym deliuered dyd delyuer hym death shalbe geue away ye praise redeptio iudas therfore ye writer doth place truly tel v yt examinatio god doeth enquire men mighte haue done thei haue done wil yt purpose wil may come ye accompt yt thinke hard let litle cosider tolerable waiwardnesse refuse thig witnessed plain testimony scripture excedeth capacitie fynd fault yt thing ar vttered god vnlesse knowe profitable knowe wold neuer haue comanded taught prophetes apostle wise ought embrace meke willingnesse lern yt wtout exceptio soeuer taught ye holy scripturs yt frowardly outrage prating sith euidet yt thei babble god worthy longer confutation ende fyrst booke seconde booke institution christian religion whiche intreateth ye knowledge god redemer christ whiche knowledge firste opened father time lawe v gospell fyrste chapter adames sinne fallynge awaye mankinde became accursed degenerate hys firste estate wherin intreated original sinne without cause hath knowledge ben olde prouerbe muche commended man thought shame ignoraunt thynges pertayne course man lyfe muche shamefull knowinge selues whereby commeth passe taking counsel thinge necessary miserably daseled yea altogether blinded muche profitable lesson muche dylygentlye muste take heede disordrely vse see som philosopher haue done exhortinge man knowe himselfe withall appoint ende know hymselfe shoulde ignorant owne dignitie excellencie nothinge el thei beholde himselfe wherby may swell vaine confidence puffed vp pride knowledge oure selues first standeth thys pointe considering geuen v creation howe bountifully god contynueth hys gracious fauoure towarde v may knowe howe great ben excellencie oure nature continued vncorrupted may withall thinke vpon ther nothing v oure owne haue gotten borrowing god hathe bestowed vpon v maye alwaies hang vpon hym cal minde oure miserable estate ye fal adam feeling wherof may throwe downe al gloryinge truste seluesgenes ouerwhelme v shame truely humble v god beginning fashioned v like owne image end raise vp mindes study vertue meditation eternall life least greate noblenesse oure kinde whiche maketh v different brute beastes shoulde drowned wyth slouthfulnesse good v knowe yt therfore endued vnderstandinge keping holly honest lyfe shulde cede forwarde appointed ende blessed immortalitie firste dignity come minde heauy sight oure filthines shame doth thruste selfe pres sin person fyrste man fallen oure estate vpon groweth hatred lothinge oure sel true humilitie kyndeled newe desire seeke god whome euery v maye recouer good thinges whereof founde altogither voyde emptye thinge surely ye truth god appointeth sought examinynge oure selues meane requyreth suche knowledge maie bothe call v away fro confidence oure owne power making v destitute al matter glory vpon may bringe v submission whiche rule behoueth v keepe wyll attaine true marke bothe right knowledge welldoinge neyther yet ignoraunt howe muche pleasant opinion yt allureth v rather consider oure good thinges loke vpon oure miserable nedynesse dishonore whiche ought ouerwhelme v shame ther nothynge man nature coueteth stroked flattery therfore heareth giftes hym magusyed leaneth syde wyth ouermuche lyghtnes belefe whereby muche lesse maruelled herein greatest parte men haue perniciously erred sith ther naturally planted mortall menne blynde loue selues moste willingly perswade themselues nothinge ought woorthyly hate wythout maintenance moste vaine opinion dothe eche gett credit man aboundantly sufficient hym selfe make hym selfe liue well blessedlye contente thinke modestly howe soeuer graunt somewhat god leaste shoulde seeme arrogantly take selues yet parte principall matter glorye confidence alway remayneth selues nowe come talke allurementes tickeleth ye pride already selfe itcheth within bone ther nothinge may delite therefore hath extollinge moste fouourably aduaunced excellency man nature hathe accepted well lykynge reioisement manner age soeuer suche commendacion man excellency teacheth man reste selfe dothe nothinge delyte swetenesse dede deceyueth bryngeth moste wretched destruction assent vnto purpose auaileth v standynge vpon vaine confidence deuise apoint attempt gooe thinges thinke oure behoofe fyrste beginninge enterpryse forsaken destytute sounde vnderstandinge true strengthe yet go boldely tyll wee fall downe destruction otherwise happen haue affiaunce thei thing theyr owne power therefore man geue heede suche teacher holde v consyderynge onely oure owne good thynges shall profyte learninge knowe hym selfe shall carryed violently awaye worste kynde ignoraunce therefore poynte trueth god dothe agree common naturall meanynge men second part wisedome consisteth ye knowledge oure selues yet verye manner knowinge muche disagreement iudgement fleshe man thinketh hathe well searched himselfe trustinge vpon owne vnderstandinge integrytie taketh boldenes encourageth selfe doinge due y vertue biddinge battell vice trauayleth al study bende himselfe whiche comly honest loketh vpon trieth himselfe rule god iudgement inneth nothinge maye raise vp minde good affiance inwardely hathe examined selfe discouraged tyll beinge altogether spoyled confydence leaueth himselfe nothinge towarde well orderinge lyfe yet wold god haue v forgette firste noblenes gaue oure father adam whiche ought good righte awake v ye studie righteousnes goodnes consider either oure owne firste estate ende created shalbe pricked forwarde studye vpon immortalitie desire kyngedome god consideratio farre putting v courage rather discouraging v throweth v doune humblenes first estate oures euen whence false ende oure creation euen whiche altogether tourned away lothinge oure owne miserable estate may gro e sorrowe groninge may also sighe losse dignitie nowe saye man ought beholde nothinge himselfe may make hym bolde courage wee meane nothinge vpon affiance whereof oughte proude wherefore liste heare knoweledge man oughte haue himselfe let v thus diuide firste consider ende created endued giftes bee despised whiche thought may styrred vp meditation hearinge god lyfe come let weye hys owne strength rather needy wante strengthe perceiuynge whereof hee maye lye extreeme confusion one vtterly broughte naught fyrste consideration tendeth thys ende hee maye knowe hys duety howe muche able towarde perfourminge yt wyll entreate bothe ordre teachinge shall requyre bicause muste nedes lighte negligence detestable wicked acte whiche god seuerally punyshed wee muste consider verye fourme fall adam kyndeled horryble vengaunce god vpon mankynde y childishe opynyon hathe commonly receiued concerninge intemperaunce glotonye though summe heade vertues consysted forbearinge one onely frute flowed euery syde store sortes deyntyes bee desyred blessed frutefulnesse earthe th onely plentye also varyetye make pleasure therefore muste looke bicause forbiddinge tree knoweledge good euell tryall obedience adam obeyinge myghte proue yt wyllyngely iect ye gouernement god ye name tree selfe shew ye comaundement geuen none ende contented owne estate wt wicked lust adueuree himselfe higher ye promise wherby bidde hope eternall life longe eate tree life agayne horrible threatening death sone taste tree knowledge good euell serued proue exercise fayth herof harde gather meanes adam prouoked wrathe god agaynste selfe augustine deede sayeth amisse sayeth pryde beginnyng euels ambition lifted vp man higher laweful permitted mighte haue continued estate must fetch ful definition maner tentation moses describeth sithe woman deceite serpent led awaye infidelitie appereth disobedience beginning ye fallrom whiche thing paule cofirmeth teaching men loste one man disobedience withall noted first man fell subiection god taken entisementes satan also despising trueth tourne waye lying surely god worde beyng one despised reuerence god shaken bicause maiestie doth way abide honore among v worshippe remaine inuiolate hange vpo mouth therfore infidelitie roote falling awaye thereupon arose ambition pride adioyned vnthankefulnesse adam coueting graunted vnreuerently despise greate liberalitie god wherewyth enriched monstruous wickednesse sonne earth thoughte small thyng made likenesse god vnlesse mighte also bee made egall god apostasie filthy detestable offense whereby manne withdraweth selfe allegeance creatour yea outrageously shaketh yoke vaine extenuate sinne adam albeit simple apostasie ioyned shamefull reproches agaynst god assented sclaunders satan wherein accused god lying enuye niggardly grudgyng finally infidelitie opened gate ambition ambition mother obstinate rebellion make men caste awaye feare god throwe themselues whether lust caried therfore bernarde doeth rightly teache gate saluation opened vnto v day receiue gospel eares eue windowes stode ope satan death let adam would neuer haue ben bolde agaynst comaundement god beleue worde truely best bridle right keping affection good order thinke yt ther nothyng better kepe righteousnesse obeyenge ye comaundementes god ye chiefe ende happy life beloued therefore beyng carried away blasphemy deuell asmuch lay extinguishe whole glory god spirituall life adam abide ioyned bounde creatour alienation death soule neyther maruell yf fallynge awaye destroyed owne posteritie whiche peruerted whole order nature heauen earthrom viij creature doe grone sayeth paule beyng made subiecte corruption agaynst one shoulde aske cause doubte beare parte punishement manne deserued whose vse created sythe curse goeth throughoute costes world proceded faulte bothe vpwarde downeward nothing agaynst reason spread abroade issue therefore heauenly image defaced alone suffer punishment place wisedome strength holinesse truth iustice whiche ornamentes ben clothed came moste horrible pestilence blindenesse weakenesse filthinesse falsehod iniustice also entangled drowned whole ofspryng misery corruption cometh inheritaunce olde writer called originall sinne meaning word sinne corruptio nature good pure mater haue much contention bicause nothyng farther comon reason men made gilty one man faulte sinne become co mon whiche semeth haue ben cause oldest doctours churche darkely touche pointe leaste set plainely conuenient yet fearefulnesse coulde bryng passe pelagius arose whose prophane inuention adam sinned owne losse hurted posteritie sutteltie satan wente hidyng disease make incurable proued manifest testimonie scripture sinne passed fro firste man al posteritie brought cauillation passed imitation propagation therfore good men trauailed pointe aboue al augustine shewe corrupted forein wickednesse bryng v ye wombe mother viciousnesse planted begetting whiche denie moste greate shamelesnesse rashenesse pelagians celestians seeme marueylous hym whiche writinges holy manne shall perceyue howe shamelesse beastes thynges surely doubtfully spoken dauid confesseth begotten iniquity hys mother conceyued sinnep livij doeth accuse sinnes father mother better sette forth goodnesse god towarde hym begynneth confession hys owne wickednesse hys verie begettyng asmuche euident peculiar dauid alone followeth common estate mankynde noted vnder hys example therefore descende vncleane sede borne infected wyth contagion sinne yea see lighte thys lyfe bee sight god filthie spotted could geue cleane vncleanesseiobe xjiijiiij one boke iob heare vncleannesse parentes passeth chyldren wythoute anye exception theyr beginnynge defiled defilynge shall finde beginnyng vnlesse goe vp fyrste parente v wellhed thus therefore adam onely progenitour also roote man nature therefore corruption mankynde worthelye corrupted whyche apostle maketh playne comparynge hym christerom vxij sayeth one manne sinne entred whole worlde death sinne death wente ouer menne asmuche haue sinned grace christ righteousnesse lyfe restored vnto v pelagians prate adam sinne spred abroade imitation haue profite righteousnesse christe example sette v followe whoe canne abide suche robberie god honour question christes righteousnesse oures communication thereby lyfe followeth also bothe loste adam recouered christe sinne death crepte adam abolished christ wordes playne many made righteous obedience christe disobedience adam made sinner therefore betwene two relation adam wrappyng v destruct ion destroyed v hym christe grace restored v saluation clere light trueth thinke nede longer laborious profe also firste epistle corinthiansi cor xvxxij goeth aboute stablishe godly trust resurrectio sheweth life recouered christ loste adam pronounceth wee dead adam doeth also therewithall plainely testifie infected filth sinne damnation coulde reache vnto touched giltinesse iniquitie canne waye playnelier vnderstanded meaneth relation member sentence teacheth hope life restored christe well enough knowen done waye meruellous maner communicating christ poureth v force righteousnesse wrytten placero viijx spirite life vnto v righteousnesse sake therefore wee maye otherwyse expounde whyche sayde dead adam thus sinnynge dyd onely purchace mischiefe ruine hymselfe also throwe downe nature hedlonge like destructio corruption hym selfe whych perteyneth nothyng v bicause infected al sede corruptio wherinto fallen otherwise sayeng paule could stad trueeph ijiij nature sonnes wrath yf already accursed wombe easelye gathered nature meante suche create god suche corrupted adam conuenient god shold bee made authour death adam therefore corrupted hym selfe infection passed hym hys ofsprynge heauenly iudge hym selfe christe doeth also playnely enough pronounce borne euell corrupted teacheth soeuer borne fleshe ioan fleshe therefore gate lyfe closed agaynste menne vntill begotten agayne neyther vnderstandynge thereof curiouse disputation nedefull whyche little combred olde wryters whether soule sonne procede deriuation soule father bycause infection principally resteth must co tent wyth suche giftes pleased lorde haue bestowed vpon nature man lefte wyth adam therefore adam loste receyued lost himselfe also v whoe shall carefull conueyance soule soule shall heare adam receyued ornamentes whyche loste lesse v hymselfe geuen one manne alone assigned whole nature manne therefore agaynste reason yf beynge spoyled nature bee lefte naked poore yf beyng infected wyth sinne infection crepeth nature therefore rotten roote arose vp rotten branch whiche sent rottennesse twigges spronge chyldren corrupted father also infectiue theyr chyldren saye beginnynge corruption adam continuall flowynge one conueyed auncesters posteritie infection hath cause substaunce flesshe soule bycause ordeyned god suche giftes geuen fyrste manne manne shoulde bothe haue lose well hym selfe pelagians doe cauill likely chyldren doe take corruption godly parentes sithe oughte rather sanctified cleannesse easely confuted descende spirituall regeneration theyr car generation therefore contra lag est augustine sayeth whether vnbeleuer bee condemned gilty beleuer quitte innocent begette innocentes gilty bycause beget corrupted nature nowe doe maner partake parentes holinesse speciall blessyng people god whyche proueth firste vniuersall curse mankinde wente nature giltinesse sanctification supernatural grace ende thynges spoken thynge vncertayne vnknowen lette v define originall sinne yet meane examine definition made wryters brynge forthe one onely whyche thynke bee moste agreable wyth trueth originall sinne therefore semeth bee inheritably descendynge peruersnesse corruption nature poured abroade partes soule whyche fyrste maketh v gilty wrath god also bryngeth forth workes v whyche scripture calleth workes flesh properly paule oftentimes calleth sinne gal workes arise adultery fornication theftes hatred murthers banketinges manner calleth fruites sinne albeit likewise called sinnes commonly scripture also paule hym selfe therefore twoo thynges distinctly noted beyng partes nature corrupted peruerted nowe euen corruption holden worthily damned co uicted god whome nothyng acceptable righteousnesse innocencie purenesse yet bonde respecte others faulte sayde sinne adam made subiecte iudgement god taken innocent vndeseruyng beare blame faulte bycause offendyng clothed wyth curse therefore sayde hath bounde v neuerthelesse punishment came vpon v also infection distilled hym abideth v whiche punishment iustly due wherefore howe euer augustine doeth oftentimes call others sinne shewe playnely conueyed v propagation yet doeth also affirme wythall propre euery onero vxij apostle selfe expressely witnesseth therefore death came vpon menne bycause men haue sinned wrapped originall sinne defiled spottes thereof therefore infantes themselues whyle brynge owne damnation mother wombe bounde others owne faulte though haue yet brought forth fruytes theyr owne ini ie yet haue seede thereof enclosed within yea r whole nature certayne seede sinne therefore hatefull abhominable god whereupon followeth th proprely accompted sinne god coulde gi inesse wythout sinne pointe peruersenesse neuer cesseth v continually bryngeth forth newe frutes euen woorkes fleshe haue descrybed ly e b rnynge fornace bloweth flame sparcles sprynge doeth wythout ceassyng caste water therefore whyche haue defyned origin sinne bee lackyng originall ryghteousenesse whyche ought haue ben v although deede comprehende thynge selfe yet haue fully enough expressed force efficacie thereof nature bare empty goodnesse also plentuous fruteful al euilles idle thei haue saide concupiscence haue vsed worde farre matter added graunted parte euer man euen vnderstanding wil soule fleshe corrupted stuffed full wyth concupiscence ende shortelyer whole man hym selfe nothing el concupiscence wherfore haue sayde al partes soule possessed sinne sithe adam fell awaye fountaine righteousnesse onely inferioure appetite allured wicked impietie possessed castle hys minde pride pearced innermoste parte hys hearte y fonde foolyshe thyng restraine corruption proceded thense onely sensuall motion call call certayne nouriture allureth styrreth draweth synne onely parte whyche amonge y called sensualitie wherein peter lombarde ha disclosed hys grosse ignoraunce whyche seekynge archynge place saythe fleshe paule witnesseth proprely deede bicause appeareth ye fleshe though paule meane onely parte soule whole nature whyche comparison set supernaturall grace paule taketh away doubte teachinge corruption resteth one parte alone nothinge pure cleane deadly infection thereof entreatynge corrupted nature doothe onely condemne inordinate motion appetite yt appeare specially trauayleth proue vnderstandynge mynde subiecte blyndenesse heart peruersnesse ye thyrde chapter romaine nothinge el description original synne appeareth plainely renewinge spyrite whyche compared wyth olde man fleshe dothe onely signifie grace wherby inferioure sensuall parte soule amended also conteyneth full reformation partes eph therefore paule dothe commaund onely oure grosse appetite brought naught also yt selues renewed spirite oure mynde lykewyse place hee biddeth v transfourmed newnesse minde rom whervpon foloweth parte wherin moste shineth excellence noblenesse ye soule onely wounded also corrupted needeth onely healed manner put newe nature howe farre synne possesseth bothe vnderstandinge mynde hearte wyll see hereafter onely purposed shortely touche whole man ye heade foote ouerwhelmed wyth ouerflowinge water parte hym l te synne rom therefore soeuer procedeth frome hym y accompted synne paule sayth affection fleshe thoughtes enmity againste god therefore deathe nowe lette gooe presume make god author theyr sinnes bicause say men naturally synful thei wrongfully seeke woorke god owne fylthynesse whyche ought rather haue sought nature adam whyle yet sounde vncorrupted therefore oure destruction commeth faulte oure fleshe god asmuche perished meane yt degendred fyrst esta e yet let man murmure say god might haue better foreseen oure saluation prouided yt adam shold haue fallen obiectio abhorred al godly mindes ye muche presumptuous curiositie also perteineth ye secret predestination whiche shal entreated place couenient wherefore let v remembre oure fall imputed corruption nature accuse god himselfe author nature true deede deadely wounde sticketh fast nature muche materiall knowe whether came nature ell ye beginning hathe rested euydent ye wounde geuen synne therfore cause shoulde complaine oure selues whiche thynge ye scripture hath dyligently noted eccl ecclesiastes saieth haue founde yt god hathe made manne righteous thei haue soughte many inuentions appeareth yt destructio man imputed onely selfe asmuche hauing gotten vpryghtnesse goodnesse god hys owne madnesse fallen vanitie saye therfore man corrupted faultienesse naturall suche proceded nature wee denye proceded nature make appeare rather qualytye come thynge whyche y happened man substantiall propretie hathe ben putte begynninge yet call yt naturall man shoulde thinke euery man getteth euell custome wheras holdeth men bounde inheritably descendinge righte oure owne head withoute authoritie eph ye cause apostle teacheth yt nature chyldren wrathe coulde god whome meanest woorkes please wrathefull againste noblest creature rather wrathefull againste corruption worke againste worke selfe therfore man nature corrupted manne vnfitly saide bee nature abhominable god shalbe also vnaptely called naturally peruerse corrupted augustine feareth respecte nature corrupted call synnes naturall whyche doe necessaryly reigne fleshe grace god absente vanysheth away foolyshe tryfelynge deuise maniches whiche imagined euellnesse hauinge substaunce man presumed forge hym newe creatour leaste shoulde seeme assigne ryghteous god cause begynnynge euell seconde chapter man newe spoyled freedome wyll made subiecte myserable bondage sythe haue seen ye dominion sinne sin ye tyme helde ye firste man bounde vnto doothe onely reigne mankinde also wholy possesseth euerye soule nowe muste nerely examine sin broughte bondage whether spoyled freedome yf yet remayne parcell howe farre force thereof procedeth ende trueth question maye easyly appeare vnto v wyll waye sette vp marke vnto whole summe maye bee dyrected thys shalbe best waye auoyde erroure daungers considered lyke fall boothe side man y putte vpryghtnesse thereby taketh occasion slouthfullnesse nd bicause saide hymselfe canne dooe nothinge studye righteousnesse fourth hee neglecteth yt wholly yt pertained nothinge vnto hym againe presume take nothing vpon hymselfe yt neuer little bothe god honore shall bee thereby taken frome hym man hymselfe bee ouerthrowen wyth rashe confydence therfore ende strike vpon rockes course y bee kepte man beynge enfourmed remaineth hym goodnesse beynge euerye syde compassed aboute wyth moste miserable necessitie may yet taught aspire goodnesse wherof voide libertie wherof depriued may sharpelye styrred vp slouthfullnesse fained furnished greatest power howe necessarye seconde poynte euery man seeth fyrste see doubted moe yt oughte bee beynge sette oute controuersye oughte plainely stande trueth yt nothing taken away man owne farre behoueth throwen downe false boastinge selfe graunted man glorye hymselfe euen time bountefulnesse god garnished moste singular ornamentes howe muche oughte nowe humbled sythe vnthankefulnes hee thruste downe fro hye glorye extreeme shame yt time say aduaunced hyghest degree honoure scripture attributeth nothynge ell vnto hym created image god whereby secretly teacheth man blessed owne good thinges partakynge god therefore remayneth nowe beyng naked destitute glorye acknoweledge god whose liberalitie coulde thankefull flowed full richesse grace nowe length wyth confession hys owne pouertie glorifie hym whome acknoleging good gyftes dyd gloryfye also muche oure profyte prayse wysedome strengthe taken v yt pertayneth glorye god thei ioyne oure ruine robberie god geue vnto v thynge whyche y true el done wee taught yght oure owne force wee bee lyfted vp hye staffe reede maye breake wee fall grounde albeit oure force yet muche comended thei compared ye staffe reede smoke yt vaine men haue imagined babble wherfore wtout cause excellence sentence ofte repeted augustine yt free wil rather throwe hedlonge stablished yt defend thought nedeful speake waie preface many mennes sake whan thei heare man power ouerthrowen fro ye grounde yt power god may builded man muche hate manner disputing dangerous much superfluus whiche yet appeareth bothe religion necessarie v moste profitable whereas haue lyttle sayde vnderstandynge mynde heart placed power soule nowe lette v consyder bothe able dooe phylosophers deede great consente imagin yt vnderstanding mynde sitteth reason whiche like lampe geueth lighte al counsells like queene gouerneth saye endued wyth diuine lighte canne geue good counsell excelleth liuely force able well gouerne syde sense dulle bleare yed alway creepeth grounde walloweth grosse obiectes neuer lyfteth vp selfe true insyght appetite canne abide obey reason yelde selfe sense subdued carried studye vertues holdeth ryght waye transfourmed wyll yf yt geue selfe subiect bondage sense corrupted peruerted degendreth luste wheras opinion dooe sitte soule power haue spoken vnderstandinge sense appetite wyll whiche woorde nowe commonly vsed thei say vnderstandinge endued wt reason best gouernesse towarde good blessed lyfe doe holde selfe within owne excellence shew forth force yt naturally geuen inferioure motion whiche called sense wherewith man drawen erroure deceite thei say bee suche may tamed rodde reason little little bee vanquished place wyll myddest betwene reason sense thinge owne orderinge hauinge libertie whether liste obey reason geue foorthe selfe bee rauyshed sense sometime deede denye beynge ouercome verye experience hardely man stablisheth reason reigne queene wythin hymselfe sometyme tickeled inticementes pleasure sometime deceiued false semblance good thynges sometime importunatelye striken immoderate affection vyolently haled oute waye de legbili tusc que lib rope stringes synowes plato saieth whiche reason cicero saith yt sparkes geuen nature peruerse opinion euell manner quenched suche disease haue one gotten place ye mindes men thei graunt yt outragiously ouerflowe easily may restrayned sticke compare wylde horse whyche throwinge away reason castynge charyote dryuer dooe range vnrulyly wythout measure thys make question arist th lib cap vertues vice oure owne power saie thei oure choise y also oure choyse dooe nowe bee oure choyse dooe y yt also dooe free choyse seeme thinges yt doo forbeare thinges forbeare therefor good thing liste may likewise leaue vndone euell may also eschewe ye yea haue burste forthe great licentiousnes haue bosted yt dede yt god gifte yt liue seneca oure owne liue wel holily thense commeth saying cicero person cotta de nat de lib bycause euery man selfe getteth vertue hymselfe therefore neuer wyse men dyd thanke god sayth hee vertue praised vertue wee glorye whyche shoulde bee yf yt gyfte god oure selues lyttle thys y iudgemente menne fortune asked god wysedome bee taken himselfe therfore sume opinion al philosopher reason man vnderstandinge suffycyente ryghte gouernaunce wyll beynge subiecte yt y deede moued sense euell thynges euen hathe free election canne stopped folowe reason guide al thinges among ecclesiasticall wryters al ther haue ben none dyd acknowledge bothe soundenesse reason manne hathe sore wounded synne hys wyll excedingly entangled peruerse desyres yet many haue muche assented philosopher whiche auncient thinke much aduaunce ye strength man vpon consideration lest thei sholde haue expressly confessed weakenesse firste thei sholde haue made ye philosopher whome thei contended laugh least thei shoulde geue fleshe whiche yt selfe dull goodnesse newe occasion slouthfullnesse therefore bycause woulde teache thinge absurditie common iudgemente men theyr study make ye doctrine scripture halfe agree teachinges philosopher thei principally regarded seconde pointe make place slouthfullnesse appereth owne woordes hom de proditione iudae chrysostome hathe one place bicause god hathe putte bothe good euell thinges oure owne power hee hathe geuen v freedome election wythholdeth vnwilling chrys gen hom embraceth willing againe oftentymes euell yf hee wyll tourned good y good slouthfullnesse falleth becommeth euell bycause god made oure nature haue free wyll hom hee layeth necessytye vpon v geuynge conuenient remedy suffreth lye mynde paciente againe vnlesse wee bee holpen grace god wee canne neuer dooe thynge well vnlesse wee brynge whiche oure owne canne obtaine fauoure god saide shold god helpe wee muste also brynge somewhat thys y commonly famylyar woorde lette v brynge whiche oures god wil supplie reste dialog contra elagium wherwith agreeth whiche hieremye saith oure part beginne god make ende oure part offer wee canne hys fullfyll canne yow see nowe sayinges gaue man towarde studye vertue meete bycause thought coulde otherwise awake dulnesse naturally v yf dyd proue onely synned apt handeling thei haue done wee shall see surely sayinges whyche wee haue rehersed mooste false shall appeare nowe althoughe grecian amonge principally chrysostome haue passed measure aduancinge ye power man yet ye olde writer except augustine point eyther varie wauer speake doubtefully manner certaintie canne bee gathered theyr writynges therefore tarrye vpon exacte reckenynge euerye one theyr sayinges heare wee wyll touche oute euerye one muche playne declaration matter shall seeme require folowed whyle euery one hymselfe soughte prayse wyttte defending man nature fel continually little litle one worse worse till came farre man commonly thoughte bee corrupted onely hys sensuall parte haue reason altogether wil parte vncorrupted meane time thys flewe aboute men mouthes naturall giftes corrupted man supernaturall taken awaye meanynge tended scarsely hundredth man euen slightly vnderstad parte woulde plainely shewe sorte corruption nature could easely contented wordes muche materiall hedefully weyed manne beyng partes nature corrupted spoyled supernaturall gyftes able dooe therefore whyche boasted selues bee disciple christe spake thys matter muche like phylosophers name freewill still remayned amonge larines manne hadde styll abiden vncorrupted state grecian ashamed vse worde muche arrogantly called autexousion say owne power man power selfe bycause therfore euen commune people hadde receiued principle man endued wyth free wyll manye woulde seeme excellente tell howe farre extendeth fyrste lette v searche force woorde self lette v procede simplicitie scripture shewe man able owne nature towarde good euell free wyll woorde commonly founde men wrytynges yet fewe haue defined yet semeth origen rehersed thynge agreed lib nonlatin alphabet sayde power reason discer e good euell power choose eyther augustine varyeth hym teacheth yt power reason wyll whereby good chosen grace assisteth euell grace cesseth bernarde hee meaneth speake suttlely speaketh darkely whyche sayeth consent reason libertie wyll canne loste iudgemente reason auoyded definition anselmus familiar enoughe whiche sayth powere kepe vprightenesse selfe lib therefore peter lombarde schoolemen haue rather embraced augustine defynytyon cause yt bothe playner dyd exclude grace god withoute whyche sawe wyll sufficient yt selfe brynge also theyr owne suche thynges thought eyther better serue playner declaration fyrste agree name arbitrium free choyse rather bee referred reason whose parte discerne betwene good euell thynges adiectiue free pertayneth properly wyll p rt ar whyche may tourned eyther wherefore sythe freedome proprely belongeth wyll thomas sayeth would well agree yf free called power chosyng whyche beinge mixt vnderstanding appetite dothe incline appetite nowe haue thinges reache power free wyll consysteth saye reason wyll nowe remaineth shortly see howe muche geue either parte commonly wonte make subiecte free determination man thynges meane whyche belonge kingedome god referre true ryghteousnesse speciall grace god spiritual regeneration whiche thinge ye author booke callynge gentyles meaneth shewe amb lib cap hee reckeneth vp three sortes wylles fyrste sensitiue seconde naturall ye thyrde spyrytuall whiche saith man hath fyrste twoo hys owne lybertye laste woorke holly ghoste man whyche whether true shall entreated place fytte nowe purpose shortely reherse opynyons confute hereby commeth passe wryters speake free wil thei pryncipally seke yt able doe ciuile outewarde doinges obedience ye lawe god whiche latter poynt thinke pryncipall yet thynke bee neglected whyche meanynge truste shall shewe good reason hathe distinction receyued schooles reckeneth vp three sortes freedomes fyrste necessytye seconde synne thyrde mysery whiche fyrste naturally stycketh faste man yt meane taken awaye twoo loste synne thys dystinction wyllingly receyue sauynge necessytye wrongefully confounded compulsion betwene whyche twoo howe muche dyfference y howe necessary dyfference considered shal appeare place receyued shall controuersie man hathe free good workes vnlesse holpen grace speciall grace whiche geuen onely electe regeneracio passe vpon phrenetike men whiche babble yt grace offered generally without difference yet made plaine whether altogither depriued power well whether haue yet power althoughe litle weake whyche selfe dede nothynge helpe grace dothe also part lib dist master ye sentence goeth make playne sayth two sortes grace necessary v whereby may made mete good worke one thei call working grace wherby effectually wil good together workinge grace whiche foloweth good helpinge whiche diuision mislike yt geueth ye grace god effectuall desyre good secretly sheweth meaninge yt man alredy owne nature certaine maner desireth good though vneffectually bernarde affirminge good dede worke god yet graunteth man yt motion hee desireth yt good wil farre fro ye meaning augustine fro whome yet lombard wold seeme haue borowed divisio seconde part ye divisio doubtfulnes speache offendeth whiche hathe bredde wronge exposition thought therefore worke togither seconde grace fo god bicause lieth power either make voide first grace refusing amb lib cap confirme obedientlye folowinge whereas author boke calling gentile dothe thus expresse free vse iudgement reason depart fro grace may worthy rewarde haue departed thing whiche coulde done workynge togither holly ghoste may imputed merites whose wyll possible haue ben done two thing note waye nowe reader thou maist see muche dissent soundest forte ye scholeme much farther differ later sophisters euen muche farther gone auncient tyme yet somwhat suche sorte perceaue diuision manner thei haue geuen free wil man length lombard sayth lib dist haue free therfore bycause alyke able eyther thynke good euell onely free compulsion whiche freedome hindered althoughe peruerse bondemen sinne doe nothinge sinne therfore man shalbe saide haue free sorte bycause hath free choise well good euell dothe euell wyll compulsion well saide purpose yt garnyshe smale matter wyth proude title goodly libertie forsooth man compelled serue sinne yet wyllynge seruaunte hys wyll holden fast bounde setter sinne truely abhorre striuinge woordes wherewith churche vainely wearied thinke suche wordes greate religious carefulnes taken hede whiche sounde absurditie specially wher errour hurtefull praye whyche heare free wil assigned man conceaue lorde bothe owne mynde wyll able hym selfe turne hym selfe whether parte one wyll saye perill shalbe taken awaye people dylygentlye warned meaninge rather forasmuche witte man naturally bent falsitie soner conceiue errour one little worde truth longe tale whiche thing haue certaine experience worde wished omittinge exposition olde wryters thei manner came thei sticke vpon naturall signification woorde haue ben carried truste selues bringeth distruction authoritie father move v haue dede continually worde mouth thei withal declare muche thei esteme vse lib contr ul hom ioan ad ast cap fyrst augustine whiche sticketh call bonde wyll one place angry yt denye free wil declareth chiefe reaso saith onely let man bolde denye freedome wyll go aboute excuse sinne surely place confesseth wyll manne free wythoute holye ghooste muche yt subiecte lustes doe bynde conquere yt de perfect st agayne wyll ouercome wyth synne whereinto fell nature begane wante freedome enchir ad au ca bonif lib ca ibid ca agayne man hauynge yll vsed hys free wyll loste bothe hymselfe yt agayne free wyll become captiue nothinge towarde ryghteousnesse againe canne free whyche grace god hathe made free againe ad b n lib ca iustice god fullfylled lawe commaundeth man dothe hys owne strength holy ghoste helpeth man free made free god obeyeth thynges shortely rendreth cause place writeth man receiued greate force free created ad bonis lib ca loste sinninge therfore place shewed free stablished grace sharply inueieth take vpon without grace de uerbis aposi ser therfore sayth dare wretched men either proude freewil made free de spiritu litera cap owne strength yf allready made free marke name freewyll mention freedomeij cor iijviij spirite lorde freedome bondemen sinne thei boste free wyll whome manne ouercome hym hee y made bonde yf bee made free boaste theyr owne woorke free wyll bee bondseruauntes whyche sayethiohn xvv wythoute ye canne nothynge besyde also place hee seemeth sportyngly mocke vse woorde hee sayde de correp gra ca wyll deede free butte made free free righteousnesse bondeseruaunt synne whyche sayinge place hee repeteth expoundeth manne y free ryghteousnesse choyse synne hee y free grace sauyoure hee doothe testifie freedome manne y nothynge ell freemakinge manumission righteousnesse seemeth trymely mocke vayne name thereof therefore yf manne wyll permytte vse thys woorde wyth euell signification hee shall bee troubled mee doynge bycause thynke yt canne bee kepte wythoute greate peryll mulde turne greate benefite churche yf yt abolyshed neyther wyll selfe vse yt woulde wyshe yf aske mee counsell forbeare yt maye seeme haue broughte greate preiudice agaynste selfe whiche haue confessed al ecclesiasticall writer excepte augustine haue spoken doubtefully diversly matter certaintie oute writinges construe thys mente therefore thruste geuinge voice herein bicause thei againste mente ende ye simply good faythe wolde haue godly wittes prouided whiche thei weite vpon men opinion thys poynte shall alwaie wauer vncertaine sorte thei sometime teache man beinge spoiled strengthe freewyll flee grace onli somtime thei furnish seme furnish wt owne armure harde make appeare suche doubtefullnesse speache nothynge verye lyttle esteemyng man strength haue geuen prayse good thynges holy ghoste yf heare recyte certayne sentence theyrs whereby playnely taughte de predestinatione sanctorum lib augu gen meaneth sayinge cypryane whyche augustine ofte repeteth wee oughte glorye nothynge bycause haue nothynge oure owne man wholy despoyled hym selfe maye learne hange vpon god meaneth sayinge augustine eucherius thei expound chryste tree lyfe whome hee reacheth hande shall lyue tree knowledge good euell free choyse wyll whereof tasteth forsakynge grace god shall dye hom aduen meaneth chrysostome euerye man y naturally onely synner also alltogether synne wee haue good thynge oure owne yf manne toppe tooe bee altogether synne yf yt bee lawefull attempte howe muche power free wyll able dooe howe maye yt bee lawefull parte prayse good woorke betweene god man coulde reherse thys sorte verye manye sayinges oute leaste manne shoulde cauill choose oute thynges onelye make purpose dooe craftelye leaue oute suche thynges make agaynste mee therefore dooe forbeare suche rehersall yet thys dare affyrme howe euer bee sometyme busye auauncynge freewyll thys yet theyr purposed marke teache manne beeynge alltogether tourned awaye truste hys owne power haue hys strengthe reposed god alone nowe come symple settynge fourthe trueth consyderynge nature manne constrayned repete whyche begynnynge thys chapter speake waye preface anye manne mooste dyscouraged throwne downe wyth conscience hys owne myserye needynesse nakednesse shame hathe hee beste profyted knowledge hymselfe y nooe daunger bee feared leaste manne wyll take muche hymselfe hee learne hee wanteth bee recouered god hym selfe hee canne take nothynge hys owne ryghte bee neuer little shall destroie selfe vaine confidence conueynge honoure god hym selfe become gyltye haynous sacrylege truely ofte thys luste inuadeth owre mynde wee desyre haue oure owne whyche maye reste oure selues rather god lette v knowe thys thoughte y mynystred v nooe couseller butte persuaded oure fyrste parentes haue wyll bee lyke vnto god knowynge boothe goode euell bee woorde deuell rayseth vp manne hym selfe lette v geue place vnto yt vnlesse wee lyfte take counsell oure enemye y pleasaunte deede manne haue muche strength hys owne hee maye reste hym selfe butte wee bee allured thys vaine affiaunce lette many sore sentence make v afrayde whyche wee bee throwen downe iere cursed y hee whyche trusteth manne setteth fleshe bee hys arme agayne god hathe pleasure strengthe horseps lv x neyther delyteth legges manne delyteth feare hym attende vpon mercyeesay xlxxix agayne yt y hee whyche geueth strengthe vnto hym fayneteth vnto hym hathe strengthe hee encreaseth power euen yonge menne shall faynte bee wearye yonge menne shall stumble fall butte weyte vpon lorde shall renewe theyr strengthe whyche sayinges tende thys ende wee leane vpon opynyon oure owne strengthe bee yt neuer lyttle yf wee meane haue god fauourable vnto vsiac iiijvi whyche resysteth proude geueth grace ye humble agayne lette promyses come oure remembrance wyll poure oute water vpon thyrstyeesa xliiijiiii floudes vpon drye grounde agayne yee thyrste come vnto water whyche promyses dooe testyfyeesa vi none admytted receyue blessynges god pyne awaye wyth feelynge theyr owne pouertye suche promyses bee passed ouer y esayeesa thou shalte haue sonne shyne daye neyther shall bryghtenesse moone shyne vnto thee lorde shall bee thyne euerlastynge lyghte god thy glorye lorde deede doothe take awaye shynynge sonne moone hys seruauntes bycause hymselfe alone appeare gloryous hee calleth theyr confydence farre awaye euen thynges compted opinion moste excellente truely sayinge chrysostome hathe allwaye excedyngelye well pleased mee foundation oure wysedome humylytye yet sayinge augustyne sayeth hee rhethoritian beeynge asked hom de perf euangel epist del diosc fyrste thynge rule eloquence answered pronunciation seconde hee aunswered pronunciation thyrde aunswered pronunciation yf one aske rule christian relygyon fyrste seconde thyrde tyme alwayes woulde aunswere humylytye hee meaneth humilytye manne knowinge lyttle vertue bee hymselfe absteyneth pride hautynesse mynde butte truely feeleth hym selfe bee suche one hathe refuge butte humylytye ioan hom place hee declareth let manne sayeth hee flatter hym selfe hys owne y deuell thynge whereby hee y blessed hee hathe god onelye haste thou thyne owne butte synne take awaye thee synne whyche y thyne owne li de nat gratia cap psal ryghteousnesse y god agayne y possybylytye nature presumed yt y wounded mayned troubled loste yt needeth true confession false defense agayne euerye manne knoweth hymselfe hee y nothynge hymselfe hee hathe helpe hys weapon hym selfe broken warres ceassed yt y needefull weapon wyckednesse bee brooken sunder shyuered peeces burnte thou remaine vnarmed haue helpe thy selfe muche weake thou arte thy selfe muche lorde receiueth thee vpon thre score tene psalme hee forbyddeth v remembre oure owne ryghteousnesse wee maye acknowledge ryghteousnesse god hee sheweth god dooeth commende hys grace vnto v wee maye knowe oure selues nothynge wee stande onely mercye god oure selues wee nothynge euell let v therefore stryue god oure righte wythdrawen oure saluation geuen oure humblenesse y hys hienesse confession oure humblenesse hathe hys mercye readye remedye neyther yet doe requyre man e conuinced shoulde wyllyngely yelde hymselfe yf haue power shoulde tourne hys mynde yt bee subdued vnto true humylytye layinge awaye disease selfeloue desyre victorye wherewyth beynge blinded hee thinketh highely himselfe hee shoulde well consider hymselfe true lookynge glasse scrypture common sayinge whyche thei haue borrowed oute augustine pleaseth mee well naturall gyftes corrupted manne synne supernaturall hee made emptye thys latter parte supernaturall gyftes vnderstande wel lyghte faythe ryghteousnesse whyche suffycyente attaynyge heauenly lyfe eternall felycytye therefore banyshynge hym selfe kyngedome god hee also depriued spyrytuall gyftes wherewyth hee hadde furnyshed hope eternall saluation wherevpon foloweth hee y banished kyngedome god thynges belonge blessed lyfe soule extinguished hym vntyll grace regeneration hee recouer sorte fayth loue god charytye towarde oure neyghboures studye holynesse ryghteousnesse thynges bycause christe restoreth vnto v compted thinges comming v besid nature therefore wee gather one taken awaye agayne soundenesse vnderstandinge mynde vpryghtenesse hear e taken awaye together thys y corruption naturall gyftes thoughe remayne somewhat lefte vnderstandynge iudgemente together wyth wyll yet canne wee saye oure vnderstandynge y sounde perfecte whyche boothe feeble drowned many darkenesses oure wyll peruersenesse therof y suffic ently knowen syth therefore reason whereby man discerneth betwene good euell whereby hee vnderstandeth iudgeth naturall gyste yt coulde altogether destroied partly weakened partly corrupted foule ruynes thereof appeare sense doothe iohn sayeihon iv lyghte shyneth yet darkenesse darkenesse comprehended yt whyche woordes boothe thynges playnely expressed peruerted degendred nature manne shyne yet sparkes shewe hee y creature hauinge reason hee differeth brute beastes bicause endued vnderstanding yet yt light choked wyth greate thyckenes ignoraunce yt canne effectuallye gette abroade dyll bycause yt y vnseparable nature man peryshed bounde peruerse desyres yt couet good thynge thys deede y full definition yet suche needeth made playne wyth wordes therefore ordre oure talke maye procede accordynge fyrste distinction wherein wee diuided soule manne vnderstandyng wyll let v fyrste examyne force vnderstandynge condemne perpetuall blyndenesse man leaue vnto manner skyll kynde thynges y onely agaynste worde god also agaynste experience common reason wee see planted manne certayne desire searche trueth whyche hee woulde aspyre hauinge felte sauoure thereof thys therefore y syghte man vnderstanding y naturally drawen loue trueth neglectyng whereof brute beastes proueth grosse sense wythout reason yt thys lyttle desyre suche yt faynteth yt entre begynnynge race bycause falleth vanitie wytte manne canne dullnesse keepe ryghte way searche oute trueth straieth diuerse erroures groopynge darkenesse oftentimes stombleth tyll length yt wander vanysheth awaye seekynge trueth yt doothe bewraye howe vnfytte yt y seeke fynde trueth yt y sore troubled wyth vanytye oftentymes yt dyscerneth thynges true knoweledge whereof yt expedyente bende yt selfe therefore yt tormenteth yt selfe wyth fonde curyosytye searchynge oute thinges superfluous nothing worth thynges moste necessarye bee knowen eyther taketh noe heede neglygentlye seldome tourneth surelye scarse tyme applyeth studye earnestlye vnto whyche peruersnesse whereas prophane wryters dooe commonly complayne yt y founde menne haue entangled selues wherfore salomon hys ecclesiastes hee hadde gone throughe studyes whyche men thynke selues bee wyse yet pronounceth vaine tryfelynge yet trauales witte alwaye become voyde yt attayneth somewhat specyally yt bendeth yt selfe inferioure thinges yea blockyshe yt tasteth also lyttle hier thinges soeuer negligently applye searchynge yet wyth lyke power conceauynge yt y carryed vp aboue compasse thys present lyfe pryncipally conuinced owne weakenesse wherefore wee maye better see howe farre according degree abylytye yt procedeth euerye thynge yt y goode putte fourthe dystynction lette thys therefore bee distinction one vnderstandynge earthely thynges heauenly thynges earthly thynges call doe concerne god kyngedome true ryghteousnesse blessednesse eternall lyfe haue theyr respecte relation thys presente lyfe yt contayneth wythin boundes thereof heauenly thinges cal pure knowledge god ordre true righteousnesse misteries heauenly kyngdome fyrste sorte policy gouernaunce householde handy craftes liberall scienses seconde sorte knowledge god god rule frame oure lyfe accordynge yt concernynge fyrst muste confesse bicause man creature nature geuen lyue company together also naturall instinction bente cheryshe preserue feloweshyppe company therfore see myndes men vniuersall impression certaine ciuill honestie ordre hereby yt commeth passe founde noman vnderstandeth company men oughte bee keepte ordre lawes conceyueth hys minde prynciples lawes hereof commeth perpetuall consente well nation menne vnto lawes bycause seedes thereof naturally planted menne wythoute teacher lawemaker weye disscusions fyghtynges afterwarde arise whyle desyre peruerte lawe ryghte loose absolute gouernementes kynges luste strayeth abroade steede ryghte eues robber whiche y faulte common thynke bee vniuste whyche haue stablyshed iuste syde styffely saye laudable whiche haue forbydden menne therefore hate lawes bycause dooe knowe lawes good holly ragynge wyth heddye luste doe fyghte agaynste manyfeste reason theyr fansi dooe abhorre whych vnderstandyng minde thei allowe latter sorte stryuyng suche yt taketh awaye fyrste conceiuing equitie menne dooe stryue amonge selues concerninge poyntes lawes agree together certaine summe equitie wherein proued weakenesse mann witte euen seemeth folowe righte waye yet halteth staggereth styll thys remayneth true sowen menne certayne seede polytyke ordre y large proofe orderynge thys lyfe manne y voyde lyghte reason nowe folowe artes boothe liberall handy craftes learnynge whereof bycause y v certaine aptnesse also doothe appeare force mann wytte bee yt menne bee apte learne yet y token certayne enoughe common naturall power y almooste manne founde whose conceyte wytte doothe arte shewe fourthe selfe neyther haue onely power facylytye learne also deuyse euerye arte newe thinge eyther amplifie make perfecter whyche hathe learned wente whyche thyng yt moued plato erroniouslye teache suche conceauyng y nothyng ell calling remembrauce good reason oughte compell v confesse beginnyng thereof naturally planted witte man poyntes therefore done plainely testyfye y geuen men naturally
