vniuersall conceyuynge reason vnderstandynge yet y yt vniuersall benyfyte therein euery manne oughte himselfe acknoweledge peculiar grace god whyche thankefullnesse creatore hym selfe doothe suffycyently awake v hee createth naturall fooles whome hee maketh v see wyth gyftes man soule excelleth yf bee endued wyth hys lyghte whyche y naturall men yt y yet altogether free gyfte hys lyberalytye towarde euerye man inuention ordrely teachynge artes inwarde excellente knoweledge whyche propre fewe perfecte argumente common conceyuynge wytte yet bycause wythoute dyfference happeneth godlye vngodlye yt y ryghtefully reckened amonge naturall gyftes oft therefore lyghte vpon profane wryters lette v putte mynde maruaylous lyghte trueth shyneth wytte manne howe muche soeuer yt bee peruerted fallen fyrste integrytye y yet styll clothed garnyshed wyth excellente gyftes god wee consyder spyryte god y onely fountayne trueth wee wyll neyther refuse despise trueth yt selfe wheresoeuer yt shall appeare excepte wee wyl dishonourably vse spyryte god gyftes holy ghoste canne bee sette lyghte without contempte reproche hymselfe shall wee denye trueth shyned oulde laweyers whyche haue sette fourth ciuile ordre dyscyplyne wyth greate equytye shall wee saye phylosophers blynde boothe exquysyte contemplation cunnynge descryption nature shall wee saye thei wytte whiche settinge ordre arte speache haue taught v speake wyth reason shal saye madde whithe settynge fourthe physycke haue employed theyr dilygence v mathematicall scienses shall wee thynke dotynge erroures madde menne rather wee canne readde wrytynges oulde menne concernyng thynges wythoute greate admiration theyr wytte shall wee thynke thynge praysewoorthy excellente whyche wee doe reknoweledge come god let v bee ashamed greate vnthankefulnesse whyche heathen poetes fell whyche confessed boothe phylosophye lawes good artes inuentions mod sythe yt appeareth men whome scripture calleth naturall menne sharpe deepe sygthe searchynge oute inferioure thynges lette v learne suche exaumples howe manye good thynges lorde hathe lefte nature manne hathe spoyled true god meane tyme yte lette v forgette moste excellente good gyftes spyryte god whyche common benefyte mankinde hee dealeth abroade whome pleaseth behoued vnderstanding skill requyred framyng tabernacleexo xxxiij xxxvxxx shold poured beseleel oliab ye spirit god mer el ye knowledg thinges whiche moste excellent man life sayde communicated vnto v spirite god neither cause manne aske haue wicked doe god spirite altogether estranged god saide spirite god dwelleth faythfull onely vnderstanded spyrite sanctification whyche consecrate god felfe temple yet doeth neuerthelesse fyll moue quicken thynges wyth vertue spirit accordyng propertie euery kinde whyche hath geuen lawe creation haue ben lordes shoulde holpen trauaile seruice wicked naturall phylosophie dialectike mathematicall knoweledges lette v vse leaste yf neglecte giftes god willingly offred suffer iuste punishmet slouthfulnesse leaste shoulde thinke manne blessed vnder elementes world graunted vnto great abilitie conceiue truth also added power vnderstande vnderstandyng followeth thereof vanishyng transitorie thyng god stedefaste fundation trueth augustine teacheth truely haue sayd master sentence scholemen compelied assent vnto lib dist free giftes taken man fall naturall giftes remayned corrupted defiled themselues asmuch come god bicause cease pure defiled manne haue prayse lette bee summe seene mankynde reason whyche propre nature whyche maketh v differ brute beastes brute beastes doe differ sense thynges without lyfe borne certayne naturall fooles idiotes defaulte obscureth generall grace god rather sight put mynde lefte vnto selues ought iustely ascribed kindenesse god bicause spared v rebellion drawen wyth destruction whole nature whereas doe excelle sharpenesse conceiuyng doe passe iudgement haue quicker witte learne arte variete god setteth forth grace vnto v manne shoulde clayme selfe owne whyche floweth god mere liberalitie howe becometh one excellente common nature myght appere aboue speciall grace god whyche omittyng many sayeth openly bounde none byside god poureth singular motion according callyng euery manne whiche thyng meete many example bokes ye iudges wher sayde spyrite lorde ad whome called rule people finally euery noble arte speciall instruction whyche reason strong men followed saul whose heartes lord touched1 ministring kingedome propheeyed samuel sayde thus1 spirit lord shall come vpon thee thou shalt man continued whole course gouernemente spoken dauid spirite lorde came vpon daye forwarde spoken place touchinge particular motion yea homere men sayde excell witte onely iupiter hathe dealte euerye manne also tyme requyred truely experience teacheth whyle many tymes suche men stande amased moste sharpe deepewytted wittes men hand god rule euerye moment whyche reason yt sayde taketh witte wyse maye wander oute waye paragraph yet thys diuersitie wee see remaynynge markes image god whyche dooe make difference betwene mankynde creature declared man reason seeth commeth kyngedome god spirituall insight whyche consysteth chyefely three thynges knowe god hys fatherly fanoure towarde v wherein oure saluation standeth waye frame oure lyfe accordynge rule hys lawe bothe first two ye seconde proprely thei wytty blinder molle denye bee readde phylosophers concerninge god many thynges well aptely spoken yet suche dooe alwaye sauoure certayne gyddy ymagynation lorde gaue deede y aboue sayde lyttle taste godheade pretende ignoraunce coloure vngodlynesse many tymes moued speake many thynges confession wherof selues myght conuinced thei sawe thynges sawe suche seynge directed trueth muche lesse attaine vnto lyke wayfaringe man myddest feylde sodayne momente seeth faire wyde glysterynge lyghtninge night time wyth suche quickely vanishinge sight soner couered againe darkenesse night stirre foote farre canne brought way helpe besyde smale droppes truthe wherwyth chaunce sprincle bokes howe many howe monstruous lye defyled fynally thei neuer muche smelled assurednesse god good towarde v without whiche man witte muste nedes filled infinitie confusion therefore man reason neither approcheth goeth towarde one directeth syghte vnto thys trueth vnderstande whoe true god one towarde v bicause dronke false persuasion oure owne deepe insight hardely suffer oure selues persuaded matter god vtterly blynde dull thynke shall bee better confyrme yt testymonyes scripture reason thys dothe ihon well teache place whiche euen n w alleged ihon wryteth lyfe god beginnyng lyfe whyche shoulde lyghte men lighte shine darkenesse darkenesse coprehended sheweth deede man soule lightened brightnesse god light neuer altogether without small flame leaste sparcle yet suche light comprehendeth god bycause man quickenesse wit toward knowledge god mere darkenesse holy ghost calleth men darkenesse one spoyleth abilitie spirituall vnderstandyng therefore affirmeth faythful embrace christiohn ixiij borne bloud wil flesh man god saye fleshe capable hye wisedome conceiue god god vnlesse lightened spirite godmatth xvi xvij christ testified special reuelation father peter know perswaded whiche ought controuersie nature wanteth whyche heauenly father geueth electe spirite regeneration matter doubte vpon thus speaketh faythfull people prophetps xxxiiij x cor xii ihon iijxxvij thee fountayne lyfe thy light shal see light apostle testifieth thing whe saieth man call iesus lorde holy ghost iohn baptist seyng dulnesse disciple crieth man receiue thyng vnlesse geuen aboue meaneth gifte speciall illumination common gifte nature appereth hereby complaineth many wordes spoken tommende christ disciple preuayled nothyng see sayeth wordes nothyng informe men mindes concernyng diuine thynges vnlesse lorde geue vnderstanding spirite yea moses reprocheth people wyth forgetfulnesse yet noteth withal meanes growe wise misteries god benefite goddeut xxix ij thyne eye sayeth haue seene greate token wonder lorde hath geuen thee heart vnderstande eares heare eye see shoulde expresse yf called v blockes consideryng workes god whereupon lorde prophete promiseth greate graceie xxiiijvij wyll geue israelite hearte maye knowe hym signifiyng thereby man witte onely muche spiritually wyse lightened hym christe plainely confirmed wyth hys owne moutheihon vixxiiij sayeth manne come hym whome shalbe geuen father hym selfe liuely image father whome whole bryghtnesse glorie expressed vnto v therefore coulde better shewe power knowe god sayeth wee haue eye see image openly sette presente v came earth purpose declare father wyll vnto menne dyd faythfully dooe hys office yes surely yet nothynge wroughte hys preachynge vnlesse inwarde schoolemaster holyghost set open waye mindes therefore none come hym haue heard ben taught father maner waye learnyng hearyng euen holy ghost maruellous singular vertue formeth eares heare mindes vnderstande leaste seme raung allegeth prophecie elaye promiseth repairyng church whych shall gathered together saluationesa iiiixiii shal taught lord god foresheweth peculiar thyng concernyng electes euident speaketh kinde learnynge also common wicked vngodly remayneth therefore muste vnderstande thus way kingdome god open man holy ghost enlightening shal make newe minde paule speaketh playnely whiche purpose entryng discourse matter condemned men wisedome follie vanitie vtterly brought naught laste concludeth thus1 cor iiiiiii naturall man perceiue thynges spirit god foolishnesse vnto vnderstande bicause spiritually iudged whome doeth call naturall euen stayeth vpon light nature saye comprehedeth nothing spiritual misteries god bicause slouthfulnesse neglecteth nay rather although wold trauaile neuer much nothing bycause forsoth spiritually iudged meaneth bicause beyng vtterly hidden light man opened reuelation spirite reckened follie spirite god geueth light auaunced thinges god hath prepared loue aboue capacitie eye eares mindes yea testified man wisedome certaine veile whereby man minde kepte seyng god1 cor ixx meane apostle pronounceth wisedome world made folly god shal forsoth geue vnto sharpenesse vnderstanding whereby maye pearce secrete place heauenly kingdome farre beastelinesse v whiche taketh awaye menne place prayer geueth god alone god sayeth father gloryeph ixv geue spirite wisedome reuelation nowe thou hearest wisedome reuelation gifte god followeth lightene ye eye minde surely yf neede newe reuelation blinde themselues yt foloweth ye maye knowe hope calling c therefore confesseth wittes men capable great vnderstandyng knowe owne callyng let pelagian babble god doth remedie dulnesse vnskilfulnesse doctrine worde directeth ma vnderstanding whether without guide could haue atteined dauid lawe wherein comprehended al wisedome maye desired yet contented requireth haue eye opened maye consider misteries laweps cxixxviij whiche speache truely secretly sayeth sunne ryseth vpon earth worde god shineth men get muche thereby vntill himselfe therefore called father lightesiac ixvij geue open eye bicause euer shineth spirit al thing possessed darknesse apostle wel largely taught best schoolemaster yet needed spirite trueth instruct mindes doctrine hearde beforeiohn xi ij xxvi wold haue bidden loke thing aske god doe thereby confesse wante god promiseth v doth argue need let man nowe doubte confesse much able vnderstande misteries god enlightened grace geueth selfe vnderstanding much blinde doth acknoweledge owne blindenesse nowe remaineth thirde pointe knowyng rule well framynge life whiche doe rightly call knoweledge workes righteousnesse wherein man wit semeth bee somewhat sharpe sight two apostle testifiethro ijxiiii gentile whiche haue lawe doe workes lawe themselues stede lawe shewe lawe written heartes conscieces bearing witnesse thoughtes accusyng within themselues excusing iudgement god gentile haue righteousnesse naturally graue mindes surely say altogether blynde order life nothing co mon man lawe naturall whiche apostle speaketh place sufficiently instructed right rule life let v waye purpose knowledge lawe planted men shall appeare howe far bringeth toward marke reason truthe also euident wordes paul man marke placing sayde litle whiche sinned lawe iudged lawe haue sinned without lawe perishe without lawe might seme vnreasonable gentils perish without iudgement going addeth conscience steade lawe therfore sufficient iust damnation therfore ende lawe naturall man may made inexcusable shal defined il sorte knowledge conscience sufficiently discerneth betwene iust vniust take away men pretence ignoraunce proued gilty owne testimony tendernesse man toward selfe euyls alway turneth away mynde muche may feling sinne pretagora whiche reason semeth plato moued thynke sinne done ignorance dede fitly sayd men hypocrisie went farre hiding vice mynde might knowe itselfe gilty god sinner seking escheue iudgement emprinted drawen back vnto suffered winke compelled whether wil time open eies falsly sayd sinneth ignoraunce paraph lib de anima cap themistius sayth truly teacheth vnderstanding seldome deceiued blyndenesse goeth whe cometh speciall case euery man generally asked wil affirme manslaughter euell conspireth kil enemy deliberateth vpon good thyng adulterer generally condemne adulterie owne priuately flatter ignoraunce man comyng speciall case forgetteth rule lately agreed vpon generall question whiche thyng augustine discourseth finely exposition first verse lvij psalme albeit thyng continuall sometime shamefulnesse euell deede presseth conscience deceyuynge selfe vnder false resemblance good thing wittingly willingly runneth euell medaea apud ouidium whiche affectio came sayinges see thee better allowe followe worse wherefore thinke aristotele hath aptely made distinction betwene incontinence temperance ethic cap incontinence reigneth sayeth reason troubled affection passion knoweledge taken away minde marketh euell owne acte generally seeth like troubled affectio cooled repentaunce immediatly foloweth intemperaunce extinguished broken feeling sinne side obstinately standeth still conceyued choyse euell thou hearest iudgement vniuersally named difference good euell thinke euery sounde perfect iudgement ma heartes furnished choise iust vniust ende pretede ignorance nedefull see trueth euery thyng enough vnderstande farre canne escape awaye beyng conuict witnesse conscience euen already beginne tremble iudgement seate god wil trie reason lawe god whych exampler true righteousnesse shal finde howe many wayes blinde truely atteineth chiefe thing first table confidence god geuyng hym prayse strength righteousnesse callyng vpon name true kepyng sabbat soule euer naturall sense smell lawful worshippyng god consisteth like thinges prophane men worshippe god although called awaye hundred time theyr vaine trifle yet alwaye slyde backe thither agayne denie deede sacrifice dooe please god vnlesse adioyned purenesse minde wherby thei declare tonceyue somewhat spirituall worshippyng god whyche yet corrupte false inuentions neuer persuaded al true lawe perscribeth shall saye wit excelleth sharpe vnderstandynge whych neyther selfe wise harken teachyng commaundementes ye second table hath vnderstandyng much came nerer preseruation ciuile felowshyppe among menne albeit euen herein also founde many time faile euery excellet nature semeth moste vnresonable suffer vniuste imperious manner gouernyng ouer meane may put away iudgement ma reason none part seruile base courage suffer patiently againe part honest free borne heart shake reuenge iniuries rekened fault among philosopher lorde condempning muche noblenesse courage comaudeth kepe ye patience ill reported among men keping lawe vnderstandinge marketh desire mynde naturall manne suffereth self brought acknowledge disease desire lighte nature choked vp come firste entrie bottomlesse depth whe philosopher note immoderate motios minde fault meane motion appeare shewe forth themselues grosse toke make accompt euell desire gently tickle minde wherefore plato worthyly founde faulte withall imputed sinnes ignoraunce opinion reiected whiche teach purposed maliced frowardnesse vsed sinnes finde muche experience oft fall good intent reason ouerwhelmed wyth many sortes beyng deceyued subiecte many errours stombleth many stayes entangled many streightes farre sure directyng howe little estemed lord partes lifeij cor iijv paule sheweth sayeth sufficient thynke thyng selues selues speaketh affection taketh also awaye v shuld thinke come mindes thynge done well diligence insighte vnderstandyng heade corrupted canne deuise thinke vpon nothyng right lorde semeth hard v doe vnwillingly suffer selues bee spoyled sharpenesse reason whyche accompt moste precious gifte holy ghoste semeth moste full equitie whiche knoweth thoughtes wisemen vayne whyche pronounceth playnly inuention man heartps xciiijxi onely euell oure witte conceiued deuiseth vpon purposeth goeth alwaye euellgen viiij viijxxi howe canne come minde purpose whyche pleaseth god whome onely holynesse righteousnesse acceptable bee seene reason mynde whyche waye euer turne self miserably subiecte vanitie dauid knewe weakenesse hym selfeps xixxxciiij prayed haue vnderstandyng geuen hym learne lordes commaundementes righte hee sec e ly sayeth therein owne witte sufficeth hym whyche desireth haue newe geuen hym hee doeth onely one almoste ten tymes one psalme repeteth prayer whyche repetyng priuely declareth wyth howe greate neede dryuen praye whiche prayeth alonephil iiiij paule comonly vseth praye church cease sayeth praye youcol iix desire ye may filled wyth knowledge god wisedome spirituall vnderstandyng ye maye walke worthely god c ofte maketh thing good gift god let v remember doth withall testifie aug lib de peccat mer remiss cap lieth man power augustine farre acknoweleged defaut reson vnderstande thinges god thinketh grace illumination lesse necessarie mindes light sunne eye cotent addeth correction saying lifte vp eye see light eye minde lie shutte vnlesse lorde open scripture teacheth mindes enlightened one daye alone maye afterwarde see themselues euen alleged paule belongeth continuall procedinges encresinges doeth dauid expresly set wordesps cxix x whole heart haue sought thee make straye thy commaundementes ben regenerated sclenderly profited true godlinesse yet confesseth euery moment nedeth continuall direction leaste swarue knowledge wherewith enduedpsa ljxij therefore place prayeth haue right spirite renewed lost owne faulte bicause belongeth god restore vnto v thing beyng loste time whyche himselfe gaue beginnyng nowe examined wherein standeth chiefe libertie free choise hath ben already seene choyse doth rather belong vnderstandyng first thyng whiche philosopher haue taught receyued comon consent thynges naturall instinction desire whiche good maye seme belong vprightnesse man let v marke force free considered appetite rather procedeth inclination essence aduisement vnderstandyng minde euen schoolemen confesse freewill hath action reason turneth selfe obiectes whereby meane obiect appetite must suche maye subiecte choyse goe deliberation prepareth waye choise truely manne consider naturall desire good manne shall finde comon beastes also desire well shewe good appereth moueth sense followe man doeth neyther choyse reason maye followe diligence thing deede good according excellence immortall nature taketh reason counsell bendeth minde without reason without counsel like beast foloweth inclination nature therefore maketh nothynge freedome manne sense nature carried desire good requisite discerne good right reason hath knowen choose hath chosen followe leaste man shoulde doubte noted double sophisticall argument appetite called proper maner naturall inclination good called vertue iustice estate saye man wel good case finally although man neuer much desire attain good yet foloweth man whome eternall blessednesse pleasant yet none aspireth vnto mouing holy ghost wherfore sithe naturall desire men well maketh nothing proue fredome wyll metalles stone doth affection inclinyng perfection substace lette v consider thinges whether infected corrupted partes engendreth nothing euell whether kepeth still percell vnhurte whense doo growe good desire attribute first grace god wil effectually seme side saye secretly soule power selfe aspire good weake growe perfecte affection rayse vp endeuour doubte schoolemen haue commonly embraced opinion borowed origen certaine olde wryters muche wont consider man pure naturall thinges terme suche one apostle describeth hym wordesro vi xv doe good would euell would doe present vnto performe finde maner discourse paule followeth altogether wrongfully peruerted entreateth christian wrastling whiche shortly toucheth galatian whiche faithfull continually fele within seluesga vxvij battel flesh spirit spirit nature regeneration apostle doeth speake regenerate appeareth whe said dwelleth goodnesse addeth exposition meaneth fleshe therfore saith doeth euill sinne dwelleth meaneth correction flesh euen muche sayd thus god dwelleth selfe good founde fleshe hereupo foloweth maner excuse self euil sinne dwelleth whiche excuse belongeth regenerate whiche chiefe part soule tende vnto good nowe conclusion adioyned declareth matter euidently delited saith lawerom vijxxij according inward man see lawe membres fighting lawe minde hath suche stryuing selfe regenerate spirite god carieth leauinges flesh wt ad bonif lib cap et l retract therfore augustine wheras one thought ben spoken nature man reuoked expositio false ill agreyng together truelie allowe menne without grace haue motion good though thei smallii co iijv shall aunswere apostle whiche sayeth sufficient muche thinke thyng shall wee aunswere lorde pronounceth moses euery inuention man hearte euellgen viijxxi wherefore sithe haue stombled false takyng one place cause shuld staye vpon iudgement let rather sayeng christe preuayle doeth sinneioh viijxxxiiij seruaunt sinne sinner nature therefore holden vnder yoke sinne nowe yf whole manne subiect dominio sinne must needes selfe chiefe seate thereof bounde faste wyth moste streight bondesphi ijxii otherwise sayeng paule wold stande together god whyche worketh v goe grace holy ghost awaye therefore many haue triftingly spoken concernyng preparation although sometime faithfull doe praye haue heart formed obedience lawe dauid doth many place yet noted euen desire prayeng god whiche may gather wordesps lixij wisheth haue cleane heart created within surely taketh selfe beginnyng creation de uerbis apostoli serm therefore let rather sayeng augustine haue place v god preuent thee thinges sometime preuent thou wrath howe confesse thou haste thinges god euer good thou haste soeuer euell thy selfe little nothing oures sinne third chapter p corrupt nature man procedeth nothing damnable manne waye better knowen eyther parte soule yf come forth title wherewith scripture doth set bee paynted whole woordes christeioh iijvi whiche borne fleshe fleshe easy proue proued bee miserable creature affection flesherom viijvi apostle witnesseth death asmuche enimitie agaynste god subiecte subiecte lawe god fleshe peruerse al affection continually vseth enmitie agaynste god agree rightousnesse lawe god finally bryng forth nothing matter death nowe graunt nature manne nothy yge fleshe gather good yf thou canste saye name fleshe belongeth onely sensuall hyer par e soule sufficiently confuted woordes chryste apostle lordes argumente manne muste bee borne agayneioh iij xi bycause fleshe commaundeth bee borne agayne accordynge bodye mynde borne agayne yf parte bee amended renewed doth comparison sette bothe place confirme spirite compared agaynste fleshe lefte meane thynge betwene therefore whatsoeuer spirituall reason called fleshly haue nothynge spirite regeneration therefore fleshe whatsoeuer haue nature matter otherwise coulde haue doubte taken awaye v pauleeph iiijxiij described ould man saide corrupt concup scences erroure biddeth v renewed spirite oure minde see doth place vnlawefull euell lustes onely sensitiue part also minde therefore requyreth renuinge truly lyttle painted oute suche image man nature shewe part wherein corrupted peruerted whereas writeth al nation walke vanitie minde darkened vnderstading estraged life godeph iiijxvij reason ignoraunce blindenesse hearte doubt spoken lorde hathe reformed vprightnesse wisedome iustice whiche also made plaine comparison adioyned putteth faithfull minde thei haue learned christ wordes gather ye grace christ onely remedye whereby deliuered blindenesse euels ensue thereof esay also prophecied ye kingdome christesa lxij promised lorde euerlastynge lighte churche yet darkenesse couered earthe ste people whereas testifieth lyghte god shall arise onely churche truely without church leaueth nothing darkenesse blindenesse reherse perticularly suche thynges written euery specially psalmes prophetes againste vanitie manpsa lxijx greate thing dauide writeth weyed wyth vanitie shall vayner vanitie self witte wounded greuous weapon thoughtes come oute scorned foolyshe rifelynge madde peruerse easier condemnation heart called guilfull peruerse aboue thinge bicause studie shorte wil contente one place aloneier xvij suche one shall like bright loking glasse wherein may beholde whole image naturerom xiijx apostle hee goeth aboute throwe downe arrogance mankynde doth testimony one ryghteons manne one manne vnderstandeth se keth godpsal xiiijiiij gone oute waye made vnprofitable together none dothe good one throte open sepulcheresa iixxij wt tongue worke deceytfully poyson serpentes y vnder theyr lyppes whose mouthe y full cursing bytternesse whose feete swyfte shedde bloude whose wayes y sorrowe vnhappynesse whyche haue feare god theyre eye wyth thunderboltes hee inueyeth agaynste certayne menne butte agaynste whole nation sonnes adam neyther declyneth hee agaynste corrupte manner one twoo age butte accuseth contynuall corruptio nature purpose place simply chide men make amende teache rather menne oppressed wyth calamitie impossyble ouercome whyche cannot gette vp agayne vnlesse bee plucked mercie god bycause coulde bee proued vnlesse ben ouerthrowe destruction nature brought forth testimony whereby proued nature destroyed let therefore remayne agreed menne suche described faulte euell custome also corruptnesse nature otherwise apostle argument stande saluation manne mercie god bycause selfe vtterly loste paste hope wyll busie selfe prouynge applyeng testimony manne shoulde thinke vnfitly vsed wyll take yf ben firste spoken paule taken prophetes firste taketh awaye manne rightousnesse integritie purenesse vnderstandyng wante vnderstandynge proueth apostasie departyng god whome seeke firste degree wisedome wante muste nedes happen fallen awaye god sayeth gone waye become rotten none doeth good adioyneth haynous faultes wherewith defile member one let lose wickednesse laste testifieth voyde feare god whose rule steppe shoulde haue ben directed bee inheritable gyftes mankynde vayne seeke anye good thyng nature deede graunt faultes doe appeare euery manne yet bee denied hydra lurketh heartes menne bodye whyle already fostreth enclosed wythin cause matter disease although payne bee yet vehement canne bee called healthy canne soule bee reckened sounde whyle swarmeth full suche disease vice albeit similitude dothe agree pointes bodye neuer muche diseased remayneth quicknesse lyfe soule beyng drowned gulfe destruction trouble wyth vice also altogether voyde goodnesse question manner whiche hath ben assoyled nowe riseth vp agayne newe age haue ben whiche guidyng nature haue ben bente vertue al life regarde though many slippynges maye noted manner yet studie honestie haue shewed profe purenesse theyr nature rewarde suche vertues haue god although fully declare shall speake merites workes yet wee muste somewhat speake place farre necessarie makyng playne present argument example therefore seeme put v mynde wee shoulde thinke man nature together corrupt instruction haue excelled noble actes also ye whole course life haue behaued themselues honestly must thinke corruptio nature place grace god clease inwardely restraine lord wold suffer mindes menne loose reynes runne wildly sortes lustes without doubte would would playne experience make v beleue euels wherewith paule condemneth nature gom moste truely sayde hym canst thou exempt thy selfe number whole feete swift shed bloud handes defiled robbery manslaughter throtes like vnto open sepulchre tungues deceitfull lippes venymous workes vnprofitable wicked rotte deadly whole minde without god whose inwardes peruersenesse whose eye bent entrappinges heartes lift vp dispiteousely triumph ouer partes applied infinite mischeues euery soule subiecte suche monster apostle boldly pronounceth truely see would come passe lorde would suffer luste manne wander owne inclination mad beaste hedlong caried awaye streame neuer swifte strong whereof ouerflowyng violent lorde healeth disease electe meane wee set forth restraineth putting bridle mouth breake farre foreseeth bee expedient preseruynge vniuersitie thinges hereby holden shame feare lawes burste forth many sortes filthinesse howebeit great part hide vncleannesse bycause thinke honest trade life good doe certayne sorte aspire towarde rise vp aboue common sorte maiestie maye kepe duetie god prouidence bridleth peruersenesse nature breake forth doyng cleanseth within yet doubte dissolved eyther muste make camillus like vnto catiline el camillus shall haue example nature yf bee framed diligence altogether without goodnesse graunte deede goodly giftes whyche camillus bothe giftes god seeme worthy bee commended weyed themselues shall bee proues naturall goodnesse hym muste returne minde frame argumente sorte naturall manne exelled suche vprightenesse manner nature vndoubtedly without power towarde studie vertue aug lib c ra um minde peruerse croked folowyng thyng rather vpright straightnesse doubt yf graunt naturall manne power man nature goodnesse reherse vnto behalfe yf greatest shewe purenesse bee founde alwaye carried corruption therefore leaste ye commende manne vertue whose vice deceyue vnder vertues image dooe gene vnto manne power desire goodnesse longe remayneth taste owne peruersenesse albeit moste sure easy solution question common gyftes nature special grace god whiche diuersly certaine measure dealeth among men otherwise vngodly whiche reason feare common speache call one man well natured euell nature yet wee cease include bothe vnder vniuersall state man corruption shewe speciall grace god hath bestowed vpon one whiche hath vouchsaued geue ye whe pleasure make saule kinge formed new man reason plato alludinge fable homere sayth kinges sonnes created notable singular mark bicause god prouidinge mankinde furnisheth principle nature whome appoynteth beare gouernement store house came greate captaines renomed history also thoughte priuate men bicause euery man hathe moste excelled ambition hath mooste moued forwarde wyth wh che spotte vertues defiled thei lose fauoure god accompted nothingeworth soeuer semeth praiseworthy vngodly men besyde chefe part vprightnesse faileth studye aduaunce glorye god whiche thei wante whome hathe regenerate spirite neither y yt vainely spoken esaieesa xii vpon christe resteth spirite feare god whereby taught many strange fro christ without eare god whiche beginning wisedome vertues deceiue v vaine shewe graunte shall haue praise courte policie common fame men heauenly iudgemente seate shall bee valewe deserue ryghteousenesse suche bondage synne therefore wyll deteyned one moue selfe goodnesse muche lesse applye selfe suche mouing ye beginninge tournynge god whiche scripture wholy imputed grace godier xxxixviij ieremie prayeth lorde tourne hym yf hee wyll haue hym tourned wherevpon prophete chapter deserybynge spirituall redemption faythefull people sayeth redeemed oute hande stronger meanynge wyth howe streyghte fetter sinner bound longe beynge forsaken lorde hee lyueth vnder yooke deuell yet wyll styll remayneth whyche wyth mooste bente affection y bothe inclyned hasteth synne manne depryued wyll hee dyd caste hym selfe thys necessytye soundenesse wyll bernarde saythe vnaptelye whyche teacheth wyll y v wyll good y profytynge wyll yll y defaute therefore symplye wyll y woorke manne wyll euell corrupte nature wyll well grace nowe whereas saye wyll putte libertie y necessytye drawen ledde euell yt y marueyll yf shoulde seeme harde speache vnto manne whiche neither hathe absurditie yt varieth vse holy menne offendeth canne make dyfference betweene necessytye compulsyon yt manne aske y god necessytye good y deuell necessytye euell canne aunswere goodnesse knitte god diuinitie necessarie god good deuell hys fall estranged partaking goodnesse nothinge euell robber god barke say god deserueth smale prayse goodnesse whyche compelled keepe shall ready aunswer commeth passe infinite gooddesse violent impulsion euell therefore necessitie god well hinder free god well deuell whyche euell yet willingly sinneth shall saye manne doothe therefore lesse wyllyngely synne thys hee y subiecte necessitie sinning thys necessitie whereas augustine e che speaketh lib de persect euen also enuiously pressed cauilation celestius sticked affirme woordes vp libertie came passe manne wyth synne nowe corruption whyche stowed punyshemente hathe libertie made necessitie ofte falleth mention therof bo bteth speake thys manner necessarye bondage synne de nat grat alibi therefore let thys summe distinction kepte manne syns hee y corrupted synneth deede wyllyngely agaynste compelled moste bente affection minde vyolente compulsion motion hys owne luste forren constraynte yet suche peruersenesse nature hee y hee canne bee moued dryuen euell thys bee true surely yt playnely expressed hee y subiecte necessytye yn ynge ser super ca te bernarde agreeynge augustine wryteth thus onely manne among liuinge creature free yet meane sinne hee also suffreth certaine violence nature euen thereby also hee shoulde bee depryued freedome whyche wyllynge free lyttle wyll beynge chaunged selfe worse woote corrupte marueylous manner maketh necessitie necessitie muche willinge excuse wyll wyll forasmuche drawen aluremente exclude necessitie necessitie certaine manner willing afterwarde saith pressed wyth yoke yet none certaine wyllynge bondage therefore reason oure bondage miserable reason wil inexcusable bicause wil free made selfe bond seruaunt sinne length concludeth soule certaine marueilous euell manner holden bonde seruaunt free vnder certaine willinge yll free necessitie bonde seruante reason necessitie free reason wyll whiche maruelous miserable therein gylty wherin free therein bonde wherein gylty therein bond wherin free herby truely reader perceiue brynge new shynge whyche longe agoe augustine broughte fourthe oute consent godlye men almoste thousande yeares kepte styll monkes cloysters lombarde coulde distynguyshe necessitie compulsion gaue matter pernitious erroure otherside good consider manner remedie grace god whereby corruption nature amenhed healed whereas lorde helpyng v geueth v whyche wante shall knowe worke v streightwaye appeare side nedynesse apostle sayeth philippiansphil ivi trusteth whiche beganne good worke performe vnto daye iesus christe doubte beginnynge good worke meaneth beginnyng conuersion whiche therefore god beginneth good worke v stirryng vp heartes loue desire endeuour righteousnesse speake properly bowyng framyng directyng heartes righteousnesse endeth confirmyng v perseuerance manne cauill good begonne lorde beyng selfe weake holpen holy ghost place declareth able doe beyng lefte vnto selfeeze xxxvi xvi geue sayeth newe heart put newe spirit middes take awaye stony heart flesh geue heart fleshe put spirite middes make walke co maundementes whoe shall saye weakenesse man strengthened helpe whereby maye effectually aspire choise good must whole transformed renewed softenesse stone help made tenderer abide bowed euery way wil graunt heart man pliable obey whiche right yt whiche vnperfecte supplied grace god meante shewe similitude goodnesse coulde euer wroong heart vnlesse made throughly new let v parte betwene v chalegeth self alone therefore stone transformed fleshe god turneth v desire whiche right whiche owne taken awaye cometh place thereof god saye taken awaye bicause conuersion man whiche firste nature abideth whole also saye created newe beginneth turned euell good affirme wholy done god bycause able much thinkeii cor viij vi phi ijxiij apostle witnesseth therefore place sayeth god doth helpe weake amende peruerse worketh v whereupon easely gathered whiche saide euer good worke grace whyche sence place sayethij cor xijvi god worketh neyther doth entreate vniuersal gouernement geueth vnto god alone prayse al good thinges faythfull haue sayeng truely maketh god authour spiritual life euen beginning end whiche self thing taught wordesi cor viijvi sayeng faythful god christ playnly maketh mention newe creation wherin whiche common nature destroied vnderstanded comparyson betwene adam christe whyche place plainely expresseth teacheth worke god created christe good workes whyche hee hathe prepared shoulde walke goeth aboute reason proue oure saluation free gifte bicause beginninge goodnesse seconde creation whiche wee obteyne christe power oure selues yt neuer smale shoulde haue also portion merite hee proue v altogether nothing worthe resoneth haue deserued nothing bicause create christe good workes whiche god hathe prepared whiche wordes signifieth againe partes good workes euen ye first motio propre god reason ye prophete said ye psalme yt workemanshipe god shoulde particion addeth made selues speaketh ther regeneration whiche ye beginning spirituall life appeareth ye tenor text wher foloweth yt people ye flocke pasture see howe contended simply haue geuen god ye praise saluation doth expresly exclude v fro felowshipe would saye ther resteth pece neuer lyttle man glorie bicause god ther peraduenture graunt yt beynge owne nature turned away good conuerted power lord beinge prepared hath also owne parte doinge ad bonif epist augustin teacheth grace goeth euerye good worke dothe accompanie leade waytinge maide forgoer whiche thynge beinge euell spoken holy man peter lombarde doth disordrely wri purpose affirme wel wordes prophete whiche haue alleged ye place two thinges plainely signified lorde dothe bothe correcte oure corrupted rather destroie also himselfe putteth place thereof good muche preuented grace yt respect geue leaue call wayting maide beinge reformed worke lord wrongfully geuen man doth wil comming obey grace going therfore well written chrysostome ser de inuent cru yt neither grace wtout without grace worke thing grace worke selfe euen nowe haue seen paule neither augustine purpose called man ye wayting mayde grace assigne vnto certaine second office good worke bicause entent confute ye wicked doctrine pelagius whiche set ye principal cause saluation man deseruing therfore stode vpo point yt grace al deseruing sufficiente ye matter hand medlinge ye meane time wt question cocerning ye perpetuall effect grace yet place excellently wel handleth sometimes saith yt lord doth preuent ye vnwilling hee maye foloweth wyllynge wyll vayne maketh altogether whole authour good worke albeit senteces touchyng matter au lib de remiss peccat ca iohn vixlv plaine neede log arguyng vpon men sayeth doe labour finde something owne god may founde know first boke pelagius celestius doth expound saying christ euery one hath hearde father cometh sayth freewill holpen maye knowe done also maye doe hath knowe god teacheth letter law grace ye spirit teacheth hath learned doth see knowyng also desire willing performe doyng bicause hand ye chiefe point wherupon mater hangeth let v go forward proue summe therof reders fewe playne testimony scripture leaste man accuse v wrongfull wresting scripture let v shew trueth affirme beyng take scripture wanteth testimonie holy man meane augustine thinke expedient thinges rehersed may brought scripture cofirmation meanyng moste chosen shalbe brought forth way may prepared vnderstand al rest comonly red agayne thinke shall vnfitly done openly shewe agree well man worthyly consent godly men doth much esteme surely euidet plaine certaine profe beginning goodnesse el god founde bent good elect cause election sought man whereupon foloweth man hath right selfe procedeth good pleasure whereby electe ye creatio world also reason vnlike vnto yt wheras beginning willing doyng wel faith seene whense saith self cometh asmuch whole scripture crieth free gift god foloweth mere grace god al minde naturally bent euell beginne good therefore lord nameth two thinges couersio people take away stony heart geue heart flesh plainly testifieth selues must done away may conuerted righteousnesse euer cometh place therofier xxxijxxxix vttereth one place sayth ieremie wil geue one heart one way maye feare al dayes litle geue feare name heart departe fro agayne ezechieleze xixix wil geue one heart wil geue newe spirite bowel take away stony heart flesh geue heart flesh coulde euidently clayme himselfe take v euer good right declareth conuersion creation newe spirite newe heart followeth alwaye bothe proceedeth goodnesse till reformed reformation muche good god v reade prayer holy mene made effecte lorde incline heart sayeth salomon maye kepe commaundementes1 reg viij viij sheweth frowardenesse heart whiche naturally reioyseth rebell agaynste lawe god boowedps c xixxxxvi thyng psalme lorde incline heart thy testimony comparison contrarietie alwaye noted whyche betwene peruerse motion heart whereby carried obstinatie correction whereby led obedienceps lixij david feelyng selfe tyme without directyng grace praieth god create newe heart within hym renewe righte spirite within bowelles doeth acknowledge partes heart full vnclennesse hys spirite writhen wyth croked peruersenesse callynge cleannesse whyche prayeth creature god doeth attribute wholly god yf anye manne take exception saye verye prayer token godly holy affection oure aunswere ready though dauid time somewhat come amendement yet doeth still compare firste state sorrowefull fall felte therefore takyng vpon hym person manne enstranged god good cause prayeth haue geuen hym thynges god geueth electe regeneration beyng like dead manne wisheth hym selfe bee created newe bondeslaue satan maye bee made instrumente holyghoste maruellous monstrous surely luste pryde god requyreth nothyng earnestly wee moste religiously kepe sabbat resting owne workes v nothyng hardly obteyned bidding owne workes farewell geue due place workes god sluggishnesse hindered christe hath geuen testimonie euident enough grace make bee enuiously suppressedioh xvi sayeth uine bee branch father husbandeman branche beare fruite selfe vnlesse abide uine vnlesse abide without nothyng beare fruite none otherwise braunche buddeth beyng plucked grounde without moysture neede seke aptnesse nature goodnesse playne coclusion without ye nothing doeth saye weake sufficiet selues bryngyng v nothyng excludeth opinion power neuer little beyng graffed christe beare fruite lyke uine whiche taketh efficacie liuelinesse moisture earth deaw heauen cherishyng sonne see nothinge remayne v doyng good worke yf kepe whole god whyche fonde suttle deuise alledged vayne iuyce already enclosed wythin branchematth xv xiij certayne power bryng forth frute therefore taketh earth firste roote bycause bringeth somewhat owne christe doeth meane nothing el drye sticke nothing worth seuered bicause selues beyng separate haue power doe well also place sayeth euery tree father hath platedphil xiij shal rooted vp wherfore apostle ascribeth whole vnto place alredy alleged god sayth worketh v bothe performe firste parte good worke seconde stronge endeuour doyng authour bothe god therefore steale god take selues thinge eyther effectuall workyng sayde god doth help weake somewhat lefte v sayde maketh nowe good set v bicause good yet still oppressed weight fleshe rise vp sayde ouercome hardenesse battell ministred vnto v stedfastnesse endeuour euen effect otherwise coulde stande together whyche teacheth placei cor xijvi god alone bryngeth effect thynges wherein haue taught whole course spirituall life comprehended whyche reasonps lxxxvixi dauid prayed haue wayes lorde opened vnto hym mighte walke trueth addeth unite thou heart feare thy name whyche wordes signifieth euen well minded subiecte many withdrawynges minde easily vanish fal awaye bee stablisshed constantie whiche reason place prayed haue steppe directed kepe worde god requireth also haue strength geuen fightps c xix c xxxiij lette iniquitie sayeth beare rule ouer sorte therefore doeth lorde bothe beginne ende good worke v maye worke wil conceyueth loue whiche right enclined desire thereof stirred vp moued endeuour followyng choyse desire endeuour fainte procede euen effecte laste manne goeth forward constantly continueth ende moueth suche sorte hath many age ben taught beleued afterwarde choyse eyther obeye withstande motion wyth mightyly strengthnyng therefore muste bee reiected whyche chrysostome ofte repeteth whome draweth draweth beyng willyng wherby secretly teacheth god doeth reache hande see yf wee holpen ayde graunte suche state manne whyle yet stoode might bowe eyther parte sithe hath taught example howe miserable freewill vnlesse god bothe v shall become v yf geue v grace accordyng small proportion rather wee dooe obscure extenuate vnthankefulnesse apostle doeth teache grace good offred v yf doe accepte performe v whiche nothyng el lorde spirite dothe direct howe gouerne heart reigneth owne possessioneze xixix xxxvixxvij neyther doeth promise ezechiel geue electe newe spirite onely ende maye able walke commaundementes make walke deede neyther christes sayengioh ixxlv euery one hath hearde father cometh otherwyse taken teache grace god effectuall selfe li de prae de augustine also affirmeth whyche grace god vouchesaueth geue menne generally without regarde sayeng thynke occam commonly spoken among people denieth nothyng hym doeth lieth menne deede taught god goodnesse layed open menne without exception seeke asmuche onely beginne seeke whome heauenly grace hath breathed vpon muche little pece oughte plucked awaye prayse truely prerogatiue electe beyng regenerate spirite god moued gouerned guidyng therefore augustine doeth worthyly well mocke clayme parte willing selues doeth reprehende thinke generally geuen menne whyche speciall testimonie free election augu de r nature sayeth grace common menne callynge brickle sutteltie wit like glasse glistereth mere vanitie generally extended whiche god geueth onely whome pleaseth place howe camest thou beleuyng feare thou least thou takest vpon thee thou haste founde iuste waye thou perishe iuste waye came sayest thou free came mine owne swellest thou wilt thou heare also geuen thee heare euen hym calleth man cometh vnlesse father drawe himiohn vixliiii without controuersie gathered iohns woordes heartes godly effectually gouerned god workyng followe wyth vnc ngeable affection begotten god sayeth ne bicause seede god abideth see meane motion whiche sophisters imagine whiche liber e maye eyther obeye refuse openly excluded effectuall constancie continue affirmed continuaunce shoulde doubte haue ben made shoulde haue ben taken free gyfte god vnlesse moste wicked errour growen force distributed accordynge deserte menne euery manne hath shewed selfe vnthankefull firste grace asmuche errour hath growen vpon pointe thought bee hande refuse receyue grace god offred opinion beyng dryuen awaye dothe also fall selfe albeit herein erre manner wayes biside teache thankefulnesse towarde first grace lawefull vse thereof rewarded later giftes adde also nowe grace alone doeth worke v onely worker together v firste wee ought beleue lorde dayely enricheth heapeth seruauntes wyth newe giftes grace bycause liketh fauoreth worke whiche hath begonne findeth somwhat whereupon bestowe greater grace hereto serue sayinges hathmat luc shalbe geuen agayne oh good seruaunt thou haste ben faithfull fewe thinges set thee ouer many two thynges taken heede neyther lawefull vse firste grace sayde rewarded later grace copted rewarding cesse reckened free grace god graunt therefore blessyng god looked faythfull howe muche better haue vsed firste grace shalbe encreased wyth much greater saye vse also lorde rewardyng free good vse lesse wrongfully vnhappyly olde distruction workynge together workyng grace augustine vsed deede delayeng fitte definition god together workyng v doth ende yt whiche workinge beginneth still grace chaungeth name accordynge diuerse manner effecte whereupon followeth doth parte betwene god v yf wer mutual meetyng together motion bothe noteth multiplication grace whyche purpose belongeth whyche place teacheth many gyltes god dooe goe good manne amonge whiche selfe one whereupon foloweth leaueth nothynge maye clayme selfephil whiche thynge paule also hath namely expressed sayde god whiche worketh v bothe performe addeth doeth bothe good declaryng worde free goodnesse whereas wounte saye haue one geuen place firste grace owne endeuors doe nowe worke together grace followeth aunswere yf meane wee haue ben one th power lorde broken obedience righteousnesse doe owne accorde goe forwarde inclined follow workynge grace speake nothyng agaynste moste certayne suche redinesse obeyng grace god reygueth whense cometh spirite god alwaye agreyng wyth selfe doth cherishe confirme stedfastnesse continuyng affection obeyeng whyche selfe engendred beginnyng meane man taketh self whereby labour grace god moste pestilently deceyued purpose sayeng apostle wrongefully wrasted ignoraunce haue labored grace god me1 cor take bycause might seeme somewhat arrogantly spoken preferred self therefore corrected wyth referryng prayse grace god yet calleth selfe worker together grace maruell many whiche otherwise euell menne haue stombled straw apostle doeth wryte grace lord labored entent make selfe partener labour rather correction geueth awaye prayse labour grace sayeth haue labored grace god doubtfulnesse speache deceyued specially ill translation wherein force greke article lefte bee translated worde worde doth saye grace worker together wyth grace wyth worker thyng doth augustine teache darkely though shortly thus sayeth good manne goeth many giftes godps lixxi whyche goeth selfe one foloweth reasonpsa xxiijvi bycause wrytten hys mercie hath preuented mercie shall followe preuenteth manne willyng make hym followeth willyng vayne serm cant whome bernarde agreeth bringing church speakyng thus drawe manner vnwillyng thou mayste make willyng drawe lyeng slouthfull thou mayest make runne nowe let v heare augustine speaking owne wordes least pelagians age saye sophisters sorbon shoulde wonte laye charge antiquitie agaynste v wherein followe father pelagius whome longe agoe agustine drawen forth contention booke correption grace wrytten ualentine entreateth largely whyche reherse shortly yet doe owne wordes capi e adam geuen grace continuyng good yf would v geuen ouercome concupiscence therefore able would might able v geuen bothe bee able firste libertie able sinne oures much greater able sinne leaste thought speake perfection come immortalitie lombard wrongfullly draweth meanyng within little plucketh doubt sayth wil holy much kindled holy ghost therfore able bicause therefore wilij cor xijix bicause god worketh great weaknesse yet behoueth power made perfect repressing pride owne left vnto helpe god maye god doth worke amonge many temptation shoulde needes fall downe weakenesse therfore could continue therefore succour geuen weakenesse man moued without swaruyng seueryng grace god therfore shoulde afinte howe weake euer cap entreateth largely howe heartes doe necessitie follow mouing god worketh affection sayeth lorde doeth drawe menne deede owne willes suche selfe hath wrought nowe haue thyng testified augustine mouth whyche principally desire obteyne grace onely offered god receyued refused euery man free election also grace formeth electio heart euery good worke foloweth frute effecte thereof haue obeyeng whiche hath made also wordes place nothyng grace maketh eeuery good worke v whereas sayeth place taken awaye graeeepist cv euell turned good holpen good meaneth onely manne drawen without motion heart carried outwarde impulsion inwardely affected heart obeyeth grace specially freely geuen electepist cvi wryteth thus vnto boniface knowe grace geuen menne whome geuen geuen accordynge merites workes accordynge merites free fauour whome geuen knowe iuste iudgement god geuen epistle strongly fighteth agaynst opinion grace folowyng geuen deseruynges menne bycause refusinge firste grace shewed themselues worthy haue pelagius graunt grace necessarie v euery doynges geuen recompense workes maye bee grace deede matter comprehended shorter summe eight chapter boke ualentine correptione grace firste teacheth man obteyneth grace libertie libertie grace grace affection delite printed framed continuance strengthened wyth inuincible force grace gouerneth neuer falleth awayeepist xlvi grace forsaketh tombleth downe free mercie god bothe conuerted good beyng conuerted abideth direction man wyll good stedfastnesse direction hangeth vpon onely god vpon merite owne manne lefte suche free liste call wryteth place neyther turned god abide god grace grace able able fourth chapter p god worketh heartes men yt sufficiently proued thynke man holden captiue yoke sinne owne nature neyther aspire desire trauaile endeuour goodnesse byside haue rehersed distinction betwene compulsion necessitie whereby might appere sinneth necessitie yet neuerthelesse sinneth willingly asmuch subiect bondage deuell semeth rather led deuels owne resteth nowe declared sorte bothe kindes workyng question assoiled whether euel workes thing attributed god whiche scripture sheweth vsed working one place augustine compareth man horse whiche ready ruled ryder god deuell compareth ryders god sayth sit vpon like sober connyng rider gouerneth temperatly spurreth forwarde slowe plucketh backe quicke restrayneth wantonnesse wildenesse tameth stubbornnesse guideth right way deuell haue possessed like foolish wanton rider violently carrieth place waye driueth diches rolleth downe steepe place spurreth forward stubbornnesse fearcenesse similitude wil time conte ted sithe cometh better place sayde naturall man subiect rule deuell stirred mente thereby man striuing agaynst resistyng compelled obeye compell bondeslaues agaynst wil reason beyng lordes co maundementes beyng bewitched deceites satan necessitie yeldeth selfe obedient euery leadyng whome lord vouchesaueth rule spirite iust iudgement sendeth away moued satan wherfore apostle saythii cor ii iiii god world hath blinded mindes vnbeleuers ordeyned destruction see light gospell place worketh disobedient childreneph iiii blindynge wicked wicked deedes followe thereupon called workes satan whiche yet cause bee sought elswhere man ariseth roote euell wherin resteth fundation kingdome satan whiche sinne farre order god doyng thinges may appere certainly vnto v let hurt done holy man iob chaldeesiob exaple chaldee killed herdemen like enemy warre droue awaye cattle booty nowe wicked deede plainely seene worke satan idle whome historie sayeth dyd procede iob acknowledge worke lord whome saith haue take away thing taken away chaldee referre selfe work god authour sathan authour authour must either excuse sathan company god report god authour euill uery easely first loke vpon ende done manner purpose lorde calamitie exercise patience seruant deuil goeth driue despeir chaldee right lawe seke gaine whiche man suche diuersitie purpose maketh great difference worke maner lesse diuersitie lord leaueth seruant sathan afflicted chaldee whome chose minister execute leaue deliuer driuen sathan venemous stinges pricked forward myndes chaldee whiche otherwyse peruerse selues mischief furiously runne wrong bynde defile membres wicked therfore properly said sathan doth worke reprobate whome exerciseth kingdome say kingdome wickednesse also sayd god worketh maner satha selfe muche instrument wrath according bidding commaundement turneth self hether thither execute iust iudgementes speake god vniuersall mouing wherby al creature susteined thence thei take effectuall power thing speake special whiche appeareth euery special act see therfore absurditie one selfe acte ascribed god satan man diuersitie ende maner causeth therin appeareth iustice god without fault also wickednesse sathan man bewrayeth selfe reproche olde wryters point also somtime precisely afraid simply confesse truthe feare least open wyndowe wickednesse speake irreuerently workes god whiche sobrietie embrace thinke nothing daungerous simply holde scripture teacheth li de pr dest grat augustine hym selfe sometime free superstition saith hardening blynding perteine worke god foreknowledge phrase scripture allowe subtilties whiche phrase plainly shew therin somwhat el god besides forknowledge augustine himselfe v boke iulianus goeth earnestly long processe proue sinnes permissio suffera ce god also power former sinnes might punished lykewyse whiche fourth concerning permission weake stande oftentimes sayd god blyndeth hardeneth reprobate turneth boweth moueth heartes haue el taught large maner yt neuer expressed flee free forknowledge sufferance therfore answere done two maners first light taken away remaineth nothing darknesse blyndnesse spirite taken away heartes ware hard become stone direction cesseth wrasted crokednesse well sayd doeth blinde harden bowe whome taketh away ye power se obey rightly second manner whiche commeth nere propertie wordes executing iudgementes sathan minister wrath bothe appointeth purpose ende pleaseth hym stirreth vp willes stregtheneth endeuorsdeut xxx whe moses reherseth king sehon geue passage people god hardened spirite made heart obstinate adioyneth ende purpose might saith geue handes therfore god haue destroied making heart obstinate god preparation destruction firste manner seemeth bee spoken taketh away lyppe speaker truthiob xiixx taketh away reason elder taketh heart away set ouer people hee maketh wader way lord haste thou made v madesay lxiij xvij hardened oure hearte wee shoulde feare thee iudge rather sorte god maketh men forsaking perfourmeth worke testimony goe hardening pharao wyll harden heart pharao heare youexod iiijxxj vii ij xi let people go afterward saith hath made heauy hardened heart harden susteining true deede somwhat committed heart sathan confirmed obstinacie vpon saydexod iij xix wyll holde heart people went egypt inhabitantes countrey came fourth met lyke ennemies whome styred vp truely moses affirmeth peopledeut ijxxx lorde hardened heartes prophet reciting historie saith turned heartespsa e vxxv hate people nowe say stumbled left without counsell god hardened turned purpose bowed selfe thing moreouer oft pleased punish transgressours people perfourme worke reprobate man may see effectualnesse working hym seruice ministersesay vxxvi vijxviij ezech xijxiij xvijxx ier lxxiii esa xxv depr edest sa wherfore somtyme threatened would call whistle sometyme lyke net hym entangle sometyme lyke mallet strike israelite specially declared idle called sennacherib whiche bothe directed dryuen hande cut augustine one place dothe amisse appointeth sorte muche sinne owne muche si ning doe power god deuided darkenesse pleaseth hym nowe ministery sathan vsed pricke forward reprobate oft lorde prouidence appointeth may sufficiently proued though one place onlyi sa xvi xviij x xxix oftentimes sayde samuel euell spirite lorde euill spirite lorde either violently carry leaue saul say spirite holy ghost blasphemous therfore vncleane spirit called spirit god aunswereth commaundement power rather instrument authour selfe also added withallij thes ijx whiche paul teacheth efficacie errour deceiuing sent god haue obeyed truth may beleue lie alway great difference one selfe worke betwene whiche lorde doeth whiche sathan wicked goe maketh euill instrumetes hath vnder hand may turne whether list serue iustice muche euyll doe bring fourth effect wickednesse haue conceiued corruptnesse nature reste suche thynges serue deliuer maiestie god slaunder cut shifting wycked already sette fourth chapter concerning prouidence place purpose shewe howe sathan reigneth reprobate god worketh bothe although haue touched yet playnely declared libertie man hath doinges whiche neyther iust faulty selues belonge rather bodely spirituall lyfe suche thinges haue graunted free election rather thinke would striue matter great importance mynded certainly proue thyng graunte although confesse whiche doe holde haue power ryghteousnesse holde thyng principally necessary saluation yet doe thynke point also neglected may knowe speciall grace lorde ofte cometh mynde chose whiche profit oft wyl enclyneth therunto agayne ofte wyt mynde eschueth whiche el would haue hurt v force god prouidence extedeth thus far make success thynges come passe shall forsee expedient also make wylles men tend therunto truely consider wyt administration outwarde thinges shall thynke farre vnder wyll man shall geue credit many testimony whiche crie lord dothe thynges also rule heartes shall compelle v yelde wyll subiect speciall mouing goder xiiij procure good willes egyptian israelite lende moste precious iewels woulde neuer haue founde heartes haue done owne accorde therfore heartes subiect lord ruled seluesgen xliijxiiij truely iacob bene persuaded god put men diuerse affection pleaseth hym would haue sayd sonne ioseph thought heathe egyptian god graunte fynde mercie man also whole churche confesseth psalmepsal cvi xlvj pleased god haue mercie vpon itpsal sam sa io leuit deut meekened heartes cruell nation againe saul waxed fire anger prepared warre cause expressed spirite god enforce hym turned away absolons mynde embracinge counsell achitophel whiche wont holden oracle inclined rehabeam persuaded yong men aduise made nation great afrayde comyng israell truely harlot rahab confessed done god agayne threw downe heartes israell dread fearfulnesse lawe threatened would geue fearefull hearte man wyll take exception saye singular example rule wherof thynges vniuersally ought reduced saye sufficiently proued whiche affirme god oft meaneth prepare waye prouidence euen outward thynges dothe bowe tourne wylles men choise free god beareth rule ouer fredome thereof thy mynde hangeth rather vpon mouing god vpon fredome thyne owne choyse daylye experience shall compell thee thynke whether thou wylt thynges perplexitie thy iudgement wyt oft fayleth thee thinges hard doone thy courage fainteth againe thinges moste obscure present aduise offred thee thynges great perillous thou hast courage ouercomming difficultie doe expounde whiche salomon sayethpro eare may heare eie may see lorde worketh bothe take speaketh creation speciall grace vsing thempro whe wryteth lorde holdeth hande boweth whether wyll hearte kynge streames water truely vnder example one speciall sorte comprehendeth whole generaltie wyll man free subiection preeminence principally belongeth wyll kyng whiche vseth kyngdome vpon wylles wyll kynge ruled hande god shall wyll exempted fro estate li de gratia libero arb ad valent ca upon point notable sayinge augustine scripture diligently loked vpon dothe shewe good willes men whiche euyll maketh good beyng made hym selfe dothe direct good doinges eternall lyfe also willes preserue creature world power god maketh inclined whether wyll wyll either doe benefites execute punishementes iudgement moste secrete deede moste righteous let reader remember power man wyll weyed successe thynges whiche vnskylfull men vnorderly wont doe seme selues proue trimly wittely man wyll bondage euen hyest monarch haue thynges flowyng owne desire power wherof speake considered within man measured outwarde successe disputacion freewyll question whether man may outwarde impedimentes perfourme put execution thinges hath purposed mynde whether haue euery thyng bothe free election iudgement free affection wyll whiche bothe man haue attilius regulus enclosed narrowenesse tonne set full sharp prickes shall lesse haue free wyll augustus cesar gouerning great part worlde beck countenaunce fift chapter pa confutacion obiections wont brought defence free wyll yt myght seme haue saide enough already concerning bondage man wyll false opinion libertie labour throwe downe hedlong contrary part pretende certayne reason assaile meanyng first heape vp together diuerse absurdity whereby may bryng hatred thing abhorring common reason afterward set vpon testimony scripture bothe enginse shall beate back order say synne necessitie cesseth synne voluntarie may auoyded also weapon pelagius assaile augustine whose name wyl yet haue oppressed till haue satisfied concerning matter selfe denie therfore sinne ought lesse imputed necessary denie agayne dothe followe whiche conclude may auoyded voluntarie man dispute god seeke escape iudgement pretense coulde none otherwyse god hath aunswere ready whiche place haue spoken creation corruption nature men made bondeslaues synne wyll nothing euell whence cometh want power whiche wycked would gladly pretende vpon adam owne accorde made hym selfe subiect tyrannie deuell hereupon therfore grewe corruption bondes wherof holden fast tyed fyrst man fell creatour men iustly holden gylty fallynge away let thinke selues excused necessitie whiche selfe haue moste euident cause dampnation haue aboue plainely set fourth haue geue example deuel hym selfe wherby might appeare whiche necessarely synneth dothe neuerthelesse wyllyngly sinne agayne electe aungels wyll declyne good yet cesseth ser ca whiche thinge bernard also aptly teacheth therfore miserable necessitie voluntarie whiche yet holdeth v subiect vnto bond slaues synne haue reheased second part theyr argument faulty voluntarie streightway leapeth free haue proued voluntarely done whiche yet subiect free election say bothe vertues vice procede fre choyse wyll reasonable either punishement bee layde vpon man rewarde geuen hym argument although aristoteles yet graunt place vsed chrysostome hierome commone argument pelagians hierome selfe hideth epit ad c ciphon diacon also reherseth wordes grace god worke v labour shalbe crowned punishementes aunswere iustlye layde vpon v whome ye gyltinesse sinne procedeth matter maketh whether sinne done free bonde iudgement bee done voluntarye luste specially syth manne hereby proued synner hee vnder bondage synne rewardes ryghteousnesse greate absurditie forsoothe yf wee confesse thei hange rather vpon god bountifullnesse vpon oure owne deseruynges howe ofte fynde wee thys thynge repeted augustine god crouneth oure deseruynges hys owne gyftes called rewardes due oure deseruinges suche rendred grace already bestowed vpon v wisely deede thei note thys nowe ther remaineth place deseruynges thei come oute fountaine free wyll wher recken whiche saye farre differynge trueth thei muche deceiued psal augustine doubteth commonly teache necessarie thinke vnlawefull confesse saithe bee merites menne euer thei bee hee commeth wyth due rewarde free grace alone beynge free maketh free synne findeth menne sinner psal agayne shall bee rendred thee due thee thou arte punyshed y done god hathe geuen thee punyshement whyche y due butte geueth thee grace whyche y due thou wylte bee estraunged grace boaste thy deseruynges epist de uerbis apostol sermo agayne thou arte nothynge thy selfe synnes thyne butte deseruynges god punyshemente y due thee rewarde commeth hee shall crowne hys owne gyftes thy deseruynges meaninge place hee teacheth grace deseruynge butte deseruynge grace lyttle hee concludeth god wyth hys gyftes goeth deseruynges oute hee maye gather hys owne deseruinges doothe geue alltogether freelye bycause hee fyndeth nothynge wherevpon saue butte neede yt make longer regyster suche sentence often founde hys wrytynges1 cor iiijvij apostle shall yet better deliuer thys erroure yf heare begynnynge hee conueieth glorie saintes whome hathe chosen hathe called whome hee hathe called hee hathe iustified whome hee hathe iustified hee hathe gloryfyed witnesseth apostle faythefull crowned bycause lordes mercye theyr owne endeuoure boothe choosen called iustyfyed awaye therefore wyth thys vayne feare shall e bee anye deseruynges yf free wyll shall stonde yt y mooste foolyshe bee frayed awaye flee whyche scrypture calleth vs1 cor iiijvii saythe hee thou haste receyued thynges gloryest thou yf thou haddest receyued thou seest cause hee taketh thynges free wyll leaue place deseruynges butte bountiefullnesse lyberalytye god y manyfolde impossible bee spente oute grace whyche hee bestoweth v bycause maketh oures hee rewardeth yf oure owne vertues moreouer brynge fourthe whyche maye seeme bee taken oute chrysostome hom gen thys bee power oure wyll choose good euell partaker nature muste eyther euell bee good farre y soeuer hee wrote booke callyng gentyles whyche y carryed aboute vnder name ambrose hee maketh thys argumente lib ca manne euer departe faythe vnlesse grace god dyd leaue vnto v state mutabylyte wherein yt y marueyle excellente menne fell besyde selues howe chaunseth yt came chrysostomes mynde yt y god election maketh dyfference betweene menne v wee feare graunte whyche paule wyth greate earnestnesse affyrmethrom iiix togyther peruerse geuen wyckednesse butte wyth hym adioyne thys god mercye yt commeth passe abyde peruersenesse therefore whereas naturally wee sycke one desease onely recouer healthe vpon whome yt hathe pleased god laye hys healynge hande reste whome iuste iudgemente hee passeth ouer pyne awaye theyr owne rottenesse tyll bee consumed neyther y yt cause contynewe ende fall theyr course begonne contynuaunce yt selfe y gyfte god whyche hee geueth indyfferently butte dealeth yt whome yt pleaseth hym selfe manne aske cause dyfference contynewe constantly fayle vnstedfastenesse wee knowe none cause butte god susteyneth one sorte strengthened wyth hys power perysh doth geue strengthe sorte maye bee exaumples inconstancie presse v sayinge exhortation vaynelye taken hande vse admonition y superfluous yt y fonde thynge rebuke yf yt bee power synner obey lyke thynges tyme paste obiected agaynste augustyne hee compelled wryte booke corruption grace althoughe hee largely reipe away yet hee bryngeth hys aduersaryes thys summe manne commaundemente learne thou oughtest dooe correction learne thyne owne faulte thou haste yt prayer learne whense thou mayste receyue whyche thou wolddeste haue argumente manner y booke spyryte letter hee teacheth god measureth commaundementes hys lawe strengthe manne hee hathe commaunded whiche y ryghte hee freelye geueth hys electe power fullfyll yt thys matter longe dysputacion fyrste wee onely thys cause butte also christe apostle nowe let looke howe wyll gette maysterie stryuynge matche selues wyth suche aduersariesjohn xvv dothe christe whyche testyfyeth wee canne nothynge wythoute hym thynge lesse rebuke chastyce wythoute hym dyd euell dothe hee lesse exhorte euery manne applye hym selfe good woorkes howe seuerely dothe paule inuey agaynste corynthians neglectynge charytyei cor iijiij rom ixxvj yet prayeth charitie bee geuen menne god hee testifieth epistle romaine neither hym wylleth hym runneth god hathe mercye yet hee cesseth afterwarde admonishe exhorte rebuke therefore speake lorde hee lose hys laboure requyrynge menne thynges whyche hee hymselfe alone canne geue punyshynge thynges whyche done wante hys grace admonyshe paule spare themi cor iijvij whose power wyll runne butte mercie god goynge whiche nowe hath forsaken lorde verye good reason hys doctryne whyche offreth yt selfe redily founde reuerently seeke yt howe muche doctrine exhortation rebukynge woorke themselues chaungynge mynde paule declareth wryteth neither planteth thynge hee watereth lorde geueth encrease onely effectually woorketh wee see moses seuerely stabelysheth commaundementes lawe prophetes sharpely call vpon threaten transgressor whereas yet confesse menne onely waxe wyse hearte geuen vnderstande propre woorke god circumcise heartes steede stony heartes geue heartes fleshe writ lawe bowells menne fynally renewynge soules make hys doctryne may effectuall wherfore serue exhortation thys purpose thei dispysed wycked wyth obstynate hearte shall witenesse vnto shall come iudgemente seate lorde yea euen nowe alreadye beate strike conscience howesoeuer moste frowarde manne laugheth scorne yet canne disproue thou wilte saie may sylly miserable menne yf softenesse heart whyche necessarily required obedience denied naye rather doth excuse selfe canne impute hardenesse heart none hymselfe therefore wycked wyllyngely readye mocke oute yf myght throwen downe wyth force whether chefe profite towarde faithfull considered whome lorde woorketh thinges spirite hee leaueth instrumentes worde vseth without effecte let therfore stande whyche true strength godly resteth grace god accordyng sayinge propheteezech xixix geue newe heart maye walke thou wylte saye nowe admonyshed duetye rather lefte direction holy ghoste moued wyth exhortation sythe canne make haste styrrynge forwarde holy ghooste woorketh thei chastised tyme gone oute waye syth fell necessarye weakenesse fleshe man arte thou apoynte lawe god pleasure bee prepared exhortation receiue selfe grace whereby wroughte exhortation obeied haste thou thys ordre bite carpe exhortation rebukynges dyd nothynge el profyte wyth godlye reproue synne euen thing onely compted alltogether vnprofitable nowe asmuche holy ghooste woorkynge inwardly thei muche auaile enflame desire goodnesse shake sluggyshnesse take awaye pleasure venymo swetenesse wyckednesse syde engendre hatred irkesomnesse therof whoe dare cauill thei superfluus manne require plainer aunswere let take thys god woorketh twoo sortes hys electe inwardly spirite outwardely worde spirite enlyghtninge theyr myndes framinge heartes loue keepinge iustice hee maketh newe creature worde stirreth desire seke atteine renuinge bothe hee sheweth fourth effectuall woorkinge hande accordinge proportion dystributio hee sendeth woorde reprobate thoughe amendement yet hee maketh serue vse bothe present time thei maie bee pressed witnesse conscienceih vjxliiij maye againste daie iudgemente bee made inexcusable thoughe christe pronounce manne commeth hym whome father draweth electe come thei haue hearde learned father yet doothe hee neglecte office teacher voice dylygentlie calleth whome necessarily behoueth bee inwardely taughte holly ghosteij co ijxvj thei maie thinge profyte paule teacheth teachinge vaine reprobate bicause sauoure deathe deathe butte swete sauoure god thei verye laborious heapinge together testimony scripture dooe purpose thei canne oppresse v wyth weyghte thei maie yet numbre battelles commeth hande strookes weaker multitude muche pompe shewe soeuer hath fewe strippes discomfyted putte flyghte shall yt bee verye easye v ouerthrowe wyth theyr route bycause place abuse agaynste v one dyuyded theyr ordres meete vpon fewe specyall poyntes wee shall wyth one aunswere satysfye many therefore yt shall bee needefull tarrye vpon dyssoluynge euerye one partycularlye theyr cheefe force sette commaundementes whyche thynke bee tempered oure strengthes soeuer y proued bee requyred one yt necessarylye foloweth yt maye bee perfourmed therefore runne throughe euerye commaundementes doe measure proportion oure strengthe saye eyther god mocketh v hee chargeth v wyth hollyenesse godlynesse obedyence chastitie loue mekenesse hee forbiddeth v vncleannesse ydolatrie vnchastenesse wrathe robberye pryde suche lyke hee requyreth onely thynges oure power nowe maye dyuyde three sortes manner commaundementes heape together requyre oure fyrste conuersion god speake symply keepynge lawe commaunde v contynue grace god wee haue receyued fyrste lette v speake generalitie descende specyall sortes extende power manne commaundementes lawe hathe deede longe agoe begonne bee commune hathe shewe butte yt proceded mooste rude ignoraunce lawe thynke yt heynous offence yf yt bee sayde keepynge lawe y ympossyble reste forsoothe vpon thys moste stronge argumente ell lawe geuen vayne speake suche sorte yf paule hadde noe spoken lawe beseache meane sayinges lawe sette bycause transgression lawe y knoweledge synnegala iijx rom iijxx rom vijvii tim iv thes iijxii lawe maketh synne lawe entred synne myght abounde yt meante lawe bee lymyted oure strengthes leaste yt shoulde bee geuen vayne rather yt sette farre aboue v conuince oure weakenesse truelye man defynition ende fullfyllynge lawe y charytye butte hee wysheth myndes thessalonian bee fylled wyth charitie hee dothe sufficientlye confesse lawe soundeth oure eares wythoute profyte vnlesse god inspire whole summe thereof oure heartes truelye yf scrypture dyd teache nothynge ell butte lawe y rule lyfe vnto wee oughte frame oure endeuours woulde also wythoute delaye agree theyr opinion whereas yt dothe dylygently playnely declare vnto v manyfolde vse lawe yt y conueniente rather consyder interpretation lawe maye doe manne muche concerneth thys presente cause yt teacheth sone yt hathe appoynted wee oughte dooe power obeye commeth goodnesse god therefore moueth v prayer whereby wee maye requyre haue giuen v onelye commaundemente promise oure strengthe tryed whether sufficient aunswere commaundement syth ther promyses ioyned wythall whiche crye oute onely oure aide also oure whole power consysteth helpe god grace testifie enoughe altogether vnfitte muche insufficient keepe lawe wherefore let thys proportion oure strengthes wyth commaundementes god lawe enforced lord hadde measured rule iustice whiche hee purposed geue lawe accordynge rate oure weakenesse rather hys promysses wee oughte consyder howe vnreadye wee oure selues whyche euerye behalfe muche neede hys grace whoe saye shall perswaded lyke true lorde appointed lawe stockes stone neyther dothe manne goe aboute perswade yt wycked neyther stockes stone beynge taughte lawe theyr lustes stryue agaynste god proued gyltye theyr owne wytenesse yet godly beeynge putte mynde theyr weakenesse flee vnto grace whyche purpose serue sayinges augustine enchir ad lau de grat li arb ca hom ioan lorde commaundeth thynges wee maye knowe wee oughte aske hym greate profite commaundements yf muche bee geuen free wyll grace god bee honoured faythe obtayneth whyche lawe commaundeth yea lawe therefore commaundeth faythe maye obtayne whyche commaunded lawe yea god requyreth faythe yt selfe v fyndeth requyre vnlesse hee geue fynde epist agayne let god geue hee commaundeth commaunde wyll shall plainely bee seen rehersinge three sortes commaundementes touched ioel lorde oftentimes commaundeth bothe lawe prophetes co uerted vnto hym iere syde prophete aunswereth conuerte lorde shall conuerted thou didst conuerte repented c commaundeth v circumcise vncircumcised skynne oure hearte deut ez moses declareth yt thys circumcision done owne hande eche wher requireth newenesse hearte place hee testifieth yt geuen himselfe whyche god promiseth saith augustine free wil nature lib de christi himselfe doth grace ye note himselfe reherseth v place among rule ticonius yt wel make difference betwene lawe promise betwen commaundementes grace nowe let goe gather commaundementes whether man able thing toward obedience suche sorte yt thei destroye grace god whiche ye commaundementes selues fullfylled commaundemets seconde sorte symple whyche wee bydden honoure god serue cleaue
