vnto hys wyll kepe hys comaundemtes folowe doctrine innumerable place doe testifie gyft euer ryghteousnesse holynesse godlinesse puritie may bee thirde sorte exhortacion paul barnabas faithfull whiche rehearsed luke shoulde abyde grace god whence strengthe constancie paul teacheth placeephe v xvj ephe ijxxx remayneth sayeth brother bee ye stronge throughe lorde place forbyddeth v doe greue spirite god wherewith sealed vp vnto daye redemption thynge requireth could beperfourmed men therfore wysheth thessaloniansthes xij god namely woulde recken worthy holy callyng fulfyll purpose goodnesse woorke faythe lykewyse seconde epistle corinthiansi cor vii xi entreating almes oftentymes commaundeth theyr good godlye wyll yet litle thanketh god put hearte titus take vpon hym geue exhortacion titus coulde muche vse office mouthe exhorte farre god put vnto hym howe shoulde haue bene wyllynge doe vnlesse god hym selfe directed heartes craftier sorte doe cauyll testimony impediment wee maye ioyne owne strengthes god helpe weake endeuours bryng also place prophetes effect conuersion seemeth bee parted halfe betwene god vszach tourne ye wyll tourne maner help lord bryngeth v haue aboue shewed nedefull repete one thyng woulde haue graunted vainely gathered requyred v power fulfyll lawe god dothe comaunde obedience much euident fulfillyng commaundementes god grace lawegeuer bothe necessary v promysed vnto v thereby appeareth least required v able payeier xiijiij saying hieremie wyped away cauillatios couenaunt god made auncient people voyde literall coulde otherwyse bee stablyshed spirite cometh vnto whiche frameth heartes obedience neither dothe saying tourne ye wyll tourne vnto fauour errour meant tourning god wherewith renueth oure heartes repentaunce wherewyth hee prosperitie thynges dothe declare hym selfe fauourable merciful aduersitie somtime sheweth displeasure therfore people vexed many sortes misery calamity dyd complayne god turned awaye aunswereth shall destitute fauour retourne vprightnesse lyfe hym selfe paterne righteousnesse therefore place wrongfully wrested drawen pourpose woorke conuersion shoulde seeme bee parted betwixte god men thynges haue comprehended muche shortelyer bycause propre place matter shall bee entreate lawe seconde sorte argumentes muche like vnto fyrst alledge promise whereby god dothe couenaunt wyth oure whiche sorte seeke good euell ye shall liue ye heareamos ye shall eate good thynges earth ye swoarde shal deuoure bicause lordes mouth hathe spoken itesa ier deu leu againe thow put awaie thine abhominations oute syghte shalte thou dryuen oute thou shalte obeye dylygently voyce lorde thy god obserue hys commaundementes whiche commaunde thee thys daye lorde thy god wyll set hye aboue nation earth lyke thei inconueniently wer mockerie thinke benefites whiche lorde dothe offer hys promise assigned oure owne wyll vnlesse v stablyshe make voyde ryght easye yt amplifie thys matter wyth eloquent complaintes lorde dothe cruelly mocke v pronounceth fauoure hangeth vpon oure wyll yf wyll oure power liberalitie god bee goodly thynge forsoothe yf hee sette benefytes v wee haue power vse merueylous assurednesse promyses whiche hange vpon thinge impossyble myghte neuer fulfylled suche promise haue condition adioined speake place shall plaine absurditie impossyble fullfyllynge muche concerneth place denye god dothe vngently mocke v moueth v deserue hys benefytes whome hee knoweth vtterly vnable whereas promyses offered faythefull wycked haue theyr vse wyth boothe sortes god wyth hys commaundementes prycketh consciens wycked shoulde swetely take pleasure theyr synnes wythout remembrance hys iudgementes promyses dothe manner take wytnesse howe vnwoorthye hys goodnesse canne denye moste ryghtfull conuenyente lorde good whome y honored punyshe despysers hys maiestye accordinge seueritie therefore god dothe well ordrely promyses hee adioyneth thys condytyon wicked bounde fetter synne shall onely enioye hys benefytes yf departe wyckednesse thys purpose onelye maye vnderstande woorthylye excluded thynges due true woorshyppers god againe bycause hee seeketh meanes styrre vp faythefull call vpon hys grace yt shall bee inconuenyente yf hee attempte thynge also promysses whyche wee haue shewed hee hathe donne greate profyte wyth commaundementes towarde beynge enfourmed wyll god hys commaundementes put minde miserie whiche withal heart farre dissent fro therwithal pricked forward call vpon spirite whereby may directed ryght waye sluggishnesse sufficientlie sharpened commaundementes added promise whiche certayne swetenesse may allure v loue desyre haue rightuousnesse may bee seruent seeke fauour god loe howe requestes wyll shall heare lorde neyther geueth v power wyll heare yet mocketh v want power thyrd sort argumentes hath also great affinitie twoo fourmer bryng fourth place wherein god reprocheth vnthankefull people sayeth selues onlye cause receyued tender loue kyndes good thyngesnum xiiij xliij whiche sorte place amaleck chananee whose swerde shall fal ye would obeye lorde called ye aunswered notier xxxij xiij wyll doe house silo agayne nation hath hearde voyce lorde god hathe receyued disciplineier xxxij therfore cast away lorde agayne ye haue hardened hearte would obey lord euilles happened vnto howe saye could suche reproches layde agaynst whiche myght redely aunswere v loued prosperitie feared aduersitie obteyne one auoyde obeyed lorde hearkened voyce cause therof lybertie doe subiect dominion synne uaynly therfore euylles layde charge power auoyde leuyng pretense necessitie wherein haue weake sickly defence aske whether purge selues fault founde gylty faulte lorde doeth without cause reproche came passe peruesnesse felt fruite clemencie let aunswere therfore whether denie theyr frawarde wyll cause theyr stubbournesse fynde spryng head euyll within selues gape fynde foreine cause myght seme haue bene authours owne destruction true owne faulte none others synners bothe depriued benefites god chastised punishementes great reason heare reproches mouthe god goe obstinatly forwarde faultes maye learne misery rather accuse abhorre owne wickednesse blame god vniust crueltie haue cast wyllyngnesse learne may wery theyr synnes deseruynges whereof see selues miserable vndone maye retourne waye acknowledge wyth earnest confession whyche lorde rehearseth chydynge whyche purpose appeareth solempne prayer danieldan ix whyche ninth chapter chydinges prophetes whiche alledged auayle godlye fyrst vse wee see example iewes whome hieremie commaunded declare cause misery wheras yet shold haue fallen otherwise lorde foresaideiere vijxxvij thou shalte speake vnto woordes shall heare thee thou shalte call shall aunswere thee ende thei singe deafe men beinge euen lothe vnwillynge yet thei sholde vnderstande true thei hearde wicked sacrilege thei shold lay vpon god ye blame euels rested selues fewe solution thou maist easily deliuer thy selfe infinite heape testimony whiche erecte image free enemy grace god wont gather together well oute commaundementes oute protestation againste professor laweps lxxviijviij psal lvvij reprochefully spoken psalme concerninge iewes frowarde generation haue made theyr hearte streight also psalme prophete exhorteth men hys age harden theyr heartes bycause faulte obstynacie remayneth peruersenesse men fondely gathered thereof hearte pliable either sideps cxix c ij preparinge whereof onely god prophet saith haue enclyned hearte keepe thy commaundementes bycause willingely cherefull earnest affection minde addycted himselfe god yet dothe boaste selfe bee author owne inclination confesseth psalme gyfte god therefore muste holde minde admonition paulephilip xij ddeth faithefull worke owne saluation feare trembling bicause lorde worketh bothe willinge perfourminge deede hee assigneth office doinge shoulde geue selues sluggyshnesse fleshe hee commaundeth haue feare carefullnesse humbleth may remembre thing whiche thei commaunded propre worke god wherein plainely expresseth faithefull woorke passiuely may call muche power ministred heauenij pet iv sholde cleame nothinge selues wherefore peter exhorteth v shoulde adde power fayth graunteth vnto v seconde office shoulde thynge seuerally oure selues onely awaketh slothefullnesse fleshe wherewyth commonlye fayth yt selfe choked purpose seemeth sayeinge paulei thes xix extinguyshe spirite slouthefullnesse dothe oftentimes crepe vpon fayethfull yf corrected butte yf manne conclude vpon yt y theyr owne choyse cheryshe lyghte beynge offred ignoraunce shall bee easily confuted bycause selfe dylygence paule requyrethij cor vij cometh onely god also oftentimes commaunded purge oure selues fylthynesse whereas holy ghoste claynte hym selfe alone offyce makynge holy fynally waye grauntynge thynge conueyed v proprely belongeth god playne woordes ihoni vxviij whosoeuer y god saueth hym selfe aduauncers freewyll take holde thys sayeinge yf wee saued partelye power god partely oure owne though wee heauen safe keeping wherof apostle maketh mention whiche causeioh x ijxv christ also praieth father saue v euill knowe godly whyle warre satan get victory armie weapon armure weapon godi pet ixxij wherfore peter commaunded v purifie soules obedience truthe addeth way correction holy ghoste finally man strength orce spirituall battelli ioh iijix iohn viiij iohn briefly sheweth sayth whiche begotte god sinne sede god abideth place randreth reason faith victory ouercometh worlde yet alleged testimonie lawe moses whiche semeth muche saluationdeut xxxxj publishing lawe protesteth vnto people maner commaundement commaude thee day hid thee neither far heauen hard thee thy mouthe thy hearte thou shouldest truely taken spoken bare comaundementes graut smal weight present matter though easy mocke saying spoken easinesse redinesse obseruation knowledge yet euen peraduenture would also leaue doubte apostle whiche doubtfull expositour taketh away doubte v whiche affirmeth moses spake doctrine ye gospell obstinate man wyll sayro xviij paul violently wrested wordes myght drawen gospell although boldenesse say shall without impietie yet sufficient matter beside authoritie apostle couince withal moses spake commaundementes puffed vp people moste vaine confidence el haue done throwen selues downe hedlonge taken vpo keping lawe owne strengthe thing heard ready easinesse keepe law accesse vnto hedlong fall destruction wherfore nothing certaine moses wordes meane couenant mercie publyshed together streight requiring lawedeut xxxviij fewe verse taught heartes must circumcised god may loue therfore placed ye easinesse wherof streightway speaketh strength man helpe succour holy ghost performeth worke mightely weakenesse albeit place simply vnderstanded commaundementes rather promise gospell whiche far stablyshing power v obteine righteousnesse vtterly ouerthrowe paule considering proueth testimonie saluation offred v gospell vnder hard impossible codition wherwith lawe dealeth v shall atteyne whiche haue fulfilled commaundementes vnder condition easy ready playne come vnto therfore testimony maketh nothyng chalenge freedome man also certayne place wonte obiected whereby shewed god sometime withdrawynge succour grace tryeth menne wayteth see ende applie theyr endeuoursosee vxiiij place osee goe place till putte heart seeke face fonde thyng saye yf lorde consider whether israell would seke face vnlesse mindes p able might theyr owne incline themselues one side though thinge commonly vsed god prophetes make shewe yf despise caste awaye people till haue amended life aduersaries gather suche threateninges meane gather people beyng forsaken god maye purpose owne saluation scripture shall crye agaynste doyng confesse grace god necessarie conuersion ryue wyth v graunt necessarie still haue man power preserued vnto howe proue truely place like one thyng departe aside manne loke doe beyng geuen ouer lefte selfe thyng helpe litle strength measure weakenesse manne saye doe manner speakyng meane aunswer muche effecte yf god sayde asmuche preuayle nothyng wyth stubborne people admonishyng exhortynge rebukynge withdrawe selfe sit e still suffer afflicted see yf length long misery wil begynne remember seke face lordes goynge farre awaye signifieth takynge awaye prophecie lookyng menne doe signifieth kepynge silence hidynge hym selfe dothe time exercise diuerse affliction bothe thynges dothe humble v shoulde soner bee dulled amended wyth scourge aduersitie vnlesse dyd frame v tractablenesse spirite nowe whereas lorde beyng offended manner weried obstinate stubbornnesse dothe time leaue v takynge awaye worde whyche wonte geue v certayne presence hym selfe dothe make profe would doe absence falsly gathered hereof strength freewill beholde trie asmuch doth end dryue v acknowledge owne beyng nothyng brynge also defence continuall manner speakyng vsed bothe scripture talke men good workes called oures lesse sayd doe thing holy pleasyng god commit sinnes sinnes iustly imputed v procedyng v truely righteous doynges also somwhat reason ought assigned vnto v reson sayd thinges doyng whereof beyng vnable owne motion moued god like sto e therefore though geue chiefe parte grace god yet maners speakyng shewe endeuour hath also yet seconde parte thyng onely still enforced good workes called oures would obiecte agaynemath vi bread called oures pray haue geuen v god gette title possession bountifulnesse nd free gifte god thyng becometh oures whiche otherwise due vnto v therefore eyther let laugh absurditie lordes prayer let recken laughed good workes called oures haue propertie liberalitie god somwhat stronger scripture oftentimes affirmeth selues worship god obey law applie good workes sithe duty properly belongyng minde howe could agree thinges referred holy ghost also attributed v vnlesse certaine co municating endeuour wt power god snare shal easily vnwinde selues wel consider manner spirit lord worketh holy one similitude wherewith enuiously presse v purpose fonde thinke mouing differeth nothing casting stone neither doth thing folow doctrine recken among natural power man allow refuse wil wil endeuour resist allowe vanitie refuse perfect goodnesse euell vnwillyng good endeuour selues wickednesse resist righteousnesse doth lord herein vse peruersnesse instrumet wrath directeth appointeth ende wil euell hande maye execute good worke shall compare wicked manne serueth power god laboreth obey owne lust stone beyng throwe violence caried neither mouing sense owne see much differece doth good thinges principal question whe erecteth kingdome spirit restrayneth man carried vp downe wanderyng lustes accordyng inclination nature may bent holinesse righteousnesse boweth frameth fashioneth directeth rule righteousnesse stomble fall doth stablish confirme strength spirit reason augustine sayth thou saye vnto wrought worke yea thou workest art wrought thou workest well whe thou art wrought good spirit god worketh thee helpeth worke geueth self name helper thou also workest somwhat firste parte teacheth man workyng taken awaye mouyng holy ghost bicause nature whiche ruled aspire goodnesse addeth name help may gathered also worke somwhat ought take geue thinge seuerally v bycause would cherish slouthfulnesse v matcheth working god oures wil may nature well grace therfore sayd litle unlesse god helpe v shal able ouercome yet fight hereby appereth grace god word take speake regeneration rule spirit direct gouerne manne gouerne vnlesse correct reforme renewe whense saye beginnyng regeneration oures might destroyed vnlesse moue stirre dryue forward carry hold whereupon truely saye al doynges procede wholly worke grace meane time denie true augustine teacheth destroyed grace rather repayred bothe thinges doe stand well together men sayd restored faultinesse peruersenesse thereof beyng reformed directed true rule iustice also newe sayde created manne asmuch defiled corrupted needeth vtterly put newe nature nowe cause contrarie maye well sayde doe thyng spirit god doth v although owne self geue v toward nothing may seuered grace therefore muste kepe minde haue el alledged augustine vayne trauayle finde manne good thinge proprely owne euer mixture men studie brynge strength free grace god nothing corruptyng manne would delay wine dirty bitter water although euer good manne procedeth mere instincte holy ghoste yet bicause naturally planted v whythout cause sayd thinges whereof god chalengeth prayse selfe firste bycause oures euer goodnesse worketh v vnderstand selues bycause minde oures oures endeuour oures whiche directed good testimony biside scrape togither shal much trouble euen meane whittes haue wel conceiued solution aboue sayd allege sayeng genesisgen ii thine appetite shalbe vnder thee thou shalt beare rule ouer whiche expound sinne yf lord promise cain force sinne shoulde get vpper hande minde yf would labour subduyng saye better agreeth order text taken spoken abel god purpose reproue wickednesse enuie cain conceyued brother doth two wayes one vayne imagined mischiefe excell brother god sight whome honour geuen vnto righteousnesse much vnthakful benefite god alredy receyued could abide brother although subiect vnder authoritie lest shoulde seme therefore embrace exposition bicause agaynst vslet v admitte god spake sinne god eyther promiseth commaundeth whiche declareth commaundeth haue alredy shewed thereby foloweth proofe power manne promiseth fulfillyng promise cain became subiecte sinne ouer whiche haue dominion saye promise included secrete condition yf ben sayd haue victorie yf would stryue receyue croked compass yf dominion meante sinne man doubte spoken way commaundement wherein determined able doe ought doe yea though aboue power albeit bothe matter selfe order grammer doe require comparison made cain abel bicause elder brother haue ben set behinde younger vnlesse become worse owne wicked doyng vse also testimonie apostle whiche sayth willethro ixxvi runneth god hath mercie whereby gather somewhat man endeuour whiche selfe though weake beyng holpen mercie god without prosperous successe soberly weye matter paule entreteth woulde vnaduisedly abuse sentence know may bryng forth origen hierome mainteiners expositio lib ad rom hiero dial p la could side set augustine thei haue thought maketh mater v know paule meante teacheth saluation prepared lord vouchsaueth graut mercie ruine destructio prepared al hath chosen vnder example pharao declared state reprobrate also cofirmed assurednesse free election testimonie moses haue mercie vpon whome haue mercie nowe concludeth thath willeth runneth god hath mercie thus vnderstanded endeuour ar sufficient bicause weake great weight whiche paule sayth ben aptly spoken therfore awaye suttelties saye willeth runneth therfore wil runing paules meaning simply thus runnyng get v waye saluation herein mercie god speaketh otherwise place doth titustit iijiiij writeth goodnesse kindenesse god appereh workes righteousnesse whiche haue done infinite mercie thei theselues yt make argument paul meant runing bicause saide yt willeth runneth would geue leaue reason fashion haue done good workes bicause paule sayeth haue atteined goodnesse god good workes haue done see fault argumet let open eye shal perceiue owne without like deceite epist ad vitale sure reason augustine resteth vpon therefore sayd willeth runneth bicause neyther runnyng sufficient maye turned contrarie parte mercie god bycause alone worketh sithe seconde absurditie augustine doth rightfully conclude spoken meanyng good man vnlesse prepared lord ought bothe wil runne bicause god worketh bothe v lesse vnaptly doe wreste sayeng paulei cor ii ix worker god whiche doubt ought restrayned minister called worker bryng thing themselues bycause god vseth seruice hath made mete furnished necessarie giftes bring forth ecclesiasticus whoe vnknowen writer whose authoritie doubted although refuse whiche yet maye lawfully doe doth testifie freewill sayetheccl xv xiiii man sone created lefte hande owne counsell commaundementes geuen obserued agayne preserued manne set life death good euell euer would geuen hym manne receyued creation power obteine eyther life death side aunswere loste truely minde speake agaynst salomon whiche affirmeth man beginnyng create vprighteccl vi xxx forged vnto himselfe many inuentions bycause manne swaruyng loste shipwrecke bothe selfe good thinges foloweth geuen firste creation belongeth nature beyng corrupted degenerate therefore answere onely also ecclesiasticus selfe euer thou meane instruct man seke within selfe power atteine saluation thy authoritie great force v maye preiudice neuer small vndoubted worde god thou studie restraine malice flesh whiche layeng blame owne euels vpon god vseth seke vayne defense selfe therefore thou answerest vprightnesse geuen vnto men whereby maye appere selfe cause owne destruction willingly agree vnto againe thou agree nowe owne faulte spoyled ornamentes wherewith god clothed beginnyng confesse together needeth physician defender yet haue nothing oftener mouth parable christ way faryng man whome theues layde abrode half dead waye paragraph know common almost writer calamitie mankynde represented vnder figure wayfaryng man thereupo aduersaries gather argumet man maymed robberie sinne deuell kepeth still remayning leauinges former good thinges asmuch said le half aliue half life vnlesse portion right reason remayned firste would geue place allegorie beseche wold doubt deuised father biside natural sense lordes wordes allegory ought goe haue rule scripture goyng far theselues sufficient ground doctrine want resons whereby liste ouerthrow deuise worde god leaueth man halfe life teacheth vtterly dead much concerneth blessed lifeeph iiv paule speaketh redemption doth say healed half dead half aliue raysed vp agayne dead calleth vpon halfe aliue receiue light christ slepe buried like maner speaketh lord selfe saythioh vxxv houre come dead shal rise againe voice face would set light allusio many playne sentence let allegorie haue force certayne testimonie yet shall wrynge v thereby manne halfe aliue therefore hath somewhat left safe graunt hath witte capable vnderstandyng although pearce heauenly spirituall wisedome hath true iudgement honestie hath felyng godhed howebeit atteine true knoweledge god purpose come thinges truely bryng passe sayeng augustine taken v whiche also approued comon consent scholes man fall freely geuen good thinges whereupon saluation hangeth take awaye naturall giftes corrupted defiled let therefore truthe remayne v vndoubted shaken engine minde man estranged righteousnesse god conceiueth coueteth enterpriseth wickednesse filthinesse vncleanesse mischiefe heart throughly soked poison sinne breath nothing corrupt stinke time doe vtter goodness showe yet still minde remayneth alwaye wrapped hypocrisie deceitefull crokednesse heart entangled inwarde peruersnesse sixte chapter p manne beyng loste must seke redemption christ sithe mankinde hath perisshed persone adam excellence nobilitie beginnyng haue spoke would litle profit v wold rather turne greater shame till god appere redemer person begotten sonne acknowlegeth men defiled corrupted sinne worke therefore sithe fallen life death al knowledge god creatour wherof haue entreated vnprofitable vnlesse folowed also faith setting forth god father vnto v christ truely natural order frame world schoole vnto v learne godlinesse whense might made passage v eternall life perfect felicite sin falling away whether euer turne eye vpward downeward curse god still presenteth self vnto sight whiche possesseth enwrappeth innocent creature fault muste needes ouerwhelme owne soules desperation although god wil fatherly fauor toward v stil many wayes appere yet beholding world canot gather father conscience inwardly pricketh v sheweth sinne iuste cause forsaking god accopt recken v child byside v slouthfulnesse vnthankefulnesse bicause mindes blinded see truthe also sens peruerse maliciously defraude god glorie therefore muste come sayeng paulei cor ixx bicause wisedome god world knewe god wisedome pleased god foolishnesse preachyng saue beleue wisedome god calleth honorable stage heauen earth furnished innumerable miracle beholdyng whereof ought wisely haue knowen god bicuase ill profited therein calleth v backe fayth christ whiche semeth foolish vnbeleuers doe disdayne wherfore although preaching crosse agree ma witte yet ought humbly embrace desire returne god creatour maker maye beginne agayne father truely sin fall first manne knoweledge god auayled saluationioh xviiiii without mediatour christe speaketh owne age comprehendeth age sayth eternal life know father one true god hath sent iesus christ much fowler sluggishnesse take vpon set open heaue prophane vnbeleuing men without grace scripture eche teacheth gate whereby entre saluation yf wil restraine sayeng christ publishing gospel haue redinesse wherwith confute hath ben comon sentence age among al nation without reconciliatio enstranged god prononced accursed child wrath please god maye also alleged yt christ answered woman samariaiohn iiixx ye worship ye know worship know bicause saluatio fro iewes wordes condeneth falshod religion gentile also assigneth reason redemer promised vnder lawe chosen people whereupon foloweth worship euer pleased godehp x whiche respect vnto christ whiche cause also paule affirmeth yt al nation gentile without god voide hope life nowe whereas iohn teacheth life beginnyng christ worlde fell muste nedes returne fountayne christ therefore christ much reconciler affirmeth selfe life truely inheritance heauen belongeth none child god mete accompted place degree child grafted body begotten sonne iohn plainely testifieth beleue name made child god bycause directly purpose yet discourse faith christ therefore shall time sufficient haue touched waye therefore god neuer shewed selfe mercifull olde people euer put hope grace without mediatour omit speake sacrifice lawe wherein faythfull openly plainely taught saluation el sought cleansing performed christ alone saye blessed happy state church hath ben alwaye grounded vpon persone christ though god comprehended issue abraham couenant yet doth paule wisely reasongal iiixvi christ proprely seede whome nation blessed asmuch knowe reckened seede begotten accordyng flesh speake nothing ismael howe came passe two sonnes isaac esau iacob brother borne one birth yet together mother wombe one chosen refused yea howe came passe elder reiected yoger toke place howe also came passe greater parte forsaken apppereth therefore seede abraham principally reckened one persone promised saluation neuer stande sure till came christe whose office gather together thinges scattred abrode therefore firste adoption chosen people hange vpon grace mediatour whiche though playne woordes expressed moses yet sufficiently appereth commonly knowen godly kyng create amonge people hanna mother samuel entreating felicitie godlyi sam x euen sayed thus song god shal geue strength king shall exalt horne anointed whych wordes meaneth god shal blesse church wherewith also agreeth oracle within little adioyned priest whome shall apoint shal walke myn anoynted neither doubted heauenly father haue liuely image christ seene dauid posteritieps x therefore meanyng exhorte godly feare god biddeth kisse sonneiohn vxxi wherewith sayeng gospel also agreeth honoreth sonne honoreth father therefore although fallyng awaye ten tribe kingdome decayed yet behoued couenant stande whiche god made dauid successorsi reg xi xi xxii also sayde prophetes altogether cut kingdome dauid seruauntes sake hierusalems sake whome haue chosen shall remayne one tribe thy sonne thing repeted second thirde time also expresly addedi king xixxxix king xv iii king xi xxxiiij afflict seede dauid euer within litle space time sayd dauid seruantes sake god hath geue light hierusalem rayse vp sonne kepe hierusalem sauetie state grew toward destruction said agayne god would scatter iuda dauid seruauntes sake bycause spoken would geue light sonnes euer finally summe beyng passed ouer dauid chosen vpon whome good pleasure god restps lxxviij lxlxvij place sayd hath refused tabernacle silo tabernacle ioseph hath chosen tribe ephraim hath chosen tribe iuda mount sion whiche hath loued hath chosen seruant dauid fede iacob people israell inheritance coclude pleased god saue church safetie preseruation thereof hange vpon one hed therefore dauid crieth lord strength people strength saluations christ addeth prayer saue thy people blesse thine inheritaunce meanyng state church vnseparable knot ioyned gouernement christ ye meaning placepsa xxx lord saue v let king heare v daye shall call vpon whiche wordes plainely teacheth faithfull vpon none confidence flee helpe god bycause hidden vnder succour kingps c xviijxxvxxvi whiche gathered psalme lord saue v blessed cometh name lorde playne enough faithfull called backe vnto christe maye hope shalbe saued hand god respect hath prayer churche calleth vpon mercie godpsal lxxxxviii let thy hand vpon man thy right hande vpo sonne man thou hast preserued apointed thy self though authour psalme bewaileth scattring abrode whole people yet prayeth restitutio hed alone people led awaye exile lande wasted thinges man seruyng destroyedlamet hieremie lamenteth ouerthrowe church doth principally complaine destruction kingdome al hope cut faithful father time lawe whome might direct fayth comfort promised affliction specially deliueraunce church described banner affiance hope auaunced christ alone god went sauyng people messiahhab ii xii sayth habacuc ofte prophetes make mention restoryng church call backe people promise made dauid concernyng euerlasting continuaunce kyngdome maruell otherwise ben assurance couenant whiche purpose serueth notable aunswere esaye sawe vnbeleuyng kyng achaz refused whiche declared raysing siege hierusalem present safetie sodenly passed ouer messiasesa vijxiiij beholde virgin shall conceyue brynge forth sonne meanyng indirectly though king people frowardenesse refused promise offred vnto though dyd purpose bende themselues discredite truthe god yet couenant voyde redemer shoulde come apoynted tyme finally care prophetes ende might shewe god would merci ull alwaye set kingedome dauid whereupon hanged redemption euerlastyng saluationesa lviij esaie saith make couenant faythfull mercy dauid beholde haue geuen witnesse vnto nation bycause faythfull state worste coulde otherwise haue hope meanes beyng witnesse god would appeasable toward themhier xxixvi likewise hieremie raise vp beyng despeire sayth beholde dayes come wherein rayse vp vnto dauid righteous branche shall iuda sauedeze xxxiiij xxiij israell shal dwell safetie ezechiel sayth wil rayse vp one shepeherd ouer shepe euen dauid seruant lorde god seruaunt dauid shepeherd make couenaunt peace also man placeeze xxxvij xxv entreated incredible reneweyng sayeth seruaunt dauid shalbe kynge shalbe one shepeherd ouer make euerlastynge couenaunt peace gather fewe place many bycause onely meane haue reders put mynde hope godly hath alwaye ben reposed el christe prophetes also speake agreably hereunto sayde oseeosee ixij child iuda child israell shalbe gathered together shall apoynt themselues one hed whiche afterwarde plainely expoundethose iijv child israel shall returne shal seke lord god dauid king michee speaking returne people expresly sayeth king shal goe lord hed amos meanyng prayse renewyng peopleamos ixxi sayth daye rayse vp tabernacle dauid fallen downe hedge vp gappes rayse vp place ouerthrowen euen bicause standard saluatio haue royal glory rise vp againe hie stock dauid whiche fulfilled christzac ixix therefore zacharie age nerer appering christe dothe plainely crie glad thou doughter sion reioyse thou doughter hierusale beholde thy king cometh righteous saued agreeth wt place psalme alleged lord strength saluations anoynted saue v saluation deriued hed whole body god wil haue iewes instructed prophecy seke deliuerance bende eye directly christ though shamefully swarued yet could remembrance general principle abolished god hand christ promised dauid would deliuerer church couenant shoulde owne free graunt wherby god adopted chosen hereby came passe song sounded mouth child christe litle death entred hierusalemmat xxi ix hosianna sonne dauid appereth comonly knowen spoken accordyng common vse songe pledge god mercie remayned vnto comyng redemer cause christ selfioh xiiiji make disciple plainely perfectly beleue god biddeth beleue self beleue ye god sayth beleue also though speake properly fayth climeth vp christ father yet meaneth faith albeit reste vpo god doth litle litle vanish away vnlesse become meane holde assured stedfastnesse otherwise maiestie god hie mortall menne whiche crepe vpon ground like wormes atteine vnto wherefore allowe common sayeng god obiecte fayth sorte nedeth correction bycause christ vaine called inuisible image godcolo ixv title put minde yf finde god christ saluation knowe vnto v although among iewes scribe pharisee darkened false inuentions prophetes spoken concernyng redemer yet christ toke thing confessed receiued common consent none remedie despered case meane deliueryng church geuyng mediatour deede commonly knowen amonge people ought haue benro x iiij whiche paule teacheth christ ende lawe howe true assured doth plainely appere lawe prophetes speake yet fayth bicause shalbe el conuenient place let reders holde faste stablished firste degree godlinesse acknoweledge god father vnto v defende gouerne cherishe v till gather v together euerlastyng inheritaunce kingedome hereby plainely appereth sayde euen nowe knowledge god bringeth saluation standeth without christ therefore beginnyng hath ben set forth vnto al elect loke vpon rest al affiance according meanyng writeth ireneus father whiche vnmesurable sonne measured bycause hath applied selfe measure capacitie least shuld drowne mindes vnmeasurablenesse glory whiche thing phrentike men consideryng wrest profitable sentence wicked fantasie though christ portion godhed deriued whole perfectioni iohn ij xxxi whereas meaneth nothing el god copreheded christ alone sayeug iohn hath alway ben true hath sonne neither hath father though old time many boste thei worshipped soueraigne god maker heauen earth yet bicause mediatour impossible truely taste mercie god persuaded father therefore bicause knew head christ ye knowledge god vayne among wherby also came passe length falling grosse filthy superstition bewrayed owne ignorace day turkes although report ful mouth creatour heauen earth god yet doe thrust idole place true god swarue christ seuenth chapter pthat lawe geuen holde still people nourish hope saluation christ vntill comyng continual processe haue rehearsed may gathered lawe added foure hundred yeres death abraham entent leade awaye chosen people fro christ rather kepe mindes expectation vntill comyng kindle desire confirme loking waxe faint wt long tarriance meane word law ten comaundementes prescribe rule liue godlyly righteously also forme religio deliuered hand moses moses made lawgeuer abolish blessyng promised kinred abraham rather see howe euery putteth iewes remembrance free couenant made father whose heires ben sent renewe plainely set forth ceremony vaine fond offer vp lothesome stinke fatte cattel reconcile theselues god thereby flee sprinkling water bloud wash away filthinesse finally al seruice god apointed lawe considered self conteine shadowes figure truthe answer vnto shalbe morkerie wherefore without cause bothe stephen sermonact v iiij epistle hebrewes place diligently weyedhebr viijv exod xxvxl god comaundeth moses make thinges perteinyng tabernacle according paterne ben shewed mout ben spiritual thing apointed tend vnto iewes shuld lesse haue fondly spent labour gentile trifle prophane men neuer earnestly applied studie godlinesse cannot without lothsome tediousnesse abide many sondry fashion vsages maruell god wearied people suche heape ceremony also despise scorne childrens playes cause consider ende fro figure law seuered muste needes condemned vanitie figure sheweth god therefore comaunde sacrifice bicause wold occupie worshipped earthly exercise rather raise vp mindes hier whiche may also plainely appere nature spirituall delited worshipping spiritual sayenges prophetes testifie wherein rebuke iewes sluggishnesse thei thought sacrifice value god bicause purpose derogate thing law accordyng true expositours lawe would meane haue men eye directed marke fro common people strayed grace offred iewes certainly gatheredexo xv law voide christ moses set forth vnto ende adoption become prestly kingdome god whiche coulde obieine vnlesse meane therof greater excellent recociliation bloud beastes lesse likely adam child inheritably descendyng infection al borne bondslaues sinne aduaunced royal dignitie become partaker glorie god vnlesse excellent benefite come vnto el themselues also could right priesthode remaine force among filthinesse sinnes abhominable god vnlesse ben consecrate holy head wherefore peter doth aptly turne sayeng moses teacheth fulnesse grace taste whereof iewes taken vnder lawi pet iji geuen christ ye sayeth chosen kinred kingly priesthode ende tendeth turnynge wordes shewe whome christ appered gospell haue obteined father bicause endued bothe priestly kingly honour trustyng vpon mediatour maye freely bolde come forth sight god waye noted kingdome whiche length erected house dauid part law conteined vnder ministerie moses wherupon foloweth yt well kinred leuites posteritie dauid christ set ore eye olde people doble loking glasse sayd euen could otherwise god eyther kinges priestes bondslaues sinne death defiled owne corruptio hereby appereth yt yt sayeng paule moste truegal iii xxiii iewes holden vnder keping scholemaister til sede came whose sake promise geuen bicause christ yet familiarly knowen like vnto child whose weakenesse could yet beare full knowledge heauenly thinges thei ceremony led hand christ spoke may better vnderstand many testimony prophetes although comaunded come dayly newe sacrifice appease god yet esaye promiseth al sinnes shalbe cleansed one sacrificeesa liij wherewith daniel agreably sayethdaniel ix priestes apointed tribe leui enter sanctuarie ye priest one sayd yt othe chosen god priest euerps cxiiij according order melchisedech time ye anointing oyle visible daniel vision pronouceth shal manner anointyng bicause tarry vpon many example authour epistle hebrewes eue iiij chapter xi doth largely plainely enough shew ceremony nothing worth vaine til come christ concerning ten comaundementesrom xiiij lesson paule likewise kept minde christ ende law vnto saluation euery one beleuethij cor iijvi lesson christ spirit quickeneth letter whiche selfe slayeth first two meaneth righteousnesse vainely taught commaundementes vntill christ doe geue bothe free imputation spirite regeneration wherefore worthyly calleth christ fulfilling ende law bycause nothing profit v knowe god requyreth v vnlesse succour v faynting oppressed vnder yoke vntolerable burden place teacheth lawe made transgressionsgal jxix bryng menne humilitie beyng proued gilty theyr owne damnation bycause true preparation seke christ euer teacheth diuerse wordes al well agree together bicause contentio peruerse teacher fained deserue righteousnesse workes law confute errour compelled somtime speake precisely bare lawe whiche yet otherwise clothed couenant free adoption good know taught morall law made inexcusable owne giltynesse maye moue v craue pardon true taught perfectio rightousnesse lawe also followeth absolute keping thereof perfect righteousnesse god whereby man maye demed accompted righteous heauenly throne iudgementdeut xxxxix wherfore moses published ye law doubted protest heauen earth set israell life death good euell maye denie reward eternal saluation belongeth vpright obedience lawe lord hath promised agayne yet good examine whether performe obedience vpon desert whereof may conceiue trust reward small purpose see rewarde eternall life set kepynge lawe vnlesse knowe whether maye waye attaine eternall life herein weakenesse law doth shewe selfe bycause kepyng law founde none v al excluded promise life doe fall curse onely doe nowe tell doth come passe needes muste come passe doctrine lawe far aboue power manne maye deede far loke promise yet gather fruite therefore one thing remayneth goodnesse may better weye owne miserie considereth hope saluation beyng cut death dothe certainely hag ouer side presse v terrible penal lawes holde entagled fast bound v euery one without exceptio presse v say pursue v vnappeasable rigour may se present death law therfore loke vpo lawe nothing discouraged confounded despeire asmuch al damned cursed kept far blessednesse offreth worship wilt thou say doth lord mock v finally doth differ mocking shewe forth hope felicitie allure exhort men vnto protest layed open v whe ye meane season entrie vnto forclosed impossible come answere although promisses lawe much conditional hang vpon perfect obedience ye law found yet geuen vaine haue lerned shalbe voide effect vnto v vnlesse god embrace v wt free goodnesse without regarde workes vnlesse embrace faith goodnesse geue v gospel want effectualnesse yea condition annexed doth freely geue al thing vnto v addeth also heape bountifulnesse yt refusing half ful obedience remitting much wanteth ful performance maketh v enioy frute promise law selues fulfilled codytion wil preset procede matter bicause shalbe largely entreated shal speake iustificatio faith wheras sayd impossible kepe law wordes expounded proued wont among people commonly accompted opinion great absurditie far hierome doubted pronouce accursed hierome thought doe nothing staye vpon v let v searche truthe make longe circumstance diuerse sortes possibility call impossible neuer ben also hindered ordinance decree god neuer herafter maye recorde farthest time memorie saye hath none holy beyng clothed bodie death hath euer atteyned full perfection loue loue god heart al minde al soule power againe hath ben none hath ben troubled concupiscence saye naye see deede maner holy men foolish superstition doth imagine vnto v euen whose purenesse heauenly angel scarcely counteruaile bothe scripture profe experience saye also shall none herafter shall come marke true perfection vnlesse loosed burden bodye point open testimony scripturei reg vii xl p cxliij salomon said righteous vpon earth sinneth dauid sayd euery liuing manne shal iustified thy sight iob many place affirmeth ye paul plainly allgal flesh lusteth agaynste spirit spirit flesh reson proueth vnder law subject curse bycause writtend xx xxvi cursed al doe abide al comaundementes therof meanyng rather taking thing confessed man abide soeuer forespoke scripture must holden perpetual yea necessarie sutteltie pelagians trouble augustine sayeng wrong done god say doth comaund tha faithful able grace performe augustine auoide cauillation cofessed lib de tu gra lord might deede wold aduauce mortal man purenesse angel neither hath done time wil bicause hath otherwise affirmed scripture yt also denie adde incoueniet dispute power truthe therfore sentence subiect cauillations man saye thing impossible wherof scripture pronounce shal thei dispute word disciple asked ye lordmat xixxiv de se ritu litera may saued answered men deede impossible god al thing possible also augustine strog reason stiffly defendeth flesh neuer yelde god due loue owe loue saith foloweth knowledge man perfectly loue god hath first fully knowe goodnesse wader world see glasse darke speach foloweth therfore loue vnperfect let therefore remaine controuersie flesh impossible fulfil lawro viij behold weakenesse owne nature shal yet also place proued paule whole mater may plainly set forth let v compendious order gather vp together office vse lawe cal morall far vnderstand coteined three partes first sheweth euery man righteousnesse god ye righteousnesse acceptable god admonish certifie proue gilty yea condemne euery owne vnrightousnesse nedeful yt man blinded dronke loue driuen knowledge confession weakenesse vncleannesse asmuch vanitie euidently conuinced swelleth mad affiance owne strength neuer brought think scledernesse therof long measureth proportion owne wil sone beginneth copare stregth hardnesse ye lawe findeth matter abate courage euer conceiued great opinion yet feleth pante vnder great burden shake folter laste euen fall downe faint taught scholing lawe putteth arrogacie wherwith blinded likewise healed disease pride wherof haue said sick long suffred stand iudgemet deuiseth hypo e stede rightousnesse wherwith beyng coteted riseth vp courage whote forged rightousnesses ye grace god soue copelled trie life balaunce law leauing presumption yt counterfait righteousnesse seeth infinite space distat fro holinesse againe floweth full infinite vice wherof seemed cleane euels luste hidden deepe crooked priuie corner easily deceiue sighte manrom lxjvij withoute cause apostle saith yt knew luste except ye lawe saide thou shalte luste bicause except lawe disclosed lurking hole destroyeth miserable manne secretly feeleth deadly darte thereof lawe like certaine lookinge glasse wherein beholde fyrste oure weakenesse oure wickednesse laste boothe oure accursednesse euen glasse representeth vnto v spottes face power fayleth man folowe righteousnesse muste needes sticke faste myre synnes sinne foloweth curse muche ye greater transgressio lawe holdeth v gyltye conuicte muche greuous iudgemente condemneth vsrom xijx j purpose maketh sayenge apostle lawe knoweledge synne ther speaketh onely fyrste office lawe proofe wherof synners yet regenerate like twoo sayenges lawe entred synne mighte abounde therefore ministration deathe worketh wrathe slayethrom vxx ii cor rom iiijxv without doubt muche groweth iniquitie muche vnderstandynge synne conscience striken bycause vnto breache lawe added obstinacie againste maker lawe foloweth therfore lawe armeth wrathe god destruction synner bicause selfe nothinge accuse condemne destroy de corre gratiae vide ambros cap de iae uita beata cap augustine writeth spirite grace absente lawe presente v onely thys ende accuse v kyll v yet thys sayde neyther lawe dishonored thereby thinge taken excellence thereof truely yf oure wholy framed disposed obedience lawe plainly onely knoweledge sufficient saluacion asmuche oure fleshely corrupte nature fighteth enemie spirituall lawe god nothinge amended ye dyscipline therof foloweth lawe whiche geuen saluacion founde fitte hearer tourneth occasion sinne death sithe proued transgressours plainly yt openeth righteousnesse god muche ye side discloseth oure iniquitie ye surely ye confirmeth rewarde life saluacion laide vp ryghteousnesse muche assured maketh destruction wicked farre therefore sayinges shoulde dishonoure lawe muche auaile glorious commendation godes bountie truely herby appeareth hindered oure owne wickednesse peruersenesse enioye blessednesse life set openly abroade v lawe wherby grace god helpeth v without ye succoure ye lawe made much sweter mercie louely geueth vnto v whereby learne hee neuer wearied often doinge v good heapinge newe giftes vpon v whereas iniquitie condemnation v sealed testimonie lawe done thys purpose leaste well profyte make v fall downe despere discouraged mindes tumble hedlong deede reprobate amased manner butte y reason theyr obstinatie chyldren god behoueth ende instruction graunterom iijxx apostle testifyeth condemned iudgemente lawe euery mouthe maye stopped woorlde maye become bounde vnto god yet apostle place teachethrom xixxxij god hath concluded vnder vnbeleife destroye suffer perishe butte hee myghte haue mercye leuinge foolishe opinion owne strength thei myghte vnderstande stande vpholden onely hande god beynge naked emptye maye flee hys mercye maye rest selues wholly vpon hyde selues wholly take holde yt alone steede righteousnesse merites whyche layed open christe menne soeuer bee wyth true faythe desyre looke yt god commaundementes lawe appeareth butte rewarder perfecte ryghteousnesse whereof destitute syde rygorous iudge euell doynges christe hys face shyneth full grace lenitye euen towarde wreatched vnwoorthy synners profytynge craue grace hys helpe augustine speaketh ofte epist hee wryteth hylarie lawe commaundeth endeuorynge doe thynges commaunded beynge wearyed oure weakenesse vnder lawe wee shoulde learne aske helpe grace epist agayne aselius profyte lawe conuince manne hys owne weakenesse compell hym craue physycke grace y christe epist agayne innocente rome lawe commaundeth grace mynystreth strengthe againe ualentine libro de corre gratia psal psal god commaundeth thynges wee canne doe wee maye learne knowe aske hym agayne lawe geuen accuse beynge accused shoulde feare fearinge shoulde craue pardon presume owne strengthes againe lawe geuen purpose greate make lyttle shewe thou haste strengthe thyne owne ryghteousnesse thou poore vnwoorthy needye shouldest flee vnto grace serm hee tourneth hys speache god saythe lorde mercyfull lorde commaunde canne bee fullfylled yea commaunde whyche canne thy grace bee fullfylled menne canne fullfyll yt theyr owne strengthe euerye mouthe maye bee stopped manne maye thynke hym selfe greate let bee lyttle one lette woorlde bee gyltye thee wyse heape vp manye testimony sythe holly manne hathe wrytten booke proprely matter whyche hee hathe intituled spirite letter seconde profytynge hee dothe lyuely descrybe eyther bycause hee knewe yt dyd hange vpon former bycause hee dyd well vnderstande bycause hee wanted woordes wyth dystinctely playnely expresse hys meaninge whiche yet rightly conceyued firste office lawe idle euen reprobate also thoughe goe thus farre forwarde child god throwinge downe fleshe bee renued florishe againe inwarde man amased firste terroure lie still desperation yet serueth shewe fourth equytie god iudgemente conscience tossed suche wayes euer wyllingely desire make shyfte agaynste iudgemente god nowe yet opened yet astonyshed testimonie lawe conscience bewraie selues haue deserued second office lawe thei whiche touched care whiche iuste right vnlesse thei compelled whe heare terrible penall ordinaunces therein may restrayned least feare punishement thei restrained bycause inwarde minde moued affected withall bicause beynge brideled thei withholde hande outwarde worke kepe peruersenesse within whiche otherwise thei woulde haue outragiously poured oute thereby become truelye nether better ye righteous god although beinge letted either feare shame thei dare put practise thei haue conceiued minde openly blowe abrode rage lust yet haue thei hearte framed feare obedience god yea thei holde backe themselues much stronglier within thei kindeled thei burne thei boyle redy thinge breake fourth whether terroure lawe staye onely also thei moste spitefully hate lawe detest god lawemaker yf coulde thei woulde faine take awaie whome thei canne abide neither commaundeth rightfull thinges reuengeth vpon despisers maiestie deede darkely plainely generally yt regenerate feelinge thei drawen folowinge lawe willinge submission resisting willes violence feare constrained enforced righteousnesse necessarie publike common state men quiet wherof herein prouided ordre taken thinges co founded vprore whiche woulde come passe thinges lawefull men yea vnprofitable chyldren god bee exercised wyth thys schoolynge longe theyr callynge beynge yet destytute spyrite sanctification styll wanton follye fleshe drawen backe though outward licentiousnesse terroure god vengeance although thei yet tamed minde thei goe present time little forwarde yet thei partely growe vre beare yooke christe thei called altogether rude rawe dysciplyne thynge vnknowen thys offyce apostle seemeth proprely haue touchedi tim iix hee sayeth lawe sette ryghteous manne butte vnryghteous dysobedient wicked synners euell doer prophane men slaiers parentes murtherers fornicator sodomite robber child lyers periured men soeuer ell againste sounde doctrine sayeth staye wylde outragynge lustes fleshe ell woulde straye abroade without measure bothe maye bee applyed whyche hee saythe placegal iii xx iii lawe iewes schoolemayster christe twoo sortes menne whome wyth schoolynge shee leadeth hande christe one sorte whome wee fyrste spake bycause full affyance theyr owne strengthe ryghteousnesse meete receiue grace christe vnlesse bee fyrste emptyed therefore lawe bryngeth downe humilitie knoweledge selues maye bee prepared desyre whyche thoughte thei wanted sorte neede brydle holden backe leaste geue loose remes wantonnesse theyr fleshe fall alltogether studye ryghteousnesse spyryte god doth yet gouerne sometime lustes boile yt greate perille leaste thei throwe downe soule subiecte forgetfullnesse despisinge god wolde come passe god remedie prouide therefore hee hathe apoynted inheritaunce kyngedome yf regenerate keepeth workes lawe vnder feare vntyl tyme visitation chaste pure feare ought chyldren yet profitable feare may according capacitie taught introduction true godlynesse thys haue many proues needeth example soeuer haue tyme contynued knowynge god wyll confesse happened vnto holden brydle lawe feare obedience god vntil time beinge regenerate hys spirite beganne hartelye loue hym thirde vse whiche also principall vse nearely loketh vnto propre ende law concerneth faithful whose heartes allready lyueth reigneth spirite god although haue lawe wrytten grauen heartes finger god saye affectioned mynded direction spirite thei desire obeye god yet doe still twoo way profite lawe verye good meane wherby maie dayly better assuredly learne lord whyche aspyre vnto maye bee confyrmed vnderstandynge thereof seruaunt already bente affection hys hearte please hys lorde yet hathe hee neede dylygentelye searche oute marke fashion hys lorde hee maye frame applye hym selfe vnto lette none v exempte hym selfe thys neede manne hathe hetherto attained greate wysedome hee may dayly instruction lawe gette newe profyte proceedynge purer knoweledge godes wyll bicause wee neede onely doctrine also exhortation thys profite shall seruaunt god take lawe often meditation thereof stirred vp obedience strenghthened holden backe slyppery waye offendinge thys manner muste holly one dryue forwarde selues whyche wyth howe greate cherefullnesse euer trauayle godwarde accordynge spirite yet thei alwaye loden sluggyshnesse ye fleshe procede wyth suche ful redinesse thei oughte thys fleshe lawe geuen whyppe lyke slowe dull asse yt maye prycked forwarde worke yea spirituall manne bycause hee yet dyspatched burden fleshe yt shall bee continuall pricke suffcreth hym stande styllpsal xixvi euen thys vse dauid hadde respecte hee dyd sette fourth lawe notable praise lawe lorde y vndefiled conuertynge soules iustices lorde vpryghte chearynge heartes commaundemente lorde y bryghte geueth lyghte eye c agayne launterne feete y thy woorde lyghte vnto pathes innumerable hee reherseth psalme neyther thynges agaynste sayinges paulepsal c xix c v wherein v shewed vse lawe mynystreth regenerate butte yt y able geue manne yt selfe butte prophete reporteth wyth howe greate profyte lorde doothe instructe readynge hys lawe whome hee inwardely inspyreth readynesse obeye hee taketh holde commaundementes onely butte also promyse grace annexed thynges whyche onely maketh bytternesse ware sweete lesse ameable lawe yf yt shoulde onely wyth requyringe threateninge trouble soules carefully wyth feare vexe wyth terroure butte specially dauid sheweth hee lawe conceyued mediatoure wythoute whome y delyte sweetenesse whyche whyle vnskyllfull menne canne discerne boldely shake awaye moses bydde two table lawe farrewell bycause thynke yt y agreable christyans cleaue doctrine conteyneth minustration deathe lette thys prophane opynyon departe farre oute oure myndes moses taughte excellently well lawe whyche wyth synners canne engendre nothynge butte deathe oughte holly haue better excellente vse thus hee reddy dyedeut xxxi vi hee openly sayde people laye youre heartes vpon woordes doe testyfye youe thys daye ye maye commytte youre chyldren ye maye teache keepe doe fullfyll thynges wrytten volume thys lawe bycause vaynely commaunded butte euerye one shoulde lyue butte yf manne canne denye appeareth yt absolute paterne ryghteousnesse eyther wee muste haue rule lyue iustely vpryghtely el yt y lawefull v departe yt manye butte one rule lyfe whyche y perpetuall canne bee bowed therefore whereas dauid maketh lyfe ryghteous manne continually busied meditation lawe let v referre one age onelypsal bycause moste meete age cude woorlde lette v therefore frayed awaye flee beynge instructed bycause yt appoynteth muche exacte holynesse shall perfourme whyl wee shall carry parson bodie nowe yt executeth v office rygorous exacter wyll satysfyed wyth hys full taske perfourmed butte thys perfection vnto exhorteth v sheweth v marke towarde whyche oure lyfe endeuoure lesse profitable v agreable wyth oure dutie whyche endeuoure fa le well thys lyfe y race space whereof beynge runne cute lorde wyll graunte v atteine marke towarde whyche endeuoures trauaile farre nowe therefore whereas lawe hathe towarde faythfull power exhorte suche power maye bynde theyr conscience curse butte suche wyth often callynge maye shake sluggyshnesse pynche imperfection awake many thei meane expresse thys delyueraunce curse thereof saye lawe abrogate faythfull speake yet lawe moral dothe commaunde whyche ryghte butte onely vnto whych makynge afrayde confoundynge conscience damne destroye truely suche abrogation lawe paule dothe plainely teache also lorde himselfe spake appeareth thys woulde haue confuted opinion shoulde dissolue lawemat vxvi vnlesse hadde commonly receyued amonge iewes butte forasmuche could ryse causelessly wythoute coloure lykely grewe vpon false vnderstandynge hys doctryne manner erroures wonte take occasion truthe leaste shoulde also stumble stone let v dylygently make distinction abrogate lawe remayneth yet force lorde protesteth came destroye lawe butte fullfill yt till heauen earthe passe awaie one iote lawe sholde passe awaye butte shoulde fullfylled sufficiently confyuneth hys comminge nothinge shoulde taken awaye keepinge lawe good cause sithe came rather ende heale offence wherefore doctrine lawe remayneth christian inuiolable teachynge admonyshynge rebukynge correctynge maye frame prepare v euerye good woorke thynges paule speaketh curse euident belonge verye instruction butte onely force byndynge conscience lawe onely teacheth butte also wyth authoritie requyreth whyche yt commaundeth yt perfourmed yea yf duetye stacked parte bendeth thunderboulte curse al iijx xxvijxxvj thys cause apostle sayth woorkes lawe subiecte curse bycause wrytten cursed euery one fullfylleth sayeth vnder woorkes lawe sette ryghteousnesse forgeuenesse synnes whyche loosed rigoure lawe teacheth therefore muste bee loosed bondes lawe vnlesse wyll miserablye peryshe vnder bondes bondes rigerous sharpe exactinge releaseth nothing extremitie lawe suffereth offense vnpunished curse saye christe mighte redeeme v made curse v wrytten cursed euery one hangeth vpon treega iij iij iiiiiiiii deut xxixxii capter folowinge deede sayth christe made subiecte lawe redeeme vnder lawe one meanynge addeth adoption mighte receiue righte child shoulde oppressed wyth perpetuall bondage shoulde holde oure conscience fast strained anguishe death meane tyme thys alwaye remaineth vnshaken nothinge withdrawen authoritie lawe oughte styll bee receyued v wyth reuerence obedience ceremony otherwise whiche abrogate effecte vse onely christe hys commynge hathe made ende doth thing diminish holynesse rather setteth fourth maket glorious shold haue geuen vaine shewe olde people vnlesse power deathe resurrection christe beene shewed therein hadde cessed wee coulde daye discerne purpose ordeyned therefore paule proue keepinge nowe onely superfluous also hurtefull teacheeh weare shadowes whereof wee haue bodye christecolos iixvii see therefore howe abolishinge trueth shyneth better still farre veile spred shewe figure christe hathe already playnelye appearedmat xxv ii therefore veile temple deathe christe torne twoo peeces fell downe bycause nowe true expresse image heauenly good thynges come lyghte whyche vnperfectly begonne wyth darke rude draughtes authore epistle hebrues saytheheb xi luc xvixxvi herevnto serueth sayeng christe lawe prophetes vnto tyme ihon tune forwarde kyngdome god beganne bee ioyefully preached meaninge holy father without preachynge conteyneth hope saluation eternall lyfe bicause farre vnder shadowes onely dyd beholde whiche wee thys daye see full lyghte behoued churche god shoulde clymbe vp hyer firste instruction ihon baptist declareth lawe geuen mosesiho ixv grace truth beganne iesus chirste althoughe purginge sinnes truely promised olde sacrifice arke couenant sure pledge fatherly fauoure god yet shadowe ben grounded vpon grace christe wherin sounde perfect eternal stedfastnesse let remaine sure yt although ye ceremonial vsages ye lawe haue cessed obserued yet ye ende yt better knowen great ye profite christes co minge wyth takinge awaye vse hathe sealed force effecte deathe somwhat harde point paule noteth hath renued together himcoloss iixii ye deade sinnes vncircumcision fleshe forgeuinge offence blotting handwriting remained ye decree v whyche contrarie vnto v hath taken awaye fastninge crosse c seemeth stretche abolyshinge lawe nowe haue nothing decree therof thei erre expond onely lawe morall whose vnappeassable rigoure rather doctrine thereof thei thinke taken away deepely weying wordes paule espie proprely spoken lawe ceremoniall doe shewe worde deuill doth one signifie paule ephesian saith thus peaceep ixiiij maketh one yt maketh voide law comaundementes consistinge ye decree yt might make two himselfe one new man doubt speaketh ther ceremony calleth partition wherwith iewes seuered gentile wherefore graunt first expositor rightfully reproued yet mee thinkes sufficientlye well set fourth minde apostle like haue two place compared together pointes purpose aduertise ephesian adoption felowship israel teacheth yt stoppe taken awaye whereby tyme kepte asunder ceremony vsages washinges sacrifice wherewith iewes made holy vnto lorde seuer gentile epistle colossian whoe seeth oucheth hyer misterie deede point disputation ther mosaicall obseruations whervnto false apostle laboure driue christian people epistle galatian fetcheth controuersie wer bringeth back first heade therof doth also place ye ceremony consider nothing el necessitie yt vse purpose call handwriting v moreouer set whole summe manner redemption shold ca celled wherefore matter selfe trieth secret thing considered truste haue atteined naturall vnderstandinge leaste graunted bee true one place truli written augustine yea hath taken plaine wordes apostle iewish ceremony rather confession cleansinge sinnesheb vii ix x thei ell sacrifice confesse selues conscience gylty death put cleansinges place thei cleansinges testifie selues vncleane handwriting sinne vncleannesse oft renewed ther discharge testifying thereof whyche cause apostle writeth lengthe meane deathe christeheb ixxv perfourmed redemption offence remayned vnder olde testamente therefore apostle dothe woorthyly call handwritinges againste obserue asmuch ther openly ale owne damnation vncleannesse hindereth also partaker grace v obteyned chryste ceremony whyche apostle dothe seuer christe bicause time vsed obscure glorie christe thus learn ceremony consydered selues well fittly called handwrytynges againste saluation men bicause solemne instrumentes testified beinge bounde false apostle wente aboute binde christian churche againe paule withoute cause admonyshe coloss au fetchinge signification poynte thei shoulde fall backe agayne suffered selues sorte yoked withall benefite christ wrested awaie muche hauinge one perfourmed eternall clensinge hathe vtterly abolyshed dayly obseruations whiche onely force seale sinnes coulde nothing puttinge awaye eyghte chapter exposition morall lawe thinke shall bee purpose enterlace ten commaundementes lawe wyth shorte exposition bycause thereby shall better appeare haue touched keping whiche god hathe one appoynted remaineth yet force also shall haue besides profe seconde poynte iewes dyd onely learne true force godlines also ye terroure ye iudgement syth thei sawe selues vnable keepe compelled whether woulde drawen mediatore nowe setting forth sume thofe thinges requyred true knowledge god wee haue already taught conceyue hym accordynge hys greatnesse butte maiestie presenteth selfe vnto v binde v worship knowledge selues haue set chiefe pointe beynge voyde opinion oure owne strength cleane stripped truste owne righteousnesse side discouraged beaten downe wyth conscience owne needynesse shoulde learne perfect humilitie abacement oure selues lorde setteth fourth bothe poyntes lawe firste chalenging himselfe due power gouerne hee calleth v reuerence hys diuine maiestie appoynteth oute vnto v wherein standeth consisteth publyshyng rule righteousnesse againste righteousnesse oure nature yt y peruerse croked doth alway striue beneth ye perfectio wherof power selfe weake feble good lieth great way bylowe reproueth v weakenesse vnrighteousnesse moreouer inwarde lawe whyche haue beforesaide bee grauen imprinted heartes men doth certaine manner enforme v thinges learned two table oure conscience doth suffer v stepe perpetuall slepe withoute feelynge inwardly wytnesse admonysher thynges owe god layeth v difference good euell accuseth v swarue oure dutie manne beinge wrapped darkenesse erroures scarse euen sclenderly tasteth lawe nature worship pleaseth god truly farre distante righte knoweledge thereof byside hee swollen arrogancie ambition blinded selfeloue yt yet loke vpon wer descende learne submitte humble himselfe confesse owne myserie therfore necessarie bothe oure dulnesse stubbornesse lorde hathe set v lawe wrytten whyche shoulde bothe certainely testifie whyche lawe naturall obscure also shoulde shake awaye oure drousenesse liuely touche oure mynde remembrance nowe easye vnderstande learned lawe god oure creatoure ryght hathe place oure father lorde thys reason owe glorie reuerence loue feare yea also oure owne lyberty folowe whether soeuer luste oure minde doth moue v oughte hange vpon hys backe reste onely vpon whyche pleaseth hym learne deliteth ryghteousnesse vpryghtnesse abhorreth wyckednesse therfore vnlesse wyll wyth wycked vnthankfullnesse fall awaye oure creatoure wee muste necessarily obserne ryghteousnesse oure life longe onely yelde vnto reuerence owe preferre oure owne foloweth due worship obseruation righteousnesse holynesse cleannesse neither maye pretende excuse wee wante power lyke wasted detters able paye conueniente wee shoulde measure glorye god oure owne power whatsoeuer bee alwaye abydeth lyke hym selfe louer ryghteousnesse hater wickedesse whatsoeuer requyreth v bycause ca ne requyre nothynge butte whyche ryghte bonde nature muste necessitie obey able oure owne faulte holden bounde oure owne luste wherein sinne reighneth loose libertie obey oure father cause shoulde allege necessitie oure defense euell whereof bothe within v imputed vnto oure selues haue thus farre profited teaching lawe muste teachinge lawe also descend vnto ourselues whereby lengthe may carry away two thynges firste comparing ye righteousnesse ye law life learne yt farr able satisfie ye god yt therfore worthy haue place among creatoures much lesse reckned among child second considering oure strength learn yt onli insufficiet fulfil ye law also vtterli none al hervpon foloweth bothe distruste oure owne strength care fearefullnesse mynde conscience canne beare burden iniquitie iudgement god present iudgemente god canne bee felte butte stryketh v dreadefull horroure deathe lykewise beynge constrained wyth proues owne weakenesse canne choose butte fall despere owne strength affection engendre humilitie abatemente courage lengthe commeth passe man made afrayde wyth felinge eternall death seeth hange ouer deseruinge vnrighteousnesse turneth hym selfe onely mercy god onely hauen saluation feelynge hys power paye oweth vnto lawe desperinge hym selfe hee maye take breathe againe beginne craue looke helpe el butte lorde contented haue procured reuerence hys righteousnesse hathe also added promyses threatnynges fyll oure heartes wyth loue hym wyth hatred wyckednesse bicause oure mynde blynde moued onely beautie goodnesse pleased mooste mercyfull father hys tendre kyndnesse allure v wyth sweetenesse rewardes loue longe hym pronounceth therefore wyth hym rewardes layed vp vertue hee shall spende laboure vayne whosoeuer bee shall obey hys commaundementes hee proclameth syde hee onely abhorreth vnryghtcousnesse also shall escape vnpunyshed hee wyll bee reuenger contempte hys maiestie exhorte v meanes hee promyseth well blessinges thys present lyfe also eternall blessednesse obedience keepe commaundementes transgressor therof threateneth bothe present misery punyshmente eternal death promise doth thyngesleu xvi v shall liue also threatenynge aunswereth soule synneth shall dye doe wythoute doubte belonge immortalitie deathe comeeze xviijiiii xx shall neuer ended wheresoeuer mentioned good wyll wrathe god vnder one contained eternitie lyfe vnder eternall destruction present blessynges curse longe regyster rehersed laweleu xxviiiii xxvii penall ordinaunces appeareth soueraigne cleannesse god suffer iniquitie promise byside greate loue righteousnesse finde hearte defraude rewarde ther also proued merueilous bountifullnesse wheras oures indetted vnto maiestie good ryght whatsoeuer requyreth v demaundeth due det payment det worthy rewarde therfore departeth owne right offereth rewarde oure obedience yelde oure selues thinges yt due promise bring vnto v partly said alreadye partly shall appeare plainely place fitte sufficeth present remembre consyder promysses lawe small commendation ryghteousnesse maye certainely appeare howe muche keepynge thereof pleaseth god penall ordinaunces set forthe detestation vnryghteousnesse leaste synner delited swete flatteringes vyces sholde forget iudgment lawemaker prepared hym nowe whereas lorde geuynge rule perfecte ryghteousnesse hathe applyed partes thereof hys owne wyll therein declared nothynge hym acceptable obedyence whiche muche diligently marked wantonnesse man mynde ready deuyse nowe dyuerse sortes worshyppinge winne fauoure wythall age irreligious affectation religion bycause naturally planted witte manne hath shewed yet dothe shewe fourthe selfe menne alwaye delyte inuente waye obtayne ryghteousnesse bysyde woorde god whereby commeth passe commaundementes lawe haue small place amonge woorkes commonly called good woorkes innumerable rate mennes woorkes occupyeth allmoste roome thynge meante moses restraine suche lycentiousnessedeut x viij publyshynge lawe hee spake thus people geue heede heare thynges commaunde thee may bee well thee thy chldren thee euer thou shalte doe whyche good pleasaunte thy god commaunde thee onely adde vnto dymynyshe yt hee hadde protested thys hys wysedome vnderstandynge nation hee hadde receyued iudgementes ryghteousenesse ceremony lorde hee saide futher eut iijix keepe therefore thy selfe thy soule carefully thowe forgette woordes whyche thyne eye haue seene tyme fall oute thy hearte bycuase god foresee israelite woulde reste butte hadde receyued lawe woulde besyde trauaile bryngynge fourthe newe ryghteousnesse yf seuerely holden backe therefore hee pronounceth herein conteyned perfection ryghteos nesse whyche shoulde haue beene strongest staye holde backe yet dyd cesse boldenesse muche forbydden butte v wee surely comprehended wythin charge doubte continueth styll wherby lorde hathe chalenged hys lawe absolute doctryne righteousnesse yet wee contented therewyth doe monsterouslye trauaile forgynge coyninge newe good woorkes one vpon healinge thys faulte best remedye shall bee yf thys thoughte shall stedfastely settled v lawe geuen v god teache v perfect ryghteousnesse yt therin taught righteousnesse butte examined appoynted rule god wyll therefore newe fourmes workes vaynely attempted winne fauoure god whose true worshype standeth onely obedience butte rather suche studye good woorkes wandereth oute lawe god intolerable defylynge god ryghteousnesse true ryghteousnesse augustine also saythe moste truely lib de c de de bo coniugali contra aduer legis proph whyche calleth obedyence done god somtime mother keeper somtime originall vertues wee haue expounded lawe lorde fitely pofite shall confirmed whiche haue spoken office vse lawe beginne discusse euery seuerall commaundemente selfe shall good nowe geue suche lesson serue vniuersall knoweledg therof fyrste let v holde determined life man instructed lawe onely outewarde honestye also inwarde spirituall righteousnesse whiche thynge whereas man denye yet ther fewe rightly marke commeth passe bicause loke vpon lawemaker whose nature nature lawe also ought weied kinge proclamation forbid committe fornication kill steale case graunt yf man onelye conceiue minde luste committe fornication synne steale comitte thynges deede compasse prohibition reason bicause foresighte mortall lawemaker coulde extende outwarde ciuilitie commaundementes broken whe outewarde offence committed god whose eye nothinge escapeth whyche regardeth muche outewarde shewe cleannesse hearte vnder forbiddinge fornication manslaughter thefte forbiddeth luste wrathe hatred co etynge mann guyle soeuer y lyke insomuche hee y spirituall lawemaker hee speaketh lesse soule bodye butte manslaughter soule wrathe hatred thefte soule y euell desyre couetousenesse fornycation soule y luste butte man lawes also wyll man saye haue regarde entente wylles success fortune graunte yet suche entente wylles haue outewardely broken oute weye wyth entente euerye outewarde acte hathe done butte searche secrete thoughtes therefore satysfyed manne onely wythholdeth hys handes offendynge syde bycause heauenly lawe y made oure mindes therfore restraynte myndes y pryncypally needefull keepinge thereof butte common sorte menne euen mightylie dissemble contempt lawe doe frame theyr eye feete handes partes bodye obseruation lawe meane time thei holde hearte moste farre obidience thynke selues well dyscharged yf keep close menne whiche thei sighte god heare yt sayde thou shalte kyll thou shalte committe adulterie thou shalte steale drawe oute swerde kil thei ioyne bodyes harlotes laye handes vpon menns goodes thys y well hytherto butte whole heartes breathe oute murder boile luste thei cast eye asyde men good deuoure couetinge nowe wanteth whiche chiefe pointe law whense praie commeth grosse dullnesse leauinge lawemaker thei rather measure righteousnesse witie doth paule mightily crie outerom vij x affirminge lawe spirituall whereby meaneth onely demaunndeth obedie ce soule mynde wyll also requireth angelike purenesse whiche hauinge ye fylthynesse ye fleshe cleane wyped awaye maye sauoure nothinge spirite saie meaninge lawe thruste newe exposition oure owne folowe christ best expositoure lawe pharises hadde infected people false opinion perfourmeth lawe hathe wyth outewarde worke committed nothinge againste lawe reproued moste perilous erroure pronounced vnchaste lookinge woman y fornication hee protested mansleyers hate brother maketh gyltye iudgement haue conceiued wrathe minde gylty counsell murmuringe grudginge haue vttered token displeased minde gyltye hell fyer tauntes raylynge breake fourth open anger haue espied thynges haue famed christe moses geuer lawe gospell whiche supplied imperfection lawe moses wherevpon commeth common pryncyple perfection lawe gospell whyche farre passeth oulde lawe whiche y moste pernicious opinion hereafter wher shal gather summe commaundementes shall appeare moses himselfe howe reprochefully thei dishonoure lawe god truely sheweth holynesse father dyd muche dyffer hypocrisye leadeth v awaye frome onely perfecte rule ryghteousnesse easye confute erroure thoughte christe adde vnto lawe whereas restore lawe integritie whyle hee made free cleansed yt beinge obscured lie defiled leuen pharises let oure secounde note alwaye conteyned commaundementes prohibition wordes expressed whiche yet tempered bee like lesbion rule whereby licenciously wrestinge scripture may make every thing lyste many bringe passe vnmeasured libertie runninge large yt authoritie scripture groweth contempte despere vnderstandinge therefore yf yt bee possyble wee muste take suche waye maye ryghte perfecte pathe leade v wyll god wee muste saye searche howe farre oure exposition maye exceede boundes woordes maye appeare addition mennes gloses knitte woorde god butte rather pure naturall meaninge lawe geuer y faythefully rendred truely manner commaundementes yt y manyfest fyguratiue speaches meaninge expressinge parte maye woorthyly bee laughed wyll restraine meaninge lawe narrownesse wordes euident therefore sober exposition dothe passe beyonde woordes howe farre remaineth harde iudge vnlesse measure appoynted wherefore thynke thys best measure directed entente commaundemente euery commaundemente weyed geuen v example euerye commaundemente either waye byddynge forbidding trueth bothe sortes shall fourthwith founde consider entent ende thereof ende fifte conmaundement honoure geuen whome god appoynteth therefore summe commaundement righte pleaseth god wee honoure whome hathe geuen excellence abhorreth contempte stabbournnesse againste entente fyrste commaundemente god alone honored summe therefore commaundement shallbe true godlinesse say true worship maiestie pleaseth god abhorreth vngodlynesse euery commaundement muste looke vpon matter yt treateth muste searche oute ende till fynde lawemaker doth testifie therin proprely please displease laste muste wee drawe argument contrarie manner pleaseth god contrary displeaseth displease hym contrarie pleaseth hee commaunde forbiddeth contrarie forbid commaundeth contrarye whiche somwhat darkely touched shal expounding commaundementes become plaine practise wherfore yt suffyseth haue touched sauing last pointe shortly confirmed profe thereof bicause otherwise either sholde bee vnderstanded beinge vnderstande might parhappes beginninge seeme sounde lyke absurditie thys needeth profe good thing commaunded euell forbidden yt contrarie ther man graunt common iudgemente much sticke admitte euell thinges forbidden contrarie dueties commaunded vniuersall opinion vertues commended contrarie vice condemned require somwhat formes speache signifie commonly amonge people thei moste part take vertue contrary vice absteining vice say yt procedeth farther yt contrarie duty doinges therfore commaundement thou shalt kyll common sense men consider nothing ell must absteine hurt lust hurte say conteined yt shold ye helpes may succoure life oure neigheboure leaste speake without reason proue thus god forbiddeth yt brother hurte missused bicause willeth yt neighebours life deare precious vnto v doth therfore require withall dueties loue may done v preseruatio may see ye ende ye comaundement doth alwai disclose vnto v al yt therin comaunded forbidde god suche halfe commaundements hath figure rather secretli signified expressed wil wher ther wonte many reason rendred thereof one reason pleaseth aboue ye rest bicause ye flesh alway endeuoreth extenuate fylthinesse sinne coloure faire pretense sauinge euen palpable grossenesse hathe set forthe example euery kinde offence whiche moste wicked abhominable hearinge whereof oure sens might moued horroure therby emprinte oure myndes haynous detesting euery sorte sinne manie time deceiueth v weyinge vice yt thei
