thinge secret make seme small deceites lorde dothe disclose hee accustometh v referre al whole multitude vice principall head best shewe muche euery kinde abhominable example wrathe hatred thoughte heynous euells thei called owne name forbidden v vnder name man slaughter better vnderstande abhominable god whose worde set degree horrible offence moued iudgement accustome oure selues better weye haynousenesse faultes seemed lyghte vnto v thyrdely consydered meaneth dyuidynge lawe god twoo table whereof wisemen wyll iudge somtime mention made vnfitly purpose oute cause haue cause ready dothe suffer v remaine doubte matter god diuided lawe two partes whiche conteined whole righteousnesse hath assigned fyrste dueties religion peculiarly pertaine worshipinge godheade dueties charitie whiche belonge vnto men first foundation righteousnesse worship god whiche beinge one ouerthrowen membres righteousenesse torne sunder dissolued like partes house vnioynted fallen downe manner righteousnesse wylte thowe call yt thou vexest men wyth robberye extorcious meane time wicked sacrilege thou spoylest god maiestie glorie thou defilest thy bodye fornication thy blasphemy thou prophanely abuse sacred name god thou murtherest man thou trauaile destroye extinguishe memorie god wherefore righteousenesse vainely bosted without religion maketh better shew mangeled bodye heade cutte shoulde broughte fourth beautifull syghte religion onely principall part righteousnesse also soule wherwith breatheth quickened men keepe equitie loue amonge selues without feare god therfore saye worshipe god beginning foundation righteousenesse bicause taken awaie al equitie continence temperance men vse amonge selues vaine tryflinge god saye also springe heade liuely breathe righteousnesse bicause hereby men learne lyue among selues temperately wythoute hurte doynge one reuerence god iudge right wrong wherefore first table instructeth v godlinesse propre duty religion wherwith maiestie worshipped prescribeth home feares sake name ought behaue selues felowship menmatt xxij xxxvij luke xxxvij reason lord euagelistes reherse summe gather whole law two principall pointes one loue god al heart al soule strength loue neighbour selues thus thou seest two partes wherein concludeth whole lawe directeth one toward god apointeth toward men although whole law coteined two principal pointes yet ende take away al pretense excuse pleased god declare ten commaundementes largely plainly al thinges belong honour feare loue also charitie whiche comaundeth v beare men sake thy studie ill spent knowe diuision commaundementes thou remember matter wherin euery man ought haue iudgement free whiche ought contentiously striue thinketh otherwise must needes touche point least reader shoulde eyther scorne maruell diuision shall vse newe lately deuised law diuided ten wordes bicause oft approued authoritie god himselfe controuersie wherefore doubt number manner diuiding diuide thei geue three comaundementes first table put vij second wipe number comaundement concernyng image least hide vnder first whereas without doubt seuerally set lord commaundement tenth commaundement couetyng thinges neighbour sendly teare two biside shal done vnderstande suche manner diuidyng vnknowen purer age recke fower seuerall comaundementes first table place first set promise without commaundement bicause vnlesse conuinced euident reason take ten wordes moses ten commaundementes thinkes see many diuided fit order therefore leauyng opinion follow best alloow whiche later sorte make first comaundement shalbe stede preface whole law shal follow comaundemetes fower first table sixe seconde suche order shalbe rehearsed augustine also boniface agreeth v lib qu et test whiche rehersyng kepeth order god serued obedience religion idole worshipped name lorde taken vaine seuerally spoke shadowish comaundemet sabbot place deede first diuision pleaseth sclender cause bicause number three first table consist three comaundementes misterie trinitie plainly appereth albeit place sticketh confesse otherwise rather liketh diuisio byside authour ye unperfect worke vpo matthew side iosephus vndoutedly according comon consent time assigneth either table fiue comaundementes whiche bothe reason bicause confoudeth distinction religion charitie also confuted authoritie lord matthew reckeneth comaundement honoring paretesmatt xixxix number secod table let v heare god speakyng owne wordes first commaundement lord thy god whiche haue brought thee lande aegypt house bondage thou shalt haue straunge god face whether make first sentence part first comaundement reade seuerally indifferet denie standeth stede preface whole law first making lawes heede take yt shortly abrogate cotempt therfore god first prouideth maiestie lawe shall make maye neuer time come contempt stablishing wherof vseth three maners argumentes first chalengeth self power right dominion whereby may constraine chosen people must necessitie obey setteth forth promise grace swetenesse therof allure studie holinesse thirdly reciteth benefite reproue iewes vnthankefulnesse obedience answer kindnesse name iehouah lord meant authoritie lawful dominio al thinges abide right thinges referred himrom xixxxvi paule sayeth therfore word alone sufficiently brought vnder yoke god maiestie bicause mo struous v seke withdraw selues fro vnder gouernement whome hath shewed hath power commaund whome obedience due lest seme drawe necessitie also allureth swetenesse pronouncyng god churche hidden speache mutuall relationier xxx xxxiij mat xxijxxxij whyche conteyned promise bee god shal people whereupon christ proueth abraham isaac iacob haue immortall lyfe god testified god wherefore muche effecte yf saye thus haue chosen people doe good present lyfe also geue blessednesse life come end tendeth noted diuerse place ye law whe ye lord doth vouch saue deale thus mercifully vsde vijvi ijij x v xviij call v companie people choseth v sayth moses yt peculiar people vnto self holy people kepe commaundementes whense also cometh exhortionleu xix ye holy holy two deriued protestation prophet sonne honoreth fathermal ivi seruant honoreth lord lord feare father loue foloweth rehersal benefite whiche ought much force moue v faulte vnthankefulnesse detestable euen among men put israel remembrance benefit lately done one ye miraculous greatnesse thereof beyng worthy remembrance euer remaine force wt posteritie morouer agreable present matter lord semeth say yt deliuered miserable bondage purpose obediece redinesse seruice honor author deliuerance vseth also ende holde v fast true worshippyng alone set certaine title whereby maketh sacred maiestie differently knowen al idoles forged god sayd suche redy inclination vanitie ioyned rashe boldnesse sone god named minde ca take hede self falleth away vaine inuention therefore lord meaneth bryng remedie mischief setteth owne godhed certayne title dothe compasse v within certayne grate leaste wander hether thether rashly forge selues new god forsakyng liuing god erect idole cause oft prophetes meane properly point clothe enclose within markes wherby opened people israell yet called god abrahamexo iijvi amos iij habac iixxviii p lxxxii xxixi e xxxviixvi god israell set temple hierusalem among cherebins like formes speache binde one place one people set purpose staye thoughtes godly god whiche couenant hath made israell hath represented waye lawefull varie paterne let remayne stedfastly emprinted mention made deliuerance ende iewes might cherefully geue themselues god doth right clayme vnto least thinke nothyng belongeth v ought consider bondage egypt figure spiritual captiuitie wherin al holden bound vntil heuely deliuerer make v free power arme conuey v kingdome libertie therfore olde time minded gather together israelite scattered abrode worshipping name deliuered intolerable dominion pharao wherewith thei oppressed al daye professeth self god doth nowe deliuer deadly power deuell whyche shadowe signified corp ral bondage wherefore man minde ought inflamed harken lawe whyche heareth haue proceded soueraigne king whome al thinges take beginnynge mete haue also ende appointed directed manne saye ought bee rauished embrace lawemaker kepynge whose commaundementes taught peculiarly chosen whose bountie loketh bothe flowynge store good thinges also glory immortall life whose maruellous power mercie knoweth deliuered iawes death hath grounded stablished authoritie lawe setteth forth yt first comaundement haue straug god end commaundement god wil haue preeminencie wholly enioy owne authoritie amog people yt maye comaundeth farre fro v vngodlinesse superstitio wherby glory godhed either diminished obscured reason comaundeth worship honour true endeuour godlinesse simplicitie wordes themselues manner expresse haue god muste also comprehended therein al thinges properly belong whereas therfore forbiddeth v haue god meaneth thereby geue awaye el whiche propre although thinges owe vnto god innumerable yet vnfitly may brought vnto fower principall pointes adoratio wherunto thing hanging vpon adioyned spiritual obedience co science affiance inuocation thankesgeuing adoration cal reuerence worship whiche euery one v yeldeth vnto submitteth vnto greatnesse wherfore without cause make part therof yeld conscience subiection lawe affiance assurednesse restyng reknowleging power whe reposing al wisedome righteousnesse power truthe goodnesse thinke selues blessed partakyng inuocatio resortyng minde faith help succour oft necessitie presseth v thankesgeuyng certayne thankefulnesse whereby prayse good thinges geuen vnto god suffreth nothyng conueyed awaye el commaunded wholly geuen self neither shall enough absteyme hauyng straunge god vnlesse thou restrayne thy self many wicked contemners ar wonte thinke rediest way scorne religion true religion muste goe whereby mindes may directed liuyng god knowledge whereof beyng endued maye aspire reuerence feare worshyp maiestie embrace communicatyng good thinges euery seke helpe reknowledge aduaunce co fession prayse magnificence workes marke al doynges life beware peruerse superstition whereby mindes swaruyng true god drawe hether thether vnto diuerse god wherefore contented one god let v call remembrance whiche beforesayd forged god dryuen farre awaye worship torne sonder whiche alone claymeth lawfull take awaye thing fro glorie neuer litle thinges belong may wholly remayne percell sentence foloweth face encreaseth hainousnesse god prouoked ialousie oft thrust owne inuetions place vnchaste wonlan bringyng adulterer openly husbades eye vexe minde therefore god testified present power grace loked vpo people chosen fray wicked act falling geueth warnyng new god brought witnesse beholder sacrilege boldenesse encreased much wickednesse man thinketh fleynges away begile eye god side god cryeth euer purpose euer goe euer practise cometh sight let therefore conscience cleane euen secret thoughtes swaruyng haue religion please lord requireth haue glory godhed whole vncorrupted outward confession also eye whiche behold secret corner heartes second commaundement thou shalt make thee grauen image similitude thinges heaue aboue earth beneth water vnder earth thou shalt worship serue first comaundement pronouced one god byside others god deuised openly declareth maner god kinde worship honored maye presume forge carnal thing ende therefore commaundement yt haue lawefull worship prophaned superstitious vsages wherfore summe calleth draweth v away carnal obseruations foolish minde wont inuent conceiueth god accordyng owne grosnesse therefore frameth v lawful worship spirituall worship apointed speaketh grossest faulte offense namely outward idolatrie two partes commaudement first restrayneth libertie doe presume make subiect sens forme represent god incomprehensible seconde part forbiddeth v honor image religious sake morouer shortly reciteth al ye formes wherwith wont expressed shape prophane superstitious nation thinges heauen meaneth sunne moone starres paraduenture also birdes expressyng meanyng fourth deuteronomie meaneth well birdes starresdeut iiijxv whiche note would haue spoken sawe vnskilfully applie angeles therfore omitte partes bicause sufficiently knowen themselues haue already first boke taught plainely enough euer visible formes god man doth inuent directly contrarie nature therfore sone image come sorth true religion corrupted defiled penall ordinance foloweth ought litle auayle shake slouthfulnesse threteneth lord god yelous god visiteth iniquitie father vpon child vnto thirde fourth generation hate name sheweth mercie vnto thousandes loue kepe commaundementes much effect yf haue sayde vpon whome ought brynge v thereunto speaketh power doth without punishment suffer selfe contemned diminished deede let name el whyche signifieth god eut bicause deriued strength expresse sense better sticke translate put texte calleth himselfe elous abide fellow thirdly affirmeth reuenger maiestie glorie yf doe transferre creature grauen image short sclender reuenge suche shall extend chyldren chylderns child childrens childrens child suche shalbe owers father vngodlinesse also sheweth perpetuall mercie bountifulnesse vnto longe continuance posteritie loue kepe lawe common manner god take vpon persone husband towarde v conuinction wherewith bindeth vnto v receiueth v bosome church like vnto certaine holy wedlock muste stande mutuall faythfulnesse dothe duty faythfull true husbande agayne requireth v suche loue chastitie ought wedlocke yelde soules satan lust filthy desire flesh defiled wherupon rebuketh apostasie iewes co plaineth throwe away chastitie defiled adultery therfore husband holy chast himselfe kindled anger yf see wiues minde encline strang loueriere iij osee ij lord hath wedded v vnto truthe testifieth hath feruently burnyng ialousie oft neglecting purenesse holly mariage defiled wicked lustes specially trasferre ectt superstition worship name whiche ought vncorrupted asmuch meane doe breake faith geuen wedlocke also defile weddyng bed bryngyng adulterer thretening seen meaneth sayth visit iniquitie father vpon child vnto third fourth generation biside stadeth equitie god iustice punish innocent others offence god self also saytheze xviijxx make sonne beare wickednesse father sentence one repeted prolongyng punnishmente sinnes auncelters vpon generation comenum xiiij viij doth moses oftentimes speake vnto lord lord rendrest iniquitie father child vnto third fourth generatio likewise ieremieier xxxii xviii thou shewest mercie thousandes rendrest iniquitie father bosome child many trauaile much losyng knot thinke vnderstaded temporall punishmentes whiche child suffer parentes faultes absurditie asmuch oftetimes layed vpon saluationesa xxxix vij deede true elaye declared ezechias yt sonnes shuld spoiled kingdome caried exile sinne yt comitted house pharao abimelech plaged offending abrahagen xiixvii xx iii yt alledged assoiling question rather shift true exposition like place threteneth greuous reuenge may limited within boundes present life therfore thus taken yt iust curse lord lieth vpo head wicked also vpo whole familie curse one lieth vpon el loked yt father destitute spirit god liue wickedly sonne likewise forsaken lord father fault follow way destruction finally childes childe childe childes childe yt cursed seede detestable fal hedlong first let v see whether reuenge vnsemely iustice god al nature danable know yt destruction prepared ye lord vouchsaueth comunicate grace neuer lesse thei perish owne vnrighteousnesse vnrighteous hatred god neither left cause quarel holpe grace god saluation wheras therfore punishmet laied vpo wicked euel doer offense yt house depriued yt grace god many generatios ca accuse god iust reuege ye lord ye side pronouceth yt punishment father sinne shal passe ouer vnto ye sonne note ther entreated israelite long cotinually vexed wt many calamitieseze xviii xx thei began vse prouerbe yt theire father eate sower grape wherwith ye childrens teeth set edge wherby thei meant father comitted sinnes wherof thei otherwise righteous deseruing suffer punishmet rather vnappea able wrathfulnesse god tha moderate seueritie prophet pronounceth vnto yt bicause punished owne offense yt sta deth wt iustice god yt righteous sonne shuld suffer punishmet noughtinesse ye wicked father thing also coteined present ordinance uisityng whereof mention made ul illed ye lord taketh away fro house wicked grace light helpes saluation child blinded forsaken goe steppe father susteine curse father offense asmuch put teporall misery last eternall destruction herein punished iust iudgement god sinnes owne iniquitie side offred promise enlarging mercie god thousand generation whiche promise also often founde scripturesgen xvijvij prou xxvij set solemne couenant churche thy god thy seede thee whiche thinge salomon hauing respect vnto writeth childre righteous shalbe blessed death reason holy bringing vp also litle auaileth thereunto also yt blessing promised couenat grace god shall rest eternally house godly herupon groweth great cofort faithfull great terrour wicked euen death remembrance bothe righteousnesse wickednesse great force god cursing one blessyng redoundeth vnto posteritie much shal light rest vpo head doer themselues maketh nothing agaynste v issue wicked many time cometh good profe issue faithfull swarueth kinde bicause lawmaker meante stablish perpetual rule derogate free election sufficeth comforte righteous terrour sinner penaltie vayne effect although doe alwaye take place temporall punishmentes layed vpon fewe wickedmen testimony wrath god agaynst sinnes iudgement shal one day geuen vpo sinner although many escape vnpunished euen ende life god geueth one example blessing shew mercie boutifulnesse sonne father sake geueth profe constant perpetual fauour worship one pursueth wickednesse ye father sonne sheweth iudgement prepared reprobate owne offence assurednesse place principally respect vnto way comendeth vnto v largenesse mercie whiche extendeth vnto thousand generation whereas assigned fower generation vengeance third commaundement thou shalt take name lord thy god vayne end comaundement yt haue maiestie name holy among v therfore summe shalbe defile contemptuously irreuerently vsing whiche prohibition comaundement hangeth orderly together take studie care godlily reuerence therefore ought order selues mindes tonges neyther thinke speake thing god misteries reuerently much sobrietie weyeng workes conceiue nothing honorable toward three thing say behoueth v negligently marke euer minde conceiueth euer tong vttereth may sauour excellecie maye agree holy hyghnesse name finally may serue aduauce magnificence rashly disorderly abuse holy worde reuered misteries either ambition couetousnesse owne triflinges beare dignitie name emprinted thei may kepe honour estimation among v last al carp speake euel workes wretched men wont babble reprochefully euer reherse done report wordes praise wisedom righteousnesse goodnesse sanctifie name god otherwise done defiled vaine peruerse abuse bicause violently carried fro right vse wherunto apointed though hurt done yet spoyled dignitie litle litle brought contempt much euel rash redinesse vse name god season much mischief employed euell v make serue superstition necromancie cruell execration vnlawfull coiurations wicked enchauntementes swearyng chiefly mentioned comaundement thing wherin peruerse abuse god name detestable thereby may better altogether frayed awaye defilyng thereof commaundement geue worship god reuerence name truthe equitie kept among men appereth afterward second table condemneth periurie false witnesse wherby hurt done felowship vaine repete agayne co maundement entreated dutie charitie also diuisio law requireth bicause said god vaine apoint two table law wherby gathered yt comaundement chalengeth owne right defendeth holynesse name teacheth men owe men first learned othe takyng god witnesse confirme truthe whiche speake cursed speaches coteine manifest reproches god vnworthy reckened among othes suche takyng witnesse whan rightly done kinde worshippyng god shewed diuerse place scriptureesa xixxviij whe esaye prophecieth calling assyrian egyptian felowship couenat wt israel shal speake sayth tong chanaan shal swere name lord say sweryng name lordesa lxvxvi shall yelde confession religion againe speaketh enlargemet kingdome sayth whosoeuer shall blesse shall blesse god faythfull shal swere land shal swere true god hieremie saythiere xijxvi yf shal teach ye people swere name thei haue taught swere baal shalbe buylded vp middes house good cause sayde call vpon name lorde witnesse doe witnesse religion towarde wee confesse eternall vnchaungeable truthe whome call vpon onely moste substantiall witnesse truthe aboue also defense thereof whiche able bryng forth hidden thynges light knowet heartes testimony menne doe ayle f ee god witnesse specially thynge proued lieth secrete conscience whyche cause lorde bitterly angry sweare strange god iudgeth manner swearyng manifest manifest fallyng allegeanceier vvij thy sonnes haue forsaken swere god declareth haynousnesse offense threatenyng punishmentsoph iv destroye sweare name lord swere melchan nowe vnderstande lordes othes worshippe name muche diligent hede taken stede worshippyng doe conteine dishonour contempt abacement small dishonour periurie committed swearyng wherefore called laweleu xixxij profanation lefte lorde spoyled truthe shall ceasse god truely spoyled thereof made affirmer approuer falshodiosue vijxix wherefore iosua minded dryue alchan confesse truthe sayd sonne geue glorie lord israell meanyng thereby lorde greuously dishonored yf manne sweare falsly hym maruell doe much v lieth manner stayne holy name lye manner speache vsed amonge iewes ofte called take othe appereth like protestation pharisee vse gospell iohniohn ixxxiiii sa xiiii ii reg vi xxxi ii cor ixiiii heedefulnesse formes othes vsed scripture doe instructe v lorde lyueth lorde doe thinges vnto adde thynges lorde witnesse vpon soule whyche doe proue call god witnesse sayenges also wishe take vengeance periurie speake deceyptfully name lorde made vile common vsed superfluous othes although bee true suche case also taken vayne wherefore shall sufficient absteyne caring falsly vnlesse also remember swearing suffred ordeined luste pleasure necessity sake therfore goe beyond lawfull vse thereof applye thinges necessarie necessitie pretended serue eyther religion charitie wherein daye menne doe muche licentiously offende muche intolerably custome hath cessed reckened offense af whiche yet iudgement sea e god lenderly weyed euery wythout regarde name god y defiled triflynge talkes yt y thought euel bicause long suffred vnpunished boldenesse come rest possession great wickedne e comanndement lord remayneth orce penaltie abideth strength shall one daye haue effect whereby certayne speciall reuenge proclaymed agaynst vse name vayne commaundement also transgressed poynt othes put holy seruantes god place god manifest vngodlynesse trasferre glorie godhed themdeut vixiii xxx exod xxiii xiii neyther without cause lorde hath geuen speciall commaundement swere name speciall prohibition forbidden heard swere strange god apostle euidently testifieth writeth men swearyng call vpon hier themselues god whiche none greater owne glory swere swere himselfe anabaptistes contented wyth moderation swearyng detest othes without exceptio bycause prohibition christ generallmalt v iac v saye vnto ye swere let tale yea yea nay nay euer euell meane without consideration stumble agaynst christ make aduersarye father come downe heauen repeale father decree eternall god doth lawe permit swearyng thyng lawfullexod xxiixi iohn viixvi whiche enough also necessitie doth commaunde christ affirmeth one father bringeth thyng whiche father commaunded doctrine c wil make god contrarie whiche shal afterwarde forbidde condemne thing n men behauiours whiche hath allowed comaunding bycause difficultie wordes christ let v litle weye herein shall neuer atteyne truthe vnlesse bende eye vnto entent christ take heede vnto purpose goeth purpose eyther release restreyne lawe reduce true naturall vnderstandyng whiche ben muche depraued false gloses scribe pharisee holde minde shall thinke christ dyd vtterly condemne othes onely othes whiche doe transgresse rule lawe thereby appereth people time forbeare manner swearyng periuries whereas lawe dothe forbidde periuries also idle superstitous othes lorde therefore sure expositour lawematth vxxxiiii doth admonish euell forswere also sweare howe sweare vaine othes commended lawe leaueth safe libertie seme fight somewhat strongly take earnest holde worde whiche yet referred worde sweare formes swearyng rehersed also parte errour sweare heaue earth thought touch name god therfore principall kinde offense commaundement lord doth also cut bye shiftes thinke haue escaped speakyng name god call heauen earth witnesse way also noted although name god expressed yet men indirect formes sweare sweare liuely light bread eate baptisme token god liberalitie toward neither doth christ place forbiddeth sweare heauen earth hierusalem speake correct superstition men falsly thinke rather confuteth sophisticall sutt ltie whiche thought faulte babblingly throwe indirect othes though spared holy name god whiche engrauen benefites otherwise either mortal man dead man angel put place god amonge prophane nation flatterie deuised stinkyng forme sweryng life soule kyng false making god doth obscure minish glory one god meane procure credit sayenges holy name god although indirectly done yet al triflyng othes maiestie offended christ taketh fro licentiousnesse pretense excuse forbiddeth sweare aliac vxii iames tendeth purpose recityng wordes christ whiche haue alleged bycause rash boldenesse hath alwaye ben world whiche prophane misuse name god ye referre worde substance without exceptio altogether vnlawfull sweare wherefore serueth exposition whiche added afterward neyther heauen earth c whereby sufficiently appereth cauillatios met withall iewes thought fault excused therefore nowe doubtefull sounde iudgementes lorde place onely reproue othes forbidden lawe himselfe whiche shewed life examplar perfection taught sticke sweare occasion required disciple whoe doubte obeye theyr maister thinges folowed example whoe dare saye paule wold haue sworne yf swearing ben vtterly forbidden matter required sware without sticking yea somtime adding execration question yet ended bicause think publike othes excepted prohibitio othes yt take magistrate doth offer v require v prince vse take stablishing league people thei sweare allegeace prince ye soldiar whe put othe true seruice yt warre like sort thei adioyne rightfully otheshebr vixvi paule cofirme ye dignitie gospell asmuch apostle office ar priuate publike minister god truely denie yt safest othes bicause thei ar defended wt soudest testimony scripture magistrate comaunded doubtful case driue witnesse othe ot side answer othe apostle sayth me controuersies meane ended comaundement bothe haue perfect allowance office yea maye note among old heathen men publike solemne othe great reuerece comon othes vsually spoken without consideration either nothing litle regarded bicause thought maiestie god al yet much dangerous condemne priuate othes necessarie case soberly holyly reuerently taken whiche mainteined reason example lawfull priuate men weighty earnest matter appele god iudge betwene much lawefull call hym witnesse put case thy brother accuse thee false breache faith thou endeuorest purge thy self accordyng dutie charitie meanes suffer satisfied thy good name come perill obstinate maliciousnesse thou shalt without offense appele iudgement god please time make thine innocency knowen weight wordes considered lesse matter call witnesse therefore see case affirme callyng hym witnesse vnlawful without many example therof though othe abraham isaac abimelech sayde serue purposegen xxixxiiij xxvixxxi xxxiliij ruth iijxiij xviii x bycause made name publike companie yet iacob laban priuate stablished couenant mutuall othe betwene themselues booz priuate man whiche meane cofirmed promise mariage ruth abdias priuate man iuste manne fearyng god whiche affirmed vnto elia othe thing meant persuade therefore haue better rule othes tempered vnaduised common without regard vsed ragyng lust triflyng serue iuste necessitie lordes glorie mainteyned edification brother furthered whiche ende commaundement lawe tendeth fourth commaundement remember thou kepe holy sabbat day sixe dayes shalt thou worke thy workes seuenth day sabbat lord thy god thou shalt worke c end comaundement beyng dead owne affection workes busied meditation kingdome god meditation exercised meanes hath ordeyned bicause comaundement hath peculiar seueral consideration fro rest therfore must haue also seuerall manner exposition old writer vse call shadowish commaundement yt conteyneth outward obseruation day whiche comming christ taken away figure wherin graunt say truely touche half matter wherfore must fetche exposition farther think haue marked three cause cosidered wherupo comaundement consisteth first heauenly lawmaker meant vnder rest seuenth daye set figure people israel spirituall rest whereby faithfull ought esse owne workes might suffer god worke secondarily wil haue one apointed daye wherein mere together heare lawe execute ceremony leest bestowe peculiarly meditation workes callyng remembrance might exercised godlinesse thirdly thought good haue day rest graunted seruants liued vnder gouernement wherin might haue cessyng labour many wayes taught shadoweng spiritual restnum xiiixxii ezec xxxxi xxiiixxxviii ier xviixii xxvii exod xxxi xiii xxxvii nehe ixxiiij principal point sabbat lorde required keping comaudement maner seuerely meaning prophetes declare al religio ouerthrowen coplaineth sabbates polluted defiled kept sanctified though pece seruice beyng omitted remained wherin might honored set forth obseruing therof hie praise whiche cause faithful among oracle maruelously esteme reuelyng sabbat nehemiah thus spake leuites solemne couocation thou hast shewed father thy holy sabbat hast geuen comaundementes ceremony law hand moses see howe singular estimation among al comaundementes law whiche thinges serue set forth dignitie misterie wel expressed moses ezechiel thus haue exodus see yt ye kepe sabbat day bicause token betwene generation maye know lord sanctifie kepe sabbat holy vnto let child israell kepe sabbat celebrate generation euerlastyng couenat betwene child israel perpetual token yet ezechiel speaketh largeezec xxxij summe therof cometh effect token wherby israell knowe god sanctifier sanctification mortifiyng owne appereth apt relation outward signe inward thing self must altogether rest god may worke v must depart owne wil must resigne vp heart must banish lustes eshhebr iijxiii iiiiix finally muste cesse doynges owne witte maye haue god workyng v maye reste apostle also teacheth perpetual cessyng represented iewes kepyng one daye among seuen whiche daye make obserued greater deuotion lord commaunded owne exaple auaileth litle stirre vp man endeuour maye know tendeth folowyng creatour man searche secret signification number seuen asmuch nomber scripture nomber perfection without cause chosen signifie euerlastyng continuance wherwith also agreeth moses day declared lord rest workes maketh ende describyng succeding dayes nightes maye also brought probable note number lord thereby meant shewe sabbat neuer perfectly ended til came last day beginne blessed rest doe dayly procede profityng bicause haue still continuall warre flesh shall ended vntill sayeng esaye fulfilledesa lxvix iij concernyng continuyng newe moone newe moone sabbat sabbati cor xvxxviij euen god shalbe may seme therfore yt lord hath vij day set forth people perfection come sabbat laste daye whole lite might cotinuall meditation sabbat aspire perfection man mislyke obseruation number matter curious agaynst maye simply take lorde ordeyned one certaine day wherein people might vnder scholyng lawe bee exercised continuall meditation spirituall reste assigned seuenth daye eyther bycause thought sufficient settynge forth liken se owne example might better moue people kepe leaste put mynde sabbat tended ende become like vnto creatour maketh small matter misterie remayne whiche therein principally set forth concernynge perpetuall reste ou workes consideration whereof prophetes nowe th call backe iewes shoulde thynke themselues charged carnall takyng rest bys de place alredy leged haue thus esayeesa viii xiii thou turne awaye thy oote sabbat thou doe thine owne holy daye shalt call sabbat delicate holy glorious lorde shalt glorifie thou doest thyne owne wayes sek st thine owne speake worde shalt thou de ted lord c doubte commyng lord christ muche ceremoniall herein abrugate truthe whose presence figure vanish awaye bodie sight whereof shadowes leite ye rue fulfillyng sabbatro viiiii beyng buryed hym pti grafted felowship death beyng made partaker resurrection maye walke newnesse life therfore place apostle writeth sabbat shadowe thing come true bodie saye perfect substance truthe christcoloss iixvi xvii whiche place hath well declared coteyned one day whole course life vntill beyng vtterly dead selues filled life god therefore superstitious obseruing day ought far christian asmuche two later cause ought reckened among olde shadowes doe belong like age sin sabbat abrogate yet hath still place v mere apointed dayes hearyng worde breakyng misticall bread publike prayer seruautes labore graunted rest labour doubt commaundyng sabbat lord care bothe th thinges first hath suf ic ent testimonie vse iewes proue second moses spake deuteronomie wordes paragraph thy man seruant thy mayde seruat maye reste well thou remember thou thy selfe didst serue egypt paragraph againe exodus thy oxe thy asse maye rest sonne thy bo woman maye take breath denie bothe thinges serue v aswell iewes ge church commaunded v word god necessitie susficiently knowen experience life certainely appointed haue ordinarie day kept xiiijxl thinges sentence apostle done comly order among v farre co esse order kepte without policie moderation hand present trouble ruine church bee dissolued necessitie among v relete whereof lord apointed sabbat iewes let man saye belongeth nothyng vnto v moste prouident tender father willed lesse prouide necessitie iewes ut thou wilt saye rather dayly mete together difference dayes maye taken awaye would god w graunted truely spirituall wisedome thynge worthy haue dayly pece time cut yf obteined weakenesse many haue dayly metinges rule charitie doth suffer v exact order whiche see layed vpon v god compelled somwhat long bicause day many vnquiet spirites rayse trouble concernyng sondaye crie christian people nourished iewishnesse bicause kepe obseruation dayes answere kepe dayes without iewishnesse bicause behalfe far differ iewes kepe streight religion ceremonie wherein thinke spirituall misterie ured reteine necessarie remedie kepyng order churchcoloss ij iii paul teacheth kepyng thereof iudged christian shadow thing come therefore feared labored vayne amonge galathians bycause still obserue dayesgal iiij romanes meth superstition man make differece betwene daye daye paragraph whoe sa yng mad men dothe see obseruyng apostle meaneth regarde political ende order church wheras kept still shadowes spirituall thinges euen muche darken glory christ light gospell therfore cesse handy workes bicause thinges dyd call away holy study meditation certayne religion cessinge worke thei dreame thei still kept misteries olde time deliuered apostle saie inueyeth disordered difference day againste lawefull choice day serueth quietnesse christian feloweship church himselfe ordeine sabbat kept vse appoynteth corynthians dayei cor xvj ij wherin thei shoulde gather collection releue brothren hierusalem feare superstition danger thereof feaste dayes iewes sundayes christian nowe haue expediente ouerthrowinge superstition daie iewes religiouslye obserued taken awaie necessarie keepinge comclinesse ordre quiet churche daye appoynted vse albeit olde father haue without reason choise put place sabbat daie daie call sundaie whereas resurrection lorde ende fullfyllinge reste whereof olde sabbat shadowe christian daye made ende shadowes put mynde thei shoulde longer sticke vnto shadowishe ceremonie yet reste vpon numbre seuen yt wolde binde churche bondage thereof neither wil condemne church haue solemne dayes meetinges thei withoute superstition whiche shall bee thei onely applyed oseruation discipline well appoynted ordre let summe hereof thys ye trueth geuen ye iewes vnder figure deliuered v without shadowes firste oure life longe sholde meditation continuall sabbat rest oure owne workes lorde may worke v spirit hist trip lib c euery man priuately ofte hath leysure shoulde diligently exercise himselfe godly calling minde workes god also al sholde keepe lawefull ordre churche appoynted hearinge woorde ministration sacramentes publike prayer thirdely shoulde vngently oppresse bee vnder v trifelynges false prophetes vanish awaie age paste haue infected people wyth iewyshe opinion muche ceremoniall commanudement take away whiche thei tongue call appoyntinge seuenth daye muche morall remayneth whiche keeping one daie weke nothinge ell effect reproche iewes change daye keepe still holinesse minde still remaineth wyth v lyke signification mysterie day amonge iewes truely see good thei haue done doctrine thei cleaue constitution theise muche exceede iewes grosse carnall superstition sabbat rebukinge readde isaieesa ixiii lviijxiij lesse fittly serue dayes prophete reproued hys tyme butte generall doctrine principally kept leaste religion shoulde fall awaie waxe faint among v holy meetinges diligently kept outwarde helpes vsed profitable nourishe worshippinge god fifte commaundement honoure thy father thy mother thou maist liue longe vpon lande lorde thy god shall geue thee ende commaundement bicause lorde delyteth preseruation ordre therfore willeth degree preeminence hath ordeined broken summe therfore shalbe reuerence whome lord hath set ouer v yeld honore obedience thankefullnesse whervpon foloweth forbidden v withdrawe thynge dignitie either contempt obstinate vnthankfulnes doth worde honoure scripture signifieth largely apostle saythi tim xv elder whiche rule well worthy doble honore meaneth oneli yt reuerence y due vnto also recompense ministerie deserueth bicause comaundement subiection doth disagree peruersnesse man nature swelleth greedinesse climbing hie hardly abideth broughte lowe therefore hath set kinde superioritie example nature moste amiable leste enuious bicause mighte easelyer meken reclaime mindes vse submission therfore lord doth little little traine v lawefull subiection easy beare asmuch rule alike whome geueth preeminence doth communicate name farre necessarie preserue preeminence name father god lorde belong vnto alone ofte heare one named minde muste needes touched feeling maiestie therfore maketh partaker thing maketh glister certaine sparke brightnesse thei may honorable euery one accordinge degree therfore oure father haue consider somewhat ye nature god bicause beareth name god without cause prince oure lorde hath partakinge honore god wherfore ought doubted god doth set generall rule knowe man ordinaunce set ouer v yelde vnto reuerence obedience thankfulnesse suche dueties lieth v maketh difference whether thei worthy vnworthy sorte soeuer thei thei haue without prouidence god atteyned place reaso whereof lawemaker woulde haue honored yet namely hathe geuen commaundemente reuerence parentes haue brought v lifeexod xxi leuit xxix whiche reuerence nature ought manner instructe v monster men breake authorite parentes dishonore stubbornesse therfore lord commaunded disobedient parentesleu xix pro xx deu xxixviij mat xviiij eph vi coloss iijxx slaine men vnworthy enioye benefite lighte doe reknowledge whose meanes thei came many addition lawe appeareth bee true wee haue noted three partes honoure speaketh reuerence obedience thankfullnesse firste lorde estabelysheth commaundeth killed curseth father mother punisheth contempte dishonoure seconde confirmeth appointeth punishment death ye disobedient rebellious child thirde belongeth sayinge christe fyftene matthew commaundement god good oure parentes oft paule maketh mention commaundement expoundeth therein obedience required annexed promise commendation whyche dothe rather putte v minde howe acceptable vnto god submission commaunded paule vseth pricke stirre vp oure dulnesse saieth fyrste commaundemente promise promise went first table speciall proprely belonginge one commaundement extended whole lawe nowe thus taken lorde spake israelite peculiarly lande whiche promised inheritance possession lande pledge god bountyfullnesse let v meruell pleased god declare fauoure geuinge lengthe lyfe whiche man might longe enioye hys benefite meaninge therefore thus honoure thy father thy mother yt longe space life thou maist enioye yt possession lande shalbe vnto thee testimony father sith earthe blessed faithfull doe woorthyly recken present life amonge blessinges god therefore thys promise dothe likewise belonge vnto v asmuche continuance hys life profe god good neither promised v promised iewes thoughe contained blessednesse selfe bicause wonte bee godlye token god tender loue therfore chaunce obediente child parentes taken life ripe age whyche y oftentimes seen yet doth god lesse constantly continue perfourmance promise shoulde rewarde hym wyth hundreth acre lande whome promised one acre consysteth consider yt long life farre promysed v blessinge god blessinge farre proofe fauoure whiche death doth muche plentifully perfectly witnesse shewe effect seruauntes moreouer lorde promiseth blessinge presente life child honoure parentes reuerence ought doth wythall secretly saye assured curse hangeth ouer stubborne disobedient child shoulde wante execution hee pronounceth hys lawe subiecte iudgemente deathe commaundeth putte execution escape iudgemente hee hymselfe taketh vengeance one meane see howe greate numbre sorte menne slaine battailes fray tourmented strange vnaccustomed fashion manner proofe thys threatninge vayne butte yf escape olde age syth lyfe beynge depriued blessinge god doe nothynge butte miserably languyshe reserued greater paynes hereafter farre beynge partaker blessyng promised godly chyldren butte thys y also waye bee noted wee commaunded obey butte lorde euident foundation layed sitte hye place wherevnto lorde hathe aduaunced communicatinge portion hys honoure therefore submission vsed towarde oughte bee steppe towarde honouringe soueraigne father wherefore yf moue v transgresse lawe woorthyly bee accompted parentes butte straungers laboure wythdrawe v obedience true father y bee thoughte prince lordes sortes superioures shamefull againste conuenience reason theyr preeminence sholde preuayle presse downe hys hyghnesse sithe theyres hangeth wholye vpon ought onely guide v vnto sixte commaundement thou shalte kyll ende thys commaundemente asmuche god hathe bounde together mankinde certaine vnitie euery man ought regarde safetie men thinge geuen hym charge summe therfore violence wronge yea harme doinge whereby oure neighboures bodie maie bee hurte forbidden v therefore commaunded power succore oure trauaile defende life oure neighboures faithfully imploye wee procure thynges maye make theyr quiet watche keepe hurte yf daunger geue helping hande thou consider god lawmaker saithe thinke withall meaninge thys rule also gouerne thy soule yt mere fonde thinge thynke espieth thoughtes hearte principally resteth vpon shoulde instructe nothing body true righteousnesse therfore manslaughter hearte also forbidden lawe inwarde affection preserue oure brother life geuen commaundement hande deede bryngeth fourth ye manslaughter minde conceiueth infected wrathe hatred loke whether thou canst angry wyth thy brother wythout burning desire hurt thou canst angry canst thou hate asmuche hatred nothynge butte olde rooted anger although thou dissemble goe aboute winde oute thy selfe vaine circumstance yet anger hatred effection hurtei iho v thou wilte styll dallye oute shyftes defende allready pronounced mouthe holy ghooste hee mansleyer hatethe hys brother hys hearte pronounced mouthe lorde christe hee gyltye iudgemente angry wyth hys brothermat vxxv hee y gyltye counsell saythe racha hee gyltye hell fyer saythe vnto hym foole scripture noteth twoo poyntes equitie vpon whyche commaundement grounded bycause manne bothe image god oure owne fleshe wherefore vnlesse well defyle image god wee muste haue care touche manne none otherwyse sacred thynge vnlesse putte naturallnesse man muste cheryshe oure owne fleshe manner exhortation yt fetched ye redemption grace christ shall entreated place god willed twoo thinges naturally considered man myght perswade v preseruation sholde reuerence image god emprinted embrace oure owne fleshe hathe therfore escaped crime manslaughter hathe kepte selfe shedinge blode thou committe thinge dede thou go thinge endeuoure thou conceiue thynge desire purpose y safetie thou arte holden gilty manslaughter againe thou trauayle thy power occasion may serue defende life thou doest like haynousnesse offende lawe muche care taken safetie body let v hereby gather howe muche studie trauaile due safetie hys soule whyche lorde syght dothe infinitely excell bodye seuenth commaundement thou shalte committe adulterie ende commaundement bycause god loueth charitie cleannesse therfore vncleannesse oughte departe farre awaye v summe therefore shall defyled wyth vncleannesse lustfull intemperance fleshe wherevnto aunswereth affyrmatiue commaundemente yt chastely continently ordre partes oure lyfe butte fornication hee forbiddeth name whyche vnchaste luste tendeth fylthynesse whyche grosse sensible somuche also defyleth body hee myghte brynge v abhorre fylthye luste syth manne created thys estate liue solitarie lyfe butte vse helper ioyned vnto hym sin curse synne driuen necessitie lorde hathe behalfe prouyded helpe muche sufficient ordeined marryage sanctified blessing ye feloweship begonne authoritie whereby foloweth feloweship manne woman oute mariage accursed hym felowship mariage selfe ordeined remedie necessitie wee shoulde runne oute vnbrydled luste therfore lette v flatter oure selues sith heare man coupled woma mariage without curse god nowe muche condition nature luste enkyndled syns fall manne wee become doubtely subiecte desire companie woman excepte bee whome god hys singular grace hathe exempted let euerye man loke well geuen vnto hym uirginitie graunt vertue despised butte syth denied graunted time let troubled incontinence striuinge wyth canne gette vpper hande resorte helpe mariage maye keepe chastitie degree vocation conceiue thys woorde succoure owne intemperance wyth remedie offered graunted thei stryue agaynste god resyste ordinaunce let man carpe mee many daie ayded helpe god hee canne thyngespsal xxi xiiij helpe god presente onely wyth walke way vocation whiche thei wythdrawe selues whyche forsakynge helpes god trauaile ouercome master necessity wyth vayne rashe boldenesse lorde affyrmeth continence singular gyfte god sorte geuen generally vniuersally whole bodye churche fewe membres thereof fyrste hee sayth certaine kynde menne haue gelded selues kyngedome heauen thei myght loosely freely applye selues affayres heauenly kyngedome man shoulde thinke suche geldinge power manne hee shewed little men able receiue butte whome peculiarlye geuen heauenmat xixxij cor vijvij wherevpon concludeth canne take let take butte paule yet affyrmeth playnely hee wryteth euerye manne hathe hys propre gyfte god one thus thus whereas open declaration admonyshed euery mannes power keepe chastitie single lyfe althoughe wyth studie trauayle indeuoure neuer muche vnto y peculiar grace whiche god geueth certaine men may haue ready worke wee striue god nature whiche hathe institute doe applye kinde oure lyfe proportion oure power lorde forbyddeth fornication therefore hee requyreth cleannesse chastitie v keepe butte one way euery manne measure selfe owne measure neyther let manne despise mariage thinge vnprofitable superfluous hym otherwise desyre syngle life vnlesse able liue without wife therin also let prouide onely quiet commoditie fleshe onely beynge loosed bonde maye readinesse prepared dueties godlynesse asmuche benefite geuen many time let euery man longe absteyne fro mariage shalbe meete liue kepe single estate strength faile tame luste let hym learne lorde hathe nowe layed vpon necessitie marry cor vii ij ix thys apostle sheweth commaundeth auoyde fornication euery man haue owne wife euery woman haue owne husbande liue continently shoulde marry lorde fyrste declareth moste parte men subiect vice incontinence subiecte vnto excepteth none commaundeth onely remedie wherewith vnchastitie resisted therefore bee incontinent neglect helpe infirmitie thys meane thei sinne euen thei obey commaundement apostle neyther let hym flatter hymselfe toucheth woman thoughe hee coulde bee rebuked vnchastitie meane season hys minde burneth inwardly luste paule defineth chastitie cleannesse myndej cor vi xxiiii ioyned wyth chastitie bodye woman vnmarried saythe hee thynketh vpon thynges lorde asmuche shee holy bothe bodie spirite therefore hee byngeth reason confirme former commaundement dothe onely saie better man take wyfe defile hym selfe companie harlote hee sayth better marry burne nowe yf maryed folkes confesse felowship together blessed lorde thereby admonished defile intemperate dissolute luste thoughe honestie mariage couer fylthienesse incontinence yet oughte fourthwyth prouocation thereof wherefore let maried folkes thynke thynges lawefull vnto let euery housband haue owne wyfe soberly lykewyse wyfe housebande doinge lette committe nothynge vnbeseeminge honestie temperance mariage oughte mariage made lorde restrained measure modestie ouerflowe euery kynde extreeme lasciuiousnesse lib dc phil thys awantonnesse ambrose rereproued wyth sayeng sore deede vnfyte calleth housbande adulterer hys owne wyfe whyche bse wedlocke hath care shamefastnesse honestie laste let v consider lawemaker doth condemne fornication euen whyche syth hys owne right oughte possesse v wholly requyreth purenesse soule spirite bodie therefore hee forbyddeth committe fornication hee also forbiddeth wanton attyre bodie wyth vncleanly gesture fylthy talke laye wayte trappe others chastite sayinge withoute good reaso archelaus spake yongma aboue measure wantonly deintely clothed made matter parte wer filthilye vnchaste wee haue regarde vnto god abhorreth filthinesse euer parte either oure soule bodie appeareth put thee oute doute remembre lorde commendeth chastitie lord require chastitie v condemneth euer agaynste therefore thou couet shewe obedience neither let thy mynde burne inwardly wyth euell luste lette thine eye runne wantonly corrupte affection let thy bodye trimmed vp alluremente lette thy tongue filthy talke entise thy mynde lyke thoughtes lette thy gluttonous belly enflame thee intemperance vice certayne blottes wherewyth purenesse chastitie y spotted eyghte commaundement thou shalte steale ende thys commaundemente bycause god abhorreth vnrighteousnesse yt euery man may haue hys owne renred vnto hym summe therefore shall bee wee forbidden gape men goodes therefore commaunded euery man employ hys faythfull trauaile preserue eche manne hys owne goodes thus ought thinke euery man possesseth happened vnto hym chaunce fortune distribution soueraigne lorde thinges therfore man good gotten hym euell meanes wronge done disposition god theftes many kyndes one standeth uiolence goodes manner force robbing licenciousnesse bereued kynde consisteth malicious deceite guylefully conueyed awaye sorte standeth hidden sutteltie wroonge owner coloure law sorte flatterie sucked awaye pretense gifte leaste sholde tarry longe vpon rentinge seuerall kyndes thefte lette v knowe crafty meanes whereby possession money oure neyghboures conueyed vnto v one goe croked wayes syncerenesse hearte desire beguile meane hurte accompted theftes althoughe pleadinge lawe maye preuayle yet god doth otherwyse way seeth ye long captious suttleties wherwith ye guilefulman beginneth entangle simpler minde till length drawe nettes seethe harde vngentle lawes wherewyth myghtier oppresseth throweth downe weaker hee seeth yt allurementes wherwith baiteth hooke yt crastier taketh thee vnware whyche thinges hidden iudgement man come knoweledge thys manner wronge onely money ware landes euery man ryght defraude oure neighboure goodes denye dueties whiche wee bounde doe hym idle factore baylye deuoure master substance heedefull care thrifte either wrongfully spoyle doe ryoutously waste substance committed vnto seruant mocke master yf disclose secretes meanes hee betraye life hys goodes agayne lorde doe cruelty oppresse householde god gylty thefte withholdeth conueieth man goodes perfourmeth whiche office callinge oweth shall therfore ryghtly obey thys commaundement contented oure owne estate seeke get gaine honest lawefull couet waxe riche wroong goe aboute spoyle oure neighboure hys goodes oure owne substance maye encrease laboure heape vp cruell rich wroonge oute men bloode wee immeasurably scrape together euery way right wronge either oure couetousnesse maye bee filled oure prodigalitie satisfied side lette bee perpetuall marke ayde men faithfully counsell helpe kepe owne farre may haue false deceytful men let v rather redy yelde vp owne striue onely butte lette v communicate necessity store releue nede whome see oppressed harde poore estate fynally lette euery man loke howe muche duety bounde vnto lette faithfully paye reason lette people haue honoure sette ouer let paciently beare gouernement obey lawes commaundementes refuse nothinge maye beare still kepinge god fauorable vnto againe lette take care people preserue comon peace defende good restraine euell ordre thinges redy geue accompte office soueraigne iudge lette minister church aithfully applye ministerie corrupt doctrine saluation deliuer pure syncere people god let instructe onely learning also wyth example lyfe fynally let ouer good sheperdes ouer shepe let people lykewise receiue messingers apostle god geue honoure whereof hyest maister hath voutsaued minister vnto suche thinges necessarie life lette parentes take feede rule teache child committed god greue turne away mindes crueltie rather cheryshe embrace suche lenitie tendernesse becommeth person whiche manner haue allredy sayde child owe parentes obedience let yonge men reuerence olde age euen lorde willed age honorable let olde men also gouerne weakenesse youth wisedome experience wherein thei excell yonge men ratinge rough loude brawlinges temperinge seueritie mildenesse gentlenesse lette seruantes shewe selues diligent seruisable obey eye hearte seruinge god himselfe also lette maisters shewe selues testie harde please oppresse much sharpenesse reprochefully vse rather acknowledge thei brothren felowe seruantes vnder ye heauenly lord thei ought mutually loue gently entreat maner sai let euery cosider degre place oweth neighboures let paie oweth moreouer oure mynde oughte alwayes haue respecte lawemaker wee maye knowe lawe made well oure myndes oure handes men shoulde studie defende commodity profite nynthe commaundement thou shalte lyeng witnesse agaynste thy neighboure ende thys commaundement bycause god whyche trueth abhorreth lyinge oughte obserue trueth without deceitfull coloure summe therefore shall wee neither hurte man name either slaunders false reportes hinder goodes lyeng fynally wee offende manne luste speake euell bee busie whiche prohibition ioyned commaundement farre maie employe oure faythfull endeuoure euery man affyrminge trueth defende safetie bothe name goodes seemeth lorde purposed expounde meaning commaundement thre twenty chapter exodus woordesexod xxiij leuit xix xv thou shalte vse voyce lyeng shalte ioyne thy hande speake false witnesse wicked agayne thou shalte flee lyeng also place doth onely call v awaie lyeng pointe wee accuser whysperers people also man deceiue brother hee forbiddeth bothe seuerall commaundementes truely doute commaundementes hee hathe forbidden crueltie vnchastitie couetousnes restraineth falshoode whereof twoo partes wee haue noted either wee offende good name oure neighboures maliciousnesse frowarde mynde backbite lyeng sometime euell speakinge hinder commodity dyfference whether thys place vnderstanded solemne iudiciall testimonie common testimonie vsed priuate talkes wee muste alway haue recourse thys prynciple generall kyndes vice one speciall sorte sette exaumple wherevnto reste maie bee referred cheefely chosen wherein fylthynesse faulte moste apparant conuenient extende generally slaunders sinister backebytinges oure neighboures wrongefully greeued falshoode witnessing whiche vsed iudiciall courtes neuer withoute periurie periuries muche thei prophaine defile name god already sufficiently mette withall thirde commaundement wherefore righte vse commaundement tonge affirminge trueth serue bothe good name profite neighboures equitie therof manifest good name precious treasure euer bee lesse hurte man bee spoiled goodnesse name hys goodes learninge hys substaunce sometime false wytnesse dothe muche vyolence handes yet yt marueylous wyth howe neglygent carelessnesse menne commonly offende thys poynte founde verye fewe notably sycke thys desease muche delyted wyth certaine poysoned sweetnesse bothe searchynge oute dyscolynge euells lette v thinke sufficient excuse yf oftentymes wee lye hee forbyddeth thy brother name bee defyled wyth lyenge wylleth also bee pre erued vntouched farre truthe suffer howesoeuer hee taketh hede hym selfe onely hee tell lye yet secretly confesseth hee hathe charge hym butte thys ought suffice v kepe safe neighboures good name god hathe care yt wherefore wythoute doubte euell speakinge vtterly condemned butte wee meane euell speakynge rebukynge whyche y vsed chastismente accusation iudiciall processe whereby remedye soughte euell publyke reprehension whyche tendeth putte synners feare bewrayinge faultes whose safetie behoued shoulde bee forewarened leaste shoulde daunger ignoraunce butte meane hatefull accusynge whyche aryseth malyciousnesse wanton wyll backebyte also thys commaundement extended poynte couet vse scoffinge kinde plesauntnesse myngeled wyth bytter tauntes thereby bytyngely touche mennes faultes vnder pretense pastime manye doe seeke prayse merry conceytes wyth menes shame yea greefe also suche wanton raylynge many tymes oure neyghboures lyttle reproched nowe yf wee bende oure eye lawemaker whyche muste accordynge hys ryghtefull authoritie beare rule lesse ouer eares mynde ouer tongue truelye shal finde yt greedynesse heare backebytynges hasty readynesse euell iudgementes lesse forbydden fond manne shoulde thynke god hateth faulte euell speaking tongue doth disalowe faulte euell maliciousnesse hearte wherefore yf v true feare loue god let v endeuoure farre may expedient charitie beareth geue neyther oure tongue oure eares euell speakinges bitter iestynges leaste rashely without cause yelde oure mindes indirecte suspicion beinge indifferent expositor men sayinges doinges let v bothe iudgemente eares tongue gently preserue honoure safe tenthe commaundement thou shalte couet thy neighboures house c end comaudemet yt bicause ye lord wil ye soule wholi possessed wt ye affectio loue al lust shake mind contrarie charitie summe therefore shall bee noe thoughte creepe v whyche maye moue oure myndes wyth concupiscens hurtefull tourninge towarde others losse wherewyth side agreeth commaundement whatsoeuer conceiue purpose study vpon bee ioyned wyth benifite commoditie oure neighboures seemeth ariseth harde combersome dyfficultie bee truely sayde v vnder name fornication thefte conteyned luste fornication purpose hurte deceyue maye seeme superfluously spoken couetynge mennes good shoulde afterwarde bee seuerally forbydden v butte distinction betweene purpose couetynge wyll easylye loose v thys knotte purpose wee haue meante speakinge yt commaundementes y delyberate consent wyll luste hathe subdued mynde butte couetynge maye bee wythoute suche eyther aduisment assent mynde onely prycked tyckled vaine peruerse obiectes therefore lorde hathe heretofore commaunded rule charitie sholde gouerne oure wylles studyes woorkes hee nowe commaundeth co ceptions oure maynde bee directed rule bee none crooked wrythen maye prouoke oure mynde waye hee hathe forbydden oure mynde bee bowed ledde wrathe hatred fornication robberie lyinge hee dothe nowe forbidde v moued therevnto withoute cause doothe requyre greate vprightenesse whoe canne denye ryghteous power soule bee possessed charitie butte swarue marke charitie whoe canne denye dyseased nowe whense commeth yt manye desire hurtefull thy neighboure enter thy hearte butte thys neglectynge hym thou carest onely thy selfe yf thy mynde altogether throughlye soked wyth charitie percell thereof shoulde bee open suche imaginacions therefore muste needes bee voyde charitie farre receyueth concupiscens butte manne obiecte yet yt meete yt phantasy wythoute ordre tossed mannes wytte lengthe doe vanyshe awaye shoulde bee condemned concupiscence whose place hearte aunswere oure question kynde phantasy whyche whyle present oure myndes together byte strike oure heart desire asmuche neuer commeth oure mynde wyshe thyng butte oure hearte styrred vp leapeth wyth therefore god commaundeth marueylous feruentnesse loue whyche wylleth bee entangled wyth neuer small snare concupiscence hee requyreth marueylouslye framed mynde whyche che hee suffereth muche wyth slyghte prouociatons bee thynge styrred agaynste lawe loue thys exposition augustine dyd fyrste open mee waye bycause thou shouldest thinke yt without consent graue authoritie though yt lordes purpose forbid v wrongfull coueting yet rehersing hath brought forth example thing yt commonly doe deceyue v wyth false image delyghte bycause hee woulde learne nothynge concupiscence draweth yt thinges vpon whyche yt moste rageth triumpheth loe seconde table lawe wherein taught sufficiently owe men god sake vpon consideration wherof hangeth whole rule charitie wherefore shall vaynely call vpon duetyes conteined thys table vnlesse doctrine doe staye vpon feare reuerence god vpon foundation whyche seeke twoo commaundementes prohibition couetinge wyse reader thoughe saye nothing wyll iudge wronge diuision teare sunder whyche butte one maketh nothinge againste v worde thou shalt couet seconde time repeted fyrste sette house hee renteth partes thereof beginninge wyfe whereby playnely appeareth hebrues doe well ought bee reade one whole sentence god effecte commaundeth euery man possesseth shoulde remaine safe vntouched onely wronge lust defraude also leaste desyre may moue oure myndes ende whole lawe tendeth shall hard iudge fulfillinge ryghteousnesse yt myghte frame lyfe manne example purenesse god god hathe therein painted oute hys owne nature manne perfourme deedes whiche commaunded hee shall manner expresse image god hys lyfe therefore moses meante bring summe thereof myndes israelite hee saidedeu xxij nowe israel dothe lorde thy god aske thee butte thou feare lorde walke hys wayes loue hym serue hym thy hearte thy soule keepe commaundementes hee cessed styll synge songe againe vnto ofte purposed shewe ende lawe doctrine lawe hathe suche respect herevntode viv xjxiv ioyneth man moses place termeth maketh manne sticke faste god holynesse lyfe nowe perfection holynesse consisteth twoo principall pointes allready rehersed loue lorde god withall oure hearte oure soule oure strengthemat xxij oure neighboure oure selues firste deede oure soule bee partes fylled loue god selfe fourth floweth loue oure neighboure whiche thinge apostle sheweth wrytethi tim v ende lawe loue pure conscience farthe fained see howe heade set conscience faith vnfained saye one worde true godlynesse thense y charitie deceyued therefore hee deceyued whosoeuer thynketh lawe taughte onely certayne rudimentes fyrste introduction ryghteousnesse wherewyth menne became bee taughte theyr fyrste schoolynge butte yet dyrected true marke good woorkes whereas beyonde sentence moses thys paule youe canne desyre nothynge wantynge hygheste perfection howe farre praye youe wyll hee proceede wyll bee contented wyth thys institution whereby manne y instructed feare god spirituall worshypynge obeinge commaundementes folowe vprightnesse waye lorde finally purenesse conscience syncere faithe loue whereby confirmed exposition lawe whiche searcheth findeth commaundementes therof dueties godlynesse loue thei folow onely drie bare principle taught one halfe god know ende thereof apostle witnesseth wheras rehersing summe law christ apostle somtime leaue first table many deceiued therin thei wold faine draw wordes bothe table christ mathew calleth ye chiefe pointes lawe mercy iudgement faith vnder worde faith doubtfull mee meaneth truth faithfulnesse towarde men sentence might extended whole lawe take religiousnesse towarde god thei laboure vainemat vxiij christe speaketh workes wherwith man ought proue selfe righteous son note also cesse maruell yonge man asked hym commaundementes kepinge wherof enter life answered thinges onely thou shalte kill thou shalt committe adulteriemat xixxxviij thou shalte steale thou shalte beare false witnesse honoure thy father thy mother loue thy neighboure thy selfe obeying firste table consisted manner eyther affection hearte ceremony affection hearte appeared ceremony hypocrite continually vse workes charitie suche maye declare perfect righteousnesse commeth eche ofte prophetes muste nedes familiar reader meanly exercised manner alwaye echorte repentaunce leaue oute firste table onely call vpon faith iudgment mercie equitie thus thei ouerskippe ye feare god thei require earnest proofe thereof token yt wel knowen thei speake keepinge law thei moste parte rest vpon seconde table bicause therein studie righteousnesse vprightnesse openly seen y needlesse reherse place bicause euery man himselfe easyly marke whiche saye thou wilt say auailable perfection righteousnesse liue innocently among men true godlynesse honore god bicause man doth easilye kepe charitie pointes vnlesse earnestli feare god therfore therby proued hathe godlinesse also biside asmuch lord well knoweth benifite come v vnto thing doth also testifie ye prophetpsal xvj therfore requireth dueties self doth exercise v good workes toward neighbour therfore wtout cause ye apostle setteth ye whole perfectio ye holy one charitieeph iv colos iiixiiij rom xiij inconuenientlye place calleth ye fullfillinge lawe adding hathe perfourmed lawe loueth neighboure againe lawe comprehended one worde loue thy neighboure thy selfe teacheth thing christe doth saithmatt vijxij whatsoeuer ye men ye thys law prophetes certaine lawe prophetes faith belongeth true worship god holdeth principal place loue beneth lower degree lordes meaning yt lawe prescribed vnto v obseruation right equitie wherein exercised testifie godlye feare v therefore let v sticke faste oure lyfe shalbe best framed god rule lawe shall euery waye profitable oure brothren butte whole lawe redde one syllable apoynteth man r le suche thynges shall leaue vndone commoditie owne fleshe surely sith men borne disposition naturalli thei much carried hedlong loue selues much soeuer thei fall truthe yet still thei keepe selfe loue needed lawe enflame loue aug lib de doctrin chri c naturally selfe much beyonde measure whereby plainly appeareth loue oure selues loue god oure neighboure keping commaundements liueth best moste holyly nere maie liueth trauileth leaste selfe man liueth worse wyckedly hee liueth trauileth himselfe thinketh vpon seketh thinges hys owne lord expresse howe greate ernestnes ought led loue oure neighboures apointed bee measured loue selues rule bicause vehement stronger affection measure force manner speaking diligently weyed doth certaine sophisters haue foolishly dreamed geue first degree ye loue selues seconde charitie rather affection loue naturally drawe selues geueth away vnto wherevpo apostle saithi cor xiij v yt charitie seketh reaso estemed worth heare yt ye thing ruled euer inferiore rule god doth make ye loue selues rule whervnto charitie toward shold subiect whereas peruersnesse nature ye affectio loue wont rest selues sheweth ought el wher spred abroade yt shold lesse cherefulnesse feruentnesse carefulnesse ready good oure neighboure oure selues sith christe hath shewed parable samaritane ye vnder name neighboure euery man conteined neuer strange vnto vsluc xxxxvi ther cause whi shold restraine ye comaudemet loue within ye bondes owne frendshippes acquaintance deny yt nerer yt man vnto v ye familiarli holpen endeuours good ordie huma itie req ireth ye many moe dueties friendship men shold comunicate togither bounde togither wyth streighter bondes ky red familiaritie neighebourehoode wythout offense god whose prouidence manner driuen thervnto say al mankinde without exception embraced one affection charitie thys behalfe dyfference barbarous grecian woorthy vnwoorthy friende foe bicause thei considered god selues whyche consideration tourne away maruell entangled many erroures wherefore wyll keepe true trade louinge muste tourne oure eye vnto man sighte whome woulde ofter enforce v hate loue vnto god commaundeth loue offer poured abroade among menne perpetuall foundation whatsoeuer man yet ought loued bicause god loued wherefore moste pestilent either ignoraunce malice schoolemen commaundementes touching desyringe reuengmente louinge oure enemy whiche olde time bothe geuen iewes tyme commonly geuen christian haue made councels whiche libertie obey obey necessarie obeyinge thei haue posted ouer monkes wer though one poynt forsoothe righteous simple christian thei willingelye bound selues keepe ye councels thei rendre reason thei receiue lawes seeme burdenous heauy specially christian vnder lawe grace dare thei presume repel eternall law god touching louing oure neighvoures suche dyfference leafe lawe therein rather eche founde commaundementes moste seuerely require v loue oure enemy manner sayinge wee commaunded feede oure enemie hungrypro xxvxxi exod xxiij iiij set right way ox ass strayinge waye ease thei faint vnder burden shall good beastes sake without good selfe worde lorde euerlastingedeu xxxi ix v leu xixxviiii leaue vengeance requite whiche also spoken plainely large place seke vengeance neither mindefull iniurie thy citizen either let blot thynges oute lawe let acknoweledge yt lorde lawemaker lieingly faine councell geuer praye meane thynges thei haue presumed mocke withall vnsauorie glosematt vxliiij loue enemy doe good hate youe praie persecute youe blesse curse ye may chyldren youre father heauen lib de com punctione cordis heare reason wyth chrysostome necessarie cause plainely appeareth exhortation commaundementes remayneth blotted numbre child god opinion onely monkes shall child heauenly father thei onely shall bold call vpon god father shall churche meane season shall like righte sent awaie gentile publicansmat vxlvi christe saith ye freindely friendes fauoure looke thereby doe gentile publican shall good case forsoth title christian lefte vnto v inheritaunce kingdome heauen taken awaye v lib de doctri ch stia c lesse stronge augustine argument sayth lorde forbiddeth commit fornication lesse forbiddeth touche wife thine enemie thy frende forbiddeth thefte geueth leaue steale nothyng eyther thy frend thine enemie two steale commit fornication xiij paule bryngeth within compasse rule loue yea teacheth coteyned vnder commaundement thou shalt loue thy neighbour thy selfe therfore eyther paule muste haue ben false expositour lawe necessarily foloweth hereby enemy ought also loued euen commaundement lyke frendes therefore doe truely bewraye themselues bee chyldren satan licentiously shake common yoke child god doubted whether haue published doctrine grosse dulnesse shamelesnesse none olde wryters doe pronounce thynge certayne mere commaundemetes euen gregory age doubted appereth owne affirmation without controuersie taketh commaundementes foolishly thei reson say weighty burden christian though coulde deuised thing weighty loue god al heart al soule al strength co parison lawe thing maye compted easy whether loue enemy laye away desire reuege minde deede thinges hye harde weakenesse euen leaste tittle lawe lord whome vse strength let geue commaundeth commaunde christian menne vnder lawe grace vnbrydledly wander without law graffed christ whose grace free curse lawe whose spirite haue lawe written heartes grace paule vnproprely called lawe alludyng lawe god agaynst set co parison men name law dispute vpo mater nothyng lyke sorte called ueniall sinne bothe secrete vngodlynesse agaynste firste table also direct transgressyng laste commaundement define thus desire without aduised assent resteth long heart say come heart wante thynges required lawe forbidde haue strange god minde shaken engine distrust loketh aboute el touched wyth soden desire remoue blessednesse otherwaye whense come motion although quickely vanish awaye thyng soule empty receyue tentations ende drawe argument greater length commaundement geuen loue god heart oure mynde wyth soule yf power soule te loue god haue allready departed obedience lawe bicause enemy doe therein arise kingdome interrupt decree proue god hath throne well stablished conscience laste commaundement haue alredy shewed properly belongeth hereunto hath desire minde pricked v alredy gilty couetyng therewithall made transgressor law bycause lord doth forbid v purpose practise thyng maye others losse also pricked swell couetyng curse god doth alwaye hange ouer transgression lawe therefore proue euen least desire free fro iudgement death weyeng sinnes sayth augustine let v brynge false balance weye liste list owne pleasure lib de donatist cap sayeng heuy light let v bryng god balance holy scripture lordes tresorie let v therein weye heuy rather let v weye reknowledge thinges alredy weyed lord sayth scripture truely paule sayth rewarde sinne death sheweth knewe stinkyng distinction sithe muche enclined hypocrisie cherishement thereof ought haue ben added fla ter slouthfull conscience would god would consider sayeng christ meanethmatth vxix transgresseth one leaste commaundementes teacheth men shalbe compted none kingdome heauen sort dare extenuate trasgression law worthy death ought haue considered comaunded comaundeth bicause authoritie diminished euery transgression litle euer lawe hath geuen comaundement small matter god maiestie offended thing moreouer yf god hath declared law euer contrarie law displeaseth imagine wrath god disarmed punishement death shall forthwith follow vpon hath pronounced plainely would rather finde heartes heare voyce trouble clere truthe vnsauorie suttelties argumenteze xviijxx rom vixxiij soule sayth yt sinneth shall die againe whiche euen nowe alleged reward sinne death albeit graunt sinne bicause denie yet stande stiffe deadly sinne sithe haue hetherto much borne owne madnesse let yet legth learne waxe wiser continue dotage wil bid farewel let childre god learne al sinne deadly bicause rebellion agaynst god whiche necessitie prouoketh wrath bicause breache law vpon whiche iudgement god pronounced without exception sinnes holyones veniall pardonable owne nature bicause obteyne pardon mercie god ix chapter p christ although knowen iewes vnder law yet deliuered gospell bycause pleased god olde time vainely expiation sacrifice declare father vayne consecrate chosen people himselff euen without doubte knowen image wherein appereth v full brightnesse therefore malachiemal iiiiii bidden ye iewes take hede law moses continue studie thereof bicause death come certaine interruption office prophetes forthwith declare shuld arise sonne righteousnesse wordes teacheth lawe auaileth purpose hold godly expectation christ come yet muche light hoped come deedei pet ixii reason doth peter say prophetes make searche diligently enquire saluation opened gospell reueled vnto minister themselues owne age vnto v thinges declared gospel doctrine vnprofitable people olde time nothing auailed themselues bicause thei enioyed treasure god sent vnto v hand day grace wherof testified familiarly set eye wheras litle sippe offred vnto v plentiful enioyeng therof therefore christ whiche affirmeth yt witnesse borne moses yet extolleth mesure grace wherby excel iewes speaking disciplesiohn vxlvi mat xiiixvi luc xxxiij sayd blessed eye see whiche ye see blessed eares athat whiche ye heare many kinges prophetes haue wished haue obteined smal comendation reuelyng gospel god preferred v holy father excelled rare godlinesse whiche sentence place disagreeth saydiohn vi lvi abraham saw daye christ reioysed though sight thing farre distant somwhat darke yet wanted nothyng assurance good hope thense came ioye whiche accompanied holy prophet euen death sayeng iohn baptistiohn xviij man hath seen god time begotten bosome father hath declared vnto v doth exclude godly whiche ben dead fro elowship vnderstandyng light shineth persone christ coparyng estate oures teacheth yt misteries thei saw darkly vnder shadowes manifest v author episte hebrewes doth wel set sayeng god diuersly many wayes spake olde time propheteshebr beloued sonne although therefore begotten one day v brightnesse glory point substance god father olde time knowen iewes haue place alleaged paule guide old deliuerance yet true whiche paule el teachethii cor iiii vi god comaunded light shine darknesse hath nowe shined vpon heartes set forth knowledge glorie god face iesus christ bicause appered image maner make visible comparison darke shadowish forme ben much fowle detestable vnthankefulnesse peruersnesse blinde midde daye therefore paule sayth mindes darkened satan see glorie christ shining gospell though veile set betwene take gospell clere disclosyng misterie christi tim iiiivi graunt truely respect paul calleth gospel doctrine fayth al promise finde law concernyng free forgeuenesse sinnes whereby god reconcileth men accompted partes therof copareth faith terror wherewith conscience troubled vexed saluation sought workes wherupo foloweth takyng name gospel largely co teined vnder testimony god old time gaue father mercie fatherly fauour excellent signification saye applied publishyng grace geuen christ meanyng receyued common vse also hangeth vpon authoritie christ apostle whereupon proprely ascribed vnto himmat iiiiix mar ii preached gospell kingdome marke maketh preface maner beginnyng gospell iesus christ neede gather place proue thing sufficiently knowen christ therefore comyng hath made clere life immortalitie gospellii tim ix whiche wordes paule meaneth father drowned darknesse death vntil sonne god put flesh clayming prerogatiue honour ye gospell teacheth newe vnwonted kinde message whereby god performed thinges promised truthe promise shuld fulfilled persone sonne although faithful haue alway found experiece sayeng paule true christ promise yea amen bycause sealed heartes yet bicause hath accomplished al partes saluation flesh therefore selfe liuely deliueryng thinges rightfully obteyned newe singular title prayseioh ili whereupon cometh sayeng christ hereafter ye shall see heauens open angel god ascendyng descendyng vpon sonne manne though seme haue relation vnto ladder shewed vision patriarch iacob yet setteth excellecie coming mark opened gate heauen men entrie
