thereof maye stand familiarly open men yet must take hede deuelish imagination seruet tus whe goeth least faineth goeth extoll greatnesse grace christ vtterly abolissheth promise ended together lawe layeth fayth gospell brought vnto v accomplishment promise though difference betwene v christ deede euen nowe declare christ left nothyng vnperformed whole summe saluatio wrongfully gathered thereupon alredy enioye benefites purchaced though sayeng paule false saluation hidde hope graunt deede beleuyng christ also passe fro death life meane season muste holde sayeng iohn although knowe child god yet hath yet appered till shalbe like vnto till shall see suche therefore although christ offer vnto v gospell present fulnesse spirituall good thinges yet enioyeng thereof lieth still hidde vnder kepyng hope till beyng vnclothed corruptible fleshe transfigured glorie goeth v meane time holy ghoste biddeth v reste vpon promise whose authoritie ought v put silece barkinges filthy doggei tim iii viii ii tim ii cor vii paule witnesseth godlynesse hath promise well life come ye life present reason boasteth apostle christ accordynge promise life place putteth v minde haue promise whiche olde time geuen holy men finally setteth summe felicitie sealed vp holy spirit promise yet otherwise enioye christe farre embrace clothed promise whereby cometh passe dede dwelleth heartes yet wander yourney abrode bicause walke fayth sight two thinges ill agree together possesse christ perteineth perfection heauenly life yet faith beholdyng good thinges seene difference noted nature qualitie promise bicause gospell sheweth finger thing lawe shadow vnder figure hereby also errour conuinced whiche neuer otherwise compare lawe gospell compare merites workes free imputation righteousnesse although deede comparison contrary reiected bycause paule doth oftentimes vnderstand name lawe rule liue righteously wherin god requireth v whiche geuing v hope life vnlesse al pointes obeye side adding curse neuer litle swarme fro place disputeth yt freely please god pardon reckened righteous bicause obseruation law wherunto reward promised found therfore paule doth fitly make ye righteousnesse law gospel contrarie one gospell succede place yt whole lawe shoulde brynge diuerse meane saluation rather confirme proue force euer law promised ioyne body shadowes christ sayth lawe prophetes vntill iohn maketh father subiect curse whiche bound seruantes lawe escape rather instructed certayne udimentes stayed great way beneath heygheth doctrine gospellro lxvi therefore paule callyng gospell power god saluation euery beleuer addeth hath witnesse lawe prophetes ende epistle although shew litle praise iesus christ reuelation misterie kepte secret euerlastyng time yet doth qualifye sayeng adding expositio teachyng openly shewed writynges prophetes wherupon gather entreate whole lawe gospell differeth lawe respecte playne disclosyng thereof yet inestimable flowyng store grace whiche hath ben layed open v christ without cause sayde commyng heauenly kingdome god erected earth nowe betwene lawe gospell came iohn whiche osfice meane affinitie bothe though called christ lambe god sacrifice cleansyng sinnes shewed forth summe gospell yet bicause dyd expresse incomparable stregth glorie length appered resurrection therefore christ sayeth egal apostlesmatt xixi wordes meane though iohn excell amonge sonnes wome yet least kingdome heauen greater bicause doeth commend persones men preferred iohn prophetes auaunceth preachyng gospell hiest degree whiche preachyng see place signified kyngdome heauenioh ixxiii whereas iohn himselfe dothe answere voice though inferiour prophetes dothe fayned humility sake meaneth teache propre office embassadour committed executeth office apparitor forespoken malachiemal iiiiv beholde sende elia prophet great terrible daye lorde doe come truely dyd nothing el whole course ministerie endeuour get disciple christ also esaye proueth enioyned hym god sense christ called candell burnyng shinyngiohn vxxiv bycause broade daye yet appered yet let maye reckened among publisher gospell like vsed baptisme whiche afterwarde deliuered apostle whyche beganne fulfilled apostle free procedynge christ taken vp heauenly glorie x chapter pof likenesse olde newe testamen thinges aforesaide may appere euidetly men beginning world god adopted estate people law bond doctrine remaineth force among v bound couenat bicause smal importance point wel established adioyne vnto addition sithe father partaker al one inheritance v hoped one saluatio grace al one mediatour farre estate differed oures felowship although testimony haue gathered law prophetes profe therof make playne neuer rule religion godlinesse people god yet bicause writer oftentimes many thinges spoke difference old new testament may make reder yt sharp iudgement doubte therefore shall rightfully apoint one peculiar place better exact discussyng matter yea thing also otherwise shuld haue profitable v made necessarie mostruous losel seruettus diuerse mad sect anabaptistes haue opinion people israel tha heard swine thei fondly faine haue fatted vp lord earth without hope heauenly immortalitie therfore maye kepe away pestilent errour godly mindes also plucke doubtes whiche wont arise vpon hearyng mention diuersitie betwene old new testament let v way loke haue like vnlike one couenant lord made israelite olde time comyng christ couenant hath made v sin christ hath ben openly shewed bothe pointes maye made playne one word couenant al father differeth nothing fro oures substance matter selfe altogether one selfe ministration diuerse bicause great shortnesse man able atteine certaine vnderstadyng must need procede longer declaratio meane profit thing shewyng like rather one shalbe superfluous discourse againe new vpo al special particular haue alredy ben declared shalbe season mingle thinges together remayne yet spoke place must chiefly rest vpon three principall pointes firste holde carnal wealth felicitie marke apointed iewes aspire vnto adoption chosen vnto hope immortalitie truthe adoption certainly assured vnto bothe oracle lawe prophetes secondarily couenat whereby thei ioyned lord vpholden merites theires mercie god called thirdly bothe knew christ mediatour whome bothe ioyned god enyoye promise whiche pointes bycause seconde paraduenture yet sufficiently knowen shall place appointed declared large shall confirme many clere testimony prophetes owne mere goodnesse tender fauour euer good lord time promised people israell third also hath alredy plaine declaratios haue left first altogether vntouched therfore settyng point bicause moste specially belongeth present matter make v moste controuersie employe earnest trauaile yet wante yet thyng explication maye way supplied conuenient place added truely apostle taketh awaye doubt allrom iij sayth god father long prophetes holy scripture promised gospell whiche afterward published accordynge time apointedro iij xi agayne righteousnesse fayth whiche caught gospell selfe hath witnesse lawe prophetes gospell doth hold heartes men ioye present life lifteth vp hope immortalitie doth fasten earthly delites preachyng hope layed vp heauen doth manner transport thether thus defineth placeeph ixiij sin ye beleued gospell ye sealed vp holy spirit prymise earnest inheritance redemption possession purchaced agayne haue heard faith christ iesucol iiiii charitie toward holy one hope sake layed vp heauen wherof ye haue heard true speache gospell againe hath called v gospel partakynge glorie lord iesus christ1 thess ii xiiii wherefore called word saluation power god saue faithfull kingdome heauen doctrine gospell spirituall openeth entrie possession incorruptible life let v thinke whome promised declared passe ouer neglect care soule lie dully like beastes sekyng pleasure body neither let man cauill promise whiche sealed law prophetes cocernyng gospel ordeyned new people within litle spake gospell promised lawe addeth thinges law conteineth without doubt properly directed vnder lawe graunt deede argument forgetfull one sayd thinges whiche lawe conteineth belong iewesro iiixix remember fewe verse affirmed gospell promised lawe wherefore apostle sheweth plainly old testament chiefly tended life come sayth vnder conteined promisses gospel reason foloweth bothe stoode vpon free mercie god also confirmed meane christ preachyng gospell pronouceth thing sinner iustified fatherly kindenesse god without owned deseruyng whole summe thereof fulfilled christ whoe dare make iewes without christ whome heare couenant gospell made whereof christ fundation whoe dare make stranger benefite free saluatio heare doctrine righteousnesse fayth ministred dispute longe euident matterioh viiilvi haue notable sentence lord abraham reioysed might see daye sawe glad thing christ testifieth abraham apostle sheweth vniuersal faithful peopleheb xiiiviii whe sayth christ abideth yesterday daye euer speaketh eternall godhed christe also power whiche continually opened faythfull wherefore bothe blessed uirgin zacharie songesluc iliiix lxxii say saluation reueled christ performance promise whiche god olde time made abraham patriarch lord geuyng christ discharged olde othe sayd ende therof alway christ euerlasting life yea apostle doth make israelite egall v grace couenant also signification sacramentes meanyng example punishmentes wherewith scripture reciteth corrected olde time make corinthian afraydei cor xi xi runne like offense beginneth preface cause chalenge prerogatiue vnto selues deliuer v vengeance god susteined asmuch lord graunt vnto benefites hath gloriously set forth grace among token yf haue sayd ye trust ye peril bicause baptisme wherewith ye marked supper ye dayly receyue haue excellent promise meane time despisyng goodnesse god ye licetiously wanton know ye iewes also without sacramentes yet lord seuerely put iudgementes execution baptized passyng ouer sea cloude wherewith defended burnyng heate sonne saye passage carnall baptisme whiche certayne proportion answereth spirituall baptisme yf allowed true apostle argument could procede meaneth haue taken away christian thinke excell iewes prerogatiue baptisme neyther whiche foloweth subiect cauillation eate spirituall meate eate dronke spiritual drinke whiche expoundeth christ ouerthrowe sentence paule obiecte whiche christ saythiohn vi father eate manna wildernesse dead eateth fleshe shall dye euer whiche two place easily made agree together lorde bycause talked hearer sought bee filled foode belly cared meate soule tempered talke somewhat capacitie specially frameth comparison manna bodye accordynge sense required gette himselfe credite woulde approue power doynge suche miracle moses dyd wildernesse ob eyned manna heauen manna conceyued nothynge remedie carnall hunger wherewith people vexed pearced hyer misterie whiche paule hath respect vnto christ therefore shewe howe muche greater benefite ought loke hande reported moses dyd bestow vpon father frameth comparison great miracle opinion worthye remembred lorde moses ministred fonde heauen people susteine smal time perishe hunger wildernesse gather hereby howe muche excellente meate geueth immortalitie see lord passed ouer thyng whiche principall manna spake onely bacest profit euen bycause iewes purpose reproche hym dyd caste moses teeth whiche succored necessitie people remedie manna answered minister muche hyer grace comparison whereof carnall fedynge people whiche alone muche estemed ought righte nothyng regarded paule bycause knewe lord rayned manna heauen dyd poure downe seding belly also dyd distribute spirituall misterie figure spi ituall quickenynge christ dyd neglecte parte worthy consideration wherfore certainely clerely foloweth promise eternall heue ly life whiche nowe lord vouchesaueth graunt vnto v communicated vnto iewes also sealed spiritual sacrametes whiche mater augustine disputeth largely agaynst faustus manichee yf reader rather haue testimony alledged vnto lawe prophetes whereby may perceyue spirituall couenant common also father heare christ apostle also follow desire muche willingly bycause meane aduersaries shalbe surely conuinced shall haue afterwarde waye dallye beginne profe whiche although knowe anabaptistes pride thinke verye fonde manner bee laughed yet shall muche auayle suche reders willyng learne haue sounde wit take principle confessed suche effectuall force lyfe worde god whome euer god vouchesaueth partaker therof1 pet ixxiij quickeneth soules sayeng peter hath alwaye ben force incorruptible seede whiche abideth eueresa xii also gathereth wordes esaye sithe god old time bound iewes vnto holy boud doubt also seuer hope eternal life saye embraced worde whiche ioyne yer god take maner comunicatyng generall manner whiche poured abrode throughout heauen earth creature world whiche although quicke thinges euery one proportion nature yet doth deliuer necessitie corruption speake speciall manner whereby soules godly bothe lightened vnto knowledge god manner coupled enlightenyng worde sithe adam abel noe abraham father cleaued vnto god saye doubtfull entrie immortall kingdome god sound partakyng god whiche without benefit eternall life yf seme somewhat entangled goe let v come forme couenant shall satisfie sobre wittes also shall sufficiently conuince ignorance bende themselues speake agaynst god alwaye thus couenant seruantesleu xxvixij god ye shalbe people whiche wordes prophetes themselues wont expound life saluation whole summe blessednesse co prehended dauid doth without cause often pronounceps cxliii xv p xxxiiixij blessed people whose god lord blessed natio hath chosen inheritance earthly felicity sake bycause deliuereth death preserueth euer cotinually sheweth eternal mercie whome hath taken peopleabac ix esa xxxiiixxi deu xxxii xxix prophetes thou art god shall die lord king lawmaker shall saue v blessed art thou israel bycause thou art saued lord god labour ouermuch thynge needelesse admonition sound eche prophetes shall wante nothyng toward abundance good thinges assurance saluatio lord god rightfully face sone beginneth shine present pledge saluation man shall openly shewe himselfe god also open treasure saluationleu xxvixij god condition dwell middest v testified moses presence obteyned life must also together possessio although expressed yet thei promise spiritual life plaine enough wordes godexod vivij declare would god vnto body alone principally soules soules vnlesse ioyned god righteousnesse remaine estranged death side let ioyning present shal bring euerlastyng saluation byside testifie god also promised would alway ende hope contented present benefites extended eternitie many sayenges shewe speakyng future time meant much faithfull present euels also time come doe comfort themselues god neuer fayle nowe concernyng seconde part promise yet plainely assured blessyng god prolonged vnto beyond boundes life sayeng god seede yougen xvijvij minded declare good toward beyng dead doyng good posteritie much would fauour faile toward themselues god like vnto menne whiche therefore carry loue frendes child bicause power interrupted death employe frendely doynges vpo beare good god whose bountifulnesse hyndered death taketh awaye dead frute mercie whiche sake poureth thousand generation therefore lordes notable profe set forth vnto greatnesse flowyng pletie goodnesse fele deathexo xxvi described slowe ouer posteritie truthe promise lord seale brought forth fulfillyng named god abrahamexo iijvi isaac iacob long death ben fond naming thei vtterly perished ben one sayd god notmat xxijxxi luc xxxxxi deu xxxiij iij wherefore euangelistes reherse one argument sadduces driuen streight could denie moses testifie resurrection dead learned moses saintes hand wherupon easy gather destroyed death whome iudge life death receyued sauegard custodie protection principal point wherupon cotrouersie hangeth let v loke whether faithfull themselues haue ben instructed lord perceiued shuld haue better life el neglectyng life eye first state life enioyned god continuall exercise whereby might put minde moste miserable mengen iijxvij happinesse life adam vnhappy euen remembrance happynesse lost painfull labour hardly susteyne nedynesse shuld pressed curse god labour handes euen receyued extreme sorrow whiche remayned comfort two sonnes one taken awaye wicked slaughter brother lefte aliuegen iiiiviii whose sight worthily detested abhorred abel cruelly murthered floure age became example wretchednesse mengen vixxii noe whole world carelesly liued pleasure spent good part age great werinesse bildyng arke escaped death came passe greater troublesgen iii yf haue died hundred deathes byside arke graue x monethes nothing vnpleasaunt holden longe manner drowned dong beastes passed ouer great difficulty fell newe matter grefe saw self scorned owne sonne compelled owne mouth curse great benefit god receiued safe generall flood abraham deede may one alone compared hudred thousandgen xii iiii consider faith set vnto v best rule beleuing whose kinred must accopted maye child god absurditie abraham father faithfull possesse much smalest corner among throwen downe number moste honorable degree whole churche muste destroyed touchyng experience lyfe firste called comaundement god plucked away cotrey parentes frendes whome menne thinke bee chiefe swetenesse life euen god determined purpose meante spoyle pleasure life sone came lande commaunded dwell dryuen thense famine thither fled succour saue himselfe compelled deliuer wife abused whiche knowe whether bitter many deathes returned lande owne dwellyng driuen agayne thense famine felicitie dwell lande wherein man muste oft hungry yea die famine runne awaye therewithall brought necessitie abimelechgen xlixii muste needes redeme life losse wife many yeres longe wandred vncertainely hether thether compelled continuall brawlynges seruantes put away nephew whome loued owne sonne whiche departyng without doubt dyd otherwise take yf suffred cutting one limmes litle heard carried awaye captiue enemy whether euer wente founde neyghbours outrageously barbarous whiche woulde suffer muche drynke water welles himselfe digged great labour woulde haue redemed vse hand king gerar first ben forbidden came old age saw thing vnpleasant bitter age hath himselfe punished hauing child till beside hope begate ismaell whose birth yet payed dere whe weried brawlyng sara yf maynteinyng stubbornnesse bondwoman himselfe cause trouble household length isaac borne condition firste begotten ismaell must forsaken cruelly caste dores isaac left whome weryed age silly good man might rest within litle commaunded kil man wit deuise miserable father made butcher owne sonne isaac dyed sickenesse whoe woulde haue thought olde manne moste miserable sonne geuen mockeage whome griefe want child doubled ben slayne straunger vnhappinesse thyng woulde haue muche encresed miserie passeth example miserie haue slayne father one hande finally whole course life tossed vexed man would table paint example miserable life could finde none fit abraham let man obiect altogether vnhappy length prosperously escaped many greate tempestes saye liueth blessed lyfe whiche longe space together paynefully weareth infinite trouble without felyng euels quietly enioyeth present good thinges isaac lesse troubled euelles yet scarce euer toke taste swetenesse also felt vexation doe suffer manne blessed earth famine chaced lande chanaangen xxvi xxxv wyfe violently plucked away bosome neighbour ofte troubled meanes oppressed fayne stryue water home owne housege xxviii suffred muche troublesonnesse childrens wiues greued wyth disagreementes sonnes could remedie greate mischiefe banishment whome blessed iacob nothynge el notable example extreme infelicitie passed childehod moste vnquietly home amonge threatenynges terror elder brotherge xxviii v whiche length copelled geue place fled parentes natiue countreyge xxixxx biside greuous thing liue banishment nothyng kindly gently receiued vncle laban sufficed serued seuen yere hard cruell seruice also muste guile defrauded wife wiues sake driuen new seruice daye fried heate sunne night laye wakyng payned froste cold himselfe complayned space xx yeares suffred hard life dayly vexed newe iniuries father lawegen xxxixxiii neyther quiet owne house seyng diuided manner scattered abrobe hatred brawling enuye w ues comaunded returne cou trey compelled watche auantage take iourney much like shamefull runnyng awaye yet could escape vniust dealyng father lawe fayne suffer reproches rebuke middes iourney fell muche cruell distressegen xxxii xi came nere brother many deathes eye mighte prepared cruell manne bent enemie aboue mesure tormented drawen sonder terrible feares long loked brother comyng whe came one sight fel downe half dead feete vntill found fauorable durste haue hopedgen xxxv xvi biside firste entrie lande lost rachel derely beloued wyfe afterwarde heard word sonne whiche herge xcj xxx whome therefore loued aboue reste torne wilde beastes whose death howe great griefe conceyued himselfe declared longe wepynge obstinately stopped vp wayes whereby comfort mighte come leauyng hymselfe nothynge goe downe sonne waylyng grauege xxx ii ij meane time howe great cause griefe wayting werinesse rauishment deftourynge daughter boldenesse sonnes reuenging whiche made abhorred sight inhabitantes countrey also procured moste present perill vtter destructiongen xxxvi xij followed horrible outragious offense ruben first begotten sonne whiche suche coulde chaunce greuous wheareas defilyng man wyfe reckened amonge hyest yll fortune sayde wickednesse committed man owne sonne within litle whyle afterge xxxvi xviii house spotted vunaturall adulterie many shame might well breake heart otherwise constant vnable vanquished calamity nere ende life sought prouide succour famine striken tidynges newe misfortune vnderstandynge sonnes kepte prysongen xl xxxii recoueryng whome compelled leaue rest beniamin dearling ca think suche heape mischeues one moment geuen hym safely take breath therefore himselfe beste witnesse himselfegen x vii ix affirmed pharao dayes shorte uell vpon earth nowe truely declareth hath passed lyfe continuall misery denieth felte prosperitie whiche lorde promised therefore eyther iacob vnkindely vnthankefully weye grace god truely professed ben miserable vpon earth affirmation true foloweth hope fastened vpon earthly thinges holy father loked vndoubtedly blessed lyfe hande god truely bothe thought sawe bee manner blessednesse blessednesse earthly li e whiche thynge apostle also doth shewe excellently well abraham sayth direct fayth lande promise strange landheb xiix dwellyng tentes isaac iacob parteners inheritaunce loked citie set vpon good fundation maker bilder whereof god dead fayth receyuyng thinges promised loking farre beleuyng confessyng gestes stranger vpon land whereby declare sought coutree yf ben moued desire lande whense came power returne sought better heauenly coutree wherefore god shamed called god asmuch hath prepared citie ben duller blockes followe promise earnestly wherof appered hope earth vnlesse loked fulfillynge el chiefely enforceth without good reason thei called life iourney home euen moses reporteth stranger foreners lande chanaan lordes promise wherby made heires itgen x v ix sheweth plainely therefore lordes promise cocernyng possessio therof respect wherefore purchaced one foote land chanaan burial wherby testified hope shuld receiue frute promise till death cause iacob much estemed buried theregen x vij x x xxx compelled sonne ioseph promise swere performe ioseph willed bonesge lxxv certayne age longe fallen powder remoued thither finally appereth plainely trauailes life alway set blessednesse life come purpose iacob haue much desired great danger sought preeminence first begotten whiche shoulde procure nothyng banishment manner caste beyng childe good vnlesse respecte hyer blessyng declared yt meanyng wordes spake among last breathingesgen xlixxviij lord loke thy saluation saluation could haue loked whe sawe laye ready geue vp ghost vnlesse seene death beginnyng newe life dispute holy one chrildren god euen without taste suche vnderstandyng whiche otherwise enemie truthe meant balaam whe saydnum xxiij x psa cxvixv p xxxiiijxx j let soule dye death righteous let laste time like vnto theires meante thynge dauid afterwarde vttered death sainctes precious sighte lorde death wicked euell furthest bounde ende death coulde noted difference betwene righteous vnrighteous differ one diuersite estate death shall befall bothe yet come beyonde moses whiche menne saye office perswade carnall people worship god frutefulnesse ground plentie thinges yet vnlesse manne flee light willyngly offreth selfe alredy playne declaration spirituall couenant yf come downe prophetes full brightnesse bothe lyfe euerlastyng kyngdome christ vtter themselues first dauid time accordyng order god distribution shewed heauenly misteries shadowes darkely rest yet plainnesse certaintie directeth al sayenges end estemed ye earthly dwellingps xxx xxiii sentece testifieth forener strager al father euery liuing vanitie euery one walketh shadow exspectatio lord euen thee hope truely yt cofessyng earth nothinge sounde stedfast kepeth still stedfastnesse hope god cosidereth felicitie layed vp place consideration wont call ye faithefull oft meaneth comforte truely place spoken shortenesse transitorie vanishing image man life addethpsal xvii mercie lorde euer vpon feare like wherevnto hundred seconde psalme beginning lorde thou didst lay foundation earth heauens workes thy handes thei shal perishe thou abidest thei shal waxe olde like garment thou shalt change apparell thou remaine selfe thy yeares shall faile sonnes thy seruantes shall dwell thy posteritie shalbe stablished thee godly cesse decay heauen earth stablished lorde foloweth saluacio ioyned eternitie god hope stand vnlesse rest vpon promise set forth esaicesai livi heauens sayth lorde shall vanish away like smoke earth shalbe worne like garment inhabitantes shall perish like thynges saluacion shalbe euer righteousnesse shall faile euerlastingnesse geuen righteousnesse saluacion respect thei remaine god respect thei felte men neither may otherwyse take thynges commonly speaketh prosperous successe faithfull applie ye open shewing ye heauenly glorie saienges lorde kepeth soules righteouspsa xcviix shal deliuer hand sinner light arisen righteous ioye vpright heartepsal cxiiviiix p cxlx p cxiivi p xxxiiiixxiii righteousnesse godly man abideth euer hys horne shalbe exalted glorie desire sinner shal perish righteous shall confesse vnto thy name vpright shall dwell thy countenance againe ye righteous shall eternall remembrance againe lorde shall redeeme soules hys seruantes lorde oftentimes leaueth seruantes lust wycked onely vexed also torne peeces destroied suffereth good lye languishing darkenesse filth whyle wicked manner shine among starres doth chere brightnesse countenance enioye long continuing gladnesse wherefore euen also hideth yf faithfull fasten eye vpon presente state thynges shalbe striken sore temption though wer fauoure reward innocencye god much doth wickednesse ye part prosper florish ye companie godly oppressed shameps lxxiiixvii pouertie contempt kyndes cross wanted little saith foote slipped steppe fell abroade fortune fooles greueth see prosperitie wicked length rehersall concludeth bente thought coulde vnderstand thinges tormente spirit till enter sanctuarie lorde vnderstand last ende let v therfore learne yet confession dauid holy father vnder old testament ignorant seldome neuer god doth world performe seruantes thinges promiseth therefore dyd lifte vp theyr mindes god sanctuarie wherein thei laied vp store whiche appeareth shadowe present life last iudgement god thei coulde see eye content vnderstande faithe trustinge vpon affiance whatsoeuer happened worlde yet thei doubted time wold one come promise god shoulde fulfilled sayengs witnessepsa xvij psa l x psa x ijxiij wil behold face god righteousnesse wil satisfied thy countenance againe greene oliue tree house lorde againe righteous shall florish date tree shal sprede branch like ceder libanus planted house lorde thei shall florishe palace oure god shall still beare frute thei shall fat grene olde age saide little deepe thy thoughtes lord wicked florish thei budde like herbe yt thei may perishe euer faire shew beautie faithfull face worlde shall bee tourned warde dysclosing kingdome god thei tourned eye eternitie thei despised hardnesse enduring moment present miseriespsal lvxxiix boldly burste forth woordes thou shalte suffer euer righteous dye thou shalte throwe downe wicked hedlong pit destruction worlde pitt eternall destruction may swallowe vp wicked amonge whose felicity also reckened place thei close vp ende life momentiob xxixiij without long languishing greate stedfastnesse holly one dauid himselfe eche complaineth onely shaken trouble also oppressed vtterly broken peeces forsoothe set eye altering course worlde beareth whiche vnstable vnstedfast ebbing flowing tide lorde shall one day sitte eternall settling heauen earthpsa xlix v place hee excellently well describeth foolish stay vpon welthinesse proude bicause great rich yet man though florish neuer great dignitie redeeme brother death man paye god ye price raunsome wheras thei see bothe ye wyse dye wicked also fooles perishe leaue ryches stranger yet thei thinke thier house shal abide euer dwellynges ende age thei aduaunce name vpon earth man shall continue honore shalbe like beastes yt die imaginacion theires extremest folly whyche yet posteritie gredyly folow thei shalbe placed like flock hell deathe shall haue rule ouer lyght ariseth vpright shall haue dominion ouer beautie shall perishe hell dwelling house first laughing scorne foolish thei rest slipperie rollynge good thinges worlde dothe shewe wyse must seeke farre felicitie euidently discloseth misterie resurrection destruction extinguishmente erecteth kingdome godly rising light pray shall wee call reueling newe life whyche foloweth ende thys present life thense spring vp consideration whiche faythfull oftentimes vsed comforte thir misery remedie patience momente lordes displeasureps xxxv life mereye howe determine affliction ende moment affliction manner life longe dyd thei espye longe e duringe godes kindenesse whereof thei scarsely felt lyttle taste thei hadde sticked faste vpon earthe coulde haue founde thing bicause thei loked vpon heauen thei acknowledged moment time lord exercise holy one crosse mercy wherein thei gathered together last worldes age againe oresee eternall neuer endinge destruction vngodlye whiche dreame happy one daiepro xvij wherevpon came sayinges remembrance righteous shall blessing butte name wicked shall rotte precious deathe saintes sighte lordeps cxvi xxxx sa x deathe wicked moste euell againe samuel lorde shall keepe feete holy wicked shall put silence darkenesse whiche declare thei well knewe howesoeuer holy diuersly carryed aboute yet laste ende lyfe saluation prosperitie wycked pleasaunt waye whereby thei little little slide forwarde gulfe deathe therefore thei called deathe suche destruction vncircumcisede xx x xxxi p lxixxx whome hope resurrection cutte awaie wherefore dauid coulde deuise greuous curse let blotted boke life written righteous aboue notable sayeng iob knowe redemer liueth last daie shal rise againe earth fleshe shall see god sauioure hope layed vp bosome haue mynde make shewe sharpe witte cauill vnderstanded last resurrection firste daye iob loked haue god gentle himiob x xxxv whiche although graunt parte yet shall wee enforce confesse whether wyll noe iob coulde haue come largenesse hope rested thoughte vpon earthe therefore muste needes confesse lifted vp eye immortalitie come whiche sawe redeemer would present euen lyeng graue thinke present life death vttermost desperation whiche death coulde cutt iobs hopeiob iijxv yea though kill said neuerthelesse still hope let trifler carpe saie sayenges fewe whereby y proued suche doctrine among iewes wyll answer fewe dyd sayenges vtter secret wisedome wherevnto onely certayne excellente wittes seuerally priuately suffred atteine thei holy ghoste apointed teacher people openly published misteries god vniuersally learned ought principle common religion among people therefore heare publike oracle holy ghoste wherein spake spirituall lyfe clerely plainely churche iewes pointe vntolerable stubbournesse sende away fleshly couenant wherin mention made nothing earth earthly wealthinesse come downe latter prophetes wee maye freely walke oure owne felde yf harde v gett vpperhande dauid iob samuel shall muche easye god kepte distribution ordre disposinge couenant hys mercye howe muche nearer drewe processe tyme full perfourmance thereof muche greater encreasementes reuelation hee dyd daye daie bryghtly shewe therefore beginning firste promise saluation made vnto adam glystered oute smale sparkle hauinge added vnto greater largenesse light began put forth whiche thense fourth brake displayed bryghtnesse farther abroade till length cloudes dryuen awaye christe sonne righteousnesse fully lyghtned whole woorlde neede therfore feare wee fayle testimony prophetes seeke proue oure cause bicause see wyll aryse huge deale matter wherevpon shoulde bee constrained necessytie tarrye longer proportio purpose maye beare woulde growe worke great volume also bicause haue already thinges haue saide made plaine waye euen reader meane capacitie maye goe forwarde wythoute stumbling therefore wyll present absteine long tediousnesse whyche y lesse necessarie geuing reader warning hande remembre open theyr owne waye key haue fyrste geuen theyr hande ofte prophetes speake blessednesse faithfull people whereof scarscely leaste steppe seen present life thei maye resorte distinction prophetes better e presse goodnesse god shadow expresse people temporall benefites certaine rough drawing ye portraiture therof ye perfect image yt thei haue painted therof suche might rauish men myndes earh element worlde age shal perishe necessitie rayse vp considering felicitie lyfe y come spirituall wyll content one example israelite carryed awaye babylon sawe scattering abroade like vnto deathe coulde hardely remoued thys opinion thought al fable ezechiel prophecied restitution xxxv jiii bicause thei reckened euen one tolde rotten carcase shoulde restored againe lyfe lorde shewe euen difficultie coulde stop bringing hys benefite effect shewed prophete vision field full due bone moment ye onely power hys worde restored breath liuelienesse vision dede serued correct incredulitie present time meane season put iewes minde far ye power lord extended beyond accompt people whyche easyly quyckened onely becke bone already rotten scattered abroade wherefore shall compare wyth sayeng esaieesa xxvixix deade shall rise carcase thei shall rise againe awake ye reioyse dwell dust bicause deaw greene fyelde thy deaw thou shalt pluck downe lande gyantes ruine people enter thy tentes shutt thy dores vpon thee hide little whyle tyll displeasure passe ouer beholde lorde shall goe hys place visite iniquitie dweller vpon earthe agaiste hym earth shal shewe forth bloode shal longer hide slaine albeith man shoulde fondly woulde goe drawe suche rule place wythout couering shewe immortalitie come prepared faithful kingedome god whyche sorte haue recited lyke sorte moste parte reste specially twoo one esaieesai lxvixxj newe heauen newe earthe make stande mee shal seede stande shal moneth moneth sabbat sabbat fleshe shall come worshippe face faith lorde shall goe see deade carcase men haue offended mee worme shall dyeda xiji fyer shall quenched daniel time shal rise vp michael great prince standeth sonnes people shall come tyme distresse suche syns nation fyrste began shall thy people saued shall founde wrytten thy boke slepe duste earthe shall awake eternall life euerlastinge shame nowe prouinge twoo pointes father christe pledge couenant reposed affiance bleesing wyll trauaile therein bicause haue lesse controuersie plainnesse let v therfore boldely determine thys whych engine deuel may remoued olde testament couenant whiche lorde made people israel limited within compasse earthly thinges also conteyned promyse spirituall eternall life expectation whereof must nedes haue ben imprinted mindes truely consented couenant let v put farre awaye madde pernicious opinion either god set forth hys promise iewes nothinge ell iewes sought nothynge ell syllynge belly delites fleshe floryshinge wealth outwarde power frutefullnesse chyldren whatsoeuer naturall man esteemethmat viijxi daie christe promiseth kingdome heauen thei shall rest abraham isaac iacobact iii xxii peter affirmed iewes time heires grace gospel thei wer child prophet comprehended ye couenant ye lord olde time made wyth people shoulde bee wittenessed wyth wordes onely lorde also approued deede moment rose againemat xxvii li vouche saued haue many ye holy men rise againe companie made bee seen citie geuing assured token whatsoeuer suffered purchacing eternall saluacion pertemeth lesse faithful old testamentar xvvi j vnto v peter testifieth thei also endued spirit faith wherby regenerate lyfe nowe heare spirit v certaine sparcle immortalitie wherevpon also place called earnest inheritance likewise dwel dare take inheritance life whereby muche maruell olde time sadduces fell grossnes erroure denyed bothe resurrection also substance soules bothe whiche poyntes thei sawe sealed clere testimony scriptur lesse maruelled eue day olly nation loking earthly kingdome christ scripture long declared shoulde haue punishment refusing gospell behoued iuste iudgement god strike myndes blindenesse whiche refusinge lighte heauen offered dyd wylfully brynge selues darken e cor iiixiiii therefore thei reade continually turne ouer moses butte stopped wyth veyle sette betweene thei see light shineth countenance shal remaine couered hidden til turned christe whome nowe thei trauaile leade drawe away muche lieth xi chapter difference one testament wilt thou say shall dyfference lefte betweene olde testament newe purpose serue place scripture wher thei compared one againste thinges moste contrary willingly allowe difference rehersed scripture nothing hinder vnitie already stablyshed shalbe plaine see shall haue entreated ordre dyfferences farre euer coulde marke remembre chefely fower numbre lyst adioyne v say trust proue thei suche rather belong manner ministratio substance meane thei shall nothinge hinder yt promise olde new testament may remaine al one one foundatio ye promise christ fyrst difference yt although euen olde time also lordes wyl dyrect myndes people haue raysed vp heauenly inheritance yet myght better nourished hope therof gaue seen rather tasted vnder earthly benefytes nowe hauing reueled grace lyfe come gospell clerely plainly directeth mindes streight way meditation thereof leauinge inferioure manner exercising whyche vsed israelite marke purpose god doe thynke olde people clymbed hyer good thynges promised bodye thei often heare lande chanaan named excellent rather reward kepers god lawe thei heare god threatneth nothing seuerely transgressor law shal dryuen possession lande scattered abroad strange region thei see manner effect come blessinges curse pronounced moses herby vndoubtedly determine iewes owne sake others seuered nation churche christ might haue image whose outwarde forme shee might see exaumples spirituall thinges fith scripture dothe sometimes shew god himselfe directed earthly benefites hee ende might leade hande hope heauenly benefites muche vnskilfulnesse wyll sate blockishnesse consider ordre disposition issue pointe oure controuersie sorte men thys teache possession land chanaan israelite chefe last blessednesse v reuelinge christ doth figuratiuely signifie heauenly inheritaunce syde affirme thei dyd earthly possession whiche enioyed lokinge glasse beholde inheritance come whiche beleued prepared heauen shall better appeare similitude paule vsed galatiansgal ii j compareth nation iewes hyer wythin age whiche yet able gouerne hym selfe foloweth guydinge tutor schoolemaister whose custodie hee committed whereas applieth similitude ceremony nothinge hindereth yt may also fittly serue purpose inheritance apoynted apoynted v suche yet want age thei capacitie enter vpon vse churche among whereof age yet childyshe therefore lorde kepte vnder schooling hee gaue spirituall promise naked openly wer shadowed earthly promise therfore wher called abraham isaac iacob posteritie vnto hope immortalitie promised lande chanaan inheritance determine hope vpon beholdynge shoulde exercise confirme selues hope true inheritance yet appeare myghte deceiued geuen hyer promyse testifie lande hyest benefite god abraham suffred f ye slouthefull promyse receyued lande hys minde wt greater promise raised vp vnto yt lorde abraham hearde saide vnto himge xvi thy protector thy rewarde exceedinge greate see abraham hathe ende reward set fourth lorde shoulde accompte vpon transitorie slippery reward elementes worlde rather thinke suche canne wither away afterwarde adioyneth promise lande entent sholde token good god figure heauenly inheritance holy men meaning owne sayenges declare dauid riseth vpwarde temporall blessinges highest last blessingps lxxiijxxvi lxcxiiiiiiij p xviv p cxliivi hearte saith fleshe fainte desire thee god portion euer againe lorde parte inheritance cuppe thou art sauest mine heritage againe haue cryed vnto thee lorde saide thou art hope portion lande liuing truly thei dare speake withoute doubt professe hope thei climbe aboue worlde good thinges presente prophetes ofte describe blessednesse worlde come vnder yt figure thei receiued lorde saienges vnderstandediob xviiixv godly shal possesse land inheritance wycked shal destroied hierusalem shal aboud kinde richesse syon ouerflowe plentie al thinges whiche see proprely spoken lande oure wayfaringe earthly ierusalem true contrey faithfullps cxxxii iij heauenly citie wherein lorde hathe commaunded blessinge life euer reason reade holy men time olde testament esteme mortal life blessinges therof nowe meete although thei knewe wel thei shold rest ende race yet thei called mynde markes grace lord pointed therin exercise according ye small rate tendernesse thei felte greater swetnesse considered selfe lorde testifyinge good toward faithful present good thinges shadowe expresse spirituall felicitie suche figure signes side corporal paine shewe exaumples hys iudgement againste reprobate therefore benefytes god wer seen earthly thinges wer also punishmetes whyle vnskilfull weye thys comparison agreement may call betweene punishmentes rewardes thei marue l muche alteration god olde time sodeinely ready take vengeance euery offence man sterue horrible punishmentes nowe layed awaye affection old angrienesse punisheth bothe muche gentlie seldomer yea cause doe almoste imagine severall god olde newe testament whiche manichee deede butte shal easily delivered suche doubtes laye mindes consider ordrely disposition god haue spoken whose tyme signifie set forthe figure grace eternal felicitie come temporall benefites greuousnesse spirituall deathe corporall peines whereby hee deliuered hys testament israelite yet certaine manner folded vp difference olde newe testament sayde bee fygures olde testamente dyd shewe onely image abscence truthe shadowe steede bodye newe testament geueth truthe present sounde bodie self difference mentioned commonli whersoeuer new testament comparison set againste olde largely entreated epistle hebrues el apostle disputeth againste whiche thought obseruations moses lawe might taken awaye thei sholde also drawe wyth ruine religion confute thys erroure vseth whiche forespoken prophete concerning presthoode christe whereas geuen hym eternall presthoodepsa cx certaine prestehoode taken away wherin newe successor dayly put one hee proueth institution newe prestehoode preferred bicause stablished othe addeth change preestehoodehe vijxl xix ixix xi also conteined change testament necessarie proueth reason weakenesse law coulde helpe nothing perfection procedeth declaring weakenesse euen certaine outwarde righteousness fleshe whyche could make obseruers perfect according conscience sacrifice beastes coulde neither wipe away synnes purchase true holynesse concludeth therefore shadowe good thynges come liuely image thinges selues therefore office bee introduction better hope whiche delyuered gospell bee seen poynte couenant lawe compared couenant gospell ministerie christe ministerie moses comparison concerned substance promisses greate dyfference betweene twoo testamentes sithe poynte oure case leadeth v waye muste tende thys ende fynde oute truth let v set forth heere couenant whiche hathe stablished eternall neuer peryshe accomplyshment therof whereby atteineth stablished continuing force christe whyle suche establyshment expectation lorde moses apointe ceremony bee solemne signes coufyrmation nowe came question whether ceremony ordeyned lawe oughte geue place christe althoughe ceremony deede onely accidentes verylye addition thynges adioyned people call accessarie thynges couenaunte yet bycause weare instrumentes meanes admynistration thereof beare name couenaunte yt selfe lyke y wonte bee attributed sacramentes therefore summe olde testamente thys place called solemne fourme confyrmynge couenaunte conteyned ceremony sacrifice apostle saythe bycause yt y nothynge perfecte vnlesse wee passe therefore yt behoued shoulde bee dysco tinued abrogate place myght geuen christe assurer mediatore better testament whome eternall sanctification one purchaced elect transgression blotted oute remayned vnder lawe like better thus olde testament lorde whiche deliuered wrapped vp shadowish effectual obseruation ceremony therfore time bicause wer hang suspense vntyll myght staye vpon stedfast substantiall confyrmation onely made newe eternall consecrate stablyshed bloode christe wherevpon christe calleth cuppe gaue supper disciple cup newe testament bloodemat xxvi signifie testamet god attemeth trueth whiche cometh newe eternal sealed bloode hereby appeareth sense apostle saide scholynge lawegal iiixxiiii iiii iewes brought vnto christ shewed flesh confesseth thei child heires god yet suche yonge age kept vnder custodie schoolemaster behoued ere sonne righteousnesse yet rysen sholde neither great brightnesse reuelation great deepe sight vnderstandynge therefore god gaue measure light hys worde thei saw yet farre darkely therfore paule expresseth sclendernesse vnderstanding ye terme yonge age whiche lord wil haue exercised yt element worlde warde observation rule instruction child vntyll christe shoulde shyne broade behoued knowledge faithfull people shoulde growe full age distinction christe selfe meant ofmat xixiii hee saide lawe prophetes vntyll ihon thenseforth kingedome god preached lawe prophetes open men time euen thei gaue taste yt wisedome time come sholde plainely disclosed thei shewed twinclingely shyning farr came passe christ might pointed finger kingedome god set open laied abroade treasure al wisdome vnderstanding whereby wee atteineclos iix euen manner secret closettes heauen maketh v ther scarsely one found christian churche excellencye faith maye compared abraham prophetes excelled suche force spirite euen daye thei lighten whole worlde withall oure question grace lord hathe bestowed vpon ordinarie disposition vsed teachinge people suche declared prophetes selues endued peculiar knoweledge aboue rest euen preaching dark enclosed figure thinges farre moreouer howe meruellous knoweledge soeuer appeared aboue yet forasmuche wer dryuen necessitie submit common childish struction people thei selues also reckened nu bre child fynallye neuer chaunged suche clere sfyght tyme dede parte savoure darknesse timematt xiijxvij lu xxxiiij whervpon christ saide many kinges prophetes haue desired see thinges ye see haue seen heare thynges ye heare haue hearde therefore blessed eye bicause see eares bicause heare truely meete presence christ sholde haue excellencye prerogatiue shoulde arise clere reuelinge heauenly mystery purpose also maketh euen nowe alleaged firste epistle peter pet ix yt opened trauaile profitable principally oure age nowe come thirde dyfference whiche taken oute ieremieier xxxixxxj whose woordes beholde dayes shall come saithe lorde wyll make newe couenant house israel house iuda accordinge couenant made wyth father daye toke hand leade oute launde egypt couenant thei made voyde althoughe ruled ouer thys shall couenant make house israel wyl put lawe theyr bowelles wyll wryte heartes mercifull iniquitie man shall teache hys neighboure man brother shall al knowe leaste vnto moste whyche wordes apostle tooke occasion make thys comparison betweene lawe gospell hee called lawe literall gospel spiritual doctrinei cor vi lawe sayde fashioned oute table stone gospell wrytten heartes lawe preachinge deathe gospell preachinge lyfe lawe preachinge damnation gospel preachinge righteousnesse lawe made voyde gospell abydeth sithe apostle purpose butte declare meanynge prophete shall bee suffycient wee weye woordes one atteyne meanynge bothe bee vnly enesse betweene apostle speaketh odiouslye lawe prophete dothe symple respecte bycause certayne naughty menne hauinge wronge zeale lawe whyche peruerse loue ceremony obscure brightnesse gospel disputeth nature lawe accordinge erroure foolish affection therefore shall good note peculiarly paule bycause comparison sette olde newe testament one consider nothing law whiche proprely belongeth vnto example lawe dothe commonly euery place containe promise mercie bycause borowed ell therfore reckened part lawe mere nature lawe spoken onely thing ascribe vnto commaunde thinges right forbidde wicked doynges promyse reward folowers righteousnesse threaten punishmente transgressor meane time neither change amende ye peruersenesse heart naturally men nowe let v expounde apostle comparison one peece olde testament literall bicause published without effectuall workinge spirit newe spiritual whyche lorde hathe spiritually grauen heartes men therefore seconde diuersitie declaration fyrste olde deadly bicause nothinge wrappe mankinde within curse newe instrumente lyfe bycause deliuereth curse restoreth fauoure god olde ministerie damnation bycause condemneth adam child vnrighteousnesse newe ministerie ryghteousnesse bicause reue eth mercie god whyche made ryghteous last diuersitie referred ceremony bycause olde testament mage thynges absent behoued shoulde tyme de aye vanyshe away gospell bycause geueth true bodye deede kepeth styll fyrme perpetuall stedfast esse ieremie dede calleth euen morall lawes weake fraile couenant reason bycause sodeine fallynge away vnthankfull people broken forasmuche suche breakynge faulte people proprely layed vpon testamente ceremony forasmuche theyr owne weakenesse dissolued comminge christe cause weakenesse within selues nowe dyfference letter spirite taken thoughe lorde hadde geuen lawes iewes wythout frute hauyng none conuerted vnto hym spoken waye comparison aduaunce abundance grace wherewyth lawemaker puttinge newe personage honorably sette forth preachinge gospell yf wee recken vp multitude whome lorde oute al people hath preaching gospell regenerate wyth hys spirite gathered communion churche shall saye fewe manner none olde time israell wyth affection mynde entirely heart embraced couenant lorde whoe yet many yf bee reckened theyr owne numbre wythoute comparison third difference riseth fourth scripture calleth old testament testament bondage ingendreth feare men myndes newe testament testament libertie bycause rayseth vp confydence assurednesse sayth paule eyght romamesrom iv ye haue receyued spirit bondage agayne feare spirite adoption whiche crie abba father hervnto serueth epistle ye hebrues faithefull nowe come bodyly mount xiixx kind led fyre whirlewinde darkenesse tempest nothing heard seen striketh menns mindes terrore much moses hym selfe quaked feare terryble voyce sounded whyche besoughte myghte heare butte wee come mounte syon cytye sy ynge god heauenly hierusalem butte whyche paule shortly toucheth sentence haue alleged epistle romaine setteth largely ye epistle galatian maketh allego e twoo sonnes abraham mannergala iiijxxi agar bondwoman fygure mount sinai people israel receiued lawe sara freewoman figure heauenly hierusalem whense procedeth gospell seede agar borne bonde whiche maye neuer come inheritance seede sara orne free whome inheritaunce due lawe made subiect bondage gospell onely regenerate freedome summe commeth effecte olde testamente dyd stricke conscience feare tremblinge bene ite newe testament commeth passe thei made ioyefull olde holde conscience bounde vnto yoke boudage lyberalitie newe thei discharged bondage brought freedome oute people israel thei obiect againste v holy father sithe euident endued wyth spirit foloweth thei also partaker selfe freedome ioye answer neither bothe came lawe thei felte selues lawe oppressed estate bondage weried vn e e conscience ed succoure gospell therefore peculiar frute newe testament beside common lawe olde testament wer exempted euels moreouer wyll denye endewed wyth spirit freedome assurednesse part fele seare bondage lawe howe soeuer enioyed prerogatiue whyche obteined grace gospell yet subiect bondes b rdens obseruation common people sithe therefore compelled carefull keeping ceremony whyche signes scholing muche like vnto bondage handewritinges whereby confessed selues gylty synne discarge bonde maye rightfully saide comparison v vnder testament bondage feare wee haue respecte common ordre dystribution lorde vsed wyth people israel three laste comparison haue recited lawe gospell wherfore name olde testament meant lawe name nwe testament meant gospell fyrste stretched comprehendeth vnder promise also published lawe lib ad boni ca butte whereas augustine denyeth oughte reckened vnder name olde testament therein thought well meant euen thynge nowe teache hee hadde regarde sa enges hieremie paule olde testament seuered woorde mercye grace thys also hee aptelye adioyueth place chyldren promise regenerate god whyche faythe woorkynge throughe loue haue obeyed commaundements beginning worlde belong newe testament hope fleshly earthly temporall spiritual heauenly eternal good thinges principally beleuing mediatore whome thei doubted spirite munstred vnto bothe good haue pardon oft sinned thinge minded affirme sainctes whome scripture reherseth haue beginning worlde chosen god partaker selfe blessing v vnto eternal saluation difference therfore betwene oure diuision augustine oures according sayeng christematth j lawe prophetes vnto ihon thenseforthe kingdome god preached dothe make distinction betweene clerenesse gospell darker dystribution woorde wente augustine doothe onely ouer weakenesse lawe strength gospell also noted concerning holy father liued vnder olde testamente steyed allwaye aspired newe yea imbraced assured partakinge thereof apostle condemneth blindenesse accursednesse whiche beinge contented present shadowes stre ch vp minde vnto christe speake nothinge rest greater blindenesse imagined hope purginge sinne killinge beast secke cleansing soule outward sprinkling water seeke appease god colde ceremony thoughe muche delited therewith absurdity thei fall sticke fast obseruations lawe without respect christe fifth dyfference may adde lyeth vntill comming christe lorde chosen one nation within woulde keepe seuerall couenant grace hyest dystribute nation deuided sonnes adam saith moses people fell possessionde xxxiviii de xxiiij iacob corde inheritance place thus speaketh people beholde heauen earth lord thy god cleaned onely thy father loued choose sede euen selues oute nation therefore hee vo tchesaued graunte knoweledge hys name people onely yf onely men belonged vnto hym layed hys couenant theyr bosome openli shewed presence godhed honored prerogatiues butte omitte reste bene ites speake whiche onely oure purpose bounde hym communycatynge woorde hee might called co mpted god meane season suffered nation walke vanitie though enter course thynge wyth hymact x iijxvi neither dyd helpe destruction euen onely remedie namely preachinge hys woorde therefore israel lordes sonne hys derlynge straungers israell knowen hym receyued hys charge protection mere le te owne darkenesse israell sanctified god prophane israell honoured wyth presence god excluded comming nye vnto fullnesse time come appointed restoringe men reconciler god men deliuered deede particion plucked downega iiijiii ep ijxiiii gala vixv psal ijv psal lxi whiche longe holden mercye god enclosed within ye boundes israel peace preached farre euen nere adioyned together reconciled god might growe one people wherefore nowe respect greke iewe circumcision vncircumcision christe nation geuen inheritaunce endes earth peculiar possession yt vniuersally without difference might haue dominion sea sea riuers vttermost endes worlde therfore callinge gentile notable token whereby clearely shewed excellencie new testament aboue olde deede beene testified many plaine oracle prophetes perfourmance thereof still differred vnto kyngdome messias christe hym selfe dyd procede vnto ye first beginning preaching differred long vntill partes oure redemption perfourmedphil ii mat xvxxiiv ye time abacement ended hee receiued father name y aboue name knee shoulde bowe cause conuenience time yet fulfilled saide woman chanaan sent lost sheepe ye house israel suffred apostle firste sending passe bondes goe ye saith hee waye gentile entre city samaritanes rather go ye loste sheepe house israell howesoeuer vttered many testimony yet apostle first beginne seemed newe strange thing vnto wer afraid monster truely fearefully without sty king thei firste set vpon maruel seemed reason lorde whiche many age chosen israel nation shoulde nowe vndoe choise sodenly changing purpose dede spoken afore prophecy thei coulde geue great heede prophecy nothing moued newenesse thing sawe example whiche lord shewed calling gentile yt sholde one day come passe sufficient moue biside hade called certaine ner engraffe householde abraham adde vnto people percel general calling gentile onely made egall iewes also appeared came place iewes become deade yet stranger whome god hath tine brought bodie churche neuer made egall iewes therefore without cause dothe paule extoll misterie hidden fron age generationscol xv whiche hee also saythe bee maruellous angle fower fiue pointes thinke haue well faithfully sette foorthe whole dyfference olde newe testamente muche sufficeth simple ordre teaching bicause many report varietie gouerning churche diuers manner teaching great alteration vsages ceremony greate absurditie thei also answered passe forth thinges may done shortly bicause obiections strong thei nede curious confutation hangeth together saie thei god doth alway stedfastly agree selfe shoulde suffer great alteration afterwarde disalowe ye thing commaunded commended answer god ought therefore compted mutable applied diuerse formes diuerse age knewe bee expedient euery one husbandman apoint household one sorte businesse winter sommer shall wee therefore accuse inconstancie thinke swarueth righte rule husbandrie agreeth continuall ordre nature lykewise father household doe instructe rule ordre child one sorte childhoode youth man state therefore saye fickle forsaketh purpose therfore charge god reproche inconstantie yt hath seuered diuersitie time fite agreable markes last similitude ought fully satifye v paule maketh iewes like vnto child christian yongmen disordre therin gouernement god yt helde childish lesson whiche according capacitie age fitte instructed v stronger manly discipline therefore herein appeareth constancie god taught one selfe doctrine age continueth requyring worshippe name commaunded beginning wheras chaunged outwarde forme manner thereof shewed selfe subiect change butte farre tempered selfe capacitie man diuerse chaungeable whense say thei commeth diuersitie bicause god willed coulde well beginning sin comming christ reuele eternal life plaine wordes without figure instruct sacrament easye perceaue geue holy spirite poure abroad grace throghoute whole worlde euen like thei quarell god hathe created worlde late sith might haue created ye beginning yt haue enterchaunged course betwene winter sommer betwene daye night v euen al godly men ought thinke let v doubt whatsoeuer god hath done wisely righteously done although oftentimes knowe cause ought haue done take presumptuously much vpon v geue god leaue haue cause owne purpose secret hymselfe fro v meruellous say thei nowe refuseth abhorreth ye sacrificeng beastes furniture leuiticall presthode wherewith olde time delited though outward transitorie thinges delite god waye moue affection haue already said none owne cause disposed saluation men physicion heale yong one good meane fro disease afterward vse maner healyng man beyng old shall therefore say hath refused manner healyng whiche pleased rather continuyng still hath cosideration age behoued christ beyng absent expressed figure one sort signes sort shewed come mete beyng alredy deliuered represented signes concernyng god callyng nowe commyng christ largely spred abrode among people grace holy ghost plentiously poured whoe pray ca denie right god haue owne hande disposyng owne grace geue light nation pleaseth rayse vp preachyng worde place pleaseth geue doctrine howe great profityng successe doctrine pleaseth age take away knowledge name world theyr vnthakefulnesse againe whe restore owne mercie see therfore cauillatios much vnmete wherwith wicked men point disquiet mindes simple make call eyther righteousnesse god faith scripture doubte xii chapter pthat behoued christ performe office mediatour made man much behoued v bothe god man whiche mediatour man aske necessitie deede symple absolute necessitie commonly call proceded heauenly decree whereupon hanged saluation men mercifull father apointed best v whereas owne iniquity cast cloude betwene v vtterly excluded v kingdome heauen could interpreter restoryng peace could atteine vnto god whoe could haue atteyned vnto coulde sonnes adam dyd theyr father shune sight god feare could angel also neede head whose knittyng together might perfectly vnseuerably cleaue vnto god past hope vnlesse maiestie god wold descend vnto v could ascende vnto behoued sonne god become v immanuel god v sort mutuall ioynyng godhed nature man might grow one together otherwise neyther could ye nerenesse nere enough allyance stronge enough v hope god dwelleth v greate disagreement betwene filthinesse moste pure cleannesse god although manne stande vndefiled without spot yet estate base atteyne god without mediatour could beyng plenged downe death hell deadly fall defiled many spottes strikyng owne corruption ouerwhelmed accur ednessei tim ijiii therfore without cause paule meanyng set forth christe mediator doth expresly recite man mediator sayth god man man iesus christ might haue sayd god ye least might haue left name man well god bycause holy ghost speakyng mouth knew weakenesse therfore prouide time vsed fit remedie setting amog v sonne god familiarly one v therefore least man trouble know mediatour sought whiche waye come vnto namyng man putteth v minde nere vnto v yea nere toucheth v asmuch owne fleshe truely meaneth euen thyng place set moe wordes haue bishop haue compassion infirmitieshebr iiiixv asmuche thinges tempted sinne excepted shall also appere plainely consider meane thyng mediatour restore v fauour god make v child men childre god heyres hell heyres kingdome heaue whoe coulde doe vnlesse sonne god made also sonne manne take oures vpon hym conueye vnto v make oures grace whiche nature therefore earnest trust chyldren god bicause naturall sonne god hath shapen himselfe bodie body fleshe fleshe bone bone might one v disdayned take vpon hym whiche propre vnto v make agayne belonge v whiche propre himselfe common together v might bothe sonne god sonne man hereupon cometh holy brotherhode whiche commendeth owne mouth saythih xxvii goe vp father father god god meane inheritance kingedome beauen assured vnto v sonne god whome wholly proprely belonge hath adopted v brother bycause yf brethrenrom viii xvii partaker inheritaunce moreouer cause profitable whyche redemer shoulde bothe god manne office swallowe vp death whoe coulde doe lyfe selfe office ouercome sinne whoe coulde doe ryghteousenesse selfe office vanquish power worlde ayre whoe coulde doe power aboue bothe worlde ayre nowe whose possession life righteousnesse empire power heauen god alone therefore moste mercifull god persone begotten sonne made himselfe redemer haue v redemed principal point reconciliation god man lost disobedience shuld remedie set obedience satisfie iudgement god paye penaltie sinne therfore came forth true man lord put persone adam toke vpon name entre stede obeyeng father yeld fleshe pryce satisfaction iust iudgement god fleshe suffer peyne deserued asmuch therefore neyther beyng god could fele death beyng man could ouercome death coupled nature man nature god might yelde one subiect death satisfie sinnes power might wrastle death get victorie v therfore spoile christ eyther godhed manhode deede eyther diminishe maiestie glory obscure goodnesse side lesse wrong vnto whose faith thereby weaken ouerthrowe stande restyng vpon fundation byside hoped redemer sonne abraham dauid whyche god promised lawe prophetes wherby godly mindes gather frute beyng course pedigree brought dauid abraham certainely knowe christ spoken many oracle whiche euen declared principally beholden mynde common nature betwene v pledge felowship sonne god yt clothed flesh vaquished death sinne together victorie might oures triuph oures offred vp sacrifice flesh receyued v hauyng made satisfaction might wype away giltinesse appease iust wrath father shalbe diligently hedefull cosidering thing ought wil easily neglect wadryng speculatios auish vnto light spirites desirous noueltie sort christ shuld haue ben although ben neede remedie redeme makinde graunt yt first degree creation state nature vncorrupted set head ouer angel cause paule calleth first begotten al creaturescol ixv sithe al scripture crieth clothed wt flesh might redemer much rashe presumptio imagine cause end end christ promised fro beginning well enough knowe eue restore world falle ruine succour men beyng lost therefore vnder law image set forth sacrifice make faythful hope god would mercyfull satisfaction made sinne reconciled whereas age euen law yet published mediatour neuer promised without blood gather apointed eternal counsell god purge filthinesse men shedyng bloud toke expiation prophetes preached hym yt promised recociler god men one specially notable testimonie esaye shall suffice v allesa liijxiv fortelleth shalbe stricken hande god sinnes people chastisement peace vpon priest offer vp sacrifice woudes come health bicause al haue strayed ben scattered abrode like shepe therfore pleased god punish might beare iniquity sithe heare christe properly apointed god help wretched sinner euer passeth beyond boundes doth much follow foolish curiositie nowe one come affirmed cause comyng appease god gather v vp death life thyng apostle testifie himioh iix iohn teacheth worde made fleshe declareth fallyng awaye manne himselfe hearde speaketh thus owne officeioh ixiiij god loued world gaue begotten sonne euer beleueth shuld perish haue euerlasting life againeiohn iiixvi ioh vxxv iohn xi mat xviij matt ix houre come dead shall heare voice sonne god heare shal liue resurrection life beleueth although dead shall liue agayne sonne cometh saue whiche lost agayne whole neede physician neuer make ende reherse apostle one consent call v fountayne truely come reconcile godhebr vi honor priesthode shoulde haue come nought asmuche priest apointed meane betwene god man make intercessioii cor vxix righteousnesse bicause made sacrifice v god impute sinnes vnto v finally shoulde spoyled honorable title wherewith scripture doth set also sayeng paule proue vainero viiiiii whiche impossible law god hath sent owne sonne likenesse flesh sinne shoulde satisfie vstit iixi neyther stande teacheth place glasse appered goodnesse god infinite goodnesse toward men christ geuen redemer finally scripture euery assigneth ende sonne god would take vpon fleshe also receiued comaundement father made sacrifice appease father toward vslu xxiiiixxvi ioh xxvii iohn iiixiiii iohn xiixxvij xxviii written behoued christ suffer repentance preached name therfore father loueth bycause geue lyfe shepe commaundement gaue moses lifted vp serpent ye desert must sonne man lifted vp place father saue fro houre therfore come euen houre father glorifie thy sonne plainly speaketh end toke fleshe might sacrifice satisfaction awaye sinne sort doth zacharie pronouncelu ixix came according promise geuen father geue light sate shadow death let v remember thinges spoken sonne godcol iiiii cor iiii whome paule place testifieth treasure knowledge wisedome hidden byside whome glorieth knoweth nothing anye manne take exception saye none thinges proue contrarie christ redemed men beyng daned might also puttyng flesh testifie loue toward beyng preserued safe answer short yt asmuch holy ghost pronounceth eternal decree god two thynges ioyned together christ redemer also partaker one nature v therefore lawefull v searche euer tickled desire knowe beyng contented vnchangeable ordinance god doth shewe also contented christ geuen v price redemption paule reherseth ende sente also climbyng hye misterie predestination fitly represseth wantonnesse itchyng desire man witeph iiijv father chose v christ creation worlde make v sonnes adoption according purpose accepted v beloued sonne haue redeptio bloud truely fal ada set though formost time shewed god determined age help miserie makinde aduersarie obiecte againe purpose god dyd hang vpon fall manne whiche fore ent enough saye wicked boldnesse breake forth fayne newe christ euer suffer themselues searche hope know christ god hath foreapointed secret decree good cause pauleephe iiixvi discoursed ye proper office christ whish ye ephesian spirit vnderstanding coprehend length heygth bredth depth euen loue christe surmounteth al knowledge euen purpose would set barres mindes mention made christ neuer litle swarue grace reconciliation wherforei tim ixv sithe faithfull sayeng paule testifieth christ come saue sinner gladly rest whereas place apostle teacheth grace whiche nowe disclosed gospell geuen v christe time worlde determine ought constantly abide therein ende agaynst modestie osiander carpeth vniustly whiche hath agayne time vnhappily stirred question lightly moued accuseth presumption yt saye sonne god shuld haue appered flesh yf ada fallen bycause inuention confuted testimonie scripture though paule bridle froward curiositie spoken redemption purchaced christ comaundeth auoyde foolish question iijix madnesse dyd burst farre disordrely coueted seme witty moued questio whether sonne god might haue take vpon nature asse monstruousnesse godly worthyly abhorre detestable let osiander co fute pretense neuer expressely confuted scripture though paule accompteth nothing precious worthy knowen christ crucified doth therfore admit asse authour saluatioeph iiijxxij therfore place reporteth christ eternal cousel father ordeined head gather althinges together wil neuer acknowledge hath office redemyng apointed principle braggeth triflyng would haue man created image god bicause fashioned paterne christ come mighte resemble father alredy decreed clothe fleshe whereupon gathereth yf adam neuer fallen fro firste vncorrupted originall state yet christ haue ben man howe triflyng wrested menne haue sounde iudgement easily perceiue themselues meane time first thinketh hath seene ymage god forsothe glorie god onely shyne excellent giftes wherewith garnished also god himselfe essentially dwelt although graunt ada beare image god much ioyned god whiche true hyest perfection dignitie yet saye likenesse god el bee sought markes excellencie wherewith garnisshed adam aboue liuynge creature christe image god menne doe graunt one consent therefore euer excellencie grauen adam proceded onely begotten sonne approched glorie creatour e ixxvij therefore manne created image god whome creatours haue glorie seene lookynge glasse degree honour aduauced benefite begotte sonne saye sonne common head well angel menne dignitie bestowed vpon manne also belong vnto angel heare called child god inconuenient denie somethyng wherein resemble father nowe yf haue glorie represented well angel menne seene bothe nature osiander dothe fondely trif e sayeng angeles set behinde menne bicause beare image christ could continually enioye present beholdyng god vnlesse like hymco iijx paule teacheth menne otherwise renewed image god coupled angel maye cleane together vnder one head finally yf beleue christ shalbe laste felicitie made like forme angeles shalbe receyued vp heauen osiander conclude originall paterne image god christ man reason manne maye say christ muste needes haue ben partaker nature angel bicause image god perteineth also therefore osiander hath cause feare god shoulde bee found lier vnlesse ben firste stedfastly vnchangeably decreed minde haue sonne incarnate bycause yf integritie adam fallen angel haue ben like vnto god yet therfore haue ben necessarie sonne god made eyther man angel ame feareth absurditie least vnlesse vnchangeable counsell god ben creation man christ borne redemer first man haue loste prerogatiue asmuch nowe borne man accident cause restore mankinde beyng loste might gathered thereupon christ created image adam muche abhorre whiche scripture openly teacheth made like vnto v thinges except sinnehebr iiii xv luke iiixxxviii cor xvxlvii whereupon luke doubteth recken h sonne adam genealogye would fayne know paule calleth christ seconde adam bycause estate manne apointed might rayse vp posteritie adam ruine order creatio haue ben called firste adam osiander boldly affirmeth bycause christ alredy knowe man minde god men formed paterne paule namyng second adam setteth meane betwene first beginnyng man restitution obteine christ fall man whereby grew necessitie haue nature restored first degree wherupon foloweth yt cause sonne god borne become man meane time osiander reasoneth ill vnsauorily adam longe stande without fallyng haue ben ymage himselfe christ aunswere contrarie bycause though sonne god neuer put fleshe neuerthelesse body soule manne haue shyned image god bright beames whereof alwaye appered christ verily head hath soueraigne supremicie foolishe suttletie assoyled whiche osiander bloweth abroade angel shoulde haue lacked head vnlesse ben purposed god clothe sonne fleshe yea though ben fault adam doth rashly snatche holde whyche manne right wit graunt christ hath supremicie ouer angel shoulde haue prince muche manne easily gathered wordes paulecolos xv muche eternall worde god firste begotten creature create ought reckened amonge creature bycause state worlde integritie suche begynnynge garnished wyth excellentt beautie originall much made mannecoloss ixviii col xvi firste begotten dead apostle one shorte clause setteth forth bothe poinctes bee considered thynges create sonne mighte beare rule ouer angel made manne might begynne redemer lyke ignoraunce sayth men haue christ kyng yf ben man though kyngdome god coulde stad yf eternal sonne god although clothed ye flesh man gatheryng together angel men felowship heauenly glorie life himselfe beare soueraintie false principle alwaye deceiued rather deceyueth church haue without head vnlesse christ appered flesh though euen angeles enioyed head could likewise diuine power rule ouer menne secret force spirit quicke nourish like owne body till beyng gathered vp heauen might enioy al one lite angel trifle haue hether confuted osiander accompteth strong oracle eue beyng dronke swetenesse owne speculation vseth blowe fonde bacch cry matter nothyng one bringeth yth much strog prophecie ada seyng wife saydge ixviii nowe bone bone fleshe flesh proueth prophecie bicause matthew christ geueth sayeng god though euer god hath spoken men conteyneth prophecie let osia der seke prophecy euery commaundement lawe whiche certaine haue come god author biside christ haue ben grosse earthly yf rested vpon erall sense bycause speaketh mistical vi wherunto hath vouchesaued receyue churche faithfulnesse betwene man wife cause reacheth god pronounced man wife shalbe one flesh man attemp breake tha insoluble knot diuorce osiander lothe simplicitie let blame christ led disciple misterie suttelly expouding sayeng father neyther yet doth paule mameteyne erroureph iijxxx whiche sayd flesh flesh christ addeth great misterie purpose tel meaning adam spake vnder figure similitude mariage set forth holy couplyng together maketh v one christ doe wordes sound bicause geueth warnyng speaketh christ church doth way correction seuer spirituall ioynyng christ church law mariage wherfore fickle reason easily vanisheth awaye thinke nede shake vp sort chaffe bicause vanitie sone found short confutation sobrietie shall aboundantly suffice eede soundly child god fulnesse tune come sonne god sent made woman made vnder lawe redeme vnder lawe xiii chapter p christ toke vpon true substance flesh man vnlesse deceiued superfluous entreate agayne godhed christ whiche hath alredy man place ben proued playne strong testimony remayneth therefore seene beyng clothed flesh hath fulfilled office mediatour truth humaine nature hath olde time ben impugned manichee marcionites whome marcionites fained ghost stede body christ manichee dreamed heauenly flesh bothe many strong testimony scripture stand blessing promised neyther heauenly seede coun erfaite shape mange xiixviii xxviiiii psal x vvii mat ii rom iiii rom ixv sede abraham iacob neither eternal throne promised man made ayre sonne dauid frute wombe therefore beyng deliuered flesh called sonne dauid abraha bicause borne wombe uirgin create ayre bicause paule expoundeth accordyng flesh made seede dauid place apostle teacheth descended iewes whiche cause lorde himselfe contented bare name man doth oftentimes call sonne manne meanyng expresse plainely man truely issued seede mankinde sithe holy ghoste hath oft many meanes great diligence simplicitie declared thinge obscure self would haue thought men shamelesse presume yet spred mistes darken yet haue testimony hand listed heape vp sayeng paulegal iiijiiii god sent sonne made woma innumerable place whereby appereth subiect hungre thirst colde infirmity nature many chiefly chosen maye moste auaile edifie mindes true cofideceheb xvi sayd gaue great honour angel take nature vpon toke nature flesh bloud might death destroy power death agayne benefite communicating reckened brethreheb ixi xvii hebr iiiixv againe ought haue ben made like vnto brother might made merciful aith ull intercessour haue bishop compariont infirmity like ye purpose serueth whiche touched litle behoued sinnes world cleansed flesh whiche paule playnely affirmeth truelyro viiiiiii euer ather hath geuen christ doth therefore belong v bicause head whiche whole body beyng knit together groweth one yea otherwise agree togetherioh ixvi whiche sayd spirit geuen without measure shoulde drawe fulnesse thereof asmuch greater absurditie say god enriched essence accidentall gifteioh xviixix cause christ sayth place sacrifice self place bryng forth confirme errour doe vnaptly wrest nothyng preuayle triflyng suttelties goe wipe away thinges haue alleged part marcion
