imagineth christ put fantasticall body stede true body bicause place saydphil iivii made likenesse man found shape manne nothing weyeth paules purpose place meanyng teach manner body christe toke vpon whereas might haue shewed orth godhed made none shewe abiect vnregarded man exhort v example submission sheweth asmuch god might haue set forth glory seene worlde yet gaue ouer owne right owne accord abaced bicause put ymage seruant contended humilitie suffred godhed hidden veile flesh doth teache christ behaued himselfe also whole processe texte easily gathered christ abaced true nature manne meaneth shape founde manne time glorie godhed dyd shyne forth shape manne appered base abiect estate otherwise place peter coulde stande togetheri pet iiixviii dead fleshe quickened spirit yf sonne god ben weake nature manne whiche paule expresseth plainely sayengii cor xiii iiii cor xvxlvii suffred reason weakenesse fleshe hereunto serueth exaltation bycause expressely sayd christe atteyned newe glorie abaced himselfe whiche could well agree spoken man hauing fleshe soule manichee framed christ body ayre bycause christ called seconde adam heauenly heauen neyther place doth apostle bryng heauenly essence body spirituall force whiche beyng poured abrode christ doth quicken v nowe haue alredy seene peter paule doe seuer fleshe rather doctrine whiche receiued among true teacher concernynge flesh christ v ry well proued place christ one nature body v vaine argument paul vehemencie olowethi cor xvxvi yf christ risen agayne shal also rise agayne rise christ also risen cauillatio euer eyther olde ichees newe disciple goe aboute escape shall winde theselues away fowle shifte thei fondly say christ called sonne manne much promised menne playne hebrewe phrase man deede called sonne manne christ without doubte kepte phrase owne tonge also ought make question ought vnderstanded child adam goe farre place viij psalme whych apostle apply christ shalbe sufficient enough man thou arte myndefull sonne man thou visitest figure expressed true manhode christe though immediatly begotten mortall father yet race came adam el place could stande whiche haue alredy alleged christ made par aker fleshe bloudhebr iixiiii might gather yonge childre seruice god wordes plainely determined christ made fellow partaker one nature v whych meanyng also sayth bothe authour holinesse made holy one proued processe text referred felowship nature bicause addeth therefore ashamed call brother sayd faythfull god great dignitie cause ashamed bicause christ infinite grace doth ioyne himselfe base vnnoble therfore sayd yt shamed vaine obiect meane ye wicked shal become brethern christ bycause know child god borne fleshe bloud holy ghost fayth therfore fleshe maketh brotherly ioyning although apostle geue honour faithful one christ yet foloweth wicked maye borne originall saye christ made man make v sonnes god sayeng extendeth men bicause fayth meane whiche spiritually graffeth v ye body christ also foolishly moue brawle name first begotterom viijxxix saye christ haue ben borne adam streight beginning might first begotten among brother title first begotte referred age degree honourhebr ijxvi excellence power colour hath whiche bable christ toke man angel bicause receyued mankinde fauour set largely honour god vouchesaued geue v compared angel v behalf set behinde v yf testimonie moses well weyed sayth seede woman shall breake serpentes headge iiixv shal vtterly ende controuersie christ spoken mankinde bicause victorie gotten christ v generally prounounceth posteritie woman get vpperhand deuell whereupon foloweth christ issued mankinde bicause god purpose rayse vp eue spake vnto good hope fainth sorrow lesse wickedly foolishly entangle allegory testimony christ called seede abraham frute wombe dauid name seede ben spoken allegorie truely paule wold haue left vntolde plainely without figure affirmeth many sonnes abraham redemersgal iiixviii one christ like sort allege otherwise called sonne dauid bicause promised length dewe time deliuered paule one named sonne god addethrom iiii accordyng fleshe truely meaneth nature ix chapter callyng hym blessed god sayth seuerally byside accordyng fleshe descended iewes nowe truely begotten seede dauid purpose shalbe sayeng frute wombe meaneth promiseps cxxxii xi thy loynes shall descende shall abide thy seate genealogie christ rehersed matthew sophistically mocke though reherse parentes marie ioseph yet bicause speaketh thyng sufficiently knowen abrode among people reckeneth enough shewe ioseph came seede dauid whe well knowen marie stocke luke presseth teachyng saluation brought christ comon mankinde bicause christ author saluation proceded adam common parent al graunt deede genealogie none otherwise gathered christ sonne dauid much begotten uirgin newe marcionites colour errour proudely proue christ toke body nothyng affirme woman sedelesse ouerthrow principle nature bycause questio diuinitie reason bring fickle maye easily confuted therefore touch thinges belong philosophie physike hold contented wipe away thinges alleage scripture aaron ioiadah toke wiues tribe iehuvah difference tribe ben cofounded woman engendryng seede well enough knowe tha touchyng ciuile order kinreds reckened seede man yet excellecye kinde man aboue woman proue h contrarie generation sede woman mu te solution extendeth genealogy oftentimes scripture reckeneth vp genealogie nameth n shal therfore saye wome nothing child know woman compreheded vnder name men sort sayde woman bryng forth husbandes bicause name household alway remayneth male nowe graunted excellencie male kinde child compted noble vnnoble according estate father also state bodage issue foloweth womb according iudgemet ciuile lawiers whereby maye gather issue engendred seede woman hath long time ben receyued common vse natios mother called genitrices engendrers wherewith god lawe also agreeth whiche el wrongefully forbidde mariage vncle sister daughter bicause consanguinitie betwene also lawful man marry sister mother side begotten father graunte passiue power ribed woman answer thing indifferently spoken mengal iiii christ himselfe sayde made woman woman theyr companie shakyng shame lewdely aske whether saye christ engendred menstruall sede uirgin likewise aske whether congele bloud mother whiche shalbe costrayned confesse ther ore fitly gathered matthewes wordes bicause christe begotten marie paragraph engendred seede like eng ndring meant sayd booz begotte rahab neither doth matthewe describe uirgin condu pipe whiche christ passed seuereth maruellous manner generatio common maner christ begotten seede dauid euen sort isaac begotten abraham salomon dauid ioseph iacob likewise sayd christ begotte mother euangelist frameth order speache willyng proue christ came dauid contented one reason begotten marie whereby foloweth toke matter confessed marie kinne ioseph absurdity wherewith would charge v stuffed ful childish cauillations thei thinke shame dishonour christ haue taken original men bicause could exempt vniuersall lawe encloseth ofspryng adam without exceptio vnder sinne comparison reade paul doth easily assoyle doubtero vxii one came sinne sinne death righteousnesse one man grace hath aboundedi cor xvxlvii wherewith also agreeth comparison first adam earth earthly natural second heauen heaue ly therefore placerom viiiiii apostle teacheth christ sent likenesse sinfull flesh satif ie law doth expresly seuer common estate men man without fault corruptio childishly trifle reasonyng thus christ free spot secret workyng holy ghost begotten seede marie woman seede man seede vncleane doe make christ free spot cause enge dred mother without copulatio man bicause sanctified holy ghost generation might pure vncorrupted haue ben fall adam alway remayned stedfastly determined v oft scripture putteth v minde clennesse christ meant true nature manhode bicause superfluous say god cleane also sanctificatio speaketh xvii iohn could haue place nature god neyther fayned two sedes ada although came infection christ bicause generatio man vncleane vicious self accidentall fa lyng therefore maruel christ whome estate innocencie restored exempt common corruption whereas also thrust vpon v absurditie yf worde god put flesh enclosed narrow pryson earthly bodie mere waywardenesse bycause although infinite essence worde growe together one person nature man yet fayne enclosyng sonne god descended maruellously heauen yet left heauen bee maruelously borne uirgins wombe conuersant earth hange vpon crosse yet alway filled world euen beginnyng xiiii chapter p howe wo nature mediatour make one persone sayd worde made flesh vnderstanded though e turned flesh confusely mingled fleshioh ixiiij bicause chose temple uirgins wombe dwell sonne god became also sonne man confusion substance vnitie persone affirme godhed ioyned vnited manhode eyther haue whole propretie remayning yet bothe made one christ thyng worldly thinges maye found like great misterie similitude man moste fit whome see consist two substance whereof yet neyther myngled eyther kepeth propertie owne nature neyther soule body body soule wherefore thyng maye seuerally spoken soule whiche waye agree body likewise body thynge maye sayd whiche meane agree soule maye sayd whole man whiche vnfitly taken neyther soule body seuerally finally propreties soule sometime attributed body property body sometime soule yet consisteth one man many formes speache signi ie bothe one persone man compounded two nature knit together two diuerse nature make persone doe scripture speake christ sometime geue vnto thinges ought singularly referred manhode sometime thinges peculiarly belong godhed sometime thinges comprehend nature doe agree neyther seuerally conioynynge two nature christ doe suche religiousnesse expresse sometime put common together figure among olde author called communicatyng propreties thing weake vnlesse many phrase scripture eche redy finde dyd proue nothing hereof hath ben deuised man thing whiche christ spake himselfioh viijlviij sayeng abraha far disagreyng mahode neither ignorant cauillation erronious spirites depraue place say yt age bicause alredy foreknowen redemer well counsell father mindes godly openly distinguissheth daye manifestation eternall essence purpose pronunce h vnto himselfe authoritie antiquitie wherin excelleth aboue abraha doth vndoutedly chalenge ye propre godhed wheras paule affirmeth yt first begotte al creaturescolos ixv ih xviiv al thinges al thinges kepe beyng wheras reporteth glorie father creation worldih vxvii worketh together father thing nothing agree ye nature men therfore certaine like peculiarly ascribed godhedesa xlijl luc ilii ih viiil mat xiii ih xiiiix vixxxvi wheras called seruant father wheras sayd grew age wisedome fauour god men seketh owne glorie knoweth last day speaketh doeth owne sayd seene felt wholly belongeth manhode respect goodluc xxiiiixxxix neither encrease thing worketh thinges owne sake neyther thing hidden doeth thinges accordyng free choise owne wil ca neyther seene felt yet doth seuerally ascribe thinges nature man taketh vpon yf agree person mediatour communicating propreties paule saythact xxxxviiii co iivi iho ii god owne bloud purchase vnto church lord glorye crucified againe iohn sayth worde life felte truely god neither hath bloud suffereth ca touched handes bicause whiche bothe god man christ beyng crucified shed bloud v thing done nature man vnproperly ye without reason geuen godhedi iho iiixvi like example iohn teacheth god gaue soule v therefore also propretie mahode comunicate natureih iiixiii agayne christ sayd beyng yet conuersant earth man hath ascended heauen sonne manne heauen truely accordyng manhode flesh put heauen bycause hymselfe bothe god manne reason vnitie bothe nature gaue one whiche belonged playnely place set forth true substace christ comprehende nature together sort many gospell red singularly belonging neither godhed manhode bothe togetherih ixxix vxxi hath receiued father power forgeue sinnes rayse vp geue righteousnesse holinesse saluatio made iudge ouer quicke dead honored euen father isiho ixv finally called light world good shepeherd dore ye true uine prerogatiues sonne god shewed ye flesh although enioyed father world madeih xxii yet maner respect could geuen man nothyng mani cor xv xxiiii meanyng ought take whiche paule christ iudgement ended shal yelde vp kingdome god father euen kingdome sonne god beginning shal haue ending euen laye hid vnder basenesse fleshe abaced himselfe takyng vpon hym forme seruauntphilip ij v layng aside porte maiestie shewed himselfe obedient father hauyng performed al subiection length crowned honour gloryheb iivi phil iix cor xvxxvi auaunced hiest dominion yt knee shal bowe shal yeld vp father bothe name crowne glorie euer hath receiued father god may al purpose power dominio geuen father shuld gouerne v sense also sayd yt sitteth right father time til may enioye ye present beholding godhed ye errour ye old father ca excused thei toke heede person ye mediatour haue obscured natural meaning almost al yt doctrine read gospel iohn haue entangled themselues many snare let therefore vnto v keye right vnderstandyng thinges belog office mediatour spoken simply nature god nature therfore christ shal reigne till come forth iudge world much ioyneth v father accordyng smal measure weakenesse beyng made partaker heauenly glory shal see god hauing performed office mediatour shall cesse embassador father shalbe contented glory whiche enioyed making world ye name lord doth respect peculiarly agree ye person christ signifieth meane degree betwene god v purpose maketh yt sayeng pauli cor viij one god al thing one lord althinges eue dominio time comitted father vntil diuine maiestie seene face face fro fare yt thing shal decay yelding vp dominio father yt shal become much ye glorious shal god also cesse ye head christ bicause christes godhed shal shine self wheras yet couered wt certaine veile obseruatio shal smal seruice assoile many doutes ye reader fitly applie maruellous much vnskilful yea vtterly vnlearned combred formes speache see spoke christ wel agree neither godhed manhode bicause cosider agree persone wherin shewed god office mediatour alway easy see well althinges hang together haue sober expositour examine great misteries wt deuout reuerence ought nothyng furious phretike spirites trouble catche holde thinges spoken manhode aug ad cap take awaye godhed likewise thynges spoken godhed take away manhode thing ioyntly spoken bothe nature seuerally agree wyth neither take awaye bothe el say christe manne bycause god god bycause manne neyther manne god bycause bothe manne god therefore doe determine christ bothe god manne consistynge bothe nature vnited though confounded oure lorde true sonne god euen according manhoode though reason manhoode erroure nestorius driuen farre away v went rather draw sonder distinguish ye nature yt meane imagine doble christ wheras see yt scripture crieth oute loude voice bothe name sonne god geuen borne uirginluc xxxiij xl uirgin selfe called mother lorde must also beware madnesse eutiches leaste goe shewe vnitie person destroie either nature haue already alleged many testimony euery many alleged godhede distinguished manhoode may stoppe mouthes euen moste contentious little adioyne testimony confute better fained deuise present one place shal content v christ woulde haue called bodie templeiho ijxix vnlesse godhed distinctly dwell therein wherefore nestorius worthily co demned synode ephesus also eutiches afterwarde condemned synodes constantinople chalcedon asmuch lawfull confounde twoo nature christ drawe sonder oure age also hath risen vp lesse pestilent monster machaell seruettus whiche thruste place sonne god fained thing made essence god spirit fleshe three elementes vncreate firste denieth christ way sonne god begotten holy ghost wombe uirgin ende tendeth subtletie distinctio ye two nature one ouerthrowen christe might thought certaine thing mingled god man yet neither god man whole processe trauaileth toward point christ openly shewed flesh wer onely certaine shadowish fygures god whereof trueth effect length worde whiche ordeined honore began truely ye sonne god wee dede confesse ye mediator borne uirgin proprely sonne god christ man coulde mirore inestimable fauoure god vnlesse dignitie geuen called onely begotten sonne god meane season definition church standeth stedfastly grounded copted sonne god bicause worde begotten father worldes hypostatical vnion take vpon nature man hypostatical vnion called olde father whiche maketh one person twoo nature whiche phrase speache deuised ouerthrowe dotinge erroure nestorius bicause fained sonne god dwell fleshe yt yet man seruettus slaundereth v make twoo sonnes god saie eternall word already sonne god clothed fleshe saie thinge el manifested flesh neyther dothe folowe yt god man beganne newe god absurditie saye sonne god appeared fleshe whiche yet alwaie eternall begetting sonne whiche angeles wordes marye secretly shew holy thinge shall borne thee shall called sonne god shoulde haue saide name sonne whiche obscure time lawe shoulde nowe become famous euery knowen abroaderom viijxv wherewith agreeth sayenge paule nowe christe child god freely boldnesse crye abba father holy father olde tyme also accompted among chyldren god yea bearynge bolde vpon interest called vpon god name theyr father bicause sin begotten sonne god brought fourth worlde heauenly fatherhod become plainely knowen therefore paule assigneth priuilege kingdome christ yet stedfastly holden god neuer father either angelles men respecte onely begotten sonne men specially whome owne wickednesse maketh hatefull god child free adoption bycause hee sonne god nature cause seruettus shoulde cauill hangeth vpon filiation becomming sonne whiche god hadde determined selfe bicause oure purpose heare speake fygures howe expiation shewed bloode beastes bicause thei coulde dede child god vnlesse adoption grounded vpon head reason take heade common bres goe yet whereas scripture calleth angelles sonnes godps lxxxijvii whose greate dignitie dyd hang vpon redemption come yet muste needes sonne ordre whiche maketh father father repete againe shortly adde mankinde sith first beginning bothe angelles men created condition yt god shoulde common father bothe sayeng paule true christe alway heade firste begotten creaturescol ixv haue firste degree thinke rightly gather also sonne god creation worlde filiation may terme beganne sin manifested fleshe shal folowe yt also sonne respect nature man seruettus suche frentike men woulde haue christe appeared flesh sonne god bycause fleshe hee coulde called name nowe let aunswere whether sonne accordinge bothe nature respect bothe deede thei prate paule teacheth farr otherwise graunte deede christe fleshe man called sonne faithfull adoption onely grace true naturall therefore onely sonne marke may discerned god voutsaueth geue name sonnes v regenerate newe life name true onely begotten sonne geueth christ onely onely sonne great numbre brothren bycause hee possesseth nature whiche wee haue receiued gyfte honoure wee extende whole person mediatore truely proprely sonne god whyche also borne uirgin offered hym selfe sacrifice hys father vpon crosserom yet respecte hys godheade paule teacheth saith seuered oute preache gospell god whiche promised sonne whiche begotten seede dauid according fleshe declared sonne god power nameth distinctly sonne dauid accordinge fleshe shoulde seuerally say declared sonne god vnlesse meante shewe dyd hange vpon thinge vpon fleshe sense place saitheii co xliiiiii hee suffered weakenesse fleshe rose againe power spirite euen place maketh dyfference bothe nature truely must needes graunt hathe mother whiche called sonne dauid hathe father whiche called sonne god thing seuerall nature manne scripture geueth hym twoo name callynge sometimes sonne god sometimes sonne man seconde contention moued according common vse hebrue tongue called ye sonne man bycause ye ofspringe adam ye contrarie affyrme called sonne god respecte godheade eternall essence bycause lesse meete yt referred nature god called sonne god ye nature man yt called ye sonne man place alleaged paule dothe meane hee whiche accordinge fleshe begotten seede dauidro ixv otherwise declared sonne god power tha teacheth place christe whiche accordinge fleshe descended iewes god blessed euer nowe yf bothe place distinction double nature bee touched ryghte thei saye whiche according fleshe sonne man also sonne god respect nature god deede disordrely enforce maintenance errore place saiderom viijxxxij god spared owne sonne angel commaunded shoulde borne uirginlu ixxxij shoulde called sonne highest leaste thei shoulde glorie fickle obiection lette weye v little strongly thei reason rightly concludeth conception beganne sonne god bycause hee conceiued called sonne god shal yt folowe beganne woorde hys manifesting fleshe bycause ihon saithi ih ii brengeth tydinges worde life whiche hys handes haue handled lykewyse whiche reade prophete jic vij thou bethleem ye lande iuda art little one thousandes iuda yt shal borne guide rule people israell hys comminge fourth beginninge day eternitie howe wyll bee compelled expounde thys yf wyll content folowe suche manner reasoninge haue protested agre nestorius whiche imagined double christe whereas oure doctrine christe hathe made v sonnes god wyth hym ryghte brotherly conioyninge bycause hee onely begotte sonne god fleshe whiche hee toke v augustine dothe wisely admonishe v bright glasse wherein beholde maruellous syngular fauoure god atteined honoure respect man whiche coulde deserue therefore christe adorned excellencie euen accordinge fleshe wombe mother sonne god yet vnitie person fained suche mixture maye take awaye whiche propre godheade noe absurditie eternall woorde god christe reason twoo nature vnited one person bee dyuerse way called sonne god hee bee accordinge diuerse respectes called sometime sonne god sometyme sonne man dothe cauillation seruertus accomber v christe appeared fleshe called sonne god vnder figure bycause although describinge hym somewhat darke yet already clerely proued otherwise eternall god bycause worde begotten eternal father name dothe otherwise belonge person mediatore whiche hathe taken vpon bicause god openly shewed fleshe god father called father beginninge hadde mutuall relation sonneep iiixv whome kinred fatherhoode reckened heauen earthe hereby easy gather euen time lawe prophetes sonne god name commonly knowen churche striue onely onely woorde salomon discoursinge infinite hyghenesse god affyrmeth well hys sonne hymselfe incomprehensible tell hys name yf thou cannest saithe name sonnepro xxxiiij yet ignorant contention testimonie sufficient force neither muche grounde vpon sauinge sheweth thei maliciously cauill denye christe sonne god respect made man bysyde oldest writer one mouthe consent haue openly testified shamelesnesse lesse worthy bee scorned abhorred dare obiect ireneus tertullian againste v bothe whiche confesse sonne god inuisible whiche afterwarde appeared visible althoughe seruettus hathe heaped vp horrible mounstruous deuises whiche paraduenture woulde allowe yet yf ye presse harde ye shall perceiue acknoweledge christe sonne god fleshe graunt respect conceiued wombe uirgin holy ghost like maniches olde time foolishly affyrme man hath soule deriuation god bycause thei reade god breathed adam breathe lyfe take faste holde name sonne leaue difference betweene nature babble disordrely christ man sonne god bycause accordinge hys nature man begotten god eternall begettinge wysedome salomon speaketh destroyed noe accompte made godheade mediatoreec xxiiijxiiii fantasyed ghooste thruste place manhoode deede profitable confute grosser deceytes seruettus wherewith hathe bewitched hymselfe ende godly reader admonyshed thys exaumple maye holde selues within compasse sobrenesse modestie sauinge thinke shoulde bee superfluous bycause haue already done booke selfe summe commeth effecte sonne god forme mynde beginning euen appointed man shoulde essentiall image god hee dothe acknowledge woorde god butte outewarde shewe hee expoundeth bee begettinge hym begotten god beginninge begette sonne whiche also acte extended nature yt selfe meane tyme hee confoundeth spirite wyth woorde god distributed inuisible woorde spirite fleshe soule finally fyguration christe hathe place begettinge saithe hee whiche shadowyshe sonne fourme lengthe begotten woorde whyche hee assigneth office seede whereby shall folowe hoges doge well chyldren god bycause create original sede woorde god althoughe hee compounde christe three vncreate elementes make begotten essence god yet faineth hee fyrste begotten amonge creature essentiall godheade stone accordinge degree leaste shoulde seeme strippe christe oute hys godheade hee affyrmeth hys fleshe consubstantiall wyth god woorde made manne tourninge fleshe god whyle canne conceyue christe sonne god vnlesse hys fleshe came essence god tourned godheade bryngeth eternall person woorde nothinge taketh v sonne dauid promised redeemer ofte repeteth thys sonne begotten god knoweledge predestination lengthe made manne mater whyche begynnynge shyned wyth god three elementes whiche afterwarde appeared fyrste lyghte worlde cloude pyller fyre howe shame fully hee sometime dysagreeth himselfe tedious reherse thys shorte recitall reader haue sounde witte maye gather circumstance thys vncleane doge hope saluation vtterly extinguished yf fleshe godheade selfe shoulde cesse temple thereof none oure redeemer begotten seede abraham dauid accordinge fleshe truely made man wrongfully standeth vpon wordes ihon word made flesh thei resiste erroure nestorius thei nothing wicked inuention whereof eutiches authore forasmuche onely purpose euangelist defende vnitie person twoo nature xv chapter maie knowe ende christ sent father brought v three thinges principally considered hys propheticall office kingdome preesthoode augustine saithe rightly although heretikes doe bragge name christe yet haue one foundation wyth godly paragraph remayneth onely propre churche yf thinges diligently considered belong christe christe shall founde among name dede daie papistes although name sonne god redemer world sounde mouth yet bicause beinge contented wyth vayne pretense name spoyle hys power dignitie sayeng paule maie wel spoken themcol ii xix thei haue head therfore faith maie finde sounde mater saluation christ rest principle bee stablished office whiche committed hym hys father consysteth three partes geuen bothe prophete king preest albeit small profite knowe name withoute knowledge ende vse thei also named among papistes coldly greate profite knowen eche title conteineth haue saide though god sending prophetes continuall course one neuer leaue people destitute profitable doctrine suche sufficiente saluation yet myndes godly hadde alwaie perswasion full lyghte vnderstandinge hoped onely comminge messias yea opinion thereof come euen samaritanes whoe yet neuer knewe true religion appeareth sayeng womanio iiixxv messias commeth shall teache v thinges iewes hadde rashly gathered vpon presumption mindes thei taught assured oracle beleued notable among sayeng esaieesa viiij beholde haue made witnesse people haue geuen hym guide schoolemayster people euen place called angell interpreter great counsell manner apostle commending perfection doctrine gospellhebr ii hadde saide god olde time spake father prophetes diuersly vnder manifolde fygures addeth laste spake vnto v beloued sonne bicause common office prophetes keepe churche suspense vpholde vntil comming mediator therefore reade scattering abroade faithfull complayned thei depriued ordinarie benefite sayengps lxxiiiiix danie ixxxiiii see oure token prophet among v hathe knoweledge christe farre time appointed daniell seale vp vision prophete onely prophecye whyche spoken shoulde stablished assured credit also faythfull shoulde learne wyth contented mynde want prophetes time bicause fulnesse closing vp reuelations hande noted ye title commendation christ belongeth three office know tyme law well prophetes preestes kynges anoynted holy oyle whyche cause renoumed name messias geuen promised mediator thoughe deede confesse haue also declared place called messias peculiar consideration respect kyngedome yet annointinges respecte office prophet preeste haue place neglected v fyrste twoo expresse mention made esaieesa iii woordes spirite lorde iehoua vpon therefore lorde hathe annoynted shoulde preache meeke shoulde brynge healthe contrite hearte shoulde declare deliuerance captiues shoulde publishe yere good wyll c see anoynted wyth spirit bee publisher witnesse grace father common manner seuered teacher hadde lyke office againe noted toke anoyntinge selfe alone myghte execute office teachinge whole bodie hys continuall preachinge gospell vertue spirit shoulde ioyne wythal meane tyme thys remayneth certayne thys perfection doctrine whiche hathe broughte ende made prophecy doe diminish authoritie beinge content wyth gospell doe patche forain thynge vnto voyce whyche thundered heauenmat xvij saienge beloued sonne heare hathe auaunced hym singular priuilege aboue degree thys oyntement poured abroade heade vnto membres forespoken ioelioel ijxxviij cor ixxx col ijiii chyldren shall prophecie youre daughter shall see vision c paule sayth yt geuen v vnto wysedome place hidden treasure knowledg vnderstandin hathe somewhat meaninge oute hym nothinge profitable knowe whyche fayth perceaue hee haue comprehended whole infinitnesse heauenly good thynges whyche cause hee writeth placei cor ii haue compted precious knowe nothinge iesus christe crucified whiche moste true bycause lawfull passe beyonde simplicitie gospel herevnto tendeth dignitie prophetes office christ might knowe summe doctrine whiche hee hathe taught conteined poyntes perfect wisedome nowe come hys kingdome whyche vayne speake reader firste warned nature thereof spirituall thereby gathered bothe purpose serueth auaileth v whole force eternitie therof also eternitie whyche daniel angell dothe attribute person christe agayne angell luke dothe woorthily applie saluatio people also double two sortes one belongeth whole bodie churche propre euery membre firste bee referred whyche saide psalmepsa lxxxix xxxvi haue one sworne holynesse dauid wyll lye seede shall abide euer hys seate shall bee sunne syghte yt shal stablyshed moone euer faythfull wytnesse heauen neyther doubtfull god dothe promise hande sonne eternal gouerner defender churche true perfourmance thys prophecie canne founde noe el christ asmuche immediatly deathe salomon greater parte dignitie kingedome fell awaie dishonoure house dauid conueyed ouer priuate man afterwarde little lyttle diminished tyll length came vtter decaie wyth heauy shamefull destruction meaninge hathe exclamation esaie whoe shall shewe fourth generation sa liii ii prnounceth christe shall remayne aliue deathe ioyneth hym wyth hys membres therefore ofte heare christe armed wyth eternall power let v remembre euerlastinge continuance church vpholden support remayne stil safe among troublesome tossinges wherewith continually vexed amonge greuous terrible motion threaten innumerable destruction dauid scorneth boldnesse hys enemiespsalm iixxxiiii goe aboute breake yoke god christe saith kinges people raged vayne bycause dwelleth heauen strong enough breake violent assaultes assureth godly contynuall preseruation church encourageth hope well ofte happeneth oppressed place saithe person godpsal fitte righte hande till make thine enemy thy foote stoole warneth v howe many strong enemy euer conspire besege churche yet haue strengthe enoughe preuaile agaynste vnchangeable decree god whereby hathe apointed hys sonne eternall kinge wherevpon foloweth impossible deuell preparation woorlde maye bee able time destroy churche whiche grounded vpon eternall seate christe muche concerneth speciall vse euery one eternall continuance ought raise v vp hope immortalitie see whatsoeuer earthly worlde endureth timeiob viiixxxvi yea fraile therefore christe lifte vp oure hope vnto heauen pronounceth kingdome worlde finally v heareth kingdome christe spiritual let raised vp saieng let pearce hope better lyfe whereas hee nowe defended hande christ let hym looke ful frute grace world come haue sayde force profite kingedome christe otherwise perceiued v wee knowe spirituall appeareth sufficiently though muste liue warfare vnder crosse ye whole course oure life estate harde miserable sholde profite v gathered together vnder ye dominion heauenly kinge vnlesse wer certaine enuy frute therof state earthly life therefore knowen whatsoeuer felicitie promised v christ consisteth outward comodities shold leade merry quiet life florish wealth assured al harmes flowe full deliteful thinges flesh wont desire wholy belongeth heauenly lyfe worlde prosperous desired state people partly mainteyned plentie good thinges peace home partely strong forceable defense wherby maie safe outward violence christe also dothe enriche thynges necessarie eternall saluation soules fortifieth strength whiche thei mai stande inuincible al assaultes spiritual enemy whereby gather reigneth v within without furnished farr god knoweth expedient v ye gyftes ye spirite wherof naturally empty maie fyrste frutes perceaue truely ioyned god vnto perfect blesednesse bearinge v bolde vpon power spirit may doubt shall alwaie haue victorie deuell worlde euery kinde hurtfull thingeluc xvijxxviii thys purpose tendeth unswer christe pharises bicause kingedome god v shal come obseruation likely bicause professed hee kinge vnder whome souereigne blessinge god hoped scorne requyred hym shewe fourth signes hee bycause thei otherwise muche bent earth shoulde foolishly rest vpon worldly pompes byddeth enter owne consciencesro x iiixvii bycause kingdome god righteousnesse peace ioye holy ghos e hereby breefely taughte kingedome christ auayleth v bycause earthly fleshly subiecte corruption spirituall lifteth v vp euen eternall lyfe maie patienth passe ouer life misery hunger cold cotempt reproches greues contented one thinge oure king neuer leaue v destitute succoure v oure necessity till hauing ended oure warre called triumph suche manner reigning communicate v hathe rec iued father nowe whereas armeth furnisheth v wyth power garnisheth v beautie magnificens enricheth v wealth hereby ministred vnto v moste plentyfull matter glorie vpon also bold courage fight without feare deuell sinne death finally yt clothed wt hys righteousnes wee may valiantly ouercome al reproches ye world liberally filleth v giftes againe oure parte may bring forth frute glorye therfore kingly anointing set forth vnto v done wt oyle ointmetes made wt spice called ye anointed god bicause vpo hath rested ye spirit wisdome vnderstading cousel strength feare god thys oyle gladnesse wherewpth psalme reporteth annoynted aboue fellowes bicause suche excellencie hym shoulde needy hungry already saide hee priuately enriched hym selfeihon iiixxxiiii iho ixvi poure plentie vpon v hungry drie sayde father gaue spirite sonne measure expressed reason shoulde receiue fulnesse grace grace oute fountaine floweth liberall geuingeeph iiiivii whereof paule maketh mention whereby grace diuersly distributed faithful according ye measure gyfte christe hereby whiche saide sufficiently confyrmed kyngedome christ consisteth spirite earthly delytes pompes therefore muste forsake woorlde maye partaker itih xxxii lu iiixxii visible signe holy anoyntinge shewed baptisme christe holy ghooste rested vpon lykenesse doue holy ghooste hys gyftes meante woorde anoyntinge oughte seeme neither noueltie absurditie none waie quickened specially muche concerneth heauenly lyfe droppe lyuely force v whiche holy ghoste poureth v whyche hathe chosen seate christe thense heauenly rychesse mighte largely flowe oute vnto v whereof wee neady whereas bothe faythfull stande inuincible strengthe king also spiritual richesse plenteously flow vnto thei vnwoorthyly called christian eternitie wherof haue spokeni cor xvxxiiii cor xvxxviii nothynge derogate sayeng paule shall yelde vp kyngdome god father againe sonne hym selfe shall made subiecte god maye thynges hys meaninge nothynge el perfect glorie administration kyngedome shall bee suche nowe father hathe geuen power sonne sonnes hande maye gouerne cherishe susteine v defende v vnder hys sauegarde helpe v whyle lyttle time waueringe abroade god christ meane betweene god v lyttle lyttle brynge v perfect conioyning wyth god truely whereas sytteth right hande father muche effecte yf hee called father deputee vnder whome whole power dominion bycause god rule defende hys churche meane maie call person hys sonne also paule dothe expounde fyrste chapiter ephesian sette ryght hande father heade churche whyche body meanynge tendeth whyche hee teacheth placephi iiix geuen hym name aboue name name iesus knee shoulde bowe tongue confesse glorie god father euen woordes also hee setteth oute kingedome christe ordre necessarye oure presente weakenesse paule gathereth ryghtely god shall bee hymselfe onely heade churche bycause christes office defendynge churche shall fulfylled reason scripture commonly calleth lorde bycause hys father dyd sette hym ouer v thys ende exercise hys owne lordely power hym though bee manye lordeshippes worlde yet v one god father whome thynges hym one lorde christ whome thinges saithe paule wherevpon rightly gathered selfe godesa xxx xx whyche mouthe esaie affyrmed selfe kynge lawemaker churche thoughe euery call power hee hathe benefite gifte father yet meaneth nothynge ell reigneth power god bycause hee hathe therefore putte personage mediator descendinge bosome incomprehensible glorie father might approche nye vnto v muche rightfull wee bee consent prepared obey wyth greate cherefullnesse directe oure obedience hys commaundement ioyneth office king pastor towarde willingly yelde selues obedient syde heare beareth yron scepterpsa psa x x breake broose obstinate lyke potter vessells wee heare also shall iudge nation couer earthe wyth dead corps ouerthrowe heigth standeth againste hym whiche thinge ther example seen daye full proofe thereof shal laste iudgement whiche maie also proprely accompted laste acte kingedome concerninge preesthoode thus breefely holden ende vse hee shoulde mediatore pure spotte shoulde hys holynesse reconcile v god bycause iuste curse possesseth entrie god accordinge hys office iudge ente againste v necessarie expiation vsed hee beinge preeste maie procure fauoure v appease wrathe god wherfore christ might fulfill office behoued hee shoulde come fourth sacrifice lawe yt lawefull preeste entre sanctuarie withoute bloode faithful might know yt thoughe preeste become meane v make intercession yet god coulde made fauourable v oure sinnes purged upon whyche poynte apostle discourseth largely epistle hebrues seuenth chapiter almoste ende tenth butte summe commeth effect honoure preestehoode applied none christ sacrifice death hathe wyped awaie oure gyltynesse satisfied oure synnes howe weightie mater wee enfourmed solemne othe godps xiiii whiche spoken without repentance thou art preest euer according ordre melchisedech without doubte hys establishe principle pointe knew chefe ioynte wherevpon oure saluation hanged saide y waie open v oure praiers god vnlesse oure filthynesse purged prestes sanctifie v obteine grace v ye vncleannesse wicked doinges sinnes doth debarre v see yt must beginne ye death christ yt efficacie profyte hys preesthoode maie come vnto v thys foloweth hee y eternall intercessor whose mediation wee obteyne fauoure vpon againe ariseth onely affiance praye also quietnesse godly conscience whyle safely leane vpon fatherly tendernesse god certaynely perswaded pleaseth whatsoeuer dedicated mediator wheras time lawe god commaunded sacrifice beastes offered newe ordre christe one shoulde bothe sacrificed hoste prest bicause neither coulde founde meete satisfaction synnes worthy great honoure offer vp god onely begotten sonne nowe christe beareth person preest onely eternall meane reconciliation make father fauourable mercifull vnto v also bryng v felowship great n honoure yt defyled oure selues yet beinge made preestes offer vp oure seluesreue ivi oures god freely enter heauenly sanctuarie sacrifice prayer prayse come v may acceptable sweete smelling sight god thus farre dothe saying christe extende sake sanctifie selfeio xvijxv bicause hauinge holynesse poured vpon v muche hathe offered v himselfe father otherwise stincke please pure cleane yea holy hervnto serueth anoynting sanctuarie wherof mention made danielldani ixxxiiij comparison contrarietie noted anointing shadowish anointing vse angell haue sayd shadowes driuen away cleere preesthod person christe muche detestable inuention whiche contented sacrifice christe haue presumed thrust selues kil daily enterprised among papist masse reckened sacrificing christe xvi chapter howe christe hathe fulfilled office redeemer purchace saluacion v wherin intreated deathe resurrection hys ascendyng heauen al haue hetherto saide christe directed marke damned deade loste oure selues maie seke rigteousnesse deliuerance life saluation taught notable saing peteract ii ixii ther none name vnder heauen geuen men wher ther must saued neither name iesus giuen vnaduisedly chaunsable aduenture yt men brought heauen angell publysher god decree wyth reason also assigned bicause sent saue people sinnesmat ixii lu xxxi wordes noted whiche haue touched place office redeemer appoynted hym hee shoulde bee oure sauioure butte meane time oure redemptio shoulde vnperfect vnlesse hee continuall proceedynges conuey v forwarde vttermoste marke saluation therefore sone swarue neuer lyttle hym oure saluation lyttle lyttle vanisheth awaie whiche wholly resteth hym wilfully spoile selues grace reste admonition bernarde worthy rehersed ber sermo name iesus onely lyght also meate yea oile also without al meate soule drye also salte without seasoning wherof al set v vnsauorie fynally hony mouth melodie eare ioyfulnesse hearte also medicine whatsoeuer spoken disputation vnsauorie thys name soundeth behoueth weie diligently howe saluation purchased v may onely perswaded ye author also embracing thinges sufficient stedfast vphold faithe wee maye refuse suche thinges myghte drawe v awaye hether thether sithe man descende selfe earnestly consider feelinge god angry bent agaynste hym hathe neede carefully seeke meane waye appease whiche demaundeth satisfaction common assurednesse required bicause wrathe curse god lyeth alwaie vpon sinner tyll loose gyltenesse righteous iuge suffereth lawe broken without punishment ready armed reuenge goe seen waye howe agreeth together god whiche preuented v wyth mercie oure enemie vntyll reconciled v christe howe could hee haue geuen v hys onely begotten sonne syngular pledge loue vnlesse already embraced v wyth hys free fauoure bycause therefore ariseth seminge contrarietie firste vndo knotte holy ghoste commonly speaketh manner scripturesrom vx god enemye men tyll restored fauoure deathe christgal iiix col ixxi thei accursed till theyr iniquitie purged sacrifice thei seuered god tyll receyued conioyninge hys bodie suche manner phrase applied oure capacitie maie better vnderstande howe miserable wreatched estate beinge oute christe spoken expresse woordes wrathe vengeance god euerlastinge death rest vpon v woulde lesse acknowledge howe miserable shoulde bee without god mercie woulde lesse regarde benefite deliuerance example man heare spoken god suche time thou wast yet sinner hated thee cast thee away thou hadst deserued thou shouldest haue suffered horrible destruction bicause hath willingly owne free kindenesse kept fauoure suffered thee estranged hym hathe deliuered thee perill truely bee moued parte feele howe muche oweth mercie god butte yf hee heare syde whyche scripture teacheth hee synne estraunged god heyr wrathe subiect curse eternall deathe excluded hope saluation stranger blessing god bondslaue satan captiue vnder yoke synne fynally ordeined vnto already entangled wyth horrible destruction case christe became intercessor entreate christ toke vpon suffered punyshment whiche iuste iudgement god hange ouer al sinner hathe purged bloode euels yt made hatefull god expiation sufficient satisfaction sacrifice made god father intercessor wrath appeased within thys foundation resteth peace betweene god men vpon bonde conteined good wyll towarde shall muche moued liuely represented howe greate miserie hathe deliuered summe bicause oure minde neither desirously enoughe take holde life mercie god receiue suche thankefulnesse ought striken throwne downe wyth feare wrath god dreade eternal death taught holy scripture wythout christe wee maye see god manner wrathfully bent againste v hande armed destruction wee maye embrace hys goodwyll fatherly kindnesse otherwhere christe althoughe bee spoken according weakenesse oure capacitie yet falsly saide god whyche hyghest ryghteousnesse loue wickednesse whiche seeth v therfore al haue v worthy hatred god therfore respect oure corrupted nature euell life added vnto truely displeasure god gylty sight borne damnation hell bicause lorde wyll lose whiche y v fyndeth yet somwhat hys goodnesse maye loue howesoeuer sinner owne faulte yet remaine hys creature howesoeuer haue purchaced death oure selues yet made v vnto lyfe moued meere free louinge v receiue v fauoure sith perpetuall vnappeasable disagreement betweene righteousnesse iniquitie longe remayne sinner hee canne receiue v wholy therefore taking waie matter disagreement might wholy reconcile v vnto doth expiation sette forth deathe christe take away whatsoeuer euel v wee weare vncleane vnpure may nowe appeare righteous holy hys sight therfore god father dothe wyth hys loue preuent goe oure reconciliation christei ih iiiixxix yea bycause fyrste loued v therefore hee afterwarde doothe reconcile v vnto hymselfe bycause vntyll christe wyth hys deathe come succoure v remaineth wickednesse v whiche deserueth god indignation accursed damned sight therefore wee fully fyrmely ioyned god vntill christe ioyne v therefore wee assure oure selues haue god made well pleased fauourable vnto v muste fasten oure eye myndes vpon christe onely deede obteyne onely oure synnes imputed v imputing whereof draweth wrathe god reason paule saith loue wherwith god embraced v ye creation ye worlde staied grounded vpo christ thing plaine agreable ye scripture make place scripture accorde well together saideihon iiixvi rom vx god declared loue towarde v gaue hys onely begotten sonne deathe yet oure enemie till made fauourable againe v deathe christe maie strongly proued require testament olde churche allege one place augustine teacheth tract euang lo loue god saith incomprehensible vnchangeable beganne loue v sin time wee weare reconciled bloode sonne making worlde loued v euen weare thynge myght also child wyth hys onely begotten sonne therefore whereas wee reconciled deathe christe taken thoughe sonne dyd therefore reconcile v vnto hym myghte nowe beginne loue v whome hated reconciled already loued v whome weare enemy reason sinne whether true saiero vviij let apostle b witnesse hee dothe commende saith loue towarde v bicause wee yet sinner christ died v therfore loue v euen weare enemy hym wroughte wickednesse therefore maruellous deuine mannner loued v euen hated v hated v weare suche made v bicause oure wickednesse euery syde wasted awaie hys woorke knewe howe euery one v bothe hate whiche oure selues made loue whiche made wordes augustine nowe demaunded howe christe hathe done away sinnes taken away strife betwene v god purchased suche righteousnesse mighte make fauourable well willing towarde v maie generally answered hathe brought yt passe whole course hys obedience whiche proued testimonie paulero vxix one man offense many wer made synners one man obedience wee made righteous place extendeth cause pardon deliuereth v curse lawegal iiiiiiij mat iiixxv whole life christe saying fulnesse tyme come god sente sonne made woman subiecte lawe redeeme vnder lawe affirmed baptisme fulfilled one part righteousnesse obediently dyd comaundement father finally time toke vpon person seruant beganne paye raunsome redeeme v butte scripture sette oute manner oure saluation certainelymat xxviv doothe ascribe peculiar proprely belonginge deathe christe hee hym selfe pronounced hee gaue hys lyfe bee redemption manyrom iiijxxv ihon ixxix paule teacheth hee dyed oure synnes ihon baptiste cryed oute christe came take awaye synnes woorlde bycause hee lambe god place paule saithrom iij rom v cor vxxi iustified freely redemption christ bycause set forth reconciler owne bloode againe iustified bloode reconciled deathe againe knewe sinne made sinne v might ryghteousnesse god recite testimony bicause mimbre woulde infinite many muste bee hereafter alleged order therefore summe belefe whiche thei call apostle creede ordrely passed immediatly byrthe christe deathe resurrection wherein consisteth summe perfecte saluation yet reste obedience excluded whiche hee perfourmed life hi ivii paule comprehendeth wholye beginninge ende sayinge abaced selfe taking vpon forme seruant obedient father death euen ye death crosse truely euen death willing submission hath firste degree bicause sacrifice vnlesse ben willingly offred xxv nothing profited toward righteousnesse therfore lord testified gaue soule shepe expressly addeth man taketh awaye elfe according yt meaning esaie saithesa vij iho xviijiiii mat xxvij ij yt helde peace like lambe sherer historie gospel reherseth went forth met souldiers pilate left defending selfe stode still yelde selfe iudgement pronounced vpon without strife bothe taken infirmity vpon behoued obedience father shoulde way tried sclender shew incomparable loue towarde v wrastle horrible feare middest cruell tormentes cast awaie care hymselfe might prouide v beleued could sacrifice bee well offered god otherwise christe forsaking owne affection submitte wholy yelde father willheb xv psa xlix proofe whereof apostle dothe fyttly allege testimonie psalme booke lawe written yt may doe thy god thy lawe middest heate saide loe come bicause trembling conscience finde reste sacrifice washing whereby sinnes cleansed therefore good cause directed thither deathe christe appointed v matter lyfe nowe forasmuche oure owne gyltinesse curse due vnto v heauenly iudgement seate god therefore fyrste recited howe hee condenmed ponce pilate presidente iurie wee shoulde know punishement wherunto weere subiecte iustely layde vpon v wee could escape dreadfull iudgement god christe deliuer v suffred himselfe condemned mortall man yea wicked heathen man name president expressed onely procure credit historie shoulde learne whiche esaie teachethesaliijix chastisemente peace vpon stripe wee weare healed take awaie oure damnation euery kinde deathe sufficed suffer satisfye oure redemption one speciall kynde deathe bee chosen wherein bothe drawinge away oure damnation himselfe takyng giltynesse vpon might deliuer v bothe ben murthered theues ben ragyngly slayne commotio common people death shoulde haue ben apparance satisfaction brought arrained iudgement seate accused pressed witness agaynst mouth iudge condemned dye token vnderstande dyd beare persone gilty manne euell doer two thinges noted whiche bothe afore spoken prophecy prophetes doe bryng singular comforte confirmation fayth heare christ sent iudges seate death hanged amonge theues haue fulfillynge prophecie whiche alleged euangelist accompted amonge wicked liijxi mar xvxv euen take vpon stede sinner man righteous innocent bycause suffred death cause innocencie sinne side heare acquited mouth whereby condemned pilate compelled openly one beare witnesse innocencie let come mynde whiche prophetps lxijv repayed whiche taken awaye shall beholde persone sinner euell doer represented christe open apparance innocencie shall become playne see charged rather others offence owne suffred therefore vnder ponce pilate solemne sentence presidentih xviiixxxviij reckened number wicked doer yet iudge time pronounced righteous affirmed founde cause condemnation acquitall giltynesse made v subiect punishment remoued vpo head sonne god settyng one agaynst ought principally holde faste leaste tremble carefull life long though iuste vengeance god dyd hang ouer v sonne god hath taken vpon himselfe byside manner death without singular mysterie crosse accursed onely opinion men also decree lawe god therefore christ lyfted vp crosse made hymselfe subiecte curse behoued done curse remoued v might deliuered curse sinnes prepared v rather dyd alredy rest vpon v whiche thynge also shadowe expressed lawe sacrifice satisfactorie oblation offred sinnes called ashemoth whiche worde proprely signifieth sinne selfe whiche figuratiue chaunge name holy ghost meant shewe lyke vnto cleansyng playsters drawe themselues beare curse due sinnes whiche figuratiuely represented sacrifice moses deede deliuered christ original paterne ye figure wherfore performe perfect expiat oesa liijv xxi gaue owne soule ashame satisfactorie oblation prophete calleth vpon whyche filt punishement might caste cesse imputed v apostle testifieth thyng playnely teachethij cor vxxi whiche knewe sinne father made sinne v might made righteousnesse god sonne god beyng cleane faulte dyd yet put vpon reproche shame iniquity side couered v cleannesserom viijiij semeth meante speaketh sinne sinne condemned fleshe father destroyed force sinne curse thereof remoued layed vpon fleshe christ therefore declared sayeng christ death offred vp father satisfactorie sacrifice whole satisfaction sinne beyng ended sacrifice might cesse dread wrath god nowe playnees liijvi sayeng prophete meaneth iniquity v layed vpon entendynge wype awaye filthinesse iniquity hymselfe waye enterchanged imputation couered crosse whereunto fastened token apostle testifiethgala iijxiij deu xxvijxxvi christe sayeth redemed v curse lawe made curse v wrytten accursed euery one hangeth tree blessynge abraham mighte christe come gentile peter respect vnto teacheth christ dyd beare sinnes vpon treei pet ijxxv bycause token curse doe playnely learne burden wherewyth weare oppressed layed vpon hym yet bee vnderstanded toke vpon hym suche curse wherewith hymselfe ouerloden rather takyng vpon dyd treade downe breake destroye whole force fayth conceyueth acquitall condemnation christ blessyng beyng accursed wherefore paule dothe without cause honorably report triumph christe obteyned hymselfe crosse crosse whyche full shame ben turned chariot triumphecol ijxix sayth hande wrytyng whiche v fastened crosse princely power spoyled led openlyhebr ixxv j maruell bycause apostle testifieth christe offred vp hymself eternall spirit therupon proceded turnynge nature thinges thynges maye take stedfaste roote throughly settled heartes let v alwaye thynke vpon sacrifice washyng coulde certainely beleue christe raunsome redemption satisfaction vnlesse ben sacrificed hoste therefore often mention made bloud scripture sheweth manner redemyng albeit bloud christ shed serued sacrifice also steede washyng cleanse awaye filthynesse foloweth crede dead buried agayne seene howe dyd euerye putte hymselfe stede paye pryce redemption death held v bound vnder yoke christ stede dyd yelde hymselfe power deathheb ijix deliuer v apostle meaneth wryteth tasted death men dyeng brought passe shoulde dye whiche one death dyd redeme lyfe v differed fro v gaue hymselfe death deuoured shoulde swallowed vp gulfes rather shoulde swallowe vp whyche shoulde haue benne presently swallowed gaue hymselfe death subdued shoulde oppressed wyth power thereof rather shoulde ouerthrowe death whyche approched nere v yea already beaten v downe triumphed vpon vsheb ijxix finally death mighte destroye hym power death deuell might deliuer feare death lyfe longe subiecte bondage fyrste fruite death dyd brynge v enterpartenyng hymselfe v mortifieth earthly membres hereafter vse owne workes killeth olde manne shoulde liue beare frute purpose perteyneth buriall beyng partaker thereof also buried sinnegal ijxix ixxiiii apostle teacheth graffed lykenesse death christe buried hym death sinne crosse worlde crucified v worlde dead together dothe onely exhorte v expresse example christes deathcol iiiiii declareth suche effectualnesse ought appere christian vnlesse make death vnprofitable frutelesse therefore death buriall christe offred v double benefite enioyed deliuerance death whereunto weare become bonde mortifieng fleshe meete ouerpasse goynge downe helles wherein small importaunce effecte redemption although appeareth wrytynges olde father parte whiche read crede olde time much vsed church yet entreatynge summe doctrine necessarie haue place allowed thyng conteyneth profitable despised misterie right weyghty matter also olde wryters doe leaue whereby maye gesse certayne time added dyd presently little little growe vse church certaynely question proceded common iudgement godly muche none father dothe wrytynges make mention christes goyng downe helles although dyuerse manner exposition whome tyme firste added maketh litle purpose rather crede take heede vnto therein certainely haue full poyntes perfect summe fayth whereinto nothing maye thrust whiche taken pure worde god nowe yf precise curiositie admit crede yet shall streight waye bee made appere playnely great importaunce summe redemption yf lefte loste great parte fruite death christ agayne thynke newe thyng spoken article wordes thing repeted whyche spoken buriall asmuche worde infernum hell scripture oftentimes vsed graue graunt true whyche allege signification worde hell oftentymes taken graue agaynste opinion two reason whyche easilye persuaded dissent idlenesse thynge harde vnderstande hath one ben set playne easye wordes afterwarde wyth darker implication wordes rather pointe toward declare wo maners speakyng expresse one thynge ioyned together behoueth later exposition former exposition yf manne saye thus whereas sayde christ buried thereby meante went downe hell agayne likely superfluous vayne repetitio could haue crepte abrigemet chefe pointes faith summarily noted fewe wordes possible doubte many shall haue somewhat diligently weyed matter selfe easily agree expounde otherwyse saye christ went downe soules father dyed time lawe carry tidynges redemption performed deliuer pryson wherein kepte enclosed profe herof wrongfully draw testimony psalmepsa xxvi brake brasen gate yron barres agayne zachariezaca xxi redeemed bounde pit wherin water whereas psalme speaketh theyr deliuerances farre countrees caste captiue bondes zacharie compareth babylonicall ouerthrowe wherein people oppressed drye pit bottomlesse depth withall teacheth saluation whole churche commynge depe helles wote howe come passe whiche came thought certaine place vnder earth whereunto haue fayned name limbus fable although great authours day many earnestly defende truthe yet nothing el fable enclose soules dead men pryson childish neede yt christes soule shuld go downe ther set libertie deede willingly cofesse yt christ shined power spirit might know grace thei tasted hope deliuered ye world purpose may ye place peter probably applied sayeth yt christ came preached spirites yt dogeon pryson commonly translatedi pet iijxix processe text leadeth v faithfull dead time partaker grace bicause dothe thereby amplifie force christes death pearced euen dead godly soules enioyed presente sight visitation whiche carefully loked side plainely appere ye reprobrate excluded fro saluation whereas peter sayeng maketh distinction betwene taken though mingled together godly vngodly without difference meante teache generally bothe one common felyng death christ concernyng christes goyng downe helles byside consideracion crede muste seke certayne exposition assuredly haue suche one worde god holy godly also full singular comforte christes death ben effect yf suffred corporall death behoued also shoulde feele rigour god vengeance might bothe appease wrathe satisfie iuste iudgement cause also behoued hand hande wrastle army helles horrour eternall death haue euen nowe alleged prophet chastisement peace layed vpon himesa liijv striken father sinnes broused infirmity whereby meante put stede wicked doer suretie pledge yea gilty persone himselfe able suffer punishmentes shoulde haue ben layed vpon one thyng exceptedact iixxiiij could holden still sorrowes death therefore maruell yf sayde wente downe helles sithe suffred death wherewith god wrathe stryketh wicked doer exception fonde yea scorned whyche saye exposition order peruerted bycause absurditie set buriall whyche wente settyng forth thynges christe suffred sighte menne good order foloweth inuisible incomprehensible iudgement whiche suffred sight god shoulde knowe body christ geuen ye price redemptio greater excellent price payed soule suffred terrible tormentes daned forsaken manne according meaning doth peter say christ rose againe hauyng loosed sorrowes death iixx whiche impossible holden ouercomme doth name simply death expresseth sonne god wrapped sorrowes death whiche procede curse wrath god whiche originall death howe small matte ben carelesly sporte come forthe suffer death true profe infinite mercye shunne death whyche sore trembled doubte apostle meanyng teache epistle hebrewes wrytethiob vvij christ heard owne feare translate reuerence pietie vnfitly bothe matter selfe manner speakynge proueth christ therefore prayeng teares mightye crye hearde owne feare free death swallowed vp death sinner bicause yt place oure persone vpon truely imagined dredfull bottomlesse depth manne fele himselfe forsaken enstranged god heard calleth vpon hym euen yf god himselfe conspired destruction euen thether see christ throwen downe farre enforcement distresse compelled crye outps xxij mat xx ijx god god hast thou forsaken whereas woulde haue taken spake rather accordynge opinion felte himselfe case probable asmuche euident sayeng proceded anguishe bottome heart yet doe meane thereby god tyme enemie angry coulde angry beloued sonne vpon whome mynde rested vide cyrill lib de rectum fide ad regin howe coulde christ intercession appease father wrath towarde hauynge hatefully bente agaynst himselfe meanyng suffred greuousnesse god rigor beyng striken tormented hande god fele token god angry punisheth lib de trin whereupon hylarie argueth thus goyng downe haue obteyned death slaine place agreeth iudgement lib lib sayth crosse death helles lyfe agayne place sonne god helles manne carried vp heauen doe alledge testimonie priuate manne apostle affirmeth rehersing frute victorie deliuered whiche weare feare death al life long subiect bondage behoued therefore shal ouercome feare naturally dothe continually torment oppresse mortall men whiche coulde done fightyng moreouer feare common feare conceiued vpon sclender cause shall playnely appere fightynge hand hand power deuel horrour death peines helles came passe victorie triumphed ouer nowe death shoulde feare thynges whiche prince hath swallowed vp lewde menne although vnlearned yet rather moued malice ignoraunce crye haynous wrong christ bycause agaynste conueniencie reason fearefull saluation soule hardly enforce cauillation sayeng ascribe sonne god desperation whiche contrarie fayth first doe maliciously moue controuersie christes feare trembling whiche euangelistes playnely report little time death approched troubled spirit passioneth wyth heauynesse metyng began vehemently tremble feare say counterfait yt foule shift must therefore ambrose trulie teacheth boldly confesse sorrowfulnesse christ vnlesse shamed crosse truely yf soule ben partaker peyne ben redemer body behoued wrastle rayse vp laye throwen downe heauenly glorie nothyng appeired thereby euen herein gloriously shineth goodnesse whyche neuer sufficiently praysed refused take weakenesses vpon whense also comforte oure anguish sorrowes whiche apostle setteth v mediatour dyd feele infirmity might bee earnestly bente succour v miserie saye thynge whiche euell selfehebr iiiixv vnworthily ascribed christ though wiser spirit god whiche ioyneth two thinges together christe thynges tempted yet without sinne therfore cause weakenesse christ make v afrayde whereunto violence necessitie co pelled mere loue v mercie led submit himselfe euer owne suffred v diminisheth nothyng power one poynte backebiters deceyued perceyue christ infirmitie cleane free faulte spot bycause kepte himselfe within boundes obedience whereas founde moderation corrput nature al affection troublesome violence excede measure doe wronge measure forme god standard man vncorrupted state moderation hauyng force affection restrayne excesse wherby might well like vnto v sorrowe dread fearefulnesse yet marke differed v beyng confuted thei leape cauillation though christ feared death yet feared curse wrath god fro knew safe let godly reader weye honorable christ yt teder fearefull part rascall sort men theues euell doer obstinately hast death many wt haute courage despise midly suffer constacie stoute courage sonne god astonished maner striken dead wt feare euen whiche among common sort might accompted miraculous reported vehemencie griefe droppes bloud fal face neither make shew eye whe secret corner whether gone companie groned vnto father putteth dout ye needeful haue angel come downe fro heauen relieue wt vnwonted maner coforting shameful tedernesse sayd haue ben far tormented feare comon death melt bloudy sweate able comforted sight angel doth prayer thryse repeted fathermat xxvi xxix possible let cuppe departe proceding fro incredible bitternesse heart shewe christ cruell harder battell common death whereby appereth trifler agaynst whome nowe dispute doe boldly babble vpon thynges knowe bicause neuer earnestly considered howe great importance redemed iudgement god wisedome well vnderstand deere saluation dyd cost sonne god yf man aske christ went downe hell prayed escape death answere beginnyng whereby may gathered greuous terrible tormentes suffred whe knew stand arrayned cause iudgement seate god although moment time diuine power spirit hide selfe geue place weakenesse fleshe yet muste know tentation felyng sorrowe feare suche agaynst fayth fulfilled whiche sermon peteract ijxxiiij could holden sorrowes death bycause felt himselfe forsaken god yet nothyng swarue trust goodnesse whiche proued notable callyng vpon god paragraph extremitie peyne cryed god god hast thou forsaken though aboue measure greued yet cesseth call god whome cryeth forsaken moreouer hereby confuted well errour apollinaris called monothelites apollinaris fayned christ eternall spirit stede soule half though could cleanse sinnes way obeyeng father affectio obedience soule whiche soule knowe troubled purpose driue awaye feare bryng peace quietnesse soule agayne confusion monothelites see nowe willed thinge accordyng nature manhode whiche willed according nature godhed omit speake howe subdue aforesayd feare contrarie affectionioh xiixxvii herein playne shewe contrarietie father deliuer houre euen herefore came euen houre father glorifie name whiche perplexitie yet outrage seen v euen must al endeuour subdue selues nowe foloweth resurrection dead without al haue hetherto vnperfect sithe appereth crosse death buriall christ nothyng weakenesse faith must passe beyond thinges maye furnished ful strength therfore although haue death full accomplishment saluation bicause bothe reconciled god iust iudgement satisfied curse taken awaye penaltie fully payed yet sayd regenerate liuing hope deathi pet iiii risyng agayne risyng againe rose vp vanquisher death victorie fayth consisteth resurrection howe better expressed wordes paulerom iiijxxv sayth christ died sinnes raysed vp agayne iustification haue sayd death sinne taken awaye risyng agayne righteousnesse renewed restored could dy ng deliuer v death yf lyen still ouercome death could haue gotten victorie v ben vanquished fight wherefore doe parte matter saluation betwene death resurrection christ death saye sinne taken awaye death destroied resurrection righteousnesse repaired lyfe raysed vp agayne meane resurrectoi death doth shewe forth force effect vnto v therefore paule affirmeth resurrection declared sonne god bycause last vttered heauenly power whiche bothe cleare glasse godhed stedfast staye fayth also place teacheth christ suffred weakenesse flewi cor xiijiiii phil iijx rose againe power spirit meaning place entreateth perfection sayth maye knowe power resurrection yet adioyneth fellowship death wherw th aptly agreeth sayeng peteri peter ixxi god raysed vp dead gaue glorie faith hope might god faith beyng vpholden death wauer power god whiche kepeth v vnder fayth doth principally shewe selfe resurrection therefore let v remember oft mention made death also comprehended whiche properly belongeth resurrection like figure comprehension word resurrectio oft vsed seuerally without speaking death draweth whiche peculiarly pe teineth death much risyng agayne obteyned crowne conquest resurrection lifei cor xvxvij therefore paule doth good cause affirme yt fayth destroyed gospell become vayne deceitefull resu tion christ fastened heartes therfore another place gloried death christ agaynste error damnationrom viijxxxiiij amplifie sayth yea whiche died risen vp agayne nowe standeth mediatour v presence god furthermore haue declared vpon partakyng crosse hangeth mortificatio flesh vnderstanded resurrection obteyne commoditie whiche answereth mortificatio sayth apostle therefore graffed likenesse deathrom viiiij beyng partaker resurrection may walke newnesse life therefore place gathereth argument dead together christcol iijv proue ought mortifie member vpon earth likewise also bicause risen vp christ gathereth thereupon ought seke thinges abouecol iiji vpon earth wordes exhorted raysed vp exaple christ follow newnesse life taught wrought power yt regenerate righteousnesse obteyne also third frute resurrection yt earnest deliuered v assured owne resurrection whiche knowe resurrection certaine argument whereof disputeth large xv chapter first epistle corinthian waye noted sayd rose agayne dead sayeng expressed truthe bothe death resurrection yf ben sayd bothe die death menne naturally doe dye receyued immortalitie fleshe whiche put mortall resurrection vnfittly adioyned ascendynge heauen although christ beganne fully set forth glorie power risyng agayne nowe layed awaye base vnnoble estate mortal life shame crosse yet ascendynge vp heauen truely beganne kyngedomeeph iiijx whiche conuersant earthiohn vijxxxvij therefore iohn rehearsed notable callyng thirst let come c sayth holy ghost yet geuen faythfull bycause iesus yet glorified whiche lord himselfe also testifie disciplesiohn xvivij sayeng expedient goe awaye doe goe away holy ghost shall come geueth comfort corporall absence leaue parentlesse come agayne certayne manner deede inuisible yet desired bycause taught assured experience authoritie whyche enioyeth power whiche vseth sufficient faithfull make liue blessedly also die happyly truely see howe muche greater abundance spirite poured much royally aduauced kingdome howe much greater power shewed bothe helpyng ouerthrowyng enemy beyng therefore taken vp heaue toke away presence body sight cesse present faythfull yet wandred earth present power gouerne heauen earth rather promised would v ende worlde performed ascendyng whiche bodye lifted vp aboue heauens power effectuall workynge poured spred abrode beyonde baundes heauen earth rather forty dayes disciplesact iiii ix beyng companie seyng folowyng ascended heauen sitteth right hande father gone awaye presence maiestie therefore accordyng presence maiestie alwaye haue christ accordyng presence fleshemarc xvi heb iiij truely sayd disciple ye shall alwaye haue church dayes accordyng presence flesh nowe holdeth fayth seeth eye wherfore foloweth sitte downe right hande father whiche spoken waye similitude taken prince haue theyr sitter whome commit office rule gouerne stede sayd christ father exalted reigne hand receyued sit right hand yf ben sayd inuested dominion heauen earth solemnely entred vpon possession gouernement committed vnto entred vpon also continueth till come downe iudgement doth apostle expounde iteph ixx phi ijix cor xvxxvii eph iiiixv act iixxx iiixxi sayth thus father hath set right hand aboue principalitie power streght dominion euery name named world world come c hath put althinges vnder feete hath geuen head church aboue althynges nowe see shal called iudgement seate shalbe founde alyue daye whome death hath taken companie quicke place expoud wordes quicke dead otherwise see olde wryters dyd stick doubte vpon constructio article aforesayd meanyng plaine easy perceyue doth better agree ye crede euidet written accordyng capacitie comon people herewith nothyng disagreeth whiche apostle affirmethhebr ixxvij apointed men one die shall slepe shalbe meaneth one moment mortall life shall perish swallowed vp vtterly transformed newe nature perishyng fleshe man denye death yet meanetime remayneth true quicke dead shalbe summoned solemne protestation paule timothee hereupon ariseth singular comforte heare iudge whiche hath alredy apointed v parteners wt iudging far goe vp iudgement seate condene v shuld mercyfull prince destroy owne people head scatter abrode owne membres patrone condemne owne clyentesroma vxxxiii yf apostle dare crie christ intercessour v ca none come forth codemne v much true christ beyng intercessour condemne whome hath receyued charge tuition truely small assurednesse shalbe brought iudgement seate owne redemer whome saluation loked moreouer whiche nowe gospell promiseth eternall blessednesse shall sittyng iudgement performe promiseioh vxxij therefore ende father hath honored sonne geuyng al iudgement hath prouided conscience tremblyng feare iudgement hetherto haue folowed written one man asmuch euident euen fro farthest age hath alwaye continued sacred authoritie credit among godly thing whiche cared haue wholly controuersie whole historie fayth shortly well distinct order rehersed nothyng conteyned sealed sounde testimony scripture beyng vnderstanded purpose either curiously doubte stryue whoe author vnlesse parhappe enough man assured truthe holy ghost also vnderstad either whose mouth spoken whose hande written asmuche see whole summe saluation partes thereofact iiijxii comprehended christ must beware drawe awaye part therof neuer litle seke saluatio taught name iesusi cori ixxx hebr xiixvii seke giftes spirit found anoynting seke strength dominion yf seke cleannesse conception yf seke tender kindnesse sheweth selfe byrth whereby made thinges like chapter p truely properly sayde christ hath deserued god fauour saluation v question also assoyled addition suttle men wrong maner whiche although confesse yt obteine saluation christ yet ca abide heare name deseruing think grace god obscured haue christ instrumet minister ye author guide prince lifeact iijx peter calleth deede confesse yt man set christ simply agaynst iudgement god shalbe roome deseruing bicause foud man worthinesse may deserue fauour god augustine moste truely wryteth libro de sa ctoru moste clere light predestination grace sauiour hymselfe manne christe iesus whiche hath obteyned nature manne whiche without deseruynges workes fayth goyng beseche let answered whereby man deserued taken vp worde coeternall father one persone begotten sonne god let therfore appere head fountayne grace fro whome according mesure euery one floweth abrode member grace euery one beginnynge fayth made christian whiche man beginnyng made christ de bo perseuera cap vlt agayne place playner example predestination mediatour himselfe made seede dauid man righteous neuer vnrighteous without deseruynge goynge euen dothe vnrighteous make righteous membres hed forth foloweth therefore speake christes deseruyng doe say beginnyng deseruyng clymbe vp ordinance god whiche firste cause thereof bycause god owne mere good apointed mediatour purchace saluation v deseruyng christ vnfitly set agaynst mercie god common rule thinges orderly one vnder doe disagree therefore maye well stande together man iustification free mere mercie god also deseruyng christ come betwene conteyned vnder mercie god agaynst workes aptly set directly contrarie free fauour god obedience christ either degree christ could deserue thyng good pleasure god bycause apointed purpose sacrifice appease wrath god obedience put away offence finally summe bicause deseruynge christ hangeth vpon grace god whiche apointed v meane saluatio therfore well deseruing grace fitly set workes men distinction gathered many place scripture god loued worldih iijxiii yt gaue begotten sonne euer beleueth shall perish see loue god holdeth first place soueraigne cause original foloweth fayth christ second nerer cause man take exception saye christ formal cause doth diminish power wordes may beare yf obteine righteousnesse fayth resteth vpon matter saluation sought whiche many place playnely proued first loued himih iiiji firste loued v sente sonne appeasyng sinnes wordes clerely shewed god ende nothing withstand loue toward v apointed v meane reconciled christ worde appeasyng great weight bycause god certayne vnspeakeable manner euen time loued v also angry v vntil reconciled christ purpose serue sayenges satisfactio sinnes paragraph againe pleased god hym reconcile thinges hymself appeasyng himselfe bloud crosse c agayne god christ reconcilyng worlde himselfe impu yng men sinnesephe ij vi eph ivi agayne accepted v beloued sonne agayne might reconcile bothe god one man croue reason mysterie fetched first chapter ephesian paule taught chosen christ addeth therwithal haue obteined fauour god beginne embrace fauour loued making world bicause vttered loue reconciled bloud christ sithe god fountaine al righteousnesse must needes long sinner haue god enemie iudge wherfore beginning loue righteousnesseii cor v described paule made done sinne sinne v might righteousnesse god meaneth haue obteyned free righteousnesse sacrifice christ yt please god nature child wrath sinne estranged distinction also meante oft grace christ ioyned loue god wherupo foloweth geueth v owne hath purchaced otherwise would agree prayse geuen seuerally father grace procedeth truely perfectly gathered many place scripture christ obedience hath purchaced v fauour father take thyng confessed christ hath satisfied sinnes hath suffred punishmet due vnto v obediece hath appeased god finally beyng righteous hath suffred vnrighteous saluation purchaced v righteousnesse whiche much effecte deserue butro vxi paule witnesseth reconciled haue receiued reconciliation death recociliation hath place went offence therefore meanyng god whome hateful reaso sinne ye death sonne appeased might fauorable vnto v comparison contrary foloweth litle diligently noted trasgression one manro vxix many made sinner also ye obediece one many made righteous ye meaning thus ye sinne ada enstranged god ordeined destruction obedience christ receiued fauour rigteous future time verbe doth exclude present righteousnesse appereth processe texte sayd free gift many sinnes vnto iustification saye grace purchaced v deseruyng christ meane cleansed bloud death satisfactio sinnesi ih iv luc xxijxx bloud cleaseth v fro sinne bloud yt shed remission sinne effect bloud shed yt sinnes imputed vnto v foloweth price iudgemet god satisfied purpose serueth sayeng iohn baptistih ixxix beholde lambe god taketh awaye sinne worlde setteth comparison christ agaynst sacrifice law teache fulfilled whiche figure shewed knowe moses eche
