saith iniquitie shalbe cleansed sinne shalbe putte awaie forgeuen finally well taught olde figure force effect death christe point apostle setteth epistle hebrueshebr ixxxii fytly taking principle remission wrought withoute shedynge bloode whervpon gathereth christ abolishing sinne appeared one sacrifice againe offred vp take awaie sinnes manie hadde saide bloode goates calues butte owne bloode hee one entred holy place finding eternall redemption nowe thus reasoneth bloode calfe sanctifie accordinge cleannesse flesh muche conscience cleansed bloode christ deade workes easily appeareth grace christe muche diminished vnlesse graunt vnto sacrifice power cleansinge appeasing satisfieng little hee addeth mediator new testament whiche called maie receiue promise eternall inheritance meane death redemption sinnes goinge remained vnder lawe specially conuenient weye relation paule describethga iiixiii became curse v c superfluous yea absurditie christ shoulde charged curse entent payinge owe shoulde purchace righteousnes themesa liiiv also testimonie esaie playne chastisement peace laied vpon christ obteined healthe stripe christe satisfied oure sinnes coulde haue saide appeased god takinge vpon peine wherevnto subiect wherewith agreeth whyche foloweth place sinne people haue striken let v also recite exposition peteri pet iixxiii shall leaue nothing doubtful beare sinne vpon tree saithe burthen damnation whiche deliuered laide vpon christe apostle plainely pronounce payed pryce raunsome redeeme v gyltinesse deatherom iiixxiij iustified grace redemption whiche christ whome god hathe set propiciatorie faith bloode paule commendeth grace god point bicause hath geuen price redemption deathe christ biddeth v flee vnto hys bloode hauinge obteined righteousnesse maye stande boldly iudgement god effecte saieng peteri peter ixviii redeemed golde siluer precious bloode vnspotted lambe comparison also woulde agree vnlesse price satisfaction ben made sinnesi cor vixx whiche reason paule saith preciously bought also saieng wold stande together ther one mediator gaue hymselfe bee redemption vnlesse peine hadde ben caste vpon whiche wee deserued therefore apostle defyneth redemptino bloode christ forgeuenesse synnescol ixiiii shoulde haue saide wee iustified acquyted god bycause bloode aunswereth satisfaction vscol viixiiii wherewyth also agreeth place hande writinge v cancelled vpon crosse therein meant payment recompense acquyteth v gyltinesse also great weight wordes paule iustified workes lawegal ijxxi christe dyed nothynge hereby gather muste fetche christe whyche lawe woulde geue yf man fulfyll whyche one wee obteyne grace christe whyche god promysed oure woorkes lawele xviijv sayde dothe thynges shall lyue whyche lesse playnely confyrmeth hys sermon made antiocheact xiiixxxviii affyrmeth beleuynge christe iustified thynges whiche coulde iustified lawe moses kepinge lawe righteousnesse denie christe deserued fauoure v takynge burden vpon hym reconciled v god yf selue kept law purpose serueth yt whiche afterward writeth galatiansgal iiiiiiii god sent sonne subiecte lawe mighte redeeme vnder lawe ende serued submission purchaced v righteousnesse taking vpon hym make good whyche wer able pay hereof cometh imputation righteousnesse without woorkesrom iiii wherof paule speaketh bycause righteousnesse reckened v founde christ truely cause fleshe christ called meateioh vilv bicause finde substance life power proceedeth nothinge el bicause sonne god crucified price righteousnesseeph vii rom iiii xxv paule sayth gaue vp hymselfe sacrifice swete sauoure place died sinnes rose againe iustification hervpon gathered saluatio geuen v christe also yt sake hys father fauourable vnto v doubt yt perfectli fulfilled god vnder figure pronounceth esaieesa xxxviixxxv saieng wil mine owne sake dauid seruantes sake whereof apostle right good witnesse saith sinnes forgeuen name sakei io ijxii though name christ expressed yet ihon accustomed manner signifieth hym thys pronoune heio vilvij whiche sense also lorde pronounceth liue bicause father shall ye also liue bycause wherewith agreeth whiche paule saithphi ixxix geuen bicause christe onely beleue also suffer demaud whether christ deserued lombard ye scholemen lesse foolish curiositie tha rash determination thei affirme sentent li dist neded ye sonne god come purchace new thing himselfe lord declaring counsel doth put wholy doubt said yt father prouided comoditie sonne deseruinges yt deliuered deathrom viii esa ixvi spared bicause loued ye worlde prophetes manner speaking noted child borne v reioce ye daughter sio behold thy king cometh thee also confyrmation loue shoulde colde whyche paule setteth outerom vx christe suffered deathe enemy therevpon gather respect himselfe plainely affirmeth saiengioh xvii sanctifie selfe geueth awaie frute holynesse vnto doth thereby testifie purchaceth nothing hymselfe truely moste worthyly noted christe geue selfe wholy saue v certaine manner forget himselfe thys purpose thei doe wrongfully drawe testimonie paulephi iiix therefore father hath exalted geue name c deseruinges coulde man obteine iudge worlde heade angeles enioye soueraigne dominion god hym shoulde rest maiestie thousandth parte whereof power men angeles reache vnto solution thereof easy playne paule doth ther entreate cause exalting christelu xxiiiixxvi onely shewe effect ensuing thereof might example v thing meant whiche spoken place behoued christe shold suffer enter glorie father thirde booke institution christian religion whiche entreateth manner howe receiue grace christ profites growe vnto v effectes ensue thereof fyrste chapter thinges spoken christ profite v secret working holy ghoste nowe seen howe good thinges doe come vnto v whiche father hathe geuen begotten sonne priuate vse enriche without needed fyrste learned longe christe oute v seuered whatsoeuer suffered dyd saluation mankinde vnprofitable nothinge auayleth v therefore maye enterparten wyth v thinges hathe receiued hys father behoueth become ouresephe iiiixv rom viiixxix ro xixvii ga iiixvi dwell v cause called heade fyrste begotten amonge many brother side saide graffed putte hym haue saide euer possesseth belongeth nothinge v vntyll growe together one hym although true wee obteyne thys faythe yet forasmuche see al without dyfference embrace enterpartening christe whyche offered gospel therefore reason teacheth v clymbe vp hyer enquire secret effectuall workinge spirite whyche brought passe enioye christe good thynges haue entreated eternall godhede essence spirit thys present let v content wyth thys one speciall article christe came water bloode spirite shoulde testifie hym leaste saluation hathe purchaced shold slippe awaie v alleged three witness heaueni io vvii father worde spirit also three earth water bloode ye spirit without cause testimonie spirite twise repeted whiche feele bee engrauen oure heartes steede seale whereby commeth passe sealeth washinge sacrifice christ whiche meaninge peter also saith faythfull chosen santification spirit vnto obedience sprynkling ye blood christi pe iii whiche woordes telleth v entent shedinge holy bloode shoulde become voyde oure soules cleansed wyth secrete wateringe holy spirite according whervnto paule also speakinge cleansinge iustification saieth made partaker bothe name iesus christe spirite oure god finally thys summe holy spyrite bonde wherewyth christe effectually byndeth v vnto hym proofe whereof also serue wee haue taughte laste booke thys concernynge hys anoyntynge matter specially worthy knowen may made certainly euident must holde minde christ came furnished holy spirit certaine peculiar manner ende might seuer v worlde gather v together hope eternal inheritance cause called spirit sanctification bicause doth onely quicken nourish v general power appeareth wel mankinde liuinge creature also v roote feede heauenly life therefore prophetes principally comend kingdome christe title prerogatiue shoulde florishe plentifull aboundance spirit notable aboue rest place ioelioel iixxviii day poure spirit vpon al fleshe though prophet seeme restraine giftes spirit office prophecieng yet vnder figure meaneth god enlightning spirite make scholers whyche vnskilfull voyde heauenly doctrine nowe forasmuche god father dothe sonnes sake geue v holy spirit yet hathe left whole fulnesse thereof ende shoulde minister distributer liberalitie sometime called spirite father sometime spirite sonnerom viii ix ye saith paule fleshe spirit spirit god dwelleth haue spirit christe herevpon putteth v hope ful renuing raised vp christ deade shall quicken mortall body bicause spirit dwelling vsro viiixi absurditie father bee ascribed praise owne giftes whereof author yet ascribed christe whome giftes spirite lefte maie geue hisihon vii xxxvii eph iiiivii therefore calleth thirste come drynke paule teacheth spirit distributed euery one according measure gifte christ knowen called spirite christ onely respect eternall worde god spirit ioyned father also according person mediator bicause power come v vainei cor xvxlv whiche meaning called seconde adam geuen fro heauen quickning spirit whereby paule compareth ye singular life yt sonne god breatheth yt yt thei may alone hym natural life also common ye reprobate likewise wissheth faithful fauoure christ loue god ioyneth withall common partaking spirit without man tast neither fatherly fauoure godro vv bountifulnesse christe also saith place loue god poured oure heartes holy spirite geuen v shalbe profitable note wyth title scripture setteth holy spirite entreateth beginninge whole restoring oure saluation fyrste called spirit adoption bicause wytnesse vnto v free goodwil god wherewyth god father hathe embraced v hys beloued onely begotten sonne might father vnto v doth encourage v praie boldly yea dothe minister v wordes crie oute feare abbagal iiiivi ij cor ixxi father reason hee called earnest pledge seale inheritance bicause geueth life heauen v wandringe worlde like deade men maie assured oure soule safegarde vnder faithefull keping god cause also called life reaso righteousnesse forasmuch secret watering maketh v frutfull brynge forth buddes righteousnessero viiijx oftentimes called wateresa lvi esa xliiiiii iohn viixvii eze xxxvixxv esaie ye thyrste come water againe poure spirit vpon thyrsty stoodes vpon drie land wherewith agreeth sayeng christ euen allege thyrste let come albeit sometime called reason power purge cleanse ezechiell lord promiseth cleane water wherwith wil washe people fylthinesse forasmuch herestoreth norisheth liuely quicknes vpo hath poured liquore hys grace therefore called name oyle anoyntementi io iixx lu iiixvi agayne bycause continually seethynge oute burninge vp vice oure luste hee setteth oure heartes fyre wyth loue god zeele godlynesseiohn iiiixiiii act ixxi also thys effect worthyly called fyre finally described vnto v fountaine whense flowe vnto v heauenly rychesse hande god wherewyth vseth hys power bycause breathe hys power breatheth diuine lyfe v wee nowe styrred oure selues ruled hys styrringe mouynge yf bee good thynges v bee frutes hys grace oure owne gyftes wythout hym bee darkenesse mynde pereuersnesse hearte thys poynte y sette oute playnely enoughe tyll oure myndes bee bente vpon holy ghoste christe lyeth manner idle bycause coldely espye wythout v yea farre awaye v wee knowe hee profyteth none whose heade hee y fyrste begotten amonge brethrenephe iiijxv rom viiixxix gala iijxxvii eph vxxx whyche haue putte hym thys conioynynge onely maketh concernyng v come vnprofytably wyth name sauioure proofe hereof serueth holy mariage whereby made fleshe hys fleshe bone hys bone yea one wyth hym spirite onely hee maketh hym selfe one wyth v grace power spirite wee made hys membres hee conteyneth v vnder hym wee agayne possesse hym forasmuche faithe principall woorke moste parte referred thynges commonly finde spoken expresse force working bicause bryngeth v light ye gospel nothyng faith ihon baptiste teacheth yt prerogatiue geuen ye beleue christio ixiii yt thei ye childre god ar borne flesh blood god wher setting god againste fleshe bloode affirmeth supernaturall gift thei receiue christe faith whoe otherwise shoulde remaine subiect owne infidelitie like vnto answer christemat xvixvii fleshe bloode hathe reueled thee father whiche heauen thinges nowe shortly touche bycause haue already entreated large lyke also saieng pauleeph ixiii ephesian sealed vp holy spirit promisse paule sheweth inwarde teacher whose workynge promyse saluation pearceth oure mindes whiche otherwise shoulde beate ayre oure eares likewyse saithii xiii thessalonian chosen god sanctification spirit beleuing truth whiche ioyning together brefely admonisheth faythe selfe proceedeth nothing el holy spiriti ioh iiixxiiij iiii ioh xiiijxvij whych thyng ihon setteth plainely saieng knowe abideth v spirit whiche hathe geuen v againe knowe dwel v bicause hath geuen v spirit therfore christ promised disciple spirit truthe whiche worlde canne receiue thei might bee able receiue heauenly wisedome assigneth spirit propre office put mynde thynges hadde taught mouthe bicause vaine shoulde light shewe selfe blinde vnlesse spirit vnderstanding shoulde open eye minde man may rightly call holy spirit keye treasure heauenly kingdome opened vnto v may call enlightningij cor iijvi eyesight oure minde see therefore doth saint paule muche commend ministerie spirit bycause teacher shoulde crie without profiting vnlesse christ himselfe inwarde maister shoulde drawe spirit geuen father therefore haue sayde persecte saluation founde person christ may made partaker therof doth baptize v holy spirit fyrelu iiixvi lightning v faith gospell newe begetting v maie newe creature purging v vnholy fylthynesse doth dedicate v holy temple god seconde chapiter faithe wherein bothe sette definition propreties hathe declared al thinges shalbe easy vnderstand shewed plaine definitio fayth reader may knowe force nature thereof fyrste conuenient call minde againe thynges haue ben already spoken syth god doth appoint v law ought fall point thereof terrible iudgement eternall death pronounceth doth rest vpon v againe forasmuch hearde altogether aboue oure strength beyond oure power fulfill lawe beholde selues w ie estate worthy deseruinges good hope left lie cast away god vnder eternall destruction thirdly hath ben declared one meane deliuerance drawe v wretched calamitie wherin appeareth christ redeemer whose hand pleased heauenly father hauing mercie vpon v infinite goodnesse clemencie succoure v wyth sounde faith embrace thys mercie constant hope rest vpon conuenient v weie manner faith ought al thei adopted god hys chyldren enter vpon possession heauenly kingdome forasmuch certaine euery opinion yet euery perswasion sufficient bring passe great thing much care study must loke searche natural propretie faith muche hurtfull thys day erroure many behalf great part world hearing name faith conceiueth hier thing certaine common assent historie gospel yea thei dispute faith scholes barely callynge god obiecte faithe thei nothinge haue saide place vaine speculation rather draw wretched soules right way tha direct true marki tim vixvi wheras god dwelleth light none atteine behoueth necessitie christe become meane betweene v yt whyche cause calleth hym selfe light world place way truth life bicause man commeth father fountaine lifeiohn viijx ih xiiijvi luc xxij cor ij act xxxvii ii cor iiii vi bicause onely knoweth father faithful whome pleaseth disclose according reason paule affirmeth accompteth nothing excellent knowen christ xx chapiter actes saith preached faith christ c place bringeth christ speakeinge manner wil send thee amonge gentile yt thei maye receiue forgeuenes sinnes por ion among holy one faith paule testifieth yt glorie god person visible vnto v whiche one effect enlightning knowledge god glorie shineth face true dede yt faith hath respect one god also added acknowledge whome hath sent euen iesus chrste bicause god himselfe shoulde haue lyen secret hydden farre v vnlesse brightnesse christe cast beames vpon v entent father left al yt onely begotten sonne euen comunicatinge good thynges wyth expresse true image glorie saide must drawen spirit yt maie stirred seeke christ againe ought admonished libr de ciuit dei cap inuisible father el sought image whiche mater augustine speaketh excellently well whiche entreating marke faith shoote saith must know whether must goe waie gathereth yt safest waye erroures god man god whome go man go bothe founde christe neyther dothe paule speaketh faith god meane ouerthrowe whiche ofte repeteth faith hath whole stay vpon christei p ixxi peter dothe fittly ioyne bothe together saieng beleue god therefore thys euell euen innumerable imputed scholemen whiche haue hidden christe veile drawen hym beholdyng whome vnlesse dyrectly bent shall alwaie wander many vncertaine maze bysyde thys theyr darke definition doe deface manner bring naught whole force faithe haue forged deuyse vnexpressed faith wyth name thei garnyshing theyr grosse ignorance doe greate hurte deceyue silly people yea saye truely plainely thinge deede thys deuyse doth burie vtterly destroye true faithe beleue vnderstand nothing thou obediently submitte thy sense churche faythe standeth ignorance knoweledge onely god wyll god neither obteine saluation thys wee eyther ready embrace true whatsoeuer churche appoynteth committe office searchyng knowing acknowledge god mercifull father v reconciliation made christ christe geuen v vnto ryghteousnesse sanctification lyfe thys knoweledge saye submitting oure sense atteine entrie kyngedome heauenrom xx apostle saith hearte beleue righteousnesse wyth mouthe confession made saluation hee sheweth enoughe man vnexpressedly beleue whiche vnderstandeth seeketh learne requyreth expressed acknowleging god goodnesse whyche consysteth oure ryghteousnesse dede denie ye ignorance wherwith copassed yt ther herafter shalbe many thinges wrapped hidden v till hauing put burden flesh come nerer presence god thinges hidden v nothing profitable suspend iudgment stay mind determined purpofe kepe vnitie churche vnder thys coloure entitle ignoraunce tempered humilitie name faithio xviiii great absurditie faith lieth knoledg god christ reuerence ye church se maze thei haue framed hidden implication thinge whatsoeuer wythoute choise bee thrust vnder title church gredy receiued ignorant wer oracle ye sometime also monsterous erroures whyche vnaduysed lyghtnesse beleefe wheras yt mooste certayne downefall ruyne yet excused yt beleueth nothynge determynately wyth co dition adioyned yf faith church suche faine truth holden erroure light blindnes true knowledg ignorance bicause wil tarry long confuting doe warne ye reader copare doctrine wyth oures ye pleanesse trueth sefe wil selfe minister confutation ready enough y ye question among whether fayth yet wrapped wyth many remnauntes ignoraunce definitiuely say thei beleue aryght stande amased ignorance yea doe atter selues therein doe agree authoritie iudgement churche concerning thing vnknowen though scripture euerywhere teache fayth ioyned knoweledge graunt longe wander home thys worlde oure faith fully expressed onely bicause many thing yet hidden v bicause compassed many mistes erroures wee atteine thinges hyghest wysedome moste perfect thys profite proceede forwarde gentill willingnesse learnephili iiixv therfore paule exhorteth faithfull vpon thinge thei differ one abide reuelation truely experience teaceth till vnclothed oure fleshe atteine knowe lesse wisshed dayly reading light vpon many darke place whiche conuince v ignorance brydle god holdeth v modestie assigning euery one measure faith euen best teacher may ready learne notable exaumples thys vnexpressed faithe may marke disciple christ thei hadde obteined fully enlightned see thei hardly tasted fyrste introduction thei sticke euen smallest pointes howe hanginge mouthe maister yet muche proceede yea woman information ranne graue resurrection master lyke dreame vnto sithe christe dyd beare wytnesse theyr faythe may saie vtterly without faith rather dad perswaded christe shoulde ryse agayne care wold haue perished superstition dyd drawe woman embalme spice corpes deade man whome ther hope life although thei beleued word whome thei knewe speaker trueth yet grosnesse styll possessed myndes wrapped theyr faithe darkenesse thei manner amased wherevpon saide thei last beleued thei hadde tryall thinge selfe proued truethe wordes christ beganne beleue bycause seede hidden fayth whiche deade heartes receiuing liuelynesse dyd sprynge vp therefore true fayth vnexpressed faythe bicause reuerently embraced christe onely teacher beynge taught determined author saluation fynally beleued came heauen grace father gather disciple heauen neede seke familiar poofe hereof al thinges alway vnbelefe mingled faith may also call vnexpressed faithe whiche yet deede nothinge preparation faithe euangelistes reherse many beleued whiche onely beinge rauished admiration wyth myracles proceded christe messias whyche ben promysed albeit thei tasted much sclender learning gospell obedience brought subiectio willingly submitt selues christe beareth name faith deede beginning faithe courtie beleued christes promise concerninge healinge sonne came homeio iiijiii euangelist testifieth beleued againe bycause receiued oracle whiche hearde mouthe christe submitted hym selfe authoritie receiue hys doctrine albeit knowen tractable ready learne yet fyrste place woorde beleninge signifieth particular beleefe seconde place maketh hym numbre disciple professed bee scholers christe alyke exaumple dothe ihon sette forthe samaritanes whiche beleued woman reporteiohn iiii ranne earnestly christe whiche yet hadde hearde hym saide thus beleue bycause thy report haue hearde know sauioure worlde hereby appeareth whyche yet instructed fyrste introduction disposed obedyence called faithfull deede proprely thys respect god hys tender kyndenesse voutchesaueth graunte greate honoure godly affection willingnesse learne desire procede differeth farr grosse ignor ce wherein lye dull content wyth vnexpressed saith suche papistes haue imagined paule seuerely condemneth whiche alwaie learningij tim iiivii yet neuer come knowledge trueth howe muche greuous reproche deserue purpose stadie know nothing therfore ye true knowledge christ receiue offered father saye clothed gospel appoynted marke oure faith go right waie gospell going guide v truely ther opened v ye treasure grace shut vp christ litle pro ite v paule ioyneth faithe vnseparable companion doctrine wher saithe ye haue learned christ ye haue taught trueth christeeph iiiixx yet restraine faith gospell confesse hath much taught moses prophetes suffised edification faith bicause ther hath ben deliuered gospel fuller opening faithro xiiii therefore woorthyly called paule doctrine saith cause also saithe place comming faith lawe taken awaie meaning word faith ye ewe vnaccustomed manner teaching wherby christ sin appeared scholemaster hath plainl set forth mercy father certainly testified saluation albeit shalbe ye easye conuenient ordre descend degree generaltie ye specialtie first must put minde yt general relation faith word faith seuered ye word ye sun beames ye sume fro whome thei procede therfore esaie god cryeth outesa lviii io xxiii heare soule shall lyue fountaine faythe ihon sheweth woordes thinges written ye may beleue prophete meaninge exhorte people beleefepsa xv vi saythe daie yi ye shall heare hys voyce heare commmonly taken beleue moreouer god dothe wythout cause esaie sette thys marke difference betwene child churche straungers instructe thei maie taught benefite vniuersall shoulde direct hys woordes fewe wherewith agreeth thys euangelistes commonly vse woordes faithfull disciple seuerall wordes expressing one thing specially luke oft actes apostlesact vii x xxvi xixxvi xiii xiiij yea stretcheth name euen woman ninthe chapiter actes wherefore faith swerue neuer little marke ought directly leuelled kepeth owne nature butte becometh vncertaine lightnesse belefe wandring erroure mynde worde foundation wherwith faith vpholden susteined swarue falleth downe therfore take awaie ye worde shal remaine faith dispute whether ministerie man necessarie sowe worde god faithe may conceiued thereby question el entreate saie worde self howesoeuer conueied v like mirroure faith may beholde god whether god dothe therein vse seruice man worke owne onely power yet doth alwaie shewe selfe worde whome drawe vnto wherevpon paule defineth faithe obedience geuen gospellro iv rom place praiseth obedience faithe philippiansphilip iixvij onely purpose vnderstanding faithe knowe god also yea chefely vnderstande wil beareth toward v muche behoueth v knowe one v nowe therefore come thys point faithe knoweledge god perceyued worde foundation hereof foreconceiued persuasion truthe god assurednesse whereof longe thy minde shal dispute selfe worde shall doubtful weake credit yea rather credit also sufficeth beleue god true speaker whiche neither deceiue lie vnlesse thow holde vndoubtedly determined whatsoeuer procedeth sacred inuiolable truthe bicause euery word god man hearte raised vp faith must yet search faith word hath proprely respecte vntoge ijxvii iiijx saieng god adam thou shalte die death saienge god cain bloode thy brother crieth earth yet suche saiengs selues canne doe nothynge butte shake faythe muche lesse able stablyshe faythe denye meane season yt y offyce faythe agree truthe god howe ofte soeuer soeuer sorte soeuer yt speaketh butte nowe oure question onely faythe fyndeth woorde lorde leane rest vpon oure conscience beholdeth onely indignation vengeance howe canne butte tremble quake feare howe shoulde yt butte flee god whome yt afraide faythe oughte seeke god flee plaine therefore haue yet full definition faythe bycause accompted faithe knowe wyll god sorte euer yf place wyll whereof many tymes message sorrowefull declaration dreadful putte kindenesse mercie truely shal come nerer nature faithe wee allured seeke god wee haue learned saluation laied vp store v whyche thynge confyrmed vnto v declareth hath care loue v therefore needeth promise grace whereby maie testifie oure mercifull father otherwise wee canne approche vnto hym vpon alone hearte man maie safely rest thys reason commonly psalmes two thinges mercie truth cleaue togetherpsa xlxi bicause neither thynge profite v know god true vnlesse mercifully allure v vnto neither power embrace mercie vnlesse owne mouthe offer itps xxvxx haue reported thy truth thy saluation haue hidden thy goodnesse thy truthe thy goodnesse thy trueth keepe placepsa xxxvj vi psa cvii p cxxxviii thy mercie heauens thy trueth euen cloudes againe wayes lorde mercie trueth keepe couenant againe mercie multiplied vpon v truth lorde abydeth euer againe singe thy name vpon thy mercie trueth omitte whiche prophetes meaninge god mercifull faythfull hys promyses wee shall rashly determine god merciefull vnto v vnlesse himselfe testifie himselfe preuent v wyth callinge leaste wil shoulde doubtful vnknowen haue already seen christ ye onely pledge loue without whome euery side appeare token hatred wrath nowe forasmuche knoweledge god goodnesse shall muche preuayle vnlesse make v rest therefore suche vnderstanding banished mingled doubting doth soundli agree selfe disputeth selfe man witte yt blinde darkened farre atteining climbing vp perceiue god also hearte man wauereth perpetuall doubting farre resting assured persuasion therefore behoueth bothe witt lightned oure heart strengthened meane ye worde god may ful credit v shal haue perfect definition fayth saie yt stedfast assured knowledge god kindnes toward v grounded vpo ye trueth free promise christ reueled mindes sealed heartes ye holy ghoste procede shalbe necessary yt make preamble dissolue certain doubt otherwise might make stoppe ye reader first must confute ye distinctio yt flieth scholes betwene faith fourmed vnformed thei imagine touched feare god feling godlinesse beleue necessarie saluation though holy ghooste lyghtenyng oure heartes vnto faythe witnesse v oure adoption yet presumptuously scripture crieth againste geue name faith suche perswasion voide feare god wee neede striue theyr definition simply reherse nature faith declared worde god whereby shall plainely appeare vnskilfully foolishly thei rather make noise speake haue alreadie touched parte rest wyll adde hereafter place shall serue present saie yt bee imagined greater absurditie inuention theires wyll haue faith assent whereby euery despyser god maie receiue whiche vttered scripture fyrste thei haue seen whether euery manne hys owne power brynge faithe hymselfe whether holy ghooste witnesse adoption therefore chyldyshly plaie fooles demaundinge whether faithe whiche qualitie addeth dothe fourme faithe newe faithe whereby appeareth certainely bablinge neuer thought syngular gyfte holy ghooste begynning beleuinge dothe already conteine reconciliation whereby manne approcheth god dyd weye sayeng paulerom xx hearte beleued righteousnesse thei wold cesse fayne colde qualitie hadde thys one reason shoulde sufficient ende thys contention assent haue already touched wyll againe largely repete rather hearte brayne rather affection vnderstandyngerom iv whyche cause called obeydience faythe whyche suche lorde preferreth kynde obeydience aboue woorthyly forasmuche nothynge precious hym hys trutheio iiixxv whyche ihon baptist wytnesseth beleuers doe yt subscribe seale vnto sythe matter y doubtefull doe one woorde determinately saie speake fondly saie faithe fourmed addynge godly affection vnto assent whereas assent selfe least suche assent y declared scripture consisteth godly affection butte yet y playner argument offereth yt selfe alleged whereas faythe embraceth christe hee y offered v father christe y offered onely ryghteousnesse forgeuenesse synnes peace butte also sanctification fountayne lyuynge water wythoute doubte noe mann ecanne euer truely knowe hym vnlesse doe therewythall receyue ye sanctification ye spirite manne desyre haue plainely spoken faythe consysteth knowledge christe christe canne bee knowen butte wyth sanctification hys spirite therefore foloweth fayth meane seuered godly affection whereas wonte laye thys agaynste v paule sayethi cor xiix manne haue faythe hee remoue mountaynes yf haue charitie hee y nothynge whereby woulde deforme faythe spoylinge charitie consyder apostle place meaneth faithe chapiter next hadde spoken diuerse gyftes holy ghoste amonge whyche reckened diuerse kindes language power prophecie hadde exhorted corynthians folowe beste giftes saie suche gyftes whereby profit commoditie myghte come whole body churche streyght waie saide woulde shewe yet excellent waie suche gyftes howe excellent soeuer bee selues yet nothinge esteemed vnlesse thei serue charitie geuen edyfyeng churche vnlesse bee applyed therevnto loose theyr grace proofe thys particularly reherseth repetynge selfe gyftes hee hadde spoken butte name hee vseth woordes power faythe one thynge power miracle sythe therefore thys whether ye call power faithe particular gyfte god whyche euery vngodly manne maye boothe haue abuse gyfte tongnes prophecie gyftes grace yt y maruell yf yt bee seuered charitie butte erroure menne standeth thys thys woorde faythe hathe dyuerse sygnifcations consyderinge dyuersitie thinge sygnifyed dispute though taken one thynge place lyke place iames whyche allege mayntaynance erroure shall bee el dyscussed butte althoughe teachynges sake wee meane shewe manner knoweledge god y wycked wee graunte dyuerse sortes faythe yet wee acknoweledge speake butte one faythe godly scripture teacheth many deede doe beleue y god thynke hystorie gospell partes scripture true commonly wee wonte iudge suche thynges eyther reported beynge done longe agoe suche wee oure selues haue beene presente seen bee also goe bothe beleue woorde god moste assured oracle altogether despyse hys commaundementes somewhat sorte moued hys threatenynges promyses deede testified suche haue faythe butte y spoken oute abuse bycause wyth open vngodlynesse fyghte agaynste woorde god refuse despyse butte rather pretende certayne shewe obedyence thys ymage shadowe faythe yt value yt woorthy name faythe frome sounde truthe howe farre dyffereth althoughe shall hereafter largely entreated yet cause contrarie shoulde nowe touched waie said simon magus beleuedact viiiixiii xviii whyche yet wythin lyttle bewrayed hys owne vnbelefe whereas saide beleued vnderstande hee fained belefe hadde none hearte butte rather thinke ouercome ye maiestie gospell certaine faith acknowledged christ author lyfe saluation willingly professed himselfe bee one hys manner y sayde gospell luke beleue tymeluc viiivii xiij whome seede worde choked vp bring forth frute take rote al withereth awaie perisheth doubt suche delited certaine taste worde doe greedyly receiue beginne feele diuine force farre deceitful counterfaiting faith thei guile men eye also owne myndes thei perswade selues reuerence whiche thei shewe worde god moste true godlynesse bycause thei thinke vngodlynesse manifest confessed reproche contempte worde manner assent soeuer pearceth ye heart remaine stablished though sometime seemeth haue taken rootes yet liuely rootes heart man hathe many secrete corner vanitie full many hidinge hole lyeng couered wyth guilefull hypocrisie ofte deceiueth himselfe let glorie suche shadowes faith vnderstandiac iixix therein thei noe better deuell firste sorte men farre worse deuell whiche senslessly heare vnderstand thinges knoweledge whereof deuells tremble pointe egall deuell feeling suche wherewith thei touched tournet terroure discouragement knowe thinke harde assigne faith reprobate whereas paule affyrmeth faythe frute electionii te iiiii whyche doubte yet easily dysolued thoughe none receiue light faith truely feele effectuall working gospell foreordeyned saluacion yet experience sheweth reprobate sometime moued wyth feeling elect owne iudgement thei nothing differ electe wherefore absurditie apostle ascribeth taste heauenly giftesheb vi christ ascribeth fayth tyme soundly perceaue spirituall force grace assured light faith bicause lorde co demne make excusable conueieth himselfe mindes farre forth goodnesse maie tasted without spirit adoption obiect ther remaineth nothing faithfull whereby proue certainely adoption answere thoughe great likenesse affinitie betwene elect god endued fallinge faith time yet liueth elect onely affiance whiche paule speaketh thei crie full mouthe abba father therefore god doth regenerate onely elect incorruptible seede euer seede lyfe planted heartes neuer perisheth soundly doth seale grace adoption may stable sure withstandeth inferioure working spirite maie haue course euen reprobate meane season faithfull taught carefully humbly examine selues least steede assurednesse faith creepe carelesse confidence fleshe byside reprobate neuer conceiue confused feelinge grace rather take holde shadowe sounde bodie bicause holy spirite doth proprely seale remission sinnes electe onlye applye speciall fayth vse yet truely sayde reprobate beleue god mercyfull vnto bicause receyue gifte reconciliation although confusedly plainely enough partaker selfe fayth regeneracion child god bycause seme haue well beginnynge fayth vnder cloke hypocrisie denye god dothe farre geue light vnto theyr myndes acknowledge grace maketh felyng different peculiar testimonie whiche geueth elect neuer come sounde effecte fruition thereof dothe therefore shewe himselfe mercyfull vnto hauyng truely deliuered death dothe receyue sauegarde onely discloseth present mercie vouchesaueth graunt electe liuely roote fayth continue ende obiection answered yf god doe truely shewe grace remayneth perpetually stablished cause contrarie god maye enlighten present felyng grace whiche afterwarde vanisheth awaye also though fayth bee knowledge god kindenesse toward v assured persuasion truthe thereof yet maruell felynge god loue temporall thynges dothe vanishe awaye whyche although haue affinitie wyth fayth yet doth muche differ fayth graunt god vnchangeable truthe thereof dothe alwaye stedfastly agree wyth selfe denye reprobate doe procede farre atteyne vnto secrete reuelation whyche scripture sayeth belonge electe onely therefore denye doe eyther conceyue god vnchangeable doe stedfastly embrace truthe thereof bycause abide felynge vanisheth awaye lyke tree planted deepe enough take liuely rootes processe tyme waxeth drye although fewe yeres bryngeth forth blossomes leaues also frute finally fall firste manne image god mighte haue benne blotted mynde soule maruell yf god shyne vpon reprobate wyth certayne beames grace whyche afterwarde suffreth bee quenched cause contrarie maye lightly ouer washe throughly soke wyth knoweledge hys gospell meane tyme bee holden truthe howe small weake euer sayth hee electe yet bycause sure pleadge spyrite god seale adoption prynte thereof canne neuer bee blotted theyr heartes reprobate ouer spred wyth lyght afterwarde commeth nought yet spyrite deceyptefull bycause geueth lyfe seede casteth theyr heartes make abyde alwayes incorruptible dothe elect goe yet whereas euident teachyng scripture dayely experience ye reprobate sometime touched felyng god grace muste needes raysed heartes certayne desire mutuall loue time lyued saul godly affection loue god whome knew fatherly handeled therefore delited certayne swetenesse goodnesse persuasion fatherly loue god faste rooted reprobate doe soundely loue agayne chyldren led wyth certayne affection like hired seruauntes christ spirite loue geuen ende shoulde poure membres truely sayeng paule extendeth furtherrom vv elect loue god poured abrode heartes holy spirite geuen v euen loue yt engendreth confidence callyng vpon whyche haue touched contrarie side see god bee maruelously angry chyldren whome yet cesseth loue hymselfe hateth bycause make afrayde wyth felynge wrath entent abate theyr pride fleshe shake drowesinesse moue repentance therefore one tyme conceyue hym bee bothe angry sinnes also mercyfull vnto bycause fainedly doe praye appease wrathe whome yet flee wyth quiet assured trust hereby appereth true doe counterfayte shewe fayth whyche yet doe lacke true faith caried wyth sodeyne violent motion zele deceyue themselues wyth false opinion doubte sluggishnesse possesseth doe well examine heart ought haue done likely suche whome iohn witnesseth christ dyd commit himselfe yet beleued hymih ijxxiiij bycause knewe knewe manne many dyd fall common fayth call common bicause fayth lasteth time hath greate lykenesse affinitie liuely continuynge fayth christe woulde haue sayde disciplesih viijiij ye abide worde ye truely disciple ye shall know truthe truthe shall make free speaketh embraced doctrine exhorteth encrease fayth shoulde owne sloughtfulnesse quench lighte geuen themtit ii therefore dothe paule affirme fayth peculiarly belongeth electe declaryng many vanish away bycause haue taken liuely roote like christ also sayth matthewmatt xvxiij euery tree father hath planted shalbe rooted vp grosser kinde lyeng ashamed mocke bothe god mennei ii iames inueyeth agaynst kinde menne wyth deceiptfull pretense doe wickedly abuse faythi tim iv neyther woulde paule require child god fayth vnfayned respect many presumptuously chalenge vnto themselues whyche haue vayne colored deceyte beguile sometime themseluesi tim xix therefore compareth good conscience cheste wherein fayth kepte bycause many fallynge good conscience haue suffred shipwreck fayth must also remember doutefull signification woord fayth oftentimes fayth signifieth sounde doctrine religion place nowe alleaged epistle paule wrytethi tim iijix deacon holde faste misterie fayth pure conscience againe publisheth fallynge awaye certayne faith side sayth timothee nourished vp woordes faythi tim iiii vi ii tim xvi iijviii tit ixiii iiii sayth prophane vanity opposition falsly named science cause many depart faith whome place calleth reprobate touchyng fayth agayne chargeth tit agayne sayeng warne sounde fayth soundenesse meaneth nothing el purenesse doctrine easily corrupted brought kynde lightnesse men euen bicause christecl iiiii whome faith possesseth hidde treasure wisedome knoweledge therefore fayth worthyly extended signifie whole summe heauenly doctrine seuered contrariewise sometime restrayned signifie particular obiectmat ixii matthew sayth christ saw fayth let downe manne sicke palsey tyles chryst himselfe cryeth founde israell great fayth centurion brought likely centurion earnestly bente healyng doughtermat viiix care whereof occupied minde yet bycause beyng contented onely assent answere christ required christes bodyly presence therefore respecte circumstance fayth muche commended litle haue shewedi cor xiiix paule taketh fayth gifte workynge miracle whyche gifte haue neyther regenerate spirite god doe hartyly worshippe also place setteth fayth doctrine whereby instructed fayth wryteth fayth shall bee abolished question meante ministerie church whiche profitable oure weaknesse formes speach standeth proportionall relation name fayth vnproperly remoued signifie false profession lyeng title fayth shoulde seeme harde figuratiue abuse feare god set corrupte wrongefull manner worshyppynge oftentymes sayde holy historie forraine nation whiche ben transplanted samaria place borderynge feared fayned god god israell whiche much mingle heauen earth together question fayth whiche maketh chyldren god different vnbeleuers call vpon god name father whyche passe death life christ eternall saluacion dwelleth v force nature thereof thinke haue shortly plainely declared let v againe goe partes euen beginning beyng diligently examined thinke shal remaine nothing doubtefull defining faith cal knowledge meane thereby coprehendyng men vse haue thinges subiect man vnderstandyng far aboue ma wit must goe beyond surmount self come vnto yea come vnto yet doth atteyne whiche feleth persuaded whiche conceiueth vnderstandeth assurednesse persuasion yf ma owne capacitie throughly perceyue thing familiar manephe iiixviij therefore paule sayth well calleth comprehende length bredth depth heighth knowe loue christ farre surmounteth knowledge meanynge signifiecolos ixxviii thynge whiche mynde conceyueth faythe euery waye infinite kinde knowledge farre hyer vnderstandynge yet bycause lorde hath disclosed saintes secret whiche hidden age generation therefore good reason fayth scripture sometime called acknowledging iohn calleth certayne knowledgei ih iiiii testifieth faithfull doe certainely knowe child god vndoutedly knowe assuredly rather beyng confirmed persuasion god truthe beyng informed naturall demonstration hisi cor vvi also wordes paule doe declare sayeng well body wanderyng abrode lord bycause walke fayth sighte whereby sheweth thynges whiche vnderstande fayth yet absente v hidden sight hereupon determine knowledge fayth stadeth rather certaintie comprehendyng call sure stedfaste knowledge expresse thereby sound constantie persuasion faith contented doubtefull rowling opinion also co tented darke entangled vnderstading requireth ful fixed assurednesse men wont haue thinges foud experience proued vnbelefe sticketh faste depe rooted heartes bent vnto men confesse mouth true god faithfull without great contention persuaded heart specially cometh profe waueryng menne discloseth fault hat ore hidden without cause scripture n ble cit e comendacion maineteyneth authoritie worde god endeuoreth geue remedie aforesayde disease god maye obteyne fully beleued v promise wordes lorde sayth dauid pure wordespsa xixxxxi e ryed fornace earth fined seuen time agayne worde lorde fined shielde truste salomon confirmynge samepro manner wordes sayth euery worde god pure sithe whole cxix psalme entreateth manner vpon weare superfluous allege moe place truely oft god doth comend word vnto v doth therein waye reproche v vnbeleuingnesse bycause commendacio tendeth end roote vp peruerse doubtinges heartes also many coceiue mercie god take litle co fort thereof euen therewithall pinched miserable carefulnesse doubte whether mercifull noe bicause enclose within narrow boundes mercifulnesse whiche thinke themselues moste assuredly perswaded thus thinke themselues mercie deede greate plentiefull poured vpon many offrynge selfe ready menne certayne whether extende vnto rather whether shal atteyne vnto thought stayeth midde race halfe therefore doth confirme spirite assured quietnesse dothe trouble vnquiet doubtefulnesse far felyng full assurednesse whiche scripture alwaye assigned fayth euen suche one playnely settynge v goodnesse god dothe clearely put doubte muste needes truely feele proue selues swetenesse thereofeph iiixx therefore apostle fayth deriueth assured confidence agayne boldenesse thus sayeth christe haue boldenesse entrance confidence whiche fayth whiche wordes truely sheweth right fayth bolde quiet mindes shewe selues presence god boldnesse procedeth assured confidence god good saluation whiche true many time word faith vsed confidence herupon hangeth chiefe staye faith think promise mercie lord offreth true biside v selues rather inwardly embracing make owne fro hense procedeth co fidence paule place calleth peacerom vi vnlesse rather say yt peace deriued assurednesse maketh consciece quiet cherefull god without coscience must necessitie vexed manner torne peces troublesome trembling vnlesse parhappes forget god selfe slober litle may truely say litle doth log enioy miserable forgetfulnesse often recourse remembrance god iudgement sharply tormented briefly none truely faithful beyng persuaded soud assurednesse god mercyfull louyng father doth promise himselfe thinges vpon trust god goodnesse none trustyng vpon promise god good toward conceyueth vndoubted lokynge saluationhebr iijxiii apostle sheweth wordes yf keepe sure ende confidence gloriyng hope hereby meaneth none hopeth well lorde confidence glorieth heyre kyngdome heauen none saye faythfull leanyng vpon assurednesse owne saluation doth confidently triumph vpon deuell death taught notable concluding sentence paulerom viiixxxvii persuaded sayth neyther death life angeles principality power thinges present thinges come shalbe able separate v fro ye loue god wherwith embraceth v christ iesu like manner apostle thinketh eye minde meane well lightened vnlesse see hope eternall inheritance whiche calledephes ixviii eche common manner teachyng declareth otherwise well comprehend goodnesse god vnlesse gather frute great assurednesse man say faithfull doe finde experience far thing within themselues whiche recordyng grace god toward tempted vnquietnesse whiche oftentimes chaunceth vnto also sometime shaken greuous terror great vehemencye temptation throw downe mindes thing semeth sufficiently wel agree assurednesse fayth therefore doubt must answered haue aforesayde doctrine stande truely teache fayth ought certayne assured doe imagine suche certaintie touched doubtynge suche assurednesse assayled carefulnesse rather saye faythfull haue perpetuall stryfe owne distrustfulnesse farre setlynge conscience peasable quietnesse maye interrupted trouble yet side saye sorte euer bee afflicted doe neuer fall departe assured confidence whiche haue conceyued mercie god scripture setteth forth example fayth playne notable dauidpsa xliivi xliiiv specially manne beholde whole continuall course lyfe yet howe alwaye quiet minde hymselfe declareth innumerable complaintes whiche time shal sufficient doe choose fewe reprocheth owne soule troublesome motion el angry owne vnbeleuengnesse treblest thou soule sayth art thou disquieted within trust god truely discouragement plaine token destruction euen thought himselfe forsaken god place reade larger confession thereofpsa xxxixxij sayth sayd ouerthrow cast sight thy eye also place disputeth himselfe carefull miserable perplexitie yea quareleth nature god sayeng hath god forgotten haue mercie caste euer yet harder whiche folowethps lxxviix haue sayde die mine charge right hande hyest despere condemneth himselfe destruction confesseth himselfe tossed doutyng vaquished battel leaueth nothyng bycause god hath forsaken hath turned destroy hande wont helperpsa cxvivii wherefore without cause exhorteth soule returne quietnesse bicause found experience tossed amog troblesome waues yet whiche meruellous al assaultes faith vpholdeth heartes godly truely like vnto date tree endeuour rise vpwarde agaynst burden howe great soeuer dauid might seme vtterly ouerwhelmed yet rebukyng himselfe cesseth rise vp god truely striuing owne weakenesse resorteth faith trouble alredy manner conquerour whiche maye gathered sentence likepsa x viixiii waite lord stronge shall stregthen heart waite lord reprocheth himselfe fearefulnesse repetyng twise con esseth somtimes subiect many troublesome motion meane time doth become displeased himselfe faultes earnestly endeuoreth amendement truely nerely good examination compare achaz shalbe founde great differenceesa viiiii esaye sente brynge remedie carefull griefe wicked king hypocrite spake vnto wordes sauegarde quiet feare c achaz sayd heart moued tree woode shaken winde though hearde promise yet cessed quake feare therefore propre rewarde punishment vnbelefe tremble feare temptation turneth himselfe awaye god doth open himselfe gate fayth contrarywise faythfull whome weighty burden temptation maketh stoupe maner oppresseth costantly rise vp although without trouble hardinesse bicause thei know owne weakenesse thei pray prophetepsa cxixxiiii take worde truth away mouth co tinually wordes taught somtime become dumme though fayth vtterly ouerthrowen yet faint turne backes procede battell prayer encourage slouthfulnesse lest fauoring themselues growe vnsensible dulnesse vnderstadyng therof needeful returne diuision fleshe spirit wherof made mention place doth behalf clearly appere godly heart therefore eleth diuisio self partly delited swetenesse acknowledging ye goodnesse god partly greued bitternesse felyng owne miserie partly resteth vpon promise gospel partly trembleth reason testimonie owne wickednesse partly reioyseth conceyuing life partly quaketh feare death whyche variation cometh imperfection fayth muche neuer good case course present life beyng healed disease distrustfulnesse altogether filled possessed wt faith hereupon procede battels whe distrustfulnesse abideth remnates fleshe riseth vp assaile faith inwardly conceiued faythfull minde assurednesse mixed doubtfulnesse come alwaye pointe faith stadeth certaine clere knowledge darke doubtefully entangled knowledge god toward v though diuersly drawen sondry thoughtes yet therefore seuered fayth though vexed tossyng vp downe distrustfulnesse yet therefore drowned bottolesse depth thereof though shaken yet thrust downe place alwaye ende battell faith doth length wrastling ouercome hard trouble wherwith besieged semeth danger let sunnne sone droppe fayth neuer small poured heartes beginne beholde face god milde pleasant louyng towarde v yet see farre far distant v sure sight know deceiued fro thense forward howe muche profit ought continually profit procedyng come vnto much nerer therfore certainer beholdyng continuance made familiar vnto v see minde enlightened knowledge god first holden wrapped much ignorance litle litle wyped awaye yet minde hindered beyng ignorat thinges darkly seyng seeth enioyeth clere knowledge god wil toward first principal point fayth man beyng shut vp pryson haue beames sunne shinyng sidelong narrowe windowe half glummeryng wanteth deede free beholdynge sunne yet seeth eye vndoubted brightnesse thereof receyueth vse beyng ounde fetter earthly body howe euer eche side shadowed muche darkenesse yet sufficiently enligh ened vnto perfect assurednesse light god extendyng beames light vpon v though litle shew forth mercie pointes apostle wel teacheth diuerse place sayth xiiixx know vnperfectly prophecie vnperfectly see darke speakynge glasse sheweth howe sclender litle portion true godly wisedome geuen v present life though wordes expresly shewe faith vnperfect long grone vnder burden flesh happeneth vnto v owne imperfectio haue neede continually exercised learning yet secretly declareth thinge whiche infinite comprehended small capacitie narrowe compasse paule reporteth whole church vnto euery owne v owne dulnesse hinderance staye come nere wished sure vndeceuiable taste self euen small droppe faith doth make v fele apostle sheweth place affirmeth cor iiix ii gospell beholde glory god vncouered face hauing veile betwene v effectually transformed image entanglemetes ignorance muste needes wrapped together bothe muche doubtyng feareful tremblyng specially asmuch heart certaine natural instinct self enclined vnbeleuingnesse byside tentations bothe infinite number diuerse kinde oftetimes great sodeine violence assayle v specially owne conscience oppressed heauy burden sinnes lyeng vpon dothe sometime lament grone selfe sometime accuseth selfe sometime secretely murmureth sometime openly troubled whether therfore aduersities shew apparance wrath god conscience doth finde selfe profe matter wrath thense vnbelefe doth take weapon engine vanquish fayth withall whiche alway directed ende thinkyng god aduersarie hatefully bent agaynst v bothe hope helpe hande also afrayde deadly enemie beare assaultes faith doth armie fortifie self worde god tentation assayleth god enemie bicause sharpe v faith side answereth euen punisheth also mercifull bicause chastisement cometh rather loue wrath faith striken thought god reuenger iniquity agaynst stroke setteth pardon redy al offense oft sinner resorteth mercifulnesse lord godly minde euer maruelous wise tossed vexed yet length riseth vp aboue dagers neuer suffreth confidece god mercie plucked awaye rather euer contention trouble wery ende turne assurednesse cofidence herof profe holy one whe thinke themselues moste al pressed vengeance god yet euen make complayntes god semeth shal heard euen neuerthelesse call vpon purpose make moane whome thei hoped comfort truely would neuer finde heartes cal vpon vnlesse beleued helpe hande prepared themmat viiixxv disciple whome christ blameth smalnesse fayth coplayned deede perished yet called helpe rebuketh small fayth yet doth reiect nuber maketh number vnbeleuers stirreth shake fault therefore affirme againe whiche haue aboue spoken roote fayth neuer plucked godly heart sticketh faste bottome howe euer shaken seme bende waye waye light thereof neuer quenched choked vp lyeth leaste hidden vnder ember token playnely shewed word vncorruptible sede bringeth forth frute like selfe spryng whereof doth neuer whither vtterly perish whereas extremest matter despeire holy one ele according cosideracion present thinges hande god bent destructioiob xiiixv yet iob affirmeth hope shall procede far though god kill yet wil therfore cesse trust truthe therefore vnbelefe reigneth within heartes godly outwardly assayleth neither doth deadly wound wepons troubleth hurteth yet wound curable faythephe vixviii paule teacheth serueth v sheld beyng holden vp agaynst weapos doth receiue force either vtterly driueth backe least breaketh violece thei pearce danger life therefore fayth shaken like strog souldior violent stroke darte compelled remoue foote geue ground litle faith self wounded like buckler stroke part broke yet yt strike alway godly minde atteine rise thus hie say dauidpsa xx iiij walke middest shadow death wil feare none euel bicause thou art deede terrible walke ye darknesse death faithfull much strength soeuer haue must afrayde yet bicause thought surmounteth haue god present prouidynge safetie feare ouercome assurednesse augustine sayth great engine euer deuell raiseth vp v log possesseth place heart faith dwelleth cast dores may iudge successe faithfull escape safe euery battel receyuyng fresh courage redy come againe field also fulfilled whiche iohn sayth canonical epistle victorie ouercometh worldi ih viiij eue faith affirmeth yt shal winne victorie one fewe battels one assault also shal get ouerhande whole world although thousand time assayled kinde feare tremblyng one assurednesse faith nothing diminished ye thereby soundely stablished faithfull either thinking exaples god vengeance wicked shewed lesson learne carefully beware happen prouoke god wrath theselues offense recording theselues owne miserie learne hang altogether vpon lord without thei see theselues fickle soner vanishing blast winde apostle setting forth ye scourge wherwith ye lord old time punished people israeli cor xxi putteth ye corinthian feare yt entagle theselues wt like euels doth therby abate affiace shaketh away ye dulnesse flesh whiche faith wont oppressed tha stregthened whe taketh occasio yt iewes fal exhort ye standethro xixx take heede yt fal doth therby bidde v wauer though fully assured stedfastnesse taketh away arrogat presumptio rash trusting much owne stregth yt thrusting iewes ye gentile receyued place shuld much outragiously triumph agaynst albeit speaketh faithfull also sayeng comprehendeth hypocrite gloried outward shewe neyther doth admonish euery man particularly makyng coparison betwene iewes gentile shewed iewes reiected suffer iuste punishment vnbelefe vnthankfulnesse also exhorted gentile beyng prowde extollyng themselues lose grace adoption lately conueyed vnto generall reiectyng iewes remained yet fallen couenant adoptio gentile might arise without true faith puffed vp foolish confidence flesh abuse god louyng kindnesse owne destruction although take spoken elect faithfull yet thereupon shall follow inconuenience one thyng holde downe rash presumption whiche remnantes fleshe crepeth sometime euen holy one vayne confidence waxe outragiously wanton thyng strike conscience feare rest full assurednesse mercie god teacheth feare trembling worke owne saluaciophil ijxij requireth nothing el shuld accustome v much abacyng selues reuerently loke vp vnto mightinesse god truely nothyng doth much awake v cast confidence assurance mynde vpon lorde doth distrust selues carefulnesse coceyued knowledge conscience owne wretchednesse accordyng meanyng sayeng prophet takepl vviij multitude thy goodnesse entre thy temple worship feare comely conioyneth boldnesse fayth leaneth vpon god mercie reuerent feare whiche muste needes fele oft comyng sight god maiestie perceyue glorious bryghtnesse thereof howe greate owne filthinesse salomon sayth truelypro xxviii xiiij pronounceth man blessed continually maketh owne heart afrayde hardening thereof men fall hedlong euell feare meaneth maye make v heedefull wherby shuld troubled vtterly fall euen feare minde confounded self dothe recouer selfe agayne god despeiryng self reuiueth trust therefore cause contrarie faythfull maye one time bothe feare also enioye moste assured comfort respect somtime turne eye behold owne vanitie somtime cast thought minde vpon truthe god man saye shal feare fayth dwell bothe one minde euen thus contrarily vnsensible dulnesse carefulnesse wheras wicked trauaile procure themselues want grefe feare god might trouble yet iudgement god presseth atteyne whiche desire nothyng withstande god maye exercise humiliti fightyng valiantly maye restrayne themselues vnder bridle modestie processe texte appereth entent apostle assigneth cause feare tremblyng good pleasure god whereby geueth bothe wel valiantly goe according meaning ought take sayeng propheteose iiiv child israel shal feare god godnesse bicause godlinesse engedreth reuerence god swetenesse pleasant taste grace filleth man beyng discouraged feare admiratio make hange vpon god humbly yeld himselfe subiect power yet herby make roome pestilet philosophie whiche many halfe papistes daye beginne coyne corner bicause ca defende grosse doubtfulnesse hath ben taught scholes thei flie deuise make confidece mingled distrustfulnesse thei confesse oft loke vnto christ finde full mater hope well bicause alwayes vnworthy good thing offred v christ would haue v wauer stagger beholding owne vnworthinesse briefely place conscience betwene hope feare altereth one enterchangeable time course compare fayth hope together one springeth vp pressed downe whe one ariseth othre againe falleth whe satan seeth yt open engine wherwith time wont destroy ye assurednesse faith nothing preuaile endeuoreth croked vndermininges ouerthrow manner cofidence shal shal yeld desperatio say thou cosider christ assured saluatio thou returne thy self assured danation therefore necessitie distrust good hope must enterchageable course reigne thy minde though ought imagine christ standyng far rather dwellyng within v therefore loke saluation hande bycause appereth far vnto v bicause hath graffed v bodye maketh v partaker good thinges also therefore thus turne argument themselues thou consider thy self certaine damnation bicause christ good thinges way comunicatyng geuen vnto thee thinges made thine thou arte made member yea one righteousnesse drowneth thy sinnes saluation taketh awaye thy damnation worthynesse co meth betwene thee god thy vnworthynesse come sight god briefely truthe ought neyther separate christ v v bothe handes holde fast felowshippe whereby hath coupled himselfe vnto v apostle teacheth vsro viiix body deede sayth dead reason sinne spirit christ dwelleth life righteousnesse according men trifeling deuise haue said christ deede hath life sinner remayne subiect death damnation sayth far otherwise teacheth damnatio deserue swalowed vp saluation christ reason haue alleged bicause christ v dwelleth within v cleaueth vnto v diuidable knot felowshippe certaine maruellous communion dayly groweth v one body till made altogether one v yet denie haue sayd litle sometime happen certaine erruptions fayth weakenesse thereof amonge violent sodeine motion bowed hether thether thicke miste tetations lig thereof choked euer happeneth cesseth endeuour seke god otherwise doth bernarde argue purposely entreateth question v homelie dedication temple oftentimes say benefite god studieng vpon soule thinkes finde two thinges contrarie behold soule selfe selfe selfe saye nothyng truely yt vtterly brought nought neede nowe recken vp particularly misery soule loaden sinnes couered darknesse entangled deceitfull enticementes itchyng lustes subiect passion filled illusion alwaye enclined euell bent kindes vice finally full shame confusion al righteousness beynge loked vpon light truthe founde like clothe stayned flouresesa lx iivi shall vnrighteounesses thereof accompted light v darkenesse great shal darkenesse bematt v xiij without doubte man made like vnto vanitie man brought nought man nothing vtterly nothing whome god doth magnifie nothyng toward whome god heart set brother let v take heart againe though nothing owne heartes peraduenture maye somewhat v lie hidden heart god father mercy father miserable howe doest thou set thy heart toward v thy heart thy treasure e thy treasure nothyng nation thee yf shalbe reputed nothyng euen thee within thee iudgement thy truth affection thy pitie thou callest thinges though therefore bothe bicause thou callest thing also bycause thou callest though respect theselues yet thee according sayeng paulero ixxii workes righteousnesse calleth sayth couplyng together bothe consideracions maruellous truely thinges knit together one destroye also co clusion plainely declareth wordes consideracios diligently loke vpon selues yea one consideracio nothing much magnified thinke glorieng semeth tempered paradueture encreased truely perfectly stablished glorie selues lord thinke thus hath determined saue v shal deliuered may take courage let v climbe vp hier watche toure seke citie god seke teple seke ye house seke spouse haue forgotte say feare reuerece saye heart god allowyng worthy owne worthinesse feare lord whereof comonly euery place witnesse borne al holy one whiche place called beginning wisedom place wisedome selfepro ivii although onepsal cxi yet procedeth fro double vnderstanding god hath reuerence father lordpro xvx iij therefore yt truely worship endeuor shewe bothe obedient sonne seruisable seruant vnto himmalac ivii obedience geuen father lord prophet calleth honor seruice done lord calleth feare sonne sayth honoreth father seruant lordiob vi xxvi father honor lord feare soeuer putteth differece betwene thou seest confoundeth together therfore let feare lord vnto v reuerece mingled wt honor feare neither maruel one minde receiue affectios cosidereth father god vnto v hath cause enough although helles al drede displeasure greuously tha death also wantonnesse flesh rune licentiousnesse sinning restraine al meanes ought therewithal take hold thought lord vnder whose power liue abhorreth al iniquitie whose vegeance shall escape yt liuing wickedly doe prouoke wrath theselues iohn sayth feare charitie perfect charitie casteth fearei iob iiii viij bicause feare conteyneth punishment disagreeth say ye wicked feare god respect drede incurre displeasure might doe without punishmet bicause thei know armed wt power reuege therfore thei shake feare ye hearing wrath also feare wrath bicause thinke hangeth ouer loke euery moment shal fal vpon heds faithfull aboue sayd feare displeasure punishment troubled feare punishmet hang ouer neckes made ware procure sayth apostle whe speaketh faithful ye deceiuedeph vvi commeth wrath god vpon child vnbelefeco iijvi threateneth god wrath come vpon putteth minde thinke vpon wrath god prepared suche wicked doinges recited thei themselues willing also proue albeit seldome happeneth reprobate awakened wyth onely bare threateninges rather beyng already grosse vnsensibly dull owne hardnesse oft god thundreth heaue harden themselues obstinacie one striken hand whether thei enforced feare feare commonly call seruile feare comparison se contrarie free natured willyng feare becometh child suttelly thrust middle kynde bicause seruile constrayned affection sometime subdueth men mindes come willyngly feare god vnderstand good wil god wherunto faith sayd haue respect possession saluation eternall life obteined wat good thing god fauorable vnto v abundantly sufficeth v assurednesse saluation whe himselfe doth assure v louepsal lxixiiij ephes ijxiiii let shewe face sayth prophet shalbe safe wherupon scripture determine summe saluatio god putting away al enmity hath receyued v fauour whereby shew god reconciled vnto v remayneth perill al thing shal prosper well v therfore faith hauing taken hold loue god hath promise present life life come perfect assurednesse al good thinges may gathered word god faith doth certainely promise self eyther legth honor wealth life asmuch god willed none thinges apointed vnto v contented assurednesse god neuer faile howe euer many thing faile v perteine maintenance present life chiefe assurednesse faith resteth expertation life come set doubt worde god euer misery calamity betide vnto whome god loueth worke contrarie good perfect felicitie therefore meane expresse summe blessednesse named fauor god whiche spring flowe vnto v al kindes good thinges may comonly note throughout scripture euer mentio made eternal saluation also good thing v alwaye called backe loue godpsa lxiijiiii cause dauid sayeth goodnesse god felt godly heart sweter desired life selfe finally yf thinges el flowe vnto v accordynge owne wishing vncertaine god loue hatred felicitie shalbe accursed therefore miserable yf fauorable face god shine vnto v euen misery shalbe blessedrom viiixxiv bicause turned helpes saluation paule heaped vp rehersall aduersities yet glorieth seuered loue god prayer alwaye beginneth fauour god whense floweth prosperitie likewise dauid setteth fauour god agaynste terror trouble vsps iiiiiii sayth shall walke middest shadowe death feare euels bycause thou arte alway fele mindes wauer vnlesse beyng cotented fauour god seke peace haue inwardly fixed sayd psalmeps xxxii xii blessed people whose god lord nation whome hath chosen inheritance make fundation fayth bee free promise god bycause fayth proprely stayeth vpon though fayth doe beleue god bee true thynges whether commaunde forbidde whether promyse threaten also obediently receyueth comaundementes bewareth thynges prohibeteth hath regard threatenynges yet properly beginneth promise therein continueth thereupon endeth fayth seketh lyfe god whiche founde commaundementes declaratios penalty promise mercie promise suche freely geuen conditionall promise whiche sente owne workes doth otherwise promise life perceiue stand selues therfore wil haue faith treble wauer must stay promise saluatio willingly liberally offred v lord rather respect miseriero xviii tha worthinesse wherfore apostle beareth witnesse gospell word faith whiche name taketh fro comaundementes also promise lawe bicause nothyng stablish faith liberal embassage god recocileth world therfore apostle oftentimes maketh relation faith gospell togetherro ivi v xvij teacheth ministerie gospell comitted vnto obedience faith power god saluation euery one beleueth reueled righteousnesse god fro faith faith maruell sithe gospell ministerie reconciliationij cor vxviij testimonie sure enough god good toward v knowledge whereof faith requireth therfore saye faith must rest vpon free promise denie faithful euery way embrace receiue worde god apoint promise mercie propre marke faith euen faithfull ought deede acknowledge god iudge punisher wicked doynges yet properly haue regard vnto mercifull kindenesse asmuch described considered one louyng mercifullps lxxxviv ciiilxixiv far wrath much goodnesse gentle vnto pouryng forth mercie vpon al workes neyther yet regarde barkynges pyghius suche dogges finde faulte restraint though diuidyng fayth take holde one peece thereof graunte haue alredy sayd general obiect faith thei terme truthe god whether threaten put v hope fauour wherefore apostle ascribeth faythheb xivii noe feared destruction worlde yet seene feare punishment shortly come worke fayth ought threatenynges excluded definition fayth deede true cauillers vniustly accuse v though denied fayth hath respecte partes word god meaning shew two thing first faith neuer stedfastly standeth vntil come free promise otherwise recociled god bycause coupleth v christ pointes worthy noted seke fayth may make differece betwene childre god reprobate betwene faithful vnbeleuing man beleue god bothe iustly commaundeth commaundeth truely threatneth shall therefore called faithfull nothing lesse therefore stedfast stay faith vnlesse grounded vpon mercie god nowe ende dyspute faith maie learne way saluation doth faith bring saluation respect yt graffeth v body christ therefore inconuenience definition de enforce principal effect thereof ioyne vnto gerall name stede difference marke seuereth faitfull vnbeleuing finally malicious haue nothinge finde fault withal doctrinero xvi thei must wrappe vp paule v blame calleth gospel proprely word faith herevpon againe gather haue declared faith doth lesse neede worde frute doth neede liuely roote treepsa ixxi bicause none dauid testifieth trust lorde knowe name thys knowledg according euery man imagination farre god hymselfe witnesse hys goodnesse whych prophet confyrmeth placepsa cixxliv sayeng thy saluation accordinge thy worde againe haue trusted thy word saue wher noted relation faith worde howe saluation foloweth yet meane time exclude ye power god beholding whereof vnlesse faithe susteine selfe neuer geue vnto god due honourero iiiixxi paule seemeth reherse certaine sclender common thing abraham beleued god promised blessed seede able perfourme againe placeij tim ixviii speaking himselfe knowe whome haue beleued sure able keept haue left vntill da e man weie himselfe howe many doubtinges power god oftentimes creepe man mynde hee shall well perceiue highly esteme worthy haue little profited faith confesse god able whatsoeuer euen leaste tentation throweth v downe feare amaseth v horroure thereby appeareth plainely diminish estimation god power preferre aboue thynges satan threatneth againste god promise reaso esay meaning print ye heart people assurednesse saluation dothe honorably entreateth infinite power god seemeth ofte sone hee hathe begonne speake hope pardon reconciliation hee tourneth thing wandereth longe superfluous circumstance rehersinge howe maruelously lorde gouerneth frame heauen earth whole ordre nature yet nothinge serueth fittly circumstance matter speaketh vnlesse power god wherby able thinges presently set eies eares wil hardly heare worde wil esteme much worth beside declared effectual power bicause godlinesse haue already shewed place doth alwaie applie power god vse worke specially setteth selfe workes god wherby hath testified himselfe father herevpon commeth scripture often mention made redemption wherby israelite might haue learned god whiche one author saluation euerlastinge preseruer thereof dauid putteth v mynde hys owne exaumple benefites whiche god hathe particularly bestowed vpon euery man doe afterwarde auaile confyrmation faithe yea god seemeth haue forsaken v behoueth v stretche oure wittes hys aunciente benefites maie recomforte v saide psalme haue ben mindefull olde day haue studied vpon thy workesps cxliii lxxviixi c againe remembre workes lorde meruelles beginning bicause without word quickly vanisheth awaie conceiue power god woorkes therefore without cause affyrme faithe vnlesse god geue lighte vnto testimonie hys grace question myghte bee moued y bee thought sara rebecca bothe moued semeth zele saithge xviv passed beyonde bondes word sara feruently desyred promysed issue gaue bondmaide housbande denied shee many way sinned nowe touche onely thys faulte beinge carryed awaye wyth zele restraine herselfe within bondes god worde yet certaine desire proceeded faithge xxvi rebecca certified oracle god electio sonne iacob procured blessing euell crafty meanes deceued hir husbande witnesse minister grace god shee compelled sonne lye dyuerse guile deceites corrupted trueth god fynally makinge scorne hys promise shee dyd muche laye destroie yet thys acte howe muche soeuer euell woorthy blame without faith necessarie sholde ouercome many offense shee might earnestly endeuoure atteine whiche without hope earthly profite ful greate trouble daungers wee may say holy patriarche isaac altogether without faithe bicause beinge oracle god admonished honoure transferred yonger sonne yet cessed bee fauourably bente hys fyrste begotten sonne esau truely example teache oftetimes erroures mingled faithe yet faith true faith hath alwaie vpper hande particular erroure rebecca make void effect blessing neither make voide faith whyche generally reigned mynde beginning cause doynge neuerthelesse therein rebecca vttered howe readye man mynde fall sone geueth hym selfe neuer lyttle lybertie thoughe man defaut weakenesse dothe darken faith yet doth quenche meane time putteth v minde carefully wee oughte hange vpon mouthe god also confyrmeth whyche wee haue taughte faythe vanysheth awaye vnlesse yt bee vpholden woorde myndes boothe sara isaac rebecca hadde become vaine theyr croked wanderinges waie vnlesse thei ben god secret brydle holden obedience worde againe without cause include promise christ forasmuche knowledge apostle includeth al gospellro ixvii ii cor xx place teacheth promise god yea amen reason whereof ready shewed god promise thinge therein sheweth hys good promise hys testimonie loue neither maketh mater wycked haue great continuall benefites god liberalitie heaped vpon doe thereby wrappe themselues much greuous iudgement syth thei neither thinke acknowlege yt thing com vnto fro ye hande god thei acknowlege thei themselues consider goodnesse therefore thei thereby better taught mercie brute beastes according ye measure estate receiue frute god liberalitie yet perceiue neither doth make againste v many time refusing promise apointed occasion procure selues greater vengeance although effectuall workinge promyses onely appeare haue founde faith v yet force natural propretie neuer extinguyshed oure vnbeleefe vnthankfulnesse therefore lorde hys promyses doth prouoke man onely receiue also thynke vpon frutes hys bountifulnesse hee doth therwith declare vnto hys loue wherevpon muste returne thys poynte euery promyse testifieng god loue towarde vsmatt iiixvii question man loued god christe beloued sonne whome loue father abydeth resteth hym poureth selfe abroade vnto vseph ivii paule teacheth wee haue obteyned fauoure beloued one therefore muste needes bee deryued come vnto v meane hymeph iixiiii thys cause apostle place calleth oure peace place hee setteth hym oute bonde whereby god fatherli natural kindenes bound vnto v foloweth must caste eye vpon hym oft promyse y offered vsro viiiiii xvviii paule teacheth absurditie god promyses whatsoeuer bee confyrmed fulfilled hym certayne exaumples make contrarie yf y lykely naaman syrianact xviii hee requyred prophete manner worship god arighte instructed concerning ye mediatoract viiiii vxvii yet godlynesse praised cornelius gentile romaine could scarcely vnderstand yt knowen al ye iewes yea darkely yet almes praiers acceptable godii ro vxvii act viiixiii ye sacrifice naaman prophet answer allowed whych thing neither coulde obteine faythe lykewise yt maie sayde ennuche whome philppe carried yf hadde faythe woulde haue taken vpon trauayle exspenses longe iourney worshippe yet see philippe examined bewrayed ignorance mediator truely graunte theyr faythe vnexpressed concerning christes person also concerninge power office committed vnto father yet meane time certaine thei instructed suche principle gaue taste christe althoughe small neyther ought seeme strange neither wold eunuche haue come haste ierusalem farre countrie worship vnknowen god neither cornelius one embraced iewish religion spende much time without acquainted first groundes true doctrine naaman ben fonde absurditie elyzeus taught small thynges haue saide nothinge principal pointe therefore although among darke knoweledge christ yet likely ther knowledge bicause thei vse selues sacrifice lawe whiche must haue discerned ende christe false sacrifice gentile bare outward declaration word god ought haue largely sufficed make beleued owne blyndenesse stubbournesse withstande oure minde hath suche inclination vanitie neuer cleaue faste vnto trueth god hathe suche dulnesse alwaie blinde see light thereof therefore nothynge auailably done worde without enlightninge holy ghoste whereby also appeareth faithe farre aboue man vnderstanding neither shal sufficient minde lightned spirit god vnlesse hearte also strengthened stablished power wherein schoolemen altogether erre whiche considerynge faithe onely take holde bare simple assent knowledg leauinge confidence assurednesse heart therefore faith way syngular gyfte god bothe mynde man cleansed taste trueth god hearte stablished therein holy ghoste onely beginner faythe also degree encreaseth vntil bring v heauenly kingdomeii ti ixiiii ga iiiii good thinge saith paule whiche committed thy keping kepe holy ghoste dwelleth v howe paule saithe holy ghoste geuen hearing faythe may easily dissolue hadde ben one onely gyfte holy ghoste ben absurditie call holy ghost effect faith whyche author cause faithe maketh report gyftes wherewyth god garnysheth churche encreasinges faithe bryngeth perfection meruell ascribe thynges faithe whiche maketh v fitt receiue reckened moste strange conclusion saide man whome geuen beleue christ partely bycause consyder either howe secrete hye heauenly wysedome howe greate man dulnesse conceiuinge misteries god partly bycause looke vnto assured stedfast constantnesse hearte saye cheefe parte faith paule preacheth manne wytnesse wyll mannei co ii xi
