spirite manne within howe shoulde man sure god truth god vncertaine among v thinges presently beholde eye shold assured stedfast among v ther wher ye lord promiseth thinge neither eye seeth witt comprehendeth herein man sharpnesse vnderstanding ouerthrowen faileth fyrste degree profitinge god schoole forsake owne wit veile cast v hyndred atteine misteries godmat xix luc xxxi mat xvixvii cor iixiiii rom xixxxiiii cor iix whiche disclosed little one neither dothe flesh blood disclose natural man perceiue thing spirit rather learning god foolishnesse bicause spiritually iudged therfore herin ye helpe ye holy ghost necessarie rather herein force onely reigneth ther noman knoweth ye minde god hath ben counseller holy spirit searcheth thinges euen ye depe secretes god whome brought passe know minde christ man saith come meihon vixliii vnlesse father yt sent drawe hym euery one therfore hath heard learned father commeth yt man hath seen ye father sent god euen therfore come vnto christ drawen ye spirit god drawen lifted vp witt minde aboue owne vnderstanding soule enlightned hym taketh wer new sharpnes vnderstanding wherwith maye beholde heauenly misteries brightnes wherof daseled selfe man vnderstanding receiuing brightnesse lighte holy ghost doth neuer till truely beginne taste thinges belong ye kingdome god altogether vnfauourie without iudgment tast take assay themlu xxiiiixxvii xiv therfore christ notably set vnto two hys disciple misteries kingdome yet nothing preuailed vntill opened sens might vnderstand scripturesihon xvixv ye apostle weare taughte godly mouth yet spirit truth must sent vnto poure mindes yt doctrine whiche hearde eares worde god like vnto sunne shineth vnto whome preached profit amonge blinde men al behalfe blind nature therfore pearce minde inward master holy ghoste making enlightning entrie place entreat ye corruption natur haue largely shewed vnfit men beleue therefore wil wery ye reader repeting ye againeii cor iiiixiii let sufficient yt spirit faith called paule faith selfe spirit geueth v haue naturally therfore praieth yt god fulfil ye thessalonian al good pleasureii thes xi ye worke faith power wherin calling faithe worke god geuing yt title name additio calling figure appositio god good pleasure denieth yt man motion contented therwith addeth declaratio god power writing ye corynthians saith faithe hangeth vpon wisedome men grounded vpon power holy ghoste speaketh dede outewarde miracle bicause reprobate blynde beholding hee comprehendeth also inwarde seale wherof maketh mention place god gloriously set forthe liberalitie noble gifte vouchesaueth graunt al vniuersally without difference singular priuilege geueth whome proofe whereof haue alleged testimony augustine faithfull expositor crieth woulde please sauioure teache beleuing selfe gifte deseruing noman saith commeth vnlesse father drawe whome geuen father maruellous twoo heare one despyseth ascendeth vp let despiseth impute himselfe let ascende yt arrogantly assigne himselfe place geuen one greueth say depth crosse wote depth iudgmentes god mate searche procedeth see whereby see sauinge see thus farre god hym hym muche bottomelesse depth depth crosse maie crie woundering shewe disputing finally summe commeth christ enlightneth v vnto faith power hys spirite doth withall graffe v bodie wee maie made partaker good thynges nowe remaineth whiche minde hathe receiued may conueied ye heart word god throughly receiued faith swimme toppe braine hath taken roote bottome heart may inuincible defense beare repulse engine tentations true true vnderstanding mynde enlightning thereof confyrmation hearte power much euidently appeareth euen muche distrustfulnesse hearte greater blindnesse witte harder haue mynde furnyshed wyth assurednesse witte bee instructed thinking therefore spirit perfourmeth office seale seale vp heartes promyses assurance whereof fyrste emprinted oure wittes serueth earnest confyrme stablyshe themeph ixiii sithe ye beleued saith apostle ye sealed vp holy spirite promyse whiche earnest oure inheritance see teacheth spirit heartes fathfull grauen seale reason calleth spirite promise bycause ratifieth gospell vnto v lykewyse corynthians saithe god whiche annoynted vsii cor ixxii vv whiche hath also sealed v geuen earnest hys spirite oure heartes place speaketh confidence boldnesse hopigne well hee maketh pledge spirite foundation thereof neither yet haue forgotten whyche sayde remembrance whereof experience continually reneweth faithe tossed wyth dyuerse doubtynges myndes godly seldome quyet least doe alwaie enioye peafable state wyth soeuer engine shaken either thei rise vp gulfe temptation abide faste standing truely thys assurednesse onely nourisheth defendeth faithe holde fast whiche saide psalmeps xlviiii lorde y oure protection oure helpe trouble therefore feare whe earthe shall tremble mountaines shal leape heart ye sea also moste swete quietnesse spoken place laye downe slepteps iiivi rose againe bycause lorde hathe susteined meante thereby dauid alwaie wyth one vndisturbed course framed merry cherefulnesse respect hee tasted grace godesa xxxi psal xxxivii heb xxvi according proportion faith therefore hee gloryeth hee wythoute feare despiseth euer might disquiet peace minde therfore ye scripture meaning exhort v faith biddeth v quiet esaie saide hope silence shall strength psalme holde thee stil lorde waite wherwith agreeth saieng apostle hebrues patience needefull c hereby may iudge pestilent doctrine scholemen otherwise determine grace god towarde v morall coniecture euery man thinketh himselfe worthy truely shall weie oure workes howe god minded towarde v graunt atteine yt wyth coniecture yt neuer sclender sith faithe oughte haue relation simple free promise lefte cause doubtiong confidence beseache shall armed saie god fauourable vnto v vpon condition purenesse oure life deserue bycause haue appoynted one place proprely discussing herof therfore wil speake present specially asmuche plaine enoughe nothinge contrarie faith either coniecture thinge nere vnto doubting thei ill writhe purpose testimonie preacher whiche thei haue ofte moutheseccl ix noman knoweth whether worthy hatred loue speake nothinge place common translation corruply turned yet child ignorant salomon meaneth word man iudge present state thing god hateth god loueth laboreth vaine troubleth himselfe profitte peines sithe thinges happen alike righteous ye wicked offreth sacrifice offreth none whervpon foloweth god doth alway witnesse hys loue whome hee maketh thynges happen prosperously dothe alwaies vtter hatred whome hee punishetheccl iiiix dothe condemne vanitie man witte sith dull thynges moste needefull knowen hadde written little canne discerned ye soule man differeth soule beast bicause seemeth dye like manner manne gether thereof opinion wee holde immortalitie soules standeth vpon coniecture maye worthyly compted madde manne theyr right wittes whiche gather certaintie god grace bycause wee conceyue none carnal beeholdynge presente thynges thei alleage point rashe presumption take vpon v vndoubted knoweledge god woulde dede graunt vnto take muche vpon v wolde make incomprehensible secret purpose god subiect sclendernesse oure wittei cor ii x j symply saie paule haue receiued spirite thys worlde spirit god whose teachinge wee maie knowe thinges geuen v god canne thei barke againste muste slaunderously speake ye spirit god horrible robberie god accuse reuelation commeth either lyeng vnassured doubtefull offend affyrminge assured say also without greate presumptuousnesse dare glorie spirit christe woulde thynke dulnesse greate woulde bee compted maisters worlde fowly stumble fyrste principle religion surely woulde thinke credible vnlesse theyr owne wrytynges abroade dyd testifie ytrom viiixiiii paule pronounceth yt onely chyldren god moued wyth hys spirit menne woulde haue bee chyldren god moued wyth theyr spirit without spirite god paule teacheth call god oure fatherrom viiixvi holy ghoste ministreth woorde vnto v whyche onely canne beare witnesse oure spirite child god men althoughe forbydde v call vpon god yet take awaie spirite whose guydinge hee shoulde haue rightly called vpon paule denyeth thei seruantes christ moued spirit christ men faine christianitie needeth spirit christerom viijxi paule maketh hope blessed resurrection vnlesse wee feele holy ghoste abydynge v forge hope withoute suche feeling peraduenture answere thei denie yt ought endued point modestie humilitie acknowledge meaneth biddeth corynthians trie whether thei faithii cor xiijv proue themselues whether thei haue christe whome vnlesse man acknowledge dwelling reprobate spirite god hath geuen v saith ihon knowe abydeth vsi iho iiixxiiii el cal promise christ dout compted seruantes god without spirite whiche hathe openly declaredesa xxxiii iii woulde poure vpon biside wronge holy ghoste whiche separate faithe peculiar worke sithe firste lesson godlie religion token miserable blindenesse haue christian noted arrogancie dare glorie presence holy ghoste without whiche glorieng christianitie selfe dothe stand thei declare example truely christ saide spirite vnknowen worldeioh xiiiixvii onely knowen whome abideth bycause thei go ouerthrowe stedfastnesse faith digging onely one myne assayle also otherwise thei say yt although according present state righteousnes mai gather iudgment ye grace god yet ye knowledg perseuerance ye ende abideth suspense goodly cofidence saluation forsoothe left vnto v iudge morall coniecture yt preset moment fauoure shal become v morrow tellrom viiixxxviii apostle teacheth farr otherwise surely perswaded saith neither angeles power principality neither death life neither present thing thing come shal seuer v fro ye loue wherwith ye lord embraceth v christ thei seke escape trifling solutio pratinge yt apostle yt speciall reuelation thei holden hard slippe away ther entreateth good thing yt comonly come faith faithfull yt himselfe specialli felethi cor xxii ye paule place putteth v feare wt mention weakenes vnstedfastnes let yt standeth saith beware yt fal true suche feare wherby shold ouerthrowe wherby may learne humble selues vnder ye mighty hand godi pet vvi peter expoundeth ordre truthe limite ye assurednes faith moment time whose propretie passe beyond space life extend immortalitie come sithe therefore faithfull impute ye grace god yt lightned wt spirite thei faith enioy ye beholding ye heauenly life farr glorieng fro presumptuousnesse yt man ashamed confesse doth therin bewraie extreeme vnthankfulnesse vnkindely hiding god goodnes doth declare modestie submissio bicause semed yt nature faith could otherwise better plainly declared ye substance ye promise vpon whiche resteth vpon propre foundation yt promise taken away faith falleth rather vanisheth away therfore toke definition fro thense yet varieth definition rather descriptio ye apostleheb xii yt applieth discourse wher saith yt faithe substance thinges hoped certaintie thing yt seen word hypostasis substace terme vseth meaneth wer vpholding stay wherevpon ye godly minde leaneth resteth shold say ye faith certain assured possession thing yt promised v god vnlesse man rather take hypostasis affiance mislike albeit folowe comonly receiueddan viix againe signifie ye euen ye last day ye bokes shalbe opened thei hier thing yt may perceiued wt sens seen wt y handled handes ye otherwise possessed v go beyond ye capacitie witt bend vnderstanding aboue thing yt ye world yea climbe aboue selues hath therfor added yt assurednesse possessio thing yt lie hope therefore seenrom v ixxiiii plaine appearace paule writeth hope neither hope thing see whe calleth certaintie profe augustine hath oft translated coiunction thing present aug hom ioan greke elenchos saith asmuch say euidente shewinge thinges appearinge seeinge thinges seen de peccal merit remiss lib cap plainnesse darke thinges presence thynges absente open shewinge hidden thinges mystery god suche pertaine oure saluation seen selues owne nature call yt butte wee beholde onely hys worde whose truthe oughte fully perswaded oughte holde speaketh already done fulfylled howe canne mynde lyfte vp selfe receiue suche taste god goodnesse yt must nedes therewyth wholy kyndled loue god againe flowing plentie swetenesse whiche god hathe laied vp store feare canne bee truely knowen muste therewythall vehemently mo e affection whose affection one moneth vtterly rauisheth carrieth hym beyonde himselfe therefore maruell peruerse crooked hearte neuer entreth affection whiche beinge conueyed vp heauen suffred com thee moste secretly hidden treasure god sacred priuie place hys kyngedome whyche maie defyled wyth entrance vncleane hearte lib disl sepius scholemen teache charitie faithe hope y mere madnesse faythe onely fyrste engendreth charitie v howe muche ryghtly dothe bernarde teache ser annuntiatione beleue saythe testimonie conscience paule calleth glorie godly consisteth three thynges first necessarie beleue thou canst haue forgeuenesse synnesii cor ixii pardon god thow canst haue good worke vnlesse also geue last thou canst noe woorkes deserue eternall life vnlesse also bee geuen freely little addeth thinges suffice ther certain beginning faith bicause beleuing sinnes forgeuen god oughte also beleue forgeuen v till also perswaded testimonie holy ghoste saluation laied vp store v bicause god forgeueth sinnes geueth merites also geueth reward wee maie stay styll beginninge thinges shalbe entreated place fit nowe let onely suffice knowe faithe whersoeuer liuely faith shalbe possible yt hathe yt hope eternal saluation vndiuidable copanio rather ye engendreth bringeth forthe self hope taken away eloquently gloriously soeuer talk faith yet conuicted haue faith faith aboue said assured persuasio god truth yt lie vnto v deceiue v become voide thei haue conceiued assurednesse truely therwithal looke tyme come god shall performe promise whiche perswasion true brefely hope nothing el loking thinges whiche faith hath beleued truely promise god faith beleueth god true hope loketh ye performance truth conueniente time faithe beleueth oure father hope looketh shewe himselfe suche one toward v faith beleueth eternall life geuen v hope looketh one daie reueled faithe foundation wherevpon hope resteth hope nourisheth susteineth faithe man canne looke thynge god hande butte hee hathe fyrste beleued hys promise againe weakenesse faythe muste pacient hope expectation bee susteined cherished fall faintinge wearines reason paule doth wel place saluacion hoperom viiixxiiii hope silence loketh ye lord restraineth faith fal hedlong much haste hope strengthneth faithe wauer god promyse beginne doubt truth hope refresheth faith yt ware weary hope stretcheth faythe vttermoste bonde fainte midde course beginning finally hope continually renewinge restoringe maketh ryse vp fressher selfe continuance howe many wayes helpes hope necessarie strengthning faithe shall better appeare yf consyder wyth howe many sortes temptation assailed shaken haue embraced worde god fyrst lorde differring promise doth oftentimes hold oure myndes longer suspense wee woulde wishe office hope perfourmeheb iiiii whiche prophete commaundeth thoughe hys promise tarry yet sholde waite stil sometime suffereth v onely faint also seemeth bee hiely displeased muche necessarie haue hope helpe vsesa viijxvii ii pet iijiiii according saieng prophete maie stil loke lorde hath hidden face iacob rise vppe also scorner peter saith aske promise hys comming forasmuch sin father slept thynges continew beginning creation yea flesh world wisper thing oure earespsa x xixiiii must faith staye sufferace hope holden fast fixed beholdyng eternitie maye accompt thousand yeres like one daye thys conioyning aliance scripture sometime confoundeth name faythe hopeii pet iiiviii pet iv peter teacheth power god preserued faithe vnto disclosinge saluation geueth vnto faithe whyche dyed fittely agree hope without cause asmuche haue already taught hope nothing el nourishment strength faithe sometimes ioyned together epistle faithe hope shoulde godph paule philippian faith deriueth expectation bicause pacientli hoping holde desire suspense till god conuenient oportunitie opened whiche matter wee maye better vnderstande tenth chapiter hebruesgal vv whyche haue already alleaged paule place although speake vnproprely yet meaneth ye thing wordes loke spirit faith hope righteousnesse euen bicause embracing testimonie gospell concerning free loue loke time god shall openly shewe whiche nowe hidden vnder hope nowe plaine folishly peter lomberd laieth two foundation hope yt grace god deseruing work hope haue mark directed vnto faith haue already declared yt faith hath one mark mercie god ought loke maie speake eye good heare liuely reaso bringeth saith thou darst hope thing without deseruinges shal worthy called hope presumption whoe gentile reader worthyly abhorre suche beastes saie rashe presumptuous dede man haue cofidence god true word lord willeth v loke thinges goodnesse thei saie presumption leane rest vpon master meete suche scholers founde madde schole filthy babbler v se wee commaunded oracle god conceiue hope saluation let v gladly presume much vpon truthe trusting vpon onely mercie casting away confydence workes bolde hope well deceiue saide vnto according faithematt ixxxix thyrde chapter ar regenerate faithe wherein entreatch repentance albeit haue already partly taught faith possesseth christe eioye hys benefites neuerthelesse thys weare yet darke vnlesse dyd also make declaratio ye effectes feele thereby without cause said summe gospell standeth repentance forgeuenesse sinnes therfore leauing two pointes whatsoeuer shal saie faith shalbe hungry vnperfect yea manner vnprofitable disputation faith forasmuch christ doth geue vnto v obteine faith saie newnesse life fre reconciliation reaso ordre teaching requireth place beginne speake bothe oure next passage faith shalbe repentance bicause article well perceiued shall better appeare howe man iustified onely faithe mere pardon yet real holinesse life maie call seuered fro free imputation righteousnesse ought oute question yt repentance doth immediatly folow faith also spring wheras pardon forgeuenesse therfore offred ye preaching ye gospel ye sinner deliuered ye tyranie satan ye yoke sinne fro miserable bondage vice maie passe ye kingdome god truly man embrace ye grace gospell muste returne erroures hys former life right way applie studie meditation repentance thinke repentance dothe rather goe faithe flow spring forth frute tree thei neuer knew ye force therof moued weake argument thinke christ saie thei ihon preachinges first exhorte ye people repentancemat iiiix mat iiiivii thei afterwarde saye ye kyngdome heauen hand comaundemet preach ye apostle receiued ordre paule folowed luke reporteth thei superstitiously stick vpon ye ioining together syllablesact xxxxi thei mark meaning ye word hang together whe ye lord christ iho preach manner repent ye ye kingedome heauen come neare hande fetche cause repentance fro grace promise saluatio therfore word much effecte thei said ye kingdo heaue com nere hand therfore repet ye matthewe hathe shewed ihon preatched saith fulfilled prophecie esaieesa xliii concerninge voyce cryeng wyldernesse prepare waie lorde make streight pathes oure god prophete voice co maunded beginne comfort glade tydinges yet referre beginning repentance faith dreame certaine meane space time wherein bringeth meane shew man earnestly applie selfe repentance vnlesse know selfe god man truely perswaded god hathe firste receiued grace thing shalbe plainely dyscussed processe folowing paraduenture deceiued many firste terroures conscience tamed framed obedience thei haue throughli disgested yea haue tasted knowledge grace feare beginning whiche accompte among vertues bicause thei see nere true iuste obedience oure question diuersly christ draweth v vnto prepareth v endeuoure godlinesse say yt ther vprightnesse founde reigneth spirit whiche christe receyued communicate membres according saieng psalmepsa cxxx iiii wyth thee mercifulnesse thou maiest bee feared noe man shall euer reuerently feare god trusteth god mercifull vnto man wil willingly prepare himselfe kepinge lawe perswaded seruices please tendernesse pardoning bearing faultes signe fatherly fauoure whiche also shewed exhortation oseeose viii come let v returne lord bicause hath plucked v heale v hath striken v wil cure v bicause hope pardo vsed pricke make lie dull sinnes doting erroure without coloure reason whiche beginne repentance apoint certaine day new co uertes thei must exercise themselues penance day one past admit communion grace gospell speake many anabaptistes specially maruelously reioyce compted spirituall co panions iesuites dregges suche frutes forsoothe ye spirit giddinesse bringeth forth determine repentance within co passe fewe day christian man ought extende continuance throughout whole life certaine learned men euen long time meaning speake simply syncerely repentance according ye truth scripture haue said yt consisteth two part mortification vinificatio mortification thei expounde sorrowe ye soule feare coceiued acknowledging sinne feling iudgement god man one broughte true knowledge synne truely begynneth hate abhorre synne heartyly misliketh hymselfe confesseth himselfe miserable loste wyssheth himselfe man touched wyth feelinge iudgemente god one immediatly foloweth vpon hee lyeth stryken ouerthrowen trembleth humbled cast discouraged despeireth fyrst parte repentance whiche thei haue co monly called contrition uiuification thei expounde comfort groweth faithe man ouerthrowen conscience sinne striken feare god loking afterwarde vnto goodnesse god vnto mercie fauoure saluation throughe christe raiseth vp himselfe takethe breath againe recouereth courage returneth death life woordes haue right exposition aptly enough expresse nature repentance wher thei take uiuification cherefulnesse whiche minde receiueth beinge brought quietnesse trouble feare therein agree forasmuche rather signifieth desire liue holyly godly whiche groweth regeneration saide man dyeth himselfe beginne liue god bicause thei sawe word diuersly taken scripture haue made twoo sortes repentance bycause woulde make differently knowen mark haue called one repentance law sinner wouded ye searing iron sinne worne awaie feare wrath god sticketh fast trouble winde himselfe repentance thei call gospell whyche synner dede greuously vexed himselfe ryseth vp higher taketh holde christ salue sore ye comforte feare ye hauen miserie ye repentance ye law thei putt examplesge iiiixii kin xvxxx mat xxvii iiii cain saul iudas whose repentance scripture reherseth vnto v meaneth acknowleginge greuousnesse theyr sinne afraide wrath god thinking vpon god onely reuenger iudge thei fainted feeling therefore repentance nothing el certain entrie hel wherinto thei entred present life beganne already suffer punishment face wrath god maiestie repentance gospel see al galled spurre sinne themselues recoforted refreshed confidence mercie god turned vnto lordiiii e xx e xxxviii ezechias striken feare receiued message death praied weping loking vnto goodnesse god toke againe good confidence vnto niniuites wer troubled horrible threatning destructionion iiiv thei clothed selues sakcloth ash praied hoping ye lord might turned turned furor wrathe dauid confessed much sinned nombring peopleii ii said lord take awaie ye wickednesse thy seruant acknowledged offense adulterieii xiixiii v nathan rebuked cast himselfe downe lorde therwithal also loked pardon suche ye repentance yt preachinge peter pricked heart trustinge vpon goodnesse godac iixxxvi thei saide furthermore ye men brothren shall doe repentance peter himselfe whiche wept dede bitterly cessed hope well although al thinges true yet name repentance farre learne scripture wyse taken wher comprehend faith vnder repentance disagreeth whiche paule saith actesact xxxxi testified iewes gentile repentance vnto god faith iesus christe reckeneth repentance faithe twoo dyuerse thinges true repentance stande without faithe thoughe bee seuered yet muste distinguished faithe wythout hope yet faithe hope dyuerse thynges repentance faith although hange together one perpetuall bonde yet thei rather would conioyned confounded truly ignorant vnder name repentance comprehended whole tourning vnto god whereof faithe leaste part meaninge comprehended shall moste easyly appeare force nature thereof shalbe declared name repentance hebrue deriued couerting returning greke chaunging mynde purpose thinge selfe dothe ill agree wyth either deriuations whereof summe departing oure selues shoulde turne vnto god puttinge olde mynde shoulde putte newe wherefore iudgmente repentance maie thus amysse defined true turninge oure lyfe vnto god proceedinge pure earnest feare god whiche consisteth mortifyeng fleshe olde man quyckening spirite thys sense taken preachinges wherin either prophetes olde time apostle afterwarde exhorted men time repentance thinge thei trauailed perswade confounded theyr synnes pricked wyth feare lordes iudgement shoulde fall downe humbled hym agaynste whome offended true amendement returne right waiemat iiii sa vii therfore wordes turned returne vnto lord repente penaunce amonge vsed wythoute difference one signification therefore also holy historie saith men repet lorde liued wantonely owne lustes regardinge begynne folowe hys worde ready captaines commaundement goe whether calleth themlu iiivii ro viiiii act xxvixx ihon paule vsed wordes bringe forthe frutes worthy repentance leade suche lyfe maye represent testifie suche amendement doinges go shall profitable playnely sette large definition haue made wherein cheefely three pointes considered fyrste wee call tourning life vnto god require transfourming onely outwarde woorkes also soule selfe whiche hathe put oldnesse beginneth bring forth frutes workes agreable renewingeze xv xxxi prophet goeth expresse commaundeth calleth repentance make newe heart therefore moses oftentimes meaning shewe israelite might repent rightly turned vnto ye lord teacheth yt done al heart wt al soule ner speaking see often repeted ye prophet naming ye circumcising ye heart shaketh away inward affection place whereby man maye better perceiue naturall propretie repentance fourthe chapter ieremeier iiiiiij thou returne israell saith lorde returne plowe vppe arable lande sowe vpon thornes circumcised lorde take away vncircumcised skinnes heartes se pronounceth shall nothinge preuaile taking vpon folowing righteousnesse vnlesse wickednesse first plucked bottome heartes moue throughly warneth thei haue doe wyth god whome nothing gotten dalying bicause hateth double heart therfore esaie laugheth scorne foolishe endeuoures hypocritesesa lxvij vi whiche dede busily go outward repentance ceremony meane tyme hadde care loose bundle wickednesse wherewith helde poore men fast tyed also well sheweth dueties vnfained repentance proprely standeth second point taught repentance proceedeth earnest feare god minde sinner inclined repentance must stirred vp thinking vpo iudgment god thought one throughly settled god wyll one daye goe vp hys iudgement seate require accompt saienges doinges suffer silly man rest take breathe one minute time continually stirreth vp thinke vpon newe trade life whereby may safely appeare iudgement therefore oftentimes scripture exhorteth repentanceie iiiiiii act xviixxx maketh mention iudgement iereme least peraduenture wrath go fyre none quench bycause naughtinesse workes paules sermon athenian wheras hetherto god hath borne time thys ignorance nowe geueth warning men al men euery may repent bycause hathe apointed daie wherein iudge worlde equitie many place sometime declareth punishmentes already extended god iudge sinner shoulde thynke wyth selues worse thinges hang ouer repent time haue example thereof xxix exodus bycause turning beginneth abhorring hatred synneii co viix therefore apostle maketh sorrowfulnesse suche accordinge god cause repentance calleth sorrowfulnesse accordinge god wee onely afraide punishment hate abhorre sinne self asmuche vnderstand displeaseth god maruel vnlesse sharply pricked slouthfulnesse oure flesh could corrected yea prickinges woulde suffice dulnesse slouthfulnesse therof vnlesse god stretching roddes pearce depely also obstinatie whiche muste beaten downe beetle therefore peruersenesse nature enforceth god seueritie vseth threatning bicause shoulde vaine call v alluringly faire speache wee lye slepe recite testimony commonly offer selues founde feare god manner also beginnyng repentance though man life absolutely furnished pointes vertues applied worshipping god may deede praysed world heauen shalbe mere abhomination asmuche chiefe parte righteousnesse geue god due right honour wherof wickedly robbed bende selues yeld v subiect gouernement thirdly remaineth declare meant say repetance consisteth two partes say mortifiyng flesh quickenyng spirit prophetes plainly expresse although somwhat simply grosly accordyng capacitie carnal peopleps xxxiiiixv esa ixvi say cesse euel goodnesse againe washed cleane take away ye euel workes mine eye cesse doe peruersly learne well seke iudgement help oppressed c call men away fro wickednesse require death whole flesh stuffed full wickednesse peruersnesse deede vneasy hard thing put selues depart fro natural dispositio neyther ca thought flesh throughly dead vnlesse al haue selues abolished asmuch al affectio flesh enemie godro viiiiiii first entree obeying lawe forsaking owne nature afterward thei expresse renewyng frutes folow therof righteousnesse iudgemet mercie enough dueties rightly vnlesse minde self heart haue first put affection righteousnesse iudgement mercie done whe spirit god hath soked new thoughtes affection soules first washed holynesse may rightly compted newe truely naturally turned away fro god vnlesse ye forsaking selues goe neuer go toward right therfore oft comaunded put olde man forsake world flesh bidde lustes farewel renewed spirit minde morouer name mortificatio doth put v minde hard forget former nature bicause therby gather otherwise framed feare god learne principle godlinesse violently slaine worde spirit brought nought euen though god pronounce haue v accompted amonge child needeth death commune nature thinges happen vnto v partaking christ yf doe truely communicate death power old man crucifiedro vivi body sinne dieth corruption former nature maye liue partaker resurrection raised vp newnesse life yt maye agree righteousnesse god one worde expoud repentance regeneration hath marke wherunto directed yt image god adam offence fowly defaced maner vitterly blotted may renewed v apostle teachethij cor xviii whe sayth representyng glory god vncouered face trans ormed image glorie glorieeph iiijxxiij spirit lord againe ye renewed spirit minde put new man whiche created accordyng god righteousnesse holinesse truth agayne placecol iijx puttyng new man whiche renewed knowledge image hym created therefore regeneration benefit christ restored righteousnesse godi cor vijxij fallen adam manner pleaseth lord wholly restore whome adopteth inheritance life restoryng fulfilled one moment one day one yere continuall yea sometimes slowe procedynges god taketh awaye corruption fleshe elect cleanseth filthinesse consecrateth temple renewyng sens true purenesse maye exercise themselues life repentance knowe warre hath ende death much greater lewdenesse filthy rayler apostata staphylus whiche foolishly sayth confound state present life heauenly glorieii cor iiiixii expounde paule image god holinesse true righteousnesse though thing defined seke whole fulnesse perfection yet denie place encreasces saye howe nere man approcheth likenesse god much image god shineth faithful may atteyne hereunto god assigneth race repentance wherin runne life long child god therfore deliuered regeneratio bondage sinne hauing obteined ful possessio libertie thei fele trouble flesh yt thei shold haue remayning continual matter stryfe wherwith maye exercised exercised also maye better learne owne weakenesse point wryters sound iudgement agre together ther remaineth regenerate feding euel whense continually spryng desire allure stirre sinne cofesse also holy one still holden entangled disease lusting withstand somtime tickled stirred either lust couetousnesse ambition vice neither needefull labour muche searchyng old writer haue thought herein asmuche augustine may sufficient paragraph whiche hath faithfully great diligence gathered al iudgemetes therfore let reader gather certaintie shall desire learne opinion antiquitie may seme differece betwene v graunteth faithfull long dwell mortal body holden bound lustes lust yet dareth call disease sinne beyng cotent expresse name weakenesse teacheth becometh sinne either worke consent added conceite receiuyng yeldeth first desire accompt sinne tickled desire al law god yea affirme corruption engendreth desire v sinne teach therfore alway sinne holy one vntil vnclothed ye mortall body bycause remaineth fleshe peruersnesse lustyng fighteth vprightnesse yet doth alway forbeare vse name sinne serm da uerbis ap sayth paule calleth name sinne whense spryng sinnes vnto fleshly concupiscence asmuch perteyneth holy one loseth kingdome earth perisheth heauen wordes confesseth faithfull gilty sinne much subiect lustes fleshe sayd god purgeth church fro al sinne promiseth grace deliuerance baptismeephes vxxvi fulfilleth elect referre rather giltinesse sinne tha matter sinne god truely performeth regeneratyng kingdome sinne abolished holy ghost ministreth strength whereby get vpper hand conqueror battell cesseth reigne well themro vivi therfore say olde man crucified law sinne abolished child god yet remayne leauynges haue dominion humble knowledge conscience owne weakenesse confesse imputed weare affirme cometh passe mercie god holy one deliuered giltinesse whiche otherwise iustly reckened sinner gilty god sentence shall hard v cofirme asmuch euident testimony scripture vpo matter wold haue plaine paul crieth romanes chap viiro vijvi first haue place shewed augustine proueth strong reason paule speaketh persone regenerate speake vseth wordes euell sinne thei wil speake v may cauil word whoe denie striuing lawe god euell whoe denie withstanding iustice sinne finally whoe w graunt yt fault spiritual miserie al thinges reported disease paule againe haue assured demonstration law whiche whole question may easily discussed comaunded loue god heart al soule al power sithe al partes soule ought occupied ye loue god certaine satisfie comaundement conceiue heart desire neuer litle suffer thought entre minde maye withdraw loue god vanitie power ye soule affected sodeine motion coprehend wit coceyue minde therfore open way vaine corrupt thoughtes entre shew euen much voide loue god wherfore confesseth lustes flesh sinnes disease lusting call fedyng well spryng sinne muste needes denie transgression lawe sinne man thinke absurditie desire wherwith man naturally moued affection vniuersally condened wheras put man god author nature answer doe condemne desire god hath engrauen minde man firste creation rooted without destroyeng nature man outragious vnbridled motion fight ordinance god nowe sithe reason peruersnesse nature power infected corrupted doynges appereth continuall disorder intemperance bicause desire seuered fro intemperance therefore say corrupt like haue whole summe fewer wordes teache desire men euell accuse gilty sinne naturall inordinate call inordinate bycause pure cleane thynge come corrupte vncleane nature ad boni augustine dothe much varie doctrine appereth shewe somwhat much feareth enuie pelagians labored bryng sometime forbeareth vse name sinne yet writeth law sinne still remaynyng holy one onely giltinesse taken awaye plainely sheweth doth much disagree meanyng alleage sentence wherby shal better appere thought second boke iulian law sinne released spiritual regeneration abideth mortal flesh released herein bicause giltnesse taken away sacrament whereby faithfull regenerate abideth bycause worketh desire agaynst whiche faythfull doe fight agayne therfore law sinne also membres great apostle released baptisme ended agayne lawe sinne yet remainyng giltinesse baptisme discharged ambrose called wickednesse bicause wickednesse ye flesh lust spirit againe sinne dead respect giltinesse wherin helde v euen beyng dead still rebelleth til healed perfection burial yet playner v boke blindenesse heart bothe sinne whereby menne beleueth god also punishment sinne whereby proude heart chastised worthy correction cause sinne thyng committed errour blinde heart lust flesh agaynste whiche good spirit lusteth bothe sinne bycause disobedience agaynst gouernement minde also punishment sinne bycause geuen recompense deseruynges disobedient cause sinne manne consenteth defection manne borne infection wythout anye doubtefull speache calleth sinne bycause errour one ouerthrowe truth cofirmed lesse feared sclaunderours reportes xlj homelie vpo iohn tlesse speaketh according ye true meaning mind saythro vixij ye flesh thou serue law sinne yt whiche apostle sayth let sinne reigne mortal bodie obey desire therof sayth let let reigne long thou liuest sinne must needes thy mebres least let reigne taken let done whiche commaundeth defend luste sinne wont obiecte sayeng iamesiac lust hath conceiued bryngeth forth sinne easily confuted vnlesse thinke speaketh ill workes actuall sinnes euell self shall accompted sinne calleth mischeuous deedes wicked offense ofsprynges sinne geueth vnto name sinnne doth folow thereof luste euell thyng damnable god certaine anabaptistes age deuise wote phre tike intemperance stede spirituall regeneration sayeng child god restored state innocecie ought carefull bridlyng luste fleshe spirit folowed guide vnder whose guidyng neuer goe way incredible man minde could fall great madnesse vnlesse opely proudely babble abrode doctrine truely monstruous mete suche suffer punishment suche blasphemous boldnesse haue persuaded minde turne truth god lie shal al choise honestie dishonestie righte wronge good euell vertue vice taken awaye suche difference saye cometh cursednesse olde adam whiche exempted christe nowe shalbe difference betwene fornication chastitie playne dealyng sutteltie truthe lyeng iustice extortion take awaye vayne feare saye spirit commaund thee euell thyng thou boldly without feare yelde thee guidynge thereof whoe choose astonished monstruous thinges yet common learnyng amonge whiche blynded wyth madnesse lustes haue put common reason christ beseche doe frame vnto v spirite doe belche reknowledge one christ spirit whome prophetes haue commended gospell geuen v doth preache whome heare thyng spirit patrone manslaughter whoredom dro kennesse pride cotentio couetousnesse gutle author loue chastitie sobrietie modestie peace teperace truth giddy spirit runneth hedlong without consideration right wrong ful wisedome vnderstanding discerneth rightly betwene iust vniust stirreth vnto dissolute vnbridled licentiousnesse maketh difference betwene lawefull vnlawfull teacheth kepe measure temperance doe labour longer confutynge beastly rage christian spirit lord troublesome phantasie whiche eyther themselues haue brought forth dreame haue receyued beyng forged reuerently seeke knoweledge scripture two thynges taught hym first geuen v vnto sanctificatio might bryng v obedience god wil beyng purged vncleannesse defilinges whiche obedience stand vnlesse lustes tamed subdued wherunto men would geue bridle libertie secondly taught cleansed sanctification still besieged many vice much weakenesse longe enclosed burden bodye whereby cometh passe beyng farre distant perfection haue neede alwaye encrease somewhat beyng entagled vice haue neede dayly wrastle whereupon also foloweth shakynge slouth carelesnesse muste watche heedeful mindes compassed vnware snare fleshe unlesse paraduenture thinke haue proceded apostleii cor xiixv ro viivi yet weried angel satan strength might made perfecte weakenesse whiche vnfaynedlye represent fleshe diuision flesh spirit whereas apostle describynge repentance reckeneth seuen eyther cause effectes partes thereofi vii doth good cause endeuour carefullnesse excusyng indignation feare desire zele punishement neyther ought seme absurditie dare certainely determine whether ought compted cause effectes may defended disputation maye bee also called affection ioyned wyth repentance bicause leauynge question maye vnderstande paule meaneth shalbe content simple declaration sayth therefore heauinesse whiche accordynge god ariseth carefulnesse touched earnest felynge displeasure bycause hath sinned agaynst god therewithall stirred vp diligence heedefulnesse winde himselfe clerely snare deuell take better heede snare fall gouernance holy ghost oppressed wyth securitie nexte excusyng whiche place signifieth defense whereby sinner escape iudgement god eyther dothe denye hath offended diminisheth hainousnesse faulte purgation whiche standeth rather crauyng pardon defense cause lyke child reprobate acknowledge confesse faultes doe yet vse entreatynge maye take place protest meanes haue cast awaye reuerence owe parentes finally excuse goe proue themselues righteous innocent maye obteyne pardon foloweth indignation wherby sinner fretteth inwardly hymselfe quareleth hymselfe angry hymselfe recordeth owne peruersnesse owne vnthankfulnesse god name feare meaneth tremblynge stryken mindes ofte thynke bothe haue deserued howe horrible seueritie god wrathe agaynste sinner muste needes vexed wyth maruellous vnquietnesse whiche bothe instructeth v humilitie maketh v ware agaynst time come nowe yf feare doe sprynge carefulnesse whereof spoken see lynkyng hange together semeth hath vsed worde desire diligence dutie redy cherefulnesse obeye whereunto acknowledgynge owne faultes ought chiefely prouoke v thereunto also belongeth zele ioyneth immediatly next vnto signifieth feruentnesse wherwith kindled spurred forwarde pryckyng thoughtes haue done whether throwen selfe hedlonge yf mercie god help last punishment rigorous selues streightlier examine owne sinnes much ye ought trust god fauorable merciful vnto v truely possible soule beyng striken horrour iudgement god muste needes execution punishyng self truely godly ho e punishmetes shame confusion mourning lothyng theselues affection spring earnest acknowleging sinnes let v remeber measure kepte sorrow swallow v vp bicause nothing redily happeneth fearefull conscience fallyng despeire also yt crafty meane euer sata findeth ouerthrowe dreade god drowneth gulfe sorrowe maye neuer rise vp againe truely feare great endeth humilitie departeth hope pardon alwaye apostle teacheth sinner must bewareheb xijii moue himselfe lothyng himselfe despeire oppressed great feare doe flee awaye god whyche calleth v repentance sermone cant upon whiche point lesson bernarde profitable sorrowe sinnes necessarie yf bee cont nuall counsell sometime returne faute g nous paynefull remembrance owne wayes vp playne grounde cherefull remembrance benefites god let v mingle honye worm wood holsome tternesse may bring v health shalbe dronke tempered w swetenesse ye thinke selues humilitie thinke also lord goodnesse may also perceiued frutes repentance euen duty godlinesse toward god charitie toward therewithall holinesse purenesse life finally earnestly man examineth life rule god law much surer token sheweth repetance therfore holy ghost oftentimes exhorteth v repentance calleth v sometime commaundementes lawe sometime duty secod table albeit place hath condemned vncleannesse fountayne heart descende h afterwarde outwarde testimony doe set true repentance whiche thynge hereafter set reader eye table description christian lyfe gather testimony prophetes wherein partely scorne folly goe appease god ceremony shewe mere mockery partely doe teache outwarde vpryghtnesse lyfe principall part repentance bycause god loketh vpo heart euer euen meanely exercised scripture shall perceiue without ma puttyng mindeioel haue god labour vayne vnlesse beginne inward affectio heart place ioel shall litle helpe vnderstandinge resteioel ijxiij sayth teare heartes garmets also pointes expressed wordes iamesiac iiijviij ye wicked doer cleanse handes ye double men purge heartes deede addition ioyned ye first part shewed fountayne beginning muste wipe awaye secret filthynesse may altar set vp god heart biside also certaine outward exercise whiche vse priuately remedy huble selues tame flesh publikely declaration repentance procede fro punishment whiche paule speaketh cor vijxi propreties afflicted minde lothesomnesse mournyng weping flie gorgeousnesse al trimmyng forsake al delites feleth great euell rebellion fleshe seketh al remedy bridle moreouer wel bethinketh greuous thing haue offended iustice god rest vntill haue owne humilitie geuen glorie god exercise olde writer oftentimes rehearse speake frutes repentance albeit doe place whole force repetance yet reader shall pardo speake thinke semeth vnto stand much vpon man wisely weye truste agree haue two wayes gone beyond measure muche enforced inmesurable commendation aduaunced bodyly discipline deede obteyned people earnestly embrace manner darkened whiche ought haue ben much greater importance secondely geuing punishmentes somewhat rigorous ecclesiasticall mildenesse maye beare shal haue occasion shew place bicause many heare wepyng fastynge ash spoken ofioel ijxij bothe often place specially ioel measure chiefe part repentance fastyng wepyng therefore theyr errour taken awaye spoken turnyng whole heart lord cuttyng heartes garmentes proprely belonging repetance weping fastyng ioyned continuall necessary effectes therof spoken respect speciall circumstance bicause prophecied haged ouer iewes greuous destruction therefore counselleth preuent wrath god repenting also vtteryng token sorrow man standyng arrayned vseth humbly abace hymself ouergrowen bearde vncombed heare blacke apparel moue iudge pitie behoued stode accused iudgement seate god piteous array besech extend rigour although ash sackcloth paraduenture fitly agree time yet certaine wepyng fastyng conuenient good vse amonge v oft lorde semeth threaten v plague calamitie maketh danger appere doth certaine maner geue warning prepared armed reuenge therfore prophet wel exhorted contreemen wepyng fasting sorrowful manner accused menne whose offence sayd litle examination euen pastor church doe ill daye see ruine hangyng ouer neckes people woulde crye vpon make hast fasting weping thei wold greater inwarde care diligence alwaye enforce whiche principal point must cut heartes garmentes doubt fastyng alway ioyned repentance apointed peculiarly time miserable plague therefore christ ioyneth waylingmatt ixxv acquiteth apostle neede thereof vntill time beyng spoyled presence tormented grefe speake solene fasting priuate life godly ought tepered honest sparyng sobrietie whole course thereof may appere certaine kinde fasting bicause matter shalbe declared againe place shall entreate discipline church therefore doe sclenderly touche one thyng adde waye name repe tance applied outward profession vnproprely turned naturall meanynge whiche haue aboue set forth muche turnyng vnto god confession fault besechyng god charge peyne giltinesse penance ash sackcloth nothing elsmatt xixxi luc xxiij vtter displeasednesse god angry v greuous offense publike kinne confession whereby condemning selues angeles world preuet iudgement god1 cor xi iij paule rebukyng slouthfulnesse tenderly beare faultes sayth yf iudge selues shoulde iudged god alwaye necessarie make men openly counsell witness repentance confesse priuately god part true repentance whiche omitted nothing vnreasonable loke haue god pardon v sinnes whiche flatter selues hide hipocrisye least bryng light behoueth v confesse sinnes whiche dayely co mit greuous offense ought drawe v cal agayne remembrance thynges seme longe agoe buried whiche lesson dauid geueth v exampleps livij beyng touched shame newly committed fault examineth euen time mother wombe confesseth euen corrupted infected filthinesse fleshe doeth diminish haynousnesse fault many hide themselues multitude seke escape punishment wrappyng dauid doth far otherwise simple plainesse enforceth fault sayeng beyng corrupt fro first infancie hath cessed heape euels vpon euels also place likewise examineth passed lifeps xxvix yt craueth mercie god yt sinnes youth truely shal proue drowsinesse shaken away fro v gronyng vnder burden bewayling euels aske reli se god moreouer noted repentance co mauded cotinually applie differeth fro repetance lifteth vp death either haue filthily fallen vnbridled licentiousnesse haue throwen forth themselues sinne certaine manner rebellion reuoltyng haue shaken yoke god scripture oftetimes exhorteth repe tance meaneth therby passage rising againe fro death life reherseth people penaunce meaneth turned fro idolatrie grol e offence like maner paul threateneth mourning vnto sinner haue done penance wantonnesse cor xij fornication vnchastitie differece diligently marked least heare yt ar called penace tha carelesse assuredness shuld crepe vpo v though mortifieng fleshe belog vnto v care wherof corrupt desire yt alway tickle v vice comonly budde vp v suffer v release therfore speciall repentance required deuell hath violetly carried away fro feare god fast bound danable snare taketh away ordinary repetance corruptnesse nature copelleth v applie throughout ye whole course life true euidently certaine summe gospel conteined two principall pointes repentance forgeuenesse sinnes doe see lord doth therefore freely iustifie may also sanctification spirit restore true righteousnessema xix mat iijij iohn angel sent face christ prepare wayes preached repent ye kyngdome heauen come nere hande callyng repentance dyd put minde acknowlege themselues sinner damnable lord might heartes desire mortif eng fleshe newe regeneration spirit tellyng kingdome god called faith kingdome god whiche taught hand meant necessarie borne againe thei wyll entre kingdome god forgeuenesse sinnes preached men ar taught christ made redemptionro ixxi righteousnesse saluatio life whose name freely accompted righteous innocent sight god whereas bothe grace receiued fayth haue place declared yet bicause goodnesse god whereby sinnes forgeuen profe obiect fayth therefore shalbe good diligently distinguished repentance hatred sinne beginnyng repentace openeth v first entrie vnto christ sheweth none miserable afflicted sinnersesa lx mat xiv luc iiiixviij matt ixxxii act iiixxvi v xxxi grone labour loden hungry
