iudgement righteousnesse bycause saluation come nere hand agayne shall come sion redemer iacob repet sinnes againe seke lord may found cal vpon nere let wicked leue way wickednesse thoughtes turned lordact iixxxviii shall haue mercie againe turne ye repent sinnes may done away yet noted codition annexed though repentance fundatio deserue pardo rather bicause lord hath determined haue mercie vpo men ende yt shuld repet teacheth men whether shall trauaile obteine grace therfore long shall dwell pryson body must continually wrastle vice corrupt flesh yea naturall soule paragraph plato sayth certayne place life phylosopher meditation death may truely say life christian perpetuall studie exercise mortifieng fleshe till beyng vtterly slayue spirit god get dominion v therefore thinke hath much profited hath learned much mislyke sticke faste hat myre goe rather haste long toward god graffed death life christ studie vpon continuall repentance truely otherwise haue naturall hatred sinne man euer hated sinne vnlesse first loue righteousnesse doctrine simple thought beste agree th truthe scripture nowe repentance singular gift god thinke wel knowen doctrine aboue taught neede repete long discourse proue agayneact xixviii therfore church prayseth hath admiratio benefit god hath geuen gentile repentance vnto saluationi tim ijxiv paule commaundyng timothee patiet milde toward vnbeleuers sayth time god geue repentance maye repent snare deuel god deede affirmeth willeth conuersion al directeth exhortation generally men effectual workyng therof hangeth vpon spirit regeneration bicause easy create v men owne power put better natureeph ijx therfore whole course regeneration without cause called worke god created good workes hath prepared walke soeuer lordes deliuer death quickeneth spirit regeneration repentance properly cause saluation bycause alredy seen vnseparable fro fayth mercie godesa lixxx sithe esaye testifieth redemer come iacob returned wickednesse truely standeth stedfastly determined euer liueth feare god spirite hath wrought vnto saluation manesa lxiijxvij therfore esaie faithful complaine lament forsaken god recken token beyng reprobate heartes hardened god apostle also meanyng exclude apostataes hope saluationheb vivi apointeth reason impossible renewed vnto repentance bicause god renewyng wil haue perish sheweth toke fatherly fauour maner draweth vnto beames cherefull mery contenace side hardenyng thundereth agaynst reprobate whose wickednesse vnpardonable whiche kinde vengeance apostle threateneth wilfull apostataeshebr xxxix whiche depart faith gospell make scorne god reprochefully despise grace defile treade vnder feete bloud christ yea much crucifie agayne doth fondly rigorous men would haue cut hope pardon wilfull sinnes teacheth apostasie vnworthy excuse maruell god doth punish contempt full sacrilege vnappeasable rigour sayth yt impossiblehebr viiiij haue one ben enlightened haue tasted heauenly gift haue ben made partaker holy ghost haue tasted good word god power world come yf fall shuld renewed repetance crucifiyng againe newe makyng scorne sonne god againe placeheb xxxv sayth willingly sinne knowledge truth receyued remayneth sacrifice sinnes certayne dreadfull expectation iudgement c also place wrog vnderstandyng wherof nouatians old time haue gathered matter play mad men whose rigorousnesse certaine good beyng offended beleued counterfait epistle apostle name whiche yet partes doth truely fauour apostolike spirite bycause contend none allowe easy shewe sentence nothing mainteine errour firste necessarie apostle agree maister whiche affirmeth sinne blasphemie shal forgeue except sinne agaynst holy ghost forgeuen neyther world world come certaine saye apostle contented exception vnlesse make aduersarie grace christ whereupon foloweth pardon denied special offense one whiche procedyng desperate rage ascribed weakenesse openly sheweth man possessed deuell discusse behoueth enquire horrible offense shall haue forgeuenesse whereas augustine one place defineth obstinate stifnesse euen vnto death despeire pardon doth well agree wordes christ tha shall forgeuen world eyther spoken vaine maye comitted life augustine definition true committed vnlesse continue euen vnto death wheras saye sinneth holy ghost enuieth grace bestowed vpon brother see fro whense fetched let v bring true definitio beyng one proued sure testimony shall easily sel e ouerthrowe reste saye therefore sinne agaynst holy ghost set purpose resist truthe god brightnesse wherof daseled pretend ignorance whiche ende re stmat x xxxij marc iijxxix lu xijx christe meanynge expounde whiche sayd immediatly addeth speaketh worde agaynst sonne man shalbe forgeue blasphemeth agaynst holy ghost shal forgeuen matthew blasphemie holy spirit putteth spirit blasphemie speake reproche sonne also spoken agaynst holy ghost stumble vnware truthe god knowyng ignorantly speake euell christ hauyng yet minde would extinguish truth god disclosed vnto one one worde offend whome knowen lordes anoynted men sinne agaynst father sonne many day hatefully detest doctrine gospell whiche know doctrine gospell would redy worship heart thei whose conscience conuinced worde god whiche forfake fight agaynst yet cesse fight agaynst sayd blaspheme holy ghost asmuch wrastle enlightening work holy ghost many iewes whiche could resist spirit spake stephenact vix yet endeuored resist doubt many carried vnto zele lawe appereth malicious wickednesse dyd rage agaynst god himselfe saye agaynst doctrine whiche ignoraunt god phariseesmatt ix iiij xii lord inueyeth ouerthrow power ye holy ghost defamed name beelzebub therfore spirit blasphemie man boldnesse purpose leapeth forth reproche name god paule signifieth whe saythi tim ixiii obteined mercie bicause ig oratly comitted thinges vnbelefe whiche otherwise ben vnworthy god fauour ignorace ioyned vnbelefe cause obteined pardo therupo foloweth yt place pardon knowlege ioyned vnbelefe thou marke wel thou shalt perceiue apostle speaketh one particular fal vniuersal departyng whereby reprobate forsake saluation maruel iohn canonical epistle affirmeth haue ben elect fro went outii ih ixix fele god vnappeasable directeth speache imagined might urue christian religion although one departed fro calling false pestilent opinion sayth whiche true way returne open comunion christ wittingly willingly haue cast awaye cast away dissolute licentiousnesse lyfe transgresse word lord thei set purpose cast away whole doctrine therfore deceit wordes fallyng sinning bicause nouatians expound falling man beyng taught law lord yt ought steale comit fornication absteineth stealing fornication cotrarywise affirme yt secret comparison contrary wherein ought repeted althinges cotrarie first spoke yt expressed particular fault whole turning away fro god may cal apostasie whole therfore saythhebr viiiij haue fallen haue one ben enlightened haue tasted heauely gift ben made partaker holy ghost also tasted good worde god power world come vnderstanded yt aduised vngodlinesse haue choked ye light ye holy spirit haue spit agayne tast heauenly gift haue enstraged themselues sanctificatio holy ghost haue troden vnder foote word god power world come expresse aduised purpose wickednesse place afterwarde addeth worde name eb x xvi wilfully sayth left sacrifice sinne willingly knowlege truthe receiued doth denie christ continual sacrifice purge iniquity holy one expresly crieth almost ye whole epistle declareth priesthode christ sayth remaineth whe one forsaken forsaken truth gospell set purpose renounced whereas thinke harde far tender merciefulnesse god put awaye flee beseching lord mercie easily answered doth say pardon denied turne lord vtterly denieth rise vnto repentance bycause iuste iudgement god striken eternall blindnesse vnthankefulnesse maketh nothyng contrarie afterward applieth purpose example esau whiche vaine attempted howling wepyng recouer right firste begotten doth threatenyng prophet crie wil hearezach vij xiij phrase speache meante neyther true conuersion callyng vpon god carefulnesse wicked wherewith beyng boud compelled extremitie loke vnto carelesly neglected good thing lordes helpe doe muche call vpon mourne taken therefore prophet meaneth nothing el cryeng apostle nothing el weping horrible torment desperation fretteth vexeth wicked good marke diligently el god disagree himselfeze xviij xxi crieth prophet wil merciefull sone sinner turneth haue alredy sayd certayne minde man turned better god grace preuentyng also promise concernyng callynge vpon neuer deceyue blinde torment wherwith reprobate diuersly drawen see muste needes seeke god may finde remedie euels yet flee presence vnproperly called conuersion prayer question moued whereas apostle denieth god appeased fained repentancei reg xxviiixxix achab obteined pardon turned awaye punishment pronounced vpon yet appereth reste course life haue ben onely striken amased sodeine feare deede put sacke cloth scattered ash vpon laye vpon ground testified hubled god enough cut garmentes heart remayned thicke swollen malice yet see god turned mercy answere somtimes hypocrite spared time yet euer wrath god lyeth vpo done much sake common example whereas achab punishment mitigate vnto profit got therby fele liue earth therefore curse god although hidden yet faste abidyng place house went eternall destruction seene esaugen xxvi xviii though repulse yet temporall blessyng graunted wepyng bycause spiritual inheritance oracle god could rest one brother iacob chosen esau refused puttyng awaye exclude mercie god comfort left beastly man fat fatte earth deaw heauen sayd euen nowe ought referred example shoulde learne cherefully applie mindes endeuours repentace bycause doubted truely hartily turned god ready forgeue v whose mercifulnesse extendeth selfe euen vnworthy longe shewe anye grefe al therwithal also taught terrible iudgemet prepared obstinate whiche make sport lesse shamelesse face iron heart despise set nought threatenings god manner oftetimes reached hand childre israel releue misery although cry counterfait heart doble false psalme coplaynethps lxxvi xxxvi returned nature minded frendly gentle dealing bryng earnest conuersion make vnexcusable yet releasing punishmentes time doth binde perpetual law therby rather riseth somtimes rigorously hypocrite doubleth peines yt therby may appere much fayning displeaseth haue sayd sheweth example redinesse geue pardon godly may encouraged amedement life pride maye greuously condemned stubbornly kick pricke fourth chapter pthat sophisters babble scholes penance far purenesse gospell entreated confession satisfaction nowe come discusse thynges schole sophisters haue taught repetace firste gregory rehersed lib dist ca ij ambr reser illie r dist de p ni et c poeni priore august reser ca dist c poe post ambr resert dist poenit c vera poeni wil run ouer wordes may bycause minde goe least boke labour draw short abridgment growe huge greatnesse sophisters haue entagled many volume beyng matter otherwise hard shal hardly finde get one fal dregges first definyng shewe yt neuer vnderstode repentace thei take hold certaine sayenges olde writer nothing al expresse ye nature repentance repent wepe sinnes passed commit sinnes wept agayne lament euels passed commit agayne euels lamented agayne certaine sorowful reuege punishing sory haue committed againe sorrow heart bitternesse soule euels man hath comitted hath consented graunt thinges well sayde father contentious man might easily enough denie yet spoken entent describe repentance exhort wrote fal againe saine offense whiche ben drawen liste turne suche title commendation definition maye also adioyned rightfully chrysostome repentance medicine destroyeth sinne gift geue heauen maruellous vertue grace surmounting force law yea doctrine thei afterward teache somwhat worse definition sticke earnestly outward exercise manne gather nothyng el infinite volume repentance discipline rigorousnesse serueth partly tame fleshe partly chastise punish vice thei kepe maruellous silence inward renewing minde draweth correction life ther deede muche talke among contritio attrition thei tormet soules many doubtes thruste muche troble carefulnesse thei seeme haue throughly wounded heartes thei heale ye bitternesse light sprinkling ceremony lib sen ca e po distri c psecta poenitentia whe thei haue thus curiously defined repentance thei diuide contrition hearte confession mouthe satisfaction worke logically thei defined although thei wolde seeme haue wasted age framinge syllogismes man go proue definition kinde argument force among logician man may wepe sinnes passed committ wept may bewaile euels passed commit bewailed maye punishe himselfe sory haue committed c although confesse mouth howe maintaine diuision true penitent man confesse repentance may without confessio thei answer diuision referred repentance respect sacrament meant whole perfection repentance whiche thei comprehend definition ther cause blame let lay fault themselues make purer plainer definition truely according grossnesse thing disputed referre thing definition stay grounde whole disputation admit masterlike licence let v particularly consider partes ordre wheras negligently leape ouer trifle thynges thei wyth greate grauitie countenance publish misteries vnwittingly neither painefull confute thei thinke selues haue depely suttlely disputed woulde think conscience wery reader trifle without profit truely easy know question thei moue tosse wherewith thei miserably encomber themselues prate thinges thei know example whether repentance sinne pleaseth god whe obstinacie endureth againe whether punishmentes laied vpon man god auaile satisfaction againe whether repentance maye oftentimes reiterate deadly sinnes wher thei fowly wickedly define penance dayly done veniall sinnes likewise thei much torment themselues grosse erroure vpon saieng hierome repentance second bourde shipperack wherin thei shewe thei neuer waked brutish dulnesse feele much farr thousandth part faultes wold reader shold note quarel shadow asse earnest mater al entreated saie forgeuenesse sinnes wheras thei require three thing repentance contrition heart confession mouth satisfaction worke thei therwithal teache three thinges necessarie obteining forgeuenes sinnes behoue v know thing oure religion truely behoueth v moste meane vnderstand knowe well meane lawe vpon condition easinesse hardnesse forgeuenesse sinnes obtained knowledge stande plaine certaine conscience haue rest peace god confidence assurednesse continually trembleth wauereth troubled tormented vexed horriblye dreadeth hateth fleeth sight god forgeuenesse synnes hange vpon condition whiche thei binde nothing miserable nothinge lamentable case make contrition firste parte obteining pardon require due contrition saie perfect full meane time thei determine man may assured hathe full measure perfectly perfourmed contrition truely graunt euery man ought diligently earnestly enforce hymselfe bitterly weping synnes whett himselfe lothing hatred sorrowe repented breedeth repentance vnto saluation suche bitternesse sorrowe requyred maie proportionally aunswer greatnesse fault suche maye balaunce counterpaise trust pardon pure conscience maruelously tormented troubled see selues chaunged due contrition sinnes doe atteine measure due determine selues haue duely perfourmed muche duely oughte saie muste muche lyeth v come still pointe howe dare manne assure himselfe hath employed force bewaile synnes conscience hauinge longe wrastled selues longe exercised battailes doe length finde heauen reste yet somewhat ease selues thei enforce selues sorrowe wringe teares make perfect contrition yf saie slaundre let come forthe shewe one man suche doctrine contrition hathe eyther ben driuen despeire hath set defense counterfaiting sorrowe steede true sorrowe againste iudgemente god haue also oure selues saide one place forgeuenesse synnes neuer commeth without repentance bycause none afflicted wounded conscience synnes syncerely call vpon mercie god haue therewithall saide repentance cause forgeuenesse sinnes tormentes soules whiche saie muste perfourmed duetie haue take awaie haue taught sinner loke vpon owne contrition owne teares fasten bothe eye vpon onely mercie godmat xixviij esa lxi luc iiiixviii haue onely putte minde christ called laboring loden sent publish glad tidinges poore heale contrite heart preache remission captiues deliuer prisoner comforte mourne whiche shold excluded ye pharises filled righteousnesse doe acknowledge owne pouertie also despisers carelesse god wrath seke remedy euels suche doe laboure loden contrite hearte bounde captiue greate difference betweene teaching man deserue forgeuenesse sinnes due full contrition whiche sinner neuer perfourme instructing hunger thirste mercie god acknowledging hys owne miserie owne vnquietnesse wearinesse captiuitie maie shewed ought seeke releefe rest libertie finally maie taught humbling himselfe geue glorie god concerning confession ther hath alwaie great strife betwene canonistes scholediuines one sorte affyrme confession commaunded special commaundement god sorte denie saie commaunded onely ecclesiasticall constitution contention hathe appeared notable shamlessnesse diuines haue corrupted violently wrasted many place scripture thei alleaged purpose thei sawe yt thei coulde obteine required thei woulde thought suttle rest escaped away shifte confession came lawe god respect substance butte afterwarde receiued frome lawe positiue euen foolishest sorte amonge laweyers doe saie citation came law god bicause said adam wher arte thou likwise exceptionsgen bicause adam aunswered waie exception saieng wife thou gauest c bothe citation exception receiued forme geuen ciuile law lette v see argumentes thei proue thys confession either formed unfourmed commaundement god lorde saie thei sent leprous men preestesmatt v luc vx deu xixiviii sente confession whoe euer hearde spoken leuiticall preestes appointed heare confession therfore thei flee allegory saie commaunded lawe moses preestes shoulde discerne betwene leprosie leprosie sinne spirituall leprosie therfore preestes office pronounce vpon aunswer aske waie place make iudges ye spiritual leprosie thei draw knoweledge natural fleshely leprosie forsoothe mocke scripture lawe geueth leuiticall preestes knowledge leprosie therefore let v take yt vpon v sinne spirituall leprosie therefore lette v also bee examiner sinne nowe aunswere sithe preestehoode remoued necessarie law remoued alsoheb vii x al presthodes remoued christe fulfilled ended therefore onely al right honoure preesthoode also remoued thei loue wel folow allegory let set christ preest heape vpon iudgement seate free iurisdiction al thing easily content suffer moreouer allegorie vnfitt setteth among ceremony lawe whiche mearly politike christe send leprous menne preestes preestes shoulde cauill hee breake lawe commaunded man healed leprosie bee shewed preeste purged offering sacrifice therefore commaunded leprous men cleansed whiche belonged law goe saith shewe selues preeste offer gifte moses hathe commaunded lawe shoulde witnesse vnto truely miracle shold haue ben witnes vnto thei pronounced leprous nowe pronounce healed thei whether thei compelled become witness christes miracle christ leaueth miracle examinedmat xxuii xiiii matt xxviiii thei canne denie bicause thei still dallie therfore worke witnesse vnto place gospell shalbe preached worlde witnesse al nation ye shalbe ledde kinges gouernours witnesse iudgemen e god thei maie strongly conuinced hom de muli hananaea thei rather folow chrysostome also teacheth christe iewes sake shoulde accompted breaker ye law albeit cleare matter ashamed alleage wittnesse man wheras christ pronounceth leaueth righte lawe whole preestes professed enemy gospell whiche alway bent carpe mouth ben stopped wherfore popish sacrificeng preestes maie still keepe possession let openly take partes must necessitie restrained force yt speake ill christe nothing belongeth trewe minister thei bring second argument fountaine allegorie though allegory greate force confyrme doctrine lette force proue make fairer shewe syde thei thei sayihou xixliii lorde commaunded disciple lazarus raised vp thei shold vnbinde losse hys bondes first lie wher reade thay ye lorde saide disciple muche likely saide iewes yt stoode ye miracle might made euident without suspition fraud power appeare greater without touching onely worde raised vp deade men thus expounde lorde take awaie wrongfull opinion iewes willed rolle awaie stone fe le stinke beholde assured token death see rising onely power worde first feele liuing er contra iudes gentile haer ti iudgement chrysostome let v graunt yt spoken disciple wil thei get therby lord gaue apostle power loose much fitly handesomely might thinges applied waie allegorie saie signe ye lord meanie instruct faithful loose yt raised vp yt sholde cal remembrance sinnes yt forgotten thei shold condemne sinner acquited thei sholde reproche men thinges forgeuen thei shoulde rigorous punish lightly offended wher mercifull easily entreated spare truely nothing ought moue v readinesse forgeue exaumple ye iudge threatneth wyll vnappeasable rigorous vngentle nowe let goe boaste allegory nowe thei ioyne nere hande v thei fight thei thinke open sentence thei came ihons baptisme confesse sinnes iames willeth confesse oure sinnes one maruell wolde baptised confesse sinnes saide ihon preached baptisme repentance baptised water vnto repentance shold haue baptized confessed themselues sinner baptisme token forgeuenesse sinnes shold admitted token sinner thei acknowledg themselues therfore thei confessed sinnes thei might baptised without cause doth iames bidde v confesse one thei marke foloweth nexte thei would vnderstande also maketh little confesse saithe one sinnes praie one ioyneth together mutuall confession mutuall praier must confesse prestes onely muste wee also praie prestes onely yea might folowe wordes iames onely preestes mighte confesse willeth shold confesse one speaketh onely may heare confession worde greke allelous mutually enterchangeably turnes thei like best terme waye reciprocatio one enterchageably none cofesse thei meete confession whiche prerogatiue syth thei vouchesaue graunt prestes also put ouer ye office confessing therefore away trifelinges let v take meaning apostle simple plaine yt sholde laye weakenesse one others bosome receiue mutuall counsel mutuall compassio mutuall comforte one wee naturally priuie weakenesses brothren shold praie ye lord thei alleage iames v earnestly require ye confessio ye mercy godgala iii xxii man confesse god mercie vnlesse haue first confessed owne miserie ye wee rather pronounce accursed yt doth godro iijix angel churche yea men confesse himselfe sinner lorde hath concluded al vnder sinnes yt al mouthes might stopped fleshe humbled god onely iustified exalted maruell face thei dare affirme confession whereof thei speake lawe god vse wherof graunt dede auncient butte suche able proue olde time haue ben libertie truely euen owne cronacles declare certaine lawe constitution time innocent ye thirde surely thei auncient lawe wolde rather haue taken holde thereof haue contented decree ye counsell laterane made selues laughed atthis pope euen child thing thei sticke come forged decree whiche thei father vpon auncient counsells thei maie reuerence antiquitie dasell eye simple point came minde thrust false packe therefore owne witnesse ther yet passed three hundred yeares sin innocent thirde laied snare vpon men charged necessitie confession speake nothinge time barbarousnesse woordes minisheth credit law wher good father commaunde euery one bothe kindes male female one euery yeare confesse hys sinnes preest pleasant men merily take exception yt commaundement conteined hermaphrodite sate belongeth one either male female sin yt time grosse beastesnesse hathe bewrated selfe scholar expounde meant prest whatsoeuer al pope hyred bablers prate holde bothe christ neuer author thys law compelleth men recken vp sinnes also passed thousande twoo hundred yeares resurrection christe suche lawe made tyrannie firste brought godlynesse learning destroied visor pastor without choise taken al licentiousnesse vpon moreouer euident testimony bothe hystories auncient writer whiche teach confession politike discipline redemed byshops lawe made christe apostle wil alleage one many whiche shall plaine proofe thereof tripart hist lib sozomenus reporteth constitution bishop diligently kepte west church specialli rome wherby sheweth vniuersall ordinance church saith one preestes peculiarly appointed serue office whereby dothe sufficiently confute men falsly saie keyes geuen vse vniuersally whole ordre presthode common office preestes special duetie one chosen thervnto ye bishop whome thys daie cathedrall church thei call penitentiarie examiner haynous offense wherof punishment perteineth good example saith immediatly yt also ye manner constantinople till certaine woman faining came confession founde haue colored vnder pretence ye vnhonest co panie vsed certaine deacon acte nectarius man notable holines learning bishop churche toke away ye custome confessing let ass lift vp eares auricular confession wer lawe god durst nectarius repelle destroie wil thei accuse heretike schismatike nectarius holy man god allowed consenting voice olde father sentence thei muste condemne churche constantinople whiche sozomenus affyrmeth manner confessing onely let slype time also discontinued euen till within time remembrance yea let codemne apostasy onely church constantinople also cast church whiche haue neglected lawe whiche thei saie true inuiolable commaunded christian abrogation chrysostome also bishope constantinople doth many place euidently testifie homil psal maruell dare mutter contrarie tell saith thy sinnes thou mayest away thou ashamed tel man sinnes yt thou hast done tell daily thy soule say confesse thy fellow seruant may reproche thee tell god taketh care confesse thy sinnes vpo thy bed yt thy coscience may daily recognise euilles sermone de poeniten confess nowe necessary confesse witness present let examinatio thy sinnes done thy thought let iudgement without witnesse let god se thee confessing homil de incoprehen dei natura contra ano maeos leade thee stage thy fellow seruantes copell thee disclose thy sinnes men rehearse vtter thy conscience god shewe thy woundes lord best surgeo aske salue shew wil reproche thee nothing wil moste gently heale thee tel man homil de laz ro least reproche thee neither confessed thy felow seruaunt may vtter abrode lord lord shew thy woundes hath care thee gentle phisitio afterward bringeth god speaking thus copel thee come ye mids stage cal many witness tel thy sin alone priuatly may heale thy sore shal say chrysostome rashly wrote like thinges would deliuer men conscience bondes wherwith bond ye law god dare require necessitie whiche doth vnderstand comaunded worde god matter may made plainer easier first faithfully rehearse kinde confession taught worde god wil also declare inuetions al could draw drie infinite sea wherin thei coprehend ye som secret confession loth rehearse oft ye old translatour hath geuen translation worde confesse stede praise whiche grossest vnlearned men comonly knowe sauing good haue presumptuousnesse bewrayed doe geue away whiche written praise god tyrannical commaundement proue cofession auaileth cheare ye mindes thrust place psalmepsar xli v voice reioising confession suche change may serue shall haue list proued list seing thei become past shame let godly reders remember iust vengeaunce god haue ben cast reprobate minde presumption detestable rest simple doctrine scripture shal danger suche deceites beguile v therin apointed one order confessing much lord yt forgeueth forgetteth putteth away sinnes therfore shold confesse sinnes obtain pardon ye phisician therfore let v shew disease vnto greued offended therfore let v seke peace hand knower heart priuie al thoughtes therfore let v make haste poure harte finally calleth sinner therfore let v delay come himpsal l v haue saith dauid made sinne knowen vnto thee haue hidden vnrighteousnesse haue sayd wyll confesse vnrighteousnesse lord thou hast forgeuen wickednesse heart confessio dauid euen vse nede copelled comaundement trained deceite recken vp sinnes far thei shal thinke behouefull yt may receiue sound frute cofort faithfull pastor ought leaue libertie church also mainteine stoutly stand defence wil haue tyrannie absent ministerie superstition people sorte confession christ speaketh mathew thou offer thy gift altarmath vxxiii remebrest thy brother hath thing thee leaue thy gift go first reconciled thy brother come offer thy gift charitie hath bene appeired fault repaired acknowleging crauing pardo offence haue comitted kinde coteined confession haue sinned euen offending whole church christ maketh great matter priuate offence one forbid holy misteries haue sinned brother till iust amendes reconciled howe muche greater reason hath offended churche euill exa ple recouer fauour churche acknowledging faultii cor iivi corinthian receiued comunion whe yelded selfe obedient correction also forme confessio vsed olde churche ciprian maketh mention thei penance sayth due time come confession laying handes byshop clergie receiue leaue come comunion order forme confessing scripture vtterly knoweth dutie binde cosciences new bondes whome christ moste sharply forbiddeth v bring bondage meane time muche speake shepe present selues shepeherd meane partaker ye holy supper wold gladly haue euery obserued haue encombred conscience may fro thence receiue singular profit admonished meane prepare place admonishment alwaye tyrannie supersticion away thre kindes cofession power keyes hath place either whole churche solemne reknowleging faultes craueth pardon priuate man notable fault hath bred comon offence doth declare repetance ye vnquietnesse conscience doth nede help ye minister discloseth weakenesse vnto diuerse wayes taking away offense although therby also peace coscience prouided yet ye principal end yt hatred sholde taken away men mindes knit together bond peace vse haue spoke despised yt may willingly cofesse sinnes whole churche standeth iudgement seate god confesseth self gilty hath one refuge vnto ye mercy god scleder light cofort haue ther present christes embassadour hauing comandemet recociliation may heare absolution pronounced vnto profitablenesse keyes worthely commended embassage performed rightly suche order religiousnesse besemeth likewyse manner estranged selfe churche receiueth pardon restored brotherly vnitie howe great benefite vnderstadeth selfe forgeue christ hath saidmat xviij xix ioh xxxxiij euer ye forgeue sinnes earth shal forgeuen heauem lesse effectualnesse profit priuate absolution asked haue nede speciall remedy releue weakenesse happeneth oftentimes heareth generall promise directed whole cogregation faithfull remaineth neuerthelesse doubte hath still vnquiet minde though yet obteined pardon man haue disclosed parsone secret sore minde heareth peculiarly directed selfe saying gospelmat ixij thy sinnes forgeuen thee good hope stablisheth hys minde vnto assurednesse deliuered trembling wherwith tormented speake keyes muste take hede dreame certaine power seuered fro preaching gospell place shal haue occasion fully declare matter againe shall entreate gouernement churche shall see power binde lose whiche christ hath geuen churche bounde worde moste true ministerie keyes whole force wherof standeth grace gospel publikely priuately sealed vp heartes faithfull whome lord hath ordeined done preaching say romishe diuines decree euery one either kinde c omnis utrius que sexus de su trinitate fide catho ecre pope innocentius cousell laterane recited lib senten c lib senten dist cap mat xviii xix son e come yeares discretion must yerely one least confesse sinnes owne prest sinne forgeuen onlesse haue firmely conceiued entent confesse whiche intent performe occasion offred may nowe entrie open paradise preste hath power keyes may lose binde sinner worde christ vaine euer ye binde c power stoutely fight among selues say one keye substance power binde loose knowledge dede requisite good vse accessary essentially ioyned sawe much vnbridled licence haue reckened vp two keyes discretion power againe sawe ye lewde boldnesse prestes restrained moderation haue forged keyes say authoritie discerning thei vse geuing determinate sentence power practise executing sentence knowledge standeth couseller date simply expounde binding loosing forgeue put away sinnes heare lorde criyng prophet iesa xliij xxv none put awaye thy synnes israel saye prestes office pronounce whoe bee bounde loosed declare whose synnes forgeuen reteined dothe declare either confession absolueth reteined sinnes sentence excommunicated receiueth againe partakyng sacramentes finally vnderstande yet doubt styll may obiected oftentimes priestes doe bynde loose men vnworthye whiche therfore bounde loosed heauen whiche laste refuge aunswere geuing keyes muste bee construed limitation saye christ hath promised iudgement seate suche sentence preste shalbe allowed hathe bene iustly pronounced according deseruinges hym bounde loosed require moreouer saye keyes geuen christe priestes delyuered byshoppes tyme promotinge presthode free vse remayneth suche doe exercise ecclesiasticall office excommunicate suspended prestes haue deede keyes rusty bounde vp say thynges may wel seme modest sober comparison rest vpon new uield haue forged newe keyes say treasure ye churche locked vp keyes shall hereafter trye place fit nowe wyll fewe woordes aunswere euerye one particularlye present speake ryght wrong bynde soules faithfull lawes muche consider place serueth charge men lawe reckening vp sinnes saye sinne forgeuen vpon condition intent conceiued confesse babble remaineth entrie paradise occasion confessing neglected wyse sufferedpsa xixxiii must sinnes reckened vp dauid whoe thinke well studied vpon confession sinnes yet cried shall vnderstande error lorde cleanse secret sinnesps xxxviii place iniquity haue passed aboue head lyke weightye burden haue wared heauy aboue strengthe truely vnderstode howe great bottomlesse depthe sinnes howe many sortes misch euous doings many heades monster hydra beare long tayle drew therfore went recke vp register depth euels cried vnto ye lord ouerwhelmed v ried choked gate helles haue copassed let thy hande drawe whiche drowned great pit fai ting ready die nowe maye thinke vpon nombryng sinnes seeth dauid make nombre wyth thys butcherye soules haue beene touched anye feelynge god haue beene cruelye vexed fyrst called selues accompte deuyded synnes armes boowes braunches twigges according men rule weyed quality quantity circumstaunces matter went litle forwarde proceded litle eche syde skye eche side sea hauen safe roade mo passed ouer greater heape alway thrust self sight yea thei rose vp hye mountaines ther appeared hope much long co passinges waie escape thei sticke fast betwene sacrifice stone last founde issue desperation cruel butcher ease woundes themselues made lated certaine gentle plaisters euery man sholde muche coulde new care againe rose vp yea new tormetes slea sylly soules thinke haue employed time enough haue endeuored selfe suche diligence oughte haue passed ouer many thinges negligence forgetfulnesse commeth negligence excusable ministred plaisters asswage suche peines repent thee thy neglygence bee altogether carelesse shall bee pardoned al thing close vp wounde muche easmente euell poysons couered honey thei shold bitternesse offende firste taste enter bowel thei perceiued therfore terrible saieng alway calleth vpon soundeth care confesse al thy sinnes horroure bee appeased buy assured comforte let reader consider possible bring accompt doinges whole yeare gather together sinnes thei haue done euery daie asmuche experience proueth euery man euening shall recken vp faultes one daie memorie confounded therewith greate multitude diuersitie presenteth selfe speake grosse blockish hypocrite thinke thei haue done sufficiently haue noted three sower greatest sinnes speake true worshipper god whiche thei see themselues oppressed examinatio haue made adde also saieng ihoni ioh iii xx oure owne heart accuse v god greater oure heart thei quake feare sight iudge whose knowledge farre sourmounteth oure vnderstandinge whereas greate parte worlde rested vpon suche flattery wherewith deadely poyson tempered thys came passe bycause beleued god satisfied bycause selues fully satisfied anchor caste midde sea shoulde reste lyttle saylinge wayfaringe man weary fainetynge shoulde lye downe waye laboure muche prouinge thys euery man maie witnesse hym selfe shorte summe shewe manner law thys fyrst simply impossible therefore nothinge destroy damne confounde cast ruine desperation hath ledde sinner true feeling sinnes maketh hypocrite ignoraunce god themselues whyle wholy busyed reckenynge vppe theyr synnes meane tyme forgette secrete sinke vyces hydden iniquity inwarde fylthynesse knowledge whereof shoulde cheefely haue weyed myserie thys moste certaine rule confession acknowledge confesse bottomlesse depth euell great passeth vnderstandyngluc xviiixiii thys rule wee see publicanes confession made lorde mercifull synner shoulde saie euer altogether sinner atteine witte expresse tongue greatnesse sinnes let bottomlesse depthe thy mercie swallow vp bottomles depth sinne thou wilt saie oure sinnes confessed confession acceptable god whiche knitte vp twoo woordes sinner rather muste endeuoure selues much v lieth poure oure heart lorde onely one worde confesse oure selues sinner also truely heartyly acknowledge oure selues suche al oure thought record howe greate diuerse oure filth sinnes onely wee bee vncleane howe great howe many partes oure vncleannesse onely detters howe greate dettes wee bee loden howe manie way charged onely bee wounded also howe manie deadly stroke wounded reknowleging sinner hath wholy poured himselfe godpsal xixxxxi lette earnestly syncerely thinke yet remaine moe sinnes secret corner euels depe thei throughly disclosed crieth dauid whoe vnderstandeth errours lorde cleanse hidden sinnes wher thei affirme sinnes forgeuen intent confessing firmely conceiued gate paradise shutte neglecteth occasion offered may confessed god forbidde shoulde graunt forgeuenesse sinnes alwaie hath ben reade thei haue confessed sinnes eare preste wee reade haue obteined forgeuenesse sinnes christes hande truely thei coulde confesse neither prestes confessor confessing many age thys confession vnhearde time sinnes weare forgeuen thys condition may nede dispute longer doubtfull matter worde god plaine abideth euer whensoeuer synner repenteth remembre iniquity dare adde thinge worde byndeth sinneseze xviiixxi mercie god whereas thei saie iudgement canne geuen cause heard haue solution readinesse doe presumptuously take vpon selues haue made themselues iudges maruell thei boldely frame themselues suche principle man right wit wil graunt thei boaste office binding loosing committed though weare certain iurisdictio ioyned inquisition moreouer whole doctrine crieth oute yt authoritie vnknowen ye apostle neither doth belong preeste whiche desireth absolution knowe certainly whether synner loosed forasmuche heareth neuer know whether ye reckning iust perfect shold ther absolution suche restrained word yt iudged moreouer ye whole ordre loosing stadeth faith repetance two thing hidden ye knowledg man setence must geue vpo man foloweth therfore yt assurace binding loosing subiect iudgment earthly iudge bicause minister worde dothe office geue absolution conditionally spoken sinnes sake whose sinnes ye forgeue c thei doubte pardon whiche promised commaundement worde god shall ratified heauen therefore maruel condemne desire haue vtterly taken awaie auricular confession thinge pestilent many way hurtfull churche thinge selfe indifferent yet asmuche vse profite hathe geuen cause many wickedness sacrilege erroures whoe thinke ought presently abolished thei deede recken vp good v whiche thei boaste vpon profitable butte either false valewe due onely thei commend singular prerogatiue shame great punishment cofesseth wherby sinner time com made warer preuenteth punishment god punishing himselfe thoughe dyd humble man shamefastnesse enoughe call yt hie iudgement seate heauen meane hearing god forsoothe wel profited shame one man knowledge cesse sinne bee ashamed haue god witnesse oure euell conscience althoughe also moste false bee seen nothinge groweth greater confidence licentiousnesse sinne men hauing made confession preeste thinke maie wipe mouthe saie onely made yeare longe bolder sinne rest yeare bearing themselues bolde vpon confession thei neuer sighe vnto god thei neuer returne themselues heape sinnes vpon sinnes til vomit vp al one thinke haue one vomited vppe thinke selues discharged burden thei haue taken awaie god iudgment thei haue geuen preeste haue brought god forgetfulnesse haue made preeste priuie moreouer whoe doth meryly see daie confession hande whoe goeth confession cherefull hearte commeth rather wil drawing backewarde like taken necke drawen pryson vnlesse paraduenture preestes vse ioyfully delite themselues mutuall rehersals doinges weare mery tale wil defile much paper monstruous abhominations wherof auricular cofession swarueth ful onely saie holy man vnwisely one rumor fornication toke awaie confession church yea ye remembrance flocke therby putt minde y nedefull done daie vpon infinite whordomes adultery incestes bawderies consessionars allege thys purpose power keyes doe therevpon sette peupe prore kyngedome prouerbe bee seen howe muche oughte auayle saye keyes geuen wythoute cause yt sayde wythoute causemat xviiixviii whatsoeuer loose vpon earthe shall also loosed heauen make worde christe voide answer weighty cause key shold geuen bothe haue euen already declared shal plainly shew againe come entreat excommunication one swerde cutt holde al thei require y saieng sacryficeng preestes vicar successor apostle shall also entreated place nowe thei raise vp engine whereby thei wolde defende themselues therby may buildinges ouerthrowen christe geue apostle power binde loose gaue holy ghoste therefore saie none haue power key haue first receiued holy ghost denie man vse key hauing holy ghoste going teaching informing bee done triflinge saie thei haue holy ghoste dede thei denie vnlesse paraduenture thei faine thei faine dede ye holy ghoste vaine thing thing nothing therin thei shall beleued engine thei vtterly ouerthrowe soeuer dore thei boast yt thei haue keie man may alway aske whether thei haue holy ghoste whiche iudge gouerner key thei answer thei haue thei maie asked againe whether holy ghoste may erre thei wil glade speake expresly althoughe thei crokedly vtter doctrine therefore gathered preestes haue power ye key whiche commonly without consideration loose thinges lorde wold haue bounde binde thinges lorde commaunded loosed whereas thei see themselues conuinced clere experimentes thei without choise loose binde worthy vnworthy thei vsurpe power without knowledge although dare denie knoweledge requisit good vse yet thei write ye power geuen euel disposers ye power whatsoeuer thou bindest loosest earthe shalbe bounde loosed heauen either promise christ must lie thei haue power well binde loose neither may thei dallye saie saieng christe limited according deseruings yt bound loosed also confesse none bounde loosed thei yt worthy bound loosed ye messingers gospell churche haue woorde whyche thei measure worthinesse thys woorde messangers gospell maye promise men forgeuenesse sinnes christe faythei cor viix thei maye proclaime damnation vpon embrace christ word church pronounceth fornicatours adulterer theues mansleiers couetous men vniust men haue parte kingdom god bindeth sure bondes worde churche looseth whome yt comforteth repentant power shall knowe bounde loosed able binde loose without knowledge thei saie thei loose authoritie geuen vnto whe ye loosing vncertain haue imaginatiue power yf vse haue already prouch eyther vse vncertaine vse maye accompted none wheras cofesse great parte prestes rightly vse keyes power without lawefull vse effect whoe shall assure loosed good vser keyes euell vser hath el voyde disposyng say foud loosed thee know asmuch lack right vse ye keyes yf thou deserue loose thee much might wil say laye man could beare patient eares turke deuell asmuche saye haue worde god sure rule loosyng power geuen loose thee yf thy deseruynges see therfore meant defined keyes authoritie discernyng power executyng knowledge adioyned counseller like counseller serueth good vse vndoubtedly euen desired reygne theyr owne licentiously without god worde man take exception saye lawfull minister christ shall lesse doubtefull office bycause absolution hangeth vpon fayth shall alwaye remayne doubtefull sinner shall haue eyther none cold comforte bycause minister himselfe whiche competent iudge fayth assured absolution haue answer thereunto redinesse saye sinnes forgeue preste wherof himselfe hath ben hearer opinion forgeuenesse hangeth vpo iudgement prest yf wisely discerne whoe worthy pardon whole doyng voyde effect finally power whereof speake iurisdiction adioyned examination wherunto pardon absolutio restrained point found sure ground rather bottomlesse depth confession found hope pardon also lame prest himselfe muste needes sticke suspense tell whether sinner doe faithfully recken vp euell deedes finally suche ignoraunce rudenesse prestes moste parte fitter doe office shoemaker plowe ground rest manner ought worthily suspect themselues hereupon therefore riseth perplexitie doubtfulnesse pope absolution bycause haue grounded vpon person prest also vpon knowledge may iudge thinges informed examined proued nowe man aske good docters whether sinner reconciled god sinnes forgeuen see haue answer shalbe compelled confesse vnprofitable prest pronounceth forgeuenesse sinnes yt hath heard rehearsed long sinnes deliuered condemnation behalf confesseth hurtfull carefulnesse holdeth conscience bound appereth hereby resteth vpon prestes discretion call determine nothing certainly worde god doctrine teache free cleare fro al absurdity absolution conditionall sinner trust yt god merciful vnto sincerely seeke cleansing sinnes ye sacrifice christ obeye grace offred ca erre according office preacher proclaimeth yt geue instructios word god sinner may embrace sure cleare absolution simple coditio annexed embracing grace christ according generall doctrine maister himselfmatt ixxxix done thee accordyng thy fayth hath ben wickedly despised paparie foolishly thei confound thing yt scripture teacheth power keyes haue promised wil speake place shalbe conuenient place come entreate gouernement church let reader reme ber thing wrongfully wrested auricular secret confession whiche spoken christ partly preachyng gospel partly excomunication wherefore obiect power loosing geue apostle prestes may vse forgeuing sinnes acknowleged vnto playne yt take false fond principle bicause absolution serueth fayth nothing el witnesse pardo take ye free promise gospell confession hangeth vpo discipline church pertaineth nothing secret sinnes rather example comon offense church may take away wheras scrape together testimony proue sufficeth confesse sinnes either god laye vnlesse prest hearer trauaile therin lewde may ashamed whe auncient father cousel sinner vnburden theselues owne pastour ca expouded particular rehearsal vse lumbard like sinister dealing seme set purpose haue geue theselues fayned bokes pretense wherof might deceiue simple deede truely confesse bicause absolutio alway accopanieth repentance therefore proprely remaineth bond touched repentance although haue yet confessed therfore yt ye prest doth much forgeue sinnes pronouce declare forgeuen albeit ye word declaring thei slily brig grosse errour thrusting ceremonie stede doctrine wheras thei patche vnto yt absolued face church yt alredy obteined pardo god incoueniently draw peculiar vse euery particular yt haue already sayd apointed comon discipline offense haynous notorious fault take away depraue corrupt moderatio addyng maner forgeuyng enioyning penaltie satisfaction wherin thei presumptuously claime theyr sacrifice power part yt halfes god hath place promised v whole together simply requireth repentance faith partition exceptio robberie god effect asmuche yf prest takyng vpon persone tribune become intercessour god would suffer god mere liberalitie receyue fauour hath lyen prostrate tribune seates hath ben punished whole summe cometh point yf wil make god authour counterfait confession therein falshod co demned haue proued false forger fewe place allege sithe euident law made men say bothe tirannicall made iniuriously agaynst god whoe bindyng men conscience word haue free bondage men nowe obteynyng pardon necessitie prescribed thyng whiche lord wold free say sacrilege suffred bycause nothing properly belongyng god forgeue sinnes wherein co sisteth saluation v moreouer haue shewed tirannie first brought world oppressed filthy barbarousnesse haue also taught pestilent lawe eyther throweth downe hedlong desperation poore soules euer abideth feare god reigneth carlesnesse deliteth vayne flattery maketh duller last haue declared euer mitigatios bryng tend ende entangle darken depraue pure doctrine hide vngodlinesses deceitfull color third place repentance assigne satisfaction wherof euer babble may ouerthrowen one worde lib ser dist c c non sufficit de pont cap med ade dist c nullus ade dist say enough repenteth absteyne former euels chaunge behauior better vnlesse make satisfaction god thing hath done many helpes whiche maye redeme sinnes wepinges fastinges oblatios workes charitie must winne lord fauorable muste paye dettes righteousnesse god must make amendes defaultes wt must deserue pardo although largesse mercie hath forgeuen faulte yet discipline iustice reteineth peine peyne must redemed satisfaction effect al say cometh point deede obteine pardo sinnes mercifulnesse god meanes ye deseruing workes whiche offense sinnes may recopensed due satisfaction may fully made god righteousnesse lie set free forgeuenesse sinnes whiche nothing euidently spoke ye scriptureesa lijiij ro vv coloss iixiiii iijv first forgeuenesse gift mere liberalitie creditour sayd forgeue yt acknowlegeth acquitance yt monye payed without paymet willingly owne liberalitie cancelleth detters bond secodly word freely added take away al opinion satisfaction cofidence therfore yet set vp satisfactios yt stricke downe mighty thuderbolt ye lord crieth esaieesa xliij xv put away iniquity mine owne sake mindefull thy sinnes dothe openly declare fetcheth cause fundation forgeuenesse owne goodnesse moreouer whereas whole scripture beareth witnesse christe paragraph forgeuenesse sinnes receyued name doth thereby exclude name nowe teache receyued name satisfaction neyther denie geue satisfaction although saye bee vsed helpes waye meanes whereas scripture sayth name christ meaneth bryng nothyng allege nothyng owne reste vpon commendation christ pauleii cor vxix affirmeth god reconcilyng world selfe christ sake imputyng men sinnes immediatly sheweth meane manner bycause without sinne made sinne v suche peruersnesse saye bothe forgeuenesse sinnes reconciliation performed bothe one time moste euident writinges bewrayed owne filthynesse one two scholemen vniuersally maister confessed christ payed penaltie sinnes vpon tree accordyng doctrine peteri pet ijxxiiij ii tim iix ih ij v xii immediately correcteth sayeng adding exception baptisme temporall penalty sinnes released baptisme minished help penance crosse christe penaunce maye worke together iohn sayth far otherwise yf sinne haue aduocate father euen iesus christ whiche propitiation sinnes wryte vnto child bycause sinnes forgeuen name sake truely speaketh faythfull whome setteth foorth christe bee propitiation sinnes sheweth satisfaction whiche god beyng displeased maye bee made fauorable appeased doth saye god one reconciled vnto christe nowe se ke meanes maketh hym perpetuall aduocate alwaye restore v intercession fauour father perpetuall propitiation whiche sinnes maye cleansed awaye euer true iohn saydi xxvi beholde lambe god beholde taketh awaye sinnes worlde taketh awaye sayth hymself none say haue peace god esaie saythesa liiiiiii pet iixxiiii ro viiiiii gala iiixiii father hath layed iniquity v vpo sonne healed stripe thing peter rehearsyng wordes sayth christ body beare sinnes vpon tree thee pestilent folly example grace god worketh alone firste forgeuenesse sinnes yf afterwarde fall obteynyng seconde forgeuenesse workes doe worke thynges maye haue place thynges assigned christ conscience pacification shal man conscience heare sinnes redemed satisfaction shal certainely knowe measure satisfaction therefore shall alway doubte whether haue god merciefull shall alwaye bee exed alwaye quake feare rest vpon light pe satisfaction doe contemptuously esteme iudgement god doe litle consider great greuousnesse sinne declare place although graunt redeme sinnes iust satisfaction yet thing called placeesa xliiiixxij mich vijxix cast behinde backe wype away like cloude drowne bottome sea impute hide manner speche holy ghost doth plainely expresse meanyng vnto v would apply vnto willinge eares learnepsa xxxijxij truely god doe punysh sinnes imputeth taketh vengeance remebreth cal iudgemet doth hide examine doth cast behinde backe loke vpon hath wiped away like cloude sift hath cast bottome seaps lii j manner doth augustine expoud plaine wordes god haue couered sinnes wold loke vpo wold loke vpo wold mark wold marke wold punish would know rather pardon therfore say ier xviji weye ye side meant speches lorde doth binde vp iniquity sacke doth gather bundell laye vp doth graue iron pointell adamant stone signifie doubt vengeance shalbe geuen recompense also doubted beare sinnes bodye vpon treei pet ijxxiii meane nothing el ther suffred peyne punishment due sinnesesa liijv hath esaye liuely declared sayth chastisemet correctio peace vpo correctio peace ye peine due sinne shold suffred could recociled god vnless yt entred stede loe thou seest plainely christ suffred peynes sinnesrom iiixxiiij cor ixxx eph ivij col ixiiij tim ijvi deliuer oft paule maketh mention redemption performed christ vseth cal greke apolutrosin whereby meaneth redemption comonly taken price satisfaction redemption whiche manner wryteth christ gaue self ilutron price raunsome v propitiatio lord sayth augustine sacrifice sacrifice offred v death christ whiche apointed law moses cleansing offense sinnes ministreth v strong battel rame lord doth apoint manner satisfieng requireth whole recompense sacrifice whereas yet thinges doth moste diligently exact order set ceremony expiation commeth passe commaundeth recompense faultes comitted workes requireth sacrifice satisfaction bicause declare one kinde satisfaction wherby iudgement appeased sacrifice israelite offer weyed worke men estemed truthe say sacrifice christ manner recompense lord receyueth vsos e xii iij see hath well expressed fewe wordes thou shalt sayth take away iniquitie god loe forgeuenesse sinnes shal paye thee calues lippes loe satisfaction knowe yet suttelly slippe awaye make distinction betwene euerlastyng peyne temporall peines teache temporall peyne kinde punishment god taketh well body soule except euerlastyng death restraynyng doth litle help place haue aboue recited expresly dryue therunto againe promise mercie lordes hand manner alwaye purpose preache peynes forgeuenesse thereof truely lord ezechiell pronounceth make ende exile babyloneze xxxvj xxij xxxij sake iewes sake allege sa xijxiii dauid say beyng rebuked nathan prophet adulterie manslaughter receiued pardon sinne yet afterward punished death sonne gotten adulterie taught redeme satisfaction peynes extended forgeuenesse faulte daniel aduised nebuchadnezer redeme sinnes wt almesdan iiii iiii salomon writeth equitie godlinessepro xvivi xxii pet iiiiviii luc vii xlvii iniquity forgeuen place charitie multitude sinnes couered sentence peter also confirmeth agayne luke lorde sayth woman sinner many sinnes forgeuen bicause hath loued much peruersly wrongfully euer weye doynges god marked haue ouerpassed twoo kindes god iudgement would haue seen rebukyng dauid far manner punishment suche might though tende reuengement bycause litle behoueth vsal vnderstand wherunto chastisementes haue respect wherwith god correcteth v sinnes howe much differ fro exaples wherewith pursueth wicked reprobate indignation therefore thinke shall byside purpose comprehend shortly summe order playne teachyng let v cal one kinde iudgement iudgement reuenge chastisemet vnderstanded god punisheth enemy iudgement reuenge vseth wrath confoundeth destroyeth bryngeth nought therfore let v take properly vengeance god punishyng ioyned indignation iudgement chastisement dealeth cruelly angry punisheth destroye sendeth downe lightenyng kill therefore properly punishment vengeance correctio admonishment one doyng iudge father iudge punisheth euell doer hath regard offense punisheth fault father somwhat rigorously correcteth childe doeth reueged punish rather teache make water time come chrysostome certayne place vseth similitude somwhat differyng yet commeth point sonne sayth beaten seruant also beaten one punished bondseruant bycause hath offended chastised freeman sonne nedyng correction one correction serueth profe amendement scourge punishment maye haue whole matter shortly redy summe let first two distinction wheresoeuer punishment reuenge sheweth self curse wrath god whiche alwaye withholdeth faythfulliob iiixvii pro vixi eb xiii contrarywise chastisement bothe blessyng god beareth testimonie loue scripture teacheth difference commonly euery sufficiently expressed worde god euer affliction wicked uffer present life therein painted vnto v certayne entrie hell whense doe alredy see far eternall damnation far beyng amended takyng profit thereby rather beginnynges prepared cruell hell length abideth themps cxvii xviij psa cxixxvii lord chastisyng chastiseth seruantes doth put death therfore confesse beate rodde good true instruction rede euery holy one suffer suche punishmentes quiet minde haue alwaye prayed escape first kinde scourge chastise lord sayth ieremie thy iudgementier xxiiij thy wrath least thou destroy poure thy wrath vpo nation yt haue knowen thee vpon kingdomes haue called vpon thy nameps viij xxx iijij david sayth lord rebuke thy wrath correct thine anger maketh nothyng contrarie oftetimes sayd lord angry punisheth sinnes esaieesa xiji wil cofesse thee lord bicause thou hast angry wt thy wrath turned thou hast comforted againe abacuchabiiiii thou hast ben angry shal remeber mercie micheemich vijix wil beare wrath lord bicause haue sinned putteth v minde iustly punished nothing preuaile murmuryng also yt faithful haue aswagemet sorto cosidering purpose god manner sayd doth defile owne inheritace yet know neuer defile spoken respect purpose meaning god punisheth vehement feling sorrow fele suffer seueritie euer pricketh faithful smal rigour sometimes woundeth thei thinke theselues far damnation hell testifieth haue deserued wrath behoueth lothe themselues euels touched greater care appease god carefully make haste craue pardon euen doynge sheweth euident testimonie fauorable kindenesse wrath couenant continueth made v true salomon truthe whereof deceyue hath affirmedps lxxxixxxxi shall neuer bee made voyde sayth child forsake lawe walke iudgementes yf defile statute kepe commaundementes visite sinnes rodde stripe wil take away mercie whiche mercie make v assured sayth rodde wherewith correct posteritie salomonij sa vijxiiij shalbe menne stripe child menne clause meaneth moderation lenitie withall secretlye declareth bee confounded extreme deadly horrour fele hand god great regard hath lenitie chastising israell sheweth prophetesa xlv ij x haue purged thee sayth fyre siluer thou shouldest haue ben consumed albeit teacheth chastisementes serue cleanse hym sayth vseth temperately bee muche consumed needefull euery man reueretly feareth god geueth follow godlinesse muche tendrer beare wrath reprobate although grone vnder scourge yet weye cause rather turne backe bothe owne sinnes iudgemet god slouthfulnesse gather hardnesse bycause murmure kicke agaynst make vprore agaynst iudge furious soden rage astoni eth madnesse furor faythfull beyng admonished correction descend consider sinnes beyng striken dread horrour flee huble wise pray pardon vnlesse lord dyd aswage sorrowes wherwith poore soules torment themselues would ainte hundred time euen smal token wrath let second distinction reprobate stryken scourge god thei alredy certaine manner beginne suffer peines iudgement though shall escape vnpunished haue taken hede suche token wrath god yet punished ende make come better minde great hurr proue god iudge reuenger child beaten roddes thereby punished god sinnes thereby profit amendement therefore take thei rather haue respect time come time paste serm de poenite co es rather expresse chrysostomes wordes mine owne sayth god doth lay peine vpon v punishyng sinnes past correctyng v agaynst time come sayth augustine thou suffrest yt whiche thou lamentest medicine thee peine chastisement damnatio put away scourge thou wilt put away inheritance c knowe ye brother miserie mankinde world groneth medicinall sorrow penall sentence c sentence haue therefore thought good alleage manner speche haue aboue writen shuld seme man newe vnused hereunto serue co plaintes full indignation wherein lord oftentimes doth expostulate vnkindenesse people thei stiffly despised al punishmentes esaye saithesa iv purpose strike sole foote crowne hed whole place bicause ye prophetes ful sayenges shalbe sufficient haue briefly shewed god punish churche none intent tamed amed therefore caste saul kingdomei sam iv x iii sa xijxviii cor xixxxii punished reuengement toke dauid yonge sonne corrected amendement accordyng meanyng taken paule sayth iudged lord corrected damned worlde child god afflicted hande heauenly father peyne wherewith confounded chastisement wherwith instructed whiche pointe augustine plainely side lib de peccato merito ac remiss ca teacheth peynes wherwith like chastised god ar diuersly considered bycause holy one battels exercise forgeuenesse sinnes reprobate without forgeuenesse peynes wickednesse whiche place rehearseth peynes layed vpon dauid godly men sayth tended end godlinesse shold humbling themesa xlij exercised proued esaie sayth iewishe people iniquitie forgeuen bycause receyued full chastisement lordes hande proueth pardon sinnes hangeth vpon full paymet ye peyne effect asmuch sayd bycause ye haue alredy suffred peynes enough greuousnesse multitude thereof haue ben nowe pyned awaye long mournyng sorrow therefore nowe time receyuing tidynges full mercie heartes reioyce fele father god take vpon person father whiche repenteth euen iuste seueritie compelled sharply correct sonne thoughtes necessarie faithful furnished bitternesse afflictionsi pet iiijxvij ier xxv ix time iudgement beganne house lord name called vpon shuld child god thei beleue seueritie god fele vengeance beyng stryken hand god imagineth god punishyng iudge coceyue angry enemie vnto detest scourge god curse damnation finally neuer perswaded god loueth yt shall thinke minded toward still minded punish profiteth vnder rod god thinketh bee angry sinnes merciefull louynge otherwise muste needes happen whiche prophet complayneth feltps lxxxviij xiiij p xxvii sayth thy wrathes god haue passed ouer thy terror haue oppressed also moses writeth bycause haue faynted thy wrath haue ben troubled thy indignatio thou hast set iniquity thy sight secretes light thy countenance bicause dayes gone awaye thy wrath yeres consumed worde passed mouth side dauid sayth thus fatherly chastisementes teache faythfull rather holpen oppressed therebyps iiii p lxx viii xvii blessed man whome thou haste corrected lord hast instructed thy law geue quiet fro euell dayes pit digged sinner truely harde tentation god sparyng vnbeleuers winkyng faultes semeth rigorous agaynst therefore gaue cause comfort admonishment law wherby learne done prouide saluation called agayne waye wicked caried hedlong errours whose ende pit difference whether peyne euerlastyng duryng time well warre famine pestilence sickenesse iudgemet eternall death curse god layed vpon menne ende instrumentes lordes wrath vengeance agaynst reprobate nowe thinke men doe perceyue whereunto tended chastisement lord vpon dauid euen instruction god greuously displeased manslaughter adulterie agaynst shewed great indignation beloued aithful seruant dauid taught bolde like deede peyne wherby shuld make certaine recompense god iudged kinde correction whereby lord punished people sore pestilenceii sam xiiiii dauids disobedience whereinto fallen numbryng people deede freely forgeue dauid giltinesse sinne bicause perteined bothe publike example age also humbling dauid haynous offense remayne vnpunished therefore moste sharply chastised rodde whiche marke also ought haue eye vniuersal curse mankinde whereas pardon obteined yet suffer misery weare layed vpon first parent peyne sinne perceyue selues suche exercise admonished greuously god displeased wt transgression law beyng throwen downe hubled knowledge conscience owne miserable estate may eruetly aspire true blessednesse shalbe foolish shal thinke calamity present life layed vpon v giltinesse sinne homil de pr ad argi rium thinke meanyng chrysostome wrote thus god therfore laye peines vpo v cal v perseuering euels repentance repentance one shewed peine shalbe superfl ous therefore knoweth expedient euery man nature handleth one man roughly louynge tendernesse therfore mindeth teache inmeasurable takyng punishmentes reprocheth hard hearted obstinate people beyng striken yet make ende sinning meaning complainethier viii o e viivi ephraim ake scorched one side rawe bycause correction pearce mindes people hauynge vice boyled might made mete receyue pardon truely speaketh sheweth sone man hath repented wil become appeasable stifnesse enforced rigour chastisyng faultes haue ben preuented willyng amendement yet forasmuch suche hardnesse rudenesse vniuersally needeth chastisemet semed good beyng wise father exercise al without exception comon scourge al life long maruelous thei cast eye vpon example dauid moued many example might haue beholden free forgeuenesse sinneslu xviii ii luc xxii mat ixij read publicane wet temple iustified folowed peyne peter obteyned pardon offence teares reade sayth ambrose satis actio reade man sicke palsey heard spoken rise thy sinnes forgeuen thee peyne layed vpon al absolution rehearsed scripture set geuen freely great number example rule shoulde rather haue ben gathered example conteyneth certaine speciall matter daniel exhortation wherin counselleth nebuchadnezer redeme sinnes righteousnessedan iiijxxiiij iniquity pitieng poore meanyng saye righteousnesse mercie satisfactorie appeasementes god redemption peines god forbidde euer redemption sauinge bloud christ referre word redeming rather men god sayd king thou hast vsed vnrighteous violent gouernement thou hast oppressed humble thou haste spoyled poore thou haste hardly vniustly handled thy people thy vniust exaction thy violence oppression nowe render mercie righteousnessepro xxij likewise salomon sayth charitie multitude sinnes couered god among men theselues thus whole verse hatred raiseth vp contention charitie couereth iniquity whiche verse manner doth waye comparison contrary compare euels growe hatred frutes charitie meanyng ha e together one byte barke reproche rayle turne thinges worst loue together doe dissemble many thynges amonge themselues doe wynke many thinges pardon many thinges one one alloweth others faultes beareth helpeth admonishyng rather galleth reprochyng themi pet iiijviij pro xvivi bee doubted peter allegeth place sense vnlesse accuse deprauyng wrongfully wrestynge scripture whereas teacheth sinne purged mercifulnesse liberalitie doth meane recompense therewith made sinne face lord god beyng appeased suche satisfaction dothe release peyne otherwise would haue layed vpon accustomed manner scripture declareth shall finde merciefull vnto leauyng former vice iniquity turne godlinesse truthe say wrath god doth cesse iudgement rest cesse euell doynges neither doth describe cause pardon rather manner true conuersion many time prophetes doe declare hypocrite doe vayne pester god forged ceremonious vsages stede repentace whereas vprightnesse life duty charitie yt deliteth himhebr xiijxvi also author epistle hebrewes comending liberalitie gentlenesse teacheth yt sacrifice please god christ tau ting pharisee geuing hede cleansyng dishesmat xxiij xxv luc xixxxix neglected cleannesse heart comaunded geue almes might cleane dyd thereby exhorte make satisfaction teacheth manner cleannesse pleaseth god whiche kinde speach haue entreated place touching place luke hath sound iudgement read parable lord reciteluc vijxxxvi make v controuersie therupon pharisee thought himselfe lord know woman easily receiued presence thought christ wold haue receiued knowen sinner thereby gathered christ prophet might suche sorte deceyued lord shewe sinner sinnes alredy forgeuen dyd put parable two dettours one creditour vpo vsurie one ought fifty ought fyue hundred bothe theyr dettes forgeuen whether oweth thanke pharisee answered whome moste forgeuen lorde replyed learne hereby womas sinnes forgeuen bycause hath loued muche whiche wordes see maketh loue cause profe forgeuenesse sinnes deriued vpo similitude ettour whome fyue hundred forgeuen whome dyd saye therefore forgeuen bycause loued muche therefore loued muche bycause forgeuen hereunto muste similitude bee applyed sorte thou thynkest woman sinner thou oughtest knowe none suche asmuch sinnes forgeuen sinnes forgeuen loue ought proue vnto thee whereby rendreth thanke benefite argument gathered folowyng effect whereby thinge proued signes ensuyng meane obteyned forgeuenesse sinnes lord openly restifieth thy fayth sayth hath saued thee therefore obteyne forgeuenesse fayth charitie geue thankes testifie bountiefulnesse lord thinges commonly founde bookes olde wryters concerning satisfactio litle moue see deede many wil speake plainely manner al whose bokes remayne haue eyther erred point spoken crabbedly hardely graunt rude vnskilfull haue wrytten thynges sense newe satisfactionars reade hom psal chrysostome one place writeth thus wher mercie required examination cesseth mercie asked iudgement rigorous mercie craued place peine mercie inquisition mercie answer pardoned whiche wordes howsoeuer wrested yet thei ca neuer made agree scholemens doctrine ye boke ecclesiastical doctrine whiche fathered vpo augustine red thus satisfactio repentance cut cause sinnes graunt entrie suggestion whereby appereth doctrine satisfaction sayd geuen recompense sinnes committed euen time laughed scorne asmuch referre satisfactio heedefulnesse absteining sinnes time come allege whiche chrysostome sayth hom gen enchi il requireth v shold confesse sinnes vnto teares sithe suche sentence many time founde wrytinges others augustine deede place calleth ye workes mercie remedy obteine forgeuenesse sinnes bicause shuld stuble litle word preuenteth place flesh christ sayth true sacrifice sinnes sinnes wholly put away baptisme also afterward crepe weaknesse whiche whole church crieth day forgeue v trespass forgeuen singular sacrifice haue part called satiffaction recompense rendred god open declaratio wherby ben excomunicate would receiued agayne comunion assertayne church repentance weare enioyned vnto repet certayne fasting thing whereby might perswade men weare truely hartily wery former life rather blot remembrance former doynges sayd make satiffaction god ye church cap rehersed ye decretes cap acti bus de p rit dist also expressed augustine word enchirrdion laurece auncient custome co fessions satisfaction day vsed toke beginning truely viperous birthes whiche brought palle yt remayneth much shadowe ye better forme know old writer doe sometime speake somewhat hardly sayd euen denie paraduenture erred herein thing weare besprinkled spot thei one handled men vnwashed handes altogether defiled must contend authoritie old wryters good god olde writer thrust vnto v good part wherwith peter lombard chapion hath botched vp patched senteces gathered ye vnsauorie dotage certaine moke caried vnder ye name ambrose hierome augustine chrysostome present questio taketh manner augustine boke repentace foolishly botched good bad scraper together beareth deede name augustine boke man beyng meanely learned would vouchesaue acknowlege wheras narrowly examine folly let reader pardon wold ease tediousnesse shuld laboursome yet plausible bewray great shame thinges haue heretofore bosted vpon misteries bycause purpose teache frutefully therefore passe ouer fifte chapter p suppliynges whiche adde satisfaction pardon purgatory doctrine satisfaction flowe indulgeces pardon say power wa teth make satisfaction supplied pardos thei runne far forth madnesse define distributio merites christ martirs pope dealeth abrode bulles although haue neede helleborus purge fretike braine tha argumetes answer yt much worthy yt trauaile stand vpo confuting triflyng error already shake wt many battelrammes selues growe decaied age bende toward falling yet short confutation shalbe profitable ignoraunt altogether omitte pardon haue long stand safe haue long ben vnpunished hauing ben vsed outragious furious licetiousnesse may serue teache v darke night error men certaine age past haue ben drowned sawe selues openly vncoloredly scorned pope bulbearers gainful markettes made saluation soules price saluatio valued penny nothing set frely geuen colour wyped offringes filthely spent vpon brothel bawdes bankettinges greatest blower abrode pardon greatest despisers mostre doth dayly greater licentiousnesse ouerrunne worlde grow outrage yt ende newe lead dailye brought new mony gotten yet hye reuerence receiued worshipped bought pardon suche among rest sawe somewhat farther yet though godly deceiptes wherby might beguiled profit ye length sin world suffred selfe somwhat wiser pardon waxe colde litle litle become frosen till vtterly vanishe awaye muche many se filthy gaming ye deceiptes theftes robbery wherwith pardoner haue heretofore mocked begiled v yet se fountaine ungodlynesse whence spring good shewe sort pardon also wyped spottes call treasure churche merites
