penitentes charged rigorous satisfaction could beare whiche felt selues aboue measure oppressed penance enioyned required churche release mitigatio graunted suche called indulgence pardon turned satisfaction churche god sayde recompense whereby menne may redeme selues iudgement god therewithall dyd also drawe indulgence pardon propitiatorie remedy delyuer v deserued punyshementes blasphemer haue recited haue forged shamelessely haue colour let trouble v purgation axe already broken hewed downe ouerthrowen fundations agree men thinke best dissemble point make mention purgatorie whereupon say great contention arise small edification gotten truely selfe would also thynke suche trifle worthy negligently passed ouer accompt earnest matter muche purgatorie bulded manye blasphemes daily vpholden new blasphemes raiseth vp many greuous offence truely winked peraduenture might sort haue ben dissembled tyme inuented curious bolde rashenesse without worde god men beleued wote reuelations fained crafte sathan confirmation certayne place scrypture fondlye wrested bee lorde geueth leaue man presumptuousnesse breake secrete place iudgementes hath seuerely forbydden men enquyre truthe dead mendeut xviij xxi neglecting worde permitteth hys worde vnreuerently defyled let v graunte thynges myght whyle haue bene borne thynges great importaunce cleansyng synnes soughte el bloude christe satisfaction geuen awaye anye thynge moste perillous speake therfore must crye onlye vehement stretchynge voyce also throte sydes purgatorie dampnable deuyse sathan maketh voyde crosse christ layeth intolerable sclaunder vpon mercie god febleth ouerthroweth faythe el purgatorie amonge satisfaction soules men departed doe paye death ouerthrowyng opinio satisfaction purgatorie immediatlye ouerthrowen verye rootes former discourse euident bloud christe onely satisfaction propitiatorie sacrifice cleansing synnes faythfull remayneth purgatorie mere horrible blasphemie christe passe ouer robbery god wherewith dayly defended offense bredeth religion thynges innumerable whiche se haue come spryng vngodlinesse good wryng handes suche place haue falsely wrongfully taken scripture say thei lorde affirmeth synne holy ghost shold forgeuen worldemat xiilij worlde come thereby sheweth forgeuenesse sinnes worlde comemar xxvi seeth lord speaketh fault sinneluk xijx purgatorie muche opinion peine suffred sinnes wherof denie fault forgeuen present life may carpe v shall haue yet plainer solution lord meant cut hope pardon haynous wickednesse thought enough saye neuer forgeuen amplifie vsed diuision wherein comprehended bothe iudgement euery man conscience feleth life last iudgement shalbe openly pronounced resurrection though shold haue sayd beware ye malicious rebellio moste present dampnation set purpose shall endeuour quenche light holy ghost shall obteine pardon neither life whiche geuen sinner conuersion last daye lambes shalbe seuered angel god fro goates kingdome heauen shalbe cleansed offense brynge fourth parable mathewemat vxv agree thine aduersarie least deliuer thee ye iudge iudge sargeant sargeant pryson whence thou shalt get vntil thou hast payed uttermoste farthing place iudge signifie god aduersarie plentife deuil sargeant angell pryson purgatorie wyll gladlye yelde vnto euident men christe meant showe howe many daungers mischeues caste selues rather obstinatly pursue extremitie lawe deale according equitie good ryght ende exhorte hys disciple earnestly agreement equitie praye shall purgatorie founde phil iixthey fetche argument saying paul affirmeth knee thynges heauen earthe helles shall bowe christ take confessed helles meant adiudged eternal damnation therfore remayneth must soules lying peine purgatorie reason euyll apostle knelynge meane true godly worshippyng sithe teacheth dominion geuen christ wherby creature bee subdued profe contrary may helles vnderstande deuels shalbe brought iudgement god acknowledge hym iudge feare tremblyng lyke paul hym selfe expoundeth prophecie placerom xiijx sayeth shalbe brought iudgement seate christ wrytten truly lyue euery knee shal bowe c maye expounde whiche reuelation haue heard creaturesreuel vxv bothe thynges heauen vpon earth vnder earth sea haue hearde saye hym sytteth throne lambe blessinge honor glorie power euer euer doe deede easely graunte creature doe thynke heare rehearsed moste certaine conteined creature without reason without sense whereby affirmed nothing el partes world ye hyest toppe heauens mydle point earth doe manner declare glorie creatorij mach xijxliii whiche alledge historie machabees vouchesaue answer least seme recken worke nombre holye bookes augustine receyued canonicall first sure credit receiue iewes sayeth esteme wryting machabees doe lawe prophetes psalmes whiche lorde hym selfe hath witnessed witness saying necessary thynges fulfylled wrytten lawe psalmes prophetes concerninge hathe bene receiued churche vnprofitably soberly red heard cotra g iu dent epi cap luk xxiii hierome teacheth without doubtinge authori ie therof force prouing doctrine euidently appeareth olde booke whiche entituled vnder name cypriane concerning exposition crede place olde churche doe stryue without causeii macha xvxxxvi though author hym selfe doeth sufficiently shew muche credited ende craueth pardon haue spoken thyng well truely confesseth writynges nede pardon sayeth plainly oracle holy ghost besyde godlynesse iudas praysed none cause assured hope last resurrection sent offrynge dead hierusalem neither dothe wryter historie referre whiche iudas pryce redemption myght partaker eternall lyfe faithfull died contrie relgio doyng dede without superstition preposterous zele foles drawe sacrifice lawe farre vnto v muche knowe thynges doe cesse comming christ vse haue inuincible bulwarke paul whiche easely battered man saith buylde vpon foundationi cor iii gold syluer precious stone tynber heye stubble lorde shal shewe euery man worke shall reueled fier fier shall trie euery man worke man woorke doe burne shall suffer losse shalbe safe fier fier saye fier purgatorie filthiness synne cleansed away may enter pure kyngdome god moste parte olde wryters thought fierchryses august saye trouble crosse whiche lorde tryeth rest filthinesse fleshe muche probable fainyng purgatorie doe neyther agree men thynke haue attained certaine muche plainer vnderstandyng yt place vtter wold haue aunsweare whether apostle sainctes must haue gone fier purgatorie knowe wyll saye nay muche inconuenient must haue neded purged whose merites dreame ouerflowe aboue measure bres churche apostle affirmeth dothe saye worke shalbe proued worke neither argument enchir ad laurent augustine confuteth expositio whiche absurditie dothe saye shal passe fire workes haue faithfully buylded churche shall receiue reward whan worke examined fier first see apostle vsed metaphore called doctrine inuented man braines woed hey stubble metaphore hath apparant rescue wood sone put fier consumeth wasteth doctrine continue come examined man ignoraunt suche tryall cometh holy ghost therfore folowe true cause metaphore match partes together iust relatio called triall holy ghost fier euen nerer gold siluer put fier muche surer profe haue goodnesse finenesse lordes truthe exactlye weyed spirituall examination muche greater confirmation credit receiueth hey wood stubble put fier brought sudein consuming inuentions men stablyshed worde god beare triall holy ghost fall away perishe finally forged doctrine compared wood hey stubble like wood hey stubble burned fire destroied destroied driuen awaye spirite lorde foloweth holy ghoste fier wherwith shalbe proued whose profe paul according common vse scripture calleth day ye lord called day ye lorde whensoeuer doth way shew presence men face principally shineth truthe shineth vpon v haue proued paul meaneth fier triall holy ghost saued fier suffer losse worke shall hard vnderstande consider kinde men speaketh toucheth buylders churche keping true fundation doe builde disagreing matter vpon say swaruing ye che e necessarie article faithe erre pointes smaler lesse perilous mingling owne deuises worde god suche say must suffer losse worke hauing deuises destroyed selues saued fier saye ignorance errour alowable lorde cleansed grace power holy ghoste therfore whosoeuer haue defiled golden finenesse god worde dong purgatorie must nedes suffer losse work wyll say hath ben auncient vsage ye churche paul answered obiection hee comprehendeth owne tyme sentence saith must suffer losse theyr worke building churche lay thing vpon ye fundation ageeth therfore aduersaries obiect hath bene vsed aboue thousand thre hundreth yeres haue priayes made dead aske againe word god reuelatio example done want testimony scripture also example holy men ye ther red shew thing mourning order funeralles somtimes founde manye long tale prayer see one tittle greater weight matter ought haue ben expressely spoken old father selues prayed dead see herein wanted comaundement god lawfull example durst thei say thei suffer somewhat men therfore affirme whiche ought drawen example faithfull ought enterprise nothing vpon assured conscience paul reacheth assurednesse principally required prayer likely led reason vnto sought comfort releue sorrowe semed vnnatural shew god testimonie loue toward dead man wit enclined affection know experience also ye receiued custome like burning brand set many men mindes fier know nation age funeralles done ye dead soules yearely purged though satan beguiled foolish men deceites yet toke occasion beguile true principle death destruction passage life dout yt euen superstition condemneth ye ge tile iudgement seate god neglecting care life come whiche professed selues beleue nowe christian would worse heathen men ashamed nothing dead though thei vtterly destroyed hereupon came ill aduised diligence slowe looking funeralles bankettinges offeringes thoughte put selues dauger great reproche whiche first proceded wrongful folowyng heathen exa ple multiplied often newe encreasces principall holinesse papistriereu xiiii xij helpe dead distresse scriture ministreth muche better perfecter comfort testifieth dead blessed die lorde addeth reason thenceforth reste labour ought muche tenderly folow affection loue set vp wrongful manner praying churche truely hathe meane wysdome dothe sone perceiue red hereof olde wryters done beare common vsage ignorance people selues also graunte caried away errour euen vnaduised lightnesse belefe wont rob men wittes iudgement meane tyme redynge doth shew howe doubtyngly comende prayer dead augustine boke cofessions reporteth monica mother earnestly desire might remembred celebrating misteries altar old wyues request whiche sonne neuer examined rule scripture according affectio nature wold haue allowed booke made care dead conteineth many doubtinges right ought coldnesse thereof quenche heate foolyshe zele man desyre proctor dead men truely colde lykelyhodes wyll bryng care careful one piller doyng despised custome growen vse dead prayed though graut olde wryters church charitable vse help dead yet must styll holde one rule whiche deceiue lawefull v prayer vse thynge owne requestes must made subiect worde god wyll apoynte wyll haue asked nowe whole lawe gospel muche one syllable geue lybertie praye dead prophane abuse inuocation god attempt commaundeth v aduersaries maye boaste thei haue auncient churche companion errrour say great difference betweene thei vsed memoriall dead least seme haue cast away care therwithall confesse doubted state purgatory affirmed nothing held thing vncertaine men require haue yt whiche haue dreamed purgatorie holden wtout questio article faith sclenderly passe lightly ouer communion holy supper commende dead god continually call vpon care dead importunate praysing make preferred aboue dutiefull workes charitie yea harde v brynge forth testimony olde wryters doe manifestly ouerthrowe prayer dead whiche weare vsed augustine teacheth men loke resurrection fleshe eternall glorie euery man receiueth rest yt foloweth death hom ioan worthy dieth therfore testifieth godly doe immediatly death enioye blessed rest well prophetes apostle martyr estate suche beseche shal prayer auaile passe ouer grosser superstition wherwith haue bewitched mindes simple whiche yet innumerable part monstruous haue honest collour excuse also let passe moste filthy byings sellinges haue vsed ye worlde suche gro e senslesse ignorance neuer make ende also reader shal without rehearsal haue sufficient wherupon may stablishe conscience sixt chapter pof life christian man first argumentes scripture exhorteth v therunto haue already sayd marke whereunto regeneration tendeth life faithful shold appeare agrement consent betwene righteousnesse god obedience shoulde confirme adoption whereby receiued bee child although lawe coteine selfe newnesse wherby image god restored v yet dulnesse hathe nede many prickinges forwarde helpes therfore shalbe profitable gather diuerse place scripture order framing life haue desirous mynde amendemet may wander way endeuour take vpon framing christian man life ignorant entre manifold plentuous argument suche may greatnesse therof fill long volume wold absolutely entreate pointes se great legth stretched exhortatorie oration olde writer made euery one one seueral vertue yt done muche idle babbling euer vertue man purpose set oration stile runeth self largenes plentie matter yt man seme haue discoursed well vnlesse haue spoken muche mind stretche far institution life promise teache peculiarly go euery speciall vertue wander abrode exhortation let suche thinges fetched men writinges specially homelies olde father shalbe enough shewe orderly trade wherby godly man may guided right marke framing life shortly apoint certain vniuersall rule whiche may well trie duty shal paraduenture season fit tyme make declamatios wyll leaue whiche selfe mete doe doe naturally lo e shortnesse peraduenture woulde speake large woulde frame well longer manner teaching wer neuer muche pleasyng yet would scarce haue mynde put profe course present worke requyreth knyt vp simple doctrine great shortnesse maye phylosophers haue certaine endes right honestie whiche deriue particular duty al companie vertues scripture without order matter holdeth moste goodly well ordred disposition muche certaine phylosophers order onely difference vaine glorious men haue diligentlye endeuoured atteine exquisite plainesse order shewe fourth ready aptnesse theyr wytte spirite god taught without curious affectation hath exactely continuallye kept orderly trade whiche yet hee sometyme vseth doth sufficiently declare neglected v instruction scripture teacheth whereof nowe speake standeth chiefely vpon two partes first poured brought myndes loue ryghteousnesse whiche otherwyse nature nothyng inclyned seconde rule sette oute vnto v maye suffer v goe waye folowyng ryghteousnesse commendation righteousnesse hath bothe manye good reason whiche haue herebefore diuerse place spoken shall place briefely touche foundation maye better beginne putteth v mynde yt must holy god holye scattered abrode lyke straying shepe dispersed abrode maze worlde gathered v together agayne ioyne v one flocke hym selfe heare mention made ioynyng god lette v remember holynesse must bond therof merite holinesse come common hym rather must first clea e vnto hym beyng endued holynesse may folowe whether calleth greatly perteineth glorie haue felowship wickednesse vncleannesse therfore also teacheth ende callyng whiche ought alwaye haue respect vnto wee wyll answere god calleth v purpose drawen wickednesse filthenesse worlde geue selues leaue lyfe long wallowe styll moreouer also admonysheth v ende maye reckened among people god must dwell holy citie hierusalempsa xxxvviii psal iviixxiii whiche hath halowed selfe vnlawefull vnholyly profaned vncleannesse inhabitantes hence came sayinges shall haue place tabernacle god walke without spot studie followe ryghteousnesse c meete sanctuarie wheron dwelleth lyke stable full filthinesse better awake v sheweth god father hath ioyned v self chist hath printed image v whiche would haue v fashioned nowe let finde better order among phylosophers thinke phylosophie concerning manner orderly framed wyll excellently well exhorte v vertue bring nothynge el shold liue agreably nature scripture bringeth exhortation true welspring whe teacheth v referre life god authour whome bond also hath taught swarued kynde true originall state creation immediatly addeth christ whome come againe fauour god set v example expresse forme therof life may man require effectual one thing ye maye manne require thys onelye thynge lorde hathe adoption made v chyldren condition lyfe shoulde resemble christe bond adoptio geue auowe selues righteousnesse moste wicked breach allegiaunce depart creatour also forsweare sauiour scripture taketh matter exhortation benefites god whiche reherseth vnto v partes saluation sheweth sithe god hath shewed himselfe father vnto vsmal ivi worthy condemned extreeme vnthankfulnesse likewise oure behalfe shewe oure selues child vnto himephe vi iho iiii ephe xv sithe christe hathe cleansed v washing blood hath made v partaker cleansing baptisme semely spotted newe filthinesse sithe hath graffed v body must carefullye take hede sprincle spot blott vpon v hys membersheb x cor vi sithe self head ascended heauen behoueth v laying awaye earthly affection doe heart aspire heauenward sithe holy ghost hath dedicated v temple god must endeuour god glorie may honorably set vsi cor vi pet ixv iho xviij ephe v colos iii cor iii ii cor vi thess v v muste doe thyng may bee prophaned filthynesse synne sithe soule body ordeyned heauenly incorruption vnperishing crowne must diligently trauayll may kept pure vncorrupted vnto day lord say best layed foundation bylde man lyfe suche lyke found among phylosophers whiche commendation vertue doe neuer climbe aboue naturall dignitie man heare fit place speake vnto hauing nothynge title badge christ yet would named christian face doe boste holy name sithe none haue felowship christ haue receiued true knowledge hym worde gospellephe iiii apostle sayeth haue ryghtly learned christ taught must cast alway old man corrupted according desire errour haue put christ therfore proued falsly yea wrongfully pretende knowledge christ although eloquently roundely talke gospell doctrine tong life coceiued learning wt vnderstading memorie receiued possesseth whole soule findeth seate place hold moste inward affection heart therfore either let cesse sclau der god boste yt ar let shew selues vnworthy scholar christ maister haue geuen ye first place doctrine wherin religion coteined saluatio beginneth must poured hearte passe maners yea transforme v vnfrutefull vnto v ye phylosophers iustly chafe shamefull reproche driue copanie yt professing art yt ought scholemaistres life turne sophistical babbling much better reason shal detest trifling sophisters yt cotented role gospel vpon ye top tonges ye effectual working wherof ought pearce innermost affectios heart rest soul alter whole man hundred time cold exhortation phylosophers yet require manner christia man sauour nothing absolute gospel neuerthelesse wished must endeuour v toward seuerely require gospellike perfection yt wold acknowledge christian yt hath yet atteined vnto al excluded fro churche sith man found yt great space distant many haue hetherto litle way proceded toward yet vniustly cast away let yt set marke eye whiche alone endeuour may directed let apointed gole v runne trauaile vnto lawfull thee make partitio god take vpo thee part thinges yt comauded thee word leaue part thine owne choise first euery comendeth integritie chefe parte worshippinge word meaneth pure simplicitie mynde yt without deceitfull colour faining whiche doble heart set contrarie shold sayd yt beginning liuing vprightly spiritual ye inward affection mind without faining dedicate god obserue holinesse rightuousnesse man earthly prison ye body hathe great strength haste suche freshnesse runing perfectly ought greater number feble yt staggering halting yea creping vpon ground auaunce slowly forward let v euery one go according ye measure litle power procede iourney begon man shal go vntowardly shal eueryday get ground thoug litle therfore let v cesse trauail yt may cotinually procede somwhat ye way ye lord let u despeire vpon ye sclendernesse going forward howsoeuer ye successe answer oure desire yet wee haue lost laboure day passeth yesterday yt pure simplicitie loke vnto mark long toward end course soothingly flattering selues tenderly bearing wt euyls continuall endeuour trauailing yt may stil become better tha selues till atteine goodnesse selfe whiche deede seke followe lyfe long shall atteine vnclothed weakenesse fleshe shalbe receiued full fellowship therof seuenth chapter pthe summe christian lyfe utreated forsaking selues albeit lawe lorde haue moste aptly well disposed order frame man life yet semed good heauenly scholemaister instruct yet exact trade rule set fourth lawe beginning trade dutie faithfull yelde body god liuingrom xlii holy acceptable sacrifice vnto therein standeth true worshipping hereupon gathered occasion exhorte men applie selues fashio world transformed renewinge mynde may proue wyll god great thyng consecrate dedicate god shoulde thencefourth thynke speake imagine nothing glorie thyng consecrate applied vnholy v without great wrong done vnto hym lordes appeareth errour auoyded whereunto doynges life directed owne therfore let neither owne reason owne wyll beare rule counselles doynges owne therfore let v make end v tend vnto seke whiche may expediet v according flesh owne thertore muche may let v forget selues thynges owne side god therfore let v lyue dye hym god therfore lette wisdome wyll gouerne doinges god therfore lette partes life tende towarde onlye lawfull end oh howe muche hathe profited hauinge learned hymselfe owne hath taken hym selfe rule gouernement selfe geue godro xiiiiviii ye moste strong working pestilence destroy men obey themselues hauen safetie neither knowe wyll thing hym selfe folow god going let therfore first steppe man departe selfe may apply force wit ye obeying lord obeying cal onely whiche standeth obedience worde wherby mynd manephe iiiixxiii voide sensualitie flesh bendeth selfe wholly god spirite trasformation whiche paul calleth renewing minde first entrie life al ye phylosophers ignoraunt make reason gouernesse man thinke ought heard finally geue assigne rule manner christian phylosophie biddeth geue placegal ixx yeld subiect holy ghost yt man mai liue beare christ liuing reignig hereupon followeth also point seeke thinges owne thinges accordinge lorde make aduauncement glory also profe great profiting manner forgetting selues altogether leauing ye regarde selues trauail employ study god comaundemetes scripture biddeth v leaue priuate regarde selues doth race mindes couetousnesse hauing gredy seking power fauour men also roteth ambition al desire worldly glorie secrete pestilence truly christia man must fashioned disposed thinke throughout al life hath god sort shal examine al doings god iudgement shal reuerently direct vnto earnestly bent diligence minde hath learned loke vpo god thinges hath therewithall turned away vaine thoughtes forsaking selues whiche christe euen first beginning instructio earnestly gaue charge disciple whiche one hath gotten possession ye heart leaueth place first neither pride disdainfulnesse vain glorious bosting neither couetise filthy lust ryotousnesse deintinesse euils engendred loue selues cotrariwise whersoeuer reigneth either moste filthy vice range without shame ther spice vertue corrupted peruerse desire glory shew man thou canst vnlesse haue forsaken selfe according commaundement lorde owne free vse goodnesse among men haue ben possessed feling haue folowed vertue haue done ye least praise sake phylosophers euer moste affirmed vertue desired selfes sake puffed vp great pride appeared desired vertue thinge might haue matter proude vpon god nothing deli ed neither gapers people breath swelling beastes pronouceth yt thei haue already receiued rewarde world maketh harlottes publicanes nerer kingdome heauen yet haue throughly declared many great stoppes hindreth whiche right long hath forsaken selfe truely sayde tyme past world vice hidden soule man thou canst finde remedy denying thy selfe leauing regarde thy selfe bende thy mynde seeke thinges lorde requireth thee seke therfore please place paul doth plainly although shortly goe throughe partes well ordred lifetit iixii saying grace god bryngeth saluation vnto men hathe appeared teacheth v denie vngodlynesse worldly lustes lyue sobre mynded ryghteously godly present world loking blessed hope glorious appearing ye mighty god sauiour iesus christ whiche gaue selfe v redeme v vnryghteousnesse purge v peculiar people vnto selfe feruently geue vnto good workes hath set forth grace god encourage make redy waye v worshyppe god taketh awaye twoo steppe doe moste hynder v saye ungodlinesse wherunto naturally muche enclined worldly desire whiche extende vnder name vngodlinesse meaneth superstition also comprehendeth disagreeth earnest feare god worldly lustes effect much affection fleshe therfore commaundeth v respect table ye lawe put owne wit forsake owne reason wyll informeth v doinges lyfe bringeth thre partes sobrietie righteousnesse godlinesse whiche sobrietie without doubt signifieth well chastitie temperaunce pure measurably sparing vse temporall thinges pacient sufferance pouertie righteousnesse conteineth al duty equitie geue euery man owne thirde godlinesse seuereth v defilinges worlde true holinesse ioyneth v god thinges knyt together vnseparable knot make full perfection muche nothing hard forsaking reason fleshe yea subduing renouncing desire geue selues god brother studie angelike life filthy state earth therefore paul loose myndes snare calleth v back hope blessed immortalitie admonishing v stryue vaine christ hath one appered redemer last coming shall shewe frute saluation hath purchaced thus driueth away enticementes blynde v make v aspire ought heauenly glorie yea teacheth must trauaill men home worlde heauenly inheritaunce lost fall away v nowe wordes perceiue forsaking selues hath partly respect menrom xiixx phi iiiii partly yea chiefly god scripture biddeth v behaue selues men preferre v honour faithfully employ selues wholly procure commodity therfore greueth commaundementes mynde able receiue first beinge made voide naturall sense suche blyndnesse runne loue selues euery man thinketh self haue iust cause aduaunce selfe despise comparison self god haue geuen v good gift bearing selues bolde therof lift vp courage swell maner burste pryde vice wherwith abound diligetly hyde selues flatteringly faine light scle der sometime embrace vertues good giftes whiche prayse selues better doe appere least compelled geue place enuiousnesse deface fynde fault faultes contented seuerely sharpely marke also odiously amplifie hereupo groweth insolence euery one v though priuileged commo estate would hier rest carelesly proudely set light euery despise inferiours poore yeld ye rich base people gentleman seruantes maisters vnlearned learned man doth nourish within opinio excellencie euery man flatteryng beareth certaine kingdome brest presumptuously takyng vpon somwhat whereby please themselues iudge vpon wittes manner menne yf come contention bursteth poyson many doe make shewe great mekenesse longe finde thinges gentle louely howe many one kepeth continuall course modestie whe pricked stirred anger remedie hereof moste hurtfull pestilence loue soueraigntie selfe loue rooted bottome heartes rooted doctrine scripture taught muste remember good giftes god hath geuen v owne good thynges free giftes god wherof yf proude bewraye owne vnthakefulnesse whoe maketh thee excelli cor iiijvij paule sayth yf thou haste receyued al thinges doest thou boste yf geuen thee muste continuall reknowledgyng faul e call selues ck humilitie shal remayne v nothyng proude shalbe much matter abace selues agayne commaunded whatsoeuer giftes god see men reuerence esteme giftes also honour menne great lewdnesse v take honor ye god hath vouchesaued geue fault taught winke cherish flattering reason faultes triumphe agaynst whome ought beare good honour shall ome passe wyth man euer haue doe shall chaue selues temperatly modestly also gently frendly man shal neuer come way true mekenesse yf haue heart endued abacyng hymselfe reuerencyng howe hard thee thy dutie sekyng profit thy neyghbour thou shalt herin labour vayne vnlesse thou depart regard thy selfe manner put thy selfe howe canst thou performe thynges paule teacheth bee workes charitie vnlesse thou forsake thy self geue thy self wholy otheri cor x iiij charitie sayth patient gentle proude disdaynefull enuieth swelleth seketh owne angry c one thyng required seke thing owne shall doe small violence nature whiche bendeth v loue selues doth easily suffer v negligently passe ouer selues owne thynges watch men comodities yea depart owne right igne scripture leade v thether hand warneth v euer gracious giftes obteyne lord comitted vnto v vpo conditio shold bestowed comon benefit church therfore true vse al god grace liberal bountiful comunicating certaine rule forceable exhortation could deuised keping tha thaught good giftes haue thynges god deliuered comitted trust vpo codition shuld disposed benefit neighbour ye scripture goeth yet copareth power wherewith bers man body endued meber hath power applieth priuate vse poureth abrode membres body taketh profit therof procedeth comon comoditie whole body whatsoeuer godly man able ought able brethre prouiding none otherwise priuately minde bent comon edificatio church let therfore order kindnesse doyng good whatsoeuer god hath bestowed vpo v wherby may help neighbour ye baylies therof bound render accompt disposyng right disposing tried ye rule loue shal come passe shal alway ioyne trauail men comoditie care owne profit also set care owne happen bee ignorant true lawe disposyng giftes receyue god hath olde time set lawe euen smalest giftes liberalitieexo xxijxxix xxiij xix commaunded first frutes corne offred vnto whiche people might testifie vnlawfull take frute good first consecrate giftes god onely sanctified vnto v haue owne hande dedicate authour thereof euidet vntrue abuse thereof doth fauour suche dedication shalbe vayne thee goe enriche lord communicatyng thy thing therefore sithe thy liberalitie extende vnto himps xviiij heb xiijxvi prophet saith thou must vse toward saintes earth therfore almes compared holy oblation maye nowe correspondent lawe shuld wery doyng good otherwise must needes come quickly passe thing must adioyned ye apostle speaketh ofi cor xiijiiij charitie patiet moued anger lord comaudeth good al vniuersally great part vnworthy thei cosidered owne deseruing ye scripture helpeth wt good meane whe teacheth must haue respect deserue theselues image god considered men owe honour loue diligently marked householde saythgal vix muche renewed restored spirit christ therfore whatsoeuer thou light vpon needeth thy helpe thou hast cause withdraw selfe fro doyng good thou say stranger ye lord hath geue marke ye ought familiar vnto thee reason forbiddeth thee despise thine owne fleshesa iviijvii thou say yt base nought worth lord sheweth one hath vouchesaued geue beautie image thou saye thou owest nothing thing hath done thee god hath set place respect whome thou knowest many great benefites wherwith hathe bound thee vnto thou say yt vnworthy thou shuldest labour thing al sake image god whereby comended thee worthy thou shouldest geue thy selfe thou hast vnto yf haue deserued good thy hande also prouoked thee wronges euell doyngesmatt vixxiiii xviijxxxv euen iuste cause thou shuldest cesse loue dutifull workes loue thou wilt saye hath far otherwise deserued hath ye lord deserued co maundeth thee forgeue wherein hath offended thee truely willeth imputed himselfluc xvijiij truely ye way come vtterly agaynst nature much hard man meane loue hate v recompense euel doyng goodmatth vxliiij render blessynges reporches remeber muste consider malice men loke vpon image god whiche defacing blotting fault doeth beautie dignitie self allure v embrace therfore mortification shal take place v performe dueties charitie performeth doeth dutifull workes charitie although leaue none vndone doth syncere affection loue maye happen man maye fully performe menne oweth muche concerneth outward duty yet maye far true performyng maye see would seeme liberall whiche yet doe geue nothyng eyther pryde loke chorlishnesse wordes vpbrayde become suche wretchednesse vnhappy worlde almoste almes geuen menne least moste parte men without reprochyng whiche peruersnesse haue ben tolerable among heathen christian somwhat required shew cherefulnesse cou tenance make doynges louely gentlenesse wordes first must take vpon personage whome see neede helpe pitie case yf themselues dyd fele suffer maye bee caried felynge mercie gentlenesse euen would helpe themselues shall come minded helpe brother defile doynges arrogante vpbraydyng also neyther despise brother whome doeth good one needyng helpe treade hym vnder foote one bounde vnto vse reproche sicke member easyng whereof whole body laboreth thynke specially bounde member bycause hath drawen helpe vnto hath recompensed thought common enterpartenyng duty betwene member one body hath free kynde gifte rather payement whiche beyng due lawe nature monstruous denie reason shall follow may thinke discharged hath performed one kinde dutie commonly vsed riche manne hath geuen thing owne leaueth charge men belongyng rather euery manne shall thinke thus himselfe altogether detter neyghbours must determine none ende vsyng liberalitie abilitie fayleth large euer must measured rule charitie nowe let v fully declare principall parte forsakyng selues whiche sayd haue respecte god haue sayd muche already whiche superfluous rehearse agayne shalbe sufficient entreate far frameth v quietnesse minde sufferance first therefore sekyng commoditie quietnesse present life scripture calleth v herunto resignyng v thinges lordes wil yeld vnto affection heart tamed subdued cou wealth honor compasse authoritie heape vp rich gather together al folly serue royaltie pope lust outragious gredinesse infinite side pouertie ignobilitie base estate haue maruellous feare maruellous hatred moue v trauaile al meanes eschue hereby man may see vnquiet minde haue many shiftes attempt study wery life frame life owne deuise atteyne thinges affection ambitio couetousnesse requireth side escape pouertie basenesse therfore godly must kepe waye entangled snare first let either desire hope thinke vpon meane prosperyng blessing lord therfore let safely boldely rest theselues vpon euer flesh thinke self sufficient self eyther trauaileth owne diligence endeuoreth owne studie holpen sauour men atteyning honour wealth yet certayne thinges nothing shall nothyng preuayle wit trauaile much lord shall prosper bothe side blessyng findeth waye al stoppes make thinges procede v ioyfull lucky end soeuer maye moste obteyne glorie wealth without dayly see wycked get heapes greate honour richesse yet much vpon whome resteth curse fele parcell felicitie obteine nothing without blessing shal turne v euell coueted maketh men miserable therefore yf beleue meane prosperous successe wished cosisteth blessing god beyng absent kindes miserie calamitie muste happen vnto v remayneth also gredyly endeuour wealth honour standing vpon owne finesse wit diligence leauing fauour men trustyng vpon vayne imagination fortune alwaye looke vnto lord led guidyng euer lot hath prouided first shall come passe shall violently rush catchyng richesse inuadynge honour wronge guile euell crasty meanes extortion doyng iniurie neighbour shal onely followe fortune maye leade v innocence whoe maye hope helpe god blessyng among fraudes extortios suttle meanes wickednesse god blessing followeth man thinketh purely doeth rightly calleth back desired fro croked thoughtes corrupt doynges shalbe bridled burne inmeasurable desire growyng riche ambitiously gape honor face may man trust holpen god obteine thynges desireth agaynst worde god forbidde god geue helpe blessyng whiche curseth mouth last succede according wish hope yet shalbe restrayned impatience cursyng estate soeuer bycause know murmure agaynst god whose richesse pouertie basenesse honor disposed brefely resteth hymselfe suche sorte aforesayd vpon blessyng god neyther euell suttelties hunt thinges menne wont outragiously couet whiche crafty meanes thinketh shall nothyng preuayle yf thyng happen prosperously impute hymselfe owne diligence endeuour fortune assigne god authour yf men estate doe florish goe sclenderly forward yea slide backeward yet beare ill fortune greater quietnesse moderation mynde prophane manne wil beare meanely good successe whiche altogether good desired bycause hath comfort wherein maye quietly rest vpon hiest toppe wealth authoritie bycause accompteth thinges ordered god auailable saluation see dauid mindedps cxxxi yeldeth himselfe ruled god declareth himselfe like weyned childe walketh hye thinges maruellous aboue godly mindes ought haue quietnesse sufferace consistyng behalf also muste extend al chaunces wherunto present life subiect therfore hath rightly forsaken himselfe hath resigned himselfe vp wholly lord suffreth partes lyfe gouerned framed minde euer happen neyther thinke himselfe miserable enuiousnesse agaynste god complayne fortune howe necessarie affection shall hereby appere yf consider howe many chaunces subiect diuerse kyndes disease doe trouble v sometime pestilence cruelly reigneth sometime sharply vexed calamity warre somtime frost haile deuouring ye hope yere bringeth barennesse yt driueth v dearth somtime wife parentes child kinsfolkes taken awaye death house consumed fier thinges chauncyng whereof men curse life derest day birth haue heaue light execration murmure god thei eloquent blasphemy accuse vniustice crueltie faythfull manne muste euen chaunces beholde mercyfull kindenesse fatherly tendernesse god therefore whether see house destroied kinsefolke slayne yet therfore cesse prayse god rather turne himselfe thought yet grace lord dwelleth house leaue desolate yf corne blasted bitten consumed frostes beaten downe hayle see famine hand yet despeyr speake hatefully godps ixxixx ij remayne confidence yet lordes protection shepe brought vp pasture therfore finde v foode euen extremest barrennesse bee troubled sicknesse eue discouraged bitternesse sorrow burst impatience quarell thus god consideryng righteousnesse lenitie god correctio call back patience finally euer shall happen bicause knoweth ordeined hand god take well pleased thankefull minde least stubbornly resist authoritie whose power hath yelded himselfe therfore let foolish miserable comfort heathen far christian man heart stregthen mindes agaynst aduersities impute fortune whome copted oolish angry bicause blinde vnaduised blindely wounded bothe deseruing vndeseruyng contrarywise rule godlinesse hand god iudge gouernesse bothe fortune runneth forward vnaduised sodeyne rage orderly iustice dealeth among v bothe good thinges euell eight chapter p bearyng crosse whiche part forsakyng selues godly minde muste yet climbe vp hier euen whereunto christ calleth disciple yt euery one take vp crossemat xvi whome lorde hath chosen vouchesaued receiue companie must prepare theselues hard trauailsome vnquiet life full many diuerse kindes incomodities heauenly father exercise sort may haue true profe beginnyng christ first begotten sonne procedeth order toward al childrenmatt iiixvii xviiv wheras christ best beloued sonne aboue reste whome father minde fully pleased yet see tederly deintily handeled maye truely sayd yt exercised perpetual crosse long dwelled earth life nothinge el kinde continuall crosse apostle sheweth cause thereof behoued learne obedience thinges suffred priuilege selues estate whereunto behoued christ hed subiect specially sithe became subiect thereunto cause shew v example patience therefore apostle sayth apointed end child godro viiji fashioned lyke vnto whereupon also harde sharpe chaunces reckened aduersities euels ariseth great comfort vnto v comunicate suffringes christ entred maze trouble heauenly glorie maye diuerse tribulation brought glorie sayth paule himselfact xiiijxxii phil iijx learne communicating affliction also conceyue power resurrection fashioned like vnto death prepared felowship glorious risyng agayne howe much maye auayle aswage painefulnesse crosse afflicted aduersities muche surely felowship christ confirmed communicating whereof suffringes made blessed vnto v also much help v furtherance saluation byside lord neede take vpon beare crosse testifie proue obedience father diuerse cause haue neede leade life vnder cotinual crosse first naturally bent attribute thinges flesh vnlesse weakenesse shewed v eye easily esteme owne stregth aboue due measure doubte soeuer happen wil cotinue vnbroken vnouercome al hard assaultes whereby caried foolish vaine confidence flesh trusting therupon stubbornly waxe proude god though owne power without grace suffice v arrogancie ca way better beate tha whe proueth vnto v experience feble also fraile therfore afflicteth v either shame pouertie losse childre sicknesse calamity beyng vnable beare respect selues doe sinke downe vnder beyng humbled learne call vpon strength whiche maketh v stand vpright vnder heauy burden afflictios yea moste holy wel euer know stand grace god owne force yet muche assured owne strength constancie vnlesse tryall crosse bring inward knowledge theselues slouthfulnesse crept dauidps xxxvi sayd rest shall neuer moued lorde thou hadst stablished thy good pleasure strength hill thou hiddest awaye thy face striken confesseth sluggishnesse prosperitie sens dulled regardyng grace god vpon whiche haue hanged leaned vnto himselfe promise himselfe perpetuall continuance chauced great prophet v ought fearfull may heedefull therefore whereas prosperitie flatter themselues opinion greater constancie patience one humbled aduersitie learne former opinion hypocrisie faythfull saye beyng admonished example disease thereby profit humilitie beyng vnclothed wrongfull confidence flesh maye resort grace god one come grace fele presence god strength wherein abundantly sufficent succour paule teacheth trouble engendred paciencero viij paciece profe whereas god hath promised faithfull present trouble fele true stande patiently beyng vpholden hande theyr owne stregth able patience therfore bringeth profe experience holy one god neede requireth deede performe ye help hath promised thereby also hope confirmed asmuche much vnthankefulnesse loke time come truth god already experience proued constant sure see howe many good thinges doe come vnto v one knot crosse ouerthrowyng opinion falsly presume owne strength disclosing hypocrisie deliteth v shaketh awaye hurtfull confidence fleshe teacheth v beyng humbled rest vpon god commeth passe neyther oppressed fall downe victorie foloweth hope much lord performing hath promised stablisheth credit truthe time come truely although moe reason appereth much exercise crosse necessarie v matter small importance haue blinde loue thy selfe wiped away thou mayst wel know thine owne weakenesse fele thine owne weakenesse thou mayest learne distrust thy selfe distrust thy selfe thou mayst remoue thy confidence thy selfe vnto god rest confidence heart vpon god beyng vpholden help thou mayst continue vnouercomme last end stande fast grace thou mayest vnderstad true promise know profe truthe promise thy hope may strengthened thereby lord hath also end afflictyng trie patience instruct v obedience vse obedience toward geueth pleaseth hym open example make approued witness set forth grace hath bestowed vpon holy one lie idly hidde within therefore bringyng forth open shewe strength suffrance constancie wherwith hath furnished seruauntes sayd tryeth pacience hense came sayenges god tempted abraham profe godlinessegen xijj refused offer vp sacrifice owne sonne therefore peter teacheth fayth proued trouble vij golde tried fornace whoe say expedient moste noble gift pacience faithful man hath receyued god shuld brought forth vse may made certainely knowen manifest otherwise men esteme worthy god doth rightfully ministreth matter stirre vp vertues hath geuen faithfull lie hidden yea lye vnprofitable perish good reason affliction holy one without patience shold nothyng saye also crosse instructed obedience bicause taught liue owne wish god truely thinges flowe vnto owne minde would know folow god de uit bed cap seneca reherseth olde prouerbe exhorted man suffer aduersities folow god whiche declared truely entred vnder yoke god yelded hand backe god correction nowe righteous shewe selues thinges obedient heauely father ought refuse meanes accustome v yeld obedience vnto yet perceyue howe necessarie obedience v vnlesse also consider wanton fleshe shake yoke god sone hath ben litle deintily tenderly handled happeneth vnto chaunceth stubborne horse whiche yf fewe dayes pampred idlely afterward fearcenesse tamed neyther know rider whose gouernement somwhat obeyeddeu xxxii xv continual v god coplayneth haue ben people israel beyng well fed couered fatnesse kick agaynst fed nourished v liberalitie god shuld deede haue allured v consider loue goodnesse asmuche euell nature alwaye corrupted tender vsage necessarie v restrayned discipline runne outragiously stubborne wantonnese grow fierce vnmeasurable abundance richesse shuld waxe proude beyng lifted vp honor become insolent beyng puffed vp good giftes eyther soule body fortune lord foreseeth expedient preuenteth remedie crosse subdueth bridleth fearcenesse fleshe diuerse wayes much healthfull euery man like sicke one disease like neede hard healyng thereupon seene howe exercised one kinde crosse whereas heauenly physician handleth getly purgeth sharper remedy meaneth prouide health yet leaueth none free vntouched bycause knoweth without exception diseased moreouer moste mercifull father needeth preuent weakenesse many time correct passed offence therfore oft afflicted remembrance forepassed ought entre minde without doubt shall finde haue done somewhat worthy chastisement yet ought chefely ground exhortation patience vpon acknowlegyng sinne scripture ministreth v far better considerationi cor xiviij sayth lord correcteth v aduersities damned worlde therefore ought euen sharpnesse tribulation acknowlege kindnesse goodnesse father toward v asmuch eue cesseth saluation doth afflict destroy kil v rather deliuer v fro danation world thought shall leade v scripture teacheth placepro iijxi sonne refuse lordes correctio wery thou shalt rebuked whome lord loueth correcteth embraceth father doth childe know rod rod father dutie rather shewe selues obedient child willyng learne obstinatie like desperate men hardened euell doynges lord leseth v vnlesse call v backe correction fallen awaye authour epistle hebrewes rightly sayth bastardeshebr xijviij child yf correction therfore froward yf suffer whe declareth good care hath saluatio scripture teacheth differece betwene vnbeleuers faythful vnbeleuers bond slaues rooted hardened wickednesse made worse obstinate wt whippyng faithful like childre hauing honest freedome nature therby profit repetace must thou choose whether nuber thou wilt bicause haue spoken matter place cotent touche briefly make end moreouer singular comfort suffer persecution righteousnesse ought thinke great honor god vouchesaueth graunt v garnisheth v peculiar marke souldiours meane suffer persecution righteousnesse suffer defense gospell also troubled defense righteousnesse whether therfore maineteynyng truthe god agaynst lie satan takyng hande defense good n innocentes agaynst wronges wicked driuen runne displeasure hatred world whereby life good estimatio may come daunger let greuous lothsome vnto v employ selues god let v think selues miserable thing hath mouth pronouced v blessedmat vx pouertie deede cosidered self miserable likewise banishment conteptious estate prisonment shame finally death vttermost calamity whe fauour god breatheth vpo v ther none al thing turneth felicitie therfore let v rather cotent wt testimonie christ wt false estimation ye flesh shal come passe shal reioyse apostle god shall accopt v worthy suffer reproche name beyng innocet knowing selues clere coscience nougthy dealyng wicked men spoiled good deede brought pouertie therby amonge men richesse truely growe vnto v heauen god thrust house inwardly receiued houshold god vexed despised take muche deper rootes christ noted reproches shame much honorable place kingdome god slayne entrie made open v vnto blessed life let v ashamed esteme lesse thinges vpo lord hath set great pryce shadowysh fickle enticyng pleasure present life sithe therefore scripture doth like admonition geue sufficient comfort shame calamity suffer defense righteousnesse muche vnthankefull yf doe gladly cherefully receyue lordes hande specially sithe kinde crosse moste properly belongyng faythfulli pet iiiixii whereby christ glorified v also peter teacheth greuous gentle nature suffer shame hundred deathesi tim iiii x therefore paule expresly admonisheth shall suffer persecution also reproches bycause trust liuyng god place teacheth v example walke sclaunder good reportii cor viviii yet required v cherefulnesse maye take awaye felyng bitternesse sorrow el patiece holy one crosse patience vnlesse thei bothe tormented sorrow vexed grefe hardinesse pouertie peyne sickenesse grefe shame horrour death valiatnesse temperance beare indifferently euery one doth natural bitternesse therof bitte heartes v herein doth valiantnesse faythfull man shewe self beyng assayed felyng bitternesse greuously euer troubled yet valiantly resistyng ouercommeth patience vttereth selfe herein yf beyng sharply prouoked yet bridled feare god bursteth disteper cherefulnesse appereth herein yf beyng wounded sadnesse sorrowe resteth vpon spirituall comfort god conflict whiche faithfull susteyne agaynst natural felyng sorrow studie patience temperance paul hath wel described wordesii cor iiii viii put distresse al thinges made sorrowfull labour lefte destitute suffer persecution forsaken throwe downe perish see beare crosse patiently altogether astonished without al felyng sorrow stoikes olde time foolishly describe valiant hearted man one puttyng nature man like moued prosperitie aduersitie sorrowfull ioyefull state yea suche one like stone mo ed nothyng haue profited hye wisedome forsothe haue painted image wisedome neuer found neuer herafter among rather coueted haue exact precise patience haue taken awaye vse patience man life day also amog christian newe stoikes recken fault grone w pe also sad carefull strange conclusion commonly procede idle men whiche busieng themselues rather speculation doyng nothyng brede v new found doctrine haue nothyng stony philosophie whiche maister lord hath condemned worde also example mourned wept owne men aduersitiesioh xviixx worlde sayth shall reioyse shall mourne wepe bicause man finde faulte therewith open proclamation hath pronounced blessed mournematth viiij luc xxiixliiij maruell wepyng blamed shal iudge lord whose body dropped blouddy teares euery feare noted infidelitie shall iudge quakyng feare wherewith reade sclenderly striken sadnesse mislyked shal like confesseth soule sad euen death thought good speake ende cal godly mindes despear therfore altogether forsake studie patience bycause put naturall affection sorrow whiche must needes happen make patience senslesse dulnesse valiant constant man stocke scripture geueth holy one prayse patience troubled hardnesse aduersities yet thei ouercome throwe downe pricked bitternesse also delited spirituall ioye distressed grefe yet receyue courage againe beyng cheared comfort god yet meane time repugnancie abideth still heartes naturall sense eschueth dredeth thinges knoweth affection godlinesse trauaileth euen difficulty obeyeng god repugnancie lord expressed sayd thus peterih xxix whe thou waste yong thou didst gird thy self didst walke whether thou woldest thou art old shall gyrde thee leade thee whither thou shalt willyng neyther likely peter time came must glorifie god death drawen vnwillyngly resistyng vnto el martyrdome haue small prayse howe euer great cherefulnesse heart obeye ordinance god yet bicause put nature manne doubly strayned two sortes willes dyd himselfe cosider bloudly death suffer beyng stryken horrour thereof would gladly haue escaped side came minde called vnto commaudement god conqueryng treadyng downe feare gladly yea cherefully toke upon therefore must endeuour yf disciple christ mindes inwardly filled great reuerence obedience god may tame subdue ordinance contrarie affection shall come passe whatsoeuer kinde crosse vexed eue greatest anguish minde shall constantly kepe patience aduersities shal haue sharpnesse wherwith shalbe bitten afflicted sicknesse shal bothe grone disquieted desire health beyng pressed pouertie shalbe pricked inge carefulnesse sorrowe shall striken grefe shame contempt iniurie shall yelde due teares nature burial frendes alway shalbe conclusion lord willed therefore let v folow yea euen middest prickynges sorrow middest mourning teares thought must needes come betwene incline heart take cherefully thinges reason whereof moued asmuche haue taken chefe cause bearyng crosse cosideratio wil god must wordes define difference betwene phylosophical christian patiece truely fewe phylosophers climbed hie reason vnderstand hand god doth exercise v affliction thinke yt god behalf obeyed bryng reason bicause must doe necessitie el say thou must yeld vnto god bicause thou shalt trauail vaine wrastle obey god bicause must necessitie might escape would cesse obey scripture biddeth v consider far thing wil god yt say first iustice equitie care saluatio therfore christian exhortation patience whether pouertie banishmet prisonment shame sickne e losse paretes child like thing greue v must think yt none thinges doth happen wil prouidence god doeth nothyng iust order one innumerable dayly offense deserue chastised sharply greuous correction mercifull kindnesse god layeth vpo v great equitie yt flesh tamed made acquainted yoke yt doe wantonly grow wild according nature righteousnesse truth god worthy shuld take peine appere vndoubted righteousnesse affliction without vnrighteousnesse either murmure wrastle heare cold song must geue place bicause muste necessitie heare liuely lesson ful effectualnesse must obey bycause vnlawfull resist must suffer patiently bycause impatience stubbornesse agaynst righteousnesse god bicause yt thing worthy loued v know safetie benefite good father doth waye also comfort v affirmeth euen afflicteth v crosse prouideth safetie certayne trouble healthful v receyue thankfull well pleased minde therefore patiently suffryng doe forceably yeld necessitie quietly agree owne benefit thoughtes say make muche mindes greued crosse naturall felyng bitternesse much thei cheared spiritual gladnesse wherupo also foloweth thankes geuyng whiche without ioye prayse lord thankes geuyng procedeth nothing chereful ioyful heart nothing yt ought interrupt praising god thankesgeuyng v hereby appereth howe necessarie bitternesse crosse tempered spirituall ioye ix chapter pof meditation life come euer kinde trouble distressed must alwaye loke ende vse selues contempt present life therby stirred meditatio life come bicause god knoweth wel howe much nature enclined beastly loue world vseth fit meane draw v back shake sluggishnesse shuld stick fast yt loue none v desireth seme aspire endeuour al life log heauely immortalitie ashamed excel brute beast nothing whose state nothing inferiour oures vnlesse remaine v hope eternitie death examine deuises study doynges euery man shall finde nothyng therin earth hereupon groweth senslesnesse minde beyng daseled vaine glistering richesse power honor dulled see far heart also beyng possessed couetousnesse ambition lust weyed downe rise vp hier finally al soule entangled enticementes flesh seketh felicitie earth lord remedie euell doth cotinual example misery teach vanitie present life therfore thei promise theselues life soud quiet peace suffreth many time disquieted troubled either warres vprores robbery iniuries much gredinesse gape fraile transitorie richesse rest richesse yt already possesse somtime banishment sometime barrennesse earth somtime fire somtime meanes bringeth pouertie least holdeth measure muche ease take pleasure benefites mariage eyther maketh bee vexed frowardnesse wiues plucketh downe wt ill childre punisheth wat issue al thing tenderly beareth yet least either swell foolish glorie inmeasurably reioyse vaine confidence doth disease danger set eye vnstable vanishing al good subiect mortalitie therfore rightly profit discipline crosse learne yt life considered self vnquiet troublesome innumerable wayes miserable point fully blessed yt reckened good thinges thereof vncertaine fickle vaine corrupted many euels mixed herupo determine nothing sought hoped strife whe thinke crowne muste lifte vp eye heauen thus muste beleue minde neuer truely raysed desire meditation life come vnlesse haue first conceyued contempt present life betwene two meane earth must either become vile sight holde v bound intemperate loue therfore haue care eternitie must diligetly endeuour loose selues fro fetter bicause preset life hath many flatteryng pleasure wherewith allure v great shewe pleasantnesse grace swetenesse wherwith delite v much behoueful v called away bewitched alluremetes pray would done enioy continual concourse good thing felicitie sithe continuall spurres euels sufficiently awaked consider miserie thereof learned doe knowe also common people haue prouerbe common man life like smoke shadow bycause sawe bee thyng profitable knowen haue set many notable senteces nothyng either negligently consider lesse remember goe aboute thinges though would frame selues immortalitie earth ther corp caried burial walk amog graues bicause image death eye graunt maruelously well discourse like phylosophers vpon vanitie life albeit yt cotinually many time al thing nothing moue v happeneth philosophie lasteth sone turne backes wanisheth awaye leaueth steppe al remebrance behinde finally passeth away clapping hades vpo stage pleasant sight forgetting death also yt subiect death though neuer heard report therof fall carelesse assurednesse earthly immortalitie meane time tel v ye prouerbe man creature dayes continuance graunt deede heedelesly yt still thought euerlastyng continuance resteth minde whoe therfore denie great profit v admonished wordes exaples experiece may couinced ye miserable estate earthly life asmuche euen conuinced scarcely cesse stand amased peruerse foolish admiratio though co teined vttermost end good thinges necessarie yt god instruct v dutie likewise behalues harken calleth awaketh dulnesse despisyng world may al heartes endeuour meditatio life come let faithfull accustome themselues suche despisyng present life maye neither engendre hatred thereof vnthankfulnesse toward god life howsoeuer ful infinite misery yet worthily reckened amog sclender blessynges god therfore acknowlege benefit god gilry small vnthankfulnesse toward god himselfe specially ought bee faythfull testimonie god good asmuche wholy directed furtherance saluation openly deliuer vnto v inheritance eternall glorye hys shewe hymselfe father vnto v smaller example benefites dayely bestowed vpon v sithe therefore life serueth v vnderstand goodnesse god shal disdaine though crume goodnesse must therefore put felyng affection recken among giftes goodnesse refused though wanted testimony scripture many euident nature self doth exhort v geue thakes lorde hath brought v light graunteth v vse geueth v necessarie succor preseruation muche greater reason yf consider certayne manner prepared glorie heauenly kingdome lorde hath ordeyned whiche time come shalbe crowned heauen must fight certaine battels earth triumph till ouercome hard aduentures battel obteyned victorie reason yt diuerse benefites beginne therin taste swetenesse god liberalitie hope desire whetted long reuelyng thereof determined gift god clemencie lyue earthly lyfe whiche bound vnto ought mindefull thankfull shal fit order come cosider miserable estate therof end yt may deliuered fro much gredinesse wherunto haue sayd selues naturally enclined euer taken wrongfull desire life ought added ye desire better life graut deede thei thought truely thought best borne next die quickly could beyng destitute light god true religion see therin vnhappy miserable dyd without reason mourned wepte birthes frendes solemnely reioysed burial without profit bicause beyng without right doctrine fayth see may turne good godly self neither blessed desired ended iudgement desperation let therfore marke faithful iudgyng mortall life vnderstand self nothing miserie maye resort wholly freshly redily eternall life come come comparison present lyfe maye safely neglected also vtterly despysed lothed comparison heauen contrey earth el place banishment departyng world entryng lyfe world graue abide el drowned death deliuered bodie set perfect libertie bodye el pryson enioye presence god hyest summe felicitie miserable lacke til escaped worldii cor vvi wander abrode lord therefore earthly life compared heauenly life doutlesse ought despised troden vnder foote neuer hated respect holdeth v subiection sinne yet hatred properly layed vpon life euer yet must moued either werinesse hatred desyrynge end may also redy lorde abide yt werinesse may far grudging impatience like place battell array wherin lorde hath placed v ought kepe tyll call v awayrom viixxiiii paul dede lameteth state holden bond bondes body longer wyshed sigheth feruent desire redemption neuerthelesse obey commaundement lorde professed self ready bothphilip ixxiii acknowledgeth owe vnto god glorifie name either death life god determine moste expedient glory therfore must liue die lorde let v leaue tyme life death styll feruent desire death cotinually occupied meditation therof despise life comparison immortalitie come wyshe forsake shall please lorde bondage sinne monstruous stede desire death manye bost selues christian afrayed tre ble euery mention thing betokening vnluckely vnhappy truely maruell naturall sease v quake fear heare dissoluing v wyse tolerable christian man brest light godlinesse greater comfort ouercome suppresse feare howe great soeuer consider vnstedfast faulty corruptible fraile withering rotten tabernacle body therfore dissolued may afterward restored againe stedfast perfect vncorruptible heauenly glorie shall faith compell v feruently desire whiche nature feareth consider death called home banishmet inhabite contry yea heauenly contrey shall obteine comfort nothinge desireth abide continualli graunt therefore affirme yt ought loke vnto immortalitie come wher may atteine stedfast state appeareth earthii cor vi paul dothe well teache faithfull ought goe cherefully death would vnclothed desyre newly clothed shall brute beastes yea lifeles creature euen stockes stonesrom viiixix knowing present vanitie earnestly bent loking last day resurrection may child god deliuered vanitie shall endued light wyt aboue wyt enlightened spirite god standeth vpon lift vp myndes beyond rottennesse earth perteineth present purpose place speake peruersnesse beginning haue alredie professed would take vpon large handlinge common place would counsel suche fearfull myndes rede cyprian boke mortalitie vnlesse thei mete sent phylosophers may beginne ashamed se contempt death shewe let v hold certainly determined man hath well profited christes schole doth ioyfully loke daye death last resurrection paule describeth faithfull marke paragraph also common scripture call v thither oft set forthe ground perfect gladnesse paragraph reioyce saithe lorde lift vp head redemption commeth nere hande reasonable praie yt thing willed great force raise vp ioye cherefulnesse v sholde brede nothing sorrowe discouragement still boast hym oure scholemaster let v therfore gette sounder minde howsoeuer blinde senslesse desire flesh striue let v doubt wishe comming lorde onely wishinge also groning sighing thing happy shal come redemer v drawe v infinite gulfe euels misery leade v blessed inheritance life glorie certainely true nation faithfull longe dwel earthro viiixx vi cor xvxix must shepe appointed slaughter mate fashioned like christ heade therfore thei moste lamentable case vnlesse thei minde raised vp heauen surmounted worlde passed ouer present face thing contrariwise whe thei haue one lif ed heades aboue earthly thinges although thei see wealth honoures wicked storyshing thei see enioying quiet peace thei see proude gorgiousnesse sumptuousnesse thinges see stowe plentiful store al delites side thei spoyled wickednesse yf susteine reprochfull dealinges theyr pride thei robbed couetousnesse thei vexed outrage thei easily vpholde themselues aduersyties daie shalbe eiesesa xxvxvii reuel viixvii lorde shall receiue faithfull quiet kingdome shal wipe teares theyr eye shall clothe robe glorie gladnesse shall feede vnspeable swetnesse deinties shall aduaunce felowshippe hie estate ynally shall vouchesaue enterparten hys felicitie wyth wycked one haue floryshed ear shall throwe extreeme shame shall change delites tormentes laughing mirth weping gnasshing tethe shall disquiet peace terrible torment co science shall punish deintinesse vnquenchable fier shall put heades subiection godly men whose patience thei haue abusedi thes ivi righteousnes paule testifieth geue release miserable vniustly afflicted render affliction wycked afflict godly lorde iesus shall reueled heauen truely onely comfort whiche taken awaie must necessitie either despeir flatteringly delite oure selues wyth vayne comfortes worlde oure owne destructionps lxxiii euen prophete confesseth fete stagged taried longe vpon considering present prosperitie wicked coulde otherwise stande stedfaste entred sanctuarie god bended eye last ende godly wicked conclude one word crosse christ triumpheth heartes faythfull vpon deuil fleshe synne wicked eye turned power resurrection tenth chapter phowe ought vse present lyfe helpes thereof suche introduction scripture doth also wel informe v right vse earthely benefites whiche thyng neglected framyng order lyfe must lyue must also vse ye necessary helpes life neyther eschue euen thynges seme rather serue delite necessity therfore must kepe measure may vse pure conscience either necessitie delight measure lorde apointeth worde teacheth lyfe bee certaine iorney strange countrey whiche trauayle towarde kingdome heauen must passe earth doubtlesse ought far vse good thynges earth may rather hynder iourney therfore paul doth vnprofitably counsell v vse worlde though vsed bye possession suche mynde vse bee solde place slippery slope bothe sydes quickely maketh v fall let v labour fasten foote maye stande safely haue bene otherwyse good holy men whiche intemperance ryot continually range vnbridled lust vnlesse sharply restrained wer desirous corret great mischiefe thei could finde none way suffred man vse benefites earth far necessitie required dede godly counsell wete seuere whiche perilous thyng put streighter bondes vpon conscience wherewith bounde worde god expounde necessitie absteine thinges whiche man may without opinion man might scarcelye take foode bread water yet seuere red crate thebane thrawe goodes sea destroyed thought shoulde destroyed many daye seeke pretence whereby intemperance ye fleshe vse outwarde thinges may excused whyle goe prepare way flesh raging wantonesse take thinge confessed whiche graunte libertie restrained limitation measure left euery man conscience vse muche seeth lawfull truly confesse conscience neither ought point bounde certaine precise formes lawes muche scripture teacheth generall rule lawfull vse must surely measure vse according rule let principle ye vse god giftes swarueth way referred ende wherunto authour selfe hath created apointed v muche hathe created good hurt therfore man kepe righter way shal diligetly loke vnto end consider end hath created meates shall finde meant make prouision necessitie also delite pleasure apparell beside necessitie apointed ende whiche comlinesse honestie herbes tree frutes beside diuerse profitable v also pleasantnesse sight swetenesse smell true prophet would recken amog benefites god wyne maketh glad heart manpsa ciiiixv oyle maketh face shine scripture woulde echewhere set fourth liberalitie rehearse hath geuen suche thinges men naturall quality thinges sufficiently shew end howe far may vse shall lorde haue set floures great beutie presenteth selfe eies shall haue geuen great swetenesse sauour naturally floweth smelling shall vnlawfull either eies take vse beautie smelling feele swetenesse sauour hath made difference colour hathe made acceptable hath geuen gold siluer iuorie marble speciall grace whereby might made precious metalles stone finally hath made many thinges commendable vnto v without necessary vse therfore away vnnaturall philosophie whiche grau ting v ye creature vse necessitie doth niggardly bereue v lawfull vse god liberalitie also take place vnlesse first haue spoiled al sens made blok side must lesse diligence prouide stay lust ye fleshe whiche brought order ouerfloweth without measure hath haue said defeders vnder pretense allowed libertie graunt vnto thinges first one bridle put mouth determined thinges created v end know authour geue thankes tender kindnesse toward v thy thankes geuing thou gluttonously fill thy selfe deintye meates wyne thou either made senslesse vnfit duty godlinesse thy callyng reknowledging god yf thy fleshe great abundance boilynge fylthye luste dothe vncleannesse infecte thy mynde thou canste see thing ryght honest apparel thankfulnesse god yf costlye gorgiousnesse thereof bothe fall admiration selues disdayne trymnesse cleanlynesse prepare selues vnchastitie reknowledging god mynde fixed vpon gaynesse apparell manye geue sens bodelye delytes mynde lyeth ouerwhelmed many delited marble gold payntinges become menne made marble bee turned metalles bee lyke vnto paynted image smelle kytchen swetenesse auours dulleth smell nothyng spiritual also seen rest therfore certaine hereby licenciousnesse abusing somewhat restrained rule paul confirmedrom xiiix iii carefull fleshe lustes therof whiche graut muche thei boyle aboue measure temper surer redier way whiche made v contempt present life meditation heauenly immortalitie therupon folow two rule one vse worldi cor vi iii minded though thei vsed yt mary wiues though mary yt bye though thei bye paul teacheth yt shold learne well beare pouertie quietly patietly abundance moderatly yt bidde h thee vse world though thou didst vse doth cut away ye intemperance gluttonie meat drinke much deintinesse sumptuousnesse pride hautinesse nicenesse fare bylding apparell also care affection yt may either withdrawe thee hinder thee thinking heauely life fro study garnish thy soule long ago truely sayd cato great carefulnesse trimming body great carelesnesse vertue old prouerbe yt whiche much busied care body ar commoly carelesse soule therfore although libertie faithfull outward thinges restrained certain forme yet truely must subiect law beare little theyr owne affection contrariwise still call vpon selues continually bent mynde cut shew superfluous plentie muche restraine ryotous excesse take diligent hede helpes make selues hinderaunces rule shalbe haue small sclender rychesse may learne lacke pacietly carefully moued immeasurable desire whiche paciece kepe ha e litle profited lordes schole yt hath least somewhat profited behalf scarcely haue thing wherby proue selfe scholar christ beside part vice accompanie desire earthly thinges beareth pouertie impatiently doth moste part bewray contrarie disease abudance meane hereby whiche wilbe ashamed poore cote wilbe proude costly cote content hungry supper disquieted desire deintier would also intemperately abuse deinties hardly vnquietly beareth priuate base estate absteine pryde climbe honorsphil iiiixij therfore let haue vnfained zele godlinesse endeuour learne apostle example full hugry haue store suffer want scripture hath also third rule wherby tempereth vse earthly thinges whiche haue spoken sumwhat entreated preceptes charitie scripture decreeth al earthly thinges geuen v bountifulnesse god apointed oure comoditie may thing deliuered v kepe wherof must one day yelde accompt must therfore dispose saying may continually sound eares yeld accopt thy aylywike therwithall let also come mynde whoe asketh suche accompt euen hath muche commended abstinence sobrietie honest sparing modestie abhorreth riotous sumptuousnesse pride ostentation vanitie whiche alloweth disposing goodes suche ioyned charitie whiche hath already wt mouth condemned deliteful thinges withdrawe man mynde chastitie cleannesse doe dull wit darkenesse last noted lorde biddeth euery one v al doinges life haue eye calling knoweth great vnquietnesse man wit boyleth howe skipping lightnesse caried hether thether gredy ambitio holde diuerse thinges one therfore thinges shoulde confounded follie rashenesse hath apointed euerie man duty seuerall kindes lyfe man rashly runne beyond bondes hath named suche kyndes lyfe vocation therfore euery man seuerall kinde life vnto standing apointed god theyr life vncertainly wander diuision necessary al doinges measured thereby sight oftentimes contrary iudgemet man reason philosophie dede accompted noble euen among phylosophers man deliuer contrie tyrannie voice god iudgemet priuate man openly condemned layeth hand vpon tyrant wil tarry vpon rehearsing example sufficient knowe calling lord euery thing beginning fundation well whiche doth diriect shal neuer kepe right way doinges may paraduenture somtime somwhat seming worthy praise butte whatsoeuer sight men throne god shalbe reiected moreouer shalbe conuenient agrement partes life therfore life shall best framed shalbe directed marke man caried owne rashenesse attept tha calling may beare knoweth lawful passe beyond bondes shalbe man base estate shal contentedly liue priuate life least shold forsake degree wherin god hath placed againe shalbe smal relefe care labor greues burden man shall know yt thinges god guide willingly magistrate execute office housholder bynd selfe dutie euery man kinde life beare passe discommodities care tediousnesse anguish therof perswaded euery ma burden laid vpon god hereupon also shal growe singular co fort muche shalbe worke filthy vile one thow obey thy calling shineth precious sight god aleuenth chapter pof iustification fayth fyrst definition name thyng thinke haue already sufficiently declared howe remayneth men accursed lawe one helpe recouer saluation agayne faith benefites god bestoweth vpon man fruites bringeth fourth hym summe christ geuen v goodnesse god coceiued possessed v faith partakyng whome receiue principally twoo grace first reconciled god innocencie may nowe stede iudge haue merciful father heauen second sanctified spirite maye geue selues innocencie purenesse lyfe regeneration whiche second grace haue alredy spoken muche semed sufficient manner iustification therfore lesse touched serued well purpose first vnderstande faythe whiche alone receiue frely geuen righteousnesse mercie god idle good workes also good workes holy one wherupon part question entreateth wicked doer gylty conscience anye wicked also come daunger iudgement condemnation bersabe sayeth solomon shalbe wicked doersi reg ixxi doth therein acknowledge offense complayneth son shalbe put shame numbred among reprobate condemned processe text easelye appeareth worde latine also otherwyse taken way relation signifie qualitie co cerning matter nowe hande paul saith scriptur forseegal iiiviii rom iiixxvi god iustifieth gentile faith may man vnderstande thereby god doth impute righteousnesse faith againe whe sayth god iustifieth ye wicked man fayth christ meanyng therof benefite fayth deliuer damnation whiche wickednesse deserued yet speaketh playnely conclusio cried thusrom viiixxxiii shal accuse god elect god yt iustifieth shall condemne christe died yea rose againe nowe maketh intercession v muche effect say shall accuse whome god acquiteth whoe shall condemne whose patrone christ defendeth iustifie therfore nothing el acquite hym accused gilthynesse allowyng innocencie sithe therfore god doth iustifie v ye intercessio christ doth acquite v allowace innocencie imputatio righteousnesse may copted righteous christ righteous selues xiii chapter actesact xiiixxxviii defende hys deceites reader shall pardon nowe touche thinges ordre teaching requireth dyfferred place although excuse meaning nothing el name essentiall righteousnesse resist thys opinion yt accompted righteous christes sake yet plainly expresseth yt cotented ye righteousnes yt purchased v ye obedience sacrifice christ faineth substantially righteous god well substance qualitie poured v reason earnestly affirmeth christ also father holy ghoste dwel v although graunt true yet saie wrongfully wresteth hee shold haue considered manner dwellyng father holy ghoste christe fulnesse godhead onely grace mediator righteousnesse simply perfectli offered v persone wee made partaker righteousnesse god god essentially made one v saye christe iustyfying v y essentiall conioynynge made oures onely heade hee y manne butte also substaunce diuine nature y powred v hee shoulde wyth lesse hurte feede hym selfe deyntyly paraduenture greate contention shoulde haue raysed thys doubtynge erroure butte sythe thys beginning lyke cuttle casting oute blacke thycke bloode hydeth many tayles muste nedes earnestly resiste vnlesse wyll wittyngly wyllyngely suffer ryghteousnesse taken v whiche onely god lyfe proue fyrst point god dothe iustifie onelye forgeuinge also regenarating asketh whether god doeth leaue whome dothe iustifie suche nature chaunging nothyng theyr vyces aunswere hereof verye easye christe torne partes two thing whiche together ioyntly receiue hym saye righteousnesse sanctification inseparable therfore whomesoeuer god receiueth fauour dothe also therwith geue spirite adoption power wherof newly fashioneth image ye brightnesse ye sunne seuered heate therof shall therfore saye ye earth warmed light enlightened heate nothing fit purpose similitude sunne heate geueth life frutefulnesse earth beames geueth light brightnesse mutuall vnseparable co ioyning yet reason forbiddeth conuey one whiche peculiar like absurditie confusion two sortes grace osiander thrusteth god dothe dede renew obseruing righteousnesse whome frely accopteth righteous therfore osiander confoundeth gift regeneratio fre acceptation affirmeth al one selfsame thing scripture ioyning together singularly excellent wt long continuance hee length encreasced yet hee waye please god receiued faythe grace offered promyse whereupon foloweth iustification place workes paull well affirmeth ye osiander obiecteth ye power iustifiyng faith selfe respect receiueth christe wyllynglye graunte fayth iustifie selfe inwarde force call alwaye feble vnperfect could worke iustification part
