soule craue grace christe able receyue christ whereupon gather doe take christ power iustifying teache first receiued fayth righteousnesse receyued yet doe admit crooked figure sophister sayth faith christ earthen pot treasure gold hidden reson vnlike faith although selfe worthynesse price may iustifie v bryngynge christ pot full money maketh man ryche therfore say fayth whiche onely instrument receyue rightuousnesse vnfitly mingled christe whiche materiall cause bothe author minister great benefit nowe doubt also dissolued howe worde faith ought bee understanded entreate iustification receiuing christ goeth sayeth inward worde receiued ministration outwarde worde thereby drawe v priesthode christ persone ye mediatour outwarde godhed v deuide christ say eternall worde god whiche reconciling v god flesh gaue v righteousnesse confesse yt otherwyse could haue fulfilled office mediatour purchaced v righteousnesse vnlesse ben eternall god osianders doctrine christ god made righteousnesse v respect nature godhed manhode properly belong godhed shal peculiar christ common father holy ghost muche ther one righteousnesse one moreouer whiche naturally fro eternitie coulde bee conueniently sayde bee made v butte althoughe graunte god made righteousnesse v howe shal agree whiche set betwene made god truely properly belongeth persone mediatour whiche though conteine hym selfe nature godhede yet specially signified proper title whiche seuerally discerned fro father holy ghost folishly triumpheth one worde hieremiciere xv promiseth lorde iehoua shalbe righteousnesse shall gather nothinge christ righteousnes god openly shewed flesh place haue rehearsed paules sermonact xxxxviij god purchased himselfe churche bloud man gather therupon bloud wherewith sinnes purged diuine nature godhed abyde fowle errour osiander thinketh childishe cauillation hath gotten thinges swelleth leapeth ioye stuffeth many leaues full bigge wordes yet plaine redy solutio saying worde iehoua dede made issue dauid shalbe righteousnesse ye godlyesay liijxi esaie teacheth sense saying iust seruant shal knowledge selfe iustifie many let v note father speaketh geueth ye sonne office iustifiyng addeth cause iust setteth manner meane call doctrine wherby christe knowen comodious exposition take worde daah knowledge passiuely hereupon gather first christe made righteousnesse putte fourme seruaunt secondely hee dyd iustifie v respect hee shewed hym selfe obedient father therefore hee dothe v according nature godhed according office dispensation comitted vnto although god alone ye fountaine righteousnesse made righteous meane partaking yet vnhappy disagremet estranged fro righteousnesse must nedes come lower remedy christ may iustifie v ye force death resurrectio obiect yt worke excellency yt aboue ye nature man therefore ascribed ye nature god ye first graunt secod say yt vnwisely deceiued although christ could neither clese soules bloud appease father sacrifice acquite v gyltinesse doe office prest vnlesse ben true god strength fleshe ben weake great burden yet certain performed thinges according nature mahod demaunded iustified paul answereth ye obediece christ otherwise obey taking vpon shape seruantrom vxix wherupon gather righteousnesse geue v fleshe likewyse wordes whiche maruell osiander ashamed allege often apoynteth fountayne ryghteousnesse el wordes soud far otherwise yt righteous ye cleansing made christ uery yong beginner shold haue bene ignorant righteousnesse god taken righteousnesse god alloweth iohniohn x glorie god compared glorie men knowe sometime called righteousnesse god wherof god author god geueth v though say nothing reders yt haue sound wit doe perceiue yt nothing el meant place stande vpright iudgement seate god beinge vpholden cleansing sacrifice christes death great importance word osiander agree v point iustified christ respect yt made propiciatorie sacrifice v whiche agree nature godhed whiche sort christe manner teaching sene sacramentes whiche although direct faithe whole christ halfe christ yet withall teache matter righteousnesse saluation remaineth flesh man either iustifieth quickeneth selfe christ heartes misticall vnion hiest degree christ made may make v partaker giftes wherwith endued therfore beholde hym far selues righteousnesse may imputed vnto v haue put graffed body finally hath vouchsaued make v one therfore glorye haue felowship righteousnesse osianders sclaunderous cauillation cofuted saith yt compt faith righteousnesse though spoiled christ right whe saye yt come faith empty geue roume grace yt maye fil v osiader refusing spiritual coioyning enforceth grosse mingling faithful therfore odiously calleth zuinglians subscribe fantastical errour concerning essential righteousnesse thinke yt christ substacially eaten lordes supper compt great glorie bee reproched proude geuen error albeit toucheth also wryters wel knowen worlde whome ought haue modestly reuerenced moueth nothing whiche meddle mine owne priuate cause muche sincerely handle cause free corrupt affection therefore importunatelye requyreth essentiall ryghteousnesse thee essentiall dwellynge christe v tendeth thys ende first god grosse mixture poure selfe v fayneth fleshely eatynge christ supper secondlye god breathe ryghteousnesse v wherby maye really righteous opinion righteousnesse well god hym selfe goodnesse holinesse purenesse god wyll spende muche labour wyping away testimony bryngeth whiche wrongfully wresteth heauenlye lyfe present statei pet iiiii christ sayeth peter geuen v precious moste great promyses shoulde made partaker nature god though weare nowe suche gospell promysed shalbe last comming christe yea iohn telleth vsi iho iiii shall see god shalbe lyke vnto hym thought good geue small taste reader doe purpose passe ouer trifle harde confute wyll tedious superfluous worke seconde point lurketh poyson teacheth righteous together god thynke haue alredy sufficiently proued although doctrine pestilent yet colde frutelesse selfe vayne melteth away ought worthely vnsauorie sounde godly reders intolerable wickednesse vnder pretense double rightuousnesse abhorreth nothing tha say iustified free imputation god iustifie v acquiting pardoningi cor vxii meaneth saying paul god christe reconciling worlde hym selfe impu ynge men synnes hym done synne made clerely shewe phrase borrowed vse lawe man beyng meanely practised hebrewe tongue haue sober brayne ignoraunt phrase came thence whereunto tendeth meanethrom iiiivii nowe paul sayeth dauid described ryghteousnesse without workes wordes blessed whose synnes forgeuenps xxxii let osiander aunswere whether full definition halfe one truely paul bryngeth prophet witnesse though taught yt forgeuenesse sinnes part righteousnes thing yt ioyneth iustifiyng man includeth whole ryghtuousnesse free forgeuenesse pronoucing ye man blessed whose sinnes couered god hath forgeuen iniquity imputeteh trasgressions doth measure iudge suche man felicitie thereby way righteous dede imputatio osiander taketh exception saieth sclaunderous god contrary nature iustifie deede remayne styll wicked must remember haue already sayde grace iustifying seuered regeneration although seuerall thynges sufficiently knowen experience abide alwayes righteous nantes sinne must nedes farre otherwyse iustified reformed newnesse lyfe later point reformation god beginneth elect throughout whole course life litle litle sometime slowly procedeth thei alway seate danger iudgemet death iustifieth partmeale thei may freely clothed purenesse christ appere heauen portion righteousnesse could appease conscience tyll satisfied ye god fully pleased v righteous sight exception whereupon foloweth doctrine iustification misturned yea ouerturned foundation doubtinge cast men myndes affiance saluatio shaken whe thee free dredlesse inuocation hindred yea quiet tranquillitie spirituall ioye sta lyshedgala iiixviii wherupon paul gathereth argument contrary proue inheritance lawe meane faith made voide whiche haue respect workes ouerthrowen none moste holy shall therin finde wherupon trust differece iustifiyng regeneratyng whiche two thinges osyander confoundinge together calleth two sortes righteousnesse wel expressed paul speaking reall righteousnesse dede vprightnesse wher endued whiche osiander nameth essentiall righteousnes lamentably crieth outrom vii xiiii wretche shal deliuer body death fleing righteousnesse whiche grounded vpon mercie god gloriously triumpheth ouer life death reproches hunger sworde aduersities whoe shall accuse electes god whome iustifiethrom viiixxxiii surely persuaded nothing shall seuer v loue christ plainely publisheth hath righteousnesse whiche alone fully sufficeth saluation god wretched bondage whiche knowyng selfe litle beuayle estate may mouish way hinder boldnesse glorie diuersitie sufficiently knowen familiar al holy one grone vnder burden iniquity yet victorious confidence mount vp aboue feares osiander obiecteth disagreeth nature god falleth vpon selfe although clotheth holy one double rightuousnesse furred garment yet compelled confesse without forgeuenesse synnes neuer pleased god true least let graunt yt thei righteous dede accompted righteous according apointed proportion imputation call howe far shall sinner extend free acceptation put place ryghteousnesse shall measure pounde ounce truely shall hang doubtefull waueryng side side bicause may take vnto much righteousnesse shalbe necessarie stablish confidence happy wold binde god law iudge cause shal stade stedfast thou mayest iustified thy sayenges ouercome thou art iudgedpsa iivi howe great presumption condemne chefe iudge freely acquiteth answer maye force haue mercie vpon wil haue mercie yet intercession moses god put silence sayengexod xxixix tended ende spare none acquite altogether taking away condemnation although gilty offense say whiche loste haue sinnes buried iustified god bicause god hateth sinne loue none whome iustifieth maruellous manner iustifieng beyng couered righteousnesse christ stand feare iudgement haue deserued worthily condemne themselues accompted righteous without themselues reader warned thei take good heede misterie whiche braggeth wil hide hath longe largely trauailed proue obteine fauour god imputation righteousnesse christ bicause bee impossible compte righteous righteous vse owne wordes leng h concludeth christ geuen v vnto righteousnesse respect nature manhod nature godhed although righteousnesse found person mediatour yet righteousnesse god doth bynde vp rope made two righteousness plainely taketh away office iustifieng christes nature mahode good see disagreeth sayd place christ made vnto wisedome belogeth none eternal word therfore christ man wisedom answer begotten sonne god deede eternal wisedomecol iiiij paules writinges name geuen diuerse wise bicause al treasure wisedome knowlege laied vp therfore father disclosed vnto v paule sayth referred vnto essence sonne god vse rightly applied christes nature manhode bicause although shined light darkenesse put fleshe yet hidden light till christ came forth nature manioh viiixii shinyng sunne righteousnesse therefore calleth light world also folishly obiected yt power iustifieng far aboue bothe angeles men asmuch hangeth vpon worthinesse creature vpon ordinance god angel take vpon satisfie god nothyng preuaile bicause apointed theruntogala iiixiii singularly belonged christ man made subiect lawe redeme v fro curse law also doth sclaunderously cauil yt denie christ righteousnesse accordyng nature godhed doe leaue one part christ worse make two god bicause although thei cofesse yt god dwelleth v yet saye againe righteous righteousnesse god although call christ author life respect suffred death destroye power death take awaye honor whole christ openly shewed god fleshhebr ijxiiij make distintio righteousnesse god coueyed vnto v may enioy point osiander hath fowly erred neither denie opely geue v christ procedeth secret grace power god striue agaynst ye righteousnesse whiche christ geueth v righteousnesse god procedeth god hold stedfastly haue righteousnesse life death resurrection christ ouerpasse heapyng together place whereof maye wel ashamed wherwith hath tediously cobred ye reader without choise without comon reason proue whersoeuer made mention righteousnesse ought vnderstanded essentiall righteousnesse dauid calleth vpon righteousnesse god help wheras doth aboue hundred time osiander sticketh corrupt many senteces nothing stro ger obiectio properly rightly called righteousnesse whereby moued rightly god worketh v performe also denie god reformeth v spirit vnto holinesse life righteousnessephilip ijxiii must first see whether immediatly hand sonne hath lefte al fulnesse holy spirit abundat store supplie ye neede mebres moreouer although righteousnesse come vnto v secret fountayne godhed yet foloweth christ sactified flesh sakesiho xviixix righteousnesse vnto v according nature godhed lesse fond sayth yt christ righteous ye righteousnesse god bicause vnlesse ye wil father moued could haue satisfied ye office comitted vnto though haue place sayd yt al deseruings christ procede fro mere good god yet maketh nothing fantastical thing wherwith osiander bewitcheth simple men eye whoe would suffer gather coclusion bicause god fountaine beginning righteousnesse therfore essentially righteous essence god righteousnesse dwelleth vsesa lixxvij redeminge church sayth esaye god put righteousnesse harnesse dyd spoyle christ armure geuen make perfect redemer prophet meante nothyng el god borowed nothing himselfe holpen ayde red v thing paule brefly expressed wordesro iijxxv sayeng gaue v saluatio shewyng righteousnesse doth ouerthrowe teacheth place righteous obediece one maro vxix finally whosoeuer wrappeth vp double righteousnesse poore soules maye rest mere mercie god dothe mockerie crowne christ wt thornes asmuch great part imagineth righteousnesse made faith workes let v first shew also righteousnesse fayth workes doth differ one stablished must needes ouerthrowenphilip ivviii apostle fayth estemed al thinges dong might winne christ finde righteousnesse god faith copting righteousnesse law whiche faith iesu christ see also coparison cotraries declared ye wil obteine righteousnesse christ must sake owne righteousnessero iii therefore place sayth yt cause fal iewes goyng stablish owne righteousnesse subiect righteousnesse god stablishyng owne righteousnesse shake away righteousnesse god therefore obteine god righteousnesse owne must vtterly abolishedrom iiixx ii sheweth thyng fayth glorieng excluded law faith wherupon foloweth long remaineth righteousnesse workes litle soeuer still remaineth v glorie vpo faith exclude al glorieng righteousnesse workes wise coupled righteousnesse faith effect speaketh playnely iiij chapter romanesro iiiiij leaueth roume cauillations shiftes sayth abraham iustified workes hath glorie immediatly addeth hath glorie sight god foloweth therefore iustified workes vryngeth argument contrary reward rendred workes done det grace righteousnesse geuen fayth accordyng grace therefore deseruinges workes wherfore farewell dreame imagine righteousnesse made faith workes mingled together sophisters thinke haue suttle shifte make themselues sport pastime wrestyng scripture vayne cauillations expond workes place men yet regenerate doe literally endeuour free without grace christ saye belogeth spiritual workes opinion man iustified bothe faith workes workes giftes christ frutes regeneration saye paule spake none cause conuince iewes trusting vpo owne workes dyd foolishly presume clayme righteousnesse theselues sithe spirit christ doth geue v endeuour owne motion nature doe marke ye coparison righteousnesse law righteousnesse gospell paule bringeth place workes excluded title euer adorned teacheth righteousnesse law yt shuld obte e saluation hath performed whiche law comaundeth righteousnesse fayth yf beleue christ died risen againe moreouer shall shewe place fitio sauctification righteousnesse seuerall benefites christ whereupon foloweth spirituall workes come accompt power iustifieng ascribed fayth paule denieth eue alleged abraham thing wherupo glorie god bicause made righteous workes ought restrayned literall outward kinde vertues endeuour free although life patriarch abraham spirituall manner angelike yet sufficient deseruynges workes purchace righteousnesse god scholemen teach litle gros mingle preparation lesse infect simple vnskilfull corrupt doctrine vnder pretense spirit grace hydyng mercie god whiche able appease tremblyng conscience confesse paul doer law iustified god bicause far keping law herupon gather workes al haue auailed righteousnesse nothing help v bicause lacke comon papistes scholemen point doubly deceiued bicause cal faith assuredne se consciece loking reward hand god deseruinges also bicause expound grace god free imputation righteousnesse holy ghost helpyng endeuour holinesseheb xivj reade ye apostle cometh god muste first beleue god rendrer reward seke marke manner seking deceyued name grace plamely proued owne writing lombarde expoundeth lib ca iustification christ geuen v two wayes first sayth death christ doth iustifie v charitie stirred vp heartes made righteous secondly death sinne destroyed whereby satan helde v captiue nowe hath whereby condemne v see considereth grace god principally iustification far directed good workes ye grace holy ghost would forsoth haue folowed opinion augustine foloweth far goth far waye fro rightly folowing bicause augustine haue spoke thing plainly darkeneth thing augustine vnpure corrupteth scholemen haue stil strayed worse worse till hedlong fall length rolled downe pelagian errour sentence augustine least manner speakyng altogether receyued though singularly w taketh man prayse righteousnesse assigneth wholly ye grace god yet referreth grace sanctificatio wherby renewed newnesse life holy ghost scripture speaketh righteousnesse faith leadeth v far end yt say turnyng away loking vpo owne workes loke vnto mercie god perfection christ teacheth order iustificatio first god vouchsaueth embrace beyng sinner wt mere free goodnesse consideryng nothing miserie whereby may mo ed mercie asmuch seeth altogether naked voide good workes fetchyng cause good moueth sinner feling goodnesse desperyng vpon owne workes casteth summe saluation vpon god mercie felyng fayth felyng sinner commeth possession saluatio acknowlegeth doctrine gospel reconciled god obteyning forgeuenesse sinnes meanes righteousnesse christ e iustified although regenerate spirit god thinketh vpon continuall righteousnesse layed vp good workes applieth righteousnesse christ thinges shalbe euery one particularly weyed shal geue perfect declaratio sentece albeit thei might better disposed order set forth maketh litle mater hang together sort may haue whole mater truely declared surely proued good remember relation haue sayd betwene faith gospell bycause sayd cause faith iustifieth recemeth embraceth ye righteousnesse offred gospel whereas sayd offred gospel therby al cosideratio workes excluded thing paule declareth many time el plainly two place romanesro xv comparing lawe gospell together sayth righteousnesse law thus man yt doth thinges shal liue righteousnesse faith offreth saluation thou beleue thy heart confesse thy mouth lord iesus father hath raysed vp dead see maketh difference law gospel lawe geueth righteousnesse workes gospel geueth tree righteousnesse without helpe workes notable place maye deliuer v many harde doubtes yf vnderstande righteousnesse geuen v gospell free condition lawe reason doth one great seming contrarietie set promise way opposition lawgala iijxviij ye inheritance law promise rest chapter effect truely lawe selfe hath also promise therefore must needes promise ye gospel somthing different diuerse fro promise lawe vnlesse confesse comparison sond diuersitie shall bee vnlesse freely geuen vpholden mercie god whereas promise lawe hange vpon condition workes neyther let manne carp agaynst saye place righteousnesse reiected whiche menne owne force freewill would compell god receiuero vi ij asmuch paule without exception teacheth law comaunding profiteth nothing bicause none comon multitude also perfectest fulfilleth loue vndoubtedly chefe point law spirit god frameth v vnto v cause righteousnesse euen holy one vnperfect therefore self deserueth reward second place manifest man iustified lawe god bicause righteous man shall liue fayth law faithgal iijxij man doth thynges shall liue howe coulde argument otherwise stande together vnlesse agree vpon point workes come accompt faith vtterly seuered lawe sayth differeth fayth bicause workes required righteousnesse thereof therefore foloweth workes required righteousnesse faith relation appereth iustified faith iustified byside deseruing workes yea without deseruyng workes bycause faith receyueth righteousnesse gospel geueth gospel differeth law point bindeth righteousnesse workes setteth mercy god like herunto whiche affirmeth romanesro iiiiii abraham nothyng glorie vpon bycause fayth imputed vnto righteousnesse addeth confirmation bycause place righteousnesse faith workes whiche rewarde due bee workes sayth due rewarde rendred vnto whiche geuen faith freely geuen meanyng ye wordes vseth place serue proue wheras adioyneth within litle therefore obteyne ye inheritance fayth accordynge grace hereupon gathereth inheritance free gift bicause receyued fayth commeth bicause fayth without help workes leaneth wholy vpon mercie god meanyng without dout teacheth placero iiixxi righteousnesse god openly shewed without law although haue witnesse borne law prophetes bicause excludyng lawe sayth holpen workes obteyne workyng come empty maye receyue time reader perceiueth wt equitie sophisters daye cauill doctrine saye man iustified faith dare denie man iustified faith bicause often foud scripture bicause word neuer expressed abide haue addition made answer wordes paule affirmeth righteousnesse fayth except freely geuenro iiiiii howe free gift agree workes cauillations mocke whiche sayth place righteousnesse god manifestly shewed gospellro ii righteousnesse manifestly shewed gospell surely therein conteyned torne halfe righteousnesse full perfect therefore lawe hath place therein stande vpon false also foolish shifte exclusine word doth perfectly enough geue al thing faith taketh al thinges workesro iiixxi xxiiii praye meane sayenges righteousnesse manifestly shewed without law iustified freely without workes law haue witty shifte escape withall whiche although deuised themselues borowed origene certaine old writer yet foolish prate ceremoniall workes law moral excluded profit continuall brawling know first rule logike thei thinke apostle doted alleged place proue sayeng man shal thynges shall liue themgal iijx cursed euery one fulfilleth thinges written volume lawe unlesse mad saye life promised kepers ceremony curse thretened onely breaker place bee vnderstanded morall lawe doubte morall workes also excluded power iustifieng purpose serue argumentes vsethro iiixx iiixv bycause knowledge sinne lawe therefore righteousnesse lawe bycause lawe worketh wrath therefore worketh righteousnesse bycause lawe make conscience assured therefore also geue righteousnesse bycause fayth imputed vnto righteousnesse therefore righteousnesse rewarde worke geuen beyng due bycause iustified fayth therefore gloryeng cut ofgala iii xxi ben lawe geuen might geue life righteousnesse truely lawe god hath shut vp vnder sinne promise might geuen beleuers let nowe fondly saye yf dare thynges spoken ceremony manner child would hisse great shamelesnesse therefore let v hold certayne whole lawe spoken power iustifieng taken awaye lawe manne maruell apostle vsed addition beyng content namyng workes reason ready shewed although workes hiely estemed yet haue value allowance god rather owne worthinesse whoe booste vnto god righteousnesse workes hath allowed whoe dare clayme reward due vnto hath promised haue therfore bountifulnesse god compted morthy name reward righteousnesse value cause purpose doth shew obedience godgala iii xvii wherfore apostle place proue abraham could iustified workes allegeth law geuen almost fower hundred thirty yeres couenant made unlearned men would laugh suche argument bicause might righteous workes publishyng law bicause knew yt value workes ye testimonie vouchsauing god therfore taketh thing cofessed ye law thei power iustifie vnderstad namely expresseth ye worke law whe meaneth take awaye iustification fro workes bycause controuersie may moued none albeit sometime excepteth workes without additio sayth testimonie dauid blessednesse assigned man iiijvi whome lord imputeth righteousnesse without workes therfore cauillatious bryng passe shall get generall exclusiue vayne seeke triflyng sutteltie iustified faith whiche worketh loue righteousnesse must stand vpon louegal vvi graunt deede witn paule faith iustifieth whiche effectually workyng chatitie faith taketh power iustifiyng effectualnesse charitie yea doth meane iustifie bicause bryngeth v communicatyng righteousnesse christ el apostle earnestly presseth fall noughtrom iiijiiij worketh sayth reward teckened accordyng grace accordyng det worketh beleueth iusti ieth vnrighteous fayth imputed vnto righteousnesse could speake euidently sayeng righteousnesse faith workes whiche reward due fayth imputed vnto righteousnesse righteousnesse geuen grace due let v examine howe true whiche sayd definition righteousnesse fayth reconciliation god whiche consisteth vpon forgeuenesse sinnes muste alwaye returne principle wrath god refteth vpon men long cotinue sinner hath esaye excellently well set wordesesa lixvij lord shortened able saue eare dulled heare iniquity haue made disagreement betwene god sinnes haue hidden face heareth heare sinne diuision betwene man god turnyng awaye god face sinner neyther otherwise disagreyng fro righteousnesse haue felowship sinnerom viii wherefore apostle teacheth manne enemie god till restored fauour christ whome therfore lord receyueth ioynyng sayd instifie bycause neyther receyue fauour ioyne himselfe muste sinner make righteous say done forgeuenesse sinnes whome lord hath recociled iudged workes shalbe found still sinner deede whoe yet must free cleane sinne certayne therefore god embraceth otherwise made righteous bicause cleansed hauing spottes sinnes wiped awaye forgeuenesse tha righteousnesse maye one worde called forgeuenesse sinnes clerely seene wordes paule whiche haue already allegedii cor iijxix god christ reconcilyng world imputyng sinnes man hath lette v word reconciliationii coriiixxi addeth summe message knew sinne made sinne v might made righteousnesse god nameth righteousnesse reconciliation without difference maye perceyue one mutually conteyned vnder teacheth manner atteyne righteousnesse sinnes imputed vnto v wherefore doubte thou hereafter howe god doth iustifie v thou hearest doth reconcile v imputyng sinnesro iiijvi romanes proueth testimonie dauid righteousnesse imputed without workes bycause dauid pronounceth man blessed whose iniquity forgeuen whose sinnes couered lord hath imputed offense without doubt blessednesse meaneth righteousnesse sithe affirmeth stande forgeuenesse sinnes cause shuld otherwise define itluc ilxxvii therefore zacharie father iohn baptist singeth knowlege saluatio consisteth forgeuenesse sinnes whiche rule paule folowyng sermon whiche made antiochians concernyng summe saluation luke reporteth itact xiiixxxviii concluded maner forgeuenesse sinnes preached vnto euery one beleueth iustified thinges whiche ye could iustified lawe moses apostle knitteth ye forgeuenesse sinnes righteousnesse sheweth bothe one whereupon rightfully reasoneth righteousnesse freely geuen vnto v whiche obteine louyng kindenesse god neyther ought seme strange vnused speache faithful righteous god workes free acceptation sithe bothe oft found scripture old authours also sometime speake augustine sayth thus one place de ciuit dei ca righteousnesse saintes worlde standeth rather forgeuenesse sinnes perfection vertues wherewith agree thte notable sentence bernard sinne righteousnesse god serm cant serm righteousnesse man merciful kindenesse god affirmed christ v righteousnesse absolution therefore righteous haue obteyned pardon mercie hereupon also foloweth meane christes righteousnesse obteine iustified god asmuch effect yf sayd man righteous himselfe bycause righteousnesse christ imputation enterpartened whiche thyng worthy heedefully marked trifling errour vanisheth away saye man therefore iustified faith bicause fayth taketh part spirit god whiche made righteous cotrarie doctrine aboue taught thei neuer made agree together doubt voyde owne righteousnesse taught seke righteousnesse without himselfeii cor v xxi apostle affirmeth moste plainely writeth knew sinne made v propitiatorie sacrifice cleanse awaye sinne might made righteousnesse god see righteousnesse v christ belongeth v title bicause partaker christ bicause possesse richesse maketh nothing contrarie place teachethro vi iij sinne condened sinne flesh christ righteousnesse lawe might fulfilled v meaneth ful illing obteyne imputation lord christ doth sort comunicate righteousnesse v certayne maruelous maner poureth force therof v much perteineth iudgement god appereth otherwise meane sentence spoken little beforero vxix disobediece one man weare made sinner obedience one man iustified el set righteousnesse obediece christ affirme hereby accompted righteous bicause obedience christ imputed vnto v owne therefore thinkes ambrose hath excellently well shewed example righteousnesse blessing iacob l b de iac ui beata iacob hauing deserued preeminencie first begotten sonne hid apparell brother beyng clothed brother cote sauored swete smell crept fauour father receiued blessing owne comoditie vnder persone doe lie hidden vnder precious purenesse christ elder brother may get testimonie righteousnesse sight god wordes ambrose wheras isaac smelt sauour garmentes paradueture meant thereby iustified workes faith bicause fleshly weakenesse hindereth workes ye brightnesse faith whiche meriteth forgeuenesse sinnes ouershadoweth errour deedes truely may appere face god vnto saluation necessarie v smel swetely odour haue faultes couered barred perfection xii chapter p end may fully perswaded free iustification muste lift vp mindes iudgement scare god although appereth euidet testimony thinges true yet shall clearely perceiue necessarie thei vntill haue set eye thing ought groundes disputation first therfore let v remeber purpose speake righteousnesse worldly iudicial court heauenly iudgement seate measure owne small portion vprightnesse workes god iudgemet maye satisfied maruelous see rashnesse boldnesse commonly debated yea seen howe none doe boldely fuller mouthes sayeng prate righteousnesse workes either monstruously sicke open outwarde disease bee ready burste inward vice commeth passe bicause thinke vpon righteousnesse god wherof neuer litle felyng wold neuer make greate mockerie truely measure lightly regarded whe acknowleged perfect nothyng imputed vnto euery waye whole absolute defiled vncleannesse suche neuer neuer shal able found man deede easy redy euery man scholes talke vaynely vpon worthynesse workes iustifie men come sight god dalliance must auoide bicause earnest doyng vsed triflyng strife wordes saye must apply minde profitably enquire true righteousnesse maye answere heauenly iudge calleth v accompt let v thinke iudge one owne vnderstandinges themselues imagine one painted scripture whose brightnesse starres shalbe darkened whose strength hilles melt away whose wrath earth shake whose wisedome wise take sutteltie whose purenesse thinges proued vnpure whose righteousnesse angel able beare whiche maketh innocent innocent whole vengeance one kindled pearceth bottome hel saye sit examine men doynges whoe shall appere assured throneesa xxxiij xiiij whoe shall dwell deuouryng f er sayth prophet whoe shall abide continuall burninges walketh righteousness speaketh truth c let suche one come forth euer answer maketh none cometh forth terrible sayeng soundeth cotrarie lord thou marke iniquitiesps xxxii iob iiijxvij lord shal abide truely must needes immediatly perish writte place shall man iustified compared god shall purer maker beholde serue faythfull hath found peruersnesse angel much shall yt dwell house aye haue earthly fundation consumed mothes th shalbe cut downe mornyng euenyngiob xvxv beholde among saintes none faythfull heauens ane sight much man abhominable vnpro table whiche drinketh iniquitie water graunt deede booke iob mention made righteousnesse hyer kepyng lawe good vnderstande distinction bicause although manne satisfie lawe yet could stand triall righteousnesse passeth sens therefore although iob cleare owne conscience yet amased able speake bicause seeth angelike holinesse appease god exactly weye workes therfore wil time ouerpasse righteousnesse haue spoken bicause incomprehensible saye yf life examined rule written lawe senslesse many curse wherewith lorde hath willed v awaked torment v horrible feare among general curse xxviix vii cursed euery one doth abide al ye thinges written boke finally al discourse shalbe vnsauorie colde vnlesse euery yelde gilty heauenly iudge willingly throwe downe abace himselfe beyng carefull may acquited say haue lifted vp eye learne rather tremble feare tha vainely reioyse deede easy long coparison extendeth men euery thinke haue somwhat ought despise rise vp haue respect vnto god sodenly co fidence falleth ground commeth nought case altogether soule respect god man body respect heauen sight eye long cotinueth vewyng thing lie nere vnto doth shew pearcing force one directed vp sunne bryng daseled dulled great brightnesse therof feleth lesse feblenesse self beholding sunne perceiued strength beholdyng inferiour thinges therfore let v deceyue selues vayne confidence although compt selues eyther egal superiour menne nothyng god whose knowlege tried wildenesse tamed admonition answer v sayd pharisee iustifie selues menluc xvixv hie men abhominable god goe thy way proudely boste thy righteousnesse among men god heauen abhorreth say seruantes god truely instructed spiritps xliiiii entre iudgement thy seruant euery liuing shal iustified thy sight sayth although somwhat diuerse meanyngiob ixviij man righteous god comende shall able answer one thousand nowe playnely heare righteousnesse god euen satisfied workes men examineth v thousand offense purge selues one righteousnesse chosen instrumet god paule conceyuedi cor iiiiiiij professed knewe himselfe gilty nothyng thereby iustified example holy scripture also godly writer shewe alwaye minde augustine sayth ad lib ca godly grone vnder burden corruptible flesh weakenesse life haue hope haue one mediatour iesus christ righteous appeasement sinnes sayth hope confidence workes whe calleth leaueth none super cat serm bernard sayth deede safe stedfast rest assurednesse weake woundes sauiour much surer dwell therein mightier saue world rageth body burdeneth deuel lieth waite fall bicause bulded vpon sure rocke haue sinned greuous sinne conscience troubled shall ouertrobled bicause shall remember woundes lord hereupon afterward concludeth therefore merite lordes takyng mercie psal qui habitat sermo vtterly without merite longe without mercy mercy lord many also haue many merites shal sing mine owne righteousness lord remember thy righteousnesse also righteousnesse made vnto righteousnesse god againe place cant sermo whole merite man put whole hope saueth whole man likewise reteyning peace self leaueth ye glorie god thee sayth let glorie remaine vnminished shalbe well haue peace forswere glorie altogether least wrongfully take vpon yt whiche mine owne lose also whiche offred plainely place sayth church careful merites hath surer safer waye glory vpon purpose god cause thou shouldest aske merites hope good thingseze xxxvixx j xxx specially thou hearest prophet doe sake myne owne sake sayth lord sufficeth merite know merites suffice sufficeth merit presume merites bee without merites sufficeth iudgement whereas freely vseth word merites good workes must therein beare custome end purpose make hypocrite afrayde wildly range licentiousnesse sinnyng agaynst grace god afterward expoundeth sayeng happy church neyther wanteth merites without presumption presumption without merites hath wherupon presume merites hath merites deserue presume presuming deseruyng therfore presumeth much boldly bicause presumeth hauyng large matter glorie vpon euen many mercy lord truthe exercised conscience perceyue sanctuarie safetie wherein may safely rest themselues haue iudgement god starres semed moste bright night season doe loose brightnesse sight sunne thinke shall become eue rarest innocencie man shalbe copared purenesse god shalbe seuere examination shall pearce hidden thoughtes hearti cor iiij ii paule sayth shall reuele secretes darkness disclose hidden thing heart whiche shal compell lurking vnwillyng conscience vtter al thinges fallen remembrance deuell accuser presse v whiche priuie wicked deedes hath moued v doe outward pompous shewes good workes estemed shal nothing profit v purenesse shalbe required wherefore hypocrisie wherby euery knowyng gilty god desireth boste men also wherwith euery man deceiueth himselfe god al inclined stroke flatter selues shal fal downe confounded howsoeuer proude dro ken oldnesse yt bend wit sight maye deede short time swetely pleasantly frame righteousnesse themselues righteousnesse shalbe shaken awaye fro iudgement god like great richesse heaped vp dreame vanish away fro men thei awake shal earnestly sight god enquire true rule righteousnesse shal certainly finde al workes iudged owne worthinesse nothing defilinges filthinesse amog comon people accopted righteousnesse god mere wickednesse whiche iudged puritie vnclennesse whiche reckened glorie shame beholding perfection god let greue v descend loke vpon selues without flatterie blinde affectio loue maruel al blinde behalf much none v doth beware pestilent tendernesse toward ye scripture crieth naturally sticketh fast v euery man sayth salomon owne way right eyesp xiij xviij againe al wayes seme cleane owne eye acquited blindnesse sayth place lord weyeth heartes say man flattereth reason outward visore righteousnesse beareth resemblance ye meane time lord balace examineth hidden vnclennesse heart therfore sith nothing profit flattery let v wilfully mocke selues owne destructio may trie selues rightly must necessarily cal back coscience iudgement seate god altogether neede light disclose ye secret foldinges peruersnesse otherwise lie depely hidden neuer til shal clerely perceiue meant hereby man beyng rottennesse wormeiob xvx iob xiiijiiij iob ixxx abhominable vaine drinketh wickednesse water far iustified god whoe shuld make yt cleane coceiued vncleane seede one shal also finde yt experience iob sayd wil goe shew self innocent mine mouth shal condene shewe selfe righteous wil proue wicked meant one age onlyesa iiiivi al age whiche prophet old time complayned israel went astraye like shepe euery one turned aside owne way coprehendeth grace redemption come rigorousnesse examinatio ought procede far till subdue v fully throwen downe withall meane prepare v receiue grace christ deceyued thinketh himselfe able receyue enioyeng grace vntill haue first throwe downe hawtinesse mindei pet v knowen sayeng god confoundeth proude geueth grace humble way humble selues beyng altogether needy empty geue place mercie god call humblenesse thinke haue thing remayning v hetherto haue taught hurteful hypocrisie haue ioyned two thinges together muste thinke humbly selues god must make accopt owne righteousnesse confesse god contrarie owne thinking wickedly lie vnto thinke ought semeth glorious v must troden vnder footeps therfore whe thou hearest ye prophet prepared saluation humble people abacemet eye wicked first thinke entrie open saluation vntil thou haue layed away pride taken thee perfect humblenesse hublenesse certaine modestie whereby thou geuest ouer lorde heare bredth thine owne right called huble men neither presumptuously aduaunce themselues reprochefully triumph ouer although thei stad vpo estimation owne excellence vnfained submission minde throwen downe wt feling owne miserie nedinesse eche described ye word god lord sayth thus zephaniaszepha l xi wil take away thee outragiously reioyseth wil leaue middes thee ye afflicted man poore man thei shal trust lord doth plainely shewe whoe humble euen lie afflicted knowledge owne pouertie side calleth proude outragious reioysers bicause ioyeng prosperitie ar wot reioyse without measure huble purposeth saue leaueth nothing trust ye lord likewise sayd esayeesa lxviij esa lviixv whome shal looke vnto poore contrite spirit feareth wordes againe hie excellent inhabiteth eternitie name holy dwelleth hye holy place contrite humble spirit quicken spirit humble heart contrite thou oft hearest name contrition vnderstand thereby wound heart suffreth man throwen downe ground ryse agayne contrition ought thy heart wounded thou wilt accordyng sayeng god aduaunced humble done thou shalt brought lowe mighty hade god thy shame disgracement beste schoolemaister thinking enough shewe wordes hath also set vnto v parable image true humilitie painted tableluc xixij xiij bryngeth forth publicane standyng far daryng lifte vp eye heaue much knocking brest prayeth wise lord mercifull sinner let v thinke token fayned modestie dare loke vp heauen come nerer knockynge brest confesseth himselfe sinner let v know bee testimony inward affection side setteth pharisee whiche thanketh god common sorte men eyther oppresser vnrighteous man adulterer bycause fasted twyse sabbat gaue tithe possessed wyth open confession acknoweledge righteousnesse hath gift god bycause standeth confidence righteous departeth god vnfauored hatred publicane acknowledgyng owne wickednesse iustified hereby may se great ye estimatio hubling v god heart open receiue mercie vnlesse first voide al opinion owne worthinesse opinion hath possessed place shutteth vp way god mercie entre man doubte herof christ sent father earth comissio bryng glad tidinges pooreesa lxii heale contrite heart preache libertie captiue deliuerance shut vp pryson cofort mourne geue glorie ashesmatt x xxviij matt ixxiij oyle mournyng robe prayse spirit sorrowe according comission calleth none labour lode take part liberalitie place sayth came call righteous sinner therfore geue place callyng christ let arrogancie carelesnesse depart far awaye v arrogancie groweth foolish persuasion owne righteousnesse man thinketh haue somwhat deseruing wherof may co mended god carelesnesse may euen without persuasion workes many sinner bicause beyng droke swetenesse vice think vpo iudgement god lie senslesly amased disease drousinesse yt aspire mercie offred must lesse shake dull sluggishnesse must caste away vaine confidence selues maye without encombrance hasten christ beyng empty hungry may filled good thinges shal neuer sufficietly haue trust vnlesse vtterly distrust selues shall neuer sufficietly raise vp courage vnlesse thei first throwe downe selues shal neuer sufficietly haue consolatio vnlesse first desolate selues therfore mete take hold obteyne fauour god casting away al trust selues trusting vpon assurednesse goodnesse augustine sayth forgettyng owne deseruinges de uerbis apest ca embrace giftes christ bicause sought deseruinges v come giftes serm cant wherewith bernard well accordeth co paryng proude men vnfaythful seruantes arrogantly clayme thyng neuer litle owne deseruinges bicause wrongfully kepe themselues prayse grace passyng wall would saye bryngeth forth sunbeame whiche receyueth window tary longer herevpon let v take short generall sure rule prepared take parte frutes god mercie hath vtterly emptied himselfe saye righteousnesse whiche none vayne windye image righteousnesse bicause euery man much hindereth receiuing liberalitie god resteth xiii chapter p two thynges marked free iustification alwaye two thinges principally loked vnto say maye remayne lord glorie vnminished wholly perfectly mainteined cosciences vntroubled quietnesse calme tranquillitie iudgement see oft howe earnestly scripture exhorteth v geue god confession praise entreate righteousnesse apostle testifiethrom iijxv lordes principal purpose geuing v righteousnesse christe might shewe owne righteousnesse shewyng hee declareth immediatly alone knowen righteous iustified faith iesus christ thou seest righteousnesse god sufficiently set vnlesse alone accompted righteous communicate grace righteousnesse deserue meane haue euery mouth stopped whole world made subiect whyle hath thing speake owne defence longe somewhat taken away glory godezec xxxl ezechiel teacheth muche glorifie name reknowleging wickednesse shall remember sayeth wayes al wicked doinges wherewith ye haue defiled ye shall displeased selues owne syght euels ye haue comitted ye shall knowe lorde shall good myne owne name sake according moste wicked offence thinges conteined true knowledge god broosed knowledge owne iniquitie cosider doth good v vnworthy therof great hurt attempt steale awaye lorde parcell neuer small prayse free goodnesse like wise ieremie crieth outier ixxiij let ye wise man glorie wisdome riche man richesse strong man stregth let glorieth glorie lorde doth declare somwhat diminished god glorie glorie self purpose truely doth paule apply wordesi cor ixxx teacheth partes saluation reposed christ glory lord meaning riseth vp god darkeneth glorie whosoeuer thinketh hathe thing neuer litle owne truthe neuer truely glorie vnlesse vtterly put glorie side holde catholike principle glorie god glorie seluesrom iixix paul iudgeth meane worlde made subiect god matter glorie vpo vtterly taken fro men therfore esaie declareth israel shall haue iustification godesaie xlvxxv sith also shall also haue praise though say lord end iustifieth elect glorie nothing el howe ought praised lorde taught verse next yt sweare righteousness strength lord note required bare confession cofirmed othe shold thinke shal discharged wote fained humilitie let man allege excuse doth glorie without arrogance reknowlegeth righteousnesse estimation engendreth co fidence cofidence bredeth glorie therfore let v remeber disputatio righteousnes must haue regard end praise therof remaine lorde whole perfect muche declaratio righteousnesse apostle testifieth hath poured grace vpon vsrom iiixxvi might iust iustifiyng faith christeephe iii eph iviii wherfore place taught lord gaue v saluation set glorie name afterward repeting ye thing addeth ye ar saued grace gift god workes none shold glorie peter telleth called vnto hope saluation shold declare power yt hath called v darkenesse maruelous light without doubt meaning make ye praise god sound eares faithful yt shold wt depe silence oppresse al arrogancie fleshe summe man without robberie god chalege self one crum righteousnesse euen muche plucked taken away glorie god righteousnesse aske meane conscience may quited god shall finde meane free righteousnesse geuen v gift god let v alway thinke vpon saying salomon shall saypro xx x haue cleansed heart made cleane sinne truely man shall ouerwhelmed infinite filthinesse therfore let euen perfectest man descende conscience call doinges accopt end shal haue shal swetely rest though al thing good order betwene god shall rather vexed terrible tormentes whe shall fele matter damnation abiding selfe iudged according workes conscience loke vpon god must necessitie either haue assured peace iudgement beseged wt terror hell therfore profit nothyng disputing righteousnesse vnlesse stablyshe suche righteousnesse stedfastnesse wherof soule may bee staied iudgement god soule shall haue whereby may bothe without feare appeare face god receiue iudgement vnshaken till let v knowe yt haue found vnfained righteousnesse therfore without cause apostle standeth muche vpon pointrom iiiixiiii whose wordes rather expresse mine owne saith promise inheritance law faith made voide promise made abolished first inferreth faith disanulled made voide yf promisse righteousnes haue respect deseruinges workes hang vpon keping law could neuer man assuredlye rest could neuer come passe might assuredly determine self satisfied ye law dede neuer man doth workes fully satisfie wherof nede seke far testimony proue euery man may witnesse selfe right eye behold hereby appereth depe darke corner hypocrisie buried mindes carelesly beare selues stick set flattery iudgegement god though thei would binde stay iudicial proceding faithfull sincerely examine selues greued tormented far maner carefulnesse therfore ther entre mindes doubting length despeire eche man selfe make accompt howe great burden det still ouerpressed far conditio wherwt charged loe faith meane already expressed extinguished wauer varie carried vp downe stick fast doubting holden suspense stagger length despeire trust strengthen thy minde constant certaintie perfect assurednes haue whervpo rest faste thy foo e adioyneth also thing yt ye promise shal therby made effect voide fulfilling therof hang vpon oure deseruing shal come thus farre deserue ye bountifulnes god also second point hangeth vpon former ye promise shal fulfilled yt beleue therfore faithe fallen ther shall remaine force ye promisse therfore inheritance faith yt may according grace stablishe promise abundantly wel stablished resteth vpon ye mercy god bicause mercy truth wt perpetual knot ioyned together yt sai whatsoeuer god mercifulli promiseth also faithfulli performeth dauidps xxixlxxiii yt required saluation word god first determineth ye cause therof mercye let thy mercy saith come vnto thy saluation according thy word rightfully bycause god meane perswaded make promise mere mercie therfore must herin stay deepely fasten hope loke work seke helpe shold think herin speake new thing augustine doth also teache yt ought psal tract priore christ saith shal reigne euer seruantes god hath promised god hath said yt enough god hath sworne therefore asmuch ye promise stablished according deseruinges according mercie man ought speake fearefully yt whych doubte bernarde also saythe ded ea templi ser disciple christe saye whoe canne bee saued butte hee aunswered thys y impossible menne butte yt impossible wyth god confidence comforte whole grounde oure hope beyng assured possibilitie saye hys wyll whoe knoweth whether worthy loue hatredeccle ixi cor iixvi hath knowen ye lord meaning hath ben counseller faith must necessitie help v must truthe succoure v yt hidden v heart ye father may reueled ye spirit spirit testifieng may perswade heartes ye sonnes god may perswade v calling iustifyeng v freely fayth thing ther certaine meane passage ye eternall predestination ye glorie yt come brefely let v thus conclude scripture declareth yt promise god stablished vnlesse taken hold assured affiance conscience whersoeuer doubting vncertaintie pronounceth yt thei voide againe yt pronounceth yt nothing stagger wauer thei rest vpo workes therfore must nedes either lose righteousnesse must cosider workes faith must take place whose nature lift vp eares shut eies yt say hedefully bent promise turne away thought man worthinesse deseruingzach iiiix notable prophecie zacharie fulfilled wickednes land shalbe done away man shal call frend vnder vine vnder figge tree prophet declareth yt faithful otherwise enioy true peace obteining forgeuenesse sinnes cauelatio reme bred prophetes whe thei speake kingdome christ set outward blessinges god figure spirituall thingesesaie ixvi ephe iixiiii wherupon christ called king peace peace appeaseth al troublesom motios coscience seke meane doth must nedes come sacrifice god appeased shal neuer cesse tremble feare shall determine god appeased satisfactorie cleansing wherin christ hath susteined wrath finally peace el sought terror christ redemer vse darke testimonie paul euery denieth peace quiet ioy left consciencesrom vi vnlesse determined iustified faith therwithall declareth whense assurednes cometh namely ye loue god poured heartes holy ghost said yt cosciences otherwise quieted vnlesse certeinly persuaded yt please god wherupo also place crieth ye persone al ye godlyrom v shall seuer v fro loue god whiche christ shall reble euen euery litle breath till arriued yt haue shalbe without care euen darkenes death long ye lord shal shew selfe pastor vspsa xxiiixii therfore whosoeuer prate yt iustified faith regenerate ar iust liuing spiritually neuer tasted swetenesse grace cosider yt god merciful vnto wherupo also foloweth know manner praiyng rightly turkes whatsoeuer profane nation paul witnesseth true faith vnlesse teache put v minde ye swete name father yea vnlesse ope mouth freely crie abba fathergal iiiivi whiche place plainely expresseth saith yt christ haue boldnesse entrie cofidence ye faith truly cometh passe gift regeneration alway vnperfect flesh conteineth self manifold mater douting wherfore must necessitie come remedy yt faithful shold determine may right hope ye inheritace ye heauely kingdome graffed ye body chist frely accopted righteous touching iustificatio faith thing merely passiue bringing nothing recouering fauour god receiuing christ whiche want xiiii chapter pwhat beginning iustification continuall procedinges therof mater may bee made plaine let v searche may ye righteousnesse whole course life let v make fower degree therof either endued knowledge god drowned idolatrie entred profession sacrametes denyeng god vncleannes life thei confesse mouth thei christes name thei hypocrite couer ye wickednes heart wt vaine deceitful color regenerate ye spirit god thei endeuoure themselues true holines specially thei iudged natural giftes ye croune heade ye soule foote ther shal found one sparcle goodnesse vnlesse paraduenture accuse ye scripture falshed whe setteth ye sonnes adam wt title yt thei bee froward stubborne heart yt al ye imaginatio heart euel fro infantieier xviiix gen viiixxi psax ii xi xiiijii gen viiii gal vxix yt thoughtes vaine yt thei haue ye feare god eies yt none vnderstadeth seketh god brefeli yt thei flesh word vnderstaded al workes paul reherseth fornicatio vncleanes vnchastitie riotousnes worshipping ydoles witchcraftes enmity contention emulation anger dissension sectes enuies manslaughter whatsoeuer filthines abhomination mai deuised forsothe ye worthinesse wt cofidence wherof thei must proued among excel wt honestye manner may haue shew holynes amog men yet bicause know yt god regardeth ye outward glistering must searche ye fountaine work wil haue auaile thing righteousnes muste saye throughly loke fro affection heart workes procede although lieth open large fielde discourse yet bicause ye matter may declared word folowe asmuch may brefenesse teaching first deny yt whatsoeuer excellent giftes appeare ye vnbeleuers thei ye giftes god neither differ fro common iudgement yt wold affirme yt ther difference betwene ye iustice temperance equitie titus traianus ye rage intemperace crueltie caligula nero domitian betwene ye filthy lustes tiberius behalfe ye continence uespasian yt wee may tarry vpon special vertues vice betwene ye obseruing ye despising right lawes ther great difference right wronge yt appeareth euen ye deade image therof thing shal ther remaine well ordered ye world cofound together therfore differece betwene honest vnhonest doinges lord hath engrauen mindes al men also doth oft confirme dispensation prouidence see extendeth many blessinges present life yt among men doe folowe vertue bicause ye outwarde image vertue deserueth much ye leaste benefit pleaseth declare profe much true righteousnes pleaseth suffreth euen outwarde fained righteousnes wtout reward whervpo foloweth yt euen cofessed vertues thei rather image vertues ye giftes god forasmuch ther nothing wise praise worthy whiche proceedeth neuerthelesse true whiche augustine writeth stranger fro true religion one god howesoeuer accompted worthy admiration opinion vertue li cotra ulianum onely worthy reward rather worthy punishment bicause thei doe defiling hearte bespott pure good thinges god though thei instrumentes god preserue felowship iustice continence teperance minde valiantnesse wisdome yet euelly execute good workes god restrained euil sincere loue goodnesse either ambition loue theselues crooked affectio wheras therfore ar corrupt ye vnclenesse hart beginning reckened amonge vertues vice wont deceiue reason nerenesse likenes vertue finally whan remebre thend right euer god serued whatsoeuer tendeth end fourthwt worthily loseth name right bicause therfore haue respect mark ye wisdome god apointeth although thing seme good doyng yet wrongful end sin cocludeth therfore yt al ye fabricii scipioes catoes al excellent actes yet sinned behalfe yt wheras lacked ye light faith apply end ought haue applied cause true righteousnes much duty weyed doinges endes moreouer true iohn saith life without sonne godi iohn vxii haue part christ maner men euer whatsouer goe yet run forward whole course destruction iugement eternal death reaso li ad bonisac ca said augustine oure religio disceneth ye righteous ye vnrighteous law workes lawe faith wtout seme good workes turned sinnes wherfore augustine saith wel place pref psalm copareth ye endeuour running ye way much faster man runneth ye way much ye mark therfore made much miserable wherfore affirmeth better halt ye way run ye way finally certaine thei euel tree forasmuch without ye comunicating christ sanctification may therfore beare faire fruites beautifull eye yea swete tast wise good fruites hereby easily perceiue whatsoeuer man thinketh purposeth doeth yt reconciled god faith accursed value righteousnesse certaine deseruing danatio dispute herof doutful thing sith alredy proued ye witnes thapostleheb xivi impossible yt man mai please god wtout faith shall yet appere plainer proufe grace god comparison directly set naturall state man scripture crieth euery wher god findeth nothing man wherby may prouoked good wt owne free goodnes preuenteth dead atteine life lightneth v knowledg himselfiohn vxxv said raise v death make v new creature se oftentimes specially apostle goodnes god set foorth vnto v title god saith riche mercyeph iiiiii great loue wherwt loued v euen whe dead sinnes hath made v aliue together christ c place wher vnder figure abraha entreateth ye general calling faithful saith god yt geueth life ye dead calleth thinges though nothyng beseche wherfore lord strongly beateth downe arrogancie historie iob wordes preuenteth meiob ii rom xxixv shal rendre al thinges ar mine sentece paul expouding applieth shold think bring ani thig lord mere shame needines emptines wherfore place aboue cited proue yt ar come hope saluatio grace alone work allegeth yt ar creature bicause ar new begotte christ iesus good work hath prepared yt shuld walk theeph iix said v may boaste yt hathe righteousnes prouoked god sith first power good procedeth regeneratio ar made nature oyle shal soner wrong stone tha good work v truly wonderful condened great shame dare yet say ther remaineth ani thing therefore let v confesse wt noble instrumet godi ti ix yt ar called god holy callig accordig work accordig purpose grace ye kindnes loue god sauior toward v hath appearedtit iiiiiii bicause hath saued v ye work righteousnes haue according mercie yt iustified grace might made ye heires eternal life bi confessio dispoil al righteousnes eue ye least litle pece therof til bi merci regenerate hope eternal life forasmuch ye righteousnes work brig thig toward ye iustifyig vsro xivi matt ixxiii falsly said yt ar iustified grace truly thapostle forgotte hiself whe affirmed iustificatio fre gift place resoneth yt grace grace work thing auail thig doth ye lord mean whe saith came cal righteous sinner sinner ar receaued seeke entry fained righteousness stil thought hath recourse mind peril least shold wrong mercy god carefully trauail prouig thig though wer doutful darke bycause enuiousnes vnlesse straightli thrust place neuer yeldeth god yt copelled tary sowhat ye loger vpo yet asmuche ye scripture clere inough matter wil fighting rather vse ye word therof mine esai whe hath described ye vniuersal destructio makind doth imediatly veri fitly adioyn ye ordre restoringesa lvix lord hath seen semed eye saw ther maruailed none offereth hath set saluatio arm hath stregthned hiself wt righteousnes righteousness true ye prophet saith yt ther yt helpeth ye lord recouerig saluatio prophet wher bringeth ye lord discoursig ye recociling siners hiselfose iixii saith wil espouse euer righteousnes iudgmet grace mercie wil sai hir yt hath obteined merci yu hast obtained merci couenat certain ye first coioyning yt haue wt god stadeth vpo ye mercy god ther left foudatio righteousnes wold fain learn fame yt meteth god wt righteousnes work whether thei think yt ther ani righteousnes al acceptable god madnes thik acceptable thig god ca procede fro enemy wholli abhorreth wt al doings al paragraph sai ar ye dedli professed enemy god ye truth self testifieth til iustified ar receiued fredship iustified beginnig loue righteousnes work shal go ihon turne away pestilent arrogance dothe diligently put v mind first loue ye self thing ye lord long taught bi prophet se x iil v wil loue saih wt fre loue bicause mine anger turned certainly loue prouoked workes hath owne accorde inclined self vnto v ye rude comon sorte men think nothing el hathe deserued yt christ shoulde performe oure redeption yet entring ye possession redemptio holpen owne work yea hosoeuer redemed christ yet till calling father graffed communion bothe heires darkenesse death enemy god cor vixi paul teacheth cleansed wasshed vncleannesses blood christ vntill holy ghoste worketh cleansing v whiche thing peter minding teache declareth sancrifinge spirite auaileth vnto obedience sprinkling bloode christi pet ii spirite sprinkled bloode christ vnto cleansing lette v thinke watering sinner without christ let therfore remaine certaine yt beginning oure saluatio yt certain resurrectio fro death life bicause christes sake geue v beleue first begin passe fro death life sort comprehended whyche haue diuision aboue set ben noted second third sort men ye vncleannesse conscience proueth yt ar yet regenerate spirit god againe wheras regeneration proueth ye want faith wherby appeareth yt thei yet reconciled god yet iustified sight forasmuch good thing ar atteined faith sinner estranged fro god bring orth yt accursed iudgemet folish boldnesse dede al wicked men puffed vp specially hypocrite bicause howesoeuer thei knowe whole hearte swarmeth ful fylthinesse yet thei work yt haue shew goodnes thei think worthy yt god shold despise herof groweth yt pernicious errour yt proued gilty wicked mischeuous minde yet thei driue cofesse theselues void righteousnes eue whe thei acknowledg theselues vnrighteous bicause thei ca deny yet thei arrogatly claime som righteousnes vnto vanitie ye lord excellentli wel cofuteth bi ye prophethag ii ask saith ye prestes saieng man carrie sanctified flesh ye heme garmet putteth bread meate shal sactified prestes answered haggee said defiled soule touche thinges shal defiled prestes answered shalbe defiled haggee said people befor face saith ye lord al ye work hand al thinges yt thei offer shalbe defiled wold god yt saieng might either get ful credit wt v wel settled remebrace ther though otherwise whole life neuer hainous wicked doer yt ca e abide perswaded yt ye lord plainely pronounceth naughtiest sone hath performed one two doubtful dedes ye law doubteth shalbe accopted righteousnes ye lord crieth ye contrarie yt ther sanctificatio gotten therby vnlesse ye heart first wel cleansed conteted therewt affirmeth yt al ye work whatsoeuer thei yt proceede fro sinner defiled vncleannes ye heart therfore let ye name righteousnes depart fro work ye lord mouth condemned filthines wt howe fit similitude doth shew ye might haue ben obiected yt whatsoeuer ye lord commaunded inuiolably holly contrarie side setteth maruell thinges hallowed lawe lorde de ied filthinesse naughty men whereas vncleane hand prophaneth holy thing touching matter excelletly wel handleth esai offer saith hee sacrifice vaineesa ixiii incense abhomination soule hateth calendes solemnity thei become tedious haue werie bearing shal hold vp hand wil tourne away mine eye shall multiply prayer heare handes full bloud washed cleane take away euell thought meaneth lord lotheth obeying owne lawe yea heere refuseth nothing naturall obseruing law begining wherof euery teacheth vnfained feare name wh taken away euer thinges ar offered trifle stinking abhominable filthinesse let hypocrite go keping peruersnes wrapped vp heart endeuour deserued ye fauour god wt work bi mean thei shal prouoke wrathpro xv viij sacrifice wicked abhominable prayer vpright men pleaseth therfore hold dout ought commonly knowen eue meanly excercised scripture euen work glister gloriously men yet truly sanctified ar far fro righteousnes sight lord aug lib de poe il gregor yt thei iudged sin therfore thei haue said truly haue taught fauour wt god procured anye person workes contrary wise work please neuer til whe ye person hath firste foud grace ye sight god ordre religiously kept ye scripture leadeth v ye hand moses writeth yt lord respect abell worksgen iiiiiiii act xv vi see howe hee declareth god fauorable menne hath respect work wherfore clesing ye heart must go yt work come fro v may louingly receiued god bi se sayig ieremy alway forceiere viii yt work god haue respect vnto truth faith heartes men ar clensed holy ghost hath affirmed mouth peter whereby certen first foundation true truely faith let v looke righteousnesse thei haue haue set fowerth degree wee graunt god meane righteousnesse christ reconcileth v selfe giuing v tree forgiuenesse sinnes accompteth v righteous mercie also conioyned beneficiall holy spirit dwelleth v power wherof lustes flesh dayiye mortified sanctified say hallowed lord vnto true purenesse life heart ar framed obedience law may chief serue meanes aduaunce glorie euen whyle guyding holy ghoste walke way lorde least yet wee forgettyng selues ware proude lefte certayne remnant imperfection may minister v matter humilitie ther none righteous ing bui v saith ye scripture yt doth good sinneth maner righteousnes therfore wil thei yet get workes first saie yt best worke yt brought forth yet alwaye sprikled corrupted wt vncleannes ye flesh hath som dregges mingled wt sai let holy seruant god chose al life ye excellet thing yt shal think yt hath done ye whol course therof let wel cosider al ye part wtout dout shall find somwher somwhat sauoring ye rottennes ye flesh forasmuch wel chereful quicknes neuer ought slacking course weaknes much although se yt ther ar euidet fowle blottes wherwt ye work ye holy spredde yet grant yt thei nothing little spottes shal thei nothing offende ye eies god euen ye sterres cleane thus haue shewed yt commeth muche one good woorke holy men whiche iudged selfe deserueth iuste rewarde shame secodly say yt wer possible yt shold haue som throughly pure perfect work yet one sinne enough blot quench al ye reme brance ye former righteousneseze xviijx iiii iac iix ye prophet saithe whome also iames agreeth yt offedeth saith one made gilty al fith mortal life neuer pure void fro sine whatsoeuer righteousnes shold purchace fro time time wt sinnes folowing corrupted oppressed lost shold com ye sight god accopted v righteousnes finalli whe ye righteousnes work entreted must haue respect ye work ye law ye comaundement therfore eke righteousnes law shal vain bring forth one two work perpetual obedience ye law necessarie wherfore lord doth one many foolishlythinke impute v righteousnesse yt forgeuenes sinnes wherof haue spoken hauing one obteined pardon oure life past afterwarde seeke righteousnesse lawe bicause shoulde nothing el butte bringe v false hope mocke laughe v scorne sith perfectio cold com v log clothed wt flesh sith ye law thretneth death iudgmet al yt performe ful rightousnes work shal alway haue wherof mai accuse codene v vnlesse ye mercie god ye side wtstand acquite v fro time time wt cotinual forgeuenes sinnes wherfore stadeth alwaye certain said ye beginning yt weied worthines whatsoeuer purpose go yet wt al trauailes endeuours worthy death destruction upo two point must strongly stad fast yt ther neuer work godli wer examined ye seuere iudgmet god danable ther shewed possible yet corrupted defiled wt ye sinnes wherwt certaine doer loden looseth grace cheefe point disputatio ye beginning iustification stri e betwene v ye souder sort scholmen yt sinner freely deliuered fro damnation obteineth righteousnes yt ye forgeuenes sinnes sauing yt thei vnder ye worde iustification comprehende renewing wherwt newly formed ye spirite god vnto ye obedience ye law thei thus describe ye righteousnes regenerate yt man one recociled god ye faith christ good workes iudged righteous god theyr deseruynge v accepted lord contrariwise pronouceth yt imputed abraha faithe righteousnesrom iiiixiii time whe yet serued idol whe al ready mani year excelled holines life therfore abraha long worshiped god fro pure hart performed yt obediece ye law whiche mai performed mortal yet hath righteousnes reposed faithe wherevpo gather accordig ye argumet paul yt workshabac iiiiii likewise whe said prophet righteous shal liue faith spoke wicked prophane men lorde iustifieth couerting faith speach directed faithfull promised life faithrom iiiivii psa xxxii paul also taketh away doubt whe cofirming sentece taketh verse dauid blessed ar whose iniquity forgeue certein dauid speaketh wicked faithful self bicause spake felig coscience therefore blessednes must haue one lifeii cor vxviii hold throughout al life last testifieth yt embassage cocerning fre reconciliatio wt god published one two day perpetual ye church therfore faithfull haue euen ye end life rigteousnesse yt set foorth christ euerlastyngly remaineth mediatour reconcile ye father v effectualnesse death euerlasting namely washing satistactio expiationfinally perfect obedience wherwt al iniquity couered neither doth paul ephesian say haue beginning saluation grace saued grace workes yt man glorie starting hole whiche ye scholemen seke escape deliuer say ye good workes inward worthinesse theselues great ualue yt sufficiet purchace righteousnesse yt thei great value grace accepting driuen cofesse yt righteousnesse workes life alway vnperfect graut yt long liue nede forgenesse sinnes wherby ye way workes may supplied yt defautes comitted recopensed wt workes supererogation answere yt accepting grace cal none tha fre goodnes wherwith ye father embraceth v christ whe clotheth v ye innocecie christ accompteth ye beneficial meane therof may take v holy pure innocent righteousnesse christ perfect abide sight god must set stede presented barre suretic herewith beyng furnished obteine cotinual forgeuenesse sinnes faith ye purnesse herof filthiness vnclenesses imperfection couered imputed hidden buried yt may come ye iugement god vntil ye houre come whe ye olde slain vtterly destroied v ye goodnesse god shal receiue v blessed peace new adam let v loke day lorde whiche receiuing vncorrupt body shalbe remoued glorie heauenly kingdome thinges true verily workes selues make v acceptable pleasing god neither workes theselues please respect yt couered wt righteousnes christe pleaseth god obteineth forgeuenes sine god hath promised ye rewarde eternal life certaine workes promiseth yt doth thing shal liue settig ye notable curse agaist yt continue al thingsleui xviii v wherby deuise righteousnesse part largely confuted sithe righteousnes admitted heaue whole obseruing law whit souder yt wot babble supplieng recopense work superero gatio thei still returne place fro whese thei ar alredy shut yt kepeth law part workes far righteous man sound iugement wil graunt thei shamelesly take cofessed oft lord testifieth yt acknowlegeth righteousnesse work ye perfect obseruing law obstinatie yt whe destitute yt obseruing leaste shold seme spoiled al glorie yt haue altogether geue place god boste selues wote small peces workes go satisfaction redeme yt wanteth satisfactios haue already sufficietly ouerthrowe yt ought much dreame say thei play fooles wey detestable thing sin god truly thei shold vnderstad whole righteousnes men laid vpo heap sufficient make recopence one sinnegene iiixvii se one offence cast awai abadoned god yt therwithal lost al mean recouer saluatio therfore power satisfaction taken away wherwt flatter selues surely shal neuer satisfy god nothig pleasant acceptable procedeth fro enemy enemy al purposeth impute sinnes therfore sinnes must couered forgiue lord haue respect worke whervpon foloweth forgiuenesse sinnes fre grace wickedly blaspheme thrust satisfactios let v therforephil iijxiii exaple ye apostle forgettig thing ar behind v hasting forward thinges v run race endeuouring price highe calling c doth bosting work supererogation agre rule taught v whe haue done thing ar comaunded v say vnprofitable seruantes haue done oughtluk xviix say god fain lye determine thy self thou arte assured lord therfore comandeth v vnfainedly think consider selues fre beneficiall doings hi render due seruice worthily ar seruantes endetted many seruices ar able discharge although al thought membres wer turned dutieful deed law therfore saithe whe ye haue done thing yt comaded c much effect righteousnesse one man tha al righteousnes men therfore may none moste farre distant fro marke bee bolde boste haue added heap ful measure neither ther cause may take exceptio say nothing withstadeth endeuour mai procede beyod necessary duty som behalf ceasseth yt fro necessary must altogither hold ca imagin nothing auaileth either worship loue god compreheded vnder law god part law let v boaste voluntary liberalitie bound neccessitie purpose glorieng paul season alledged among corinthian owne wil yeld righti cor ixi otherwise might haue vsed wold hath employed vpon muche ought dutie also hath geuen free trauail beyond boundes duty shold haue marked ye reason expressed yt least shold offense weake false deceitful workemen boste selues alluring shew liberalitie wherby might bothe procure fauour poisonous doctrine raise vp hatred gospel paul driue necessitie either bring doctrine christ danger mere suche craftes go christian man indifferent thing runne offense may refraine graunt apostle somthing supererogation ye lord right required wise distributer gospel say whiche dutie doe finally although appere suche cause yet saying chrysostome alway true al thinges case wherin propre possession bondman whiche certaine law due lordluc xviivii christ bath vttered parable asked thanke wil geue bondseruant hauing ben day trauailed sondry labour returneth home v euening possible hath labored greater diligence durst haue required yet hath done thing estate bodage ought whole abilitie speake sort supererogatios whiche men wil boste god trifle suche neither hath tyme comanded doth approue wyl allowe accopt shalbe made significatio graunt workes supererogation namely whiche spoken prophetpsal ixii hath required thing handes let remeber place also spoken thingespsal lvii wherfore ye wey siluer bread ye spend labour satisfied dede hard idle come ye iudgement god remaineth nothing al mortal men holde peace dume tedeth purpose yt rather willingly yeld tha dagerously striue ye rigorousnes god meaneth felt righteousnes self tha ye first moment shold fall ye sight god affiance driuen away al glorieng must also necessarely depart geue praise righteousnes workes ye affiace wherof trebleth ye sight god sa xlvixx esa lxi must therfore come whether esaie calleth v yt al seede israel may praised glorie god true whiche saith place yt ar ye planting glorie god mynde therfore shall rightly purged whe shal neither behalf rest vpon cofidence workes reioise glory errour encouraged folish men puffing vp false lying affiance alway set cause saluatio workes loke ye fower kindes cause phylosophers eache v cosider effect thinges shal find yt none doth accord workes ye stablishing saluatio scripture doth euery report ye cause procuring eternall life v mercie heauenly father free loue towarde v yt material cause christ obedience sined nede ye glory god iustified frely grace yu hast head first fountain namely yt god embraced v free mercie foloweth redeptio christ iesu yu hast ye matter wherof righteousnesse made v faith bloude shewed ye instrumetall cause wherby ye righteousnes christ applied v last al ioyneth end saithe vnto shewyng righteousnesse may righteous righteousmaker faithe christe touche way righteousnes standeth goodnesse god may fully shyne see partes saluation without v cause wee shoulde either haue affiance glorie workes neither euen ye sworne ennemies grace god moue controuersie v efficient fynall cause vnlesse wyll denye whole scripture materiall formall cause caste false colour though workes haue half place faithe righteousnesse christ also teache scripture criynge whiche simply affirmeth christ v righteousnesse life benefit righteousnesse possesed faith holy men oftentimes strengthen comforte selues remembrance owne innocencie vprightnesse somtime also forbeare report prayse done twoo wayes either comparing good cause euell cause wicked conceiue thereby assured trust victory muche commending righteousnes ye iust deserued condemning aduersaries euen without comparison thei recorde theselues god purenesse conscience bringeth comfort affiance first two wayes shall se hereafter let v brefely declare latter agreeth whiche haue aboue said yt iudgemet god must rest vpo affiance workes glorie vpon opinion agrement holy one concerneth founding stablishinge saluation without respect workes bend eies goodnesse god bend selues afore al thinges beginning blessednesse rest therin fulfilling conscience founded raised stablished also stablished consideration workes namely far ye witnessings god dwelling reigning v sithe therfore affiance workes hath place vnlesse thou haue first free promise righteousnesse forbid vnderprop strengthen faith signes good god toward selfe al good giftes whiche god hath bestowed vpon v whe recorded remebrance v certaine manner beames face god
