tourne awaie free fauoure godephe iii vii paul testifieth ther length breadth depth heigth shoulde say whethersoeuer sens godly tourne themselues howe hie soeuer thei clyme farre wide soeuer thei extend yet thei ought goe oute loue christe holde selues wholy meditation therof bicause comprehendeth al kindes measure therfore saithe excelleth surmounteth aboue knowledge acknowledge howe muche christe hathe loued v fulfilled fulnesse godrom viii vii place glorieth godly vanquisher battell addeth reason bycause loued v see ther y holy one affiance work whiche either geueth thinge merite forasmuche thei regarde none otherwise giftes god whereby thei reknowledg goodnesse none otherwise signes calling whereby maie thinke vpon election whiche withdraweth thing free righteousnesse whiche wee obteine christe asmuche hangeth vpon standeth withoute thing doth augustine wordes wel set writeth saie lorde despise workes handes haue sought lorde handes haue deceiued commned workes handes feare least thou haste loked vpon thou shalt finde moe sinnes merites onli say ask desire despise ye workes thy hand beholde thy worke mine thow beholdest mine thou damnest thou beholdest thine thou crownest also whatsoeuer good workes haue thee setteth two cause dare boaste workes god bycause haue good workes seeth therin nothing owne secondly bycause also ouerwhelmed wyth multytude synnes whereupon commeth passe conscience feleth thereby feare dismaieng assurednesse therfore woulde haue god otherwise loke well doinges reknowledging grace calling maie make ende worke hathe begonne furthermore wheras scripture sheweth good workes faithfull cause lorde doth good vnderstanded haue set may stand vnshaken effect saluation consisteth loue god father mater obedience sonne instrument enlightning holy ghooste saie faithe end glorie great kindenes god thinges withstande lorde maye embrace workes inferiour cause whense cometh namely whome lord mercie hath apointed inheritace eternal hath chosen doth iustifie may legth glorifie maketh grace yt goeth step toward foloweth certaine maner cause oft hath occasio assigne true cause biddeth v flee workes holdeth v thinking vpon ye mercie god manner thing teacheth apostlerom vl xiij reward sinne death grace ye lord life euerlasting doth set righteousnesse coparison sinne setteth life agaynst death doth make righteousnesse cause life maketh sinne cause death comparison contrary haue stand well together much broken turning apostle meant coparison expresse truth death due deseruings men life reposed mercie god finally maners alway looke vnto free election fountaine beginning although loueth giftes dayly geueth much thei spring fountaine yet part holde fast free acceptation whiche alone able vpholde soules giftes spirit know thei geue hope frute ye mercie god thou hast escaped al dager pouertie vnthakfulnesse presumptio happy ye church neither wateth merites without presumptio presumptio without merites litle largely shewed godly meaning vsed merites saith shold church careful hath stedfaster surer cause glorie ye purpose god god ca denie wil yt hath promised cause ye shuldest aske xx vi ii merites may hope good thinges specially sith hearest sayd sake sake sufficeth merit know yt merites suffice al workes deserue ye scripture sheweth whe saith yt thei abide ye sight god bicause thei ful vncleannesse ye perfect obseruing ye law could found shal deserue whe teacheth yt think ourselues vnprofitable seruates haue done al thinges comaunded v xvi bicause shal haue geue nothing freely ye lord haue weried wel doyng yeld true thankfulnesse great boutifulnesse god vndouted grace god soeuer workes deserueth prayse one droppe ought properly ascribe selues truely earnestly acknowlege vanisheth away perfect euer yt defiled spot therefore let lord cal iudgement eue thing best workes shal verily espie owne righteousnesse man dishonestie shame good workes therfore please god vnprofitable doer rather receiue reward large benefites god bicause thei deserue bicause ye goodnesse god hath self apointed price vnto spitefulnesse men contented liberalitie god geueth vndue rewardes workes deserue thing wt ambitio full sacrilege endeuor yt wholly liberalitie god maye seme redred merites appelle comon iudgement euery man hath takyng profit pece ground man liberall graunt also claime himselfe title propretie doth vnthankfulnesse deserue lose self possession whiche likewise bondslaue beyng made free lord hide basenesse estate libertinelibertine free manumissio birth boaste freeman borne worthy brought back former bondage ye right vse enioyeng benefite neyther clayme selues tha geue defraude author benefite praise rather behaue selues yt hath geuen fro v may seme certaine maner remaine corrupted latine translation appereth framing wordes loger ioyning together sentence goyng epistle hebrues cause snare v one litle word greke wordes apostle nothing el yt sacrifice please acceptable god alone ought largely suffice subdue beate downe outragiousnesse pride yt faine worthinesse workes beyod rule scripture ye doctrine scripture good workes continually sprinkled many filthy spottes hath shewed faithful thinges shalbe set ouer many yet also sheweth place encreases faithful ye giftes free goodnesse ye thirst sayth come watersesa lvi ye haue monie come bye milke honye without monie vouchsaueth graunt honor v also ye giftes hath geue v thing age past ben handled disposed order thei ought haue neuer arisen many trobles dissensions1 coriijxi paul sayth yt ye bulding christian adopted heauenly father child heires bloud reco ciled fatheriohn xxxviij beyng geuen kept deliuered peril perishyng beyng lost beyng engraffed alredy certaine manner partaker eternall life beyng open danger satan yet oures power geue heaue earthmatth xxviijxvii whereby may treade downe sata v breake ye gate helles howsoeuer stil cary wt v body death yet life v brefely al thing oures haue thing selues nothing vpo foundation say behoueth bulded wil encrease holy temple lord ye world hath long time otherwise taught haue ben foud wote moral good workes may made acceptable god yt thei graffed christi ih vxij though scripture lieth whe sayth al death haue possessed ye sonne death shold thei bring forth matter lifero xiiijxxiij though force whatsoeuer done without faith sinne though may good frutes euell tree haue moste pestilent sophisters left christ wherein may shewe forth power saye hath deserued v first grace namely occasion deseruyng nowe part faile occasion offred desperate shamelesnesse vngodlinesse whoe would haue thought men professing name christ durst strippe naked power manner treade vnder foote testimonie eche spoken iustified beleue felowes teache cometh benefit way opened euery man iustifie himselfe would god tasted sayenges meane haue life yt haue sonne godi ih vxi iohn vxxiiii rom iiixxiiii ioh iiixxiii eph iivi col ixiii whosoeuer beleueth already passed death life iustified grace yt might made heires eternal life faithful haue christ abidyng whome cleaue fast god whiche partaker life sit heauely place transplanted kingdome god haue obteined saluatio innumerable declare cometh fayth christ nothing power obteine righteousnesse saluatio bothe geuen v therfore sone thou art fayth engraffed christ thou art already made sonne god ye heire heaue partaker righteousnesse possessor life lie may better cofuted thou hast obteyned ye fit abilitie deserue euen ye deseruinges christ comunicated thee ye sorbonical schooles ye mother al error haue take fro v ye iustificatio faith ye sume al godlinesse graut verily word yt iustified formed faith afterward expound bicause good workes haue faith auayle righteousnesse yt thei seme manner name faith mockage sithe wtout great enuiousnesse could passed ouer silence seyng oft repeted scripture yet coteted prayse good workes priuilie steale fro god somwhat geue away bicause thei see good workes litle auaile aduauce properly called merites accompted frutes grace god picke strength free oyle forsothe stone denye deede principal cause grace affirme thereby excluded free whiche merit later sopisters teach lib dist also pythagoras lobard copare men may say sound witted sobre truely point maruelous blindenesse whe augustine oft mouth thei saw great carefulnesse prouided yt pece glorie good workes neuer litle shold coueyed men whe entreated free recited certaine testimony purspose whiche sort often time found many like writinges whe forbiddeth v yt boste merites psal epist bicause eue thei also giftes god writeth yt merit grace gotten sufficience al made grace c maruell lombard blinde ye light scripture appereth wel practised yet nothing could desired plaine disciple word ye apostle whe forbiddeth christias al glorieng adioyneth reason lawfull glorie bicause ye handyworke god eph iix created al good workes walk sithe therfore cometh v good thing much regenerate regeneratio whole god without exceptio right shold claime selues one ounce good workes finally whereas cotinually call vpo good workes meane time instruct cosciences neuer dare haue affiace haue god wel pleased fauorable workes cotrarywise without makyng metion merit yet doctrine raise vp courage faithful wt singular cofort whe teach yt workes please god vndoutedly accepted vnto yea also require yt attept goe worke without faith say vnlesse first assured confidence minde determine shall please god wherfore let v suffer selues led much one heare bredth away fro fundatio beyng layed wise bulders afterward wel orderly bulde vpon neede doctrine exhortatio ioh ixij pet iiiiiij tim x luc xx thei put men minde sonne god hath appered end may destroy workes deuel sinne god time past enough fulfilling desire gentile elect god velleis mercie chosen vnto honour whiche ought made cleane al filthinesse al spoken one shewed christ wil haue disciple forsaking themselues taking vp crosse follow yt hath forsake hath cut roote al euels maye seke thinges owne hath taken vp crosse hath framed patience mildenesse example christ conie neth al duty godlinesse holinesse shewed obediet father euen death wholly occupied doyng workes god whole heart breathed glorie father gaue soule brother bothe good wished good enemy neede cofort wil bryng maruelous comfortii cor iii viii affliction made careful labour forsaken brought lowe cofounded throwe downe perish alway bearing v body mortifieng iesus christ ye life iesus may manifestly shewed vsii tim phil iiix dead shall also liue together suffer shal also reigne together fashioned like suffringesrom viiixxix till atteyne likenesse resurrection asmuch father hath predestinate fashioned like image sonne whome hath chosen maye first begotten among brethre therfore neyther death present thinges thinges come shall seuer v loue god christ rather thinges shall turne v good saluation loe iustifie workes god say god regenerate made newe creatureii pet may passe kingdome sinne kingdome righteousnesse testimonie thei make callyng certayne iudged tree frutes xvi chapter pa confutation sclaunders whereby papistes goe bryng doctrine hatred one word may shamelesnesse certayne vngodly men confuted whiche sclaunder v sayeng destroy good workes doe draw men awaye followyng say iustified workes deserue saluatio againe make easy away right cousnesse teache lieth free forgeuenesse sinnes enticement allure men sinne whiche owne much enclined thereto already sclaunders say one word sufficiently confuted yet brefely answer bothe allege iustification fayth good workes destroyed leaue vnspoken manner men zelous louers good workes whiche doe backbite v let haue licence freely rayle licetiously infect whole world filthinesse life faine greued fayth gloriously aduaunced workes dryuen downe place raysed vp stablished neyther doe dreame fayth voyde good workes iustification without onely difference confesse fayth good workes necessarily hange together yet set iustification fayth workes reason doe haue redinesse easily declare turne christ vnto whome faythe directed whome receyueth whole strength therefore iustified faith bycause fayth take holde righteousnesse christ alone reconciled god thou canst take holde thou must also therewithall take holde sanctification geuen v righteousnesse wisdome sanctification redemptio therfore christ iustifieth none whome doth also sanctifie cor ixxx benefites coupled together perpetuall vnseperable knot whome enlighteneth wisdome redemeth whome redemeth iustifieth iustifieth sanctifieth asmuch question righteousnesse sanctifieng let v staye vpon maye put difference betwene yet christ conteineth bothe vnseperably wilt thou therfore obteine righteousnesse christ thou must first possesse christ thou canst possesse thou must e made partaker sanctification bicause torne peces sithe therefore lord doth graunt v benefites enioyed none otherwise geuing geueth bothe together one neuer without appereth true iustified without workes yet workes bycause partaking christ wherby iustified lesse coteined sanctification righteousnesse also moste false mindes men withdrawen affection weldoyng take opinion merityng way reader must warned foolishly reason fro reward merit shall afterward plainly declare namely bicause know principle god lesse liberal assigneth reward workes whe geueth power well rather differre place fit shalbe enough touche howe weake obiection whiche shalbe done two wayes first whereas say shalbe care well framyng life hope reward set erre quite truth enteded men serue god thei loke reward let hire sell labor litle preuayle god freely worshipped freely loued say alloweth worshipper hope receyuing reward cut yet cesseth worshippe moreouer men pricked forward man put sharper spurres vnto taken ende redeption calling word god spurreth men withal teacheth wicked vnthakefulnesse mutually loue agayne whiche first loued v blood christ conscience cleansed dead workeshebr ixxiiii luc x iij serue liuyng god haynous sacrilege beyng one cleased defile selues newe filthinesse prophane holy blood deliuered handes enemy maye without feare serue holinesse righteousnesse dayes liferom vixviij made free sinne maye free spirit folow righteousnesse olde man crucified may rise agayne newnesse life agayne dead christ becommeth member must seeke thinges abouecol iiii must world wayfaring men home may long toward heauen treasuretit ijxi grace god hath appered end forsakyng al vngodlinesse worldly desire maye liue soberly holyly godlyly world lokyng blessed hope appering glorie great god sauior therefore apointed stirre vp wrath selues may obteyne saluation christ teples holy ghosti thes vix cor iijxvi eph iixx vviii ii cor vi thes iiii sanctificatio absteyne vnlawfull desire callyng holy fulfilled purenesse life purpose deliuered sinne obey righteousnesse pricked forward charitie liuely argument tha iohn shold mutually loue one god hath loued v herein child differ childre deuell child light child darknesse bycause abide loue againe yt argument paule cleaue christ member one body mete holpen one mutuall duty strongly prouoked holinesse heare agayne iohn haue hope sanctifie theselues bycause god holy agayne mouth paule hauyng promise adoptio cleanse selues defilyng flesh spirit heare christ settyng forth example vnto v follow steppe fewe thinges haue set forth taste yf ented goe dryuen make long volume apostle full encouragementes exhortatios rebukynges whereby maye instruct man god euery good worke without mention merit rather fetch chefe exhortation saluation standeth vpon mercie god vpon merite oures paule hath whole epistle discoursed hope life v righteousnesse christro xiii cometh downe morall exhortation besecheth mercie god whiche hath vouchesaued exted v truely one cause ought haue ben sufficientmatth vxvi god may glorified v vehemently moued glorie god yet remembrace benefites ought haue ben sufficient stirre vp well men whiche paraduenture thrustyng merites beate seruile constrayned obedience lawe falsly saye haue nothing whereby maye exhorte men good workes bicause goe waye worke though god much desired obedience paragraph whiche protesteth loueth cherefull geuer forbiddeth thyng geuen heauinesse necessitie neyther doe speake doe eyther refuse despise kinde exhortation ix ii whiche scripture oftentimes vseth maye leaue meane vnattempted euery way stirre vp mindes rehearseth reward god render euery according workes denie thing yea chefe amog many graunt yt ought take beginning therat moreouer affirme maketh nothing ye settyng vp merites men boste shal hereafter see last saye profitable vse vnlesse doctrine haue first taken place iustified merit christ coceyued faith merites workes bicause none fit endeuour holinesse vnlesse haue first digested doctrine thing also prophet wel signifieth thus speaketh god xxxx thee mercie thou mayest feared sheweth worshippyng god whe mercie acknowleged vpon alone bothe founded stablished worthy noted maye know beginning worshippyng god aright affiance mercie also feare god whiche papistes haue meritorious haue name merite bicause grounded vpon pardon forgeuenesse sinnes moste vayne sclaunder men allured sinne affirme free forgeuenesse sinnes whiche saye righteousnesse consisteth saye great value good oures recompensed therefore neuer obteyned vnlesse freely geuen moreouer v deede freely geuen christ bought derely namely owne moste holy bloud byside whiche price value enough might payed iudgement god menne taught thinges put minde thanke moste holy bloud shed oft sinne furthermore learne filthinesse suche neuer washed awaye fountaine moste pure bloud ought heare thynges conceyue greater horrour sinne yf sayd wyped awaye sprynklyng good workes yf haue thynge god howe dred beyng one cleansed wallowe themselues agayne myre muche lieth trouble infect purenesse fountayne haue washed feete sayth faythfull soule salomo shal againe defile cant euident whether sort doe bothe abace forgeuenesse sinnes make vile dignitie righteousnesse babble god appeased owne trysting satisfaction donge affirme giltinesse sinne greuous bee purged light trifle displeasure god heauie released satisfaction value therefore prerogatiue bloud christ say righteousnesse fayle time restored repaired satisfactorie workes thynke precious matched anye recompense workes therfore restoryng thereof must flee mercie god rest thing perteyne forgeuenesse sinnes let sought next chapter xvii chapter p agreement promise lawe gospell let v also goe argumetes wherwith satan soldiars garde goeth eyther ouerthrowe batter iustification fayth thinke haue already wrong fro sclaunderers charge v enemy good workes iustification taken awaye good workes good workes done done shold denied good put affiace glorie ascribe saluatio affiance glorie authour saluation christ sonne god oures likewise sonnes god heyers heauely kingdome beyng called goodnesse god owne worthinesse ye hope eternal blessednesse bicause biside assayle v haue sayd engine goe let v goe forward beatyng awaye also first come backe promise lawe lord set forth kepers law aske whether wil haue vtterly voyde effectuall bycause absurditie scorned say voyde take confessed effectualnesse hereupon reason iustified faithdeut viixi thus sayth lord shalbe yf thou shalt heare commaundementes iudgementes shal kepe lord also shall kepe thee couenant mercie whiche hath sworne thy father shall loue thee multiplie theeier viiii xxiii blesse thee c agayne ye shall wel direct wayes endeuors yf ye walke strange god yf ye iudgement betwene man man goe backe malice walke middest recite thousand peces sorte whiche sithe nothyng differ sense shalbe declared solutio thesedeut xixxvi summe moses testifieth lawe set forth blessyng curse death life thus therfore reson eyther blessyng made idle frutelesse iustification fayth alone haue already shewed sticke faste lawe ouer v beyng destitute al blessing hangeth curse thretened al transgressor lord promiseth nothyng perfect kepers law none found therefore remaineth mankinde law accused subiect curse wrath god whiche maye loosed must needes goe power law brought libertie bo dage therof carnall libertie whiche withdraw v fro kepyng law allure v thinke thinges lawfull suffer lust stayes beyng broken loose reyn runne riot spiritual libertie whiche may comfort rayse vp dismayed ouerthrowen conscience shewyng free curse damnation wherewith lawe helde downe bond fast tied deliuerance subiection law man mission may cal obteyne whe fayth take holde mercie god christ whereby certified assured forgeuenesse sinnes felyng whereof law prick bite v reason euen promise offred v lawe vneffectuall voyde vnlesse goodnesse god gospell help condition kepe whole law vpo promise hang wherby alone thei performed shal neuer fulfilled lord helpeth leauyng part righteousnesse workes supplyeng part mercieful bearyng v setteth christ fulfillyng righteousnesse apostle sayd iewes beleued iesus christ knowing man iustified workes lawe xvi addeth reason holpen fulnesse righteousnesse fayth christ iustified workes law faythfull remoue law fayth may fayth finde righteousnesse see absent law truely forsake righteousnesse lawe therefore let list amplifie rewardinges whiche sayd prepared keper law therewithall cosider cometh passe peruersnesse fele frute thereof till haue obteyned righteousnesse faith dauid made mention rewardyng whiche lord hath prepared seruantes descendeth reknowledging sinnes wherby rewarding made voyde paragraph also xix psalme gloriously setteth forth benefites law crieth whoe shall vnderstand faultes lord cleanse fro secret faultes place altogether agreeth place sayd wayes lord goodnesse truth leaue himp x addeth thy name sake lorde thou shalt mercifull peruersnesse muche ought also reknowledge deede good god set forth vnto v lawe might deserue workes neuer cometh v deseruyng workes geuen vanish awaye without frute haue eue already protested meaning say verily vtter effectualnesse toward v long haue respect merit workes therfore considered themselues certayne maner abolished apostle teacheth noble promise paragraph haue geuen commaudementes shal shall liue value stand still shal neuer whit profit ben geuen bicause belongeth euen holy seruauntes god whiche far fulfillyng lawe compassed many transgression promise gospel put place offre free forgeuenesse sinnes bryng passe selues acceptable god workes also haue thanke lord accepteth also extedeth blessinges whiche couenant due keping law graunt therefore thinges whiche lord hath promised lawe folowers righteousnesse holinesse rendred workes faythfull rendryng cause alway cosidered powreth grace workes cause see three first god turnyng away sight fro workes seruates alway deserue rather reproche praise embraceth christ meane faith reconcileth without meane workes secod fatherly kindnesse tender mercifulnesse lifteth vp workes great honour weyeng worthinesse accompteth value third receiueth workes pardon imputyng imperfectio wherwith al beyng defiled otherwise rather reckened amog sinnes vertues hereby appereth much sophisters haue ben deceiued whiche thought gaylye escaped al absurdity sayd workes owne inwarde goodnesse auayle deserue saluation forme couenant bicause lord hath liberalitie much estemed meane time considered howe far workes whiche would haue meritorious conditio promise vnlesse went bothe iustification grounded vpon fayth forgeuenesse sinnes eue good workes themselues haue neede wiped spottes therefore three cause god liberalitie brought passe workes faythfull acceptable noted one suppressed two yea principall allege ye sayeng peter whiche luke rehearseth ye actes finde truthe god accepter personesact xxxxiiii euery nation doth righteousnesse acceptable hereupon gather semeth vndouted man doth right endeuors get himselfe fauor god beneficiall gift god alone obteyneth saluation yea god doth mercie help sinner workes bowed mercie wise make scripture agree together vnlesse note double acceptyng man god man nature god findeth nothyng whereby maye enclined mercie miserie therfore certayne man naked needy goodnesse side full stuffed loden al kindes euels god first receyueth qualitie pray shal say worthy heauely calling away therefore vaine imaginyng merites god euidetly setteth free mercifulnesse place sayde voice angell cornelius prayer almes asceded sight god men lewdly wrested man endeuor good workes prepared receiue grace god muste needes cornelius already enlightened ye spirit wisdome sithe endued true wisdome namely ye feare god yt sanctified spirit sith folower righteousnesse apostle teacheth certaine frute therof al vv al thing therefore whiche sayd haue pleased god grace far yt endeuor prepare receiue truely ca one syllable scripture brought forth agreeth doctrine yt none cause god accept man vnto bicause seeth euery way lost left himselfe bicause haue lost vseth mercie deliueryng see accepting hath regard righteousnesse man mere token goodnesse god toward men beyng miserable moste vnworthy great benefit lord hath brought man bottomlesse depth destruction seuered himselfe grace adoption bicause hath nowe begotten newely formed newe life nowe embraceth newe creature giftes spirit acceptyng whereof peter maketh mention whiche faythfull vocation allured god euen respecte also workes lorde loue kisse good thinges whiche worketh spirit alwaye remembred none otherwise acceptable god respect workes muche cause sake whatsoeuer good workes hath geuen encreasyng liberalitie also vouchesaueth accept whense haue good workes bicause lord hath chosen vessel vnto honor garnish true godlinesse whereby also accompted good though nothing wanting bicause kinde father tederly graunteth pardon deformity spottes cleaue summarily signifieth nothing el place god child acceptable louely seeth markes feature owne face haue place taught regeneratio repairyng image god v asmuch therfore wheresoeuer lord beholdeth owne face worthily loueth hath honor without cause sayd life faithful beyng framed holinesse righteousnesse pleaseth bycause godly beyng clothed mortall fleshe yet sinner good workes begonne sauoryng faultinesse fleshe fauorable neyther vnlesse embrace christ themselues manner place taken whiche testifie god kinde mercifull folowers righteousnesse moses sayd israelitesdeut vijix lord thy god kepeth couenant thousand generation sentece afteward vsed people common manner speache salomon solemne prayeri viijxxiij sayth lord god israell whiche kepest couenant mercie thy seruates walke thee whole heart wordes also repeted nehemias paragraph al ye couenates mercie ye lord likewise behalues requireth seruates vprightnesse holinesse lifedeut xx xviii goodnesse made mockerie man swelling vaine reioysing reason therof blesse owne soule walking meane time peruersnesse heart wil way kepe dutie admitted comunio couenat yet neuerthelesse couenat self made beginnyng free perpetually remayneth suchii sam xxiji maner dauid glorieth yt redred reward cleannesse hades yet omitteth fountaine haue spoken drawen wombe bicause god loued setteth goodnesse cause abateth nothyng free mercie whiche goeth giftes whereof beginning ye way shalbe profitable touch formes speakyng differ promise law cal promise law eche comonly writte bokes moses much also found many promise ye gospel properly belong ministerie law promise name euer list cal declare reward redy vpon condition thou co maunded thee sayd lord kepeth couenat mercie loue therin rather shewed maner men seruantes haue faithfully receiued couenant cause expressed lord good manner shewyng lord vouchsaueth graunt v ye grace eternal life end loued feared honored v whatsoeuer promise mercie scripture rightfully directed reuerence worship author benefites ofte therefore heare doth good kepe law let v reme ber child god signified dutie whiche ought continual cause adopted honor father therfore lest disherite selues right adoptio must alway endeuor wherunto calling tendeth let v againe kepe minde yt accoplishment mercie god hangeth vpo workes faithfull therfore fulfilleth promise saluation whiche answer callyng vprightnesse life bicause acknoweth natural toke child ruled spirit vnto good herunto let yt referred ye xv psalme spoken citezens ye church lord whoe shal dwel thy tabernacle whoe shal rest thy holy hill innocent hades cleane heartesa xxxii xiiij c agayne esaie whoe shall dwel deuouring fire doth righteousnesse speaketh right thinges c described staye whereupon faythfull may stand lord manner wherewith merciful father bringeth felowship therein defendeth stregtheneth bicause abhorreth sinne loueth righteousnesse ioyneth cleanseth wt spirit yt may make like fashion kingdome therfore ye question ye first cause wherby entrie made open holy one kingdome god fro whense haue yt thei may stand fast abide haue answer ready bicause lord mercie hath one adopted perpetually defendeth question manner must come downe regeneration frutes therof rehersed psalme semeth much hardnesse place garnish good workes titie righteousnesse affirme man iustified first sort many place obseruinges comaundementes called iustifications righteousness sort exaple mosesdeut vixxv shalbe righteousnesse kepe commaudementes thou take exception say promise law knit codition impossible proueth nothing ca make ye answer yt shalbe thee righteousnesse lorddeu xxiiij xiii p vix x redeliuer poore man pledge c againe prophet sayth yt zele reuenging shame israell imputed phinees righteousnesse therfore pharisee time thinke yt haue large matter triuph vpon say righteousnesse faith set vp ye iustificatio workes geueth place right make argument righteousnesse bee workes false iustified faith though graunt commaundementes law called righteousness maruell deede howebeit muste warne reader grecian haue fittly translated hebrue word hucmi dikaiomata righteousness comaundemets worde willingly release quarell neyther doe denie law god conteineth perfect righteousnesse although bycause detters thinges commaundeth therfore euen haue performed ful obedience therof vnprofitable seruates yet bicause lord hath vouchsaued graunt honor righteousnesse take away whiche hath geuen therefore willingly confesse full obedience lawe righteousnesse kepyng euery comaudement part righteousnesse yf whole summe righteousnesse partes also denie suche forme righteousnesse therefore take away righteousnesse law maymed vnperfect felfe reason weakenesse flesh seene ye scripture calleth simply comaundemetes lord righteousness also geueth name workes holy one reporteth zacharie wife walked righteousness lordluc ivi truely whe speaketh weyeth workes rather ye nature ye law tha owne propre estate howbeit againe noted eue sayd negligence greke translator law made asmuch luke wold alter nothing ye receiued traslation also striue god hath commaunded thinges lawe men righteousnesse righteousnes performe keping whole lawe euery transgression broken wheras therfore law doth nothing prescribe righteousnesse haue respecte ye seueral comaundementes therof righteousnes haue respect men whome thei done thei obteine praise righteousnesse one worke beinge trespasser many worke whiche euer partly faulty reason imperfection come second kinde chefe hardnes paul hath nothing strong proue righteousnesse fai whiche written abrahambe iiiiiii psal c vixxxi faithe imputed righteousnesse sith therfore said acte done phinees imputed righteousnesse paule affirmeth faith may also conclude work whervpon aduersaries though thei wonne victorie determine dede iustified without faith also iustified alone workes accomplish righteousnesse therefore beseache godly thei knowe true rule righteousnesse taken scripture thei religiously earnestly weie scripture may without cauillations rightly made agree selfe asmuch paul knewe yt iustificatio faith ye refuge yt ar destitute righteousnesse doth boldly coclude yt al thei yt ar iustified faith ar excluded righteousnesse work sith certayne iustification faith common faithfull dothe thereof like boldenesse conclude man iustified work rather contrariewise men iustified without helpe workes one thing dispute value work themselues thing accompt made stablishing righteousnesse faith shal set price vpon work according worthinesse saie thei vnworthy come sight god therefore man hath workes whereof may glorie god spoiled al helpe work iustified faith define righteousnesse thus sinner receiued communion christ hys grace reconciled god cleansed bloode obteineth forgeuenesse sinnes clothed righteousnesse stadeth assured heauenly iudgment eate whe forgeuenesse sinnes set good workes folowe haue valuation deseruing bycause whatsoeuer vnperfect couered ye perfectio christ whatsoeuer spottes fylthinesse wyped away wyth hys cleannesse yt maye come ye examination iudgement god therfore giltines al trespass blotted whereby men hindred yt thei bring forthe nothing acceptable god faulte imperfection buried whiche wonte also defile good workes ye good workes faithful compted righteous one imputed righteousnesse man obiect assaile righteousnesse faithe first aske whether man compted righteous one two holy work rest work life trespasser law absurditie aske compted righteous many good work yf parte founde gilty also shal bolde affirme penal ordina ce law crieth oute proclameth al accursed haue fulfilled comaundementes lawe vttermostdeut xxvij moreouer wil go ask whether ther work yt deserueth accused vncleannesse imperfection howe could eies eue starres cleane enoughiob iiii xviii angeles righteous enough shal compelled graunt good worke defiled transgression adioyned ye corruptnesse selfe haue honoure righteousnesse nowe bee certaine proceedeth righteousnesse faith yt woorkes otherwise vnpure vncleane halfe workes worthy ye sight god much lesse loue imputed righteousnesse thei wt boasting righteousnesse workes destroye iustification faith wheras iustification thei shold vaine boaste righteousnes wyll thei make viper birth therto end saiengs vngodly thei denie iustificatio faith beginning foundatio cause matter substance ye righteousnesse work yet thei coclude ye man iustified faith bycause good workes also accopted righteousnesse therfore let v let passe folly confesse truth yt righteousnesse work sort soever accopted hangeth vpon iustificatio faith onely nothing minished also cofirmed namly wherbi strength therof appeareth mighty neither yet let v think yt work ar comeded fre iustificatio yt thei also afterward come ye place iustifieng parte yt office betwene faithe vnlesse iustificatio remaine alway whole vncleannes workes shalbe vncouered absurditie yt man iustified faith yt righteous also woorkes esteemed righteous aboue worthynesse maner wil graut workes righteousnes part aduersaries theselues wold haue also yt alowed god wer perfect ful righteousnesse remebre vpo foudatio vpholde al ye difficultie shalbe disolued til beginneth acceptable worke whe receiued wt pardo whense cometh pardo bicause god beholdeth v amp al thinges christe therefore graffed christ therfore appeare righteous god bicause wickedness couered innocence workes taken righteous bicause whatsoeuer faultines otherwise buried ye cleannesse christe imputed may rightfully sai yt bi onli faith oly also work ar iustified righteousnes work sorte soeuer hangeth vpo faith tree iustification made ought included vnder sette vnder effect vnder cause therof may cal farre oughte bee raysed vp either destroy darken itro iiiivii paule dryue men confesse yt oure blessednesse cosisteth ye mercy god work chefli enforceth saying dauid blessed thei whose iniquitties forgeuenps x xii whose sinnes couered blessed ye lord hath imputed sinne thrust ye contrary innumerable saying wherin blessednesse seemeth geuen workspsa cxxii pra xiiii xxi psal ii ix p cvi ii cxix mat vii blessed man whiche feareth lord whiche hath pitie poore hath walked councell wicked beareth temptation blessed kepe iudgement vndefiled poore spirit meeke mercifull c shall make shall bee true paul saith bicause thinges ar ther comended neuer man therfore allowed god foloweth ye man alwai miserable vnlesse deliuered misery forgeuenesse sinnes asmuch therfore kindes blessednes ar extolled scripture fal void ye man receiueth frute none til haue obteined blessedness forgeuenes sin mai afterward make place foloweth yt ye hiest chefe also blessednes vnlesse paraduenture haue weakned consist alone ther much lesse reason calling righteous shoulde trouble v comonli geue ye faithful graut verili yt thei ar called righteous ye holines li asmuch thei rather endeuor ye folowig righteousnes fulfil righteousnes self mete yt righteousnes suche giue place iustification faith whence hath thei say haue yet busines iames namelye wt ope voice fighteth vsiam ixii teacheth yt abraha iustified work also al iustified workes faith wil thei draw paul fight iames thei hold iames minister christ saying must take disagre fro christ speakig mouth paul holy ghost affirmeth mouth paul abraha obteined righteousnesse faith workes also teach iustified faith without work ye law holy ghost teacheth iames abraham righteousnes consisteth workes faith certain holy ghost fighteth wt himselfe agrement shall ther therfore two enough ye aduersaries thei pluck vp righteousnes faith wolde haue fastened depe rootes render conscience quietnesse thei haue great care whereby verily may see yt thei gnaw ye iustificatio faith ye meane tim apoint mark righteousnes wher cosciences may stay therfore let triumph thei list yt thei may boaste victorie yt thei haue taken away certainetie righteousnesse wretched victorie thei shal obteine ye light truth quenched ye lord shal suffer ouerspred ye darknes lie whersoeuer ye truth god shal stand thei shall nothing preuaile deny therefore yt saieng iames thei still cotinually hold vp v wer ye shelde achilles doth thing al make may made plaine first must loke ye mark yt apostle shooteth must note wher thei deceiued bicause many whiche mischefe wont continual ye church openly bewraied infidelitie neglecting omitting al ye propre work ye faithful yet cessed boaste ye false name faith iames doth mock ye folish boldnes therfore purpose point diminish ye force true faith shew ondly trifle chalenge much ye vaine image yt contented herwt thei carelesly ranne dissolutely abroade licentiousnesse vice ground coceiued shalbe easy perceaue oure aduersaries misse thei fal two deceites ye word one ye name faith yt ye word iustifieng whereas apostle nameth faith vaine opinion farr distant ye truth faith spoke waie graunting derogation matter whych sheweth ye beginning word profiteth brothre man say yt hath faith hath work doth say haue faith wtout workes man boast plainely also speaketh little mockerie maketh yt worse deuills knowledg last al calleth dead definition maye sufficiently perceaue hee meaneth thou beleuest saith yt god truely nothing conteined thys faith beleue god maruel iustifie taken let v think thing bared christian faith nature whereof y farre otherwise manner doth true faith iustifie v coioyneth v christ made one wt may enioy partakyng hys righteousnesse dothe therefore iustifie v conceiueth knowledge beinge god thys resteth vpon assurednesse mercy god haue yet work vnlesse examine also deceite word asmuche iames setteth part iustificatio work wil make iames agreing wt rest scripture must necessitie take word iustifieng significatio tha take paul paul saith yt ar iustified whe ye remebrance vnrighteousnes blotted ar accopted righteous iames ment yt takinge wrongefully alleged yt moses abraha beleued god c thus frameth together abraha bi work obteined righteousnes bycause sticked ye comaundemet god offer vp sonne scriptur fulfilled whiche saithe hee beleued god imputed righteousnesse absurditie effect hys cause eyther moses dothe place falsely testifie faythe imputed abraham righteousnesse deserued righteousnesse obedience whiche shewed offering vp isaac abraham iustified faith ismael yet conceiued whych nowe growen past childehode isaac borne therfore shal saie got righteousnesse obedience folowed long afterward wherefore either iames wrongfully misturne order wickednesse thinke meant say iustified though deserued accompted righteous truely appeareth speaketh declaration righteousnesse implication yf saide whoso righteous true faithe thei doe proue righteousnesse wt obediece good work wt bare imagelike visor faith sume disputeth meane ar iustified requireth ye faithful working righteousnesse paule affirmeth yt iustified wtout ye help work iames doth suffer accopted righteous want good workes co sidering end shal deliuer v al dout aduersaries hereby chefely deceiued yt thei think yt iames defineth ye maner iustifieng wheras trauaileth nothing el ouerthrowe peruerse carelesnes vainly pretend faith excuse despisinge good workes therefore howe manye way soeuer thei wrest ye word iames thei shal wring nothing two sentence vaine bodilesse shewe faith doth iustifie yt faithful man cotented wt imaginatiue shew doth declare righteousnesse good workes yt thei allege paul meaning yt doer ye lawro iixiii ye hearer ar iustified nothing helpeth escape away wt solutio ambrose yt therfore spoke bicause fulfilling law faith christe see yt meare starting hole nothing nedeth abroad way open ye apostle throweth yt iewes fro folish cofidence whyche boasted theselues knowledg law meane time thei greatest despisers therfore thei shold stand much conceite bare knowledg ye lawe warneth yt righteousnesse sought law ye knowledg ye obseruing required verily make doubt yt righteousnesse law standeth workes yet also righteousnesse cosisteth worthinesse merites work yet proued yt iustified work vnlesse thei bring forth man yt hath fulfilled ye lawe yt paul meant none otherwise ye hanging together ye text shalbe sufficient testimonie generally codemned gentile iewes vnrighteousnesse descendeth particular shewing saith yt thei sinned wtout law perish wtout law spoken ye gentile thei whiche haue sinned ye law iudged ye law perteineth iewes bicause winkinge trespassinges proudly gloried onely law adioyneth yt whiche fitly agreed yt law therfore made yt shold made righteous hearing ye voice therof til obeied shold say sekest thou righteousnesse law allege ye hearing self small importace bring work whiche ye maiest declare yt lawe set thee vaine workes bicause thei destitute folowed yt thei wer spotled glorieg ye law therfore must ye meaning paul rather frame contrary argument righteousnes law consisteth ye perfectio work man boast yt hath workes satisfied ye law therfore righteousnes ye law thei allege also place wherin ye faithful boldly offer righteousnesse ye iudgmente god examined require ye sentece geue according itpsa viii sort iudge lord according righteousnesps xviii according innocence heare righteousnesse god thou haste proued heart hast visited night wickednesse founde mepsal xviii xxi againe lorde shall rendre according righteousnesse shal recompense according ye cleannesse hand bicause haue kept ye way ye lord haue wickedly departed fro god shalbe vnspotted shal kepe fro iniqui iepsa xxvii iudge lorde bycause haue walked mine innocence haue sit wt lieng men wil entre wt yt wycked thing destroy soule wt ye vngodly life wt men blood whose hand ar iniquity whose right hand filled wt giftes haue walked innocently haue aboue spoke affiance ye holy one seme simply take theselues work testimony yt haue alleged thei shal much accobre v vnderstaded according compasse thei comonly call circumstance ye doble neither would thei haue wholy examined yt thei shold either codened acquited according ye continual course whole life thei bringe iudgment special cause debated neither thei claime selues righteousnes respect ye perfectio god comparison naughty wicked first ye iustifieng man entreated required yt haue good cause particular mater b certaine perpetual agreement righteousnesse whole life ye holy e thei cal vpo ye iudgmet god approue innocencie offer theselues free fro al giltinesse euery behalfe faultlesse verily whe thei haue fastned affiance saluation goodnesse onely yet trusting yt ye reuenger ye poore afflicted right equitie thei comend ye cause wherein ye innocent oppressed thei set aduersaries wc ye iudgment seate god thei boast innocence shal aunswer ye pureueise god seuerely searched bicause coparison ye malice obstinancie suttletie wickednesse aduersaries thei know yt plainnes righteousnes simplicitie cleanes knowe pleasing god thei feare cal vpo iudge betwene theselues thei sa xxvi xiii dauid said saul lorde rendre euery according righteousnesse truth meant lord shold examine reward euery man according deseruings toke ye lord witnesse great innocecy copariso ye wickednes saul paul whe bosteth wt glorieng yt hath good witnesse coscience cor ixii yt hath trauayled wt simplicitie vprightnesse ye churche god meaneth yt stadeth vpo glorieg god copelled wt ye sclauders ye wicked defedeth faithful honest dealing knew pleasing ye merciful kindnes god agaist al euel speaking whatsoeuer bei cor iiijxiij se saith place knoweth euel ye therby iustified namly bicause knew yt iudgment god far surmuteth ye bleareyed sight howsoeuer therfore ye godly defend innocece agaist ye hypocrisie ye vngodly ye witnessing iudgmet god yet thei haue doe wyth god alone crye oute wyth one mouthe thow marke iniquitieps cxxx iii cxl p xxxviiiii lorde lorde shall abide entre iudgement thy seruantes bycause euery one liueth shall iustified thy sight distrusting owne workes thei gladly sing thy goodnesse better life also place vnlyke man may yet tarrypro xxvi xxiixv ez xviiiix xxxii xv salomon saith whiche walketh vprightnesse righteous againe path righteousnesse life death whiche manner ezechiell reporteth shal liue life doth iudgment righteousnesse none either denye darken let come forthe one sonnes adam vprightnesse ther none either thei must perishe sighte god flee sanctuarie mercie neither meane time denie faithfull vprightnesse though halfe vnperfect step towarde immortalitie whence commeth bicause whome lord hathe taken couenant grace searcheth work according deseruinges kisseth wt fatherly kindenes wherby vnderstand yt scholemen teache yt work haue value ye accepting grace thei meane yt workes otherwise sufficient purchase righteousnesse ye couenant ye law ye accepting god auauced value equalitie saie yt thei defiled bothe wt trespassinges owne spottes value al muche lord tenderly graunteth pardo bothe yt say geueth free righteousnesse maeph iiiii thes iiixiii neither praiers apostle seasonaly thrust place wher wissheth great perfectio ye faithful thei may faultlesse vnblamable day ye lo wordes deede ye celestines olde tune turmoile affirme perfectio righteousnes life thinke sufficient answer brefely augustine al godly oughte dede endeuoure toward mark yt thei may one day appeare spotlesse faultlesse ye face god bicause best excellent maner life nothing going forward shal til atteine mark vnclothed flesh sinne shall fully acknowledging imperfection bothe trueth humilitie xviii chapter rewarde righteousnesse workes ill gathered let v passe ouer saiengs affirme ye god wil rendre euery man according workesmat xvixxvii ii examined rule iudgmente butte least courage shold faint teacheth thei please pardo although augustine speaketh somwhat otherwise yet doth disagree matter shall appeare hys word thirde boke boniface cap wher compared two men together ye one life euen miraculously holy perfect honest dede vncorrupt maners perfect much wanteth last concludeth thus euen man manner semeth much inferioure reason true gaine dutiefull doinges greate value god thei richesse laied vp store v hand whoe shal feare saie scripture dothe ofte plainely witnesse butte man leape mere goodnesse god worthinesse workes shalbe mortificatio ie christ yt life maye bee shewed v bee fashioned like suffringes may come likenesse resurrection dead reason whiche adioined serueth proue worthinesse confirme ye hope ye kingdom god said agreeth wt iust iudgmente god take vengeance enemy vexation thei haue done agreeth also geue release reste vexation place whiche teacheth becommeth righteousnesse god forgett obedience declareth maner vnrighteous shold forget hath meaning god quicke outhfulnesse hath geuen v assurance yt laboure shall bee vaine shal take glorie let v alwaye remembre promise shold bring v profit vnlesse free couenaunt mercie went wherevpon whole assurednesse saluacion shold rest standing vpon couenant ought assuredly trust shal also want rewarde liberalitie god oure workes howsoeuer thei vnworthy apostle confirme v yt expectation affirmeth yt god vnrighteous wil stand promise one made therefore thys righteousnesse rather referred truth god promise iustice rendring due accordyng meaning notable saienge augustine ye holy sticketh reherse often notable think vnworthy yt continually remebre psal lord saith faithful hath made decter v receyuing thinge v promising thinges v also alleged saienges paul haue al faithe remoue moutaines placei cor xiii haue charitie nothing nowe remaine hope faith charitie greatest amog charitiecolos iiixiiii aboue thing haue charitie ye bod perfectio ye first two place pharises affirme rather iustified charitie faith namely ye chefer vertue thei saie fond argument easily wyped away haue place already declared yt thing whyche ar spoke ye first place perteine nothing true sayth place also expound true faith tha saith yt charitie greater yt meritorious bicause fruteful bicause extedeth bicause serueth mo bicause remaineth alway force wheras vse faith cotinueth time haue regard excellence ye loue god shold worthily haue chefe place whiche paul speaketh enforceth thing onely yt shold wt mutuall charitie edifie one ye lord let v imagine yt charitie dothe euery waie excell faithe yet man sounde iudgement yea sound braine wil gather thereof yt doth iustifie punc power iustifieng faith hath consisteth worthinesse ye worke iustification standeth vpon ye onely mercie god deseruing christ iustificatio faith taketh holde said iustifie aske aduersaries cause assign iustification charitie thei wil answer yt bicause dutiefull acceptable god therfore ye deseruing therof righteousnesse imputed v bi acceptatio goodnes god see wel argument procedeth say yt faith iustifieth bicause ye worthinesse selfe deserueth righteousnes v bicause instrument whyche freely obteine ryghteousnesse christ men omitting mercy god passing ouer christ summe righteousnesse standeth affirme iustified benifite charitie bicause excelleth aboue faith euen man wolde reason king fitter make shooe shooemaker bicause infinite way excellent argument plaine example sorbonicall schooles doo much taste vttermoste part lippes ye iustification faith wrangler yet carpe aske small distance place take name faith paul diuersly haue weightie cause exposition sithe giftes whyche paul rehearseth certaine maner vnder faith hope bicause thei perteine ye knowledge god contemneth al way recapitulation vnder ye name faith hope shold say ye prophecie tonges grace knowledg interpretation tend mark leade v ye knowlege god know god life none otherwise hope faith therfore name faithe hope comprehend al thing together ther remain three hope faith charitie yt say great diuersitie gift euer ther thei ar al referred among ye chefe charitie c ye third place thei gather charitie bond perfection also ye bond righteousnesse nothing el perfection first speake nothing howe paul ther calleth perfection ye membres ye churche wel set ordre cleaue together graunt yt charitie made perfecte god yet newe thing bring thei forth alwaie ye contrarie side take exceptio sai yt neuer come perfectio vnlesse fulfil al ye part charity therupo wil gather yt sith ar farr fro ye fulfilling charitie therfore al hope perfection cutt wil go al ye testimony day ye folish sorbonistes rashly snatch ye scripture thei first come hande throw v worthi laughed yt selfe also rehearse vnlesse wold worthily compted fond therfore wil make end shal haue declared saieng christ wherwt thei maruelously please theselues ye lawyer asked necessarie saluatio answered yt wilt entre lifemat xixxvii kepe ye comaundemets wold sai thei comaunded ye author grace get ye kingdom god ye keping comaundemets though forsoth certain yt christe tepered answeres wt saw yt doctor ye law asketh ye meane obteine blessednes ye onely wt thing men maye atteine vnto bothe ye person yt spake question self led ye lord answer lawyer filled wt ye persuasio ye righteousnes ye law blinde conscience work againe sought nothing el wer yt work righteousnes saluatio gotte therfore worthily set ye law ther perfect mirrore righteousnes also wt loude voice pronounce yt commau demets must kept life sought work doctrin necessary knowe christias shold thei flee christ thei acknowledg thei ar falle fro ye way life ye hedloge downefal death shold thei vnderstand far haue straied fro ye way life vnlesse thei first vnderstande yt way life thei taughte yt sanctuarie recouer saluacion christ whe thei see great difference betwene life righteousnesse god whiche conteined ye keping law summe saluation sought workes muste kepe ye comaundements whiche instructed perfect righteousnes must stick fast vnlesse wil faint midde course none v able kepe ye comaundemetes sith therfore excluded fro ye righteousnesse ye law must necessity resort helpe namly ye faith christ wherfore ye lord calleth back ye doctor law knew swel wt vaine confidence work lawe wherby may learne yt sinner subiect dreadful iudgement eternal death place wtout making mention ye law coforteth yt already humbled suche knowledgematt xixxxix promise grace come mee ye yt laboure loden wil refresh ye shal finde rest soules laste thei weary wt wresting scripture thei fal suttleties sophisticall argumentes thei cauil vpon faith place called worke therupon thei gather yt wronfully set faith contrarie workesihon v xxix thoughe forsothe faithe yt obeying god dothe deseruing procure vnto v ryghteousnesse rather bycause embracing mercie god sealeth oure heartes righteousnesse christe offred v preaching ye gospell reader shal pardo tarry vpon confuting suche folly thei themselues witho assaulte sufficiently ouerthrowen theyr owne feeblenesse way confute one obiection whyche seemeth haue shewe reason least shold troble ar well practised sith comon reason teacheth contrary one rule particular sinnes imputed v vnrighteousnesse thei say meete al particular good workes geue praise righteousnesse thei satisfie answer damnation men proprely proceedeth vnbelefe fro particular sinnes dede agree vnbelefe fou taine roote euels firste departinge god folow particular trespassinges ye law wheras seeme set one selfe reason good euell workes weieng righteousnesse vnrighteousnesse therein compelled disagree righteousnes workes perfecte obedience lawe therfore thou canst righteous vi work vnlesse thou folow streight line whole cotinuall course thy life sone thou haste swarued thou arte fallen vnrighteousnesse hereby appeareth righteousnesse commeth one fewe work vnswaruing vnweried obseruing ye wil god ye rule iudging vnrighteousnesse cotrar yt hath comitted fornicatio hath stolen one offence gylty death bicause hath offended maiestie god therefore suttle arguer stumble thei mark saieng iamesiam iix sinneth one made gylty al bicause hath forbidden kil hath also forbidden steale c therfore ought seeme absurditie saie death iuste rewarde euery sinne bicause thei euery one worthy iuste dyspleasure vengeance god thou shalt reason foolishly ye contrarie side thou gather one good worke man may reconciled god whiche many sinnes deserueth wrathe xix chapter christian libertie must entreate christian libertie declaration whereof must omitt whose purpose comprehed abridgment summe doctrine gospel thing principally necessarie without ye knoweledg wherof conscience dare maner enterprise nothing without doubting thei stumble start back many thing thei alway stagger tremble specially appendant iustification auaileth little vnderstanding strength thereof yea thei earnestly feare god shal hereby receiue incomparable frute doctrine wicked lucianicall men pleasantly taunt scoffeslucian godlesse man bicause ye spiritual darkenesse wherwyth thei taken euery wanton railing lawful wherfore shal come forth fi season profitable differ thys place ye plainer discoursing haue already diuers place lightly touched bicause sone mention brought christian libertie either filthy lustes boyle mad motion arise vnlesse wanton wittes timely met withall whiche doe otherwise naughtily corrupte veste thinges men pretense libertie shake obedience god breake forthe vnbridled licentiousnesse men disdaine thinking yt moderation ordre choise thinges taken awaie shold beinge compassed suche narrowe streightes shall wee bidde christian libertie farewell cutt fitt occasion suche periles haue saide vnlesse yt fast holden neither christ truthe gospel inward peace soule rightly knowen rather must endeuoure necessarie part doctrine suppressed yet meane time fonde obiections may mette withall whiche wont rise therevpon christian libertie think consisteth three partes firste conscience faithful affiance iustification god sought may raise aduaunce theselues aboue law forget whole righteousnesse lawe sithe lawe haue already place declared leaueth man righteous either excluded fro hope iustificatio muste loosed lawe regarde al hadde workes who hinketh must bring somwhat neuer little good workes obteine righteousnesse apointe ende measure butte maketh selfe detter whole law therfore taking away al mention law layinge aside al thinking vpon workes must embrace onely mercye god entreate iustification turning away sighte selues must behold christ alone ther question righteous although vnrighteous vnworthy taken worthy thinge conscience wyll atteine certaintie thei must geue place ye lawe neither man hereby gather law superfluous faithfull doth therfore ceasse teache exhorte pricke forwarde goodnesse although iudgment seate god hath place conscience two thinges diuerse must wel diligently distinguished v whole life christian ought certaine meditation godlinesseeph iiiii he ii v bycause called sanctification herein standeth offyce law yt putting mind duetie shold stir vp endeuor holynesse innocecie coscieces carefull may haue god mercifull shall answer vpon affiance shall stand called iudgement reckened ye law requireth onely christ must set forth righteousnesse whiche passeth perfection awe upon point hangeth almost al argumet epistle galathians thei fond expositers teach paule cotendeth libertie ceremony may proued place argumetsgala iiixiii vi sort christ made curse v might redeme v fro curse law againe stand fast libertie wherewith christ hath made free againe entangled yoke bondage beholde paule say ye circumcised christ shal nothing profit circumcised deitor whole law christ made idle whosoeuer ye yt iustified law ye falle away fro grace wherin truely conteyned hier thing libertie ceremony graut deede yt paul entreareth ceremony bicause cotendeth ye false apostle wet bring againe christian church ye old shadowes law abolished ye coming christ discussing questio hier place disputed whole controuersie stoode first bicause iewish shadowes ye brightnesse ye gospel darkened sheweth haue christ fu geuing de de al thinges whiche shadowed ceremony moses secondly bicause deceiuers filled ye people noughty opinio namely yt obediece auailed deserue ye fauor god standeth much vpo point faithful shold think yt thei ca workes law much lesse litle principle obteine righteousnesse godgal iix xxx therwithal teacheth yt thei crosse christ free fro danatio law otherwise hangeth ouer al men shold ful assurednesse rest christ alone place proprely perteineth purpose last al mainteineth cosciences faithful libertie bound religion thinges necessarie second part hangeth vpon former part co science page duplicate page duplicate obey law compelled necessitie law beyng free fro yoke law self owne accord thei obey wil god bicause abide perpetual terror long vnder dominio law thei shal neuer chereful redinesse framed ye obediece god vnlesse thei first haue libertie geuen exaple shal briefly plainely perceiue thing meanedeut viv comaundemet law yt loue god wt al heart al soule wt al stregths may done soule must first made voide sense thought heart must cleased al desire al stregths must gathered vp drawe together purpose thei haue gone far way lord yet far marke though loue god minde sincere affection heart yet haue still great part heart soule possessed desire fleshe drawen back stayed goyng forward hasty course god deede trauayle forward great endeuor fleshe partly febleth strengthes partly draweth self shall fele thei nothing lesse tha performe law wil thei couet endeuor nothing perfection ought loke vpon law see whatsoeuer worke attept purpose accursed neyther cause man deceiue gathering worke therefore altogether euell bycause vnperfect therfore god doth neuerthelesse accept good law requiring perfect loue condeneth al imperfectio vnlesse rigor mitigated therefore workes fal nought wold haue seme partly good shal finde yt transgression law euen bicause vnperfect loe al workes subiect curse law thei measured ye rule ye law shold vnhappy soules cherefully applie theselues work thei might trust colde get thing curse otherside beyng deliuered fro seuere exacting lawe rather whole rigor lawe thei heare called god fatherly gentlenesse thei wil merily great cherefulnesse answer calling folow guiding summe boud yoke ye law ar like vndseruats apointed lordes certain taskes work euery day seruats thinke yt thei haue done nothing dare come ye sight lordes vnlesse haue performed ful taske workes childre liberally freemalike handled father stick present begonne half vnperfect workes yea hauing fault trusting yt wil accept obedience willingnesse minde although thei haue exactly done much good wil must may haue sure affiace yt obedieces shalbe allowed kinde father little soeuer rude vnperfect soeuer thei also assureth v ye prophet wil spare saith ye father wont spare sonne yt serueth himmala iiixvii word spare set beare wt al getly winke faultes forasmuch also maketh mention seruice affiance litle necessarie v without shall go thinges vaine god accompteth himselfe worshipped worke truely done v worshipping done among terror douted whether god offended worshipped oure worke cause author epistle hebrues referreth good workes yt red holy fathersrom xii faith weyeth faythro vi ii touching libertie place epistle romaine paule resoneth yt oughte haue dominion ouer v bicause vnder lawe vnder grace exhorted faithfull sinne reygne mortal bodie geue theyr member weapon wickednesse sinne shoulde dedicate selues god alyue deade theyr member weapon righteousnes god whereas might side obiect yet carry fleshe full lustes sinne dwelleth adioyneth comforte libertie law shold say though doo yet throughly fele sin destroyed ye righteousnes yet liueth yet ther cause shold feare discouraged though ben alwaidispleased wt remnantes sin forasmuch ar grace made free law theyr workes shuld examined rule law gather yt may sinne ar vnder law let know libertie perteineth nothing ende wherof encourage god third part bound conscience god outward thinges selues indifferent may indifferently sometime vse sometime leaue vnused knowledge libertie also necessary v shalbe absent shalbe quiet conscience ende superstition many daye thinke v fonde moue disputation free eating fleshe free vse dayes garmentes suche smale trifle dede thinke weight commonlye thoughte conscience haue one cast selues snare entre long combersome waye whence afterwarde finde easy way get oute man beginne doubt whether maye occupye linnen shetes shertes hankercheifes napkines neither wil doubt whether may vse hempe last wil also fal doubt mater waye himselfe whether suppe without napkin whether maye without handkerchifes man thinke deyntye meate vnlawful length shal quietnesse lorde eate either brounebreade common meates remembreth may yet susteine body bacer fode doute pleasaunte wyne afterwarde drinke deade wine good peace conscience last al wyl bolde touche sweter cleaner water finally length wil come point thinke vnlawfull common sayinge treade vppon strawe lying crosse begonne lyghte stryfe question whether god haue v vse thinges whose ought guide al counsel doynges hereby must needes carried desperatio confuse deuouryng pit must despising god casting away feare make theselues away destruction haue redy way whosoeuer entangled doubting way soeuer turne themselues see euery present offense conscience know sayth paule nothyng comon meaning comon vnholy thinketh thing comonro xiiiixiiij comon wordes maketh al outward thinges subiect libertie prouided alway yt mindes haue assurance ye libertie god superstitious opinio cast v dout thing nature cleane defiled v wherfore addeth blessed ye iudgeth yt alloweth yt iudgeth eate condened bicause eateth faith yt faith sinne amog narrow streightes neuerthelesse wt carelesly venturing al thing shew theselues bolder thei asmuch turne theselues away fro god thei throughly pearced wt feare god thei theselues also copelled many thing cosciece discouraged fal downe wt feare al receiue none ye giftes god thakesgeuing aboue yet paule testifieth yt thei al sanctified vse meane thankesgeuing yt procedeth fro heart yt acknowlegeth ye liberalitie goodnesse god giftes many deede vnderstad ye benefites god vse thei prayse god workes sith thei persuaded thei geuen theselues shold thei thank god ye geuer thus summe see whereto libertie tendeth namely shold vse giftes god vse hath geue vnto v without scruple cosciece without trouble minde whiche confidence soules maye haue peace wt acknowlege liberalitie toward v co preheded al ceremony yt libertie obserued yt cosciences shold bound wt necessitie kepe shold remeber ye vse god benefit subiect theselues vnto edification diligently oted christian libertie partes spiritual thing yt whole stregth whereof cosisteth appeasing fearful conscience god either vnquieted careful ye forgeuenesse sinnes thei pensiue whether imperfect workes defiled ye faultes flesh please god thei troubled vse indifferet thing wherfore thei wrogfully expoud either make cloke desire yt thei may abuse giftes god lust thinke libertie vsed men therfore vsing haue regard weake brethre first kinde men day much offend almost may abilitie wealth sumptuous deliteth excessiue gorgiousnesse furniture banbets apparel body bilding house hath wil excel al kinde statelinesse whiche doth maruellously flatter finenesse al thing ar defended vnder ye pretense christia libertie say thinges indifferent graut man indifferently vse gredily coueted whe proudely bosted whe wastefully spent certaine thinges otherwise theselues lawful faultes defiled sayeng paule doth wel put differece betwene thinges indifferent thing cleane ye cleane defiled vnbeleuingtit ixxv nothing cleane bicause minde cosciece defiled accursed riche men haue cofortluke vixxiiii amos vi esa vvii satisfied wt meate laugh whiche slepe bed iuory whiche ioyne land land whose bankets haue lute harp taber wyne uerily iuorie golde richesse good creature god permitted yea apointed prouidence god men vse neither forbidde eyther laugh satisfied meate ioyne new possession owne olde possession aucesters delited musical melodie drynke wine true deede haue plentie thinges wallow delites glut theselues make wit minde dronke present pleasure alway gape newe doynges far fro lawfull vse ye giftes god therfore let take away immeasurable desire let take away immeasurable wasting let take away vanitie arrogance yt may pure conscience purely vse giftes god minde shalbe framed sobrietie shall haue rule ye lawfull vse side let moderation wanting euen base common delicates much truely sayd oftentimes frise course cloth dwelleth purple heart somtime vnder silk purple lieth simple humilitie let euery man degree liue eyther poorelyphil iii meanely plentifully al remember fed god liue riotous let thynke yt lawe christian libertie haue learned paule contented thinges whiche presently haue skill bothe humble excell yf taught place thinges full hungry haue plentie suffre want herin also many men erre bycause though libertie shold bee sounde safe vnlesse men witness thei vn scretly vnwisely vse vnseasonable vsing thei many time offend weake brothren may see day whiche thinke theyr libertie stande vnlesse thei take possession eating fleshe fryday blame eate butte false opinion muste dryuen myndes thei oughte thynke theyr lybertie obteyne newe thing sight menne god standeth well absteinynge vsynge vnderstande yt maketh matter god whether eate fleshe egges whether thei weare redde blacke garment enough coscience nowe free whyche benefite suche lybertie due therefore althoughe afterward absteine al theyr life long flesh weare alway one colore yet thei lesse free yea therefore bicause thei free thei free coscience absteine thei hurtfully offend bicause nothyng regard weakenesse brother ought beare rashly comit nothing offense somtime also behoueth libertie set forth men graunt measure heedefully kept cast away care weake whome lord hath earnestly geuen v charge place therefore speake somewhat offense differece thei take auoided neglected wherupo may afterward determine place libertie among men like well comon diuision whiche teacheth yt offense one sort geue take asmuch hath plaine testimonie scripture doth vnfitly expresse meaneth thou thing vnseasonable lightnesse wantonnesse rashnesse order fit place whereby ignorat weake offended yt may called offense geue thee bicause came passe thy fault yt offense stirred vp alway called offense geuen thing ye fault wherof came ye doer yt thing self called offense taken whe thing otherwise euelly done time euell wrogfull maliciousnesse minde drawe occasion offense case offense geuen wrongfull construers without cause take one ye first kinde offense none offended weake ii kinde sowre nature pharisaical scorneful head offeded wherfore shal cal ye one offense weake pharisee shal teper vse libertie ought geue place ignorance weake brethre wise ye rigorousnesse ye pharisee yelded weaknesse paule sheweth many placesro xiiiji xiij beare sayth weake faith againe let v herafter iudge one rather let laied brother offense occasio falling many sayengs ye entent fit red ye place self tha rehearsed summe yt strog shold beare ye weakenesses brethre please selues euery one v please neighbor vnto good edifiengi cor ye pharisee offended sayenges answered neglected offendyng cared yet stil matter hangeth doutfull vnlesse know taken weake whoe pharisee difference beyng taken away see amog offense vse al libertie remaineth might neuer vsed without great danger semeth paule hath moste playnely declared doctrine example far libertie either tempered defended though offensesact xviiij gal iij toke timothee copanie circumcised could brought circumcise titus diuerse doynges change purpose minde namely circumcising timothee free men made seruaunt men made iewesi cor xix xx iew might winne iewes vnder law vnder law might winne vnder law al thing al yt might saue many writeth place thus haue right moderation libertie may indifferetly restrained profit respect vnto stoutely refused circumcise titus testifiethgal iiiiii writing thus neither titus whiche although grecian copelled circucised bicause false brother com way whiche priu crept espie libertie haue christ iesus might bring v bodage gaue place su e much time yt truth ye gospel might also time must necessitie defend libertie weake conscience endagered vniust exa nges false apostle must euery thing studie preserue charitie haue regard edifieng neighbouri xx al thin sayth lawful al thing expedi al thing lawful al thing edifie let seke yt yt others nothing plainer rule tha yt must vse libertie may turne edifieng neighbor expediet neighbor must beare counterfait ye wisedom paul forbearing libertie nothing lesse tha applie ye duty charitie yt may prouide owne quietnesse wish al metion libertie buried wheras lesse behoueful neighbor somtime vse libertie benefit edificacio fit place restraine comoditie parte godly man thinke free power outward thing therfore grauted may freer duty charitie whatsoeuer haue spoke auoiding offense meaning yt referred meane indifferent thinges thing yt necessarie done left vndone feare offense libertie submitted charitie charitie self likewise ought vnder purenesse faith uerily also ought regarde charitie far ye altar yt neyghbours sake offende god intemperance bee allowed whyche doe nothyng troublesome turmoylyng whiche rather rashely ren thinges leysurely rippe ney yet harkened leader men thousand sortes vngodlinesse yet doe faine must behaue themselues thei offense neighbour though meane edifie conscience neighbor euell specially wheras thei sticke fast myre without hope gettyng pleasant forsothe whether neighbor instructed doctrine example life say must fed milke whome fill euell poisonous opinios paule reporteth fed corinthias drinking milkei cor iijij popish masse ben among would haue sacrificed geue drinke milke milke poison therfore lie sayeng feede whome vnder shew flattering alluremetes cruelly kill grauntyng dissemblyng time allowed long yet feede child milke neuer growe bigger maye least able beare light meate certaine neuer brought vp milke two reason moue doe nowe sharpely contend first bicause folly scarcely worthy confuted sithe worthily seme filthy sight men haue sounde wit secondly bicause haue sufficietly done peculiar bokes thing already done let reader remeber whatsoeuer offense satan worlde goe turne v awaye ordinance god stay v folowyng apointeth yet must neuerthelesse goe earnestly forward whatsoeuer daungers hange vpon yet libertie swarue one heare bredth commaudement god neyther lawefull pretense attempt thyng whiche geueth v leaue therefore sithe faithfull conscience hauyng receyued suche prerogatiue libertie haue aboue set forth haue benefit christ obteined entangled snare obseruations thinges whiche lord willed libertie conclude exempt al power men vnmete either christ lose thake great liberalitie conscience profit neyther ought thinke slight matter see haue cost christ deare namely whiche valued golde silueri pet gal vi ii owne bloud paule sticketh say death made voide yf yeld selues subiection men trauaileth nothing el certaine chapter epistle galathians shew christ darkened rather destroyed v vnlesse conscience stand fast libertie whiche verily haue loste maye men snared bondes lawes ordinance thyng worthy knowen nedeth longer plainer declaration sone word spoken abrogating ordinaces men great trouble raysed vp partly seditious men partly sclaunderers though whole obedience men one taken away ouerthrowen therefore none v maye stumble stone first let v cosider two sortes gouernement man one spirituall whereby conscience framed godlinesse worship god ciuile whereby man trayned duty humanitie ciuilitie whiche kept among men commonly vnfit name called spirituall temporall iurisdiction whereby signified first two formes gouernement perteyneth life soule later occupied thinges present life fedyng clothing setting forth lawes whereby man may spend life amog men holyly honestly soberly first kinde hath place inward minde later kinde ordereth ye outward behauiours one may cal spirituall kingdome ciuile kingdome two haue diuided must eyther alway seuerally considered themselues one consideryng must withdraw turne away mindes thinking vpo man two worldes whiche diuerse kinges diuerse lawes may gouerne putting difference shall come passe whiche gospell teacheth spirituall libertie shall wrongfully draw ciuile order though christian accordyng outward gouernement lesse subiect lawes men bicause conscience libertie god though therefore exempt bondage fleshe bycause free accordyng spirit againe bicause euen ordinance whiche seme pertaine spirituall kingdome maye errour must also put difference betwene whiche taken lawfull agreable worde god side whiche ought haue place amonge godly ciuile gouernement shalbe el place speake also ecclesiastical lawes omit speake time bicause full entreating shal fit fowerth booke shall speake power church discourse let conclusion question beyng haue sayd selfe darke entangled doth cause accobre many bicause thei suttelly enough put difference betwene outward court call court conscience moreouer encreaseth difficultierom xiiji v paule teacheth yt magistrate ought obeyed feare punishmet conscience wherupon foloweth cosciences also boud ciuile lawes come naught haue spoken shall speake spirituall gouernement losyng knot firste good knowe conscience definition therof fetched propre deriuatio word men minde vnderstandyng conceyue knowledge thinges thereby sayd scire know wherupon also deriued name science knowlege thei haue felyng iudgemet god witnesse ioyned whiche doth suffer hide sinnes yt drawen accused iudgemet seate god felyng called conscience certayne meane betwene god man bicause suffreth man suppresse himselfe whiche knoweth pursueth farre till bryng giltinesse whiche paule meanethrom ijxv sayth coscience doth together witnesse whe thoughtes accuse acquite iudgement god simple knowledge might remaine enclosed within man therefore felyng whiche presenteth man iudgement god keper ioyned man marke espie al secretes nothing may remaine buried darknesse whereupon also cometh olde prouerbe conscience thousand witness reason peter hath set examination good co science quietnesse minde pet iijx beyng persuaded grace christheb xii without feare present selues god author epistle hebrues setteth haue conscience sinne stede deliuered acquited sinne may accuse v therefore workes haue respect men coscience referred god good consciece nothing el inward purenesse heartii tim iv whiche sense paule writeth charitie fulfillyng law pure conscience faith fained afterwarde also chapter sheweth howe muche differeth vnderstanding sayeng suffred shipwreck fro faith bicause thei forsake good consciece wordes signifieth liuely affection worship god sincere endeuor liue holyly godlyly somtime deede extendeth also menact xxiiiixvi luke paule protesteth endeuored himselfe walke good conscience toward god men therfore sayd bicause frutes good coscience flowe come euen men speakynge properly hath respect god haue already sayd hereby cometh passe law sayd binde conscience simply bindeth without respect men without hauing consideration example god comaundeth kepe minde chaste pure al lust also forbiddeth al maner filthinesse wordes outward wantonnesse whatsoeuer kepyng law coscience subiect although liued one world behaueth intemperantly sinneth yt geueth euel exaple brother also hath consciece bound giltinesse god thinges themselues meane consideratio ought absteine brede offense conscience still beyng free paule speaketh flesh consecrate idolesi cor xxxviii sayth moue dout touch coscieces sake say consciece thine others faithfull sinne beyng first warned neuerthelesse eate fleshe howsoeuer respect brother necessarie absteine prescribed god yet cesseth kepe still ye libertie coscience thus see law bindyng outward worke leaueth coscience vnbound xx chapter p prayer chiefe exercise faith whereby dayly receiue benefites god thinges haue ben hetherto spoken plainely perceyue needy voyde al good thing wanteth al helpes saluation wherfore seke relefes whereby may succour needinesse must goe himselfe get el afterward declared vnto v lord doth owne free liberally geue v christ offreth v stede miserie felicitie stede neede welthinesse whome openeth v heauenly treasure whole faith behold beloued sonne vpon whole expectatio hang whole hope sticke fast reste verily secret hidden philosophie whiche wrong logiciall argumentes learne whose eye god hath opened may see light light sin taught fayth acknowledge euer haue neede whatsoeuer wateth v god lord iesus christ namely whome lorde willed whole fulnesse largesse rest thense drawe
