plentifull fountaine remayneth seke praiers craue haue learned otherwise know god lord geuer good thing allureth v pray goe praye shold nothing profit v alone man neglect treasure shewed buried digged ground therfore apostle shewe true fayth idle callyng vpon god hath set order gospell spryngeth faith heartes framed cal vpon name god thyng litle saydrom viiixxvi spirit adoption sealeth heartes witnesse gospell rayseth vp spirites dare shewe forth desire god stirre vp vnspeakable gronynges crie confidence abba father mete therefore last poynt bycause spoken waye lightly touched nowe largely entreated therefore get benefit prayer atteyne riches whiche layed vp v heauenly father certayne communicatyng men god whereby entryng sanctuarie heauen owne presence cal touchyng promise thyng whiche beleued affirmyng word vayne maye neede requireth finde experience therefore see nothing set forth v loked hande lord whiche also comaunded craue praiers true prayer digged vp treasure fayth hath loked vpon beyng shewed gospell lord necessarie many wayes profitable exercise prayer wordes sufficiently declared undoutedly without cause heauenly father testifieth fortresse saluation callyng vpon name namely whereby call v presence bothe prouidence whiche watcheth take care matter power susteineth v beyng weake manner fayntyng goodnesse receiueth v fauor beyng miserably loden sinnes finally whereby cal al whole geue present v hereby groweth singular rest quietnesse conscience haue disclosed lord necessitie whiche distressed v largely rest though onely none euels hidden persuaded bothe well willyng toward v able prouide well v man saye know without put minde bothe part distressed expedient v maye seme certayne manner superfluous troubled prayer though winked slept vntill awaked voice reason marke ende lord hath instructed pray ordeined much owne cause rather oures willeth deede right yt due rendred acknowledge come whatsoeuer men require doe perceiue make profit doe testifie wishynges profit also sacrifice wherewith worshipped commeth v therefore much boldly holy father gloriously talked bothe theselues benefites god much sharply pricked forward pray example elia shalbe enough v whiche beyng sure counsell god rashely promised raine achabi kin xviii xiii yet busily prayeth betwene knee sendeth seruant seuen time espie dyd discredit oracle god bycause knew dutie least faith waxe drowsy sluggish laye vp desire god wherefore although lye senslesse dull perceiue owne misery waketh watcheth v somtime also helpeth v vndesired yet much behoueth v continually called vpon v heart maye enflamed earnest feruent desire seke loue worship accustome selues euery necessitie ee shoote anchare againe desire wishe maye entre minde whereof ashamed make witnesse learne present wish yea poure whole heart eye may framed receiue al benefites true thakfulnesse minde yea outward thankesgeuyng put minde prayer yt thei come v fro moreouer yt haue obteined yt whiche desired beyng persuaded hath answered prayer may therby ye feruetly caried thinke vpo kindenesse therewithal embrace wt greater pleasure thinges acknowledge haue ben obteined prayer laste vse experience maye accordyng measure weakenesse assure mindes prouidence vnderstand promiseth neuer faile v doth owne accord open v entrie cal point necessitie also hath hand alway stretched help doth feade wordes defendeth present help cause kinde father although neuer slepeth sluggishe yet oftentimes maketh shew though slept sluggish maye exercise v otherwise sloughtfull sluggish come aske require owne great benefit therfore foolishly cal away mindes men fro prayer babble prouidence god maketh safekeping al thingespsa xiiixviii vaine weried callinges vpon whereas lord cotrariwise vaine testifieth e al call vpo name truth none sort triffingly say superfluous aske thinges whiche lord owne ready geue whereas euen thinges flowe v owne free liberalitie wil haue v acknowlege graunted prayer whiche thing notable sentece psalm doth testifie wherwith many like sayenges accordps xxxiiiixvi eye lord vpon righteous eares vnto prayer sayeng setteth prouidence god bent accord prouide sor safetie godly yet omitteth exercise faith wherby sloughtfulnesse wiped fro mindes men eye god therfore wake may succour necessitie blinde againe behalues heare groninges maye better proue loue toward vspsa xxxiiiii bothe true watcheman israell slepeth slombreth yet sitteth still hauynge forgotten v seeth v dull dumme frame prayer rightly well let first rule otherwise framed minde heart becometh entre talke god whiche verily shall atteyne touchyng minde beyng free fleshely care thoughtes wherwith may called away withdrawe fro ye right pure beholding god bend self wholly prayer also much possible lifted vp caried aboue self neither require minde libertie pricked nipped wt wheras cotrariwise feruetnesse praier must much carefulnesse kindled v see yt holy seruats god som e declare great tormentes much carefulness hat thei vtter lord bewayling voice depe depth middest iawes death say al strage foreyne care must driuen away wherwith minde selfe wandring hether thether caried beyng drawen heauen pressed downe earth meane must lifted vp aboue selfe maye bryng sight god thinges whiche blinde foolish reason wont imagine may holde self bound within compasse owne vanitie rise vp purenesse worthy god bothe thinges specially worthy noted yt whosoeuer prepareth pray shold thereto applie al sens endeuors men wont diuersly drawen wandering thoughtes bicause nothyng contrarie reuerece god tha lightnesse witnesse waton licetiousnesse lose al feare thing must much earnestly labor find hard man bent praye shal fele manye biethoughtes crepe vppon either breake bowing swaruing hinder course praier let v cal minde great vnworthines god receiueth v vnto familiar talke abuse great gentelnesse minglyng holy profane thinges together reuerence holdeth mindes fast bounde vnto talked meane man middest praier forsaking leape hether thether let v therfore know none rightly wel prepare theselues prayer maiestie god pearceth come vncumbred earthly care affection ment ceremonie lifting vp handes men remeber farre distant god vnlesse lifte vp sens hie also said psalmpsa xxv thee haue lifted vp soule scripture oftentimes vseth maner spech lift vp praier desire hard god sit stil dregges let summe much liberallye god dealeth v gently alluring v vnlode care bosome muche lesse excusable ar vnlesse excellent incomparable benefit v ouerwey al thinges draw v vnto self may earnestly apply endeuors sens pray done vnlesse mind strogly wrastling hinderance rise vp aboue point haue set forth yt aske god geueth leaue though biddeth v poure oure harte yet doth indifferently geue loose reynes folyshe froward affection promiseth according wil godlypsa ixiiix procedeth tender bearing submitteth wil pointes men commonly much offend onely part presume without shame without reuerence speake god folly shamelesly present throne whatsoeuer liked theyr dreame also great folishenes senlesse dulnesse possesseth dare thrust hearing god euen al filthy desire wherof would greatly ashamed make men priuie profane men haue laughed scorne yea detested boldnesse yet vice selfe hath alwaye reigned hereby came passe ambitious men haue chosen iupiter patrone couetous men mercurie desirous learning apollo minerua warri r mar lechorous folke uenus like day haue euen touched men prayer graunt licence vnlawful desire sportinglye talke egalles god suffreth gentlenes mocked claiming himselfe right maketh praiers subiect aucthoritei ihon vx restraineth bridle therfore must kepe fast saying ihon affiance yt aske thynge according wil heareth v forasmuch ability ar far fro sufficient performe great perfection must seke remedie helpe v ought bend sight mind god affection heart ought also followe ende bothe doe staye far benethe yea rather doe faynt fayle carried contrarie waye therefore god succour weakenesse prayer geueth spirite scholemaister instruct v right gouerne affection bicause knowe ought praye oughtrom viiixxvi spirit commeth succour maketh intercession v vnspeakeable groninges deede eyther prayeth groneth stirreth vp v affiance desire sighynges whiche strength nature able conceyue without cause paule calleth vnspeakeable groninges faithful send forth guidyng spirit bicause whiche truely exercised prayer ignorant holden perplexitie blinde care scarcely finde profitable speake yea goe vtter stammeryng wordes sticke fast encombred wherupon foloweth gift prayeng rightly singular gift thinges spoken purpose fauoryng owne slouthfulnesse geue ouer charge prayeng spirit god lie dull carelesnesse whiche muche enclined heard wicked sayenges must lie negligently gapyng wayte vntill preuent mindes occupied el rather lothyng owne slouthfulnesse sluggishnesse craue suche helpe spiritii cor xiiii xxvi neyther doth paule biddeth v pray spirit therefore cesse exhort v wakefulnesse meanyng instinct spirit vseth force frame prayer nothyng hindereth slacketh owne endeuor bicause god behalf proue effectually fayth moueth heartes let also law prayeng alway fele owne wante earnestly thinkyng howe stande neede thinges aske ioyne prayer earnest yea feruent affection obteine many slightly manner sake recite prayer prescribed forme though rendred certayne talke god although confesse necessarie remedie euels bicause destructio without help god craue yet appereth dutie custome asmuch meane time mindes colde weye aske generall confuse felyng deede necessitie leadeth hereunto dothe stirre present case aske relefe neede nowe thynke hatefull detestable god faynyng manne asketh forgeuenesse sinnes meane tyme eyther thynkynge sinner thynkyng vpon sinner euen god himselfe playnely mocked suche peruersnesse haue sayde mankinde full manner sake many tymes aske many thynges god whyche certaynely iudge without liberalitie come haue already remaynyng faulte semeth bee lighter yet tolerable whiche haue conceyued principle muste sacrifice god prayer doe mumble vp prayer without musyng minde vpon godly muste principally take heede neuer co e sight god aske thyng bycause doe boyle earnest affection heart therewithall desire obteyne yea also though thinges aske glorie god seme first sight prouide owne necessitie yet ought asked lesse feruentnesse vehementnesse desire praye name hallowed must maye speake feruently hunger thirst hallowyng man obiect alway dryuen like necessitie praye graunt deede difference profitably taught v iamesiac vxiii man heauy amonge let praye whoe mery let sing therefore euen common felyng teacheth v bicause slouthfull therfore ye matter requireth sharply pricked forward god pray earnestly dauid calleth fit timepsa xxxii bicause teacheth many place much hardly trouble discommodities feares kindes tentations presse v much freer accesse open vsephe vixviii though god call v vnto yet lesse true sayeng paule muste pray time bicause howsoeuer thing prosperously flowe according heartes desire matter mirth doth compasse v euery side yet minute time wherein neede doth exhorte v praye man haue abundance wine wheate yet sithe enioye one morsel bread ye cotinual grace god whole cellar barnesful shal let craue dayly bread nowe yf call minde howe many daungers doe euery moment hange ouer v feare selfe wil teache v yt haue time free prayer may better perceiue spiritual thing shall many sinnes whereof knowe selues gilty suffer v sit still without care humble wise craue pardon bothe fault peine tentations graunt v truce neede hast vnto helpe moreouer desire kingdome glorie god ought plucke v selfe fittes continually alwaye bee fit time v therefore without cause oft commaunded pray continually doe yet speake perseuerance prayer wherof mention shalbe made herafter scripture warneth v ought pray continually accuseth slouth ulnesse bicause perceiue howe necessarie care diligence v rule hypocrisie craftinesse lyeng god debarred yea driuen far away prayer god promiseth nere al cal vpon truth pronounceth thei shal finde seke whole heart aspire thether please themselues owne filthinesse therfore right prayer requireth repetace wherupo comonly said scripture yt god heareth wicked doer yt prayer accursed like sacrifice also bicause rightful yt thei find ye eares god shut lock vp heart shold finde god easy vow hardnesse prouoke stiffenesse esaie threatneth maneresa vxv ye shal multiplie praiers heare hand full bloode againe ieremieier xivii xi haue cried haue refused heare thei shall likewise crie heare bycause taketh hie dishonoure wicked men shold boast couenant whiche al life defile holy name wherfore esaie coplaynethesa xxixxxxix iewes come neare lippes theyr heart farre speaketh praiers affirmeth abhorreth fayninge al partes whorshipinge purpose maketh saieng iamesiam iiiiiij ye ask receiue bicause ye aske il ye may spende vpon pleasure true dede shal againe shewe little herafter praiers godly thei poure rest vpon worthinesse yet admonition ihon superfluousi ihon xxii ask thing shal receiue bicause kepe commaundements forasmuch euel conscience shutteth gate againste v wherevpon foloweth none rightly praie hearde pure worshipper god therefore whosoeuer prepareth praie let lothful euels whiche done wt repentance let put person minde begger hereunto let third rule ioyned whosoeuer presenteth god praie shold forsake al thinking glorie put al opinion worthinesse finally geue ouer al trust himselfe geuing avacing ye glorie wholi god least take thing neuer little selues wt swellinge fal away face submission throweth downe heighth haue often exaumples seruantes god amonge holyer euery one much throwe downe commeth sight lord daniel whome lord commended wt great title praisedaniel ixxviii saide wee poure praiers thee righteousness thy great mercy heare v lord lord mercifull v heare v doe thing aske thine owne sake bycause thy name called vpo ouer people ouer thy holy place neither doth crooked figure men sometime speake mingle selfe wt multitude one people rather seuerally confesseth owne gyltinesse humbly fleeth sanctuarie forgeuenesse expresly sayth cofessed sinnes sinnes people thys humblenesse dauid also setteth example saith entre iudgement thy seruant bicause thy sight euery one liueth shall nat bee iustifiedps cxiiiiij suche manner esaie prayeth loe thou art angry bicause wee haue sinned worlde founded thy way lxxiiiiv therefore shalbe sa ed haue filled vncleannesse al righteousness defiled cloth wee haue al withered away leafe iniquity scatter v abroade winde none calleth vpon thy name rayseth vp himselfe take holde thee bycause thou hast hidde thy face fro v hast made v pine awaie hande oure wyckednesse therfore lord thou art father claye thou art fasshioner worke thy hand angry lord neither remembre wickednes euer behold loke vpon v ar al thy people loe thei stand vpo affiance al vpon onely thinking vpon thei god thei despire wil haue care likewise ieremieie xiiii iniquity answer v thou thy name sake bothe truely holyly written whome soeuer written vnknowe author fathered vpon ye prophet baruch soule heauy deosolate ye greatnes euel croked weake hungrye soule fainting eies geue glorie thee lord according ye righteousness father doe poure praiers thy sight aske mercie thy face lord god bicause thou art merciful haue mercie vpon v bicause haue sinned thee finally beginning also ye preparing praieng rightly crauing pardo wt humble plaine confession fault neither hoped euen ye holiest man may obteine thinge god vntil hee bee freely reconciled neither possible god may fauourable pardoneth wherfore maruel faithful wt keie ope theselues ye dore pray learne many place ye psalmes dauid whe asketh thingpsa xxvvi xviii saith remembre ye sinnes youthe remember according thy mercie thy goodness sake lord loke vpo afflictio labore forgeue al sinnes wher also see yt enough euery seuerall day cal selues accopt new sinnes also remebre sinnes might seeme haue long agoe forgottenpsa livii ye prophet place hauing cofessed one haynous offense occasio returneth eue mother wombe wherin gathered ye infectio make ye faulte seme lesse ye corruptio nature ye heaping together ye sinnes whole life much rigorous y codemning much easy maye finde god entreate although ye holy one alwaye expresse woordes aske forgeuenesse sinnes yet diligently weie praiers whiche scripture rehearseth shal easily finde yt say yt thei gathered minde praie ye mercy god alwaye toke beginning appeasing bicause euery man examine owne conscience far fro bold open care familiarlie wt god trembleth euery coming toward except yt standeth vpo trust mercie pardon ther also special confession wher thei aske release peines thei also praie haue sinnes forgeuen bicause weare absurditie effecte take awaye cause abideth muste beware god fauourable vnto v testifye hys fauoure wyth outwarde signes bycause boothe hee hymselfe wyll keepe thys ordre yt lytle profyte v haue hym benefytiall vnlesse oure conscience feelynge hym appeased shoulde througely make hym louelye vnto v whyche wee also taughte aunswere christe hee hadde decreed heale manne sycke palseymat ixii hee sayde thy sinnes forgeuen thee lifting vp mindes therby yt chefely wisshed god first receiue v fauoure shew forth frute reconciliation helping v byside yt speciall confession present gyltynesse wherby faithful make supplication obteine pardon euery speciall faulte peine general preface procureth fauour praiers neuer omitted bicause vnlesse thei grounded vpon free mercie god shall neuer obteine thing god whereunto maye referred sayeng ihoni ihon iix confesse oure sinnes faithfull righteous forgeue v cleanse v al iniquitie cause behoued praiers time law hallowed expiatio bloode might acceptable people sholde put minde thei vnworthy great prerogotiue honour til cleansed defilinges thei shold onely mercie god conceiue affiance praye wheras ye holy one seme somtime ye entreating god allege ye helpe owne righteousnes dauid saithps lxxxv ii kin xxii kepe soule bicause good ezechias remebre lord beseche thee yt haue walked thee truthe haue done good thyne eye formes speaking thei meane nothing el regeneratio testifie theselues ye seruants childre god himselfe pronounceth yt wil mercifullps xxxiiiixvi iho iii teacheth yt prophet haue already seen yt eies vpon ye righteous care vnto praiers againe ye apostle shal obteine whatsoeuer ask kepe comaundemets sayenges doth value praier ye worthines work stablish affiance whose cosciece wel assureth un ayned vprightnes inocenci al ye faithful ought ye taken ye truth god ye blindeman yt sight restored saith ihonih ixxxi yt god heareth sinner wee vnderstad sinner ye como vse ye scripture wtout al desire righteousnesse altogether slepe rest vpo sinnes forasmuch heart euer breake forth vnfained calling vpo god dothe also aspire godlines therfore wt promise accord ye praiers ye holy one wherin thei make mentio purenes innocency yt thei may fele yt geuen loked al seruants god comoly found yt thei vse kinde praier thei ye presence ye lord copare selues wt theyr enemy fro whose vniust dealing thei wished themselues deliuered hande comparison noe maruel thei broughte forth righteousnesse simplicitie hearte moue hym ye rather ye rightfulnes cause helpe therfore take away fro godli heart good man may vse purenesse conscience lord strengthen promise wherwith lord comforteth vpholdeth true worshipper meaning trust obteining stand vpon mercye god laieng away al thincking owne deseruing fourth rule yt throwen subdued wt true humilitie shold neuerthelesse wt certain hope obteining encouraged praie thing dede contrarie shew ioyne wt feeling ye iust vengeace god sure affiance fauour thing yet wel agree together ye onely goodnesse god raise v vp oppressed wt euels haue taught repentance faith knite companios together wt vnseparable bond whiche yet ye one afraieth v ye chereth v praiers thei must mutually meete together agrement dauid expresseth fewe wordsps vviii saith wil ye multitude thy goodnesse enter thy house wil worship temple thy holinesse wt teare ye goodnes god coprehendeth faithe ye meane time excluding feare bicause maiestie driueth v reuerence also vnworthinesse holdeth v feare forgetting al pride assurednesse meane affiance shoulde stroke ye minde losed al feling carefulnesse wt swete ful quietnesse rest peasably hauing al thinges flowing thei wold wishe touched wt care kindled desire swel wt feare good spurre ye holi one cal vpon god whe distressed wt owne necessitie thei ar vexed wt greate vnquietnesse almost dismaied themselues til faith come fit time succour bicause distress ye goodnesse god shineth dede grone wearied wt weight preset euels thei ar also peine greued wt feare greater yet vpholde thei bothe releue cofort ye hardnes bearing hope escape deliuerance therfore ye praier godly man must arise affection must also conteine shewe bothe namly grone present euels carefully afraide newe yet thet wtal fle god douring yt read reache helping hande god maruelously prouoked wrathe distrustfulnes aske ye benefites whiche hope obteine therfore ther nothing agreable wt ye nature praiers tha yt law prescribed apointed yt thei breake forthe rashli folow faith going principle christ calleth v saiengmatth xixxiiii matt xxixxii say vnto whatsoeuer thing ye require beleue yt ye shal receiue thei shal happen also cofirmeth place whatsoeuer ye aske praier beleuing ye shall receiue wherewith agreeth iames saieng nede wisedome let hym aske yt hym whyche geueth al men freelyiam vxv vpbraydeth butte let hym aske faithe doubtinge wherein setting doubtinge contrarie faithe dothe moste fitly expresse nature lesse y bee noted addeth yt obteyne nothynge whyche call vpon god waueringe doubte doe determine heartes whether shal hearde noe whome hee also compareth waues whyche dyuersly tossed driuen winde wherupon place hee calleth right praier praier faith againe god oft affirmeth wil geue euery one accordinge faith signifieth wee obteine nothing without fayth finally faith obteineth soeuer y graunted prayer thys y meante notable sayenge paule whyche foolyshe menne doe take noe heede vnto howe shall manne call vpon hymro xxiiii whome hee hathe beleued butte whoe shall beleue vnlesse hee haue hearde faith commeth hearing hearing worde god conueying degree beginning praier faithe hee plainely affirmeth god syncerely called vpon preachinge gospell merciefulnesse gentilenesse hath ben made knowen familiarly declared necessitie aduersaries thinke vpon therfore bidde ye faithful holde wt assured cofidence minde yt god fauourable beareth good wil thei thinke speake great absurditie thei vse true praier thei wold truely vnderstand yt god rightly called vpo wtout ye stedfast feeling god good wil sith wel perceiue ye force faith experiece feleth heart may man profit disputting wt men openly shew yt thei neuer thinge vaine imagination force necessarie yt assurednes require chefely learned inuocation seeth bewraieth yt hath dul coscience let v therefore leauing kinde blindemen stick fast ye saienge paule yt god called vpo yt know mercie ye gospel ar surely perswaded yt ready manner saieng shold lord verily doubt whether thou wilt heare bicause distressed wt carefulnes flee thee ye maiest help worthy ye wonted maner al ye holi one whose praiers reade ye scripture neither hath ye holy ghost thus taught v ye apostle biddeth v goe ye heauenly throne wt cofidenceheb iiiixvi ep iiixii yt may obteine grace place teacheth yt haue boldnesse accesse cofidence faith christ must therfore holde fast wt bothe handes thys assurednesse obteine ask sith ye lord wt voice co maudeth v al ye holy one teache example wil praie wt frute ye praier pleasing god whiche springeth oute presumptio faith may call grouded vpo dredlesse certaintie faith might haue ben cotent ye bare name faithe onely added cofidence also furnished ye liberty boldnesse marke put differece betwene v vnbeleuers dede also praie god aduenture reaso ye whole church praieth ye psalmeps xxxiii let thi mercy vpo v put trust thee codition also spoken place ye prophetps lxvix p vxv day shal crie know yt god wt ye morning wil direct self thee wil watch word gather yt praiers ar vaine cast ayre vnlesse hope adioyned fro whense watchtoure wee may quietli waite ye lord wherwt agreeth ye order paules exhortatio yt moue ye faithful praie spirit al time wakefulnes diligenceeph vi xvi first al biddeth take ye sheld faith yt helmet saluatio ye swerd spirit whiche word god let ye reader cal remebrance yt haue said yt faith ouerthrowe ioyned acknowledging miserie nedinesse filthines wt heauy weight euer euell doings ye faithful fele theselues ouerloden greued ye thei bee voide al thing may procure fauoure god also yt thei burdened wt many offense may woorthily make dreadful yet thei cesse present theselues neither doth feling make afraide yt thei still resort forasmuche ther waie come praier ordeined wherby shold arrogantli aduance selues god esteme great value thing wherbi cofessing giltines shold bewaile misery childre familiarli ope coplaints parets rather ye vnmeasurable heape euels ought ful spurres prickes prick v forward praie also ye prophet teacheth v exapleps lxiiiiv saieng heale soule bicause haue sinned thee grant dede saiengs shold deadli pricking vnlesse god helpe ye good father incoparable tender kindnes hath brought remedie fit season wherby appeasing al troble assuaging al care wiping awaye feares mighte gently allure v hym yea takinge awaie doubtes much stoppes might make v easy waie first whe comaundeth v pray doth ye commaundement accuse v wicked obstinacie vnlesse obey nothing could precisely comaunded yt ye psalme cal vpo ye day trobleps lxv forasmuch amonge ye dueties godlines ye scripture comendeth none often nede tarry longer vpo pointmat viivii ask saith master ye shal receiue knock shal opened howbeit also wt ye comaundement ioyned promise necessarie though men cofesse yt commaundement ought obeied yet part would flee fro god calleth vnlesse promised yt wold easy entreated yea wold offer two thinges stablished certaine yt whosoeuer make delay yt thei come streight god ar rebellious disobedient also proued gilty infidelitie bicause thei distrust ye promise muche noted bycause hypocrite vnder ye color humilitie modesty wel proudly despise ye comandemet god discredit gentile callinge yea defraud ye chefe part worship yt hath refused sacrifice ye time al holines semed stande declareth yt ye chefe thing precious aboue al called vpo ye day nede therfore wher requireth owne encourageth v cherefulnesse obeing ther ar none gay color doubtting yt may excuse v wherfore many testimony ar comoly foud ye scripture wherby ar comauded cal vpo god many staddardes ar set vp eies put affiance v rushenesse rushe ye sight god vnlesse preuet v wt calling v therfore openeth v ye way wt voice saiengzach xiiiix saye ye ar people thei shal say ye art god se preuenteth ye worship willeth follow therefore bee feared shoulde bee swete melodie tuneth specially let notable title god come minde whervpon staye wee shall easily passe ouer al stoppes thou god hearest prayerps lxviii euen thee shall fleshe come y louely allurynge god bee granyshed wyth thys tytle whyche maye ascertayne v nothynge y propre hys nature graunte desire humble suters hereby prophet gathereth gate standeth open fewe men bicause speaketh euen saiengpsa lxv cal vpon day trouble wil deliuer thee yu shalt glorifie according rule dauid laieth promise geuen himii sa viixxvii may obteine asketh thou lorde hast reueled eare thy seruant therefore thy seruaunt hath found heart pray wherupon gather yt feareful sauing much promise encouraged place armeth himselfe wt general doctrineps cxlvxix wil ye feare yea may note ye psalmes yt breaking course praieng passeth ouer sometime ye power god somtime goodnesse somtime ye truth promise might seeme dauid vnseasonable thrusting sentence made mangled praiers ye faithful know vse experience yt feruentnesse fainteth vnlesse thei put new nourishmentes vnto therfore praieng ye meditatio bothe ye nature god word superfluous ye example dauid let greue v thrust thing may refresh fainting heartes new liuely strength wonderful wt great swetenesse promise either coldly almost moued great parte men wandring compass rather leauing fountaine liuing water digge themselues drie pittes embrace liberalitie god freely offered inuincible tour ye name lordpro xviiix saith salomon righteous man shal flee shalbe saued ioel prophecied horrible destructio handioel iixxxii added notable sentence whosoeuer calleth vpo ye name lord shalbe safe sentence know perteine proprely course gospelpsa xxlvxxiii scarcely euery hundreth man moued go forward meet god crieth esaie ye shall cal vpo wil heare yea ye crie wil answer honor also place vouchesaueth geue comon ye whole church belongeth al mebres christe hath cried meps xcixv wil heare trouble wt yt maie deliuer neither yet haue already saide purpose recken vp al place choose chefe whiche may take taste kindely god allureth v vnto wt streight bond vnthankfulnes bound among sharp prickinges sluggishnesse stil maketh delay wherfore let saienges alway sound earesps cxlv lord nie al cal vpon cal vpon trueth also saiengs haue alleaged esaie ioel god affirmeth hedeful heare praiers yea delited wt sacrifice swete sauoure cast care vpo singular frute receiue promise god whe make praiers doubtingly ferefulli trusting vpon word whose maiestie wold otherwise make v afraide dare cal vpon name father forasmuch vouchesaueth put swete name mouthes remaineth hauing allurementes shold know haue thereby matter enoughe obteine praiers forasmuch praiers stand vpon merite al worthines hope obteining ar grouded vpo promise god hang vpo nedeth none vnderproppinge loketh vpwarde hither thether therefore must determin mind yt although excel like holines praised ye holy father prophtes apostle yet bicause ye comademet praier como v faith also comon rest vpo ye word god right ar fellowes wt god haue shewed promisig yt wil getle merciful al geueth cause hope al eue ye mo miserable yt thei shal obtein thei ask therfor ye general formes ar noted fro thei sai fro ye first ye last excluded onli let ther preset purenes heart misliking selfes humility faith let hypocrisy vnholily abuse name god wt deceitful callig vpon ye good father wil put back exhorteth com hi also moueth al meanes yt ca herupo cometh yt maner prayig dauid haue eue rehersed vii xxvii lo yu hast promised lord thy ser cause thy seruat dai gathereth courag hath foud prayer might make therfore lord god ye art god thy word shalbe tru thou hast spoke thi seruat benefitsps xixlxivi begin therfore also place perform thy seruat according thy word al ye israelits together oft thei arme theselues wt remebrance couenat sufficietly declare yt shold prai fearfully e xxxii wheras ye lord apoiteth herin folowd ye exaples ye father specially iacob yt cofessed yt vnworthy many mercy receiued ye god yet saith yt ecoraged require greater thing bicause god promised yt wold whatsoeuer color yt vnbeleuers preted whe thei flee god oft necessitie presseth whe thei seke craue helpe thei much defraud hi due honor thei made theselfs new god idol mean thei deny yt author al good thing ye side ther nothing stroger deliuer ye godly fro al dout tha armed wt thought yt stop ought stay obey ye comandmet god pronouceth nothing pleasing tha obediece yt said clerel appereth yt dredles spirit pray agreeth wel wt fear reuerece carefulnes absurdity say yt god raiseth vp ye ouerthrowe maner formes speach agree well together seming ar contrary ieremie daniel say yt thei throw prayer godiere xiiii dani ixxviii ie xlii iili xx psa xli place iereme saith let praier fal ye sight god yt may haue mercie ye remnant people side ye faithful oftentimes said lift vp praier speaketh ezechias requiring ye prophete make intercession dauid desireth yt praier may ascende incense although thei perswaded ye fatherly loue god cherefully comitt theselues faithful keping dout craue helpe whiche freely promiseth yet doth idle carelesnesse lift vp though thei cast away shame thei ascend vpward degree promyses yt thei stil remaine humble suppliant ye abacemet theselues ar questios obiected tha one ye scripture reporteth yt ye lord grated certain desire yet brake forth minde quiet wel framed uerili iust cause ioatham auowed ye inhabitats sicheiu ixxx ye destructio afterward cae vpo yet god kindled wt feruetnes anger vegeace folowing execratio semeth alow iltepered violet passiosiud vixxviii heat also caried samso whe said strengthe god yt may take vengeace ye vncircumcised though ther pece good zele migled wt yet hote therfore faulti gredines vengeace beare rule therin god grated wherupo semeth yt mai gathered yt although ye praiers framed accordig ye prescribed rule ye word yet thei obteine effect answer first yt general law take away singular example yt sotime special motios haue ben put wherby came passe yt ther cosideratio tha ye como peopleluk ix ye answer christ noted whe ye disciple vndiscretly desire couterfait ye exaple elia yt thei knew spirit thei endued must go yet say yt praiers alwai please god grateth yt much serueth exaple yt clere praise made plaine ye scripture teaceth namely succoureth ye miserable heareth ye gronings vniustli trobled craue help yt therfor executeth iudgmets whe ye coplaints ye poore rise vp hi although thei vnworthy obtein anithig neuer litle oft hath taking vegeance ye cruelty robbery violece silthi lustes wicked doings ye vngodly subduig boldnes rage also ouerthrowig tyra nous power testified yt helpeth ye vnworthili oppressed yet beat ye aire wt praieng vncertaine godhedps cvii one psalme plainly teacheth yt praiers want effect yet pearce heauen faith gathereth together praiers necessitie wringeth lesse ye vnbeleuers tha ye godly ye felig nature yet proueth ye effect yt god fauourable bicause dothe wt gentlenes testifie yt thei pleasing enlarge set mercie circumstance euen vnbeleuers praiers ar denied ye pricke forward true worshiper pray thei see profaine wailigs somtime wat effect yet ther cause ye faith ful shold swarue fro ye law laid vpo god shold enuie ye vnbeleuers though thei gotten som great gaine whe thei haue obteined desirei king xxixxxix maner haue said yt lord bowed wt ye repetance achab yt might shew exaple easy entreat toward elect true turning brought appease therfore ye psalme blameth ye iewespsa c yt thei hauing bi experiece proued easy grant praiers yet wtin litle returned ye stubbornes nature also plainely appeareth ye historie ye iudges namely yt oft thei wept although teares deceitful yet thei deliuered hand enemy therfore ye lord indifferently bringeth forth sunne vpo good euel doth also despise weepinges whose cause righteous misery woorthy helpe ye meane time heareth saluation tha herein ministreth foode ye despisers goodnes questio semeth somwhat harder abraha samuel e xviiixiij sam x ye one warrated word god praied ye sodomite ye agaist manifest forbiddig praied saul paragraph likewise ieremie praied yt citie might destroied though requestes denied yet semeth harde take faith butte solution shall truste satisfie sober reader yt ei instructed wt ye general principle whereby god comaudeth merciful eue also ye vnworthy wer altogether wtout faith although speciall case opinion deceyued paragraph augustine writeth wisely certaine place sayth holy one praie faith ask god contrarie yt hath decreed euen bicause thei pray according wil yt hidden vncheageable wil ye wil inspireth yt mai heare maner wisely maketh differece wel said bicause incoprehensible cousel tepereth ye success thing yt praiers ye holy one voide ar wrapped wt faith errore together neither yet ought auayle exaple folow tha excuseth ye holy one theselues whome denie haue passed measure wherfore wher appeareth certaine promise must ask god wt coditio adioined purpose serueth ye saieng dauidpsa viivii watch ye iudgment yt hast co maunded bicause telleth warranted special oracle aske temporall benefite also profitable note yt thing haue spoke ye fower rule right praier exactly required wt extreeme rigor yt god refuseth ye praiers shal finde either perfect faith perfect repentace together wt feruentnesse zele wel ordered requestes haue said yt although praier familiar talke ye godly wt god yet must kepe reuerence modestie yt geue loose reines requestes whatsoeuer thei yt desire tha god geueth leaue least ye maiestie god shold growe contempt wt v yt must lift mindes vpward pure vndefiled worshiping hath euer performed wt purenesse ought speak nothing ye comon sort many co plaintes dauid sauore vnteperance yt meant purpose quarel wt god carpe iudgments bicause fainting weakenesse found better comfort cast sorrowes bosome yea god beareth wt childish speache pardoneth ignorace oft thing vnaduisedly escapeth v truely wtout teder bearing ther shold libertie praieng although dauids mind submit wholly ye wil god praied wt lesse patiece tha desire obteine yet arise yea boile somtimes troublous affection much disagreing ye first rule yt haue set specially maye perceaue conclusion ye xxxix psalme wt great vehemence sorrow yt holy man carried away yt cold kepe measure cesse saith fro til go away man wold saye yt like desperate man desireth nothing el yt hand god cessing might rot euels saith wt auowed minde runneth outrage ye reprobate ar wont wold haue god depart fro coplaineth yt wrath god heaui beare tentatios also ther fal oftentimes requestes well framed according rule word god holy one sufficiently weie lawful expedient whatsoeuer prayer spotted wt faultes thei deserue refused yet ye holy one bewaile correct theselues come theselues againe god pardoneth thei offend also second rule bicause thei oftentimes driuen wrastle wt coldenesse theyr nede miserie dothe sharply enoughe pricke praie earnestly oftentimes happeneth yt mind slippe aside manner wander away vanitie therefore behalfe also y nede pardon least faint vnperfect broken wanderinge praiers haue deniall god hath naturally planted ye mindes men praiers perfect wt mindes lifted vpwarde herevpon came ye ceremonie lifting vp hand haue said hath ben vsed al age nation yet vre howe many one ther whe lifteth vp handes doth coscience finde dul bicause heart resteth vpo ye groud touching ye asking forgeuenesse sinnes althoughe none faithful ouerpasse yet thei ar truely exercised praiers fele yt thei bring scarscely ye tenth part sacrifice dauid speakethps xvxi acceptable sacrifice god troubled spirit broken humbled heart god yu wilt despise ther alway doble pardon asked bothe bicause thei knowe theselues gilty cosciences many faultes wt feeling wherof thei ar yet touched mislike themselues much thei ought also yt much geuen profite repentance feare god thei throwe downe wt iust sorrowe offense shold pray escape ye punishement ye iudge chefely ye feblenesse imperfectio faith corrupteth ye praiers ye faithfull vnlesse ye tendre mercie god helpe maruell yt god pardoneth default doth oftentimes exercise yt wt sharpe instruction hee woulde purpose quench faith harde tentation faithful copelled criepsa lxxx long wilt angry vpo praier thy seruat though ye praiers made god angry whe ieremie saithlam iiiviii lord hath shut praier dout yt shake wt violent pange troble innumerable exaples co moly found ye scripture appeareth yt faith holiones oftetimes mingled tossed wt doutinges beleuing hoping thei bewraied yet vnfaithfulnesse bicause thei come far wished thei ought endeuor much ye fault amended thei maie daily com nerer ye perfect rule praying ye meane time fele great depth eueis thei drowned eue ye remedy get theselues new disease sith praier ye lord doth worthily lothe vnlesse winke ye spottes wherwt thei ar al besprinkled reherse thing end yt faithful shold carelesly pardo themselues thing sharply chastising theselues thei shold trauaile ouercome stoppes although satan laboure stoppe vp al way may kepe praieng yet neuerthelesse thei sholde breake bring certainly perswaded yt although thei vncombred hinderance yet endeuors please god theyr praiers allowed yt thei trauaile bende themselues thetherward whether thei atteine forasmuche man woorthy present himselfe god come sight heauenly father himselfe deliuer v bothe shame feare whiche sholde haue throwen downe al courage hath geuen v sonne iesus christe lorde aduocate mediator vsi tim iv ioh iii whose leading may boldly come hym trusting haue intercessor nothing shall denied v aske name nothing denyed father vnto muste bee referred whatsoeuer haue heretofore taught concerning faithe bycause promise setter vnto v christ mediator vnlesse hope obteining stay vpon taketh selfe benefite praieng sone terrible maiestie god commeth minde impossible shoulde tremble feare acknowledging owne vnworthinesse sholde driue v far away tyll christe come meane betwene v e iiiixv may change throne dreadefull glorie throne grace also ye apostle teacheth may bolde appeare withal cofidence shal obteine mercie finde grace help coming fit seaso ther law set yt shold cal vpo god like ther promise geuen thei shalbe heard cal vpon ar peculiarly comaunded cal vpo ye name christ haue promise set forth yt shal obteine ye whiche wee shal aske nameiho xiiiixiii xvixxvii hetherto saith ye haue asked thing name aske ye shal receiue ye day ye shal aske name whatsoeuer ye ask wil yt ye father may glorified ye sone hereby plaine without controuersie yt thei cal vpo god name christ stubbornly breake comaundements regarde wil nothing thei haue promise obteine thingii cor ixx paul saith al promise god ar christ yea amen say thei confirmed fulfilled ye circustance ye time diligentli marked wher christ co maundeth disciple fle intercessio yt gone vp heaueioh xvixxvi ye houre saith ye shal aske name certain yt euen ye beginning none wer hearde yt praied meane ye mediator reason ye lorde ordeined lawe ye pres alone entring ye sanctuarieex xxviiiix xiixxi shold beare vpo sholders ye name tribe israel many precious stone breast people shold stand far porche thense sholde ioyne praiers prest yea sacrifice auailed hereto praiers shold made sure force therefore shadowish ceremonie lawe taught wee shutt oute face god therefore wee neede mediator whyche maye appeare oure name maye beare v vpon hys sholders holde v fast bounde breast may hearde person sprynkeling bloode praiers cleansed whiche wee haue already saide neuer vorde filthinesse wee see holy one thei desyred obteyne thynge grounded theyr hope vpon sacrifice bycause knewe stablishinges requestes lett hym remembre thy offrynge sayeth dauid make thy burnt offringe fatt herupon gathered god hath ben fro ye beginning appeased ye intercessio christ receiue ye praiers godly doth christe apoint new heire disciple shall beginne praie name bicause grace daye glorious deserueth commendation wi h v sense said little hetherto ye haue asked thinge name nowe aske thei vnderstode nothing office mediator whereas iewes instructed principle bicause thei yet clerely knowen christ ascending heauen shold surer patron church therefore comfort greefe abscence speciall frute claimeth himselfe office aduocate teaceth thei haue hitherto wanted che e benefite shalbe graunted enioye ded mediation thei shal frely cal vpon godheb xxx apostle saith newe waie dedicate blood much lesse excusable oure frowardnes vnlesse armes saieng embrace inestimable benefite whiche proprely apointed v nowe whereas onely waie onely entrie graunted v come vnto god whoe doe swarue way forsake entrie remayneth waie entrie god nothinge left throne wrath iudgment terroure finally sithe father hathe marked oure heade guide thei wise swarue go awaie labore much lie h race dysfigure marke god hath imprinted christ set mediator whose intercession father may made v fauourable easy entreated howe ye meane time holy one haue theyr intercession left themi ti iii wherby thei mutually comend safetie one god apostle maketh mention hange vpon one intercession farre thei minish thing thei springe affectio loue wherwith embrace one membres one body thei al erred vnt ie heade sythe therefore also made name christe doe el butte testifie noe manne canne holpen prayer al butte wyth intercession christe christe wythe hys intercession wyth standeth butte churche wee maye wyth prayer bee aduocates one lette thys remaine certayne intercessor whole churche oughte bee directed onely one yea cause ought specially beware vnthankfulnesse bycause god pardoning oure vnworthinesse doth onely geue leaue euery one v praie himselfe also admitteth v entreaters one god appointeth aduocates churche deserue worthily reiected praie pryuately euery one himselfe pride abuse libertie darken honoure christe nowe yt y meare trifelynge whyche sophisters bable christe y mediatoure redemption butte faythefull mediatoures intercession thoughe christe hauynge perfourmed mediation time hathe geuen hys seruauntes eternall mediatoreshippe whyche shall neuer dye full courteouslye forfoothe handle hym cutte awaie little portion honor hym scripture saythe farre otherwise wyth symplicitie whereof godly man ought contented leauinge deceyuers ihon saithe iohn ii yf doe synne haue aduocate wyth father christe iesus dothe meane one olde tyme patrone v rather assigneth hym euerlastinge intercessioniho viiixxxii ti iiv ro xvxxx howe saye thys paule also affirmeth sitteth right hande god father maketh intercession v place calleth hym mediatoure god men meaneth prayer whych little made mention hadde said intercession muste made men proofe sayeng hee addeth menne one god one mediatore none otherwise doth augustine expounde lib contra par ca saith thus christian menne dothe mutually commende themselues prayer none maketh intercession al onely true mediatoure paule apostle though principall membre vnder heade yet bycause hee membre bodye christe knewe greatest truest preeste church entred figure ye inward place ye vaile ye holy holy place expresse stedfast trueth innermost place heauenrom xvxxx eph viix colo iiii cor xiixxv holynesse shadowish eternal comendeth hymself also ye prayer faithful neither doth make mediatore betweene ye people god prayeth yt al ye mebres bodye christe shoulde mutually praye hym bycause membres carefull one one membre suffer suffer mutuall prayer one membres yet trauayling earthe may ascende head gone heauen whome appeasement synnes yf paule mediatoure apostle shoulde also bee mediatores many mediatoures neither shold paules owne reason stande faste whych hadde saide ther one godeph iiiiiii one mediatoure one god menne ye manne christe whome wee also one wee keepe vnitie faithe bonde peace againe place thou seke preest aboue ye heauens psa wher maketh intercessio thee whiche earth died thee yet dreame yt falleth downe father knee humble wise entreateth v vnderstand wt apostle appeareth face god vertue hys deathe auayleth perpetuall intercession v yet beinge entred sanctuarie heauen vnto ende age world alone carrieth god prayer people abiding farre porche touchinge saintes whiche deade fleshe liue christ geue praier lette v dreame themselues haue waye askynge christe whyche onli way praiers acceptable god name therefore sithe scripture calleth v backe christ sith heauenly father wil gather together al point much dulnesse wyll say madnesse desire make oure selues entrie wee shoulde bee ledde waie hym wythoute whome euen selues haue entrie open hath usually done certaine age past yt day done whersoeuer papistrie reigneth denie merites ar fro time time thrust obteine ye good wil god ye moste part christ passed ouer god praied name beseche couey away ye office yt intercession haue affirmed belong christe alone againe angel deuel euer reueled one syllable intercession whiche men fame scripture nothinge reason therefore inuentinge trueli witte man seketh selfe succoures wherwith sertified ye word god plainli bewraieth distrustfulnesse appeale al cosciences yt delited wt ye intercession saintes shal finde yt cometh fro ground bicause thei ar greued wt carefulnes though christ wer behalf either weake rigorous whiche doubtfulnesse firste thei dyshonoure christe robbe title onely mediatoure whiche geue father singular prerogatiue oughte also conueied away doinge thei darken glorie hys byrth thei make voide hys crosse finally soeuer hee hathe done suffered spoyle defraude due praise thereof tende thys ende maie bee deede accompted onely mediatoure therewith caste awaye goodnesse god whiche gaue hymselfe father father vnlesse thei acknowledge christ brother thei vtterly denye vnlesse thei thinke beareth brotherly affection towarde ther nothing kinde tender wherfore scripture offereth v sendeth v lib de isa ani stayeth v hym saythe ambrose y oure mouthe whyche wee speake father oure eye whyche see father oure ryghte hande whyche offer v father otherwise whole intercession neyther saintes haue thing god thei aunswer common praiers thei make church ar ended wt conclusion adioyned christ lord trifeling shifte bicause ye intercessio christ lesse profained mingled wt ye praiers merites dead men vtterly omitted dead mouth al letanies hymnes prose wher honor lefte vngeuen deade saintes mention christ folysh dulnesse proceded far yt haue ye nature superstitio expressed whiche hath one shaken ye bridle wont make end running stray yt men one begone loke ye intercessio saintes litle litle ther geue euery one special yt according ye diuersitie busines somtime one somtime shold called vpon intercessor selues euery one hys peculiar sainte whose faythe comitted theselues wer ye keping safgarding god wherewt ye prophet ye olde time reproched israell god set vp according nubre citiesiere xviii xiii eue ye numbre person sith saintes referre desire wil god behold rest vpon thinketh foolishly fleshly yea sclauderously assigneth praier whereby praie coming kingdome god moste far distant whiche thei faine ye euery one wt priuate affection partially bent owne worshiper length many absteined fro horrible sacrilege calling vpo helper principal ruler saluatio lo wherunto foolish men fal whe thei wander true stading yt ye word god speake ye grosser mounstruousnesses vngodlines wherin although thei abhominable god angel men thei yet ashamed wery thei falling ye image picture barbara catharine muble pater noster father madnes pastor care heale restraine yt beinge allured wt swe e sauour game thei allow wt reioising although thei turne fro themselues blame haynous offense yet colore wil thei defende ye loy medard praied vnto looke vpo helpe seruants fro heaue yt holy uirgin praied vnto comaud sonne yt thei ask old time forbidden councell carthage yt alter directe prayer shold made saintes likely yt whe ye holy men could altogether suppresse ye force ye naughty custome yet ye added least restrait yt publike praiers shold corrupted wt forme saint peter praie v much hath deuellish importunacie ranged whiche stick geue away deade men proprely belonged god christ wheras thei trauaile bring passe ye intercessio may seme grouded vpon ye authoritie scripture therin thei labor vaine reade oftetimes saye praiers angel ye said praiers faithfull hand caried sight god thei liste copare holy men departed present lifede ixiiii esa xcxixi p xxxiiii viij angel thei shold proue yt thei ar ministring spirit comitted ye ministerie loke safetie whoe ye charg geue kepe v al way go v admonish counsel v watch v al thing geue angel wrongfully wrappe vp deade holy wt angel appeareth largly many diuers office wherbi ye scripture putteth difference betwene man dare execute office aduocate earthely iudge vnlesse admitted whense haue wormes great libertie thruste vnto god patron whome read yt office enioyned god wil appoint ye angel loke vnto saftie wherfore thei frequet holy assebles ye church stage wherin thei wander ye diuers manifold wisdom god couey away yt peculiar verily confounde peruert ye ordre set god ought haue ben inuiolable like hadsomnesse procede alleging testimoniesiere xvi god said ieremie moses samuel shold stad mi soule people saithe coulde hee haue spoken thus deade men vnlesse knewe made intercession liuinge butte contrarye syde gather thus sythe yt therby appeareth neither moses samuel made intercession people israel intercession al dead men saintes thought careful ye safetie ye people whe moses cesseth behalfe farre passed al liued folowe flight suttelties say dead make intercessio liuing lord sayd shold make intercessio much colorably reason thys maner extreme necessitie people moses made intercession sayd shal make intercession therfore likely none maketh intercession sithe al farr gentlenesse goodnesse fatherly carefulnesse moses thys forsoth get cauilling wou ded weapon wherwith thought themselues gaylye fensed fonde simple sentence wrested lord pronounceth yt wil spare offense ye people although seen moses patron samuel whose prayer shewed hymselfe tender sense moste clerely gathered like place ezechieleze xi ixiiii saith lord three men citie noe daniel iob shal deliuer sonnes daughter righteousnesse shal deliuer soules dout meant twoo happen reuiue againe thirde aliue namely daniell knowen first flouring hys youth shewe incomparable example godlinesse let v leaue scripture plainly sheweth haue ended courseact xiiixxxvi therfore paule speaketh dauid teacheth doth wyth prayer helpe hys posteritie onely serued tyme answere againe shall take prayer charitie ye whole course lyfe breathed nothing charitie mercie uerily wil curiously searche doe muse vpon likely carried aboute hether thether diuerse particular requestes rather ye staied vnmoued wil long kingdome god standeth lesse destruction wicked saluatio godly true dout charitie co teined communion body christ extedeth nature communion beareth though graut pray thys maner v yet therfore depart fro owne quietnesse diuersly drawen earthly care muche lesse muste therefore call vpon neither doth thereby followe muste doe men whiche lyue earth may commende one prayer thys serueth nourishing charitie among part mutually take vpon necessity amog themselues thys commaundemet lord without promiseeccl ixv vi twoo thing haue alway chefe place praier suche consideration farr dead lorde hath conueyed companye hath left v enterchange doinges v farr may gather coniectures man allege ye impossible ye thei must kepe charitie towarde v ioyned one faith v yet hath reueled ye haue log eres reach voice pearcing eye watch necessity prate shadowes wote brightnesse countenance god extending beames vpon mirror maye hye beholde mater men beneath affirme specially boldnesse thei dare ell go dronken dreames brainerom viii vi without word pearce breake hidden iugementes god treade scripture vnder fete oft pronounceth wisdome ye fleshe enemie wisdome god wholly condemneth vanitie naturall witt willeth al reason throwen downe onely wil god loked vnto v testimony scripture bring defede lye noughtily wrest iacob say prayeth yt hys name name father abraham isaac called vpon ouer posteritie xlviii xvi firste let v see forme calling vpon amog israelite call vpon father helpe beseche god remember seruantes abraham isaac iacob therfore example maketh nothing speake ye saintes themselues blockes dulnesse neither vnderstande call vpo name iacob called vpon maruell forme also childishly srumble thys maner speche seldome founde scripturesesa iiiii esaie sayth meane men called vppon ouer w men haue husbandes vnder whoes charge defense liue therfore calling vpon name abraham vpon israelite stadeth conuey pedegree hym doo solemne memorie honor author parent neither doth iacob careful enlarging renome hys name asmuch knew whole blessednesse posteritie consisted enheritance couenant god made wt wisheth seeth ye chefe al good thinges accompted hys kynred nothing ell couey succession couenant againe bryng suche remembrance prayer flee intercession deade put ye lord minde couenant wherby kynde father hath promised wil fauourable beneficial abrahas isaac iacobs sake litle holy one otherwise leane vpon merites father common sayeng chirch prophet testifieth thou art father abraham knew v notesa ii vi israel ignorant v thou lord art father redemer whe thus adde therwithal returne lord thy seruats sake yet thinking vpo intercessio bending minde benefite couenant sith haue lord iesus whoes hand ye eternal couenant mercy made also cofirmed v whoes name shoulde rather vse praiers good maisters wil haue patriarch e wordes made intercessor woulde sayne know great route abraha father chirch hath place al amog sinke fetch aduocates vnknowe let answere fit ye abraha god preferred aboue al aduanced hyest degree honor neglected suppressed uerily whe euident vse vnknowe ye old chirch thought good hiding newnesse speake nothing olde father though ye diuersitie name excused new forged maner whereas obiect yt god prayed vnto haue mercy people dauids sake doth nothing al make defse error yt strog profe ye confutation therof cosider person dauid beare seuered al ye assebly ye saintes ye god stablish ye couenant hath made hys hande ye couenat rather considered tha ye man vnder figure ye intercessio christ asfirmed certaine ye yt beloged dauid much image christ accordeth wt forsothe moueth yt oftentimes red yt prayer saint haue ben heard euen prayed trusted thee sayth prophet saued cried confoundedpsal xxiiv therefore let v also pray yt maye heard men otherwise ought doe wrongfully reson none shalbe heard haue one ben heard much better doth iames say elia sayeth man like v prayed prayer raineiam v xvii rained vppon earth three yeares six monethes againe prayed heaue gaue raine earth gaue frute doth gather singular prerogatiue elia oughte ee teacheth continuall strength godly pure prayer exhorte v likewise pray niggardly costrue redinesse gentlenesse god hearing vnlesse experience cofirmed sure affiance promise promiseth eare shalbe enclined one two yet fewe al call vpon hys name much lesse excusable foolishnesse seme set purpose despise many admonition scripture dauid oft deliuered power godpsa cxiii viii psa liiviii psalme xxxiiiivii draw power hymselfe shoulde deliuered hys helpe himselfe affirmeth farr otherwise righteous loke til thou render agayne righteous shall see shall reioyse truste lorde behold thys poore man hath cryed god hath answered psalmes many suche prayer whiche craue whiche requireth moueth god maner righteous made ashamed may example raised vp hope wel lett v nowe contented thys one example therefore euery holy one shall praye thee fitt tyme whiche place haue much willingly rehearsed lewde babbler whiche doe lett hire seruice waged tong haue ben ashamed allege proue intercession dead thoughe dauid meant thing ell shewe frute shall come mercifulnesse gentlenesse god shall heard thys kynde muste learne experience grace god wel towarde selues sclender helpe confirme credit hys promise leaue vnrehearsed many place dauid setteth hymselfe benefites god mater confidence reders psalmes shal commonly fynde without seking selfe thing iacob taught hys exaplege xxxiix vnworthy al thy mercy truthe ye hast performed thy seruante wyth staffe haue passed ouer thys iordan come fourth twoo andes allegeth dede promise alone also ioineth effect may couragiously tyme come trust god towarde hym like mortall men whiche wery liberality whoes abilitie wasted weyed hys naturepsa xxxivi dauid wisely doth sayth thou hast redemed god speakest truth yt hath geue god ye prayses saluation addeth true speaker vnlesse cotinually like himselfe could gathered benefites sufficiently strong reason affiance callyng vpon hym knowe oft helpeth v sheweth example profe hys goodnesse nede feare hope shalbe put shame disapoint v let thys summe wheras scripture setteth thys vnto v ye chefe point ye worshipping god refusing al sacrifice requireth v thys dutye godlynesse prayer wythout manifeste sacrilege directed wherefore also sayed psalme stretch fourth handes strange god shall god require thingspsa xl iii xxi againe wheras god wil called vpon fayth expresly comaundeth prayer framed according rule hys worde finally whereas fayth founded vpo word mother right prayer sone swarue worde prayer must nedes corrupted alredy shewed ye whole scripture sought thys honor therin chalenged god onely touching office intercession haue also shewed peculiar christ prayer acceptable god whiche mediator halloweth though faythfull one offer prayer god brother haue shewed thys abaeth nothing onely intercession christ altogether standing vpon commende themselues god moreouer haue taught vnfittly drawen dead men neuer rede hath ben commaunded shoulde pray v scripture doth oftentimes exhorte v mutuall doinges thys dutie one dead much one syllable yea iames ioyning twoo thinges together confesse selues among selues mutually pray one doth secretly exclude dead men therfore condemne thys erroriame vviii thys one reason sufficeth beginning prayeng rightly spryngeth fayth fayth cometh hearing worde god mention fained intercession superstition hath rashly gotten selfe patrones whiche geuen god whereas scripture ful many formes prayer example founde thys patroneshyp without papacie thei beleue praier moreouer certaine superstition hath growe distrustfulnesse either content christ intercessor haue altogether robbed praise thys later point easily proued shamelessnesse haue stronger argument proue haue nede intercession saintes whe obiect vnworthy familiar accesse god dede graunt true therupon gather leaue nothing christe whiche esteme intercession nothing worth vnles adioyned george hyppolite visor although praier properly signifieth wish petition yet great affinitie betwene petitio thankesgeuing yt maye fittly comprehended vnder one name speciall sortes paul rehearseth fal vnder first part diuision asking crauing poure fourth desire god requiring wel thinges seme sprede abrode glorie set foorth hys name benefites profitable vse geuing thankes due prayse magnifie good doinges towarde v acknowleging receued liberalitie whatsoeuer good thinges come v therfore dauid coprehended twoo partes together sayengpsa xv cal vpo day necessitie wil deliuer thee thou shalte glorifie scripture vaine commaundeth v vse haue sayd place nedinesse greate experience selfe cryeth euery syde pinched pressed many great distress haue cause enough shoulde sighe god humble wyse call vpon hym though free aduersities yet gyltynesse wicked doinges innumerable assaultes tentations ought pricke forwarde holy aske remedie sacrifice prayse thankesgeuing interruption without haynous synne forasmuch god cesseth heape vppon diuerse men diuerse benefites dryue v though slack slow thakfulnesse finally great plentuous largesse hys benefites doth maner ouerwhelme v many greate miracle hys seen euery syde way soeuer thou turne thee yt neuer want grounde mater prayse thankesgeuing thing may somwhat plainlier declared sith al hope wealth stande god haue sufficiently proued yt neither thing prosperitie blessing must cotinually comit selues al thing himihon iiiixiiii esa xxx xxxiii whatsoeuer purpose speake let v purpose speake doe vnder hys hand wil finally vnder ye hope hys helpe al pronouced accursed god deuise determine purpose vpo trust selues ani wtout wil wtout callig vpo enterprise attept begin thig wheras haue diuerse time alredy said yt duely honored acknowleged ye author al good thing therupon foloweth al thing receiued hade ye yelde cotinual thaks ye right way v vse benefites flow procede fro liberality end ye shold cotinually busied cofessing prayse geuing thanksi timo iiiiv metonymia p xliiii paul testifieth yt sanctified worde prayer doth therwithal signifie holy cleane v without worde prayer vnderstanding ye worde fayth figure therfore dauid sayth well hauing receiued liberalitie lorde declareth geuen hym hys mouth new song wherby verily signifieth malitious silence passe ouer hys benefites without prayse sithe ofte geueth v mater say good hym doeth good v also esaie setting singular grace god exhorteth faythfull new vnwonted songesa iix psal lixvii esai xxxviiixx ion xix psa cxviiii psa cvix vii psa cxxviii sense dauid sayth place lord ope thou lippes mouth shal shew fourth thy prayse likewise ezethias ionas testifie thys shalbe ende deliuerance celebrate goodnesse god songes teple thys law dauid prescribeth al godly shal repay lord sayth thynges hath bestowed vpon wil take cup saluations wil cal vpon name lord ye law ye chirch foloweth psalme saue v god yt may cofesse thy name glory thy prayse againe hath loked vnto prayer solitarie hath despised prayer thys shalbe wrytten generation shal folow people created shal prayse ye lord may declare hys name hym prayse hierusalem yea oft faithful beseche god hys name sake professe themselues vnworthy obteine thing name binde themselues geue thankes promise shalbe right vse bountifulnesse god yt shalbe publisher osee speaking redemptio come chirch saythose xiiiiiii take away iniquitie god lift vp good paye calues lyppes benefites god doe onely clayme themselues prayse tong also naturally procure loue haue loued sayth dauid lord hath heard voice praierps cxvii p xviiii againe place rehearsing yt helpes felt sayth wil loue thee god strength neither shall prayses euer please god shal flow thys swetenesse loue yea also muste holde fast thys sayeng paulephil iiiivi prayer wrongful faulty adioyned geuing thakes thus sayth al prayer beseching thankesgeuing let petetions knowen god sithe testinesse tediousnesse impatiece bitternesse grefe feare moue many prayeng murmure commaundeth affection tempered faythfull haue obteyned ye desire neuerthelesse cherefully blesse god thys knot ought haue place thing maner cotrary wt much holy bad doth god bind v sing praise oft maketh v enioy requestes haue taughte yt prayer hallowed ye intercessio christ otherwise vncleane ye apostle comaundeth v offer sacrifice praise bi christ putteth mind yt haue mouth cleane enough praise ye name godheb iiixv vnlesse ye presthode christ become ye meane wherupo gather yt haue ben mostruously bewitched ye papacie ye greater part marueleth yt christ called aduocate cause paule commaundeth bothe praye geue thankes without cessingi te vxiii namely willeth great continuing may euery tyme euery place mater business prayer men shoulde lifted vp god whiche may bothe loke thinges hys hande yelde praise thinges offreth v continuall matter prayse praye cotinual diligece prayeng although specially cocerne ye propre priuate praiers euery man yet somwhat also perteineth publike prayer chirch neither continuall ought otherwise done tha according politike order shall commo consente agreed vpon among graunt dede therefore certayne houres set appointed indifferent god necessarie v men commoditie men may prouided thinges according sayeng paul may comlyly orderly done chirchi cor x xl maketh nothing contrarie euery chirch ought bothe tyme tyme stirre vp selfe often vse prayer admonished greater necessitie feruent earneste endeuor perseruerance hath great affinitie continuall diligence shalbe fitt place speake aboute ende nowe make nothing much babbling whiche christe willed shold forbiddenmath vivii forbiddeth continue long oft much affection prayer trust maye wryng thing oute god dulling eares much babbling talke persuaded maner men knowe hypocrite consider haue god lesse make pompous shewe prayer triumph pharisee thanked god like men without dout reioysed hymselfe eye men would prayer seke get fame holynesse hereupon came much babbling day vpon like cause vsed papacie vainly spende tyme repeting prayer doe set themselues among people long heape word sith thys babbling childishly mocketh god maruell forbidden chirche ende nothing vsed earnest proceding bottome hart nere kinde lyke corruption christ codeneth wt thys namely ye hypocrite bosting sake seke haue many witness rather occupy ye market place pray prayer want ye prayse ye world wheras haue alredy shewed thys marke prayer shooteth myndes may caryed vpwarde god bothe cofessio prayse crauing helpe therby may vnderstand yt chefe duty therof stand ye minde hart rather ye prayer self properly affectio ye inward hart poured fourth layed ope god ye searcher hart wherfore alredy said heauenly scholemaister minded set best rule prayengmat viv commaunded v goe chamber dore beyng shutt pray father whiche secrete father secret may heare v whe hath drawe away fro example hipocrites ambicious bosting shewe praiers sought fauor therwithall addeth better namely entre chamber pray dore shut word expounde willed v seke solitarie whiche may helpe v descende entre throughely wyth whole thoughte hart promising affection harte god shalbe nere v whoes temple bodyes ought meant deny expediente also pray place sheweth prayer certaine secrete thing whiche bothe chefely placed soule requireth quiet therof farr trobles care wtout cause therfore ye lord himselfe also disposed apply himselfe earnestly prayer coueied solitarie place farr fro ye troblesome copany teach v exaple yt help ar despised minde slippry self bet earnest applyeng praier meane time eue middest multitude men absteined praying occasion tyme serued al place nede shalbe tim lift vp pure handes finally thus holden whosoeuer refuseth praye holy assemblie godly knoweth pray apart solitarinesse home againe neglecteth pray alone priuatly diligently soeuer haut publike assembly doth make vaine prayer geueth opinion men tha secrete iugement god meane time common prayer chirch shoulde growe contempte god olde tyme garnished glorious titlesesa specially called temple house prayer thys sayeng taught chefe part worshipping hym dutie prayer ende faythful one consent exercise themselues teple set vp standard thempsa also added notable promise abideth thee god prayse sion thee vow shalbe payed wordes prophet telleth v prayer chirch neuer voyde lord alway ministreth hys people mater sing vpon ioy although shadowes law cessed yet ye lordes wil thys ceremonie nourish among v also vnitie fayth doute promise belongeth v christ hath stablished hys owne mouth paule teacheth force euer lord hys worde commaundeth faithful vse co mon prayer must common temple appointed vsing whoso refuse communicate prayer ye people god cause abuse thys pretense enter chamber may obey commaundemente lordmat promiseth wil whatsoeuer twoo three shall aske gathered together hys name testifieth despiseth prayer openly made yt bosting seking glory absent vnfained true affectio present dwelleth secret hart right vse temple truely must againe beware neither haue begon certayne age past accopted take propre dwelling place god whense may nerely bende hys eare vnto ayne wote secrete holinesse whiche maye prayer holy god sith selues teples god must pray selues wil cal vpon god holy temple grossenesse let v haue commaundement call vpon lord spirite truth without difference place leaue iewes gentilesiob dede temple olde time commaundemente god offring prayer sacrifice tyme truth lay hydde figured vnder suche shadowes liuely expressed vnto v doth suffer v sticke materiall temple neither temple geuen iewes themselues condition shold enclose presence god within walles therofesa wherby myght exercised beholde image true temple therefore wise thought god dwelleth temple made handesactes sharply rebuked esay stephen moreouer euident neither voice song vsed prayer haue force whit profite god vnlesse procede depe affectio hart rather prouoke wrath v come fro lippes throte forasmuch abuse holy name make mockerie maiestie gather wordes esay although extende yet perteine also reproue thys faultesa mat thys people sayth cometh nere mouth honoreth lippes hart farr fro haue feared commaudement doctrine men therfore beholde make people miracle great wondred wisedome shall perish wise men prudence elder shal vanishe away neither yet doo condemne voice singyng rather doo hyely commende accompany affection mynde exercise mynd hold intentiue thynkyng vpon god slippery rollyng easily slacketh diuersly drawen vnlesse stayed diuers helpes moreouer wheras glorie god ought certaine maner shine al partes body specially behoueth tong applyed auowed seruice singing speaking properly created shew fourth display praise god chefe vse tong publike prayer made assemblie godly tend thys ende may wt one common voice one mouth together glorifie god worship one spirite one faith openly men mutually euery one hys brother maye receiue confession fayth example wherof maye bothe allured stirred vse singyng chirches may touche also waie certaine onely aunciet also vse among apostles1 cor maye gather wordes paule syng spirite syng also mynde agayne colossian teachyng admonishing mutually hymnes psalmes spirituall songes singyng grace hart lorde first place teacheth syng voice harte commendeth spirituall songes wherewith godly doo mutually edifie themselues confess lib cap yet vniuersal augustine testifieth reporteth time ambrose chirch millain first began sing iustina mother valentin cruelly raged true faith people vsed watchinges wont afterwarde westerne chirches folowed litle sayed maner came easterne chirches telleth also seconde boke retractations time receiued africa one hilarie sayth ruler euery place wheresoeuer could malicious blaming raile maner began carthage hymnes altar pronounced boke psalmes either oblation whe ben offred distributed people answered commaundement brother truely song tempered grauitie becommeth presece god angel procureth dignitie grace holy action muche auaileth stirre vp myndes true affection feruentnesse prayeng muste diligently beware eares hedefully bente note confess lib x ca xxxiii myndes spiritual sense wordes wyth peril augustine certaine place sayth moued sometime wished yt ye maner athanasius kept shold stablished commaunded reder shoulde sounde hys wordes small boowing hys voice liker one readeth one singeth remembred howe muche profite hymselfe receyued syngyng inclined ye side therfore vsyng moderation dout holye profitable ordinance side songes euer framed swetenesse delite eares become maiestie chirch hyely displease god whereby also playnly appereth common praiers spoken greke among latine men latine among frenchemen englishemen hath heretofore ben eche commonly done people mother tongue comonly may vnderstoode whole assembly forasmuche ought done edifiyng whole chirch whiche receiue fruite sound vnderstanded haue regarde neither charitie humanitie shold least haue ben somwhat moued authoritie paulei cor xiiiixvi whoes wordes nothyng doutfull thou blesse saieth spirite howe shall filleth place vnlerned man answer amen thy blessing sith knoweth thou saiest thou dede geuest thankes edified therfore sufficiently wonder vnbridled licentiousnesse papistes apostle openly cry againste feare roare strange tongue moste babblyng prayer whiche themselues sometyme vnderstand one syllable wold haue folkes vnderstand paule teacheth ought otherwise pray sayth spirit praye also mynde syng spirite sing also mynde signifieng name spirite singular gifte tonges many endued abused seuered mynde fro vnderstading must altogether thik meane possible neither publike priuate praier tong without hart must hyely displease god moreouer muste thinke mynde ought kyndled feruentnesse thoughte maye farre surmounte tong maye expresse vtterance fynally tong necessarie priuate prayer farre inwarde felyng either able suffice enkindle selfe vehemence enkindlyng violently carieth woorke tong though good prayer sometyme without voyce yet oftentymes betydeth affection mynde feruent bothe tong breaketh foorthe voice membres gesturyng without excessiue shew hereupon came mutteryng hannai sam ixiii like thing holy one alway fele themselues burst broken vnperfect voice gesture body wont vsed praier knelyng vncoueryng hed exercise endeuor ryse vp greater reuerencing god must learne onely certaine rule also forme prayeng namely heauenly father hath taught v beloued sonnemath viix wherin may acknowe vnmesurable goodnesse kyndenesse besyde warneth exhorteth v seke hym al necessitie child wont flee father defenceluc xii ii oft troubled distresse saw yt sufficiently perceiue sclender pouertie mete asked profite prouided also ignorace capacitie wated supplied furnished hath prescribed v form wherin hath table set whatsoeuer may desire soeuer auaileth profit whatsoeuer necessary ask whiche gentlenesse receaue great fruit comfort yt vnderstand yt aske inconuenient thyng vnsemyng vnfit thyng finally nothyng acceptable hym sith aske maner owne mouthe plato sawe folly men making requestes god alcil ii vel de vo whiche beyng grauted many tymes befell much owne hurt pronounced best maner prayeng taken olde poete kyng iupiter geue vnto v beste thynges bothe aske doo aske commaunde euell thynges away v euen aske verily heathen man wyse iudgeth howe perillous aske lorde whiche owne desire moueth v therwithal bewrayeth vnhappy caserom viii vi one open mouthes god without danger vnlesse spirite instructe v right rule praying muche greater estimation priuilege worthy v sithe onely begotten sonne god ministreth wordes mouthe may deliuer mynde doutyng whether call forme rule praying made six petition cause agree diuide seuen partes puttyng aduersatiue word semeth euangelist men ioyne two peces together sayd august enchirid ad laurent cap chrysos au per imperf suffer v oppressed tentation rather helpe weakenesse deliuer v faynt olde writer also think syde nowe whiche mathew added seueth place way declaration ioyned sixt petition although whole praier euery parte regarde specially glorie god yet three first petition peculiarly appoynted god glorie whiche alone ought loke vnto without respect say owne profite thre haue care v proprely assigned aske thinges profite pray name god halowed god proue whether loued honored v freely hope reward must think nothyng commoditie glorie must sett v alone must beholde fixed eies otherwise ought mynded praiers sort euen tourneth great profite sanctified pray also likewise made sanctification eye saied must winke certayne maner blinde suche profite may one loke hope priuate benefite cut yet ceasse wishe pray sanctification thynges perteine glorie godexo xxxii xxxii rom ixiii sene example moses paule greuous turne away myndes eies themselues vehement enflamed zele wish owne destruction though owne losse might auaunce glorie kyngdome god ye side pray dayly bread geuen v although wyshe owne commoditie yet also ought chefely seke glorie god would aske vnlesse might turne glorie let v come declaryng praier selfe father whiche art heauen first entrie mete said prayer ought none otherwise offred v god name christe name bee made acceptable vnto sin call father truely allege v name christ boldnesse myght man call god father burst foorth great rashnesse take hymselfe honor sonne god vnlesse adopted child grace christ true sonne geue v brother hath propre natureiohn ixii iohn iiii psalme xxviix p xxviix esa lxiiixvi ii tim ii xiii may benefit adoptio made oures sure faith embrace great bountifulnesse iohn saith yt power geue beleue ye name begotte sonne god yt also may made childre god therfore calleth father called v swetenesse name delyuering v distrust sithe found greater affection loue father therfore coulde surer example testifie vnmeasurable deere loue towarde v named sonnes god loue much greater excellent toward v loue parentes passeth men goodnesse mercy father earth hauing shaken feling fatherly naturalnesse wold forsake child yet wyll neuer faile vsmat viixi esa xlixxv denie hymselfe haue promise beyng euell geue good giftes child howe muche father heauen agayn prophet mother forget child though forget yet forgett thee child childe geue hymselfe tuition stranger forein man vnlesse complain either crueltie pouertie father seke succor ell alone vnlesse reproche hym pouertie wante abilitie crueltie extreme rigorousnesse neither let v allege worthily made fearefull conscience sinnes whiche may make father neuer mercyfull kynde daily displeased among men sonne better aduocate pleade cause father better meane gett recouer fauor beyng loste hymselfe
