humbly lowly acknowlegyng fault doo beseche father mercie fatherly bowel hide themselues must moued prayer shall father mercy doii cor iiii god comfort shall rather heare teares gronynges child intreatyng themselues specially sith dothe call exhorte v intercession whatsoeuer succor wherof fearefully flee withoute shewe despeire distrust kyndnesse mercifulnesse father ouerflowyng plentie fatherly kyndnesse depainteth setteth vnto v parableluc xvxx father louyngly embraceth sonne estranged hymselfe riotously wasted substance euery way greuously offended tarieth till wordes craue pardon hymselfe preuenteth hym knoweth hym afarre returnyng owne wyll goeth mete hym comforteth receiueth hym fauor settyng man example great gentlenesse mynded teache v howe muche plentifull kindnesse ought loke hande father also best mercyfull father howsoeuer vnkynde rebellious noughty child yet cast self vppon mercie myght make assuredly beleued suche father v christian willed called father also expresse name father myght thus talke hym father hast great naturall kyndnesse towarde thy chyldren great easynesse pardon thy child call thee pray thee beyng assured fully persuaded thou bearest affection v fatherly howsoeuer vnworthy suche father small capacity hart conceiue great vnmeasurablenesse fauor onely christe v pledge earneste adoption also geueth v spirite witnesse adoptiongal iii vi may free lowde voyce crie abba father ofte therfore delay shal arde v let v remembre aske hym correctyng fearefulnesse sette v spirite coragiousnesse guide pray boldly whereas taught euery one shoulde seuerally call hym owne father rather common together call hym father therby put mynde howe great affection brotherly loue ought among v whiche altogether one right mercy liberalitie child suche father haue one common father cometh whatsoeuer good thyng may betide vnto vsmat xxiii ix ought nothyng seuerall among v whiche ready great cherefulnesse mynde communicate one muche nede requireth desirous oughte reache hande helpe one nothyng wherin may profite brother commende care prouidence good father beyng well pleased fauoring nothing al wated verily euen owe father truely hartily loueth father household doth also embrace whole housholde loue good likewise loue affection beare heauenly fatherephes ixxiiii must shewe towarde people householde inheritance hath honored hath called fullnesse begotten sonne let christian man therfore frame prayer rule common may comprehend brother christe hym onely presently seeth knoweth suche al men lyue vpon earth god hath determined knowlege sauyng lesse godly naturall wish best hope beste howbeit ought certayne singular affection beare special inclination household faithgal vix apostle hath euery thing peculiarly commended vnto v sume al praiers ought made haue respect communitie lord hath stablished kyngdome house yet withstandeth may specially pray selues certaine yet mynde depart hauyng eye communitie one swarue applie thynges vnto though singularly spoken forme yet directed marke cesse common may easily vnderstoode like example commaundemet god generall relieue nede poore yet obey commaundement ende helpe pouertie knowe see nede although passe ouer many whome see pressed lesse necessitie either know able helpe maner also doo god hauyng regard vnto thinkyng vppon common felowship chirche doo make suche particular prayer whiche doo common mynde particular wordes commende god whoes necessitie god willed nereiy knowen howbeit thyngs like praier bestowyng goodes liberalitie geuing vsed toward whoes nede haue perceyued prayer may helpe euen strange moste vnknowen v howe greate space ground soeuer distant v done generall forme praier wherin child god conteined among also hereto may applie paule exhorteth faithfull tymei tim iiviii lift vp euery pure handes without stryfe warneth strife shutteth gate praiers willeth one mynde lay petition common together added heauen wherupon gathered bounde faste enclosed compassed circle heauen within certayne barres salomon also confesseth heauens heauens conteyne hymi kin viii xxxvii esa lxvii acte viixlix et xviixxiiii hymselfe faith prophet heauen seate earthe footestoole wherby verily signifieth limited certaine coaste spread abroade throughout thynges mynde suche grossenesse coulde otherwyse conceiue vnspeakable glorie signified v heauen nothing come vnder sight ample fuller maiesty sith therfore wheresoeuer sens comprehende thyng vse fasten god sett place seke hym raised vp aboue sense bothe body soule agayne maner speakyng lifted vp aboue chaunce corruption change finally signified comprehendeth cotemeth whole worlde gouerneth power wherfore al one ben called infinite greatnesse height incomprehensible substance vnmeasurable power euerlastyng immortalitie haue must lift vp mynde hier god spoken dreame earthly fleshly thyng hym measure hym small proportion drawe rule affection therwithall raysed vp affiance whose prouidence power vnderstande heauen earth gouerned let summe vnder name father sett v god hath owne image appeared v may called vpon assured faith familiar name father onely applied stablishe affiance also auaileth holde fast myndes drawen doutfull fained god shoulde onely begotten sonne clymbe vp onely father angel chirche seate placed heauen gouernance worlde put mynd without cause come hym present care cometh owne mete v come god saith apostle must first beleue godhebr xivi rewarder seke hym bothe thyngs christ affirmeth propre father faith may stayed hym may certainly persuaded carelesse safetie vouchesaueth euen v extende prouidence whiche introduction paule prepareth v pray rightely hiddeth petition opened god sayth thus ye carefull nothyngphilip iiiivi lorde hande wherby appeareth doutefully perplexitie tosse theyr prayer mynde whiche haue well settled thempsalme xxxiiixviii eie god vpon righteous firste petition name god hallowed neede wherof ioyned greate shame shamefull glorie god partly vnthankefulnesse partly maliciousnesse darkened muche lyeth boldenesse furious stubbornesse vtterly blotted though wicked wolde burst themselues wylfulnesse full sacrilege yet holynesse name god gloriously shineth without cause prophet crieth thy name god hy praise al endes earthpsalme xlviiixi wheresoeuer name god knowen strengthes power goodnesse wisdome righteousnesse mercie truthe must shewe foorth themselues whiche may drawe v admiration stirre v vp publyshe praise sithe therfore holynesse god shamefully taken hym earth able reskue least commaunded take care prayer summe wishe honor geuen god whiche worthye haue men neuer speake thinke hym without moste hye reuerence wherunto contrarie vnholy abusyng whiche hath alway common worlde day also rangeth abroade hereuppon commeth necessitie petition whiche liued v godlynesse though little oughte haue ben superfluous ye name god haue holynesse safe seuered breatheth nothyng glorie commaunded pray god wil deliuer holy name al contempt dishonor also wil subdue al mankind reuerece wheras god discloseth hymself v partly doctrine partly workes otherwise sanctified v geue behalfes yt embrace whatsoeuer shal come hym seueritie haue lesse praise among v mercifulnesse forasmuche hath manifolde diuersitie workes emprinted markes glorie may worthily drawe tonges confession praise shall comme passe scripture shall haue full authoritie v successe shall hynder blessyng whiche god deserueth whole course gouernyng worlde agayne petition also tendeth purpose vngodlynesse whiche defyleth holy name may destroyed taken away whatsoeuer thynges doo darken diminishe sanctifieng well sclaunders mockynges may driuen away god subdueth al sacrilege glorie may therby shine abroade seconde petition kyngdome god may come although conteyne newe thyng yet withoute cause seuered fyrst consyder owne drewsynesse thyng greatest profitable thyng whiche oughte selfe haue ben well knowen many wordes ofte beaten v therfore haue ben commaunded pray god bryng subiection length vtterly destroye whatsoeuer spotteth holye name nowe added like maner request kingdome come although haue alredy sett fourth definition kingdome yet brefely rehearse god reigneth men wel forsaking themselues despising world earthly life yelde themselues righteousnesse aspire heauenly lyfe therfore twoo partes kyngdome one god correcte power spirite corrupt desire fleshe multitude make warre hym frame sens obedience hys gouernement therfore none kepe right order thys prayer beginne themselues say cleansed corruption troble quiet state kingdome god infect purenesse therof worde god lyke kyngly scepter commaunded pray wil subdue myndes harte al men willing obedience done secret instinct hys spirite vttereth effectuall force hys worde may auaunced degree worthi afterward must come wicked obstinatly desperate rage resist authoritie god therfore setteth vp hys kyngdome humbling whole world diuerse maners tameth wantonness breaketh vntamed pride thys daily wished done may please god gather hymselfe chirches coastes worlde enlarge encreasce number enriche giftes stablishe right order side ouerthrowe enemy pure doctrine religion scatter abrode counsel cast enterprise wherby appeareth endeuor daili proceding vaine commaunded v mater men neuer good case filthinesse bring shaken away cleansed full purenesse florisheth liuely forcei cor xvxxviii fulnesse differred vnto last comming christ paule teacheth god shalbe al al thys prayer ought withdrawe v corruption world seuer v god hys kyngdome florishe v also kindle endeuor mortifie flesh finally instruct v bearing crosse forasmuch god wise haue hys kyngdome spred abrode neither ought take miscontentedly outward man destroyed inwarde man renewed thys nature ye kingdome god submitt selues righteousnesse therof make v partaker glorie thys done whe brightly setting fourth light truth alway new encreasces wherby ye darkenesse lye satan hys kyngdome may vanish away destroyed perish defendeth helpe hys spirite directeth vprightnesse strengtheneth co tinuance ouerthroweth wicked cospiracies hys enemy shaketh abrode treason deceites preuenteth malice beateth downe stubbornnesse til length kill antichrist spirite hys mouth destroy vngodlinesse brightnesse comming third petition wil god done earth heauen although hangeth vpon kingdome seuered vaine added seuerally grossnesse whiche doth easily conceiue god reigne world shal therfore absurditie taken waye plainer exposition god shal king world al thing shal submitt themselues meant hys secret wherby gouerneth al thinges directeth ende though satan men troblesomly caried againste yet hys incomprehensible counsell turne aside violent motion also driue order may hath purposed spoke wil god namely whereunto answereth willing obedience therefore heauen name compared earth angells sayd psalmepsal ciiixx willingly obey god diligently bent commaundements therfore comaunded wish heauen nothing done becke god angel quietly framed al vprightnesse earth al stubbornnesse peruersenesse quenched may subiect gouernemet require renounce desire owne fleshe whosoeuer doth resigne yelde affection god doth much hym lyeth set forasmuch nothing cometh v faulty againe thys prayer framed forsaking selues god may gouerne v wil may also create v new mindes new harte olde brought nought may fele selues none motion desire mere cosent wil summarily may wil nothing selues spirite may gouerne harte inwardly teaching v may learne loue thinges please hym hate thinges displease wherupon also foloweth whatsoeuer affection fyght wil may make vaine voide loe first three chefe pointes thys prayer asking wherof oughte haue onely glorie god eye leauing respect selues hauing regarde owne profit whiche although come hereof largely vnto v yet ought seke albeit al thinges though neither thinke wish aske must neuerthelesse come passe due time yet must wishe require thys doe smal profit trauaill may testifie professe selues seruantes childre god much v lyeth endeuoring truely throughly geuen set fourth hys honor due hym bothe lord father whoso therefore doe affection zele auauncing glorie god pray name god hallowed hys kyngdome come hys wyll done accompted among childre seruantes god thinges shalbe done agaynst willes shal turne confusion destruction foloweth seconde part ye prayer come commodity bidding farewel glorie god paul witnessethi cor x xxxi regarded euen meate drink shold seke profitable selues haue alredy geuen warning thys difference god peculiarly claiming three petition hymselfe doth draw v hymselfe wholly may thys wise proue godlinesse graunteth v also haue eye commodity condition aske nothig selues ende whatsoeuer benefites bestoweth vpo v may set fourth glorie forasmuche nothing rightfull lyue dye hym thys petition aske god generally al thinges whiche vse body nedeth vnder elementes world wherwith may fed clothed also whatsoeuer foreseeth profitable v may eate bred peace prayer brefely yelde selues care commit v prouidence may fede cherishe preserue v good father disdayneth receiue also body hys faythfull sauegarde keping exercise fayth smal thinges loke thinges hys handes euen crumme bred droppe water wheras come passe wote iniquitie moued vexed greater care fleshe soule many dare trust god soule yet carefull fleshe yet doute shall eate wherewith shalbe clothed haue plenty wyne wheate oyle aforehande tremble feare muche esteme shadow lyfe lasteth moment euerlasting immortalitie whoso trusting god haue one cast away carefulnesse prouision fleshe also loke saluatio euerlasting lyfe hys hand greater thing therfore smal exercise fayth hope thinges god whiche otherwise much holde v care haue smally profited haue put thys vnbeleuingnesse whiche cketh fall within bone almost men whiche doe teache transubstantiall bred semeth smally agree meaning christ yea euen thys frayle lyfe geue god office nourishing father prayer vnperfect reason whiche bryng muche profane mete child god ought spiritual cast minde earthly care also wrappe god therin wt though blessing fatherly fauor doth also appeare sustenace lyfe though written vaine yt godlinesse hath promyses life come also preset lyfe although forgeuenesse synnes much greater value sustenance body yet christ hath set inferior thing first placei timo iiiiviij entent lift v vp degree twoo petition properly belong heauenly lyfe wherin regarde grossenesse commaunded aske bred shoulde contente quantitie heauenly father vouchesaueth geue v shoulde seke gayne vnlawful crafty meanes meane tyme muste learne made title gifteleu xxvi ix neither diligence trauaill handes sayed moses doe themselues gett v thing vnlesse blessing god presente yea plentie bred shoulde nothing al profit v vnlesse god turned nourishmente therefore thys liberalitie god lesse necessarie riche poore hauing cellers barnes full yet fainte drynesse emptinesse vnlesse hys grace enioy bred word day euery day euangelist also adiectiue daily doe bridle muche gredines fraile thinges wherwith wont burne measure wherunto ioyned euells sithe haue ple tifull abundance gloriously poure vppon pleasure delites boasting kindes riotous excesse therefore commaunded aske much enough necessitie day day affiance whe heauenly father hath fed v thys day wil also faile v morrow therfore great plentie thinges euer doe flowe vnto v yea whe barnes stuffed cellers ful yet ought alway aske daily bred must certainly beleue al substance nothing somuche lord doth pouring blessing continuall encreasce make frutefull substance hand insomuch doth euery houre geue v portion graunt v vse itdeu viiiiii math iiii iiii whereas pride men doth hardly suffer selfe persuaded lord testifieth hath shewed singular example therof age fed hys people manna wildernesse teache v liueth bred onely rather worde cometh hys mouth whereby declared power alone lyfe strengthes susteined although doe minister vnto v vnder bodily instrumentes wont also teache v contrarie exa ple oft willeu xxvi xxvi breaketh strength calleth staff bred men eating may pine hunger drynkyng may dried vp thirst whoso coteted wt daily bred vnbrideled gredinesse gaping endlesse store whoso ful abundance carelesse reason heape richesse doe neuerthelesse sue god praier nothing ell mocke hym firste sorte suche men aske whiche woulde obteine yea whiche moste abhorre haue daily bred much lyeth dissemblingly hide god affection couetousnesse wheras true prayer oughte poure whole mynde selfe whatsoeuer inwardly lieth hydden sort aske whiche loke hande namely whiche thinke haue themselues called oures bountifulnesse god haue sayd muche appeareth maketh oures righte due v yet exposition reiected whiche haue also touched bred meante whiche earned rightfull harmelesse trauail gotten deceites extorcious alwaye men get selues yl wheras praye geuen v thereby signified fre gifte god whense soeuer come v yea shall moste seme begotten owne policie trauail earned handes forasmuch cometh passe blessing labor prosper wel nowe foloweth forgeue v dettes whiche petition nexte folowing christe hath brefely conteined whatsoeuer maketh heauenly lyfeier xxxixxxiii xxxiiiviii twoo partes aboue standeth spirituall couenant whiche god hath made saluation hys chirche wryte lawes harte mercyfull iniquitie christ beginneth forgeuenesse sinnes adioyne seconde grace god defende v power hys spirite susteine v hys helpe maye stande vnouercome againste tentations sinnes calleth dettes dett bounde pay penaltie meanes able satisfie vnlesse acquited thys forgeuenesse whiche pardon hys free mercie himselfe liberally wypeth dettes taking payment v mercie satisfieng himselfe christerom iiixxix hath one geuen himselfe recompense therfore whoso trust god shalbe satisfied owne mennes merites satisfactios forgeuenesse sinnes recompensed redemed haue parte communicating thys free forgeuenesse call vppon god thys manner doo nothing subscribe owne accusation yea seale owne condemnation owne witnesse confesse themselues detters vnlesse acquited benefit forgeuenesse whiche yet doo receiue rather refuse thrust vnto god owne merites satisfaction doo beseche mercie doe appeale iugement dreame perfection themselues whiche taketh away nede craue pardon lett haue suche disciple whome itching eares driueth error certaine many disciple gett taken away christ forasmuche instructing confesse giltinesse receiueth none synners cherisheth sinnes flatteringes knewe faythful neuer throughly vnclothed vice fleshe alway remayne subiect iugement god dede wished yea earnestly endeuored hauing performed partes dutie may truely reioyse god cleane spott forasmuch pleaseth god litle litle make againe image v alwaye remayneth infection fleshe remedie ought haue despised christ authoritie geuen hys father commaundeth v throughout whole course life fle crauing pardo giltinesse shalbe able suffer new maisters goe imagined ghost perfect innocecie dasel ye eye ye simplei ioh make trust yt may made free fro fault ihon witnesseth nothing ell make god lier withal one worke lewde men cancilling one article feare sonder meane weaken fundation ye whole couenant god wherin haue shewed yt saluatio coteined robber god seuer thinges coioyned also wicked cruel ouerwhelme poore soules despeire traytors themselues yt like bryng themselues slouthfulnesse directly contrary ye mercy god wheras obiect wishing coming ye kyngdome god also aske putting away synne childishe firste table thys prayer set forth vnto v hye perfection part set fourth weakenesse twoo thinges fittly agree together spring toward marke despise remedy necessitie requireth finally pray may forgeuen selues doe forgeue dettors forgeue pardon al whomsoeuer haue ben thing offended either vniustly handled dede reprochefully vsed worde lyeth v pardo giltinesse fault offense perteineth god alone thys forgeuing owne willingnesse lay away mynde wrathesa xliiixxix hatred desire reuengement voluntarie forgetfulnesse treade vnder fote remembrance iuries wherefore may aske forgeuenesse synnes hande god doe also forgeue offense towarde v either haue done v wrong kepe hatred harte purpose reuengementes imagine occasion may hurt yea endeuor come fauor againe enemy deserue well kynde frendly doinges winne vnto v thys prayer beseche god forgeue v require graunt v forgeuenesse whiche graunt pray graunt v vnlesse graunt whoso therfore doe obtein prayer greuous iugemet last al noted condition forgeue v forgeue dettors herefore added deserue forgeuenesse ye forgeuenesse graunt yt cause forgeuenesse v expressed thys worde partly lordes comforte weakenesse fayth added signe whereby may assured hath surely grauted v forgeuenesse synnes surely knowe conscience haue grauted thesame mynde voyde cleansed al hatred enuye reuengement partly thys marke wipeth number child may bolde call vpo father hedlong hasty reuenge hardily entreated pardon doe vse stiffly continuing enmites doe cherishe themselues displeasure towarde pray turned themselues whiche also luke expresly spoken wordes christ sixt petitio haue sayd answereth promise engrauing lawe god harte doe without continual warrfare hard great striuinges obey god pray furnished wepons defended suche succor may able get victorie whereby warned stande nede grace spirite whiche may soften direct harte obedience god also hys helpe wherby may make v vnuicible bothe al trayterous entrappinges violet conflictes satan tentations many diuerse sortes peruerse thoughtes minde prouoking v trespassing lawiam iii xiiii mat iiiii ii either owne luste doth minister vnto v deuell stirreth vp tentations also thinges owne nature euell yet craft deuel made tentations whe set eye occasion drawen awaye swarue god tentations either ryghte hande left righte hande richesse power honor commonly glistering shewe good dasel sight menii thesa iiiv catche bayted hoke flatterings beyng entrapped suche deceites dronke suche swetenesse may forget god left hande pouertie reproches despisinges trobles suche greued bitternesse hardnesse therof may vtterly discouraged caste away fayth hope finally altogether estranged god tentations sortes fighte v eyther kindled v owne luste set v craft satan pray heavenly father suffer v yelde rather vpholde v rayse v vp hande strong strength may stande fast assaultes malicious enemie whatsoeuer thoughtes put mynde whatsoeuer sett v either side maye turne good neither puffed vp prosperitie throwen downe aduersitie neither yet doe require may fele tentations al haue great nede stirred vp pricked pinched least muche reste growe dull vaine dauid wishe temptedpsa xxviii ge xxiii deu viiiii xii iii without cause lord daily tempteth hys electe chastising shame pouertie troble kyndes crosse god tempteth one maner satan satan destroy damne confounde throwe downe hedlong god prouing hys may haue tryall vnfainednesse exercising may confirme strength mortifie purge fier seare fleshe whiche vnlesse thys wise restrained woulde waxe wanton woulde wildly outrage aboue measurei cor xxiii moreouer satan assaileth men vnarmed vnredy may oppresse vnware god euen tempting worketh effecte whiche maye paciently beare whatsoeuer sendeth vpon name euell whether vnderstande deuell synne maketh litle materii pet iiix pet vviii satan dede himselfe enemie lyeth wayte oure lyfe synne armed destroye v thys therefore request may ouercome ouerwhelmed tentations may power lorde stande strong contrary power wherwith assailed yelde v vanquished tentations receiued keping charge safe hys protection may endure vnouercome ouer sinne death gate hel whole kingdome deuil deliuered euel also diligently marked aboue strength matche deuil greate warrier beare force violence otherwise vainely mockage aske alredy selues surely whiche prepare battell trust themselues sufficiently vnderstade ferce wel armed enemy haue pray deliuered power ye mouth mad raging lyon wheras torne peces teeth pawes swallowed throte vnlesse lord deliuer v ye middest deathpsalme lxxiiii yet therewithal knowing thys lorde shall stande v fight v ouerthrowen shal strength shew stregth let trust list ability strengthes free thinke haue themselues let suffice ye stand strong stregth god thys prayer coteineth tha first sight beareth shewe ye spirite god stregth fight cobate sata shal able get ye victorie vntil filled wt spirite shal haue put al weakenesse fleshe whe therfore pray deliuered satan deuel pray bee tyme tyme enriched new encreases grace god til fully stuffed may triuph ouer euel semeth hard rough yt craue god leade v tetatio forasmuch cotrary nature tempt iames witnesseth question alredy partly assoiled sayd lust properly cause al tentations wherwith ouercomeiames ixiii therfore worthily beareth blame therof nether doth iames meane thing ell faultes without cause wrongfully layed vpon god whiche dryuen impute selues knowe selues conscience qyltye thys withstandeth god maye pleaseth hym make v bonde satan caste v awaye reprobate sense filthy lustes leade v tentation iugement righteous dede yet oftentymes secret forasmuche cause often hidde men yet certainly knowen hym wherupon gathered vnfit manner speaking persuaded doth without cause oft threaten yt reprobate shalbe striken blindnesse hardening harte shalbe sure token vengeance three petition wherwith peculiarly comende v thing god euidetly shew haue said pr yers christian ought comon tend ye comon edifieng ye chirch encrease communio faithful doth euery man pray haue thing priuatly geuen al co mo together pray bred forgeuenesse sinnes yt may led tetatio ye may deliuered fro euil furthermore adioyned cause haue great boldnesse aske great trust obteine although ye latine copy yet agreeth fittly thys place tha yt shold seme worthy omitted namely yt ye kingdome power glorie euer ye perfect quiet rest soule praiers commeded god worthinesse shold bolde one ope hys mouth hym howsoeuer moste miserable howsoeuer vnworthy al men howsoeuer voyde al comendacio yet shal neuer wat cause pray neuer destitute cofidece forasmuch father ca haue kingdom power glorie take away fro hym ye end added amen wherby expressed feruetnesse desire obteine thigs yt haue asked god hope cofirmed yt al thing alredy obteined shal surely geue v promised god ca deceiue thys agreeth wt maner prayer haue rehearsed lord thy name sake sake righteousnesse wherby holy one expresse ye end prayer also co fesse yt vnworthy obteine vnlesse god fetch ye cause fro hymselfe trust spede cometh onely nature god thus haue whatsoeuer oughte yea wise may aske godmat xviiv set fourth forme wer rule prayeng taught best scholemaister christ lorde hath set ouer v teacheresa xiii alone hath willed harkened vnto bothe alway hath ben eternall wisedome beyng made man geuen men angell great counsell prayer pointes fully perfect whatsoeuer foreyn strange thyng added referred vngodly vnworthy allowed god summe hath sett foorth mete hymsee augustine praier proba pleasyng hym necessarie v finally graunt wherfore dare go aske thing god beside firste adde owne wisdome god done without mad blasphemie hold themselues vnder wil god despising gredynesse wander finally shal neuer obteine thyng forasmuche pray without faith doute suche praiers made without faith wanteth woorde god de fuga perse cut vpon vnlesse faith grounded wise stande forsaking maisters rule doo folowe owne desire onely without worde god also much able whole endeuor therefore tertullian lesse fitly tha truly hath called lawful prayer secretely signifyeng lawlesse vnlawfull woulde haue thynges taken though bounde forme prayer may change worde sillable echewhere red many prayer scripture farre differyng woordes yet written spirite day profytable vsed v many continually put mouthes faithful spirite lykenesse wordes muche agree onely meanyng teachyng man shold seke loke aske thyng summarily comprehended praier whiche thoughe moste differ wordes yet differeth sense like certaine praiers found scripture come godly harte applied verily none bee founde whiche maye matche muche lesse passe perfectnesse praier nothing left might thought vpon praise god nothyng ought come mynde man owne profites fully hope worthily taken away men attempt make better summe let v remembre doctrine wisedome god hath taught willed willed nedefull although haue aboue saied ought alway breathe vpwarde myndes lifted vp god pray without ceassyng yet forasmuche suche weakenesse nedeth bee vpholden many helpes suche dullnesse needeth pricked forwarde many spurres good euery one v appoynt hymselfe priuately certaine houres whiche may passe away without prayer may haue whole affectios mynd throughly busied purpose rise mornyng go day worke sitt meate haue ben fedde blessyng god take v rest let superstitious obseruyng houres payeng taske god may think selues discharged houres trayning weake wherby may exercised time time stirred vp specially ought carefully loke oft either selues distresse se distresse hardnesse aduersitie runne streight waye hym feete harte yt suffer prosperitie owne men passe testifie acknowlege bee praise thankesgeuyng finally diligentlye bee obserued prayer goe bynde god certaine circumstance appoynt hym shal time place maner prayer ar taught make hym law appoynt condition leaue thynges may maner tyme place pleaseth wherfore ere make prayer selues first praie done already submitt restrained bridle put vppon maye presume bryng god rule make hym iudge gouernor desyres myndes framed obedience suffer selues ruled lawes god prouidence shall easily learne continue praier longyng desire paciently waite lord beyng assured although appeare yet alway present v seeth tyme declare howe deaffe eares gaue praiers whiche eye men semed despised shalbe present comfort faint fall downe despaire time god answere firste requestes like wont whiche caried sodeyne heate call vpon god come fyrst bruntes bryng present helpe imagine hym angry hatefully bent agaynst castyng away hope obteynyng cesse call vpon rather differ yng hope well tempered euennesse mynde let v goe forwarde perseuerance much comended v scripture psalmes may oftentymes see howe dauid faithfull men seme maner weried prayeng beate aire threwe away word god heard yet cesse prayeng word god hath full authoritie manteined vnlesse credite therof bee set aboue success thynges moreouer let v tempte god prouoke v beyng weried oure importunacie whiche many vse doo nothing indent god vpon certain condition binde lawes couenantyng though seruant desire doo presently obey disdayne chafe carpe hym murmure turmoile therfore oftentymes furor beyng angry grau teth mercie beyng fauorable denieth example hereof child israellnum xixviii whome ben better haue ben heard lord flesh eate vp wrath yet length long lokyng sense perceiue haue preuailed prayeng feleth fruite thereof yet faith shall assure v whiche bee perceiued sense namely haue obteined expedient v forasmuche lord dothe ofte certainly take vpon haue care greues haue ben one laide bosome make v possesse abundance pouertie comfort affliction howsoeuer thynges faile v yet god neuer faile v suffereth waityng patience disappoynted alone shall suffice v steede thynges forasmuche conteineth hymself al good thyngs shall one day disclose vnto v day iudgement shall plainly shew foorth kyngdome besyde although god graunt v yet dothe alway answer accordyng expresse forme request holdyng v outwarde semyng suspense yet meane vnknowe sheweth yt praiers wer vaini iohn viv meant word iohn know yt heareth v aske thing know haue petition aske meant word iohn know heareth v whe aske thyng hym seemeth weake superfluousnesse wordes singularly profitable declaratio namely god euen doeth folowe desire yet gentle fauorable prayer hope resteth vpon worde may neuer disappoynt v patience faithfull doo farre nede susteyned long stand vnlesse dyd stay vpon lorde dothe light trailles proue tenderly dothe exercise oftentymes driueth greatest extremity driuen thether suffreth long sticke fast myre ere geue taste swetenesse andi sam ii vi hanna saith slayeth quickneth leadeth helles bringeth backe againe coulde dou discouraged fall hedlong despaire vnlesse distresse desolate already halfe dead thought rayse vp god doth loke vpon shall hande ende euels howsoeuer stande fast vppon assurednesse hope ceasse meane tyme pray prayer stedfastnesse continuance nothyng preuayle prayeng pthe xxi chapiter eternall election wherby god hath predestinate saluation destruction nowe whereas couenant life egally preached al men whome preched doth eyther egally continually finde like place diuersitie wonderous deapth iudgement god appeareth neyther dout diuersitie also serueth free choise god eternall election euident wrought god saluation frely offred debarred comyng arise great hard question otherwise discussed tha godly myndes haue certainly stablished whiche ought holde cocerning election predestination many think combersome question thynke nothing lesse reasonable comon multitude men fore ordeined saluation destruction wrongfully encombre themselues shall afterwarde euident framyng mater together beside darknesse maketh men afrayde onely profytablenesse doctrine also moste swete fruite sheweth foorth selfe shall neuer clerely persuaded ought saluation floweth fountain free mercie god till eternall election knowen v comparison bryghtly setteth foorth grace god dothe without difference adopt hope saluation geueth denieth muche ignorance principle diminisheth glorie god howe much withdraweth true humilitie playne see paul denieth whiche necessarie knowen possible knowen vnlesse god leauyng alltogether respect workes chose hath determined himselfe tyme sayth remnantes saued according free election grace workes forasmuche grace gracerom xiv woorkes grace forasmuche worke woorke must broughte backe begynnyng election maye certaine saluation cometh v otherwhere mere liberalitie god whiche haue principle quenched niggardly much lieth darken yt ought gloriously full mouthe haue ben publyshed plucke vp roote humilitie paule saluation remnant people ascribed free election clerely testifieth onely knowen god dothe mere good pleasure saue render rewarde done whiche shutt gate none may bolde come tasting doctrine lesse wrong god neither shal thyng suffice humble v ought neither shall otherwise feele hart muche bounde god neither yet otherwhere vpholdyng stay sounde affiance christe himselfe teacheth deliuer v feare make v vnuanquishable among many danger ambush deadly battells promiseth whatsoeuer hath receiued father keepeiohn xxv shall safe wherof gather shall continual tremblyng miserable whosoeuer knowe themselues propre possession god therfore yll prouide bothe themselues faithfull beyng blynde thre profites haue touched woulde wishe whole fundation saluation quite taken among v moreouer hereby chirch appeareth vnto v serm cant whiche otherwise bernard rightly teacheth possible founde knowen among creature bothe way meruailous wise lieth hidden within bosome blessed predestination within masse miserable damnation ere entre matter selfe must hand two sortes speake two sortes men entrentyng predestination wheras selfe somwhat combersome made doutfull yea dangerous curiousnesse men cause ran stoppes restrained wandring forbidden compass climbyng vp hye may leaue god secrete searche turne ouer boldnesse importunacie forasmuch commonly se many runne headlong among otherwise euell men fit occasion warne behalfe due measure theyr duetie first therfore let remembre enquire vpon predestination pearce secrete closet wisedome god wherinto man doo carelesly boldly breake shall bothe atteyne wherwith satisfie curiousnesse shal entre mase wherof shall fynde way get neither mete man shoulde freely search thynges god hath willed hidden himselfe turne ouer eternitie height wisedome willed honored conceiued also mought meruailous vnto v secretes whiche hath determined opened vnto v hath disclosed worde hath determined farre forsawe pertayne v profitable v come sayth augustine way faithe let v stedfastly holde homili ioh h viiixxvi bringeth kynges chamber whiche treasure knowlege wisedome hidden lorde himselfe christ enuie excellent moste chosen disciple said haue many thynges sayde ye beare nowe must walke must profit must encreasce harte may able conceiue thynges co ceiue last day find v profityng shal learne whiche coulde thought force v worde lorde onely way may leade v searche whatsoeuer lawfull learned light may geue v light see whatsoeuer ought see hym shall easily holde backe restraine v rashenesse shall knowe soone gone boundes worde runne oute waie darkenesse race must needes oftentymes stray slippe stumble first therfore let eye couet knowlege predestination whiche set foorth woorde god poynt lesse madnesse man haue go vnpassable waie se darknesse neither lett v ashamed ignorant somewhat wherein learned ignorance rather lett v willyngly absteine serchyng knowlege wherof excessyue couetyng foolishe p rillous yea deadly wantonnesse witt prouoke v shalbe profitable alwaye sett agaynst whereby may beaten backe much honey good serchyng glorie dothe turne vnto glorie curiouspro xxvxxvii good cause shoulde frayed away boldnesse whiche nothing throwe v downe headlong ruine haue remedy euell doo commaunde mention predestination bee maner buried least teache men flee euery maner questionyng therof rocke although moderation men bee herein worthily praysed iudge mystery shoulde tasted suche sobrietie yet descende muche beneath meane little preuaile witte manne whiche doothe lyghtly suffre selfe restrained therfore behalf also maie kepe right ende must returne worde lorde whiche haue sure rule vnderstanding scripture schoole holy ghoste whiche nothyng lefte bothe necessarie profitable knowen nothyng taught whiche behouefull learne whatsoeuer therfore vttered scripture concernyng predestination muste beware debarre faithfull least seme either enuiously defraude benefite god blame accuse holy ghoste hath published thynges whyche wyse profitable suppressed let v say geue leaue christian man open mynde eares sayenges god whiche directed hym doone temperance soone lorde hath closed holy mouth may also forclose himselfe way enquire shall beste boude sobrietie learnyng alway follow ye lord goyng vspro xxvii also whe maketh ende teaching ceasse learne neither danger feare greate importance ought therfore turne awaye myndes oracle god notable sayeng salomon glorie god concele word sithe bothe godlinesse common reason teacheth generally meant euery thyng muste seke difference least brutishe ignorance shoulde please v vnder color modestie sobrietiedeu xxixxxix difference fewe woordes playnly sett moses lord god sayth belong secretes b v child hath disclosed thynges see commendeth people studie doctrine law onely reason decree god pleased god publish howe withholdeth people within boudes reason lawfull mortall men thrust themselues secretes god prophane men graunt mater predestination sodenly catche hold somewhat may carpe cauill barke scoffe waywardnesse doo fray v away chefe article faith must kept secrete whiche almost none thei thei leaue vntouched blasphemie frowarde wytt lesse prowdly outrage heareth essence god three persones heare god forsawe shoulde becomme man created hym neyther absteyne laughyng shall vnderstande lyttell fiue thousande yeares passed sin creation worlde wyll aske power god long idell asleape fynally nothyng brought foorthe whych scoffe restrainynge sacrilege must holde peace godhead sonne holy ghost must passe ouer silence creation worlde yea truthe god bothe behalfe euery mighti r neede feare euell speakyng wicked cap v que ad augustine strongly maynteineth worke good perseuerance see false apostle coulde defamyng sclanderyng true doctrine paule make hym bee ashamed whereas say whole disputation perillous also godly myndes de bono perseuer cap maketh exhortatios shaketh faith troubleth hart self vaine augustine sticketh confesse cause wonte blamed freely preache predestination readinesse wherwithall largely confuteth many diuers absurdity thrust place rather reserue euery one wyped away place fitt onely desire generally obteyne thynges lorde hath layed vp secrete may searche thynges hath brought openly abroade may neglect least either one part condemned vayne curiositie parte vnthankfulnesse lib de gen ad lite also wel sayd augustine may safely folow scripture whiche motherly pace goeth stoupyngly least shoulde forsake weakenesse ware fearfull would haue predestination buried least shoulde trouble weake soules color beseche wyll couer theyr arrogance indirectlye accuse god foolishe vnaduisednesse though foresaw danger thei think themselues haue wisely mett soeuer therfore trauaileth bryng doctrine predestination mislikyng openly saith euyl god though somwhat vnaduisedly slipped hurtful chirche predestination wherby god adopteth hope life iudgeth eternall death man would accompted godly dare simply denie wrappe vp many cauillations specially make foreknowlege cause dede doo say bothe god say one wrongfullye made subiecte geue foreknowlege god meane thynges alway haue ben perpetually dooe remayne vnder eies knowlege nothyng come pa e thynges present present dothe imagine onely conceyued formes thynges presente v whereof mynde holdeth fast remembrance truely beholdeth seeth sett hym foreknowlege extendeth whole compasse worlde creature predestination call eternall decree god whereby hadde determyned hymselfe willed become euery man created like estate eternall life eternall damnation foreappointed therfore euery man created one ende say predestinate either lyfe death predestination god hath onely testified euery seuerall persone hath shewed example therof whole issue abraham wherby myght playnly appeare lyeth shall estate euery nation hyest diuided nation seuered child adamdeuter xxxiiviii parte people israell corde inheritance separation eye men persone abraham drye stocke one people peculiarly chosen beyng refused cause appereth sauyng moses cutte occasion gloryeng posteritie teacheth excell onely free loue god assigneth cause deliuerancedeu iiiixxxvii god loued father chose seede playnely chapiter pleased choose passed nation numberdeu viiviii loued admonition often repeted hym beholde lorde thy god belongeth heauendeu xxiiii earth whatsoeuer thyngs hath pleased hymselfe onely father hath loued hath chosen sede agayne place sanctificatio comaunded themdeu xxiii v chosen peculiar people agayne place loue affirmed ye cause protection whych also faithfull doo declare one voyce sayeng hath chosen v inheritauncepsa xlvii v glorie iacob whome hath loued impute free loue gyftes wherewith garnished god onely knewe themselues obteined deseruynges also euen holy patriarch endued suche vertue coulde purchase hymselfe posteritie greate prerogatiue honor stronglye treade downe pride vpbrayded haue deserued strongly treade downe pride vpbrayded yt haue deserued thing forasmuch stubborne hard necked peopledeu ixv oftentimes prophetes hatefully way reproche cast iewes teethe election fowly departed whatsoeuer nowe lett come fourth wil binde election god either ye worthinesse men merites work see one nation preferred al heare god led respect fauourably bent fewe vnnoble yea rowarde disobedient men wil quarel hym hys shewe suche example mercie shall neither pratling voice hinder worke throwing stone tauntes heaue shall hitt hurt righteounesse rather shall fall backe vpon owne heds moreouer israelite called backe thys principle free couenant either thankes geuen god hope raised vp time come made v selues saith prophet people shepe pasture negatiue superfluous added exclude v may knowe good thinges wherwith excell god onely author fetched cause therof himselfe nothing worthie greate honor also biddeth contented mere good pleasure god wordsps cvvi sede abraham seruantes child iacob elect hath rehearsed continuall benefites god frutes election length concludeth dealt liberally remembred hys couenant doctrine agreeth song whole chircheps xliiiiiiii thy right hande light thy countenance gaue lande father thou wast pleased noted tion made land visible signe secret seuering wherin adoption conteined thankefulnesse dauid place exhorteth peopleps xxxiii xii sayeng blessed nation whoes god lorde people whiche hath chosen inheritance himselfe samuell encourageth good hope sayeng lorde wyll forsake youi samu xxxxii hys owne great name sake pleased create people himselfe signe stable stedfaste election whiche one semed haue ben fallen awaye also sayed place haue chosen thee haue caste thee awayeesa xiiix setteth oute continuall course notable liberalitie hys fatherly good wyll yet playnly aungell sayeth zachariezach ii xii god shall yet choose ierusalem though hardly chasting reiected though exile interrupting election yet remaineth inuiolable although signes therof alway appeare added seconde degree narowly restrained seen special grace god kinred abraham god refused nourishing chirche shewed reteined among childre ismael beginning obteined egall degree brother isaac spirituall couenante ben lesse sealed hym signe circumcision cutt esay last innumerable multitude almost israell isaac sede called calling endured iacob lyke example god shewed reiecting saule whiche thing also gloriously sett fourth ye psalme hath putt backe tribe iosephpsalme lxxviiilxix tribe ephraim hath chosen hath chosen tribe iuda holy historie diuerse time repeteth wonderfull secret grace maye better appeare change ismaell esau suche graunt fell adoption owne faulte gyltynesse condition adioyned faythfully kepe couenant god whiche falsly brake yet singular benefit god vouchesaued preferre aboue getilespsa xlvii xx sayd psalme hath done nation hath opened hys iugementes haue without cause sayd twoo degree noted nowe choosing whole nation god shewed owne mere liberalitie bounde lawes free egall portion grace required hys hande vnequalitie wherof sheweth truely free gifte therefore malachie amplifieth vnthankfulnesse israell onely chosen mankinde also seuered holy house peculiar people doo vnfaythfully wickedly despise god beneficiall fathermal iii esau brother iacob sayth yet iacob loued esau hated god taketh confessed eyther borne holy father successor couenant finally braunch holy roote nowe childre iacob commonly bonde taken dignitie whe esau first begotten refused father nature inferior made ye heyre proueth doblely vnthankfull complayneth holden wyth doble bonde althoughe allredy sufficiently euidente god doth hys secrete counsell freely chose whome wyll reiecting yet hys free election hetherto halfe shewed tyll come particular persones whome god onely offereth saluation assigneth certaintie effect thereof suspense doutefull accompted onely sede whereof paule maketh mention althoughe adoption left hande abraham yet many posteritie cutt rotten member election maye effectuall truely stedfast must nedes ascende hed heauenly father hath bounde together electe one one hath knit hymselfe knott impossible loosed adoption kinred abraham shined liberall fauor god denied men yet member christe appeareth muche excellente strength grace graffed hed doe neuer fall awaye saluation therefore paule doth fittly reason place malachie euen nowe alleged god making couenant eternal life calleth people hymselfe parte speciall manner election doth choose effectually common grace whereas sayed haue loued iacob perteineth whole issue patriarch prophete setteth compariso posteritie esau yet withstandeth persone one man sete fourth v example election whiche slippe away muste come marke tendeth paule doth vainely note called remnantes experience teacheth greate multitude many slide vanishe away oftentimes remaineth small portion generall election people alway fyrme stedfast reason offring selfe redinesse whome god couenanteth doeth geue spirite regeneration power whereof maye continue couenante ende outwarde changing without inwarde effectualnesse grace might force holde certayne meane thyng betwene forsaking whole mankinde election small nomber godly whole people israell called inheritance god whome yet many stranger god nothing made couenant woulde bee father redemer rather hath respecte hys owne free fauor vnfaythfull falling away many also hys truthe abolished reserued remnante appeared hys calling without repentance whereas god tyme tyme choose vnto hymselfe chirche rather child abraham prophane nation regarde hys couenante beyng broken whole multitude restrayned fewe shoulde vtterly fall awaye fynally common adoption sede abraham certayne visible image greater benefite whiche god hath vouchesaued graunt fewe many thys reason paule diligently putteth difference betwene child abraham according fleshe hys spirituall child called example isaac vayne vnfrutefull thing simply chylde abraham whiche mighte sayd without dishonor couenante vnchangeable counsell god wherby hath predestinate would selfe effectual later sort vnto saluatio warne reders bring foreconceiued iugement either side til appeare place scripture broughte fourth thoughte therefore scripture clerely sheweth saye god eternall vnchangeable counsel hath one appointed tyme come would take saluatio syde would condemne destruction thys counsel touching elect say grouded vpon free mercie without respect worthinesse man appointeth damnatio hys iugement dede iust irreprehensible also incoprehensible entrie lyfe forclosed elect set vocation testimonie election iustification signe manifest shewing til come glorie wherin fulfilling vocatio election god maketh elect shutting reprobate eyther knowlege hys name sanctification spirite doth markes open iugemet abideth wil passe ouer many fayned inuentions foolish haue forged ouerthrowe predestination nede confutation sone brought fourth doe largely bewraye owne falsnesse wil tarry vpon either controuersie amog learned may bryng hardinesse simple vngodlinesse faire seming showe pretendeth scoffe righteousnesse god pthe xxii chapiter confirmation doctrine testimony scripture al thing haue set without controuersie among many specially free election faithfull yet weakened common sort thinke god foreseeth euery man deseruinges shalbe maketh difference betwene men therefore foreknoweth shalbe vnworthy hys grace adopteth place child whoes nature espyeth wil bent wickednesse vngodlinesse appointeth damnation death cloking veile foreknowlege darken election faine hath beginning ell opinion receiued commo sort opinion common sorte alone al age hath greate mainteiners whiche doe plainly confesse entent trust shall muche hurte cause name obiected v truthe god herein certaine may shaken clere maye darkened authoritie men neyther exercised scripture worthy voyce doo rayle thys doctrine wyth greater maliciousnesse frowarde pryde oughte suffered god choosing hys owne wyl leaueth picke quarel hym thing selfe knowe true shal preuaile brawling god teach nothing approued experience alway libertie god bestowe hys grace whome enquire wherby posteritie abraham excelled vouchesauing wherof foude cause ellswhere god let answere men rather ox ass whe hande god make dogges fashioned hys image wyll geue leaue brute beastes quarell wyth god estate thoughe difference vnrighteous truely righteous enioy prerogatiue whiche haue obteined deseruinges tha god diuersly deale abrode benefites according measure hys iugement skippe ouer persones inequalitie hateful least example christe oughte afrayed prate boldly hye mysterie conceiued sede dauid mortall man vertues wyll say deserued wombe made hed angel onely begotten sonne god image glorie father lyghte righteousnesse saluation worlde de corrept grat ad valent cap de bono perseue cap vt de ver apost sermo viii ephe iiiii thys thing augustine wisely noted hed chirche moste clere mirror free election lest troble v member ryghteously liuing made sonne god great honor freely geuen hym myght afterwarde make partaker hys gyftes man aske farr distante hym corrupte purenesse suche man shall bewraye onely hys madnesse therewithall also hys shamelessnesse goe forward labor take god free power choose refuse let also take away whiche geuen christe nowe worth trauayle consider scripture pronounceth euery one paule verily teacheth chosen christe taketh away respecte owne worthinesse al one sayd whole sede adam ye heauely father founde nothing worthy election turned hys eye vnto hys christ thoose member hys body whome would take felowship lyfe lett thys reson force among faythfull therefore adopted christe heauenly inheritance selues able receiue greate excellence whiche also toucheth place whe exhorteth colossian geuing thankescol lxii thys god made fytt partaker estate holy electio goe thys grace god made fitt obteyne glorie life come shall god hymselfe nowe fynde v wherby maye moued elect vsephe iiiii meaning shal yet openly expressed sayeng hys hath chosen v sayeth ere fundacios world layed according good pleasure might holy vnspotted vnreprouable sight setteth good pleasure god al deseruinges whatsoeuer profe may strong worth labor note al ye partes place coupled together doe leaue doute nameth elect dout speaketh faithful also afterwarde affirmeth wherefore doe fowle glose abuse name whiche wrest age gospel first published sayth elect beginning world taketh away respect worthinesse reason difference betwene whiche yet afterwarde adam egall elect christ foloweth yt euery man seuered without hymselfe also one forasmuch see al member christ added elect might holy plainly cofuteth error deriueth election foreknowlege forasmuch paule cryeth sayth whatsoeuer vertue appeareth men effecte electio hyer cause sought paul answereth god hath predestinate yea according good pleasure wordes ouerthroweth whatsoeuer meanes electio men imagine themselues also teacheth whatsoeuer thinges god geueth towarde spirituall lyfe flowe thys one fountaine god hath chosen would ere wer borne seuerally layed vp grace vouchesaued geue whersoeuer pleasure god reigneth work come considered doth dede pursue comparison co traries vnderstanded himselfe declarethii timo iix hath called v sayth wt holy calling according workes according hys purpose grace geuen v christ tymes world haue alredy shewed al dout take away foloweth might holy vnspotted thou say foresawe holy therefore chose v thou shalt peruert order paule thus therefore thou mayest safely gather chose v might holy chose v foresawe would two thinges contrarie one godly haue election holy come meane woorkes neyther cauillation thing worth commonly flee lord doth render grace election workes going yet graunteth workes come whe sayd faythfull chosen might holy therewithall signified holinesse come toke beginning election shall thys sayeng agree together thinges deriued election gaue cause election thing sayd semeth afterwarde confirme strongly sayth according purpose wil whiche purposed himselfeeph iv say god purposed hymselfe much effect ben said without himselfe considered nothing wherof regarde decreing therfore addeth ye whole summe election tendeth ende shoulde prayse grace god truely grace god deserueth praysed alone electio vnlesse election free free shal god electing doe consider shalbe workes euery one therfore fynde ye whiche christ sayd hys disciple hath place vniuersally among al faythful ye haue chosen meiohn xvxvi haue chosen onely excludeth deseruinges past also signifieth nothing themselues chosen preuented wt hys mercie lyke thys sayeng paul also vnderstode first gaue himrom xixxxv shal receiue recompense meaneth shewe goodnesse god preuenteth men fyndeth nothing neither past come wherby may wonne fauourable ye romaine fetcheth thys questio foloweth largelyro ixvi denyeth yt al israelite issued israel although ryght inheritance blessed yet succession egally passe al beginning thys disputation proceded pryde deceitful glorieng iewishe people whe claimed themselues name chirch would haue credit gospell hang vpo wil papistes thys day would gladly wyth thys fained color thrust themselues ye place god paul although graunt ofspryng abraham holy reson couenaut yet affirmeth yt parte stranger onely warue kynde lawful child become bastardes speciall election god standeth aboue reigneth hyest top alone maketh ye adoption therof sure owne godlinesse stablished hope saluation owne fallyng away alone disherited paul verely fondly vnconueniently lift vp reders euen secrete election wil god cause wherof neither appeareth sought without hymselfe maketh one sorte differing al child israel true israelite vainly fayned euery man estate hath beginning hymselfe foloweth mater vnder example iacob e au bothe sonnes abraham bothe together enclosed one mother wombe monsterlyke change honor firste birth remoued iacob whiche change paul affirmeth testified election one reprobation originall cause enquired whiche teacher foreknowlege wyll haue sett vertues vice men thys easy shorte way wyth god shewed persone iacob chooseth worthy hys grace persone esau refuseth foreseeth vnworthy thus saye boldly sayeth paule yet borne done good euell according election purpose god mighte abydero ixx workes hym calleth sayed elder shall serue yonger written iacob haue loued esau haue hated foreknowlege force difference brother verily mention vnfittly made tyme let v graunt yt iacob chosen worthinesse gotte workes come purpose paul say yet borne vnaduisedly added yet done good shalbe redy answer nothig hidden god godlinesse iacob presente hym workes win grace shold worthily haue price iacob borne ben growen full age apostle goeth forwarde vndoing knot teacheth yt adoption iacob made workes calling god work enterlaceth time come time past directly setteth ye calling god meaning stablishig one expresly ouerthrow sayd considered hath pleased god men haue brought themselues last al certayne wordes election purpose al cause whatsoeuer men wont faine ellswhere secret counsel god quite remoued thys mater color wil bring darke thing electio assigne place workes either past come vtterly mocke yt ye apostle affirmeth yt difference brethre hangeth vpon consideration work vpon ye mere calling god put betwene whe wer yet borne neither ben ignorant sutteltie soundnesse wel knewe yt god foresee goodnesse man yt hath first determined benefit election geue fleeth yt vnorderly order set good workes cause theselues thus haue ye word ye apostle saluation faythful founded vpon wil electio god fauor gotten workes cometh free calling haue also image thing sett v esau iacob brethre issuing bothe one paretes enclosed yet bothe one wombe yet brought world al thinges egal yet ye iugement god diuerse taketh one forsaketh nothing first birth right wherof one excelled also passed ouer thyng geuen yonger denied elder yea also god semeth alway set purpose haue despised first birth cutt fleshe al mater gloryeng refusing ismaell cast hys mynde isaac plucking backe manasse honored ephraim interrupt sayeng must inferior smal benefites determine summe ye lyfe come hath ben aduaunced ye honor first birth therefore reckned adopted inheritance heauen spare paul himselfe though alleging testimony wrested scripture strange sense answere haue done herebefore apostle nether slipped vnaduisednesse wilfully abused testimony scripture sawe whiche abide consider god minded earthly signe declare spiritual election iacob otherwise hidden inaccessible throne vnlesse refer ye first birth graunted vnto worlde come shoulde vaine fonde forme blessyng wherby obteined nothyng manyfolde misery discommoties grefefull banishement many bitternesse sorow care therefore paule sawe without douting god outwarde blessyng testified blessing whiche kyngdome prepared spirituall neuer decayeng seruant douted profe spirituall blessyng fetche argument outward blessyng also must remembre land canaan adioyned pledge heauenly dwellyng ought al douted yt iacob graffed angel body christ might partaker lyfe iacob therefore chosen esau reiectedrom ixxv predestination god made different hym differed deseruyngs aske cause apostle rendreth sayde moses wyll haue mercie vpon haue mercie wil vouchsaue graunt mercie whome soeuer vouchsaue graunt mercie beseche meaneth uerily lord plainly pronouceth men haue themselues cause shold good fetcheth cause owne mercie onely therfore saluation worke god setteth thy saluation himselfe alone wilt thou descende thy self appointeth thee mercie alone wilte thou runne thyne owne deseruinges holdeth thy thoughte wholly merciefulnesse alone wilt thou turne part ye beholding thyne owne work therfore must nedes come lesser people paule place saith haue ben foreknowen godrom xiii suche sort men imagine foreknow idle watchtoure thinges worketh notact iixxiii suche sense ofte red truely peter sayth luke ye christ determined cou sel foreknowlege god appoynted death doth bryng god loker author saluationi pet iii peter also sayth faithfull whome wrote chosen accordyng foreknowlege god proprely expresseth secrete predestination wherby god hath marked child whome wold worde purpose whiche ioyneth diuers woorde expressyng one thing forasmuche dothe euery signifie stedfast determination commonly calle vndoutedlye teacheth god author saluation goeth oute hymselfe whiche sense sayth chapiter christe lambe foreknowen creation worlde fonde triflyng say god hye stande lokyng whense saluation come mankynde therefore paule foreknowen people muche small portion mingled multitude falsly pretendeth name godii tim xij place also paule beate downe bostyng beyng couered visor doo take vpon themselues thefe preeminence among godly world sayth god knoweth finally sayeng paule poynteth vnto v two sortes people one whole kynrede abraham seuerally chosen oute whiche beyng layde vp vnder eye god hidden sight men dout toke moses whych affirmeth god mercifull whome wyll althoughe spake electe people whoes estate outwarde seemyng egall shoulde haue sayde common adoption included hym speciall grace towarde holye treasure yt common couenaunt withstandeth small numbre maye exempte degree wyllyng make hymselfe free disposer ruler thyng precisely denyeth merciefull one rather reason pleaseth hym mercie commeth hym seeketh though deede suffer denyall yet either preuenteth partely getteth hymselfe fauor wherof god claymeth hymselfe prayse let soueraigne iudge maister pronounce whole mater saw great hardnesse hearer dyd maner waste wordes without fruite among multitude remedie offence crieth whatsoeuer father geueth shall come wyll father whatsoeuer father hath geuen meiohn vixxxvii shall lose thyng note begynnyng taken father gyfte may deliuered faithfull kepyng defence christe man peraduenture turne circle aboute wyll take exception sayeng onely accompted propre possession father whoes yeldyng hath ben voluntarie fayth christe standeth onely vpon poynte althoughe fallynges awaie greate multitude doo shake whole worlde yet counsell god shallbe stedfast stande faster heauens themselues election may neuer fayle sayde haue ben elect father beefore gaue onely begotten sonne aske whether nature yea rather whyche straungers made owne drawyng hym greatee clearenesse woordes christe shiftyng couered darknesseiohn vi l iii man sayth come vnlesse father drawe hym hathe hearde learned father commeth generally without difference bow knee christ election common nowe fewnesse beleuers appeareth manifest diuersitie therfore christe affirmed disciple whiche geuen peculiar possession god father within little addedioh xvii praie worlde thou hast geuen thyne whereby proued whole worlde belongeth creator sauyng grace delyuereth fewe wrath god eternall deathe whiche otherwyse shoulde haue perished worlde selfe lefte owne destruction whiche appoynted meane time although christe putt hymselfe meane betweene yet claymeth himselfe power choosyng common fatherioh xiii viii iohn xvxix speake sayth knowe whome haue chosen man aske whense hath chosen answereth place oute worlde whiche excludeth prayer commendeth disciple father holden affirmeth knoweth whome hath chosen signified speciall sort generall kynde men speciall sort made differ qualitie owne vertues heauenly decree wherupon foloweth many excell force diligence christ maketh hymselfe author election place reckeneth iudas among elect wheras deuell referred onely office apostleshyp whyche althoughe bee cleere myrror fauor god paul oftentymes acknowlegeth owne persone yet conteyneth selfe hope eternal saluation iudas therfore vnfaithfully beare office apostle myght worse deuell whome christ hath one graffed bodye suffre none perishe preseruyng saluation wil performe whiche hath promysed stretche foorth power god whiche greater whereas sayth place father whome thou haste geuen haue loste none sonne perditioniohn xxxviii although abusiue speche figure yet hath doutefull meanyng summe god maketh chyldren free adoption whome haue chyldren inwarde cause therof hymselfe content owne secrete good pleasure ambrose origene hierome thoughte god distributeth grace among men retract lib cap epist ad si forseeth euery man vse well yea augustine one opinion better profited knowlege scripture reuoked euidently false also strongly confuted yea reuokyng reprouyng pelagians continued error sayeth meruayl apostle knew moste suttle sense hadde sette thyng wondred brother yet borne afterwarde obiected question agaynste hymselfe sayeng vniustice god fytte place hym answere god foresawe merites bothe yet sayeth fleeth iudgements mercie god homil ioh place taken awaye merites election sayth confuted vayne reasonyng whyche defende foreknowlege god agaynste grace god therefore saye chosen makyng worlde god foreknewe wee woulde bee goodiob xvxvi hymselfe woulde make v good sayeth whyche saythe ye haue chosen haue chosen hadde therefore chosen v forknewe woulde good shoulde therwithall also haue forknowen woulde choose hym foorthe foloweth effecte let testimonie augustine bee force among wyllyngly reste authoritie father howe augustine suffreth hymselfe seuered reste cleere testimony sheweth disagreemente false maylyce whereof pelagians burdened hym de praed sanct ca xix chapiter booke predestination sainctes allegeth ambrose christe calleth whome hathe mercie agayne willed vndeuoute myghte haue made devoute god calleth whome vouchesaueth whome wylle maketh religious lysted knytte together whole volume augustine coulde readily shewe reader neede woordes wyll loade tediousnesse goe lett v imagine speake lett v geue hede mater selfe harde question moued whether god dydde ryghteously vouchesaued graunte grace whyche question paule myght haue vncombred hymselfe one woorde alleged respecte woorkes therefore dothe rather continueth discourse whyche abydeth hardenesse oughte holye ghoste whyche spake mouthe disease forgetfullnesse therefore withoute circumstance answereth god therefore fauoreth electe therefore hath mercie oracle god wyll haue mercie vppon whome wyll haue mercieex xxxiii xv wyll shewe mercie whome shewe mercie muche effect sayd god moued mercie reason wyll haue mercie therefore sayeng augustine remaineth true grace god doth find men fitt chosen maketh neyther thyng passe vpo sutteltie thomas foreknowyng deseruyngs dede cause predestination behalfe act hym doth predestinate deu tract quest behalfe maye certayne maner called accordyng particular weyeng predestination sayd god predestinateth glorie man deseruynges hath decreed geue hym grace may deserue glorie sythe lorde election haue v loke vnto nothyng mere goodnesse man shall couete see shalbe wrongfull gredinesse lusted striue sutteltie want wherwith beat backe silly suttletie thomas affirmeth electe glorie certayne maner predestinate grace whithe may deserue glorie answer contrary syde say predestination vnto grace serueth election vnto lyfe waityng maide grace predestinate whome possession glorie hath ben long agoe apoynted pleaseth lord bryng child election iustification therupon shall folowe predestination glorie rather cause predestination grace contrariwise away striuynges thynges superfluous suche shall thynke wysedome enough worde god ambro de vocat gent li cap olde tyme truely written ecclesiasticall writer whiche assigne election god merites wyse ought bee som obiect yt god shold cotrari hiself shold vniuersally cal al hi receue elect opinio yt vniuersalues promise taketh awaye difference speciall grace thus certayne sobre men speake muche oppresse truthe debarre exabhed question brydle curiositie many wyll prayse woorthye theyr counsell allowed dallyeng shiftes neuer excusable theyr obiectyng whiche doo raylyngly inuep agaynst verily fonde cauillation shamefull error howe scripture maketh two agree together outward preachyng al men called repentance faithe yet al men geuen spirite repentance faith haue place already declared somewhat muste bee repeted agayne nowe whyche require denye sythe two wayes false thretneth whyle rayneth vppon one citieamos iiii vii viiixi acc xxivi shall droughte vppon pronounceth shal place famine doctrine byndeth hymselfe certayne lawe call men egally whiche forbyddyng paule speake asia turnyng hym bythinia draweth hym macedonia sheweth owne power distribute treasure whomesoeuer shall please hym yet playnely sheweth esaieesa viiixvi peculiarly directeth electe promyses saluation sayeth onely mankynde indifferently shall disciple whereby certayne doctrine saluation wrongfully sette open common men profite effectually whyche sayde seuerally layde vp onely chyldren chirche lette suffice presente althoughe voyce gospell speake generally yet gifte faithe rareesa liiii esaie assigneth cause arme lorde open men sayde gospell maliciously frowardlye despised many doo stubbornly refuse heare peraduenture color touchyng vniuersall callyng preuayle neither purpose prophet dymynyshe faulte men teacheth fountayne blyndnesse god vouchsaueth open arme onely geueth warnyng fayth singular gift eares beaten vayne outwarde doctrine woulde fayne know doctor whether onely preachyng fayth make chyldren god certainly sayde fyrste chapiter iohniohn xii whosoeuer beleue begotten sonne god themselues also made child god place cofused heape iumbled vp together speciall order geuen faithfull whiche borne blood wil fleshe man god say mutuall consent faith word namely whersoeuer faith newe thyng seede fall among thornes stonie place greater part appeareth dede obstinate god also al men haue eies eares shall agree god calleth knoweth come dever apost se let augustine answere wilt thou dispute meruaile crie depthe lett v bothe agree feare least perishe error moreouer election paule witnesseth mother faith turne back argumet vpon owne headehhes iiii faith therfore general election speciall orderly hangyng together cause effectes easily gathered paul saith full al spirituall blessing god chosen v creation worlde therefore richesse common god hath chosen onely whome wouldetit ii reason place commendeth faith electe least thought man doeth hys motion get faith glorie may remaine god freely enlightned hym whome chosen bernarde saith rightly frendes seuerally heare also saith ad tho prepos beuer epist feare thou small flocke geuen know mysterie kyngdom heauen euen hath foreknowen predestinate fashioned like image sonne great secrete counsel made knowen lord knew knowen god made many est men neither doth vouchsafe make partaker great mysterie selfe men whome hath forknowen predestinate little concludeth mercie god eternitie euen eternitie vpon feare hym eternitie reason predestination eternitie reason blessed makyng one without beginnyng without endyng nede cite bernarde witnesse heare master owne moutheiohn vixlvi none doo see whiche god wordes signifieth begotten agayn god dasell brightnesse countenance election faith dede fittly ioyned kepe second degree order wordes christ doo clerely expresse place wil father lose hath geuen whosoeuer beleueth sonne shall perishe would haue saued would appoint ouer sonne keper would graffe body holy bond faith certain faith singular pledge fatherly loue la ed vp childre hath adopted therfore christ place faith ye shepe folow shepherd know voiceioh xiiii folow strager know voice stranger whense cometh difference eares boared god maketh himselfe shepe made one ye heauely grace cause also lord teacheth yt safetie shall alway certaine free danger kepte inuincible power god wherfore concludeth vnbeleuers shepe namely nuber god hath promised esaie shalbe disciple nowe testimony haue alleged expressed perseuerance therwithal testifie vnmouable stedfastnesse electio let v speake reprobate apostle ioineth together iacobrom ixxiii hauing yet good work deserued nothing taken grace esau beyng yet defiled wicked dooyng hated turne eies workes wrong apostle though sawe thyng whiche clerely see proued sawe forasmuch expresly enforceth pointe yet done good euell one chosen refused proue fundation predestination god workes agayne moued obiection whether god vnrighteous allegeth ben moste certaine plaine defence righteousnesse namely god reduced esau according euellnesse cotent solution reprobate stirred vp ende glorie god may sett foorth last adioyneth concluding sentence god hath mercie vpon hardeneth see howe imputeth bothe onely god therfore declare reason vouchsaueth graunt mercie pleseth neither also shal haue cause reiectyng owne sayd god hardeneth sheweth mercie wil men therby warned seke cause ell pthe xxiii chapiter confutation sclaunders wherwith doctrine hath alwaye wrongfully burdened witt man heareth thynges frowardness therof restrained bloody blast trumpet soundyng battaile diuersly excessiuely turmoyleth many deede thoughe would driue away malice god doo graunte election denye man reprobate ignorantly childishely forasmuche election selfe coulde stande vnlesse set contrary reprobation god said seuer whome adopteth vnto saluation foolishly said doo either chaunce owne endeuor obteyne whiche onely election geueth therefore god passeth ouer reiecteth none cause exclude inheritance dothe predestinate child neither waiwardnesse men tolerable suffre selfe bridled word god incomprehensible counsell god entreated whiche angel themselues worship haue already heard hardening lesse hand god mercie neither dothe paule men doo haue spoke busily labor excuse god lyeng defencerom ixxx teacheth lawfull thing formed quarell formed nowe admitt reiected god wil vncombre themselues sayeng christe euery tree father hath plantedmat xvxiii shalbe plucked vp roote plainly heare adiudged auowed destruction heauenly father hath vouchsaued plant holy tree ground denie signe reprobatio nothing clere ye may proued cesse wragle let sobrietie faith contented admonition paule cause quarel godrom xxi willyng one syde shewe wrath make power knowen doo dumme sufferance lenitie beare wyth vessel wrathe prepared destruction side make knowe richesse glorie toward vessel mercye hath prepared glorie let reders marke paule cutte occasion whisperinges backbitinges geueth chiefe rule wrath power god bicause vniust depe iudgementes swallow vp sens made subiect determination aduersaries aunswer triflyng god doth vtterly reiect whome suffreth lenitie abideth mynde hanging suspence towarde peraduenture may repente thoughe paule geueth god patience loke turning whome sayeth made destruction augustine sayth rightly expoundeth place lib v co tra iul cap power ioyned sufferace god doth suffer gouerne power say also nothing said vessel wrath prepared destruction god hathe prepared vessel mercie bicause meane ascribeth chalengeth prayse saluation god blame destruction casteth vpon owne doo bring vpon themselues although graunt paul diuerse maner speaking didde soften rowghnesse first part sentence yet mete assigne preparing vnto destruction thing secret counsel god also affirmed little rest texte god stirred vp pharao hardneth whome wherupo foloweth hidden cousel god ye cause hardning ye lest get augustine saith lib de predest sanct ca yt whe god wolues maketh shepe doth mightier grace reforme hardnes may tamed therefore god cause doth couert ye obstinate bicause doth shew forth mightier grace wateth wold shew forth sayenges dede shoulde sufficient godly sobre remembre themselues men forasmuche venemous dogges cast vp one sort venime god mater shal serue answer euery one particularly foolishe men doo diuers way quarell god though hym subiect accusation first therfore aske right lorde angry creature whome hath first prouoked offence condemne destruction agreeth rather wilfulnesse tyrant lawful sentece iudge therfore say yt cause shold charge god bare without owne deseruyng predestinate eternal death thought time com mynd godly breake violent assaultes shalbe sufficiently armed although consider howe greate wickednesse euen muche enquire cause wil godthys ke augustine lib de gen ont n ani ca sith thinges yt ye cause worthily ought haue cause somwhat must go wherto must boud vnlawful one imagine ye god ye highest rule righteousnesse yt whatsoeuer willeth eue yt willeth ought take righteous therfore asked lord answered bicause willed thou goe asking willed thou askest greater hier thing god canot foud let therefore rashnesse man restrayne self seke least paraduenture may finde whiche bridle say shalbe wel withholden whosoeuer wil dispute secretes god reuerence boldenesse ye wicked drede openly speake euel god lord owne righteousnesse without defense shal sufficietly defend shal take al shiftyng fro cosciences hold fast conuinced condemne neither yet thrust fained deuise absolute power prophane worthily ought abhorted v faine god lawlesse law bicause plato sayth men stand neede lawes whoe troubled vnlawful lustes ye wil god pure al fault also hiest rule perfectio yea law lawes denie subiect yelde accompt denie also mete iudges wold pronouce cause owne sense wherfore attept lawfully maypsa li let threatenyng psalme bryng v feare god shal ouercome oft iudged mortall man god kepyng silence put enemy silence may suffer freely scorne holy name deliuereth v word weapon agaynst wherefore man assayle v wordes god hath beginning predestinate death whe thei could yet deserue iudgemet death steede answer may againe side aske thinke god oweth wil iudge bi owne nature sort al corrupted sinne hatefull god tirannous crueltie vpright reason iustice lord h predestinate death estate nature subiect ye iudgemet death vniustice theselues beseche may complaine let al sonnes ada come let striue dispute creator eternall prouidece generation condemned euerlastyng miserie shall able one mutter agaynst defense god side shal call reknowlegyng themselues take corrupt masse maruell subiect damnation let therefore accuse god vniustice eternall iudgement apointed death thei themselues ele whether willingly led owne nature whereby appereth wrogfull desire murmuryng bicause set purpose hide cause damnatio copelled acknowlege theselues ye layeng blame vpon god may acquite though hundred time confesse true god author yet wipe away giltinesse whiche beyng engrauen co science time oft recourse presenteth self eye agayne except saye predestinate ordinance god corruption whiche alledged cause danation whe therfore thei perish corruptio thei nothing suffer punishmet miserie predestinatio adam sel drew posteritie hedlog therefore uniust whiche doth cruelly mocke creature graunt deede yt al child ada fel wil god miserie state wherin boud yt sayd ye beginning length must alway returne determination wil god cause wherof hidde foloweth god subiect sclauder wil paul answer manerro ixxx man art thou cotendest god doth thing formed say formed hast thou formed hath potter power make lupe one vessel honor dishonor say righteousnesse god truely defended seke shift thei wont haue want iust e euse el semeth sayd tha god hath power hindered doyng thing whatsoeuer himselfe far otherwise stronger reason brought whe comaunded think one god comit vniustice iudge world properly perteine nature god iudgemet naturally loueth righteousnesse abhorreth vnrighteousnesse wherefore apostle though ouertake loke hole hide shewed reason righteousnesse god hier either measured measure man may comprehended sclender capacitie wit man apostle deede confesseth depth iudgemetes god
