wherwith mindes men shold swalowed ther endeuored pearce teacheth also haynous wrog binde workes god law sone vnderstad reason may bold disalow knowen sayeng salonio yet fem rightly vnderstand great creator al redreth reward foolepro xxvix reward transgressor crieth concerning greatnesse god whose punish fooles transgressor although vouchesaue let haue spirit mostruous madnesse men couet make whiche vnmeasurable subiect ye smal measure reasoni tim vxx angel stoode still vprightnesse paul calleth elect stedfastnesse grouded vpon good pleasure god falling away proueth forsaken thing cause alleged reprobatio hidden secret counsell god goe let present manichee celestine sclau derer prouidence god say paule ought reason rendred therof bicause greatnesse far surmounteth vnderstanding maruel absurditie wold haue power god limited yt may able work minde able conceyue saye augustine created lorde whome without dou yng foreknew goe destruction done bicause willed willed p rt ask reason comprehend either mete nd god come downe cotrouersie amog v whiche mention made vnder name named ye hiest rule righteousnesse therefore question moued vnrighteousnesse righteousnesse clerely appereth neither let v ashamed exaple paule stoppe mouthes wicked ro time time oft thei shalbe bold barke repete whoe ye miserable men yt lay accusation god charge therfore lay charge bicause doth teper greatnesse workes dulnesse though thei therfore wrogful bicause hidden fro flesh vnmeasurablenesse ye iudgementes god cleare experience knowen vnto ye know called depe bottomlesse depthps xxxv nowe aske narrow capacity wit whether coprehend whiche god hath decreed good doth therfore mad searchyng plunge selues bottolesse depth reason self teacheth shalbe destruction ye least restrained feare whiche historie iob bookes prophetes report comprehensible wisedome terrible power god thy minde vnquieted let greue thee embrace counsell augustine august de uerb apost punc serm thou beyng man lokest answer hand also therfore let v heare sayth art thou better faithfull ignorance rash knowledge seke merites thou shalt finde nothing peine depth peter denieth ye e beleueth depth sekest thou reason wil treble depth reason thou wonder dispute thou beleue see depth reache bottome paule rested bicause found wondering calleth iudgementes god vnsearchable art thou come search sayth wayes impossible traced ou doest thou trace procedyng shall nothyng profit neyther shall satisfie waye wanton curiousnesse neyther doth lord neede defense whiche hath vsed spirit whiche spake mouth paule forget speake well cesse speake god obiection also ariseth vngodlinesse yet deth directly accusing god excusing sinner howebeit sinner condened god iustified without dishonor iudge thus therefore prophane tonges bark agaynst god sayeng shold god impute thing sinne men wherof hath predestinatio layed necessitie vpo men thei thei wrastle decree thei vaine sithe ca al therfore rightfully punished thing whereof yt e cause god predestinatio absteine fro yt defense wherunto ye ecclesiastical writer comonly flee namely ye fore knowlege god withstadeth ye may accopted sinner bicause god foreseeth euels man owne cauillatio wold stay rather presse v wt sayeng yt god might would haue prouided remedie euels foresaw sithe hath done hath determined purpose created men end behaue earth prouidence god man created condition yt al thinges doeth blamed auoyde enterprised ye wil god therfore let v see knot ought well loosed first ought holde certaine among al men whiche salomo sayth god hath created thinges himselfprou xvi ii wicked euel day behold dispising al thing ye god whe power remaineth rule safetie death ordereth cousel beck among men borne adiudged eue mother wobe death wt destructio may glorifie name man answer yt necessitie layed vpon prouidence god rather yt created suche estate bicause foresaw peruersnesse come neither sayth nothing al altogether old writer wont deede somtimes vse solutio doubtingly scholemen rest vpon though nothing could obiected agaynst deede wil willingly graunt yt foreknowlege alone bryngeth necessitie creature although al men agree wil haue also cause thing semeth ualla otherwise much practised holy writing saw depely wisely shewed cotention superfluous bicause bothe life death rather doynges god foreknowlege god foresee success also dispose order wil questio shold wtout cause moued whether foreseyng thing auailed necessitie sith doth none otherwise fortee ye thing yt shal come passe bicause hath decreed yt shold come passe vaine moue cotrouersie foreknowlege certaine al thing happe rather ordinace comademet thei say writte expresse wordes decreed god adam shold perish falling away though god scripture reporteth whatsoeuer wil created noblest creature vncertaine end thei say freewill might shape owne fortune god decreed nothing hadle according deseruing cold deuise receyued shalbe almightinesse god whereby gouerneth al thinges according secret cousel hangeth vpon none thing self predestination whether wil sheweth adam posteritie came passe naturally men lose saluation fault one parent hindereth cofesse one man agaynst willes cofesse makinde lose labour dallyeng shiftes scripture crieth persone one man made bonde eternall death sithe imputed nature playne proceded wonderous cousell god much absurditie good patrones righteousnesse god doe stumble strawe leape ouer great beames againe aske came passe fall adam wrappe vp eternall death many nation child beyng infantes without remedie bicause pleased god tonges whiche otherwise pratlyng must necessitie dume terrible decree graunt yet man shalbe able denie god foreknew end haue ere created therefore foreknew bycause ordeyned decree man inuey agaynste foreknowledge god rashly vndiscretely stubleth matter beseche heauenly iudge accused ignorant come therfore eyther iuste colorable complaynt toucheth predestination neyther ought serue absurditie whiche say god foresaw onely fall first man ruine posteritie also disposed owne belongeth wisedome foreknow thinges shalbe belongeth power rule gouerne thinges hand question augustine well discusseth doth sayeng holsomly confesse rightly beleue euchir ad laur god lord thinges created thinges good foreknew euell thinges spring good knewe perteyned almighty goodnesse euen euell thinges well suffer euell ordered life angel men might firste shewe free could benefit grace iudgement iustice could runne distinction permission haue graunted wycked doe perish god permittyng willyng saye permitteth bycause willeth howebeit likely man onely permission god without ordinace brought destruction though god apointed condition would haue chiefe creature therefore wil dout cofesse simply augustine de gen ad leter lib cap ye god necessitie thing willeth must necessitie come passe thing shal truely come passe hath foreseen excuse themselues vngodly eyther pelagians manichee anabaptistes epicurean ower se te haue question shall obiect v necessitie wherewith bound predestination god bryng nothing fit purpose predestination nothing el dispensation righteousnesse god hidden deede yet without faulte asmuch certayne vnworthy predestinate estate also certayne ye destruction moste righteous whiche entre predestination moreouer destruction hangeth vpon predestination god bothe cause matter thereof founde themselues first man fell bicause lord iudged expediet iudged vnknowen v yet certaine iudged reason bicause saw therby glorie name worthily set forth thou hearest mentio ye glorie god thinke righteousnesse must righteous deserueth prayse man therefore falleth prouidence god ordeyning falleth owne fault lord litle pronounced thinges whiche made good whense therfore cometh peruersnesse man ixxxi fall away god least thought creation lord comendation allowed came therfore owne euelnesse corrupted nature whiche receiued pure lord fall drewe whole posteritie destruction wherefore let v rather beholde euident cause damnation corrupted nature mankinde whiche nerer v searche hidden vtterly incoprehesible cause thereof predestination god neyther let greue v far submit wit vnmeasurable wisdome god may yeld many secretes thing neyther grau ted lawfull know ignorance well learned couetyng knowlege kinde madnesse pa happes wil say haue yet brought enough subdue wicked excuse verily confesse neuer brought passe vngodlinesse alway grudge murmure yet think haue spoken much might suffice take away reason also color gainesayeng reprobate wold thought excusable sinning bicause escape necessitie sinnyng specially sithe necessitie cast vpon ordinace god denie therby wel excused bicause ordinace god whiche coplaine thei destinate destruction hath righteousnesse vnknowe deede v yet certaine wherupo coclude yt eare euel layed vpon righteous iugemet god teache ouerthwartly seke beginning danatio bend eye secret closet counsel god wink corruptio nature fro whense danation springeth withstandeth ye thei ca impute god witnesseth owne creation although man create ye eternal prouidece god calamitie wherunto subiect yet ye mater therof toke god asmuch meane loste bicause wente kinde pure creation god corrupt vnpure peruersness aduersaries god predestination sclander also wt third absurditie whe impute nothing el ye choise wil god thei made free fro vniuersal destructio maketh heires kingdome therby thei gather yt accepting persones whiche ye scripture euery denieth therefore either scripture disagreeth self electio god respect deseruinges first ye scripture sense denieth yt god accepter persones tha iudge name persone signifieth man thing beyng seen eye man wont procure either auor grace dignitie hatred cotempt shame richesse wealth power nobilitie office contree excellencie beautie side pouertie neede basenesse vilenesse contept otheract xxxxiiii ro ii gal vixxviii iiv col iiixxv eph vi peter paule teache lord accepter persones bicause putteth differece betwene iewe grecian refuse one embrace ye respecte nation iames vseth wordes whe mindeth affirme god iudgement nothing regardeth richesse paule place speaketh thus god iudgyng hath consideration freedome bondage wherefore shal cotrarietie shal say yt god accordyng good pleasure without deseruyng choseth sonnes wil reiecting refusing matter may thus opened men maye fully satisfied aske howe cometh passe two betwene whome deseruing putteth difference god electing passeth ouer one taketh ye side aske whether thei thinke taken thing yt may make minde god encline toward thei confesse thei needes must yt nothing shal folow yt god loketh vpo fro owne goodnesse fetcheth cause good aug b ny lib cap wheras therfore god chooseth one refusing cometh respect man mercie alone whiche ought haue libertie shew forth vtter self whe pleaseth haue place also shewed beginning many called noble1 co xxvi wise honorable god might humble pride flesh far fauor boud persones wherfore many falsly wickedly accuse god partial vnrighteousnesse yt doth predestination kepe one self course toward al men say thei finde gilty let egally punish yf finde vngilty let witholde rigor iudgement deale eyther mercie forbidden would haue mercie compelled altogether geue ouer iudgement require gilty al may together suffer one peyne graunt giltinesse comon say mercie god helpeth let help say answer rightfull also punishing shew rightfull iudge suffer el eyther goe spoyle god power haue mercie al leaste graunt vpon condition vtterly geue ouer iudgmet epist g wherfore sayengs augustine wel agree together sithe first man whole masse mankinde fell condemnation vessel made honor ye vessel righteousnesse ye mercie god wheras made dishonor imputed vnrightfulnesse iudgement c de bono perse useth god redreth due peyne whome calleth geueth vndeserued grace thei deliuered al accusation manner creditor whose power forgeue one aske ye therfore ye lord also may geue grace wil bycause mercifull geue bicause iust iudge may geuing yt deserue shew free grace geuing declare deserue wheras paule wryteth god enclosed vnder sinnerom ixxxi might haue mercie vpon therewithall added dettor man bicause first gaue may require like also often say ouerthrowe predestination standeth carefulnesse endeuor well doyng falleth awaye whoe say shall heare eyther life death certainely apointed eternall decree god come minde maketh matter behaue sithe predestination god worke nothing hindered furthered shal al men dissolutely throw forth theselues desperate manner runne hedlong whether lust shall carrie verily say altogether falsly many swine whiche filthy blasphemy defile doctrine predestination pretense also mocke admonishmentes rebukynges sayeng god knoweth hath one determined v haue decreed saluation wil bring v time apointed haue predestinate death shold trauaile vaine contrarie scripture teacheth much greater reuerence religiousnesse ought think great misterie doth instruct godly far sense well cofute men outrage doth speake predestinatio ende encouraged boldnesse vnlawful rashnesse attept searche vnattained secretes god rather beyng humbled aba ed learne treble iudgement reuerently loke vp mercie mark faithfull wil leuell theselues filthy groyning swine well confuted paul say goe carelesly forward vice bicause nuber elect vice shal nothing hinder shal length brought life paul telleth ende ph iiii leade holy faultlesse life marke electio directed vnto holinesse life ought awake sturre v vp cherefully practise holinesse serue clokyng slouthfulnesse howe greatly thinges differ one cesse fro well doyng bicause election sufficeth saluatio apointed end election applie selues endeuor good doynges away therfore sacrilege wrongfully misturne whole order electio stretch blaspemies say whiche reprobrate god shal lose labor goe make himselfe allowable innocencie honestie life therein taken shamelesse lie whense could endeuor come election whosoeuer nuber reprobate vessel made dishonor cesse continuall wicked doynges prouoke wrath god agaynst themselues euident token confirme iudgement god whiche already pronounced vpon far striuyng vaine maliciously shamefully sclaunder doctrine though ouerthrow al exhortatios godly liuing matter olde time augustine burdened greate malice wiped away boke correption grace written ualentine redyng whereof appease al godly trac able men yet wil touch fewe thinges trust shall satisfie honest contentious haue already seen open lowde preacher free election paule therefore colde admonishyng exhortyng let good zelous men copare earnestnesse shal found se comparison incredible heate truely principle taketh away doutes called vncleannesse euery man possesse vessell honori thes vii eph ii c agayne handy worke god created good workes whiche hath prepared walke summarily euen meanely exercised paule shal without long declaration easily perceiue fitly maketh thinges agree thei fayne disagree christ commaundeth men beleue yet definitiue sentence neyther false contrarie comaundement saythiohn v lx man come whome geuen father let preachyng therefore haue course whiche maye bring men fayth continuall profityng holde faste perseuerance neither yet let knowlege predestination hindered obey may proude owne maye glorie lordmat ix christ nothyng sayth whoe hath eares hearyng let heare therfore exhorte preach haue eares willingly obey lack eares fulfilled whiche writtenesa viix hearyng heare sayth augustine shold haue lib de perso cap haue whoe hath knowen minde lord must therfore denied open bicause compreheded whiche hidden sayenges haue faithfully reported augustine bicause paraduenture wordes shall haue authoritie mine goe let v bring forth wordes red heard many turned dulnesse sluggishnesse beyng enclined fro labour lust goe desire ought therefore accompted false whiche spoken foreknowlege god god haue foreknowen shalbe good shal good great euelnesse soeuer nowe liue haue foreknowen wil euell shal euel great goodnesse soeuer seen shal therfore thing truely spoke foreknowlege god cause either denied left vnspoken namely spoken men goe error cap rule sayth kepe truthe vnspoken one thing necessitie speake truth cause leauyng truth vnspoken long search al whiche yet one made worse whiche vnderstande meane make learned vnderstand whoe speake thing deede made learned yet made worse true thing case speake made worse conceiue speake made worse conceyue thinke done truth rather spoken maye conceiue conceyue kepe vnspoken neither maye conceiue also vnderstandeth may worse wheras heare conceiue also many shold learne wil say scripture witnesseth lawfully might haue spoke feare least speake offended conceiue feare least holde peace conceyue truthe deceiued falshed whiche sentence last shortly knittyng vp cap plainely also confirmeth wherefore apostle followed doctor church namely godlyly preache eternall election god holde faythfull awe vnder discipline godly life doe aduersaries beyng confuted inuincible violence truthe thinke saye well sayeng whiche spoken predestination preached people although true yea must wise preached hath eares heare may heare hath eares haue receiued fro promiseth geue truely let receiueth refuse yet receiueth take drinke drink liue godlinesse preached yt god may rightly worshipped also predestination whiche hath eares heare grace god may glorie god yet holy man singular desire edifie tempereth manner teaching truthe offense wisely auoyded far lawfully maye sheweth thinges truely sayd maye also conueniently sayd man thus preache people ye beleue cause ye already predestinate god destruction suche man doth cherish slouthfulnesse also maineteyne wickednesse man also stretch sayeng time come saye whiche heare shall beleue bicause reprobate shalbe rather cursyng teachyng therfore augustine vnworthily biddeth departe church foolish teacher vnlucky ill prophecieng prophetes place truely affirmeth beholden man profiteth rebukyng hath mercie helpeth whiche maketh profit whome euen without rebukyng thus otherwise god forbidde saye power iudgyng belongeth rather claye potter agayne afterward men rebuking either come returne way righteousnes worketh saluatio heartes whosoeuer planted watereth geueth encrease wil saue freewill man resisteth therefore doubted willes men resist god heauen earth hath done soeuer would hath also done thinges come may wil asmuch euen willes men doth wil agayne whe wil leade doth binde wt corporal bondes inwardly worketh inwardly holdeth heart inwardly moueth heart draweth willes hath made addeth ought wise omitted bicause know whoe belongeth belongeth number predestinate ought affectioned would al men saued shal come passe whome soeuer finde shall trauaile make partaker peace peace shal rest vpon child peace therfore part must applie holsome sharp rebukyng men like medicine perish destroye shalbe worke god make profitable whome hath foreknowen predestinate xxiiii chapter p election stablished callyng god reprobrate bryng vpon themselues iust destruction wherunto apoynted matter maye plainely appere must entreate bothe callyng elect blinding hardening wicked first haue already spoken somwhat confuted errour whiche thing generalnesse promise extendeth egally mankinde election otherwise god hath hidden himselfe doth without choyse length disclose callyng man maye therefore call testifieng itrom v xxix whome hath foreknowen hath also fore apointed fashioned like image sonne whome hath fore apointed hath also called whome hath called hath also iustified time come maye glorifie lord hath electing already adopted number child yet see entre possession great benefit called side beyng called nowe enioye certaine communicatyng election whiche reason paule calleth spirit whiche receiuero v xv eph ix bothe spirit adoption seale earnest inheritance come namely bicause doeth testimonie thereof stablish seale heartes assurednesse adoptio come though ye preachyng gospell spryng fountayne election yet bycause also comon reprobate therfore could selfe sure profe thereof god effectually teacheth elect may bryng fayth haue alleged wordes christih xixlvi xv v ioha xliiii lib de grat chris tra pelag caelest ca whoe god none seeth father againe haue shewed thy name men whome thou haste geuen wheras sayth place man come vnlesse father drawe whiche place augustine wisely weyeth whose wordes truthe sayth euery one hath learned comet whosoeuer cometh certainely neyther hath learned doth therefore folow come also cometh vnlesse haue bothe willed done euery one hath learned father come also cometh whe present bothe profit comming affection willyng eled light refuse loke vpon electio yet meane time denie ende maye certayne saluation must beginne word affiance ought therewith contented maye call vpon god name father quite contrarie righte order maye certified counsell god nere vnto v mouth heart couet flie aboue cloudesdeut x xxiiii therefore rashnesse restrained sobrietie faith maye suffice v god outward worde witnesse hidden grace conduit pipe whiche floweth water largely v drinke doe hinder springhed maye haue due honor therefore wrongfully whiche hang strength election vpon faith gospel faith fele electio perteyneth v shall kepe beste order sekyng certaintie election sticke fast later signes whiche sure witnessinges satan tetation either greuously dangerously astonish faithful disquieting doubt election doth also moue peruerse desire seke way cal loking way wretched man enterpriseth breake hidden secretes wisedome god pearce euen hi st eternitie vnderstand determined iudgemet seate god throweth himselfe hedlong swallowed vp depth vnmeasurable deuouryng pit wrappeth himselfe innumerable snare ca winde ouerwhelmeth himselfe bottolesse depth blinde darknesse rightfull foolishnesse wit punished horrible ruine attempteth owne force rise vp height wisedome god much deadly tentation none comonly bet rarely man foud whose minde somtime striken thought whens hast thou saluation election god election reuelation hast thou whiche thought haue one taken place man eyther perpetually vexeth miserable man terrible tormentes vtterly dismayeth truely would haue surer argument experiece proue howe wrongfully men imagine predestination minde infected error pe ilent tha plucketh downe thrusteth conscience peace quietnesse toward god therefore feare shipwreck muste diligently beware rocke whiche neuer stryken vpon without destruction though disputyng predestination bee estemed like dangerous sea yet passyng found safe quiet yea pleasant saylyng vnlesse man doe wilfully couet danger drowne themselues deadly bottomlesse depth whiche certified election doe enquire secret counsell god without worde whyche doe rightly orderly searche suche sorte conteyned worde receyue thereof singular frute comfort let therefore way searche beginne calling god ende howebeit withstandeth faithfull may thinke benefites whiche dayly receiue hande godesa xx doe descend secret adoption saye esaye thou haste done maruels thy thoughtes olde true faithfull asmuch adoption token lordes cofirme much lawful knowe cousel least man think weake testimonie let v consider much bothe clearenesse certaintie bringeth v whiche thing bernard speaketh fitly spoken reprobate sayth purpose god standeth sentence peace standeth vpon feare bothe coueryng euels rewarding good thynges maruellous manner good thinges also euell doe worke together vnto good whoe shall accuse elect god sufficeth righteousnesse haue alone mercifull whome alone haue sinned hath decreed impute yf neuer ben litle place true reste whiche vnworthily maye geue name bedchamber whiche god seene troubled wrath withholden care wil proued good well pleasyng perfect sight doth make afrayde calmeth doth stirre vp vnquiet curiousnesse appeaseth doth wery sens quietet quiet truely taken god beyng appeased appeaseth thynges beholde quiet quiet first seke fatherly kindenesse fauorable minde god must turne eye christmatt iii xvii whome alone soule father resteth seke saluation lyfe immortalitie heauenly kingdome muste also flee asmuch alone bothe fountayne lyfe author saluation heir kingdome heauen nowe whereto serueth election beyng adopted heauenly father degree chyldren maye fauour obteyne saluation immortalitie howe euer sekyng thou tosse shake yet thou shalt finde vttermoste marke extendeth therefore whome god hath taken child sayd hath chosen themselueseph iii christ bycause could loue geue honour inheritance kingdome vnlesse firste ben made partaker chosen shall finde selues certaintie election yet god father yf imagine naked without sonne christ therefore mirrour whome bothe muste without deceite maye behold election sithe whose bodie father hath apoynted graffe whome eternitie hath willed maye take chyldren many reknowlegeth amonge member haue witnesse playne sure enough yt written boke life comunicate christ yt sure comunio gaue v preaching gospel testified geuen v father good thinges ouresrom viijxxxi ih iiixv ih vxxviiii iohn vixxxv sayd put growe together maye liue bicause liueth oft doctrine repeted father spared begotten sonne whosoeuer beleueth maye perish beleueth sayd haue passed death life sense calleth bred life eateth shal die euer say hath witnesse v shalbe receyued heauenly father place child whome hath ben receiued fayth couet accompted among child heires god maye climbe aboue christ vttermoste marke much mad sekyng without whiche haue already obteined maye found alone moreouer sithe eternal wisedome vnchangeable truth faste settled counsell father eared least declareth v word varie thing neuer litle father whiche seke rather faithfully openeth vnto v beginnyng euer shalbe practise doctrine ought also vre prayer though faith electio doth encourage v cal vpo god yet make prayer vnorderly done thrust presence god couenant condition lord elected heare asmuch willeth v cotent promise el seke whether wil entreatable v wisedome shall deliuer v many snare skill applie right vse whiche hath ben rightly written let v vndiscretely draw hether thether ought haue ben restrayned also stablishyng affiance staye election whiche haue sayd ioyned callyng whome christ taketh beyng enlightened knowlege name bosome church sayd receiue faith protectioniohn vixxxvii x iv whome euer receiueth sayd committed father deliuered trust maye kept eternall life meane christ crieth lowde voyce many father willeth saued hath deliuered protection therefore list know whether god haue care safetie let v seke whether hath committed v christ whome hath made onely sauior nowe dout whether bee receyued christ fayth kepyng preuenteth doutyng voluntarily effreth shepeheard pronounceth shalbe number shepe heare voyceioh xiii let v therefore embrace christ beyng liberally set open v coming mete v shal number v flocke shall kepe v enclosed folde entreth v carefulnesse state comerom viii xx mat xxiixiiii cor xxii paul teacheth thei called chosen christ sheweth many called chosen yea also paule himselfe place dishorteth v carefulnesse let standeth sayth loke fall againe art thou grafted people god proude feare god able cut againe maye graffe finally wee sufficiently taught experience selfe calling faith smale value vnlesse adioyned continuance happeneth al christ hath deliuered v thys care verily promyses haue respect time comeihon vixxxvii xi father geueth mee shall come shall come mee cast oute doer againe sente father lose nothing al thing hath geuen may raise vp againe last dayio xxvii againe shepe heare voice thei folowe knowe geue eternall life thei shall perishe euer neither shall man take hande father gaue greater man take hande fathermatt xvxiii pronou ceth euery tree whiche father hathe planted shall plucked vp roote signifieth cotrary side thei neuer plucked saluation haue roote god wherewith agreeth saieng ihoni ihon iixix rom viiixxxviii thei ben v thei gone v herevpon also commeth noble glorieng paul life death present thinges thinges come glorieng must nedes grounded vpon gift continuance neyther doubt directeth saieng faithfull place paul saithphilip ixvi hath begonne good worke shal ende euen vntil day christ also dauid faith fainted leaned vpon stay thou shalt forsake worke thy handespsalm xxxviiiviii nowe neither doubtfull christ prayeth faithfull asketh thinge whiche asketh peterluc xxi xxxi faith maye neuer faint whereby gather thei danger falling awaie bycause sonne god askinge stedfaste continuance godlinesse suffered deniall woulde christe haue v learne hereby wee shoulde truste shall perpetually safe bicause one made dayly happeneth thei whiche semed christes agayne reuolt fal yea place affirmeth none perished geuen fatherihon xvixii yet excepteth sonne perditio true dede also certaine neuer clea e christ fiance heart wt whiche sate yt assurednesse election y stablished thei went v saith ihon thei v thei ben vsi ih xix thei still taried v neither deny thei haue like signes calling elect haue graunt thei haue sure stablishment election bidde faithfull fetche worde gospell wherfore let suche example moue v quietly reste vpon promise lord pronouncethih iiixvi vixxxix yt al thei geuen father receiue true faith sith keper pastor none shal perishe iudas shal speake hereafter paule doth counsell christian assurednesse altogether butte carelesse loose assurednesse fleshe whiche draweth wyth pride presumptio disdaine quencheth humilitie reuerence god bringeth forgetfulnes grace receiued speaketh ye gentile whome teacheth yt thei ought proudly vngently reproche yt iewes iewes beinge disherited thei set stede feare also requireth wherewt thei sholde dismaied stagger whych framing v ye humbler receiuing grace god shold abate nothing ye affiance therof haue said place beside yt doth speake euery particularly ye sectes theselues generally ye churche diuided two part enuie bred dissensio paul putteth ye getiles minde yt beig supplied ye place ye peculiar holy people ought bee cause feare modesty amog ther wer many puffed vp wt glory whose vaine bostig profitable beat downe haue place shewed yt hope extended ye time come euen beyonde death yt nothing contrarye nature doubte shall become v saieng christ many called chosen il take yt maner ther shalbe nothing doubtful hold faste yt ought clere ye thing aboue spoke yt ther ar two sort calling ther vniuersal calling wherby ye outward preaching ye word god calleth al together euen also setteth forth vnto yt sauour death vnto matter greuous codemnatio special calling whiche ye part vouche saueth geue ye faithful whe ye inward enlightning spirit maketh yt word preached setled heart yet somtime maketh also partaker enlightneth time afterward ye deseruig vnthankefulnes forsaketh striketh wt greater blindenes nowe ye lorde sawe ye gospel published far wide despised many due price fewe describeth v god vnder perso kingemat xxii preparinge solemne feaste sendeth messingers rounde bidde greate multitude gestes yet get fewe bicause euery one allegeth lettes excuse length compelled vpon refusal cal hie way euery one meteth hetherto euery man seeth parable must vnderstand outward callinge addeth afterward god doth like good maker feast goeth aboute table chere gestes finde clothed weddinge garment wil suffer vncleanlines dishonoure solemnitie feast part parable grant vnderstand enter church profession faithe clothed sanctification christ suche dishonor botch churche lorde wyll suffer euer fylthinesse deserueth wil caste therfore ar chosen great numbre yt called yet wt ye calling say yt faithfull ought iudge election general calling also common wicked special calling bringeth wt ye spirit regeneratio ye earnest seale ye inheritance come wherwt heart sealed vp agaist ye day ye lordeph ixiii sume sith hypocrite boast godlines wel ye true worshiper god christ pronouceth yt length thei shalbe cast place thei wrongfully possessepsa xvi said ye psalm lord shall dwell thy tabernacle innocent handes man pure heartpsa xxiiij againe place generation seke god seeke face god iacob dothe ye spirite exhorte faithful sufferance thei take greuously yt israelite mingled wt ye church length visor shalbe plucked thei shalbe cast shame reason exception euen alleged christ saith yt none perished ye sonne perditioniho xviixii dede vnpropre speache yet darke accompted among shepe christe yt one dede bicause kept ye place oneihon vilxx ihon xiii place ye lorde affirmeth yt hee chosen wt apostle yt spoke onli respect ye ministerie twelue saith haue chosen one deuel yt chosen ye office apostle speaketh choosing saluacion denieth far away fro numbre ye choosen saieng speake alihon xiii iii know whome haue choosen man bothe place confound ye word choosing shal miserably entangle himselfe make differece homil nothing plaine therfore gregory teacheth ill pestilently saith yt know calling vncertaine election wherby moueth al men feare trembling vsing also reaso bicause know day shalbe know ye place sufficiently declareth stumbled blocke bicause hanged election vpo ye merites work mater enough discourage ye mind men colde strengthen remoue theselves ye affiance ye goodnes god herof ye faithful haue som taste yt haue determined ye begining ye predestinatio rightly thought vpo bringeth shaking faith rather best strengthening yet denie yt holy ghoste frameth talke ye smale measure oure senseeze xiiiix whe saith ye secret people thei shal ye rowle seruants thei shal writen though god beginne write ye booke life reckeneth ye numbre wheras yet know euen ye witnesse christephil iiiiiii yt name child god beginning written ye boke life wordes expressed casting away semed chefe among electe saide psalmepsa lxixxxix let blotted boke life let written righteous electe neither immediatly wombe al one time calling gathered together flocke christe pleaseth god distribute grace ere thei gathered together chefe shepeherd thei scattered abroad ray common deserte differ nothinge sauing defended singular mercie god fallinge extreeme hedlong downefall deathe therefore loke vpon selues shall see offspring adam fauoreth comon corruption whole masse carried extreeme dispe red vngodlynesse cometh passe goodnesse naturally planted bicause eye god watcheth hand stretched saluation thei ye dreame fro natiuitie planted heartes wote sede election ye vertue whereof thei alwaie enclined godlynes ye feare god thei holpe proue ye authoritie scripture also confuted experience selfe thei dede bring forth fewe example proue yt elect euen enlightning vtterly stranger religio paul pharisee liued vnreprouablephil iiiv act xii cornelius almes praiers accepted god paul grant cornelius wee saye deceiued appeareth yt already enlightned regenerate wanted nothing clere reueling gospel wil thei wring fewe example al elect alway endued wt spirit godlinesse man shewing ye vprightnesse aristides socrates zenocrates scipio curius camill sholde therof gather al thei left blindnesse idolatrie wer desirous folowers holines honestie yea scripture place one openly crieth againste ye state paul describeth ye ephesias regeneracioeph iiii sheweth one grain sede ye saith deade wt defaultes sinnes ye walked according ye time worlde according ye prince yre worketh ye obstinate child among whome also somtime conuersant ye lustes flesh thinges yt liked oure fleshe minde nature child wrathep vviii eph iiiixxiii also remembre yt ye somtime wtout hope lacked god world againe ye somtime darkenesse ye light lord walke ye child light paraduenture thei wil haue thinges referred ye ignorance ye true god wherewt thei denie yt elect holden yt called albeit shamelesse cauilling sith therof concludeth thei ought nowe noe either lie steale yet thei answer placesi cor viix place corynthians pronounced neither whoremonger idolatrers adulterer weakelinges buggerers theues couetous men shalbe heires ye kingedome god addeth thei wer wrapped haynous offense thei knew christ thei bothe washed bloode made free spiritrom xix againe place romaine ye haue geuen membres bond vncleannesse iniquitie vnto iniquitie yeld bondage righteousnesse frute thinges whiche ye nowe worthily ashamed c manner seede election praie dyd budde whiche bring manifoldly defiled life wyth desperate wickednesse wallowed abhominable accursed sinne woulde haue spoken opinion shold haue shewed much thei bound bountifulnesse god thei ben preserued slyding great filthinesse peter also shoulde haue exhorted thankefulnesse ye perpetual sede electioni pet iiijiii hee contrary wise putteth mynde ye time past sufficed make ende lustes gentile ende lustes gentilesios iiiii kin xiixvii luk xxiixvi come example budde righteousnesse rahab harlot faith manasse hierusalem dipped manner drowned bloode prophetes thefe amonge laste gaspinges beganne thinke repentance away therfore argumentes whiche silly curious men rashely deuise themselues without scripture let abide certaine v scripture hathe haue straied like loste shepe euery one hathe swarued owne wayeesa liiivi perdition goulfe perdition whome lorde hath determined one plucke forthe differreth tyl hys fyt time onely preserueth fall vnto vnpardonable blaspheme lorde effectualnesse hys callinge towarde electe maketh perfecte saluation wherevnto hadde eternall counsell appoynted hathe hys iudgementes againste reprobate whereby executeth counsel whome therefore hath created vnto shame life destruction deathe thei shoulde instrumentes wrathe example se eritie fro yt may com end somtime taketh awaie ye power heare word somtime preachinge hee blyndeth amaseth fyrst maner wheras innumerable example lette v choose one cleare notable reste passed awaye fower thousande yeares afore christe whyche hee hydde gentile lyghte hys healthe bringing doctrine aunswer therefore made enioye greate benefit bycause iudged vnworthy whiche come shall proued woorthy whiche thynge byside experiencemala iiii malachie substantiall wytnesse wich reprouinge infidelitie mingled grosse blasphemy yet declareth shall come redeemer therefore hee rather geuen shal trouble hymselfe vaine yt shal search cause hyer secret vnsearchable counsell god neither bee feared least scholer porphirie shoulde freely gnaw righteousnesse god answer nothing defense say none perishe vndeseruing free bountyfulnesse god deliuered ther largely enoughe saide setting forth glorie needeth shyftinge soueraigne iudge therefore maketh awaie predestination hath one reiected beinge depriued communicatinge lyghte hee leaueth blindenesse manner bothe dayly example also many conteined scripture one selfe preachinge commonly made hundred twenty receiue ready obedience faith rest either set naught scorne hisse abhorre man aunswer diuersitie proceedeth theyr malice peruersnesse shall yet satisfie v bycause others witte also shoulde possessed malice vnlesse god dyd amende goodnesse therfore shal still encombred vnlesse call mynde whiche paule saithi cor iiii vii maketh thee differ wherby signifieth excell theyr owne vertue onely grace god therfore dothe graunting grace passe ouer luke sheweth causeact xiijxlviij bycause ordeined life shal think bicause thei vessel wrath vnto dishonor wherfore let greue v saye augustine god sayth might turne euell good de gen ad liter lib cap bicause almighty mighte dede therefore doth bicause wold wold ought wise ought much better shift chrysostome homil de co uers pauli say draweth willing reacheth hand difference may seme stand iudgemet god wil men truely standeth propre motion man euen godly feare god haue neede singular instruction yt spiritact xvixiiij lydia ye purple seller feared god yet behoued heart shold opened might harken doctrine paul profit spoke one woman alone shold know profiting euery man godlinesse secret worke spirit verily brought questio ye lord sendeth word many whose blindnesse haue enforced purpose doth hidde many comaudements carried pharao bicause hoped yt often repeted message wold appeased beganne foreknew foretolde ye end goe sayd moses declare wilgod xxi ezech ijiij xijii wil harden heart obey stirreth vp ezechiel warneth aforehand sendeth rebellious stubborne people end afrayde perceiue singe defmen foretelleth ieremieier ix yt doctrine shold become fier destroye wast people like stubleesa viix prophecie esaye yet enforceth thus sent lord goe saye child israell hearyng heare ye vnderstande seyng see ye know make obstinate heart people make heauy eares ouer playster eye least paraduenture maye see eye heare eares vnderstand heart beyng turned may healed behold directeth voice maye waxe deff lighteth light maye made blinde sheweth forth doctrine thei may made dul layeth remedieioh xijxxxix thei may healed iohn alleging prophecie affirmeth yt iewes could beleue doctrine christ bicause curse god lay vpo neither also co trouersie god haue enlightened deliuered doctrine wrapped vp darke speches thei may nothing profit thereby thrust greater dulnesse christ also testifiethmat xiiixi doth therefore expound apostle parable whiche spoken multitude bycause geuen know misteries kingdome god common people meaneth lorde wilt thou saye teachynge whome prouideth maye bee vnderstanded consider whense faulte thou wilt cesse aske worde great darknesse soeuer yet alwaie light enough conuince conscience wicked remaineth v see ye lord doth ye plaine yt doth answered yt done bicause men haue deserued vngodlinesse wickednesse vnthankfulnesse ye shall dede wel truely saide bicause appeareth yet ye reaso diuersitie bowed obedience continue hardenedrom xvii searching must nedes go yt paule hath noted moses namely god hath raised vp beginning yt might shew name ye whole earthe whereas therfore ye reprobate obey word god opened vnto shalbe wel imputed malice peruersenesse heart therwithal added yt thei therfore geuen peruersnesse bicause righteous yet vnsearchable iudgement god thei raised vp set forth glorie wt damnation likewise said ye sonnes helii sam iixxv yt thei harkened holsome warninges bicause ye lord willed kil denied yt stubbornesse proceded naughtinesse therwtal touched thei lefte stubbornesse ye lord might haue softened heartes namly bicause vnchangeable decree hadde one appointed destructionihon xiixxxviii purpose serueth yt saieng ihon done great signes man beleued ye word esaie might fulfilled lorde whoe hath beleued hearing though excuse ye stifnecked fro blame yet content wt reaso yt grace god vnsauorie men till holy ghost bring taste christ alleging ye prophecie esaieihon vixlv thei shall al taught god lendeth end proue yt iewes ar reprobate stragers fro ye church bicause ar vnapt learne bringeth cause therof yt promise god dothe perteine thei cor ixxiii thig saieng paul cofirmeth christ ye iewes offense ye gentile foolishnes ye called ye strength wisedome god hath tolde comonly happeneth ofte gospel preached namly maketh obstinate despised saith yt price called dede little named beleuers meant take away ye due degree fro ye grace god goeth faith rather added seconde saieng waie correction yt thei embraced ye gospel shold geue ye praise faith calling god also litle teacheth yt chosen god ye vngodly heare thinges thei crie oute god wt inordinate power abuseth poore creature sporte crueltie know al men many way enda gered iudgment seate god yt asked thousand thynges thei satisfie one doe confesse yt reprobate suffer nothing agreeth wt ye iust iudgment god whereas clerely atteine ye reaso therof let v discotet ignorat somwhat wher ye wisedo god lifteth vp self great heigth forasmuch ther ar place scripture wont obiected god semeth denie yt done ordinance wicked perish yt crieng agaist thei wilfulli ing death vpon themselues let v brefely declaring place shewe thei make nothing sentence aboue set ther brought forth place ezechiel god wil death sinner rather may touc ed liue paragraph thei wil extende mankinde doth moue many repentance whose mindes pliable obediece dayly allurement ware harder hardermat xjiixxiii sodomite christ witnesseth preaching ye gospel miracle wold haue brought forth frute iurie commeth passe therfore god wil al saued openeth gate repentance miserable wold haue ready receiue grace hereby see yt place violently wrested god whereof prophet maketh mention set eternall counsel whereby hathe seuered elect reprobate seke true natural meaning propet purpose bryng hope pardon penitent ye summe yt douted yt god readie forgeue sone sinner turneth therefore willeth death much willeth repentace experience teacheth wylleth repent whome generally calleth yt yet toucheth al heartes yet therfore said dealeth deceitfully bicause although yt outward voice make vnexcusable heare obey yet truly accopted testimonie ye grace god testimonie reconcileth therfore let v holde ye meaninge prophet yt death sinner pleaseth god yt godly may haue affiace yt soue thei shal touched wt repentance pardo ready wt god wicked may fele yt fault doubled answer great mercifull kindenesse gentlenesse god mercie god therfore wil alwaie mete repentance whome repentance geuen al prophetes apostle ezechiel himsefe plainely teach secondly ther alleged place paul wher saith yt god willeth al sauedi tim iiiiii although haue diuerse meaning ye yet somthing thei agre together answer first yt ye rest texte made plaine howe willeth paul coupleth together yt willeth saued come ye acknowledginge trueth haue bee determined ye eternal counsel goddeut iiiivii yt thei receaue ye doctrine saluacio meaneth sayenge moses nation noble god commeth neare hee dothe thee howe came passe god restrained many people lyghte gospell whiche order enioyed came passe pure knowledg godlynesse neuer came scarscely tasted muche darke prynciples hereof yt shall nowe easye gather whereto paule tendeth hadde commaunded timothee make solemne prayer churche kinges prynces seemed somewhat absurditie prayer shoulde bee made god kynde menne manner despeired bycause onely stranger fro body christe also endeuored al theyr force expresse kingdom added yt acceptable god willeth al saued wherbi verily signifieth nothig el hath stopped vp yt way vnto saluation degree rather hath powred mercie yt willeth man voide senteces declare god hath secret iudgement determined al men shewe pardon redy al sinner turne themselues require stifly stande vpon sayd haue mercie vpon contrarie side answer whiche written placeps cxvii god heauen doeth whatsoeuer wil word therfore must expounded yt may agree otherexo xxxiij xix wil haue mercie vpo wil haue mercie wil shew mercie wil shew mercie chooseth haue mercie doth geue sithe clearely appereth place spoken particular men degree men make longer disputing howbeit also noted paule doth affirme god doth alway euery men leaueth libertie length make kinges magistrate partaker heauely doctrine although reason blindenesse rage seme presse v strogly obiecting place peter god willeth none perish receyueth al repentance vndoyng knot doth offer selfe second worde bycause receyue vnderstaded euery taught truely turning hand godeze xxxvi xxvi whether wil turne let himselfe asked promiseth geue certayne fewe men fleshly heart leauyng stony heart true deede vnlesse ready receyue whiche call vpon merciezach iiii sayeng false turne wil turne saye none mortal men doth come god preuented god repentance manii tim ii xxv paule would say paraduenture geue repentance yea vnlesse god word exhorteth al repentance secret mouyng spirit bryng chosen itier xxxixviii ieremie would say turne lorde shalbe turned thou hast turned haue repented thou wilt say yf shalbe smal truthe promise gospel testifie wil god affirme yt willeth yt inuiolable decree howesoeuer promise saluation vniuersall yet nothyng disagree predestination reprobate direct myndes effect knowe till promise effectuall v receyue fayth side fayth made voyde promyse therewithall abolished nature let v see whether thynges disagree together sayde god hath eternitie ordeyned whome embrace loue vpon whome exercise wrath promiseth saluation al without difference truely say agree well promisyng meaneth nothing el yt mercie set open al couet craue thing none hath enlightned enlightueth hath predestinat saluacio thei saie haue ye truth ye promise sure vnshaken said yt disagreement betwene ye eternal election god testimonie grace offereth nameth al verily yt cosciences ye godly may ye sa ely rest thei vnderstand yt ther dyfference synuers preset ye wicked may cauil excuse yt thei sactuary whervnto thei may wtdrawe themselues ye bondage sinne wt owne vnthankfulnesse thei refuse yt offred therfore ye mercie god ye gospel offred sortes faith yt say ye enlightnig god maketh difference betwene ye godly vngodly ye one sort feleth ye effectualnesse ye gospel sort obteine frut therof enlightning self also hath ye eternal electio god ye rule thereof co plaint christmat xxiij xxxvii thei allege ierusale ierusalem howe oft haue willed gather together thy chicken ye woldest maketh nothing grant ye christ ther speaketh ye person also reprocheth yt al age thei haue refused grace must define ye wil god entreated neither vnknowen diligently god endeuored kepe stil yt people wt great stifenesse thei euen ye first ye last geuen theyr wadering desire refused gathered together foloweth therof ye counsel god made voide ye malice answer say nothing lesse greeth wt nature god haue doble wil grant thei fitly expoud thei consider many testimony god putting vpo affection man descedeth beneath owne maiestie saith hath wt stretched armes called rebellious peopleesa vii hath early late trauailed bring backe thei wil applie al thing god consider figure ther shal arise many superstuous cotentions one solution bringeth agrement yt propretie figuratiuely applied god howbeit solution whiche haue brought place largely sufficeth although god sense manifold yet doth himselfe dyuersly accordinge hys wisedomeeph iiix diuersly manifolde paul calleth amaseth oure sens till shall geuen v knowe marueylously willeth semeth thei also mocke cauillations sith god father al vnrighteous shold disherit hath wt fault deserued punishment though liberalitie god streacheth euen hogges dogges speake onli mankinde let aunswer god bounde one people father therof also people pricked smal numbre floure butte owne luste euel speakynge hindereth railers consider god bringeth forthe sunne shine vpon good euell inheritance laied vp fewe paragraph whome shall one day sayd come ye blessed father possesse kingdom c thei obiect also god hateth none thinges hath made although graunte yet remaineth safe whiche teache reprobate hatefull god rightfully bicause thei beinge destitute spirit bring forth nothing cause curse thei saue difference iewe gen ile therfore grace god wythout difference set menne namely thei grant paule determineth god calleth well iewes gentilesrom ixxxiiij accordynge hys good pleasure bounde man maner also wyped awaie whiche thei obiect placerom xixxii god hathe enclosed al thinges vnder sinne may haue mercie vpon namely bicause saluacion saued ascribed mercie although benefite common al many thinges alleaged partes let conclusion tremble paule great depth wanton tongue shall busiero ixix de praede gra cap ashamed thys crieng man arte thou striuest god augustine truely stirmeth thei peruersly measure righteousnesse god measure righteousnesse man xxv chapter laste resurrection although christ sonne righteousnesse hauing ouercome deathii ti ix ihon vxxiiii shining gospel geueth v lighte life paule witnesseth whereby also saide beleuing haue passed death life beinge nowe foreners stranger citizen saintes householde godeph iixix whiche hath made v sit onely begotten sonne heauenly place nothing may wanting perfect felicitie yet least shold greuous vnto v exercised vnder harde warfare though frute victorie christ hath gotten must holde fast place taught ye nature hope bicause wee hope thing appeare said place faithe demonstratio thing inuisible log enclosed ye pryson flesherom viii xxviii xxiii cor vvi colos iiiiii iixii wayfaring lorde whiche reason paul saith place deade life hidden christ god life shall appeare shall also appeare glorie therfore y oure condition liuing soberly iustly godlily world loke ye blessed hope ye coming ye glorie ye greate god sauiour iesus christ neede singular patience yt wee wearied either tourne backe course forsake stading therfore whatsoeuer hath hetherto set concerning saluacion requireth mindes lifted vp heaueni peter viii yt may loue christ haue seen beleuynge hym maye reioyse wyth vnspeakeable glorious ioyfulnesse tyll wee receyue ende oure saythe peter telleth vscolos iv manner paul saith yt faythe charitie godly hath respect ye hope laied vp heaue thus eies fastened vpon christ hang heauen nothing wt holdeth earthe carrieng v promised blessednessematt viixxi truely fulfilled heart treasure herevpon cometh faith rare world bicause nothing hard dulnesse inumerable steppe climbe vp aboue wt endeuoringe forward price heauenly calling great heape misery wherwt almoste ouerwhelmed added mockinges vngodly men wherewt simplicitie railed volutarily forsakinge allurementes present good thinges seeme folowe blessednes hidden fro v fleeing shadow finally aboue beneth v v behinde v violent tentations besege v susteining feare wherof courage shold far weake vnlesse beinge vncumbred earthly thinges thei fast bound ye heauenly life seming far fro v wherfore hath soundly profited ye gospel whiche enured continual meditation blessed resurrection ye soueraigne ende good thinges ye philosopher haue olde time curiousli disputed also striued among theselues yet none except plato acknowleged soueraigne good man conioyning wt god maner coioyning yt colde perceaue much wt smale taste maruel sith neuer learned ye holy bonde therof v perfect felicitie knowen euen earthly wayfaring daily enkindleth heartes wt desire till ye ful enioyning may satisfie v therefore said yt none receiue frute ye benifites christ thei yt lift vp theyr mindes ye resurrectiophil iijviii paul setteth vp marke ye faithful toward saith yt endeuoreth forgetteth al thing til co much ye cherfulli ought trauail toward least world wthold v suffer greuous punishmet slothfulnesse wherfore place marketh ye faithful wt mark yt conuersatio heaue fro whese also thei loke sauiour yt courage shoulde faint race ioyneth al creature companion wt bicause euery ar seen deformed ruines saith yt al thing heauen earth doe endeuour ye renewing sith adam fal dissolued perfect ordre nature creaturesro viiixix bondage peineful greuous whervnto subiect reaso sinne thei endued feling yt naturally couet ye perfect estate fro fallen therfore paul saith yt thei grone peine childe bearing geuen first frutes spirit may ashamed pyne awaie corruption least folow dead element beare peine others sinne ye pricke v forward calleth last coming christ redemption true dede al partes redemption already fulfilled bicause christ hath one ben offered sinnes shall seen againe without sinne vnto saluacionheb x misery soeuer pressed let redeptio susteine v eue vntill ye performace weight ye thing self shal whet endeuor neither doth paul wtout cause affirme yt ye whole gospel void deceitfuli cor xviiii vnlesse ye dead rise bicause state shold miserable tha state al men namly sith lieng open ye hatredes reproches many euery houre danger yea shepe appointed ye slaughter therfore ye authoritie therof shold fal away one part also ye whole sume whiche bothe adoptio effect saluacio coteineth let v hedefully bent earnest thing al yt cotinuance time may make v wery purpose haue differred place yt whiche breefely entreate yt reader may learne thei haue receiued christe ye author saluatio rise vp hier may knowe yt clothed wt heauenly immortalitie glorie yt whole body may made lyke fashioned ye heade also ye holy ghost oftentimes setteth forthe perso exaple ye resurrectio thing harde beleued ye body thei haue cosumed wt rottennesse shal appointed time rise vp againe therfore many ye philosopher haue affirmed soules imortal ye resurrectio ye flesh hath ben allowed wherin although ther excuse yet ar thereby put minde yt harde thing draw man sens beleue faith may ouercome great stoppe ye scriptur ministreth two helpes ye one ye likenes christ ye ye almightines god nowe oft ye resurrectio thought let ye image christ come mindes ye nature yt toke v ranne ye race mortal lifeij cor iiii x yt hauing obteined immortalitie v pledge ye resurrectio co ye misery wherwt ar beseged carie mortifieng flesh yt life may openli shewed v may seuer fro v neither possibly must torne sunderi cor xvxiii whervpo cometh yt argument paul deade rise againe neither christ risen bicause verily taketh yt principle cofessed ye christ made subiect death obteined victorie death rising againe priuately self yt begone ye heade must nedes fulfilled al ye membres accordinge ye degree ordre euery one right yt thei shold al pointes made egal wt said ye psalmps xvix thou shalt suffer thy meke one see corruptio although portio trust perteine v according measure gift yet ful effect hath appeared christ whiche free fro rotting hath receiued againe body wholephili ii xxi least felowship blessed resurrectio wt christ shold doutful v yt may contented wt pledge paul expresly affirmeth yt therfore sitteth heauen shal come ye last day iudge yt may make oure base vile body like fashioned glorious body place also teacheth yt god raysed vp sonne fro death ye entent shew token power stretche effectual force spirit toward v faithful whome therefore calleth life liueth v bycause geuen ende sholde make aliue yt mortall v knit vp brefe abridgement thing might largely handled ar worth gorgeously set yet trust yt godli reader shal word fide matter enough mai suffice edifie faith christ therfore risen yt might haue v copanions ye life come raised vp ye father much ye head ye church fro doth wise suffer plucked away raised vp ye power ye spirit common v vnto office quickening finally raised vp yt shold resurrection li e haue saide yt miroure seen v liuely image resurrection let v sure substance stay minde yt yet lotheful wery longe tarieng bycause part measure ye season time patiently rest til god owne fit time repaire kingdome purpose semeth ye exhortatio paul first frutes christ thei yt christes cor xv euery one ordre questio shold moued ye resurrection christ vpo ye resurrection v founded se many diuerse meanes hath made approued witnesse v fine nosed men laugh hystorie ye euangelistes rehearse childish mockerie importance shall ye message feareful silly wome bring afterward ye disciple cofirme beig maner astonished whi christ rather set vp ye triumphinge ensignes victore ye middest temple market place came forth terrible ye sight pilate doth also proue himselfe ye preestes whole hierusalem yt hee risen vp aliue againe ye witness chose prophane men wil scarscely grant sufficient answer yt although beginning ye weakenesse therof conteptible yet al gouerned ye wonderful prouidence god ye partly loue christe zele godlinesse par ly owne hardnesse belefe carry hast ye sepulchre lately ben dismayed feare ye thei might seing witness ye thing also sholde heare angel yt whiche saw eies shal suspect credit whoe thought fable whiche thei heard wome til brought present sight thyng self al ye people ruler largely couinced maruel wel ye sight christ signes grauted sepulchre sealed vp ye watchemen watched itmat xxvii vi xxviiixi ye third day body found soldiours corrupted wt monie scattered rumor ye disciple stole away though thei power gather band together armure practised men enterprise seate ye soldiars courage enough driue away pursue ye help people thei might haue take pilate therfore ring truely sealed resurrectio christ watchemen set sepulchre holding peace lieng made publisher ye resurrection meane time ye voice angel sounded risen hereluk xxiiij vj heauenly glisteryng plainely shewed yt men angel afterward remained douting christ himselfe toke away disciple saw ofter one also felt feete hades hardnesse beleuing litle profited strengthenyng faithe disputeth among misteries kingdome god ye laste sightes beholding himact iiij ascended heauen sight shewed ye xi apostle also seen one moe fiue hundred brethreni cor xvvi ihou xvi act ix ii act viilv sent holy ghost shewed sure proofe life also souereigne power said profitable yt goe otherwise holy ghost shall come nowe paule ouerthrowen waye strength deade man felt whome persecuted haue hie power stephan appeared ende namely assurednes life might ouercome feare death discredit many authentike witness onely parte distrustfulnesse also frawarde furious stubbournesse haue said yt prouing resurrectio sens must directed infinite power godphi iiixx paule brefely teacheth may make saith vile body like fashioned bodye hys brightnes accordig working power may subdue al thing wherfore nothing vnmete haue respect may naturally done wher inestimable myracle set v wt greatnes therof swalloweth vp sens yet paul setting forthe exaple nature reproueth theyr dulnes deny resurrectio thou foole saith yt thou sowest quickened vnlesse first die c saith yt sede sen forme resurrection bicause rottennes groweth corne neither harde thinge beleue heedeful ought miracle throughout al costes ye world doe offer themselues oure eies butte lette v remembre none truely perswaded resurrectio come rauished admiratioesa xxvi xix geueth power god glorie esaie lifted vp wt affiance crieth oute thy deade shall liue carcase shal rise awake ye praise ye dweller dust despeired case lifteth vp god author lyfe whose hande end deathps lxviii iob xixxxv said psal iob also liker carrion tha trusting vpo power god sticketh though whole sounde lifte vp himselfe daye saienge knowe redeemer liueth laste daye shall rise vpon duste namely shewe forthe power therein shall againe compassed skinne flesh shal see god shall see none albeit doe suttlely wreste place thoughe oughte bee vnderstande resurrection yet strengthen whiche couet ouerthrowe bycause holy menne theyr euels seeke comforte el lykenesse resurrection whyche better appeareth place ezechiel iewes beleued promise retourne obiected lykely waye shoulde bee made open deade menne come theyr grauee xxxl iviii vision shewed prophet fyelde ful drye bone lorde comaunded take againe flesh sinewes although vnder figure raiseth vp people hope returne yet mater hoping gathereth resurrectionihon vxxvii v examplar deliuerances faithful fele world christ taught voyce gospell geueth life bicause iewes receiued saide maruell bicause houre co meth whyche graues shall heare voyce sonne god shall come forthe therefore thys example paule tim iiii viij let v already cherefully triumph middest battels bycause whiche hathe promised life come mighty kepe yt lefte lette v glorie crowne righteousnesse laide vp v whiche iust iudge shall deliuer v shal com passe whatsoeuer greues suffer thei shalbe v shewing life come bicause agreeth nature god render affliction wicked whiche afflict v v vniustly afflicted rest appearing christ angel power flame fire holden whiche addeth afterwarde shall come may glorified saintes made wonderfull al haue beleued bicause gospel hath ben beleued althoughe mindes men ought haue ben continnually occupied studie yet though thei would set purpose destroy remembrance resurrection haue called death vt ermost bounde thinges destruction man verily salomon speaketh common receiued opinionec ixiiij hee saithe liuing dogge better deade lion place whoe knoweth whether soule man go vpwardec iijxxi soule beaste goe downewarde al age brutishe senslesse errore hath ben comon worlde yea hath broken ye church self formarc xiixvi luck xxxxvi ac iiviij sadduces haue presumed professe openly resurrection yea soules mortal grosse ignorance sholde helpe excuse man infideles euen instinct nature haue alwaye image resurrection theyr eies purpose serued holy inuiolable manner burieng earnest newe life neither may answered spring erroure bicause religiousnesse buriall alway vre amonge holy father god willed manner remaine amonge gentile image rusurrection set might awake drowsinesse althoughe ceremonie wanted vse profitinge yet profitable v wisely marke ende bicause sclender confutation vnbelefe yt al together professed yt man beleued satan hath astonished sens men thei haue buried body remembrance resurrection also hath practised corrupt parte doctrine diuerse fained inuentions length mighte vtterly die passe ouer howe paules time satan beganne pinche little folowed millenary whiche limited reigne christe thousande yeares erroure childishe nedeth worthy confutatioreue xxiiij neither doth reuelatio make side whiche certaine thei colored erroure forasmuche place mentioneth numbre thousande hee entreateth eternall blessednesse church diuers trobles come vpon churche yet trauailed earth whole scripture crieth shalbe end blessednesse elect punishment reprobate thinges whiche bothe hidden sight far passe capacitie minde eyther muste fetch credite certaine oracle god muste vtterly caste away whiche assigne chyldren god thousand yeres enioye inheritance life come marke great dishonor bothe christ kingdome yf shal clothed immortalitie neyther christ hymselfe whose glorie shalbe newly fashioned receiued immortall glorie blessednesse shal haue end kingdome christ vpon stedfastnesse whereof standeth endureth time finally eyther vnskilfull matter concernyng god go croked maliciousnesse ouerthrow whole grace god power christ fulfillyng wherof otherwise perfect sinne beyng blotted death swallowed vp eternall life fully restored blinde men may see fondly playe fooles feare thei ascribe god great crueltie reprobate condemned euerlasting peynes lord forsothe shall wrong denie kingdome whiche haue vnthankfulnesse made themselues vnworthy say thei sinnes endure time graut maiestie yea righteousnesse god whiche haue offended sinnyng eternall worthily therfore remembrance iniquitie dyeth peyne excedeth measure faulte blasphemie suffred maiestie god litle set despising therof estemed greater value destruction one soule let v leaue trifle least contrarie haue sayd may seme iudge dotage worthy confutation byside haue ben two doting error brought men peruersly curious one sort thought though whole man died soules shall rise agayne body asmuch graunt soules immortall spirites say shalbe clothed new body whereby denie resurrection flesh first sort bycause haue touched somwhat speakyng creation man shalbe enough warne reders againe beastly errour make spirit fashioned image god vanishyng blast whiche doth nothing quicke body frayle life bryng teple holy ghost nothyng finally spoyle part v wherein dimnesse chefely shineth markes immortalitie appere spoyle say gift estate body better excellent estate soule scripture teacheth far otherwise compareth body cotage whiche sayth remoue die bicause estemeth v part whiche maketh v differing brute beastesii pet xiiii cor v peter beyng death sayth time come muste saye awaye tent paul speaking faithful hath sayd earthly house shalbe dissolued bildyng v heauen adioyneth wayferyng lord long abide body desire presence god absence body soules ouerliue body hath god present seuered body apostle taketh away doutynghebr xiixxxi teacheth ioyned felowship spirites righteous whiche wordes sheweth ioyned felowship holy father whiche euen beyng dead doe kepe godlinesse v member christ vnlesse growe together unlesse also soules beyng vnclothed body kepe still substance able receyue blessed glorie christ wold haue sayd thefeluc xxiiixliii day thou shalt paradise hauing clere testimony let v dout example christ dyeng commend soules god example stephen commit christ kepeact vii ix pet iixxv vnworthily called faithfull shepeherd bishop leaue knowmatth vviii xxvi ioh xii xxii scripture hath sayd christ present receiueth paradise maye enioy comfort side soules ye reprobate suffer suche peines haue deserued goeth teacher maister shall nowe open v whiche god hath hidden place questio lesse fond vayne asmuch know dimension soule body whereas blessed gatheryng together holy spirites called bosome abraham enough v wayfaryng receyued common father faithfull may communicate v frute fayth meane time scripture euery biddeth v hang vpon expectation christes coming differreth crowne glorie till let v content bondes apointed v god namely soules godly hauyng ended labor warfare doe goe blessed reste happy ioyfulnesse loke enioyeng promised glorie thinges holden suspense till christ redemer appere reprobate dout haue estate iude assigneth deuelsiud ivi holden bound cheynes till drawen punishment whereunto condemned lesse monstruous error whiche imagine soules shall receyue againe body wherwith clothed shal haue new body reason manichee triflyng mete flesh vncleane shold rise againe though vncleanesse soules yet debarred hope euerlasting life therefore one shold say yt infected filth sinne cleansed god passe ouer dotage fleshe naturally vncleane bicause create deuel shew euer v vnworthy heauen hindereth resurrection first wheras paule biddeth faithfull cleanse themselues de ilyng fleshe spiritii cor v therupo foloweth iudgement place pronouncethii cor v euery man shal receiue body eyther good euel wherewith agreeth writeth corinthiasii cor iiii x thes vxxiii ye life iesus christ may openly shewed mortal flesh reason place doth lesse pray god preserue body whole vnto day christ soules spirites maruell bicause great absurditie body god hath dedicate temple himselfe fall away rottennesse without hope risyng againe say thisi cor vixv thei also member christ god commaundeth partes sanctified willeth name praysed tongesi tim iiviii pure handes lifted vp sacrifice offred madnesse therfore part whiche heauenly iudge hath vouchesaued graunt great honor brought mortal man dust without hope restoringi cor v xx likewise paule exhorteth v suffer lord well body soule bycause belong god verily suffreth whiche chalengeth god holy adiudged eternall rottennesse neyther plainer determinatio scripture thing tha risyng againe flesh bearei cor x iliii corruptible sayth paule must put vncorruption mortall must put immortalitie god make new body changyng qualitie ben sayd must renewed doutful speache paraduenture mought haue geuen occasion cauillatioro xiiii xi pointyng ingar body wherewith clothed promiseth vncorruption plainely enough denieth new body made yea could sayth tertullia speake plainly vnlesse holden owne skinne hand cauillation escape fro place sayth christ shalbe iudge world allegeth testimonie esayeesa xlixxviii liue sayth lord euery knee shal bowe much plainly pronounceth speaketh shalbe subiect yeld accompt life could agree newe body brought iudgement seate nowe wordes daniel doutfulnessedan xii many slepe earth dust shall awake eternall life reproches euerlastyng contempt sithe fetcheth new matter fower elementes make men calleth dead men graues plaine reason teacheth mortalitie whiche toke beginnyng fall man accidental repayring christ brought perteineth body began mortall truely wheras athenian laughed paule affirmed resurrection therupon may gather manner resurrection preached laughyng smally anayleth strengthen faith sayeng christ also worthy notedmatth xxviii feare kil body kil soule feare throwe soule body hell fire cause feare vnlesse body whiche beare subiect punishmet lesse plaine sayeng christiohn vxxviii houre cometh yt graues shal heare voice sonne god shall come forth haue done good resurrection life haue done euel resurrection iudgement shal say soules rest graues lieng may heare christ rather comaundement body shal returne liuelinesse lost moreouer shal haue new body gene v likefashioning head membres christ rose againeih iixix forgyng himselfe newe body sayd destroy teple three day wil bulde vp toke againe body borne mortall much profited v new body beyng put place olde body ben destroyed offred vp sacrifice satisfactorie cleansing must also holde fast felowship whiche apostle preacheth cor xvxii rise againe bicause christ hath risen againe nothyng lesse probable flesh whiche beare mortifieng christ depriued resurrection christ whiche verily appered notable example risyng agayne christmat xviiiii many body saintes came graues canne bee denied forshewyng rather earnest laste resurrection whiche hope candidati men clothed white among romanes suters newly elected office suche enoch elia whome tertullian calleth new possessor resurrection bycause beyng body soule deliuered corruption receyued kepyng god ashamed cleare matter spende many wordes reader shall contentedly beare trouble hole maye open frowarde bolde wittes deceyue simple flyeng spirites wyth whome nowe dispute bryng forth fained inuetion owne brayne resurrection shalbe creation new body reason moueth thinke bicause semeth incredible yt carion consumed long cottenesse shold returne aucient state therfore vnbele e mother opinion v side spirit god eche scripture exhorteth hope resurrection fleshcol iix reason baptisme paule witnesseth v seale resurrection come likewise holy supper allureth v trust thereof receyue mouth signes spiritual grace truely whole exhortation pauleii cor viii vii ro viijxi geue mebres weapon vnto obediece righteousnesse shold cold vnlesse ioyned whiche addeth afterward hath raised vp christ fro dead shall quicken also mortal body profit applie feete handes eye tonges vnto seruice god vnlesse partaker frute rewardi cor vixii xvxix thing paul plainly confirmeth owne wordes sayeng body fornication lord lord body hath raised vp christ shall also rayse vp v power plaine wordes folow body teples holy ghost mebers christ meane time see ioyneth resurrection chastitie holinesse litle sayth price redemption perteineth also bodiesgala vixvi resonable body paul hath borne prin e christ honorably glorified christ shold lose ye reward crownephil iijxxi whereupon also came glorieng loke redemer heaue shal make vile body like fashioned body brightnesse true must many affliction entre kingdome godact xiiiixxii reason suffreth debarre body entrie god exerciseth vnder standard crosse honoreth praise victorie therfore matter arose among saintes douting yt hoped copanios christ remoueth owne persone al affliction wherewith proued teache bring life yea vnder law exercised holy father faith outward ceremonie purpose serued vsage burieng haue already shewed know new life prepared body layed vp hereunto also tended spice signes immortalitie wherewith vnder law darknesse faith holpen eue sacrifice neither maner bredde superstitio asmuch see yt spirit doth lesse diligently reherse burialles chefe misteries faithmat xxvix christ commendeth worke special worke truely none reson bicause lifteth vp eye fro beholding graue corrupteth destroyeth sight renewyng moreouer diligent obseruing ceremonie whiche praysed father sufficiently proueth yt rare pretious help faithgen xxi iiii xix neither would abraha haue carefully prouided burieng place wife vnlesse ben set eye religion profit hier world namely yt garnishing dead body wife signes resurrection might cofirme owne faith faith household clerer profe thing appereth exaple iacobge xiviixxx testifie posteritie yt hope promised land euen death fallen minde comaunded bone caried thether besech clothed new body shold haue geuen fond comandement cocerning dust yt shold brought nothing wherfore authoritie scripture force v ca required doctrine either clere certaine profe euen child vnderstand wordes resurrectio raysing vp againe neither cal resurrection first created neither shold sayeng christ stad fastieva vix whatsoeuer father hath geuen shal perish wil rayse vp last day purpose serueth word sleping perteineth body wherupo also burieng place called coemeteria sleping place remaineth speake somwhat yt manner resurrection paragraph vse word bicause paul calling misterie exhorteth v sobrietie bridleth libertie dispute like philosopher freely suttelly first muste holde haue sayd shall rise againe fleshe whiche beare touchyng substance qualitie shalbe flesh christ whiche ben offred sacrifice raysed vp againe yet excelled quality yf ben altogether flesh thing paule declareth familiar example one substance fleshe man beast al one qualitie starres haue like matter like brightnesse teacheth though shal kepe stil substance body yet shalbe change state may muche excellent body therefore maye raysed vp agayne shal perish vanish awaye puttyng corruption shal put vncorruption asmuch god hath al elementes ready becke hardinesse shall hinder may commaund earth water fier reder semeth cosumed themesa xxvi also esay testifieth though without figure sayth beholde lord shal goe forth place maye visit iniquitie earth earth shall discouer bloud shal hide dead noted difference betwene haue ben dead long daye shall finde aliuei cor xv shall slepe paul sayth shall changed saye shall necessitie distance time betwene death beginnyng seconde life bycause moment time twyncling eye sound trompet shall pearce rayse vp dead vncorruptible sodeyne change fashion agayne liuing gloriei thes iiii v place comforteth faythful whiche muste die bycause whiche shall remayne aliue shal goe dead rather shall first rise agayne whiche haue slept christhebr ixxxvii obiect sayeng apostle apointed mortalll menne one dye easy answere sayeng state nature changed kinde death fittly called therefore thinges agree wel together shalbe renewed death shall put mortall bodie yet necessarie seueryng bodie soule shalbe sodeyne changyng ariseth harder question right resurrection whyche singular benefit christe common also wicked accursed god h xixxv knowe adam condemned death christ came resurrection lyfe came geue life mankinde vniuersally without choyse agaynst reason obstinate blindenesse obteyne godly worshipper god obteine onely faith yet remaineth certaine shalbe one resurrection iudgementmat xxvxx resurrectio life christ shall come seuer lambes goates answer ought seme strange likenesse whereof see dayly experience see adam depryued inheritance whole worlde lesse iuste reason debarred common foode eatyng tree lyfe whense commeth passe god doth onely make sunne ryse vpon good euellmatth vxlv also touchyng v present lyfe inestimable liberalitie continually floweth forth large plentuousnesse hereby verily knowe thinges whiche properly belong christ member doe also ouerflowe wicked rightfull possession maye made inexcusable wicked oftentimes finde god beneficiall meane proues yea suche somtime darken blessinges godly yet turne greater damnation man obiect resurrection fitly compared fadynge earthly benefites also answere sone estranged god fountayne life deserued death deuell whereby vtterly destroyed yet maruelous counsell god founde meane state lyfe mighte liue death absurditie ought seme yf resurrection happen wicked whiche draweth agaynst willes iudgement seate christ whome nowe refuse heare mayster teacher small peyne consumed awaye death yf suffer punishment obstinacie broughte iudge whose vengeance haue without ende measure prouoked agaynst themselues although muste holde whiche haue sayd whiche notable confession paule felix conteynethact xx xv loketh resurrection righteous wicked yet scripture oftentimes setteth forth election together heauenly glorie child god bicause christ proprely came destruction saluation worlde therefore crede made mention blessed life much prophecie death swallowed vp victorie shall till fulfilledose xiiixiiii cor xvliiii let v alwaye haue mynde eternall felicitie ende resurrection excellencie whereof yf thinges spoken whiche tonges men able speake yet scarcely smallest parcell thereof bee expressed howe euer truely heare kyngdome god shalbe stuffed full bryghtnesse ioye felicitie glorie yet thynges spoken moste farre remoued sense remayne wrapped darke speaches vntill daye come himselfe shall geue v glorie seene face facei ih iiiii know sayth iohn chyldren god hath yet appered shalbe lyke shal see wherfore ye prophet bicause thei could wordes expresse spiritual blessednesse self manner grosly portray vnder bodily thinges much feruentnesse desire must wt tast ye swetenesse kindled v let v chefely cotinue thought yt god certaine fountaine drawen drie coteyne fulnesse al good thing nothing beyod coueted yt
