tend toward soueraigne good ful perfection felicitie taught many placesge xvii abraham thy reward excedyng great sayeng accordeth dauidps xvivi psa xviixv ii pet iiiii lord portio lot hath wel fallen againe place shalbe satisfied thy countenance peter pronounceth faithfull called end may made partaker nature god bicause shalbe glorified saintes shalbe made wonderfull haue beleued lord enterparten glorie power righteousnesse elect yea geue enioyed better certayne manner growe one let v remeber vnder benefit conteyned kinde felicitie haue much profited meditation let v reknowledge yet staye beneth bottome rootes conceiuyng minde compared highnesse misterie wherfore behalfe muste kepe sobrietie least howe muche greater boldinesse shal flie vp hye beyng vnmindefull owne smal measure muche brightnesse heauenly glorie ouerwhelme v fele also vnmeasurable gredinesse knowe lawfull tickleth v whense bothe triflynge hurtfull question spryng time time triflyng call whiche profit gathered seconde kinde worse bycause whiche geue themselues doe entangle themselues pernicious speculation therefore call hurtfull whiche scripture teache ought dout v namely god diuersly distributyng giftes saintes world doth vnequally enlighten measure glorie shal equal heaue god shall crowne giftes neyther doth belong indifferently whiche paule saythi thes iixix mat xixxxviii ye glorie crowne daye christ also sayeng christ apostle ye shall sit iudgyng twelue tribe israell paule whiche knowe god enricheth holy one spirituall giftes earth beautifieth glorie heauen douteth peculiar crowne layed vp accordynge rate labor christ set forth apostle dignitie office dyd beare telleth frute thereof layed vp heauen daniel also saythda xiiiii wise shal shine brightnesse firmament whiche iustifie many sterres worldes ende euer yf man heedefully consider scripture doe promise eternall lyfe faythfull also speciall rewarde euery one whereupon commeth sayeng pauleii timot xiiixiiij matt xixxxix lord render daye whiche promise christ confirmeth ye shall receyue hundred folde eternall life finally christ beginneth worlde glory bodye manifolde diuersitie giftes encreaseth degree shall also make perfect heauen al godly receyue one consent bycause sufficiently testified worde god side leauyng crabbed question whiche shall know hinderance passe apoynted bondes part doe onely priuately forbeare superfluous searchyng vnprofitable thinges also thynke ought beware whithe answeryng nourishe lightnesse men hungry vayne knowledge doe aske howe greate shalbe distance betwene prophetes apostle agayne betwene apostle martyr many degree uirgins differ maried folkes finally leaue corner heauen vnsearched commeth mindes enquire purpose serueth repairing worlde sith child god shal nede nothing greate incomparable plentie shall lyke angel whose eatinge signe eternall blessednesse aunswere yt syghte shal great pleasantnesse greate swetenesse onely knoweledge withoute vse felicitie shall farre passe helpes wherwith holpen let v imagine oure selues bee sette moste wealthy coaste worlde shall wante ple sure yet whome sickenesse somtime hinder suffer vse benefites god whose course owne intemperance doth ofte breake sunder wherevpon foloweth cleare enioying pure al faulte although vse corruptible life perfection felicitie goe aske whether drosse corruption metalles bee far restoring contrarie whiche though respect graunt themro viijxxii yet loke paule repairing fault toke beginning sinne towarde whiche repairing grone trauaile yet procede aske better estate prepared man sithe blessing issue shall ende knot also easy loosed whereas scripture honorably setteth kinde blessyng referred encreasces wherewith god continually draweth forward ordre nature marke perfectio knowen manner sithe vnware easily taken allurementes maze draweth depelier length euery man deuises please himselfe ende stryuyng therefore let shorte waye v contented glasse darke speach vntil shal see face face fewe greate multitude care whiche waye may go heauen time couet knowe done commonly sluggish slow enter battells already paint themselues imagined triumphes bycause noe description canne matche greuousnesse vengeance god vpon reprobatemat viiixii xxiixiii mar ixxliii theyr tormentes peines ar fygured v bodyly thing namely darkenesse weping gnasshinge teethe vnquencheable fyer worme endlessly gnawinge hearte suche manner speache certaine holy ghooste meante trouble oure sens wyth horroresa lxxiixxiiii yt y sayde y prepared eternitie deepe hell nouryshmentes thereof fyre much wood blast lord streame bremstone doth set fieresa xxxxxxiii thinges muste holpen certaine manner conceyue miserable state wicked ought chiefely fasten thought vpon howe wretched thing estranged felowship god also fele maiestie god bent thee thou canst escape fast strayned first displeasure like violent fier touchyng whereof thinges deuoured swallowed vp creature serue execute iudgement whome lord shall shewe wrath shal fele heauen earth sea beastes cruell indignation enflamed armed destruction wherefore small thyng apostle pronounceth sayth vnbeleuyng shal suffer eternal punishmet dyeng face lordi thes iix glorie power oft prophetes caste v feare bodily figure although speake nothing excessiuely dulnesse yet adde fore shewynges yt iudgement come sunne moone whole frame world wherfore vnhappy conscieces finde rest beyng vexed tossed terrible whirlewinde fro felyng themselues torne peces god beyng angirly bent agaynst beyng pearced launced deadly stinges trebling lightening god beyng broosed weight hand much ease entre al bottomlesse depthes deuouryng pittes stande one moment terror great pressed euerlastyng neuer cessing siege whiche thyng xc psalme conteyneth notable sentence although onely sight scatter abrode mortall men bryng nought yet worshipper howe muche ferefull world much enforceth pricketh forward loden crosse vntill ende third boke fovrth boke institution christen religion entreateth outvvard meanes helpes vvherby god allureth v felovvshyp christ holdeth v therein p first chapter true churche ought kepe vnitie mother al godly faith gospel christ become made partaker saluation broughte eternal blessednesse already declared last booke rudenesse slouthfulnesse yea vanitie witte doe nede outwarde helpes whereby fayth v maye engendred growe encrease proceding towarde marke wherunto tendeth god hath also added therby prouyde weakenesse preaching gospell might floryshe hath left treasure churcheeph iiiixi hath appointed pastor teacher whoes mouth myght teache hath furnyshed authoritie finally hath left nothyng vndoone might auaile holy consent faith right order first hath ordeined sacramentes fele experience profitable helpes nourishe confirme faith beeyng enclosed prison fleshe yet attaine degree angel god applying hymselfe capacitie accordyng hys wonderful prouidence hath appointed meane wherby far distant fro might come vnto hym wherfore order teaching requireth entreate church gouernemet order power sacramentes lastely also ciuile order therewithall call away godly reader corruption wherewyth satan papane hath depraued thynges god appointed saluation begin churche whoes bosome god wil haue hys child gathered together onely helpe ministerie nouryshed whyle infantes yong chyldren also ruled motherly care tyll growe ryper age length come marke fayth lawfull thynges seuered god hath conioyned fatherma xix gal viiixxvi churche also mother onely vnder lawe also sin commyng christe paule wytnesseth teacheth child newe heauenly hierusalem crede professe beleeue churche spoken onelye visible churche whereof entreate electe god whose number also comprehended departed death therefore thys worde beleue set oftentimes difference noted betwene child god vngodly betwene peculiar flocke sauage beastes wheras many doe enterlace worde without probable reason graunt dede commonly vsed also wanteth consenting testimonie antiquitie forasmuch euen nicen crede reported ecclesiasticall historie addeth preposition withall maie marke writinges auncient father old time receiued without controuersie say beleued churche churche augustine aunciet writer whatsoeuer whoes work remaineth vnder name cyprian concerning exposition crede onely speake themselues also expresly note vnproper maner speaking preposition adioyned confirme opinion trifling reason therefore testifie beleue god vpon true speaker minde reposeth selfe confidence resteth could coueniently spoken say churche could sayed beleue forgeuenesse sinnes resurrection fleshe therefore although would striue woordes yet rather folowe proprietie speakyng shoulde fittest expresse matter tha curiously seke formes speche wherby matter may without cause darkened ende yt know although deuill attempt meanes ouerthrowe grace christe though ennemies god carried violente rage entente yet extinguished bloude christ made barren bryng forth fruite secrete election god inward callyng co sidered alone knoweth whoe hys holdeth enclosed vnder seale paule termeth saying beare hys token whereby maye seuerally knowen reprobateep ixiii small contemptible number lyeth hid vnder huge multitude fewe graines wheate couered wyth heape chaffe god onely lefte knowledge churche fundation whereof secrete election sufficiente conceiue thoughte mynde multitude elect vnlesse thinke vppon suche vnitie churche whiche truely perswaded selues engraffed vnlesse vnder head chryste vnited together wyth reste member abydeth v hope inheritaunce come therefore called catholike uniuersall fynde two three church christe muste torne sonder whyche done electe god knitt together christe hang vpon one head may growe together one body cleauing together wyth suche compacting ioyntes member one selfe body beeing truely made one whiche one hope fayth charitie one selfe spirite god dooe lyue together beeing called onely one inheritaunce eternall lyfe also one partaking one god christe wherefore althoughe sorowefull desolation eche syde presenteth selfe sighte crieth nothing lefte churche yet lette v knowe christes death frutefull god maruellously secrete corner preserueth churchi kin xixxviii sayed elia haue kept selfe seuen thousande men haue bowed knee baal albeit article crede doeth respecte belong outwarde churche euery one v shoulde holde himselfe brotherly consente child god shoulde yelde vnto churche authoritie whiche deserueth finally behaue shepe flocke therefore adioyned communion saintes parcell although commonly old writer doe leaue yet neglected wel expresseth qualitie churche sayed saintes gathered together felowshyppe christ condition whatsoeuer benefites god bestoweth vpon shoulde cotinually communicate one wherby yet diuersitie grace taken away know gyftes holy ghost diuersly distributed neyther order ciuile gouernemente disturbed whiche lawfull euery man priuately enioye owne possession necessarye preseruatyon peace among men haue among selues peculiare deuyded property thynges communitie affirmed luke descrybeth multitude beleuers one harte one souleacte iiii xxxi eph iiiiiiii paule exhorteth ephesian one body one spirite called one hope possible truely perswaded god common father christ common head conioyned among themselues brotherly loue shoulde continually communicate thynges haue nowe muche behoueth v knowe profyte therupon returneth vnto v beleue churche thys ende may certainly perswaded member thys meane saluation resteth vpon sure sounde stayes although whole frame world shaken come ruine fall downe firste standeth wyth goddes election neyther varye faile together wyth hys eternall prouidence certayne manner ioyned wyth stedfastnesse christe whiche suffer faithfull plucked hym hys owne member rente torne peces beside assured trueth shall alwaye abyde wyth v long holden bosome churche laste fele promise belong vsioel iixxxii abd xv p xlvi vi shalbe saluation syon god shall euer abide hierusalem may time moued muche partaking churche doe holdeth v felowshippe god also worde communion muche comforte remayneth certayne soeuer lorde geueth hys oure member belongeth v oure hope theyr good thynges confirmed suche sorte embrace vnitie churche nedefull haue already sayed see churche selfe wyth eies fele handes rather thys consisteth faith admonished oughte lesse thinke passeth vnderstanding openly appeared neither fayth therefore worse conceiueth vnknowen asmuche herein commaunded discerne reprobate electe whiche office god onely oures determine assuredly mindes mercifull kindnesse god father throughe effectual working holy ghost come partaking christ seuered peculiar righte proper possession christe asmuche number partaker greate grace sithe nowe purpose entreate visible church lette v learne euen thys one title mother howe muche knowledge thereof profitable yea necessarye v asmuche entrye life vnlesse conceiue v hee wombe vnlesse bryng v fourth vnlesse fede v breastes fynallye vnlesse kepe v vnder custodye gouernaunce vntyll suche tyme beyng vnclothed mortall fleshe shall lyke vnto angelsmat xxiixxx e xxxvii xxxi ioel ii xxxii oure weakenesse suffreth v dismissed schole tyll haue scholar throughout ye whole course lyfe beside oute bosome forgeuenesse synnes saluation hoped wytnesseth esaye ioeleze xiiiix agreeth ezechiel declareth shall number goddes people whome putteth awaye heauenly lyfe contrarie side sayed wryte name among citezens hierusalem turne selues folowyng true godlynesse whiche manner also sayed psalmepsa cvi iiii remember lord good wyll thy people visite thy saluation maye see benefytes thy electe maye merry myrth thy people maye reioyse wyth thy enherytaunce whiche woordes fatherly fauoure god peculyar testimonie spirituall lyfe restrayned hys flocke departyng churche alwaye damnable lette v procede prosecute whiche properly belongeth placeeph iiiixi paule writeth christ might fulfill thynges gaue apostle prophetes euangelistes pastor teacher restoryng holy one ye worke ministerie vnto edification body christe vntill come vnitie fayeth acknowledgyng sonne god vnto perfecte manne measure ful growen age chryst see god whiche able make hys perfecte momente yet wyll haue growe manly age brynging vp church see meane expressed vnto pastor enioyned preachyng heauenly doctrine see one excepted broughte one rule shoulde wyth milde spirite willing learne yelde themselues teacher appoynted vse marke esaye longe sette kingdome christe sayethesa lix xxi spirite whiche thee woordes haue putte thy mouth shall neuer departe neyther oute thy mouth mouth thy sede thy childrens child wherevpon foloweth worthy perishe wyth famyne pining hunger whosoeuer refuse spirituall meate soule reached vnto god handes churcherom xxvii god doeth breath fayth v instrumente gospel paule sayeth fayth hearyng also wyth god remayneth hys power saue paule witnesseth vttereth displayeth preaching gospel thys reason olde time wylled shoulde made holye assemblyes sanctuaryeps cxxxii xiiii psa lxxxii doctryne vttered mouth priest shoulde nourishe consente fayth ende glorious title haue respect temple called rest god sanctuary house sayed syt betwene cherubins bryng estimation loue reuerence dignitie ministerie heauenly doctrine whiche otherwyse syghte mortall despised man would little diminisheii cor iiii vii therefore shoulde knowe earthen vessel broughte fourth vnto v inestimable treasure god himselfe commeth fourth much author degree wil haue himselfe acknowledged presente institution therefore hath forbydden geue themselues iudgement flying birdesleui xi xxxi south sayinges magicall artes necromancie superstition immediatly addeth geue whiche oughte suffice steade al yt saye shal neuer destitute prophetes like set olde people angel raised vp teacher earth whiche mighte truely performe office angel thys daie also teache v men olde time contente onely lawe added priestes expositor whose lippes people enquire true meaning therof thys day willeth v hedefully ben reding also appointeth maisters ouer v whose trauail may holpen wherof commeth double profite one parte good tryal proueth obedience heare minister speaking euen himselfe side also prouydeth weakenesse manner men rather speake vnto v interpreter allure v vnto thondryng driue v away fro hym truely expedient familiar maner teaching v al godly fele feare wherwith ye maiestie god doth worthily astonish thynke authoritie doctrine abaced contempt men called teache wray vnthankefulnesse among many excellent giftes wherewith god hath garnished mankinde singular prerogatiue vouchesaueth consecrate mouthes tonges men himselfe hys owne voyce shoulde sound wherefore oure behalues lette v greued obedientlie embrace doctrine saluation sette fourth hys commaundemente hys owne mouthe althoughe power god bounde outwarde meanes yet hath bounde v ordinarye manner teaching whiche whyle phrentyke menne refuse kepe wrappe themselues many deadly snare eyther pryde disdainefulnesse enuie moueth many perswade themselues sufficiently profyt owne priuate readyng study despyse publike assembly accompte preaching superfluous sith muche lose breake sonder holy bonde vnitie man escapeth due punishment thys diuorce bewitcheth hymselfe wyth pestylente error moste wicked dotage wherfore pure simplicitie faith maye flourishe among v lette v greued vse thys exercyse godlynesse whiche god institution hath shewed necessarie v earnestly commendeth neuer yet foud euen wanton dogges whiche woulde say ought stoppe oure eares agaynst god age prophetes godly teacher haue hard strife againste wicked whoes stubbornnesse neuer come vnder yoke taughte mouth ministerie menne whiche muche blotte oute face god whiche shineth vnto v doctrine olde tyme faythfull commaunded seke face god sanctuaryepsa cxviii cor iiivi ofte repeted lawe cause doctrine lawe exhortation prophetes liuely image god paule affirmeth hys preaching shineth glorye god face chryste howe muche detestable apostate whiche gredely seeke deuide church thoughe driue shepe foldes caste mouthes wolues must holde whiche haue alleged oute paule churche otherwyse bylded outwarde preaching holy one holden together wyth bonde wyth learning profyting one consente kepe order appointed god churche thys ende principally haue sayed faythfull olde time vnder lawe commaunded resorte sanctuarie moses speaketh dwelling place god doeth withall call place nameexod xxxxiiii god hath sette memorye hys name whereby playnly teacheth without doctrine godlinesse vse thereof douteful reason dauid greate bitternesse spirite complayneth tirannous crueltie hys enemyes kepte entring tabernacle semeth commonlye many childishe lamentation shoulde small losse also greate pleasure shoulde forgone thereby wante entrie temple enoughe delytefull thinges bewaileth one griefe anguishe sorowe freted vexed manner wasted nothyng greater estimation wyth faythfull thys helpe wherby god degree lyfteth vp hye also noted god mirror hys doctrine alway shewed himselfe holy father knowledge spiritual wherfore ye teple called onely face also take awaye superstition hys foote stoleps cxxxii vii p xcix vi para xxviii ii acte viixlviii thys happy metyng vnitie fayth whyle hyest euen lowest doe aspire head temple euer gentyles vpon purpose builded god mere prophaning hys worshyp whereunto thoughe lyke grossenesse yet somwhat iewes fell whereof stephen mouth esay reprocheth sayeth god dwelleth temple made wyth handes c onely god doeth hys worde sanctifie himselfe temple lawefull vse rashly attempt thing wythout commaundemente euill beginning doe cleaue newe deuises whyche euill spreade abrode without measure yet xerxes cou sell magitians burned vp plucked downe temple greece vndiscretely sayed goddes al thynges ought freely open inclosed within wals tyles thoughe power god entente myght nere v certayne manner descende vnto v yet neyther chaunge place fasten v earthly meanes rather certayne chariotes carry v vp heauenly glory inmeasurable greatnesse thereof fylleth thynges yea heygth surmounteth heauens forasmuche time hath greate strife effectualnesse ministerie excessiuely amplyfye dignitie thereof affirme whiche properly belonging holy ghost wrongfully geue away mortal thynke minister teacher pearce mindes harte amende well blindnesse mindes hardnesse harte mere geue ryght determination thys cotrouersy contende partes shal easily accorded expresly noting place god author preachyng ioyning spirite promiseth fruite therof againe seueryng hymselfe outwarde helpes chalengeth himselfe alone wel beginninges fayth whole course thereof office seconde elia malachie witnesseth enlighten mindesmal iilvi ioh xvxvi pete xxiii cor liii xv cor ixii ii cor iii vi cor iiiiii ga iii cor iiiix turne harte father child vnbeleuers wysedome righteous christ pronounceth sendeth apostle shoulde bryng fruite theyr labor fruite peter shortly defineth saying regenerate incorruptible sede therefore paule gloryeth gospell begate corinthyans seale hys apostle shyppe yea lyterall minister suche dyd onely beate eares wyth sounde voyce geuen hym effectualnesse spirite doctryne shoulde vnprofytable whiche meaning also place saieth hys gospell worde onely power affyrmeth also galathyans hearyng receiued spirite fayth finallye many place maketh hymselfe onely woorker together wyth god also assygneth hymselfe offyce geuynge saluatyon truelye neuer broughte fourth thinges entent geue vnto himselfe thing neuer little seuerally god place shortlye declareth saying laboure vnprofitable lordi iii v ga iiviii according power mightily working againe place mightie peter towarde circumcision also mightie towarde gentilesi cor iiivii howe leaueth nothing seuerally minister appeareth place planteth nothing watereth nothing god geueth encrease haue laboured grace god truely must holde fast sayinges god ascrybing himselfe enlyghtenyng mynde renewing harte teacheth robberie god man take vpon himselfe parte either meane time man offer hymselfe minister god ordeyneth willing learne shall knowe frute thys manner teachyng vaine pleased god yoke modestie vaine laied vpon faithful churche visible whiche within compasse knowledge iudgemente mete geuen therof thinke already appeare euidently haue saied haue sayed holy scripture speaketh churche two sortes somtime nameth churche meaneth churche dede god none receiued grace adoption child god santification spirite true member chryst truelye comprehendeth onely holy one dwell earth also electe haue ben sin beginning world often time vnder name church signifieth vniuersall multitude men scattered abrode worlde whiche professe worshyp one god christ baptisme entre hys fayth partaking supper testifie vnitie true doctrine charitie haue agremente worde lorde preaching thereof doe kepe ministerie ordeined christe thys churche mingled many hipocrites whiche haue nothyng christ name outward shewe many ambicious couetous enuious euill speaker vncleane life suffred time either lawfull order iudgemente couinced alway vre seueritie discipline oughte therefore muste nedes beleue churche inuisible v seen eies god commaunded regarde thys churche whiche called churche respecte men kepe communion therefore muche behoued v knowe lorde hath sette oute certayne markes signes vnto vsii tim ii xix thys dede singular prerogatiue god himselfe knowe hys haue already alleaged oute paule truelye rashenesse menne shoulde crepe farre prouided verye successe thynges daylye puttyng v mynde howe farre secrete iudgementes dooe surmounte oure vnderstandyng euen seemed moste desperate accompted vtterly paste hope goodnesse called backe waye seemed stande fast comparison doo oftentymes fall homel ioan therfore according secrete predestination god augustine saieth many shepe without many wolues within knoweth hath marked knowe neither hym theim selues openly beare badge onely eies doo see holy without faynyng continue euen ende whiche chiefe poynt saluation yet syde forasmuche forsawe somedeale expediente knowe accompted child hath parte applied himselfe capacitie certaintie faith necessarie hath put place therof certayne iudgement charitie wherby acknowledge membres churche bothe confession faith example lyfe partakyng sacramentes dooe professe god christ v knowledge body therof howe much knew necessary saluation muche certayne markes hath sette loe herevpon groweth aryseth vnto v face church visible eye soeuer see word god purely preached hearde sacramentes ministred accordyng institution christ wise douted churche godmath xviiixx forasmuche promise canne deceiue soeuer two three gathered together name middes theim maie euidently vnderstande summe matter must procede degree say vniuersall churche multitude gathered together nation soeuer beyng sundered seuerally scattered distance place yet doeth agree one truth godly doctrine bounde together bonde one selfe religion vnder comprehended al particular church whiche townes streetes accordyng order me necessitie euery one may rightfully haue name authoritie church particular men profession godlinesse reckened among church although dede straungers churche yet doo certain maner belong vnto tyll publike iudgement banished howbeit somewhat diuers maner iudgyng priuate men church may fall experience men shal thynke bee altogether woorthy company godly yet muste vse like brother accompt among faithfull comon consent churche wherby suffered borne withall body christe dooe oure testimonie allowe suche membres churche leaue place haue among people god till orderly ryght lawe taken away multitude must otherwise thinke hath honoureth ministerie worde administration sacramentes deserueth without doute bee estemed iudged churche certain thyngs without fruit also preserue vniuersall church vnitie whiche diuelyshe spirites haue alway trauailed cut sunder neither doo defraude authoritie lawful assembly whiche disposed accordyng fitnesse place haue sette signes discerne churche preachyng worde obseruyng sacramentes bee must bryng foorth fruite prospered blessyng god doo say wheresoeuer woorde preached springeth vp fruite saie receiued hath staied seate bringeth foorth effectualnesse therof preachyng gospell reuerently heard sacrament neglected howe soeuer tyme appeareth deceitfull doutfull face church wherof man maye vnpunished eyther despise authoritie refuse admonition resist counsel mocke correctios much lesse depart breake sunder vnitie lorde hyely estemeth communion churche compteth traiterous runne away forsaker religion soeuer shall stubbornely estraunge hymselfe christian felowshyp suche one hath true ministerie worde sacramentes commendeth church authoritie violate iudgeth owne diminished neither smalle importaunce churche called pyller strong staye truthe house godi ti iiixv whiche wordes paule signifieth ende truthe god shoulde decay worlde churche faithfull keper therof god haue preachyng worde kept pure shewe hym self vnto v father housholde ministerie labour feedeth v spirituall n urishementes procureth thyngs make saluation also sclender praiseeph vxxvii ephes ixxiii said chosen seuered christ spouse shoulde without wrinkle spot body fullnesse hym whervpon foloweth departyng churche denyeng god christ therfore much wee muste beware wicked disagreement whyle goe muche v lyeth procure ruine god truth worthy shoulde sende downe lyghtenyng whole violent force wrath destroy v neither imagined faulte haynous wicked breache faith defile mariage onely begotten sonne god hath vouchesaued contracte v wherfore let v diligently kepe markes emprinted myndes let v esteme accordyng lord wil thing satan endeuoureth take awaye abolishe one bothe somtyme markes raced blotted may take awaye true naturall distinction churche sometyme broughte contempt maye en fallyng away plucke v churche craft brought certayn age paste pure preachyng worde ha h vanished away nowe doeth greate importunacye trauaile ouerthrowe ministerie whiche yet christ hath stablished churche taken away edification churche perisheth howe daungerous yea deadly tentation doeth come mynde depart congregation wherein seene signes token whiche lorde thought church sufficiently described se howe great hede taken bothe side shoulde deceiued vnder title church euery congregation pretendeth name churche must examined maner triall touchstone haue word sacramets order appointed lorde wil deceiue v let v boldly yeld vnto honor due church contrary wise boaste selfe without word sacrament must lesse fearefull consciece beware suche deceites side must flee rashenesse pride saie pure ministerie woord pure vsage celebratyng sacramentes sufficient pledge carnest maye safely embrace churche felowshyppe wherein bothe shalbe extendeth farre neuer caste longe shall continue althoughe swarme full many faultes yea maye faultynesse creepe admynistration eyther doctrine sacramentes whyche oughte estraunge v communyon article true doctrine bee one sorte necessarie bee knowen oughte certayn vndouted men propre principle religion sort one god christe god sonne god oure saluation consisteth mercye god suche lyke bee beyng controuersye betwene church yet doo breake vnitie fayth church disagree aboute one poynt withoute luste contention withoute stubburnesse affyrmyng one thinke soules departe bodyes doo flye vp heauen churche dare determyne nothyng place yet certaynely holdeth lyue lordephili iiixix woordes apostle lette v perfecte thynke one thynge yf ye thynke thyng otherwise thys lorde shall also reuele vnto doeth sufficientlye shewe diuersitie opinion matter bee necessarye oughte bee grounde dysagreemente amonge christian deede principal pointe agree thynges muche man wrapped lyttell clowde ignoraunce eyther muste leaue churche muste pardon beyng deceyued suche thynges maye bee vnknowen withoute violatyng summe religyon without losse saluation meane defend error neuer litle wold think shuld cherished flattering winking say ought rashly euery light dissention forsake church least doctrine reteined safe vncorrupted wherin standeth safetie godlynesse vse sacrame te kept institute ye lord mean time endeuor amed yt displeaseth v therin according dutie herevnto belongeth sayinge paulei corin xiiiixxx thyng better reueled hym sitteth let first holde peace whereby euidente membres churche euery one charged endeuour publike edification accordyng measure grace done comely accordyng order neither doo forsake communion churche abiding doo trouble peace well ordred discipline thereof bearyng imperfection life gentle tendernesse ought go muche herein slipperye easynesse fall herein small deuises doeth satan laye wayte v haue ben alway whiche fylled false perswasion perfect holynesse though already made certayne ayry spirites despised company men sawe remainyng thyng nature man suche old tyme cathari madde donatistes day anabaptistes whiche woulde seeme haue profited aboue reste offende vndiscrete zele rygteousnesse madde pride see amonge gospell preached fruite lyfe agreablye aunsweryng doctrine therof iudge churche dede moste iust displeasure suche one wherevnto moste miserable age worlde geue muche occasion nether may excuse accursed slouthfulnesse whiche lord suffer vnpunished euen alredy beginneth greuous scourge chastise woe therfore v whiche dissolute licentiousnesse wicked dooynges make weake conscience wounded reason v agayne offende haue spoken measure theyr beeyng displeased lorde requireth clemencie leauyng doo geue selues wholly immeasurable rigorousnesse thynke churche sounde purenesse vprightnesse lyfe hatred synnes departe lawfull churche whyle thynke swarue company wicked men alledge churche christe holye maye also vnderstande myngled good euill men lette heare parable mouthe christe wherin compared nettemat xiiixlvii mat xiiixxiii math iiixii whiche fyshes kyndes gathered together chosen tyll bee layde abrode vpon shoare let heare lyke vnto corne fielde whiche beyng sowen good graine ennemies fraude scattered tare whiche cleansed vntyll croppe bee broughte barne floore fynally let heare lyke vnto floore wherein wheate gathered together lyeth hydden vnder chaffe tyll beyng clensed fanne sy e length laide vp ye grainer lorde pronounce churche shall euen daye iudgement troubled euyll burdened mynglyng euyll men doo vayne seeke churche sprynkled spotte crie intollerable thyng pestilence vice raungeth abroade saying apostle dooe also answere among corithians onely gone waie infection hadde maner possessed whole body onely one kynde synne many neither light offence certayn horrible outragious doings onely corruption maners also doctrine case saith holy apostle say instrument holy ghoste whoes testimonie churche standeth falleth doth require diuision doth banishe kingdom christ doeth strike extremest thunderbolt curse doeth none thyngs acknowledgeth reporteth churche christ felowship sainctes remayne churche among corinthiansi cori ixi iiiiii vi vi vii et ixi xvxii contention sectes enuious partakynges doo broyle quarels brawlynges vre gredynesse hauyng wicked dooyng openly allowed whiche abhominable amonge gentile paules name vniustly rayled whome ought haue honoured father scorne resurrection dead ruine wherof whole gospell falleth gracious giftes god serue ambition charitie wher ny thing vncomely vnorderly doone therfore styll remayne churche ministerie word sacramentes refused dare take away name churche charged tenth part fau e great precisenesse deale cruelly church present tyme pray wold haue galathiansgalat almost vtter forsakers gospel among yet apostle founde church obiect also paule greuousely rebuketh corinthian sufferyng company man hainous synner setteth generall sentence wherin pronounceth vnlawfull euen eate breade manne reprochefull lyfe crie outei cor vii lawfull eate common breade howe may lawfull eate bread lorde confesse dede greate dishonour hogges dogges haue place among child god also muche dishonour holy body christe geuen foorth truely bee well ordred church suffer wicked men bosome without choise admitte bothe worthy vnwoorthy together holy banket forasmuch ye pastor doo alway diligently watche yea somtyme tender bearyng men ought hindered vse seueritie woulde commeth passe euen ar openlye euyll alway thruste company holy one graunte bee faulte neyther wyll dymynysshe sithe paule dooeth sharpely rebuke corinthian although churche slacke duetie shall therfore immediately power euery priuate man take vpon selfe iudgemet seuer dede deny doyng godly man withdraw himselfe al priuate company euil men entangle willing familiaritie one thing flee companie euill men thyng hatred theim forsake communion churche thynke sacrilege partaker lordes bread therin muche rigorous paule exhorteth v holy pure partakyng requyreth one examin euery man whole churche echone proue hym selfei cor xixviii vnlawfull comunicate vnworthy man truely paule would byd v looke circumspectly whether multitude whoes vncleannesse might defiled nowe requireth onely euery man proofe themselues sheweth nothyng hurteth v vnwoorthie doo thruste selues among v nothyng el ment whiche saieth afterwardei cor xixxix eateth vnworthily eateth drinketh iudgement selfe doeth say himselfe rightfully ought stande choise euery particular man bee receiued reiected knowledge hereof belongeth whole church knowledge without lawfull order hereafter shall saide large therfore shoulde vnryghtuous priuate man defiled vnworthynesse whome neyther ought kepe backe commyng althoughe vndiscrete zeale rightuousnesse tentation doeth sometyme also entre good men yet shall finde muche precisenesse groweth rather pride disdainfulnesse false opinion holynesse true holynesse true zeale therof therfore bolder standerd bearer make departyng churche moste parte doo vpon cause despisyng men boast selues better contra par lib cap therfore augustine saieth well wisely godly order maner ecclesiasticall discipline ought principally haue regarde vnto vnitie spirite bonde peace whyche apostle commaunded kept bearyng one whiche beeyng kepte medicine reuenge proued bee onely superfluous also pernicious therfore nowe medicine euill child hatred men iniquity affection owne contention doo gredyly labour eyther wholly drawe least diuide weake common people entangled bosting name swelling pride madde stubburnesse traiterous sclaunders troublesome sedition least shuld seme want lyght truth doo pretende shadowe rigorous seueritie thynges holy scripture commaunded done gentler kynd healing sauyng sinceritie loue kepyng vnitie peace correct faultes brother abuse sacrilege schisme occasyon cuttyng e usd lib ca ii godly quiet men geueth counsell mercifully correct whiche whiche paciently beare grone mourne loue vntyll god eyther amende correct haruest roote vp tare fanne chaffe lette godly trauaile fortifie theim selues armures least seme selues strong couragious reuengers rightuousnesse departe kingdom heauen kyngdom rightuousnesse sithe god haue communion churche kepte outward felowshyp hatred euill men doth breake toke elowship entreth waie wherby slippery falling fro comunion saint let thinke yt great multitude many truly holy innocent eies lord see let think euen diseased many doo please flatter selues faultes beyng awakened earnest feare god doo aspire greater vprightnesse let thinke iudgement ought geuen man one dede forasmuche holiest sometime fall away greuous fal let think gather church lieth weight ministerie woorde partaking holy misteries force shoulde vanishe away fault wicked men last lette theim consider iudging churche iudgement god greater value iudgement man also pretend churche without cause called holy mete wey holinesse excelleth least admitte church suche one pointes perfect leaue churche alleph vxv true dede paul saith christ gaue churche sanctifie clensed lauer water word life make vnto glorious spouse hauyng spotte wrinkle c yet also nothyng lesse true lord dayly worketh smoothyng wrinkle wipyng away spottes whervpon foloweth holynesse yet fully finished therfore churche holy dayly profiteth yet perfect daiely procedeth yet come marke holinesse also place shalbe largely declared whereas therfore prophetes prophecie shalbe holy hierusalemioel iiixvii esa xxxv viii whiche straungers shal passe holy temple wherinto vncleane men shall entre let v take spotte membres churche whole endeuour aspire holinesse soud purenesse goodnesse god clennesse ascribed whiche haue yet fully obteined although oftentimes rare token sanctification among men yet must determine hath bene time sin creation worlde wherin lord hath churche shall also tyme ende worlde wherin shall haue albeit immediatly beginnyng whole kynde men corrupt defiled sinne adam yet polluted masse god alway sanctifieth som vessel vnto honour age without felyng mercie hath testified certayn promisespsalme lxxxixiiii psalm xxxiixiii hie xxxixxxv haue ordeined testament elect haue sworne dauid seruant euer continue thy sede builde thy seate generation generation agyan lord hath chosen syon hath chosen dwelling reste euer c agayne thynges sayth lorde geueth sunne lyght day moon starres light night lawes shall faile sede israell shall also faile hereof christ self apostle maner prophet haue geuen v example horrible description wherin esaie hieremie ioel abacuc doo lament sickness churche hierusalem common people magistrate priestes thing corrupt esaie douteth match hierusalem sodom gomorrha religion partely despised partly defiled maners comonly reported theftes extortion breach faith murthers like mischieues yet therfore prophet neither erect selues new church buyld vp newe altar whiche might haue seuerall sacrifice soeuer maner men yet considered god left word ordeined ceremony wherby worshipped myddest assemblie wicked held vp pure handes vnto hym truely thought gather infection thereby would rather haue dyed hundred tymes haue suffred selues drawen therevnto therfore nothing withheld departing desire keping vnitie prophet thought conscience estrange selues church many great wicked doyngs one two men maner whole people take muche vpon v dare depart comunion church men maners doo satisfie eyther iudgemente yea christian profession maner world tyme christe apostle yet desperate vngodlynesse pharisee dissolute licenciousnesse liuing eche reigned could hynder vsed ceremony people assembled rest one temple publike exercise religion whereof came knew felowship euill men defile pure coscience communicate ceremony man litle moued prophet apostle let yet obey authoritie christ therfore cyprian well saieth lib iii epist though sene tare vncleane vessel churche yet cause shuld depart churche must onely labour may wheate must vse diligece endeuour muche may may golden syluer vessell breake earthen vessel work lord also geuen iron rodde let man chalenge hym selfe whiche proprely belongyng sonne onely able alone fanne floore clense chaffe seuer tare man iudgement prowde obstinacie presumption full sacrilege peruerse furour taketh selfe c therfore let bothe thynges remayn certainly fixed first hath excuse yt owne forsaketh outward comunion church ye word god preached sacrament ministred faultes many hindrace may therin rightly professe faith ceremony institute god bicause godly conscience hurt ye vnworthines ether pastor priuate man misteries holy vpright neuerthelesse pure holsome together handled vncleane precisenesse disdainfulnesse procedeth yet acknowledge chirche one pure al spottes neuer smal yea angry wt good teacher exhorting ye faithful goe forwarde teache al life long grone vnder burden vice flee vnto pardon prate yt meane led fro perfection graunte dede yt earnest calling vpon perfection ought slowly coldely trauail much lesse idle fil mindes confidence therof yet course say deuelish inuention therefore crede forgeuenesse synnes aptly ioyned next chircheesay xxx iiixiiii none atteine citezens household chirch red ye prophete therfore bilding heauely hierusale ought go wherin afterward mercifulnesse god maye haue place yt whosoeuer come vnto iniquitie may take away say yt ought first bilded yt ca chirch wtout ye forgeuenesse synnes lord hath promised mercy ye comunion sainctes therfore ye fyrst entry v ye chirch kingdome god forgeuenesse synnes wtout haue couenaut coioyning wyth godose iixviii thus sayeth ye prophete ye day wil strike couenant wt beast ye feld wt fowle aire vermin ye earth wil breake ye sword war earth wil make men slepe wtout feare wil espouse vnto euer wil espouse say righteousnesse iudgement mercy copassions see mercy ye lord recocileth v himselfe place foresayth yt people shalbe gathered together agayne scattered abrode wrath saieth wil cleanse fro al wyckednesse wherewith haue synned agaynst meio xxxiiiviii wherfore ye signe washing enter ye felowshyp ye chirch wherby may taught yt entrie open v householde god vnlesse fylthynesse fyrst wiped away hys goodnesse forgeuenesse sinnes ye lord doth receiue adopt v one ye chirch ye also preserueth maynteineth v stil purpose wer haue suche pardon grauted v serue vse euery one godly wytnesse himselfe yt mercy god vain mocking grauted one none yt cosciece priuie throughout whole life many weakenesses nede ye mercy god truly vain god promiseth thys grace peculiarly household vain comaundeth message recociliatio daily offred vnto therefore throughout al life carry v ye r nantes sine vnlesse susteined wt cotinual grace lord forgeuing oure synnes shal scarcely abide one momet ye chirch ye lord hath called vnto eternal saluatio therfore ought thike yt pardon alway ready sinnes wherfore ought holde assuredly liberalitie god meane christes deseruing sanctification spirite sinnes haue daily pardoned v called graffed ye body ye chirch deale benefite vnto v keyes geuen chirch christ gaue apostle commaundemetmat xvixix xviii xv iohn xxxxiii cor vxx deliuered power forgeue sinnes meante onely yt shoulde loose fro sinnes yt wer fro vngodlinesse couerted faith christ rather yt continually execute office among ye faythful thing paule teacheth writeth yt embassage reconciliation left minister chirche wherby oftentimes christes name exhort ye people reconcile themselues god therfore comunion sainctes ye ministery chirch self sinnes cotinually forgeue v ye priestes bishop ye office committed doe wt promyses gospel cofirme godly conscience hope pardo forgeuenesse wel publikely priuately according necessitie requireth many weakenesse nede singular atonemetact xxxx paul reporteth yt commo preaching also house testified fayth christ seuerally admonyshed euery one ye doctryne saluation therfore haue three thyngs noted first yt great holynesse soeuer ye child god excel yet alway estate long dwel mortal body yt without forgeuenesse sinnes stade god secondly yt benefite proper ye chirche yt otherwise enioy abide comunion therof thirdly distributed vnto v minister pastor eyther preaching gospel ministryng sacramentes thys behalfe principally appeareth ye power ye keyes ye lord hath geuen felowship faythful wherfore let euery one v thinke duty el seke forgeuenesse sine lord hath set publyke recociliation belongeth discipline shal speake place fyt forasmuch phrentyke spirites yt haue spoken doe goe plucke away fro chirch anchore saluatio conscience ye strogly confyrmed pestilent opinion nouatians old time troubled ye chirch wt doctrine much vnlyke nouatians age also hath many anabaptistes fal dotage faine yt people god baptisme regenerate pure angelyke lyfe yt corrupted wt filthinesse flesh man offende baptisme leaue vnto nothing vnappeasable iudgement god briefely graunte hope pardon sinner falle grace receiued acknowlege forgeuenesse synnes wherby first regenerate although lye clerely confuted scripture yet men finde may deceiue also olde tyme nouatus many folowers let v shortly shew mad others destruction first wheras commaundement lord holy one dayly repete prayermat vixi forgeue v dettes truely thei cofesse theselues detters nether thei craue vain lord hath alway appointed thyng asked whiche himselfe woulde geue yea wheras hath testified whole prayer shalbe heard father yet hath also sealed thys solution peculiar promise wyll lorde requireth holy one theyr lyfe long confession synnes yea continuall promyseth pardon boldnesse eyther exempte synne haue stumbled vtterlye exclude grace nowe doeth v forgeue seuenty tymes seuen tymes oure brother ende commaunde folow clementie forgeueth therfore one twise often striken downe wyth acknowlegyng synnes sighe vnto hym maye begin maner swadlyng cloutes chirche patriarch circumcised allured partaking couenaunt hauing vndoutedly father diligence ben taught righteousnesse innocencegen xxxviixviii conspired murder brother mischeuous acte abhorred euen desperate theues last mekened monition iudasgen xi ixxvii ge xxxiiiixxv ge xxxv ne xxx xvi ii sam xiiiii xv solde also intolerable hapnousnesse simeon leui wicked reuenge suche also condemned father iudgement vsed crueltie againste sichemites ruben vnclene lust defiled father bed iudas would geue hymselfe fornication agaynst lawe nature went sonnes wife yet farre wiped chosen people rather raised vp heds dyd dauid gouernoure iustice howe greate wickednesse sheding innocent bloud ope way hys blynde luste alredy regenerate among ye regenerate garnished notable prayses lorde neuerthelesse committed haynous offence horrible euen among gentile yet obtained pardon may tarry vpo single example many promyses law ye prophetes god mercy toward israelite oft proued lord sheweth himselfe appeasable offense people doth moses promyse come passe xxxiii people allen apostasie shal returne vnto lorde shall bryng thee backe captiuitie shall haue mercy thee shall gather thee together people thou hast dispersed thou scattered euen border heauen wil agayne gather thee together wyll beginne ren shoulde neuer ended prophetes full suche promyses whiche done yet r mercie people couered infinite wicked doinges hainous rebellion called betwe god chirch ouercome goodnesse god man sayeth ieremy hys wife geue body common adulterersiere iii xii abyde returne thy fornication wayes polluted da earth hath fylled thy filthy loues returne vnto wil receiue thee returne thou turne away wil turne away face thee holy angry euer truely otherwise mindedeze xviii xxiii xxiii ki viii xlvi whiche affirmeth willeth death sinner rather conuerted liue therfore salomon dedicate temple appointed also vse praiers made obteining pardon sinnes heard thense sayd thy sonnes shall synne man sinneth thou beyng angry shalt deliuer ennemies shal repente hart turned shal entreate thee captiuitie saying haue sinned haue done wickedly shal pray toward land thou hast geuen father towarde holy temple thou shalte heare praiers heauen shalt made mercifull thy people hath sinned thee wickedness wherewith haue offended theeiiiixxviii iii vainly lorde ordeined law daily sacrifice sinnes ye lord forseen hys people troubled continuall disease sinnes would neuer haue appointed remedyes thys benefite taken away faythful comming christ wherin fulnesse grace shewed forth dare pray pardon synnes offende lorde may obteine mercytit iix iiiiiii ii tim iix math xxxxiii mar vixxxviii mat xxvi xxxix ii iiivi viiixvii gal ivi iii iiiiix ii cor xiixxi shal el saye yt chryste came destruction saluation mercifulnesse god pardoning sinnes olde testament continually redy holy one sayd vtterly taken away beleue scripture expresly cry yt chryst grace kyndnesse lord fully appeared plentifulnesse mercy poured oute reconciliation god men fulfilled let v dout floweth vnto v bountiful mercifulnesse heauenly father cut shortened hereof want example peter whiche heard denied ye angel god confessed name christ men denied thrise one nighte yt without execration yet put away pardon yt liued inordinatly among ye thessalonian chastised yet gently called repentaunce euen symon magician hymselfe cast desperation rather comaunded hope well peter counselleth hym slee prayer yea haynous sinnes haue sometime possessed whole chirches paul rather getly vnwrapped tha pronounced accursed faling away ye galathians meane offense corinthian wer much lesse excusable tha abounded moe nothyng lighter sinnes yet neyther excluded fro mercy god yea eue yt synned aboue rest vncleannesse fornication vnchastitie namely called repentance ye couenant lord remaineth shal remaine euer inuiolable solenely made wt christ ye true salomo mebers wordesps lxxxix xxxii hys sonnes shal forsake lawe shall walke iudgementes shall defile righteousness kepe commaundementes wil visite iniquity wyth rod sinnes wyth stripe mercye wyll take away hym fynally order crede taughte remaineth chirch christ continual pardon synnes chirche stablished yet forgeuenesse sinnes adioyned somwhat wiser see doctryne nouatus confuted wt great plainnesse scripture make euery synne vnpardonable wilful transgressing lawe whiche man wittingly willingly falleth say vouchsaue graunt pardon synneleui iiii man hath erred ignorance wheras lord law commaundeth one sorte sacrifice offred clensing wilful synnes faythful redeme ignorance great lewdenesse shall graunt clensyng wilful synne say nothing plainer sacrifice christ auaileth forgeue wylfull synnes holy one forasmuche lord hath testified thesame carnal sacrifice signes againe excuse dauid ignorance euident haue wel instructed law dyd dauid knowe great faulte adultrie maslaughter dayly punished brotherslaughter seme patriarch lawfull thyng corinthyans ill profyted thought wantonnesse vncleannesse whordome hatred contention pleased god dyd peter beyng diligently admonished knowe great matter forsweare hys maister therfore let v wyth owne enuyousnesse stoppe vp way agaynst mercy god gently vttereth selfe truely ignorante olde writer expounded synnes dayly forgeuen faythfull light offense crepe weakenesse fleshe thought soleme repentance whiche required haynous misdedes myght iterate baptysme sayeng taken though would eyther throwe hedlong desperation first repentance fallen agayne extenuate synnes though wer smal syght god knew holy one oftentymes stagger infidelitie superfluous othes somtymes fall chafed vnto anger yea breake eue manifest raylinges besyde troubled wyth euils ye lord sclenderly abhorreth called put difference betwene publyke crymes wyth great offense came knowledge chirche wheras hardly pardo committed thyng worthy ecclesiasticall correction therfore thought hardly haue pardon lord thys seueritie meant make afraied rashly runne wycked doinges deseruing wherof myght estranged communion chirche howbeit truely worde lord whych herein ought rule vnto v appoynteth greater moderation teacheth rigor discipline farre extended ought chefely prouided swallowed vp wyth heuinesse haue declared large ii chapter comparison false chirche true chirche howe greate value ministery worde sacramentes ought v howe farre reuerence ought procede vnto v perpetuall token wherby discerne chirche hath already declared say whersoeuer ministery abideth whole vncorrupted faultes disease maners impediment may beare name chirche ministery selfe small error corrupted may estemed lawfull moreouer haue shewed error ought pardoned wherby ye pryncipal doctrine religion hurt wherby chefe poyntes religion ought agreably holden among faythful destroyed sacramentes yt abolish empaire lawful institution yt ordeined sone lying broken chefe tower religion sone summe necessarye doctryne peruerted ye vse sacramentes falleth truely destruction ye chirch foloweth like man lyfe ende throte thrust hart deadly wounded thys clearely proued wordes paulep iixx teacheth fundation chirch layed vpon doctrine apostle prophetes christ himselfe hed corner stone fundation chirche doctrine prophetes apostle faythfull commaunded repose saluation christ take awaye doctrine shal bilding stande longer therfore chirche muste nedes fall downe summe religion falleth able vpholde againe true chirche piller slay trueth certainei tim iii xv chirche lyeng falshode haue vsurped dominion sith case vnder papistrie may vnderstand much chirche remayning stede ministery ye worde reigneth peruerse gouernement made lye mingled together partly quencheth partly choketh pure light place ye lordes supper entred filthy sacrilege forme worshipping god deformed manifolde intolerable heape superstition doctryne without christianitie stande altogether buried dryuen publike assembly scholes idolatry vngodlinesse therfore peryl lost departing fro danable partakyng many mischeues plucked fro chirche christ comunion ye chirch ordeined thys ende yt bonde wherby enta gled idolatrye vngodlynesse ignorance god kindes euils rather wherby fast holden feare god obedience truth dede gloriously set chirch vnto v yt seme chirch ye world afterwarde though victory gotten decree yt e schismatykes dare withdrawe themselues obedience chirche painte heretikes dare one mutter doctrine therof proues confirme haue true chirche alledge auncient chronicle olde tyme italy fraunce spayne say fetche beginnyng holy menne sounde doctrine founded raised vp chirches stablished doctrine edifieng chirche bloud chirche hath ben among consecrate bothe spiritual gyftes bloud martyr preserued continuall succession bishop myght fall away rehearse muche ireneus tertullian origen augustine estemed succession howe triflyng thynges howe mockery make easily vnderstande content little wey truely woulde also exhort selues earnestly take hede herevnto trust might thyng preuaile teachyng forasmuche leauyng regarde truthe doo bende themselues onely purpose way defende owne cause wyll onely speake fewe thynges whereby good men loue truthe may wynde selues suttle cauillations fyrste aske theim doo alledge aphrike egypte asia euen countreyes holye succession byshoppes hath ceassed meane whereof boast haue preserued chirches come therefore poynt saye therefore haue true chirche sin fyrst began hath ben destitute bishoppes perpetuall course haue succeded one caste greece waie therefore aske agayne say chirche loste among grecian among succession byshops neuer interrupted whiche theyr opinion onely keeper preseruer chirche make grecian schismatikes right departing apostolike sea haue lost priuilege much deserue loose departe christ himselfe foloweth therfore pretence succession vaine vnlesse posteritie doo kepe faste abide truthe christe haue receaued father hande hande therefore romanistes day doo alledge nothyng el whiche appeareth iewes olde tyme alledged prophetes lorde reproued blyndnesse vngodlynesse idolatrie gloriously boasted temple ceremony priesthodes whiche thynges great reason thinke measured chirche steede chirche shewe certayne outwarde visours oftentymes farre chirche without whiche chirche maye well stande therefore nede confute theym argumente wherewith hieremie fought agaynst foolyshe presumptuousnesse ieweshier viiiiii shoulde boaste lying woordes saying temple lorde temple lord temple lord forasmuch lord doth acknowlege thing worde heard reuerently obse ued glory god sit betwene cherubins sanctuarieeze xiiii promised hys stedfast seate yet priestes one corrupted worshipping hym wt peruerse superstition remoued el left place wythout holinesse temple semed holily appointed perpetuall dwelling god mighte forsaken god become vnholy cause men faine v god bounde person place fast tyed outwarde obseruations must nedes abide haue onely tittle shewe churche paul contendeth epistle romaine ix chapter xii sore trouble weake conscieces iewes semed people god onely refuse doctryne gospel also persecute therfore hath sette oute doctrine remoueth dout denyeth iewes beeyng enemy trueth churche howsoeuer wated nothing otherwise myght required outward forme church therfore denieth bicause embraced christ somwhat expresly epistle galathians gal iiiixxii wherin coparing ismael isaac sayeth many holde place churche inheritaunce belongeth begotte free mother whence also descendeth comparison two hierusalems law geuen mount sina gospel came hierusalemgen xxix many seruilely born brought vp wythout douting boast themselues childre god churche yea proudely despyse natural chyldren god themselues bastardes syde also heare one pronounced heauen caste bonde woman sonne lette v standyng vppon thys inuiolable decree boldely despyse vnsauerie boastinges proude reason outwarde professyon ismael also circumcised contende antiquitie fyrst begotten yet see put awayro ixvi cause demaunded paul assigneth none accompted chyldren begotte pure lawfull sede doctryne according thys reason god denyeth bounde wycked pryestes thys couenanted father leui angel interpreter yea turneth agaynst themselues false bostyng wherewyth wonte rise vp prophetes dignitie priesthode singular estimation thys wyllyngly admitteth wyth condition debateth wyth ready keepe hys couenaunt doe mutually performe parte hym deserue reiected loe succession auayleth vnlesse therewithal also ioyned inuitation euenly continuing course euen thys effect successor sone proued haue swarued theyr originall depryued honor unlesse parhappes caiphas succeded many godlye byshops yea euen aaron hym continuall vnbroke course succession therefore mischeuous assemblie worthy name churche tolerable euen earthly dominion tyranny caligula nero heliogabalus suche called true state common weale succeded brute scipions camilles specially gouernement churche nothyng fonde leauyng doctrine sette succession person neyther holy doctours falsely thruste vnto v meane thyng lesse praie precisely ryght inheritance church byshops successiuely placed one controuersie begynnyng age nothyng chaunged doctrine alledged whiche myght suffise make ende newe errours doctrine oppugned ben euen apostle constantly one agreing consent reteined therfore cause shold longer go forward deceiue pretending false colour vnder name churche reuerently esteme becometh v come definition water common sayeng cleaueth vnto stick fast myre put stinkyng harlo place holy spouse christe puttyng changelyng deceiue v beside admonition let v remebre also augustin ad vina cen epist xlvii speaking church saith sometime darkned couered multitude offence cloude sometime caulmnesse time appeareth quiete free sometime hidden troubled waue tribulation temptation bringeth forth example oftetimes strongest pillers either valiantly suffred banishment faith hidden whole worlde like maner romanistes vexe v make afraide ignoraunt wyth name church whereas deadly enemy christe therfore althoug pretende temple priesthode suche outward shewes vayne glistring wherwyth eye simple bee daseled oughte nothyng moue v graunt ther church word god doth appere perpetual marke wherewith god hath marked hisioh xviii xxxvii iohn xxiiii truth saith heareth voyce agayne good shepeherd knowe shepe knowen shepe heare voyce know follow little sayd shepe follow shepherde know voyce follow straunger runne away know voyce straungers therfore wilfully madde iudgyng churche wheras christ hath marked vndoutefull signe wheresoeuer seene deceiue certainly sheweth churche bee remayneth nothing geue true signification churchephes iixx paule rehearseth church builded vpon iudgementes men vpon priesthodes vpon doctrine apostle prophetes rather hierusalem seuerally knowen babylon church christ conspiracie satan difference wherewyth chryste hath made differet one god saith heareth word godioh viiixlvii ye therfore heare ye ar god summe forasmuche chirche kingdom christ reigneth word doutfull man wordes lyeng whiche christes kyngdom fayned without scepter say without holy worde accuse v schisme heresie bothe preach contrary doctrine obey lawes haue assembly praiers baptisme ministration supper holy doinges seuerally dede sore accusation suche needeth long laboursome defence called heretikes schismatikes makyng diuision doo breake sunder communion chirche comunion holden together true bondes say agrement true doctrine lib que sti euag secund math brotherly charitie whervppon augustine putteth difference betwene heretikes schismatikes heretikes dede false doctrine corrupt purenesse faith schismatikes somtime eue like faith breake bond felowship also noted conioinyng charitie hangeth vpon vnitie faith faith ought beginnyng therof ende finally onely rule let v therfore remembre oft vnitie chirch commended vnto v required myndes agree christ willes also may ioyned together mutual well willing christ therefore pauleeph iiiiv philip iiii et v exhorteth v wel willing taketh foundation one god one faith one baptisme yea euer teacheth v one mynde one wil addeth christ according christ meanyng factious copanie wicked agreement faithfull whiche wythout woorde lorde cyprian also folowyng paule deriueth whole fountaine agreement chirch onely bishoprike christ afterward addeth chirch one de simp praesa spredeth abrode largely multitude encrease frutefulnesse like bee many sunne beames one light many brauches tree one body grounded vpon fast roote many streames doo flowe one fountayne althoughe nomber seme scattered abrode largenesse ouerflowing pletie yet vnitie abideth original take away beame sunne body vnitie suffer diuision breake brauche tree broken braunche spring cutte streame spring hed beyng cut dryeth vp also chirch ouerspred ye light lord extended ouer whole worlde yet one light spred euery nothing could said fitly expresse vndiuidable knitting togither mebers christ haue one see continually calleth v backe veray hedde wherupon pronounceth heresy schismes doo arise herof men returne originall truth seke hedde kepe doctrin heuenly maister let go cry heretikes haue departed chirch sithe hathe ben cause estrangyng theim one wise abide pure professyng truthe tell howe haue driuen v cursynges cruell execration whiche selfe doyng doeth abundantly enough acquite v vnlesse also condemne apostle schismatikes haue one causeioh viii christ say dyd forsay apostle tyme shuld com shuld cast synagoges name sake synagoges speaketh wer accompted lawfull chirches sithe therfore euident caste ready shewe doone name sake christ truely cause ought fyrst enquired thyng determined vpon v either one way howbeit content discharge poynt enough behoued shuld depart fro yt might com christ shall appeare yet certainly estimation ought haue chirches tyranny rom id hath possessed compared olde chirche isra y described prophetes true chirch among iewes israelite continued couenant obteyned thynges benefite god whervpon chirch consisteth truthe doctrine lawe ministerie therof among priestes prophet signe circumcision entred religion sacrame te exercised confirmation faith dout title wherwith lorde hath honoured chirche fittly perteyned felowship forsakyng lawe lorde went kinde idolatrie superstition partly lost prerogatiue dare take waye name chirche god hath left preachyng worde obseruation mystery agayne dare call chirche without exception word lord openly freely troden vnder foote ministerie therof chief sinew yea soule chirch destroied man saye therfore parcell chirch remaining among iewes fel away idolatrie answer easy fyrst say yt fallyng away certayn degree say one falle iuda israell suche tyme first swarued pure worshyppyng god iaro beam fyrst made calues ope prohibition god dedicate vnlawful place worshipping vtterly corrupt religio iewes first defile selues wicked superstitious maners wrongfully changed order outward forme religion although vnder rechabeam alredy gotten many peruerse ceremony yet taried hierusalem bothe doctrine lawe priesthode ceremonious vsages suche sorte god hadde ordeyned theim godly hadde tolerable state chirche among israelite vnto reigne achab amendement thynges thense foorthe fell worse worse succeded afterwarde destruction kyngdome partly like vnto hym partlye minded somwhat better folowed example iarobeam euery one wycked ydolaters iewrye nowe diuerse change whyle somme kynges peruerted worshippyng god wyth false forged superstition restored religion decaied vntill priestes selues defiled temple god prophane abhominable vsages let papistes much soeuer extenuate owne faultes denye among state religion corrupt defiled kyngdome israell vnder iarobeam haue grosser ydolatrye doctrine one droppe purer vnlesse peraduenture euen also vnpure god yea men endued wyth meane iudgement shalbe witness thing self also declareth herein tell nothyng trueth wyll dryue v comunion chirch require two thyngs v first shuld comunicate wyth al praiers sacramentes ceremony whatsoeuer honor power iurisdictio christ geueth hys chirch shuld geue chirch ye first point graunt prophet hierusalem whe thinges much corrupted dyd neither seuerally sacrifice assembly pray seuerall men commaundement god whereby comaunded come together salomon templeexo xxix ix knew leuiticall priestes howsoeuer vnworthy honour yet ordeined lord minister holy ceremony wer deposed dyd yet still rightfully possesse place whyche chiefe poynte thys question compelled superstitious worshippyng yea toke hande doo nothyng whiche ordeined god among men meane papistes like thing scarcely haue meting together wherin shall defile selues open ydolatrie truly principal bond comunion masse abhorre greatest sacrilege whether rightfully wrongfully shalbe sene place present enough shew behalf case prophetes whiche although present ceremony wicked compelled beholde vse anye ceremony suche institute god wyll needes haue example altogether like let v take oute kyngdome israell ordinance iarobeam circumcision remayned sacrifice offred x xxi law accompted holy god called vppon whome receyued father forged forbidden formes worshippyng god disalowed condemned done shewe one prophet anye one godlye man one worshypped sacrificed bethell knewe coulde doo shoulde defyle selues wyth somme sacrilege haue thus muche communion chirch oughte farre bee force wyth godly shuld degenerate prophane filthi vsages thei foorth necessitie folow aboute poynte contende yet earnestly chirche bee consydered bee suche whoes iudgemente wee ought reuerence whoes authoritie regarde whoes monition obey whoes chastisementes bee moued whoes communion thynges oughte religiously obserue graunte chirche must necessitie bounde subiection obedience vnto yet willingly graunt whyche prophetes graunted iewes israelite theyr tyme thynges good yea better state see eche crie assembly vnholy whiche lawfull consente denye god trulye chirches foloweth therfore israell helias mi heas iurye esaye ieremye osee sorte whome prophetes priestes people tyme hated detested worse vncircumcised meni tim ii xv straugers chirch god chirches chirche piller truth stay lyeng tabernacle liuing god receptacle idoles therfore nedefull depart cosent assembiles nothyng el wycked conspiracie agaynst god like maner man acknowledge assembly dayes beyng defiled wyth idolatrie superstition wicked doctrine whoes ful communion christian man oughte continue euen consente doctrine shall greatlye erre bee chirches haue power keyes keyes vnseperablye knytte wyth worde whyche thense quite dryuen awaye agayne bee chirches promise christe force amonge theim vvhatsoeuer ye bynde xvixix xviii xviii iohn xxxxiii c contrarywyse banyshe communion al suche doo professe selues faynedly seruantes christ therfore either promise christ vaine least respect ar chirches finally stede ministerie word thei haue scholes vngodlynesse sink kindes error therfore either respecte chirches shal remaine token whereby lawfull assembly faithfull maye seuerally knowen meetynges turkes old tyme yet remained among iewes certain peculiar prerogatiues chirch day also take fro papistes suche steppe pleased lord haue remaynyng among dissipation chirche lord hadde one made couenant iewes rather vpholden stedfastnesse selfe dydde continue wyth ryuing vngodlynesse preserued therfore assurednesse constancie goddes goodnesse remained couenant lorde neither coulde hys faythfulnesse bee blotted theyr vnfaithfulnesse neither coulde circumcision prophaned wyth vncleane handes styll signe sacramente couenante wherevppon chylderne borne lorde called hys owne whiche vnlesse speciall blessyng belonged nothyng hym hath lefte hys couenaunt fraunce italye germanye spayne englande sin prouinces haue bene oppressed wyth tyrannye antichrist yet hys couenaunte myghte remayne inuiolable firste preserued baptisme testimonie couenant whiche beyng consecrate owne mouth reteineth owne force notwythstandyng vngodlinesse man prouidence hath wrought remayne remnantes least chirch vtterly destroied oftentymes byldinges pulled downe foundation ruines remaine hath suffred chirch either ouerthrowen antichrist foundation layd euen grounde howsoeuer punishe vnthankfulnesse men despised worde suffreth horrible shaking dissipation chaunce euen wasting willed bylding half pulled downe yet remayne wheras therfore simply graunt papistes title church therfore deny chirches amog onelye contende true lawefull orderyng chirch required commmunion sacrament signes profession also specially doctrine daniel paule foretolde antichrist sitte temple goddani ixxxvii ii thess iiii v accompt bishop rome captaine stadard bearer wicked abhominable kingdome whereas hys seate placed temple god thereby meant kingdome shalbe abolish name christ chirch hereby therfore appeareth deny euen vnder tyrannie remain chirches hath prophaned vngodlinesse full sacrilege hath afflicted outeragious dominion suche hath corrupted maner killed euill damnable doctrine poisoned drinkes wherin christ lyeth halfe buried gospel ouerwhelmed godlinesse banished worshipping god maner abolished finally wherin al thing troubled therin rather appereth face babylon holye citie god summe say chirches respect lord maruelously preserueth remnauntes people soeuer dispersed scattered abroade respecte remayne token chirch specially token effectualnesse wherof neither craft deuil maliciousnesse man destroy side mark blotted discourse ought principally haue respecte vnto saye euery one assembly whole body wanteth lawfull forme chirch p iii chapter pof teacher minister chirche theyr election office nowe mete speake order lordes haue chirche gouerned although chirche onely muste rule reigne yea beare preeminence excelle gouernement bee vsed executed onely wordmathe xxvixi yet dwelleth among v visible presence presently owne mouth declare vnto v haue saied vseth ministerie men trauaile deputy transferryng right honour vnto onely mouthe might hys owne worke like workeman doo worke vseth hys instrument compelled repete agayne thynges haue already declared might dede eyther hymselfe without helpe instrumente also meane angelles many cause rather doo men meane first declareth hys good wyll toward v taketh men shall doo message world shalbe interpreter hys secrete wyll finally shall represent owne person experience proueth vayne commonlye calleth v hys temple mouthes men oute sanctuarye geueth answeres men secondly thys best profitable exercise humilitie accustometh v obey hys worde augusti lib de doctrin christi howsoeuer preached men like vnto v yea sometime inferior dignitie selfe spake heauen maruell holy oracle without delaye reuerently receiued wyth eares myndes men woulde drede power beyng presence woulde throwen downe first sight great maiesty would confounded ye infinite brightnesse silly man risen ye dust speaketh name god good testimony declare godlinesse reuerent obedience toward god hymselfe minister yelde selues willyng learne whiche yet nothyng excelleth vsii corin iiiivii therfore cause also hath hidden treasure hys heauenly wisedome brickle earthen vessel mighte haue certainer profe much estemed v moreouer nothyng fitter cherishyng mutual charitie shold bounde together one bonde one made pastor teache rest commaunded scholar receiue al one doctrine one mouth euery able enough serue himselfe neded helpe suche pride man nature euery one would despise againe despised therfore lorde hath bounde chirch knotte whiche forsawe strongest knotte holde vnitie togither hath lefte men doctrine saluation eternall life handes might communicate reste herunto paul respect wrote ephesianseph iiiiiiii one body one spirite also ye called one hope callyng one lorde one faith one baptisme one god father whiche aboue v al vnto euery one v grace geue accordyng measure gift christ wherfore saith whe gone vp hye ledde captiuitie captiue gaue giftes men wente downe selfe hee wente vp might fulfill thynges hath geuen apostle prophetes euangelistes pastor teacher vnto restoryng holy one worke ministration edifying body christ vntill com vnitie faithe knowledge sonne god perfect man measure full growen age bee child may caried euery wynde doctrine folowyng truthe charitie let v thynges growe hed euen christ whole body conioyned compacted together ioynt subministration accordyng workyng measure euery parte maketh encrease body vnto edifiyng selfe charitie wordes sheweth ministerie men god vseth gouernyng chirche chiefe synew wherby faithfull cleaue together one body also sheweth chirche otherwise preserued safe vpholden stay whyche pleased lorde repose saluation christ saieth gone vp hye myght fulfill thinges maner fulfillyng minister hath committed officeeph iiiix hath geuen grace execute woorke disposeth distributeth giftes chirche yea certayne maner geueth hym selfe present extendyng power spirite institution vain idle restoryng holy one performed body christ edified doo thinges growe hym hed doo growe together among selues brought vnitie christ prophecie flourishe among v receyue apostleseph iiiixii refuse doctrine ministred vnto v therfore goeth dissipation rather ruine destruction chirche whosoeuer either endeuoureth abolishe order speake kynde gouernement minisheth estimation thyng necessary neither lighte heate sunne meate drynke necessary nourishe susteine present life office apostle pastor necessarie preserue chirche earthe therefore haue aboue admonished god hath oftentymes suche title coulde commended dignitie thereof vnto v haue moste hye honour price moste excellent thyng testifieth geueth men singular benefite raisyng vp teacher commaundeth prophete crye oute faire feeteesa liivii math vxv xiiii luke xxvi ii corin iiiivi ii cor iii x blessed commyng bring tidyngs peace calleth apostle lyght worlde salte earthe neither coulde office bee honourably aduaunced sayde heareth heareth despiseth despiseth place playne paule seconde epistle corinthian purpose entreateth matter affirmeth therefore nothyng chirche excellent glorious ministerie gospell forasmuche administration spiriteii cor iii ix righteousnesse eternal life like sayenges serue purpose order gouerning preseruing chirch minister lord hath stablished euer growe oute estimation among v length contempt grow vse howe greate necessitie therof hath declared onely wordes also example wil shine fully cornelius light truethact xiii act ixvi sente angell heauen sende peter vnto call paule knowlege himselfe engraffe chirch spake voice sente man shoulde receiue doctrine saluation sanctification baptisme done without cause angell interpreter god doe himselfe absteine declaring wil god commaundeth man sente declare withoute cause christ onely scholemaister faithfull commytteth paule schooling man yea euen paule determined take vp thirde heauenii cor xii ii vouchsaue graunt miraculous reuelation thinges vnspeakable whoe dare despise ministerie passe ouer thyng superfluous vse wherof hath pleased god make approued example haue rule gouernement ye chirche according institution christeph iiiixii named paule first apostle prophetes thirdly euangelistes fourthly pastor laste teacher twoo last alone haue ordinarie office chirche three lord raised vp beginning hys kingdome sometime yet also rayseth vp necessitie time requireth apostle officemar xvixv appeareth commaundemente go preache gospell euery creature certaine boundes appointed vnto ye whole worlde assigned brought obedience christe spreading gospell among nation whersoeuer shall able maye eche raise vp kingdomerom xvxix xx therefore paule wente aboute proue apostleship rehearseth hath gotten christ one citie hath farre wide spred abrode gospell hath layed handes man fundation planted chirches name lorde neuer ben heard therfore apostle sente bring backe world falling awayeeph iiiixi vnto true obedience god eche stablish kingdome preaching gospell like better first bilders chirche laye fundations therof worlde prophetes calleth expositor god whatsoeuer singular reuelation excelled suche tyme either none lesse notable euangelistes vnderstande whiche dignitie lesse apostle yet office nexte vnto yea occupied roomes suche lukeluk xi timothee titus lyke paraduenture also seuentie disciple christ appointed seconde place apostlesluke xi according exposition semeth agreable woordes meaning paule three office ordeined chirche ende perpetuall onely serue tyme wherein chirches erected none least remoued moses chryst albeit denie ye afterwarde also lord hath somtyme raysed vp apostle least place euangelistes hath ben done time nedefull haue bryng backe chirche falling away antichrist yet office selfe neuerthelesse call extraordinarie hath place chirches already well set order next pastor teacher chirche may neuer lacke betwene thynke thys difference teacher appoynted beare rule discipline ministration sacramentes admonishmentes exhortation onely expounde scripture pure sounde doctrine may kept among faithfull office pastor conteineth al thynges within haue ministeries chirch continued tyme ordeined endure perpetually ioyne euangelistes apostle shall haue remayning two couple certayne maner answeryng one oure teacher lyke olde prophetes sort pastor lyke apostle office prophetes excellent reson singular gifte yt reuelation office teacher hath manner lyke order altogether endeluke vixiii gala ii xii lorde dyd choose publish abrode world new preaching gospel degre dignitie went rest although meanyng propertie worde minister chirche maye ryghtly called apostle sente lorde hys messenger yet muche behouefull yt certayne knowledge sendyng bring thing new vnheard necessarie xii whoes number paule afterwarde added garnished peculiar title aboue rest paule hymselfe dede e place geueth thys name andronicus iunias saieth haue notable among apostlesrom xvi meaneth speake properly referreth none principal degree common vse scripturemath xi yet pastor sauing eche gouerne seueral
