chirches appointed haue al one charge apostle maner thing let v yet heare playnly lord sent apostle gaue commaundemente sayd euen preache gospellmath xxviiiix baptise beleue vnto forgeuenesse synnes commaunded distribute holy signes body bloud done loe holy inuiolable perpetual law laied vpon succede apostle place wherby receiue commaundemet preache gospell minister sacramentes wherupon gather neglect thinges fasly saye yt beare person apostle pastor paule speaketh hymselfe onely sayethi corin ii tit iix lette man esteme v minister christ distributer ye misteries god againe place bishop must fast holder faithful worde according doctrine may able exhorte sounde doctrine conuince gainesaiers lyke place echwhere founde may gather also office apostle two principall partes preach gospel minister sacramentes order teachyng consisteth onely publike sermon belongeth also priuate admonitionsac xxxx paule calleth ephesian witnesse hath fled thinges wer profyt preached taught openly euery house testifying iewes grecian repentance fayth christacte xxxxxi againe little hath ceassed wyth teares admonishe euery one neither yet belongeth purpose thys present expresse al quality good pastor onely point professe call themselues pastor made ruler chirch haue idle dignitie ye doctryne christ instruct people true godlynesse minister holy misteries preserue exercise vpryght disciplineeze xiiixvii whosoeuer set watchemen chirche lord declareth vnto negligence peryshe ignorance wyll require bloud handes also pertayneth whych paule sayeth hymselfe woe vnlesse preache gospel forasmuch distributing therof comitted finally apostle performed whole worldei cor ixxvi oughte euery pastor performe hys flocke appoynted albeit assigne euery one seuerall chirches yet meane denye bonde one chirche may helpe chirches troublesome thing doe happen requireth presence asked counsell darke matter forasmuch keping peace chirche thys police necessarie sette forth euery man shoulde doe least shoulde confusely disordered runne aboute without callyng rashly runne altogether one place leaste suche carefull owne commoditie edification chirche shoulde theyr wyl leaue chirches vacante thys orderyng ought commonly kept nere may euery man contented hys owne bondes shoulde breake man charge thys inuention man ordinance god hymselfe reade paule barnabas reated priestes seuerall chirches listria antioche iconium paule hymselfe commaundeth titus shoulde appoynte priestes euery towneact xiiiixxii tit iv phi ii one place speaketh bishoppes philippes place archippus bishop colossianscolo iiii xvii act xxxviii remaineth notable sermon luke priestes chirche ephesus whosoeuer therfore shal take vpon gouernement charge one chirche let know bound law god callyng bounde soile lawiers terme made bonde fastened vnto may one moue foo e thense co mon profit require done wel orderly called one place ought himselfe thinke remouing seke deliuered shal thinke good commoditie expedient remoued place yet ought attempt priuate aduise tarry publike authoritie whereas haue without difference called bishop priestes pastor minister rule chirches according vsage scripture indifferently vseth wordes whosoeuer doe execute ministery worde geueth title bishop paul titus comauded appoint priestes euery towne immediatly added bishop must vnreprouable c place saluteth many bishop one chirchetit iv phi ii ac xxvii rom xiivii cor xiixxviii actes rehearsed called together priestes ephesus himselfe hys sermo calleth bishop noted hetherto haue recited none office stande ministerie word neither doeth paul make mention fourth chapter haue alleged epistle romaine first epistle corinthian reckeneth vp office power gift healing interpretation gouernemente caring poore omitted yt endured tyme profytable purpose tarry vpon twoo perpetually abyde say gouernemente care poore gouernoures thinke wer elder chosen people together bishop haue rule iudgemente maners vsing discipline man cannot otherwyse expound sayeth let hym ruleth carefulnesse therfore beginning euery chirch senaterom xiiviii gathered godly graue holy men iurisdiction correcting vice wherof shal speake hereafter order one age experience selfe declareth therfore thys office gouernement also necessarye age care poore committed deacon howbeit ye romaine set twoo kyndes let hym yt geueth sayeth paule place simplicitie let hym hath mercye cherefulnessero xiiix forasmuche certayne speaketh publyke office chirch must nedes twoo seueral degree unlesse iudgement deceyue first point meaneth deacon yt distributed ye almes speaketh geuen themselues loking ye poore sicke sort wer wydowes maketh mention timothei tim vx woman coulde execute publike office geue themselues seruice poore graunt thys must nedes graunt shalbe twoo sortes deacon one sort shall serue distributing thinges poore loking poore chirche themselues although worde diaconia deaconrie extendeth yet scripture specially calleth deacon chirche hath geuen charge distribute almes take care poore hath appointed stewardes common treasurie poore whoes beginning institution officeac viiii described luke actes murmuring raysed grecian ministerie poore wydowes wer neglected apostle excusyng themselues wyth saying could serue office preachyng worde ministring table required multitude yt might chosen vii honest men mighte committe loe manner deacon apostolike chirch deacon mete v haue according example wheras holy assemblie thynges done order comly nothyng wherin ought diligetly obserued stablishing order gouernmet greater peril thing done vnorderly therfore ende vnquiet troublesome men otherwyse woulde happen rashly thrust themselues teache rule expresly prouyded man without calling take vpon hym publike office chirche therfore may iudged true minister chirche first must orderly called must answere vocation say take vpon execute duty enioyned hym may oftentymes marke paule whe meaneth approue hys apostleship manner alway wyth hys faythfulnesse executing office allegeth hys callyng great minister christe dare take vpon himselfe authoritie heard chirch appointed therunto commaundement lord also faithfully performeth whych committed vnto hym greate shamefulnesse shal man watyng either shal chalenge honor himselfe haue aboue touched necessitie executing office let v entreate onely callyng discourse therof standeth foure poyntes shoulde knowe manner minister minister ought institute wyth vsage ceremonie admytted speake outwarde solemne callyng whyche belongeth publike order chirche secrete callyng wherof euery minister priuy hys conscience god hath chirche witnesse omitt good witnesse hart ambitio couetousnesse gredy desire pure feare god zele edefye chirche receiue office offered vnto v dede haue sayed necessarye euery one v wyll approue oure ministerie allowable god neuerthelesse ryghtly called presence chirche commeth vnto euil conscience wickednesse open wont also say euest priuate men called ministerie see e able execute verily learning ioined godlinesse quality good pastor certaine preparation office lord hath appointed great office first furnisheth armures required fulfill come empty vnprepared vnto whereupo paule also corinthian meante dispute officesi cor xli vi firste rehearsed giftes whiche ought haue execute office firste fower poyntes haue propounded let v goe forwarde vnto maner bishop mete choose paule doeth largely declare two place summe commeth effect none chosen sounde doctrine holy lyfe notable vicetit iix ii timo iiii whiche mighte take awaie credite procure slaunder ministery deacon elder altogether like consideration alway loked vnto vnable vnfit beare burden layed vppon themluk xxixv xxiiii xlx mar xvixv ac iviii tim vxxii say may furnished power necessarie fulfilling office christ sende apostle garnished weapon instrumentes whiche could wante paule painted image good true bishop warneth timothee defile himselfe choosing man differeth referre worde ceremonie choosing reuerente feare kept choosing hereupon come fastinges prayer luke reciteth faithful vsed made priestes wheras vnderstode meddled earnest matter durste attempt nothyng greate reuerence carefulnesse ch fely applied theselues prayer wherby myght craue god spirite counsell discretion thirde thing haue set diuision minister chosen thing certayne rule gathered institution apostle difference comon callyng rest extraordinary ministerie might made discernable notable marke behoued whiche shoulde execute shoulde called appoynted lordes owne mouth therefore tooke hande doyng furnished man election onely commaundemente god christe hereupon commeth apostle would put place iudasac ixiii durst certainly name one man brought fourth twoo lorde shoulde declare lotte whether would succede manner also mete take thys paule denyeth create apostle men manca ixii christe god father firste poynte saye men common wyth godly minister woorde man could rightly take vppon hym execution wer called god point proper singular himselfe therfore glorieth doth onely bost hath belongeth true lawful pastor also bryngeth fourth signes apostleship whe among galathians trauailing diminishe authoritie made meane disciple put office vnder ye principal apostle defende safetie dignitie hys preaching knew shot suttle deuises neded shewe himselfe al pointes nothing inferior apostle therefore affirmeth chosen iudgement men lyke common byshop mouth manifest oracle lorde himselfe man sober wil deny yt according order lawful calling bishop appointed men forasmuch many testimony scripture profe therofgal ii neither doth saying paul make contrary said sent men men forasmuch speaketh ordinary choosing minister chalengeth hymselfe yt special apostle howbeit god also appointed paule hymselfe singular prerogatiue meane tyme vsed discipline ecclesiastical calling luke reporteth thus whe apostle fastyng praying holy ghost said seperate vnto paule barnabas worke whiche haue seuerally chosen themac xiiiii purpose serued seperatio putting handes sith holy ghost hath testified election discipline chirche appointing minister men might preserued therfore lord could playner example approue suche order dyd hauing firste declared ordeyned paul apostle gentile yet willeth appointed ye chirchacte ixxiii thing may see choosyng mathias office apostleship greate importance durst iudgement choose one degree set two men middes vpo one lot fall election might haue open testimonie heauen yet policie chirch passed ouer nowe demaunded whether minister ought chosen whole chirche onely office elder haue rule discipline whether may made authoritie one man geue thys authorytie one allege whiche paule sayeth titustit iv therefore haue lefte thee creta thou shouldest appoynte euery towne priestes timothee laye handes quicklye vppon manne deceiued thinkei tim vxxii either timothee ephesus titus creta vsed kingly power either shoulde dispose thinges owne aboue reste onelye goe people good holsome counsells onely excludyng shoulde doe lysted may seme faine thing make playne lyke example luke rehearseth paule barnabas appoynted pryestes dyuerse chirches also expresseth order manner howact xiiiixxiii sayeth done voice ordeining priestes sayeth lifting vp handes euery chirche therefore two create whole multitude grecian maner election holding vp handes declare would haue euen lyke maner romaine hystories oftentimes say yt consul kept assembly created newe officer none cause receiued voice gouerned people election truely likely paule grauted timothe titus toke himselfe see wonte create byshops voice people therefore place aboue vnderstanded yt minishe nothing common ryght libertie chirch therfore ciprian sayeth well affirmeth commeth authoritie god priest chose presence people eye men publike iudgement testimonie allowed worthy mete see thys commaundement lord obserued leuiticall priestes ru viiivi num xxxxvi act ixv viii theyr consecration broughte sight people otherwise mathias added felowship apostle otherwyse seuen deacon created people seing allowing example saieth ciprian shew ordring priest ought done knowledge people standyng orderyng may iuste lawfull hath examined witnesse therfore come thus farre worde god lawfull callyng minister seme mete created consent allowaunce people pastor ought beare rule election nothing done amisse multitude eyther lightenesse euil affection disorder remaineth forme ordering assigned laste place callyng euident apostle vsed ceremonie admitted man ministerie laying handes thynke thys vsage came maner hebrues presente vnto god laying hads would haue blessed hallowed iacob blesse ephraim manassege xlviii xiiii mat xixxv ac xixvi layed hys handes vpon heds thyng lorde folowed prayed ouer infantes meaning thynke iewes ordinace law layed handes vpon sacryfices wherefore apostle layeng handes signifie offered hym god admitted ministerie albeit vsed also vppon applyed visible grace spirite howsoeuer bee thys solemne vsage ofte called man ministerie chirche consecrated pastor teacher also deacon although certayne commaundemente concernyng laying handes yet see continually vsed among apostle diligente obseruing ought v stede commaundemente truely profitable suche signe dignitie ye ministerie commeded people also ordered admonished owne libertie made bond god chirche moreouer shall vaine signe restored naturall beginnyng spirite god hath ordeined nothyng chirch vaine must thinke ceremonie sithe proceded vnprofitable tourned superstitious abuse last holden whole multitude laye handes vpon minister pastor onely howbeit vncertaine whether many alway lay handes noact v v xiii ii euident done deacon paule barnabas fewe paule himselfe place reporteth many dyd laye handes vppon timotheeii tim ivi admonishe thee saieth thou raise vp grace whiche thee laying handes epistle spoken laying handes degree priestes doo take though paule speake companie eldersi ti iiixiiii vnderstande word ordinance selfe saied make grace whiche thou haste receiued laying handes dyd create thee priest may voyde iiii chapter state olde chirche maner gouernyng vse papacie hitherto haue intreated order gouernyng chirche hath ben deliuered v pure word god ministeries institute christ nowe thynges may clerely familiarly opened also bee better fastened myndes shalbe profitable thyngs cosider forme olde chirche whiche shall represent eies certayn image god institution although byshopes tymes set soorth many canon wherin seemed expresse expressed holy scripture yet suche hedefulnesse framed order rule god word man may easily see yt behalf maner nothing disagreyng word god although myght somwhat wantyng ordinance yet sincere zeale endeuoured preserue god institution swarued muche shall bee profitable shortely gather maner obseruation haue declared thre sortes minister commended vnto v scripture al minister old chirche diuided thre order order elder wer partly chosen pastor teacher rest rule iudgement correction maners deacon committed care poore distributyng almes reders acoluthe name certaine office called clerkes trayned youthe vpwarde certain exercise serue chirche myght better vnderstande purpose appointed myght tyme come better prepared office shall shew large esa cap therfore hierome appoynted fiue order chirche reckeneth vp byshoppes priestes deacon beleuers cathecumeni rest clergie monkes geueth proper place therfore whome office teachyng enioyned named priestes euery citie chose oute theyr owne numbre one man whome specially gaue title bishoppe dissentions shoulde growe equalitie wonte come passe yet bishop aboue reste honor dignitie dominion ouer felowes office consul senate propounde matter aske opinion goe counselling monishing exhorting gouerne whole action authoritie put execution decreed common counsell office hadde bishop assemblie priestes olde writer theim selues confesse men consent brought necessitie tymes therfore hierome vpon epistle titus saith priest whiche bishop instinction deuil dissentions religion said among people paule cephas chirches gouerned common counsell elder afterwarde seedes dissentios might plucked vp care committed one man therfore priestes doo knowe custome chirche subiecte hym sette ouer lette bishop knowe aboue priest rather custom truth lordes disposyng ought gouerne chirche common together episto ad eua place teacheth howe auncient institution saith alexandria marc euangelist euen heraclas dionysius priestes didde alwaie choose one selues set hyer degree named bishop therfore euery citie company priestes whiche pastor teacher execute among people office teachyng exhortyng correctyng whyche paule appointeth bishop iix might leaue sede trauailed teachyng yonger men hadde professed themselues souldiours holy warfare euery citie appointed certain contrey shoulde take priest then accompted body chirche euery company haue said preseruation policie peace vnder one bishop whiche aboue rest dignitie subiecte assemblie brother compasse grounde vnder bishoprike great could suffise serue al office bishop euery place contrey selfe certayn place appointed priestes whiche small matter shuld execute authoritie called contreybyshops ntrey represented bishop muche belongeth office whereof nowe speake well byshops priestes bounde apply distributing word sacramentes ordeined alexandria arrius troubled churche priest preache people episto ad e socrates saith ix boke tripartite hystorie whiche yet hierome confesseth mysliketh truely counted monstrous man geuen hymselfe byshop also dede shewed himselfe true bishop therfore suche seueritie tymes minister dryuen fulfillyng suche office lorde requireth neither doo reherse maner one age alone euen gregory tyme chirche almoste decaied certainly muche degenerate auncient purenesse ben tolerable ye byshop absteine preachyng priest saith one place dieth sound hearde epi iiii homel eze actes xxxvi asketh himselfe wrathe secrete iudge goe without sounde preachyng place paule testifieth cleane bloud saying conuinced bounde shewed giltie called priestes whiche beside euils haue owne adde also deathes kyl many beyng luke warme silent doo daily see goe death calleth himselfe silent lesse diligent worke ought spareth halfe performe theyr dueti thinke would haue done man altogither sit idle therefore greate holden chirche chiefe duetie byshop fede god people worde publikely priuately edifie chirche sounde doctrine wheras euery prouince among bishop one archebishop also nicene synode ordeined patriarch whiche shoulde degree dignitie aboue archbishop perteined preseruyng discipline howbeit discourse whiche moste rarely vsed may omitted cause therfore chiefly degree ordeined thyng hapned chirche coulde well ended fewe might referred prouinciall synode greatnesse difficultie matter required greater discussyng patriarch also called synodes might appelle generall counsel gouernement ordered many called hierarchie name thinke vnpropre truly vnused scripture holy ghost willed prouide man shoulde dreame principalitie dominion gouernement chirche spoken leauyng woorde looke vpon thyng shall find olde bishop ment forge forme ruling chirch differyng lorde appointed worde neither order deacon tyme vnder apostle receiued daiely offrynges faithfull yerely reuenues chirch bestow vpon true v say distribute fede partely minister partly poore appointment bishop also yearely rendred accomptes distribution canon doo euery make byshop distributer al goodes chirch vnderstanded though hym selfe discharge care part appoynt deacon receiued common almes chirche whiche remained geuen howe muche euery one ouerseeyng whether deaco faithfully execute beloged office thus red canon ascribe apostle comaude bishop haue goodes chirche owne power put trust soules men precious muche mete haue charge moneye power thyngs may distributed poore elder deacon may ministred feare carefulnesse counsell antioche decreed cap xxxv bishop restrained meddle goodes chirche without knowledge elder deacon poynt nede make longer disputation sithe euident many epistle gregorie euen tyme otherwyse ordinance chirch muche corrupted yet obseruation continued deacon shoulde vnder bishop stewardes poore subdeacon likely beginnyng ioyned deacon vse seruice poore difference litle litle confounded archedeacons began created plentie goodes required new exacte maner disposyng epist ad nepot albeit hierome doeth say euen age charge summe reuenues possession store collection daily offrynges wherupon gregorie declareth archedeacon salon epist lib holden gilty goodes chirch perished either fraude negligence wheras geuen rede gospell people exhort theim praier admytted delyuer cuppe holy supper rather doone garnyshe office shoulde execute reuerence suche signes admonished prophane baylywike exercised spirituall function dedicate god hereby also may iudge vse maner distribution chirch good ech ye decree synodes amog old writer foud whatsoeuer ye chirch possesseth ether lad money ye patrimonie poore therfore oftetimes song soong ye bishop deacon yt shuld remembre meddle owne goodes goodes appointed necessitie poore vnfaithfully suppresse wast shalbe giltie bloud wherby admonished great feare reuerence sight god without respect person distribute due hereuppon also come graue protestation chrysostome ambrose augustine like byshopes whereby affirme owne vprightnesse people sithe equitie establyshed lawe lord whiche employ theyr seruice chirch fedde common charge chirch also many priestes age consecratyng patrimony god willingly made poore distributyng suche neyther minister wanted sustenance poore neglected yet mean time prouided minister themselues ought geue example honest sparyng shoulde haue muche wherby might abuse riotous excesse deliciousnesse wherewith susteine owne nede clergie saith hierome able liue goodes parentes take whiche poores doo commit sacrilege abuse eate drinke selues damnation first ministration free voluntarie wheras bishop deacon theyr owne faithefull vprightnesse conscience innocence life stede lawes afterward euil example grew gredinesse peruerse affection correcte faultes canon made diuided reuenues chirche fower partes whiche assigned one parte theym clergie seconde poore thyrde mayntenance reparation chirches holye buildynges fourthe poore well straungers owne contrey whereas canon geue last part bishoppe varieth nothing aboue saide diuision meane part shoulde hys owne either hymselfe alone deuoure poure oute vpon whome lyst suffice maintaine hospitalitie paule requireth orderi tim iiiii gelasius gregorie expoude gelasius bringeth reason bishop shuld chalenge thing himselfe mighte geue prisoner stranger gregorye speaketh yet playnly maner sayth sea apostolike giue commaundement bishop ordered reuenue ariseth made fower portion saie one bishop familie hospitalitie entertainment second clergie third poore fowerth repairyng chirches therfore lawfull bishop take nothing vse much enough moderate meane foode clothyng began excede either riotous expense ostentation pompe repressed felowes obeyed put dignitie whiche bestowed vpon garnishing holy thing first litle afterward chirch became somwhat richer yet behalfe still kept meane yet money bestowed therupon remained safe poore greater necessitie happened famine possessed prouince hierusalem nede coulde otherwyse relieued tripar hist lib v lib xi ca xvi cyrillus solde vesselles garmentes spente theim vppon sustenance poore lykewyse acatius bysshoppe amida whenne greate multitude persian maner starued hunger called together clergie made notable os ion god needeth neither dish cuppes neyther ateth drinketh molt vessel make thereof bothe meate ransome men miserie ad nepotia hierom also inueyeth muche gorgiousnesse temple doeth honor make mencion exuperius bishop tholosa tyme whiche caried lordes body wicker basket bloude glasse suffered poore man hungry euen nowe sayd acatius ambrose rehearseth hymselfe lib ide offic ca arrians charged hym broken holy vessel ransom prisoner vsed godly excuse sent apostle without golde gathered chirches together without golde chirche hath golde keepe bestowe geue reliefe necessity nede kepe whiche helpeth knowe muche golde siluer assyrian toke temple lorde doth priest better melt sustenace poore relief faile enemie robber god beare away lord say hast thou suffered many needy die hunger verily thou haddest golde wherof thou mightest haue ministred sustenaunce many ledde away captiue ransomed many slayne enemie hadde ben better thou shouldest saue vessel liuyng men metalles thyngs thou shalt able answer wouldest thou say feared least god temple want garnishyng wolde answer sacramentes require golde neither doo thinges please golde bought golde raunsomyng prisoner garnishyng sacrament lib epi xxxi xxxii summe see true man saieth place soeuer chirche possessed store nedy againe bishop hath nothing poores wee haue rehearsed ministeries olde chirche whyche ecclesiasticall writer make mention rather certain exercise preparation appointed office holy men yt might leaue store chirch receiued charge gouernance discipline yong men whiche consent authoritie parentes professed theim selues souldiours spirituall warfare framed tender age shoulde come vnskilfull rawe executyng office instructed suche beginnynges called clerkes woulde deede propre name hadde rather bene geuen name grewe errour et v corrupt affection forasmuche peter calleth whole chirche clergie say lordes inheritance institution selfe holy profitable whiche wolde consecrate selues seruice chirch brought vp vnder kepyng bishop none minister chirche well informed aforehande youth bothe sucked holy doctrine seuere discipline put certayn continuyng qualitie grauitie holy life estranged worldly care accustomed spirituall care study yong souldiors certayn counter ai e skirmish instructed learn true earnest fight also certayn rudimentes whereby exercised clerkes promoted office therfore first committed clerkes charge open shutte chirch named ostiarii doorekeepers afterwarde called coluthi folowers whiche waited vpon bishop household seruices continually accompany hym fyrste honour sake suspition arise moreouer lyttle little might become knowen people get themselues commendation also might learne abyde sight men speake men made priestes came foorth teache abashed shame therfore place appointed reade pulpet maner promoted degree shewe proofe euery one diligence seueral exercise till wer made subdeacon onely meanyng rather grosse beginnyngs suche office accompted among true ministeries chirche wheras said fyrst second point callyng minister maner men ought choose greate religious carefulnesse ought vse matter therin old chirch hath folowed prescribed order paule example apostle wont come together choose pastor great reuerence careful callyng vpon name god beside forme examination wherby tried life doctrine wer chosen rule paul onely somwhat offended herein greate seueritie wolde require bishop paule requiredi iiii specially processe ti e required vnmaried life ye point obseruation agreyng paules description whiche made thirde poynt say ought institute minister kept alway one order olde tyme none receiued company clerkes without consent people muche cyprian laboureth earnestly excuse appointed one aurelius reder without askyng aduise chirche lib epist yt done besyde custom though without reason saith ordering clerkes dere brother wont first aske aduise common counsell wey maners deseruynges euery one lesser exercise muche perille chosen long proofe great office therfore consent people therin essed asked afterward degree also except bishoprike people commonly left iudgement choise bishop priestes shuld examine mete worthy sauyng peraduenture new priestes appointed paroches behoued multitude place namely consent neither meruaile people behalfe little carefull kepyng owne righte man made subdeacon shewed long profe himselfe clerk vnder seueritie disciplin vsed ben tried degree made deacon thense came honour priesthode behaued hymselfe faithfully man promoted bene dede triall many yeares eies people many canon punishe faultes chirche coulde troubled euill priestes deacon vnlesse neglected remedy howbeit priestes also alwaye required consent citie first canon testifieth lxvii distinction whiche fathered vpon anacletus finally al admission order therfore doone certaine appointed tymes yeare priuily crepe without consent faithfull shoulde muche easynesse bee promoted without witness choosyng bishop people libertie long preserued none shoulde thruste accepted therfore forbidden counsell antioche none thrust thyng also leo first doeth diligently confirme episto cap hereupon came sayenges let chosen clergie people greater number shall require agayne let hym shall beare rule ouer chosen muste nedes made ruler beeyng vnknowen examined thruste violence agayne let hym chosen bothe chosen clerkes desired people let hym bee consecrate prouince iudgemente metropolitane holy father toke great hede libertie people shoulde meane diminished general synode gathered together constatinople order nectarius wold doo without allowance whole clergie people testified epistle synode rome therfore whe bishop apoint successor otherwise stablished vnlesse whole people confirm wherof haue onely example epist theod lib ca also forme augustine naming eradius theodorite reherseth peter named athanasius successour addeth order priestes confirmed magistrate nobilitie people approued allowyng showte graunte dede also good reason stablished counsell laoditia yt electio lefte multitude scarsely happeneth time cap many heade well order thyng one meanyng commonly true vncertayne communaltie diuided contrary affection perill vsed good remedie fyrste clerkes choose chosen presented magistrate senate chiefe men people consultation thoughte election good confirmed choose dyd rather allowe matter moued multitude whiche although wer bounde fore iudgementes yet thereby coulde lesse bee disordered began multitude done onely lerne chiefly desire desire people hearde clergie dyd choose hym neyther lawfull clergie appoynt listed neyther bound obey foolish desire people leo appointeth order place episto lxxxvii saieth loked desire citezens people testimony iudgemente honorable election clerkes againe let holden testimonie honorable subscription clerkes consente order communaltie reason saieth suffereth otherwise done nothing el meaneth decree ye sinode laodicea clergie chiefe people shoulde suffer themselues carryed away vndiscrete multitude rather wisedome grauitie shoulde represse people foolish affection tyme nede require thys order choosyng yet force tyme gregorie likely endured long remayne many epistle hys geue euident testimonie thys mater ofte hath doe creating newe bishop vseth write clergie order people sometyme also ruler accordyng gouernemente citie appoynted reason disordered state chirche committeth bishoppe adioyning charge ouerseing election yet alwaye requireth solemne decree strengthened subscription yea one constantius create bishop milain lib ii ep lxix many millane reason inuasion barbarous nation fled genu thoughte election could otherwyse lawful vnlesse also called together gaue assente yea yet fyue hundred yeres paste sin pope nicolas decreed thus election byshop rome cardinall bishop shoulde beginne shoulde ioyne reste clergie distin xxiii cap nomine laste election shoulde confirmed consente people ende reciteth decree leo whiche euen nowe alleged commaundeth thense forth force malice wicked men shal preuaile clerkes make true election compelled departe citie yet commaundeth people present emperours coosent farre perceiue required twoo chirches rome constantinople twoo seates ye empire wheras ambrose sent milain wt power fro ualentinian gouerne electio new bishop yt extraordinarily done reason greuous faction wherewith citezens boyled amog themselues rome olde tyme emperours authoritie great force creating bishop gregory sayeth set commaundement gouernemente chirche epi v lib yet solemne vsage desired people manner yt clergie people appointed bishop clergie forthwith moue ye emperour shoulde eyther allowance cofirme election disalowance vndoe neither ye decree gratian gathereth together repugnante custome wherin nothing el saied yt wise suffred yt takig away yt canonical electio king appoint bishop lust ye metropolitan cosecrate none yt wer promoted violente power one thing spoile chirche right al transferred luste one man thyng graunt thys honor kyng emperour hys authoritie may confirme lawfull election foloweth entreate forme minister chirche admitted office election thys latines called ordination consecration grekes haue called cheirotonia lifting vp handes somtyme also cheirothesia laying handes howbeit cheirotonia properly called kynde election men consentes declared holding vp hand remayneth decree nicene counsell metropolitane shoulde mete together al bishop prouince order hym chose hindered either length waie sickenesse necessitie yet three ye least shoulde mete abset letter testifie consente thys canon discontinuance grewe vse afterwarde renewed many sinodes least many excuse therefore commaunded presente might haue grauer tryall learnyng manner hym ordered matter done withoute tryall appeareth cipryans wordes old tyme wonte called election present election thys ende wer gouerners nothyng troublesomly done multitude sayd people haue power eyther choose worthy priestes refuse vnworthy within litle addeth wherfore according ye tradition god apostle epi iiii lib diligently kept holden yet holden v also manner throughoute al prouinces ryght celebration orderynges bishop adioyning prouince come together people gouernor ordered bishop chosen presece people somtime slowly gathered together perill least would abuse delay occasyon ambitious suing thought enoughe election made shoulde mete allowance vpon lawful examination consecrate hym eche done without exception little little diuerse manner grewe vse chosen shoulde resorte metropolitane citie fetche ordering whiche came passe rather ambition deprauation firste institution good reason long authoritie see rome nowe encreased came place yet worse custome bishoppes almoste italie shoulde fetche theyr consecration thense whiche maye note epistle gregory onely fewe city whiche easily geue place auncient right preserued example millain lib ii ep lxix xlvi paraduenture onely metropolitane city kepte priuilege byshoppes prouince wonte come together chiefe citie consecrate archebishoppe ceremonie laying handes reade ceremony vsed sauyng solemne assemblie bishoppes certayne apparell wherby might distinctly knowen priestes ordered also priestes deacon onely layeng handes euery bishop wt copany priestes ordered priest although thyng yet bishop went done guiding therfore ordering called wherupon olde writer haue oft thys saying priest differeth bishop thyng hath power orderyng pthe v chapter olde forme gouernement vtterly ouerthrowen tyranny papacie good set men eies order gouerning chirche see rome champion therof kepe thys daye whole image hierachie whiche continually haue mouth compare order first olde chirche haue described comparison may appeare maner chirch haue vse title charge rather ouerwhelme v best begin calling see maner men order called ministerie afterwarde shal consider faythfully execute office wil geue first place bishop woulde god thys might honor haue firste place thys discourse matter selfe doth suffer one touche thing neuer lightly without great shame yet remember kind writing occupyed wil suffer talke ought framed onely simple doctrine flowe abrode beyonde due boundes let som one haue vtterly lost shame answere maner bishop thys day comonly chosen truely growen much vse haue examination learning respect learning choose lawyer rather brawle courte preach chirch certain hudred yeres hath scarcely ben euery hundreth man chosen yt vnderstode thyng holy doctrine therfore spare ye former age yt wer muche better haue ye present chirche questio iudgement manner shall fynde yt haue almost none olde canon would haue iudged vnworthy yt dronkarde whoremonger yt also cleane fro thys wickednesse either dycer hunter dissolute som part hys lyfe lighter faultes ye old canon exclude man fro bishop great absurditie yt child scarcely ten yeres olde pope graut made bishop ar growe shamelessnesse seslesse dulnesse dreaded extreme yea monstruous wicked vtterly abhorring sense nature hereby appeareth religious election negligence carelesse election al right people taken away desiringes assentinges subscribinges al thynges vanished whole power transferred canon onely bestowe bishoprike vpon afterwarde bryng hym forth sight people worshypped examined leo cryeth syde reason suffreth pronounceth violent imposition ciprian testifieth procedeth law god yt shoulde done consent people sheweth contrary manner repugnant worde god decree many sinodes doe seuerely forbid otherwyse done done commaunde voyde thynges true remayneth papacie canonical election neyther god law ecclesiasticall lawe although euil yet shal able excuse thys haue spoyled chirche right say corruption tymes required appointing bishop hatred affection preuailed people magistrate righte sounde iudgemente therefore rule thereof shoulde geuen admit verily thys extreme remedie mischiefe despeired case sith medicine selfe hath appeared hurtfull disease new euil also remedied say exactly prescribed canon ought folowe election doute people olde tyme dyd vnderstande bounde moste holy lawes saw rule set worde god cam together choose bishop onely voyce god wherby describeth true image bishop oughte worthyly value infinite thousandes canon neuerthelesse people corrupted euill affection regarde lawe equitie thys day though good lawes written yet remayne buried paper yet part vsed men maners yea alowed though done good reason dronkardes whoremonger dycers commonly promoted thys honor litle say bishoprikes rewardes adultery bawderies geuen hunter falconer thoughte gaily well bestowed way excuse haynous indignitie much wicked people say olde tyme good canon god worde prescribed bishop ought vnreprouablei timo iiii teacher fyghter c therfore charge choosyng remoued people men forsoth worde god heard among tumultes seditious partakinges people thys day remoued agayne men onely breake lawes casting away shame wantonly couetously ambitiously mingle confounde god men mater together lye say deuised remedie often rede olde tyme chirches tumultes choosing bishop yet neuer man durst think taking away authoritie people wayes whereby might either preuent faultes amend alredy comitted tell people began negligente making election caste care vppon priestes litle belonging abused thys occasion vsurpe tyranny themselues whiche afterwarde stablished newe canon set forth ordering nothing el mere mockage shewe examination sette vaine hungry wanteth euen coloure therefore wheras place prince haue couenant obteyned bishop rome themselues mighte name bishop therin chirche suffered new losse election taken awaye onely canon right violently taken verily stolen truely fowle exaple court sent bishop possesse chirches worke godly prince absteine fro corruption wicked spoiling chirche thrust vnto people bishop haue desyred least free voice allowed vnorderly manner hath long agoe ben chirches gaue occasion prince take presentation bishop owne handes rather gifte men nothing belonged whiche lesse wrongfully abuse loe noble calling reason whereof bishop boste themselues successor apostle say authoritie create priestes belongeth onely lewdly corrupte olde institution doe ordering create priestes rule fede people sacrificer sacrifice likewyse consecrate deacon nothyng true propre office ordeine onely certayne ceremony aboute chalice paten dist lxx cap sinode chalcedon contrarywise decreed orderynges absolutely geuen saye place shoulde therewithall assigned ordered shal exercise office decree twoo cause profitable first chirche shoulde burdened superfluous charge shoulde spente vppon idle menne whiche shoulde geuen poore secondly whiche ordered shoulde thynke promoted honor office committed vnto execution wherof bounde solemne protestation romishe maisters whiche thynke nothing religion cared bellye firste dooe expounde title reuenue maye suffice susteyne whether lyuelhode benefice therfore order deacon priest without takyng care ought minister geue order ryche enoughe fynde themselues man admitt thys title whiche decree counsell requireth shoulde yerelye reuenue sustenance later canon condemned bishop penaltie finde ordered without sufficient title meane restraine muche easy admitting hath ben also sutteltie deuised mocke penaltie ordered naming title whatsoeuer promiseth wilbe content therewith shift driuen action finding passe ouer thousande fraudes herein vsed doe falsly name vaine title benefice wherupon make fiue shillinges yere vnder secrete couenante doe borrowe benefice promise wil restore againe somtime restore misteries although grosser abuse taken away alway absurditie appoint priest assigne place also order man sacrifice true ordinance priest called ye gouernement ye chirche deacon called gatherig almes dede many pompes shadow show may haue reuerence among simple among haue sounde witt ca disguisinges auaile sounde stuffe trueth vnderneth vse ceremony aboute either fetched oute iewishnesse fayned themselues better forbeare true examination nothyng passe vppon shadowe reteine people consent thyngs necessarie make mention cal shadowe folishe gesturinges mete laughed framed fonde colde couterfaiting antiquitie bishop haue deputy whiche orderyng may enquire learning whether rede mass whether decline comon nowne yt shall light vpo reding coniugate verbe know ye significatio one worde necessarie yt coning enough costrue verse yet put backe fro priesthode faile euen ye childishe rudimentes yt bryng money commendatio fauor like sorte brought altare ordered asked thrise tong vnderstanded whether worthy honor one answereth neuer saw nothing want forme hath ye part play worthy may man blame reuerende father mockyng open sacrilege doe withoute shame laughe scorne god men long possession therof thynke nowe lawful whosoeuer dare one open hys mouth agaynst euident haynous wicked doinges forthwith haled punishment death thoughe one olde tyme disclosed abrode holy misteries cere would thys thought god much behaue theselues better bestowyng benefice thing one ioined wt ordering altogether separate among diuerse maner bishop onely conferre benefice wherof ar said haue ye coferring haue ye ful right haue ye presetatio reteine onely tittle collation honor sake also nomination scholes resignation either simple made cause eschange commendatorie writinges preuentions whatsoeuer sorte also behaue themselues none reproche thing affirme scarcely euery hundreth benefice bestowed daye papane without simonie olde writer defined simonie say bye ready money shewe one twentie commeth benefice without bye commendation either kinred alliance promoteth authoritie parentes pleasure get themselues fauor finally benefice geuen end prouide chirches receiue therefore call benefice worde sufficiently declare make accompt beneficial giftes prince whereby either get fauor soldiars rewarde seruices omit rewardes bestowed vpon barber cooke moile kepers dreggishe men nowe iudicial courtes doe ring matter aboute benefice man may saye nothyng el pray cast afore dog hunt thys tollerable euen heard called pastor haue broken possession chirche ferme enemie haue gotten brawlyng law haue bought money haue deserued fylthy seruices child yet scantly able speake haue receiued inheritance vncles kinsman bastardes father woulde euer licentiousnesse people though neuer corrupt lawlesse haue gone farre also monstrous one man saye manner man truely suche one gouerne himselfe sette gouerne fiue six chirches man may see dayes prince courtes yong men haue thre abbaties twoo bishoprikes one archbishopryke commonly canon fiue six seuen benefice wherof haue care receiuing reuenues obiecte eche cryed againste woorde god hath long agoe cessed estimation among obiect haue many seuere penall ordinance many counsel made agaynst thys wickednesse also boldly despise oft list say monstrous wycked doinges vtterly god nature gouernement chirche one robber shall oppresse many chirches one shoulde called pastor whiche presente flocke thoughe woulde yet suche shamelessenesse couer suche abhominable filthinesse wyth name chirche deliuer selues blame also god lewdenesses conteined holy succession merit wherof boste wrought chirche may perishe nowe whiche seconde marke iudging lawfull pastor let v see faithfully exercise office priestes created monkes call secular first twoo company vnknowen olde chirch profession monkes haue suche place chirche olde tyme chosen monastery clergie cessed monkes gregorie whoes tyme muche dregges yet suffered confusion made epi lib wylleth put clergie bee made abbot man rightly together monke clerke sith one hinderance aske well fulfylleth hys offyce canon declare vnmete pray answere forsoth allege vnto vntimely borne decree innocente boniface whereby monkes receiued honor power priesthode mighte still abide monastery reason euery vnlearned asse sone hath one possessed sea rome may one worde ouerthrowe antiquitie matter shall speake hereafter lette suffice time purer chirche holden great absurditie monke dyd execute office priesthode hierome sayeth doeth execute office priest couersant amog monkes maketh hymselfe one common people ruled priestes althoughe graunt dutie mendicantes doe preache monkes either sing muble vp mass dennes though either christ willed nature office suffereth priestes made purposeact xxxxiii wheras scripture plainly testifieth priestes office rule owne chirche wicked prophanation turne way yea vtterly change holy institution god ordered expresly forbydden ye thinges god commaundeth priestes song soong let monke contente cloister presume minister sacramentes execute thyng belonging publyke offyce let deny open mockerie god priest made purpose absteine true naturall office hath name may haue thing come secular priestes partly beneficed men call saye haue benefice whereupon liue partly doe lette daily laboure hyre massing singing liue stipende gathered thereupon benefice haue either care soules bishoprikes cure paroches stipendes deintie men gett liuing singing prebendes canonshippes personage dignity chaplainship suche howbeit sin thynges nowe turned vpside downe abbaties priory geuen boyes priuilege say common vsuall custome concerning hirelinges gett theyr lyuing daye daye shoulde dooe otherwyse dooe seruile shamefull manner geue oute selues gayne specially sith greate multitude nowe world swarmeth therfore dare beg openly forasmuch thinke little profite way go like hungry dog importunacie barkyng enforce men againste willes somewhat thruste bealy would goe expresse wordes howe greate dishonour chirch honor office priesthod come point haue ende therfore mete reader looke hande suche long declaration may proportionall heynous indignitie brefely saie office priesthod woorde god prescribethi cor iiii xxi auncient canon requyre fede chirche gouerne spirituall kyngdome christe suche sacrificer haue none work wage making market mass onely idle office also haue office exercise place assigned teach haue flocke gouerne finally nothyng lefte theim altar wherupon sacrifice christ offer god deuyls shall see place doo touche outwarde faultes onely inwarde euill whiche sticketh faste roote institution adde saying whiche sound yll eares true must speake degree bee accompted canon deanes chaplain prouostes fedde idle benefice seruice doo chirche haue put selues preachyng worde care discipline ministration sacramentes muche troublesome burden haue remaynyng wherby may boast theimselues true priestes singing forsoothe pompe ceremony purpose alledge custome vse prescription long tyme agayne syde doo laye vnto definition christ wherby hath expressed vnto v bothe true priestes ought haue accompted beare hard lawe submit themselues christes rule least let suffer matter determined authoritie primitiue chirche case shall neuer better state iudged old canon haue degenerate canon haue ben priest old time rule chirche common bishop bee companion office pastor chapiter dignity call doo nothyng belong gouernyng chirch much lesse chapleinships dregges like name accompt shall make truely word christe vsage chirch excludeth honor priesthode yet stiffely holde priestes must plucke visour shall fynde whole profession moste strange farre remoued office priestes bothe whiche apostle describe vnto v whiche required primitiue chirche therfore suche order title soeuer notified sithe newe beyng verily neyther vpholden institution god auncient vsage chirche ought haue place description spiritual gouernement chirche hath receiued consecrate lordes owne mouth rather haue speake simply grossely muche chaplain canon deanes prouostes idle bealies sort much litle fynger touch small parcell office whiche necessarily required priestes suffred wrongfully taking fals honor vpon selues breake holy institution christ remaine bishop person paroches wold god striue retein office wold willyngly graunt vnto theim haue godly excellent office dyd execute accompted pastor forsake chirches committed cast care vpon doo pastor office doo nothyng vsurer neuer stirred foote oute citie woulde professe himselfe plowman keper vineyarde souldiour ben continually bataile campe hadde neuer seene iudiciall court bookes would boast lawyer could abide stinkyng folie men doo somwhat absurdly seeme called lawfull pastor chirche yet many one doeth muche shewe exercise gouernement chirch many doo life long deuoure reuenues chirches neuer come muche loke vpon doo one yeare either come themselues sende stewarde nothyng lost letting ferme corruption fyrst crept would enioy kynde vacation exempted themselues priuiledges nowe rare example haue one resident chirch esteme theim none otherwise farmes ouer whiche sette vicar baylies farmer naturall reason reiecteth pastor flocke neuer sawe one shepe therof appeareth euen tyme gregorie certaine seedes mischief ruler chirches began negligent teachyng homil xvii dooeth one place greuousely complayne worlde saieth full priestes yet haruest seldome workemen founde dede take vpon v office priest fulfyll woorke office againe haue bowelles charitie wyll seeme lordes acknowledge selues father change place humilitie aduauncyng lordlynesse agayne pastours whyche receyue rewarde workemen fallen outwarde busynesse take hand one thyng performe leaue ministerie preachyng punishement see called bishop keepe name honor vertue sith vseth great sharpnesse word wer lesse continuyng lesse diligent office pray would say saw bishop almost none truely fewe rest scarcely euery hundreth man one life goe vp pulpet men bee come suche madnesse commonly compted thyng base dignitie bishop make sermon people tyme bernarde thinges somwhat decayed see also sharpe chidynges inueyeth agaynst whole order whiche yet likely haue ben muche purer nowe man doo well wey examine outewarde forme ecclesiasticall gouernement daie vnder papane shall fynde theuishe corner wherin robber doo licenciously range without lawe measure truely thinges vnlike institution christe yea contrarye degenerate auncient ordinance maners chirch repugnant nature reason greater iniurie done christ pretend name defence disordred gouernement say pillers chirch chief bishop religion vicar christ heds faithfull power apostle succession come vnto v alway braggyng folly though talked vnto stockes oft shal boast aske agayn haue common apostle speake inheritably descendyng honor may geuen men eue lye slepyng office preachyng whiche muche flee lykewise affirme kyngedome tyrannie antichrist answer reuerende hierarchie ofte praised notable holy men though holye father commended ecclesiasticall hierarchie spirituall gouernement deliuered hande hande apostle dreame mysshapen waste disordred heape bishop part either rude ass know first common principle faith sometyme childre yet newe come nourse learneder whiche yet rare example thinke bishoprike nothyng el title gloriousnesse magnificence persones chirches thinke fedyng flocke showemaker doeth plowyng thinges confounded babylonicall dispersyng remaineth one steppe whole ordinance father descende maners shalbe light worldemath vxiiii whiche christ requireth salte earth holynesse may perpetuall rule iudge degree men day il spoken riot wantonnesse deyntynesse finally kynde lustes degree men either fitter conninger maisters al deceit fraude treson breach faith great connyng boldnesse doo hurt passe ouer disdainfulnesse pride extorcio crueltie passe ouer dissolute licenciousnesse al part lyfe suffering wherof worlde weried feared seme enforce thyng muche one thyng say selues shall bee able denie bishop almoste none parson paroches hundreth man iudgement geuen maners accordyng olde canon either excommunicate lest put office seme say somwhat incredible farre auncient discipline growen vse commaunded exacter trial maners clergie truth let goe ye fight vnder standerd guiding see rome let boste among themselus order prestehode order haue truely euident yt neither christ apostle father old chirch nowe let deacon come forthe holy distributing haue goodes chirch howbeit nowe create deacon purpose enioyne nothing el minister altar rede sing gospell wote trifle nothing almes nothing care ye poore nothing function olde tyme executed speake institution haue respect doo dede office onely steppe towarde priesthoode one thyng kepe deacon place masse doo represente voide image antiquitie receiue offryngs consecration auncient maner communion supper faithfull kisse one offer almes altar first signe afterward liberalitie shewed charitie deaco poore men steward receiued whiche geuen distribute nowe almes cometh poore throwen sea therfore mocke chirche lying deaconrie truely therin haue nothyng like neither institutio apostle auncient vsage destribution good haue conueied way haue framed nothyng deuised vnorderly theues haue cutte men throtes diuide praye among quenchyng light god word though chirch slaine thinke whatsoeuer dedicate holy v laid open pray spoile therfore making diuision euery one hath snatched hymselfe muche coulde al old order haue declared troubled vtterly wiped rased bishop priestes city whiche made riche pray tourned canon haue made hauocke chiefe part among appereth partition vnorderly day striue bou de whatsoeuer diuision prouided one halfpeny goodes chirch come poore whoes ben half part least ye canon geue fowerth part name fowerth parte therfore appoint ye bishop bestow vpon hospitalitie duty charitie speake clerk ought portion vse ought bestow haue sufficiently declared rest apointed temple buildyngs expense ought open poore necessitie praye one sparke feare god hart wold thei abide burden consciece yt al yt eate wherwith clothed cometh thefte yea sacrilege sith ar litle moued iudgemet god least think yt men endued wit reason woulde persuade haue goodly well framed order chirche wont boaste let answer shortly whether deaconrie licence steale robbe denie shall also compelled confesse haue deaconrie left muche among disposition goodes chirch openly tourned spoilyng full sacrilege vse faire colour say dignitie chirch magnificece vncomlily vpholden haue secte shamelesse dare openly boaste fulfylled prophecy wherby old prophet describe gloriousnesse kyngdome christpsalme lxxiix esa liii lxvi kingly gorgeousnesse seen priestly order vaine say god hath promised thynges chirche kinges shall come shall worshyp thy sight shal bryng thee giftes arise arise clothe thee thy strength syon clothe thee garmentes thy glorie hierusalem shall come saba bryngyng golde incense speakyng praise lorde cattell cedar shalbe gathered together thee tarie long vpon confutyng lewdnesse seare least seme fonde therfore lose woordes vaine aske iew would abuse testimony solution would geue uerily woulde reprehende dullnesse transferred thinges fleshe worlde spiritually spoken spirituall kingdome christ know prophetes vnder image earthly thyngs paint vnto v heauenly glorie god ought shine chirche chirch neuer lesse abundance blessing whiche wordes expresse time apostle yet al confesse force kingdom christ chiefly florished abroade mean saying whatsoeuer precious hye excellent ought made subiect lord namely spoken kynges shall submit scepter christ shall throwe downe crownes feete shall dedicate goodes chirch wil say better fully performed tha theodosius casting away purple roabe leauyng ornamentes empire one comon people submitted god chirch solemne penance lyke godly prince bestowed endeuors care preserue pure doctrine chirche cherishe defende sounde teacher howe priestes tyme exceded superfluous richesse sentence synode aquileia ambrose chief sufficiently declareth glorious pouertie priestes lorde truely bishop time richesse wherwith myght haue set chirches honor thought true ornamentes chirche knewe nothyng office pastor glister shew selues proudly deintynesse fare gorgeousnesse garment great train seruantes stately palace folowed kept humblenesse modestie yea pouertie christ holily apointed among minister may long point let v gather short summe farre dispesation dissipasion good chirch vsed differeth true deaconrie whiche bothe worde god comendeth vnto v auncient chirche obserued whiche bestowed vpon garnishyng temple say ill bestowed measure vsed whiche bothe nature holy thyngs appointeth apostle holy father haue prescribed doctrine example like thing seen day temple whatsoeuer framed wil say auncient sparyng honest meane reiected nothing pleaseth sauoureth riot corruption tymes mean tyme farre hauyng due care liuely temple would rather suffer many thousand poore perish hunger would breake least chalice cruet releue nede may pronounce selfe thyng greuously would haue godly reader thinke vpon happen exuperius bishop tholosa euen nowe rehearsed acatius ambrose suche raised deathe would say truly would allow great necessitie poore richesse maner superfluous tourned way admit speake nothyng v vpon bestowed although poore many way hurtfull behalfe profitable leaue speake men goodes dedicate christ therfore disposed shall vaine say part bestowed vpon christ whiche haue wasted otherwise commaunded howbeit confesse truthe muche ordinarie reuenue chirche abated expense ar bishopriks welthy abbaties fatte finally neither many large benefice may serue fill gluttonie priest seke spare selues persuade people superstition turne shoulde bestowed vpon poore builde temple sette vp image bye iewels gette costly garmentes gulfe dayly almes consumed reuenue receiue landes possessio el shall say haue already said men eye see faithfulnesse whiche called bishop abbot dispose greatest parte madnesse seeke ecclesiasticall order mete whose lyfe ought haue ben singular exaple frugalitie modestie continence humilitie contende royaltie prince number goodes gorgiousnesse house deintynesse apparell fare howe much contrary office eternall inviolable commaudement god forbiddeth desirous filthy gainetit ivii biddeth bee contente simple liuyng onely lay handes vpon townes castels also violently entre vpon greatest lordship finally possesse forceably empire despise worde god answere auncient decree synodes wherby decreed bishop haue small lodgyng farre chirche meane fare householde stuffe conciliu carthag iiii cap xiiii xv say praise synode aquileia pouertie reported glorious priestes lorde perhappes vtterly refuse muche rigorous whiche hierome aduiseth nepotianus poore men stranger among christ guest may knowe table addeth ashamed denie glory bishop prouide goodes poore shame al priestes study owne richesse receiue must condemne themselues shame nedefull place speake hardly sithe meanyng nothyng el shew among lawfull order deaconry long ago taken away may glorie title comendation chirche thinke haue already sufficiently shewed vi chapter pof supremicie see rome hitherto haue rehersed order chirch whiche gouernement olde chirch afterwarde corrupted tymes thensefoorthe abused doo nowe popishe chirche reteyne onely name dede nothyng el visours comparison godly reader might iudge manner chirch romanists haue whoes sake make v schismatikes haue departed fro hed top whole order say supremicie see rome wherby trauaile proue haue catholike chirch haue yet touched toke beginning neither fro institution christ vse old chirch former partes whiche haue shewed haue proceded antiquitie wickednesse tymes vtterly degenerate haue put alltogether newe forme yet go persuade worlde chiefe maner onely bonde vnitie chirch cleaue see rome continue obedience therof rest say principally vppon stay take away chirche v claime themselues kepe head vpon whiche vnitie chirch hangeth withoute whiche chirche muste needes fall asunder bee broken piece thus thynke chirche maimed headlesse body vnlesse subiect see rome head therfore talke hierarchie way take beginnyng principle bishop rome vicar christe whyche head chirche steede president vniuersall chirche otherwyse chirche well ordred vnlesse see doo holde supremicie aboue therfore also bee examined sort may omitt nothyng perteineth iust gouernement chirche let therfore principall point question whether necessary true forme hierarchie call ecclesiasticall order one see aboue bothe dignitie power may heade whole bodye make chirche subiect vniust lawes laye necessitie vppon without worde god therfore aduersaries proue whiche require must first shew disposition ordeined christ purpose alledge lawe hye priesthode also hye iudgement god institute hierusalem easy geue solution many wayes one way doo satisfie first reason compelleth extende whole worlde profitable one nation yea rather order one nation whole worlde shall farre different iewes ech side compassed idolatrers diuersely drawen varietie religion god appointed place worshippyng middest part lande ordeined ouer one head bishop haue regard vnto might better kepte together vnitie religion spred abroade whole worlde doeth see altogether absurditie gouernemet east west geue one man effect much affirme whole worlde ought gouerned one ruler one piece lande hath mo ruler one yet reason ought made example folowed man ignorant hie bishop figure christ sin priesthode remoued right must also remoued remoued truely pope bold shamelessely boasthebr viixii draweth title himselfe christe whiche alone susteineth office without vicar successor resigneth honor none priesthode consisteth doctrine onely appeasyng god christe hath fully wrought death intercession whiche nowe vseth father therfore cause bynd v example perpetuall rule whiche wee haue seen enduryng tymemat xvixviii ioh xxixv new testament haue nothing bryng foorth proofe opinion saied one thou art peter vpon stone builde chirche agayne peter louest thou fede shepe admittyng strong proues must first shewe whiche commaunded fede flocke christ hath power comitted ouer chirches bynd lose nothing el ruler world peter receiued commaudement lordi pe vij exhorteth priestes fede chirch hereby may gather sayeng christ either nothyng geuen peter rest peter egally comunicate power receiuediohn xx xiii striue vainly haue place cleare exposition mouthe christ bynd lose say reteine forgeue sinnes maner binding loosing whole scripture ech sheweth paule wel declarethii cor v xviii xxvi saith minister gospel haue comaundement reconcile men god also haue power punishe refuse benefite shamefully wrest place make mention binding loosing haue already shortly touched litle hereafter shal haue occasion declare large good se onely gather famous answere christ peter promised hym keyes kyngdome heauen sayed whatsoeuer bounde earth shoulde bounde heauen agree vpon worde keyes maner binding contention shall cesse pope himselfe wil gladly geue ouer charge enioined apostle ful trauaile griefe shake hym pleasure without gaine forasmuch heauens opened vnto v doctrine gospell fit metaphore expressed ye name key men bound loosed wise faith reconcileth god belefe bindeth pope take thys onely vpo thinke wil yt would either enuye stryue successio trauailsome nothing gaineful pleaseth ye pope hereupo groweth ye beginning cotentio christ promised peter therfore gather ye mater selfe yt nothing meant ye dignitie office apostle seuered ye charge definition whiche haue rehearsed receiued shamelesly reiected nothing geuen peter yt also commo fellowes otherwise wrong done ye person maiestie doctrine halt crye side auaileth pray run vpo thys rocke shal proue preaching one gospell enioyned al ye apostle also al alike furnished wt power bynde loosemat xviii xx iohn xxxxiii christ say appointed peter prince ye whole chirch promised yt would geue hym ye keyes yt promised one place gaue also al rest deliuered handes power graunted al promised one wherin shal aboue hys felowes herein say excelleth receiued common together wyth seuerally hymselfe geuen comon answere wt ciprian augustine christ purpose prefer one set vnitie chirche de sim cleri thus sayeth ciprian yt god person one gaue ye keyes signifie ye vnitie rest ye thyng peter endued like partaking honor power beginning take vnitie chirche christ may shewed one augustine saieth peter misterie chirche homil ioh l homil xi lorde would say hym wil geue thee keyes sayed peter chirche hath ye chirche haue peter receiued ye keyes betokened ye whole chirch place al asked peter answered thou art christ said wil geue thee ye key though alone receiued power binding loosing wheras one said one al receiued al bearing perso vnitie therfore one al vnitie thou art peter vpon rocke bilde chirchemat xvixviii red spoken though christ spake thing peter paule peter himselfe speaketh christian paule maketh christ chiefe corner stoneeph iixx vpon bilded together growe holy temple lorde peter biddeth v liuely stone founded vpon chosen precious stonei pe iiv doe ioynt coupling together god cleaue also together among selues say aboue rest hath name peculiarly dede willingly graunt honor peter bilding chirch placed among first haue also first al faithfull suffer gather therupon haue supremicie ouer reste manner gathering excelleth feruentnesse zele learning courage therfore hath power ouer thoughe might better color gather andrew degree peter went time brought christ passe ouer thisioh ixl xlii let peter truely haue first place yet great difference betwene honor degree power see apostle comonly grauted peter yt speake asse blies certaine maner goe wt propounding exhorting admonishing hys power rede nothing howbeit yet come dispute yt pointe preset would proue fondly reaso name peter would bilde empire ouer whole chirche olde folly wherwith went aboute deceiue beginning worthy rehearsed much lesse confuted yt chirche bilded vpon peter sayd vpon thys rocke c father haue expounded whole scripture cryeth contrary purpose authoritie alleged agaynst god yea stryue aboute meaning wordes though darke doutful whe nothyng plainly certaynly spokenmat xvixvi peter confessed hys brethren name christ sone god upon thys rocke christ bildeth chirche paule sayeth fundation beside layed none neyther therfore refuse authoritie father wante testimony listed allege themi cor iiixi haue saied contending cleare mater trouble reders vayne specially sith thys point hath long agoe diligently enough handeled declared men side yet dede man better assoyle question scripture selfe compare place teacheth office power peter among apostle howe behaued hymselfe howe accepted runne ouer remaineth written shall finde nothing ell one xii egal rest felowe lordeact xvv doeth dede propounde counsell thyng done geueth warning mete done therewithall heareth doth onely graunte place speake minde leaueth iudgement determinedi pet vi folowed obeyed writeth pastor doth commaunde authoritie superior maketh companion gently exhorteth egalles wont doeac xiiii accused gone gentile although without cause yet answered purged hym selfe commaunded hys felowesacte viii xxiiii goe iohn samaria refused wheras apostle send hym therby declare helde hym superior wheras obeyed toke vpon hym embassage committed therby confesse felowship authoritie ouer themgala ixviii iiviii none thynges yet onely epistle galathians may easily take al doutyng v almost twoo whole chapter together paul trauayleth proue nothyng ell hymselfe egall peter honor apostleship rehearseth came peter professe subiection onely make consent doctrine approued testimonie men peter himselfe required thyng gaue hym hys ryghte hande felowship worke common together lordes vineyarde lesser grace geuen hym among ye gentile peter among iewes finally peter dealt faithfully corrected obeyed reprouing thynges doe make playne either equalitie betwene paule peter least peter power ouer rest ouer hym haue already sayed paule purpose laboureth none shoulde preferre apostleship either peter iohn wer fellowes lordes graunte whiche require concerning peter prince apostle excelled reste dignitie yet cause shoulde singular example make vniuersal rule draw perpetuitie hath one done sith farre differing reaso one chiefe among apostle forsoth fewe number one chiefe xii men shall therfore folow one oughte made ruler hundred thousande men maruell xii one among rule al nature beareth thys wit men requireth euery assembly although egall power yet one gouernour rest may haue regard vnto court wythout consul session iudges wt pretor propouder company wtout ruler felowship wt master absurditie cofessed yt apostle gaue peter supremicie ye force among fewe drawe ye whole worlde ye ruling wherof one sufficiet sai thei hath place lesse ye whole vniuersalitie nature tha al ye partes yt one soueraigne hed al herof god wil fetch profe fro crane bee alway choose themselues one guide many allowe dede example bryng forth bee resort together world choose one kyng euery seueral kyng content wt hys hyue among crane euery heard hath king ell shall proue hereby euery chirche ought haue seueral bishop appoynted cal v ciuile example allege saying homere good haue many gouernours thynges like sense red prophane wryters ye comedation monarchie answer easy monarchie praysed ulysses homere meanyng though one ought emperor whole world meane shewe one kingdome holde twoo kynges power calleth abide companion let wil yt good profitable ye whole worlde holde vnder monarchie yet great absurditie let yet wil therfore graut yt take place gouernement ye chirch chirche hath christ onely head vnder whoes dominio al cleaue together acording yt order ye forme policie hath prescribed therefore doe great wrong christeph iiiixv ye pretense wil haue one ruler ye vniuersal christ ca wtout hed christ hed ye whole body coupled knit together euery ioint wher one ministreth according ye working euery member measure therof maketh encrease ye body se setteth men wythout exception body leaueth honor name hed christ alone se geueth euery member certayne measure determined limited function whereby perfection grace soueraigne power gouernance may remayne wyth christ onely neyther ignorante wont cauill obiected say yt christ properly called hed alone reigneth hys owne authoritie hys name yt thys nothyng wtstandeth may vnder hym ministerial hed terme may vicegerent earth cauillatio preuaile nothing vnlesse first shew yt ministerie ordeined christe ye apostle teacheth yt whole ministratio dispersed ye member ye power floweth fro yt one heauely hed haue plainlier spokeep ixxii iiiixv vxiii colos ixviii iix sith ye scripture testifieth ye christ ye hed claimeth yt honor alone ought transferred christ himselfe hath made vicar yt onely redde also may largely confuted many place paule somtimes depainteth vnto v liuely image chirche one head maketh mention rather hys description maye gathereph iiiix disagreing institution christe christe ascending toke v visible presence hymselfe yet went vp fulfill thynges therefore chirche hath hym yet presente alway shall haue paule goeth aboute shewe meane wherby presenteth hymselfeeph iiiivii xi calleth v backe ministeries vseth lorde sayeth v al according measure grace hath geuen euery meber therfore hath appointed apostle pastor euangelistes teacher c doth say hath set one ouer vicegerente place require principally could meanes haue omitted ha n true christ saieth v howe ministerie men hath appointed gouerne chirche rather ministeriall hed hath committed stede nameth vn god fayth christe assigneth nothing common ministerie euery one particular measure tha commendation vnitie saied one body one spirite one hope calling one god one faith one baptisme hath also immediatly added one chiefe bishop may holde chirche together vnitie nothing could haue fytly spoken true lette place diligently weyed doute meante altogether represente holye spirituall gouernemente chirche whiche came called hierachie monarchie among minister nameth none also sheweth none also doute meant expresse manner conioyning whereby faythful cleaue together christ hed speaketh ministerial hed appointeth euery mebers particular working according measure grace distributed euery one neither reason suttelly dispute comparison heauenly earthly hierarchie safe know beyonde measure framing thys gouernemente must folow figure tha lord himselfe hath painted worde although graunt thing thei shal neuer winne profe sober men supremicie ye chirche stablished peter alway remayne perpetuall succession yet wil proue seate placed rome whosoeuer bishop chirche set ouer whole worlde right binde dignitie place geuen without mention place peter say liued died rome christ himselfe liued exercise bishoprike dyeng trimly reason peter saye hadde supremicie among apostle therefore chirche sate oughte haue priuilege sate firste antioche saye therfore chirche antioche doth rightly claime selfe supremicie cofesse old time first say remouing thense remoued rome honor brought hym epistle vnder name pope marcellus bishop antioche x ques cap saieth thus peter seate beginning afterward lordes commaundement remoued hether chirch antioche one chiefe hath geue place ye see rome oracle good man learned lord commauded cause determined law necessary answere whether wil haue priuilege personal real mirt must one three say yt personal belongeth nothing place say yt real whe one geue ye place take away reso either death departure ye perso remaineth therfore yt thei must sai mixt yt place shal simply cosidered vnlesse ye perso also agre let choose soeuer wil inferre easily proue yt rome meane take ye supremicie vpon selfe yt triflingly say ye supremecie remoued antioche rome yet antioche kepe ye secode place rome haue therfore ye first place peter sate ye ende life shal ye seconde place rather grauted tha first seate came passe yt alexandria went antioche agreeth yt chirch one disciple aboue seate peter honor ruler seate marke one disciple obteined honor therfore must either cofesse yt preposterous order must graunt v yt perpetual rule yt due euery chirche degree honor founder howbeit yt report peter sitting ye chirch rome see credit oughte haue truely whiche eusebius ruled fyue twenty yeares easily confuted euident firste seconde chapter galathians xx yeares death christ hierusalemgala ixviii gal vnder tiberius eightenthe yeare empire rebate twentie yeares duryng whiche paule wytnesse peter dwelte hierusalem wyll remayne seuentene yeres must deuided betwene twoo bishoprykes taried long antioche coulde sitte rome little whiche thyng maye yet also plainely proue paule wrote romaine iourney going hierusalemro xvxv taken thense broughte rome likely epistle written fower yeres came rome therein yet mention peter haue left peter ruled chirchero xviii yea ende also rehearseth greate number godly biddeth saluted verily gathereth together knewe yet sayth vtterly nothing peter neither present yea ye philippian sayed none faythfully loked vnto worke lord timothee complayned seke owneii timo iiiixvi timothee maketh greuous complaynte none hys fyrst defense forsoke hym therefore peter saye rome greate shame doeth paule charge forsaker gospell speaketh beleuers addeth god impute vnto howe long therefore tyme dyd peter kepe seate constant opinion writer gouerned chirche euen death among writer themselues certayne hys successor saye linus saye clement tell many fonde fable disputation betwene simon magician augustine sticketh confesse entreateth superstition aug ad sannar reason opinion rashly conceiued custome growen vse rome shoulde faste daye peter gott victory simon magician finally doinges tyme entangled diuersitie opinion ought rashly beleue finde thyng wrytten yet reason thys consente writer stryue agaynst thys dyed yet bishop specially long tyme perswaded neither muche passe vpon also forasmuche paule testifieth peter apostleshyp peculiarly belong iewes hys owne v therefore felowship couenanted betwene themselues maye confirmed v rather ordinance holy ghost may stande force among v oughte haue respecte rather apostleship paule peter holy ghost diuided prouinces betwene appointed peter iewes paule v therefore let romanistes goe seke supremicie ell worde god founde grounded let v come olde chirche may also made appeare plainly aduersaries doe lesse causelesly falsly boast consent therof doe witnesse word god therefore bragg principle vnitie chirche otherwise kept together one supreme hed earth member may obey therfore lorde gaue supremicie peter thense forth see rome right succession remaine ende affirme thys hath alwaye obserued beginning forasmuch wrogfully wrest many testimony wil first say aforehande deny olde writer eche geue great honor chirche rome dooe speake reueretly thinke done specially thre cause yt opinion wote growen force founded ordeined ministerie peter much auailed procure fauor estimation vnto therfore easte partes honor sake called see apostolike secondlye hed empire yt therefore likely place men excellente learning wisedome skill experience many thynges ell worthily consideration therof honor citie also excellent giftes god seme despised beside also thirde thing yt chirches easte grecia yea africa tumultes among themselues wt disagrementes opinion chirch rome quieter lesse full trouble rest came added much authoritie ye chirch rome doutefull time troubled reste holde doctrine one deliuered faster al ye rest shal better declare three cause say small honor commended many notable testimony olde writer oure aduersaries thereupon gather hath supremicie soueraigne power ouer chirches much amisse haue already said maye better appeare firste brefely shewe olde father thought vnitie enforce earnestly hierome writig nepotianus recited many example vnitie laste descended ye hierarchie chirch eche bishop euery seueral chirch eche archepriest eche archedeacon al ye ecclesiastical order rest vpon ruler romaine priest speaketh comendeth vnitie ecclesiastical order doeth rehearse al chirches knit together wt one hed wt one bonde nothing could haue fitly serued matter yt hand sayed yt forgetfulnesse yt omitted would haue done nothig willingly ye matter suffred saw therfore wtout dout yt ye true reaso vnitie ciprian excelletly wel describeth wordes de simpl pre bishoprike one wherof eche hath part wholly chirche one whiche encrease fruitefulnesse largely extended multitude like many sunbeames one light many branch tree one body grounded fast holdyng roote like one fountain flowe many streames though multitude seme diuersely spread abrode largenesse ouerflowyng pletie yet vnitie kept whole original chirch also ouerspread light lord extendeth beames abroade throughout whole worlde yet one eche poured foorth vnitie body seuered spreadeth branch ouer whole worlde sendeth ouerflowing streames yet one head one beginnyng c afterward spouse christ adultresse knoweth one onely house kepeth holinesse one onely chamber chast shamfastnesse see maketh vniuersal bishoprik christ onely comprehendeth whole chirch vnder saith execute office bishop vnder hed haue partes therof
