c xxxviii consent wicked worde nothyng el lese faith one thing saieth owe preseruyng vnitie faith thyng owe kepyng downe pride say boldly soeuer calleth selfe desireth bee called vniuersall bishop doeth proude aduancyng runne antichrist doth shewing himselfe proude preferre himselfe aboue rest agayne anastasius bishop alexandria haue said haue peace v vnlesse amended aduauncyng superstitious proude word first apostata hath inueted speake nothyng wrong done honour one called vniuersall bishop vniuersall chirch falleth vniuersall one falleth wheras writeth honor offred leo synode chalcedon hath colour truth neither suche thyng redde actes synode leo many epistle impugneth decree made honour see constantinople without dout would haue passed ouer argument ben liked ben true refused geuen beyng man otherwise much desirous honor would haue omitted made praise therfore gregorie deceiued thought title offred see rome synode chalcedon speake nothing fond testifieth haue proceded fro holy synode lib iiii epistol lxxvi also time calleth wicked prophane abhominable proude ful sacrilege yea deuised diuell published crier antichrist yet addeth predecessor refused least priestes shoulde depriued theyr due honor lib vii epistol lxix thing priuately geuen one place man tyme hath willed called woord man hath taken self presuptuous name least degree bishoprik take glorie singularitie seme haue denied brother nowe come iurisdiction bishoppe rome affirmeth hath ouer chirches knowe howe great contention haue ben olde tyme mater hath ben tyme wherein see rome hath coueted gette empire ouer chirches place shall oute season searche meanes grewe little lyttle power dooe yet speake infinite empire whych hath long agoe taken force self wyll differre place conuenient good shew briefly old tyme meanes hath aduaunced selfe take selfe power ouer chirches chirches east diuided troubled faction arrians vnder emperours constantius constans sonnes constantine great athanasius chief defendour true faith driuen see calamitie copelled come rome yt authoritie see rome might sort represse rage enemy confirme godly distresse honourably receiued iulius bishop obteined bishop west toke vpon defence cause therfore godly stoode great neede foreyn aide sawe good succour chirche rome willyngly gaue vnto authoritie coulde nothyng el comunion therof hiely estemed compted great shame excommunicate afterward euill wicked men also added much vnto escape lawfull iudgementes fledde sanctuarie therfore priest condemned bishop bishop synode prouince appelled rome bishop rome receiued suche appellation gredily mete semed forme extraordinarie power entermedle mater farre wide aboute eutiches condemned flauianus bishop constantinople complained leo wrong doone vnto hym leo without delay lesse vndiscretely sodeinly toke hande defence euill cause greuousely inueyed againste flauianus though without hearyng cause condemned innocent ambition caused vngodlynesse eutiches certaine space time strengthned affrica euidet oftentimes chaunced soone lewde man taken foile ordinarie iudgement flewe rome charged contreemen many sclaunderous report see rome alway ready entermedle whiche lewdnesse compelled bishop affrica make lawe none vnder peyn excomunication appelle beyond sea soeuer let v see authoritie power see rome hadde ecclesiasticall power conteined fower pointes orderyng byshops summonyng councels hearing appealles iurisdiction chastisyng admonition censure olde synodes commaunde bishop consecrate owne metropolitanes neuer bid bishop rome bee called vnto owne patriarchie litle litle grewe vse bishop italie came rome fetche consetration except metropolitan suffred themselues bee brought suche bondage metropolitane consecrate bishop rome sent thether one priestesli ii episto lxviii lxx whiche onely present president whiche thyng example gregorie consecration constantius bishoppe millain death laurence howbeit dooe thinke auncient institution beginning honor good willes sake sent one legate witness cosecration testifie comunion afterward whiche voluntarie beganne holden necessarie howe soeuer euident olde tyme bishop rome power consecratyng prouince owne patriarchie say chirches adioynyng citie canon nicene synode sayth consecration annexed sendyng synodicall epistle nothing aboue reste patriarch wont immediatly consecration solemne writyng declare faithe whereby professed subscribed holy catholike councelles rendryng accompt faith approue selues one bishop rome receiued selfe geuen confession thereby acknowleged superior lesse bounde geue lib epist lib epist lib episto require subiect common lawe truely token felowship dominion thyng example gregory epistle anastasius cyriacus constantinople place patriaches together folowe admonition censure whiche olde tyme bishop rome vsed toward dyd agayne suffer ireneus greuously reproued uictor vndiscretely thyng value troubled chirche pernicious dissention uictor obeyed spurned libertie vre among holy byshops vsed brotherly authoritie toward bishop rome admonishyng chastisyng hym tyme offended agayn occasion required admonishe duetie fault rebuked cyprian exhorteth stephen admonishe bishop fraunce fetcheth argument fro greater power comon right priestes haue among themselues beseche stephen ben ruler ouer fraunce would cyprian haue saide restraine epist lib ad pop contra epi stepha thyne saieth farre otherwise saieth brotherly felowshyp wherwith bounde one requireth yt admonishe one see also wt great sharpnes word otherwise mild nature inueyeth stephe whe thinketh insolet therfore behalfe also appereth yet bishop rome iurisdictio ouer wer prouince concernyng callyng together synodes office euery metropolitane certaine appointed tymes assemble prouinciall synode bishop rome authoritie general cousel emperour might sumo bishop attepted yt wer prouince would haue obeyed callyng also would haue rise vprore therfore emperour indifferetly warned present socrates dede reporteth yt iulius dyd expostulate bishop east tripar hist li called hym synode antioche whereas forbidden canon thyng shoulde decreed without knowledge bishop rome whoe doeth see vnderstanded suche decree bynde whole vniuersall chirche nowe meruayle thus muche graunted bothe antiquitie honor citie dignitie see generall decree made religion absence bishop rome refuse bee present dominion ouer whole chirche denie one chief graunt romanistes nowe affirme dominion ouer nowe remaineth fowerth kynde power standeth appealles euident hath chief power whoes iudgement seate appellation made many oftentimes appelled bishop rome self also went draw hearyng cause himselfe alway laughed scorne passed owne boundes speake nothyng east grecia certain bishop fraunce stoutely withstode hym semed take himselfe empire ouer theim affrica long debate mater mileuitane councell whiche augustine present excomunicate appealled beiond sea bishop rome trauailed bring passe decree might amended sente legate shewe priuiledge geuen hym nicene councell legate brought foorth actes nicene councell whiche fetched storehouse owne chirch affricans withstode denied bishopes rome ought bee credited owne cause said therfore would sende constantinople city grecia copy yt lesse suspicious found therin thyng written romains pretended decree confirmed tooke chiefe hearing cause bishop rome whiche doyng lewde shamelesnesse bishop rome hymself appeared guilefully thrust synode sardes stede nicene synode shamefully taken manifeste falsehoode yet greater shamelesse wickednesse added forged epistle councell wherein wote bishop carthage condemnyng arrogance aurelius predecessour bolde withdrawe himselfe obedience see apostolike yeldyng himselfe chirche humbly craueth pardon goodly monumentes antiquitie whervppon maiestie see rome founded childishlye vnder pretence antiquitie blind men may fynde oute gropyng aurelius saieth puffed vp deuelishe boldenesse stubbornesse rebelled christe saint peter therfore condemned curse said augustine saide many father present mileuitane councell nede spend many word confutyng foolishe writyng whiche romanistes themselues haue face left looke vpon without great shame gratian tell whether malice ignorance2 quest cap rehersed decree excommunicate appealle beyonde see addeth exception unlesse peraduenture appealle see rome may man beast voide comon reason yt except thing law whoes cause euery man seeth law made councel condemneth appealles beyod sea forbiddeth yt none appelle rome good expositor excepteth rome ye comon lawe determine questio one one historie shal make plaine maner iurisdiction bishop rome old time donate blacke house cecilian bishop carthage accused condemned cause heard knew bishop conspired would appeare mater came emperour constantine forasmuche willed haue mater ended ecclesiasticall iudgement comitted hearing melciades bishop rome adioyned felow commissioner many bishop italie fraunce spaine belonged ordinarie iurisdiction see rome heare appeale ecclesiasticall cause doeth suffre ioyned emperour yea himselfe take iudgement vpon rather ye emperor comaudement office let v heare hapned afterward cecilia got victorie augus epist donate blacke house codemned sclauder appelled constatine comitted iudgemet appelle ye bishop orleance sate iudge pronounce thought bishop rome see rome hath chief power without appellation doth melciades suffer receiue great shame yt bishop orleace preferred aboue emperor doeth euen constantine boast employed endeuor maner richesse empire encrease dignitie see wee se therefore howe farre bishop rome tyme meanes supreme dominion whiche affirmeth geuen vnto hym christe ouer chirches whiche lyengly saieth hath age possessed consent whole worlde know many epistle many writing decree wherin bishop doo geue muche boldly chalenge much vnto also al men haue little wit lerning know part vnsauerie first tast man may soone find ship cam man soud wit sobre dist xii cap sacrosa ct wil thinke goodly interpretation anacletus owne gratian reported vnder name anacletus cephas head romanists doo day abuse defence see many suche trifle gratian hath patched together without iudgement yet still great light sell suche smoke wherwith olde time wont mocke ignorant darknesse bestow much labor confutyng thing openly cofute selues reason vnsauory folie graut yt remain also true epistle ye old bishop wherin set foorth ye honor see glorious title sort epistle leo man learned eloquent also aboue measure desirous glory dominion vide epist epist whether chirches beleued testimonie aduauced dede cotrouersie appereth yt many offended ambition also withstand gredie desire somtimes appointed steede bishop thessalonica throughout grecia contrees adioyning somtime appointed bishop orleance som throughout frauce apointed hormisdas bishop hispalis vicar spain eueri wher excepteth yt geueth apointmets vpo codition yt metropolitas may haue auncient priuileges remainyng safe whole leo himselfe declareth yt one priuileges ye dout happe mater episto lxxxix ye metropolitane shold first asked aduise therfore appointmetes vicar stede wer vpo conditio yt neither bishop letted ordinary iurisdictio metropolitane iudge appealles prouincial cou cel ordering chirches ell absteine fro iurisdiction entermedle appeasing discordes farre law nature communion chirche suffreth gregory time yt aunciet order already much changed whe ye empire shake torne peces whe fraunce spaine afflicted wt many ouertrowes receiued slauonia wasted italie vexed africa maner destroied wt cotinual calamity yt great shakig ciuile affaire least ye integritie faith might remaine yet vtterly perish al ye bishop fro ech part ye rather ioine themselues ye bishop rome thereby came passe yt ye dignitie also ye power yt see greatly encreased howbeit much passe meanes brought truly appeareth greater tha ye age yet greatly differed fro vnbridled dominio yt one myght beare rule ouer wil ye see rome reuerence might wt authoritie subdue represse lewde obstinate could ye bishop kept wtin dutie gregorie doth ofte time diligetly testify yt doth lesse faithfully preserue men rightes lib episto lxviii requireth neither doe saith pricked ambition plucke fro man right desire al thing honor brethre saying writinges wherin doth proudely bost ye largenesse supremicie libr ii epi vl lib vii epi lxiii tha know bishop subiect ye see apostolike founde faulte adioyneth fault requireth al according ye order humilitie egal geueth hymselfe power correct yt haue offended doe dutie maketh himselfe egall wt reste himselfe geueth himselfe power assented yt would lyked might frely gainesay well knowen yt parte beside yt speaketh ye primate costantinople whe codemned ye prouincial synode refused ye whole iudgemete fellow bishop informed ye emperour stubbornesse emperour willed gregorie iudge ye cause see therfore attepteth thing wherby may breake ordinary iurisdiction thing doth helping doth commaundement emperour therfore al ye power ye bishop rome set obstinate vntamed heds whe neded extraordinary remedy yt helpe hinder bishop therfore taketh hiselfe ouer al lib ii episto xxxvii epi xvi tha place graunteth al ouer hiselfe whe cofesseth yt redy corrected al ameded al place doth dede comaunde ye bishop aquilela come rome pleade cause cotrouersy faith rise betwene doth comaude power yt emperor comauded neither doth geue warning alone shalbe iudge promiseth assemble synode whole mater may iudged althoughe yet moderation power see rome certayne boudes might passe bishop rome himselfe tha vnder yet appeareth much gregorie misliked state li ep v nowe coplaineth vnder color bishoprike brought backe world entangled earthly care euer serued lay yt yt honor oppressed tumult worldly affaire place great burdes saith businesse holde lib epi vii xv yt minde nothing raised vp thinges aboue shaken many waues cause leysures rest tossed tepestes troublesome lyfe yt may rightly say come ye depth sea tepest hath drowned hereby gather would haue sayed happened tymes although fulfilled office pastor yet absteyned gouernement yt ciuile empire confessed himselfe subiect emperor thrust himselfe cure chirches compelled necessitie yet thinketh hymselfe maze apply himselfe altogether office bishop yt time ye bishop constantinople striued wt bishop rome ye supremicie already said yt seate empire stablished costatinople maiestie ye empire semed require chirche also haue seconde place honor chirche rome truly beginning nothing auailed cause yt supremicie geue rome ye hed ye empire yt time dist lxxx cap vi gratian writing vnder name pope lucinus saith yt city wer otherwise diuided metropolitanes primate ought sit tha ye reson ciuile gouernemet yt also vnder ye name pope clemet saith yt patriarch wer ordeined city ye chefe flamen although false yet take truth certaine yt ende made litle change might prouinces wer diuided according yt state thinges wer primate metropolitanes wer set city excelled honor power therefore coucel taurinu decreed cap yt city ciuile gouernemet yt chefe city euery prouince chefe see bishop happened honor ye ciuile gouernement remoued fro one citie yt right metropolitane citie therwtal remoued thether innocentius bishop rome whe saw aunciet dignitie citie grow decay seate empire remoued constantinople fearing abacemet see made contrary law wherein denyeth necessary yt ecclesiastical mother city chaged ye imperial mother city change authoritie synode ought right preferred aboue one man sentece also ought suspecte innocentius himselfe owne cause howsoeuer yet owne prouiso sheweth beginning ordered metropolitane city disposed according outwarde order empire according auncient ordinace decreed ye first coucell constantinople socra hist tri part lib ix cap xiii decret xxii dist yt bishop yt citie haue priuileges honor next bishop rome new rome long time like decree made chalcedo leo stoutly cried gaue himselfe leaue esteme nothing yt sixe hundred bishop moe decreed also bitterly taunted yt toke fro see honor bolde geue chirche constantinople besech thing could moue trouble ye world smal mater mere ambition sayeth ought inuiolable whiche nicene sinode hath one decreed though forsooth christian faith wer endangered one chirch preferred though patriarchy wer diuided ende policy knowe policie receiueth yea requireth diuerse chaunges according diuersitie time therefore fonde leo pretendeth honor authoritie nicene sinode geuen see alexandria ought geue see constantinople comon reason telleth decree myght take away according respect time yea none bishop east withstode thing concerned truely proterius present made bishop alexandria place dioscorus presente patriarch whoes honor diminished parte withstand leo remained safe owne place holde peace yea assent vnto bishop rome resisteth easy iudge moueth hym foresaw yt long happened would come passe glory olde rome decaying constantinople contented seconde place would stryue wt rome ye supremicie yet wt cry much preuaile decree councell confirmed therfore successor whe saw themselues ouercome quietly gaue ouer stiffenesse suffred accompted seconde patriarche within litle iohn gregory tyme ruled chirche constantinople brake forth farre yt called himselfe vniuersall patriarche gregorie lest good cause fayle defende see constantly set hymselfe againste truely pride madnesse iohn intolerable whiche desired make boundes bishoprike egall wyth boundes empire yet gregorie doth claime himselfe denieth abhorreth name wicked vngodly lib vil episto xxx abhominable whosoeuer take vpon yea also one place angry wyth eulolius bishop alexandria whiche honored hym suche tittle beholde sayeth preface epistle ye directed selfe haue forbidden ye haue cared emprinte woorde proude callyng manyng vniuersall pope whiche praye holinesse wil withdrawen whiche geuen reason requireth compt honor wherin se honor brother diminished honor honor vniuersall chirche sounde strength brother holinesse call vniuersall pope denyeth selfe confesseth wholly truely gregorie stode good honest cause ihon holpen fauor maurice emperor could neuer remoued purpose ciriacus also successor neuer suffered himselfe entreated behalfe last phocais maurice slaine set place wote cause frendly romaine crowned without stryfe grauted boniface third gregorie neuer required rome hed chirches thys maner controuersy ended yet benefite emperor could much haue profited see rome vnlesse thinges also afterwarde happened gretia asia within litle cut fro communion rome fraunce much reuerenced yt obeyed lysted first brought bondage pipine vsurped kyngdome whe zacharie bishop rome ben helper breache faith robbery yt thrusting lawful kyng might violently enter vpon kyngdome layed open pray receiued thys rewarde see rome shoulde haue iurisdiction ouer ye chirches frauce robber wonted parting deuide ye commo spoyle good men ordered mater betwene themselues pipine haue ye earthly ciuile dominion spoiling true king zacharye made hed bishop haue spirituall power beginning weake wont new thynges afterwarde confirmed authoritie charles maner lyke cause also indetted bishop rome yt hys endeuor atteined honor empire although credible chirches eche yt tyme muche deformed yet certayn yt old forme ye chirch fyrst vtterly defaced frauce germanie remayne yet recordes court parise brefe note tymes entreate mater chirche make mention couenant pipine charles wyth bishop rome therby may gather alteration made olde state sin tyme thynges eche daily fal worse worse tyranny see rome also stablyshed encreased yt partly ignorace partly slouthfulnesse bishop one toke thynges vpo without measure proceded aduaunce hymselfe law right bishop zele thei ought endeuor themselues restrayne lust though wated courage yet destitute true learning knowledge nothing fytt attempte greate mater therefore see howe monstruous vnholy defyling holy thinges scattering abrode whole order chirche bernardes tyme coplayneth yt resort heapes rome al world lib de consi ad euge ambitious men couetous simonians robber god kepers concubine comitters incest monster obtein reteine ecclesiastical honor ye apostolike authoritie ye fraud vndermining violence growe force sayth yt maner iudging vsed abhominable vnsemely chirche also iudicial court cryeth oute chirche ful ambitious men yt none dredeth commit mischeuous actes robber caue deuide spoyles wayfairing men sayeth loke vnto mouth lawgeuer vnto hand without cause handes pope businesse thing thys yt bought spoiles chirches yt say thee oh well done well done life poore sowe stretes riche siluer glistereth myre run fro al place poore stra ger taketh vp paradueture ye runneth fastest thys maner rather thys death came thee would god might end thee among thynges thou pastor goest forwarde compassed wt much precious aray durst say rather pastor deuils shepe forsoth peter thus paule played thus lib iii thy courte accustomed receiue men good tha make good ill profit good decaye nowe abuse appealles yt rehearseth godly man rede wtout great horror last thus concludeth ye vnbrideled gredinesse see rome vsurping iurisdiction speak ye murmour commo complaynt chirches crie mangled dismembred either none fewe either bewaile feare plage askest thou plage abbotes plucked fro bishop bishop fro archebishops c maruelous mai excused ye proue ye haue fulnesse power righteousnesse ye thys ye whether ye also ought question ye sett preserue enuye euery man hys honor hys owne degree fewe thynges many listed rehearse partly yt reders may see sore chirche decayed partly may know great sorowe mourning thys calamitie helde al godly nowe albeit graunte bishop rome thys day preeminence largenesse iurisdiction see meane tymes tymes leo gregory preset state papacie yet speake earthly dominion ciuile power therof whiche afterwarde consider place fit spiritual gouernemet yt bost hath like state tymes define ye pope none otherwyse supreme hed chirche earth vniuersal bishop whole world bishop themselues whe speake owne authoritie wyth great stoutenesse countenance pronounce yt belongeth power comaude boude necessitie obey yt al decree holden confirmed diuine voice peter prouincial sinodes without force want presence pope may order clerkes chirche may cal see haue ben ordered ell innumerable sorte gratias packe rehearse least tedious reders summe onely bishop rome hath supreme hearing determining ecclesiastical cause whether iudging defining doctrine making lawes stablishing emperor kiges al clergie people dede imperiously done one man maketh hymselfe iudge al men suffreth himselfe obey iudgement vse tyranny ouer people god scatter abrode wast kingdom christ trouble whole chirch turne office pastor robberie yea thoughe neuer mischeuous sayeth bounde yelde accompte sayinges bishop god determine cause men hath wtout questio reserued bishop see iudgemet doinges subiectes iudged v oures god decree might haue weight haue falsly thrust name old bishop though thinges ben ordeined beginning wheras certaine new lately forged whatsoeuer bishop rome geueth hymselfe haue rehearsed geuen aunciet coucels yea come greate shamelesnesse ibidi ca ant haue set forth wryting vnder name anastasius patriarche costantinople wherin testifieth decreed olde rule nothing done euen furthest prouinces wer first moued see rome beside thys certaine yt vaine man shall thynke likely suche commendation see rome proceded aduersary enuier honor dignitie thereof verily behoued antichristes shoulde carried greate madnesse blindenesse lewdenesse might playne men se least many open theyr eye decretall epistle heaped together gregorie ix agayne clementine extrauagantes martine dooe yet openly fuller mouth ech breathe forth outragious fiercenesse tyrannie barbarous kinges oracle romanistes haue papacie weyed hereupon arose notable principle whiche day haue euery ye papacie ye force oracle yt pope c erre ye pope aboue councels pope vniuersall bishop al bishop supreme head chirche earth passe ouer much absurder folly foolishe canonistes babble scholes yet ye romish diuines assente also clap handes flatter idole wil deale extremitie righte man would great insolence set saying cipriane vsed among bishop whoes councell sate chiefe none v calleth hymselfe bishop bishop wt tirannous feare copelleth felow bishop necessitie obey would obiect litle afterwarde decreed carthage none shoulde called prince priestes chiefe bishop woulde gather many testimony history canon sinode many senteces ye bokes old writer whiche bishop rome shoulde brought ye felowship ye rest passe ouer al least seme precisely presse let ye best patrones ye see rome answere wt face dare defende ye title vniuersal bishop whiche se oft condemned wt curse gregorie gregory testimonie ought force therby declare yt antichrist bishop make vniuersal name also hed vsual thus sayeth one place peter chiefe meber body lib iiii ep xcii iohn andrew iames ye heds particular people yet member chirch vnder one hed yea ye holy one ye law ye holy one vnder ye law ye holy one vnder grace set among mebers altogether makyng vp ye body lord euer willed haue himselfe called vniuersal wheras ye bishop rome taketh vpo hymselfe ye power comaunding yt thing smally agreeth wt gregory saith place lib vii episto xxviii wheras eulolius bishop alexandria said comaunded hym answered wise pray ye take away thys worde comading fro hearing know ye place ye brethre maners ye father therefore comaded cared tel thigs yt thought profitable wheras extendeth iurisdiction wtout end doth therin great hayno wrong ye bishop also al particular chirches teareth plucketh peces yt may bilde seate ruines wheras exepteth fro al iudgemets wil reigne maner tirantes yt accompteth lust law yt verily hainous far fro ecclesiastical order may wise borne vtterly abhorreth al feling godlinesse also humanitie yt copelled go examine al thinges particularly agayne appelle ye wil day accopted ye beste faithful patrones ye see rome whether ashamed defende present state papacie certaine hundred time corrupt time gregory bernard state yet dyd much displease holy gregory eche complayneth libro epist vvii xxv alibi yt muche diuersly drawen away forein busynesse yt vnder ye color bishoprike brought backe world wherin serueth many care world neuer remembreth serued lay man pressed downe wyth tumulte worldly affaire hys mynde nothing raised vp thinges aboue shake many waues cause tossed tempestes troublesome lyfe may worthily say come depth sea truely among earthly business might yet teach people sermones priuately admonishe correct behoued order chirche geue counsell fellow bishop exhort dutie beside thinges remained time write yet lamenteth calamitie drowned depest sea gouernement time sea sayed papacie thys tyme likenesse haue together preachinges care discipline zele ye chirches spirituall finally nothing world yet maze praysed though could nothing founde orderly better framed coplaintes doth bernarde poure grones doeth vtter loketh vpon faultes hys age would doe behelde thys age iron worse worse iron obstinate wickednesse thys stiffly defende holy diuine holy men haue wt one mouth condemned also abuse testimonie defense papacie whiche certaine neuer knew howbeit bernardes tyme confesse corruption thynges great much vnlike tyme without shame fetche pretense meane age yt tyme leo gregory doe lyke one stablyshe monarchie emperoure would praise olde state empire rome woulde borrowe praise libertie set forth honor tyranny finally although al thing wer grauted yet ariseth fresh newe strife deny chirche rome whiche suche benefites may resident denie bishop may beare priuileges dignitie admit therfore al thing true yet haue already wroong peter mouth christe appointed hed vniuersal chirche left honor geuen hym see rome stablished authoritie auncient chirch confirmed long continuaunce supreme power hath alway one consent geuen men bishop rome hath ben iudge al cause men himselfe subiect iudgement none let haue also wil yet answere one word none thing auaile vnlesse rome chirch bishop must nedes graut mother chirches selfe chirche chiefe bishop himselfe bishop therfore haue see apostolike rome let shewe true lawfull apostleship haue chief bishop let shewe bishop shewe v face chirch name one dede haue oft mouth truly chirche knowen certaine markes bishoprike name office speake people gouernemente selfe ought continually shine chirche ministerie chirche christes institution requireth let v cal remembrance hath ben spoken office priestes bishop shall bryng office cardinal tried rule shal confesse nothyng lesse priest chief bishop would faine know one thing hath bishoplike first principal point office bishop teach people word god next point minister sacrament third admonish exhort yea correct offend hold people together holy discipline thyngs doeth yea doeth faine himselfe doo let theim tell therfore meane would haue compted bishop doeth little fynger one muche outewarde shewe touche part bishop office bishop king king although execute belogeth king doth neuerthelesse retein honor title iudging bishop respect christes comaudement alway ought force chirche therfore let romanistes lose knot denye hye bishop chiefe bishop forasmuche bishop must nedes proue last point false haue victorie first howe say onely hath propertie bishop rather thinges contrarie god shall begynne learning maners shal say shall leaue vnsayde shall make ende saye whereas worlde daye stuffed many peruerse wicked doctrine full many kyndes superstition blynded many error drowned great idolatry none hathe either flowed thense least bene confirmed neither cause bishop caried greate rage doctrine gospell newly springing vp agayne bend strengthes oppresse kindle vp king prince crueltie bicause see whole kingdom decaieth falleth sone gospel christ cometh place leo cruell clement bloudie paul fierce murtherer nature hath much moued fight ye truthe meane mayntain power therfore sithe safe till haue driuen awaye christ trauaile cause dyd syght religion contrees owne lyues shall bee v see apostolike see nothyng horrible apostasie shall christes vicar persecuting gospell furious enterprise doth openly professe self antichrist shal peter successour rangeth swerd fyre destroy euer peter hath builded shall bee hed chirch cutting dismembryng chirche christe onely true head therof doeth selfe plucke teare piece admitte verily olde time rome mother chirches yet sin hath begon seate antichriste hath cessed seme muche euill speaker railers call bishop rome antichrist thinke doo vnderstand accuse paule immodestie speake yea whoes mouth speake least man obiecte doo wrongfully wrest bishop rome word paul spoken intent brefely shew otherwise vnderstandedii thess iiii dan viixxv papacie paule writeth antichrist shal sit temple god place also holy ghost describyng image person antiochus sheweth kingdome shall consist hautinesse speche blasphemyngs god hereupon gather rather tyrannie ouer soules ouer body raised vp spiritual kingdome christ suche doeth abolish name christ chirch rather abuse pre ence christ lurke vnder title chirche vnder disguised visour although heresy sectes haue ben beginnyng belong kingdome antichrist yet paule prophecieth shal com departing description signifieth seate abhomination shal raised vp certain vniuersall departyng shal possesse chirche howsoeuer many membres chirch continue true vnitie faith addeth time began misterie set vp worke iniquitie would afterward shew openly therby vnderstand yt calamitie neither brought one ended one man wher doeth set antichrist marke plucke awaye god due honor take selfe chiefe token ought folowe seekyng antichrist specially suche pride procedeth euen publike dissipation chirche sithe therefore certaine bishop rome hath shamelessely conueyed away whiche chiefe propre thing god alone christ douted capitaine standerdbearer wicked abhominable kyngdome nowe let romanists goe obiect antiquitie v great alteration thynges honor see might stand see euseb lib iii cap eusebius telleth god might bee place vengeance remoued chirch hierusalem pella whiche heare haue one doone might ofter doone therfore de honor supremicie place dede moste hatefull enemie christ hyest aduersarie gospell greatest waster destroyer chirche moste cruel slaughterman butcher saint shold neuerthelesse accompted vicar christ successor peter ye chief bishop ye chirche onely occupieth see one chiefest verily muche scorned foolishe speake great difference betwene pope chauncerie well framed order chirche howbeit one thyng may wel take away dout question man hath right wit wil think bishoprike enclosed leade bulles muche lesse schoole fraudes deceites wiche thyngs pope spirituall gouernement consisteth therfore well sayd certain man chirche rome bosted long agoe tourned court onely nowe seene rome neither doo accuse faultes men shew papacie selfe directly contrary true order chirche come persones men well enough knowen maner vicar christ shall fynde iulius forsoothe leo clement paule shalbe pillers christian faith chiefe expositours religion whiche neuer knew thyng christ whiche learned lucians schole doo recken vp thre fower pope though doutfull maner forme religio pope whole college cardinal haue sin long ago professed day doo professe first principall article secret diuinitie reigneth amog god seconde thing writen taught concernyng christ lie deceit third doctrine life come last resurrection fable doo thinke fewe speake graut hath long ago begon ye ordinarie religio pope wheras well knowen knowe rome yet romishe diuines ceasse bost christes priuilege prouided pope erre said peter haue praied theeluc xxxii thy faith faint pray winne mocking shamelessely whole world may vnderstand come extremitie wickednesse neither feare god stande awe men let v imagine vngodlynesse pope haue spoken hidden haue neither published prechinges writinges onely haue bewrayed table chamber least within walles house haue priuilege force whyche pretende must nedes wipe iohn xxii number pope openly affirmed soules mortall die together body vntil day resurrection may perceiue whole see principall stay wholly fallen none cardinal withstode great madnessegerson whiche lyued schoole parise moued king fraunce compell recant king forbade subiectes communicate vnlesse hande repent maner proclaimed heralde pope compelled necessitie abiured error example maketh neede dispute aduersaries say see rome bishop thereof erre fayth saide peter haue praied theeluc x xxxii thy faith may fainte truely fell fowle kinde fall right faith notable example theim come peter whiche succede peter bishoprike howbeit also selfe childishe nedeth answere drawe peter successours whatsoeuer spoken petermat vi iii shall olowe satan asmuche lord said also peter go behinde thou satan thou art offence shalbe easye v turne backe later sayeng shalbe obiect agaynst v list striue playeng foole therefore returne thether whense made digression bind place christ holy ghost chirch together whosoeuer sit place although deuil yet must iudged vicar christ hed chirche one seate peter say wicked sclauderous christe also great absurditie comon reason already long ago sin bishop rome either without religion greatest enemy religion therfore ar made ye vicar christ reason seate occupieii thess iiiii idoll set temple god taken god maners iudged vppon lette pope selues answere selues one thing al wherein may knowen bishop first wheras life rome winking also secret countenance allowyng vtterly vnmete bishop whoes duetie seueritie discipline restraine licentiousnesse people wil rigorous charge men faultes themselues owne household almost whole college cardinal whole flocke clergie geuen foorth wickednesse filthinesse vncleannesse kynds lewde mischeuous doings resemble rather monster men therin truely bewray selues nothing lesse bishop yet nede feare least shold disclose filthinesse bothe wery haue doo stinkyng myre must fauour chast eares thinke haue already enough proued went although rome olde tyme ben head chirches yet day worthy iudged one smallest toe chirches feete concerning cardinal cal tell come passe yt sodeinly risen vp great dignitie name gregory time belonged bishop oft maketh mention cardinal meaneth chirche rome brefely cardinal priest nothing el bishop writer age finde name se lesse bishop bee nowe farre aboue saying augustine wel knowen although according name honor vse chirch hath alredy obteined bishopricke greater priesthode yet many thinges augustine lesse hierom dede maketh difference betwene priest ye chirch rome indifferently setteth al behind ye bishop yt long obeserued cou cel carthage whe wer present two legate see rome one bishop ye priest ye priest thrust back ye last place folow old exaples remaineth coucel holde vnder gregorie rome ye priestes sat ye lowest place subscribed seuerally themselues deacos thei place al subscribing truly office preset vnder ye bishop ministring doctrine sacramets nowe case changed become cousin kinges emperours doute grewe vp littell littell together head till aduaunced hie toppe dignitie also thought good touche shortly waie reders might better vnderstande see rome suche day doeth muche differ auncient one vnder pretense wherof doeth nowe maynteine defende selfe sort soeuer wer old tyme forasmuch haue nothyng ye true lawfull office chirche reteine onely deceitfull colour vaine visour yea forasmuche haue thinges vtterly contrary necessarie happen gregorie writeth oft lib iiii epist xxv lv lib v epist vii mala iiviii saie sayth wepyng geue warnyng groning sith order priesthode fallen within shall also able stand long without rather behoued shold fulfilled whiche malachie saith suche ye haue gon backe waie haue made many stumble lawe therfore ye haue made voide couenant leui saith lord therfore beholde haue geuen estimation vile people nowe leaue godly thynke sort supreme height hierarchie rome wherunto papistes abhominable shamlessenesse stick make subiect word god whiche ought haue ben honorable holy bothe heauen earth men angel viii chapter power chirche touchyng article faith howe vnbridled licetiousnesse hath papacie ben wrested corrupt purenesse doctrine nowe foloweth thirde place power chirche whiche partely consisteth bishop partly counsel either prouinciall generall speake onely spirituall power whiche propre chirch consisteth either doctrine iurisdiction makyng lawes doctrine hath two partes authoritie teache article doctrine expoundyng beginne discourse euery one specialtie godlye reader bee warned whatsoeuer taughte concerning power chirche muste remember applye ende wherunto paule testifieth geuenii cor xviii xiii x edification destruction whiche lawfully vse thinke selues minister christ therwithall minister people christ edifyeng chirch waie minister themselues endeuour preserue christ authoritie whiche otherwise bee safe vnlesse lefte vnto hym receiued father scholemaister chirchemat xvii v written hym alone heare hym power chirche therfore sparingly set foorth yet enclosed within certain boundes drawen hether thether lust men herunto shalbe muche profitable note described prophet apostle simply graunt vnto men power list take vpon theim plaine men slippery redinesse fall tyrannie whiche ought farre chirch christ therfore must remembred whatsoeuer authoritie dignitie holy ghost scripture geueth either prestes prophetes apostle successours apostle geuen proprely men themselues ministerie ouer appointed speake plainely one worde wherof ministerie committed wee goe order shall fynde authoritie teache answer name worde lord called office also enioined shold bring nothing selues speke mouth ye lord doeth bryng foorth hearde people haue geue instruction ought speakeexod iiiiiii entent speake nothyng beside woord moses himselfe prince prophetes hearde aboue resteexo xiiii xxxi deuter xviix first instructed commaundementes might declare thyng fro lord therfore said people thei embraced doctrine beleued god seruant moses also authoritie priestes shoulde growe contempt stablished greuous penalty therwithal lord sheweth vpon codition wer heardmala iiiiii vi saieth hath made couenant leui law truthe shoulde mouth little addeth lip priest shall kepe knowledge shall require law mouth angell god hostes therfore priest heard lette shewe messinger god isdeu xvii x let faithfully report comaundements receiued author specially entreated hearing expressely set may answer accordyng lawe god maner power prophetes generally well described ezechiellezec iiixvii thou sonne man saith lord haue geue thee watcheman house israell therefore thou shalte heare worde mouth thou shalte declare fro commaunded heare mouthe lord forbidden inuent thyng declare lorde speake may boldly boast ownehie xxiiixxviii lordes woorde hath broughte selfe thyng hieremie wordes let prophet saith dreame tell dreame let hath woorde speake worde true certainly appointeth law yt permitteth teach comanded calleth chaffe come himselfe onely therfore none prophetes selues opened mouth lord tolde hym wordes beforeesa viv ioh ivi wherupon sayinges ofte found among word lord burden lorde sayth lord mouth lord hath spoken worthily esaie cryed oute defyled lyppesesay viv iere ivi ieremie confessed coulde speake childe coulde procede ye defiled mouth one foolishe mouthe vncleane vnwise spoken owne speche lyps holy pure began instrument holy ghost prophetes boud religion deliuer nothyng haue receiued garnished notable power excellent title lorde testifieth hath set ouer nation kyngdomes pluck vp roote outiere destroy plucke downe builde plant adioyneth cause hath put wordes theyr mouth nowe looke apostle dede commended many notable title light worlde salt earth heard stede christ whatsoeuer bynde lose earth shalbe bounde loosed heauen name shewe howe muche permitted theim office apostle shoulde prate whatsoeuer list shold faithfully report commaundementes sent wordes christe playne enough hath determined embassagema xxviii ix comauded go teach al nation al thinges comaunded yea also receiued lawe laid vpon shold lawful man refuse doctrine sayth myne sent meioh viixvi father alway eternall couseller father appointed father lord scholemaister men yet executed ye ministerie teaching prescribed owne example minister rule ought folow teaching therfore power chirch infinite subiect word lord enclosed sith hath beginnyng ben force chirche day ought force seruantes god shold teache nothing whiche haue learned yet accordyng diuersitie tymes diuers order learnyng order nowe muche differeth first true whiche christe saiethmat xixxvii none hath seene father sonne hath pleased sonne shewe behoued verily alway directed eternal wisdome father whiche wold come knowledge god howe either haue comprehended mynd vttered misteries god teachyng alone secretes father ar open therfore holy father old time knew god wise beholding sonne glasse say meane god neuer meane disclose hymselfe men son wisdome light truthe fountaine adam noe abraham isaac iacob draw knowlege yt heauenly doctrine fou tain haue also al prophetes themselues drawe al heauely oracle vttered verily wisedome hath alway disclosed selfe moe way one patriarch vsed secrete reuelations therwithall confirme myndes adioyned suche signes coulde bee doutefull god spake patriarch conueied ouer hand hand posteritie whiche receiued lorde left entent sprede abrode child childrens child god secretely informyng knowe whiche heard heauen earth pleased god raise apparat forme chirche willed haue worde put writing noted prests shold fetch fro thense thei might deliuer people doctrine yt shold taught shold tried rule therfore publishyng lawmala iivii prestes comaunded teach mouth lord ye meaning shold teach nothing strauge differing kinde learning lord coprehended lawe adde diminishe vnlawful folowed prophet dede lord published new oracle added law yet new cam law respect vnto touchyng doctrine expositor law added nothyng vnto prophecy thyngs come excepted vttered nothyng el pure exposition lawe pleased lord shold plainer larger doctrine weake conscience might better satisfied comaunded prophecy also shold put writyng accompted parte worde hereunto added history whiche also workes prophetes made endityng holy ghost recken psalmes among prophecy attribute prophecy also comon psalmes therfore whole body copacted law prophecy psalmes history word lord olde people rule whereof prestes teacher euen vnto christes tyme bounde examine doctrine neither lawfull swarue either right hand left office enclosed within boundes answer people mouth godmal iiiiiiii gathered notable place malachie biddeth mindful law geue hede eue preaching gospell therby forbiddeth new found doctrine graunteth leaue swarue neuer little way moses faithfully shewed ye reason dauid honorably setteth excellence law reherseth many praise iewes couete forein thyng without sith within perfection enclosed last wisdome god openly shewed ye flesh wisdome ful mouth declared vnto v al yt euer man wit copreheded ought thought cocerning ye heuely father therefore sin christ ye fone rightousnesse hath shined haue perfect brightnesse ye truth god ye clerenesse wot mid day light dimme verily prophet meant speake meane thing whe wrote ye god old time spake diuersly many way father prophetsheb ii yt last day began speake v beloued sonne signifieth yea openly declareth god wil hereafter speake somtime sometime wil adde prophecy prophecy reuelations reuelations hath fulfilled al partes teaching sonne yt must haue thys last eternal testimonie whiche sort al time new testament wherein christe hath appeared v preaching gospell euen daie iugement expressed last houre last time last dayes ende verely contented perfection doctrine christe learne neither fayne v new beside receiue fained therfore without cause father hath singular prerogatiue ordeined sonne teacher commaunding hym manmat xviiv heard dede fewe wordes sette oute hys scholemaistership vnto v said heare whiche weight force men commonly thynke muche effect leading v away fro al doctrine men bring v commaude v loke al doctrine saluation alone hang vpon alone cleaue hym alone finally wordes sounde harke voice hym alone truely ought either loked desyred ye hand man worde lyfe hath familiarly openly disclosed himselfe vnto v yea mete yt mouthes al shut yt heauely father willed haue al treasure knowledge wisdome hidden hath one spoken spoke became wisdome god part vnperfect messias whoes hand reuelation al thinges hoped foriohn iiiixxv say left nothing afterwarde spoken let therefore stedfast principle yt worde god wherunto place geuen chirche yt conteined first law prophetes writinges apostle manner teaching rightly according prescription rule ye word hereupon also gather ther thing grauted ye apostle ye prophetes olde tyme expounde olde scripture shewe thinges yt therein taught fulfilled christ yet yt lorde saye spirite christe going certaine maner enditing wordes vnto themmathe xxviiixx christ limited embassage wt condition commaunded goe teache thinges themselues rashly forged al thynges comaunded themmat xxiii viii nothing could playnly spoke tha saieth place ye called maisters onely one maister christe emprint depely minde repeteth twise thesame place rudenesse could coceiue thynges heard learned mouth maisterioh xiii xxvi xvixiii therfore spirite trueth promised directed true vnderstanding al thinges ye restrayning diligetly noted office assigned holy ghost put minde al thinges yt taught mouth therfore peter wel taught much might lawfully leaueth nothing either himselfe distribute doctrine deliuered godi pe iiiixxi let yt speaketh saieth speake wordes god yt say doutingly wont tremble whoes coscience misgeueth wt sure cofidece beco meth ye seruat god furnished wt assured instructios thing forbidde al inuentions man minde fro hed soeuer haue proceded pure word god may heard learned ye chirch ye faithful take away ordinaces rather fained deuises al men degree soeuer decree god onely may remaine force spirituall armures mighty god cast holdesii cor xiiii ye faithful seruates god may throwe cousels al height aduaunceth selfe knowlege god may leade al knowlege captiue obey christ loe soueraigne power wherwt behoueth ye pastor chirch endued name soeuer called worde god may wt cofidece bolde al thing may copel al stregth glory wisdome height world yeld obey maiestie vpholde power may comaunde al eue fro hiest lowest may bilde vp house christ pull house sata may fede shepe driue awai wolues may instruct exhort willing learne may reproue rebuke subdue rebellious stubborne may bind loose finally may thuder lighte nede al thing ye word god howbeit haue said differece betwene ye apostle successor yt apostle wer ye certaine authetike secretary holy ghost therfore writinges estemed oracle god haue none office teache yt set fourth writte holy scripture determine therefore yt left faythfull minister may coyne new doctrine oughte simply cleaue ye doctrine wherunto ye lord hath made al wtoute exception subiect whe say meaning shew lawful al particular also lawful whole vniuersal chirch touching al particular paul verily ordeined ye lord apostle ye corinthias denieth yt hath dominio ouer faithi cor ixiiii dare take dominion vpon hymselfe paule testifieth yt belogeth acknowleged himselfe haue libertie teachig yt whatsoeuer ye pastor teacheth may therin right require beleued wold neuer haue taught corithias disciplinei cor iiixiiiixxix yt twoe three prophetes speake ye rest iudge reueled yt sate ye first hold peace spared none whoes authoritie made subiect ye iugemet ye word god wil say ye whole vniuersall chirch ye case otherwise answere yt place paul meteth wt dout also saieth yt faith hearing hearing ye word godrom x truly faith hang ye word god hath respecte vnto resteth vpon alone place left ye worde whole world herin may dout yt hath wel knowen faith faith ought staied vpo assurednesse wherby may stande inuincible sata al engine hell ye whole world assurednesse shal find ye word god againe general rule oughte haue respect vnto yt god doth therfore take fro men power set fourth new doctrine yt may scholemaister heauenly learning true ca neither lye deceiue rule belongeth lesse ye whole chirch euery one faithful power chirche haue spoken compared power wherof spirituall tyrantes haue falslye called themselues bishop prelate religion haue certayne age past bosted themselues among people god agreemente shalbe better christ hath beliall yet place purpose declare sorte wicked meanes haue exercised tyranny wil rehearse doctrine day defende first writinges swerd fyre take thyng confessed general coucell true image chirche haue taken principle without dout determine counsel immediatly gouerned holy ghost therfore erre whereas themselues rule counsells yea make doe dede chalenge themselues whatsoeuer affirme due cou cell therfore wil haue faith stande fall whatsoeuer shal determine one side maye stablished certayne mindes allow thing must allowe without douting condemne thyng must also holde codemned meane time lust despising worde god coyne doctrine afterwarde require thys rule haue fayth geuen also say christian doth certainly consent theyr doctrine wel affirmatiue negatiue expressed yet vnexpressed faith power chirche make new article fayth first let v heare argumetes proue yt authoritie geuen chirche shal se much maketh allege chirch chirch say hath notable promise shal neuer forsake christ spouse shalbe guided spirite al truth promise wont allege many geue lesse euery one ye faithful particularly tha whole chirche vniuersally though lord spake xii apostlesmath xxviii xx ioh xiiiixvi whe said behold eue end world wil aske father shal geue coforter namely spirite truth yet made promise whole nuber xii also euery one yea disciple likewise either yt alredy receiued yt afterwarde added whe expoude promise ful singular cofort though geue none ye christian whole chirche together ell take away fro al christian confidence ought receiue therby encourage yet deny yt whole felowship faithful furnished manifolde diuersitie gyftes endued much larger plentifull treasure heaue ly wisdome eche one seuerally neither meaning yt thys spoken common faithful though al alike endued spirite vnderstanding doctrine graunted aduersaries christ yt defense euill cause wrest scripture wrong sense omitting thisi cor ixii simply cofesse yt true yt lord perpetually preset ruleth wt spirite yt spirite spirite error ignorance lyeng darkenesse sure reuelation wisedome trueth light deceitfully may learne thinges geue themeph ixviii say hope calling richesse glory inheritaunce god saintes wheras faythful euen endued excellent giftes aboue rest thys fleshe receiue onely firste frutes certaine tast yt spirite remaineth nothing leeuer tha knowing weakenesse hold themselues carefully within boundes worde god least wander farr sense stray ye right waie much yet voide spirite whoes teaching truth discerned falshodephi iiixi men confesse paule haue yet atteined ye marke therfore endeuor daily profiting glory perfection wil take exception say yt whatsoeuer particularly attributed euery one ye holy one ye doth throughly fully belong ye chirche selfe although hath seming truth yet deney true god doth dede distribute euery one ye member ye giftes spirite measure yt whole body wanteth nothing necessarie whe giftes geue comon ye richesse chirche alway yt euer wateth much yt hiest perfection aduersaries bost yet ye chirche therefore lefte destitute behalf yt alway hath much enough lord knoweth necessitie requireth holde vnder humilitie godly modestie geueth knoweth expedient know also wont obiecte isephe vxxv tim iii xv chirche clensed wt washing water worde life yt might without wrincle spot yt therfore place called piller stay truth first two place rather taught christ daily worketh hath allredy done daily sanctifieth purgeth polysheth wypeth spottes truely certayne yet besprinkled spottes wrincles wanteth somwhat sanctificatio vayne fabulous iudge chirch alredy euery part holy spottlesse wherof member spotty vncleane true therefore chirche sanctified christe onely beginning sanctifieng seen ende full accomplishment shall christe holiest holy one shall truely fully fill holinesse true also spottes wrincles wiped awaye daily wiping awaye vntill christe comming dooe vtterlye take awaye remaineth vnlesse graunt must necessitie affirme pelagians righteousnesse faithfull perfect life cathani donatistes muste suffer infirmitie chirch place haue ell seen hath sense vtterly differing pretende paule hath instructed timothee framed true office bishop sayeth yt purpose yt knowe ought haue himselfe ye chirch yt greater religiousnesse endeuor bend himselfe thereunto addeth chirch piller stay truth ell wordes meane yt truth god preserued ye chirch namely ministerie preaching place teacheth christ gaue apostleseph iiiixi pastor teacher caried euery winde doctrine morked men enlightened true knowledge sonne god altogether mete vnitie faith wheras therfore truth extinguished world remayneth safe yt cometh passe hath chirche faithful keper whoes helpe ministerie susteined keping standeth ministerie prophetes apostle foloweth yt hangeth wholy herupo word lord faithfully preserued doe kepe hys puritie reders may better vnderstande vpon pointe thys question chefely standeth wil fewe wordes declare aduersaries require wherin stande say chirche erre tendeth herunto thus expounde forasmuch gouerned spirite god may goe safely without worde yt whether soeuer goeth thinke speake thing truth yt therfore determine thing wt beside god worde otherwise estemed certaine oracle god graut yt first point chirche erre thinges necessarie saluation meaning therfore forsaking al wisdome suffreth selfe taught holy ghost word god therfore difference set authoritie chirch without worde god wil annexed worde suffer seuered maruel spouse scholar christ subiect husbande scholemaister yt cotinually ernestly hageth mouth order wel gouerned house yt wife obey authoritie husbande thys ye rule wel ordered schoole yt teaching ye scholemaster alone heard wherfore let chirche wise selfe thinke thing selfe determine ende wisdoe hath made ende speaking thys maner shal also distruste inuentions owne reason thinges wherin stadeth vpo word god shall wauer distrustfulnesse doutyng shall reste great assurednesse stedfast constancie also trusting vpon largenesse promise hath shal haue whereupon aboudantly susteine fayth maye nothyng doute best guide righte way holy spirite alwaye presente therewithall shall kepe memorie vse lord would haue v receiue holy spiriteioh xvivii xiii spirite sayth wil send fro father shal leade al truth sayeth shal put minde al thinges haue tolde therfore geueth warning nothing loked spirite enlighte mindes perceiue truth doctrine therfore chrisostome saieth excellently well many sayeth boste holy spirite sermo de sanc adorand spiri iohn xiil xiiiix speake falsly pretede haue christ testified spake himselfe spake law prophetes thing beside gospel thrust vnder title ye spirite let v beleue christ fulfilling law prophetes spirite gospel word esy gather wrogfully aduersaries bost holy ghost ende set fourth vnder name strage foreine doctrine word god wheras wil wt vnspeakable knott conioined wt worde god thesame doth christe professe promiseth chirch truly sobrietie ye lord hath one prescribed chirch ye wil haue perpetually kept hath forbidden yt adde thing worde take thing fro inuiolable decree god holy ghost whiche aduersaries goe abrogate faine chirche ruled spirite without worde againe murmure v say behoued chirch shold adde thing ye writinges apostle yt theselues afterwarde wt liuely voice supply many thinges clearly enough taught namely sith christ said vnto haue many thinges said beare yt ordinancesioh xvixii wtout scripture haue ben receiued vse maners shamelessenesse graut disciple yet rude maner vnapt learne whe lord said vnto wer also holde wt dulnesse whe put doctrine writing yt afterward neded supply liuely voice yt fault ignorace omitted writinges already led spirite trueth al trueth whe set fourth writinges hindred yt thei haue therin conteined left written perfect knowledge doctrine gospell goe let v graunt require let point thinges yt behoued reueled without writing dare enterprise wil assaile augustine wordes hom ioh xcvi lord hath saied nothing v dare say dare say wherby doeth proue striue superfluous mater childe doeth knowe writinges apostle men make maner lame half perfecte frute reuelation lorde promise say christ put controuersy soeuer chirche teacheth decreethmat xviii xvii comaundeth taken heathen man publicane dare saye firste place mentio made doctrine authoritie censure established correcting vice haue ben admonished rebuked resist iudgement omitting muche maruell losels haue litle shame dare proude place shal get therby yt consent chirche neuer despised whiche neuer consenteth vnto trueth worde god chirch heard say denieth forasmuch pronounceth nothing ye worde lorde require let know wordes christ nothing take part therin neither oughte thought muche contentious stande earnestly vpo point lawful chirche make new doctrine teach deliuer oracle yt lorde hath reueled hys worde men sounde witt doe se great dauger great authoritie one grauted se also howe wyde wyndowe opened mockynges cauillations wicked saye whiche men haue iudged take oracle among christian beside christ speaking according cosideratio time geueth thys name sinagoge disciple afterwarde learne reuerence holy assembly chirche shoulde come passe yt euery citie village haue egall authoritie coyning doctrine example vse nothing helpe say baptising infantes proceded much expresse commaundement scripture decree chirche miserable succor compelled flee bare authoritie chirche defense baptisme infantes shal place sufficiently appeare yt farre otherwise likewise whereas obiecte yt founde scripture pronounced ye nicene synode yt sone cosubstantial wt father therin great wrong father though rashly codemned arrius would sweare wordes professed al doctrine coprehended writinges prophetes apostle word graut scripture whe therin oft affirmed yt one god againe christ oft called true eternall god one father thyng father nicene councell whe declare yt one substance simply set naturall sense scripture theodorite reporteth yt constantine vsed preface assemblie histo eccle li cap v disputation sayeth diuine mater prescribed doctrine holy ghost bokes gospel apostle oracle prophetes fully shewe v meanyng god therefore layeng away discorde let v take discussinges question wordes spirite tyme man spake agaynst holy monition man toke exception chirche might adde somwhat spirite reueled thynges apostle least vttered came suche thyng true whiche oure aduersaries would haue fyrste constantine euil toke chirche authoritie whereas none bishop time rose vp defend without breach faith betraiers right chirche sith theodorite reherseth willingly embraced emperor saied certaine newe doctrine vtterly vnknowen ix chapter councels authoritie although graunt al thinges concerning ye chirch yet shal therby much preuaile intent whatsoeuer said chirch geue councels forasmuche opinio represent chirch yea stiffly contend power chirche doe purpose geue gett bishop rome gard ere begin discusse question must nedes make protestation twoo thinges aforehande first shall thys point somwhat roughe lesse esteme olde councels ought doe reuerence hart wishe due honor men herein meane bee nothing withdrawen christ right christe hed councells haue man felow dignitie say hed gouerneth whole assemblie worde spirite secondly whereas geue lesse councells tha aduersaries require cause afrayed councells though dyd make side wer aboundantly furnished worde lord full profe owne doctrine fully ouerthrowe whole papistrie nede muche desire thing beside mater require old councells great part minister vnto v much may suffice let v speake thing selfe soughte scripture authoritie councells playner promise tha saying christ twoo three shalbe gathered together name middest doeth lesse belong euery particular assemblie generall councellmat xviii xx dout question standeth therin condition added god wil middest councel gathered together hys name therfore although oure aduersaries doe thousande tymes name councells bishop shal litle preuail neither shal make v beleue affirme gouerned holy ghost vntil haue proued gathered together name christ possible yt wicked euil bishop may conspire christ good honest bishop may come together hys name clere profe herof many decree yt haue proceded suche councells shalbe sene hereafter nowe aunswer one worde christe promiseth nothing gathered gether name let v therfore define denye gathered together name christdeu iiii ii reuela xxiixviii casting awaye commaundement god wherein forbiddeth thing bee added worde taken decree euery thyng owne wil beyng contented oracle scripture saye onely rule perfecte wisedome imagine new thing owned hed surelye sithe christ hath promised wyll present councels hath adioyned peculiar marke wherby make true lawfull councells differente mete neglect difference couenant old tyme god made leuitical priestsmalac iivii yt shold teach mouth alway required prophetes lawe also see haue ben laid vpon apostle breake couenat god doeth vouchsafe let haue honor presthode authoritie lette aduersaries vndoe knotte wyl make fayth bonde decree men beside worde god wheras think yt truth remaineth chirch vnlesse among pastor chirch self standeth vnlesse appere generall councells farre hauyng ben alwaye true prophetes haue left vnto v true testimony owne tymes tyme esaie chirch hierusalem god yet forsakenesa lvix pastor saith thus watchman blynde neither knowe thyng dumme dogges neither able barke lye along slepe loue sleping pastor themselues knowe nothyng vnderstande altogether loke backe vnto owne way maner osee saiethosee ixviii hiere vixiii watcheman ephraim god snare fouler hatred house god ioyning god waye mockage teacheth pretense presthod vaine chirche also endured vnto tyme hieremie let v heare saieth pastor prophet euen prestehier xiiii ii euery one foloweth lying agayne prophetes doo prophecie lye name haue sent theim commaunded least long recityng wordes let thynges red hath written whole xxiii xl chapiterseze xxiixxv time side ezechiel gently inueye men conspiracie saieth prophetes middes roaryng lyon violentlye taketh praie prestes haue broken lawe haue defiled holy thynges haue made difference betwene holy prophane rest adioyneth effect like complaintes euery prophetes nothyng ofter found perhappes might among iewes age free great euill would god deed wer holy ghost hath geuen warnyng shalbe farre otherwise wordes peter plaineii pet ii saieth olde people false prophet shall also bee among false teacher slyly bryngyng sectes perdition see saieth daunger come men comon people shal boste themselues title teacher pastorsmath xxiiiixi xxiiii ii thess iiiiii moreouer oft hath ben forespoken christ apostle great daungers hang ouer chirch pastor yea paule plainly sheweth antichrist shal sit place temple god wherby signifieth horrible calamitie whiche speaketh shall come el shall sitte stede pastor chirch place sheweth beginnyngs great mischief euen alredy nere hand speaketh bishop ephesus know saieth departure shall enter rauenyng wolues sparing flockeactes xxxix shalbe selues shall speake peruerse thynges leade away disciple muche corruption might long course yeares bryng amog pastor coulde farre goe kynde small space tyme fyll muche paper rehersyng name admonished example maner al age neither truth alway nourished bosome pastor safetie chirch doeth hang vpon state ought dede haue bene gouernours kepers peace safetie chirche preseruation wherof ordeined one thyng man performe whiche ought thyng owe whiche performeth yet lette man take wordes suche part thoughe woulde euery rashely without choise diminishe authoritie pastor onely admonishe euen among pastor selues choise bee immediatly thinke pastor called pope flocke bishop vpon none reason called pastor shaking away obedience word god tumble tosse thing owne lust meane tyme thei trauaile persuade destitute light truth spirite god perpetually abideth chirche co sisteth dieth though iugementes lorde wherby may punishe worlde daye kynde punishement wherwith somtyme toke vengeance vnthankfulnesse olde people strike pastor blindnesse amased dullnesse acha xiiiiii neither foolish vnderstande syng song whiche old time syng warred worde god enemy hieremie thus prepare selues truthehie xviii xviii come imagine imagination ieremie forasmuche lawe shall perishe preste counsell wyse man worde prophete hereby easy answer obiectio concerning general councells denied iewes true chirch time prophetes ther ben general cou cell gathered together prestes maner face chirche apperedhier iiiiix heare god saith one two whole order prestes shalbe astonied prophetes shalbe made afraide againe law shall perishe prest counsell elderseze viixxvi mich iiivi againe night shalbe steede vision darknesse stede prophecieng sunne shall fall downe vpon prophetes darkened vpon day c well suche ben gathered together one spirit haue gouerned assemblie thyng haue notable example councel achab called together ther present fower hundred prophetesi kin xxii vi et xxii come togither mynde flatter wicked kyng therfore satan sent lorde lying spirite mouth voice truthe condemned micha condemned heretike striken cast prison done hieremie prophetes let one example suffice whiche notable restioh xi xlvi councell bishop pharisee gathered hierusalem christ man say wanted muche pertained outwarde shewe ben chirch hierusalem christ would neuer haue comunicate sacrifice ceremony made solemne summoning together hie bishop sat chief whole order prestes sate hym yet christ condemned doctrine driuen away doyng profe chirche enclosed councell perill thyng happen v hath geue v assurace therof without fault sluggishnesse carelesse great mater wher holy ghost doeth expresse wordes prophecie mouth pauleii iiiii shall come departyng come pastor must first shall forsake god herin wilfully blynde owne destruction wherfore wise graunted chirch consisteth companie pastor lord hath vndertaken shall perpetually bee good hath pronounced shall sometime euill warneth v daunger doeth entente make v warer wilt thou saye shall councells haue authoritie determinyng yes forsoothe neither doo argue councels condemned actes repelled saying defaced one blotte thou wilte say thou bryngest subiection maye bee free euery man receiue refuse whiche councells haue determined oft decree councel brought foorth would haue first diligently weyed tyme holden cause holden maner men present thyng entreated examined rule scripture suche sorte determination councell may haue force foreiudged sentence yet hinder aforesaid examination wold god men kepe moderation augustine prescribeth third boke maximinus mynded brefely put silence heretike contendyng decree councels neither sayeth ought obiect thee synod nice thou synode ariminum entent conclude one foreiudged sentece neither bound authoritie one thou authority scripture propre either one suche common let striue mater wt mater cause cause reason reason come passe coucels haue maiestie ought meane season scripture alone hier place might nothing shold subiect rule therof old synod nice constantinople first ephesus chalcedon holde confutyng error willyngly embrace reuerece holy much belongeth doctrine faith conteine nothyng pure naturall exposition scripture whiche holy father spirituall wisdome applied subduyng enemy religion rose vp later councels also se appere true zele godlinesse plaine token witt learning wisdom thinges ar wonte commonly growe worse maye se later councells howe muche chirch hath nowe degenerate purenesse golden age doute corrupter age also councells haue bishoppes better sorte happened senator themselues complained well doone makyng ordinance senate rome sentence numbred weyed necessitie oftetimes better part ouercom greater truly brought foorth many wicked sentence neither nedefull gather speciall example either long haue doon diligently muche added nede reherse councels disagreyng councels cause murmure say councels disagree one lawfull howe shall iudge deceiued shall iudge scripture decree thereof agreable true doctrine onely certaine law discerne nine hundred yeares agoe sin synode constantinople gathered together vnder leo emperour iudged image sette vp chirches ouerthrowen broken piece lyttell afterward councell nice irene empresse assembled spite decreed shoulde bee restored whether two shall acknowledge lawful counsell later gaue image place chirches hath preuailed among people augustine saith doone without moste present perill idolatrie epiphanius whiche tyme speaketh much sharply saith wickednesse abhomination haue image seen chirche christian wold speake allowe councell aliue day bothe hystorians tell truth actes beleued image selues also worshipping receiued euident suche decree came satan say deprauing tearing scripture shew made mocking stocke whiche thyng haue sufficiently made open howsoeuer shall otherwise able discerne betwene contrarye disagreyng synodes whiche many vnlesse trie balance men angel worde lord embrace synode chalcedon refusyng seconde synode ephesus latter one wickednesse eutyches confirmed former condemned thing holy haue iudged none otherwise scripture folowe iudgyng woorde god gaue light doeth also nowe geue light v nowe let romanistes goe boast wont holy ghost fastned bound councells howbeit also somwhat man may well thinke bee wantyng auncient purer councels either thei beyng otherwise learned wise men wholly bent businesse hande foresee many thyngs many thynges lighter importance escaped beeyng busied weightier earnest mater simply beeyng menne myghte bee deceiued vnskilfulnesse sometyme caried headlong muche affection laste point whiche semeth hardest plaine example nicene synode dignitie whereof hath consent men worthy ben receiued hye reuerence principall article faith daunger arrius enemie present redinesse must fyght hande hande chief emportance lay agrement came prepared fight againste error arrius withstandyng carelesse great daugers yea hauyng forgotten grauitie modestie humanitie leauyng battel hand com thether purpose arrius pleasure began woud themselues inward dissentions tourne themselues stile haue ben bent arrius hearde fowle obiectyngs crime scattered bokes accusation would haue ben ende made contention vntill mutuall woundes one destroied vnlesse emperor constantine preueted professyng examinyng life mater aboue knowledge chastised suche intemperance rather praise rebukyng many way credible councels also failed whiche folowed afterward neither doeth mater nede long profe man reade ouer actes councels shall note therin many infirmity though speake nothyng greuous leo bishop rome sticketh charge ambition vnaduised rashnesse synode chalcedon yet confesseth sounde doctrine doeth dede denie lawfull synode openly affirmeth might erre man peraduenture thinke fonde busy selfe shewyng suche error forasmuche aduersaries confesse councels may erre thyngs ar necessary saluation labor yet superfluous althoughe compelled dede confesse worde yet thrust vnto v determination al councels euery mater whatsoeuer oracle holy ghost therein require toke beginnyng affirme coucels erre erre yet lawfull v see truthe soothe error intend nothyng ell may therby gathered holy ghost gouerned godly holy synodes mean tyme suffred somwhat happen nature men lest shold muche trust men muche better sentence gregorie nazianzene neuer sawe good end councel affirmeth al without exception ended ill doth leaue much authoritie nothyng nedefull make mention seuerally prouinciall councells forasmuche easy iudge general much authoritie ought haue make newe article faithe receiue kynde doctrine soeuer pleaseth romanistes see defence cause helpe reason doth faile resort extreme miserable shift although men themselues blockishe wit cousell moste wicked mynde yet word god remaineth whiche comaundeth obey ruler denie ruler ar ought take vpon themselues iosua bothe prophet lord excellent pastor let v heare wordes set lorde officeios ivii let saieth volume lawe depart thy mouth thou shalt studie vpon day night thou shalt neither bow ye right hand ye left shalt yu direct thy way vnderstad therfore shalbe v spiritual ruler shal bowe fro ye law lord neither one side doctrine al pastor whatsoeuer receiued wtout douting purpose yt shold declare great importance maner prophet heard rashely heard wherfore reason make v afraid title therby draw v partakyng blyndnesse forasmuche see side lorde hadde singular care fray v away suffring controuersie maie discussed suche determination wherunto pastor chirches shall agree common together calling vpon spirite christ shall haue muche greater force euery one seuerally conceiue home teach people priuate men shold make bishop gathered together one doo comodiously take aduise comon forme ought teach least diuersitie shold brede offence thirdely paule prescribeth order discerning doctrine vngodly man restored peace chirches whiche vexed defended eternall godhead christ againste blasphemous doctrine afterward eunonius macedonius stirred vp new trouble madnesse resisted like remedie
