athanasies basiles cyrilles suche defender true doctrine lord raysed vp lette v thinke happened ephesus second synode heresie eutyches preuailed man holy memory flauianus banished certain godly men many suche mischeues co mitted euen dioscorus seditious man naghtye nature chief spirite lord chirche graunt determine vtterly truthe doeth therfore die chirche although oppressed one councell lord meruailously preserueth maye agayne due tyme ryse vp get ouerhande denie perpetuall true certaine exposition scripture hath ben receiued consentes counsell romanists shoote mark whe teach power expound scripture belongeth councels yea without appellation abuse colour call exposition scripture soeuer decreed councels purgatorie intercession saintes auricular confession suche founde one sillable scripture thynges haue stablished authoritie chirch say speake truely receiued opinion vse therfore euery one muste bee taken exposition scripture councell decree thyng though scripture crie yet shall beare name exposition therof christ commaundeth drynke cuppemat xxvi xxvi reacheth supper councell constance forbade bee geuen laie people willed preste onely shoulde drinke directly fighteth againste institution christe haue taken exposition paule calleth forbiddyng mariagei timo iiii heb xiiiiiii hypocrisie deuels holy ghost place pronounceth mariage men holy honorable haue afterwarde forbidden prestes marry require haue take true naturall exposition scripture nothing imagined dare one open mouth contrary shalbe iudged heretike determination chirche without appellation doute exposition true haynous offence shold inueye great shamelessness shewyng ouercomyng whiche teache power allowe scripture wittingly passe ouer sort make oracle god subiect iudgement men therfore force haue pleased men blasphemie vnworthy rehersed haue touched mater already yet aske one thyng authoritie scripture founded vpon allowance chirche councels decree alledge mater thynke haue none arrius suffer himselfe ouercome nice testimony brought gospell iohn men sayeng free hym haue refused forasmuche allowance generall councell gone alledge olde rolle whiche called canon whiche say haue proceded iudgement chirche aske againe councell canon set foorth must nedes dumme howbeit desire knowe maner canon thynke se certainly agreed among olde writer hierome saieth ought force bokes machabees tobie ecclesiasticus suche shalbe thrust among apocrypha canon doo wyse suffer bee doone p x chapter pof power makyng lawes wherin pope haue vsed moste cruell tyranny butcherie vpon soules foloweth second part wil haue consist making lawes oute whiche spring haue flowed innumerable tradition men euen many snare strangle poore soules haue conscience scribe phariseesmat xxiii vi lay burden vpon men sholders themselues would touche one finger haue place taught cruel butcherie whiche commaude concerning auricular confession lawes appeareth great violence seme tolerable doe tyrannously oppresse conscience leaue vnspoken corrupt ye worship god spoile god hymselfe hys righte onely lawmaker power entreated whether chirch may bind cosciences wt lawes discourse order policie touched inteded yt god rightly worshipped according rule himselfe hath prescribed yt spirituall libertie hath regarde vnto god may remayne safe vnto v use hath made yt al decree called tradition men whatsouer yt haue concerning worship god proceded fro men beside hys worde striue holy profitable ordinaces ye chirch make ye preseruatio either discipline honestie peace ye ende striuing ye immeasurable barbarous empire may restrained vsurpe vppon soules would copted pastor chirch dede cruel butcher say lawes whiche make spiritual perteining soule affirme necessarie eternal life euen touched kingdome christ inuaded libertie geue cosciences faithful vtterly oppressed throwen abrode speake howe great vngodlynesse stablish obseruing lawes teache men seke forgeuenesse synnes righteousnesse saluatio set whole summe religio godlynesse one thyng earnestly holde yt ought necessitie laied vpo cosciences thinges wherin made free christ vnlesse made free haue taught ca rest wt god must acknowlege one king christ deliuerer gouerned one law libertie euen ye holy word ye gospel wil kepe stil grace haue one obteyned christe must holden bondage bounde bondes solon dede faine constitution lawes libertie swete yoke light burden se mere lye themselues dede fele heauinesse owne lawes casting away feare god doe carelesly stoutly neglecte owne god lawes touched wyth care saluation farr thynking themselues free long entangled snare se howe greate warenesse paule deale behalfei cor viixxv durste much one thing laye vpon men snare al without cause truely foresaw great wounde cosciences striken charged wt necessitie thing wherof lord left libertie ye side constitution almost innumerable haue greuously stablished thretening eternal death seuerely require necessarie saluatio among many hard kept al ye whole multitude layed together impossible great heape shal possible yt vpo great weight difficultie lyeth shold vexed perplexitie wt extreme anguish terror therfore purpose impugne costitutions tend thys ende inwardly bind soules god charge religion though taughte thinges necessary saluation question doth therfore encober ye part suttelly enough put difference betwene ye outward court thei cal court coscience moreouer thys encreaseth difficultie yt paul teacheth yt magistrate ought obeyed feare punishemetro xiiii cosciences sake wherupon foloweth ye cosciences also bounde wt politike lawes al fall haue spoke ye last chap entende speake cocerning spiritual gouernement ye loosing thys knot first good learne coscience definition gathered ye proper deriuatio ye word whe wt minde vnderstanding conceiue knowlege thing therby sayd scire know wherupon deriued ye name science knowlege haue feling god iugement witnesse adioined wt doth suffer hide sine yt brought accused ye iudgemet seate god ye feling called cosciece certayne meane betwene god suffreth suppresse knoweth pursueth far til bring giltinesse yt paule meaneth whe teacheth yt cosciece doth together witnesse wt mero iixv whe theyr thoughtes accuse acquite iugemet god simple knowlege might remaine enclosed therfore thys feling presenteth ye iugemet god keper ioyned marke watch al secretes yt nothing remaine buryed darkenesse whereupo also cometh ye old prouerbe cosciece thousad witnessesi pet iiixxi ye reso also peter hath set examinatio good coscience quietnesse mynde whe persuaded grace christe doe without feare present selues godheb xii author epistle ye hebrues vseth wordes haue coscience synne stede deliuered acquited synne may accuse v therfore workes haue respect ye coscience referred god ye coscience nothyng el inwarde purenesse ye hart sense paule writeth yt charitie fulfilling laweii tim iv pure coscience fayth fayned afterwarde also chap sheweth much differeth vnderstanding sayeng suffered shipwracke fayth forsake good coscience wordes signifieth yt liuely affectio worship god sincere desire liue godlily holily somtime dede referred also men luke ye paul testifiethact xxiiii xvi yt endeuored himselfe yt mighte walke wt good coscience toward god men therfore saied frutes good coscience flowe come euen speakyng properly hath respect god haue alredy said hereupon cometh yt law said binde coscience simply bindeth man without regarde hauing cosideration exaple god comaundeth kepe minde chast pure al lust also forbiddeth al maner filthinesse wordes outward wantonesse whatsoeuer ye keping lawe coscience subiect although liued one man world beha th himselfe inteperantly doeth synne thys yt geueth exaple brother hath coscience bounde giltinesse god thinges yt themselues meane cosideratio ought absteine fro brede offesei cori xxxviii ye coscience stil free paule speaketh fleshe consecrate idol sayth make dout touch conscience sake say cosciece thine ye others faithful shold sinne first warned neuerthelesse eate fleshe howsoeuer respect brother necessarie absteine prescribed god yet cesseth kepe still ye libertie coscience see law bynding outward worke leaueth conscience vnbounde let v returne ye lawes made end charge v wt religio though ye obseruing wer selfe necessarie say yt layed vpo coscience lawfull laied vpo conscieces haue doe wt wt god whereunto perteineth ye como differece betwene earthly court court coscience whe whole world wrapped thick mist ignorace yet smal sparcle light remained yt acknowleged man coscience aboue al iugemetes howbeit ye thing yt wt one worde cofesse afterwarde dede ouerthrowe yet god wil ye also remaine testimonie christia libertie might deliuer cosciences tyranny ye difficultie yet dissolued ariseth ye word paule must obeye prince onely penalty sake also cosciece semeth thereupo folowe yt prince lawes haue also dominio ouer coscice true thesame also ought said ye lawes ye chirch answere yt first must put differece betwene ye generaltie ye specialtie though al special lawes touch ye cosciece yet boude ye general comaundemet god comedeth vnto v ye authoritie magistrate vpo point stadeth ye disputatio paulro xiiii yt magistrate honored ar ordeined god ye meane time teacheth yt lawes yt prescribed belog ye inward gouernemet soule wheras eche extolleth ye worshipping god spiritual rule liuig righteously aboue al ye ordinaces whatsoeuer thig also worthy noted yet hageth vpon former lawes men whether made magistrate chirch although necessarie kepte speake good righteous lawes yet therefore themselues binde conscience whole necessitie keping referred ye general ende cosisteth thing commauded fro sort far differ yt prescribe new forme ye worshipping god yt appoint necessitie thing yt libertie yt day called ecclesiastical costitutios papacie thrust stede true necessarie worshipping god innumerable infinite bondes catch snare soules although declaration ye law haue somwhat touched yet place fitter entreate fully nowe trauaile gather together whole summe best order haue already discoursed much semed sufficient concerning tyranny false bishop take vpon themselues libertie teache whatsoeuer list wil omitt al parte wil tarry vpo declaring ye power say haue make lawes false bishop therfore burden conscience newe lawes vnder pretense ordeined ye lord spiritual lawmaker sin gouernement chirch committed vnto therefore affirme whatsoeuer commaunde prescribe oughte necessarily obserued christian people yt breaketh giltie double disobediece rebellious god chirch certainly true bishop would behalfe graunt authoritie much require much requisite wel ordering police chirche sith nothing lesse woulde accompted take thing neuer little shall take much hath ben ell considered let v graunt present whatsoeuer power true bishop haue rightly belongeth also yet deny therfore appointed lawmaker ouer faythfull yt may themselues prescribe rule liue compell ordinaces yt people committed vnto say meane lawfull deliuer chirch obserued necessitie yt haue deuised themselues without word god forasmuch authoritie vnknowen apostle oft taken away minister chirch lordes owne mouth maruel haue ben bolde take vpon daye bolde defende beside example apostle manifest prohibition god touchig yt perteined ye perfect rule wel liuing ye lord hath conteined al yt law yt hath left nothing men yt might adde summe first purpose yt ye whole vprightnesse liuing stadeth point workes gouerned wil rule holden v ye maister directer lyfeiam iiiixii declare requireth v nothing obedience reason iames sayth yt iudgeth brother iudgeth law iudgeth law obseruer law iudge one onely lawmaker saue destroy heare yt god doth claime one thing proper himselfe rule v gouernement lawes word thing spoken esayesa e xxxiiixxii although somwhat darkly lord king lord lawmaker lord iudge shal saue v truly place shewed hath power ouer soule hath iugement life death yea iames pronounceth plainly man take vpo therfore god must acknowleged king soules alone belongeth power saue destroy word esaye expresse king iudge lawmaker sauior therfore peter admonisheth pastor dutie exhorteth fede flocke vsing lordship ouer clergie whiche worde clergie signifieth inheritance godi pe vii yt saye faithfull people rightly weye lawfull transferred man god maketh owne onely shal vnderstande al power cut whatsoeuer chalenge aduaunce themselues commaunde thing chirche without worde god forasmuch whole cause hangeth therupon god lawmaker lawful men take yt honor themselues mete also therewithall kepe minde twoo reason haue spoken lord claimeth himselfe alone first wil may v perfect rule al righteousnesse holinesse knowing may perfecte knowlege liue wel manner soughte worship rightly wel may haue authoritie ouer soules ought obeye vpon whoes beck oughte hang twoo reasos wel marked shalbe easye iudge ordinance men contrary word god yt sort al fained belong true worshipping god ye obseruing wherof conscience bounde though wer necessarie obserued let v therfore remeber yt al lawes ought weyed balance wil haue sure triall yt may neuer suffer v errecol ivii first reason paule ye epistle ye colossian vseth contending false apostle yt attempted oppresse ye chirches wt newe burdes secod reaso vseth wt galatia ye like case therfore trauaileth proue ye epistle colossias yt doctrine cocerning true worshipping god sought me hand lord hath faithfully fully instructed v ought worshipped proue ye first chap saith yt gospel coteined al wisdome wherby god may made perfect christe ye beginning ii chap saith yt al treasure wisdome vnderstanding hidde christ therupo afterward cocludeth let ye faithfull beware yt vain philosophie led fro flocke christe according constitution ende chapter doth yet wt greater boldnesse condemne al ethelothreskias yt say al fained worshippings deuise theselues receiue whatsoe er precept dare theselues geue cocernig ye worshippig god haue therfore yt al ordinaces wicked obseruing wherof worshipping god fained ye place ye galatian wherwt earnestly affirmeth ye conscience ought ruled god ought entagled wt snare ope enough specially v chap therfore let sufficient haue noted whole mater shal better made open example yt goe good also apply doctrine time say yt costitutios cal ecclesiasticall wherwith pope burden chirch pernicious wicked aduersaries defende yt holy auailable saluatio twoo kindes cocerne ceremony rite perteine discipline iust cause moue v impugne truly iuster tha would firste ye author theselues clerely define yt worshipping god conteined purpose apply ceremony god shold worshipped yt cometh passe ye error ye ignorant multitude allowace yt haue ye place teachig touche ye grosse abhominations wherwt haue gone ouerthrow al godlinesse imagined among hainous offese haue failed ye least pety traditios vnlesse make worshipping god subiect fained deuises offende day beare yt whiche paul taught intolerable yt lawfull order ye worshipping god reduced ye wil specially comaund worship according ye elemetes world paul testifieth christcol iixx vi againe vnknowe wt precise necessitie binde cosciences kepe whatsoeuer comaude cry ye cotrary haue al one cause paule wise suffreth faithful conscience brought bondage men moreouer worst al added yt religio hath one begon defined wt vain inuetios euer foloweth yt peruersnesse abhominable frowardnesse wherof christ reproched pharisee yt comaundemet god made voide ye traditios wil vse mine word fighting lawmaker day let haue ye victory meane purge theselues fro accusatio christ excuse whe amog thought infinitly hainous haue omitted auricular cofessio ye time yere cometh tha haue cotinued wicked life whole yere together haue infected tong wt litle tasting flesh friday tha haue defiled body whoredome al ye dayes weke haue put hand h nest work vpo day cosecrate wote pety saint tha haue cotinually exercised mebers wicked offeses priest coupled wt one lawful mariage tha entagled wt thousand adultery haue performed vowed pilgremage tha breake faith al promise haue wasted somwhat vpo monstruous lesse superfluous vnprofitable excessiue gorgiousnesse teples tha ha e failed help ye extreme necessity ye poore haue passed id e wtout honor tha haue despitefully entreated al kindes men haue mumbled vp certaine houres great nuber wordes without vnderstanding tha neuer haue conceiued true praier hart make voide comaundement god tradition men comending keping god commaundemetes coldly lightly way lesse earnestly busily exact ye obeying owne conteined whole pith godlinesse whe reuenging ye transgressing god law light penalty satisfaction punishe least offence one decree lesse peine prisonmente banishmente fier swerd sharpe harde entreate despisers god persecute despisers themselues vnappeasable hatred extremitie doe instructe whoes simplicitie holde captiue yt would contented minde se ye whole law god ouerthrowen one smal title cal comaundemetes chirche broken firste thys point greuous offence comitted small mater tried god iudgement libertie one despiseth iudgeth casteth away though yt euil enoughga iiiiix trifling elementes world paule calleth writing galatian weyed value tha heaue ly oracle god maner acquited adulterie iudged meate hath leaue vse harlot forbidden haue wife profit verily gotten transgressing obedience much turned fro god declineth men also twoe scleder faultes disallow ordinaces first prescribe part vnprofitable somtime also fond obseruations godly cosciences oppressed infinite multitude rouled backe certaine iewishnesse cleaue shadowes eine christ wheras cal fond vnprofitable know yt seme credible wisdome fleshe whiche well lyketh themcolos iixxiii thinketh chirch vtterly deformed taken away paule writeth haue resemblance wisdome counterfait worshipping humilitie thinke sharpnesse able tame fleshe truly wholesome admonition ought neuer slippe away v men tradition sayeth deceiue vnder shew wisdome whense haue thys color fained men therfore witt man doeth therein acknowe owne acknowing doth gladly embrace thyng neuer good lesse agreed vanitie againe haue hereby commendatio seme fitt introductios humilitie yt yoke hold mindes men pressed groud last al seme tend thys end restraine deintinesse fleshe subdue rigor abstinece therfore thought wisely deuised saith paul thing doeth shake visor least ye simple deceiued wt false pretese iudged thys enough confutation sayd inuentions men passeth ouer al thinges without confutation thoughe estemed nothing yea knewe fayned worshippinges chirche condemned much suspicious faithful delite witt man knewe fained image outwarde humilitie doeth muche differ fro true humilitie might easily discerned finally knewe childish introduction estemed exercise body therfore willed thing faithfull stede cofutation men tradition fauor commended among ignorant day vnlearned comon people euery man puffed vp worldli wisdome maruelously delited beholding ceremony hipocrites foolish woman thinke nothing deuised glorious better depely searche truely weye according rule godlinesse value many ceremony vnderstande first trifle haue profite deceites vaine pompe beguile eies beholder speake ceremony vnder ye romish maisters great misteries finde experience nothing ell mere mockery maruell author haue fallen far mocke themselues trifling folly partly toke examplar dotage gentile partly maner ape vndiscretely couterfaite olde vsages law moses perteined v sacrifice beastes thinges truely although none argument yet man yt hath soude witt wil loke goodnesse heape ill patched together thing selfe plainly sheweth many ceremony haue vse amase people rather teache new founde canon yt doe rather peruerte preserue discipline hipocrites repose great importace man better loke shall finde nothing ell shadowish vanishing shew discipline come point doth see tradition heaping one vpon ouergrowen great number christian chirche may wise beare hereby come passe ceremony appeareth wote iewishnesse obseruations bring greuous butcherie christian soules ad ian episto cxix augustine complained time commau dementes god neglected al thinges ful many presumption greuously rebuked vtas touched grounde bare foote tha yt buried witt dronke nesse complained chirche whiche mercy god willed free burdened state iewes much tolerable holy man happened liue age complaintes would haue bewailed bodage number ten time greater euery small tittle hudred time rigerously loked vnto tyme wont done peruerse lawmaker haue gotten dominion make ende bidding forbidding til come extreme peuishnesse thing paule hath also well declared wordes ye dead worldcoloss iixx ye holden though ye liuyng tradition eate taste handle greeke woorde aptesthai signifieth bothe eate touche doutlesse place taken first two significatios least shold superfluous repetition therfore doth excellently wel describe procedynges false apostle beginne superstition doo forbid eate also euen sclenderly chawe haue obteined also forbid tast also graunted recken lawfull muche touch finger tyrannie ordinance men doo daye worthily blame come passe poore conscience meruailously tormented innumerable decree immeasurable exacting keping canos perteinyng discipline haue spoken place ceremony shal say brought christ beyng halfe buried returned iewish figure lorde christ saieth augustine hath bound together felowship newe people episto cxviii ad ianuar sacramentes fewe number excellent signification moste easy obseruyng howe farre multitude diuersitie vsages wherwith daye see chirche entangled doeth differ simplicitie sufficiently declared knowe crafty shifte suttle men doo excuse peruersenesse say among v manye rude people israell introduction ordeined sake whiche although stronger may well want yet oughte neglecte forasmuche see profitable weake brother answer ar ignorant owe weakenesse brother side take exception say way whereby weake may bee prouided shold ouerwhelmed great heapes ceremony lorde vaine put difference betweene v olde people wil instruct like child signes figure v simply without outward furniture saieth paule childe ruled scholemaistergal iiiii kept vnder custodie accordyng capacitie age iewes kepte vnder lawe like vnto full growen men whiche beeyng set libertie tutorshyp gouernement haue neede childishe introduction truely lorde foresee maner common people shold chirche shoulde ruled yet maner haue said make differece betwene v iewes therfore foolishe way prouide ignorant raising vp iewishenesse abrogate christ christ also touched owne woordes difference olde new people said woman samaria time come wherin true worshipper worship god spirite truth verily alway ben new worshipper differed fro old point vnder moses spiritual worshippyng god shadowed maner entagled many ceremony abolished simply worshipped therfore thei confound difference ouerthrow order institute stablished christ shal wilt thou say ceremony geuen ruder sort helpe vnskilfulnesse say verily thinke kynde helpe profitable doe trauaile suche meane may vsed may brightly sette christ darken hym therfore geuen v god ceremony laborsome shew christ present iewes moe geuen shold image absent absent say power maner signifying therfore meane may kept necessarie keepe fewnesse number easinesse obseruing dignitie signifieng also cosisteth clerenesse nede say hath ben done thyng selfe men eye omitt pernicious opinion men myndes filled thinking yt sacrifice wherewith oblation rightly made god wherby sinnes clesed wherby righteousnesse saluatio obteined wyl deny good thing ar corrupted wt forein error forasmuch behalf man may lesse offende work also comaunded god hath hainousnesse yt much honor geue work rashely fained yt thought thing deseruing eternal life work comaunded god haue reward therfore yt lawmaker respect obedience accepteth therfore receiue value worthinesse deseruing god muche estemeth obediece toward speake yt perfectio work commaunded god performed therfore work law haue thak fre goodnesse god obediece weake lame bicause dispute value work ar without christ therfore let v passe ouer ye question come back yt proprely belo geth preset argumethier viixxii esa lvii xxixxiii whatsoeuer comedation work haue haue respect ye obediece lord doth loke vpon testifieth ye prophet gaue comaudement sacrifice burnt offringes yt ye shold hearing heare voice fained work speaketh place saying ye weye siluer bred againe worship vaine precept menmat xvix therfore way excuse suffer silly people seke outward trifle ye righteousnesse wherby may stand god vphold themselues heauenly iugement seate moreouer fault worthy inueyed shew foorth ceremony vnderstanded stage play magicall enchautment certaine al ceremony corrupt hurtfull vnlesse men directed christ ceremony vsed vnder papacie seuered doctrine may holde men signes without signification finally conning craftesman belly appeareth many haue ben inuented couetous sacrificing prestes bee snare catche money beginning soeuer haue geuen foorth comon filthy gaine must nedes cut greate parte bring passe prophane market full sacrilege vsed chirch although seeme teach continuall doctrine concernyng ordinance men speakyng altogether applied owne tyme yet nothyng spoken shall profitable tymes oft superstition crepeth men wyl worship god theyr owne fayned deuises whatsoeuer lawes bee ar made purpose degenerate grosse abuse lord thretneth curse one two age al age world wil strike blyndnesse amased dullnesse worshyp doctrine men blyndyng continually maketh flee kynde absurditieesa xx xiii whiche despisyng many warnyngs god doe wilfully wrap selues deadly snare settyng asyde circumstance wyl haue simply shewed men tradition al age mete reiected chirche bee disalowed godly shalbe sure playne definition whiche haue aboue sette lawes without worde god made men end either prescribe maner worshippyng god bind conscience religion though gaue comaundement thinges necessary saluation one adioyned faultes multitude darken brightnesse gospell nothyng edifie rather vnprofitable trifling occupation true exercise godliness laied abrode filthinesse vnhonest game hard kept defiled euel superstition shall helyes may easily finde much euell heare aunswer selues tradition selues god say chirch gouerned holy gost yt erre yt authoritie therof remaineth whe obteined therwithal foloweth tradition reuelations holy ghost despised wickedly contempt god shoulde seme haue attempted thing without greate authoritie wyll haue beleued greate parte obseruations came apostle affirme one example sufficiently declared apostle thingesacts xvxx xxix beyng assembled one councell dyd decree councell commaunde gentile absteine thyngs offred idol blood strangled haue already place declared howe falsly boastyng themselues lyingly vsurpe title chirche muche concernyng present cause pluckyng awaye visor deceitfull color truely loke vpon ought principally care whiche chefely behofe maner chirch christ haue maye fashion frame selues rule therof shal easily euident vnto v chirch passyng boundes worde god doeth outrage runne riot makyng newe lawes doeth lawe whiche one prescribed chirchedeut xxxii pro xx vi remayne eternall commaunde thee thou shalte kepe thou mayste doo thou shalte adde thyng take thyng place adde word lord minishe thing least peraduenture reproue thee thou founde lyer sithe denie spoken chirch el reporte stubbornesse chirche boast haue ben bold suche prohibition neuerthelesse adde myngle owne doctrine god god forbidde assent lye wherby burden chirch greate sclaunder let v vnderstande name chirch falsly pretended ofte lust men rashnesse spoken hold self within prescribed boundes god wyldly rangeth runneth owne inuentions nothyng entangled nothing darke nothing doutefull woordes whiche whole chirche forbidden adde worde god take thyng worshippyng god preceptes concernyng saluation entreated say spoken law folowed prophecy whole ministratio gospell graunt deede adde also whiche rather fulfillyngs law addition diminyshynges lorde suffred nothyng added taken ministerie moses whych may terme darke reason many doutefull enwrappyngs tyll hys seruantes prophetes length beloued sonne ministred cleerer doctrine thynke muche seuerely forbydden v shoulde adde nothyng lawe prophetes psalmes gospell lorde gone kynde hymselfe whych hath long agoe declared nothyng hyely offended worshipped inuentions men wherof cam notable saying prophetes ought haue continually sounded eares spake wordes fathershier vii xxii day brought egypt concernyng sacrifice burnt offryng worde commaunded sayeng hearyng heare voyce wyll godhier xi samu xvxxii shalbe people ye shall walke way shall commaunde agayne haue protesting protested vnto father heare voyce lyke sayengs notable aboue reste wyll god haue burnt offrynges sacrifice rather voyce obeyed excused crime vngodlynesse easy proue falsly imputed chirch sort freely inuey agaynst tyrannie men tradition proudly thrust among v vnder title chirche neither scorne chirche aduersaries bryng v hatred vnius ly lye vpon v geue vnto prayse obedience whych knoweth greater prayse rather sore wrongdoer chirche whiche make obstinate lorde whyle fayne hath proceded tha lawfully myght word god though speake nothyng howe notable shamelessnesse ioyned great malice continually crie oute authoritie chirche meane tyme dissemblyngly hyde bothe commaunded lorde obedience oweth commaundement lorde haue mynde mete haue agree chirch perteyneth rather purpose haue eye vnto remember commaunded lord bothe v chirch one agreement obey hym doute shall well agree chirch doe thynges shewe selues obedient lord father vppon apostle originall tradition wherwith chirch hath ben hetherto oppressed point mere deceite forasmuche doctrine apostle trauaileth wholly ende conscience shold butdened newe vse men behauiours neuer put writyng euen thyngs forsothe christ yet liuyng coulde vnderstand ascendyng learned reuelation holy ghost exposition place haue el already seen much sufficient present cause truely make themselues worthy laughed whyle faine greate mystery long tyme vnknowen apostle partly obseruations eyther iewishe gentile whiche one sort ben long publyshed among iewes sort among gentile partly foolysh gesturynges vayne pety ceremony whiche foolishe sacrificyng prestes neither skill swimmyng letter vse doo trimly yea suche child fooles aptely counterfaite may sente fitter minister suche holy mystery history yet men haue sound witte myght consider thing self great heape ceremony obseruations sodenly brust ye chirch little little crept holyer bishop whiche next tyme apostle ordeyned thynges belonged order discipline afterwarde folowed men discrete enoughe curious gredy whiche later euery one striued predecessoures foolyshe enuious counterfaytyng geue place inuentyng newe thynges peryll least deuyses woulde shortly growe oute vse whiche coueted gette prayse among posteritie muche rygorous exact callyng vpon kepyng wrongfull zeale hath bredde v great part ceremony whyche sette vnto v apostolike also history doo testifie least makyng register tedious content one example ministryng lordes supper apostle tyme great simplicitie next successours garnishe dignitie mysterie added somewhat disallowed afterwarde came foolishe counterfaiters patchyng peces together haue made v apparel prest whiche se masse ornamentes altar gesturynges whole furniture vnprofitable thynges obiect olde tyme persuasion thynges one consente doone vniuersall chirch came apostle themselues whereof cite augustine witnesse wyll bryng solution word augustine hymselfe thinges saieth kepte whole world episto cxviii may vnderstand haue ben ordeined either apostle themselues generall councells whoes authoritie moste healthfull chirche lordes passion resurrection ascendyng heauen comming holy ghoste celebrate yearely solemnitie whatsoeuer lyke thyng bee founde kepte whole chirch whiche waie soeuer spread abroade reckneth vp fewe example doeth se meant impute author worthie credite reuerence obseruations vsed euen none symple rare sobre one profitable order chirch shold kepte together howe farre doeth differ whyche romishe maisters would enforce men graunte pety ceremonie among oughte iudged apostolike long wyll bryng foorth onely one example man aske whense haue theyr holy water answer apostle though history dooe attribute inuention wote bishop rome truely called apostle counsell woulde neuer haue defiled baptisme strange vnfitte signe albe thynke like true beginnyng halowyng olde written episto cxviii ad anu whyche augustine sayeth certayne chirches tyme dyd shunne solemne folowyng christes example washyng feete least vsage shoulde seeme pertayne baptisme secretely sheweth kynde washyng hadde lykenesse baptisme whatsoeuer bee wyll graunte proceded apostolike spirite baptisme dayly signe brought remembrance certayne maner bee repeted passe vpon selfe augustine place ascribeth thynges also apostle sithe hath nothyng coniectures iudgement oughte vppon bee geuen greate mater finally admytte graunte also thynges whych rehearseth came tyme apostle yet greate difference betweene institutyng somme exercise godlynesse faithful free conscience may vse vse shall profitable may forbeare making law may snare cosciences bondage author soeuer proceded sithe see slidden greate abuse nothyng withstandeth may without offence hym abolish forasmuche neuer commended muste perpetually immouable neither doth much helpe excuse tyrannie pretende example apostle apostle saye elder first chirch made decree besyde commaundement christ wherin commauded gentile abstein thinges offred idol strangled blood lawefull also lawfull successours followe oft occasion requireth wold god bothe thynges thing folow deny apostle institute decree new thing easy proued strong reson whereas peter coucel pronounceth god tempted yoke layed vpon neckes disciple doth himselfe ouerthrowe owne sentence afterward consent haue yoke layed vpon yoke layed apostle decree owne authoritie gentile shold forbidden touch thinges offred idoles blood strangled dede yet remaineth dout neuerthelesse seme forbidde dout shal easily dissolued man doo nerely consider meaning decree selfe order effecte whereof chiefe point gentile libertie left ought troubled accombred obseruations law hetherto wel maketh syde exception immediatly foloweth neither newe law made apostle diuine eternall commaundemet god charitie ought broken doth diminishe one title libertie onely admonisheth gentile shold temper themselues brethre abuse libertie offence let therfore second poynt gentile vse harmelesse libertie without offence theyr brother yet prescribe certain thyng teach appoint farre expedient tyme thynges might runne offence brother myght beware thynges adde newe thyng eternall lawe god whiche forbiddeth offendyng brother lyke faithfull pastor gouerne chirches yet wel reformed shoulde comaunde people tyll weake whome lyue doo growe stronger openly eate fleshe friday openly labor vppon holy dayes suche thyng although thynges settyng superstition asyde themselues indifferent yet added offence brother doone without faulte tymes suche faithfull shewe suche sight weake brother shall sore wounde conscience cauiller wil say make newe lawe wheras certayn onely preuent offence whiche expressely enough forbidden lord sayd apostle whoes purpose nothyng ell ta yng away mater offence call vpon lawe god coucernyng auoydyng offence sayd lord co maundement ye offend weake brother ye eate thinges offred image strangled blood weake brother shall offended therfore commaunde woorde lorde ye eate offence apostle respect thyng paule hymselfe good witnesse writeth thus verily none otherwise accordyng meanyng councell concernyng meates offred idol know idole nothyng conscience idole eate offred idol conscience forasmuche weake defiledi corin xiii see libertie made offence weake shall haue well weyed thynges shall afterwarde deceiued false color make pretende apostle defence tyrannie though apostle begon decree breake libertie chirche may able escape dryuen euen owne confession allowe solution let answer right bolde abrogate decree perill offence dissencions apostle meant prouide knowe lawe weyed ende therof forasmuch therfore lawe made respect charitie nothyng prescribed muche perteineth charitie confesse transgressyng law nothyng breakyng charitie therwithall acknowlege forged addition law god naturall simple appliance tymes maners wherunto directed although lawes hundred time vniuste iniurious vnto v yet affirme must heard without exception say intended shold consent error onely beyng subiectes shold beare hard comaudementes gouernors whiche partes refuse also lorde well resisteth truth word deliuereth v bondage libertie hath purchased v holy blood benefit wherof hath tha one confirmed word onely intended maliciously fain shold suffer greuous oppressio body coscieces spoiled libertie benefit blood christ shold seruilely tormented howbeit let v passe ouer also though made litle mater howe great importance thinke lordes kingdome take away fro claimeth great seueritie take away oft worshipped lawes men inue tions wheras wil holden lawmaker worship least man shold thinke mater nothing let v heare much lord estemeth saith people hath feared comaudement doctrine men behold wil astonish great woderous miracleesa xxixxiii wisdome shal perish fro wise men therof vnderstading shal depart elder placemat xvix worship vaine teachyng doctrine comau dements truly wheras childre israel defiled theselues many idolatry cause al euil ascribed vnclean mixture transgressing commaundementes god haue forged new worshippinges therfore holy historie rehearseth new stranger ben transplated king babilo inhabite samaria wer torne peces cosumed wilde beastes knew iudgementes statute god lande although nothing offeded ceremony yet god would haue allowed vaine pompe meane time cessed take vengeace defyling hys worship thrust deuises strange worde wherupon afterwarde sayd yt beyng made afrayd punishmente receiued ye ceremony prescribed law yet purely worship true god twise repeted feare feare wherupon gather part reuerece geuen cosisteth worshipping simply folow commaundeth mingling none inuentions therfore godly kynges oftentimes praisedii ki xxiii according al commaundementes declined ryghte hande left go yet although fayned worshipping opely appeare vngodlinesse yet seuerely co demned holy ghost e men depart commaundement godii king xvix altar achaz paterne whereof broughte samaria might haue semed encrease garnishment teple wheras deuise offre sacrifice therupo god honorably vpon first olde altar yet see spirite detesteth ye boldnesse none cause yt inuentions worshipping god vnclene corruption much clerely god opened vnto v much lesse excusable frowardnesse attempt thig therfore worthily circumstance crime manasses enforcedii ki xxiiii bilded new altar ierusalem god pronounced wil set name ye authoritie god set purpose refused many maruel god sharply threteneth wil thinges wondred ye people worshipped wt comaundemetes men pronounceth yt worshipped vaine wt preceptes cosidered ye cause religion yt say heauely wisdome hag vpo ye mouth god would therewtal se yt scleder reso god abhorreth peruerse seruices yt done accordig ye lust ma wit althoughe obey lawes worshipping god haue certaine shewe humilitie obedience yet huble god prescribe ye lawes theselues kepe ye reson paul willeth v diligently beware deceiued ye tradition yt calleth ethelothreskian iscolos iiiii wilworship inueted beside ye doctrine god verily true wisdom al men wisdom must foolish vnto v yt may suffer alone wise way kepe studie pety obseruations fayned wil men comend themselues vnto hym thrust vnto hym transgressing obedience towarde hym whiche dede geuen hath ben done many age heretofore tyme within owne remembrance also thys daye done place authoritie creature estemed tha creator religion yet worthy called religion defiled moe vnsauorie superstition euer paynime wickednesse could witt men brede al thynges carnal foolishe truely resemble theyr author whereas also patrones superstition allege samuell sacrificed ramathai samu viixvii although done beside law yet pleased god solution easy certayne seconde altar set one onely altar place yet appointed arke couenant appointed ye towne dwelled sacrifice conuenient place truely minde holy prophete make innouation holy thinges whereas god streightly forbidden thing added minished example menoha say extraordinarie singular case xiiixix priuate man offered sacrifice god without allowace god verily enterprised rash motion minde heauenlye instinction much lord abhorreth thinges men deuise themselues worship hym withall inferior gedeon notable exampleiud viiixxvii whoes ephod turned destruction hym hys familie whole people finally euery new founde inuention wherewith couet worship god nothing ell defiling true holinesse saye christ intollerable burden bornemat xxiii iii xvivi scribe pharisee bounde vpon men place christ wil men beware leuen pharisee calling leuen mathew ye euangelist expoundeth doctrine mingled purenesse worde god would haue playne tha commaunded flee beware al doctrine whereby made certaine vnto v ye place also lorde willed cosciences shoulde vexed ye pharisee traditios wordes wrested soude thing lord purposing enuey sharply againste maners pharisee first simply instruct yt heard hym yt although saw nothing life mete folow yet cesse thyngs taught wordes whyle sate chaire moses yt declare law therefore meant nothing ell prouide comon people wt euil exaples ye teacher brought despise ye doctrine forasmuch many nothing al moued resons alwaye require authoritie wil allege augustine wordes whiche thing spoken lordes shepefolde hath gouernoures faithfullin ioh act xl hirelinges gouernours faithfull true pastor heare ye yt hireliges also necessarie many ye chirch folowing earthly profites preach christe voice christ heard ye shepe folowe hireling ye pastor meanes hireling heare ye yt hirelinges shewed ye lord himselfe scribe saith pharisee sitt chaire moses doe ye thinges saye thinges thing said heare voice ye pastor hirelinges sitting chaire teache law god therfore god teacheth wil teache owne heare saith augustine wheras many vnskilfull men heare conscience wickedly boude god worshipped vaine tradition men one blott altogether al lawes whereby order chirch set frame therefore conuenient also mete wt error uerily point easy deceiued first sight doeth appeare differece betwene one sort plainly wordes sett whole mater likenesse may deceiue man first let v holde see euery felowship men policie necessarie may serue nourishe common peace reteine concorde se thinges alway orderly forme behouefull publike honestie humanitie refused ought chefely obserued chirches whiche best mainteined well framed disposition al thinges without agreement chirches al therfore wil haue safetie chirch wel prouided must altogether diligently procure paule commaundeth al thinges done comlily according order forasmuch greate diuersitie manner meni corin xiiiixl great varietie mindes greate disagremente iudgementes wittes neither policie stedfast enough vnlesse stablished certaine lawes orderly vsage obserued without certaine appointed forme therfore farr condemning lawes profitable purpose affirme yt taken away chirches dissolued sinewes vtterly deformed scattered abrode paule requireth thinges done decently order vnlesse order selfe comlinesse stablished obseruations adioyned certaine bondes thing alway excepted obseruations either beleued necessarie saluation bynd conscience religion applied worshipping god godlinesse reposed haue therfore good faithful marke putteth differece betwene wicked ordinaces haue saied ye true religion darkened cosciences subuerted lawful obseruatios ye chirch remeber lawful obseruations tende alway one twoo thinges together holy assembly faithfull al thynges done comly dignitie besemeth yt common felowship kept order certaine bondes humanitie moderation one vnderstode yt law made publike honesty sake ye superstition take away fal yt measure ye worshipping god ye inuetios whe knowe yt perteineth como vse yt false opinio bod necessitie ouerthrowe strike great terror coscieces tradition thoughte necessarie saluation herein nothing required charitie common dutiefull nourished among v good yet define plainely comprehended vnder comlinesse paule commendeth also vnder order ende comlinesse partly suche ceremony vsed may procure reuerence holy thinges maye suche helpes stirred vp godlinesse partly also ye modestie grauitie whiche ought seen honest doinges may therin principally appeare order first point gouerne may knowe rule law rule well people gouerned maye accustomed obeying god right discipline ye state chirch wel framed peace quietnesse may prouided therfore shall say comlinesse wherin shalbe nothing vaine delectation suche se playerlike apparel whiche papistes vse ceremony appeareth nothing ell vnprofitable visor gainesse excesse without frute shall accompt comlinesse shall mete reuerence holy mystery fitt exercise godlinesse least suche shall serue conuenient garnishing celebrating therof without frute may put faythfull minde howe greate modestie religiousnesse reuerence ought handle holy thinges ceremony may exercise godlinesse necessarie leade v ye streight way christ likewise may say order consisteth trifling pompes haue nothing ell vanishing gaynesse standeth suche orderly framing may take away confusio barbarousnesse obstinacie striues dissentions first sorte example paulei cor xixxi v prophane bankettinges shoulde myngled holy supper lord woman shoulde come abrode couered many haue comon vse praye kneling bare hedded minister lordes sacramentes vnclenly dignitie ye buryeng dead vse honest shewe thinges sort kynde houres appointed publike prayersi corin xiiiixxxiiii sermon celebratios mystery sermos quietnesse silence place appointed singing together hymnes dayes prefixed celebrating lordes supper paule forbiddeth woman teache chirch suche like specially thinges concerne discipline teaching catechisme censure chirch excommunication fastinges may reckened number constitution chirch receiue holy holsome may referre twoo chiefe title perteine rite ceremony discipline peace peril least ye one side ye false bishop shoulde therby catch pretese excuse wicked tyrannous lawes least side men ferefull admonished ye aforesaid euels leaue place lawes neuer holy good protest yt allow ordinaces grounded vpon authoritie god take scripture yea altogether god owne let v take example kneling vsed time commo praier demaunded whether tradition man euery man may lawfully refuse neglect say men also god god respect part comlinesse care keping whereof commended vnto v apostle men respect specially betokeneth generaltie rather pointed declaredi corin xiiiixl one exaple may iudge thought whole kynde verily lord hath holy oracle faithfully conteined clerely set fourth whole sume true righteousnesse al partes worshipping diuine maiestie whatsoeuer necessarie saluation therfore thinges onely heard scholemaster outward discipline ceremony wil prescribe ech thing particularly ought follow foresaw thys hang vpon state tymes thinke one forme fitt age herein must flee generall rule hath geuen thereby thinges tryed necessitie chirch shall require commauded order comlynesse finally forasmuch hath therfore taught nothig expresly thinges necessary saluation according maners euery nation age ought diuersly applied edifieng chirch therfore profit chirch shal require shalbe co uenient well change abrogate vsed institute newe graunte dede ought rashly oft light cause runne innouation may hurt edifie charitie shall best iudge suffer gouernesse al shall safe dutie christian people kepe thinges haue ben ordeined according rule free conscience without superstition yet godly easy redinesse obey despise passe ouer carelesse negligence farre ought pride obstinacie openly breake maner libertie conscience wilt thou say may greate obseruation warenesse yea shall stande excellently well whe shall consider stedfast perpetuall stayed lawes wherunto bounde outwarde rudementes weakenesse men although nede yet vse mutually one bounde nourishe charitie among v may recknowlege example aboue rehersed doth religion stande woman veile lawfull goe dores hed vncouered holy decree hys concerning silence suche broken wythout moste haynous offece ther misterie kneling burying dead carcase may omytted wythout synne woman nede helping neighbor make hast may suffer couer hed offendeth runne thether hed vncouered may somtyme befal yt may lesse coueniet speake tha time holde peace cause contrary reson disease bowe hys knee may pray standing finally better burie dead man spedely tyme lacke wynding shete men present conuey tarry till rott vnburied neuerthelesse thinges somwhat whych maner ordinance contree finally naturall honestie rule modestie apointeth done auoided wherein man swarue thing vnwarenesse forgetfulnesse crime committed vpon contempt stubbornnesse disallowed likewise dayes themselues whiche houres place bilded psalmes soong vpon whiche day maketh mater mete certaine day appointed houres place fitt receiue regarde preseruation peace howe greate occasion brawlynges confusion thinges lawfull euery man liste change thynges belong common state forasmuche neuer come passe one thing shall please men thinges lefte middest choise euery man man carpe againste v herein wise oughte lette hym se himselfe reson defende owne precisenesse lordei cor xixvi v saying paule ought satisfie v haue vse contende chirches god moreouer great diligence endeuored error crepe may corrupt obscure thys pure vse shalbe obteined obseruations whatsoeuer shalbe shall haue shewe manifeste profit fewe receiued principally adioyned faythfull doctrine pastor may stoppe vp waie peruerse opinion knowlege maketh thinges euery man may haue owne libertie preserued neuerthelesse shall willingly charge owne libertie certaine necessitie farr either thys comlinesse haue spoken order charitie shall require secodly selues without superstition busied obseruing thinges shoulde precisely require shoulde thinke worshipping god better multitude ceremony one chirch despise diuersitie discipline last setting herein perpetuall lawe selues referre whole vse ende obseruations edification chirch requireth may without offense suffer onely somwhat changed obseruations vse among v altered thys age presente experience certaine rite otherwyse vngodly vncomly may according fytt accasion mater conueniently abrogate suche hath ben blindenesse ignorance former tymes chirches haue heretofore corrupte opinion stiffe affection sticked ceremony scarcely sufficiently purged monstruous superstition many ceremony must taken away whiche olde tyme paraduenture ordeined without cause themselues haue notable vngodlinesse xi chapter iurisdiction chirch abuse therof seen papacie remaineth thirde parte power chirch yea chiefe parte well ordered state whiche haue saied consiste iurisdiction whole iurisdiction chirch perteineth discipline manner whiche shall entreate forasmuche citie towne stande without magistrate police chirche god haue alredy taught compelled repete againe nedeth certaine spirituall policie suche vtterly seuered ciuile policie doth nothing hinder minish rather doeth much helpe therefore power iurisdiction shall summe nothing ell order framed preseruatio spiritual policie ende beginning ordeined iudicial order chirches might vse examination maners correcte vicesi cor xii xxi rom xiiviii exercise office keyes order paule speaketh epistle corinthian nameth gouernementes againe romaine whe saith let ruleth rule carefulnesse speaketh magistrate time christian magistrate ioyned pastor spirituall gouernement chirchi tim vxvii also epistle timothee maketh twoo sortes elder labor worde vse preaching worde yet rule well later sort doute meaneth appointed loke vnto maners whole vse keyes power speake hangeth wholly vpon keyes christ gaue chirche xviii chap mathew commaundeth sharply admonished name whole chirch haue despised priuate monitios goe forward obstinacie teacheth put felowship faithful monition correction without knowlege cause therefore nedeth iugement order wherefore vnlesse make voide promise keyes take vtterly away excomunicatio solemne monition suche thynges whatsoeuer must nedes geue chirch iurisdiction let reders marke place entreateth generall authoritie doctrine xvi chapter mathewe xxi iohn power sinagoge time come transferred flocke christ untill day iewes order gouerning christ stablisheth chirch yt great penaltie much concerneth pure institution behoued forasmuch otherwise iugemente vnnoble vnregarded congregation might despised rash proude men encomber reders christ doth thesame word expresse thinges somwhat differring one shalbe profitable dissolue dout therfore woo place speake bynding loosing one ye xvi chapter mathew christ promised would geue peter ye keyes kingdome heauen immediatly addeth whatsoeuer shal bynde loose earth shalbe confirmed heauen wordes meaneth none thing doth wordes iohn sending disciple preacheiohn xxxxiii mat xvixix breathed vpon said whose synnes ye forgeue shalbe forgeuen whoes ye reteine shalbe reteined heauen bring exposition suttle enforced wrested natural flowyng offring selfe commaundemente forgeuing reteining synnes promise bynding loosing made peter oughte referred thyng ministerie worde whe lord committed apostle therewith also arme office bynding loosing summe gospell bondseruantes synne death loosed made fre redemption christ iesus receiue acknowlege christe theyr deliuerer redemer damned adiudged euerlasting bondes lorde deliuered message apostle carried al nation approue owne proceding honored noble testimonie singular strengthening apostle themselues come behoued apostle shoulde haue stedfast sounde certaintie preaching onely execute infinite labor care trouble danger also last seale blood might say knowe thesame vaine voide full power force behoued great carefulnesse great hardnesse thynges great danger persuaded businesse god worlde withstode fought againste knowe god stode side hauing christ author doctrine present sight earth vnderstande heauen confirme trueth doctrine deliuered behoued againe also certainly proued testimonie hearer doctrine gospell worde apostle god himselfe voice bred earth come downe heauen thinges forgeuenesse sinnes promise euerlasting life message saluation power man therefore christe hath testified preaching gospell nothing apostle ministerie himselfe spake promised thynges mouthes instrumentes therefore forgeuenesse sinnes preached true promise god damnation pronounced certaine iudgement god testifieng geuen age remaineth force certifie assure men word gospel man soeuer preached ye sentece god published soueraigne iudgement seate written boke life ratified firme fixed heauen thus see place power keyes nothyng preachyng gospell muche power ministerie haue respect christ hath geuen power proprely men owne worde wherof hath made men minister place whiche haue said concernyng power bynding loosyngmat xviii xvii xviii chapter mathew christ sayth brother heare chirch let thee heathen publicane uerily say vnto whatsoeuer ye bynd vppon earth shalbe bound also heauen whatsoeuer ye loose shalbe loosed place altogether like first little otherwise bee vnderstanded make diuerse haue great affinitie together first point like either generall sentece alway one power bynding loosyng namely worde god one commaundement one promise herein differ fyrst place peculiarly belongeth preachyng whych minister woord execute later place discipline excommunication committed chirche chirch byndeth excommunicateth throweth perpetual ruine desperation condemneth lyfe maners vnlesse repent doeth already warne hym damnation looseth whome receiueth communion doeth make hym partaker vnitie whych hath christ iesus therfore man obstinately despise iudgement chirch little regarde condemned consentyng voice faithful lorde testifieth suche iudgemente faithefull nothyng ell publishing owne sentence whatsoeuer earth confirmed heauen haue word god whereby may condemne peruerse haue woord wherby may receiue repentant grace erre dissent iudgement god iudge lawe god whiche vncertaine earthly opinion holy wil god heauenly oracle two place thinke haue bothe brefely familiarly truely expounded furious men without difference caried owne gidddynesse goe stablishe sometyme confession sometyme excommunication sometime iurisdiction sometyme power make lawes somtyme pardon first place allege stablyshe supremicie see rome well skill fit keyes locke dores man may say haue practised smithes craft lyfe wheras many thynke thyngs endured time magistrate yet stranger profession religion deceiued consider great difference maner vnlikenesse ecclesiasticall ciuile power chirch hath power swerd punish restrain empire comaud prison pain ye magistrate wont lay vpon tendeth end yt yt hath sinned shold punished shold willig chastisement professe repetace therfore far diuers order neither doth chirch take self thing proprely belongeth magistrate magistrate execute chirch doeth shalbe made plainer example dronke well ordered citie prison shalbe punishement hath comitted fornicatio shal haue like rather greater punishmet shal ye lawes magistrate outward iudgemet satisfied may shal geue signification repentace rather murmure grudge shall chirche case nothyng suche bee receiued supper without doyng wrong christe holye institution reason requireth offendeth chirch euill example shoulde solemne declaration repentance take away offence hath raised reason bring contrary opinion colde christe saye committed doinges chirche magistrate execute happeneth ofte time magistrate negligent yea somtime peraduenture chastised hapened emperor theodosius may beside asmuche said ye ministerie word nowe therfore sentence let pastor cesse blame manifest wicked doings let cesse chide reproue rebuke christia magistrate ought correct thing ye lawes swerd ye magistrate oughte punishyng restraining force purge ye chirch offence likewise minister worde part ought help magistrate may many offend ought working coioyned one may helpe hindrance truely man nerely weye wordes christ shall easily perceiue place described stayed state perpetuall order chirche suche endureth tyme mete accuse magistrate wyl obey monition yet shold necessary magistrate succeded office chirch promise shall saye promise one yeres uerily verily say vnto whatsoeuer ye bind earth moreouer christ institute new thing folowed custome alway obserued aucient chirch owne nation wherby signified chirch want spirituall iurisdiction whiche hadde beginning hath ben confirmed consent tymes emperor magistrate began professe christ spirituall iurisdiction abolished ordred shold diminish nothing ciuile iurisdiction confounded rightfully magistrate godly wil exempt himselfe comon subiection childre god wherof ye last part submit himselfe chirch iudgyng worde god farre ought take away ye order iugemet honorable sayth ambrose emperor called son chirche good emperor within chirche episto xxxii ad valent aboue chirch therfore honor magistrate spoile chirche power onely false exposition corrupt sentence christ also sclenderly condemne many holy bishop whiche haue ben tyme apostle haue false pretence vsurped honor office magistrate syde good see old time true vse iurisdiction chirch great abuse crepte may knowe abrogate restored antiquitie ouerthrow kingdome antichrist set vp true kyngdome christ againe first marke shotte offence preuented offence risen vp may abolished vse two thinges considered fyrst spirituall power altogether seuered power swerd executed wil one man lawfull assemblie bothe thynges obserued purer chirch holy bishop exercise theyr power fine emprisonmentes ciuile punishementes vsed word lorde ought seuerest reuenge vttermost thunderbolt chirch excomunication whiche vsed necessitie requireth neyther force strong hande content power worde god finally iurisdiction olde chirch nothyng ell declaration practise may call paul teacheth concernyng spirituall power pastorsii cor xiiii sayth power geuen v wherby may throwe strog holdes wherby may make low heighth lifteth vp selfe againste knowlege god whereby may subdue thought may leade captiue obedience christ haue readinesse reuenge disobedience doone preachyng doctrine christ least doctrine scorned accordyng whiche taught ought iuged professe themselues houshold faith done vnlesse ioyned ministerie power call priuately admonished sharply corrected also power exclude communion supper whiche receiued without prophaning great mysterie therfore whe place saith belongeth v iudge strangersi cor xii maketh child subiect censure chirch may chastise faultes secretely signifieth iudiciall order force none faithfull free suche authoritie haue declared power one man euery thyng accordyng owne wyll power assemblie elder whyche thing chirche senate citie episto e ix lib ii cyprian maketh mentio exercised tyme vseth ioyne whole clergie bishop place also sheweth yt clergy gouerned meane tyme people excluded hearyng mater thus writeth sin beginnyng bishoprike haue determined nothyng without counsel clergie consent people common vsuall maner iurisdiction chirch exercised senate elder haue saied two sortes ordeined teachyng iudges maners little little institution grewe kynd first beginning euen time ambrose onely clerkes iudges ecclesiastical iudgementes v capi ad tim thing complaineth wordes old synagoge saith sin time chirche hath elder without whoes counsell nothyng done negligence growen vse know vnlesse peraduenture slouthfulnesse rather pride teacher alone wold thought somwhat see much holy man displeased thyng better state decaied notwithstandyng yet continuyng order least tolerable would saw deformed ruines shewe almoste signe olde byldyng bewaylyng would vse fyrst agaynst lawe right bishop hath claimed hymselfe alone whiche geuen whole chirch like consul driuyng senate take empire vpon himselfe alone aboue rest honor whole assemblie authoritie one man therefore wicked dede one man remouyng common power himselfe hath bothe opened entrie tyrannous lust hath taken chirch belonged vnto hath suppressed put away assemblie ordeined spirite christ one euil alway groweth bishop disdaining thing vnworthie care haue comitted ouer hereupo created official serue roome yet speake kind men onely say nothyng differ prophan iudges yet stil cal spiritual iurisdiction men contende nothyng earthly mater although euell face dare call brawlyng courte iudgement chirche monition excommunication verily mocke god doeth poore man owe little money cited appeare condemned condemned satisfie monished seconde monition procede one steppe toward excomunication appeare monished come yeld hymself iudgement make delay monished excomunicate beseche thyng like either institution christe auncient maner ecclesiasticall order also correction vice verily onely suffer secrete allowance certaine maner cherishe confirme adultery wantonnesse dronkennesse suche kynde mischeuous doynges onely common people also clergie themselues many call fewe either shoulde seeme slouthfull winkyng may milke money speake pillage robbery bribery sacrilege gathered thereby speake maner men moste part chosen office enough muche whe romanists boast iurisdiction spirituall easy shew nothing cotrary order institute christ hath likenesse auncient custome darkenesse hath light although haue spoken thynges might alleged purpose thynges haue spoken knyt vp fewe word yet trust haue fought nowe cause man shold dout spiritual power wherof pope kingdome proudely glorieth wicked againste god vniust tyrannie ouer people name spirituall power comprehend boldenesse framyng new doctrine wherwith haue turned away sily people natural purenesse word god wicked tradition wherewith haue snared also false ecclesiastical iurisdiction execute suffraganes official graunt vnto christ kingdome among v possible kynd dominion must immediatly ouerthrowen fall power swerd whiche also geue themselues exercised vppon conscieces pertaineth present purpose entreate behalf yet also note alwaye like themselues verily nothyng lesse would taken say pastor chirch neither blame peculiar faultes men common wickednesse whole order yea verye pestilence order forasmuch thought maymed vnlesse gloriously set forth welth proude title require authoritie christ concernyng mater dout mynd debarre minister word ciuile dominion earthly gouernementmat xxxxv luc xiixxv said kyngs gentile beare rule ouer shall signifieth onely office pastor distinct office prince thynges seuered mete together one man wheras moses beare office together first done rare myracle agayne time tyl thinges better set order certaine forme one prescribed god ciuile gouernement left vnto comaunded resigne priesthode brotherex xviiixvi worthily aboue nature one shold suffise beare burden hath age beene diligently obserued chirche neuer bishoppes long true forme chirch endured homil de basil tradend one thought vsurping power swerd common prouerbe tyme ambrose emperor rather coueted prestehode prestes empire afterwarde sayth emprinted myndes men palace perteined emperor chirches prest sin way hath ben deuised wherby bishop myght holde title honor richesse office withoute burden care least lef e altogether idle power swerde geuen rather dyd vsurpation take vpon selues color wil defend shamelesnesse dutie bishop wrappe themselues iudiciall hearyng cause wyth gouernementes city prouinces large circuites meddle business vnperteining haue much worke businesse owne office wholly continually occupied withdrawen callinges away yet scarcely able satisfie suche waywardnesse sticke bost meane chirch doth florishe accordyng worthinesse selues meane tyme muche drawen away dueties vocation touchyng first point comely ornament holy office aduaunced suche heighth hyest monarch may stand feare haue cause quarel christ hath sort greuously pinched honor lest opinion could haue ben spoken dishonorably word kinges gentile prince beare rule ouer themmat xxxxv lu xxiixxv shall yet layd harder lawe vppon seruantes first layde receiued vpon himselfe sayth hath made iudge diuider among see plainly putteth away fro hymselfe office iudgynglu xiixiiii whych wolde thing agreyng office seruantes suffer themselues brought order wherunto lorde hath yelded hymselfe subiecte pointeact viii woulde god coulde proue experience easy speake forasmuche apostle thoughte good leaue woorde god minister table therby taught conuinced one man woorke bothe good bishoppe good prince whyche accordyng largenesse giftes wherwith endued able satisfie moe greater care men haue ben borne since haue yet confessed yt one applie ye ministerie worde table yt shold faint vnder burden could valor coparison apostle hundred folde excell industrie ye apostle truely attempt point shamlesse presumptuous boldnesse yet se hath ben attepted successe euidence could otherwise come passe forsaking owne office shold remoue men charge dout smal beginnyng haue litle litle growe great encreases possible shold ye first step clime vp hie somtime suttletie crooked crafty meanes priuily auaunced selues man coulde foresee would come passe tyll done somtime occasion serued terror thretenings wryng prince augmentation theyr power sometime sawe prince hard laced geue abused theyr fonde vnaduised gentlenesse olde tyme controuersie happened godly escape necessitie goyng lawe committed arbitrement bishop douted vprightnesse arbitrementes olde bishop oftetimes encobred dede greatly displeased augustine one place testifieth least party runne contentious lawyng though willes take encumbrance vpon men haue voluntarie arbitrementes whiche altogether differyng noyse iudiciall courtes made ordinarie iurisdiction litle whyle city contrees troubled diuerse harde distress resorted protection bishop sauegarded faithful succour bishoppes marueilous sutteltie protector made selues lordes yea denyed haue gotten possession greate parte violente seditious partakinges prince willingly gaue iurisdiction bishop diuerse affection moued thereunto admitting gentlenesse shew godlinesse yet wrongfull liberalitie dyd well prouide profite chirch whoes au cient true discipline haue corrupted yea say truthe haue vtterly abolished bishop haue abused suche goodnesse prince owne comoditie haue shewyng one exaple enough much testified bishop sparcle apostolike spiriteii cor wold without doute haue answered mouthe paule weapon warfare carnall spirituall beyng rauished blynd gredinesse haue destroyed bothe selues successoures chirche length bishop rome contented meane lordship fyrst layde hande vpon kingdomes afterwarde vpon empire may color whatsoeuer reteine possession gotten mere robberie sometime bosteth hath lawe god lib de consid sometime pretendeth gift constantine sometyme title fyrst answer bernarde admitte reason whatsoeuer claime vnto hym yet hath apostolike right peter coulde geue whiche gaue successor care chirches lorde maister saieth appointed iudge betwene two seruant scholar ought thinke scorne iudge men bernarde speaketh ciuile iugementes addeth therfore power crime possession ye haue receiued keyes kyngdome heauen whiche seemeth thee greater dignitie forgeue sinnes diuide landes comparison base earthly thynges haue kynges prince earthe iudges ye inuade boundes c againe thou arte made superior speaketh pope eugenius wherunto beare lordship thinke therfore howe muche soeuer thinke selues let v remembre ministerie laid vpon v lordshyp geuen v learne thou hast nede wedehoke scepter thou mayste doo worke prophete agayne playne lordship forbidden apostle goe thou therfore presume vsurpe thy selfe either beeyng lorde apostleshippe beyng apostle lordship forme apostleship lordshippe forbidden ministerie bidden wheras thynges spoken man euidente men truthe speaketh yea thyng selfe manifest without woordes cocilliu arclates yet bishop rome ashamed councell orleaunce decree supreme power bothe swerdes belong hym lawe god gift constantine meanly practised history tymes nede taught howe muche fabulous also laughed passe ouer history gregorie bothe sufficient full witnesse hereof epist v lib ii epi lib iii epi lib epi lib episto xxxiii lib iiii oft speaketh emperor calleth noble lord himselfe vnworthy seruant againe place lette lord earthly power soner angry prestes excellent consideration sake whoes seruantes let rule ouer also geue due reuerence see howe common subiection wold accompted one people pleadeth man cause owne place trust almighty god wyll geue long lyfe godly lordes dispose v vnder hande accordyng mercie neither haue therfore alleged thynges purpose throughly discusse question concernyng gift constantine reders see way chyldishly romanistes lye go chalenge erthly empire bishop muche fowle shamelesnesse augustine steuchus suche despeired cause hath ben bolde selle trauayle tong bishop rome ualla hard man learned sharp witt strongly confuted fable yet man litle exercised ecclesiasticall mater sayde mighte haue made purpose steuchus burst scattred stinkyng trifle oppresse clere light truely doeth lesse coldly handle cause master mery conceited felow faynyng wold dede take uallaes part verily woorthy cause whiche pope hyre patrones money lesse worthy hyred losells deceyued theyr hope gayne hapened eugubinus man require knowe tyme sin fained empire began ryse vp yet passed fiue hundred yeares sin bishoppes yet remained subiection prince neither pope created without authoritie emperor emperor henry fowerth name light rashe man forcast great boldnesse dissolute life gaue first occasion gregorie vii alter order court bishoprikes germanie partly sold partly laid open spoile hildebrand whiche receyued displeasure hande caught hold goodly color reuenge himselfe seemed pursue honeste godly cause furthered fauor many henry otherwise reason insolent maner gouernyng hated part prince length hildebrand whiche called hymself gregorie vii filthy naughty man bewrayed malice harte cause forsaken many conspired hym thus much preuailed successor might freely without punishment shake yoke also bryng emperor subiection hereunto added thense fourth many emperor liker henrie iulius cesar hard thing subdue sate home carelesse thinges slouthful nede vertue lawfull meanes represse gredinesse bishop thus see color goodly gift constantine shadowed wherby pope fayneth empire west deliuered vnto meane time pope cessed somtime fraude somtime wt treason somtime force inuade men dominion citie selfe free within hundred thirty yeres broughte subiection till grewe power haue day obteining encreasing wherof haue troubled christendome ye space twoo hundred yeres began yt toke dominion citie haue almost destroyed reg lib ca ye olde tyme whe vnder gregorie ye kepers good chirch take possessio landes reckened belong ye chirch maner seising ye vse prince sett tittle vpon token claime gregorie assembling councell bishop inueying sore prophane maner asked whether iudge ye clerke accursed wryting title attempt entre vpon possession al pronouced accursed claime pece groude wryting title clerke offense worthy accursing whole twoo hundred yeres together pope practise nothing ell battells sheding blood destruction army sackinges city racing ouerthrowes natios wastinges kingdomes yt might catch hold men possession cursinges enough punish example truly plaine seke nothing lesse ye glory christ wil wholy resigne al secular power yt haue therin danger glory god danger sounde doctrine danger safetie chirch carryed blinde hedlong gredinesse dominionezechl xxxiiiiiiii thinke nothing safe vnlesse may beare rule rigorousnesse prophete sayth power iurisdictio annexed immunitie ye romish clergie toke themselues thinke dignitie answere personal cause teporal iudge therin think ye libertie dignitie ye chirch consist exept fro como iugemetes lawes ye old bishop otherwise rigorous defeding ye right ye chirch iudged themselues order nothing hurt subiect ye godly emperours wtout gaine saying man alway call clerkes iugemet seates oft nede required thus saith constantine hys epistle ye nicomedians bishop shall vndiscretly disorder hymselfe boldnesse shalbe restrained execution minister god execution valentinian saith good bishop speake againste power emperor doe sincerely kepe comaundemetes god great king also obey lawes tyme men persuaded thys without controuersy ecclesiasticall cause referred iugemente bishop clerke offended nothing lawes onely accused canon cited commo iugement seate cause bishop hys iudge lykewyse question fayth controuersie mater properly perteined chirch iugement therof committed chirch vnderstanded ambrose wryteth ualentinian father honorable memoryi31 answered worde also decreed lawes cause fayth ought iudge neither vnfit office vnlike ryght agayne haue regarde scripture olde example denye cause faith cause say fayth bishop wonte iudge christian emperours emperours bishop agayne would haue come emperor consistorie either bishop people would haue suffred goe saying cause fayth ought debated chirch people affirmeth verily spiritual cause say cause religio ought drawen temporal court prophane cause pleaded worthily men prayse hys constance thys behalfe yet good cause procedeth thus farr come violence strong hande homel de basi lic trad sayeth wyll geue place willingly sayth forsake place committed vnto enforced knowe howe resist armure prayer teares let v note singular modestie wisdome holy man ioyned stoutenesse courage boldnesse iustina emperours mother could drawe hym arrians side practised dryue hym gouernement chirche haue come passe come called palace pleade hys cause therefore denyeth emperor competent iudge great controuersie maner necessitie tyme continual nature mater required iudged ought rather dye suche example consent geuen posteritie yet violence offered thynketh resistance denyeth bishiplike defende fayth ryght chirch armes cause sheweth hymselfe redy whatsoeuer emperor shall commaunde hym demaunde tribute sayth denye landes chirch pay tribute aske landes hath power claime none v resisteth manner also speaketh gregorie ignorant sayeth mynde noble soueraigne lorde lib epi vseth entermeddle cause perteining prestes least thyng burdened synnes doth generally exclude emperor iudgyng prestes sayth certayne cause oughte leaue iugement chirch thys exception holy men soughte nothing ell prynces lesse zelous religion wyth tyrannous violence wilfulnesse interrupte chirch doyng offyce neither disallowe prynces somtyme dyd vse authoritie ecclesiastical mater done preserue order chirch trouble stablishe discipline dissolue sith chirch hath power compelling oughte require speake ciuile constrayning office godly kynges prince mainteine religion lawes proclemations iudicial procedinges lib epi thys maner emperor maurice commaunded certaine bishop yt receiue fellowe bishop neighbor driuen oute barbarous nation gregorie confirmeth commaundemente lib episto xxxii xxxiiii exhorteth obeye himselfe admonished emperor come atonement iohn bishop constantinople doth dede render reason ought blamed yet doth bost immunitie secular court lib vii episto xxxix rather promiseth wil obedient farr conscience wil geue hym leaue therewithal saith maurice became godly prince gaue commaundementes prestes p xii chapter discipline chirch wherof chefe vse censure excommunication discipline ye chirch ye entreating wherof haue differred vnto place brefely declared may length passe ouer rest ye part hangeth vpon power keyes spiritual iurisdiction may easily vnderstode let v diuide chirch twoo principal degree say clergie people clerkes call vsual name yt execute publike ministerie chirch firste wil speake common discipline al ought subiect come clergie beside common discipline haue seuerall discipline themselues many hatred discipline abhorre name therof let heare felowship yea house though haue small householde kept righte state without discipline muche necessarie chirch whoes state ought orderly al therefore doctrine christ bringeth saluation soule chirch discipline stede sinewes therein wherby broughte passe member body hang together euery one hys fyt place wherfore whosoeuer either desire haue discipline taken awaye hinder restoryng therof whether set purpose vnaduisednesse verily seke extreme dissipation chirch shall betide lustfull lawfull euery man would preaching doctrine adio ned priuate admonishmentes correction suche helpes whiche susteyne doctrine suffer bee idle discipline therfore bridle wherwith may holden backe tamed coltishly resist christ pricke wherwith willing enough may stirred vp somtyme fatherly rod wherwith haue greuously falle may chastised mercifully according mildenesse spirite christ sith therfore se hande certaine beginninges horrible wastenesse chirch care order kepe people awe necessitie cryeth yt nede remedy thys onely remedy christ hath commaunded hath alway ben vsed among godly first fundation discipline priuate monition shoulde haue place say man hys accorde doe hys duty behaue himselfe licentiously liue honestly haue committed thyng worthy blame suffer himselfe admonished euery man study admonish brother occasion shall require specially let pastor prestes watchefull doe thys whoes office preach people euery house admonish exhort tyme doe sufficiently preuayle generall doctrine paule teacheth reherseth taughte priuately housesa xxxx xxvi protesteth cleane blood men hath cessed teares day night admonish euery one doctrine doeth obteyne force authoritie minister onely doth declare altogether duty christ also hath power order require keping therof marketh either obediente doctrine slouthfull man doe either stubbornely refuse going forwarde hys faultes despise admonishmentesmathe xviiixv xvii hath ben seconde tyme admonished witness called christe commaundeth called iugement chirch assemblie elder greuously admonished publike authoritie reuerence chirch may submitt himselfe obey hereby subdued continue hys wickednesse commaundeth hym despiser chirch putt away felowship faythfull speaketh onely secrete faultes must make diuisionmathe xviiixv tim vxx synnes priuate publike
