openly manifest first sort christ sayth euery priuate man reproue hym betwene thee hym alone manifest synnes paule sayth timothee reproue hym men rest may haue feare christ sayd thy brother haue offended agaynst thee wordes thee vnlesse thou wilte contentious thou canneste otherwyse vnderstande vnder thyne owne secret knowlege moe priuie thyng whiche apostle teacheth timothee concernyng rebukyng openly sinne openlygala iixiiii hymselfe folowed peter whe peter synned euen publyke offence admonyshe hym apart hymself brought fourth ye sight chirch therfore shalbe right order secret faultes goe forward according degree christ hath set manifest faultes immediatly procede chirches solemne rebuking offense publike let also distinctio sinnes defaultes wicked doinges haynous offence correcting thys later sort admonishment rebuking vsed also seuere remedie paule sheweth chastised wyth wordes corynthian committed incesti cor viiii also punished excommunication sone certified wicked dede therefore beginne better se spiritual iurisdiction chirch punisheth sinnes according word lorde best maintenance health fundation order bonde vnitie therefore chirch doth banish co pany manifest adulterer whoremonger theues robber seditious person periured men false witness againe obstinate men orderly admonished euen small faultes doe scorne god iugement taketh nothing vpon selfe without reason executeth iurisdiction geuen lorde moreouer none despise iugement chirch lightly regarde condemned consenting voice faithful lord hath testifiedmat xvixix xviiixviii iohn xx xxiii nothing ell pronouncing hys sentence whatsoeuer erth confirmed heauen haue worde lord wherby may condemne frowarde haue worde wherby may receiue repentant fauor say trust without thys bonde discipline chirches may long stande deceiued opinion vnlesse perhappes may want helpe lord foresaw necessarie v truely great necessitie therof shalbe better perceiued manifolde vse three endes whiche chirch hath respect vnto suche correction excommunicationeph v xxv first dishonor god named among christian leade filthy sinfull lyfe though holy chirch cospiracie noughtie wicked men sith chirch body christ defiled suche filthy rotten memberscolos ixxiiii shame muste come hed therefore suche thyng chirch wherby hys holy name may spotted wyth rep oche driuen householde whoes dishon e sclauder myght redounde name christian herein also consideration supper lord profaned geuing alwithout choise true distribution committed wittingly willingly admitt vnworthy man might lawfully put back giltie sacrilege homi mathe eze iiixviii xxxiiix geue abrode lordes body dogges wherfore chrysostome greuously inueyeth ye prestes whiche feare power great men dare debarre man blood sayth shalbe required handes ye feare man shall laugh scorne ye feare god ye shalbe reuerenced also among men let v feare mace purple crownes haue greater power verily rather deliuer mine body death suffer blood shed made partaker defiling therfore least holy mystery spotted sclander distributing thereof choise greatly requisite yet iurisdictio chirch secod ende least wont come passe continuall company euil good shold corrupted redy inclination go way nothing easier v ledde euill example fro right course lyfe vse apostle touched commauded corinthian put incestuous man company litle leuen sayth corrupteth whole lomp doaei cor vvi xi foresaw herein great danger forbade hym euen felowship brother sayeth among named either whoremonger couetous man worshipper idoles dronkarde euill speaker suche one graunte leaue much eate thirde ende themselues confounded shame may beginne repente filthinesse profitable also haue owne wickednesse chastised feling rod may awaked otherwyse tender bearing would haue become obstinate thing doth apostle meane sayth thus obey doctrineii thes iiixiiii marke hym kepe companye wyth hym may ashamed againe place wryteth hath deliuered corinthian satan hys spirite might saued day lordi cor vv aug de verb aposto hem lviii expounde went damnation tyme might saued euer therefore sayth deliuereth hym satan deuil chirch christ chirch wheras referr certaine vexing fleshe thynke vncertaine endes set fourth nowe remaineth se howe chirch executeth part discipline consisteth iurisdiction first let v kepe diuision aboue set synnes publike priuate secrete publike haue onely one twoo witness committed openly wyth offense whole chirch secrete call altogether hidden men ye sinnes hipocrites come iugement ye chirch meane kynde without witness yet publike firste kynd requireth degree christ rehearseth whe thing appeareth ye chirch ought dutie callyng sinner correcting according proportion offense ye second kind according ye rule christ come chirch til also obstinacie added whe ons come knowlege ye diuision noted betwene wycked doinges defaultes lighter synnes vsed great seueritie chastisemet wordes sufficeth gentle fatherly may harde confounde synner bryng hym home hymselfe yt may reioyse sory yt corrected mete haynous offense chastised sharper remedie enough wycked dede euill example hath greuously offended chirch shoulde chastised onely wordes oughte time depriued communion supper til haue geuen assurance repentance1 cor vv corinthian paule vseth rebuking wordes driueth chirche blameth corinthian long borne olde better chirch kepte order rightfull gouernement florished man done wicked dede wherupon growen offense first commaunded absteine partaking holy supper humble himselfe god testifie hys repentace chirch also certaine solemne vsages enioyned falle token repe tance done epi ii lib lib iii ep xiiii xxvi chirch satisfied layeng handes receiued fauor receiuing oftentimes called cipriane peace also briefely describeth vsage penance saieth certaine ful time come co fession laying handes bishop clergie receiue power come communion howbeit bishop clergie ruling reconciliation therewithall require consent people sheweth place discipline man exempted euen prince together common people submit themselues beare rightfully sithe euident discipline christ mete scepter crownes kinges submitted ambro lib epi iii orat habita fune theodosii theodosius depriued ambrose power come communion slaughter committed thessalonica threwe royall ornamente wherewith clothed openly chirch bewayled sinne whiche crept vpon fraude men craued pardon groning teares great kinges ought thinke dishonor humbly throwe themselues christ king kinges neither ought displease iudged chirch sith court heare nothing ell flattery necessarie rebuked lord mouth prestes rather ought wishe prestes spare lord may spare place omitt speake iurisdiction exercised spoken place onely adde ye lawfull maner proceding excommunicating man whiche paule sheweth elder doe alone themselues chirch knowing allowing sort multitude people may gouerne ye may marke witnesse keper nothing done fewe wilfull affection whole maner beside calling vpon ye name god ought haue grauitie may resemble presece christ maye vndouted sitteth ruler owne iugement ought passed ouer seueritie becometh chirch ioined spirite mildenesseii corin iivii must alway diligently beware paule teacheth yt whiche punished swallowed vp sorrow remedy made destructio ende may better gathered rule moderation wheras required excommunication sinner brought repentance euill example taken away least either name christ euil spoken prouoked followe shal haue eye thinges shalbe able easily iudge farr seueritie ought procede ought end therfore sinner geueth testimonie repentance doth testimonie much lyeth blott offense enforced enforced rigorousnesse doth excede measure behalfe immesurable seueritie olde father excused disagreed ye prescribed order lord also maruelously dangerous charged sinner solemne penance depriuation fro holy communion somtime seuen yeres sometime fower yeres somtime three yeres somtime whole life thyng could follow therof either great hipocrisie great desperatio likewise wheras man fallen seconde time admitted seconde penance cast chirch euen ende life neyther profitable agreing reson therefore whosoeuer shal wey mater sound iugemet shal perceiue want discretion ad cor ep xxxi lib howbeit rather disallow publike maner tha accuse al yt vsed wheras certaine yt many misliked therfore suffer could amende truely cipriane declareth much beside wil rigorous pacience saith easinesse gentlenesse redy come wish al returne chirch wish al fellow soldiars enclosed within tentes christ ye house god th father forgeue al thinges dissemble many thinges zele desire gather brotherhode together examine full iugement euen thinges yt comitted god pardoning defaultes ought selfe almoste defaulte doe redy full loue embrace returne repentance co fessing sinnes humble plaine satisfaction chrysostome somwhat harder yet sayth thus god kinde prest seme rigorous moreouer know gentlenesse augustine vsed towarde donatistes much yt sticked receiue bishoprike returned schisme euen immediatly repetance contrary order growen force compelled leaue iugement folow mildenesse required whole body chirch punish fallen mercifully extremitie rigor rather according precepte paule shoulde confirme charitie towarde euery priuate himselfe ought temper himselfe mercifulnesse gentlenesse therfore part wype number elect suche dryuen oute chirche despeire thoughe allredy loste maye dede iudge stranger chirch therefore stranger christ onely duryng tyme abide diuorce also shewe greater resemblance stubbornnesse gentlenesse yet lette v committ iugemente lorde hoping better time come see time present let v therfore cesse pray god comprehend al one word let v condemne death person selfe whiche hande iudgement god alone let v rather weye law lorde sort euery man work rule folow rather stande iudgement god pronounce owne let v take selues libertie iudgyng vnlesse bynde power god within boudes appoint law mercie whoes pleasure thinketh good euell men turned good stranger graffed foreins chosen chirch lord doeth therby mocke opinion men rebate theyr rashenesse restrained presumeth take selfe power iudgyng ought christ promiseth shalbe bounde heauenmathe xviiixviii whiche shall bynde earthe limitteth power byndyng censure chirch whiche excommunicate throwen euerlastyng ruine damnation hearyng lyues maners condemned also certified owne euerlastyng condemnation vnlesse repente excommunication hearyng differeth accursyng accursyng takyng away pardon doeth condemne man adiudge eternall destruction excommunication rather reuengeth punisheth maners though also punishe man yet doeth punyshe hym forewarnyng hym damnation come doth call hym backe saluation obteined reconciliation restoryng comunion ready accursyng either seldome neuer vse therfore although ecclesiasticall discipline permitteth liue familiarly haue frendly conuersation excommunicate yet ought endeuor meanes may returnyng amendment may returne felowshyp vnitie chirchii thess iiixv apostle also teacheth saith think enemy correct brother unlesse getlenesse kept well priuately common danger least discipline forthwith fall butcherie also principally required moderation discipline whithe augustine entreateth disputyng donatistes neither priuate men see faultes diligently enough corrected councell elder therefore depart chirch pastor themselues accordyng theyr harte desyre purge thynges nede amendment therfore throwe awaye ministerie lib ii contra parm capi vnwonted rigorousnesse trouble whole chirch true writeth free discharged curse whosoeuer eyther rebukyng amendeth amende excludeth sauing bonde peace exclude sauyng bond peace doeth disalowe equitie beare stedfastnesse rendreth reason therof place lib iii cap godly order maner ecclesiasticall discipline ought alway haue respecte vnto vnitie spirite bond peace apostle commaundeth kept bearing one kept medicine punishement begynneth onely superfluous also hurtfull therfore cesseth medicine yt saith doth diligetly thinke vpon thinges doth neither preseruyng vnitie neglecte seueritie discipline cap doeth immeasurablenesse correction breake bonde felowship graunteth dede pastor ought trauail point may remaine fault chirch cap also yt euery man ought power endeuor therunto plainly declareth yt neglecteth monish rebuke correct euell although fauor syn yet giltie lorde suche degree may also seuer partaking sacrament doth sinneth others euell owne willeth donemat xiiixxix vsing discretion ye lord also requireth least ta e rootyng corne hurte hereupon gathereth cyprian let man therfore mercyfully correct lette hym patiently suffer loue grone lament saith precisenesse donatistes saw faultes chirches bishop dede rebuke word punishe excomunicatio thei thought could way nothing preuaile sharply inuey bishop betrayer discipline vngodly schisme deuide themselues fro flock christ anabaptist day acknowlege congregation christ vnlesse euery point shine angelike perfectio vnder pretece zele ouerthrow al edificatio saith augustine hatred men wickednesse desire mainteyne owne contention couet either wholly draw away least diuide weake people snared bostyng name swelling pride mad stubbornesse traiterous sclauders troublesome sedition least shold openly appere want light truth pretend shadow rigorous seueritie thinges scripture comauded done moderate healing correcting faultes brother preseruing sincerenesse loue keping vnitie peace abuse sacrilege schisme occasion cutting ofii cor xixiiii doeth satan transforme hymselfe angel light occasion iuste seueritie persuadeth vnmercifull crueltie coueting nothyng el corrupt breake bond peace vnitie bond remainyng tast among christias foe made weake hurt trappes treason broken councels ouerthrowing vanishe away one thing chefely commendeth infection sinne haue entred whole multitude ye seuere mercie liuely discipline necessarie saith diuises separation vaine hurtful ful sacrilege vngodly proude trouble weake good one amende stoute euell one yt teacheth also faithfully folowed writing aurelius bishop carthage coplaineth yt dronkennesse sore codened scripturs doth range vnpunished affrica aduiseth yt assebling coucel bishop shold prouide remedy addeth thinges thinke taken away roughely hardly imperious maner teaching commaudyng admonishing thretenyng must deale multitude synners seueritie exercised vpon sinnes fewe yet doth meane bishop therefore winke holde peace publike faultes lib iii contra parm cx piii seuerely punishe afterwarde expoundeth willeth measure correction tempered farre may may rather bryng healthe destruction body therfore length concludeth thus wherefore bothe commaundement apostle wyse neglectedi cor vvii eph iiiiii seuer euell may doone without peryll breakyng peace also kept bearyng one shoulde endeuor preserue vnitie spirite bonde peace parte remaineth discipline whiche proprely conteined power keyes standeth accordyng necessitie tymes pastor exhort people either falling comon supplication exercise humilitie repentance faith thing neither tyme measure forme prescribed word god left iugement chirch obseruyng part also profitable hath alwaye ben vsed olde chirch euen apostle howbeit apostle themselues fyrst author toke example lawe prophetes see ofte weightie busynesse happened people called together common praiers enioyned fastyng comaunded therfore apostle folowed bothe new people god foresawe profitable lykewise thought exercise wherewith people may either stirred vp duetie kept awe obedience example eche holy history nede gather together summe holden oft happeneth controuersie religion must determined either synode ecclesiasticall iudgement oft choosyng minister finally oft harde matter great importance doyng agayne appere token wrath god pestilence warre famine holy ordinance profitable al age pastor exhort people common fasting extraordinarie praiers man allow testimony may alleged old testament though mete christian chirch certaine apostle also howbeit praiers thynke scarcely founde moue question therfore let v say somwhat fastyng many vnderstande profite hath iudge necessarie also vtterly refuse superfluous vse well knowen easie slide superstition holy true fastyng hath three endes vse either make leane subdue fleshe waxe wanton may better disposed praiers holy meditation shold testimonie humblyng god wyllyng confesse giltinesse hym fyrst end hath often place common fastyng men haue like state body like health therfore rather agreeth priuate fastyng second end common bothe well whole chirch euery one faithfull hath nede suche preparation prayer thirde also likewise common shal somtyme befall god shall strike nation warre pestilence calamitie suche common scourge whole people must accuse themselues openly confesse giltinesse hand lord strike priuate man ought either alone owne familie standeth chiefly affection mynde mynde affected ought bee scarcely possible breake outward testifyeng chefely turne comon edifying alltogether openly confessyng sinne shold yelde praise righteousnesse god euery one mutually exhorte theyr example wherfore fastyng signe humblyng hath often vse publikely among priuate men howsoeuer comon alredy said therfore touching discipline wherof nowe entreate oft must make supplication god greate mater expedient commaunde fastyng together praier antiochians laide handes vpon paule barnabasacts xiiii iii act xiiii xxiii thei might better comende god ministerie greate importance ioyned fastyng prayer bothe afterward made minister ouer chirches wont pray fastyng kynd fastyng regarde none thyng myght made fresher vncombred pray uerily fynde experience belly full mynde lifted vp god bothe hartye feruent affetion caried prayer continue vnderstood luke reherseth anne serued lorde fastynges prayersluke iixxxvii dothe set worshyppyng god fastyng signifieth holy woma dyd maner exercise selfe continuance prayernehe iiiii cor vii v ye fasting nehemias whe earnestly bent zele praie god deliuerance people cause paule sayth faithfull doo well absteyne tyme wedding bed may freely apply prayer fastyng ioynyng fastyng prayer stede help putteth v mynde value farre referred ende agayn place geueth rule maryed folkes shold mutually render good one playne doth speake dayly prayer suche praiers require earnest intentiuenesse agayne either pestilence famine warre begynne range abrode calamitie otherwise seme hang ouer contree people also dutie pastor exhort chirche fasting may humbly beseche lord turne away wrath geueth warnyng prepared maner armed reuenge maketh danger appere therefore accused men time past long hanging beard vncombed heare black aray wont humbly abace selues procure mercie iudge accused iudgement seate god behoueth glorie comon edificatio also profitable healthfull v shold piteous array craue escape seueritie vsed among people israell easy gather wordes ioelioel iixxv commaundeth trompet sounded congregation gathered together fastyng appointed rest folow speaketh thynges receiued common custome little said examination appointed wicked dedes people declared day iudgement hand summoned beyng accused pleade cause crieth haste sacke cloth ash wepyng fasting also outwarde testifiengs throwe themselues downe lorde sacke cloth ash paraduenture agree tymes dout calling together weping fastyng suche lyke likewise perteyne also age oft state thynges doeth require sithe holy exercise bothe humble men confesse humilitie lesse vse olde people dyd like necessitiei samn viivi xxxixiii ii kin ixii reade people israell informed instructed word god also niniuites doctrine preaching ionas fasted token sorowe cause therfore sameion iiiv outward ceremonie rest ended christ yea rather euen daye alway hath ben good helpe faithfull profitable admonition stirre vp selues great carelesnesse sluggyshnesse prouoke god chastised scourgesmath ixxv luke vxxxiiii therfore christ excuseth apostle fast doth say fastyng abrogate appointeth time calamitie ioyneth mournyng tyme shall come sayth bridegrome shall taken awaye error name let v define fastyng vnderstand abstinece sparyng meate drinke certaine thing life godly ought dede tempered honest sparyng sobrietie nere possible may whole course therof beare certaine resemblance fasting beside fasting time withdrawe thing wonted diet either one daye certaine time charge selues streighter seuerer abstinence diet ordinarie consisteth thre thyngs tyme qualitie meates smallnesse quantitie meane tyme vse doyngs fastyng fasting ordeined example man fast common praier come emptie vnto qualitie standeth deyntinesse absent beyng content common baser meates shoulde stirre vp appetite delicates rule quantitie eate sparingly lesse wont onely necessitie also pleasure must alway principally beware superstition crepe vpon v hath heretofore happened great hurt chirch muche better vse fastyng shold diligently kepte meane tyme bee corrupted false hurtfull opinion wherunto worlde sometyme falleth vnlesse pastor great faithefulnesse wisdome preuent fyrst point therfore alway enforce ioel teacheth cutt harte theyr garmentesioel iixii shold admonish people god doth greatly esteme fastyng selfe vnlesse inwarde affection harte true myslykyng sinne hymselfe true humblyng true sorowe feare god yea fastyng profitable cause ioyned inferior helpe god abhorreth nothing men settyng signes outward shew stede innocence hartesase viiiv labor false color deceiue themselues therfore esaie sharply inueyeth hypocrisie iewes thought satisfied god fasted howsoeuer norish vngodlynesse vncleane thought hart saith fastyng lord requireth foorth foloweth therefore hypocriticall fastyng vnprofitable superfluous werying also great abhomination euell nere vnto chiefly taken hede taken meritorious worke forme worshippyng god sithe thyng selfe indifferent hath value reson end ought haue respect vnto moste hurtfull superstition confounde work comaunded god necessarie themselues without respect lib ii de mor manich cap xiii lib xx cotra faust old tyme dotage manichee augustine confuteth dothe plainly enough teache fastyng iudged endes haue spoken otherwyse allowed god vnlesse referred thirde error dede vngodly yet perillous require kepyng precisely rigorously one chiefe dueties aduaunce immeasurable praise men shold thinke haue done excellent thyng haue fasted behalfe dare altogether excuse olde father haue sowed sedes superstition geuen occasion tyranny whiche hathe risen sin founde dede sometymes sounde wise sentence fastyng afterwarde mete immeasurable praise fastyng aduaunce among chief vertues tyme superstitious obseruyng lent eche growen vse common people thought therin notable seruice godmathe iiiii pastor dyd commend holy folowyng christ wheras plaine christ dyd fast prescribe example beginnyng preaching gospel myght dede proue doctrine men descended heaue meruailous grosse error cofuted many euidet resons could crepe men sharpe iudgement christ fast oft must nedes haue done wold haue set foorth law yerely fastyng one prepared himselfe publishyng gospell fasted manner menne mete haue done would haue prouoked men folow rather sheweth example whereby may rather draw men wo der stirre vp folow finally none cause fasting moses fasted receiued law ye hand lordexod xxiiiixviii et xxxiiiixxviii sith ye miracle shewed moses stablishe authoritie law ought haue ben omitted christ least gospell seme geue place lawe sin tyme neuer came man mynde vnder color folowyng moses require forme fasting people israel neither holy prophetes father folow yet mynde zeale enough godly exercise sayd heliasi king xixvi passed forty dayes without meate drinke tended ende people know stirred vp restorer law almost israell departed therfore mere wrongful zeale ful supertitio set foorthe fasting title color folowyng christe howbeit manner fasting greate diuersitie cassiodorus rehearseth socrates nynth booke hys historie romaine sayth three weekes continuall fasting except sonday saturdaye slauonians grecian six wekes seue fasting deuided time disagreed lesse difference meates eate nothing bread water added herbes forbeare fishe fowles somme difference meates diuersitie augustine also maketh mention latter epistle ianuarie folowed worse tymes preposterous zele people added bothe ignorance rudenesse bishoppes luste beare rule tyrannous rigor made wicked lawes strayne conscience pernicious bondes eatyng fleshe forbidden though defiled man added opinion full sacrilege one vppon till came bottome error yt peruersenesse shold omitted began moste fonde pretence abstinence mocke god exquisite deyntinesse fare sought praise fasting delicates suffice neuer greater plentie diuersitie sweetenesse meates gorgious preparatio thinke serue god rightly speake neuer fowlye glutte selues would bee compted holy men brefely compt greatest worshipping god abstein fleshe excepted flowe full kynde deynties syde think extremest vngodlinesse scarcelye may recompensed deathe man tast neuer little piece bacon vnsauerie fleshe browne breade ad nepotian hierome telleth euen tyme folly mocke god would eate oile caused deyntie meates fro euery place bee brought yea oppresse nature wyth violence absteined drinking water caused swete costly suppinges made drinke cup shell faulte fewe day comon fault among riche menne fast ende may banket sumptuously deyntily waste many wordes mater doutefull say bothe fasting al partes discipline papistes haue nothing right nothing pure nothing well framed orderlye whereby maye haue occasion bee proude though thyng remaining among worthy praise foloweth another parte discipline peculiarly belongeth clergie conteyned canon old bishop haue made ouer selues order clerke geue hunting dy ing banketting none occupye vsurie merchandise none present wanton dauncings ordinance also added penalty wherby authoritie canos stablished none shoulde breake vnpunnished ende euery bishop committed gouernement owne clergie shoulde rule clerkes according canon holde duetie ende ordeined yerely ouerseinges synodes anye negligent hys duetie bee admonished offended punished according measure offence bishop also selues yerely prouinciall synodes olde tyme yerely two synodes whiche iudged done thyng beside duetie bishop harde violent clergie might appelle synodes although one complained seuerest punishment offended remoued hys office time depriued comunion cotinuall order neuer vsed dismisse synode appointed place tyme next synode gather generall councell pertained emperour onely old summoninges councels testifie long seuerite flourished clerkes require word people themselues performe example dede yea much rigorous themselues people verily mete people shold ruled getler looser discipline may terme clerkes vse sharper iudgementes among themselues lesse beare themselues men growen vse nede rehearse day nothyng imagined vnbridled dissolute clergie broke foorth great licentiousnesse whole worlde crieth antiquitie shold seeme vtterly buryed among graunt dede certaine shadow deceiue eies simple suche come nerer auncient maners counterfaityng ape approcheth whiche men reason aduise notable place xenophon teacheth fowly persian swarued ordinance elder fallen rigorous kinde life softnesse deyntinesse yet couered shame sayeng diligently kept auncient vsages ye tyme cirus sobrietie temperance farr florished men neded wipe yea accompted shame posteritie continued religious obseruation man draw snott oute hys nosethrilles lawfull sucke vp fede within euen till wer rotten stinking humor gathered gluttonous eating olde order vnlawfull bryng winepots borde swill wine nede caried away dronken tolerable ordeined eate one day thys good successor haue abrogate gaue leaue continue surfettinges midde day midde nighte custome men make ende dayes iourney fasting libertie vsedly custome auoyding werinesse shorten iourney twoo houres whensoeuer papistes shall pretende bastarde rule shewe themselues like holy father example shall sufficiently reproue fonde counterfaiting painter liuely expresse one thing rigorous vnentreatable geue leaue prestes mary howe greate libertie among vse whordome vnpunished nedefull spoken bearing bolde vpon stinking vnmaried life haue hardened themselues wicked doinges forbidding doeth plainly shewe howe pestilente tradition forasmuch hath onely spoiled chirch good fit pastor also hath broughte horrible sinke mischeues throwen many soules gulfe desperation truely whereas mariage hath ben forbidden prestes hath done wicked tyrannie onely againste woorde god also equitie firste forbidde whiche lorde lefte libertie meanes lawfull men againe god hath expressely prouided hys woorde libertie broken euidente nedeth long demonstration speake paule many place willeth bishop husbande one wyfei tim iiiii ivi timo iiiiiii coulde vehemently spoken pronounceth holy ghost shalbe last tymes wicked men shall forbidde mariage calleth onely deceiuers deuells therefore prophecie thys holy oracle holy ghost wherewith willed arme chirche aforehande againste danger forbidding mariage doctrine deuells thinke haue gaily escaped wrest thys sentence montanus tatrans eucratites olde heretikes onely saye condemned mariage dooe condemne debarre clergie thynke conuenient though albeit prophecy first fulfilled aforesaid might also applied though childish fond sutteltie worth hearing saye forbidde forbid al one tyrant wo ld affirme vniust law vniustice wherof one part citie oppressed obiect prest doth marke differ people though lorde also foresee ornamets prestes oughte excell accuse apostle troubling order confounding comlinesse chirch portrayed absolute forme good bishop durste set mariage among giftes required hym knowe howe expounde namely none chosen hath seconde wife graunt new exposition false exposition appeareth texte selfe setteth quality wiues bishop deacon ought paule reckeneth mariage among vertues bishop men teache intollerable faulte order clergie sirituis ad episcop hispansaru god name contented generall disprayse call canon vnclennesse defiling fleshe let euery man thynke wt himselfe workshop thing come christ vouchesaueth honor mariage willeth image holy conioyning chirch coulde spoken honorably set dignitie mariage face therefore shall called vncleane defiled wherein shineth lykenesse spirituall grace christ nowe forbidding euidently fighteth ye word god yet fynde scripture wherewith defende leuiticall prestes bounde lie sonder wiues oft came turnes minister might handle holye thinges pure vndefiled therefore vncomly holy thinges sithe bothe much noble daily shoulde handled maryed men though one person minister gospell leuiticall presthode figure represented christ mediator god men absolute purenesse reconcile father vnto v sinner could euery behalfe expresse figure holinesse yet might certaine grosse draughtes yeld shadowe hym commaunded purifie themselues beyond maner men whe came sanctuarie namely properly figured christ pacifier recocile people god appeared tabernacle image heauely iugement seate forasmuch pastor chirch beare persone thys dayheb xiiiiiii therfore vainly copared wherfore apostle doth without exception boldly pronouce mariage honorable among men whoremonger adulterer abideth iugement god apostle theselues example approue yt mariage vnmete holinesse office neuer excellenti corin ixv paul witnesseth kepe wynes also carryed againe maruelous shamelesnesse durst set comlinesse chastitie necessarie thing ye great reproche ye old chirch abouded singular learning god yet excelled holinesse passe vpo apostle wont somtime stoutely despise beseche wil old father whome certaine haue suffered also allowed mariage order bishop forsooth nourish filthy profaning holy thing forasmuch mystery lord rightly reuerenced among moued dede nicene sinode haue vnmaried life commaunded alway want superstitious men histo tripart lib ii ca xiiii whiche doe euer inuente new thing bring themselues admiration decreed sentence paphuntius assented pronounced man lyeng owne wife chastitie therefore mariage remained holy among neither turne shame thought spott ministerie folowed tymes superstitious obseruation single life grew force hereupon came ofte vnmeasurably aduaunced praise virginitie scarcely vertue thought among people compared although mariage condemned vncleane yet dignitie therof diminished holinesse obscured semed aspire wt courage strong enough perfection refraine himselfe hereupon came canon wherby first forbidde come degree presthode shoulde contracte mariage none taken order vnmaried forsake mariage together wiues thinges semed procure reuerence presthode graunt euen antiquitie receiued great well liking aduersaries obiect antiquitie first answer libertie remained vnder apostle certaine age bishop might maried yt apostle theselues pastor great authoritie succeded place vsed without sticking exaple yt aucienter chirch ought worthily greater weight v yt think yt either vnlawful vncomly v wt praise receiued vsed secondly say ye age immeasurable affection virginitie began partial mariage lay vpon prestes law vnmaried life though thing necessarie selfe preferred vnmaried men aboue maried finally answer yt require yt wt force necessitie costraine cotinence fit kepe punished whoredomes wt seuere lawes yt cotracted mariage decreed yt geue ouer ye execution office therfore whesoeuer ye defeders new tirannie shal seke pretense antiquitie defende vnmaried life oft shal answere wt requiring yt restore old chastnesse prestes yt remoue adulterer whoremogers suffer thei suffer honest chast vse mariage bed run vnpunished al kind lust yt cal ye discontinued discipline wherby wantonness may restrained deliuer chirch wicked filthines wherwt hath log deformed whe haue grau ted must againe put mind yt bost thing necessarie selfe libertie hangeth vpon profit chirch yet say thinke condition place geuen canon lay bonde vnmaryed life vpon order prestes wiser sort may vnderstande face enemy sclaunder holy mariage prestes obiecting name antiquitie touching father whoes wrytinges remaine euen whe speake owne iugemet except hierome great spitefulnesse deface honestye mariage homel de inuet crucis shalbe content one commendation chrysostome sithe principall estemer virginitie thought haue ben lauish commendation mariage thus sayth first degree chastitie pure virginitie seconde faithfull mariage therfore seconde kinde virginitie chast loue matrimonie pthe xiii chapter vowes rash promising wherof eche man hath miserably entangled himselfe verily thing lamented chirch libertie purchased inestimable price blood christ hath ben oppressed cruel tyranny almost ouerwhelmed huge heape tradition meane time euery man priuate madnesse sheweth without iust cause hath ben much permitted god satan minister thoughte enough neglecting commaundement christe beare burden whatsoeuer layed vpon false teacher vnlesse also eche man procure himselfe seuerall burden hys digging pittes themselues drown themselues deper done striued deuising vowes might added commo bondes greater streighter byndig sithe therefore haue taughte boldnesse whiche haue borne rule vnder title pastor chirch worshipping god hath ben corrupted whe snared silly conscience vniust lawes shal season adioyne euell nere vnto may appeare world according ye peruersnesse disposition hath alway stoppes could put away helpes wherby haue ben brought god may better appeare greuous hurt hath ben brought vowes let reders kepe minde principle aboue set first haue taughte whatsoeuer may required framing life godlily holily comprehended law againe haue taught lorde might therby better call v away deuising new workes hath enclosed whole praise righteousnesse simple obedience thynges true easy iudge yt al fayned worshippiges inuet selues deserue fauor god acceptable much soeuer please v truly lord himselfe many place doth openly refuse also greuously abhorte hereupo ariseth dout vowes made beside expresse worde god accompt made whether may rightly vowed christian farr bynde among men called promise respect god called vow men promise thinges either whiche thinke pleasant vnto owe dutie therefore ought much greater hedefull obseruation vowes directed god himselfe whome ought deale earnestly thys pointe superstition hath age maruelously ranged menne without iugement without choise vowe vnto god whatsoeuer came minde mouth hereupon came folly yea monstruous absurdity vowes among ye heathen wherwith insolently mocke god would god yt christian also folowed boldnesse oughte dede haue ben se certaine age paste nothing hath ben vsuall wickednesse people eche despising lawe god wholly burne mad gredinesse vowe whatsoeuer pleased dreame wil hatefully enforce particularly rehearse hainously many way herein men haue offended thoughte good say way may better appeare moue question nedelesse mater entreate vowes erre iudging vowes lawfull wrongfull behoueth weye three thinges saye vowe made make vowe last minde vowe first pointe hath respect thiscolo iixxiii shoulde thynke haue doe god whome obedience muche deliteth pronounceth willworships accursed howe gay glorious soeuer eye voluntarie worshippes selues deuise without commaundement abhominable god foloweth worship acceptable hym allowed worde therfore let v take great libertie selues dare vowe god hath testimonie howe estemed himro xiiiixxiii whereas paule teacheth sinne whatsoeuer done without fayth extendeth doinges verily chefely hath place thou directest thy thoughte streighte waye god fall erre euen smallest thinges paule disputeth difference meates certaintie faith shineth v howe muche modestie vsed attempte thyng greatest weyghte nothyng oughte earnest vnto v duty religion lett thys therefore firste consideration vowes neuer come vowing thing conscience haue firste certainly determined attempteth nothing rashly shall free danger rashnesse shal haue god going enforming hys worde good vnprofitable done thing haue sayd cosidered conteyned measure strengthes haue eie vocation neglect benefite libertie god hath geuen v voweth eyther power disagreeth hys vocation rash yt despiseth ye bou tifulnesse god wherby appoynted lord thynges vnthankefull say thus meane thyng sett hande standing vpon confidence strength may promise god truly decreed councell arausium nothyng ryghtly vowed god haue receiued hys hande concil arausi cap xi rom xiiiii cor xiixi forasmuch thynges offred hym hys mere gyftes sith thynges god goodnesse geuen v thynges equitie denyed v let euery man paule commaundeth haue respect measure grace geuen vnto hym therefore meane nothyng ell vowes must tempered ye measure lord prescribeth thee geuing lest ye attept tha permitteth thou throw thy selfe hedlong takyng much vpon thee example murtherersact xxiiixii mentio made luke vowed would tast meate tyll paule slayen although deuise ben wicked yet rashnesse selfe suffered made lyfe death man subiect power iephthe suffred punishment hys follyiud x xxx whe hedlong heate conceiued vnaduised vow kynde unmaried life hath ye chefe place mad boldnesse sacrificing prestes moke nonnes forgettyng weakenesse thinke themselues able kepe vnmaryed lyfe oracle taught shall haue chastitie throughout al theyr lyfe ye ende wherof vowe heare worde god concernyng ye vniuersal state mengene iixviii good man alone vnderstande would god yt fele yt synne remayning v without moste sharpe prickes wyth confidence dare shake ye general callyng al life long wheras ye gift continence oftener grau ted certayne time opportunitie requireth stubbornesse let loke god helper let rather remember sayd thou shalt tept lord thy god thys tempt god endeuor agaynst nature put v hym despise preset giftes though nothyng belonged vnto v also mariage selfe god thought agaynst maiestie institute hath pronouced honorable al menheb xiiiiiii iobiiii christ lord hath sanctified hys presence vouchesaued honor fyrst miracle dare call defyling aduaunce maruelous commendation certayne vnmarryed lyfe sorte soeuer though themselues dyd shewe clere example life vnmarryed state one thyng virginitie lyfe yet shamelesly call angelyke doyng herein verily great iniurie angel god compare whoremonger adulterer somwhat ell muche worse filthier truely nede argumetes openly confuted thing selfe playnly se howe horrible peines lord doth commonly take vengeance suche arrogance contempt giftes muche truste themselues spare shame speake secrete faultes euen already perceiued much controuersie oughte vowe nothing may hinder v seruing vocation householder vowe leaue wife child take charge hande filt beare office chosen doe vowe priuate man meant libertie shoulde despised hath difficultie declared therefore thus fewe wordes expounde sith god hath made v lordes thing hath made subiect vnto v vse commoditie cause shoulde hope shalbe acceptable worke god yelde selues bondage outwarde thinges ought helpe vnto v say thys purpose many doe hereby seke praise humilitie snare themselues many obseruations god without cause willed v free discharged therefore escape danger let v alway remember ought depart order lord hath ordeined christian chirch come whiche set thirde place muche materiall minde thou makest vowe thou wilt haue allowed god sith lord regardeth hart outwarde shewe cometh passe selfe thyng chaging purpose mind doth somtime please acceptable vnto hym somtime hyely displeaseth thou vow absteyning wyne though holinesse thou art superstitious thou haue respect ende euell man disallow iudgemente fower endes vowes shalbe rightly directed teachinges sake referre twoo time past twoo tyme come time past belong vowes wherby doe either testifie thankfulnesse god benefites receiued craue turning away wrath selues doe punishe selues offense haue committed let v call firste sort exercise thankesgeuing repentance first kinde haue example tithe whiche iacob vowedgene xxviiixx lorde bring hym home safe banishment contree ye old sacrifice peaceoffringes godly kinges capitaines toke hande righteous warrepsa xxiixxvii lvixiii cxvi xiiiixviii vowe would pay obteyned victorie least oppressed great distresse ye lorde deliuered place psalmes vnderstode whiche speake vowes suche vowes may thys day also vse among v oft lord hath deliuered v either calamitie hard sicknesse hanger agaynste dutie godly manne consecrate god vowed oblation solemne token reknowleging least shoulde seme vnthankful towarde goodnesse sort seconde kinde shal suffice shewe one onely familiar exaple vice gluttonie falle offense nothing withstandeth chastise intemperance may tune forsake al deinty meates may vow adioined may binde himselfe streighter bonde yet make perpetuall lawe haue likewise offended shewe lawfull shal thinke vow profitable themselues therfore make vow lawful meane tyme leaue libertie vowes applyed time come partly haue allredy sayd tend ende may made warer partly certaine spurres may pricked forwarde dutie man seeth hym selfe inclined certaine vice thing otherwise euill temper himselfe falling fourthwith euill shal doe nothing inconueniently tyme vowe cutt himselfe vse thing man knowe thys apparell body perilous vnto hym yet entised desire earnestly couet better putting bridle vpo himselfe charging himselfe necessitie absteining deliuer hymselfe doutyng likewise man forgetfull slow necessarie duty godlynesse may takyng vow vpon hym awake memorie shake hys slouthfulnesse graunt forme childishe schooling euen helpes weakenesse without profit vsed rawe vnperfect therfore shall say vowes lawfull whiche haue respect one endes specially outwarde thinges vpholde allowance god agree vocation measured power grace geuen v god also hard gather generally thought vowes one common vowe faythfull made baptisme confirme stablish catechisme receiuyng supper sacramentes charter lorde deliuereth v hys mercy therby euerlastyng lyfe agayne behalfes promise obedience forme verily summe vowe forsakyng satan yelde selues seruice god obey hys holy commaundementes followe peruerse desire fleshe ought douted thys vowe sithe hath testimonie scripture yea required child god holy profitable saluation maketh contrarie man life performeth perfect obedience law god requireth v sith thys forme couenating comprised within couenante grace vnder whiche conteyned bothe forgeuenesse synnes spirite sanctification promise whiche make ioyned bothe besechyng pardon wyth crauyng helpe iudging particular vowes necessarie kepe mynde three former rule wherby may safely weye sorte euery vowe neither yet thinke commende vowes whiche affirme holy wold haue daily though dare teache certaine rule number tyme yet man obey counsell shall take vppon none sobre tyme thou oftentimes breake foorth makyng many vowes religiousnesse continuance growe estimation thee thou shalt come bendyng readinesse fall superstition thou bynde thy selfe perpetuall vowe either great peyne tediousnesse thou shalt vndoe beyng weried long continuance thou shalt one tyme bolde breake also playne great superstition behalf worlde hath certaine age paste ben possessed one man vowed woulde absteyne wyne though absteinyng wyne self worship acceptable god bound fasting absteinyng fleshe certaine day hadde vaine opinion fained singular holinesse aboue rest thynges also vowed muche childyshe although child holden greate wisdome take vpon vowed pilgremages holyer place somtyme either go iourney foote body halfe naked werinesse merite might gotten suche incredible zele wherof worlde hath swelled examined rule whiche haue aboue sett shalbe founde onely vayne triflyng ful manifest vngodlinesse howsoeuer fleshe iudge god abhorreth nothyng fained worshippings beside pernicious damned opinion hypocrite haue trifle thinke haue gotten small rightuousnesse repose summe godlinesse outewarde obseruations despise lesse carefull suche thynges recken vp particular formes nothyng purpose forasmuche monkishe vowes greater reuerence seme alowed common iugement chirch good speake brefely first least shold prescription long tyme defende monkerie day noted olde tyme monastery farre order liuing disposed exercise themselues greatest seueritie patiece went thether maner discipline saye lacedemonians vnder lawes lycurgus suche tyme among monkes yea muche rigorous slept vpon grounde drinke water meate breade herbes rootes theyr chiefe deynties oyle ciches absteyned delicate diet trimmyng bodye thynges myght seme aboue truthe written witness sawe proued gregorie nazianzene basile chrysostome suche introduction prepared themselues greater office college monkes sedeplottes order minister chirche bothe whome haue nowe named profe playne enough brought vp monastery thense called office bishop also many singular excellent men tyme augustine sheweth also vsed tyme monastery yelded clerkes chirch epi speaketh thus monkes isle caprarea brother exhort lord ye kepe purpose continue ende tyme mother chirche shall require trauaile ye neither gredy pride take vpon flateryng slouthfulnesse refuse meke har obeye god neither preferre ye owne quiet leasure aboue necessity chirch good men wold haue ministred trauaile haue founde haue ben borne speaketh ministerie whiche faithfull spiritually borne agayne epi also aurelius occasion fallyng geuen themselues haynous wrong done order clergie forsakers monastery chosen soldiorship clergie euen remaine monasterie vse take clergie none aproued best unlesse parhappes comon people say euell pyner good fiddler shall also ieslyngly said v euell monke good clerke muche bee lamented lifte vp monkes suche ruinous pride thinke clerkes worthy great reproche wheras somtyme eue good monke maketh good clerk haue sufficient continence yet want necessary learning place appeareth godly men wonte discipline monkes prepare themselues gouernement chirche might fitter better instructed take great office vpon atteyned ende yet tended towarde part vnlearned men suche chosen oute mete chiefely two place paynteth vnto v forme olde monkrie boke maners catholike chirche setteth holynesse profession agaynst sclanders manichee booke whyche entitled woorke monkes inueyeth agaynste certaine degendred monkes whiche beganne corrupte order wyll gather summe thynges whyche sayeth nere maye wyll vse owne woordes despysyng sayeth enticementes worlde de mor eccles cathel cap xxxi gathered one moste chaste holy lyfe spend theyr tyme together lyuyng prayer readynges disputation swellyng pride troublesome stubbornesse wane enuiousnesse none possesseth thyng owne none burdenous man gett woorkyng handes thinges wherewith bodie may fed theyr mynde may hindered fro god theyr work deliuer call deanes deanes despisyng thing great carefulnesse make accompt therof one call father father holy maners also excellent godly doctrine hye thynges doo pride prouide whome cal child great authoritie comaunding great willyngnesse obeying come together verye last tyme yt day euery one fro dwelling yet fasting heare father mete together euery one father least three thousand men speaketh chefely egypt east refreshe body muche suffiseth life healthfulnesse euery man restrainyng desire take largely euen thinges haue present spare vile onely absteine fleshe wyne much may able tame lustes suche thynges muche gredily prouoke appetite belly throte howe muche seme cleaner color whereof filthy desire exquisite meates fleshe wont fondly fowly defended whatsoeuer remaineth aboue necessarie foode remaineth oftentimes muche workes hand pinching fare greater care distributed poore gotten distribute wise trauail may haue abundance thynges meanes endeuor whiche haue aboundyng maye remayne afterward hath rehersed hardnesse wherof himselfe sene example millain ell among thynges sayth man enforced harde thynges beare ibide ca xxxiii tit x man charged whiche refuseth neither therfore condemned rest confesseth want strength folowyng remembre howe muche charitie commended remembre thynges cleane clean therfore diligence watcheth refusyng kyndes meate vncleane tame lust reteine loue brother remembrei cor vixiii meate belly belly meat c yet many strong absteine weakes sake many haue nede thus pleaseth susteine themselues baser diet nothyng sumptuous therfore themselues beyng health forbeare consideration helth compell sicke take without feare many drinke wyne yet thynk themselues defiled gently cause geuen fainter get healthe body without som foolishly refuse brotherly admonish vaine superstition sooner made weaker holier diligently exercise godlinesse know exercisyng body perteineth shorte tyme charitie chefesly kepte charitie diet charitie speeche charitie apparell charitie countenance fitted mete conspire one charitie offende accompted haynous offend god resiste charitie caste oute shunned offend charitie suffred abide one daye forasmuche wordes painted table holy man semeth haue set maner lyfe monkerie olde tyme although somewhat long yet content enterlace saw shold haue ben somwhat longer gathered thynges diuers howe muche soeuer studied brefenesse purpose go whole mater way poynt onely maner monkes olde chirche maner thyng profession monkes time soundwitted reders may iudge comparison face haue whiche allege antiquitie maynteyne present monkrie augustine depaynteth vnto v holye true monkrie would haue absent rigorous exactyng thynges worde lorde left v libertie nothyng day seuerely required compt mischief neuer purged neuer litle swarue prescribed rule color fashion garment kynde meate triflyng colde ceremony de opere monach augustine stoutly mainteineth lawful monkes liue idle vpon mennes denieth euer tyme example well ordered monasterie men set chiefe parte holinesse idlenesse take idlenesse shalbe contemplatiue life wherby bost excell men approch nere vnto angel finally augustine requireth suche monkrie nothyng exercise helpe dueties godlinesse whiche commended christian maketh charitie chefe yea almost rule therof think praiseth conspiryng wherby fewe men beyng bounde together seuered whole bodye chirche rather willeth example geue light kepe vnitie chirche bothe pointes muche difference monkrie present man scarcely fynde thyng vnlyke say contrary monkes contented godlynesse studie alone christ commaundeth continually applie imagine wote new godlinesse meditation wherof may perfecter denie would knowe vouchsaue geue owne order alone title perfection take away al calling god neither ignorant sophisti solution therfore called dothe conteyne perfection best atteyne perfection disposed boste themselues people snare vnskilfull vnware yong men mainteine priuileges aduaunce owne dignitie reproche bost state perfection nye driuen defend vaine arrogance flee startyng hole haue yet atteined perfection state wherein aspire vnto aboue meane tyme admiration among people remayneth though monkishe life angelike perfecte clensed fault pretence make moste gainefull market moderation lieth buried fewe bookes doth see intollerable mockerie let v reason though gaue profession call state atteinyng perfection uerily geuyng name speciall marke make differyng kyndes lyfe abyde great honor geuen awaye ordinance one syllable allowed callynges god whiche owne holy mouth onely commaunded also commended notable title praise accompted vnworthy great wrong beseche done god wote new founde thyng preferred aboue kyndes lyfe ordeyned hymselfe praysed owne testimonie goe let say sclauder haue said contented rule prescribed god yet though holde peace themselues doo enough accuse themselues openly teache take vpon burden christ laide vpon hismath vxiiii forsoothe promyse keepe counsel gospel concernyng louyng enemy coueting reuenge swearyng c whiche thyngs christian generally bounde herin antiquitie shewe foorth agaynst v neuer came olde father myndes crie one voice one little woorde vttered christ ought necessarily obeyed without doutyng echewhere teache thinges name commaundementes whyche good expositor triflyngly say christ counsell forasmuche haue taught moste pestilent error let suffise haue brefely noted monkrie day grounded vppon opinion whiche godly ought worthily abhorre whiche imagined perfecter rule life common rule geuen god whole chirch whatsoeuer bilded vpon fundation abhominable bryng profe perfection thinke moste strong themmat xixxxi lorde sayed yong man asked hym perfection righteousnesse thou wilt perfect sell thou hast geue poore whether yet dispute graunt yt present therfore boste made perfect forsakyng theirsi cor xiii iii summe perfection stande meaneth paule teacheth whiche hath distributed goodes poore vnlesse haue charitie nothyng maner perfection charitie absent brought man nothyng must needes answere chiefest dede worke perfection also paule crieth themcoloss iii xiiii sticketh make charitie bonde perfection without suche forsakyng certaine betwene maister disciple disagreement one clerely denieth perfection man consist forsake goodes againe affirmeth perfection without must see howe sayeng christe taken thou wilt perfect sell thou hast nowe shalbe darke senseluke xxxv wey whiche oughte alway marke preachynges christ woordes bee directed yong man asketh workes shall enter euerlastyng lyfe christ asked workes sendeth hym lawe rightfully way eternall life considered selfe otherwise vnable bryng saluation vnto v oure owne peruersnesse answere christ declared teacheth rule frame life olde tyme ben taught lawe lorde bothe geue witnesse lawe god doctrine perfecte righteousnesse therwithall dyd mete wyth sclaunders shoulde seme newe rule life stirre people forsakyng law yong man beyng dede euel mynde swelling vayne confidence answered childhode kept al commaundementes law certaine infinite space distant bosted atteined bostyng ben true wanted nothyng hyest perfection haue shewed lawe conteineth self perfect righteousnesse appereth hereby kepyng called way eternall saluation myght taught knowe little profited righteousnesse boldly answered fulfilled profitable shake familiar fault abounded richesse hart fastened vppon therefore felte secrete wounde christe launced goe sayth sell thou haste hadde ben good keper lawe thought wold haue gone away sorowfull heard word loueth god hart whatsoeuer disagreeth loue hym onely taketh dong abhorreth bringyng destruction therefore wheras christe commaundeth couetous richeman leaue hath one commaunde ambitious man forsake honor voluptuous man delites vnchast instrumentes luste conscience touched felyng generall admonition must called back particular felyng owne euell therfore doo vayne drawe speciall case generall exposition though christe set perfection man forsaking goodes whereas mente nothyng el sayeng dryue yong man stoode muche owne conceite feele owne sore mighte vnderstand yet great way distant perfect obedience law otherwise falsly take vpon graunt place hath ben euel vnderstaded father therupon grew couetyng wilfull pouertie wherby thought blessed forsakyng earthly thynges dedicate themselues naked christ trust good contentious men satisfied exposition shall doute meanyng christ howbeit father thought nothyng lesse stablishe suche perfection hath sin ben framed cowled sophisters thereby rayse vp double christianitie doctrine full sacrilege yet borne whych compareth profession monkrie baptisme yea openlye affirmeth forme seconde baptisme doute father theyr harte abhorred blasphemie nowe touchyng laste thyng whyche augustine sayeth haue among olde monkes applyed themselues whollye charitie neede shewe woordes moste farre thys newe profession thyng selfe speaketh goe monastery departe chirche doo seuer themselues lawfull felowshippe faithfull takyng themselues peculiar ministerie priuate ministration sacramentes dissolue communion chirche bee may folowe comparison beganne make may one conclude haue behalfe lyke olde monkes although dwelt seuerally men yet seuerall chirch dyd partake sacramentes together appered solemne assembly parte people men erectyng themselues priuate altar haue ell doone broken bonde vnitie haue bothe excommunicate themselues whole body chirch haue despised ordinarie ministerie wherby lord willed haue peace charitie kept among therfore howe many ministeries day say many assembly schismatikes whiche troublyng order chirch cutt lawfull felowshyp faithfull departing secrete haue geuen themselues diuers name sectes neither wer ashamed bost paule dothe detest sufficiently amplifie haynousnesse unlesse parhappe thinke christ diuided corynthians one gloried one teacher done without iniurie christe stede christian heare called benedictine franciscanes dominicanes called themselues couete seuerally knowen fro comon sort christian great pride take title profession religion difference haue hetherto rehearsed betwene olde monkes monkes age difference maners profession selfe therfore let reader remebre haue rather spoken monkrie monkes haue touched faultes sticke life fewe seuered order lyuyng selfe difference maners nede particularly declare certaine degree men defiled filthinesse vice factio hatredes affection party ambition whoter amog dede monastery liue chastly called chastitie lust farre kept downe openly euell spoken yet man shal scarcely fynde euery tenth monasterie rather stewes holy house chastitie honest sparyng diet swine bee none otherwyse satted sty least shoulde complaine handle vngen ly goe howbeit fewe thynges whyche haue touched whosoeuer knoweth thyng selfe confesse nothyng spoken accuserlike augustine accordyng testimonie monkes excelled greate chastitie yet complaineth many vagabundes whiche euell craftes deceites wiped simple men money carying reliques martyr dyd vse filthy merchandisynges yea steede reliques martyr dyd shew forth ye bone dead men many wicked doynges sclandred order reporteth sawe better men whiche haue profited monastery lamenteth hath sene worse menne disprofited monastery wold say day sawe monastery swell maner burst many despeired vice speake nothyng well knowen men yet doth dispraise perteine without exception neuer rule discipline lyuyng holyly stablished monastery remained draues much vnlike rest say monkes ar day runne kynde holy antiquitie haue yet good men locke lye hydden fewe scattered huge multitude naughty wicked men despised also lewdly rayled somtyme cruelly handeled milesians prouerbe thynke ought place honest man among comparison olde presente monkerie truste haue broughte passe whiche purposed maye appeare cowled men doo falsly pretende example firste chirche defence profession forasmuche lesse differ ape menne meane tyme sticke declare euen olde forme augustine commendeth somewhat whiche little pleaseth graunte superstitious exactyng outwarde exercise rougher discipline say wanted much affectation wrogfull zeale goodly thyng forsakyng goodes without al earthly carefulnesse god estemeth care rule householde godlily holy householder beeyng loose free couetousnesse ambition desire fleshe trauaileth purpose serue god certayn vocation goodly thing play philosopher wildernesse farre companie men agreeth christian gentlenesse hatrede mankynde flie desert solitarinesse therewithalll forsake dueties whiche lord hath chefely commaunded although graunt euell profession yet verily small euell broughte vnprofitable perillous example chirch nowe therfore let v see maner vowes wherewith monkes day professed goodly order firste mynde institute new fayned woorshippyng deserue god fauor conclude thinges afore spoken whatsoeuer vowe abhominable god secondly without regard god calling without allowance inuent suche kynde liuyng pleaseth selues saye rashe therfore vnlawfull enterprise conscience hath nothing wherupon may vpholde selfe god whatsoeuer faithro xiiiixxiii deu er xxxixvii psal cvi xxxvii sinne moreouer whe binde selues many peruerse wicked worshippings ye monkry day coteineth affirme yt cosecrate god ye deuil lawful ye prophete say yt israelite offred childre deuils god yt corrupted ye true worshipping god prophane ceremony shall lawfull v say monkes whiche cowle put vpon themselues snare thousande wicked superstition sortes vowes promise god perpetuall virginitie though bargained god deliuer nede mariage cause allege make vowe trusting vpon grace god sithe pronounceth geueth menmat xixxi v conceiue confidence speciall gifte let haue vse tyme fele themselues troubled fleshe let flee helpe whoes onely power may resist preuaile let despise remedie offered certaine word god called mariage power co tinence denyedi cor viiix continence call wherby body onely kepte cleane whoredome whereby mynde kepeth chastitie vndefiled paule commaundeth onely outwarde wantonnesse also burning minde auoided thys say hath furthest tyme memorie ben obserued whiche woulde dedicate themselues wholly lorde binde themselues vowe continence graunte dede manner hath also ben auncient tyme receiued doe graunt age free faulte whatsoeuer done must taken rule litle litle vnappeasable seueritie crept epi vowe made roome repentance euident cypriane virgin haue faith dedicate themselues god let cotinue shamefastly chastly without faining strong stedfast let loke rewarde virginitie continue better marrye delightes fall fier reproches would spare teare withall would suche equitie temper vowe continence therefore departed farr aunciente manner onely admitt moderation pardon founde vnable performe hys vowe doe without shame pronounce sinneth greuouslye remedie intemperance fleshe taking wife defile bothe body soule whoredome still enforce mater goe shewe suche vowe vsed apostle tymei tim xii paule sayth widowes hauing ben one receiued publike ministerie marrye denyed first fayth doe denie widowes whiche bounde themselues seruices chirch therewithall take vpon bonde cotinuall vnmaried life reposed religion therin afterward began vsed could beare office beeing libertie loose yoke mariage whe one geuen fayth loked backe newe mariages thys ell shake calling god therefore maruell suche desire saith waxe wanton christe afterwarde amplifie mater sayeth performe whiche haue promised chirch doe also breake make voide first faith geuen baptisme whiche comprehended euery man answere calling unlesse parhappe rather vnderstande thus hauing loste shame fro thense fourth caste away care honestie geue fourth themselues wantonnesse vnchastitie licentious dissolute life resemble nothing lesse christian woman whiche sense like well therefore answere widowes whiche receiued publike ministere lay vppon themselues bonde continue vnmaried afterwarde maried easily perceiue happened whiche paule speaketh casting awaye shame became wanton besemed christian woman onely sinned breaking faith geuen chirch swarued common law godly woman firste deny professe vnmaried life reson mariage agreed ministerie toke hand deny binde themselues al single life farr necessitie vocatio beare againe graut bounde also better mary either troubled prickinges flesh fal vnclennese thirdly say age appointed paule comonly danger specially sithe comaudeth chose cotented wt one mariage haue alredy shewed token cotinece reso disallow yt vow vnmaried life wrongfully taken seruice god rashly vowed power continence geuen lawful draw place paul nonnes created deconisses delite god singing wyth mumbling vnderstanded lyue rest time idle execute publike ministration towarde poore study earnestnesse diligence endeuor themselues duty charitie vow vnmaried life yeld therby worship god absteined mariage therby vncombred execute office fynally vow either beginning youth yet middest flowing age might afterwarde learne late experience great hedlong downefal throwen themselues semed haue passed danger vowed lesse safe holy vow enforce firste twoo pointes say lawful haue woman receiued vow continence age three score yeres forasmuch apostle admitteth woman lx yeres olde commaundeth yonger marry bryng fourth childre therfore neither release made xii yeres xx afterward thirty yeres way excused much lesse tolerable silly maides age knowe themselues haue experience themselues trained fraude costrayned force threateninges put cursed snare tarry vpo cofuting twoo vowes say beside entangled wt superstition mater day seme made purpose vow mock god least seme maliciously shake vp euery small parcel contente generall confutation whiche aboue set manner vowes lawfull acceptable god thynke sufficiently declared yet somtime vnskilfull fearefull conscience euen misslike disallowe vowe neuerthelesse dout bynding greuously tormented bothe drede breake faith geuen god side feare least sinne keping succoured may wynde themselues distresse take awaye dout one say vowes lawful rightly made nothing worth god oughte voide v contractes men promise doe bynde contract would haue v bounde absurditie driuen keping thing god doth require v specially sith work otherwise right please god conscience haue testimonie please hym remaineth certaine whatsoeuer faithro xiiii xxiii sinne whereby paule meaneth worke taken hande douting therefore faulty faith roote al good workes assured acceptable god therefore lawfull christian man goe nothing without assurednesse faulte ignorance haue taken thing hande shoulde afterwarde geue ouer deliuered error sithe vowes vnaduisedly made onely nothing binde necessarily vndone yea onely nothing estemed also abhominable ye sight god aboue shewed nedelesse discourse longer mater nedefull one argumente semeth enough pacifie godly conscieces deliuer dout whatsoeuer workes doe flowe pure fountaine directed lawfull ende refused god refused lesse forbiddeth v goe forewarde beginne hereupon foloweth vowes procede error superstition value god forsaken v moreouer yt shall knowe solution shall haue wherewith may defende againste sclaunders wicked departe monkerie honest kynde lyfe greuously accused breache fayth periurie haue broken commonly thoughte insoluble bonde wherewith bounde god chirch say bonde god doth abrogate whiche man confirmeth moreouer admitting bounde holde entangled knowing god wt error nowe sin lightened wt knowlege ye truthgal iiiiii say yt therewithall free grace christe crosse christe haue greate effectualnesse looseth v fro curse law god wherwt holde bonde much shal deliuer v fro forein bondes nothing snaring nettes satan whomsoeuer therfore christ shineth lighte gospell doute looseth snare whiche put vpon themselues superstition howbeit want yet defense fitt liue vnmaried impossible vow sure destruction soule lorde would haue saued destroied foloweth ought continue therin howe impossible vowe continece endued singular gift haue alredy taught experience speaketh though holde peace neither vnknowen great filthinesse almost monastery swarme seme honester shamefast rest yet therfore chast suppresse kepe fault vnchastitie verily god doth horrible exa ples take vengeance boldnesse men whiche forgetting owne weakenesse nature couet denied despising remedy lord geuen hande trust stubbornnesse obstinatie ouercome disease incontinence ell shall cal stubbornnesse one warned nedeth mariage geuen lord remedie doeth onely despise also bindeth himselfe othe despising p xiiii chapter sacramentes byside preaching gospell helpe like sort sacrametes haue certaine doctrine taught much behouefull v wherby may learne ende ordeined vse first mete consider sacramente semeth shalbe playne propre definition say outwarde signe wherwith ye lord sealeth cosciences promise good wil toward v susteine weakenesse faith againe behalues doe testifie godlinesse towarde well angel may also brefenesse define otherwise call testimonie god fauor towarde v confirmed outwarde signe mutuall testifieng godlinesse towarde whether soeuer choose definition differeth nothing sense definition augustine teacheth sacramet visible signe holy thig visible forme inuisible grace doth better certainly expresse ye thing selfe wheras brefenesse darknesse wherin many ye vnskilfuller sort deceiued thought good moe wordes geue fuller sentence remaine dout reason olde writer vsed worde ye sense hard see oft olde translater would reder latine greke worde mysterion mysterie specially diuine mater entreated ofeph iix iiiii translated sacrament ephesian might make knowen vnto v sacrament againe yet ye haue heard distribution grace god geuen according reuelatio sacrament made knowen mecolos ixxvi tim iii xvi colossian mysterie hath ben hidde age generation manifested saintes lord would make knowen richesse sacramente c againe timothee great sacrament godlinesse god ope ly shewed flesh would say secret least shoulde seme say somwhat vnder greatnesse thinges therfore hath put sacrament stede secret holy thing significatio somtime founde amog ecclesiastical writer well enough knowen latine called sacramentes greke mystery expressing one thing twoo seuerall wordes endeth contention hereby came passe drawen signes whiche reuerende representation hie spiritual thinges epi v ad marcel augustine also noteth one place long sayth dispute ye diuersitie signes perteine diuine thinges called sacramentes definitio haue set vnderstande sacrament neuer without promise going rather adioined certaine addition hanging ende confirme seale ye promise selfe make approued vnto v yea certaine maner ratified meane lord foreseeth nedefull first ignorance dullnesse weaknesse yet speake properly much cofirme holy word stablish v faith therof truth god selfe sounde certaine enough fro receiue better confirmation selfe faith smal weake vnlesse stayed euery side al meanes vpholden shaken wauereth staggereth yea fainteth herein verily mercifull lorde according great tender kindnesse tempereth himselfe capacitie whereas naturall men alway creping vpon grounde sticking fast ye flesh dooe thinke much coceiue spiritual thing vouchesaueth euen earthly elementes guide v vnto himselfe fleshe selfe set fourth mirror spirituall good thinges vnbodily chrysostome sayth would haue geuen v ye thinges naked vnbodily homel ad populum haue soules putte within body geueth spirituall thinges vnder visible thinges suche giftes planted nature thinges set fourth v sacramentes signed god signification comonly say yt sacramet cosisteth word outward signe must vnderstande ye worde whispered wtout meaning faith wt onely noise wt magical enchauntment hath power cosecrate ye element preached maketh v vnderstande visible signe meaneth therfore yt vsually done vnder ye tyranie pope without great profaning mystery thought inough prest people stode amasedly gazing without vnderstanding mumble vp forme consecration yea set purpose prouided yt whit doctrine shoulde thereof come people spake thinges latine vnlearned men afterwarde superstitio brake farr beleued consecration formally made vnlesse hoarse whispering sounde fewe might heare augustine teacheth farr otherwise sacramental worde let word sayth added element hom ioh xiii shalbe made sacramet whense cometh great strength water touch body washe soule word making spoken beleued worde selfe sounde passeth one thing power whiche abideth worde faith preachro xviii act xvix pet iiixxi sayth apostle wherevpon actes apostle said faith cleansing harte peter apostle sayth baptisme also saueth v putting away filthinesse flesh examination good coscience worde faith preach without dout may able cleanse baptisme also halowed se riquireth preaching wherupo faith may growe nede trauaile much profe hereof forasmuch clere christ commaunded v apostle folowed purer chirch obserued yea euen beginning world knowen oft god offred signe holy father added vnseparable knot doctrine without sens made amased bare beholding therfore whe heare mention made sacramental worde let v vnderstand promise loude voice preached minister may leade people thether hande whether ye signe tendeth directeth v neither heard trauail fight wt doble horned argument rather suttle sounde either say know knowe worde god goeth sacrament true god knowe learne new thing sacrament foloweth know neither wil sacramente teach whoes whole force standeth ye worde wherunto let brefely answere seales hanged patentes publike instrumentes take themselues nothing forasmuche shoulde hanged vaine parchemente nothing written yet doe therefore confirme seale written added writinges neither say similitude lately fayned vsro iiiixi whiche paule himselfe vsed calling circumcisio seale purposely trauaileth proue circumcision righteousnesse abraham sealyng couenaunte faith whereof alredy ben iustified beseche may muche offende man teache promise sealed sacramentes promise themselues euidente one confirmed euery one manifester fit vpholde faith ye sacrametes bring clere promise haue peculiar worde liuely represent v wer painted table neither ought yt distinction thing moue v wont obiected betwene sacramentes seales patentes wheras consist carnall elementes world suffice mete seale promise god spirituall euerlasting wont haged sealing grauntes prince concerning fading fraile thinges faithfull man sacramentes pr sente eye sticketh fleshly sighte degree proportion whiche haue spoken riseth vp godly consideration hie mystery lie hidden sacramentes sith lord calleth promisesgene vixviii ixix xviixxii couenantes sacramentes seales couenantes similitude may wel brought fro couenantes men sowe killed worke wordes vsed yea vnlesse wente sowes many time killed without inwarde hier mysterie geuing man righte hande doe sithe oftentimes handes matched enmitie woordes haue gone suche signes lawes league stablished althoughe firste conceiued made decreed woordes therefore sacramentes exercise whiche make credit woorde god certaynet vnto v carnall deliuered vnder carnall thinges shoulde instruct v according capacitie dullnesse guide v hande scholemaisters guide child iohn homel libr con fau thys reason augustine calleth sacrament visible woorde representeth promise god painted table setteth sighte conningly expressed image similitude also may broughte whereby sacramentes may plainly set call pillers fayth bylding standeth resteth vpon fundation yet setting vnder pillers surely stablished faith resteth vpon worde god vpon fundation sacramentes added stayeth yet soundly vpon vppon pillers call loking glass may beholde richesse grace god geueth v haue alredy sayd doth manifestlye shewe himselfe v much geuen dullnesse knowe doth expressly testifie good loue towarde v tha hys worde neither doe reson fittly enough purpose labor proue hereby testimony grace god also geuen wicked whiche yet doe therby fele god nothing fauourable rather procure themselues greuous damnation argumente neither shoulde gospell whiche heard despised many testimonie grace god yet christ himselfe whiche seen knowen many whome fewe receiued lyke may also se patentes greate parte multitude laugheth scorneth authentike seale howsoeuer knowe proceded prince seale withal regarde thing perteining also abhorre considering egal relation similitude haue aboue vsed ought liked therfore certaine lorde doeth offer vnto v mercy pledge grace holy woorde sacramentes receiued whiche receiue worde sacramentes sure faith like christe offred father vnto saluation yet acknowleged receiued augustine one place minding declare sayd effectualnesse woorde shewed fourth sacrament spoken beleued therefore paule speaketh faithfull entreateth sacramentes includeth communion christe sayth ye baptisedgala iiixxvii cor xiixii haue put christ againe one body one spirite baptised christe speaketh wrongfull vse sacramentes geueth colde voide figure whereby signifieth howsoeuer wicked hipocrites peruersnesse either oppresse darken hinder effect grace god sacramentes yet withstandeth ofte pleaseth god bothe may bryng true testimonie communicating christ spirite god himselfe may deliuer performe promyse determine therefore sacramentes truely called testimony grace god certaine seales good beareth toward v sealing vnto v doe meane susteine nourishe confirme encrease faith reason wont obiect sentece tryfling weake say faith good made better say faith without shaking stedfastly without withdrawing resteth vppon mercy godluk xviiv ben better suche pray apostle lorde woulde encrease faith carelesly pretende suche perfection fayth whiche neuer sonnes men hath obteined shall obteine thys lyfe lett answer manner faith thinke saydmarke ix xxiiii beleue lorde helpe vnbeleuingnesse euen fayth howsoeuer begone faith good faith myghte made better vnbeleuingnesse taken away confuted certainer argument owne conscience confesse themselues sinner whiche whether denye muste nedes impute imperfection fayth say philip answered eunuche myghte baptizedact viiixxxvii beleued hys harte place hath confirmation baptisme fayth fylleth whole hart againe aske whether doe fele good parte hart voide fayth whether doe dayly acknowledge newe encreases heathen manne gloryed waxed olde learnyng therefore christian thrise miserable waxe olde profityng nothyng whoes faith oughte goe forwarde degree age tyll growe perfect man therfore place beleue harteph iiiixiii perfectely beleue christe onely harte syncere mynde embrace hym bee full hym feruent affection hunger thirste syghe towarde hym maner scripture saye doone whole harte whiche meaneth done syncerely hartilypsal cxix x et cxii cxxxviii psal xiiiii sorce sayenges haue harte soughte thee confesse thee harte suche syde rebuketh guilefull deceitfull men vseth reproche hart hart say faith encreased sacramentes holy ghost geuen vaine whoes strength worke begyn mainteyn make perfect faith dede graunt faithe propre whole work holy ghost beyng enlightned knowe god treasure goodnesse without whoes light mynde blynde see nothyng senslesse smell nothyng spirituall thynges one benefite god set foorth consider three fyrst lord teacheth instructeth v worde strengtheneth v sacrame te last shineth myndes lyghte holye spirite openeth entrie woorde sacramentes harte whiche otherwyse strike eares bee present eies nothyng moue inward partes wherfore touchyng confirmation encrease faith wold haue reader warned thinke haue already plaine wordes expressed assigne ministerie sacramentes though thought perpetually wote secrete force may themselues able confirme faith ordeined lorde ende shoulde serue stablishyng encreasyng faith onely truely performe office inwarde schoolemaister spirite come whoes onely power bothe harte pearced affection moued entrie sette open sacramentes oure soules absente sacramentes myndes either brightnesse sunne shoulde shine vppon
