blynde eies voice sounde deafe eares therfore make diuision betwene spirite sacramentes power working remaine spirite sacramentes left ministration yea voide triflyng without workyng spirite muche effectualnesse inwardly woorketh putteth foorth force nowe plaine sorte accordyng sentence godly mynde confirmed faith sacramentes say euen eies see brightnesse sunne eares heare sounde voice whiche neither eies whitte perceiue light vnlesse sight selues might naturally enlightened eares vaine knocked crieng whatsoeuer vnlesse wer naturally made fitt heare true whiche ought one determined among v sight worketh eies seyng light hearyng worketh eares perceiuyng voice worke holy ghost harte bothe conceiuyng susteinyng cherishing stablishing faith bothe thynges likewise folowe sacramentes nothyng profite without power holy ghoste nothyng withstandeth harte alredy taught scholemaister may make faith bothe stronger encreased difference power hearyng seyng naturally set eares eye christ beside measure nature doth speciall grace worke myndes wherby obiections also comber men dissolued ascribe creature either encrease confirmation faith wrong done spirite god ought acknowlege onely author therof neither doo meane tyme take hym praise either confirming encreasyng rather affirme yt euen encreseth confirmeth faith nothing el inward enlightning prepare myndes receiue confirming set foorth sacrament yet darkly spoke shalbe made clereby similitude bryng thou purpose woordes persuade man thyng thou wilt search reason wherby may drawen thy opinion may maner subdued obey thy counsel thou haste hetherto nothyng preuailed vnlesse likewise haue pearcyng sharpe iudgement whereby may wey pitth thy reason vnlesse also haue tractable witt ready harken teachyng finally vnlesse haue conceiued opinion thy faithfulnesse wisedome may like certaine foreiudgemet cause subscribe many stubborne head man neuer bowe reason also credite suspected authoritie despised little good done euen willyng learne syde lett thynges present wyll truely bryng passe hearer whome thou geuest counsel obey selfe counsel otherwise wold haue laughed scorne woorke also spirite woorketh v least worde beate eares vayne least sacramentes shoulde stryke oure eye vayne sheweth v god speaketh therin softeneth stubbornesse oure harte frameth obedience due word lorde finally conueyeth outward woordes sacramentes eares soule therfore worde sacrament confirme faith set eies good wil heuenly father toward v knowlege whole stedfastnesse faith standeth fast strengthe encreaseth spirite confirmeth engrauing confirmation myndes maketh effectual meane tyme father lightes forbidden enlightneth bodily ei beames sunne may enlighten myndes sacramentes brightnesse set meane betwene whiche propretie lorde taught outewarde wordemat xiiiiiii luc viii xv parable called sede sede fall vpon desert vntilled pece grounde nothyng die throwen vpon arable lande well manured tylled wyll bryng foorth fruite good encrease word god light vpon stiffe necke growe barrein whiche sowen vpon sande light vpon soule manured hande heauenly spirite moste fruitefull like reason sede worde say sede corne bothe springeth encreaseth groweth vp ripenesse may say faith taketh worde god bothe begynnyng encrease perfection paule well expresseth thyngs sundry place goeth put corynthians remembrance howe effectually god vsed trauailei cor iiiiii cor iiivi glorieth hath ministerie spirite though power holy ghost wer vnseperable knot ioyned preachyng enlighten thoroughly moue mynde place myndeth admonishe themi cor iiivi force worde god self preached man compareth minister themselues husbandemen haue bestowed labor trauaile tillyng earth haue shold tillyng sowing wateryng profit vnlesse whiche sowen receiue liuetynesse heauenly benefite therfore concludeth bothe planteth watereth nothyng thynges ascribed god whiche alone geueth encrease therefore apostle preachyng vtter power spirite farre god vseth instrumentes ordeined hymselfe settyng foorth spirituall grace yet must kepe still distinction remembre man able hymselfe propre god sacramentes confirmation faith many tymes lorde meaneth take away confidence thynges hym promysed sacramentes taketh away sacramentes themseluesgenes xxxiii spoyleth thrusteth away adam gifte immortalitie sayth let eate fruite lyfe least lyue euer sayth coulde fruite restore adam vncorruption nowe fallen one said least enioy vaine confidece kepe still signe promise let bee shaken awaye hym whiche myght bryng hym hope immortalitie maner apostle exhorteth ephesian remebre forein gestes testamentesephe iixii stranger felowship israell without god without christ saith partaker circumcision whereby doth figure transnomination signifie excluded promise self receiued signe promise obiection glorie god conueyed creature whome muche power ascribed therby farre diminished haue redynesse answere set power creature onely say god vseth meanes instrumentes whiche hymselfe seeth expedient thynges may serue glorie forasmuch lorde iudge therfore bread nourishementes feedeth body sunne enlightneth world fire warmeth yet neither bread sunne fyre thing farre instrumentes dothe distribute blessynges vnto v spiritually nourisheth faith sacramentes whose onely office sett promise eies loked vpon yea pledge vnto v duetie fasten none affiance creature liberalitie bountifulnesse god ordeined v ministerie wherof geueth v giftes haue admiration praise cause good neither ought confidence sticke fast sacramentes glorie god remoued vnto leauyng thynges faith confession ought rise vp author bothe sacramentes thyngs wheras bring argument name sacrament nothyng strong sacrament saye whereas hath among allowed author many signification yet hath one agreeth signes wherby signifieth solemne othe whych soldior maketh capitaine entreth profession soldior othe warfare newe soldiors bynde faith capitain professe soldiors signes professe christ capitaine testifie serue vnder banner adde similitude make therby mater playne gowne made ye romains seuerally knowen fro grekes dyd weare clokes ye degree men rome discerned seueral signes ye degree senator degree knightes purple cote piked shooes againe knyghte comoner ryng beare signes may make v seuerally knowen prophane men thynges aboue said euident enough olde writer whyche gaue signes name sacramentes hadde regarde howe woorde vsed among latine writer theyr owne purpose fayned newe signification wherby signified onely holy signes wee searche mater depely maye seme haue relation applied woorde suche signification wherewith haue remoued name faith sense wherin nowe vsed wheras faith truthe performyng promise yet haue called faith assurednesse sure persuasion whiche truth selfe likewise wheras sacrament ye soldiors part wherby voweth hymselfe capitayne haue made capitaynes parte whereby receyueth soldiors roomes seruice sacramente lorde doothe promise oure god shall bee people passe ouer suche suttleties forasmuche thynke haue proued argumentes playne enoughe hadde respecte nothyng ell signifie signes holye spirituall thynges receyue deede similitude whyche bryng outwarde token allowe whyche last poynte sacramentes set fo chiefe yea onely thyng fyrste poynte serue faith god later poynt testifie confession men accordyng later consideration similitude haue place meane tyme lette first point remaine otherwise haue already proued mystery colde vnlesse helpes faith addition doctrine ordeined vse ende agayne must warned men doo weaken force vtterly ouerthrowe vse sacramentes contrarie syde faine sacramentes wote note secrete vertues whiche red putt god error simple vnskilfull dangerously deceiued bothe taught seke giftes god bee founde little little drawen away god embrace mere vanitie stede veritie sophisticall schooles haue taught great consent sacramentes new law say nowe vse christian chirch iustifie geue grace laie stoppe deadly sinne expressed howe pernicious pestilent opinion muche many age heretofore great losse chirch hath preuailed great part world truely vtterly deuelishe promiseth righteousnesse without faith driueth soules hedlong destruction fetcheth cause righteousnesse sacramentes byndeth miserable myndes men already owne accorde muche bendyng earth superstition rather reste sighte bodily thyng god himselfe two thyngs wold god proued experience little nede long proofe sacrament taken without faith moste certaine destruction chirch wheras nothyng loked therof without promise promise dothe lesse threaten wrathe vnfaithfull offreth grace faithfull deceyued thinketh geuen sacrament beyng offred word god receiueth faith wherupon thyng also gathered affiance saluation hangeth vpon partakyng sacrament though iustification consisted therin knowe reposed christ onely comunicated vnto v lesse preachyng gospell sealyng sacramente withoute wholly stande lib iiii de qu st ver sta lib v de bap co tra dona ca xxiiii true augustine also writeth inuisible sanctification may without visible signe agayn visible signe may without true sanctification also writeth place men put christ somtyme vntill receyuyng sacrament sometyme euen vntil sanctification life firste poynt may comon good euill propre good godly herupon cometh distinction well vnderstanded whiche augustine hath often noted betwene sacrament thyng sacrament signifieth figure truthe conteined doo hang together may seuered eue conioyning thyng muste alwaye discerned signe geue one belongeth speaketh seperation writeth sacramentes worke elect figure de bapt paruu psal lxxvii agayne writeth thus iewes sacramentes common gra common power sacramentes also washing regeneration common grace selfe whereby membres christ regenerate hed common agayne place supper lord ioha homel xxvii also daye receyue visible meate sacrament one thyng power sacramente thyng many receiue altar dye receyuyng die lordes morsell poyson iudas receiued euell thing beyng euell receiued good thyng euelly little sacramet thyng vnitie body blood christe somewhere prepared lordes table dayly somewhere certaine distance dayes therof receyued vnto life vnto destruction thyng selfe wherof sacrament receiued vnto life vnto destruction tomo whosoeuer partaker little sayd shall dye whych eateth perteineth power sacrament ye visible sacramet eateth within without whiche eateth hart presseth toothe thus heare euery sacrament seuered owne truthe vnworthinesse receiuer remaineth nothing vaine vnprofitable figure thou mayst haue signe voide truth thyng signe thou muste conceyue faith woorde enclosed muche thou shalt sacrament profite communicatyng christ muche profyte shalte thou take somewhat darke shortenesse sette mo wordes say christ mater thou wilte substance sacramentes forasmuche hym haue perfectnesse promise nothyng without hym muche lesse tolerable error peter lombard doth expresly make cause righteousnesse saluation lib sent dist wherof part therfore biddyng cause farwell whiche man witt dothe faine selfe ought stay one cause therfore muche ministerie holpen nourishyng confirmyng encreasyng true knowlege christ v possessyng hym fully enioyeng richesse muche effectualnesse haue v true faith receiue offred wicked wilte thou saye bryng passe vnthankfulnesse ordinance god voide turne nothyng answer haue said take though force truthe sacrament dyd hang vppon state hym receiueth whiche god hath ordeyned remaineth stedfast kepeth still nature howsoeuer men doo varie sith one thyng offre receiue nothyng withstandeth signe halowed worde god may dede called kepe owne force yet come thereby profite euell doer wicked man augustine dothe fewe woordes well assoyle question homi iohan xxvi saythe thou receauest carnally ceasseth spirituall thee augustine hath aforesayde place shewed sacramet thyng nothyng worth seuered fro truth therof place geueth warnyng euen conioynyng nedeth distinction least sticke much outward signe sayth folowe letter lib iii de doctri christi cap ix take signes stede thinges point seruile weakenesse expounde signes vnprofitably poynte euell wandryng error nameth twoo faultes whyche auoyded one take signes thoughe geuen vayne abacyng diminyshyng theyr secrete signification oure enuiousnesse bryng passe bryng v profite raisyng myndes beyonde visible signe geue awaye sacramente praise good thynges whiche geuen v christe onely holy ghoste whyche maketh v partaker christe hymselfe dede helpe outwarde signes whiche allure v christe bee wrested waye whole profyte vnworthyly ouerthrowen wherfore let remaine certaine office sacramentes worde god whiche offer set foorth christ vnto v hym treasure heauenly grace auayle profite nothyng beeyng receiued faith euen wyne oyle liquor though poure largely yet runne beside perishe vnlesse vessel mouth open receiue vessell though wette rounde outsyde shall neuerthelesse remayne emptie voide within beside must beware least thynges whiche haue ben written olde writer somewhat gloriously amplifie dignitie sacramentes shold leade v away error nere namely shold thinke secret power knitt fastened sacramentes maye themselues geue v grace holye ghost like wyne geuen cup wheras office appointed god testifie stablish v good wil god towarde v profite vnlesse ye holy ghost ioyne himselfe may open myndes harte make v partaker testimonie wherin also clerely appere diuers seueral grace god sacrament haue aboue touched thing v god messangers ioyfull thynges earnestes stablishyng bargaines themselues geue grace tell shewe v earnestes token doo ratifie vnto v thynges geuen v liberalitie god holy ghost sacramentes common without difference bring al men lord peculiarly geueth bringeth grace god geueth sacramentes place v whiche maketh bryng forth fruite although denie god hymselfe present power spirite present owne institution least ministration hath ordeined sacrament shold fruitlesse vaine yet affirme inward grace spirite seuered outwarde ministerie ought seuerally weyed considered god therfore truely performeth dede soeuer promiseth figureth signes neither signes want effect author may proued true faithfull question whether god worketh inwarde power call resigne office outward signes affirme whatsoeuer instrument vse original workyng nothyng hindered therby taught concernyng sacramentes bothe dignitie honorably sett vse plainely shewed profitablenesse abundantly reported best meane thynges reteined neither thyng geuen ought agayn thyng taken conuenient taken mean time fained deuise taken away wherby cause iustification power holy ghost enclosed elementes vessel waggon principall force whiche hath ben omitted expresly sett also noted god inwardly worketh minister figureth testifieth outwarde doyng least drawen mortall man god claimeth alone thyng also doth augustine wisely touche saith doth bothe moses sanctifie questio vet testa lib iii ca lxxxiiii god moses god moses visible sacramentes ministerie god inuisible grace holy spirite also whole frute visible sacrament without sanctification inuisible grace visible sacramentes profite name sacramente haue hetherto entreated nature doth generally conteyne signes euer god gaue men certifie assure truthe promise somtime willed remaine naturall thyngs sometyme deliuered miracle first kynd example gaue adam eue tree life earneste immortalitie myght assure themselues itgens iixvii iiiiii gene ixxiii long dyd eate frute therof set heauenly boaw monument noe posteritie wold thensefoorth destroye earth ouerflowyng water adam noe sacramentes tree geue immortalitie could geue selfe boaw strikyng back sunbeame vpon cloudes force hold water marke grauen word god example seales testament tree tree boaw boawe written vppon word god newe forme put begyn man thinke thynges spoken without cause boawe self day also witnesse couenant god made noe whiche boaw ofte beholde reade promise god written earthe shall neuer destroyed ouerflowyng water therfore fonde philosopher scorne simplicitie faith affirme suche varietie color doth naturally arise reflected beames cloude set let v graunte dede let v laugh scorne senslesse follie doeth acknowlege god lorde gouernor nature whiche hys ewne vseth elementes seruice owne glory emprinted token sunne ye sterres earth stone suche like haue sacramentes v vncoyned coyned siluer one value sith one metall euen one hath nothing nature stryken common marke made money receiueth newe valuation shall god able marke creature hys worde may made sacramentes whiche naked elementesgene willed ordinarie chirch nourishe worshipper seruantes one faith confession one faith lib ix contra faust manich cap vse wordes augustine men congeled together name religion either true false vnlesse bounde together felowship visible signes sacramentes sithe therefore moste good father foresawe thys necessitie beginning ordeine certayne exercise godlinesse seruantes whiche afterwarde satan turning wicked superstitious worshippinges hath many wayes depraued corrupted hereupon came solemne profession gentile holy order bastarde vsages although full error superstition yet also therewith profe men could profession religion without suche outwarde signes neyther grounded vppon worde god referred trueth whereunto signes oughte directed vnworthy rehearsed mention made holy signes whiche ordeined god haue swarued fundation helpes true godlinesse consist bare signes boaw tree vpon ceremony rather signes geuen ceremony aboue sayd ye lordes behalfe testimony grace saluatio againe behalfe markes profession openly sweare name god partes bynding faith vnto therefore chrysostome one place fittly calleth couenatinges wherby god byndeth hymselfe league v bounde purenesse holinesse life made mutuall forme couenanting betwene god v lorde therin promiseth cancell blot whatsoeuer giltinesse penaltie haue gathered offending doth reconcile v himselfe begotten sonne againe behalfes thys profession bynde oure selues vnto hym folowing godlinesse innocence man may rightly say sacrametes ceremony god wil exercise people first nourishing stirring vp stregthening faith inwardly testifieng religion men euen sacramentes also diuerse diuerse order tyme according distribution whereby pleased lorde shewe hymselfe thys manner men abraham posteritie circumcision commaunded wherunto afterwarde purifiengesge xviix leuit mathe xxviiixix xxvixxvi sacrifice ceremony added law moses sacramentes iewes vntil comming christ comming abrogate twoo sacramentes ordeined whiche nowe christian chirch vseth baptisme supper lord speake ordeined vse whole chirch layeng handes whereby minister chirch entred office vnwillingly suffer called sacrament doe recken among ordinarie sacramentes rest commonly called sacramentes accompted shal se howbeit olde sacramentes also respect marke wherunto doe tende directe maner leade hande christ rather image represent hym shewe hym fourth knowe wheras haue alredy taught1 cor ixx certayne seales wherwith promise god sealed certaine neuer offred promise god men christ may teache v promyse god must nedes shewe christ wherunto perteineth heauenly paterne tabernacle worshipping law geuen moses ye mount one differece shadowe christe promised yet loked doe testifie alredy geuen deliuered thinges shall particularly eche one seuerally declared shalbe made much playner circumcision iewes signe whereby putt mynde whatsoeuer commeth sede man saye whole nature man corrupte hath nede proyning moreouer teachinggen xxiixxviii token remembrance whereby confirme themselues promyse geuen abraham concerning blessed sede whome nation earth blessed whome owne blessing looked nowe healthfull sede taughte paule chirstgala iiixvi ro iiiixi whome alone hoped shoulde recouer whiche loste adam wherefore circumcision thyng whiche paule sayth abraham namely seale righteousnesse fayth saye seale whereby shoulde certainly assured fayth wherewith loked sede shoulde accompted god righteousnesse shall vppon better occasion place gooe throughe comparison circumcision baptisme baptisinges purifienges sette eies owne vncleannesse filthiness pollution wherwith defiled owne natureheb ixi promised washing wherby al filthiness wiped washed awayi ioh ivii reue v washing christ whoes blood beeing washed bryng hys cleannesse sight god maye hyde defilinges sacrifice accuse owne wickednesse therewithall teache necessarie shoulde satisfaction whiche shoulde payed iugement god therefore shoulde one chefe bishop mediator betwene god menheb iiii xiiii v v ix phili ii viii rom vxix satisfie god sheding blood offring sacrifice whiche suffice forgeuenesse synnes chefe prest christ himselfe shed hys owne blood himselfe sacrifice offred himselfe obediente hys father vnto death obedience toke awaye disobedience man whiche prouoked displeasure god oure sacramentes doe muche clerely presente christe vnto v nerely shewed menne sin hath ben truely deliuered father ben promised baptisme doth testifie vnto v cleansed washed supper thankesgeuing testifieth redemed water figured washing blood satisfaction twoo thinges founde christ whiche iohn sayth came water bloodi iohn v xi say mighte cleanse redeme whiche thing spirite god also witnesse yea three witness one water blood spirite water blood haue testimonie cleansing redeming spirite principall witnesse bryngeth vnto v assured credit suche wytnessing hie mysterie hath notably well ben shewed v crosse christioh xixx xiii homil iohn xx water blood slowed oute holy side whiche side cause gather many place specially vii chapter iohn whiche sense must take sayeng paulecolos iixvii vnder lawe shadowes chirst body neither meaning spoyle effecte testimony grace whiche god olde tyme proue hymselfe father true speaker euen thys day doth v baptisme holy supper onely purpose waye comparison magnifie whiche geuen v least shoulde thynke maruaylous ceremony lawe abolished comming christ schole doctrine may also brefely touche thys waye vtterly hissed wherby noted greate difference betwene sacramentes olde newe lawe thoughe nothing shadowe grace god presently geue apostle speaketh lesse honorably teacheth father eate spirituall meate eate xiii expoundeth meate christ dare make empty signe whiche deliuered iewes true communion christe grounde cause apostle handleth doth plainly fight oure side man trusting vpon colde knowlege christe emptie title christianitie outwarde token shoulde presume despise iugemente god sheweth fourth example god seueritie seen iewes shoulde knowe peynes whiche haue suffred hang ouer v folowe faultes nowe comparison mighte fitt behoued shoulde shewe vnegalnesse betwene v good thinges wherof die forbidde v boste falslye therefore firste maketh v egall sacramentes leaueth v muche smal pece prerogatiue might encourage v hope escaping vnpunished neither verily lawfull geue baptisme iiiixi tha place geueth circumcision calleth seale righteousnesse fayth whatsoeuer therefore day geuen v sacramentes thyng iewes olde tyme receiued say christ spirituall richesse power sacramentes haue also felte saye seales god good towarde hope eternall saluation ben apt expositor epistle hebrues would haue ben blynded red therehe xxi sinnes cleansed ceremony law yea olde shadowes auayling force righteousnesse neglecting comparison handeled toke holde one thing lawe selfe nothing profited folowers though simply ye figure voide truth apostle meaning bring ceremonial law nothing vntill come christ vpon alone hangeth al effectualnesse obiecte thinges whiche red paul concerning circumcision letter estimation wt god geueth nothing vaine suche sayenges seme presse farr benethe baptisme might rightfully sayd baptisme yea also sayd firste paule hym selfei gor x v sheweth god regardeth outwarde washing wherby enter profession religion vnlesse minde within cleansed continue cleannesse ende againe peter testifieth trueth baptisme standeth outwarde washingi pet iiixxi col iixi good witnessing conscience semeth also place vtterly despise circumcision made hande compareth circumcision christe aunswere euen place nothyng abated dignitie paule isputeth whiche required necessarie nowe abrogate therfore warneth faythfull leauing olde shadowes stande fast truth maisters sayth instantly call vpon body may circumcised ye spiritually circumcised according ye soule body ye haue therefore deliuerance thing dede much better tha shadow man might take exceptio ye contrary say yt figure therfore despised ye thing dede forasmuch yt putting old man spake also amog ye father yet outwarde circumcision ben superfluous preuenteth obiectio whe addeth yt colossian buried wt christ baptisme wherby signifieth yt day baptisme ye christias circucisio ye olde people therfore circucisio enioined christian wtout wrog done christ foloweth eue alleged harder assoyle iewishe ceremony shadowes thinges come christ body hard yt whiche entreated many chapter epistle hebrues yt blood beastes atteined conscience law shadowe good thinges come image thinges folowers obteined perfection ceremony moses goe backe haue alredy touched yt paule doth therefore make ceremony shadowish sounde thing fulfilling certayne maner hanged suspense vntil deliuering christ agayne say yt thys vnderstanded effectualnesse rather manner signifieng till christ manifestly shewed fleshe al signes shadow hym absent howsoeuer inwardly vtter faithfull ye presence hys power hymselfe thys ought chefely marke yt al place paule doth speake simply way cotention striued false apostle would haue godlinesse cosist ceremony wtout respect christ cofute sufficed entreate value ceremony theselues marke also author ye epistle ye hebrues folowed let v therfore remeber yt disputed ceremony take owne natural signification wrested false wrongful expositio lawful vse abuse superstition maruel therfore ceremony seuered fro christe vnclothed al force al sygnes whatsoeuer brought nought thyng signified take away whe christ wt thought manna nothing ell meate bellyiohn vixxvii applieth hys speche grosse opinion sayth yt ministreth better meate may fede soules hope immortalitie require plainer solution summe tendeth first al furniture ceremony law moses vanishing thing value vnlesse directed christe secondly respecte christe length manifestly shewed fleshe theyr fulfilling finally behoued shoulde taken awaye hys comming euen shadowe vanisheth away clere lyght sunne doe yet differre longer discourse yt mater vnto place haue purposed compare baptisme circumcision therfore sparingly touche parhaps also immeasurable praise sacramentes red ye old writer cocerning signes deceiued miserable sophisters augustine ye sacramentes ye old law promise ye sauior proem enarr p lxxiii quest super numer cap xxxiii libro ca xiiii doe geue saluatio whe marked yt formes speaking spoken also published excessiue doctrine cleane contrarie sense fro writing olde father augustine meant thing place ye augustine writeth place sacramentes law moses foretell christ oures tel present faustus promise thinges fulfilled token thinges fulfilled say figured loked doe shewe hym present hath ben already deliuered moreouer speaketh manner signifying also sheweth place lib co lit petil capitu xxxvii homil iohn xxvl law sayth prophetes sacramentes foretelling thing come sacramentes tyme doe testifie already come declare come thought thing effectuallnesse expoundeth many place sayeth sacramentes iewes signes diuerse ye thing signified egal diuerse visible forme egall spiritual power againe diuerse signes one fayth diuerse signes diuerse woordes wordes change soundes tymes truly wordes nothing signes father drinke spirituall drinke dronke bodily drinke se ye therfore faith remayning one signes varied rocke christ v christ set vpon altar dronke great sacrament water flowing rocke drynke faithfull know thou consider visible forme dronke thyng vnderstable signification dronke spirituall drinke place mysterie meate drynke psal lxxvii lib ix con fau cap xiii signification forme selfe christ figured rocke shewed v flesh howbeit behalfe also graunt difference sacramentes doe testifie fatherly good wyl god ye grace holy ghost offered v christ sacramentes testifie clerely brightly deliuering christ plenteous fuller namely difference olde new testamet beareth haue entreated de doct christ lib epi ad na augustine meant often allege best faithfullest witnesse al old writer teacheth christ reueled sacramentes ordeined number fewer signification hier force excellente thing also expediente reders brefely warned whatsoeuer sophisters haue triflingly taught cocerning worke wrought false disagreeth wt nature sacrametes god hath ordeined yt faithful voide nedy al good thing bring nothing thether beggerie whereupon foloweth receiuing men nothing wherby may deserue praise whiche theyr respecte merely passiue worke ascribed vnto pthe xv chapter baptisme baptisme signe entring wherwith ar receiued felowship ye chirch graffed christ may reckned among childre god geuen v god ende haue taught common al mystery first serue fayth hym confession men wil orderly declare maner purpose baptisme bringeth three thinges fayth also must seuerally entreated first lord setteth vnto v token profe cleansing expresse mynde better lyke certaine sealed charter wherby confirmeth vnto v al synnes defased cancelled blotted may neuer come sight rehearsed imputed willeth yt al yt beleue baptised forgeuenesse synnes therfore thought baptisme nothing ell marke token wherby professe religion men soldiars beare conufance capitaine marke profession wey chefe thing baptisme yt shoulde receiue promisemar xvixvi whosoeuer beleue baptised shalbe saued sense vnderstode paule writeth chirch sanctified christ spouseephe vxxvi tit iiiv pet jijxxii cleansed washing water worde lyfe place saued according mercy washing regeneration renewing holy ghost peter writeth baptisme saueth v paules signifie washing saluation perfectly made water water conteyneth self power cleanse regenerate renew neither peter meane cause saluation ye knowlege certaintie giftes receiued sacrament euidently enough expressed wordes themselues paul knitteth together word lyfe baptisme water sayd yt ye gospel message washing sanctifieng brought v yt baptisme message sealed peter immediatly adioyneth yt baptisme putting away ye filthinesse flesh good coscience god fayth yea baptisme promiseth v cleansing sprinkling blood christ figured water ye lykenesse cleansing washing therefore say yt cleansed thys water certainly testifieth blood christ oure true onely washing fro ell fetched surer reason confute blinde error referr al thinges ye power water tha signification baptisme selfe doth withdraw v wel visible element set oure eies meanes may bynde mindes christ alone neither thought baptisme applied time past new fallinges whiche fall backe baptisme must seke new remedy clensing wote sacramentes thoughe force baptisme worne vse error came passe old time would baptised vttermost peril life laste gaspinges might obteine pardon whole life whiche waywarde suttle prouision olde bishop oft inuey writinges thus ought thinke time soeuer baptised one washed cleansed al life therfore ofte fal must goe backe remembrance baptisme therewith must arme minde may alway certaine assured ye forgeuenesse sinnes though one ministred semeth past yet later sinnes abolished ye cleannesse christ therin offred v alway florisheth oppressed spottes ouerwhelmeth wypeth away al filthinesse yet oughte take therof libertie sinne tyme come verily hereby armed boldnesse doctrine geuen onely haue sinned doe grone weryed oppressed vnder sinnes may haue wherwith thei may raise vp comfort themselues least fal confusion desperatio paule saythrom iiixxv christ made v propitiator vnto ye forgeuenesse faultes going wherin denieth therin obteined perpetual continual forgeuenesse sinnes eue vnto death meaneth geue father onely poore synners wounded searing iron conscience sighe phisitian mercy god offred whiche escaping punishment hunt mater libertie sinne dooe nothing prouoke themselues wrath iugement god knowe dede commonly thought otherwise benefite repentance keyes baptisme obteine forgeuenesse first regeneration geuen v baptisme deuise erre herin remember power keyes wherof speake doth hang vpon baptisme ought wise seuered sinner receiueth forgeuenesse ministerie chirch namely without preaching gospell maner preaching cleansed sinnes blood christ signe testimonie washing baptisme se therfore absolution referred baptisme error hath bredde v fayned sacrament penance haue touched somwhat residue wil make ende place fit maruell men according grossenesse witt immeasurably fast tyed outwarde thynges haue behalfe also bewrayed faulte contented pure institution god thrust newe helpes fayned themselues thoughe baptisme selfe sacrament repentance repentance commended v whole life force also baptisme ought extended boundes wherfore also doute godly throughout life long oft vexed knowlege conscience owne sinnes dare calle backe themselues remebrance baptisme yt therby may confirme themselues affiance onely continuall washing haue blood christ bringeth also fruit sheweth v mortificatio christrom viiii new life hym apostle saith baptised death beyng buried together hym death may walke newnesse life whiche wordes doth exhort v folowyng hym though saye baptisme put mynde certaine example deathe christ die lustes example resurrection shold raised vp righteousnesse fetcheth mater muche deper say baptisme christ hath made v partaker death may graffed graffe receiueth substace nourishmet roote graffed receiue baptisme faith thei ought truly fele effectualnesse death christ mortifiyng flesh therwithall also fele effect resurrection quicknyng spirite herupon gathereth mater exhortation christian ought dead sinne lyue righteousnesse selfe argument vseth placecoloss iixii tit iiiv circumcised haue put olde man sin bee buried christ baptisme sense place haue alleged called washyng regeneration renewing therfore first free forgeuenesse sinnes imputation righteousnesse promised v grace holy ghoste whiche may reforme v newnesse life last faith receiueth also profite baptisme certainly testifieth vnto v graffed death life christmath iiixiii vnited christ hymselfe partaker good thynges therfore hath dedicated halowed baptisme owne body might haue comon vsgala iiixvii strong bonde vnitie felowshyp vouchsaued entre v paul proueth therby child god haue put christ baptisme see fulfillyng baptisme christacts viiixvi xixv whome also reason call propre obiect baptisme therfore meruaile reported apostle baptised name yet wer commaunded baptise name father also holy ghost whatsoeuer giftes god set foorth baptisme founde christ alone yet whiche baptiseth christmathe xxviiixix therwithall call vppon name father holy ghost therfore cleansed blood merciful father accordyng incomparable kyndnesse willing receiue v fauor hath set mediator middest procure v fauor regeneration obteyne death resurrection beyng sanctified spirite endued new spirituall nature wherfore cleansyng regeneration obteine certaine maner distinctly perceiue cause fathermath iiivi luc iiixvi iohn iiixxiii iiii mater sonne effect holy ghost iohn first baptised afterwarde apostle baptisme repentance forgeuenesse sinnes meanyng worde repentance suche regeneration forgeuenesse sinnes washyng whereby also made moste certaine ministerie iohn altogether afterwarde committed apostlesacts iixxviii diuers handes wherewith ministred make baptisme diuers doctrine sheweth baptisme iohn apostle agreed one doctrine bothe baptised repentance bothe forgeuenesse sinnes bothe name christe whome bothe repentance forgeuenesse sinnesiohn ixxix iohn saied lambe god whome sinnes worlde shoulde taken away made sacrifice acceptable father propitiator righteousnesse author saluation coulde apostle adde confession wherfore let trouble man olde writer labor seuer one whoes voice oughte muche esteme may shake certaintie scripture rather harke chrysostome denyeng forgeuenesse sinnes comprehended baptisme iohn homil mathe xiiii luke iiiiii lib v de baptis cont nat ca x luke iii xvi act xixiiii luke contrarywyse affirming iohn preached baptisme repentance forgeuenesse sinnes neither suttletie augustine receyued baptisme iohn sinnes forgeuen hope baptisme christ forgeuen dede euangelist plainly testifieth iohn baptisme promised forgeuenesse sinnes nede abate title commendation necessitie compelleth v vnto man seke difference worde god shall fynd none iohn baptised hym come apostle hym already presented himselfe abundant grace spirite poured sin resurrection christ maketh nothyng stablishe diuersitie baptismes baptisme apostle ministred yet conuersant earth called yet larger plentifulnesse spirite baptisme iohn yea eue ascesionact viiixiiii spirit geuen samaritan aboue common measure faithfull ascension althoughe baptised name iesus till peter iohn wer sent vnto lay theyr hand vpon thyng think deceiued old writer said baptisme iohn preparation baptisme christ red baptised againe paul one receiued baptisme iohn howe muche herein deceiued shall ell plainely declared place fitte itmath iiixi therfore iohn said baptised dede water christ come whiche baptise holy ghoste fyre maye fewe wordes assoiled meant put difference betwene one baptisme compared person person christ saiyng himselfe minister water christ geuer holy ghost declare power visible miracle day sende holy ghostact iiiii apostle vnder fyry tonges coulde apostle boast could also baptise day onely minister outwarde signe christ author inward grace olde writer theselues euery teach specially augustine whose principal stay agaynst donatistes one soeuer baptizeth yet christ ruler thynges haue spoken bothe mortification washyngi cori xii exo xiiii xxi shadowed people israell cause apostle sayth haue ben baptised cloude sea mortifiyng figured lorde deliueryng oute hande pharao cruell bondage made waye thorough redde sea drowned pharao hymselfe egyptias enemy folowed hard backes euen neckes ouertake maner also promiseth v baptisme signe geuen sheweth v power brought foorth deliuered thraldome egypt yt say bondage sinne pharao drowned saye deuell although euen also ceasseth exercise weary v egyptian throwen downe bottome sea beyng ouerthrowen shore yet terrible syght make israelite afrayde coulde hurte enemie yet dede threateneth sheweth weapon felt ouercome cloude signe cleansyng lorde couered cloude cast ouer gaue refreshyng coldenum ix xiiii least faint pine away cruell burning sunne baptisme acknowlege selues couered defended blood christ least seueritie god dede intollerable flame shoulde lie vpon v although mysterie darke knowen yet none way obteyne saluation two grace god wold take away signe old father adopted heires clere false haue lately taught wherin yet continue baptisme loosed deliuered originall sinne corruption adam spread abrode whole posteritie restored righteousnesse purenesse nature adam haue obteined stand fast vprightnesse wherein first created suche kynde teacher neuer vnderstode originall sinne originall righteousnesse grace baptisme haue alredy proued original sinne peruersenesse corruption nature whiche firste maketh v giltie wrath godgalat iixix also bryngeth forth workes v whiche scripture calleth woorkes fleshe therefore two poyntes seuerally marked namely partes nature defiled corrupted already suche corruption holde worthily condemned conuicted god nothyng acceptable righteousnesse innocence clennesse yea infantes themselues bryng owne damnation mother wombe although haue yet brought foorth fruites iniquitie yet haue sede therof enclosed within yea whole nature certaine sede sinne therfore hatefull abhominable god faithfull certified baptisme damnation taken away driuen forasmuch haue allready said lord doth signe promise v ful perfect forgeuenesse grau ted bothe fault whiche haue ben imputed v peine whiche haue suffred faulte take holde also righteousnesse suche people god may obteyne life say imputation onely lorde owne mercy taketh righteous innocent poynte peruersnesse neuer ceasseth v continually bryngeth foorth newe fruites namely workes fleshe haue described none otherwise burning fornace continually bloweth flame sparcles spring infinitely casteth water lust neuer vtterly dieth quenched men vntill death deliuered body death haue vtterly put themselues baptisme dede promiseth v pharao drowned mortification sinne yet may trouble v may ouercome v long lyue enclosed within pryson bodye remnantes synne shall dwell v holde fast faith promyse geuen v god baptisme shal beare rule reigne let man deceiue himselfe let man flatter hymselfe owne euell heareth synne alwaye dwelleth v thynges spoken ende shoulde carelesly slepe vpon sinnes otherwise much enclined sinne onely faint discouraged tickled pricked fleshe let rather thynke ar yet way let beleue haue much profited feele dayely somewhat minished theyr luste tyll haue atteined thether whether trauayle namely last deathe fleshe shalbe ended dyeng mortall lyfe meane tyme let cesse striue valiantly encourage goe forwarde stirre vp full victorie also oughte whett endeuors see haue long trauailed haue yet small businesse remainyng ought hold baptised mortifying fleshe begon baptisme v daily folowe shalbe made perfect whe shal remoue life ye lord saye thyng apostle paule seuenth chapter romaine moste clerely setteth oute disputed free righteousnesse wicked menne dydde thereof gather myght lyue owne luste acceptable god deseruynges workes addeth clothed righteousnesse christ therwith regenerate spirite regeneration haue earnest baptismerom vixiii hereuppon exhorteth faithfull suffer sinne haue dominion membres knewe alway weakenesse faithfull therfore discouraged adioyneth comforte vnder lawe againe might seme christian might growe insolent vnder yoke law entreateth maner abrogating therwithal vse lawe question seconde tyme differred summe deliuered rigor lawe cleaue christ office lawe conuinced peruersnesse shold confesse owne weaknesse miserie forasmuche peruersnesse nature doth easely appeare prophane man foloweth owne lustes without feare god setteth example man regenerate namely self saith therfore hath continual wrastlyng remnantes fleshe holden bounde miserable bondage consecrate wholly obedience lawe god therfore compelled gronyng crie unhappie shall delyuer body subiect deathrom viixxiiii child god holden captiue prison long lyue must nede muche carefully greued thinkyng vpon owne perill vnlesse feare mette withall therefore adioyneth vse comfort damnation christ iesu teacheth whome lorde hath one receiued fauorrom viii engraffed communion christ hath baptisme admitted felowship chirch continue faith christ although besieged sinne yea carry sinne within yet acquited giltinesse condemnation simple natural exposition paule cause seme teache new vnwonted thyng baptisme serueth confession men marke whereby openly professe wold accompted among people god wherby testifie agree christian worshippyng one god one religion finally wherby openly affirme faith onely harte shoulde breathe praise god also tong membres bodye sound suche vtterances able ought thyngs emploied seruice glorie god wherof nothyng ought voyde may example stirred vp endeuors hereunto paule respect asked corinthiansi cor iii whether ben baptized ye name christ meaning verily euen yt wer baptised name auowed themselues vnto hym swore name boud faith men coulde confesse christ alone vnlesse would forsake confession whiche made baptisme sithe declared lord regard vnto institution baptisme plaine iudge waye v vse receiue farr geuen raisyng nourishyng confirmyng faith take hande author himselfe ought holde certaine fully persuaded speaketh v signe cleseth v washeth v putteth away remebrance sinnes whiche maketh v partaker death taketh away satan kingdome febleth force lust yea groweth one v yt clothed may reckened child god thynges say doth inwardly truely certainly performe soule certainly see body outwardly washed dipped clothed either relation similitude sure rule sacramentes bodily thynges beholde spirituall thynges presently set eies forasmuch hath pleased lord represet figure suche grace bounde enclosed sacramente geuen v force therof onely lorde dothe token testifie vnto v geue v thynges neyther dothe onely fede eye naked syght bryngeth v thyng present together fulfilleth figureth hereof let cornelius capitayne example baptised hauyng receiued forgeuenesse sinnes visible grace holy ghostactes xxlviii seking baptisme larger forgeuenesse certaine exercising faith yea encreasce confidence pledge paraduenture man obiect therfore ananias say pauleact ixxvii shoulde washe away sinnes baptisme sinnes washed away power baptisme selfe answere sayd receiue obteyne gette whiche farre concerneth felyng faith geuen v lorde whether doo fyrst testifie beyng testified dothe certainlier confirme therfore onely meanyng ananias thou mayest assured paule thy sinnes forgeuen thee baptised lorde dothe baptisme promise forgeuenesse synnes receiue care howbeit mean diminishe force baptisme thyng truthe present signe farre god worketh outwarde meanes sacrament obteyne nothyng muche receiue faith want faith shalbe witnesse vnthakfulnesse wherby may declared giltie god haue beleued promise geuen farre sygne confession ought testifie affiance mercy god cleannesse forgeuenesse sinnes gotten v iesus christei cor xiixiii entre chirche christe may one consent faith charitie liue one mynde faithfull laste poynte dydde paule meane sayeth baptised one spirite may one bodye nowe true determine sacrament weyed accordyng hande whome ministred hand god whome without dout proceded herupon may gather nothing added take worthinesse hym whoes hande deliuered euen among men letter sent hand seale well knowen maketh matter maner man ye carrier ought suffice acknowe hande seale lord sacramentes carrier soeuer brought hereby error donatistes well confuted whiche measured force value sacrament worthinesse minister day catabaptistes whiche deny rightly baptised baptised wicked men idolatrers popishe kingdome therfore furiously cal vpon v baptised whoes folly shalbe armed reason strong enough thinke professed baptisme name manmath xxviiixix name father sonne holy ghost therfore baptisme man god whomsoeuer ministred althoughe neuer muche ignorant despisers god godlinesse whiche baptised v yet dyd baptise v felowshippe owne ignorance sacrilege faith iesus christe called vpon owne name name god baptised v name nowe baptisme god hath verily enclosed promise forgeuenesse sinnes mortifiyng fleshe spirituall quickning partaking christ nothing hindered iewes haue ben circumcised vncleane prestes apostataes neither signe therfore voide neded done new sufficient returne naturall beginnyng obiecte baptisme ought celebrate assemblie godly proueth whiche faultie parte destroy whole force therof teache oughte bee doone baptisme may pure voyde defilyng abolyshe ordinance god although idolatrers corrupt olde tyme circumcision corrupted many superstition yet ceassed taken signe grace neither iosias ezechias whe gathered israel departed god calle seconde circumcision nowe aske v faith hath yet folowed baptisme certayne yeares paste myghte thereby proue baptisme voyde whyche sanctified vnto v woorde promyse receyued faith question answer dede beyng blynde vnbeleuyng dyd long tyme holde faste promise geuen v baptisme yet promise selfe muche god continued alway stayed stedfast true although menne bee lyers faithbreakers yet god cesseth bee truerom iiiiii although menne loste yet christe remayneth saluation confesse therefore baptisme tyme profited v nothyng forasmuche promyse offered v without whiche baptisme nothyng laye nothyng regarded nowe sithe grace god haue begonne waxe wyser accuse owne blyndnesse hardnesse hart haue long ben vnthankfull great goodnesse beleue promise selfe vanished away rather thus consider god baptisme promiseth forgeuenesse sinnes sithe hath promised vndoutedly performe beleue promise offred v baptisme faith therfore lett v embrace hath dede long ben buried v infidelitie nowe therefore let v receiue faith wherfore lord calleth iewishe people repentance geueth commaundement seconde circumcision whyche beyng haue sayd circumcised wicked vngodly hande lyued certaine tyme entangled wickednesse earnestly calleth vppon onely turnyng harte howe soeuer couenant broken yet signe couenant ordinance lorde remayned alway stedfast inuiolable therefore onely condition repentance restored couenante whyche lord one made circumcision whyche yet beeyng receyued hande leaguebreaker preste muche laye defiled agayne effecte wherof quenched thynke shake fyery darte v allege paule rebaptised whiche one baptised baptisme iohnact xixiii owne confession baptisme iohn alltogether oures nowe euen hauyng peruersely instructed taughte true faith agayne baptised baptisme whiche without true doctrine taken nothyng ought newely baptised agayne true religion wherewith nowe firste instructed thynke somme wrongfully affectioned manne iohn whyche hadde entred theyr firste baptisme rather vayne superstition whyche thyng seeme gather coniecture hereupon confessed themselues vtterly ignorant holy ghost wheras iohn verily woulde neuer haue sente awaie hymselfe scholar vntaught neither lykely iewes althoughe ben baptised destitute knowlege holy ghost whiche famouslye spoken many testimony scripture therefore answere knowe whether holy ghoste vnderstanded sayde haue yet hearde whether grace spirite whiche paule asked geuen disciple christe graunt true baptisme iohn one selfe baptisme christ deny wer baptised agayne meane woordes baptised name iesus doo expound instructed paule true doctrine hadde rather vnderstande symply baptisme holy ghoste saye visible grace spirite geuen layeng handes whyche expressed name baptisme newe thyngact iv daye pentecoste sayde apostle remembred wordes lorde concernyng baptisme fyer spirite peter sayth came remembrance saw grace poured vpon cornelius household kinredactes xixvi neither cotrarie adioyned layd handes holy ghost came vpo luke doth tell twoo diuerse thinges foloweth maner telling commonly vsed among hebrues doe fyrste propounde summe mater set large whiche euery man may perceiue framing together woordes sayth heard thinges baptised name iesus paul layed handes vpon holy ghoste came vpon later sentence described maner baptisme ignorance corrupt former baptisme must amended seconde baptisme apostle haue ben rebaptised first al whiche whole three yeres baptisme scarcely tasted small parcel purer doctrine among v riuers might suffice renew many washinges ignorance mercy ye lord daily amended v force dignitie profit ende ye mysterie deceiued ought tyme plaine enough much concerneth ye outwarde signe would god natural institution christ preuailed much mete restraine boldenesse men though contemptible thing baptised water according precept christ inueted blessing rather enchau ting defile true hallowing water afterwarde added taper chresme blowing semed open gate baptisme although ignorante auncient beginning added packe yet lawfull bothe al godly refuse whatsoeuer thinges men haue presumed adde ordinance christ satan saw yt foolish light credit world beginninges gospel deceites easily receiued brake fourth grosser mockery hereupo spittle like trifle openly brought vnbridled libertie reproche baptisme experience let v learne yt nothing either holier better safer tha content wt authoritie christ alone much better therfore leauing stagelike pompes dasell eye simple dul mindes oft baptised presented assemblie ye faithfull offred god ye whole chirch loking witnesse praying ouer yt confession faith rehearsed wherewith catechised instructed promise shold declared conteined baptisme instructed baptised name father sonne holy ghost length sente away prayer thankesgeuing nothing omitted might make mater ceremonie proceded god author therof clerely shine ouerwhelmed wt forein filthinesse whether wholy dipped baptised yt thrise one whether sprinkled wt water onely poured vpon maketh little mater oughte libertie chirches according diuersitie contrees howbeit worde baptizing signifieth dippe certaine maner dipping vsed old chirch also perteineth purpose knowe done amisse priuate men take vpon themselues administration baptisme wel distribution supper part ecclesiasticall ministerie christ commaunde woman yet euery sort men baptize ordeined hys apostle gaue thys commaundement co maunded disciple doe ministration supper whiche seen doe executed office ryghte distributer would without dout therin followe hys example thys many age past yea maner beginning chirch hath ben receiued vse lay men might baptise peril death minister preset time se strong reason may defended olde father themselues whiche either helde suffred thys manner sure whether well done augustine semeth haue dout lib co tra epist parm ii cap xiii cap c sayth although lay man compelled necessitie doe geue baptisme tell whether man may godlily saye ought iterate done necessitie compelleth vsurping man office necessitie enforceth eyther none veniall sinne moreouer woman decreed without exception councel carthage shoulde presume baptise danger least whiche sicke shoulde die without baptisme depriued grace regeneration god pronouceth adopteth infantes owne borne promiseth wil god v sede v thys worde conteyned saluation neither shal man dare reprocheful god deny promise selfe sufficiet worke effect therof much harme doctrine euill expounded baptisme necessitie saluation hath brought fewe doe marke therfore take lesse hede themselfe thys opinion growen force lost hath happened washed wyth water state worse state olde people thoughe grace god nowe narrowly streigthened vnder law christ shalbe thought come fulfill promise abolishe forasmuch promise whiche selfe effectual enough geue health ye eighth day force without helpe signe custome augustine borne first gathered tertullian permitted woman speake chirch teache baptise offer clayme selfe execution man office muche lesse ye prestes thing epiphanius substatial witnesse reprocheth marcion lib co tra e gaue woman libertie baptise neither ignorant answere whiche thynke otherwise common vse muche differeth extraordinarie remedie extreme necessitie enforceth pronouncing yt mockerie geue woman libertie baptise excepteth nothing sufficiently appeareth condemneth thys corruption color excusable also thirde boke teaching permytted euen holy mother christ addeth restraynte example sephora vnseasonably allegedexo iiiixxv wheras angell god appeased taking stone circumcised sonne thereupon wrongfully gathered alowed god otherwyse ought sayd yt worshipping nation brought assyria raysed vp pleased god strong reason proued foolish woman dyd wrongfully drawen example imitation shold say yt certaine singular case ought made example specially yt sithe red olde tyme geuen prestes speciall commaundemente circumcise order circumcision baptisme vnlyke thys strong enough confute themmath xxviiixix wordes christ plaine goe ye teache nation baptise ordeined selfe men publisher gospell minister baptisme none apostle witnesseth doth take honor vpon himselfe chirchheb viiii ro xiiiixxiii called aaron whosoeuer without lawfull calling baptiseth rusheth man office euen smallest thinges meate drinke whatsoeuer enterprise doutefull consience paule openly cryeth synne therefore woman baptising much greuously synne euident yt breake rule appointed christ forasmuche know vnlawfull plucke sonder thinges god conioyneth al thys passe ouer would haue reders note sephoraes purpose nothing lesse doe seruice god seing sonne danger grudged murmured withoute stomachyng threwe foreskinne vppon grounde taunted husbande also angrye god fynally plaine came furiousnesse mynde murmured god husbande compelled shed blood sonne moreouer thinges behaued selfe well yet herein vnexcusable rashe presumption circumcised sonne husbande presente priuate manne moses principall prophete god whome neuer rose greater israell lawfull doe thys day woman syghte bishoppe controuersie shal easily taken away principle infantes debarred kingdome heauen whome happeneth departe present life graunted dipped water already proued small wrong done couenant god doe rest though weake selfe wheras ye effect therof hangeth neither vpon baptisme vpo additios afterward added sacrament like seale yt bringeth effectualnesse promise god thing weake self cofirmeth v wherupon foloweth child faithfull therefore baptised may first made child god stranger chirch rather therfore receiued solemne signe chirch benefite promise already belong body christ therefore omitting signe neither slouthfulnesse contempte negligence free danger therefore muche holy geue reuerence ordinance god seke sacramentes ell lorde hath lefte may haue chirch grace god bounde may obteine faith worde lorde pthe xvi chapter baptisme infantes doth well agree institution christ nature signe forasmuch age certaine phrentike spirites haue raised vp sore trouble chirch baptisme infantes doe yet cesse turmoyle choose must ioyne addition restrain furiousnesse paraduenture shal seme man much long let beseche weye himselfe yt oughte much esteme purenesse doctrine great mater together peace chirch nothing ought lothesomly receiued may auaile procure bothe beside study frame thys discourse shall smal importance clerer declaration mysterie baptisme assaile baptisme infantes argument dede fauourable shewe sayeng grounded vpon institution christ brought onely boldnesse men peruerse curiousnesse afterwarde fonde easinesse rashly receyued vse sacrament vnlesse rest vpon certaine fundation worde god hangeth thred mater well considered shall appeare lordes holy ordinance falsely vniustly charged sclaunder lett v therefore searche first beginning shall appeare deuised rashnesse men bydding farewell lett v measure true obseruation baptisme onely god shalbe proued destitute certaine authoritie must beware least pinching holy ordinance god also sclaunderous author himselfe first doctrine well enough knowen confessed among godly right consideration signes consisteth onely outward ceremony principally hangeth vpon promise vppon spirituall mystery figuring lorde ordeineth ceremony themselues therefore perfectly learne value baptisme end tendeth finally let stay thought vpon elemente bodily syghte rather let raise vp promise god therein offred v inwarde secretes whiche therein represented vnto v knoweth thinges hath atteined sound truth baptisme whole substance therof may call thereby also shalbe taught reson vse outwarde sprinkling againe contemptuously passing ouer shall haue minde wholly fastened bounde visible ceremonie shall vnderstande neither force propertie baptisme yet much thys water meaneth vse hath sentence proued many cleare testimony scripture nede thys present tarry long aboute therefore remaineth seke promise geuen baptisme force nature scripture sheweth clensing synnes obteyne blood christ first shewed mortifieng flesh standeth vpon partaking hys death faithfull regenerate newnesse life yea felowship christ summe may referred whatsoeuer taughte scripture concernyng baptisme sauing beside thys sygne testifie religion men forasmuche institution baptisme people god circumcision stede therof let v se twoo sygnes differ one lykenesse agree together whereupon may appeare relation one lorde gaue circumcision abraham keptge xviix telleth hym would god hym hys sede adding hym flowyng store suffisance thinges abraham accompt hys hande shoulde hym spryng good thinges wordes promise eternall life conteined christ expoundeth itmat xxiixxxii luke xxxxxviii eph iixii bringing argumente hense proue immortalitie faithfull resurrection god sayth god dead liuing wherfore paule also shewing ephesian destruction lord deliuered gathereth thys ben admitted couenante circumcision without christ without god without hope stranger testamentes promise whiche thinges couenante selfe conteined firste accesse god firste entrie immortall life forgeuenesse sinnes wherupon gathered forgeuenesse answereth promise baptisme concerning clensing afterwarde lorde taketh couenante abraham walke purenesse innocence hart belongeth mortifieng regeneration man shoulde doute circumcision signe mortifiengdeu xvi moses place doeth plainly declare exhorteth people israell circumcise vncircumcised skinne harte seuerally chosen people god oute nation earth goddeut xxxvi adopteth posteritie abraham people commaundeth circumcised moses pronounceth ye harte ought circumcised declaring verily trueth circumcision man endeuor towarde owne strength teacheth yt nede grace god al thynges often repeted prophetes yt nede heape place many testimony eche offer themselues proued therfore circumcision spirituall promise vttered father baptisme geuen forasmuch figured forgeuenesse sinnes mortifieng fleshe moreouer haue taught christ fundation baptisme bothe thinges remayne euidet also circumcision promised abraham hym blessing nation sealing grace signe circumcision added nowe may easily se lyke twoo signes differing promise wherupo haue declared power signes consisteth al one bothe namely fatherly fauor god forgeuenesse sinnes life euerlasting thing figured also al one namely regeneration fundation wherupon fulfilling thinges standeth al one bothe wherfore difference inwarde mysterie wherby whole force propertie sacramentes weyed vnlikenesse remaineth lyeth outwarde ceremonie smallest portion wheras chefest part hangeth vpon promise thing signified therfore may determine whatsoeuer agreeth circumcision doth also belong baptisme except difference visible ceremoniero xiiiii relation comparison apostle rule leadeth v hande wherby commaunded examine exposition scripture proportion faith truely trueth doth behalfe almost offer selfe felte circumcision certaine token iewes wherby certified chosen people householde god againe behalues professed yelded theselues god first entrie chirch also baptisme enter profession god may reckned among people mutually sweare name wherby appeareth controuersie baptisme come ye place circumcision may haue office v list search whether baptisme lawfully communicate infantes shall say doth much play foole yea dote rest onely vpon element water outwarde obseruation abide bende minde spiritual mysterie wherof consideratio shal without dout certainly appeare baptisme rightfully geuen infantes thing due vnto lord olde tyme vouchesaue admit circumcision made partaker thinges signified circumcision otherwise mere deceites haue mocked people fed deceitfull signes horrible euen heard pronounceth expresly circumcision litle infante shoulde instede seale seale promise couenant couenant remaine vnbroken stedfast doth day lesse belong child christian vnder olde testament perteined infantes iewes partaker thing signified shall debarred signe haue trueth shall put backe figure althoughe outwarde signe cleaue fast together worde sacrament plucked sonder yet seuerally considered whether pray shal esteme value truely sithe se signe serueth worde must say vnder must set inferior place sith therefore worde baptisme extended infantes shall signe say addition hanging worde debarred one reason moe abundantly enough confute speake ye contrary obiected day certainly set circumcision altogether shift graunte nowe bounde certaine dayes like iewes lorde howsoeuer certainly appointeth day yet declareth pleased infantes solemne formal vsage receiued hys couenant seke howbeit scripture openeth vnto v yet certainer knowlege truthe euident couenant lord one made abraham day lesse force christian olde time iewish people yea woorde hath lesse respecte christian respect iewes unlesse parhappes thinke christ hath comming diminished cut short grace father sayeng wt abhominable blasphemie wherfore euen child iewes wer called holy sedei cor vii xiiii beyng made heires couenant made differing child vngodly reson euen yet also child christian accompted holy yea although issue one parent faythfull apostle witnesseth differ vncleane sede idolatrers lord immediatly couenant made abraham commaunded sealed infantes outwarde sacramentgen xviixii cause christian allege day testifie seale thesame child neither let obiecte lorde commaunded hys couenante confirmed signe circumcision long agoe taken away haue redinesse answere tyme olde testamente ordeined circumcision confirme couenant circumcision taken away yet alway remaineth maner confirming whiche haue common iewes wherfore must alway diligently consider common bothe haue seuerall v couenant common cause confirming common onely manner confirming diuerse circumcision place whereof baptisme hath succeded among v otherwise testimonie whereby iewes assured saluation sede taken away v shoulde broughte passe comming christ grace god darker lesse approued testimony v iewes sayd wt extreme sclaunder christ infinite goodnesse father hath clerely liberally euer heretofore ben poured fourth vpon earth declared men must nedes graunt least pinchingly suppressed sett fourth lesse testimonie vnder darke shadowes lawe wherefore lorde iesus mynding shewe token whereby worlde mighte vnderstande come rather enlarge limit mercy god gently embraced child offred vnto hym rebuking disciple went forbid come hym forasmuche leade whome kingdome heauen belongeth away whome alone entrie open heauenmath ixxiii man say like thing hath baptisme embracing christ neither reported baptized receiued embraced wished well therefore lift folowe example let v helpe infantes prayer baptise let v weye doinges christe somwhat hedefully suche kinde men doe neither lightly passed ouer christ commaundeth infantes brought vnto adding reaso kingdome heauen afterwarde witnesseth hys wil dede embracing commendeth father praier blessing mete infantes brought christ also mete receiued baptisme signe communion felowship christ kingdome heaue shall signe denied wherby entrie opened chirch admitted may adnobred among hetres heauenly kingdome howe vninst shall dryue away whome christ calleth vnto hym spoyle whome garnisheth gyftes shutt willingly receiueth examine howe muche christe differeth baptisme yet howe muche greater pryce shall haue baptisme whereby testifie infantes conteined couenant god receiuing embracing layeng handes prayer whereby christe himselfe presente declareth bothe hys sanctified hym cauillations whereby labor mocke thys place doe nothing bewraye owne ignorance gather argument christ sayth let litle one come age good bigg one whiche allredy able goe called euangelistes brephe paidia wordes grekes doe signifie babe yet hanging brestes therefore thys woorde come simply sette haue accesse loe snare compelled make growen hard againste truthe nowe saye kingdome heauen geuen suche lyke saied suche sounder rest graunted maner reason shal reason christ wherby meaneth shewe infantes age stranger hym commaundeth infantes suffered haue accesse vnto nothyng plainer infancie dede spoken seme absurditie addeth suche kingdome heauen muste nedes infantes comprehended herein muste plaine worde suche meant infantes themselues suche like man seeth baptisme infantes framed man vpholden great approuyng scripture neither doo colorably enough play fooles obiect found one infant baptised handes apostle although expressly name rehearsed euangelistesacts xvixv xxxii yet agayne excluded ofte mention happeneth made baptisyng householde vnlesse madde reason therupon baptised argumentes force woman forbidden partake lordes supper whome reade haue ben receiued vnto tyme apostle bee contente rule faith consider institution pper requireth therby also maye easily iudge vse therof ought communicated obserue also baptisme marke ende ordeined euidently espye belongeth lesse infant elder folkes therefore depriued author muste manifestly defrauded wheras spred abrode among simple people passed long roawe yeares resurrection christ baptisme infantes unknowen therin fowly doo lye writer olde doth certainly referre beginnyng therof tyme apostle nowe remaineth breefely shewe fruite commeth obseruation bothe faithfull whiche present theyr chyldren chirche baptised also infantes themselues baptised holy water man shold despise vnprofitable idle come man minde vpon pretence mocke baptisme infantes scorneth commaundemente circumcision geuen lorde bryng foorth impugne baptisme infantes may also throwen backe circumcision lorde taketh vengeance arrogance whiche condemne comprehend sense owne fleshe god furnisheth v armures wherby foolishnesse may beaten flatt neither holy institution whiche feele faith holpen wt singular comfort deserueth called superfluous god signe communicated childe doth wer emprinted seale confirme promise geuen godly parente declareth ratified lorde god onely hym also seede nd continually shewe good grace hym onely also posteritie euen thousandth generation great kindnesse god vttereth selfe firste yeldeth moste large mater aduauce glorie ouerspreadeth godly harte singular gladnesse therwithall earnestly moued loue agayne godly father see haue care posteritie sake neither regarde man take exception say promise ought suffise confirme saluation child forasmuche hath pleased god otherwise whoe knoweth weaknesse willed behalfe much beare tenderly therfore let embrace promise god mercy extended child thynke theyr duetie offer chirche signed signe mercy therby encourage themselues assured cofidence present eye beholde couenant lorde grauen body child agayne child receyue commoditie baptisme beyng engraffed bodye chirche bee somewhat comended mebres growen riper age therby sclenderly stirred vp earnest endeuor worshyp god haue ben receiued child solemne signe adoption coulde age acknowe hym fathergen xvii xiiii finally condemnation oughte greatly make v afrayde god take vengeance man despise marke sonne signe couenant suche contempt grace offred refused forsworne let v examine argumentes wherby certaine furious beastes cesse assaile holy institution god fyrst thei see excedyngly nere driuen hard strained likenesse baptisme circumcision labor pluck sonder two signes great difference one shoulde haue thyng common say diuers thinges signified couenant altogether diuers namyng child one go aboute proue first point allege circumcision figure mortification baptisme whiche verily moste willynglye graunt maketh well syde neither doo vse profe sentence baptisme circumcision signes mortification hereupon determine baptisme set place circumcision shoulde represente vnto v thyng whiche old tyme signified iewes affirming difference couenant howe barbarous boldnesse turmoyle corrupt scripture one place alone leaue nothyng safe whole depainte vnto v iewes carnal lyker beast men forsooth couenant made procedeth beyonde temporall lyfe whome promyses geuen doe reste presente bodyly good thynges doctrine take place remayneth nation iewes tyme fylled benefites god none otherwise fatte hearde swyne stye lengthe shoulde perishe eternall damnation soone allege circumcision promise annexed vnto answer circumcision litterall sygne promyses thereof carnall truely circumcision literall signe otherwise thought baptisme apostle seconde chapter colossian maketh one spirituall othercoloss iixi sayth circumcised christe circumcision made hande puttyng away body sinne dwelled fleshe calleth circumcision christ afterward declaration sayeng adioineth buried christ baptisme meaneth wordes fulfillyng truth baptisme also truthe fulfillyng circumcision figure bothe one thyng trauaileth shewe baptisme christias circumcision ben iewes forasmuch haue euidently declared promise bothe signes mystery represented doo agree together wil present tary longer vpon put faithfull mynde though holde peace weye themselues whether taken earthly literall signe vnder whiche nothyng conteyned spirituall heauenly sell smoke simple way confute one obiection wherwith color shamelesse lye certaine principall promise wherin conteyned couenant whiche olde testamente god stablished israelite spriritual tended eternall life agayne receiued father spirituallye mete myght therof receiue affiance life come wherunto loged whole affectio hart meane tyme denie witnessed good towarde earthly carnall benefites also say promise spiritual thing confirmed promised euerlastyng blessednesse seruant abrahamgen xv xviii myght sett eies manifest token fauor addeth promise concernyng possession lande chanaan maner ought vnderstande al earthly promise geuen iewiche nation spirituall promise hed wherunto directed shold alway haue chefe place sithe haue largely entreated thynges difference newe olde testament therfore nowe slightly knitte vp namyng child finde diuersitie olde testament called child abraham whiche issued sede nowe called name whiche follow faith therfore carnall infantie circu cision graffed felowship couenant figured infantes newe testament whyche regenerate worde god immortall lyfe whych woordes beholde dede smalle sparcle truthe herin lyghte spirites greuously offende catche holde whyche fyrste commeth theyr hande go compare many thynges together stand slytly vpon one worde wherby otherwyse bee must somtyme deceiued whych rest vpon sounde knowlege nothynggal iiiixxviii rom iiii xii graunt dede carnall seede abraham tyme holde place spirituall sede whiche faith graffed hym called child howsoever naturall kinred betwene hym v meane playnly shew doo neuer spirituall blessing promised carnal sede abraham herein muche deceiued wherfore muste leuell better marke whereunto directed moste certaine guidyng scripture lorde therefore promised abraham shoulde haue seede wherein nation earthe shall blessed therwithall assureth hym would god hym sede whosoeuer faith receiue christe author blessyng heires promise therefore called child abraham althoughe sin resurrection christe boundes kingdome god haue begonne farre wide enlarged nation without difference according saying christ faithfull one gathered euery part sit downe heaue ly glorie abrahammat viiixi exo xixv isaac iacob yet many age extended great mercie iewes passing ouer chosen nation wold restraine grace tyme called peculiar possessio purchased people testifiyng suche liberalitie circumcision geuen signe wherof ye iewes might taught yt god author saluation knowledge myndes raised hope eternal life shal want god hath ons receiued charge wherfore apostle meaning proue gentile child abraham well iewes speaketh manerrom iiiix abraham saith iustified faith vncircucision afterward receiued signe circumcision seale righteousnesse faith father faithfull vncircumcision circumcision glorie circumcision folow f th father abraham vncircumcision see sortes made egall dignitie tyme appointed decree god father circumcision wall plucked downe apostle writeth place iewes wer seuered gentilesephes iixiiii entrie made open also kingdome god made father without signe circumcision haue baptisme stede circumcision wher expresly name denyeth abraham father circumcision spoken abate pride certaine omittyng care godlynesse bost themselues ceremony maner day also vanitie may confuted seke baptisme nothyng water place apostle ix chapiter epistle romaine shalbe alleged contrary teacheth whiche fleshe child abraham onely compted sede whiche child promise seemeth signifie carnall kynred abraham nothyng yet set degre diligetly marked mater ye apostle entreateth meaning shew iewes much ye goodnesse god boud ye sede abraha yea howe nothyng auayleth selfe bringeth forth ismael esau example proue whome beeyng refused stranger although accordyng fleshe naturall ofspryng abraham blessing rested isaac iacob wherupon gathered afterwarde affirmeth saluation hangeth mercie god whiche extendeth whome pleaseth hym cause iewes shold stand conceite boast vpon ye name couenat vnlesse kepe law ye couenant say obey worde agayne hath throwen downe vaine confidence kinred yet side sawe couenant one made god posteritie abraham coulde wyse made voyd xi chapiter argueth carnall kinred spoyled due dignitie beneficiall meane wherof teacheth iewes first naturall heires gospell respecte vnthankfulnesse forsaken vnworthy yet heuenly blessyng vtterly remoued nation whiche reason howe muche soeuer stubborne couenant breaker neuerthelesse calleth holye muche honor geueth ye holy generation god vouchsaued make holy couenant calleth v compared borne yea vntimely borne child abraham adoption nature twigg broken naturall tree graffed strange stocke therefore defrauded prerogatiue behoued gospel first preached household god first begotten child wherfore honor geuen vntill refused beyng offred owne vnthankfulnesse brought passe caried away getiles neither yet howe great obstinatie soeuer continue make warre gospell ought despised v consider promise sake blessing god doth yet stil remain among verely apostle testifieth shall neuer vtterly departe thencerom xixxix giftes callyng god without repentance beholde force promise geuen posteritie abraham balance weyed wherefore althoughe discernyng heires kyngdome bastardes stranger nothyng doute election god ruleth free right gouernement yet also therwithall perceiue pleased hym peculiarly embrace sede abraham mercie mercie might surely witnessed seale circumcision nowe altogether like state christian chirche paule reasoneth iewes sanctified parentes place teachethi cor vii xiiii child christian receiue sanctification parentes wherupon gathered worthily seuered rest syde condemned vncleannesse nowe doute moste false therupon conclude say infantes olde tyme circumcised dyd figure spiritual infantie ariseth regeneration worde god paule dothe suttelly play philosopherrom xvviii writeth christ ye minister circumcision fulfill promise bene made father saide thus forasmuche couenant made abraham hath respecte sede christe performe discharge promise one made father came saluatio nation iewes se also resurrectio christe iudgeth promise couenant fulfilled onely way allegorie wordes sounde carnal seede abraham entent serueth peter second chapter actesactes iixxxix declareth iewes benefite gospell due sede right couenant chapter next folowyng calleth child testamente say heiresactes iiixxv eph iixi also muche disaccordeth place apostle aboue alleged accompteth setteth circucision emprinted infant testimonie comunion thei haue christ harken trifle shalbe wroughte promise wherby lorde seconde article law vndertaketh seruantes wil fauourable sede euen thousandth generation shall flee allegory triflyng shift shal say abolished law destroyed christ came rather stablish farre turneth v good vnto lyfe lett therfore bee controuersie god good liberall sake wil haue also child whome shall begett adnumbred among people moreouer difference go put betwene baptisme circumcision ar worthy laughed void color reson also disagreeyng selues haue affirmed baptisme hath relation first day spiritual battell circumcision eighth mortification already ended forgetting turne song call circumcisio figure flesh mortified baptisme call buriall none ar put til alredy dead dotage phrentike men great lightnesse leape sondry diuersities fyrst sentence baptisme must go circumcisio thrust backe later place yet newe exaple wittes men tossed vp downe stede certain word god worship whatsoeuer haue dreamed therfore say former difference mere dreame listed expounde way allegorie vpon eyghth day yet agreed maner muche fitter accordyng opinion old writer referre numbre eighth resurrection whiche done eighth day wherupon knowe newnesse life hangeth whole course presente lyfe wherein mortification oughte alwaye goe forward till life ended mortification selfe may also ended howbeit god may seme haue mynded prouide tendernesse age differryng circumcision viii day wound shold haue ben dangerous child newe borne yet red mother howe muche stronger beyng deade buried baptisme scripture expressely cryeth cotrarye buried death entente dye thenseforth shoulde endeuor mortification nowe likewise handlyng cauill woman ought baptised baptisme must bee framed like circumcision certaine sanctifieng sede israel testified signe circumcision thereby also vndouted geuen sanctifie bothe male female onely bodyes male child marked myght nature marked yet woman certaine maner copanions parteners
