circumcision therefore sending farre away suche folly lette v sticke faste lykenesse baptisme circumcision whiche largely see agree inward mysterie promise vse effectualnesse thynke also yt bring forth strong reason childre debarred baptisme allege ar yet age able vnderstand mysterie signified spiritual regeneration first infatie therfore gather taken none childre adam till growen age mete second birth truth god echewhere speaketh thynges lefte among child adam left death forasmuch adam nothyng dye contrarywise christ comau deth brought vnto hym life therfore may geue life maketh partaker hymselfe meane tyme fellowes driuing farre away adiudge death say shift infantes therfore perishe accompted child adam error abundantly confuted witnesse scripture pronounceth dye adam foloweth remaineth hope life christei cor xv xxii ep iiiii psal livii therefore maye made heires lyfe must communicate agayne written place nature subiecte wrath god conceiued sinne wherunto damnatio perpetually cleaueth must departe oute oure owne nature entrie open v kingdome god playnely spoken fleshe blood possesse kingdome godi cor xv l therfore let al doone away soeuer shall done withoute regeneration shall see possession kyngdome finally christ say truely reporteth life necessarie graffed hymiohn x xxv et xiiiiv may deliuered bondage death saye infantes regenerate endued wt knowlege neither good euyl answer worke god yet worke althoughe subiect capacitie moreouer nothyng doutefull infantes whiche saued verily age saued regenerate lorde bryng mother wombe corruption naturally planted must purged therofreue xxixxvii ephe iiiii psa iivii admitted kyngdome god whereinto nothyng entreth defiled spotted borne synners bothe dauid paule affirme eyther remaine fauor hatefull god must nedes iustified seke moreiohn iiiiii iudge openly affirmeth entrie heauenly life open none bee borne agayne put suche carper silence shewed example iohn baptist whome sanctified mother wombe able doo rest neither dooe thyng preuaile shifte wherewith mocke one done wherupon dothe folow lorde wonte commonly doe infantes neither reason maner onely purpose shew power god vniustly enuiously limitted within narrowe boundes within suffreth selfe bounde shift euen great weight allege vsuall maner scripture worde wombe muche effecte sayd childhode may clerely see angell declared zacharieluke ixv meant thyng whiche yet borne shoulde filled holy ghoste lette v therfore attempt appoynt law god yt may sanctifie pleased sanctified childe forasmuche power nothyng minyshed truely christ therfore sanctified first infantie might sanctifie elect euery age without differece away fault disobedience ben committed fleshe hath put fleshe vpon himselfe might v stede performe perfect obedience conceiued ye holy ghost yt hauyng holynesse therof fully poured hym fleshe taken vpon hym myght poure foorth v haue christ perfect paterne grace god continually sheweth child verily behalfe also shallbe profe vnto v age infantie farre vnfitt sanctification howsoeuer yet holde controuersie none electe called present life fyrst made holy regenerate spirit god wheras obiect contrary scripture spirite acknowlegeth regeneration incorruptible sede worde godi pet ixxiii wrongfully expounde sayeng peter wherin comprehendeth onely faithfull ben taught preaching gospell suche dede graunt word lorde onely sede spirituall regeneration denye ought therupon gathered infantes regenerate power god easy ready v incomprehensible wonderfull moreouer shoulde bee safe enough v take awaye lorde maye able shewe hymselfe bee knowen whatsoeuer waye faith say hearyng wherof haue yet gotten vse neither able knowe god moses teacheth desti ute knowlege bothe good euilldeute ixxiii consider yt apostle whe maketh hearyng beginnyng faith describeth onely ordinarie distribution lorde disposition whiche vseth kepe calling appointeth perpetuall rule may vse way way verily hath vsed ye calling many whome hath geuen true knowlege himselfe inwarde maner ye enlightening spirite wtout preaching vsed meane thereof whereas thinke shalbe great absurditie knowlege god geue infantes moses taketh away vnderstading good euil beseche answere danger sayd receiue part grace wherof litle shal enioye ful plentifulnesse fulnesse lyfe standeth perfect knowlege god many first infantie death taketh away doe passe eternall life truely receiued beholde present face god therfore lord wil enlighte ful bryghtnesse hys lyghte maye presently also please hym sende shyne vppon small sparcle therof specially first vncloth ignorance ye take prison flesh meane rashly affirme endued faith fele selues yt haue altogether lyke knowlege faith rather leaue suspense somwhat restraine theyr foolish arrogance according mouth puffed vp wyth fulnesse boldly deny affirme care may yet stande strongly poynt adde baptisme sacrament repentance fayth wherfore sith neither befall tender infantie ought beware least admitted comunion baptisme signification made voyde vayne dartes throwen rather agaist god v euident many testimony scripture circumcisio also signe repetance moreouer called paule ye seale ye righteousnesse fayth let therfore reason required god hymselfe commaunded marked body infantesro xiiiixi sithe baptisme circucision one case geue nothing one muste also therewithal graunt loke backe wonted starting hole age infantie figured spiritual infates way alredy stopped vp say therfore sithe god hath communicated infantes circumcision sacrament repentance faith semeth absurditie made partaker baptisme vnlesse lyst openly rage ordinance god doinges god thys selfe also shineth wisdome righteousnesse enough beate backbitinges wicked though infantes instante circumcised dyd comprehende vndersta ding signe meant yet truely circumcised mortification theyr corrupte defyled nature mortification afterwarde exercise themselues wer growe ryper age finally easy assoile obiection saying baptysed repetance fayth come although formed yet secrete workyng spirite sede lyeth hidde thys answer one ouerthrowen whatsoeuer thei wrest v haue fetched signification baptisme sort ye title wherewith commended paulelit iv calleth ye washing regeneration renewyng wherupo gather geuen none one able coceiue thinges ye cotrary side may answer yt nether circucisio betokened regeneratio geue tha yt regenerate shal codene yt ordinance god wherfore haue allready touched diuerse place whatsoeuer argumetes tend ye shaking circucision haue force ye assayling baptisme nether escape away say yt ought take yt determined certaine stadeth vpo ye authoritie god although appeare reso reuerece due ye baptisme infantes thynges comeded vnto v ye expresse worde god sith stil fast holden wt thys doble argumet comaundement god concerning infantes circumcised either lawfull subiecte cauillatios worthy foud fault withal wer inco uenience absurditie ye comaundemet circumcision neither absurdity noted obseruing baptisme infantes ye spot absurdity place go lay vpo thus wipe away ye lord hath vouchsaued elect hauing receiued ye signe regeneration depart thys presente lyfe yt come riper age reneweth ye power spirite incoprehesible v maner alone foreseeth expediet chaunce grow vp age wherby may taught ye truth baptisme shal hereby enkindled endeuor renewing toke wherof shal learne haue ben geue fro first infatie yt exercise theselues whole course lyferom viiiii col ii xii entent ought yt applied paul teacheth twoo place yt baptisme ar buried together christ doth meane therby yt baptised must alredy first buried together wt christ simply declareth doctrine coteined vnder baptisme yea yt alredy baptysed yt mad men would affirme place yt goeth baptisme maner moses prophet put ye people minde circumcision meant wherwith yet ben marked infates effect also yt writeth ye galatiansgala iiixxvii yt baptised put christ end verili yt thei fro fourth liue christ liued although older sort receiuing signe ought folow vnderstading mysterie yet shalbe declared yt infates ought otherwise estemed accopted otherwise ought iudge place peteri pet iiixxi thinke yt haue strong holde saith yt washing wype away filthiness body witnesse good conscience god resurrection christe dede doe gather thereby nothing left ye baptisme infantes vaine smoke namely trueth farr distant often offende error haue thing order tyme goe alway signe truth circumcision also cosisted witnesse good coscience ought necessitie haue gone infates neuer haue ben circucised ye commaudement god shewing ye witnesse good conscience coteined vnder truth circumcision yet withal also comaunding infantes circumcised doeth yt point sufficietly declare yt circumcision applied ye time come wherfore present effectualnesse required baptisme infantes yt confirme stablish ye couenant made lord rest signification ye sacramente shal afterwarde folow tyme god himselfe foreseeth thinke man doth clerely see al suche reason mere misconstringes scripture rest nere kinde wil lightly runne throughe way obiect baptisme geuen vnto forgeuenesse synnes graunted wil largely make defense sentence sith borne sinner euen mother wombe nede forgeuenesse pardon seing ye lord doth cut rather assure yt age hope mercy take fro signe much inferior thing selfe wherfore go throwe v thus throwe backe themselues infantes haue remission synnes geue therfore ought haue signe taken fro themeph vxxvi allege also thys epistle ephesian ye chirch clensed lord washing water worde lyfe tha could nothing alleged fit ouerthrow error rupo groweth easy profe syde lorde haue washyng wherewith clenseth chirch testified baptisme semeth rightful want testimonie infantes whiche rightfully accompted part chirch forasmuch called heires heauenly kingdome paule speaketh whole chirchi cor xiixvii sayth cleansed baptisme water likewise place sayth baptisme graffed body christ gather infantes reckeneth among hys member oughte baptised least plucked away hys body beholde violence many engine assault fortress fayth come ye practise custome time ye apostle wherin none foud haue ben admitted baptisme whiche hath professed faith repentance peter asked yt mynded repentactes iixxxvii nedeful done cou selled first repent baptised ye forgeuenesse synnes likewise philip whe ye eunuche required baptised answered yt might baptised beleued wt al hartactes viii xxxvii hereby thinke may winne yt lawfull baptisme grau ted fayth repentance goe truely yelde thys reson first twoo place mention made faith wil proue yt repetace alone sufficeth place wherin repentance required proue fayth onely enough thinke answer one place holpen therfore must ioyned together say also likewise yt place must layed together make somwhat vndoing thys knot asmuch many setences scripture vnderstanding wherof hangeth vpon circustance place presently example peter philip spake thynges age sufficient haue practise repentance co ceiue faith earnestly deny ought baptised vntil perceiuing conuersion fayth least farr maye searched iugement men infantes ought accompted nomber euident enough olde tyme man ioyne himselfe communion religion israel behoued first taught couenant lord instructed law wer marked circumcision birth stranger people israel whome couenante ben made whiche circumcision stablished also lord adopteth abraham himselfe doth begin circumcisionge xvi hyding meane time meaneth signe first declareth couenante entendeth make fayth geuen promise maketh hym partaker sacramentgen xviixvi doth abraham sacrament follow fayth isaac sonne goeth vnderstanding mete beyng full growen age receiued felowship couenant ben hetherto stranger first learne condition therof infante begotten neded right inheritance according ye forme promise euen mother wombe conteined couenant mater may clerely brefely shewed child faithful without helpe vnderstanding partaker couenante cause shoulde debar ed signe thys sweare forme couenant verily reason place god affirmeth yt infantes whiche issued israeliteseze xvixx xxiiixxxvii begotten borne hym without dout estemeth hys child child whoes sede promiseth wil father vnfaithfull issued vngodly parentes till fayth vnited god iudged stranger communion couenant therfore maruell partaker signe signification whereof shoulde deceitfull voyde hymeph iixii effecte paule also wryteth gentile long drowned theyr idolatrie oute testamente shorte summe thynke whole mater may clerely opened whiche growen age embrace fayth christ forasmuche hetherto stranger couenante marked baptisme wheras fayth repentance come betwene onely open entrie felowship couenant infantes issued christian receiued god inheritance couenant sone borne oughte receiued baptisme hereunto muste applyed whiche evangelist speaketh ofmat liivi baptised ihon whiche confessed sinnes whiche example day also thinke mete kept turke offer himselfe baptisme shoulde bee rashly baptised v namely til confession wherby maye satisfie chirch moreouer bring fourth wordes christ rehearsed thirde chapter iohn wherby thinke presente regeneration required baptismeioh iiiv unlesse man borne againe water spirite enter kingdome god loe say howe baptisme lordes mouth called regeneration therefore whome enough knowen vnable receiue regeneratio color admit baptisme without regeneration first deceiued thys thinke thys place mention made baptisme heare name water christ declared nicodemus corruption nature taught hym men must borne newe nicodemus dreamed bodily newe birth shewed maner god doth regenerate v namely water spirite though say spirite cleansing watering faithfull soules doth office water therefore take water spirite simply spirite water neither new forme speche altogether agreeth thirde chapter mathewemat ii xxxi foloweth baptiseth holy ghost fier therfore baptise holy ghost fier geue holy ghost hath office nature fier borne againe water spirite nothing ell receiue power holy spirite doth thing soule water doth body knowe otherwise expounde oute doute thys naturall meaning purpose christ none teache must put owne nature aspire heauenly kingdome howebit list cauil vnsauoryly easy v haue graunted woulde haue inferre vpon baptisme fayth repentance forasmuch wordes christe goeth spirite certaine vnderstanded spirituall giftes come baptisme haue obteined require leauing cauillations must holde fast playne exposition haue brought til haue ben renewed liuing water spirite enter kingdome god nowe hereby also euident fayned inuention hissed adiudge al vnbaptised eternal death therfore let v according request imagine baptisme ministred none growen age saye shall become childe whiche rightly well instructed introduction godlynesse day baptising hande happen taken away soden death beside mennes hope lordes promise cleare whosoever hath beleued sonneioh vxxiiii shall see death shall come iugemente allredy passed death life founde euer damned yet baptised whiche would haue taken though meant baptisme might freely despised despising affirme lordes couenant defiled much lesse abide excuse onely enough proue necessarie immediatly thought lost whome power taken away obteine agree fained deuise shall damne without exception chaunce withholdeth baptisme wt great faith soeuer christ possessed otherwise endued moreouer make infantes giltye eternall death whome deny baptisme confession necessarie saluation let loke trimly agree wordes christ kingdome heauen adiudged age graunte euery thing much perteineth vnderstanding thys placemath xixxiiii yet shall gather nothing thereof vnlesse ouerthrowe former doctrine haue stablished concernyng regeneration infantes glory haue strongest holde institutio baptismemathe xxviiixix fetch last chapter mathew christ sending fourth hys apostle nation geueth first commaundement teache seconde baptise also last marke adioine yt beleueth baptisedmark xvi xvi shalbe saued seke saye lordes owne wordes doe openly sounde must firste teach ere baptise assigne baptisme seconde state faithmath iiixiii luc iiixxiii order lord also shewed example would baptised tyll thirtyth yere good god many wayes doe entangle theselues bewraye owne ignorance herein childishly erre fetche firste institution baptisme thense whiche christ beginning preaching geuen charge hys apostle minister therfore cause shoulde affirme ye law rule baptisme fetched place though conteined first institution therof beare thys fault yet strong thys manner reasoning truly listed dally litle lurking hole wyde felde offreth selfe open v escape sticke fast order wordes gather sayd goe preach baptise againe beleueth baptised therfore must preach baptisemar xvixv beleue require baptisme may agayn answere sayeng must baptise muste teache keping thinges christ hath commaunded namely sithe sayd baptise ye teaching kepe whatsoeuer thinges haue commaunded whiche thing haue noted sayeng christ hath ben euen alleged concerning regeneration water spirite vnderstode would haue verily place baptisme must spiritual regeneration named first place christ doth teach must regenerate spirite water water spirite nowe inuincible reason whereupon beare themselues bolde semeth somwhat shaken truth hath defense enough simplicitie wil escape away light argumentes therfore let take ful answer christ place geueth chefe commaundement concerning preaching gospell whereunto adioyneth ministerie baptisme additio ha ging vpon againe speaketh none otherwise baptisme farr ministration vnder office teaching christ sendeth apostle publishe gospel al natios ye world eche doctrine saluation gather together hys kyngdome men lost maner men certaine mentio able receiue teaching afterwarde addeth instructed ought baptised adioyning promise yt beleue baptised shalbe saued al sayeng much one syllable infantes forme therefore reasoning shal thys wherewith assaile v growen age must first instructed may beleue ere baptised therfore vnlawful make baptisme common infantes althoughe would burst themselues shall proue nothing ell place gospell must preached capacitie able heare baptised forasmuch speaketh let herof make stopp debarre infantes baptisme euen blynde men also may gropyng fynde deceites wil poynt cleare similitude cauil infantes ought haue meate taken vppon thys pretense apostle suffreth none eate laborii thes iiix shal worthy al men spit hym without differece draweth yt al men spoken one kinde one certayne age men whit handsomer handeling thys present cause euery man seeth belong one age alone draw infantes thys age also may subiect ye rule made none growen yeres example christ nothing vpholdeth side baptised thirty yeres oldeluke iii xxiii dede true reason therof redy shewed purposed hys preaching lay sounde fundatio baptisme rather stablish fundation ben laied iohn therfore mynded hys doctrine institute baptisme procure ye greater authoritie institution sanctified owne body fitnesse tyme conuenient namely began preaching finally shall gather nothing ell herof baptisme toke hys original beginning preaching gospell list appoint thirtith yere doe kepe doe receiue euery one baptisme hath iugemente sufficiently profited yea seruettus one maisters stiffly required thys tyme yet began xxi yere age boste himselfe prophet though bee suffred taketh vpon himselfe place teacher chirch member chirch last obiect greater cause baptisme geuen infantes lordes supper yet graunted though scripture euery way expresse large differece dede vsually done olde chirch appeareth cypriane augustine maner worthily growen vse consider nature propertie baptisme truely entrie chirch forme admission wherby adnubred people god signe spirituall regeneration borne agayne child god wheras syde supper geue growen age hauing passed tender infantie able beare strong meate difference euidently shewed scripture lorde muche perteineth baptisme maketh choise age doth likewise geue supper al take part fit discerne body blood lord examine conscience declare lordes deathi cor xixxviii weye power therof would haue thing plainer apostle teacheth exhorteth euery man proue examine hymselfe eate thys bred drynke thys cup therfore examination must goe vaine loked infantes agayne eateth vnworthily eateth drynketh damnation hymselfe discerning lordes body none partake worthily well discerne holinesse lordes body geue tender child poison stede liuely foode commaundement lord ye shal remembrance apostle deriueth oft ye shall eate bread ye shal declare lordes death til come remembrance beseche shal require infantes ye thyng neuer atteined vnderstanding preaching crosse christ force benefite whereof yet comprehende mind none thing prescribed baptisme therfore betwene twoo signes great difference whiche note also like signes olde testament circumcision knowen answere baptisme appointed infantes passeouer whoes place ye supper hath succeded receiue al maner gestes without difference rightly eaten myght age enquire signification men remayning one crumme sounde brayne woulde blynde thing clere offring selfe sight although greueth lode reders heape trifle yet shalbe worth trauail brefely wype away suche gay reason seruettus least anabaptistes yea great glory company thought himselfe bring prepared himselfe conflict allegeth christes signes perfect doe require perfect able conceiue perfection solution easy perfection baptisme extendeth euen death wrongfully restrayned one point time say yet perfection foolyshly required man first day wherunto baptisme allureth v al life long continuall degree obiecteth christes signes wer ordeined remembrance euery man remember buried together christ answer hath fained owne head nedeth confutation yea tha draweth baptisme paules wordes shew propre holy supper euery man examine baptisme thing wherupon gather yt rightly baptised smalnesse ageiohn iiixxxvi ar yet able receiue examination wheras thirdly allegeth abide death whiche beleue sonne god wrath god abideth vppon therfore infant beleue lie damnation answer christe speaketh generall gyltinesse wherwith ye posteritie adam enwrapped thretneth despisers gospell proudely stubbornely refuse grace offred nothing perteineth infantes also set cotrarie reason yt whomesoeuer christ blesseth discharged curse adam wrathe god sithe therfore knowen infantes blessed foloweth discharged death falsly citeth whiche redi cor xvxlvi whosoeuer borne spirite heareth voyce spirit although graunt written yet shal proue nothyng ell faithfull framed obedience accordyng spirite woorketh whiche spoken certaine number faultie drawe indifferently fowerthly obiecteth goeth naturall muste tarry type tyme baptisme whiche spirituall althoughe graunte posteritie adam begotten fleshe doo wombe beare owne damnation yet denye withstandeth god may presently bryng remedy neither shall seruettus proue many yeares appoynted god spirituall newnesse lyfe many beginne1 cor vii xiiii paul testifieth although whiche borne faithfull nature damned yet supernatural grace sauedii sa vviii luc xiiiixxi bryngeth forth allegorie dauid going vp ye toure sion leade neither blinde men lame men wt strong souldiors set parable wherin god calleth heauenly banket blinde men lame men howe seruettus vnwynde himselfe knott aske also whether lame maimed men fyrst ben souldiors dauid superfluous tary longer vpo reaso reader shall fynde holy hystorie made mere falsehodmat iiii xix foloweth allegorie apostle fisher men litle child aske sayeing christ meaneth nette gospel gathered al kyndes fishesmat xiiixlvii lyke play allegory answer whe office teaching enioyned apostle yet forbidden baptisyng infantes howbeit wold yet knowe euangelist nameth anthropous men whche woorde comprehended mankynde without exception deny infantes meni cor iixiii seuenthly allegeth sithe spirituall thyngs agree spirituall infantes spiritual also mete baptisme first plainly euidet howe wrongfully wrest place paule entreated doctrine corinthian muche stande owne conceite vayne sharpnesse witte paule rebuketh sluggishnesse wer yet instructed first introduction heauenly wisdome therof gather baptisme denied infant begotten fleshe god doth free adoption make holy sayth must fed spirituall meate newe men solution easy baptisme admitted flocke christ signe adoption suffiseth til growen age able beare strong meate therfore time examination god expresly requi eth holy supper must taried afterward obiecteth christ calleth holy supper certaine enough admitteth none already prepared celebrate remembrance deathe wherupon foloweth infantes whome vouchesaued embrace stay seuerall proper degree themselues till grow age yet stranger whereas saieth monstrous man borne eate answere soules otherwise fed outward eatyng supper therfore christ neuerthelesse meate infantes althoughe absteine signe baptisme case otherwise onely gate chirch opened agayne obiecteth good stewarde distributeth meate household due timemath xxiiiixlvi although willyngly graunt yet right wil appoint vnto v certaine tyme baptisme may proue geuen infantes tyme moreouer bryngeth comaundemet christ apostle yt shold make hast haruest whyle fieldes waxe whiteiohn iiii xxxv uerily christe meaneth onely apostle seeyng fruite labor present shoulde cherefully prepare themselues teache shall thereof gather onely tyme haruest ripe time baptisme eleuenth reason isactes xixxvi first chirch christian disciple one see nowe fondely reasoneth parte whole disciple called men full age whiche ben already throughly taught professed christ behoued iewes vnder law disciple moses yet man shall therof rightly gather infantes stranger whome lord hath testified householde besyde allegeth christian brother number infantes vnto v long debarre supper returne principle none heires kingdome heauen membres christ embracyng christ true token adoption wherby infantes ioyned common full growen men absteining time supper withstandeth perteyne body chirche neither conuerted crosse cesse brother godly although neuer cam supper afterward addeth none made brother spirite adoption geuen bearing faith answer still falleth backe deceitefull argument ouerthwartly draweth infantes spoken growen men paule teacheth god ordinarie maner callyng bryng electe faith stirreth vp faithful teacher whoes ministerie trauaile reacheth hande dare therby appoint lawe may secrete way graffe infantes christactes xxxiiii act viii xxvii obiecteth cornelius baptised receiued holy ghost howe wrongfully doothe one example gather generall rule appereth eunuche samaritanes lorde kepte contrary order baptisme went giftes holy ghost fiftenthe reason foolishe saith regeneratio made god god whome worde god spokeniohn xxxxv whiche accordeth child infantes whereas faineth godhead faithfull one dotage perteineth present place examine wrest place psalme cotrarie sense point desperate shamelesnesse christ sayth kynges magistrate called prophet goddes beare office appointed god concernyng speciall commaundement gouernance directed certaine men handsome expositor draweth doctrine gospell may banishe infantes chirch agayne obiecteth infantes accompted newe men begotten word doo nowe agayne repete haue often sayde regenerate v doctrine vncorruptible sede bee fit receiue reason age yet v aptnesse learne god kepeth degree regeneratyng afterward commeth backe allegory lawe shepe goate offred sacrifice sone came wombe lysted drawe figure purpose coulde likewise redily obiecte agaynst hym fyrst begotten thynges consecrate god soone opened wombeexo xiiiii exo xiiv lambe must killed yeares age wherupo foloweth maly stregth taried rather new yet tender issue chosen god sacrifice furthermore affirmeth none come christ haue ben prepared iohn though iohns office wer enduryng tyme omitt trulye preparation child christ embraced blessed wherfore let goe false principle length calleth patrones trismegistus sibylles proue holy washyngs perteine growen age loe howe honorably thynketh baptisme christ reduceth ceremony gentile may otherwyse ministred pleaseth trismegistus esteme authoritie god whome hath pleased make infantes holye himselfe admitte holy signe force wherof yet age vnderstad neither compt lawfull borowe cleansynges gentile thyng may change baptisme euerlastyng inuiolable law god hath stablished concerning circumcision last al maketh argument lawful baptise infantes without vnderstandyng baptisme may enterludelike sport ministred boy whe plaie matter let hym quarell god whoes comaundement circumcision co mon infantes atteyned vnderstandyng therfore playeng mater subiect folly child myght ouerthrowe holy ordinance god meruaile reprobate spirit though wer vexed phrenesie thrust grossest absurdity defence error god dothe suche giddynesse iustly take vengeance pride stubbornesse uerily trust haue made playne howe feble succor seruettus hath holpen silly brethre anabaptist think doutful sobre rashly thei trouble ye chirch christ moue brawles contention baptisme infantes profitable consyder satan goeth great sutteltie euen take away fro v singular fruite affiance spirituall ioy gathered hereof diminishe much also glorie ye goodnesse god swete godly myndes certified onely worde also sight sene eies obteine much fauor heuely father hath also care posteritie sene howe taketh vpon person prouident father household toward v euen death dothe lay away carefulnesse v prouideth forseeth child ought exaple dauid al hart leape vp vnto thakesgeuyngpsalme xlviiixi suche shewe goodnesse name maye bee sanctified verily sathan intendeth assayling great army baptisme infant namely testifyeng grace god beyng taken away promise present eies may length little little vanishe away wherupon grow wicked vnthankfulnesse toward mercy god also certaine slouthfulnesse instructyng child godlynesse spurr ar little pricked forward bring vp ye earnest feare god keping law cosider euen immediatly birth taketh acknowlegeth child wherefore vnlesse list enuiously darken bountifulnesse god let v offer child whome geueth place among familie householde say membres chirche pthe xvii chapiter pof holy supper christ auayleth v ye god hath one receiued v familie take v seruantes child may fulfill office moste goed father carefull issue taketh also vpon nourishe v throughout whole course life contented therewith pleased hym pledge geuen assure v thys continuall liberalitie ende therefore hath geuen chirche sacrament hand begotten sonneiohn vili namely spirituall banket wherin christ testifieth hymselfe quicknyng bread wherwith soules fed true blessed immortalitie forasmuche knowlege great mysterie necessarie accordyng greatnesse therof requireth diligent declaration satan myghte bereue chirch inestimable treasure hath long agoe spred mystes sin tyme darknesse obscure light hath stirred striues battels myght estrange myndes simple tastyng holy fode hath also tyme attempted craft therfore shall haue brefely knit vp summe capacitie vnlearned wyll vndo knottes wherwith satan hath endeuored snare worlde fyrst bread wyne signes whiche represent vnto v inuisible foode whiche receyne fleshe blood christ baptisme god againe begettyng v doothe graffe v felowshippe chirche adoption dothe make v owne haue sayde performeth office prouident father householde continually ministreth v meate susteineth preserueth v lyfe wherinto hath worde begotten v meate soule christ therfore heauenly father calleth v hym beyng refreshed common partakyng hym maye tyme tyme gather liuely force vntill atteine heauenlye immortalitie forasmuche mysterie secrete vnityng christe godly nature impossible comprehended geueth figure image therof visible signes moste fit small capacitie yea earnestes token geuen maketh assured vnto v seen eies familiar similitude entreth euen grossest myndes soules fed christ bread wine susteine bodily life therfore haue declared ende mysticall blessyng tendeth namely assure v ye body lord one offred v yt nowe eate eatyng doo fele v effectual working sacrifice blood one shed v vnto v continuall drinke sounde word promise adioyned takemathe xxvixxvi mar xiiii xvii luc xxiixix cor xixxiiii body whiche deliuered body therfore one offred vp saluation commaunded take eate see selues made partaker may certainly determine power death bringeth life shalbe effectuall v wherupon also calleth cuppe couenant blood certaine maner reneweth rather continueth couenant whiche hath one stablished blood muche pertaineth confirmyng faith ofte reacheth vnto v holy blood tasted great fruite verily affiance swetenesse may godly soules gather sacrament haue witnesse growen together one body christe whatsoeuer may call herupon foloweth may boldly promise vnto selues euerlastyng life whereof heire kingdome heauen wherinto entred fal away v agayne nowe condemned sinnes gyltinesse wherof hath acquired v willed imputed owne maruailous exchange whiche immeasurable bountifulnesse hath made v beeyng made v sonne man hath made v hym sonnes god coming downe earth hath made v waie goe vp heauen putting vpon mortalitie hath geuen v immortalitie takyng hym weakenesse hath strengthened v power takyng pouertie himselfe hath conueyed rich v taking hym weyght vnrighteousnesse wherewith oppressed hath clothed v righteousnesse thynges haue full witnessyng sacrament must certainly determine christ truely geuen v christ hymselfe sett present eies handled handes woorde neither lye v mocke v take eate drinke bodye whiche deliuered blood whiche shed forgeuenesse sinnes whereas commaundeth take signifieth whereas commaundeth eate signifieth yt made one subslance v whereas sayth body deliuered v blood shed v therin teacheth bothe muche toke laide away commoditie saluation truely diligently marked chefe maner whole pith sacrament standeth word deliuered shed otherwise much profit v body blood lord ar distributed vnlesse ben one geuen foorth redemption saluation therfore represented vnder bread wine shold learne also ordeined nourishment spirituall life saied corporall thynges whych shewed foorth sacrament certayne proportionall relation guyded spirituall thynges bread geuen v signe body christ ought conceiue similitude bread nourisheth susteineth mainteineth life body body christ onely meate quicken geue lyfe oure soule see wyne set foorth signe blood must call mynde v wyne bryngeth bodye may consider brought v spiritually blood christe v bee cherishe refreshe strengthen make mery sufficiently weye deliueryng holy body shedyng holy blood hath profited v shal plainly perceiue thynges whiche spoken bread wine according proportionall relation doo well accorde toward v communicated vnto v therfore chefe partes ye sacrament simply without hier consideration reach v body christ rather ye promise wherby testifieth fleshe verily meate blood drink fed eternall life wherby affirmeth himselfe breade lyfe whiche eateth shall liue euer seale saye confirme promyse bryngyng passe sende v crosse christ promise hath ben truely performed pointes fulfilled doo well healthfully eate christ crucified doo liuely feelyng conceiue effectualnesse death wheras called himselfe breade life borrow name sacrament wrongfully expounde geue v suche father performed himselfe suche made partaker humane martalitie made v parteners diuine immortalitie offring himselfe sacrifice toke accursednesse vpon yt might fil v blessing death deuoured swalowed vp death resurrection raised vp corruptible flesh put glory vncorruption remaineth appliance maye come v done bothe gospell cleerely holy supper bothe offreth himselfe v good thynges receiue faith wherfore sacramet maketh christ first beginneth bread life bringeth remembrance made bread life whiche continually eate geueth vnto v taste sauor breade maketh v fele strength bread promiseth v whatsoeuer christ suffred done geue life v geuing life euerlasting may without ende nourished susteined preserued life christ haue bene v bread life vnlesse bene borne dyed v vnlesse risen agayne v bee vnlesse effectualnesse fruite birth death resurrection euerlasting immortall thing christe hath well expressed wordesiohn vili bread wil geue flesh wil geue life world wordes without dout signifieth body shoulde therfore bee v bread spirituall life soule shold geuen forth death saluatio deliuered v eate faith maketh v partaker one therfore gaue yt might made bread gaue foorth himselfe crucified redemption world daily geueth word gospell offreth vnto v receiued far crucified sealeth deliuerance holy mysterie supper inwardly fulfilleth outwardly betokeneth herein must beware twoo faultes neither muche abaring signes seme pluck fro mystery maner knitte fast immeasurable aduancing seme meane tyme somwhat darken mystery themselues christ bread life wherewith faithful nourished eternal saluation ther man graunteth vnlesse altogether without religio point likewise agreed vpon among al men maner partaking one worde define eate fleshe christe drinke blood nothing el beleue christ himlsefe thinke christ meant certainer hyer thyng notable sermon comendeth v eatyng fleshe namely quickned true partaking hym whiche also therfore expressed woordes eatyng drynkyng least man thynke life whiche receiue hym conceyued bare knowlege syghte eatyng bread suffiseth body nourishment behoueth soule truly throughly made partaker christ power hym may quickened spirituall lyfe meane tyme confesse eatyng faith imagined difference betwene wordes eate beleue say flesh christ eaten beleuing faith made say eatyng fruite effect faith wil haue plainer eatyng faithe thynke rather followe faith wordes verily difference smalle thyng selfeeph iiixvii small though apostle teacheth christe dwelleth oure harte faithe yet manne expounde dwelling faith men doo perceyue expressed singular effect faith faithful obteyne haue christ dwellyng themiohn vili maner lorde meant callyng hymselfe bread lyfe teache faith death resurrection saluation reposed v also true partakyng himselfe brought passe life passeth v becometh oures like bread taken foode ministreth lyuelinesse body neither dyd augustine bryng patron meanyng write eate beleuyng shewe eatyng faith mouthe also denye yet therwithall adde faith embrace christe apperyng afarre makyng hymselfe one v may oure head membres yet vtterly disalow maner speakyng deny full declaration meane define eate fleshe christ otherwyse see augustine hath ofte vsed forme speche saith thirde boke christian doctrine unlesse ye eate fleshe sonne man figure teachyng must communicate passion lorde muste sweetely profitably laye vp remembrance v fleshe crucified wounded homi ioh xxxi xl act iixli agayne sayeth three thousande menne whyche conuerted peter sermon dyd drynke bloode christe beleuyng whyche shedde cruell dealyng manye place honorably setteth benefyte faith oure soules lesse refreshed communicatyng fleshe christe oure body breade whiche eate whyche certayne place chrysostome wryteth homi lx christe doeth onely faith also dede make v body meaneth doo faithe obteyne suche benefite onely meaneth exclude none heareth faithe named shoulde conceyue naked imagination haue supper onely marke outwarde profession passe ouer thinke haue sufficiently confuted errorluc xxiixx whe entreated sacramentes generally thys thing let reders marke yt cup called couenant blood promise expressed may force confirme faith wherupo foloweth vnlesse haue respect god embrace offreth doe rightly vse holy supper moreouer also satisfie acknowleging haue communion christ meane expresse doe make v partaker spirite without making mention flesh blood though al thinges spoken nothing hys flesh verily meate blood verily drinke none hath life eateth flesh drinketh blood sayenges belong ende wherfore certaine full communicating christ procedeth beyonde description narowly strained wil go knit vp wordes large farr extendeth selfe speake contrarie fault excesse shal haue longer disputation excessiue teacher according owne grossnesse frame maner eating drinking ful absurditie also transfigure christ stripped hys fleshe fantasie yet man may wordes comprehende great mysterie whiche se yt sufficiently comprehende minde therfore doe willingly confesse yt man measure hynesse therof smal proportion childishnesse rather exhorte reders yt restrayne sense minde within narrowe boundes endeuor rise vp much hyer tha guiding selfe oft speake thing whe haue trauailed say thinke haue yet sayd litle respecte worthinesse therof although minde thinking tong expressing yet greatnesse thing minde also surmounted ouerwhelmed finally therefore nothing remaineth must breake fourth admiration mysterie whiche neither mind suffise thinke tong declare yet suche manner wil set fourth summe sentence nothing dout true trust disallowed godly harte first taughte scripture christe beginning yt life bringing worde father fountaine original life whense thinges euer receiued hauing life wherfore ihon somtime calleth worde life somtime writeth life meaning euen flowyng al creature poured power breathing liuing yet ihon addeth afterwarde life tyll openly shewed sonne god taking vpo fleshe gaue himselfe seen eye felte handes though also spred abrode power creature yet man beyng synne estranged god hauing lost communion lyfe saw euery side death hanging ouer hym myght recouer hope immortalitie behoued receiued communion worde small confidence mayest thou conceiue therof thou heare yt worde god dede thou art farr remoued coteyneth selfe fulnesse lyfe thy selfe rounde thee nothyng offreth selfe present thine eye death sin fountayne lyfe beganne dwell fleshe nowe lyeth farr hydden v presently deliuereth selfe partaken v yea maketh fleshe wherein resteth power bryng lyfe vsiohn vixlviii lviii partaking therof maye fed immortalitie sayth bred lyfe come downe heauen bred whiche geue fleshe whiche geue lyfe worlde whiche woordes teacheth onely lyfe respecte eternall woorde god whiche came downe v heauen comming downe poured power fleshe whiche put thense communicatyng lyfe mighte flowe fourth vnto v hereupon also thinges nowe followe fleshe verily mente blood verily drinke whiche sustenance faythfull fostered eternall life herein therfore consisteth singular comfort godly nowe finde life owne fleshe doe onely easy passage atteine vnto haue selfe layd abrode offring selfe vnto let holde open bosome hart may embrace beeyng present shall obteyne although fleshe christe haue greate power selfe geue life v whiche bothe owne firste estate subiecte mortalitie nowe endued immortalitie liueth selfe yet rightfully called lifebringing whiche filled fulnesse lyfe poure v meaning doe cyril expounde sayeng christ father hath lyfe himselfeiohn vxix hath also geuen sonne haue life himselfe properly speaketh giftes whiche beginning possessed father whiche garnished fleshe whiche appeared therefore sheweth hys manhode also dwelleth fullnesse lyfe whosoeuer partaketh flesh blood may therwithall also enioy partaking life sort may declare familiar example foutaine water somtime drok somtime drawen somtime forrowes conueied watering groundes yet selfe doth ouerflow many v spring selfe euerlasting flowing yeldeth ministreth vnto tyme tyme newe abundance fleshe christ like riche vnwasted fountaine whiche poureth v life springing godhead selfe nowe whoe seeth communion fleshe blood christe necessarie al aspire heauenly lyfe hereunto tendeth sayeng apostle chirch body christe fulfilling hed oute whiche whole body coupled knit together ioyntes maketh encrease body body member christ al thinges vnderstande impossible brought passe must whellye cleaue v spirite body nere felowship wherby coupled fleshe hath yet set glorious titleeph vxxx sayd member body bone hys fleshe last declare mater greater wordes concludeth hys sayeng exclamation sayth greate secret therefore pointe extreme madnesse acknowlege communion faythfull fleshe blood lord apostle declareth greate rather wonder expresse let ye summe yt oure soules fed fleshe blood christ bred wyne mainteine susteine ye bodily lyfe otherwise proportional relation signe agree vnlesse soules dyd fynde fode christ done vnlesse christ truely grow one wt v refresh v wt eating fleshe drinking hys blood although seme incredible great distance place flesh christ reacheth v may meate v let v remember much secret power spirit surmounteth aboue al sens foolysh goe aboute measure hys vnmeasurablenesse measure therfore whiche mynde comprehendeth let fayth conceiue spirite truely knitteth one thinges yt seuered place nowe holy comunicating body blood wherby christ poureth hys life v euen pea ced bone marowes supper also testifieth sealeth land setting v vayne voyde signe bringing fourth ye effectuall working spirite wherby fulfilleth ye promyseth verily offreth deliuereth thing signified al sit spiritual banket although receiued frute ye faythfull onely receiue great bountifulnesse true fayth thankfulnesse mynde maner apostle sayd bred breake communion body christii cor xxvi ye cup hallow ye word prayer purpose comunion hys blood neither cause man obiect figuratiue speche name thing signified geuen signe graut verily ye breaking ye bred signe ye thig selfe admitted yet shall rightly gather deliuerance signe thing selfe deliuered vnlesse wil cal god deceiuer neuer bolde say setteth v empty signe therfore breakyng bred lorde doth truely represente partakyng hys body ought dout truely performeth deliuereth rule alway holden godly oft se signes ordeined lorde certainly thinke persuade themselues truth thyng signified present purpose lorde deliuer thee thy hande signe hys body assure thee true partaking true visible signe geuen v seale gift inuisible thing receiue signe body let v lesse certainly beleue body selfe also geue v saye therefore hath ben alway receiued chirch al teache thys day thynke right holy mysterie supper consisteth twoo thinges saye bodily signes beyng set eye doe represent vnto v inuisible thinges according capacitie weakenesse spirituall trueth signes bothe figured deliuered sort meane shewe familiarly vse set thre thinges signification mater hangeth signification vertue effect foloweth signification consisteth promisses certayne manner wrapped together signe mater substance cal christ hys death resurrection effect vnderstande redemption righteousnesse sanctification eternall lyfe whatsoeuer benefites christ bringeth v although thinges haue respect fayth yet leaue place thys cauillation though say christ receiued fayth would haue hym coceiued vnderstanding imaginatio promise offer hym yt sticke fast sight alone bare knowlege enioye true communicating hym truely se maye haue cofidence hath redeption righteousnesse crosse christ lyfe hys death principally standing vpon true co munion christ himselfe good thinges shoulde come v vnlesse christ first made himselfe oures say therefore mysterie supper signes bread wine christ truely deliuered v yea hys body blood hath fulfylled al obediece purchasing ryghteousnesse v namely first growe together one body hym beyng made partaker hys substance may also fele hys power communicating al hys good thinges come excessiue mixture superstitio hath brought herein satan hath played maruelous sutteltie withdrawing myndes men heauen might fyl peruerse error though christ fastened elemente bred first must dreame presence christ sacrament craftesme court rome haue fayned though body christ made present presence place handeled handes broosed teethe swallowed wt mouth forme recantation pope nicolas endited betengarius witnesse hys repentance namely woordes farr monstruous author glose cryeth danger reders wisely take hede themselues least sucke heresie worse berengarius seconde distinctio chapter beginning thus ego berengarius peter lombarde although trauaile much excusing absurdity yet inclineth contrary sentece nothing dout yt hath limites accordyng perpetual nature body men holden heauen one receiued vntill returne iugement draw backe vnder corruptible elementes imagyne present euery accompt vtterly vnlawfull neyther verily nedefull may enioy ye partaking much lord geueth v thys benefit spirite made one body chrysos serm de spiritu sancto spirite soule bonde therefore thys conioynyng spirite christ knitting wherof coupled together certaine conduit whiche whatsoeuer christ himselfe bothe hath conueyed v beholde sunne shyning fourth hys beames vpon earth certaine maner cast fourth substance vnto engender nourishe quicken frutes thereof extending beames spirite christ inferior conuey communion flesh blood v wherfore scripture speaketh partaking christ referreth whole force therof ye spirite yet stede many one place shalbe sufficient paule viii chapter romaine sayth christ dwelleth v none otherwise hys spirite wherby yet taketh away co munio flesh blood speake teacheth spirite alone worketh possesse whole christ haue dwelling v scholemen thought shamfastly withholde wt horror barbarous vngodlinesse yet thei also theselues nothing mocke sutteler deceites graunt christ coteined way circumscription bodily maner afterward inuent away neither selues vnderstande declare yet falleth point christ must sought forme bred call say substance bred turned christe doe fasten hym whytenesse leaue saye conteined sacrament abideth heauen determyne presence habitude whatsoeuer woordes bryng cloke deceitfull color thys ende consecration made christ bred yt thense fourth christ lieth hid vnder color bred also ashamed playne wordes expresse lib iiii dist wordes lombarde body christ selfe visible whe consecration ended lyeth hydden couered vnder forme bred forme bred nothyng ell visor taketh away sight fleshe eye neither nede many coniectures fynde snare mynded lay wordes sithe thing itselfe plainly speaketh seen howe great superstition certaine age past onely common sorte men also chefe haue ben holden thys daye holde popish chirches hauing litle care true fayth alone come felowship christ cleaue together hym haue carnall presence hym haue framed besyde worde thynke haue hym presente enough therefore summe see thys hath ben gotten thys witty sutteltie bred taken god fro hense proceded yt fayned transubstatiatio thys day fyght earnestly tha al article faith ye first bilders local presence could vnwynde themselues thys doute body christ mingled substance bread many absurdity thrust themselues place therfore driuen necessitie flee thys inuention made turning bred body body properly made bred christ mighte hide himselfe vnder forme bringeth substance nothing maruellous fel great ignorace yea senslesse dulnesse scripture also consent old chirch fighting brought abrode monster graunt dede yt olde writer somtyme vsed name turning would destroy substance outwarde signes might teache bred dedicate mysterie differeth farre common bred ech al plainly declare holy supper consisteth twoo partes earthly parte heauenly earthly part without controuersie expounde bred wyne truely whatsoever babble plain confirming doctrine want defense antiquitie whiche oftentymes presume set euident worde god long agoe sin inueted verily vnknowen better age purer doctrine religio yet florished also euen whe purenesse much defiled none olde writer doth expresse wordes cofesse holy signes ye supper bred wyne although haue sayd somtime set diuerse title aduaunce dignitie mysterie wheras say cosecration made secrete turning thing bred wyne haue euen geuen warning therby meane thinges themselues brought nought otherwise estemed common meates appointed onely fede belly forasmuch deliuered v ye spiritual meate drinke soule also deny say men turning must nedes one thing made thing meane thing made agree wil draw imagination let answere change thinke made baptisme herein father also determine maruellous turning say corruptible elemet made spiritual washing soule yet none denyeth water remayneth saye thing baptisme ye supper body though question wordes haue meaning plaine enough rather word turning ought signifie supper baptisme therefore farewel snare syllable wherby nothing el bewray hungrinesse otherwise ye significatio would agree together vnlesse trueth figured liuely image outwarde signe christes wil outward signe testifie hys fleshe meate set v empty imaginatiue forme bred true bread ye correlation similitude leade v fro visible thing inuisible al thinges may agree together signification shall extende fed forme fleshe christ baptisme forme water deceiue eye v certayne pledge washing yea deceitfull shewe geuen v occasion wauering therfore nature sacrament ouerthrowen vnlesse maner signifieng earthly signe answer heauenly thing therefore lose truth thys mysterie vnlesse true bred represent v true body christ repete againe sith supper nothing ell visible testifieng promise vi chapter iohn namely blasphemie without figure spoken fraile corruptible element christ aske whether twoo proposition bothe one effect christe sonne god bread body christe graunt diuers enforce graunte whether lett answere whens commeth difference thynke wyll bryng none bread sacramentall maner called body wherupon foloweth christes wordes subiecte common rule oughte bee tried grammer also aske precise stiffe requirers letter luke paule call cuppe testament bloodluc xxiixx cor xixxv whether expresse thyng dyd first parte call bread bodye truely religion one parte mysterie shortnesse darke longer speche fight haue warre spirite god howsoeuer cry oute touched reuerence wordes christ wherby figuratiuely vnderstande thynges playnly spoken yet pretence rightfull enoughe shoulde refuse reason whiche obiecte contrarie meane tyme haue already geuen warnyng conuenient learne maner thing testament body blood christ couenant stablished sacrifice death otherwise profit v vnlesse adioyned secrete communicatyng whereby growe one christe remaineth therfore affinitie thing signified haue signes confesse selfe name thing geuen signe figuratiuely dede without fitt proportionall agreement leaue lower contrariewise name visible signe also geuen thing signified sayd yt god appeared moses busheexod iiiii psalme lxxxiiiiviii xlii iii math iiixvi arke couenante called god face god doue called holy ghost though signe differ substance thing signified spirituall heauenly corporall visible yet doth figure thing whiche holily appointed represente naked empty token doth also truely deliuer dede may name thing rightly accorde signes deuised men whiche rather image thyngs absent markes thynges present selfe absent thynges oftentymes deceitfully shadow yet somtime garnished title thinges thinges ordeined god much greater reason borrow name thyngs alway bothe beare sure disceytfull signification haue truthe adioyned therfore great likenesse nerenesse one easy draw name froe therfore let aduersaries cesse heape vnsauory scoffing v calling v tropistes expounde sacramental maner speakyng common vse scripture whereas sacramentes agree together many thinges trasferryng name haue certaine communitie together therfore apostle teacheth stone spiritual drynke spring ye israelitesi cori xiiii christ visible signe vnder spirituall drinke truely dede discernably eie perceiued bread day called body christe forasmuche sygne whereby lorde offereth v true eatyng bodye neither dyd augustine otherwyse thynke speake least man shoulde despise newe inuention sayeth sacramentes hadde certaine likenesse thynges whereof sacramentes epi xxiii ad bonifac sacramentes likenesse oftentimes take name thing themselues therfore certaine maner sacramet body christ body christ sacrament blood christ blood christ ye sacramet faith faith many like place superfluous heape together sithe one suffiseth sauyng reader must warned holye man teacheth thyng epistle enodius trifling shift say augustine teacheth transferryng often commonly vsed mystery maketh mention supper shyft receiued myght reason generaltie specialtie neither good argument euery feling creature hath power mouing therfore oxe horse haue power mouyng howbeit long disputation hereof place ended wordes holy man sayth christ sticked call body gaue signe bodye adimantus manichean xii chapiter place vpon thirde psalme meruailous saieth patience christ receiued iudas banket wherein comitted deliuered disciple figure body blood precise man beyng blynde rest doo stand onely vpon worde though seuered mysterie solution easy saye vehemence substantiue verbe great admitteth figure graut euen wordes paule redde substantiue verbe calleth bread communicatyng body christei cor xxvi communicatyng thyng body selfe yea commonly sacramentes entreated fynde woorde vsedgen xvii xiii exod xiixliii cor x iiii iohn vii xxxix shall couenant lambe shall passeouer reherse moe paule sayth rocke christe take substantiue though toke beginnyng ascension christtit iiiv finally let answer meaneth sayeng paule baptisme washyng regeneration renewyng euidet vnprofitable many nothyng stroger confute themi cor xixii sayeng paule chirch christe bryngyng similitude body man addeth christ whiche place vnderstandeth onely begotten sonne god himselfe membres hereby thinke haue obteined soundwitted vncorrupted men sclaunders oure enemy lothsome spread abroade withdraw credit wordes christ whiche doo lesse obediently embrace wey godly reuerence yea negligent carelesnesse sheweth doo greatly care christe ment geue buckler defende obstinatie like oure earnest searchyng ought wytnesse howe muche esteeme authoritie christ odiously spread abrode naturall sense man withholdeth v beleuyng christ hath vttered owne holy mouth howe maliciously burden v sclander haue great part already made playne hereafter shall clerely appere therfore nothing withholdeth v beleuing christ speaketh obeying soone dothe becke question whether vnlawful enquire naturall meanyng good maisters may seme wel lettred forbid men departe neuer litle letter syde scripture nameth god warlike man see figuratiue translation rough maner speakyng doo dout yt comparison taken men truely vpon none pretence olde tyme anthropomorphites troubled true teaching father catching fast hold saying eies god see went vp eares hand stretched earth footestole cried god bodye taken hym whiche scripture assigneth vnto hym law receiued outragious barbarousnesse shal ouerwhelme whole light faith monster absurdity may phrentike men picke graunted allege euery small tittle stablishe opinion whiche obiect likely christ prepared apostle singular comfort aduersities speake riddle darkly maketh side come myndes apostle bread figuratiuely called body signe body without doute ben troubled monstrous thyng almost moment iohn reporteth sticke perplexitie euery least difficulty whiche striue among themselues howe christ go father moue question howe wyll goe worlde vnderstande nothyng thynges spoken concernyng heauenly father till see hym wold haue ben easy beleue whiche reso refuseth christ sitteth boorde sight enclosed inuisible vnder bread whereas therfore eatyng bread without doutyng testified consent hereby appeareth toke christes wordes sense remebred ought seme strange mystery name thing signified transferred signe therfore disciple v certaine clere comfort entangled riddle neither ther cause depart exposition enchauntment deuyll hath blynded namely shoulde faine darkenesse themselues exposition apt figure offreth self moreouer precisely stande vpon word christ shold wrongfully haue spoken one place seuerally thyng concernyng bread speaketh cup calleth bread body calleth wyne blood either shalbe confused vaine repetition shalbe partition shall diuide body blood yea shall truely sayd cuppe body bread selfe may likewyse enterchangeably sayd bread blood answer muste consider ende vse signes ordeined graunt dede meane tyme shall vnwynde themselues error must drawe absurditie bread blood wyne bodye nowe wote meaneth graunt bread body diuers thing yet affirme one spoken proprely without figure man shold say garment dede thyng differyng man yet proprely called man meane though victorie consisted obstinatie railing say christ accused lieg exposition sought wordes shalbe easy v shew reders vniust wrong catcher syllable v thei fill simple opinion withdraw credit wordes christ haue proued furiously peruerted confounded faithfully rightly expounded v sclaunder lye vtterly purged till crime wiped away spread abroade addicted naturall reason geue power god order nature suffreth common sense teacheth malicious sclauders appelle doctrine selfe haue declared whiche dothe clerely enough shewe measure mysterie proportion man reason doo make subiect lawes nature beseche haue learned naturall philosophie christe dothe heauen feede soules body fleshe body ar norished bread wyne whens cometh power fleshe may geue lyfe men say doone naturally please man reason fleshe christe reacheth v maye foode vnto v finally whosoeuer hath tasted doctrine shalbe rauished admiration secrete power god good men zelous forge themselues miracle beyng taken away god hymselfe vanisheth power desire haue reader one agayne warned diligently wey doctrine bringeth whether hang vpon common sense winges faith surmounting worlde climbeth vp beyond heauens say christ well outwarde signe spirite descendeth v may truely quicken soules substance fleshe blood fewe wordes perceyueth conteined many miracle senslesse forasmuche nothyng beside nature soules borrow spiritual heauenly life fleshe toke beginnyng earth subiect death nothing incredible thinges distant asunder whole space heauen earth shold great distance place conioyned also vnited soules may receiue foode fleshe christe therfore let waiward men cesse procure hatred v filthy sclaunder though enuiously restraine thyng immeasurable power god either foolishly erre maliciously lye question god couldeheb iiiixv woulde affirme bee done pleased hym pleased hym christ shold made like brother thyngs except synne maner thyng fleshe suche consisteth certaine measure conteined place touched seen say may god make one selfe fleshe may occupie many diuers place may conteined place may without measure forme thou madde man requirest thou power god make fleshe one selfe tyme fleshe like thou sholdest instantly require hym make one self tyme light bothe light darknesse willeth light light darknesse darknesse fleshe fleshe shall deede pleaseth hym turne darknesse lyght lyght darknesse wen thou requirest lyght darknesse may differ doest thou el peruert order wisdome god therefore fleshe must fleshe spirite spirite euery thyng suche lawe condition god hath created suche condition fleshe muste one yea certaine place consist measure forme epi ad darda thys condition christ toke fleshe vpon whiche augustine witnesseth hath geuen dede vncorruption glorye hath taken nature truth answer haue worde whereby god made playne namely graunted banish chirch gifte exposition whiche may bring lighte worde graunt haue worde suche olde tyme anthropomorphites made god hauing body suche marcion manichee fayned body christ eyther heauenly fantasticalli cor xvxlvii alleged testimony firste adam earth earthly seconde adam heauen heaue ly againe christ abaced himselfe taking vpon forme seruant founde likenesse maphi iivii grosse eater think power god vnlesse monster forged braines whole order nature ouerthrowen whiche rather limit god couet fained inuetions proue worde haue taken body christe visible heauen lurketh inuisible earth vnder innumerable litle peces bred wil say necessitie requireth body christe geuen supper uerily pleased gather fleshly eating wordes christ caried away owne foreiugement driuen necessitie coine sutteltie whole scripture crieth thing v diminished power god false doctrine prayse honorably set forasmuche alway accuse v defraude god hys honor refuse whiche according common sense hard beleued although haue ben promised mouth christ make againe answere made euen nowe mystery fayth doe aske counsell common sense quiet willingnesse learneiam ixxi spirite mekenesse whiche iames commendeth receiue doctrine come heauen perniciously erre deny followe profitable moderation hearing wordes christe thys bodye imagine miracle moste farre hys mynde thys fayned inuention aryse fowle absurdity haue allready hedlong hast put snare vpon themselues plunge themselues bottomlesse depthe almightinesse god thys meane may quenche lyght truthe hereupon commeth proude precisenesse knowe howe christe lyeth hydde vnder bred holdyng selues cotented thys saying hys body doe whole scripture doe lesse obedience care studye obteyne sounde vnderstanding thys place neither doe preposterous heate rashly without choise catch holde first thrusteth selfe myndes vsing diligent musing vpon embrace meaning whiche spirite god ministreth standing thereupon doe alofte despise whatsoeuer earthly wisdome set yea holde myndes captiue may bolde muche one litle worde carpe humble maye dare rise vp hereupon sprong vp exposition woordes christ continual vsage scripture common al sacramentes al haue ben though meanely exercysed therinluke ixxxiiii knowe neither exaple holy virgin thynke lawful v hard mater enquire may done nothing shal auaile confirme fayth godly haue learned doctrine whiche haue taughte taken worde god standeth vpon authoritie thereof make also euident greate brefenesse body christ sin tyme tha rose agayne aristotle holy ghost teacheth limited compreheded heauen vntill laste day neither ignorante boldly mock place alleged thys purpose oft christ sayth wil departeioh xiiiixxii xxviii leauing world answer departing nothing ell changing mortall state manner christe shoulde set holy ghost hys place supplye call wante hys absence forasmuche doth succede place christ himselfe doth descende oute heauenly glorye take vppon hym state mortall lyfe truely commyng holy ghost ascending christe thynges set contrarie therefore yt christe according fleshe dwel v manner sendeth spiritemat xxvixi moreouer playne wordes expresseth alway hys disciple worlde thys saying also thynke gayly wype awaye though christ sayd wil alway poore miserable subiect necessity thys frayle lyfe circumstance place cryeth playnly contrarie entreated pouertie nede miserable state earthly life worship honor anointing pleased disciple thought superfluous vnprofitable cost nere vnto riotous excesse therefore rather price thereof thought il wasted ben bestowed vppon poore trac iohn l christ answereth shall alway present maye worshipped suche honor none otherwise augustine expounde whoes wordes nothyng doutefull christ sayd ye shal alway haue spake presence body according maiestie accordyng hys prouidence according hys vnspeakable inuisible grace thys fulfilled sayd beholde euen ending worldemathew xxviiix according fleshe worde toke vnto hym according thys borne uirgin according thys taken iewes fastened tree taken downe crosse wrapped linnen clothes layed graue manifestly shewed resurrection thys fulfilled ye shall alwaye haue conuersante accordinge presence hys bodye forty dayes wyth hys disciple whyle accompanyed hym seynge folowing ascended sitteth right hande father yet gone awaye presence maiestie otherwyse according presence maiesty haue christ alway according presence fleshe rightly sayd ye shal alway haue according presence fleshe chirch fewe dayes nowe holdeth hym fayth seeth eye may note thys also brefely maketh hym presente v three wayes maiestie prouidence vnspeakable grace vnder whiche comprehend maruelous communio hys body blood vnderstande done power holy ghost fayned enclosing body vnder elemente lord hath testified hath fleshe bone may felt seen go away ascende doe signifie make shewe one ascending going awaye lib de fide symb cap vi doe dede whiche woordes sounde shall man saye assigne christe certaine coast heauen answere augustine moste curious superfluous question yet beleue heauen doth name ascending oft repeted doth signifie remouing one place denye opinion heighth onely signified maiestie empire meaneth manner ascending sight disciple loking onactes ii mark xvi xix lu xxiiiili lifted vp hye doe euangelistes plainly declare taken vp ye heauens witty sophisters answere cloude set betwene conueyed sight faithfull might learne thense fourth visible world though make credit inuisible presence ought rather vanishe away moment though cloude ought rather compasse stirred foote carried vp hye ye ayre cloude cast vnderneth hym teacheth soughte earth safely gather hath hys dwelling place heauensphi iii paule also affirmeth thense biddeth v loke hym maner angel warned disciple vaine gazed vp heauen iesus taken vp heauen shall come haue seen goe vp also aduersaries sounde doctrine starte awaye pleasante shifte thynke sayeng shall come visible neuer wente earth abideth inuisible hys though angells signifie double presence simply make disciple witness going vp seing eye douting mighte remayne euen sayd sightes beholding take vp heauen hath claymed hymselfe heauenly empire remayneth ye paciently abide expectation till come againe iudge world nowe entred heauen may alone possesse maye gather together godly forasmuche defender bastarde doctrine ashamed garnishe consenting voyces olde wryters specially augustine fewe wordes declare peruersly goe aboute whereas testimony haue ben gathered together learned godly men doe thing alredy done let hym seke oute workes wil heape together neyther augustine hymselfe al might make purpose contente shewe fewe without controuersie whole side aduersaries writhe v ad boni fac epi xxv doe allege commonly red bookes flesh blood christ distributed supper namely sacrifice one offred crosse trifling sithe also calleth eyther thankesgeuing sacramente body sense vseth woordes fleshe blood nede seke long compassing forasmuche declareth himselfe sayeng sacramentes take name likenesse thinges whiche signifie therefore certaine manner sacramente body body contra adama manich lib xii wherewith accordeth place whiche well enough knowen lorde sticked saye body gaue signe againe obiect augustine writeth expresly body christe falleth grounde entreth mouth euen sense affirmeth consumed ioyneth bothe together neither doth make contrarie whiche sayth whe mysterie ended bred consumed lib iii de trini cap x litle sayd sithe thinges knowen men forasmuche done may haue honor thing maruelous thing may ende tendeth aduersaries doe vnaduisedly draw themselues christ certaine manner beare hymselfe owne handes reached mysticall bred disciple enterlacing aduerbe likenesse certaine manner sufficiently declareth truely really enclosed vnder b edin psal xxxiii maruell sithe place plainly affirmeth body space place taken shalbe shalbe shal al hungry cauillation say place entreated supper god vttereth speciall power question moued concerning fleshe christe holy man set purpose answering sayth pi dar christ gaue immortalitie hys fleshe toke nature forme thought eche spred abrode must beware doe affirme godhed man take away truth body foloweth whiche god muste eche god reson added one person god man one christ eche thys god heauen thys man negligece ben excepte mysterie supper beyng thing earnest weyghty ben thing doctrine entreated yet man doe hedefully rede foloweth within litle shal fynde vnder general doctrine supper also comprehended christ onely begotten sonne god sonne man eche whole present god temple god chirch god dwelling certaine place heauen reason measure hys true body see howe vniting christe chirch doth christ maye lurke hidden vnder bredmat xxvixi sitteth visible heaue nede plainer declaratio added place according presece maiestie alway haue christ according presence fleshemathew xxviiixx rightly sayed ye shal alwaye haue answere thys also added according vnspeakable inuisible grace fulfilled sayd hym euen vnto ending worlde nothing auantage length restrayned hys maiestie euer comparison set body hys fleshe expresse name made differet grace power place comparison contrary red christe bodily presence left disciple spirituall presence maye bee stil playne substance fleshe distinguished power spirite conioyneth v christ though otherwise farre seuered distance place maner speaking oftentimes vseth sayth come againe quicke dead bodily presence according rule fayth sounde doctrine spirituall presence also come abide whole chirch world vntill ending world therefore thys speche directed beleuers whome already begonne saue bodily presence leaue bodily absence mighte hys father saue spirituall presence take bodily visible trifling sithe setteth also body coparison diuine power adding saue father clearely expresseth doth poure abrode grace heauen v hys spirite sithe putt muche confidence thys lurkyng hole inuisible presence goe lett v see well hyde themselues firste shall bryng fourth one syllable oute scripture wherby maye proue christe inuisible take confessed whiche man hath sounde witt graunte body christe otherwise geuen supper couered visor bred pointe aboute whiche striue v farr hauyng place principle babble compelled make double body christe opinion selfe visible heauen inuisible supper special maner dispensation trimly agreeth easy iudge place scripture witnesse peteract iiixxi peter sayth christ must holden conteined heauen til come againe teache euery without forme take exception say vniuste dealing make nature glorified body subiect lawes common nature answere draweth doting error seruettus worthily abhorred godly body swallowed vp nature hys body must faine coyne new definition bodyph iiixxi whether soeuer turne themselues fained dispensation hath place place paule sayth loke sauior heauen shall fashion base body lyke glorious body may hope like fashioning quality faine christ euery one haue inuisible vnmeasurable body neither shall founde man dull witted may make beleue great absurdity let therfore ascribe gift christes hope oure resurrection ascending heauen christe rysen againe ascended tertullian sayth carryed earnest resurrection heauens nowe weake fraile hope vnlesse selfe flesh ben raysed vp christ entred kingdome heauen propre trueth body conteined space cosist mesured proportion haue forme therfore away folish deuise doth fasten bothe mindes men christ bred purpose serueth secret presece vnder bred make hast kisse fete cause shold disalow forbid touching til haue ben taken vp heauen wil sought ellsac viilvi wheras obiect afterwarde seen stephen solution easy neither therfore necessarie christ disciple dores shut maketh neuer whit maintenance error water like fast pauemet made way christ walking vpon lake maruel comming hardnesse stone yelded selfe howbeit prouable commaundement stone remoued passage geuen hym returned place enter dores shut asmuch effect pearce whole substance diuine power open entrie himselfe sodenly stode among disciple verily maruelous maner whe dores fast lockedlu xxiiiixxxi whiche allege luke christ sodenly vanished away eye disciple went emaus profiteth nothing maketh v might take away sight himselfe made inuisiblelu xxiiiixvi went sight went iourney
