fleshe christe spirite contented therewith put vpon altogether contrarie quality wherupon necessitie foloweth doble although graunt prate inuisible presece vnmesurablenesse shal yet proued without shal vayne attempt enclose christ vnder bred unlesse body christ may euery one without copasse place shall likely lyeth hidden vnder bred supper necessitie brought monstruous beyng euery shewed strong plaine witness scripture limited measure body man ascending hath made plaine place passeth one place leaueth neither promise allege drawe ye body euen ending worldmathe xxviiixx first continuall co ioyning stande vnlesse christ dwel v corporally without ye vse supper therfore iust cause shoulde sharply brawle wordes christ may supper enclose christ vnder bred againe text selfe proueth yt christe speaketh nothing lesse fleshe promiseth disciple inuicible helpe wherby may defende susteine assaultes satan worlde enioyned hard charge least dout take hande ferefully execute strengtheneth affiance presence said succor shal faile shalbe impossible ouercome unlesse listed confounde thinges ought haue made distinction maner presence verily rather great shame vtter ignorance yelde neuer litle error speake papistes whoes doctrine tolerable least shamefast contentiousnesse carrieth away say reson nature vnited christ wheresoeuer godhed christ also fleshe seuered hys godhed though vniting haue compounded twoo nature wote meane thing neither god man dede eutyches hym seruettus plainly gathered scripture one person christ doth consist twoo nature either hath still owne propertie remayning safe eutyches rightfully condemned wil ashamed deny maruel marke cause hys condemning takyng away difference betwene nature enforcing vnitie perso made god man man god madnesse therefore rather mingle heauen earth together draw body christ heauenly sancturarie wheras bring themselues testimoniesioh iii xiii ioh ixviii none gone vp heauen come sonne man heauen againe sonne bosome father shall declare poynt like senslesse dullnesse despise communicating property olde tyme without cause inueted holy father truelyi cori iiviii lord glory said crucified paule doth meane suffred thig godhed ye christ abiect despised flesh suffer god lord glory thys manner also sonne man heauen selfe christ according fleshe dwel sonne man earth god heauen sorte sayd haue descended sayd place according hys godhed godhed forsake heauen hide selfe prison body although fylled thynges yet verye mahode christ dwelled corporally say naturally certaine vnspeakable maner comon distinction scholes ashamed reherse although whole christ euery yet whole hym euery wold god scholemen themselues wel weyed pith thys sayeng vnsauorie inuention fleshly presece christ haue ben met withall therefore mediator sithe whole euery alway hande supper speciall maner geueth himselfe present yet whole present whole said fleshe conteined heauen till appeare iudgement farre deceiued conceiue presence fleshe christ supper vnlesse made present bread leaue nothyng secrete workyng spirite whiche vniteth christ hymself vnto v thinke christ present vnlesse come downe v though lift v vp hym aswel enioy presence therfore question maner place christ bread think lawful v pluck hym heauen let reader iudge whether righter let cauillation driuen away christe taken awaye supper vnlesse hidden vnder couer bread sith mysterie heauenly nede drawe christ earth may ioyned v nowe man aske maner ashamed confesse hyer secrete eyther coprehended witt vttered woordes speake plainly rather fele vnderstand therfore herein without controuersie embrace truthe god whiche maye safely rest pronounceth fleshe meate soule blood drinke suche foode offre soule hym bee fedde holy supper commaundeth vnder signes bread wyne take eate drinke body blood nothing dout bothe dothe truely deliuer doo receiue onely refuse absurdity whiche appeare either vnworthy heauenly maiestie christ disagreyng truth nature manhode forasmuche must also fight word god also teacheth christ taken vp glorie heauenly kyngdome lyfteth hym vp aboue estate worldelu xxiiii xxvi lesse diligently setteth forth nature man thynges proprely belongyng true manhode neither ought seme incredible consonant reason whole kyngdome christ spirituall whatsoeuer doth chirch ought reduced reason worlde may vse wordes augustine mysterie done men iren lib iiii cap xxiiii god earth heauen say presence body nature sacrament requireth say excell great force great effectualnesse bryngeth myndes vndouted trust eternall lyfe also assureth v immortalitie fleshe nowe quickned immortall fleshe certaine manner communicateth immortalitie whyche caried aboue excessiue speches nothyng suche entanglementes darken simple playne truthe yet satisfied wold haue hym whyle consider speake sacrament partes wherof ought referred faith lesse deintyly plentifully feede faith partakyng bodye haue declared plucke christe hymselfe oute heauen meane tyme plainly confesse refuse mixture fleshe christ soule pouryng suche teache suffiseth v christ dothe substance fleshe breathe life soules yea doth poure v owne lyfe although flesh christ doth entre v moreouer doute proportion faith whereby paule willeth v examine exposition scripturerom xiiiii dothe behalfe well agree speake agaynst euident truthe let looke rule faith fashion themselues dothe confesse iesus christ come flesheii iohn vii god men althoughe cloke marke doo spoile hym fleshe communicatyng likewise thought whiche acknowlege none vnlesse deuoure fleshe christe vnder bread small wrong done holy ghost vnlesse beleue brought passe incomprehensible power communicate fleshe blood christ yea force mysterie taught v knowen old chirch fower hundred yeres agoe weyed accordyng worthinesse enough wherupon myght satisfied gate ben shut many fowle error haue ben kindled many horrible dissension wherwith olde tyme age chirche hath ben miserably vexed curious men enforce excessiue maner presence scripture neuer sheweth turmoyle aboute thyng fondly rashely conceiued enclosyng christ vnder bread prouerbe prowe poupe godlinesse principally behoued know howe body christ one deliuered v made made partaker blood shedde possesse whole christ crucified may enioy good thyngs nowe thynges great importance beyng omitted yea neglected maner buried onely crabbed question pleaseth howe body christ lieth hidde vnder bread vnder forme bread falsly spread abrode whatsoeuer teache concernyng spirituall eatyng contrarie true eatyng call haue respecte nothyng maner among carnall whyle enclose christ bread v spirituall secrete power spirite bonde conioynyng christ truer obiection touche onely frute effecte faithfull take eating fleshe christ haue said christ himselfe substance supper therupon foloweth effect sacrifice death ar cleansed sinnes blood washed resurrection raised vp hope heauenly lyfe foolishe imagination whereof lombarde author hath peruerted myndes thinke eating fleshe christ sacrament thus sayth sacrament thyng formes bread wyne lib sacrament thyng fleshe blood christe thyng sacrament mysticall fleshe agayne within littell thyng signified conteined propre fleshe christ thyng signified conteyned mysticall body wheras maketh difference betwene fleshe christ effectual power norishyng wherwith endued agree whereas faineth sacrament yea conteined vnder bread error suffred hereupon hath growen false exposition sacramentall eatyng haue thought wicked men also euell doer doo eate fleshe christ howe muche soeuer bee stranger hym fleshe christ selfe mysterie supper lesse spirituall thyng eternall saluation wherupon gather whosoeuer voide spirite christ eate fleshe christ drinke wine wherwith ioyned taste truely christ haynously torne sonder dead body hath lyuely strength geuen foorth common vnbeleuers expresse wordes directly whosoeuer eateth fleshe drinketh bloodiohn vilvi abideth hym answer place entreated sacramental eatyng graunt wyll nowe stomble agaynst stone sayeng fleshe selfe eaten without fruite would knowe howe long hold haue eaten iudgement shall haue waye gett obiect nothyng bee withdrawen faile promise god vnthankfulnesse men graunt dede say force mysterie remaineth whole howsoeuer wicked men doo muche lyeth endeuor make voyde yet one thyng offred thyng receiued christ reacheth spirituall meate offreth spirituall drinke men gredily eate lothingly refuse shall men refusyng make meate drynke lose nature wil say opinio holpen similitude namely fleshe christ though vnsauorie neuerthelesse fleshe denie eaten without taste faith list rather speake augustine doth say men beare away sacramet tha thei gather vessel faith nothing abated sacrament yea truth effectualnesse therof remaineth vnminished although wicked depart emptie fro outward partakyng agayne obiect worde bodye diminished wicked receiue corruptible bread nothyng ell haue solution ready god acknowen true receiuyng selfe stedfastnesse owne goodnesse ready geue yea liberally offreth vnworthy whiche refuse fulnesse sacrament ye whole world breake flesh blood christ lesse geuen vnworthy chosen faithfull one god therewithall true water lightyng vpon hard stone falleth away entrie open stone wicked hardnesse driue back grace god ca perce moreouer christ receiued without faith agreeyng reason sede bud fyre wheras aske christe come damnation vnlesse receiue vnworthily cold question forasmuch rede procure death themselues vnworthily receiuyng christe rather refusing neither doth christes parable helpe saith sede groweth vp among thornesmat xiiivii afterwarde beyng choked marred entreateth value faith whiche endureth tyme think necessary eatyng christes flesh drinkyng blood behalfe make iudas egally felow peter rather parable error cofuted christ saith yt sede falleth hie waie vpon stone neither taketh roote wherupo foloweth vnbeleuers owne hardnesse let ye christ atteineth whosoeuer desireth haue saluation holpen mysterie shall fynde nothyng fitter faithfull led fountaine shold draw life sone god dignitie honorably enough set keepe mynde helpe wherby graffed body christ beyng graffed growe together till fully make hymself one v heauenly lyfe obiect paule ought haue made giltie body blood christ vnlesse wer partaker themi cor xixxix answer ar therfore condemned haue eaten haue prophaned mysterie treadyng vnder feete pledge holye conioynyng god ought reuerently receiue augustine among old writer chiefly hath affirmed article doctrine nothyng abated sacrament grace figure made void infidelite noughtinesse men shalbe profitable proue clerely owne wordes vnfittly peruersly draw present cause cast body christ dogges eate sacramentall eating opinion wherby wicked receiue body blood christ without ye power spirit effect grace augustine cotrariwise weyeng wisely word homil ioha xxvi ioh vil eateth flesh drinketh blood shal die euer saieth namely power sacrament visible sacrament verily within without yt eateth wt harte yt presseth tooth whereupon length concludeth sacramet thing say vnitie body blood christ set men supper lorde vnto life vnto destruction thing selfe wherof sacrament al men vnto life none vnto destruction whosoeuer partaker none shold cauill thing called body grace spirit may seuered fro body cotrarie comparison betwene two wordes addition uisible inuisible driueth away al mystes vnder first coprehended body christ wherupon foloweth yt vnbeleuers communicate ye visible signe yt al douting may better taken away yt said yt bread requireth hunger inward man addeth moses aaron phinees many dyd eate mannaexod xvi xiiii pleased god spirituall meate spiritually vnderstoode spiritually hungred spirituallye tasted myghte bee spiritually fylled also daye haue receiued spiritual meat sacrament one thyng power sacrament litle abideth christ christ abideth without doute neither eateth spiritually fleshe drinketh blood though carnally visibly presseth teeth signe body blood heare agayne visible signe set coparison contrary spiritual eating wherby ye error cofuted body christ inuisible dede eaten sacrametally though spiritually heare also nothing grauted prophane vncleane beside visible receiuyng signe homil ioh lix hereupon cometh famous sayeng yt disciple eate bred ye lord iudas eate ye bread ye lord wherin plainly excludeth ye vnbeleuers fro partakyng ye body blood neither tendeth end sayth place homil lxii cor xivii lib v de bapt co tra cor xixxix meruailest thou iudas geue bread christ might made bond deuel thou seest co trary side paul geuen angel deuell whome might made perfect christ saith verily place bread supper ye body christ paule said eateth vnworthily eateth drinketh iugement himselfe haue therfore nothyng haue receiued noughtily sense declareth fully place takyng hand purposely define howe wicked euell doer professe christian faith mouth dedes deny eate body christ opinion thought thei eate sacramet dede neither saith ought said eate ye body christ thei ar reckned among membres christ speake nothing rest together ye mebers christ membres harlotiohn vixxiii lib de xxi capi xxv finally himselfe saith eateth fleshe drinketh blood abideth hym sheweth sacramentally dede eate bodye christ abide christ christ may abyde sayd though sayde abydeth abide let hym say thinke dothe eate body drynke blood let reader weye thynges sett contrary comparison eate sacrametally uery dede shall remaine dout confirmeth lesse plainly wordes prepare iawes hart herupon supper commended loe beleue christ receiue faith receiuyng know thinke receiue little fatted hart therfore sene beleued dothe fede also whiche wicked receiue restraineth visible signe teacheth christ none otherwise receiued faith also place pronoucyng expressly good euell communicate together signes co lib xiii capi xvi serm de apost excludeth euell true eatyng fleshe christ receyued thing self wold vtterly haue left vnspoken fitt mater also place entreating eatyng frute therof concludeth thus shall body blood christ life euery man sacrament visibly receiued truth selfe spiritually eaten spiritually drok therfore whoso make vnbeleuers partaker fleshe blood christ may agree augustine let shewe v visible body christ forasmuche iudgement whole truthe spirituall certainly gathered wordes sacramentall eatyng vnbelefe closeth vp entrie truthe much effect visible outward eatyng body christ might eaten truely yet spiritually shold meane whiche sayth place psal x iii ye shall eate body ye see drinke blood shall shedde shall crucifie haue comme ded certaine sacrament vnto beeyng spiritually vnderstanded shall quicken uerily woulde denie body christ offred sacrifice deliuered supper dyd set maner eatyng namely receiued heauenly glorie secrete power spirite breatheth lyfe v graunt dede oftentymes founde hym maner speakyng homil ioha xxvii body christ eaten vnbeleuers expoundeth himselfe addyng sacramente place describeth spirituall eating whiche biringes consume grace least myne aduersaries saye fighte heape place wold know vnwynde themselues one saieng saith sacrament worke elect figure truely dare denye bred supper figureth body christ wherupon foloweth reprobate debarred partakyng cyrill also thought none otherwise vi iohan cap xvii wordes doo declare man vpon molten waxe poure waxe wholly tempereth one waxe necessary man receiue fleshe blood lorde ioyned hym christe may founde hym christ wordes thinke euident ar bereued true real eatyng sacramentally eate body christ seuered power therfore faileth faith promise god cesseth rayne heauen although stone rockes conceiue liquor raine knowledge shall also easily drawe v away carnal worshipping whiche haue peruerse rashnesse erected sacrament made accompt themselues maner body bothe soule godhead together body seuered therfore christe worshipped first accompanieng whiche thei pretende denied much soeuer crie vpon absurditie body seuered soule godhed yet soudwitted sobre man persuade body christ christ thinke themselues dede gaily proue logicall argumentes sith christ speaketh distinctly body blood describeth maner presence doutfull thing gather certainly would conscience chance exercised wt greuous felyng shal logicall argument dissolued melt namely shall see themselues destitute certaine word god vpon alone soules stand fast called accompt without faint euery first moment thei shal call mynde doctrine exaples apostle themselues alone ar themselues author suche motion shalbe added small prickynges shall mater importance worship god forme nothyng prescribed vnto v concerned true worshyp god ought great lightnesse haue attepted red one word humblenesse ought holden thoughtes vnder word god wold truly haue harkened said take eate drinke wold haue obeyed comaundement wherin biddeth sacrament receiued worshipped co maunded god receiue without worshippyng assured swarue god comaudement assurednesse nothing better take worke hande haue example apostle reade haue fallen downe flatt worshipped euen sitting haue receiued eaten itact iiiiii haue vse apostolike chirch wherin luke reporteth faithfull communicate woorshyppyng breakyng breadi cor xii haue apostle doctrine wherwith paule instructed chirch corynthians professyng receiued lorde whiche deliuered thyngs verily tend end godly reader shold wey perillous hye matter wander fro simple worde god dreames owne braine thyngs aboue said ought deliuer v doute behalfe godly soules may therin rightly take hold christ must nedes lifted vp heauen office sacrament help ye mynd man whiche otherwise weake may rise vpwarde reache height spirituall mystery holden downe outwarde signe stray right way sekyng christ shall denie superstitious worshippyng men throwe themselues downe bread worship christe therein doutlesse ye nicene synode meant mete wt mischiefe whe forbade v hubly intentiue ye signes set v sursum corda none cause olde tyme ordeined consecration people shold loude voice put mynde haue harte lifted vpward scripture selfe also beside diligently declareth vnto v ascension christcoloss iiiii wherby conueyed away presence body sight conuersation shake away v carnal thinkyng hym oft maketh mention comau deth v myndes raised vpward seke heauen sittyng right hand father according rule rather spiritually worshipped heauely glorie tha perillous kinde worshippyng deuised full carnall grosse opinion god wherfore thei yt haue inueted ye worshipping ye sacramet haue dreamed theselues beside ye scripture mention shewed yet shold haue ben ouerpassed ben acceptable god also al ye scripture crieng haue framed theselues god ye wil lust leauing ye liuing god idolatry worship gift stede geuer wherin haue doblely offended ye honor taken fro god conueyed creature also dishonored defilyng prophanyng benefite holy sacramet made cursed idole let v contrarywise least fall pit throughly settle eares eies harte myndes tonges holy doctrine god schole holy ghost best scholemaister whiche suche profite atteined nothing nede gotten ell willingly ought ignorant whatsoeuer taught nowe superstition hath one passed right boundes maketh end sinning thei fel great wai thei haue deuised ceremony altogether strange fro institutio ye supper end yt might geue diuine honor signe yelde say worship christ first wer done supper wold say worshipping lawfull resteth ye signe directed christ sittyng heauen pretense bost yt worship christ bread whe thei haue promise therof consecrate host call may carie pompe may shew foorth comon gazing loked vpon worshipped called vpon aske power think rightly cosecrate uerily wil bring forth word body obiect cotrary yt therwithall said take eate neither nothing whe promise knit comaudement say yt promise conteined vnder ye comaundement seuered made promise shalbe made plainer like exaple god gaue comaundement saidpsalm lxv call vpon added promise wil heare thee calling vpon peter paule glorie vpon promise wil al crie doth wrongfully thing pray leauing comaudement concernyng eatyng catch hold maimed promise body abuse strange ceremony institution christ let v therfore remembre promise geuen kepe comaundement ioined yt destitute word remoue sacrament way haue heretofore entreated mysterie holy supper serueth faith god forasmuch lord doth bring remembrance great largesse bou tie haue shewed doth hande hande bring foorth stirreth v acknowlege doth therwithal warne v yt vnthakfull pletiful liberalitie rather yt shold publishe praise mete aduance thankesgeuyng therfore deliuered institution sacramet self apostlesluc xxiixix cor xixxvi taught doo remembrance paul expoudeth declare lord death publikely altogether one mouth opely confesse yt al affiance life saluatio reposed death ye lord yt may glorifie wt cofessio may exaple exhorte geue glory againe appeareth wherunto ye marke thys sacramet directed namely exercise v ye remebrance death christ commaunded declare lordes death tyll come iudge nothing ell publishe co fessio mouth fayth hath acknowleged sacramet death christ life seconde vse sacrament perteineth ourwarde confession thirdly lorde also willed v stede exhortatio none vehemetly encourage enflame v bothe purenesse holinesse life also charitie peace agreement lord doth therin communicate body v made throughly one v sithe hath one body whereof maketh v partaker necessarie al also partaking made one body whiche vnitie bred deliuered sacrament representeth made many graynes sort mingled together one discerned manner also oughte conioyned knitt together great agreement myndes disagreement diuision come betwene vsi cor xxvi rather expressed paules wordes cup blessing sayth blesse communicating blood christ bred blessing breake partaking body christ therefore al one body partake one bread shall haue well profited sacramet thought shalbe emprinted engrauen mindes none brother hurt despised refused abused wise offended v therewithal hurt despise abuse christ wt iniurious dealinges yt disagree brother muste therewithall disagree christe christe loued v muste loued oure brother care haue oure body also ought haue brother whiche member body part bodi touched wt ani felig grefe whiche spred abrode al partes must suffer brother greued euill wherof shoulde also touched wt copassion therfore augustine wtout cause oft calleth thys sacramet ye bonde charitie sharper spur could put v stirre vp mutual charitie amog v tha whe christ geuing himselfe v doth allure v wt hys owne exaple yt shoulde mutually dedicate deliuer selues one much maketh himselfe common al maketh al v also one himselfe hereby well confirmed whiche haue sayd place true ministration sacramente standeth without worde whatsoeuer profit commeth v supper requireth worde whether cofirmed faith exercised confessio stirred vp dutie praier nedeful therfore nothing disorderly done supper turned dumme actio hath ben done vnder tyranny pope would haue whole force consecration hang vpon ye intent ye prest though nothing perteined ye people behoued yt mysterie shoulde declared therupon hath growen error yt marked promise wherwt consecration made directed ye elemetes selues receiue christe speaketh bred may made body comaudeth disciple eate promiseth communicating hys body blood none order doth paul teach yt together wt bred cup promise offred faythful thus truely ought imagine magical enchauntment yt sufficient haue mubled vp ye wordes though ye elemetes heare let v vnderstande yt wordes liuely preaching whiche maye edifie ye hearer may inwardly pearce myndes whiche may emprinted settled harte maye shewe fourth effectualnesse ye fulfilling yt promiseth reason clerely appeareth yt layeng vp ye sacramet many earnestly require yt may extraordinarily distributed sicke vnprofitable either shal receiue wtout rehersing ye institutio christe ye minister shall together wt signe ioyne ye true declaration ye mysterie silence abuse fault ye promise rehersed ye mysterie declared yt shal receiue maye receiue frute cause shoulde doute thys true consecration ende wil consecration come force wherof commeth farr sicke men doe haue example olde chirch graunt great mater erre without greate danger nothing safer folow truth selfe see thys holy bred supper lord spiritual meate lesse swete delicate healthful ye godly worshipper god ye taste wherof fele ye christ lyfe rayseth vp thankesgeuing whome exhortation mutuall charitie among themselues side turned moste noysome poyson whoes fayth doth nourishe confirme doth stirre vp confession praise charitie bodily meate fyndeth stomach possessed wt euill humor selfe also therby made euil corrupted doth rather hurt nourish thys spiritual meate lighte vpon soule defiled malice noughtinesse throweth hedlong wyth greater fal verily ye fault ye meate selfe defyled vnbeleuing nothing cleane though otherwise neuer muche sanctified blessing lordetit ixv cor xixxix paule sayth eate drynke vnworthily gylty body blood lorde eate drinke iugement themselues discerning body lorde suche kynde men without sparcle fayth without zele charitie thrust theselues fourth lyke swyne take supper lorde doe discerne bodye lorde insomuche doe beleue body life doe muche lyeth dishonor spoiling al dignitie therof finally receiuing prophane defyle much estranged disagreyng brother dare myngle holye sygne bodye christe disagreementes thanke body christ rent sonder limmemeale torne peces vnworthily gyltie body blood lorde whiche vngodlinesse ful sacrilege fowly defile therfore thys vnworthy eating take themselues damnation wheras haue fayth reposed christ yet receiuing sacramente professe saluation ell tha forswere al affiance wherefore themselues accuser themselues themselues pronounce witnesse againste themselues themselues seale damnation againe hatred euil wil diuided drawen soder brother member christe haue parte christi cor xixxviii yet testifie saluation comunicate christe made one cause paule commaundeth man proue himselfe eate bred drinke cup wherby expounde meant euery man descende himselfe weye himselfe whether doe inwarde affiance hart rest vpon saluatio christ hath purchaced whether acknowlege confession mouth whether desirous endeuor innocence holinesse aspire folowing christ whether example redy geue himselfe brother comunicate himselfe hath christ common hym whether himselfe accompted christ likewise behalfe take al brother member body whether couet cherishe defende helpe member duty fayth charitie perfect v ought endeuor desire long towarde yt may daily encrease fayth begonne commonly goe prepare men worthinesse eating haue cruell wise tormented vexed poore conscience yet brought neuer whit thinges myghte serue purpose sayd eate worthily state grace state grace expounded pure cleansed al sinne doctrine men euer haue time ben earth debarred vse thys sacramente goe fetche worthinesse selues vtterly vndone onely despeire damnable ruine abideth v though endeuor whole stregthes shall nothing preuaile last shalbe vnworthy haue trauailed seking worthinesse salue sore haue deuised way attaine worthinesse much v lieth making examination requiring selues accompt al doinges shold contrition confession satisfaction cleanse vnworthinesse way clensing maner thing haue alredy shewed conuenient place speake much serueth present purpose saye hugry vanishing comfortes dismaied discouraged conscience suche striken horror sinne lorde speciall forbidding admitteth none partaking supper righteous innocente nedeth small hede may make man assured righteousnesse heareth required god whereby assurednesse confirmed vnto v discharged afore god haue done muche lay although yet shall man may bolde assure himselfe hath doone muche lay made certaine assurance worthinesse entrie shal alway remaine shut horrible forbidding whereby pronounced eate drinke iudgemet themselues eate drinke vnworthily nowe easy iudge manner doctrine whiche reigneth papacie author hath proceded outragious rigor thereof bereueth spoyleth miserable sinner suche tormented feare sorowe coforte sacramente whiche yet al swete delicates gospell set surely deuill coulde readier way destroye men making senslesse coulde perceiue taste sauor foode wherewith moste good heauenly father fede least therefore runne suche hedlong downfall let v remember holy banket medicine sicke comfort sinner liberal gift poore bring profit healthy righteous riche suche coulde found whereas christe geuen v meate vnderstande withoute pyne starue fainte like famyne destroyeth liuely strength body againe whereas geuen v lyfe vnderstande without selues vtterly dead wherefore worthinesse bothe onely beste bring god offer owne vilenesse may cal vnworthinesse mercy may make v worthy despeire selues may coforted humble selues may raised vp accuse selues may iustified moreouer aspire vnitie commendeth v supper maketh v one himselfe wishe v altogether one soule one hart one ong haue thinges throughly well weyed considered suche thoughtes althoughe shake v yet shall neuer ouerthrowe v howe shoulde beyng nedy naked good thinges defiled filthinesse sinnes halfe dead eate body lorde worthily rather thinke poore come liberall geuer sicke phisician sinner author righteousnesse finally dead men hym geueth lyfe worthinesse commaunded god consisteth chefely fayth whiche reposeth thinges christe nothing v nexte charitie selfe charitie enoughe offer vnperfecte god maye encrease better forasmuche geuen perfecte agreing v thys worthinesse selfe consisteth fayth charitie yet measure worthinesse haue gone farr oute waye requiring perfection fayth whereunto nothing maye added charitie egall christ hath shewed towarde v hereby doe none otherwise dryue men awaye comming holy supper sentence shoulde take place man shoulde receiue vnworthily forasmuche withoute exception holden gyltie conuicte vnperfectnesse truelye point muche amazed dulnesse saye foolishnesse require perfection sacrament may make sacrament voide superfluous ordeined perfecte weake feble awake stirre vp prick forward exercise affection faith charitie correcte defaut either much concerneth outward forme whether faithfull receiue hande whether deuide euery one eate geuen whether put agayne cup hande deacon deliuer nexte whether bread leuened vnleuened whether wyne redde white maketh matter thinges indifference lefte libertie chirch howbeit certayne vsage olde chirch euery one take handluk xxii xvii christ sayde diuide among history reporte leuened common bread time alexander bishop rome first delited vnleuened bread reaso see vnlesse new sight draw eye common people wondring rather instruct mindes good religion adiure al ar touched though light zele godlinesse tel whether euidently see bothe muche brightly glorye god shineth herein muche abundant sweetenesse spirituall comforte commeth faithfull colde playerlike trifle whiche bring one vse deceiue sense amazed people call holding people religion beeyng made foolishe senslesse wyth superstition drawen whether lyste man defend suche inuentions antiquitie self also ignorant howe aunciente vse chresme blowing baptisme howe nye age apostle supper lorde infected rustinesse verilye waywardnesse man boldnesse whiche withholde selfe muste alwaye playe wanton mystery god let v remember god doth hyely esteme obedience woorde wylleth v iudge angel whole worlde nowe byddyng farewel great heape ceremony might thus haue ben comlyly ministred oft least euery weke sette chirch first beginne wyth publike prayer sermon made minister hauing bread wyne set vpon borde shoulde rehearse institution supper shoulde declare promise yt lefte vnto v therewithall shoulde excommunicate al lord forbidding ar debarred fro afterward shoulde pray liberalitie ye lord hath geue v holy foode woulde instructe frame v also fayth thankfulnesse mynde receiue forasmuch selues would mercy make v worthy banket either psalmes shold soong somwhat red saythful semely order communicate holy banket minister breaking bred geuing people supper ended exhortation shold made pure fayth confession fayth charitie maners mete christian laste al geuing thankes shold rehersed praise soong god ended congregation shoulde let goe peace thinges haue hetherto spoken thys sacramente large shewe therfore ordeined receiued yerely one slightly maners sake commonly custome often vse al christian often remembrance repete passion christe remembrance might susteyne strengthen fayth exhort themselues sing cofession prayse god publish goodnesse finally might nourishe mutuall charitie testifie among themselues wherof saw knot vnity body christ oft communicate signe body lord token geuen receiued enterchangeably bynde selues one vnto duty loue yt none v doe thing wherby may offende brother leaue thing vndone wherby may helpe hym nede requireth abilitie sufficeth suche vse apostolike chirch luke rehearseth actesact iixlii sayth faithfull continuing doctrine apostle communicating breaking bred prayer altogether mete done assemblie chirch without word prayer partaking supper almes thys order also institute amog corynthians may sufficiently gather paul certayne many age afterwarde vse thereupon came olde canon father vpon anacletus calixtus consecration done al communicate bee without ye dores ye chirch red olde canon call canon apostle continue vnto ende receiue holy communion muste corrected men moue vnquietnesse chirche also councell antioche decreed entre chirch heare scripture absteine communion remoued chirch til haue amended faulte although first councell toletum either somwhat qualified least set fourth mylder wordes yet also decreed haue heard sermon founde neuer communicate warned warning absteyne debarred uerily ordinance holy men meant reteine mainteine often vse communion often vse receiued apostle themselues whiche saw holsome faythful litle litle negligence common people growe vse augustine testifieth hys owne tyme sacrament sayth thing vi ca iohan tract xxvi vnitie lordes body somewhere dayly somewhere certayne distance dayes prepared vpon lordes table receaued table vnto lyfe vnto destruction first epistle ianuarius doe daily communicate body blood lorde receiue certaine dayes place day let passe wherein offred place vpon saturday sonday place neuer sonday forasmuch common people haue said somwhat slack holy men cal earnestly vpon sharpe rebukinges least seme winke slouthfulness suche exaple chrysostome vpon epistle ephesian cap homil xxvi mat xxiixii sayed vnto dishonored ye banket wherfore didst thou sit wherfore didst thou come whosoeuer partaker mystery wycked shamelesse standeth presente beseche called banket washeth hys handes sitteth downe semeth prepare hymselfe eate doth tast nothing shall shame bothe banket maker banket thou sta ding among prayer prepare themselues receiue ye holy meate haste euen thys thou haste gone away confessed thou art one number last thou doest partake ben better thou hadst ben present thou wylte say vnworthy therefore neither wast thou worthy communion prayer whiche preparing receiuing holy mysterie truely thys custome commaundeth communicate yerely one certaine inuention deuill whoes mynisterie soeuer brought say zepherinus author decree likely haue ben haue ordinance paraduenture worst manner prouide chirch time dout ye holy supper set faythful oft came together assemblie neither dout good part co municate scarcely tyme happened al communicate together wheras necessarie mingled prophane men idolatrers outwarde signe testifie fayth holy man order policy sake appoynted day wherin whole people christian partaking lordes supper vtter confession faith ordinance zepherinus otherwise good hath ben euel wrested came certaine law made one communicating yerely wherby come passe almost al men haue one communicate though gaily discharged themselues al rest yere slepe soundly bothe eares ought haue ben farr otherwise done euery weke least lordes table shoulde sett assemblie christian promise declared might fede v spiritually none dede compelled necessitie exhorted prycked forwarde sluggishnesse also slouthfull rebuked heapes hungry men come together deynties without rightfull cause therefore beginning complayned craft deuil custome thrust whe apointeth one certaine day yere maketh men slouthfull reste yere se dede peruerse abuse crept euen tyme chrysostome may also therewithall see muche displeased hym complaineth greuous wordes thesame place whiche euen nowe alleged great inequalitie mater often sometimes yere came euen whe cleane easter came eue whe vncleane cryeth custome presumption vaine daily offring vsed vaine stande altar none partaketh together v farr alowed authoritie adioyned shop proceded also ordinance whiche hath stolen away violently taken away halfe supper better nuber people god namely signe blood beyng denyed lay profane men title forsothe set god inheritance became peculiar possession shauen anoynted men commaundement eternall god yt al drynke commaundement man dare discontinue repelle new contrarie law commaunding shoulde drynke law maker seme fight wtout reson god pretende peril myght happen holy cup commonly geuen though danger ben foreseen marked eternal wisdome god suttelly forsothe reson one enough say body whole christ seuered fro hys body therfore accompanieng body conteineth blood loe wit agreeth god hath neuer litle begon loose reines wanton wilde lord shewing bred saith body sheweth cup calleth blood boldnesse man reason crieth contrariwise bred blood wine body though lord cause seuered body blood bothe wordes signes though euer ben heard spoken body blood christ called god man uerily ment signifie whole himselfe might haue sayed wont speake scripture thys body thys blood willing helpe weaknesse set cup seuerally bred teache sufficeth lesse drinke meate nowe let one part taken away shall finde one halfe nourishmentes therfore although true pretende blood bred way accompanieng againe body cup yet defraude godly soules confirmation fayth whiche christe deliuereth necessarie therefore bidding suttelties farewell muste holde faste profit whiche ordinance christe twoo earnestes knowe dede minister satan doe cauil ordinarie thing make mockerie scripture first thei allege one bare ought gathered rule wherby chirch bounde perpetual obseruing lye say bare doyng christ deliuer cuppe also institute apostle tyme come doo wordes commaunder drinke ye cuppe paule reherseth dede also commendeth certain rule starting hole apostle alone receiued christ partaking supper whome already chosen taken order sacrificyng prestes would haue answere fiue question shall able escape shall easily conuinced lie fyrst oracle haue solution reueled beyng strange worde god scripture reckeneth xii sate iesus dothe obscure dignitie christ calleth sacrificing prestes name speake hereafter place fit though gaue xii yet commaunded namely shold distribute among secondely better age apostle almost thousand yeres al without exception made partaker bothe signes old chirche ignorant gestes christ receiued supper point moste desperate shamelesnesse sticke dally grautyng bee true remayne ecclesiasticall hystories lib de resur carnis theodorit lib iii cap viii eucharistia hier ii mal chrysos ii cor cap viii eucharistia remayne bokes old writer minister euident testimony matter fleshe sayth tertullian fed body blood christ soule may fatted fedyng vpon god sayd ambrose theodosius wilt thou receiue suche handes holy body lorde boldnesse wilte thou thy mouthe partake cup precious blood hierome sayth prestes whiche make thankesgeuing distribute blood lorde people chrysostome olde lawe prest eate parte people part one body set one cuppe thynges perteine thankesgeuing comon betwene prest people selfe thyng dothe augustine testifie many place dispute thyng moste knowen let greke latine writer redde ouer suche testimony shal echewhere offer themselues neither custome growen oute vse whyle remained one droppe purenesse chirch gregorie may rightly say haue ben last bishop rome teacheth kept tyme blood lambe ye haue nowe learned hearyng drinkyng blood poured mouthes faithfull yea yet endured fower hundred yeares death thynges growen oute kynde neither taken onely vsage also inuiolable lawe force reuerence god institution douted sacrilege seuer thynges lorde hadde conioyned de consecra dist ii ca co per thus saieth gelasius haue founde receyuyng portion holy body absteyne cup lett without dout seme boud wot superstition either receyue sacramentes whole bee debarred whole diuidyng mysterie committed without great sacrilege serm v de lap reason cypriane heard truely ought moue christian mynde saith teache prouoke shed blood confessing christe deny blood shal fyght make fitte cup martyrdome first chirch right communion admitte drinke cup lord whereas canonistes restraine decree gelasius prestes childish cauill nede confuted thirdly simply say bread eate cuppe shoulde drinke euen meant set purpose mete craft satan fowerthly would haue lorde vouchesaued admitt supper onely sacrificyng prestes man euer durst call partaking stranger lorde excluded yea partakyng gifte power wherof handes without commaundement onely could geue yea vpon confidence warrant vse day distribute common people signe body christ haue neither commaundement example lorde fifthly paule lie saide corynthians receiued lorde deliuered afterwarde declareth thyng deliuered without difference communicate signes paule receiued lord al shold admitted without differece let loke whome haue receiued doo dryue awaye almost people god pretend god author whome yea nay yet still clokyng abhominations dare pretend name chirchii cor iixix suche pretense defende though either antechristes chirch whiche easily treade vnder foote scatter abroade destroy doctrine institution christ apostolike chirche chirche whole force religion florished pthe xviii chapiter pof popishe masse whiche sacrilege supper christ hath ben prophaned also brought nought lyke inuentions satan hath trauailed ouerspredyng darknesse obscure defile holy supper christ least purenesse shoulde kepte styll chirche head horrible abhomination aduanced signe myght onely darkned peruerted beyng vtterly blotted abolyshed shoulde vanyshe away fall oute remembrance men namely blynded almost whole world moste pestilent error shoulde beleue masse sacrifice oblation obteine forgeuenesse sinnes beginning sounder sort scholeme toke doctrine nothyng regard farewell wyth theyr crabbed suttelties whiche howsoeuer may defended cauillyng yet therfore refused good men nothyng ell spred muche darknesse ouer brightnesse supper therefore biddyng farewell let reader vnderstand matche fight opinion wherewith romishe antichrist prophetes haue infected whole worlde namely masse worke wherby sacrificyng prest offreth vp christ doo partake oblation deserue fauor god cleansying sacrifice wherby reconcile god themselues neither hath ben receiued onely common opinion people doyng selfe framed kynde pacifyeng wherwith satisfaction made god purgyng quicke dead wordes also vse expresse thyng may gather dayly vse know depe rootes pestilence hath take vnder great seming goodnesse lurketh howe beareth shewe name christe howe one name masse many beleue comprehende whole summe faith shalbe worde god clerely proued masse muche soeuer colored glorious yet shamefully dishonoreth christ burieth oppresseth crosse putteth death forgetfulnesse taketh away frute cometh therof vnto v doth weaken destroy sacrament wherin left memorie death shall depe rootes moste strong meane word god shall cutt downe ouerthrowe face beautifull lyght bewray euell lurketh vnder let v therfore shew hath ben set fyrst place intolerable blasphemie dishonor done christheb vv vii vii et x xic xxxi consecrate father prest bishop tyme reade ordeined olde testament whoes life beyng mortal theyr presthode also coulde immortall cause also neded successor tyme tyme putt place dyedpsal cx xiii gen xiiii xviii place christ immortal nedeth vicar set hym therfore ordeined father prest euer according order melchisedech shold execute euerlastyng presthode mysterie bene long figured melchisedech scripture one broughte preste lyuyng god neuer afterwarde made mention hym though end life point likenesse christe called prest accordyng order doo daily sacrifice must nedes appoint prestes make oblation must appoint successor vicar stede christ puttyng stede spoile christ honor plucke hym prerogatiue eternal presthod also trauaile thrust hym downe right hande father whiche sitt immortall muste therwithall remaine eternall prest neither lett laye themselues pety sacrificer putt place christ dead helper eternal presthod ceasseth therfore continue strongly holden fast wordes apostleheb viix may escape namely many prestes made deathe letted continue therfore one letted death nedeth companion yet suche frowardnesse arme themselues example melchisedech defend wickednesse sayd offred bread wyne gather foreshewyng masse though likenesse betwene hym christ offryng bread wyne whiche emptie triflyng nedeth confutation melchisedech gaue bread wyne abraham companion refreshe beyng weary iorney battail sacrifice moses praiseth gentlenesse holy king fellowes vnseasonably coyne mysterie whereof mention made yet thei deceitfully paint error wt color foloweth ye prest ye hyest godheb viivii answer yt wrongfully draw bread wyne apostle referreth blessing therfore prest god blessed abraham wherupon apostle tha whome nede seke better expositor gathereth excellence lesser blessed greater oblatio melchisedech figure sacrifice masse would apostle praye ar heth al euen ye least thinges haue forgotten earnest weightie thing howsoeuer trifle shall vayne goe aboute ouerthrowe reason whiche apostle himselfe bringeth righte honor sacrificing presthoode ceaseth among mortall men christ immortall perpetual sacrificing preste vertue masse oppresseth burieth crosse passion christ verily certaine crosse christ ouerthrowe sone altar set vpheb ixxi offred himselfe sacrifice vpon crosse might sanctifie v euer purchase v eternall redemption vndoutedly ye force effectualnesse sacrifice continueth without end otherwise shold think nothing honorably christ ox calues sacrificed vnder lawe offringes whereof proued vneffectuall weake oft ren ed wherfore either must confesse sacrifice christe fulfilled vppon crosse wanted force eternall cleansyng christe hathe made ende one sacrifice one euerheb ixxxvi xx apostle sayth chiefe bishop christ one appered offring vp self ye ending world driuing away sinne againe ar sanctified wil god ing ye body iesus christ one christ wt one oblatio euer hath made perfect ar sanctified wherunto adioineth notable sentece yt forgeuenesse sinnes one purchaced ther remaineth oblation also christ signified laste saieng vttered amog last gaspings whe said ended wot note ye last saienges men diengioh xix x oracle christ dieng testifieth yt one sacrifice p rfited fulfilled whatsoeuer saluation shall lawfull v daily patch innumerable sacrifice sacrifice perfection whereof hath shiningly set forth though vnperfecte holy worde god onely affirmeth also crieth protesteth sacrifice one fully done force thereof remaineth euerlasting whoso require sacrifice accuse imperfection weakenesse masse hath ben deliuered suche sort may euery day made hundred thousand sacrifice end rendeth passion christe whereby offred hym onely sacrificed oblation father lye buried drowned vnlesse blynde see boldnesse sata whiche wrastled open clere truthe neither ignorant deceites father lyeng vseth color fraude sayeng sondry diuerse sayeng repeting applying sophisticall argument also lesse easily confuted neither christ one offer vp selfe condition sacrifice shold daily confirmed new oblation preaching gospell ministring holye supper fruite thereof shoulde communicated vnto vsi cor iivii paule saieth christe oure passeouer offred vp biddeth v eat say meane wherby sacrifice crosse rightly applied v communicated v take vse confesse prophet vnder fygures agreeable tyme prophecieth spiritual worship god spred abrode whole world geue solution thing sithe euery example commonly offre selues wil busie selfe longer rehearsall howbeit herein also miserably deceiued acknowlege sacrifice masse wheras dede faithfull nowe sacrifice lord offer cleane offring shalbe spoken nowe come downe third office masse must declare howe blotteth oute true onely deathe christe shaketh oute remembrance menne among men strength testament hangeth vppon death testator also lord hath death confirmed testament whereby hath geuen v forgeuenesse synnes eternal righteousnesse dare varie make newe thing testamente doo denye hys death holde force masse new altogether diuerse testamet doth euery seueral masse promise new forgeuenesse sinnes new purchasing righteousnesse many testament mass let christ therfore come death confirme testament rather infinite deathes confirme innumerable testamentes mass haue therfore said true sheweth selfe new testament christ therfore requireth death moreouer hoste offred must necessarily slayne sacrificed christ euery seuerall masse sacrificed muste euery moment bee thousande place cruelly slayen myne apostle argument neded offer selfe ofte muste ofte haue dyed sin beginning worlde knowe haue answere redinesse whereby also charge v sclander say obiected agaynst neuer thought yet canne knowe death life christ hande loke whether goe aboute kill hym onely purpose shew maner absurdity foloweth vngodly wicked doctrine self thing proue apostle owne mouth though crye contrarye ye ende ye world namely yt baptisme wer certaine entry admissio fayth supper cotinual foode wherewt christ spiritually fedeth ye familie hys faythful wherfore one god one fayth one christ one chirch body one baptisme ofte ministred againe ye supper fro tyme tyme distributed haue ben one receiued ye chirch may vnderstand yt cotinually fed wt christ beside twoo sacramet ordeined god neither oughte ye chirch faythfull acknowlege yt thing yt lyeth choise rayse set vp new sacrametes shal easily vnderstand ye remembreth yt hath ben plainly enough declared sacramentes appointed god end instruct v promise testifie v good wil towarde v also yt calleth minde sa xl xiii rom xixxxiiii yt none hath ben god couseller yt might promise v certaintie wil assure v bring v oute care affectio beareth towarde v wil geue deny v therewt also determined yt set fourth signe testimonie wil promise himselfe alone yt signe geue testifie v himselfe wil speake brefely paraduenture grosly plainly sacrament ca neuer without promise saluation al men gathered heape together themselues promise nothing saluation therefore neither themselues set fourth set vp sacramente therefore let christian chirch contented twoo let admitt acknowlege third preset time also desire loke ende world whereas certaine diuerse sacramentese xvixiii xviivi corin x iii numer xxiviii beside ordinarie one geuen iewes iii reson age scripture signified last houre last dayes last tymes man shoulde deceiue himselfe vaine loking new doctrine reuelation many tymes many sortes spake prophet laste dayes heauenly father hath spoken hys beloued sone manifestly shew father dede hath manifestly shewed hym full much behoueth v whyle nowe beholde hym glassei cor x xii therefore thys taken awaye men make newe sacramentes chirch god wished litle possible man inue tion might myngled sacramentes god lyke water poured wyne departeth delayed leauen scattered among whole lumpe done waxeth sower purenesse mystery god nothyng ell defyled man addeth thyng hys owne yet see farr sacramentes swarued kynde naturall purenesse handled thys day echewhere muche pompes ceremony gesturinges woorde god meane tyme neither consideration mention withoute euen sacramentes themselues sacramentes yea ceremony ordeined god greate route one lift vp hed lye oppressed litle seen baptisme ought haue shyned loked vpon haue place rightfully complained euen baptisme selfe supper vtterly buried sin hath ben turned ye masse sauing seen one euery yere mangled halfe torne fashion xix chapter fiue falsly named sacramentes declared fyue haue ben hetherto commonly taken sacramentes sacramentes shewed manner thinges former discourse concerning sacramentes myghte haue obteined thys sobre willing learne ouer curiously procede shold without word god embrace sacrament beside twoo knewe ordeined ye lord forasmuch opinion seuen sacramentes commonly vsed al men take hauing wadered scholes preachinges hath auncientie gathered rootes yet styll settled myndes men thought thing worth trauail seuerally nerely searche fyue commonly adnumbred among true naturall sacramentes lorde wyping away al deceitfull color shoulde set fourth seen simple suche falsly haue ben hetherto taken sacramentes first protest al godly doe take hande contention aboute name desire striuing weighty cause led fight againste abuse ignorante christian lordes wordes al thinges also therfore may wil apply wordes thinges godly sense kept although vnproprenesse speaking al thys graunt although better woordes shoulde made subiect thinges thinges wordes name sacrament consideratio make seuen sacramentes therewithal geue al definition yt visible formes inuisible grace make altogether vessells holy ghost instrumentes geuing righteousnesse cause obteining grace yea maister sentence himselfe denyeth sacramentes lawe moses properly called name deliuer dede thing figured beseche suffred signes lord hath hallowed mouth hath garnished excellent promise accompted sacramentes meane time honor shoulde conueyed away vsages men either haue deuised themselues least obserue without expresse commaundement god therefore either let change definition let absteine wrongfull vsing worde doth afterwarde engender false opinion ful o absurditie extreme anointing say figure cause inuisible grace sacrament ought wise graunt gather vpon truely must resist name selfe least therby admitt maye geue occasion error againe would proue sacrament adde thys cause consisteth ye outwarde signe worde finde neither commaundement promise ell crye appeareth yt brawle worde moue cotrouersie superfluous cocerning thing selfe therfore must strongly hold fast haue inuincible reson co firmed yt power institute sacrament hande none god sacrament ought wt certaine promise raise vp cofort ye coscieces ye faythful could neuer receiue certaintie manesay xlxiii rom xi xxiiii sacrament ought v witnessing good wil god towarde v wherof none men angel witnesse forasmuch none hath ben god counsell therefore alone doth right authoritie testifie v worde sacramet seale wherwt testament promise god sealed could sealed bodily thinges elementes thys worlde vnlesse power god framed appoynted therunto therfore ordeine sacrament power man make great mystery god lye hidden vnder base thynges worde god muste goe maye make sacrament sacrament augustine well teacheth homil iol lxxx act ixxl xxxxvi moreouer profitable kepte difference betwene sacramentes ceremony vnlesse fall many absurdity apostle prayed kneling therfore men shall kneele without sacrament sayd disciple prayed toward east therfore loking east shalbe sacrament paule willeth men euery place lift vp pure handesi tim iiviii rehearsed holy oftentimes prayed handes lifted vp let lifting vp hand also made sacramet finally let gesture holy one turne sacramentes howbeit would also muche passe vppon thinges ioyned greater discommodities presse v authoritie olde chirche saye pretende false color number seuen founde among ecclesiasticall writer neither certaine time first crept graut dede yt somtime thei free vsing ye name sacramet meane therby eue al ceremony outward rite al exercise godlinesse whe speake signes ought witness grace god towarde v contented twoo baptisme supper least anye man thinke falsely boste episto reherse testimony augustine ianuarius sayth first would haue thee holde fast whiche chiefe would haue passed ouer ben tyme ordeyned chirch specially sithe otherwyse obseruyng numbres curious nede yea nameth baptisme supper speaketh nothyng rest doth sufficiently signifie two mystery excell singular dignitie ceremony doo reste benethe lower degree wherfore say sacramentarie doctor destitute onely worde lorde also consent old chirch much soeuer glory pretence let v come downe speciall thynges themselues pof confirmation maner olde tyme child christian growen age discretion brought bishop shoulde fulfyll duetie whiche required growen yeres offer selues baptisme sate among bee catechized till fully instructed mystery faith coulde make confession faith bishoppe people therfore baptised infantes bicause hadde made confession faith chirch aboute ende childehod beginning yeares discretion presented againe parentes examined bishop accordyng forme catechisme whiche certaine common doyng otherwise ought worthily graue holy myght haue reuerence dignitie added also ceremonie layeng handes childe faith beyng allowed let goe solemne blessyng old writer oft make mention maner leo pope writeth returne heretikes let hym baptised agayn wanted among heretikes let vertue spirite geuen hym bishop layeng handes epist aduersaries crie rightfully called sacrament holy ghost geue leo himselfe dothe place declare meaneth wordes whoso saith baptized among heretikes let rebaptized callyng vpon holy ghoste episto lxxvii lett confirmed laieng hand receiued form baptisme without sanctifieng hierome also maketh metion writing luciferians although denye hierome somwhat erreth therin saith obseruation apostle yet far mennes folly also qualifieth addeth blessing geue bishop onlye rather honor presthode necessitie lawe therfore suche laying handes whiche done simply stede blessing prayse woulde thys daye restored pure vse thereof later age hauyng maner blotted thyng selfe hath set wot fained confirmation sacrament god haue fained vertue confirmation geue holy ghost encrease grace baptisme geuen innocentie strengthen battaile baptisme wer new begotten lyfe confirmation celebrate annoyntyng forme wordes signe thee signe holy crosse confirme thee chresme saluation name father sonne holy ghost gayely trimly done woorde god maye promise presence holy ghost bring forth one tittle wherby certifie v chresme vessell holy ghoste see oyle thicke fatt liquor nothyng ell let lawe minister yt nothing without comaudemet go let bring forth comaudemet point ministerie speake one word haue comaudemet excuse boldnesse full sacrilege maner lord asked phariseesmat xii xxv whether baptisme iohn heauen men answered men made confesse trifling vayne heauen compelled acknowlege doctrine iohn therfore least shoulde much sclander iohn thei durst confesse men therfore confirmation men proued vaine trifling persuade v heauen let proue dede defend themselues example apostle think haue done nothing rashly wel dede neither woulde blame shewed themselues folowers apostlesact viiixv laied hand vpo layeng samaritanes receiued holy ghost laieng hand diuerse tymes maketh mentio heare apostle faithfully executed ministrie lord willed visible wonderfull grace holy ghost poured vpon people shold ministred distributed apostle laieng handes vnder laieng hand thinke conteined hier mysterie expound adioyned ceremonie outeward doyng mighte signifie commended offred god vpon whome laid without guider directer chirch god stande haue eternal promise shal euer stande force christ calleth self thirstioh viixxxvii may drinke liuing water miracle power manifest workinges distributed strengthning paulega iiiiix colo iixx draweth v far away ye element world whiche condemneth nothing sticking suche pety obseruations boldly pronounce selfe lorde whoso call oyle oyle saluation defiled lyeng deuill whiche ouerspreadyng darkenesse deceiueth eies simple adde furthermore al faithfull ought baptisme receiue holy ghost layeng handes may founde full christian verba cap de consecr dis v co aurel ca vt ieiuni shall neuer christian chresmed bishopps confirmation owne sayinges worde worde thought whatsoeuer thyngs perteined christianitie set forth writyng comprehended scripture nowe perceyue trewe forme religion soughte learned ell oute scripture therfore whole wisedome god heauenly truthe whole doctrine christ doth beginne christian oyle maketh perfect sentence ar damned al apostle many martyr whome moste certaine haue neuer ben hresmed forasmuche oyle yet made beyng poured vpon myght fulfill partes christianitie rather myght made christian whiche yet none thoughe holde omitte whiche lawfull omitted without greuous offense seuerely cal vpo keping thing necessarie without saluation ca obteined vnlesse peraduenture preuented death uerily freely suffer bee despised secretly confesse greate value boste last determine holy annoynting greater reuerence baptisme cap de vero dist eadem anoynting peculiarly ministred handes chefe bishop baptisme comonlye distributed vpon meaning appeareth place sayeth hande layed vpon heretikes amended coupling charitie lib v cap xxiii greatest gifte holy ghost withoute whiche whatsoeuer holye thynges mann uayle saluation would god kepe still ye maner whiche haue said haue old tyme vntimely deliuered image sacramet borne confirmatio faine one named without iniurie baptisme catechizyng whereby child nere age discretion didde declare accompt faith chirch bee beste manner catechizing forme written vse conteinyng familiarly setting oute summe maner al article religion whole chirch faithful ought without controuersie agree chylde beyng ten yeres olde shoulde offer himselfe chirch declare confession faithe examined euery article answer euery one ignorant thing vnderstande might taught shoulde chirche witnessing beholding professe onely true pure faithe wherewith people faithfull dothe one minde worship one god discipline day force truly ye slouthfulnesse parentes would whetted carelesly neglect instruction child thing nothing belonging whiche withoute open shame could omitte among christian people greater consent faith great ignorance rudenesse many bee rashly carried away new strage doctrine finally haue certayne orderly instruction christian learning penance next place set penance entreate confusely disordredly conscience beare away sure sounde thing doctrine haue alreadye place declared large learned scripture concerning repentance also teache haue onely touch reason raised vp opinion hath heretofore reigned chirches schooles sacramente first brefely saye somwhat vsage olde chirche pretense whereof haue abused stablishe fayned inuention order kepte publike penance whiche fully done satisfaction enioyned reconciled solemne laying handes signe absolution whereby sinner selfe raised vp god truste pardon chirch admonished gently receyue fauor putting awaye remembrance offence cyprian oftentimes calleth epi lib ep ii geue peace mighte bee greater dignitie haue commendation among people ordeined ye bishop authoritie shold alway vsed ye meane herein fro hense came yt decree ye secod councel carthage lawful prest ye masse publikely recocile penitet decree ye cou cel arausiu let time penace departout life admitted ye comunio wtout ye laieng hades vsed reco ciling recouer sicknesse let stand ye degree penitetes whe ye time fully expired ca xxxiii let receiue bishop ye laieg handes vsed recociling againe ye decree thirde councel carthage let prest without authoritie ye bishop recocile penitent teded end ye seueritie woulde haue vsed ye behalf wt much lenitie grow decay therfore willed bishop iudge likely would circuspect ye examinatio thereof howbeit cyprian certaine place sheweth bishop also whole clergie layed handes thus sayth ful tyme penance come communion layeng handes bishop clergie receiue power partake communion afterwarde processe tyme came poynt beside publike penance vsed ceremonie also priuate absolution decret que hereupon came distinction gratian betwene publike priuate reconciliation iudge olde vsage cypriane maketh mention haue ben holy healthfull chirch would day restored thys later although dare disallow least speake sharpelye yet thinke lesse necessarie howsoeuer yet se yt layeng hades penace ceremonie ordeined men god set amog meane thing outward exercise verily despised ought lower degree yt comeded vnto v ye word lord ye romanistes ye scholeme haue ordinarie custome corrupt al thing wt wrog expouding carefully trauail fynding sacramet neither ought seme maruel seke knot rush haue best leaue thing entagled libr sen di cap suspese vncertaine cofounded trobled wt diuersity opinios thei say therfore either yt ye outward penace sacramet yt ought take signe ye inwarde penance contrition hart shalbe ye thing ye sacramet together sacrament twoo sacramentes one ful one outwarde penance sacramet inwarde thing sacramet yt forgeuenesse synnes thing sacrament let kepe reme brance definitio sacrament haue aboue set examine therby yt cal sacrament shal fynd yt outward ceremonie ordeined lord cofirming faith cauil yt definitio law nede obey libr que vet testam let heare augustine faine yt thei esteme holy visible sacrament sayth ordeined carnal men sake yt degree sacrametes may conueyed fro thing yt seen eye thinges yt vnderstaded like thing either theselues see shewe yt call sacramente penance augustine sayth place therfore called sacramet sermone de bapt infant one thing seen thing vnderstaded seen hath bodily forme yt vnderstanded hath spiritual frute neither doe thing wise agree sacrament penance faine bodily forme yt may represent spirituall frute kil beast vpo fightig place ther sacramet sought may much colerably said yt ye absolutio ye prest sacramet tha penace either inward outwarde might redily said yt ceremony assure faith ye forgeuenesse sine hath promise ye keyes thei cal whatsoeuer ye shal bide lose vpo earth shalbe boud losed heauen wold haue obiected yt ye part yt absolued ye prestes obteine thing absolution wheras doctrine sacramentes newe law ought worke dede figure laughed supper make doble eating sacramental eating egally common good euil spiritual eating propre ye good might also faine ye absolutio receiued twoo wayes yet could hetherto vnderstad thei meant wt doctrine haue alredy taught farr disagreeth fro ye truth god whe purposely entreated yt argument mynde shew ye dout withsladeth yt may cal ye absolutio prest sacramet lib iii que ver testam de bapt paruul libr v de bapt contra donat might answere ye mouth augustine sanctificatio without ye visible sacrament visible childishly erred blinde ye clere sunne trauailing great hardnesse yet espyed thing playne open euery man yet least waxe proude part soeuer set sacrament deny yt ought rightfully taken sacramet first special promise substace sacramet againe whatsoeuer ceremonie shewed fourth mere inuention men wheras haue alredy proued ceremony sacramentes ordeined god therfore lye deceite haue inuented ye sacrament penance lib sen dist xiiii cap de peni disti cap ii thys fayned sacrament haue garnished wt mete commendation calling seconde borde shipwrecke man haue sinning marred garmet innocence whiche receiued baptisme may penance repaire sayeng hierome whoes soeuer excused yt vtterly wicked expouded meaning though baptisme blotted sinne rather called remembrace euery sinner oft thinketh forgeuenesse sinne may therby gather vp himselfe recouer courage strengthen hys fayth shal obteine forgeuenesse synnes promised baptisme hierome hath spoken hardly vnproperly penance baptisme repaired fro fal away yt deserue excomunicate chirch good expositor drawe wickednesse therefore shall moste fittly speake cal baptisme sacrament penance sithe geuen confirmation grace seale confidece yt purpose repentance least thinke thys deuise decret xv que cap firmissime marce liiii luke iiiiii beside agreeth word scripture appeareth yt olde chirch commonly spoken like certaine principle boke extreme vnction cal thirde fained sacrament extreme vnctio done ye prest extreme thei terme oile cosecrate bishop forme thys holy anointing kind mercy god pardo thee whatsoeuer hast offeded seing hearing smelling feling tasting faine yt twoo vertues forgeuenesse sinnes ease bodily sicknesse expediet saluation souleiames vxiiii say institution set iames whose wordes sicke among let hym bryng playerlike hypocrisie whereby without reason without frute woulde resemble apostlesmarc vixiii marc rehearseth apostle first sending according commaundement whiche haue receiued lord raised vp dead blinde made cley dust spittle healed touching word maner apostle healed disease word touching anointing likely yt anointing al thing also wer causelesly put vre graunt yet yt shold meane healing signe yt dulnesse vnskilful myght put mynde whense great power proceded thys ende geue prayse therof apostle holy ghost hys gyftes signified oyle common vsual thing grace healinges vanished awaye like also miracle ye lord willed shewed tyme wherby might make ye new preaching ye gospel maruelous euer therefore though graut neuer much yt anoynting sacramente power wer ministred ye hand ye apostle nothing perteineth v ministratio power comitted greater reaso make sacramet anointing al signes rehearsed v scripture appoint siloah swymme iniohn ixvii act xxx wherinto certaine ordinarie recourse tymes sicke men may plunge themselues say done vaine truely vayne anoyntyng lye along vpon dead men paule raysed vp dead childe lyeng vpon hym cley made spittle dust sacrament wer singular example geue iames commaundemet uerily iames spake time chirch yet stil enioied blessing god affirme dede yt yet stil ye force anointing finde otherwise experiece let maruel thei haue wt boldnesse mocked soules know senslesse blinde spoyled ye word god yt life light sith nothing ashamed go mocke ye liuing feling sens ye body therfore make themselues worthy scorned whyle bost yt endued wt grace healinges lord verily present wt al age oft nede helpeth sickness lesse tha olde tyme doth vtter manifest power distributeth miracle handes apostle gift tyme also partly falle away vnthankfulnesse men therfore wtout cause ye apostle haue ye signe oile opely testified yt grace healinges comitted owne power ye power ye holy ghost ye side wrogdoers ye holy ghostmath iiixvi iohn ixxxii make stinking oile force hys power altogether like one would say yt al oyle ye power ye holy ghost called ye name scripture euerye doue holy ghost appered yt forme thigs let loke much preset enough v c rtainly perceiue yt annointing sacrament whiche neyther ceremonie ordeined god hath promise require twoo thinges sacrament ceremonie ordeined god haue promise god wtal require ye ceremonie geuen v yt promise belong vnto v man doth affirme ye circumcision nowe sacrament christian chirch althoughe ordinance god promise knitt vnto neither commaunded v promise adioyned geue v wi h conditio promise proudely bost annointing geuen v haue euidently shewed theselues declare experience ceremonie ought haue ben vsed endued grace healinges butcher skill slayeng murthering healing howbeit althoughe obteyne thys iames commaundeth concerning annointing agreeth thys age farr yet eue shal haue much preuailed prouing vnction wherwith haue hetherto annointed vsiames v iiii iames wylleth sicke men annointed men infecte fatt liquor sicke men corps half dead lyfe lieth alredy laboryng toppe lippes themselues terme extreme haue sacramente present medicine wherby may either ease sharpenesse disease least may bryng comfort soule ar cruel neuer heale time iames willeth sicke annointed elder chirch men allow anointer pety sacrificing prest wheras expounde iames presbyteros elder prestes fondly say plurall number set comlynesses sake trifling though chirches tyme abounded swarmes sacrificing prestes mighte goe long pompous shewe carrie pageante holy oyle iames simply biddeth sicke men annointed vnderstande none annointing common oyle none founde markes rehearsal men vouchesaue haue none oyle hallowed bishop say warmed much breathing enchaunted much mumbling knee bowed nine time saluted thys maner thrise haile holy oyle thrise hayle holy chresme thrise hayle holy balme oute haue sucked coniurations iames sayth sicke man annointed oyle prayer hath ben pronounced ouer hym sinnes shalbe forgeuen hym namely giltinesse taken away may obteine release peine meaning sinnes put away fat liquor prayer faithful wherby afflicted brother commended god shal vaine men wickedly lye holy say abhominable annointing sinnes forgeuen loe gayly shal preuaile haue ben large suffred abuse testimonie iames pleasure least nede trauaile log profe hereof chronicle discarge v hardnesse thei report pope innocentius augustine time gouerned ye chirch rome ordeined prestes also christian vse oyle annoint necessitie others author hereof sigebert cronicles ecclesiasticall order fourth place register hath sacrament order fruteful bredeth selfe seuen litle sacramentes worthy laughed wheras affirme seuen sacramentes whe go rehearse recken vp thirtene neither allege themselues yt one sacrament tende one presthode certaine degree vnto sith euident yt euerye one seuerall ceremony theselues say diuerse grace dout ought called seue sacramentes opinios receiued striue though thing doutefull forasmuch themselues doe plainly seuerally declare seuen first wil brefely knitt vp way many vnfauorie absurdity thrust vnto v goe aboute commende v order stede sacramentes libr sen dist xxxiiii cap wil se whether ye ceremonie chirches vse ordering minister ought called sacramet al make therfore seue ecclesiastical order degree garnish name sacrament dorekepers reders exorcistes acoluthes folowers subdeacon deacos prestes vii say seuenfolde grace holy ghost wherewt ought endued yt promoted vnto encreased largely heaped promotion ye nuber selfe hallowed wt wrogful expouding scripture whe think yt thei haue red esai vii vertues ye holy ghost wheras dede esay rehearseth sixesa xiii ezec ix ro iiiii viiixv also ye prophet met coprehed al place ell wel called spirite lyfe sanctification adoption child ye place called spirite wisdomethe first opinion hue william parise isidorus lib vii dist disti cap lect cap ostiarius vnderstanding cousel strength knowlege feare lord howbeit sutteler laughing yet wer wrote moste notable sutteltie wherewith play ye philosopher ye name acoluth calling ceroferar taper bearer worde thynke sorcerie truely one neuer heard al nation language wheras acoluthos greke simply signifieth folower howbeit shold earnestly tarry confuting men self also worthily laughed trifling mockery may able yet stil false color deceiue eue silly woman vanitie way beginneth called may seme wil purpose cast office whe take vpon title beholde haue nede consecrate sacrametes receiue holy ghost namely yt may nothing allege exercise frowardnesse tymes forsake neglect ministeries let therwtal cofesse day chirch vse frute holy order maruelously aduance whole chirch ful curse suffreth taper cruet handled childre prophane none worthy touche consecrate acoluthes committeth songes childre ought heard hallowed mouth exorcistes ende cosecrate themactes xixxiii heare iewes exorcistes se called exorcismes coniurations whiche vsed counterfait exorcistes euer heard spoke shewed exaple professio fayned haue power geue lay handes vpon mad men catechised possessed deuils perswade deuils haue power deuils doe onely yelde commaundementes also vse commaunding authoritie ouer man scarcely fynde euery tenth led euil spirite therfore whatsoeuer thinges babble concerning pery order patched together folish vnsauory lye old acoluthes dorekepers
