kinsfolkes maye bee coupled mariagegossibs mariages celebrate septuagesime vtas easter three weekes midsommer aduent twelftide innumerable like long reherse length must crepe myre wherein talk hath nowe taried longer woulde yet thinke haue somewhat profited haue partly plucked lyon skynnes ass xx chapter ciuile gouernement whereas haue aboue set twoo kindes gouernement man whereas haue spoken enough one kinde cosisteth soule inward man hath respect eternal life place requireth yt speake somwhat also ye perteineth ciuile outward righteousnesse manner course matter semeth seuered spiritual doctrine faith toke hande entreate yet proceding shal shew rightfully ioyne together yea necessitie compelled doo specially sithe one side mad barbarous men doo furiously goe aboute ouerthrowe order stablished god side flatterer prince aduauncing power without measure sticke set empire god unlesse mischeues met withall purenesse faith shal lost beside smally behofe know louingly god hath behalf prouided mankinde may florishe v greater desire godlinesse witnesse thankfulnesse first ere enter thing selfe must hold fast distinction haue aboue set least commonly happeneth many vnwisely mingle two thing together haue altogether diuerse consideration heare libertie promised gospell whiche acknowlegeth among men king magistrate hath regarde christe alone thinke take fruite libertie long see power haue preeminence ouer therfore think nothing shalbe safe vnlesse whole world reformed new fashion may neither iudgementes lawes magistrate thing thinke withstande libertie whosoeuer put difference betwene body soule betwene thys present transitorie life life come eternal shal hardlye vnderstande spiritual kingdome christ ciuile gouernemet ar thyngs far sonder sith therfore iewish vanitie seke enclose kingdome christ vnder elementes worlde let v rather thinking scripture plainely teacheth spirituall fruite whiche gathered benefite christ remember kepe within boudes thereof thys whole libertie promised offred v himgala vi cor vii xxi cause apostle biddeth v stand made subiecte ye yoke bondage place biddeth bond seruantes carefull state bicause spirituall libertie may wel agree ciuile bondagega iiixxviii col iiixi sense also sayenges taken kingdome god iew grecian male female bondeman freeman againe iew grecian circucision uncircucision barbarian scythian bondman freman christe whereby signifieth maketh mater estate thou among men vnder lawes nation thou lyuest forasmuche thynges consisteth kyngdome christ yet dothe distinction tende hereunto shoulde thynke whole order policie vncleane thyng perteyning christian men deede doo phrentike men delited vnbridled licentiousnesse crie boste sithe bee dead christ elementes worlde remoued kyngdome god sitte among heauenly one thinke vnworthy v farre benethe excellence occupied prophane vncleane care busied affaire perteinyng christian man purpose saye lawes without iudgements iudgement seates hath christian man iudgements themselues yea lawfull kill wherto serue lawes iudgementes among v haue euen nowe geuen warning kynde gouernement seuerall spirituall inward kyngdome christ also knowen nothyng disagree together ciuile gouernement dothe nowe beginne v vpon carth certaine beginnyngs heauenly kyngdome mortall vanishyng life doth entre vpon immortall incorruptible blessednesse entent spirituall gouernement long shall lyue among cherish mainteyne outward worshippyng god defend sound doctrine godlinesse state chirche frame lyfe felowship men fashion maners ciuile righteousnesse procure v frendship one norish common peace quietnesse whiche graunt superfluous kyngdome god suche nowe among v destroy present life god long toward heauenly countree wayfaryng home vpon ye earth sithe vse waifaryng nedeth helpes whiche take man take nature man wheras allege great perfection chirche god owne moderate gouernement suffiseth law themselues foolishly imagine perfection neuer found co mon felowship men sith noughty men pride great wickednesse obstinate restrained great sharpnesse lawes thynke doo see vnpunished libertie lie open lewdnesse whiche euen force sufficiently compelled doo euell ye order policie shalbe fitter place entreate meanyng haue vnderstanded thinke dryue away outragious barbarousnesse vse wherof lesse among men bread water sunne ayre dignitie muche excellent tendeth hereunto whiche onely commoditie thyngs men may breath eate drinke cherished although dede comprehendeth thynges whyle maketh liue together yet say tendeth herunto also idolatrie sacrilege agaynst name god blasphemy agaynste truthe offence religion may ryse vp scattered among people common quiet trobled yt euery man may kepe safe vnappeired may vse affaire together without hurt yt honestie modestie kept among finally yt among christian may comon shew religio among may malike ciuilitie neither let man moued yt referre care stablishing religion policie seme haue set without ye iugemet tha geue leaue wil make lawes cocerning religio worshipping god whe allow ordinace pollicie endeuoreth herunto yt true religion coteined ye law god openly publike sacrilege freely broken defiled ye reders holpe plainnesse order shal better vnderstande thought whole kinde ciuile gouernement seuerally entreate ye partes thereof three partes ye magistrate ye gouernor keper lawes ye lawes according gouerneth people gouerned ye lawes obey ye magistrate therfore let v first consider ye office magistrate whether lawful vocation allowed god maner office hath howe great power lawes christian ciuile state ordered last al profit lawes cometh people reuerence due magistrate lord hath testified office magistrate allowed acceptable hym also setting ye dignitie therof honorable titlesex xxiiviii psalme lxxxiii vi hath maruelously comended vnto v maye reherse wheras whosoeuer place magistrate named god let thynke naming small importance therby signified haue comaundement fro god furnished ye authoritie god altogether beare perso god whoes stede certaine maner supplie cauillatioiohn xxxxv ye expositio christ scripture saith called god worde god geuen thys ell god hath committed businesse serue office moses iosaphat sayed iudges appointed euery seuerall citie iuda sit iugemetdeu ixvi chron xixvi man god purpose maketh thys wisdome god affirmeth mouth salomonpro viiixv worke kinges reigne counsellers decree righteous thinges prince beare principalitie al iudges earth execute iugement thys one effect ben sayed cometh passe peruersenesse men gouernemente thinges earth hande kinges ruler prouidence holy ordinance god whome semed good order mater men forasmuch presente president among making lawes executing vpryghtnesse iugementes paule also playnly teacheth reckeneth gouernementes among giftes godrom xiiviii beyng diuersly distributed according diuersitie grace oughte employed seruantes christe edification chirche althoughe properly speaketh councell graue menne whiche primitiue chirch wer apointed yt haue ye rule ordering publike discipline office ye epistle ye corynthias calleth gouernemet yet forasmuch se yt ende ciuile power cometh ye point cor xii xxvii dout yt comedeth vnto v al kind iust gouernement speaketh plainly purposely maketh full discourse yt mater sheweth yt power ordinance godrom xiiii yt power ar ordeined god yt prince theselues ye minister god ye wel doer vnto prayse ye euil reuengers vnto wrath herunto may added also ye example holy haue possessed kyngdomes dauid iosias ezechias lordshippes ioseph daniel ciuile gouernements free people moses iosue ye iudges whoes office ye lord hath declared yt alloweth wherfore none ought dout yt ciuile power vocation onely holy lawefull god also holy honest whole lyfe men couet bring state wtout ruler take exception say yt although old time king iudges ouer ye rude people yet day ye seruile kinde gouerning agreeth wt perfectio christ hath brought wt gospell wherin bewraye ignorace also deuelish pride take vpo theselues perfectio much ye hundreth parte seen maner men soeuer easy cofute dauid exhorteth al kinges ruler kisse sone godpsal iiixii doth bidde geuing ouer authoritie stake selues priuate lifeesa xlixxxiii submit ye power yt beare christ yt alone may haue preeminece aboue al likewise esay whe promiseth kinges shalbe fosterfathers ye chirch quenes shalbe nourses doth depose fro honor rather doth honorable title make defeders godly worshipper god yt prophecie perteineth ye coming christ wittingly passe ouer many testimony eche offer theselues specially ye psalm wherin al gouernors haue right mainteined clere place paul admonishing timothee yt ye como assemblie praiers must made kingsi tim iiii addeth reaso may vnder leade quiet life wt al godlinesse honestie whiche word comitteth state ye chirch defese sauegarding cosideratio ought cotinually busy ye magistrate themselues forasmuch may put great spur wherby may pricked forward duty bryng singular cofort whereby may mitigate ye hardness office truly many great wt great endeuor vprightnesse wisdome myldenesse cotinece innocecie ought charge theselues know themselues appointed minister righteousnesse god affiace shal admit vniustice iugemet seate heare ye throne ye liuing god boldnesse shal pronouce wrogful sentence wt mouth vnderstad appointed instrumet truth god cosciece shal subscribe wicked decree yt know ordeyned write ye actes god sum remeber yt vicegerentes god must watch wt al care earnestnesse diligence may represet theselues vnto certaine image ye prouidece preseruatio goodnesse good righteousnesse god must cotinually set thys eyesier xlviii xi yt al accursed yt doe execute deceite ye worke ye vegeace god thei much greuously accursed yt vse theselues deceitfully rightful vocatio therfore whe moses iosaphat mynded exhort iudges duty nothing effectual moue mindes withal tha yt haue rehersed loke ye ye sit iugemet goddeute ixvi ii chron xixvi psalme lxxxiii esa iiixiiii namely nere cause iugemet therfore let ye feare ye lord vpo u loke diliget peruersnesse wt ye lord god place sayd yt god stode ye assebly yt god sitteth iudge middest god yt may encouraged duty heare yt deputy god must one day yelde accompt gouernemet charge worthily admonitio ought great force make defaulte wrong doer men wickedly vexe also scaunderers god himselfe whoes holy iugemetes defile haue also wherupon may singularly cofort themselues consider themselues yt busied prophane affaire fit seruant god holy office namely forasmuch deputy god yt moued many testimony scripture fro bold rayle holy ministery thing disagreing wt christia religio godlinesse ell rayle god hymselfe dishonor ioyned reproche minister verily refuse magistrate doe caste away god yt reigne ouer lord sayed thys truely people israeli samu viiivii refused gouernemet samuel shal lesse truely sayd thys daye yt geue themselues leaue rage al gouernementes ordeyned god sith lord sayd disciple kinges nation beare rule ouer themluk ixiixxv among first must made least saying forbidde christias take kingdomes gouernementes vpon handsome expositor rose strife among disciple whiche excelled lord suppresse thys vayne ambition taught ministerie like vnto kingdomes one hath preeminence aboue rest beseche doth copariso make dishonor kingly dignitie yea doth proue yt ministerie apostle office king moreouer although among magistrate themselues diuerse formes yet differece behalfe ought take al ordinance god paule also doth comprehede altogether sayth power godrom xi yt best liked al comeded notable testimonie aboue ye namely power one bringeth como bondage al except yt one man whoes wil maketh thynges subiecte olde tyme coulde lesse allowed noble excellente sort naturespro viiixv pet iixvii ye scripture mete vniust iugemetes expresly name affirmeth prouidence god wisdome kinges reigne peculiarly comaundeth king honored truly vaine yt disputed priuate men ye best state policie ye place lyue lawful consult framing comon weale also could simply determined without rashnesse forasmuchas great part order question cosisteth circumstance ye copare also state themselues together without circustaces shal easy discerne ouerweieth profitablenesse match egally together easy way fall kingdome tyranny much harder fall rule chefest men faction fewe easy people gouernement sedition truely three formes gouernementes philosopher set considered themselues wil deny yt either ye gouernemet ye chefest men state tempered comon gouernement farr excelleth al selfe seldome chaunceth yt kynges temper themselues yt wil neuer swarueth yt iust right furnished wt great sharpenesse iugement wisdome euery one seeth much sufficient therfore ye fault defaulte men maketh safer tolerable many haue gouernement yt may mutually one helpe one teache admonish aduaunce himselfe er mete may ouerseers maisters restraine wilfulnesse thys hath alway ben approued experience ye lord also hath confirmed authoritie ordeined among israelite gouernement best men nere vnto common gouernement tyme mynded haue best estate tyll brought fourth image christ dauid willingly graut yt kynde gouernement blessed thys libertie framed moderation ought orderly stablished continuance compt also blessed may enioy thys estate stoutely constantly trauail preseruing reteining graunt nothing dutie yea magistrate ought great diligence bende theselues herunto suffer libertie people appointed gouernors part minished muche lesse dissolued negligent litle careful therin false faithbreakers office betrayer contree would bryng kinde themselues lord hath appointed forme gouernement therby moued desire change thinking therof shal foolish superfluous also hurtfull thou bende thyne eye onely one citie loke beholde whole world together least sprede abrode thy sight farther distance contrees without dout thou shalt fynde vnprofitablye appointed prouidence god diuerse contrees shoulde ruled diuerse kyndes gouernemente elementes hang together vnegall temperature contrees also certaine inequalitie veri wel kept order howbeit al thing also spoken vaine wil lord shal satisfie hys pleasure set kynges ouer kyngdomes senate officer ouer free city whomsoeuer maketh ruler place conuersant dutie shewe selues yelding obedient vnto ye office magistrate place declared ye way sort described word god thinges consisteth scripture teache yt extendeth table ye law might learne ye prophane writer none hath entreated ye dutie magistrate making lawes ye publike weale yt hath begon religion worshipping god haue al confessed policie happily framed vnlesse firste care godlinesse lawes preposterous neglecting right god prouide men sith therfore al philosopher religion hath firste place sithe thesame hath alway ben obserued yt vniuersal cosent al nation let christian prince magistrate ashamed slouthfulnesse endeuor theselues care haue alredy shewed dutie specially enioyned god mete shoulde employ trauail defende maintaine honor whoes vicegerentes whoes benefit gouerne thys cause also chefely holy kinges praysed scripture restored worship god corrupted ouerthrowen toke care religioniud xxixiv might flourishe pure safe vnder contrarywise holy hystorie reckeneth state wtout gouernors among faultes sayeng kyng israell yt therfore euery man pleased hymselfe wherby follie confuted whiche would haue neglecting care god apply themselues iudges law among men though god appointed gouernors name decise controuersies omitted muche weightier importance yt hymselfe worshipped according prescribed rule law desire innouate al thinges wtout punishment moueth troblesome point wishe al reuengers ye breache peace take awayiere xxiiii muche perteineth ye seconde table ieremie warneth kinges iugemet righteousnesse deliuer ye forceably oppressed fro ye false accuser greue ye strager widow wrong shed innocent blood purpose maketh ye exhortatio red ye psalme yt shuld render right ye poore nedy acquite poore nedy deliuer ye poore nedy fro hande oppressor moses geueth charge prince set stede lett heare ye cause brethre iudge betwene brother strangerdeu ixvi deu xviixvi know face iugemet let heare wel litle great afraied ye iugemet god speake thinges ye kinges shoulde get themselues multitude horse cast mind couetousnesse lifted vp aboue brother yt may cotinually busied studieng vpo ye law lord al ye dayes life ye iudges swarue ye one side receiue giftes declaring ye office magistrate purpose much instruct ye magistrate themselues teache magistrate ende set god se therfore yt ordeined defender reuengers innocence modestie honestie quietnesse whoes endeuor shoulde prouide common safetie peace men vertues dauid professeth exemplarpsal xi shall aduauced royall seate consent euell doynges abhorre wicked men sclanderers proude men get hymselfe echewhere honest faithful men sithe performe vnlesse defend good men wronges euill let helpe good succor defense let also armed power whereby thei may seuerely suppresse open euill doer wicked men whoes lewdnesse common quiet trobled vexed throughly fynde thys experience solon sayd ye common weales consist rewarde punishment taken away whole discipline city faileth dissolued care equitie iustice waxeth colde myndes many vnlesse due honor ready vertue neither wylfulnesse wicked men restrained seueritie chastisement peynes two partes prophet comprehendeth byddeth kynges gouernours doo iudgement righteousnesseiere xxixii xxiiiii righteousnesse take charge tuition embrace defende reuenge deliuer innocent judgement withstande boldnesse wicked men represse violence punishe offence semeth doth arise hye hard question law god al christian forbidde kylexo xxxiii deu vxvii mat vxxi esa xiix xvxxv prophet prophecieth holy mount god chirche shall afflict hurt many magistrate together godly blood sheders vnderstand magistrate executing punishmentes doth nothing hymselfe executeth selfe iugementes god shall nothing combred wyth thys dout lawe lorde forbiddeth kyll least manslaughter vnpunished lawe maker hymselfe geueth minister swerd hande draw fourth mansleyers aflict hurt godly hurte afflict lordes commaundement reuenge afflictios godly would god thys alway presente myndes nothyng done rashenesse man al thing authoritie god yt comaundethrom xiii iiii going v neuer swarue ye right way unlesse parhappes bridle put vpon righteousnesse god may punish wycked doinges lawful appoint law shall cauil minister beare sweard vain sayth paule minister god wrath reuengers euil doer therfore prince ruler knowe nothing shalbe acceptable god obedience let apply ministerie desire shewe godlinesse righteousnesse vncorruptnesse allowable god thys affection moses led knowing himselfe appointed power lorde deliuerer hys people layed hys handes vpo egyptia againe slayeng three thousande men one dayex iixii acte viixxviii ex xxxiixxvii ki xiv toke vengeance sacrilege people dauid also nye ende hys lyfe gaue commaundement salomo hys sonne slay ioab semei wherupo also rehearseth thys amog vertues king slay wicked lande al worker wickednesse maye dryuen citie god whiche purpose also perteineth prayse geuen salomon thou hast loued righteousnesse hast hated wickednesse doth mylde ge le nature moses burne great crueltie beyng sprinkled embrued blood brother runneth throughout cape newe slaughter doth dauid great gentlenesse al life among hys last breathinges make bloody testamente yt hys sonne bryng hoare heate ioab demet peace graue executed vengeance committed god sanctified cruell dealing handes defiled sparing abhomination kinges sayth salomonpro xvixii pro xxviii pro xxxxvi pro xxviiii pro xvii xv pro xviixi pro xiiiixxiiii iniquitie hys throne stablished righteousnesse againe kyng sitteth throne iugement spredeth hys eye vpon euery euill man againe wise king scattereth wicked turneth vpon whele take away drosse siluer shal come fourth vessel melter take away wicked man sighte king throne shalbe fast set righteousnesse againe iustifieth wicked condemneth righteous bothe abhomination lorde againe rebellious man purchaceth euil himselfe cruel messenger sent vnto hym againe whoso sayth wycked man thou art righteous hym people nation curse nowe theyr true righteousnesse drawen swerd pursue gylty wicked men let put vp swerde holde handes pure blood meane tyme desperate men doe range murthers slaughter thei shal make theselues gilti great wickednesse much lesse shal get therby ye prayse goodnesse righteousnesse let precise cruell rigorousnesse iugement seate may worthily called rocke accused men either fauor extreme crueltie doe thinke ryghteous iugemet pronouced whyle clementie best surest couseller kynges salomo affirmeth ye preseruer ye kinges throne assistent certaine man olde tyme truely sayd principal gift prince yet magistrate must take hede doe neither rigorousnesse mynde wound rather heale superstitious affectation clementie fal cruel gentlenesse soft loose tendernesse dissolute destruction many thys olde tyme wtout cause comoly spoken vnder empire nerua yt dede euil liue vnder prince vnder nothing lawful much worse vnder al thing lawfull sith sotime kinges people must necessitie take swerd hand execute publike vegeace thys reson may also iudge yt warres lawful take power deliuered wherby may mainteine quiet dominio wherby may kepe ye seditious stirres vnquiet wherby may helpe forceably oppressed wherby may punish euil doinges fitter seaso vtter tha suppresse hys rage trobleth priuately rest euery man common quiet al men seditiously maketh vprores committeth violent oppression haynous euil doinges ought preseruers defender lawes must also ouerthrowe ye enterprise al whoes wicked discipline lawes corrupted yea worthyly punishe theues whoes iniuries haue extended onely shal suffer whole contree without punishmet vexed wasted robbery maketh differece whether king one basest commonaltie inuadeth others contree hath right spoileth like enemie alike take punished robber thys therfore natural equitie rule dutie teacheth prince armed restrayne priuate duty indicial punishmentes also defende wt warre dominion committed charge tyme enuielike assailed suche warres holy ghost many testimony scripture declareth lawful obiected yt ye new testamet neither witnesse exaple teacheth yt warre thyng lawful christias first answer rule makyng warre whiche old time remaineth also daye contrary syde cause may debarre magistrate defendyng subiectes secondly expresse declaration mater bee sought writynges apostle purpose frame ciuile state stablishe spirituall kingdome christe last say also shewed waye christe hath commyng chaunged nothyng behalf christian doctrine may speake augustine owne wordes condemned warres augu epist v ad mar would rather haue said soldiars asked counsell saluation shold cast away weapon vtterly withdraw themselues warre said strike manluke iiixvii man wrong let wage suffise whome taughte wage ought suffise veryly forbidde warriers magistrate ought take great hede nothing folowe owne desyres rather muste punish let born away hedlong angrinesse let violetly caried hatred let broile vnappeasable rigor yea let augustin saith pity comon nature punishe priuate fault must put armure ye enemie armed robber let lightly seke occasio therof take beyng offred vnlesse driuen extreme necessitie ought performe much heathen man required would haue warre seme seking peace truely oughte firste attempte thinges ere ought trye matter warrecicero finally kindes let suffer themselues caried priuate affection led como feling otherwise doe ill abuse power geuen commodity others benefit ministerie moreouer rightful rule making warre hangeth order bothe garrison league ciuile fortification garrison cal placed townes defende border comree league made prince adioyning couenante troble happen lades may mutually helpe ioyne force common together suppresse common enemy mankinde ciuile fortification whoes vse arte warre thys also wil last al adde tribute tax ye lawfull reuenues prince may chefely employ susteine co mon charge office whiche yet maye likewise vse priuate royaltie certayne manner conioyned honor princely state beare se dauid ezechias iosias iosaphat holy kynges ioseph also daniel according state person beare without offense godlinesse sumptuous common charge rede ezechiel large portion lande assigned kingesezechiel x viiixxi although paint spiritual kingdome christ yet fetcheth exaplar hys similitude lawful kingdome men yet prince agayne behalues remember treasure chamber muche owne priuate cofersro xiiivi treasury whole people paul testifieth may without manifest wrong prodigally wast spoile rather blood people whiche spare cruel vnnaturalnesse let thinke imposition subsidy kindes tribute ar nothyng supportes publike necessitie wherewyth wery poore communaltie wythout cause tyrannicall extortion thynges doe encourage prince wasteful expense ryot verily nede adde fyerbrand theyr lustes themselues much alredy kyndled sythe much behoueth shoulde pure conscience god bolde al bolde least wycked boldnesse come despising god must taught much lawful neyther thys doctrine superfluous priuate men shoulde rashly stubbornly geue themselues leaue grudge expense prince although excede common ciuile measure nexte magistrate ciuile state lawes moste strong sinewes common weales cicero calleth accordyng plato soules without magistrate stand agayn without magistrate haue liuely force therfore nothing coulde truely said lawe dumme magistrate magistrate lyuyng lawe whereas promised speake lawes christian ciuile state ought bee ordered cause man shold loke long discourse best kynde lawes bothe shold infinite perteined present purpose place yet fewe wordes way touche lawes may vse godlily god bee rightly gouerned among men selfe thyng rather haue vtterly passed ouer silence dyd vnderstande many herein verillously erre denye co mon weale well ordered whiche neglectyng ciuile lawes moses gouerned common lawes nation howe dangerous troublesome sentence let men consider shall enough haue shewed false foolish common diuision kept diuideth whole lawe god published morall ceremoniall iudiciall lawes partes seuerally considered maye knowe perteyneth v neither meane time let man combred dout iudicials ceremonial also perteyne moral lawes although olde writer whiche haue taught diuision ignorant two later partes vse maners yet myght changed abrogate moral remaining safe call moral called fyrst part peculiarly name withoute whiche stande true holynesse maners vnchangeable rule lyuyng rightly therfore morall lawe may first beginne rat sith conteined two chefe pointes one commaundeth simply worship god pure faith godlynesse embrace men vnfained loue true eternall rule righteousnesse prescribed men al age tymes wil willyng frame lyfe god eternall vnchangeable willgala iiiiiiii hymselfe worshipped v shold mutually loue one ceremoniall lawe schooling iewes wherwith pleased lord exercise certain childhode people tyll tyme fullnesse come wherin would full manifestly shewe wisdome earth delyuer truthe thynges shadowed figure iudiciall lawe geuen order ciuile state gaue certayne rule equitie righteousnesse whiche myght behaue selues harmlessely quietly together exercise ceremony proprely perteyned dede doctrine godlynesse namely kept chirch iewes worship religion god yet might distinguished godlynesse self forme iudiciall order although tended ende howe selfe charitie might best kept whiche commaunded eternall lawe god yet certayne thyng differyng comau dement louyng therefore ceremony myghte abrogate godlinesse remaynyng safe vndestroyed iudiciall ordinance also beyng taken away perpetuall dueties commaundeme te charitie may continue true verily libertie left euery nation make suche lawes shall forsee profitable whiche yet must framed perpetuall rule charitie may dede vary forme haue reason thinke barbarous sauage lawes gaue honor theues alowed common copulation muche filthy reason taken lawes forasmuche onely rightuousnesse also naturall gentylnesse kyndnesse men haue sayde shalbe playne lawes beholde two thynges ought makyng equitie law vpon reason wherof makyng selfe founded stayeth equitie naturall one lawes therfore one lawe accordyng kynde mater oughte propounded ende lawes makyngs lawes haue certaine circumstance vpon partly hang tende together one marke equitie though diuerse maketh mater nowe sithe certayne lawe god whiche call morall nothyng ell testimonie naturall law conscience engrauen god myndes men whole rule equitie wherof nowe speake set foorth therin therfore alone also must bothe marke rule ende lawes whatsoeuer lawes shalbe framed rule directed marke limited ende cause disalowe howsoeuer otherwise differ iewishe lawe one lawe god forbiddeth steale peyne appoynted theftes ciuile state iewesexo xxiii sene exodus auncient lawes nation punished thefte recompence double lawes folowed afterwarde made difference betwene manifest theft manifest proceded banishemente whippyng last punishmente deathdeu xixxviii false witnesse among iewes punished recompece egall paine place onely greate shame place hangyng crosse manslaughter lawes vniuersally doo reuenge blood yet dyuers kyndes deathe agaynst adulterer place ordeined seuerer peynes place lighter yet see howe suche diuersitie tend ende one mouthe together pronounce punishement offence haue ben condemned eternal law god manslaughter theftes adulterie false witnessings maner punishement agree neither nedefull yet expedient contree vnlesse shewe rigor horrible example mansleyers immediately destroied murder robbery tyme requireth sharpnesse peynes encreased aryse trouble common weale euils wont growe therof muste amended newe ordinance tyme warre humanitie would noyse armure fall away vnlesse caste men vnwonted feare punishementes barennesse pestilece vnlesse greater seueritie vsed thyngs come ruine nation bent certaine vice vnlesse sharply suppressed howe malicious enuious shall againste publike profite shalbe offended suche diuersitie whiche fitte holde fast obseruyng lawe god whyche saye lawe god geuen moses dishonored beyng abrogate newe preferred aboue moste vaine neither preferred aboue allowed simple comparison respect estate tymes place nation neither abrogate neuer made v lorde gaue lawe hande moses published nation florishe euery receiued nation iewes faith defence protection willed lawemaker peculiarly lyke wise lawmaker hadde making hys lawes certaine singular consideration remayneth consider haue set last place profit lawes iudicial order magistrate cometh common felowship christian wherwith also coupled question much priuate men ought yeld magistrate farre obedience ought procede many thought office magistrat superfluous among christias forsoth thei godlily craue ayde namely sithe forbidden reuenge sue law haue controuersie whereas paule contrarywise plainly testifieth xiiiiiiii ye minister god v good thereby vnderstand ordeined god defended hande succour agaynst maliciousnesse iniuries mischeuous men may lyue quiete assured lyfe vaine geuen v lorde defence vnlesse lawfull v vse suche benefite sufficiently appereth may also without vngodlinesse called vpon sued vnto muste haue doo twoo kyndes men many men boyle great rage quarellyng lawe neuer haue quiete themselues vnlesse haue strife controuersies exercise deadly sharpnesse hatred mad gredinesse reuenge hurt pursue vnappeasable stiffenesse euen verye destruction aduersarie meane tyme may thought doo thyng rightefully defende suche peruersnesse color lawe though graunted thee go lawe thy brother yet thou mayste hate hym carried againste hym furious desyre hurt hym stubbornely pursue hym let therfore said men vse lawes lawful man doo rightly vse right vse bothe pleintife sue defendant defende defendant beeyng summoned doo appere appointed day dothe exception defed cause without bitternesse affection defend whiche owne law pleintif beyng vnworthily oppressed either person goodes resort defence magistrate make complainte require equitie conscience farre gredy hurte reuenge farre sharpnesse hatred farre burnyng heate contention rather redy yeld owne suffer thing caried enemylike mynd aduersarie contrarywise beyng filled malice mynde corrupted enuie kindled wrath breathyng reuenge finally enflamed heate contention geue ouer parte charitie whole procedyng euen moste iuste cause wicked ought determined principle christian controuersie though neuer righteous neuer rightly pursued man vnlesse beare good loue aduersarie matter whiche controuersie already concluded ended composition man peraduenture say suche moderation neuer vsed goyng lawe shoulde lyke miracle suche founde graunt dede maners tymes seldome sene example good contender lawe yet thyng selfe beyng defiled addition euel ceasseth good pure heare helpe ye magistrate holy gift god must muche diligently take hede defiled faulte precisely condemne contendings lawe lett vnderstande therwithall despise holy ordinance god gifte kynde giftes whiche maye cleane cleaneact xxiii et xxiiii xii xxvx vnlesse peraduenture accuse paule wicked doyng whiche bothe put away himselfe sclanders accuser declaryng also deceite maliciousnesse iudgement claimed hymselfe prerogatiue citie rome nede appelled vnrighteous gouernor emperor iudgement seatenum xix xviii math vxxxix deuter xixiixxxv rom xiixix neither withstandeth christian forbidden desire reuenge also driue farre away christian iudgemente seates contention commo case goeth right way doth innocent simplicitie commit cause iudge common defender thynking nothing lesse reder mutual recopence euill affection reuenge matter life death greate criminall action commenced require accuser suche one commeth courte beyng taken boylyng heate reuenge touched displeasure priuate iniurie hauyng mynde withstande enterprise mischeuous manne may hurt common weale thou take away reuengyng mynde offence done comaundement whereby reuenge forbidden christian bidden desire reuenge also commaunded wayt hande lord promiseth wil present reuenger oppressed aflicted preuent reuenge heauelye defendor require helpe magistrate hande either themselues otherrom xiii iiii muste thinke magistrate reuenge reuenge man god paule sayth extedeth exerciseth ministerie man good disagree wordes christ forbiddeth resist euellmath vxxxix commaundeth turne righte cheke hath geuen blowe left suffer take away thy cloke taketh awaye thy coate willeth dede myndes much abhorre desire recompensing like like soner suffer doble iniurie done themselues desire reacquite patience neither also leade awaye christian truely oughte bee kinde men made beare reproches iniuries open malice deceites mockages noughty men onely also muste bee bearer al euilles say framed al harte hauing receiued one displeasure make themselues redy promysyng selues nothyng whole lyfe bearing continuall crosse meane tyme also muste doo good doo wrong wyshe well curse themrom xlixxi math vxxxix whyche onely victorie stryue ouercome euyll good minded wil seke eie eie tooth tooth pharises taught disciple desire reuenge taught christ suffer body mangled goodes maliciously taken forgeue owne accorde pardon euels soone done yet euennesse moderation mindes shall withstad frendshyp toward ennemies remaining safe may vse helpe magistrate preseruyng goodes zele publike commoditie may sue giltie pestilent man punished know amended death augustine truely expoundeth commaundementes tend ende epist ad marcell righteous godly man ready beare patiently malice whome seeketh haue made good men rather number good maye encrease shoulde like malice adde himselfe also numbre euell perteyne preparation hart inwardely worke done openly secrete may kept patience mynde goood openly may doone whiche see may profitable ought beare good whiche wonte obiected contendynges lawe altogether condemned paulei cor vivi also false may easily perceiued wordes immeasurable rage striuing lawe chirch corynthians farre foorth make gospell christ whole religion professed open cauillations euell speakyng wycked fyrst thyng paule blameth intemperance contentios brought gospel sclander among vnbeleuers point also suche sort striued among themselues brother brother farre bearyng wronges gredily gaped one others goodes prouoked one beyng vnprouoked hurte therfore inueyeth agaynst rage contendyng simply agaynste controuersies pronouceth fault weakenesse dyd rather suffer losse goodes trauayle euen contention preseruyng namely easily moued euery damage moste small cause runne court lawe controuersies sayth profe mynde ready anger well framed patiece christian verily ought alway rather yelde owne right go lawe whens scarcely get agayne mynd muche moued kindled hatred brother man seeth without losse charitie may defend owne losse whereof shoulde sore hindrance vnto offendeth nothing sayeng paul finally haue taught beginnyng charitie shall geue euery man best counsell without whiche whatsoeuer controuersies taken hande beyonde whatsoeuer procede holde controuersie vniust wicked fyrst duetie subiectes toward magistrate thynke moste honorably office namely acknowlege iurisdiction committed god therefore esteme reuerence minister deputy god man may fynd whiche yelde themselues obedient magistrate would whome obeye know expedient common benefite magistrate themselues thinke otherwise certaine necessarie euillsi pet iixvii prouer xxiiiixxi peter requireth somewhat v commaudeth kyng honored salomon commaudeth god kyng feared peter vnder worde honoryng conteineth sincere well demyng estimation salomon ioynyng kyng god sheweth full certaine holye reuerence dignitie also notable commendation paul obey onely wrathe consciencerom xiii v wherby meaneth subiectes ought ledde onely feare prince ruler holden subiection wont yeld armed enemie see vengeance shal redily taken vpon resist obedience shewed shewed god himselfe forasmuch power god speake men visor dignitie dyd couer foolishenesse sluggishnesse cruelty wicked maners full mischeuous doyng say degree self worthy honor reuerence whosoeuer ruler may estemed v haue reuerence respecte beyng ruler also foloweth thyng myndes bente honoring declare obedience profe whether obey proclamation paye tribute take hande publike office charge serue common defence doo commaudementes let euery soule saith paul subiect hyer powersrom xiii tit xxxi pet iixiii resisteth power resisteth ordinace god paule writeth titus warne yt subiecte ruler power obey magistrate redy euery good worke peter saith ye subiect euery humaine creature rather translate ordinance lordes sake either kyng moste excellent ruler sent hym punishement dede euell dooers praise well doer moreouer shoulde testifie doo fayne subiection sincerely hartily subiect paule addeth commende god safetie prosperitie vnder lyuei tim iii exhorte sayth made praiers besechynges intercession thankesgeuynges men kynges set superioritie may liue peasable quiet life godlynesse honestie neither let man deceiue himselfe sithe magistrate resisted god himselfe must also resisted although may thought vnarmed magistrate may frely despised yet god armed whiche strongly take vengeance dispisyng hymselfe moreouer vnder obedience contemne moderation priuate men ought bynde themselues kepe case touchyng publike state owne head entermedle publike business rashely breake office magistrate enterprise nothyng publikely thyng shall publike ordinance behouefull amended let themselues rayse vprores put handes doyng whiche ought haue fast bounde behalfe let comit iudgement magistrate whose hand alone libertie meane presume nothing vncomaunded commaundement ruler adioyned also furnished publike authoritie wont call cou seller king eares eies vnfittly man may cal handes prince whome commaundement setteth authoritie doyng thynges nowe forasmuche haue hetherto described magistrate suche dede called namely father contree poete calleth hym pastor people keeper peace protector righteousnesse reuenger innocence worthily iudged madde man alloweth suche gouernement wheras maner experience age prince beyng carelesse al thyngs foreseyng wherof ought haue ben hedefully bent doo without care slouthfully wallowe delites addicted gaine doo set sale lawes priuileges iudgementes grauntes somme spoile poore communaltie money whiche may waste vpon mad prodigall expendynges exercise mere robbery pillyng house defilyng virgin matrones murtheryng innocentes many persuaded suche shoulde acknowleged prince whoes authoritie ought obey farre may great haynous vnworthinesse among doynges much contrarie duetie onely magistrate also man beholde forme image god whiche ought shyne magistrate see token minister god whiche geuen praise good vengeance euell neither also acknowlege gouernor whoes dignitie authoritie scripture commendeth vnto v truely felyng affection hath alway ben naturally planted myndes men lesse hate abhorre tyrantes loue honor lawfull kynges loke worde god leade v subiect gouernement prince execute office warde v well suche faithfulnesse ought also meane soeuer haue dominion possession although performe nothyng lesse tha perteineth duetie prince though lord testifieth magistrate speciall great gift liberalitie preseruyng safetie men appoynteth magistrate themselues theyr boundes yet dothe therwithall declare fort soeuer haue authoritie dede rule benefite comon weale true examplars paternes bountifulnesse rule vniustly wilfully ar raysed vp hym punishe wickednesse people egally haue maiestie wherwith hath furnished lawful power procede till haue added certayne testimony pointiob ose xxiii ii esa de yet nede muche labor proue wicked king wrath god vpon earth asmuche thinke man say contrary otherwise sayed kyng common robber violently taketh away thy good adoulterer defileth thy bed murtherer seketh kill thee wheras scripture reckeneth calamity among curse god let v rather tary vpo prouing doth easily settle mindes men noughty man vnworthy al honor haue publike power possession remayneth noble diuine power lorde hath worde geuen minister hys righteousnesse iugement therfore ought hys subiectes great reuerence estimation much perteineth publike obedience would haue best king geuen first would haue ye reders perceiue diligently marke prouidece singular doinges god scripture without cause oft rehearsed vnto v distributing kingdomes making kinges pleaseth daniel sayd lorde chageth tymes course tymesdan casteth away maketh kinges agayne ye liuing may know hiest mighty kingdome men shal geue wil maner sentence wheras whole scripture aboundeth yet prophecy daniel specially swarmeth ful maner kyng nabuchadonezar conquered hierusalem sufficiently knowen namely strog inuader destroyer otherero yet ezechiel lord affirmeth gaue hym lande egipt seruice yt done hym wastyng itda daniell sayd hym thou kyng arte kyng kynges whome kyng heauens hath geuen mightie strong glorious kyngdome thee saye hath geuen landes dwell child men beastes wood fowles ayre hath deliuered thy hande hath made thee beare rule ouer agayne sayed hys sonne belsasar hyeste god hath geuen nabuchadonezar thy father kyngdome royaltiedan honor glory reason royaltie gaue hym people tribe language trembling fearfull sighte heare kyng ordeined god let v therof call remembrance heauenly warnynges concernyng honoring fearing kyng shal dout accompt wicked tyrant place wherin lorde hath vouchesaued set samuell gaue warnyng people israel maner thyngs shold suffer handes kynges sayd1 samu shalbe right king shall reigne ouer shal take sonnes put chariot make horsmen plow land reape croppe make instrumentes warre shal take daughter may dresser ointmentes cooke baker lad vineyardes best oliue platte shal take away geue bonde seruantes shall take tithe sedes vineyardes shall geue eunuch bonde seruantes shall take away bonde men bonde woman ass set worke yea shall take tithe flockes ye shalbe bonde seruantes uerily kinges haue done right whome law wel instruct al continence called right ouer people whiche behoued necessitie obey might resist samuell sayd wilfulnesse kinges shall runne licenciousnesse shall part resist whome onely thing shalbe left obey commaundementes harke worde chefely ieremie notable place worthy remebred although somwhat long yet wil contet rehearse plainly determineth whole question haue made earth menier xxvii v sayth lorde liuing creature ouerface earth great strength stretched arme wil deliuer hym pleaseth myne eye therfore haue geuen landes hand nabuchadnezar seruante nation great kinges shal serue hym tyll tyme shall come lande shalbe nation kingdome hath serued kyng babell wil visit nation swerde famine pestilence wherefore serue ye kyng babell lyue se greate obedience lorde wylled cruell proude tyrant honored reason possessed kingdome thesame heauenly decree set throne kyngdome taken vp kingly maiestie vnlawful violate haue thys co tinually myndes eye euen worst kynges ordeyned decree authoritie kynges stablyshed seditious thoughtes shal neuer come mynde kyng handeled according deseruinges mete shoulde shewe selues subiectes hym doeth hys behalfe shewe hymselfe kyng v vayne shall man obiect thys peculiar commaundemente israelite noted reason lorde confirmeth haue geuen sayeth kyngdome nabuchadnezar wherefore serue ye hym lyue whome soeuer therfore shalbe certayne kyngdome geuen let v dout obeyed sone lord aduaunceth man royall estate therein declareth hys v haue hym reigner oue xxviiiii iob xiixviii xxix vii therof generall testimony scripture salomo xxviii chapter many prince wickednesse people againe iob xii chapter taketh away subiectio fro kinges girdeth againe girdle thys confessed remayneth nothing must serue liue also ieremie prophet commaundement lord wherin commaundeth hys people seke peace babylo whether ben led away captiue pray hym peace shoulde peace beholde israelite beyng spoiled al good plucked house led away exile cast miserable bondage commaunded pray safetie conqueror place commaunded pray persecuters ye kingdome may preserued himselfe quiet themselues may also liue prosperously vnder hym dauid already appointed kyng ordinance god annointed holy oyle without hys deseruing vnworthyly persecuted saul yet hed layed waite hys lyfe estemed holy lord hallowed wyth honor kingdome1 xxiiiivii farre sayd shoulde lord thys thyng lorde annointed lorde laye hande vpon hym annointed lord1 samu xxviix againe soule hath spared thee haue sayd wyll laye hande vpon lorde annointed lord againe shal lay hande vpon anointed lord shalbe innocet sure lord liueth vnlesse lord strike hym day come dye goe battell farr lay hande vpon annointed ye lorde finally owe affection reuerence yea deuotion ruler sort soeuer therfore oftener repete may learne searche men themselues take sufficiente lord beare personage lord hath emprinted engraued inuiolable maiestie thou wilt say ruler owe mutuall duty subiectes haue alredy confessed thou therupon co clude obedience rendred none iuste gouernementes thou art foolish reasoner husbandes also bounde wiues parentes child mutuall dutieseph vii ephe vxxvi lett parentes husbandes depart fro dutie let parentes shew themselues hard vnpleasable child forbidden prouoke anger peuishnesse vnmeasurably wery let husbandes despitefully vse wyues commaunded loue1 pet iiivii spare weake vessel shall yet therefore either child lesse obediet parentes wyues husbandes subiect euil parentes husbandes suche dutie yea wheras oughte rather endeuor themselues looke behynde bagge banging backe enquire one others duty euery man set hym dutie oughte chefely haue place among vnder power wherfore vnmercifully tormeted cruel prince rauenously spoiled couetous ryotous prince neglected slouthfull princedani ixvii finally vexed godliness sake wicked vngodly prince let v first cal minde remembrance sinnes vndoutedly chastised suche scourge lord therby humilitie shal bridle impatience let v also call minde thought yt perteineth v remedy suche euells left vspro xxi psalme lxxxiii psal ii yt craue ye helpe ye lord whoes hand harte kinges bowinges kingdomes ye god shal stande assemblie god shall middest iudge god whoes face al kinges shal fal broken al iudges earth shal haue kissed annointed haue written vniust moses violence chusam king syria othoniel oute thraldomes kynges iudges tamed pryde tyrus egyptian insolence egyptian assyrian fercenesse assyriansex iiivii iud iiiix c chaldee boldnesse babilon median persian cyrus hadde subdued median vnhakefulnesse kinges iuda israel wicked obstinatie toward many benefites beate downe bryng distresse sometyme assyrian somtyme babilonians albeit al one maner ye first sort men lawful calling god sent actes taking armure kinges violate maiestie planted kinges ordinance god armed heaue subdued lesser power greater like lawful king punish lordes vnder later sort although wer directed hand god whether pleased vnwittingly work yet purposed mind nothing mischefe howsoever doinges men iudged yet lord dyd wel execute hys worke breake bloody scepter proude kinges ouerthrew intolerable gouernemetes let prince heare afrayde meane tyme must take greate hede despise offende authoritie magistrate ful reuerend maiestie whiche god hath stablished estate haue euery realme holde principal assembly forbidde according office withstande outraging licentiousnesse kingesparlamentes affirme winke kinges wilfully raging ouer treading poore communaltie dissembling without wycked breache faith deceitfully betray libertie people wherof know themselues appointed protector ordinance god obedience whiche haue determined due authority gouernors alway excepted yea chefely obserued leade v away obeying hym whoes wil ye desire al kinges ought subiect whoes decree al comaundementes ought yelde whoes maiestie mace ought submitted truely vnorderly satisfieng men runne displeasure men themselues obeyed lord therfore king kinges whe hath opened hys holy mouth heard alone altogether aboue al nexte hym subiect men set ouer v otherwise hym commaunde
